PAGE_NNP Original_NNP articlesORIGINAL_NN ARTICLES_NNP TREATMENT_NNP OF_NNP STRANGLES_NNP WITH_NNP SULPHANILAMIDE_NNP By_IN F._NNP C.MINETT_NNP ,_, Imperial_NNP Veterinary_NNP Research_NNP Institute_NNP ,_, Mukteswar_NNP ,_, and_CC MAJOR_NNP W._NNP P._NNP S._NNP EDWARDS_NNP ,_, Indian_JJ Military_NNP Veterinary_NNP Laboratory_NNP ,_, Lahore_NNP (_( Received_VBN for_IN publication_NN on_IN 24_CD July_NNP 1944_CD )_) (_( With_IN 39_CD text-figures_NNS )_) As_IN part_NN of_IN a_DT plan_NN for_IN the_DT investigation_NN of_IN strangles_NNS in_IN the_DT Army_NNP Remount_NNP Depots_NNP of_IN Mona_NNP and_CC Sargodha_NNP in_IN the_DT Punjab_NNP ,_, it_PRP was_VBD decided_VBN to_TO make_VB a_DT systematic_JJ trial_NN of_IN sulphanilamide_NN ,_, leaving_VBG an_DT equal_JJ number_NN of_IN controls_NNS treated_VBN by_IN ordinary_JJ methods_NNS ._.
The_DT present_JJ paper_NN gives_VBZ the_DT results_NNS so_RB far_RB obtained_VBN and_CC the_DT opportunity_NN is_VBZ taken_VBN to_TO discuss_VB the_DT whole_NN problem_NN with_IN an_DT eye_NN to_TO the_DT future_NN ._.

Some_DT of_IN the_DT most_RBS recent_JJ information_NN on_IN the_DT causal_NN agent_NN of_IN strangles_NNS is_VBZ fur-_JJ nished_VBN by_IN Bazeley_NNP and_CC Battle_NNP [_NNP 1940_CD ]_NNP in_IN Australia_NNP ._.
From_IN 415_CD cases_NNS of_IN serious_JJ and_CC typical_JJ equine_NN diseases_VBZ they_PRP isolated_VBD 457_CD strains_NNS of_IN hæmolytic_JJ streptococci_NN ._.
All_DT of_IN these_DT belonged_VBN to_TO Lancefield_NNP 's_POS sero-_JJ logical_JJ group_NN C_NNP ,_, in_IN fact_NN the_DT horse_NN is_VBZ the_DT commonest_JJS source_NN of_IN these_DT organisms_NNS just_RB as_IN man_NN is_VBZ the_DT usual_JJ source_NN of_IN group_NN A_NNP streptococci_NN and_CC the_DT cow_NN of_IN group_NN B_NNP streptococci_NN ._.
By_IN agglutination_NN ,_, five_CD main_JJ types_NNS could_MD be_VB distinguished_VBN among_IN the_DT 457_CD strains_NNS while_IN biochemically_RB they_PRP fell_VBD into_IN five_CD types_NNS :_: (_( a_DT )_) Str_NNP ._.
equi_NN ,_, which_WDT fer-_RB mented_VBD neither_CC lactose_JJ ,_, sorbitol_JJ nor_CC trehalose_JJ ;_: (_( b_NN )_) 'equine_VBZ 1_CD '_'' which_WDT fermented_VBD sorbitol_NN ;_: (_( c_NN )_) 'equine_VBZ 2_CD '_'' which_WDT fermented_VBD trehalose_NN ._.
Types_NNP (_( b_NN )_) and_CC (_( c_NNS )_) might_MD or_CC might_MD not_RB ferment_VB lactose_RB in_IN addition_NN and_CC they_PRP are_VBP generally_RB referred_VBN to_TO as_IN Str_NNP ._.
pyogenes_NNS equi_NNS ._.
All_PDT the_DT strains_NNS isolated_VBN from_IN fresh_JJ strangles_NNS pus_NNS were_VBD Str_NNP ._.
equi_NN (_( agglutinative_JJ type_NN 1_CD )_) and_CC this_DT type_NN was_VBD also_RB associated_VBN with_IN some_DT cases_NNS of_IN res-_JJ piratory_NN catarrh_NN ._.
There_EX appears_VBZ to_TO be_VB no_RB doubt_NN as_IN to_TO the_DT sensitivity_NN of_IN group_NN C_NNP streptococci_NN to_TO sulphonamide_VB preparations_NNS ._.
Stableforth_NNP [_JJ 1938_CD ]_NN reported_VBD that_IN sulphanilamide_NN would_MD protect_VB mice_NN against_IN 100_CD to_TO 1000_CD or_CC even_RB more_JJR minimal_JJ lethal_JJ doses_NNS of_IN culture_NN ._.
Descazeaux_NNP ,_, Courtade_NNP and_CC Rocq_NNP [_NNP 1939_CD ]_NNP in_IN similar_JJ tests_NNS used_VBD a_DT virulent_JJ hæmolytic_JJ streptococcus_NN isolated_VBD from_IN a_DT strangles_NNS abscess_NN ._.
An_DT 18-hour_JJ serum_NN broth_DT culture_NN of_IN this_DT organism_NN in_IN dose_NN of_IN 0.5_CD c.c_NN ._.
of_IN 10-7_JJ dilution_NN intraperitoneally_RB was_VBD regularly_JJ fatal_NN in_IN mice_NN ._.

1000_CD fatal_JJ doses_NNS )_) was_VBD used_VBN and_CC this_DT killed_VBN nine_CD out_IN of_IN the_DT ten_NNS control_NN mice_NN within_IN 48_CD hours_NNS and_CC the_DT remaining_VBG one_CD within_IN 72_CD hours_NNS ._.
Of_IN 10_CD mice_NNS similarly_RB inoculated_VBN but_CC also_RB given_VBN sulphanilamide2_JJ Treatment_NNP of_IN Strangles_NNP with_IN Sulphanilamide_NNP doubt_NN that_IN they_PRP have_VBP a_DT direct_JJ effect_NN on_IN bacterial_JJ metabolism_NN (_( inhibition_NN of_IN an_DT essential_JJ enzyme_NN reaction_NN )_) leading_VBG to_TO bacteriostasis_NN and_CC that_IN the_DT phagocytic_JJ cells_NNS of_IN the_DT body_NN are_VBP the_DT actual_JJ killing_NN agents_NNS ._.
This_DT effect_NN was_VBD nicely_RB shown_VBN by_IN Gay_NNP and_CC Clark_NNP [_NNP 1937_CD ]_NN in_IN the_DT case_NN of_IN an_DT experimental_JJ streptococcus_NN empyema_NN in_IN rabbits_NNS ._.
The_DT phagocytic_JJ cells_NNS themselves_PRP are_VBP unharmed_JJ by_IN concentrations_NNS of_IN the_DT drug_NN which_WDT are_VBP active_JJ against_IN bacteria_NNS ._.
McIntosh_NNP and_CC Whitby_NNP [_NNP 1939_CD ]_NNP have_VBP shown_VBN that_IN the_DT drugs_NNS are_VBP not_RB simple_JJ germicides_NNS ,_, although_IN ,_, as_IN Colebrook_NNP ,_, Buttle_NNP and_CC O'Meara_NNP [_NNP 1936_CD ]_NNP had_VBD pointed_VBN out_RP for_IN sul-_JJ phanilamide_NN ,_, the_DT drug_NN is_VBZ bactericidal_VBN on_IN small_JJ numbers_NNS of_IN hæmolytic_JJ streptococci_NN in_IN culture_NN medium_NN and_CC in_IN blood_NN ._.
It_PRP is_VBZ also_RB known_VBN that_IN they_PRP are_VBP not_RB immediately_RB active_JJ in_IN vitro_NN or_CC in_IN vivo_NN ;_: they_PRP are_VBP active_JJ on_IN highly_RB virulent_JJ organisms_NNS and_CC those_DT in_IN the_DT logarithmic_JJ phase_NN of_IN growth_NN ,_, and_CC there_EX is_VBZ a_DT quantitative_JJ relationship_NN between_IN effective_JJ dose_NN and_CC the_DT number_NN of_IN bacteria_NNS attacked_VBN ._.
Further_RB ,_, it_PRP is_VBZ decided_VBN that_IN the_DT drugs_NNS do_VBP not_RB neutralize_VB toxins_NNS ,_, they_PRP do_VBP not_RB stimulate_VB the_DT activity_NN of_IN leucocytes_NNS nor_CC influence_NN the_DT production_NN or_CC quality_NN of_IN specific_JJ immune_JJ bodies_NNS ._.
The_DT compounds_NNS are_VBP easily_RB diffusible_JJ in_IN the_DT body_NN and_CC are_VBP very_RB effective_JJ in_IN a_DT medium_NN which_WDT is_VBZ a_DT poor_JJ one_CD for_IN the_DT organism_NN ,_, e._FW g._FW urine_NN or_CC blood_NN ._.
On_IN the_DT other_JJ hand_NN ,_, as_IN Fleming_VBG [_JJ 1941_CD ]_NN has_VBZ shown_VBN ,_, pus_VB inhibits_VBZ the_DT action_NN of_IN sulphanilamide_NN ,_, so_IN that_IN it_PRP should_MD not_RB be_VB used_VBN on_IN grossly_RB septic_JJ wounds_NNS ._.
The_DT sulphonamide_NN drugs_NNS which_WDT are_VBP chiefly_NN in_IN use_NN at_IN the_DT present_JJ time_NN are_VBP sulphanilamide_RB ,_, sulphapyridine_NN (_( M_NNP &_CC B_NNP 693_CD )_) and_CC sulphathiazole_NN ._.
Sulphanilamide_NNP is_VBZ capable_JJ of_IN dealing_VBG with_IN most_JJS hæmolytic_JJ streptococcus_NN infections_NNS ,_, is_VBZ active_JJ against_IN Cl_NNP ._.
welchii_NN ,_, meningococci_NN ,_, gonococci_NN ,_, Bact_NNP ._.

Sulphapyridine_NNP is_VBZ active_JJ against_IN hæmolytic_JJ streptococci_NN ,_, pneumococci_NN and_CC Cl_NNP ._.

Sulphathiazole_NNP is_VBZ not_RB only_RB active_JJ against_IN hæmolytic_JJ streptococci_NN but_CC is_VBZ also_RB definitely_RB better_RBR than_IN the_DT other_JJ two_CD against_IN staphylococcus_NN infections_NNS ._.
Finally_RB ,_, it_PRP is_VBZ to_TO be_VB noted_VBN that_IN among_IN bac-_JJ teria_NNS belonging_VBG to_TO susceptible_JJ species_NNS drug-resistant_JJ strains_NNS are_VBP sometimes_RB met_VBN with_IN ._.
An_DT apposite_JJ illustration_NN of_IN this_DT was_VBD recently_RB reported_VBN by_IN Hendry_NNP [_NNP 1942_CD ]_NNP ._.
A_DT horse_NN undergoing_VBG immunization_NN with_IN group_NN A_NNP hæmolytic_JJ streptococci_NN developed_VBD a_DT streptococcus_NN septicæmia_NN and_CC died_VBD in_IN spite_NN of_IN 10_CD days_NNS treatment_NN with_IN sulphanilamide_NN ._.
The_DT streptococci_NN isolated_VBD from_IN the_DT blood_NN of_IN the_DT animal_NN ,_, the_DT day_NN before_IN its_PRP$ death_NN were_VBD considerably_RB more_RBR resistant_JJ to_TO sul-_JJ phanilamide_NN by_IN in_IN vitro_NN tests_NNS than_IN were_VBD the_DT organisms_NNS used_VBN for_IN immunization_NN ._.
Since_IN the_DT early_JJ days_NNS when_WRB prontosil_NN was_VBD found_VBN to_TO be_VB efficient_JJ in_IN reducing_VBG the_DT mortality_NN in_IN human_JJ puerperal_JJ fever_NN ,_, it_PRP has_VBZ become_VBN apparent_JJ that_IN the_DT sulphonamides_NNS are_VBP of_IN value_NN in_IN a_DT number_NN of_IN other_JJ human_JJ infections_NNS ,_, streptococcal_JJ and_CC otherwise_RB ,_, particularly_RB the_DT more_RBR acute_JJ class_NN of_IN disease_NN ._.
However_RB ,_, their_PRP$ efficacy_NN has_VBZ not_RB been_VBN proved_VBN in_IN all_DT cases_NNS ,_, e.g_NN ._.
French_JJ [_NN 1939_CD ]_NN in_IN a_DT series_NN of_IN painstaking_VBG and_CC controlled_VBD observations_NNS was_VBD unable_JJ to_TO demonstrate_VB any_DT useful_JJ action_NN in_IN scarlet_NN fever_NN ._.
All_DT careful_JJ practitioners_NNS realize_VBP that_IN the_DT drug_NN should_MD be_VB given_VBN as_RB early_RB as_IN possible_JJ ,_, in_IN full_JJ dosage_NN ,_, at_IN proper_JJ inter-_JJ vals_NNS ,_, and_CC for_IN a_DT sufficient_JJ length_NN of_IN time_NN ,_, say_VBP up_RB to_TO 10_CD days_NNS ._.
Continuation_NN without_IN an_DT interval_JJ beyond_IN this_DT time_NN may_MD lead_VB to_TO leucopenia_VB and_CC anæmia_VB ._.
If_IN relapses_NNS appear_VBP ,_, dosing_VBG should_MD be_VB recommended_VBN ._.
Water_NNP intake_NN should_MD be_VB restricted_VBN and_CC medicines_NNS containing_VBG sulphur_JJ withheld_NN ._.
It_PRP is_VBZ good_JJ practice_NN if_IN possible_JJ to_TO make_VB periodic_JJ estimations_NNS of_IN the_DT sulphonamide_JJ concentration_NN in_IN the_DT blood_NN ,_, since_IN the_DT rate_NN of_IN absorption_NN and_CC excretion_NN varies_NNS some-_VBP what_WP in_IN different_JJ individuals_NNS ._.
Bazeley_NNP ,_, Jokobowicz_NNP and_CC Splatt_NNP [_NNP 1940_CD ]_NNP give_VB a_DT convenient_NN dosage_NN table_NN for_IN horses_NNS ._.

The_DT foregoing_NN results_NNS are_VBP liable_JJ to_TO be_VB regarded_VBN as_IN having_VBG failed_VBN to_TO establish_VB conclusively_RB that_IN A._NNP pullorum_NN was_VBD trans-_JJ mitted_VBN by_IN A._NN persicus_NN ,_, inasmuch_JJ as_IN the_DT cage_NN ,_, in_IN which_WDT the_DT experimental_NN chickens_NNS were_VBD kept_VBN ,_, was_VBD not_RB proof_VBN against_IN other_JJ biting_VBG arthropods_NNS (_( e.g_NN ._.
mosquitoes_NNS )_) whilst_NN ,_, as_IN already_RB mentioned_VBN ,_, one_CD of_IN the_DT chickens_NNS had_VBD ,_, in_IN addition_NN ,_, received_VBD an_DT injection_NN of_IN infected_JJ blood_NN ._.
However_RB ,_, in_IN view_NN of_IN the_DT experience_NN of_IN previous_JJ workers_NNS [_VBP Bedford_NNP and_CC Coles_NNP ,_, 1933_CD ]_NN and_CC the_DT appearance_NN of_IN A._NN pullorum_NN in_IN peripheral_JJ blood_NN after_IN the_DT lapse_NN of_IN an_DT incubation_NN period_NN of_IN 14_CD days_NNS ,_, it_PRP seems_VBZ highly_RB probable_JJ that_IN tick_JJ bites_NNS were_VBD the_DT source_NN of_IN infection_NN in_IN these_DT chickens_NNS ._.
*_JJ Subsequent_NNP observantions_NNS showed_VBD that_IN this_DT injection_NN did_VBD not_RB have_VB any_DT effect_NN on_IN the_DT course_NN of_IN the_DT disease_NN in_IN this_DT chicken_NN as_RB compared_VBN to_TO its_PRP$ companion_NN ._.
Bedford_NNP and_CC Coles_NNP [_NNP 1933_CD ]_NNP have_VBP experi-_JJ mentally_RB established_VBN that_IN Argas_NNP persicus_NN can_MD transmit_VB aegyptianellosis_NN to_TO healthy_JJ fowls_NN with_IN an_DT incubation_NN period_NN of_IN 12_CD to_TO 15_CD days_NNS and_CC that_IN the_DT ticks_NNS may_MD remain_VB infective_JJ for_IN at_IN least_JJS 162_CD days_NNS ._.
The_DT presence_NN of_IN Coles_NNP '_POS haematozoon_NN in_IN fowls_JJ living_NN in_IN tick-free_JJ fowl_NN houses_NNS apparently_RB shows_VBZ that_IN it_PRP is_VBZ transmitted_VBN by_IN an_DT agent_NN other_JJ than_IN Argas_NNP ._.
Coles_NNS [_VBP 1937_CD ]_NNP also_RB recorded_VBD this_DT parasite_NN from_IN the_DT vici-_JJ nity_NN of_IN New_NNP York_NNP where_WRB ,_, according_VBG to_TO him_PRP ,_, Argas_NNP was_VBD not_RB likely_JJ to_TO occur_VB ._.
SYMPTOMS_NNP AND_NNP BLOOD_NNP CHANGES_NNP It_PRP will_MD be_VB seen_VBN from_IN what_WP is_VBZ stated_VBN above_IN that_DT piroplasms_NN (_( A._NNP pullorum_NN and_CC Coles_NNP '_POS haematozoon_NN )_) do_VBP not_RB ,_, as_IN a_DT rule_NN ,_, set_VBN up_RP any_DT appreciable_JJ symptoms_NNS in_IN adult_NN indigenous_JJ fowls_NN or_CC adult_NN fowls_NN of_IN the_DT White_NNP Leghorn_NNP breed_NN which_WDT had_VBD lived_VBN for_IN several_JJ generations_NNS in_IN India_NNP ._.
In_IN the_DT blood_NN of_IN these_DT adult_NN birds_VBD the_DT piroplasms_NNS exist_VBP in_IN small_JJ numbers_NNS ._.
In_IN the_DT case_NN of_IN one_CD bird_NN an_DT attack_NN of_IN natural_JJ spirochaetosis_NN did_VBD not_RB resuscitate_VB the_DT piroplasms_NN ;_: this_DT disease_NN was_VBD ,_, however_RB ,_, treated_VBD quite_RB soon_RB after_IN its_PRP$ appearance_NN in_IN the_DT bird_NN ._.
In_IN the_DT case_NN of_IN two_CD six_CD weeks_NNS '_POS old_JJ White_NNP Leghorn_NNP chickens_NNS which_WDT showed_VBD A._NNP pullo-_JJ rum_NN following_VBG tick_NN bites_NNS ,_, clinical_JJ symptoms_NNS associated_VBN with_IN the_DT infection_NN were_VBD studied_VBN ._.
Both_DT these_DT birds_NNS first_RB suffered_VBD from_IN a_DT mild_JJ attack_NN of_IN spirochaetosis_NN which_WDT they_PRP survived_VBD without_IN any_DT treatment_NN ._.
A._NNP pull_NN )_) -_: rum_NN first_RB appeared_VBD in_IN their_PRP$ blood_NN 14_CD days_NNS after_IN the_DT first_JJ bites_NNS of_IN infected_JJ ticks_NNS ._.
At_IN this_DT time_NN the_DT only_RB symptoms_NNS noticed_VBN were_VBD slight_JJ dullness_NN and_CC anorexia_NN ._.
Blood_NNP exa-_JJ mination_NN at_IN this_DT stage_NN revealed_VBD 43_CD per_IN cent_NN of_IN erythrocytes_NNS to_TO be_VB infected_VBN ._.
A_DT week_NN later_RB ,_, sleepiness_NN ,_, dullness_NN ,_, emaciation_NN and_CC anaemia_NN became_VBD well_RB marked_VBN and_CC the_DT appetite_NN capricious_JJ ._.
The_DT comb_NN was_VBD quite_RB blanched_VBN and_CC the_DT blood_NN when_WRB drawn_NN out_IN of_IN a_DT needle_JJ prick_NN was_VBD noticed_VBN to_TO be_VB dis-_JJ tinctly_RB watery_NN ._.
Body_NN temperature_NN showed_VBD a_DT constant_JJ rise_NN by_IN 1.0º_CD F._NNP or_CC so_RB ._.
Micros-_NNP copic_NN examination_NN of_IN blood_NN revealed_VBD a_DT heavy_JJ infestation_NN of_IN the_DT red_JJ blood_NN cells_NNS (_( 60_CD per_IN cent_NN )_) with_IN merozoits_NNS ,_, small_JJ and_CC 20_CD Piroplasmosis_NN of_IN the_DT Demestic_NNP Fowl_NNP large_JJ rings_NNS ,_, and_CC 'rosette_NNP '_POS forms_NNS of_IN A._NN pullorum_NN ._.
The_DT erythrocytes_NNS showed_VBD dis-_JJ tinct_JJ polychromatia_NN but_CC it_PRP was_VBD notable_JJ that_IN only_RB the_DT non-infected_JJ red_JJ cells_NNS had_VBD undergone_NN this_DT change_NN ._.
Coles_NNS '_POS haemato-_JJ zoon_NN was_VBD also_RB present_JJ in_IN small_JJ numbers_NNS and_CC seemed_VBD to_TO have_VB undergone_JJ no_DT appa-_JJ rent_NN change_NN in_IN numbers_NNS as_IN a_DT result_NN of_IN the_DT bites_NNS of_IN infected_JJ ticks_NNS ._.
The_DT symptoms_NNS described_VBN above_IN ,_, particularly_RB anæmia_NN and_CC emaciation_NN ,_, progressed_VBD till_JJ death_NN occurred_VBD 27_CD days_NNS after_IN the_DT first_JJ appearance_NN of_IN A._NN pullorum_NN in_IN one_CD case_NN and_CC 30_CD days_NNS in_IN the_DT other_JJ ._.
Diarrhoea_NNP was_VBD noticed_VBN two_CD days_NNS before_IN death_NN ._.
No_DT signs_NNS of_IN paralysis_NN were_VBD noticed_VBN in_IN the_DT legs_NN or_CC wings_NNS ._.
It_PRP may_MD be_VB mentioned_VBN that_IN mortality_NN from_IN aegyptianellosis_NN has_VBZ been_VBN also_RB re-_JJ corded_VBD from_IN many_JJ other_JJ countries_NNS ._.
Carpano_NNP [_NN 1929_CD ]_NNP originally_RB described_VBD ruffl-_JJ ed_NN feathers_NNS ,_, fever_RB ,_, loss_NN of_IN appetite_JJ ,_, drowsi-_JJ ness_NN ,_, paralysis_NN and_CC death_NN as_IN symptomatic_NN of_IN the_DT disease_NN among_IN the_DT imported_VBN fowls_NN in_IN Egypt_NNP ._.
A_DT fatal_JJ form_NN of_IN toe_JJ disease_NN was_VBD also_RB reported_VBN by_IN Donatien_NNP and_CC Lesto-_NNP quard_NNP [_NNP 1931_CD ]_NN from_IN Algeria_NNP ,_, Gillain_NNP [_NNP 1935_CD ]_NN from_IN Belgian_JJ Congo_NNP ,_, Debonera_NNP [_NN 1933_CD ]_NN from_IN Greece_NNP and_CC Yakimoff_NNP [_NNP 1933_CD ]_NN from_IN the_DT U._NNP S._NNP S._NNP R._NNP Coles_NNP [_NNP 1933_CD ]_NNP described_VBD loss_NN of_IN appetite_NN ,_, dejection_NN ,_, diarrhoea_NN and_CC some-_JJ times_NNS icterus_VBP as_IN symptomatic_NN of_IN the_DT disease_NN in_IN young_JJ chickens_NNS which_WDT had_VBD become_VBN infected_JJ during_IN the_DT first_JJ few_JJ days_NNS of_IN life_NN ._.
Paralysis_NN and_CC fever_NN reported_VBN by_IN Carpano_NNP [_NNP 1929_CD ]_NNP as_IN characteristic_NN of_IN the_DT disease_NN were_VBD not_RB noticed_VBN by_IN the_DT writer_NN ._.
The_DT factors_NNS governing_VBG the_DT pathogeni-_JJ city_NN of_IN A_NNP ,_, pullorum_NN do_VBP not_RB appear_VB to_TO be_VB properly_RB understood_JJ ,_, but_CC age_NN and_CC immuni-_JJ ty_NN ,_, possibly_RB due_JJ to_TO contact_VB with_IN A._NNP persi-_JJ cus_NN seem_VBP to_TO play_VB some_DT part_NN in_IN its_PRP$ deter-_JJ mination_NN ._.
Thus_RB ,_, fowls_RB imported_VBN from_IN countries_NNS free_VBP from_IN Argas_NNP ,_, and_CC among_IN them_PRP the_DT younger_JJR birds_NNS ,_, appear_VBP to_TO suffer_VB most_JJS ._.
POST-MORTEM_JJ APPEARANCES_NNP The_DT carcases_NNS of_IN both_DT the_DT chickens_NNS showed_VBD similar_JJ anatomical_JJ changes_NNS ._.
There_EX was_VBD a_DT well-marked_JJ thinness_NN of_IN muscles_NNS and_CC general_JJ anaemia_NN ;_: the_DT body_NN cavity_NN contained_VBD a_DT slightly_RB blood-tinged_JJ serous_JJ fluid_NN and_CC its_PRP$ walls_NNS were_VBD sparsely_RB petechiated_VBN ;_: the_DT spleen_NN was_VBD enlarged_VBN to_TO about_IN three_CD times_NNS its_PRP$ normal_JJ size_NN ,_, its_PRP$ parenchyma_NN being_VBG purplish_JJ in_IN colour_NN ;_: the_DT liver_NN was_VBD also_RB enlarged_VBN and_CC appeared_VBN to_TO be_VB more_RBR friable_JJ ;_: the_DT pericardial_JJ sac_NN con-_NN tained_VBD a_DT slightly_RB blood-tinged_JJ fluid_NN and_CC the_DT epicardium_NN showed_VBD a_DT few_JJ petechiae_NN ;_: and_CC the_DT alimentary_JJ canal_NN showed_VBD nothing_NN un-_JJ usual_JJ ._.
Smears_NNS of_IN heart_NN blood_NN showed_VBD numerous_JJ A._NNP pullorum_NN (_( 86_CD per_IN cent_NN ery-_NN throcytes_NNS were_VBD infected_VBN )_) and_CC an_DT almost_RB similar_JJ infestation_NN was_VBD found_VBN in_IN smears_NNS from_IN the_DT lungs_NNS ,_, liver_NN and_CC spleen_NN ._.
Poly-_JJ chromatia_NN was_VBD noticeable_JJ in_IN all_PDT the_DT smears_NNS ._.
Coles_NNS [_VBP 1933_CD ]_NN has_VBZ mentioned_VBN icterus_RB as_IN one_CD of_IN the_DT changes_NNS in_IN his_PRP$ cases_NNS ,_, but_CC this_DT change_NN was_VBD not_RB observed_VBN by_IN the_DT present_JJ writer_NN ._.
TREATMENT_NNP During_IN the_DT treatment_NN of_IN the_DT first_JJ White_NNP Leghorn_NNP hen_NN for_IN spirochaetosis_NN (_( supra_NN )_) it_PRP was_VBD noticed_VBN that_IN an_DT intramus-_JJ cular_JJ injection_NN of_IN soamin_NN (_( 1.5_CD grain_NN )_) did_VBD not_RB have_VB any_DT effect_NN on_IN A._NN pullorum_NN or_CC Coles_NNP '_POS haematozoon_NN ,_, although_IN the_DT treatment_NN caused_VBD the_DT disappearance_NN of_IN Spirochaeta_NNP anserinum_NN ._.
A_DT second_JJ injection_NN of_IN soamin_NN (_( 1_CD grain_NN )_) given_VBN to_TO the_DT same_JJ hen_NN two_CD days_NNS later_RB also_RB failed_VBD to_TO have_VB any_DT effect_NN ._.
According_VBG to_TO Hutyra_NNP ,_, Marek_NNP and_CC Man-_NNP ninger_NN [_NN 1938_CD ]_NN ,_, Stovarsol_NNP in_IN doses_NNS of_IN five_CD centigrammes_NNS per_IN os_NN has_VBZ a_DT favourable_JJ effect_NN on_IN anaemia_NN ,_, although_IN it_PRP does_VBZ not_RB kill_VB the_DT parasites_NNS (_( A._NNP pullorum_NN )_) ._.
Dona-_NNP tien_NN and_CC Lestoquard_NNP [_NNP 1934_CD ]_NNP studied_VBD the_DT effect_NN of_IN Stovarsol_NNP ,_, Gonacrine_NNP ,_, Trypan_NNP Blue_NNP and_CC Icthargan_NNP on_IN affected_JJ pullets_NNS ._.
They_PRP found_VBD that_IN Stovarsol_NNP was_VBD useful_JJ in_IN cases_NNS of_IN anaemia_NN only_RB and_CC among_IN the_DT other_JJ drugs_NNS Icthargan_NNP was_VBD efficacious_JJ only_RB after_IN a_DT second_JJ injection_NN ._.
In_IN the_DT hands_NNS of_IN Curas-_NNP son_NN [_NN 1938_CD ]_NN ,_, however_RB ,_, two_CD intra-muscular_JJ injections_NNS of_IN Gonacrine_NNP gave_VBD the_DT best_JJS results_NNS ._.
On_IN the_DT whole_NN ,_, therefore_RB ,_, the_DT position_NN regarding_VBG the_DT chemotherapy_NN of_IN aegyptianellosis_NN must_MD be_VB regarded_VBN as_IN unsatisfactory_NN ._.
SUMMARY_NNP 1_CD ._.
The_DT occurrence_NN of_IN Aegytianella_NNP pullorum_NN Carpano_NNP and_CC of_IN a_DT haematozoon_NN M._NNP ABDUSSALAM_NNP 21_CD esembling_VBG that_IN described_VBN by_IN Coles_NNP [_NNP 1937_CD ]_NNP fowls_NN has_VBZ been_VBN recorded_VBN from_IN northern_JJ ndia_NN ._.
2_CD ._.
These_DT haematozoa_NNS did_VBD not_RB appear_VB to_TO et_VB up_RP any_DT appreciable_JJ disease_NN symptoms_NNS n_IN the_DT adult_NN indigenous_JJ fowls_NN or_CC acclima-_JJ ized_JJ imported_VBN breeds_NNS ._.
3_CD ._.
In_IN an_DT attempt_NN to_TO experimentally_RB ecover_VB A._NNP pullorum_NN from_IN naturally_RB infect-_JJ d_NN ticks_NNS (_( Argas_NNP persicus_NN )_) ,_, two_CD Leghorn_NNP chickens_NNS were_VBD exposed_VBN to_TO the_DT tick_NN bites_NNS ._.
These_DT birds_NNS suffered_VBD from_IN a_DT mild_JJ attack_NN of_IN spirochaetosis_NN on_IN the_DT 6th_CD day_NN and_CC re-_NN overed_VBD ;_: on_IN the_DT 14th_CD day_NN they_PRP ,_, however_RB ,_, howed_VBD A._NNP pullorum_NN in_IN their_PRP$ peripheral_JJ lood_NN ._.
4_CD ._.
The_DT symptoms_NNS shown_VBN by_IN infected_JJ chickens_NNS were_VBD a_DT progressive_JJ anaemia_NN and_CC maciation_NN ,_, slight_JJ rise_NN of_IN temperature_NN ,_, lullness_NN ,_, diarrhoea_NN and_CC death_NN in_IN about_RB four_CD weeks_NNS '_POS time_NN ._.
The_DT main_JJ post-mortem_JJ indings_NNS were_VBD :_: the_DT enlargement_NN of_IN the_DT spleen_NN and_CC liver_NN ,_, petechiae_NN on_IN the_DT serous_JJ membranes_NNS ,_, slightly_RB blood-tinged_JJ fluid_NN in_IN erous_JJ cavities_NNS and_CC cachexia_NN ._.
5_CD ._.
Coles_NNP '_POS haematozoon_NN did_VBD not_RB appear_VB set_VBN up_RP any_DT disease_NN symptoms_NNS in_IN fowls_NN and_CC circumstantial_JJ evidence_NN showed_VBD that_IN his_PRP$ organism_NN was_VBD probably_RB transmitted_VBN by_IN in_IN agency_NN other_JJ than_IN the_DT fowl_NN tick_NN ._.
6_CD ._.
Soamin_NNP ,_, in_IN the_DT usual_JJ doses_NNS employed_VBN for_IN the_DT treatment_NN of_IN spirochaetosis_NN ,_, was_VBD found_VBN to_TO have_VB no_DT effect_NN either_RB on_IN A._NN pul-_JJ orum_NN or_CC Coles_NNP '_POS haematozoon_NN ._.

10_CD ,_, 153_CD FEEDING_NNP VALUE_NNP OF_NNP FUZZY_NNP AMERICAN_NNP COTTON_NNP SEEDS_NNP AS_NNP COMPARED_NNP WITH_NNP DESI_NNP COTTON_NNP SEEDS_NNP FOR_NNP MILCH_NNP BUFFALOES_NNP By_IN P._NNP E._NNP LANDER_NNP ,_, M.A._NNP ,_, D.Sc._NNP ,_, F.R.I.C._NNP ,_, I.A.S._NNP ,_, Agricultural_NNP Chemist_NNP to_TO Government_NNP ,_, Punjab_NNP and_CC LAL_NNP CHAND_NNP DHARMANI_NNP ,_, LAG._NNP ,_, B.Sc_NNP ._.
(_( Agri_NNP ._.
)_) ,_, A.R.I.C._NNP ,_, Assistan_NNP to_TO Agricultural_NNP Chemist_NNP to_TO Government_NNP ,_, Punjab_NNP ,_, Lyallpur_NNP (_( Received_VBN for_IN publication_NN on_IN 7_CD March_NNP 1944_CD )_) THERE_WDT have_VBP been_VBN in_IN the_DT past_JJ and_CC there_EX still_RB are_VBP to-day_JJ many_JJ prejudices_NNS amongst_VBP zemindars_NNS against_IN using_VBG fuzzy_JJ American_JJ cotton_NN seeds_NNS as_IN a_DT feeding_NN stuff_NN ._.
These_DT prejudices_NNS may_MD briefly_VB be_VB summarized_VBN as_IN follows_VBZ :_: 1_CD ._.
Fuzzy_NNP cotton_NN seed_NN is_VBZ low_JJ in_IN fat_NN in_IN com-_JJ parison_NN with_IN naked_JJ seed_NN ,_, and_CC conse-_NNS quently_RB the_DT output_NN of_IN ghee_NN from_IN buffa-_NN loes_NNS fed_VBN on_IN it_PRP is_VBZ reduced_VBN ._.
2_CD ._.
This_DT seed_NN is_VBZ considered_VBN to_TO be_VB indiges-_JJ tible_JJ or_CC harmful_JJ to_TO the_DT digestive_JJ sys-_JJ tem_NN of_IN animals_NNS ._.
3_CD ._.
Fuzzy_NNP seed_NN has_VBZ a_DT smaller_JJR kernel_NN than_IN other_JJ cotton_NN seed_NN and_CC this_DT reduces_VBZ its_PRP$ nutritive_JJ value_NN and_CC adversely_RB affects_VBZ the_DT fat_JJ content_NN of_IN the_DT milk_NN produced_VBN ._.
4_CD ._.
It_PRP reduces_VBZ the_DT quantity_NN of_IN milk_NN secre-_JJ ted_VBN ._.
5_CD ._.
Some_DT people_NNS go_VBP so_RB far_RB as_IN to_TO say_VB that_IN the_DT teats_NNS of_IN milch_NN animals_NNS become_VBP clogged_VBN up_RP if_IN they_PRP are_VBP fed_VBN on_IN this_DT seed_NN for_IN any_DT length_NN of_IN time_NN ._.
6_CD ._.
Its_PRP$ food_NN value_NN is_VBZ lower_JJR than_IN that_DT of_IN other_JJ cotton_NN seed_NN ._.
7_CD ._.
Cattle_NNS do_VBP not_RB relish_VB the_DT seed_NN because_IN of_IN its_PRP$ fuzziness_NN ._.
Work_NN has_VBZ been_VBN carried_VBN out_RP at_IN Lyallpur_NNP in_IN the_DT past_NN on_IN heifers_NNS with_IN various_JJ types_NNS of_IN cotton_NN seeds_NNS including_VBG the_DT fuzzy_JJ American_JJ types_NNS ._.

B_NNP too_RB P._NNP E._NNP LANDER_NNP AND_NNP LAL_NNP CHAND_NNP DHARMANI_NNP 27_CD uzzy_JJ cotton_NN seed_NN fed_VBN animals_NNS and_CC desi_NNS eed_VBP fed_VBN animals_NNS respectively_RB were_VBD sent_VBN o_RB 20_CD members_NNS of_IN the_DT Committee_NNP to_TO fford_VB them_PRP an_DT opportunity_NN to_TO form_VB their_PRP$ wn_JJ opinion_NN ._.

SCIENTIFIC_NNP DATA_NNP REGARDING_NNP THE_NNP GHEES_NNP Table_NNP III_NNP shows_VBZ the_DT complete_JJ analysis_NN of_IN the_DT ghee_NN made_VBD from_IN the_DT milk_NN of_IN the_DT respective_JJ groups_NNS of_IN animals_NNS throughout_IN the_DT year_NN ._.
In_IN March_NNP 1943_CD ,_, a_DT composite_JJ sample_NN of_IN ghee_NN made_VBN from_IN the_DT milk_NN of_IN the_DT animals_NNS of_IN each_DT of_IN the_DT three_CD groups_NNS was_VBD sent_VBN to_TO Sir_NNP Sorab_NNP Saklatvala_NNP of_IN the_DT Tata_NNP Oil_NNP Mils_NNP ,_, Bombay_NNP ._.
Their_PRP$ Chemist_NN found_VBD that_IN his_PRP$ Polenske_NNP values_NNS were_VBD somewhat_RB lower_JJR than_IN the_DT corresponding_JJ Lyallpur_NNP figures_NNS ._.
In_IN this_DT connection_NN it_PRP is_VBZ interesting_VBG to_TO note_VB the_DT correlation_NN which_WDT should_MD exist_VB between_IN the_DT Reichert_NNP Meissl_NNP values_NNS and_CC the_DT Polenske_NNP values_NNS as_IN given_VBN on_IN page_NN 379_CD of_IN Vol_NNP ._.
II_NNP ,_, Oils_NNP and_CC Fats_NNP of_IN Allen_NNP 's_POS Commercial_NNP Organic_NNP Analysis_NNP and_CC the_DT corresponding_JJ correlations_NNS in_IN these_DT values_NNS as_IN seen_VBN from_IN the_DT Lyallpur_NNP analysis_NN and_CC the_DT Tata_NNP analysis_NN respectively_RB ._.
The_DT analysis_NN of_IN the_DT ghee_NN sent_VBD showed_VBD certain_JJ deviations_NNS from_IN the_DT Government_NNP specifications_NNS ,_, which_WDT have_VBP been_VBN kept_VBN within_IN rigid_JJ limits_NNS to_TO safeguard_VB the_DT public_NN ._.
There_EX appeared_VBD to_TO be_VB nothing_NN in_IN the_DT ana-_JJ lytical_JJ figures_NNS to_TO show_VB that_IN the_DT ghee_NN made_VBD from_IN the_DT milk_NN of_IN the_DT fuzzy_NN and_CC naked_JJ cotton_NN seed_NN fed_VBD groups_NNS of_IN animals_NNS depart_VBP from_IN normal_JJ to_TO any_DT extent_NN which_WDT would_MD constitute_VB an_DT argument_NN against_IN either_DT ._.
Summing_VBG up_RP ,_, these_DT trials_NNS have_VBP shown_VBN that_IN the_DT prejudice_NN against_IN fuzzy_JJ cotton_NN seed_NN is_VBZ unfounded_JJ ,_, and_CC the_DT buffaloes_NNS fed_VBN on_IN the_DT rations_NNS indicated_VBD did_VBD not_RB suffer_VB on_IN that_DT account_NN (_( the_DT animal_NN which_WDT died_VBD was_VBD a_DT desi_JJ cotton_NN seed_NN fed_VBN animal_NN )_) and_CC neither_CC the_DT quantity_NN nor_CC quality_NN of_IN the_DT milk_NN or_CC ghee_JJ depart_NN from_IN normal_JJ to_TO any_DT extent_NN which_WDT could_MD cenceivably_RB be_VB held_VBN to_TO be_VB an_DT objection_NN ._.
This_DT evidence_NN ,_, and_CC the_DT published_VBN record_NN of_IN previous_JJ work_NN on_IN cows_NNS with_IN cotton_NN seed_NN and_CC cotton_NN seed_NN cake_NN should_MD be_VB brought_VBN to_TO the_DT notice_NN ,_, in_IN some_DT authoritative_JJ way_NN ,_, of_IN the_DT zamindar_NN com-_JJ munity_NN in_IN India_NNP ._.

REFERENCES_NNP Lander_NNP ,_, P._NNP E._NNP and_CC Dharmani_NNP ,_, Lal_NNP Chand_NNP (_( 1929_CD )_) ._.

10_CD ,_, No_DT ._.
6_CD PROTEINS_NNP FOR_NNP CHICKENS_NNP By_IN A.J_NNP ._.
MACDONALD_NNP and_CC S._NNP BOSE_NNP ,_, Poultry_NNP Research_NNP Section_NNP ,_, Imperial_NNP Veterinary_NNP Research_NNP Institute_NNP ,_, Izatnagar_NNP (_( Received_VBN for_IN publication_NN on_IN 20_CD June_NNP 1944_CD )_) IN_NNP earlier_RBR experiments_NNS ,_, Macdonald_NNP [_NNP 1943_CD ]_NNP concluded_VBD that_IN meat_NN offal_NN (_( intes-_JJ tines_NNS )_) can_MD be_VB used_VBN as_IN an_DT effective_JJ sub-_JJ stitute_NN for_IN milk_NN in_IN the_DT ration_NN of_IN chickens_NNS ._.
As_IN in_IN many_JJ parts_NNS of_IN the_DT country_NN separat-_JJ ed_NN and_CC other_JJ milk_NN products_NNS are_VBP relatively_RB expensive_JJ ,_, it_PRP was_VBD decided_VBN to_TO carry_VB out_RP a_DT further_JJ comparison_NN in_IN order_NN to_TO test_VB the_DT relative_JJ values_NNS of_IN meat_NN offal_NN and_CC sep-_NN arated_JJ milk_NN ._.
As_IN cereal_NN diets_NNS without_IN pro-_JJ tein_NN supplements_NNS normally_RB result_VBP in_IN high_JJ mortality_NN when_WRB fed_NN to_TO young_JJ chickens_NNS ,_, and_CC ,_, as_IN in_IN previous_JJ experiment_NN ,_, a_DT cereal_NN diet_JJ supplemented_VBN with_IN salt_NN ,_, green_JJ food_NN and_CC calcium_NN gave_VBD comparatively_RB low_JJ mortality_NN ,_, the_DT new_JJ experiment_NN was_VBD designed_VBN to_TO throw_VB more_JJR light_NN on_IN the_DT value_NN of_IN common_JJ salt_NN in_IN the_DT diet_NN of_IN birds_NNS fed_VBN on_IN low_JJ protein_NN diets_NNS ._.
METHODS_NNP Stock_NNP ._.
A_DT total_NN of_IN 296_CD White_NNP Leghorn_NNP X_NNP Rhode_NNP Island_NNP Red_NNP chickens_NNS hatched_VBD in_IN November_NNP 1942_CD were_VBD divided_VBN into_IN four_CD comparable_JJ groups_NNS and_CC fed_VBN on_IN the_DT experi-_JJ mental_JJ diets_NNS for_IN a_DT period_NN of_IN 20_CD weeks_NNS ._.
Feeding_VBG ._.
All_PDT the_DT birds_NNS were_VBD fed_VBN on_IN a_DT basal_NN mash_NN consisting_NN of_IN wheat_NN bran_NN 50_CD parts_NNS ,_, yellow_JJ maize_NN meal_NN 30_CD parts_NNS and_CC ground_NN oats_NNS 20_CD parts_NNS ._.
During_IN the_DT first_JJ eight_CD weeks_NNS ,_, the_DT birds_NNS were_VBD fed_VBN a_DT grain_NN ration_NN of_IN equal_JJ parts_NNS maize_NN ,_, jowar_NN and_CC cheena_NN ._.
From_IN 8-20_JJ weeks_NNS the_DT grain_NN ration_NN consisted_VBD of_IN equal_JJ parts_NNS yellow_JJ maize_NN ,_, wheat_NN and_CC paddy_NN ._.
The_DT grain_NN was_VBD fed_VBN at_IN 7_CD a.m._NN and_CC 4-30_CD p.m._NN throughout_IN the_DT ex-_JJ periment_NN ._.
Broken_NNP limestone_NN was_VBD supplied_VBN ad_NN libitum_NN and_CC succulent_NN green_JJ food_NN (_( ber-_JJ seem_NN )_) was_VBD fed_VBN liberally_RB once_RB daily_JJ during_IN the_DT whole_JJ experimental_JJ period_NN ._.
The_DT mash_NN was_VBD fed_VBN daily_RB in_IN a_DT wet_NN ,_, crumbly_RB state_NN according_VBG to_TO appetite_VB at_IN 9_CD a.m._RB ,_, 12_CD noon_NN and_CC 3_CD p.m._NN Group_NNP I_PRP was_VBD fed_VBN the_DT basal_NN ration_NN only_RB ._.
Group_NNP II_NNP received_VBD the_DT same_JJ ration_NN as_IN Group_NNP I_PRP with_IN the_DT addition_NN of_IN 1_CD per_IN cent_NN common_JJ salt_NN to_TO the_DT mash_NN ._.
Group_NNP III_NNP was_VBD fed_VBN the_DT basal_NN mash_NN plus_CC 0.5_CD per_IN cent_NN salt_NN and_CC the_DT mash_NN made_VBD up_RP with_IN separated_VBN milk_NN instead_RB of_IN water_NN ._.
Separated_VBN milk_NN was_VBD also_RB given_VBN ad_NN libitum_NN during_IN the_DT first_JJ 12_CD weeks_NNS ,_, whilst_NN separated_VBD milk_NN and_CC water_NN in_IN separate_JJ containers_NNS were_VBD supplied_VBN from_IN 12-20._JJ weeks_NNS ._.
Group_NNP IV_NNP was_VBD fed_VBN the_DT basal_NN mash_NN plus_CC 1_CD per_IN cent_NN common_JJ salt_NN and_CC meat_NN offal_NN (_( cleaned_VBN intestines_NNS from_IN the_DT slaughter_NN house_NN )_) ._.
The_DT amount_NN of_IN meat_NN offal_NN fed_NN was_VBD regulated_VBN ,_, so_IN that_IN the_DT pro-_JJ tein_NN content_NN of_IN the_DT ration_NN was_VBD approxi-_JJ mately_RB the_DT same_JJ as_IN that_DT fed_VBZ to_TO the_DT birds_NNS receiving_VBG separated_VBN milk_NN (_( Group_NNP III_NNP )_) ._.
The_DT quantity_NN of_IN meat_NN offal_NN required_VBN every_DT day_NN was_VBD cooked_VBN for_IN one_CD hour_NN in_IN a_DT small_JJ quan-_JJ tity_NN of_IN water_NN and_CC run_VB through_IN a_DT mincing_NN machine_NN prior_RB to_TO mixing_VBG with_IN the_DT mash_NN ._.

Rate_NN of_IN growth_NN ._.
The_DT chickens_NNS were_VBD weighed_VBN individually_RB at_IN fortnightly_RB inter-_JJ vals_NNS ._.
The_DT average_JJ weights_NNS of_IN the_DT males_NNS and_CC females_NNS from_IN 1-9_JJ weeks_NNS and_CC the_DT females_NNS from_IN 11-21_JJ weeks_NNS are_VBP given_VBN in_IN Table_NNP I_PRP ._.

DISCUSSION_NNP The_DT rate_NN of_IN growth_NN of_IN the_DT birds_NNS in_IN both_DT the_DT groups_NNS without_IN protein_NN supplements_NNS was_VBD very_RB much_JJ lower_JJR than_IN that_DT of_IN the_DT two_CD groups_NNS receiving_VBG the_DT protein_NN supplements_NNS ._.
The_DT slow_JJ rate_NN of_IN growth_NN in_IN Groups_NNP I_PRP and_CC II_NNP was_VBD most_JJS marked_JJ during_IN periods_NNS 1_CD and_CC 2_CD (_( 1-9_JJ weeks_NNS )_) ,_, so_RB in_IN the_DT period_NN when_WRB the_DT demand_NN for_IN protein_NN is_VBZ at_IN a_DT maximum_NN ._.
The_DT food_NN utilization_NN figures_NNS for_IN the_DT non-protein_JJ supplemented_JJ groups_NNS during_IN periods_NNS 1_CD and_CC 2_CD were_VBD much_RB inferior_JJ to_TO those_DT in_IN the_DT corresponding_JJ periods_NNS for_IN the_DT protein_NN supplemented_VBD groups_NNS ._.
Throughout_IN the_DT whole_JJ experiment_NN the_DT general_JJ health_NN and_CC appearance_NN of_IN the_DT birds_NNS in_IN Groups_NNP I_PRP and_CC II_NNP were_VBD much_RB inferior_JJ to_TO those_DT of_IN Groups_NNP III_NNP ahd_VBZ IV_NNP ._.
The_DT mortality_NN in_IN all_DT groups_NNS was_VBD low_JJ until_IN the_DT end_NN of_IN the_DT second_JJ period_NN ._.
As_IN would_MD be_VB expected_VBN with_IN chickens_NNS reared_VBN under_IN good_JJ environmental_JJ conditions_NNS ,_, no_DT death_NN occurred_VBD in_IN the_DT protein_NN supple-_JJ mented_JJ groups_NNS for_IN 9-21_JJ weeks_NNS ._.
On_IN the_DT other_JJ hand_NN ,_, Groups_NNP I_PRP and_CC II_NNP both_DT suffered_VBD substantial_JJ mortality_NN from_IN nine_CD weeks_NNS on-_JJ wards_NNS ._.
The_DT low_JJ mortality_NN in_IN Groups_NNP I_PRP and_CC II_NNP during_IN the_DT initial_JJ eight_CD weeks_NNS of_IN the_DT experiment_JJ period_NN seems_VBZ rather_RB surprising_JJ in_IN view_NN of_IN the_DT low_JJ protein_NN content_NN of_IN the_DT ration_NN ._.
The_DT low_JJ mortality_NN during_IN this_DT period_NN can_MD partly_RB be_VB attributed_VBN to_TO all_PDT the_DT birds_NNS having_VBG received_VBN well_RB balanced_JJ rations_NNS for_IN one_CD week_NN prior_RB to_TO commencing_VBG the_DT experiment_NN ._.
Further-_NNP more_RBR ,_, during_IN this_DT period_NN of_IN eight_CD weeks_NNS ,_, the_DT birds_NNS were_VBD well_RB protected_VBN against_IN the_DT weather_NN and_CC thus_RB did_VBD not_RB receive_VB any_DT further_JJ check_NN except_IN that_DT imposed_VBN by_IN the_DT diets_NNS fed_VBP ._.
From_IN 9-21_JJ weeks_NNS ,_, however_RB ,_, all_PDT the_DT groups_NNS were_VBD placed_VBN outside_IN in_IN houses_NNS which_WDT were_VBD more_RBR exposed_VBN to_TO weather_VB conditions_NNS and_CC this_DT ,_, in_IN addition_NN to_TO the_DT cumulative_JJ effect_NN of_IN deficient_NN feeding_NN in_IN 32_CD A._NNP J._NNP Macdonald_NNP and_CC S._NNP Bose_NNP the_DT case_NN Groups_NNP I_PRP and_CC II_NNP ,_, resulted_VBD in_IN a_DT certain_JJ amount_NN of_IN mortality_NN ._.
The_DT results_NNS obtained_VBD with_IN the_DT low_JJ pro-_JJ tein_NN diet_NN in_IN this_DT experiment_NN as_IN regards_NNS rates_NNS of_IN growth_NN ,_, food_NN utilization_NN and_CC mor-_JJ tality_NN are_VBP very_RB much_RB better_JJR than_IN those_DT reported_VBN by_IN Macdonald_NNP [_NNP 1941_CD ]_NNP on_IN a_DT simi-_JJ lar_JJ low_JJ protein_NN diet_NN ._.
In_IN this_DT experiment_NN ,_, however_RB ,_, the_DT birds_NNS received_VBD a_DT good_JJ initial_JJ diet_NN from_IN 0-1_JJ week_NN and_CC it_PRP is_VBZ very_RB probable_JJ that_IN this_DT good_JJ start_NN might_MD have_VB exerted_VBN a_DT very_RB beneficial_JJ influence_NN on_IN the_DT subsequent_JJ behaviour_NN of_IN the_DT chicks_NNS ._.
The_DT rate_NN of_IN growth_NN and_CC food_NN utilization_NN figures_NNS for_IN Groups_NNP I_PRP and_CC II_NNP were_VBD very_RB similar_JJ ._.
Whilst_NNP Group_NNP II_NNP had_VBD lower_JJR mortality_NN than_IN Group_NNP I_PRP ,_, it_PRP would_MD be_VB unsafe_JJ to_TO conclude_VB from_IN this_DT that_IN the_DT addition_NN of_IN salt_NN lowered_VBN mortality_NN ,_, since_IN both_DT groups_NNS were_VBD similar_JJ in_IN appearance_NN at_IN all_DT stages_NNS ._.
The_DT failure_NN of_IN the_DT addition_NN of_IN salt_NN to_TO give_VB any_DT response_NN is_VBZ somewhat_RB surprising_JJ in_IN view_NN of_IN the_DT proved_JJ value_NN of_IN salt_JJ supple-_JJ ments_NNS in_IN rations_NNS containing_VBG only_RB vegetable_JJ proteins_NNS ._.
Mitchell_NNP and_CC Carman_NNP [_NNP 1926_CD ]_NNP demonstrated_VBD that_IN the_DT addition_NN of_IN common_JJ salt_NN to_TO a_DT diet_JJ mainly_RB composed_VBN of_IN maize_NN greatly_RB improved_VBD its_PRP$ value_NN ._.
Prentice_NNP and_CC Baskett_NNP [_NNP 1932_CD ]_NNP and_CC Prentice_NNP [_NNP 1933_CD ]_NNP found_VBD that_IN salt_NN was_VBD very_RB beneficial_JJ in_IN the_DT diet_NN of_IN chickens_NNS ._.
Robertson_NNP ,_, Orr_NNP ,_, Prentice_NNP and_CC Macdonald_NNP [_NNP 1930_CD ]_NNP demonstrated_VBD that_IN a_DT supplement_NN of_IN salt_NN was_VBD very_RB beneficial_JJ in_IN diets_NNS containing_VBG vegetable_JJ proteins_NNS only_RB ._.
In_IN this_DT experiment_NN ,_, however_RB ,_, the_DT protein_JJ level_NN of_IN the_DT ration_NN was_VBD lower_JJR than_IN that_DT in_IN the_DT experiments_NNS reviewed_VBN here_RB ._.
Further-_NNP more_RBR ,_, the_DT liberal_JJ feeding_NN of_IN berseem_NN ,_, which_WDT is_VBZ relatively_RB rich_JJ in_IN both_DT sodium_NN and_CC chlo-_JJ rine_NN ,_, should_MD have_VB helped_VBN to_TO make_VB good_JJ any_DT deficiency_NN of_IN both_DT sodium_NN and_CC chlorine_NN in_IN the_DT cereals_NNS ._.
Robertson_NNP ,_, Orr_NNP ,_, Prentice_NNP and_CC Macdonald_NNP [_NNP 1930_CD ]_NNP also_RB reported_VBD the_DT beneficial_JJ value_NN of_IN clover_NN in_IN a_DT vegetable_JJ protein_NN diet_JJ containing_VBG no_DT salt_NN supple-_JJ ment_NN ._.
During_IN the_DT major_JJ part_NN of_IN the_DT experi-_JJ ment_NN ,_, the_DT chickens_NNS on_IN the_DT separated_VBN milk_NN diet_NNS were_VBD slightly_RB heavier_JJR than_IN those_DT of_IN the_DT meat_NN diet_NN ._.
On_IN the_DT other_JJ hand_NN ,_, the_DT mea_NN group_NN made_VBD on_IN the_DT average_NN slightly_RB better_JJR utilization_NN of_IN the_DT food_NN consumed_VBN ._.
As_IN it_PRP previous_JJ work_NN ,_, Macdonald_NNP and_CC Bose_NNP [_NNP 1943_CD ]_NNP obtained_VBD slightly_RB better_JJR growth_NN results_NNS from_IN meat_NN offal_NN ,_, further_JJ exper_NN ments_NNS will_MD have_VB to_TO be_VB carried_VBN out_RP prior_JJ to_TO making_VBG any_DT final_JJ conclusion_NN in_IN regard_NN to_TO the_DT relative_JJ values_NNS of_IN separated_JJ milk_NN and_CC meat_NN offal_NN in_IN the_DT diet_NN of_IN growing_VBG chick_NN As_IN the_DT unit_NN of_IN protein_NN in_IN meat_NN offal_NNS normally_RB cheaper_JJR than_IN that_DT in_IN separate_JJ milk_NN it_PRP is_VBZ ,_, however_RB ,_, safe_JJ to_TO conclude_VB that_IN meat_NN offal_NN could_MD often_RB be_VB profitably_RB use_NN in_IN place_NN of_IN milk_NN in_IN the_DT diet_NN of_IN chikens_NNS ._.
CONCLUSIONS_NNP (_( 1_CD )_) A_DT mixed_JJ cereal_NN diet_JJ with_IN a_DT protein_NN content_NN of_IN 10.8_CD per_IN cent_NN plus_CC liberal_JJ amounts_NNS of_IN green_JJ food_NN and_CC calcium_NN unsatisfactory_NN for_IN growing_VBG chicken_NN especially_RB in_IN the_DT early_JJ stages_NNS of_IN growth_NN ._.
(_( 2_CD )_) Little_NNP or_CC no_DT benefit_NN is_VBZ derived_VBN supplementing_VBG the_DT above_JJ diet_NN with_IN commo_JJ salt_NN ._.
(_( 3_CD )_) Separated_VBN milk_NN and_CC meat_NN offal_VBP a_DT valuable_JJ protein_NN supplements_NNS for_IN chicken_NN (_( 4_CD )_) Meat_NN offal_NN can_MD often_RB be_VB used_VBN ve_NN profitably_RB as_IN a_DT substitute_NN for_IN separate_JJ milk_NN in_IN the_DT diet_NN of_IN chicks_NNS ._.

11_CD 207_CD STUDIES_NNPS IN_NNP SANITIZING_NNP DAIRY_NNP UTENSILS_NNP UNDER_NNP INDIAN_NNP CONDITIONS_NNP By_IN Zal_NNP R._NNP KOTHAVALLA_NNP ,_, M._NNP S._NNP PHERWANI_NNP and_CC E._NNP V._NNP SESHAGHARYULU_NNP ,_, Imperial_NNP Dairy_NNP Research_NNP Institute_NNP ,_, Bangalore_NNP ._.
(_( Received_VBN for_IN publication_NN on_IN 31_CD July_NNP 1943_CD )_) INTRODUCTION_NNP MILK_NNP ,_, which_WDT is_VBZ a_DT valuable_JJ human_JJ food_NN ,_, provides_VBZ a_DT favourable_JJ medium_NN for_IN the_DT growth_NN of_IN micro-organisms_NNS ._.
The_DT Bacte-_NNP ria_NN on_IN entering_VBG the_DT milk_NN multiply_NN at_IN a_DT rapid_JJ rate_NN if_IN the_DT temperature_NN is_VBZ favour-_JJ able_JJ to_TO them_PRP ,_, and_CC bring_VB about_RB undesirable_JJ chemical_NN changes_NNS ,_, as_IN a_DT result_NN of_IN which_WDT the_DT keeping_VBG quality_NN of_IN the_DT milk_NN is_VBZ consider-_JJ ably_RB impaired_JJ ._.
It_PRP ,_, therefore_RB ,_, becomes_VBZ imperative_JJ to_TO take_VB proper_JJ precautions_NNS against_IN its_PRP$ contamination_NN from_IN all_DT pos-_JJ sible_JJ sources_NNS during_IN handling_NN ._.
One_CD of_IN the_DT most_RBS common_JJ sources_NNS of_IN contamination_NN of_IN milk_NN is_VBZ the_DT utensil_NN used_VBN in_IN its_PRP$ produc-_JJ tion_NN and_CC handling_NN ,_, if_IN it_PRP is_VBZ not_RB properly_RB cleaned_VBN and_CC sterilized_VBN ._.
Rowlands_NNS [_JJ 1934_CD ]_NN has_VBZ shown_VBN that_IN ropiness_NN in_IN milk_NN can_MD be_VB spread_VBN by_IN churns_NNS (_( large_JJ milk_NN cans_NNS )_) which_WDT are_VBP not_RB properly_RB sterilized_VBN ._.
Barkworth_NNP [_JJ 1941_CD ]_NN has_VBZ given_VBN the_DT following_JJ figures_NNS indicating_VBG the_DT extent_NN of_IN contamination_NN of_IN good_JJ quality_NN milk_NN through_IN dirty_JJ churns_NNS :_: Milk_NN in_IN the_DT bucket_NN .._VBD 12,000_CD bacteria_NNS per_IN ml_NN ._.
Same_NNP milk_NN in_IN churn_NN (_( dirty_NN )_) ._.
._.
9,900,000_CD 34_CD Sanitizing_VBG Dairy_NNP Utensils_NNP Recently_RB a_DT product_NN known_VBN as_IN Bentonite_NNP (_( a_DT kind_NN of_IN clay_NN )_) was_VBD brought_VBN on_IN the_DT market_NN ,_, and_CC it_PRP was_VBD claimed_VBN for_IN it_PRP that_IN it_PRP was_VBD a_DT useful_JJ detergent_NN for_IN cleaning_VBG dairy_NN utensils_NNS and_CC cheaper*_NN than_IN washing_VBG soda_NN ._.

of_IN the_DT rinsed_VBN out_RP solution_NN in_IN all_PDT the_DT trials_NNS ._.

Tbe_NNP primary_JJ need_NN for_IN clean_JJ and_CC sterile_JJ utensils_NNS for_IN the_DT safe_JJ handling_NN of_IN milk_NN has_VBZ already_RB been_VBN emphasized_VBN ._.
The_DT results_NNS of_IN the_DT present_JJ investigation_NN show_NN that_IN Ben-_NNP tonite_NN in_IN its_PRP$ cleansing_NN efficiency_NN stands_VBZ on_IN a_DT par_NN with_IN washing_VBG soda_NN when_WRB used_VBN under_IN conditions_NNS described_VBN above_IN ._.
The_DT indigenous_JJ method_NN although_IN better_JJR than_IN the_DT controls_NNS is_VBZ inferior_JJ to_TO either_DT washing_VBG soda_NN or_CC Bentonite_NNP ,_, the_DT reason_NN being_VBG that_IN the_DT mixture_NN of_IN mud_NN and_CC cow-dung_JJ cake_NN ash_NN ,_, used_VBN for_IN cleaning_NN ,_, is_VBZ initially_RB laden_JJ with_IN a_DT high_JJ number_NN of_IN bacteria_NNS and_CC it_PRP is_VBZ not_RB possible_JJ to_TO destroy_VB a_DT majority_NN of_IN these_DT organisms_NNS ,_, especially_RB the_DT spore_NN formers_NNS ,_, by_IN exposing_VBG the_DT utensils_NNS only_RB to_TO sunlight_VB ._.
The_DT results_NNS also_RB indicate_VBP that_IN for_IN cleaning_VBG milk_NN utensils_NNS washing_VBG soda_NN may_MD success-_VB fully_RB be_VB replaced_VBN by_IN Bentonite_NNP which_WDT is_VBZ cheaper_JJR than_IN the_DT former_JJ ._.
The_DT other_JJ ad-_JJ vantages_NNS of_IN Bentonite_NNP observed_VBD during_IN the_DT course_NN of_IN the_DT experiment_NN are_VBP that_IN it_PRP has_VBZ no_DT caustic_JJ effect_NN on_IN the_DT hands_NNS of_IN the_DT worker_NN ,_, no_DT abrasive_JJ action_NN on_IN metals_NNS and_CC it_PRP is_VBZ not_RB hygroscopic_JJ ._.

Again_RB since_IN it_PRP is_VBZ in_IN a_DT powder_NN form_NN it_PRP can_MD very_RB easily_RB be_VB handled_VBN ._.
SUMMARY_NNP AND_CC CONCLUSIONS_NNP They_PRP are_VBP as_IN follows_VBZ :_: (_( a_DT )_) The_DT comparative_JJ efficiency_NN of_IN wash-_JJ ing_NN soda_NN ,_, Bentonite_NNP and_CC indigenous_JJ ,_, method_NN in_IN sanitising_VBG milk_NN utensils_NNS has_VBZ been_VBN studied_VBN ._.
(_( b_NN )_) There_EX is_VBZ practically_RB no_DT difference_NN in_IN the_DT bacterial_JJ counts_NNS of_IN the_DT bottles_NNS and_CC cans_NNS cleaned_VBN with_IN washing_VBG soda_NN and_CC Bentonite_NNP ._.
(_( c_NN )_) The_DT indigenous_JJ method_NN although_IN much_RB better_JJR than_IN the_DT controls_NNS is_VBZ in-_JJ ferior_JJ to_TO washing_VBG soda_NN and_CC Bento-_NNP nite_RB in_IN its_PRP$ cleansing_NN efficiency_NN (_( as_IN the_DT plate_NN counts_VBZ show_NN )_) ._.
(_( d_NN )_) Bentonite_NNP is_VBZ as_RB good_JJ as_IN washing_VBG soda_NN in_IN its_PRP$ cleansing_NN efficiency_NN and_CC may_MD ,_, therefore_VB ,_, be_VB successfully_RB used_VBN in_IN place_NN of_IN washing_VBG soda_NN ,_, being_VBG cheaper_JJR than_IN the_DT latter_JJ ,_, for_IN cleaning_VBG milk_NN utensils_NNS ._.

(_( HONS_NNP ._. )_)
Assistant_NNP Warden_NNP of_IN fisheries_NNS (_( Received_VBN for_IN publicatio_NN on_IN 7_CD February_NNP 1944_CD )_) IN_NNP order_NN to_TO determine_VB sex_NN from_IN the_DT ex-_JJ ternal_JJ features_NNS of_IN Indian_JJ carp_NN ,_, Mookerjee_NNP [_NNP 1938_CD ]_NNP made_VBD a_DT study_NN of_IN 100_CD specimens_NNS of_IN Labeo_NNP rohita_NN and_CC 36_CD specimens_NNS of_IN Cirrhina_NNP mrigala_NN from_IN local_JJ markets_NNS in_IN Calcutta_NNP and_CC obtained_VBD the_DT following_JJ results_NNS :_: Labeo_NNP rohita_NN (_( 1_CD )_) the_DT pectoral_JJ fin_NN is_VBZ either_RB greater_JJR than_IN or_CC equal_JJ to_TO the_DT anal_JJ fin_NN in_IN the_DT male_NN ,_, (_( 2_CD )_) the_DT pectoral_JJ fin_NN is_VBZ less_JJR than_IN the_DT anal_JJ fin_NN in_IN female_NN ,_, (_( 3_CD )_) the_DT area_NN around_IN the_DT anal_JJ opening_NN of_IN breeding_VBG individuals_NNS appear_VBP reddish_JJ and_CC swollen_VBN in_IN the_DT female_NN but_CC not_RB in_IN the_DT male_NN ._.
Cirrhina_NNP mrigala_NN :_: (_( 1_CD )_) the_DT pectoral_JJ fin_NN is_VBZ greater_JJR than_IN the_DT anal_JJ one_NN in_IN the_DT male_NN ,_, (_( 2_CD )_) the_DT pectoral_JJ fin_NN is_VBZ equal_JJ to_TO the_DT anal_JJ one_NN in_IN the_DT female_NN ._.
These_DT tests_NNS when_WRB used_VBN as_IN a_DT means_NN of_IN differentiating_VBG the_DT sexually_RB mature_JJ male_NN and_CC the_DT female_NN of_IN these_DT two_CD species_NNS in_IN the_DT Punjab_NNP gave_VBD somewhat_RB different_JJ result_NN from_IN those_DT obtained_VBN by_IN Mookerjee_NNP ._.
Ninety-six_JJ Labeo_NNP rohita_NN and_CC 110_CD Cirrhina_NNP mrigala_NN were_VBD studied_VBN at_IN Chhenawan_NNP and_CC Lyallpur_NNP fish_JJ farms_NNS ._.
Their_PRP$ sexes_NNS and_CC weights_NNS were_VBD noted_VBN and_CC measurements_NNS in_IN mm_NN ._.
of_IN their_PRP$ total_JJ length_NN and_CC length_NN of_IN the_DT head_NN and_CC of_IN all_PDT the_DT fins_NNS and_CC girth_NN were_VBD re_RB corded_VBN ._.
The_DT length_NN of_IN the_DT fin_NN was_VBD measu_VBN red_JJ from_IN the_DT commencement_NN of_IN its_PRP$ base_NN to_TO its_PRP$ farthest_JJS point_NN along_IN its_PRP$ longest_JJS ray_NN (_( i_NN )_) Pectoral_NNP and_CC anal_JJ fins_NNS ._.
In_IN Labeo_NNP rohita_NN ,_, out_IN of_IN 96_CD specimens_NNS studied_VBN ,_, 39_CD were_VBD males_NNS and_CC 57_CD females_NNS ._.
In_IN all_PDT the_DT males_NNS the_DT pectoral_JJ fins_NNS were_VBD greater_JJR that_IN the_DT anal_NN ._.
Among_IN the_DT females_NNS ,_, 11_CD speci_NN mens_NNS had_VBD their_PRP$ pectoral_JJ fins_NNS shorter_VBP that_IN the_DT anal_JJ ,_, in_IN 5_CD they_PRP were_VBD equal_JJ to_TO the_DT anal_JJ and_CC in_IN 41_CD greater_JJR than_IN the_DT anal_JJ ._.
In_IN 2_CD of_IN these_DT 41_CD specimens_NNS ,_, the_DT difference_NN be_VB tween_JJ the_DT lengths_NNS of_IN the_DT pectoral_JJ and_CC ana_JJ fins_NNS was_VBD 5_CD mm_NN ._.
or_CC more_JJR ,_, and_CC the_DT measure_NN ments_NNS of_IN these_DT specimens_NNS are_VBP given_VBN in_IN Table_NNP I_PRP (_( iii_NN )_) (_( Females_NNP )_) ._.

equi_NN ._.
In_IN view_NN of_IN the_DT find_NN ings_NNS reported_VBN in_IN this_DT article_NN ,_, and_CC in_IN accord_JJ ance_NN with_IN the_DT definition_NN put_VBD forward_RB by_IN Minett_NNP [_NNP 1944_CD ]_NNP 'strangles_NNS '_POS may_MD have_VB to_TO be_VB accepted_VBN as_IN a_DT term_NN used_VBN in_IN a_DT clinical_JJ sense_NN to_TO a_DT disease_NN of_IN horses_NNS and_CC mules_NNS involving_VBG the_DT upper_JJ respiratory_NN tract_NN ,_, frequently_RB accompanied_VBN by_IN suppuration_NN of_IN gland_NN about_IN the_DT throat_NN and_CC caused_VBN by_IN haemolyting_VBG streptococci_NN belonging_VBG to_TO Lancefield_NNP '_POS serological_JJ group_NN C_NNP though_IN not_RB necessarily_RB of_IN the_DT same_JJ biochemical_JJ and_CC serological_JJ type_NN ._.

Srinivasan_NNP M._NNP K._NNP and_CC Choudhury_NNP ,_, S._NNP K._NNP (_( 194448_CD A_NNP Note_NN on_IN Pullorum_NNP Disease_NNP Survey_NNP in_IN India_NNP In_IN the_DT batches_NNS from_IN the_DT goat_NN nymphs_NN emerged_VBD after_IN 17_CD to_TO 24_CD day_NN ,_, most_RBS on_IN 20_CD and_CC 21_CD days_NNS ,_, while_IN in_IN those_DT from_IN the_DT hill_NN bull_VBZ the_DT nymphs_NN emerged_VBD after_IN 18_CD to_TO 25_CD days_NNS ._.
IV_NNP Nymphal_NNP stage_NN ._.
On_IN 25-8-38_JJ about_IN 100_CD nymphs_NNS were_VBD placed_VBN on_IN a_DT goat_NN and_CC an_DT equal_JJ number_NN on_IN a_DT hill_JJ bull_NN ._.

A_DT total_NN of_IN 153_CD adults_NNS from_IN both_DT groups_NNS emerged_VBD after_IN 28_CD to_TO 34_CD days_NNS ,_, comprising_VBG of_IN 63_CD males_NNS and_CC 90_CD females_NNS ._.
V_NNP Adult_NNP stage_NN ._.
Observations_NNS on_IN the_DT parasitic_JJ period_NN of_IN the_DT adult_NN stage_NN were_VBD not_RB carried_VBN out_RP in_IN continuity_NN of_IN the_DT above_JJ experiments_NNS ,_, but_CC were_VBD made_VBN at_IN a_DT later_JJ date_NN only_RB on_IN goats_NNS ._.
About_IN 14_CD adults_NNS were_VBD observed_VBN which_WDT dropped_VBD off_RP as_IN follows_VBZ :_: two_CD on_IN day_NN eight_CD ,_, one_CD on_IN day_NN nine_CD ,_, four_CD on_IN day_NN 10_CD and_CC seven_CD on_IN day_NN 12_CD ._.
SUMMARY_NNP Haemaphysalis_NNP bispinosa_NN was_VBD reare_JJ easily_RB on_IN goats_NNS and_CC hill-bulls_NNS ._.
The_DT oviposi_JJ tion_NN period_NN was_VBD 7_CD to_TO 15_CD days_NNS and_CC the_DT perid_NN of_IN survival_NN of_IN the_DT female_NN after_IN oviposition_NN ceased_VBD was_VBD three_CD to_TO six_CD days_NNS ._.
The_DT duration_NN of_IN egg-stage_NN was_VBD on_IN an_DT average_JJ 30_CD day_NN Larvae_NNP were_VBD fully_RB engorged_VBN in_IN 4_CD to_TO days_NNS ._.
Nymphs_NNP remained_VBD attached_VBN for_IN to_TO 12_CD days_NNS ,_, in_IN exceptional_JJ cases_NNS for_IN 15_CD day_NN The_DT parasitic_JJ period_NN of_IN the_DT adult_NN was_VBD from_IN 8_CD to_TO 12_CD days_NNS ._.
The_DT larval_NN and_CC nymph_NN periods_NNS (_( non-parasitic_JJ )_) ,_, counting_VBG from_IN the_DT date_NN of_IN engorgement_NN ,_, were_VBD 17_CD to_TO 25_CD and_CC to_TO 34_CD days_NNS ,_, respectively_RB at_IN 22°C_CD ._.
Of_IN 15_CD adults_NNS ,_, 63_CD were_VBD males_NNS and_CC 90_CD females_NNS ._.

27_CD ,_, 67-73_CD A_NNP NOTE_NNP ON_NNP PULLORUM_NNP DISEASE_NNP SURVEY_NNP IN_NNP INDIA_NNP By_IN S._NNP G._NNP IYER_NNP and_CC Z_NNP ._.
A._NN HASHMI_NNP ,_, Poultry_NNP Research_NNP Section_NNP ,_, Imperial_NNP Veterinary_NNP Research_NNP Institute_NNP ,_, Izatnagar_NNP (_( Received_VBN for_IN publication_NN on_IN 30_CD August_NNP ._.
1944_CD )_) As_IN is_VBZ well-known_JJ ,_, bacillary_JJ white_JJ diar-_JJ rhoea_NN or_CC more_RBR correctly_RB 'pullorum_JJ disease_NN '_POS has_VBZ assumed_VBN serious_JJ proportions_NNS in_IN many_JJ countries_NNS ,_, the_DT increase_NN in_IN incidence_NN running_VBG parallel_RB with_IN the_DT progress_NN in_IN artificial_JJ incubation_NN and_CC baby_NN chick_NN traffic_NN ._.
Cooper_NNP and_CC Naik_NNP [_NNP 1931_CD ]_NNP ,_, from_IN an_DT outbreak_NN in_IN the_DT United_NNP Provinces_NNPS ,_, isolated_VBD a_DT microorganism_NN which_WDT they_PRP typed_VBD as_IN S._NNP gallinarum_NN ._.
(_( S._NNP pullorum_NN is_VBZ now_RB classed_VBN as_IN a_DT variant_NN of_IN S_NNP ._.
gallinarum_NN ._. )_)
Naidu_NNP [_NN 1938_CD ]_NN reported_VBD its_PRP$ occurrence_NN in_IN large_JJ number_NN of_IN fowls_NN from_IN Mysore_NNP state_NN ._.
As_IN the_DT poultry_NN industry_NN is_VBZ rapidly_RB developing_VBG in_IN India_NNP and_CC as_IN a_DT few_JJ farms_NNS have_VBP actually_RB started_VBN the_DT production_NN and_CC supply_NN of_IN artificially-hatched_JJ baby_NN chicks_NNS ,_, an_DT extensive_JJ súrvey_NN of_IN the_DT country_NN was_VBD undertaken_VBN to_TO find_VB out_RP the_DT incidence_NN of_IN this_DT disease_NN ._.
State_NN and_CC Provincial_NNP Poultry_NNP Disease_NNP Officers_NNP also_RB cooperate_VBP by_IN undertaking_VBG similar_JJ surveys_NNS within_IN their_PRP$ areas_NNS ._.
EXPERIMENTAL_NNP For_IN the_DT detection_NN of_IN pullorum-infecte_JJ fowls_NN the_DT rapid_JJ whole-blood_JJ stained-antige_JJ test_NN ,_, as_IN described_VBN by_IN Schaffer_NNP ,_, Macdonld_NNP Hall_NNP and_CC Bunyea_NNP [_NNP 1931_CD ]_NNP and_CC used_VBN be_VB English_JJ and_CC American_JJ workers_NNS ,_, was_VBD em_JJ ployed_VBN with_IN slight_JJ modifications_NNS ._.
Thre_NNP authentic_JJ strains_NNS of_IN S._NNP pullorum_NN ,_, from_IN the_DT Veterinary_NNP Laboratory_NNP of_IN the_DT Ministry_NNP of_IN Agriculture_NNP in_IN England_NNP ,_, were_VBD incorpora_JJ ed_NN in_IN the_DT antigen_NN prepared_VBD for_IN the_DT test_NN A_DT drop_NN of_IN blood_NN from_IN the_DT wing_VBG vein_IN the_DT snipped_JJ comb_NN was_VBD mixed_JJ on_IN a_DT glas_JJ plate_NN with_IN an_DT equal_JJ quantity_NN of_IN the_DT stan_JJ dardized_VBN antigen_NN (_( a_DT thick_NN ,_, stained_VBD an_DT killed_VBN saline_NN suspension_NN of_IN S._NNP pullorum_FW S._NNP G._NNP IYER_NNP AND_NNP Z_NNP ._.
A._NN HASHMI_NNP 49_CD Clumping_NNP (_( agglutination_NN )_) of_IN bacteria_NN occurred_VBN in_IN a_DT minute_NN or_CC two_CD if_IN the_DT blood_NN was_VBD from_IN an_DT infected_JJ fowl_NN ,_, otherwise_RB the_DT mixture_NN remained_VBD uniformly_RB homogeneous_JJ ._.
This_DT test_NN is_VBZ rather_RB delicate_JJ ,_, but_CC is_VBZ parti-_JJ cularly_RB useful_JJ under_IN field_NN conditions_NNS ._.
The_DT birds_NNS examined_VBN were_VBD all_DT mature_NN and_CC most_JJS of_IN them_PRP from_IN breeding_VBG stock_NN ._.
They_PRP belonged_VBD to_TO 23_CD poultry_NN farms_NNS ,_, spread_NN over_IN U._NNP P._NNP ,_, Bihar_NNP ,_, Orissa_NNP ,_, Mysore_NNP and_CC Punjab_NNP ._.
These_DT farms_NNS are_VBP all_DT organized_VBN and_CC run_VBN on_IN progressive_JJ lines_NNS (_( artificial_JJ ncubation_NN ,_, etc_FW ._. )_)
and_CC should_MD thus_RB cons-_VB tute_NN the_DT probable_JJ foci_NN of_IN infection_NN if_IN any_DT were_VBD present_JJ ._.
In_IN all_DT ,_, 3798_CD birds_NNS were_VBD tested_VBN but_CC none_NN of_IN them_PRP was_VBD found_VBN to_TO be_VB infected_VBN ._.
In_IN addition_NN ,_, the_DT Poultry_NNP Dis-_NNP ease_NN Officers_NNP of_IN Mysore_NNP ,_, C._NNP P._NNP ,_, Madras_NNP ,_, Bengal_NNP and_CC Assam_NNP examined_VBD a_DT further_JJ number_NN of_IN 1219_CD birds_NNS ._.
Out_IN of_IN these_DT ,_, only_RB 11_CD birds_NNS from_IN Mysore_NNP (_( Hebbal_NNP Farm_NNP )_) gave_VBD doubtful_JJ reactions_NNS ,_, the_DT rest_NN reacting_VBG negatively_RB ._.
Bunyea_NNP and_CC Macdonald_NNP [_NNP 1941_CD ]_NNP Holm_NNP ,_, William_NNP ,_, Callahan_NNP and_CC Halversen_NNP [_NNP 1940_CD ]_NNP and_CC Johnson_NNP and_CC Pollard_NNP [_NNP 1940_CD ]_NNP described_VBD certain_JJ conditions_NNS leading_VBG to_TO false_VB or_CC non-specific_JJ reactions_NNS with_IN this_DT test_NN ._.
Materials_NNS from_IN the_DT suspicious_JJ re-_JJ actors_NNS were_VBD therefore_RB submitted_VBN to_TO more_RBR detailed_JJ laboratory_NN examination_NN ,_, but_CC all_DT proved_VBD negative_JJ for_IN S._NNP pullorum_VBD infec-_JJ tion_NN ._.
These_DT results_NNS suggest_VBP that_IN pullorum_NN disease_NN is_VBZ of_IN no_DT great_JJ significance_NN at_IN pre-_JJ sent_NN to_TO the_DT poultry_NN industry_NN in_IN this_DT coun-_JJ ry_NN ._.
This_DT apparent_JJ freedom_NN is_VBZ probably_RB due_JJ to_TO the_DT absence_NN of_IN commercial_JJ hatch-_JJ ries_NNS engaged_VBN in_IN baby_NN chick_NN traffic_NN ._.
In_IN view_NN of_IN the_DT fact_NN that_IN the_DT disease_NN has_VBZ been_VBN esponsible_JJ for_IN enormous_JJ losses_NNS in_IN other_JJ arts_NNS of_IN the_DT world_NN ,_, it_PRP is_VBZ essential_JJ that_IN very_RB possible_JJ effort_NN should_MD be_VB made_VBN to_TO ocate_VB and_CC stamp_VB out_RP any_DT possible_JJ source_NN of_IN infection_NN ,_, so_RB as_IN to_TO prevent_VB its_PRP$ spread_NN throughout_IN the_DT country_NN ._.
Careful_JJ vigilance_NN by_IN the_DT livestock_NN departments_NNS with_IN periodic_JJ surveys_NNS of_IN areas_NNS under_IN their_PRP$ jurisdiction_NN and_CC the_DT education_NN of_IN all_DT concerned_VBN in_IN the_DT diagnosis_NN and_CC control_NN of_IN the_DT disease_NN should_MD therefore_VB form_NN an_DT integral_JJ part_NN of_IN their_PRP$ poultry_NN improvement_NN plans_NNS ._.
It_PRP is_VBZ also_RB suggested_VBN that_IN all_DT imported_VBN birds_NNS should_MD be_VB tested_VBN prior_RB to_TO their_PRP$ inclusion_NN in_IN the_DT stock_NN ,_, so_RB as_IN to_TO prevent_VB the_DT introduction_NN of_IN the_DT disease_NN into_IN the_DT country_NN ._.
SUMMARY_NNP A_NNP total_NN of_IN 5017_CD adult_NN fowls_NNS were_VBD tested_VBN for_IN pullorum_NN disease_NN by_IN the_DT quick_JJ ag-_JJ glutination_NN method_NN with_IN completely_RB nega-_JJ tive_JJ results_NNS ,_, save_VBP in_IN the_DT case_NN of_IN 11_CD birds_NNS which_WDT gave_VBD suspicious_JJ reactions_NNS ._.
A_DT more_RBR de-_JJ tailed_JJ examination_NN of_IN these_DT birds_NNS did_VBD not_RB show_VB pullorum_JJ infection_NN ._.
The_DT birds_NNS inclu-_NN ded_VBN in_IN this_DT survey_NN were_VBD mostly_RB from_IN or-_JJ ganized_JJ poultry_NN farms_NNS ,_, situated_VBN in_IN U.P._NNP ,_, Bihar_NNP ,_, Orissa_NNP ,_, Punjab_NNP ,_, Mysore_NNP ,_, C.P._NNP ,_, Madras_NNP ,_, Bengal_NNP and_CC Assam_NNP ._.
The_DT survey_NN was_VBD therefore_RB well-distributed_JJ and_CC repre-_JJ sentative_NN ._.

Sc._NNP ,_, Laboratory_NNP Assistant_NNP ,_, Bengal_NNP Veterinary_NNP College_NNP ,_, Calcutta_NNP (_( Received_VBN for_IN publication_NN on_IN 6_CD March_NNP 1944_CD )_) THE_DT object_NN of_IN this_DT paper_NN is_VBZ to_TO place_VB on_IN record_NN the_DT occurrence_NN of_IN Encephalomyeli-_NNP tis_NN in_IN a_DT cow_NN in_IN the_DT Bengal_NNP Veterinary_NNP College_NNP Hospital_NNP during_IN the_DT month_NN of_IN November_NNP ,_, 1943_CD ._.
INTRODUCTION_NNP Borna_NNP disease_NN (_( Syn_NNP :_: A._NN MUKERJI_NNP 51_CD aemorrhages_NNS and_CC the_DT cerebrospinal_JJ fluid_NN both_DT in_IN the_DT meningeal_NN spaces_NNS and_CC the_DT ventricles_NNS of_IN the_DT brain_NN appeared_VBD to_TO be_VB clear_JJ and_CC increased_VBD in_IN amount_NN ._.
The_DT gas-_JJ tro-intestinal_JJ tract_NN showed_VBD inflammatory_JJ changes_NNS ._.
Microscopical_JJ examination_NN of_IN mears_NNS from_IN different_JJ organs_NNS of_IN the_DT body_NN yielded_VBD negative_JJ result_NN ,_, and_CC an_DT attempt_NN at_IN cultivating_VBG bacteria_NNS from_IN the_DT brain_NN proved_VBD futile_JJ ._.
Smears_NNS from_IN hippocampus_NN was_VBD examined_VBN and_CC found_VBN to_TO be_VB negative_JJ for_IN Negri_NNP bodies_NNS ._.
Pieces_NNS of_IN brain_NN and_CC spinal_JJ cord_NN fixed_VBN in_IN 75_CD per_IN cent_NN alcohol_NN were_VBD sent_VBN to_TO the_DT Imperial_NNP Veterinary_NNP Research_NNP Institute_NNP ,_, Izatnagar_NNP ,_, for_IN histo-patho-_JJ logical_JJ examination_NN and_CC the_DT following_JJ re-_JJ port_NN was_VBD received_VBN :_: ``_`` The_DT specimen_NNS from_IN the_DT cow_NN revealed_VBD extensive_JJ degeneration_NN of_IN the_DT nerve_NN cells_NNS and_CC very_RB marked_JJ peri-_JJ vascular_JJ cuffing_NN on_IN microscopical_JJ ex-_JJ amination_NN ._.
These_DT changes_NNS are_VBP indicative_JJ of_IN encephalomyelitis_NN '_POS ._.
The_DT above_JJ findings_NNS confirmed_VBD the_DT result_NN of_IN the_DT following_JJ transmission_NN experiments_NNS conducted_VBN in_IN the_DT College_NNP Laboratory_NNP ._.
TRANSMISSION_NN EXPERIMENTS_NNP Small_NNP pieces_NNS from_IN representative_JJ areas_NNS of_IN brain_NN and_CC spinal_JJ cord_NN were_VBD triturated_VBN in_IN normal_JJ saline_JJ solution_NN with_IN aseptic_JJ precautions_NNS and_CC an_DT uniform_JJ emulsion_NN thus_RB prepared_VBD consitituted_VBD the_DT inoculum_NN for_IN the_DT following_JJ transmission_NN experiments_NNS ._.
G._NNP P._NNP 1_CD ._.

That_IN the_DT cause_NN of_IN the_DT enteritis_NN and_CC death_NN was_VBD due_JJ to_TO these_DT immature_NN forms_NNS of_IN Cotylophoron_NNP cotylophorum_NN is_VBZ quite_RB apparent_JJ ._.
The_DT pond_NN or_CC tank_NN around_IN which_WDT the_DT goats_NNS grazed_VBD was_VBD examined_VBN to_TO ascertain_VB its_PRP$ moliuscan_JJ fauna_NN and_CC larval_NN trematodes_NNS ._.
The_DT molluses_NNS met_VBD with_IN were_VBD Indoplanorbis_NNP exustus_NN ,_, Limnea_NNP leuteola_NN and_CC Vivipara_NNP bengalensis_NN ,_, of_IN which_WDT only_RB the_DT Indoplanor-_NNP bis_NN exustus_NN was_VBD found_VBN to_TO discharge_VB cercariae_NN which_WDT resembled_VBD Cercariae_NNP in-_JJ dicae_NN XXVI_NNP (_( Sewell_NNP ,_, 1922_CD )_) ,_, while_IN the_DT other_JJ two_CD molluscs_NNS were_VBD free_JJ from_IN any_DT infesta-_JJ tion_NN ._.
It_PRP is_VBZ possible_JJ that_IN these_DT cercariae_NNS may_MD be_VB the_DT larval_JJ forms_NNS of_IN the_DT amphis-_JJ tomes_NNS in_IN question_NN ._.

DISCUSSION_NNP There_EX appears_VBZ to_TO exist_VB considerable_JJ confusion_NN with_IN regard_NN to_TO the_DT identity_NN of_IN the_DT adult_NN amphistome_NN of_IN Cercariae_NNP indicae_NN XXVI_NNP (_( Sewell_NNP ,_, 1922_CD )_) ._.
Rao_NNP and_CC Ayyar_NNP [_NNP 1932_CD ]_NNP evolved_VBD the_DT adults_NNS of_IN these_DT cercariae_NNS by_IN feeding_VBG experiments_NNS and_CC expressed_VBD the_DT opinion_NN that_IN the_DT adults_NNS obtained_VBN were_VBD Paramphistomum_NNP cervi_NN ._.
These_DT authors_NNS had_VBD obtained_VBN only_RB immature_JJ forms_NNS and_CC based_VBN their_PRP$ diagnosis_NN on_IN these_DT ._.
The_DT cerca-_JJ riae_NN of_IN Paramphistomum_NNP cervi_NN ,_, according_VBG to_TO Bennett_NNP [_NNP 1936_CD ]_NNP ,_, are_VBP lacking_VBG in_IN the_DT evagi-_JJ nations_NNS from_IN the_DT excretory_NN canals_NNS ,_, which_WDT formed_VBD a_DT prominent_JJ feature_NN in_IN Cercariae_NNP indicae_NN XXVI_NNP ._.
Hence_RB ,_, it_PRP is_VBZ doubtful_JJ if_IN the_DT adults_NNS obtained_VBN are_VBP not_RB of_IN Cotylophoron_NNP species_NNS ._.
Bennett_NNP [_NN 1936_CD ]_NN has_VBZ described_VBN the_DT cercariae_NN of_IN Cotylophoron_NNP cotylophorum_NN in_IN the_DT life_NN history_NN studies_NNS on_IN that_DT trematode_NN 56_CD Fatal_NNP Enteritis_NNP in_IN Goats_NNP and_CC concluded_VBD that_IN Cercariae_NNP indicae_NN XXVI_NNP (_( Sewell_NNP ,_, 1922_CD )_) is_VBZ not_RB the_DT larval_JJ form_NN ._.
His_PRP$ description_NN of_IN the_DT excretory_NN system_NN of_IN the_DT cercariae_NN which_WDT he_PRP has_VBZ found_VBN for_IN the_DT adult_NN parasite_NN agrees_VBZ with_IN that_DT in_IN Cercariae_NNP indicae_NN XXVI_NNP ._.
The_DT differences_NNS noticed_VBN by_IN him_PRP do_VB not_RB seem_VB to_TO justify_VB his_PRP$ claim_NN that_IN it_PRP is_VBZ different_JJ ._.
I_PRP am_VBP of_IN opinion_NN that_IN Bennett_NNP [_NNP 1936_CD ]_NNP was_VBD actually_RB dealing_VBG with_IN Cercariae_NNP indicae_NN XXVI_NNP (_( Sewell_NNP ,_, 1922_CD )_) ._.
Srivastava_NNP [_NN 1938_CD ]_NN in_IN the_DT life_NN history_NN studies_NNS of_IN Cotylophoron_NNP cotylophorum_NN has_VBZ mentioned_VBN the_DT larval_JJ form_NN of_IN this_DT parasite_NN to_TO be_VB very_RB similar_JJ to_TO Cercariae_NNP indicae_NN XXIX_NNP ,_, though_IN not_RB identical_JJ with_IN it_PRP ._.
It_PRP has_VBZ already_RB been_VBN established_VBN by_IN Rao_NNP and_CC Ayyar_NNP [_NNP 1932_CD ]_NNP and_CC Vaidyanathan_NNP [_NNP 1941_CD ]_NN that_IN the_DT adults_NNS of_IN these_DT cercariae_NNS are_VBP Fischoederius_NNP elongatus_RB belonging_VBG to_TO a_DT different_JJ genus_NN altogether_RB ._.
Further_RB ,_, Cercariae_NNP indicae_NN XXIX_NNP has_VBZ been_VBN so_RB far_RB recorded_VBN only_RB from_IN Limnaea_NNP leuleola_NN and_CC not_RB from_IN Indopla-_NNP norbis_NN exustus_NN ._.
Pande_NNP [_NN 1935_CD ]_NN records_NNS an_DT acute_JJ amphis-_JJ tomiasis_NN of_IN cattle_NNS in_IN Assam_NNP caused_VBN by_IN immature_NN forms_NNS of_IN Paramphistomum_NNP cervi_NN ._.
During_IN a_DT personal_JJ discussion_NN with_IN him_PRP ,_, he_PRP expressed_VBD the_DT opinion_NN that_IN the_DT immature_NN forms_NNS are_VBP probably_RB of_IN Cotylophoron_NNP species_NNS and_CC that_IN he_PRP was_VBD not_RB convinced_VBN that_IN they_PRP were_VBD of_IN Paramphistomum_NNP cervi_NN ._.
Le_NNP Roux_NNP [_NN 1930_CD ]_NN has_VBZ dealt_VBN with_IN two_CD severe_JJ outbreaks_NNS of_IN amphistomiasis_NN due_JJ to_TO Cotylophoron_NNP cotylophorum_NN in_IN sheep_NN and_CC goats_NNS ._.
Chatterjee_NNP [_NN 1931_CD ]_NN in_IN his_PRP$ preliminary_JJ observations_NNS on_IN the_DT life_NN history_NN studies_NNS with_IN Cercariae_NNP indicae_VBP XXVI_NNP recorded_VBD that_IN the_DT young_JJ forms_NNS developed_VBN in_IN his_PRP$ experi-_JJ mental_JJ goats_NNS by_IN feeding_VBG with_IN the_DT above_JJ cercariae_NN were_VBD of_IN Paramphistomum_NNP cervi_NN ;_: however_RB ,_, in_IN a_DT later_JJ communication_NN ,_, the_DT same_JJ author_NN [_NN 1938_CD ]_NN changed_VBD his_PRP$ opinion_NN and_CC pointed_VBD out_RP that_IN the_DT cercariae_NN in_IN question_NN was_VBD the_DT larval_JJ form_NN of_IN Cotylo-_NNP phoron_NN cotylophorum_NN ._.
Thus_RB there_EX are_VBP more_JJR cases_NNS of_IN amphis-_JJ tomiasis_NN caused_VBN by_IN immature_NN forms_NNS of_IN Cotylophoron_NNP species_NNS on_IN record_NN than_IN by_IN Paramphistomum_NNP cervi_NN or_CC any_DT other_JJ amphistoma_NN ._.

Chemical_NNP Assistant_NNP ,_, Punjab_NNP Agricultural_NNP College_NNP ,_, Lyallpur_NNP (_( Received_VBN for_IN publication_NN on_IN 24_CD August_NNP 1944_CD )_) THE_DT importance_NN of_IN vitamin_NN A_NNP as_IN an_DT essential_JJ ingredient_NN of_IN human_JJ diet_NNS can_MD not_RB be_VB over-emphasized_JJ ._.
A_DT regular_JJ supply_NN of_IN it_PRP the_DT system_NN is_VBZ indispensable_JJ for_IN the_DT proper_JJ development_NN and_CC functioning_NN of_IN the_DT body_NN and_CC as_IN a_DT preventive_JJ measure_NN against_IN usceptibility_NN to_TO disease_VB ._.
A_DT number_NN of_IN orkers_NNS have_VBP made_VBN quantitative_JJ studies_NNS on_IN the_DT daily_JJ requirements_NNS of_IN Vitamin_NNP A_NNP (_( or_CC s_VB precursor_JJ carotene_NN )_) for_IN various_JJ types_NNS of_IN animals_NNS ,_, for_IN keeping_VBG them_PRP in_IN good_JJ health_NN ._.
Thus_RB ,_, Ward_NNP ,_, Bechdel_NNP and_CC Guer-_NNP ant_NN [_NN 1938_CD ]_NN found_VBD that_IN 12-18_JJ microgrammes_NNS of_IN carotene_NN are_VBP required_VBN per_IN lb_NN ._.
of_IN body_NN weight_JJ per_IN day_NN for_IN growing_VBG dairy_NN calves_NNS to_TO prevent_VB A_DT avitaminosis_NN ._.
Converse_NNP and_CC Meigs_NNP [_NNP 1938_CD ]_NNP have_VBP deduced_VBN the_DT carotene_NN equirements_NNS of_IN cows_NNS for_IN normal_JJ reproduc-_JJ tion_NN and_CC calving_NN to_TO be_VB 80-100_JJ mg._JJ daily_JJ during_IN the_DT last_JJ months_NNS of_IN gestation_NN ;_: the_DT amount_NN below_IN 60_CD mg._NNS per_IN cow_NN per_IN day_NN resulting_VBG in_IN a_DT considerable_JJ proportion_NN of_IN till-born_JJ calves_NNS ._.
Kuhlman_NNP and_CC Gallup_NNP [_NNP 1941_CD ]_NNP working_VBG with_IN lactating_JJ cows_NNS of_IN ersey_JJ breed_NN arrived_VBN at_IN the_DT conclusion_NN that_IN 0-45_JJ microgrammes_NNS of_IN carotene_NN per_IN lb_NN ._.
of_IN body_NN weight_NN (_( or_CC 40-45_CD mg._NN for_IN a_DT 1,000_CD lb_NN ._.
animal_NN )_) is_VBZ about_IN the_DT minimum_JJ daily_JJ re-_JJ uirement_NN for_IN normal_JJ lactation_NN ._.
With_IN amounts_NNS lower_JJR than_IN 40_CD microgrammes_NNS ,_, the_DT lactation_NN was_VBD likely_JJ to_TO be_VB impaired_VBN ;_: the_DT calves_NNS born_VBN were_VBD weak_JJ and_CC the_DT cows_NNS developed_VBD abnormal_JJ conditions_NNS ._.
Similarly_RB ,_, it_PRP has_VBZ been_VBN ascertained_VBN that_IN about_RB 4_CD mg._NN is_VBZ the_DT minimum_JJ daily_JJ dose_NN for_IN man_NN ._.
The_DT most_RBS important_JJ source_NN of_IN supply_NN of_IN vitamin_NN A_NNP for_IN cattle_NN is_VBZ green_JJ roughage_NN ._.

The_DT problem_NN of_IN feeding_VBG cows_NNS ,_, however_RB ,_, is_VBZ somewhat_RB different_JJ ._.
As_IN a_DT milch_NN animal_NN ,_, the_DT cow_NN requires_VBZ vitamin_VBP A_NNP not_RB only_RB for_IN her_PRP$ own_JJ system_NN but_CC also_RB for_IN secretion_NN in_IN milk_NN which_WDT forms_VBZ one_CD of_IN the_DT important_JJ sources_NNS of_IN vitamin_NN A_NNP for_IN the_DT consumer_NN ._.
Studies_NNS on_IN the_DT relationship_NN between_IN the_DT carotene_NN content_NN of_IN the_DT feed_NN and_CC that_IN in_IN the_DT milk_NN have_VBP been_VBN carried_VBN out_RP by_IN many_JJ workers_NNS ._.
Moore_RB [_JJ 1932_CD ]_NN has_VBZ shown_VBN that_IN in_IN the_DT cow_JJ carotene_NN of_IN the_DT feed_NN undergoes_VBZ conversion_NN to_TO vitamin_VB A_DT and_CC is_VBZ secreted_VBN in_IN the_DT milk_NN partly_RB as_RB carotene_NN as_IN such_JJ and_CC partly_RB as_IN vitamin_JJ A._NN Kennedy_NNP and_CC Dutcher_NNP [_NNP 1922_CD ]_NNP demonstrated_VBD as_RB early_RB as_IN 1922_CD ,_, that_IN the_DT vitamin-A_JJ value_NN of_IN milk_NN is_VBZ influenced_VBN by_IN the_DT vitamin-A_JJ value_NN of_IN the_DT feed_NN ._.
Kraus_NNP [_NN 1931_CD ]_NN ,_, Watson_NNP [_NNP 1932_CD ]_NNP and_CC others_NNS have_VBP shown_VBN that_IN pasture_NN grass_NN is_VBZ rich_JJ in_IN vitamin-A_JJ factor_NN and_CC produces_VBZ a_DT milk_NN of_IN high_JJ vitamin-A_JJ activity_NN ._.
Recently_RB a_DT more_RBR quantitative_JJ study_NN has_VBZ been_VBN made_VBN of_IN this_DT problem_NN ._.
Hogdson_NNP and_CC co-workers_NNS [_JJ 1938_CD ]_NN have_VBP found_VBN that_IN the_DT average_JJ percentage_NN of_IN the_DT carotene_NN ingested_VBD which_WDT was_VBD secreted_VBN as_IN carotene_NN in_IN the_DT butter_NN fat_NN was_VBD 0.71_CD for_IN cows_NNS receiving_VBG hay_NN ,_, 0.22_CD for_IN cows_NNS receiving_VBG hay_NN and_CC silage_NN ,_, and_CC 0.12_CD for_IN cows_NNS receiving_VBG silage_NN only_RB ._.

increased_JJ intake_NN of_IN carotene_NN is_VBZ followed_VBN by_IN the_DT increased_VBN carotene_NN and_CC vitamin-A_JJ potency_NN of_IN milk_NN ._.

EXPERIMENTAL_NNP Five_NNP Sahiwal_NNP cows_VBZ weighing_VBG about_RB 800_CD lb_NN ._.

A_DT com-_JJ posite_JJ sample_NN of_IN morning_NN and_CC evening_VBG milk_NN was_VBD taken_VBN daily_RB for_IN fat_JJ determination_NN and_CC the_DT weekly_JJ estimation_NN of_IN vitamins_NNS ._.
The_DT estimation_NN of_IN carotene_NN and_CC vitamin_VB A_NNP in_IN milk_NN was_VBD carried_VBN out_RP according_VBG to_TO the_DT method_NN of_IN Willstaedt_NNP and_CC With_IN [_JJ 1938_CD ]_NN in_IN which_WDT 100_CD c.c_NN ._.
of_IN well-shaken_JJ milk_NN is_VBZ mixed_JJ with_IN one_CD tenth_NN of_IN its_PRP$ volume_NN of_IN 60_CD per_IN cent_NN KOH_NNP solution_NN ._.

SUMMARY_NNP (_( 1_CD )_) A_DT study_NN of_IN the_DT vitamin_NN A_DT and_CC caro-_JJ tene_NN content_NN of_IN milk_NN from_IN five_CD Sahiwal_NNP cows_NNS was_VBD made_VBN throughout_IN their_PRP$ lactation_NN ._.
(_( 2_CD )_) The_DT cows_NNS were_VBD on_IN liberal_JJ green_JJ ration_NN getting_VBG up_RB to_TO 4,000_CD mg._NN of_IN carotene_NN ;_: but_CC the_DT daily_JJ output_NN of_IN vitamin_NN A_NNP and_CC carotene_NN in_IN milk_NN was_VBD about_IN 4-5_JJ mg._NN only_RB (_( 3_CD )_) Towards_IN the_DT end_NN of_IN the_DT lactation_NN there_EX was_VBD a_DT rise_NN in_IN the_DT vitamin_NN A_NNP a_DT carotene_NN content_NN of_IN the_DT milk_NN ,_, although_IN the_DT total_JJ output_NN ,_, due_JJ to_TO fall_VB in_IN the_DT milk_NN yield_NN was_VBD not_RB much_JJ affected_VBN ._.
