258_CD ,_, 133_CD RECTAL_NNP TEMPERATURES_NNP OF_NNP CERTAIN_NNP ANIMALS_NNP AT_NNP REST_NNP By_IN F.C_NNP ._.
MINETT_NNP and_CC S._NNP SEN_NNP ,_, Imperial_NNP Veterinary_NNP Research_NNP Institute_NNP ,_, Mukteswar_NNP (_( Received_VBN for_IN publication_NN on_IN 17_CD October_NNP 1944_CD )_) (_( With_IN four_CD text-figures_NNS )_) IN_NNP view_NN of_IN the_DT variable_JJ and_CC frequently_RB high_JJ air_NN temperatures_NNS in_IN India_NNP and_CC the_DT effect_NN of_IN air_NN temperature_NN on_IN body_NN temper-_JJ ature_NN of_IN resting_VBG animals_NNS ,_, it_PRP is_VBZ important_JJ to_TO have_VB as_IN precise_JJ knowledge_NN as_IN possible_JJ on_IN the_DT normal_JJ body_NN temperature_NN under_IN different_JJ conditions_NNS ._.
This_DT is_VBZ particularly_RB so_RB with_IN relatively_RB homothermous_JJ animals_NNS ,_, i.e_NN ._.
onés_NN whose_WP$ heat_NN regulation_NN is_VBZ less_RBR perfect_JJ than_IN in_IN man_NN ._.
LITERATURE_NNP The_DT normal_JJ range_NN of_IN rectal_JJ temperature_NN for_IN various_JJ domesticated_JJ animals_NNS in_IN health_NN in_IN temperate_NN countries_NNS has_VBZ been_VBN laid_VBN down_RP by_IN numerous_JJ observers_NNS ._.
For_IN animals_NNS in_IN hotter_NN countries_NNS there_EX must_MD be_VB fewer_JJR records_NNS ._.
To_TO obtain_VB an_DT accurate_JJ idea_NN of_IN an_DT animal_NN 's_POS temperature_NN important_JJ points_NNS are_VBP that_IN the_DT thermometer_NN must_MD be_VB properly_RB used_VBN and_CC the_DT observations_NNS repeated_VBD throughout_IN the_DT 24_CD hours_NNS ._.
Lazarus-Barlow_JJ [_NN 1928_CD ]_NN has_VBZ shown_VBN with_IN rabbits_NNS how_WRB incor-_JJ rect_NN an_DT impression_NN may_MD be_VB formed_VBN of_IN the_DT normal_JJ swing_NN of_IN the_DT body_NN temperature_NN unless_IN observations_NNS are_VBP made_VBN at_IN interva_NN as_RB short_JJ as_IN ,_, say_VBP four_CD hours_NNS ._.
Varrie_NNP Jones_NNP and_CC Sims_NNP Woodhead_NNP [_NN 1915_CD ]_NNP devise_VB a_DT special_JJ apparatus_NN by_IN which_WDT the_DT rect_NN temperatures_NNS of_IN cattle_NNS could_MD be_VB recorded_VBN mechanically_RB and_CC in_IN a_DT quasi-continuons_JJ manner_NN ._.
In_IN this_DT way_NN they_PRP were_VBD able_JJ to_TO show_VB well-marked_JJ variations_NNS during_IN the_DT 24_CD hours_NNS ._.
During_IN most_JJS of_IN the_DT day_NN the_DT temperature_NN lies_VBZ between_IN 101_CD and_CC 102°F_CD It_PRP is_VBZ always_RB highest_JJS during_IN the_DT day_NN when_WRB the_DT animal_NN is_VBZ standing_VBG or_CC moving_VBG about_RB has_VBZ just_RB been_VBN fed_VBN ,_, and_CC falls_VBZ slow_JJ during_IN the_DT night_NN to_TO reach_VB its_PRP$ minimum_JJ [_JJ 100.7°F_CD ._. ]_NN
about_IN 3-5_CD a.m._NN Milking_VBG almost_RB always_RB caused_VBD a_DT slight_JJ rise_NN ._.
The_DT higher_JJR points_NNS were_VBD at_IN 8-9_JJ a.m._NN and_CC 4-6_JJ p._NN m._NN ,_, the_DT diurnal_JJ range_NN being_VBG about_IN 1.2°F_CD ._.
Woold_NNP ridge_NN [_NN 1905_CD ]_NN had_VBD likewise_NN found_VBN that_IN for_IN cattle_NNS in_IN Ireland_NNP the_DT average_JJ morning_NN and_CC evening_NN temperatures_NNS are_VBP 101.5_CD and_CC 102°F_CD ._.
Hobday_NNP [_NNP 1896_CD ]_NNP gives_VBZ figures_NNS of_IN 101.3_CD and_CC 101.8°F_CD ._.
for_IN cattle_NNS in_IN England_NNP ._.
F._NNP C._NNP MINETT_NNP and_CC S._NNP SEN_NNP 63_CD With_IN animals_NNS in_IN hot_JJ countries_NNS the_DT mat-_JJ er_NN is_VBZ somewhat_RB different_JJ ._.
As_IN pointed_VBN out_RP Hornby_NNP [_NN 1942_CD ]_NN ,_, the_DT expression_NN 'normal_POS temperature_NN '_'' ._.
as_IN applied_VBN to_TO animals_NNS under_IN such_JJ conditions_NNS ,_, has_VBZ only_RB a_DT provisional_JJ meaning_NN ._.
Regan_NNP and_CC Freeborn_NNP [_NNP 1936_CD ]_NNP found_VBD that_IN high-producing_JJ Jersey_NNP cows_NNS kept_VBD at_IN air_NN temperature_NN of_IN 85°F_CD ._.
or_CC over_IN for_IN more_JJR than_IN 24_CD hours_NNS were_VBD unable_JJ to_TO control_VB their_PRP$ body_NN temperatures_NNS ._.
Regan_NNP and_CC Richardson_NNP [_NNP 1938_CD ]_NNP found_VBD that_IN the_DT rectal_JJ temperatures_NNS of_IN cattle_NNS remained_VBD constant_JJ at_IN 101-101.3°F_JJ ._.
when_WRB the_DT air_NN tem-_JJ perature_NN was_VBD between_IN 40_CD and_CC 70°F._CD ,_, above_IN that_IN it_PRP began_VBD to_TO increase_VB and_CC at_IN 100°F_CD ._.
the_DT rectal_JJ temperature_NN was_VBD 105.1°F_CD ._.
Although_IN cattle_NNS native_JJ to_TO hot_JJ countries_NNS are_VBP more_RBR tolerant_JJ of_IN high_JJ air_NN temperatures_NNS ,_, princi-_JJ ples_NNS similar_JJ to_TO those_DT just_RB enunciated_VBN hold_RB good_JJ ._.
Their_PRP$ normal_JJ resting_NN temperatures_NNS do_VBP not_RB however_RB differ_VBP from_IN cattle_NNS of_IN cooler_NN countries_NNS ._.
For_IN instance_NN ,_, Manresa_NNP and_CC Gomez_NNP [_NNP 1937_CD ]_NNP for_IN cattle_NNS of_IN the_DT Nellore_NNP breed_NN in_IN the_DT Philippines_NNPS give_VB a_DT mean_JJ daily_JJ value_NN of_IN 38.66°C_CD ._.
(_( 101.59°_CD F._NNP )_) ,_, the_DT diurnal_JJ and_CC nocturnal_JJ values_NNS being_VBG 38.7°C_CD ._.
(_( 101.66°F_CD ._. )_)
and_CC 38.56°C_CD (_( 101.4°F_CD ._. )_) ._.
These_DT figures_NNS were_VBD based_VBN on_IN four-hourly_JJ readings_NNS taken_VBN over_RP seven_CD days_NNS in_IN April_NNP ._.
The_DT values_NNS were_VBD lowest_JJS at_IN 6_CD a.m._NN and_CC highest_JJS at_IN 6_CD p.m._NN ,_, while_IN the_DT diurnal_JJ values_NNS were_VBD said_VBD to_TO be_VB significantly_RB higher_JJR than_IN the_DT octurnal_JJ (_( number_NN of_IN observations_NNS not_RB stated_VBN )_) ._.
They_PRP too_RB note_VBP a_DT high_JJ and_CC signi-_JJ icant_JJ correlation_NN at_IN the_DT same_JJ hours_NNS of_IN the_DT lay_NN between_IN body_NN temperature_NN and_CC air_NN temperature_NN ._.
In_IN a_DT later_JJ paper_NN by_IN Manresa_NNP and_CC Falcon_NNP [_NNP 1939_CD ]_NN for_IN six_CD mature_NN Nellore_NNP cattle_VBZ higher_JJR values_NNS are_VBP given_VBN ,_, viz_NN ._.
average_JJ 39.01°C_CD ._.
(_( 102.2°F_CD ._. )_)
during_IN the_DT hotter_JJ part_NN of_IN the_DT year_NN ,_, March_NNP to_TO July_NNP (_( average_JJ air_NN emperature_NN 28.22°C_CD ._.
or_CC 82.8°F_CD ._. )_)
and_CC average_JJ 38.82°C_CD ._.
(_( 101.88°F_CD ._. )_)
during_IN the_DT ooler_NN months64_NN Rectal_NNP Temperatures_NNP of_IN Animals_NNP at_IN Rest_NNP atures_NNS (_( 3-5_CD p.m._NN )_) increased_VBD from_IN 106.4_CD to_TO 108.6ºF._CD ,_, so_RB that_IN the_DT difference_NN between_IN the_DT a.m._NN and_CC p.m._NN averages_NNS at_IN the_DT highest_JJS air_NN temperature_NN was_VBD as_RB much_JJ as_IN 3.0º_CD F._NNP From_NNP two-hourly_JJ body_NN temperature_NN recordings_NNS ,_, taken_VBN over_RP periods_NNS when_WRB the_DT average_JJ room_NN temperature_NN ranged_VBD from_IN about_IN 57_CD to_TO 75ºF._CD ,_, it_PRP was_VBD shown_VBN that_IN body_NN temperatures_NNS were_VBD highest_JJS at_IN 4_CD a.m_NN ,_, and_CC lowest_JJS at_IN mid-_JJ night_NN (_( cf_NN ._.
Fronda_NNP above_IN )_) ,_, the_DT difference_NN being_VBG about_IN 1.5°F_CD ._.
The_DT general_JJ finding_NN therefore_NN was_VBD that_IN body_NN temperatures_NNS increased_VBD and_CC decreased_VBD in_IN nearly_RB direct_JJ relation_NN to_TO the_DT air_NN temperature_NN ._.
The_DT greatest_JJS change_NN in_IN body_NN temperature_NN occur-_JJ red_JJ between_IN 6_CD and_CC 8_CD p.m._NN ,_, with_IN a_DT decrease_NN of_IN about_IN 0.8ºF_CD ._.
EXPERIMENTAL_NNP CONDITIONS_NNP The_DT experiments_NNS were_VBD made_VBN on_IN male_NN buffaloes_NNS ,_, cows_NNS of_IN theHariana_NNS breed_VBN ,_, sheep_JJ ,_, goats_NNS and_CC fowls_NN at_IN Izatnagar_NNP and_CC on_IN Kum-_NNP auni_JJ hill-bulls_NNS and_CC sheep_NN at_IN Mukteswar_NNP ._.
The_DT animals_NNS selected_VBN appeared_VBD to_TO be_VB in_IN reasonably_RB good_JJ health_NN ,_, but_CC a_DT few_JJ troubles_NNS developed_VBD during_IN the_DT experiments_NNS ._.
They_PRP were_VBD housed_VBN in_IN sheds_NNS sheltered_VBN by_IN trees_NNS and_CC were_VBD not_RB crowded_VBN ._.
In_IN winter_NN some_DT straw_JJ bedding_NN was_VBD provided_VBN ._.
They_PRP were_VBD watered_VBN and_CC fed_VBN at_IN times_NNS that_WDT would_MD not_RB interfere_VB with_IN the_DT observations_NNS ._.
The_DT cattle_NNS were_VBD given_VBN an_DT adequate_JJ ration_NN ;_: cows_VBZ received_VBD a_DT concentrated_JJ mixture_NN usually_RB containing_VBG ground-nut_JJ cake_NN ,_, rape-cake_NN ,_, wheat_NN bran_NN ,_, gram_JJ husk_NN ,_, with_IN mineral_JJ supplement_NN ,_, while_IN the_DT roughage_NN consisted_VBD of_IN hay_NN or_CC bhusa_NN ,_, fresh_JJ green_JJ fodder_NN or_CC silage_NN according_VBG to_TO the_DT season_NN ._.
Buffaloes_NNS ._.
got_VBD gram_NN or_CC cowpeas_NNS and_CC maize_VB or_CC jowar_VB with_IN the_DT concentrates_NNS ._.
Hill-bulls_NNP got_VBD a_DT ration_NN similar_JJ to_TO the_DT cows_NNS ,_, while_IN the_DT sheep_NN and_CC goats_NNS also_RB got_VBD a_DT suitable_JJ concentrate_NN and_CC roughage_NN ration_NN ._.
With_IN the_DT cattle_NNS and_CC buffaloes_NNS five_CD series_NN of_IN observations_NNS lasting_VBG 10_CD ,_, 10_CD ,_, 13_CD ,_, 12_CD and_CC 10_CD days_NNS were_VBD made_VBN in_IN April_NNP ,_, June_NNP ,_, July_NNP ,_, August_NNP and_CC December_NNP 1941_CD ,_, the_DT tempera-_JJ tures_NNS being_VBG recorded_VBN at_IN 7_CD and_CC 10_CD a.m._RB ,_, 1_CD ,_, 4_CD ,_, 7_CD and_CC 10_CD p.m._NN and_CC occasionally_RB at_IN 1_CD and_CC 4_CD a.m_NN ._.
In_IN April_NNP ,_, July_NNP and_CC December_NNP in_IN case_NN of_IN buffaloes_NNS supplementary_JJ figures_NNS for_IN 7_CD a.m._NN and_CC 4_CD p._NN m._NN were_VBD taken_VBN from_IN a_DT other_JJ experiment_NN ._.
With_IN sheep_JJ and_CC goat_NN at_IN Izatnagar_NNP there_EX were_VBD two_CD series_NN ea_NN of_IN five_CD days_NNS in_IN February_NNP and_CC June_NNP 1942_CD and_CC with_IN fowls_NNS ,_, two_CD series_NN each_DT of_IN three_CD days_NNS in_IN February_NNP and_CC (_( end_NN )_) May_NNP 1942_CD At_IN Mukteswar_NNP hourly_RB temperature_NN obser_NN vations_NNS extending_VBG over_IN 24_CD hours_NNS were_VBD made_VBN on_IN hill-bulls_NNS and_CC sheep_NN during_IN July_NNP 1942_CD ._.
Dry-bulb_JJ temperatures_NNS were_VBD recor_NNS ded_VBN with_IN a_DT hygrometer_NN suspended_VBN at_IN the_DT centre_NN of_IN the_DT shed_JJ or_CC room_NN at_IN about_IN eight_CD feet_NNS from_IN the_DT ground_NN ._.
The_DT following_NN details_NNS are_VBP necessary_JJ ._.
Buffaloes_NNS ._.
Five_CD male_JJ Indian_JJ rive_NN buffaloes_NNS of_IN 'country_NN '_'' breed_NN ,_, 6-8_JJ years_NNS old_JJ and_CC weighing_VBG 950_CD to_TO 1,100_CD lb_NN ._.
were_VBD used_VBN They_PRP were_VBD housed_VBN in_IN a_DT chapper_NN open_VBZ the_DT sides_NNS ._.
They_PRP were_VBD watered_VBN daily_RB 7-30_JJ a.m._NN and_CC 3_CD p.m._NN and_CC fed_VBN at_IN 10-30_JJ a.m._NN and_CC 4-30_JJ p.m_NN ._.
Slight_NNP exercise_NN was_VBD given_VBN at_IN 7-30_JJ a.m._NN Two_CD of_IN them_PRP suffered_VBD from_IN slight_JJ diarrhoea_NN for_IN a_DT few_JJ days_NNS during_IN the_DT first_JJ experiment_NN (_( April_NNP )_) and_CC one_CD of_IN the_DT had_VBN to_TO be_VB replaced_VBN before_IN the_DT next_JJ experi-_JJ ments_NNS ._.
Cows_NNS ._.
Five_CD in_IN number_NN ,_, ages_NNS in_IN year_NN 3_CD ,_, 4_CD ,_, 10_CD ,_, 11_CD and_CC 14_CD ,_, body_NN weights_NNS 870-1,10_JJ lb_NN ._.
Two_CD of_IN them_PRP calved_VBN in_IN February_NNP 1942_CD and_CC were_VBD in_IN milk_NN during_IN the_DT first_JJ three_CD experiments_NNS ;_: before_IN the_DT fifth_JJ experiment_NN (_( December_NNP )_) one_CD of_IN them_PRP went_VBD dry_JJ and_CC two_CD others_NNS had_VBD calved_VBN in_IN September_NNP and_CC October_NNP ._.
They_PRP were_VBD tied_VBN in_IN a_DT shed_NN ,_, which_WDT was_VBD closed_VBN on_IN three_CD sides_NNS ,_, except_IN from_IN to_TO 10_CD a.m._NN when_WRB they_PRP were_VBD tied_VBN in_IN the_DT open_JJ ._.
The_DT only_JJ exercise_NN was_VBD a_DT short_JJ wal_NN after_IN 10_CD a.m._RB Watering_NNP was_VBD at_IN 7-30_JJ a.m._NN and_CC 3_CD p.m._NN ;_: feeding_VBG at_IN 5_CD a.m._NN and_CC 3._CD p.m._NN at_IN which_WDT times_NNS they_PRP were_VBD milked_VBN ._.
The_DT air_NN temperature_NN in_IN the_DT shed_NN was_VBD about_IN the_DT same_JJ as_IN that_DT in_IN the_DT buffalo-shed_JJ ._.
All_DT five_CD remained_VBN in_IN normal_JJ health_NN ,_, except_IN that_IN the_DT youngest_JJS had_VBD a_DT slightly_RB raised_VBN tempere_JJ ature_NN for_IN 1½_CD days_NNS during_IN the_DT second_JJ experi_JJ ment_NN ._.
The_DT third_JJ and_CC fourth_JJ experiment_NN (_( July_NNP ,_, August_NNP )_) coincided_VBD with_IN the_DT monsoon_NN and_CC rain_NN totalling_VBG 11.07_CD inches_NNS fell_VBD on_IN nine_CD of_IN the_DT 25_CD days_NNS in_IN these_DT experiments_NNS ._.
The_DT temperature_NN of_IN the_DT rain_NN water_NN was_VBD 75-78°F_JJ ._.
During_IN the_DT fifth_JJ experiment_NN the_DT other_JJ F._NNP C._NNP MINETT_NNP and_CC S._NNP SEN_NNP 65_CD Cows_NNP of_IN the_DT milking_NN herd_NN were_VBD also_RB oused_VBN in_IN the_DT shed_VBN from_IN 2_CD p.m._NN to_TO 7-30_JJ m._NN Sheep_NNP (_( at_IN Izatnagar_NNP )_) ._.
Ten_CD male_JJ sheep_NN of_IN 'country_NN '_'' breed_NN were_VBD used_VBN ,_, all_DT 1-1½_JJ eárs_NN old_JJ ._.
At_IN the_DT first_JJ experiment_JJ their_PRP$ body_NN weights_NNS were_VBD 36-44_JJ lb_NN ._.
and_CC at_IN the_DT second_JJ 44-60_JJ lb_NN ._.
They_PRP were_VBD tied_VBN about_IN 2-_JJ eet_NN apart_RB in_IN a_DT shed_JJ open_NN on_IN the_DT east_JJ side_NN ._.
They_PRP had_VBD not_RB been_VBN recently_RB shorn_VBN ;_: Goats_NNP ._.
Ten_CD were_VBD used_VBN in_IN each_DT series_NN of_IN experiments_NNS ;_: before_IN the_DT second_JJ experi-_JJ ment_NN (_( June_NNP )_) there_EX were_VBD three_CD replace-_JJ ments_NNS ._.
Four_CD were_VBD males_NNS and_CC nine_CD were_VBD females_NNS ,_, and_CC all_DT but_CC one_CD were_VBD 1½_CD years_NNS old_JJ ,_, me_PRP being_VBG four_CD years_NNS old_JJ ._.
At_IN the_DT first_JJ experiment_NN their_PRP$ weights_NNS were_VBD 26-40_JJ lb_NN ._.
and_CC at_IN the_DT second_JJ 30-52_JJ lb_NN ._.
They_PRP were_VBD oused_VBN with_IN the_DT sheep_NN ,_, and_CC as_IN with_IN sheep_JJ water_NN was_VBD offered_VBN after_IN every_DT tempera-_JJ ture-recording_NN ._.
Fowls_NNP ._.
Nine_NN cocks_NNS ,_, 1_CD year_NN old_JJ and_CC about_IN lb_NN ._.
in_IN weight_NN ,_, were_VBD used_VBN ,_, mostly_RB White_NNP Leghorn-desi_NNP cross_NN ._.
They_PRP were_VBD kept_VBN in_IN separate_JJ cages_NNS in_IN a_DT large_JJ laboratory_NN ,_, the_DT doors_NNS and_CC windows_NNS of_IN which_WDT were_VBD kept_VBN open_JJ from_IN 10_CD a.m._NN to_TO 4_CD p.m._NN during_IN the_DT May_NNP experiment_NN ._.
Food_NN and_CC water_NN were_VBD always_RB available_JJ in_IN the_DT cage_NN ._.
Sheep_NNP (_( at_IN Mukteswar_NNP )_) ._.
Nine_NNP sheep_NN ,_, 1-1½_JJ years_NNS of_IN age_NN ,_, were_VBD selected_VBN as_IN being_VBG n_JJ reasonable_JJ health_NN ,_, though_IN three_CD of_IN them_PRP ad_NN 'snuffles_NNS '_POS ._.
They_PRP had_VBD been_VBN shorn_VBN eleven_JJ days_NNS before_IN the_DT experiment_NN ._.
They_PRP were_VBD kept_VBN untethered_JJ in_IN a_DT shed_JJ ,_, the_DT air_NN temper-_JJ ature_NN of_IN which_WDT was_VBD maintained_VBN at_IN 69-_JJ 4°F_CD ._.
Hill-bulls_NNS ._.
Ten_CD were_VBD used_VBN and_CC they_PRP were_VBD housed_VBN in_IN the_DT shed_NN which_WDT had_VBD been_VBN used_VBN for_IN the_DT sheep_NN ._.
The_DT air_NN temperature_NN was_VBD maintained_VBN at_IN 70-75ºF_NNP ._.
They_PRP were_VBD watered_VBN three_CD hours_NNS before_IN the_DT experiment_NN was_VBD started_VBN and_CC immediately_RB afterwards_NNS ._.
Hay_NNP was_VBD fed_VBN at_IN 6_CD a.m_NN ._.
PRELIMINARY_JJ EXPERIMENTS_NNP The_DT personal_JJ factor_NN in_IN temperature-taking_NN This_DT is_VBZ a_DT matter_NN ,_, the_DT importance_NN of_IN which_WDT can_MD not_RB be_VB too_RB often_RB stressed_JJ ,_, especia-_JJ lly_RB since_IN the_DT work_NN is_VBZ frequently_RB placed_VBN in_IN |the_NNP hands_NNS of_IN uninstructed_JJ subordinates_NNS ._.
The_DT technique_NN of_IN individuals_NNS varies_NNS ,_, both_DT in_IN respect_NN of_IN the_DT time_NN the_DT thermometer_NN is_VBZ allowed_VBN to_TO remain_VB in_IN the_DT rectum_NN and_CC the_DT depth_NN to_TO which_WDT it_PRP is_VBZ inserted_VBN ._.
In_IN order_NN to_TO check_VB up_RP these_DT points_NNS some_DT experiments_NNS were_VBD arranged_VBN ._.
In_IN one_CD of_IN these_DT ,_, six_CD obser-_JJ vers_NNS ,_, all_DT professionally_RB qualified_VBN ,_, were_VBD ._.
engaged_VBN to_TO take_VB the_DT temperatures_NNS of_IN five_CD cows_NNS and_CC five_CD buffaloes_NNS ,_, one_CD observer_NN (_( F.C_NNP ._.
M._NNP )_) acting_VBG as_IN control_NN ._.
None_NN of_IN the_DT others_NNS was_VBD informed_VBN of_IN the_DT object_NN of_IN the_DT experiment_NN ,_, but_CC an_DT instruction_NN was_VBD given_VBN that_IN the_DT thermo-_JJ meter_NN was_VBD to_TO remain_VB in_IN the_DT rectum_NN for_IN exactly_RB one_CD minute_NN from_IN the_DT time_NN it_PRP was_VBD considered_VBN to_TO be_VB in_IN position_NN ._.

and_CC showed_VBD differences_NNS of_IN not_RB more_JJR than_IN 0.2ºF_CD ._.
and_CC usually_RB not_RB more_JJR than_IN 0.1ºF_CD ._.

Relation_NN between_IN air_NN temperature_NN and_CC body_NN temperature_VBP The_DT information_NN just_RB given_VBN on_IN the_DT body_NN temperature_NN variations_NNS within_IN the_DT day_NN and_CC at_IN different_JJ months_NNS agrees_VBZ with_IN the_DT now_RB well-known_JJ fact_NN that_IN air_NN temperature_NN largely_RB influences_VBZ body_NN temperature_NN in_IN the_DT animal_NN species_NNS considered_VBN ._.
In_IN Fig_NNP ._.
3_CD are_VBP drawn_VBN graphs_NN of_IN the_DT mid-_JJ range_NN air_NN temperature_NN at_IN different_JJ times_NNS of_IN the_DT day_NN for_IN different_JJ months_NNS and_CC the_DT mean_JJ daily_JJ body_NN temperature_NN at_IN corres-_JJ ponding_NN hours_NNS ._.
Without_IN going_VBG into_IN details_NNS ,_, it_PRP will_MD be_VB seen_VBN that_DT except_IN with_IN the_DT fowls_NN a_DT rising_NN or_CC falling_VBG body_NN temper-_JJ ature_NN follows_VBZ ,_, after_IN a_DT lag_JJ period_NN of_IN perhaps_RB three_CD hours_NNS ,_, a_DT rising_VBG or_CC falling_VBG air_NN temper-_JJ ature_NN ._.
With_IN fowls_NN ,_, there_EX was_VBD no_DT indication_NN from_IN these_DT experiments_NNS that_IN a_DT rising_VBG air_NN temperature_NN influenced_VBD the_DT body_NN temper-_JJ ature_NN ,_, but_CC a_DT falling_VBG air_NN temperature_NN after_IN 4_CD p.m._NN was_VBD coincident_JJ with_IN a_DT falling_VBG body_NN temperature_NN ._.
SUMMARY_NNP The_DT following_JJ statement_NN shows_VBZ the_DT mean_JJ daily_JJ body_NN temperature_NN of_IN various_JJ species_NNS of_IN animals_NNS in_IN different_JJ months_NNS ,_, together_RB with_IN the_DT air_NN temperature_NN range_NN ._.

100.81_CD June.._NNP 8178_CD Rectal_NNP Temperatures_NNP of_IN Animals_NNP at_IN Re_NNP st_VBD 2_CD ._.
Hourly_JJ observations_NNS over_IN 24_CD hours_NNS on_IN hill-bulls_NNS and_CC sheep_NN showed_VBD that_IN the_DT body_NN temperature_NN starts_VBZ to_TO rise_VB about_RB 6_CD a.m._NN ,_, follows_VBZ an_DT upward_JJ trend_NN till_RB early_JJ evening_NN and_CC then_RB gradually_RB falls_VBZ to_TO a_DT minimum_JJ value_NN at_IN about_RB 1_CD to_TO 4_CD a.m._RB 3_CD ._.
In_IN cattle_NNS and_CC buffaloes_NNS ,_, sheep_NN and_CC goats_VBZ the_DT body_NN temperature_NN level_NN is_VBZ infl-_JJ uenced_JJ by_IN the_DT atmospheric_JJ temperature_NN ,_, variations_NNS in_IN the_DT latter_NN being_VBG followed_VBN by_IN similar_JJ variations_NNS of_IN body_NN temperature_NN ._.
The_DT diurnal_JJ level_NN therefore_RB tends_VBZ to_TO be_VB higher_JJR after_IN 1_CD p.m._NN than_IN before_IN that_DT time_NN ,_, the_DT difference_NN being_VBG far_RB greater_JJR with_IN buffaloes_NNS ,_, sheep_NN and_CC goats_NNS than_IN with_IN cattle_NNS ._.
4_CD ._.
In_IN temperature-taking_NN ,_, the_DT personal_JJ factor_NN is_VBZ important_JJ ._.
Without_IN special_JJ instruction_NN differences_NNS around_IN 1.0°F_CD ._.
may_MD be_VB registered_VBN by_IN different_JJ observers_NNS ._.
The_DT thermometer_NN should_MD be_VB inserted_VBN as_RB far_RB as_IN possible_JJ and_CC left_VBD in_IN position_NN for_IN one_CD minute_NN ._.
5_CD ._.

(_( mean_NN )_) at_IN 43_CD out_IN of_IN 51_CD trials_NNS ._.

504_CD A_NNP NOTE_NNP ON_NNP DERRIS_NNP DRESSING_NNP OF_NNP YOUNG_NNP CHICKS_NNP FOR_IN THE_NNP CONTROL_NNP OF_NNP SEED-TICKS_NNP (_( LARVAE_NNP OF_NNP ARGAS_NNP PERSICUS_NNP OKEN_NNP )_) By_IN S._NNP Gr_NNP ._.
IYER_NNP and_CC Z_NNP ._.
A._NN HASHMI_NNP ,_, Poultry_NNP Research_NNP Section_NNP ,_, Imperial_NNP veterinary_NNP Research_NNP Institute_NNP ,_, Izatnagar_NNP (_( Received_VBN for_IN publication_NN on_IN 9_CD September_NNP 1944_CD ._. )_)
EN_NNP [_NN 1942_CD ]_NN was_VBD successful_JJ in_IN eradi-_JJ ting_NN Argas_NNP persicus_NN larvae_NN from_IN affected_VBN awls_NN by_IN the_DT application_NN of_IN a_DT 10.0_CD per_IN cent_NN ueous_JJ suspension_NN of_IN derris_JJ root_NN powder_NN ._.
The_DT treatment_NN was_VBD tried_VBN by_IN the_DT authors_NNS in_IN an_DT adult_NN fowl_NN ,_, a_DT one_CD month_NN old_JJ and_CC six_CD ago-week_JJ old_JJ heavily_RB infested_JJ chicks_NNS in_IN a_DT private_JJ flock_NN where_WRB 'seed-ticks_NNS '_POS were_VBD cau-_JJ sing_JJ annoyance_NN and_CC loss_NN ._.
Six_CD of_IN the_DT chicks_NNS ed_VBP within_IN an_DT hour_NN of_IN the_DT derris_JJ appli-_JJ tion_NN ,_, while_IN the_DT two_CD oldest_JJS birds_NNS suffered_VBD no_DT apparent_JJ injury_NN ._.
In_IN order_NN to_TO test_VB the_DT toxicity_NN of_IN derris_NN applications_NNS ,_, small-scale_JJ experiments_NNS were_VBD undertaken_VBN on_IN chickens_NNS of_IN different_JJ ages_NNS ._.
EXPERIMENTAL_NNP The_DT chicks_NNS used_VBN in_IN these_DT experiments_NNS were_VBD hatched_VBN and_CC reared_VBN at_IN the_DT Institute_NNP poultry_NN farm_NN ._.
In_IN each_DT experiment_NN an_DT equal_JJ number_NN of_IN untreated_JJ chicks_NNS were_VBD used_VBN as_IN controls_NNS ,_, all_PDT these_DT remained_VBN healthy_JJ ._.
Derris_NNP not_RB powder_NN was_VBD made_VBN into_IN a_DT 10.0_CD per_IN cent_NN suspension_NN in_IN water_NN and_CC after_IN thorough_JJ stirring_NN was_VBD applied_VBN with_IN cotton-wool_NN to_TO the_DT whole_NN of_IN body_NN ,_, except_IN the_DT natural_JJ ori-_JJ fices_NNS and_CC eyes_NNS ._.
The_DT result_NN is_VBZ shown_VBN in_IN Table_NNP I_PRP ._.
TABLE_NN I_PRP Mortality_NNP in_IN chicks_NNS due_JJ to_TO derris_VB dressing_VBG Age_NNP of_IN chicks_NNS Number_NNP dressed_VBD Number_NNP dying_VBG after_IN dressing_VBG Remarks_NNP 2_CD 11_CD 7_CD Dead_JJ chicks_NNS showed_VBD acute_JJ parenchymatous_JJ nephritis_NN ._.
16_CD 11_CD 7_CD All_DT deaths_NNS occurred_VBD within_IN 18_CD hours_NNS of_IN derris_NN dressing_NN ._.
35_CD 11_CD 1_CD 60_CD 11_CD Nil_NNP As_IN derris_NN dressing_NN was_VBD found_VBN to_TO be_VB unsafe_JJ in_IN very_RB young_JJ chicks_NNS ,_, and_CC as_IN Sen_NNP [_NNP 1942_CD ]_NNP had_VBD applied_VBN the_DT dressing_VBG on_IN limited_JJ areas_NNS of_IN the_DT body_NN ,_, it_PRP was_VBD decided_VBN to_TO experi-_JJ ment_NN with_IN partial_JJ dressing_NN ,_, using_VBG very_RB young_JJ chicks_NNS (_( 2_CD and_CC 16_CD days_NNS old_JJ )_) ._.
The_DT results_NNS are_VBP given_VBN in_IN Table_NNP II_NNP ._.

and_CC 50_CD gm_NN ._.

Kumauni_NNP hill_NN cattle_NNS ._.
The_DT home_NN of_IN this_DT breed_NN is_VBZ the_DT Kumaun_NNP foot-hills_NNS of_IN the_DT Himalaya_NNP ._.
It_PRP is_VBZ one_CD of_IN the_DT smallest_JJS breeds_NNS of_IN Indian_JJ cattle_NNS ,_, with_IN short_JJ horns_NNS and_CC a_DT thoracic_JJ musculo-fatty_JJ hump_NN ._.

The_DT animals_NNS were_VBD collected_VBN from_IN various_JJ Kumauni_NNP hills_NNS and_CC may_MD therefore_RB be_VB regarded_VBN as_IN of_IN divergent_NN strains_NNS ._.

Amritmahal_NNP ._.

The_DT blood-group_NN relationship_NN to_TO these_DT three_CD breeds_NNS are_VBP too_RB close_JJ to_TO be_VB ignore_RB and_CC this_DT raises_VBZ the_DT interesting_JJ possibility_NN that_IN breed_NN may_MD not_RB after_IN all_DT have_VBP been_VBN imported_VBN a_DT separate_JJ migration_NN wave_NN ,_, but_CC may_MD be_VB the_DT outco_NN of_IN the_DT magnificient_NN efforts_NNS of_IN the_DT rulers_NNS of_IN Mys_NNP to_TO evolve_VB an_DT army_NN transport_NN beast_NN by_IN the_DT crossi_NN of_IN local_JJ south_JJ India_NNP cattle_NNS (_( Kangayam_NNP bree_VBP with_IN grey-white_JJ cattle_NNS (_( Ongole-Kankrej_NNP )_) ._.
Oth_NNP wise_NN ,_, there_EX must_MD be_VB some_DT common_JJ ancestry_VBP their_PRP$ original_JJ home_NN ._.
Summary_JJ 1_CD ._.

The_DT final_JJ blood-grouping_NN by_IN percentag_NN is_VBZ :_: group_NN O_NNP ,_, 26-8_JJ ;_: group_NN A_DT and_CC B_NNP (_( mixed_JJ )_) ,_, 8_CD group_NN AB_NNP ,_, 36_CD and_CC group_NN IV_NNP (_( negative_JJ )_) ,_, 28.8_CD ._.

3_CD ._.
Gir_NNP ,_, Red_NNP Sindhi_NNP ,_, Sahiwal_NNP and_CC Afghan_NNP cat_VBP show_VB a_DT similarity_NN in_IN blood-grouping_NN ,_, especially_RB respect_NN of_IN the_DT high_JJ frequency_NN of_IN group_NN O_NNP ,_, so_RB th_JJ these_DT four_CD breeds_NNS may_MD be_VB regarded_VBN as_IN related_JJ Hariana_NNP ,_, Ongole_NNP ,_, Kankrej_NNP and_CC Amritmal_NNP were_VBD also_RB very_RB similar_JJ to_TO one_CD another_DT and_CC so_RB m_JJ be_VB from_IN the_DT same_JJ stock_NN or_CC closely_RB related_JJ ._.

4_CD ._.

EXPERIMENTAL_NNP The_DT experimental_JJ animals_NNS were_VBD normal_JJ adult_JJ cows_NNS of_IN the_DT Hariana_NNP breed_VBD belonging_VBG to_TO the_DT Izatnagar_NNP Dairy-Farm_NNP ._.
They_PRP were_VBD selected_VBN because_IN their_PRP$ blood_NN constituents_NNS had_VBD remained_VBN constant_JJ under_IN various_JJ normal_JJ physiological_JJ conditions_NNS [_VBP Mullick_NNP and_CC Pal_NNP ,_, 1943_CD ]_NN ._.
Feeding_VBG and_CC management_NN were_VBD under_IN supervision_NN ._.
All_DT had_VBD been_VBN immunized_VBN against_IN rinderpest_NN and_CC were_VBD tuberculin-_JJ negative_JJ ;_: they_PRP remained_VBD in_IN sound_JJ health_NN through-_NN out_IN the_DT observations_NNS (_( November_NNP 1941_CD to_TO October_NNP 1942_CD )_) ._.
Since_IN proposed_VBN fortnightly_RB examinations_NNS were_VBD not_RB possible_JJ ,_, analyses_NNS were_VBD made_VBN monthly_RB ._.
Blood_NN samples_NNS were_VBD taken_VBN in_IN the_DT morning_NN before_IN feeding_NN and_CC at_IN practically_RB the_DT same_JJ period_NN even_RB month_NN ._.
Oxalated_VBN blood_NN was_VBD analysed_VBN for_IN re_NN cells_NNS ,_, white_JJ cells_NNS ,_, hæmoglobin_NN ,_, cell_NN volume_NN ,_, iron_NN inorganic_JJ phosphorus_NN ,_, sugar_NN and_CC cholesterol_NN Calcium_NNP ,_, magnesium_NN ,_, protein_NN and_CC non-protein_JJ nitrogens_NNS were_VBD estimated_VBN in_IN the_DT serum_NN ._.
Samples_NNS for_IN inorganic_JJ phosphorus_NN and_CC sugar_NN were_VBD depro_JJ teinized_VBN at_IN the_DT spot_NN of_IN bleeding_NN ._.
METHODS_NNP Cell-volume_NNP ,_, cholesterol_NN ,_, protein_NN and_CC non-protein_JJ nitrogens_NNS were_VBD determined_VBN by_IN the_DT methods_NNS Napier_NNP and_CC Das_NNP Gupta_NNP [_NNP 1941_CD ]_NNP ,_, Banerjee_NNP [_NNP 1937_CD and_CC Kjeldahl_NNP [_NNP 1883_CD ]_NNP ,_, respectively_RB ._.

From_IN the_DT tables_NNS ,_, it_PRP will_MD be_VB seen_VBN that_IN the_DT average_JJ values_NNS remained_VBD practically_RB constant_JJ throughout_IN the_DT year_NN ._.
However_RB ,_, highly_RB significant_JJ differences_NNS were_VBD found_VBN among_IN individual_JJ animals_NNS ._.
Hæmoglobin_NNP ._.
Highly_NNP significant_JJ differences_NNS existed_VBN in_IN the_DT monthly_JJ averages_NNS as_RB well_RB as_IN in_IN the_DT means_NNS of_IN individual_JJ animals_NNS ._.
Monthly_JJ averages_NNS declined_VBD gradually_RB from_IN February_NNP to_TO June_NNP ,_, and_CC from_IN July_NNP they_PRP started_VBD to_TO increase_VB ._.
It_PRP appears_VBZ that_IN the_DT concentration_NN of_IN hæmoglobin_NN is_VBZ inversely_RB proportional_JJ to_TO the_DT change_NN of_IN atmospheric_JJ tem-_JJ perature_NN ._.
In_IN South_NNP Africa_NNP ,_, Hammersma_NNP [_NNP 1937_CD ]_NNP studied_VBD the_DT seasonal_JJ variation_NN of_IN hæmoglobin_NN in_IN animals_NNS and_CC found_VBD no_DT significant_JJ variation_NN in_IN monthly_JJ averages_NNS ._.
Manresa_NNP and_CC Orig_NNP [_NNP 1941_CD ]_NN in_IN the_DT Philippines_NNPS observed_VBD that_IN the_DT hæmoglobin_NN concentration_NN in_IN experimental_JJ animals_NNS was_VBD higher_RBR in_IN winter_NN than_IN in_IN summer_NN ._.
In_IN the_DT United_NNP States_NNPS Bazett_NNP Sunderman_NNP ,_, Doupe_NNP and_CC Scott_NNP [_NNP 1940_CD ]_NNP ,_, working_VBG on_IN human_JJ subjects_NNS ,_, found_VBD that_IN a_DT slight_JJ variation_NN in_IN the_DT temperature_NN of_IN the_DT experimental_JJ chamber_NN resulted_VBD in_IN variation_NN in_IN the_DT concentration_NN of_IN blood_NN constituents_NNS ,_, the_DT trend_NN of_IN changes_NNS being_VBG similar_JJ to_TO that_DT observed_VBN by_IN us_PRP ._.
Cell-volume_NNP ._.
The_DT variation_NN of_IN cell-volume_NN as_IN a_DT result_NN of_IN change_NN in_IN air_NN temperature_NN resembled_VBD that_IN of_IN hæmoglobin_NN ._.
Statistical_JJ analysis_NN showed_VBD that_IN there_EX was_VBD highly_RB significant_JJ difference_NN among_IN the_DT monthly_JJ averages_NNS as_RB well_RB as_IN among_IN the_DT means_NNS of_IN individual_JJ animals_NNS ._.
This_DT value_NN was_VBD inversely_RB proportional_JJ to_TO the_DT change_NN of_IN temperature_NN ._.
The_DT variation_NN in_IN the_DT composition_NN of_IN body-fluid_NN with_IN seasonal_JJ change_NN helps_VBZ heat-regulation_NN in_IN the_DT animal_NN ._.
In_IN summer_NN ,_, the_DT secretions_NNS of_IN thyroxine_NN and_CC adrenaline_JJ temporarily_RB inhibit_VB dilation_NN of_IN the_DT cutaneous_JJ capillaries_NNS and_CC the_DT increase_NN in_IN plasma_JJ volume_NN helps_VBZ in_IN giving_VBG out_RP the_DT body_NN heat_NN formed_VBN in_IN excess_JJ [_JJ Kuno_NNP ._.
1935_CD ]_NN ._.
122_CD Composition_NN of_IN the_DT Blood_NNP of_IN Farm_NNP Animals_NNP in_IN India_NNP Mean_NNP corpuscular_JJ volume_NN ._.
The_DT average_JJ monthly_JJ values_NNS showed_VBD highly_RB significant_JJ variations_NNS ,_, but_CC the_DT means_NNS of_IN individual_JJ animals_NNS did_VBD not_RB differ_VB significantly_RB ._.
Monthly_JJ variation_NN was_VBD similar_JJ to_TO that_DT of_IN cell-volume_NN ._.
Mean_NNP corpuscular_JJ hæmoglobin_NN ._.
Highly_RB signi-_JJ ficant_NN differences_NNS existed_VBD among_IN the_DT monthly_JJ averages_NNS as_RB well_RB as_IN in_IN individual_JJ animals_NNS ._.
The_DT values_NNS were_VBD higher_JJR in_IN winter_NN than_IN summer_NN ._.
Mean_NNP corpuscular_JJ hæmoglobin_NN concentration_NN ._.
The_DT average_NN values_NNS showed_VBD no_DT significant_JJ variation_NN in_IN the_DT various_JJ months_NNS or_CC in_IN the_DT individual_JJ animals_NNS ._.
The_DT change_NN in_IN both_DT hæmoglobin_NN and_CC cell-volume_NN was_VBD shown_VBN to_TO be_VB proportional_JJ ._.
Iron_NNP ._.
There_EX were_VBD highly_RB significant_JJ differences_NNS among_IN the_DT monthly_JJ averages_NNS and_CC in_IN individual_JJ animals_NNS ._.
No_DT seasonal_JJ variation_NN was_VBD noted_VBN by_IN Hammersma_NNP [_NNP 1937_CD ]_NN in_IN South_JJ African_JJ animals_NNS ._.
Considering_VBG the_DT close_NN relationship_NN between_IN hæmoglobin_NN and_CC iron_NN ,_, it_PRP might_MD have_VB been_VBN expected_VBN that_IN variation_NN in_IN iron_NN would_MD be_VB similar_JJ to_TO that_DT of_IN hæmoglobin_NN ._.
Inorganic_JJ phosphorus_NN ._.
There_EX was_VBD no_DT significant_JJ difference_NN among_IN the_DT monthly_JJ averages_NNS but_CC mean_JJ values_NNS of_IN the_DT individual_JJ animal_NN differed_VBD signifi-_JJ cantly_RB ._.
Sugar_NNP ._.
The_DT mean_NN values_NNS showed_VBD no_DT significant_JJ differences_NNS in_IN the_DT monthly_JJ observations_NNS or_CC in_IN individual_JJ animals_NNS ._.
Cholesterol_NN ._.
Neither_CC the_DT monthly_JJ averages_NNS nor_CC the_DT means_NNS of_IN the_DT individual_JJ animals_NNS varied_VBD signi-_JJ ficantly_RB ._.
Ghosh_NNP [_NN 1933_CD ]_NN came_VBD to_TO a_DT similar_JJ conclu-_JJ sion_NN from_IN a_DT statistical_JJ study_NN of_IN the_DT seasonal_JJ varia-_JJ tion_NN in_IN human_JJ blood_NN ._.
Calcium_NN ._.
There_EX were_VBD highly_RB significant_JJ differ-_JJ ences_NNS in_IN both_DT the_DT means_NNS of_IN monthly_JJ observations_NNS and_CC in_IN the_DT averages_NNS of_IN individual_JJ animals_NNS ._.
Month-_JJ ly_NN values_NNS gradually_RB increased_VBN with_IN rise_NN of_IN tempera-_JJ ture_NN in_IN summer_NN and_CC gradually_RB decreased_VBN with_IN the_DT advance_NN of_IN winter_NN ._.
Hammersma_NNP [_NN 1937_CD ]_NNP noted_VBD similar_JJ changes_NNS in_IN cattle_NNS ,_, but_CC the_DT difference_NN was_VBD not_RB statistically_RB significant_JJ ._.
Craige_NNP and_CC Godd_NNP [_NNP 1941_CD ]_NNP found_VBD the_DT calcium_NN content_NN of_IN horse_NN 's_POS serum_NN to_TO be_VB at_IN its_PRP$ maximum_NN in_IN summer_NN ._.
Magnesium_NN ._.
Highly_NNP significant_JJ differences_NNS existed_VBD among_IN the_DT monthly_JJ averages_NNS as_RB well_RB as_IN in_IN individual_JJ animals_NNS ._.
Duncun_NNP ,_, Lightfoot_NNP and_CC Huff-_NNP man_NN [_NN 1940_CD ]_NN noted_VBD also_RB that_IN this_DT constituent_NN differed_VBD significantly_RB from_IN month_NN to_TO month_NN ,_, winter_NN values_NNS being_VBG greater_JJR than_IN summer_NN ones_NNS ._.
Protein_NNP and_CC non-protein_JJ nitrogen_NN ._.
Neither_CC the_DT average_JJ monthly_JJ values_NNS nor_CC the_DT means_NNS of_IN individual_JJ animals_NNS were_VBD found_VBN to_TO be_VB significantly_RB different_JJ ._.
Hammersma_NNP 's_POS [_NN 1937_CD ]_JJ findings_NNS were_VBD similar_JJ to_TO ours_VB ,_, SUMMARY_NNP Whole-blood_NNP and_CC serum_NN of_IN a_DT group_NN of_IN normal_JJ cows_NNS were_VBD analysed_VBN for_IN morphological_JJ and_CC chemical_JJ constituents_NNS over_IN a_DT period_NN of_IN 12_CD months_NNS ._.
Oxalated_VBN blood_NN was_VBD examined_VBN for_IN red_JJ cells_NNS ,_, white_JJ cells_NNS ,_, hæmoglobin_NN ,_, cell-volume_JJ ,_, iron_NN ,_, inorganic_JJ phos-_JJ phorus_NN ,_, sugar_NN and_CC cholesterol_NN ._.
Calcium_NN ,_, magne-_JJ sium_NN ,_, protein_NN and_CC non-protein_JJ nitrogen_NN were_VBD determined_VBN in_IN serum_NN ._.
Different_NNP corpuscular_NN values_NNS were_VBD calculated_VBN from_IN red_JJ cell_NN counts_NNS ,_, hæmoglobin_NN and_CC cell_NN volume_NN ._.
In_IN the_DT morphological_JJ series_NN ,_, hæmoglobin_JJ and_CC cell-volume_JJ exhibited_JJ significant_JJ seasonal_JJ variations_NNS ,_, whereas_NNS in_IN the_DT chemical_NN series_NN monthly_JJ averages_NNS for_IN iron_NN ,_, calcium_NN and_CC magnesium_NN showed_VBD significant_JJ differences_NNS ._.
In_IN the_DT former_JJ series_NN ,_, the_DT average_JJ values_NNS were_VBD highest_JJS in_IN winter_NN ,_, whereas_NNS in_IN the_DT latter_JJ series_NN they_PRP were_VBD highest_JJS in_IN summer_NN ._.
The_DT remaining_VBG constituents_NNS ,_, both_DT in_IN the_DT morphological_JJ and_CC chemical_JJ series_NN ,_, showed_VBD no_DT significant_JJ differences_NNS in_IN their_PRP$ monthly_JJ averages_NNS ._.
Practically_RB all_PDT the_DT constituents_NNS differed_VBD significantly_RB in_IN individual_JJ animals_NNS ._.
ACKNOWLEDGEMENT_IN We_PRP wish_VBP to_TO express_VB our_PRP$ gratitude_NN to_TO Dr_NNP K._NNP C._NNP Sen_NNP ,_, Officer-in-charge_NNP of_IN this_DT section_NN ,_, for_IN keen_JJ interest_NN and_CC helpful_JJ advice_NN during_IN the_DT whole_JJ period_NN of_IN observation_NN ._.

13_CD ,_, 517_CD THE_NNP COMPARATIVE_NNP VALUE_NNP OF_NNP SOME_NNP CONCENTRATES_NNP IN_NNP THE_NNP FEED_NNP OF_NNP GROWING_NNP CATTLE_NNP By_IN N._NNP C._NNP DAS_NNP GUPTA_NNP ,_, Research_NNP Officer_NNP ,_, Cattle_NNP Feeding_NNP Research_NNP Station_NNP ,_, Bharari_NNP ,_, Jhansi_NNP (_( Received_VBN for_IN publication_NN on_IN 2_CD February_NNP 1945_CD )_) (_( With_IN one_CD text-figure_NN )_) CONCENTRATES_NN can_MD be_VB broadly_RB classified_VBN into_IN three_CD groups_NNS according_VBG to_TO the_DT composition_NN ._.
Lin-_NNP seed_NN cake_NN ,_, decorticated_VBN and_CC undecorticated_JJ ground-_JJ nut_NN cakes_NNS ,_, til_NN (_( Sesamum_NNP indicum_NN )_) cake_NN ,_, rape_NN cake_NN ,_, cottonseed_VBP cake_NN and_CC guar_NN (_( Cyamopsis_NNP psoralioides_NNS )_) are_VBP the_DT common_JJ concentrates_NNS of_IN India_NNP ,_, having_VBG a_DT protein_NN content_NN of_IN over_IN 30_CD per_IN cent_NN ._.
Coconut_NNP cake_NN ,_, cotton_NN seed_NN ,_, pulses_NNS (_( legume_JJ seeds_NNS )_) and_CC pulse_JJ by-products_NNS are_VBP moderately_RB rich_JJ in_IN protein_NN and_CC have_VBP nutritive_JJ ratios_NNS similar_JJ to_TO the_DT standard_NN required_VBN for_IN production_NN ._.
Cereal_NN grains_NNS make_VBP the_DT third_JJ group_NN of_IN concentrates_NNS which_WDT are_VBP comparatively_RB rich_JJ in_IN carbohydrates_NNS but_CC low_JJ in_IN protein_NN content_NN ._.
This_DT paper_NN deals_VBZ with_IN the_DT feeding_VBG value_NN ,_, for_IN the_DT production_NN of_IN growth_NN ,_, of_IN five_CD oil_NN cakes_NNS ,_, viz_NN ._.
linseed_JJ cake_NN ,_, decorticated_VBN and_CC undecorticated_JJ groundnut_NN cakes_NNS ,_, rape_NN cake_NN and_CC til_JJ cake_NN and_CC four_CD legume_NN seeds_NNS or_CC their_PRP$ by-products_NNS ,_, viz_NN ._.
guar_NN ,_, gram_NN (_( Cicer_NNP trietinum_NN )_) ,_, arhar_FW (_( Cajanus_NNP indicus_NN )_) chuni_NN and_CC mung_NN Phaseolus_NNP mungo_NN )_) chuni_NN ._.
The_DT chuni_NN is_VBZ the_DT by-_JJ product_NN from_IN the_DT manufacture_NN of_IN split_NN pulse_NN (_( dal_NN )_) or_CC human_JJ consumption_NN ._.
It_PRP contains_VBZ chiefly_VB the_DT hulls_NNS ,_, along_IN with_IN the_DT germs_NNS and_CC broken_JJ parti-_JJ cles_NNS of_IN the_DT seed_NN ._.
In_IN all_PDT the_DT tests_NNS of_IN this_DT series_NN ,_, unseed_JJ cake_NN was_VBD used_VBN as_IN the_DT control_NN ,_, because_IN it_PRP is_VBZ one_CD of_IN the_DT most_RBS popular_JJ protein_NN supplements_NNS or_CC cattle_NNS and_CC produces_VBZ good_JJ results_NNS even_RB when_WRB used_VBN as_IN the_DT only_JJ concentrate_NN ._.
FEEDING_NN TRIAL_NNP WITH_NNP LINSEED_NNP CAKE_NNP ,_, UNDECOR-_NNP TICATED_NNP GROUNDNUT_NNP CAKE_NNP ,_, GRAM_NNP AND_NNP ARHAR_NNP chuni_NN (_( 1940_CD )_) In_IN August_NNP 1940_CD ,_, tests_NNS to_TO find_VB out_RP the_DT comparative_JJ feeding_NN values_NNS of_IN linseed_JJ cake_NN ,_, undecorticated_JJ groundnut_NN cake_NN ,_, gram_NN and_CC arhar_NN chuni_NN for_IN growth_NN were_VBD started_VBN with_IN 20_CD Hissar_NNP heifers_NNS ._.
The_DT basal_NN ation_NN ,_, which_WDT consisted_VBD of_IN wheat_NN straw_JJ ad_NN lib._NN ,_, 1lb_CD ._.
jowar_NN (_( Sorghum_NNP vulgare_NN )_) silage_NN ,_, 1.55_CD lb_NN ._.
wheat_NN ran_VBD and_CC linseed_VBD cake_NN for_IN protein_NN supplement_NN ,_, was_VBD fed_VBN to_TO all_PDT the_DT animals_NNS for_IN a_DT period_NN of_IN eight_CD weeks_NNS and_CC thereafter_RB they_PRP were_VBD distributed_VBN into_IN our_PRP$ comparable_JJ groups_NNS according_VBG to_TO age_NN ,_, live-_JJ weight_NN and_CC rate_NN of_IN growth_NN during_IN the_DT basal_JJ period_NN ._.
For_IN the_DT experimental_JJ feeding_NN ,_, group_NN I_PRP was_VBD allowed_VBN to_TO continue_VB the_DT basal_NN ration_NN and_CC groups_NNS II_NNP ,_, III_NNP and_CC IV_NNP received_VBD groundnut_JJ cake_NN ,_, gram_NN and_CC arhar_JJ chuni_NN respectively_RB in_IN place_NN of_IN linseed_NN cake_NN ,_, the_DT quantity_NN being_VBG regulated_VBN to_TO maintain_VB the_DT same_JJ level_NN of_IN protein_NN for_IN different_JJ groups_NNS ._.
Records_NNS of_IN daily_JJ liveweight_NN and_CC food_NN consumption_NN for_IN each_DT animal_NN were_VBD maintained_VBN during_IN the_DT test_NN which_WDT lasted_VBD for_IN a_DT period_NN of_IN 21_CD weeks_NNS ._.
The_DT distribution_NN of_IN animals_NNS for_IN the_DT different_JJ treatments_NNS and_CC their_PRP$ liveweight_JJ increase_NN during_IN the_DT experimental_JJ period_NN have_VBP been_VBN recorded_VBN in_IN Table_NNP I_PRP ._.
Rate_NN of_IN growth_NN with_IN the_DT different_JJ rations_NNS ._.
The_DT rate_NN of_IN growth_NN by_IN the_DT different_JJ treatments_NNS has_VBZ been_VBN statistically_RB analysed_VBN and_CC the_DT summary_NN of_IN the_DT results_NNS is_VBZ shown_VBN in_IN Table_NNP II_NNP ._.
Undecorticated_VBN groundnut_NNS cake_VBP produced_VBD the_DT lowest_JJS average_JJ growth_NN rate_NN ._.
Linseed_NNP cake_NN came_VBD next_JJ and_CC ,_, though_IN the_DT average_JJ growth_NN rate_NN is_VBZ very_RB signi-_JJ ficantly_RB higher_JJR than_IN that_DT with_IN groundnut_NNS cake_VBP ,_, it_PRP is_VBZ lower_JJR than_IN that_DT with_IN gram_NN and_CC arhar_JJ chuni_NN ._.
The_DT difference_NN between_IN gram_NN and_CC arhar_NN chuni_NN is_VBZ not_RB significant_JJ ._.
The_DT fall_NN in_IN the_DT growth_NN rate_NN from_IN gram_NN to_TO linseed_VB cake_NN is_VBZ 19.48_CD per_IN cent_NN ,_, from_IN gram_NN to_TO groundnut_VB cake_NN is_VBZ 53.60_CD per_IN cent_NN ,_, and_CC from_IN linseed_JJ cake_NN to_TO groundnut_VB cake_VB 34.12_CD per_IN cent_NN ,_, the_DT critical_JJ difference_NN at_IN 5_CD per_IN cent_NN level_NN being_VBG 12.97_CD per_IN cent_NN ._.
Similarly_RB ,_, between_IN arhar_JJ chuni_NNS and_CC linseed_VB cake_NN and_CC between_IN arhar_JJ chuni_NNS and_CC undecorticated_JJ groundnut_NN cake_VBP the_DT differences_NNS in_IN the_DT average_JJ growth_NN rates_NNS are_VBP 23.35_CD and_CC 57.47_CD per_IN cent_NN respectively_RB ,_, the_DT critical_JJ difference_NN being_VBG 14.50_CD per_IN cent_NN ._.
The_DT variations_NNS due_JJ to_TO treatments_NNS in_IN the_DT case_NN of_IN average_JJ rate_NN of_IN change_NN of_IN growth_NN rate_NN is_VBZ also_RB significant_JJ ._.
FEEDING_NN TRIAL_NNP WITH_NNP LINSEED_NNP CAKE_NNP ,_, DECORTI-_NNP CATED_NNP GROUNDNUT_NNP CAKE_NNP ,_, RAPE_NNP CAKE_NNP AND_NNP MUNG_NNP chuni_NN (_( 1941_CD )_) Sixteen_NNP Hissar_NNP heifers_NNS were_VBD selected_VBN for_IN this_DT test_NN in_IN September_NNP ,_, 1941_CD ._.

64.0_CD 68.3_CD 63.7_CD 57.9_CD 66.0_CD 63.2_CD When_WRB gram_NN ,_, guar_NN or_CC pulse_JJ by-products_NNS are_VBP present_JJ in_IN the_DT ration_NN both_DT organic_JJ matter_NN and_CC total_JJ carbohydrates_NNS are_VBP better_RB digested_VBN ,_, whereas_IN the_DT digestibility_NN of_IN protein_NN is_VBZ superior_JJ when_WRB concen-_NN trates_VBZ richer_JJR in_IN protein_NN are_VBP fed_VBN ._.
This_DT indicates_VBZ that_IN the_DT concentration_NN of_IN a_DT nutrient_NN in_IN the_DT total_JJ ration_NN plays_VBZ an_DT important_JJ role_NN in_IN its_PRP$ digestibility_NN ._.
The_DT level_NN of_IN protein_NN was_VBD the_DT same_JJ in_IN all_PDT the_DT treatments_NNS ,_, but_CC due_JJ to_TO a_DT lower_JJR intake_NN of_IN total_JJ dry_JJ matter_NN the_DT concentration_NN of_IN protein_NN was_VBD higher_RBR in_IN the_DT treatments_NNS with_IN feeds_NNS richer_VBP in_IN protein_NN ,_, resulting_VBG in_IN its_PRP$ better_JJR digestibi-_NN lity_NN ._.
The_DT same_JJ tendency_NN is_VBZ noticed_VBN with_IN the_DT digestibility_NN of_IN ether_DT extract_NN ._.
Similar_JJ observa-_JJ tions_NNS were_VBD made_VBN by_IN the_DT author_NN [_NN 1943_CD ]_NN on_IN a_DT previous_JJ occasion_NN ._.
The_DT lower_JJR digestibility_NN of_IN protein_NN of_IN the_DT total_JJ ration_NN with_IN gram_NN ,_, arhar_JJ chuni_NN and_CC mung_NN chuni_NN might_MD also_RB have_VB been_VBN influenced_VBN by_IN the_DT presence_NN of_IN more_JJR easily_RB digestible_JJ carbohydrates_NNS ._.
Gain_NN in_IN liveweight_NN in_IN relation_NN to_TO the_DT intake_NN of_IN digestible_JJ nutrients_NNS ._.
The_DT increases_NNS in_IN liveweight_JJ per_IN unit_NN of_IN digestible_JJ protein_NN and_CC total_JJ digestible_JJ nutrients_NNS have_VBP been_VBN calculated_VBN (_( Table_NNP XI_NNP )_) to_TO com-_JJ pare_NN the_DT feeding_VBG value_NN of_IN the_DT nutrients_NNS from_IN the_DT different_JJ concentrates_NNS ._.
The_DT pulses_NNS and_CC pulse_JJ by-_NN products_NNS have_VBP always_RB given_VBN higher_JJR increase_NN in_IN N._NNP C._NNP DAS_NNP GUPTA_NNP 131_CD liveweight_VBD per_IN unit_NN of_IN digestible_JJ protein_NN ._.
This_DT eater_JJ increase_NN can_MD not_RB be_VB attributed_VBN only_RB to_TO the_DT uality_NN of_IN protein_NN ,_, as_IN more_RBR carbohydrates_NNS also_RB had_VBD to_TO be_VB ingested_VBN as_IN a_DT result_NN of_IN maintaining_VBG the_DT same_JJ level_NN of_IN protein_NN in_IN these_DT treatments_NNS ._.
Balanc-_JJ ing_NN of_IN both_DT protein_NN and_CC carbohydrates_NNS ,_, which_WDT is_VBZ necessary_JJ for_IN such_JJ experiments_NNS ,_, is_VBZ only_RB possible_JJ by_IN supplementing_VBG purified_JJ diets_NNS ,_, but_CC this_DT is_VBZ not_RB practicable_JJ specially_RB with_IN dairy_NN cattle_NNS ,_, in_IN long_JJ period_NN feeding_NN trials_NNS ._.
In_IN the_DT experiment_NN during_IN 1940_CD ,_, the_DT actual_JJ amount_NN of_IN protein_NN digested_VBN was_VBD lower_JJR than_IN the_DT calculated_JJ quantity_NN given_VBN to_TO the_DT animals_NNS of_IN gram_NN and_CC arhar_JJ chuni_NN groups_NNS ,_, and_CC hence_RB ,_, the_DT level_NN of_IN protein_JJ supplement_NN was_VBD lower_JJR for_IN these_DT two_CD treatments_NNS ._.
But_CC the_DT increase_NN in_IN liveweight_JJ per_IN unit_NN of_IN total_JJ digestible_JJ nutrients_NNS was_VBD the_DT same_JJ even_RB with_IN this_DT lower_JJR protein_NN supple-_JJ ment_NN ._.
Mung_NNP chuni_NN and_CC guar_NN in_IN 1941_CD and_CC 1942_CD respectively_RB have_VBP produced_VBN decidedly_RB better_RBR rate_NN of_IN growth_NN per_IN unit_NN of_IN both_DT digestible_JJ protein_NN and_CC total_JJ digestible_JJ nutrients_NNS ._.
Thus_RB it_PRP appears_VBZ that_IN for_IN growing_VBG animals_NNS protein_VBP from_IN gram_NN ,_, arhar_JJ chuni_NN ,_, mung_NN chuni_NN or_CC guar_NN is_VBZ superior_JJ to_TO that_DT from_IN the_DT oilcakes_NNS ._.

134_CD 107.6_CD 707.7_CD 1.25_CD 0.19_CD 444_CD RELATIVE_NNP ECONOMY_NNP OF_IN THE_NNP CONCENTRATES_NNP The_DT cost_NN for_IN production_NN of_IN 100_CD lb_NN ._.
liveweight_NN with_IN all_PDT the_DT concentrates_NNS is_VBZ shown_VBN in_IN Table_NNP XII_NNP ._.
The_DT tests_NNS were_VBD carried_VBN out_RP for_IN three_CD consecutive_JJ years_NNS and_CC the_DT prices_NNS of_IN feeds_NNS varied_VBN from_IN year_NN to_TO year_NN ._.
Hence_RB ,_, to_TO compare_VB the_DT cost_NN of_IN production_NN with_IN the_DT different_JJ concentrates_NNS ,_, the_DT prices_NNS of_IN all_PDT the_DT roughages_NNS and_CC bran_NN have_VBP been_VBN taken_VBN as_IN the_DT same_JJ as_IN in_IN 1941_CD and_CC those_DT of_IN the_DT concentrates_NNS have_VBP been_VBN modified_VBN and_CC brought_VBN to_TO the_DT 1941_CD level_NN on_IN the_DT basis_NN of_IN variation_NN of_IN the_DT price_NN of_IN linseed_JJ cake_NN from_IN year_NN to_TO year_NN ._.
The_DT comparative_JJ cost_NN of_IN the_DT total_JJ ration_NN for_IN the_DT production_NN of_IN 100_CD lb_NN ._.
live-_JJ weight_NN (_( Table_NNP XII_NNP )_) show_VBP that_IN for_IN production_NN of_IN the_DT same_JJ liveweight_JJ rape_NN cake_NN is_VBZ the_DT cheapest_JJS amongst_NN all_PDT the_DT concentrates_NNS ,_, next_JJ in_IN order_NN come_VBP groundnut_NNS cake_VBP (_( decorticated_VBN )_) ,_, guar_NN ,_, mung_NN chuni_NN ,_, linseed_VBD cake_NN ,_, til_JJ cake_NN ,_, arhar_JJ chuni_NN ,_, groundnut_JJ cake_NN (_( undecorticated_JJ )_) and_CC gram_NN ._.
The_DT comparative_JJ economic_JJ value_NN of_IN a_DT feed_NN can_MD not_RB be_VB assessed_VBN only_RB by_IN the_DT market_NN prices_NNS which_WDT always_RB vary_VBP ._.
Therefore_RB the_DT quantities_NNS of_IN different_JJ concentrates_NNS which_WDT produce_VBP the_DT same_JJ increase_NN in_IN liveweight_JJ have_VBP been_VBN shown_VBN in_IN the_DT last_JJ column_NN (_( Table_NNP XII_NNP )_) ._.
But_CC for_IN true_JJ economy_NN the_DT time_NN factor_NN should_MD also_RB be_VB taken_VBN into_IN account_NN as_IN with_IN better_JJR rate_NN of_IN growth_NN ,_, the_DT period_NN of_IN unproduc-_JJ tiveness_NN is_VBZ shortened_VBN ._.
It_PRP appears_VBZ that_IN when_WRB the_DT rate_NN of_IN growth_NN is_VBZ taken_VBN into_IN account_NN guar_NN is_VBZ defi-_JJ nitely_RB more_RBR economical_JJ than_IN the_DT oilcakes_NNS ,_, and_CC both_DT arhar_JJ chuni_NN and_CC mung_NN chuni_NN may_MD also_RB prove_VB cheaper_JJR in_IN the_DT long_JJ run_NN ._.
SUMMARY_JJ Trials_NNS were_VBD conducted_VBN to_TO study_VB the_DT comparative_JJ feeding_NN values_NNS of_IN linseed_JJ cake_NN ,_, decorticated_VBN and_CC undecorticated_JJ groundnut_NN cakes_NNS ,_, rape_NN cake_NN ,_, til_JJ cake_NN ,_, guar_NN ,_, gram_NN ,_, arhar_JJ chuni_NN and_CC mung_NN chuni_VBP E_NNP 132_CD Comparative_NNP Value_NNP of_IN some_DT concentrates_NNS TABLE_NNP XII_NNP Relative_NNP economy_NN of_IN the_DT concentrates_NNS Concentrate_NNP Gain_NNP in_IN liveweight_JJ Quantity_NNP of_IN concen-_JJ trates_NNS fed_VBD Prices_NNP per_IN 100_CD lb_NN ._.

134_CD 370.5_CD 3.659_CD 22.9_CD 2.745_CD 13.92_CD 104_CD with_IN Hissar_NNP heifers_NNS ._.
The_DT tests_NNS were_VBD carried_VBN out_RP in_IN three_CD sets_NNS during_IN 1940_CD ,_, 1941_CD and_CC 1942_CD ._.
Linseed_NNP cake_NN was_VBD used_VBN as_IN control_NN in_IN all_PDT the_DT sets_NNS ._.
Varying_VBG quantities_NNS of_IN the_DT different_JJ con-_JJ centrates_NNS were_VBD fed_VBN to_TO maintain_VB the_DT same_JJ level_NN of_IN protein_NN in_IN all_PDT the_DT treatments_NNS ._.
In_IN the_DT first_JJ test_NN ,_, it_PRP was_VBD found_VBN that_IN gram_NN and_CC arhar_JJ chuni_NN produced_VBD better_JJR growth_NN than_IN linseed_JJ cake_NN ,_, while_IN undecorticated_JJ groundnut_NNS cake_VBP proved_JJ inferior_NN ._.
Among_IN the_DT concentrates_NNS tested_VBN in_IN the_DT second_JJ year_NN ,_, mung_NN chuni_NNS gave_VBD the_DT highest_JJS rate_NN of_IN growth_NN ,_, followed_VBN in_IN order_NN by_IN linseed_JJ cake_NN ,_, rape_NN cake_NN and_CC decorticated_VBD groundnut_NNS cake_NN ._.
The_DT difference_NN in_IN the_DT growth_NN rates_NNS with_IN linseed_JJ cake_NN and_CC rape_NN cake_NN was_VBD not_RB significant_JJ ._.
In_IN the_DT third_JJ set_NN ,_, the_DT growth_NN rates_NNS were_VBD in_IN the_DT decreasing_VBG order_NN of_IN guar_NN ,_, linseed_VBP cake_NN and_CC til_JJ cake_NN ._.
On_IN comparing_VBG the_DT data_NN for_IN all_PDT the_DT concentrates_NNS ,_, it_PRP was_VBD found_VBN that_IN under_IN the_DT conditions_NNS of_IN these_DT experiments_NNS groundnut_NN cakes_NNS both_DT decorticated_VBN and_CC undecorticated_JJ resulted_VBD in_IN the_DT least_JJS favourable_JJ rate_NN of_IN growth_NN ._.
Til_NNP cake_NN and_CC rape_NN cake_NN came_VBD next_JJ in_IN order_NN of_IN increasing_VBG value_NN ,_, followed_VBN by_IN linseed_JJ cake_NN ._.
Linseed_NNP cake_NN was_VBD of_IN about_IN the_DT same_JJ value_NN as_IN guar_NN and_CC was_VBD inferior_RB only_RB to_TO gram_VB ,_, arhar_VB chuni_NNS and_CC mung_NN chuni_NN which_WDT gave_VBD the_DT best_JJS results_NNS ._.
The_DT digestibility_NN of_IN organic_JJ matter_NN and_CC total_JJ carbohydrate_NN was_VBD higher_JJR when_WRB pulse_NN or_CC pulse_JJ chuni_NN was_VBD present_JJ in_IN the_DT ration_NN ,_, while_IN that_DT of_IN protein_NN was_VBD superior_JJ when_WRB the_DT concentrates_NNS richer_VBP in_IN protein_NN were_VBD fed_VBN ._.
This_DT variation_NN appears_VBZ to_TO be_VB due_JJ to_TO the_DT concentration_NN of_IN the_DT nutrient_NN in_IN the_DT total_JJ ration_NN ._.
Protein_NNP of_IN gram_NN ,_, arhar_JJ chuni_NN ,_, mung_NN chuni_NNS and_CC guar_NN appears_VBZ to_TO be_VB of_IN superior_JJ quality_NN as_IN compared_VBN to_TO that_DT of_IN the_DT oilcakes_NNS for_IN growing_VBG Hissar_NNP cattle_NNS ._.
Mung_NNP chuni_NN and_CC guar_NN produced_VBD the_DT best_JJS rates_NNS of_IN growth_NN per_IN unit_NN of_IN total_JJ digestible_JJ nutrients_NNS as_IN well_RB ._.
For_IN the_DT production_NN of_IN the_DT same_JJ liveweight_JJ rape_NN cake_NN has_VBZ been_VBN found_VBN to_TO be_VB the_DT cheapest_JJS ._.
Next_RB in_IN order_NN come_NN decorticated_VBD groundnut_JJ cake_NN ,_, guar_NN ,_, mung_NN chuni_NN ,_, linseed_VBD cake_NN ,_, til_JJ cake_NN ,_, arhar_JJ chuni_NN ,_, undecorticated_JJ groundnut_NN cake_NN and_CC gram_NN ._.
But_CC when_WRB the_DT rate_NN of_IN growth_NN is_VBZ taken_VBN into_IN account_NN ,_, which_WDT determines_VBZ the_DT period_NN of_IN unproductiveness_JJ the_DT feeding_NN of_IN guar_NN is_VBZ definitely_RB more_RBR economical_JJ than_IN the_DT oilcakes_NNS and_CC both_DT arhar_JJ chuni_NN and_CC mung_NN chuni_NN may_MD also_RB prove_VB cheaper_JJR in_IN the_DT long_JJ run_NN ._.
With_IN normal_JJ feeds_NNS ,_, the_DT consumption_NN of_IN dry_JJ matter_NN for_IN Hissar_NNP heifers_NNS weighing_VBG between_IN 400_CD and_CC 500_CD lb_NN ._.
is_VBZ ,_, on_IN an_DT average_NN ,_, 2.2_CD lb_NN ._.
per_IN 100_CD lb_NN ._.
liveweight_NN ._.

The_DT author_NN desires_VBZ to_TO express_VB his_PRP$ thanks_NNS to_TO Mr_NNP C._NNP Maya_NNP Das_NNP ,_, I.A.S._NNP ,_, Director_NNP of_IN Agriculture_NNP ,_, United_NNP Provinces_NNPS and_CC Mr_NNP Sultan_NNP Singh_NNP ,_, Deputy_NNP Director_NNP of_IN Agriculture_NNP ,_, Bundel-_NNP khand_NNP Circle_NNP ,_, Jhansi_NNP ,_, for_IN the_DT facilities_NNS provided_VBD and_CC the_DT keen_JJ interest_NN taken_VBN in_IN these_DT investigations_NNS ._.
The_DT author_NN also_RB acknowledges_VBZ with_IN thanks_NNS the_DT help_NN received_VBD from_IN Mr_NNP K._NNP Kishan_NNP ,_, Statistician_NNP ,_, Agricultural_NNP Department_NNP ,_, United_NNP Provinces_NNPS ,_, in_IN the_DT statistical_JJ analysis_NN ,_, Dr_NNP S._NNP P._NNP Srivastava_NNP and_CC Mr_NNP I._NNP N._NNP Sharma_NNP ,_, Research_NNP Assistants_NNP ,_, for_IN the_DT analytical_JJ work_NN and_CC the_DT compilation_NN of_IN the_DT experi-_JJ mental_JJ data_NNS and_CC Messrs_NNP V._NNP R._NNP Singh_NNP and_CC R._NNP S._NNP Gupta_NNP ,_, Farm_NNP Superintendents_NNP ,_, for_IN providing_VBG the_DT animals_NNS and_CC making_VBG arrangements_NNS for_IN the_DT fodders_NNS ._.

BAGOMOLASSES_NNP AS_NNP CATTLE_NNP FEED_NNP I._NNP DIGESTIBILITY_NNP AND_NNP NUTRITIVE_NNP VALUE_NNP OF_NNP BAGOMOLASSES_NNP By_IN S._NNP C._NNP RAY_NNP and_CC S._NNP K._NNP TALAPATRA_NNP ,_, Animal_NNP Nutrition_NNP Section_NNP ,_, Imperial_NNP Veterinary_NNP Research_NNP Institute_NNP ,_, Izatnagar_NNP (_( Received_VBN for_IN publication_NN on_IN 27_CD January_NNP 1945_CD )_) WITH_VBD the_DT extensive_JJ development_NN of_IN sugar_NN in-_JJ dustry_NN in_IN this_DT country_NN ,_, the_DT economic_JJ disposal_NN of_IN a_DT large_JJ quantity_NN of_IN molasses_NNS in_IN every_DT crushing_NN season_NN has_VBZ become_VBN a_DT problem_NN for_IN urgent_JJ consideration_NN ._.
Of_IN late_JJ ,_, attempts_NNS have_VBP been_VBN made_VBN to_TO open_VB up_RP several_JJ avenues_NNS of_IN economic_JJ utilization_NN of_IN mo-_JJ lasses_NNS ._.
One_CD of_IN these_DT is_VBZ its_PRP$ possible_JJ use_NN as_IN a_DT cattle-feed_NN ._.
The_DT Imperial_NNP Institute_NNP of_IN Sugar_NNP Technology_NNP had_VBD been_VBN ,_, for_IN some_DT time_NN past_IN ,_, manufacturing_VBG a_DT cattle_NNS feed_NN containing_VBG a_DT substantial_JJ quantity_NN of_IN molasses_NNS ._.
It_PRP was_VBD prepared_VBN by_IN mixing_VBG dried_VBN bagasse_JJ screenings_NNS and_CC protein_NN concentrate_NN (_( made_VBN of_IN chunni_NN and_CC an_DT oilcake_NN )_) with_IN boiled_JJ molasses_NNS ._.
The_DT mixture_NN was_VBD pressed_VBN into_IN a_DT cake_NN and_CC was_VBD named_VBN as_IN 'molasscuit_NN '_POS ._.
Some_DT feeding_NN tests_NNS with_IN molasscuit_NN were_VBD carried_VBN out_RP at_IN several_JJ centres_NNS ._.
Preliminary_JJ reports_NNS of_IN these_DT trials_NNS were_VBD some-_JJ what_WP contradictory_NN as_IN to_TO the_DT suitability_NN of_IN molass-_JJ unit_NN as_IN a_DT cattle_JJ feed_NN ._.
The_DT manufacture_NN of_IN molassed_JJ feed_NN containing_VBG protein_NN concentrate_NN was_VBD eventually_RB dropped_VBN and_CC the_DT Imperial_NNP Institute_NNP of_IN Sugar_NNP Technology_NNP is_VBZ now_RB producing_VBG a_DT new_JJ feed_NN very_RB similar_JJ to_TO the_DT foregoing_NN in_IN general_JJ make-_NN up_RB but_CC containing_VBG no_DT protein_NN supplement_NN ._.
The_DT new_JJ feed_NN has_VBZ been_VBN named_VBN 'bagomolasses_NNS '_POS ,_, and_CC is_VBZ made_VBN up_IN of_IN one_CD part_NN bagasse_NN screenings_NNS mixed_JJ with_IN two_CD parts_NNS of_IN molasses_NNS ._.
This_DT paper_NN embodies_VBZ the_DT results_NNS of_IN experiments_NNS carried_VBD out_RP with_IN a_DT view_NN (_( 1_CD )_) to_TO record_VB any_DT character-_JJ istic_JJ behaviour_NNS shown_VBN by_IN experimental_JJ animals_NNS kept_VBD on_IN a_DT ration_NN containing_NN bagomolasses_NNS ,_, (_( 2_CD )_) to_TO study_VB the_DT effect_NN of_IN incorporating_VBG bagomolasses_NNS on_IN consumption_NN ,_, digestion_NN and_CC utilization_NN of_IN a_DT main-_JJ tenance_NN ration_NN by_IN bullocks_NNS ,_, and_CC (_( 3_CD )_) to_TO evaluate_VB the_DT digestibility_NN coefficients_NNS and_CC nutritive_JJ value_NN of_IN bagomolasses_NNS ._.
GENERAL_NNP OBSERVATIONS_NNP OF_IN FEEDING_NNP BAGOMO-_NNP LASSES_NNP TO_NNP CATTLE_NNP At_IN the_DT outset_NN ,_, it_PRP was_VBD found_VBN necessary_JJ to_TO con-_JJ duct_NN a_DT number_NN of_IN preliminary_JJ feeding_NN trials_NNS to_TO fix_VB the_DT maximum_JJ quantity_NN of_IN bagomolasses_NNS which_WDT could_MD be_VB fed_VBN with_IN ease_NN and_CC without_IN inducing_VBG any_DT ill-effect_JJ in_IN the_DT animals_NNS ._.
At_IN first_RB ,_, the_DT animals_NNS showed_VBD a_DT good_JJ appetite_NN for_IN the_DT semi-dry_JJ bago-_JJ molasses_NNS ,_, which_WDT ,_, however_RB ,_, gradually_RB waned_VBN and_CC after_IN about_RB two_CD to_TO three_CD weeks_NNS the_DT animals_NNS simply_RB licked_VBD and_CC nibbled_VBD the_DT food_NN intermittently_RB ._.
It_PRP was_VBD eventually_RB observed_VBN that_IN bagomolasses_NNS could_MD be_VB fed_VBN for_IN a_DT longer_JJR time_NN ,_, if_IN it_PRP was_VBD soaked_VBN in_IN water_NN before_IN offering_VBG to_TO the_DT animals_NNS ._.
Though_IN this_DT procedure_NN offered_VBD good_JJ promise_NN ,_, it_PRP was_VBD later_RB found_VBN that_IN even_RB after_IN soaking_VBG the_DT consumption_NN of_IN bagomolasses_NNS was_VBD not_RB high_JJ enough_RB to_TO warrant_VB its_PRP$ inclusion_NN in_IN a_DT ration_NN ._.
The_DT next_JJ step_NN followed_VBD was_VBD to_TO feed_VB bagomolasses_NNS mixed_JJ with_IN a_DT bulky_JJ concentrate_NN such_JJ as_IN wheat_NN bran_NN ._.
The_DT mixture_NN ,_, as_IN before_RB ,_, was_VBD fed_VBN after_IN soaking_VBG ._.
This_DT procedure_NN was_VBD quite_RB successful_JJ and_CC the_DT animals_NNS could_MD be_VB E2_NNP 134_CD Bagomolasses_NNP as_IN Cattle_NNP Feed_NNP induced_VBD to_TO eat_VB 4_CD lb_NN ._.
of_IN bagomolasses_NNS without_IN any_DT difficulty_NN ._.
As_IN feeding_NN of_IN bagomolasses_NNS was_VBD found_VBN to_TO be_VB accompanied_VBN by_IN excessive_JJ diuresis_NN ,_, other_JJ points_NNS of_IN importance_NN recorded_VBN in_IN this_DT connection_NN were_VBD ,_, that_IN the_DT animals_NNS must_MD have_VB free_JJ access_NN to_TO common_JJ salt_NN and_CC more_RBR frequent_JJ watering_NN than_IN usual_JJ ._.
Diuresis_NN in_IN cattle_NN has_VBZ been_VBN noted_VBN by_IN Warth_NNP [_NNP 1926_CD ]_NNP and_CC recently_RB by_IN Sen_NNP ,_, Ray_NNP and_CC Talapatra_NNP [_NNP 1942_CD ]_NNP in_IN animals_NNS fed_VBN on_IN paddy-straw_NN ._.
According_VBG to_TO these_DT authors_NNS ,_, diuresis_NN is_VBZ induced_VBN by_IN the_DT large_JJ quantity_NN of_IN potassium_NN salt_NN present_JJ in_IN paddy-straw_JJ ._.
Cane-molasses_NNS is_VBZ also_RB rich_JJ in_IN potassium_NN (_( about_IN 2.62_CD per_IN cent_NN on_IN dry_JJ basis_NN )_) and_CC it_PRP is_VBZ likely_JJ that_IN the_DT observed_JJ diuresis_NN is_VBZ due_JJ to_TO the_DT high_JJ amount_NN of_IN potassium_NN present_NN in_IN bagomo-_NN lasses_NNS which_WDT contains_VBZ two-third_NN of_IN its_PRP$ weight_NN of_IN molasses_NNS ._.
In_IN this_DT connection_NN ,_, an_DT experiment_NN was_VBD designed_VBN to_TO study_VB the_DT effect_NN of_IN withdrawal_NN of_IN salt_NN from_IN the_DT ration_NN containing_VBG bagomolasses_NNS on_IN the_DT general_JJ condition_NN of_IN experimental_JJ animals_NNS ._.
The_DT effect_NN of_IN the_DT withdrawal_NN of_IN the_DT salt_NN was_VBD quick_JJ and_CC marked_VBD ._.
Within_IN two_CD weeks_NNS of_IN salt-starva-_JJ tion_NN ,_, there_EX was_VBD a_DT significant_JJ drop_NN both_DT in_IN body-_NN weight_NN and_CC food_NN consumption_NN ._.
On_IN the_DT average_NN ,_, the_DT animals_NNS lost_VBD 17_CD per_IN cent_NN of_IN their_PRP$ body_NN weight_NN and_CC the_DT food_NN consumption_NN decreased_VBN by_IN about_IN 22_CD per_IN cent_NN in_IN terms_NNS of_IN dry_JJ matter_NN ._.
As_RB soon_RB as_IN the_DT animals_NNS were_VBD given_VBN free_JJ access_NN to_TO common_JJ salt_NN ,_, its_PRP$ consumption_NN during_IN the_DT week_NN following_VBG the_DT complete_JJ deprivation_NN of_IN salt_NN was_VBD on_IN the_DT aver-_JJ age_NN 2.6_CD oz_NN ._.
per_IN day_NN per_IN animal_NN of_IN about_IN 500_CD lb_NN ._.
body-weight_NN ._.
With_IN progressive_JJ feeding_NN this_DT high_JJ consumption_NN of_IN salt_NN gradually_RB decreased_VBD to_TO the_DT normal_JJ consumption_NN of_IN 1.5_CD oz_NN ._.
per_IN animal_JJ per_IN day_NN ._.
It_PRP is_VBZ apparent_JJ from_IN the_DT foregoing_VBG evidence_NN that_WDT even_RB the_DT normal_JJ requirement_NN of_IN common_JJ salt_NN in_IN cattle_NNS is_VBZ high_JJ when_WRB bagomolasses_NNS is_VBZ in-_JJ corporated_VBN in_IN the_DT ration_NN ._.
With_IN the_DT increased_JJ intake_NN of_IN common_JJ salt_NN ,_, the_DT diuresis_NN was_VBD noticed_VBN to_TO be_VB considerably_RB reduced_VBN ._.
Singh_NNP and_CC Singh_NNP [_NNP 1934_CD ,_, 1935_CD ]_NN have_VBP recorded_VBN that_IN when_WRB molasses_NNS was_VBD fed_VBN to_TO working_VBG bullocks_NNS which_WDT were_VBD not_RB given_VBN common_JJ salt_NN ,_, the_DT animals_NNS often_RB showed_VBD froth_DT salivation_NN ._.
When_WRB these_DT animals_NNS were_VBD allowed_VBN free_JJ access_NN to_TO salt_VB ,_, the_DT trouble_NN disappeared_VBD com-_JJ pletely_RB ._.
EFFECT_NN OF_IN INCORPORATING_NNP BACOMOLASSES_NNP OF_IN THE_NNP CONSUMPTION_NNP ,_, DIGESTION_NNP AND_NNP UTILIZATION_NNP OF_IN A_NNP RATION_NNP Experimental_NNP For_IN this_DT experiment_JJ four_CD country_NN bullocks_NNS ,_, eacb_RB weighing_VBG about_IN 500_CD lb._NNS ,_, were_VBD used_VBN ._.
At_IN first_RB all_PDT the_DT animals_NNS gained_VBN in_IN weight_NN for_IN a_DT short_JJ period_NN and_CC gradually_RB settled_VBD down_RB to_TO a_DT more_RBR or_CC less_JJR station_NN any_DT weight_NN which_WDT averaged_VBD 550_CD lb_NN ._.
±10_JJ lb_NN ._.
In_IN order_NN to_TO make_VB a_DT comparative_NN study_NN ,_, the_DT who_WP investigation_NN has_VBZ been_VBN divided_VBN into_IN two_CD distinct_JJ periods_NNS ._.
In_IN period_NN 1_CD ,_, the_DT ration_NN consisted_VBD of_IN wheat-bhusa_NN of_IN known_VBN nutritive_JJ value_NN fed_VBD a_DT lib_NN and_CC a_DT fixed_JJ amount_NN of_IN wheat-bran_NN of_IN unknown_JJ nutritive_JJ value_NN (_( with_IN no_DT bagomolasses_NNS )_) ._.
During_IN period_NN 2_CD ,_, the_DT ration_NN was_VBD changed_VBN and_CC was_VBD made_VBN up_IN of_IN equivalent_JJ amount_NN of_IN the_DT same_JJ wheat-_JJ bran_NN mixed_JJ with_IN 4_CD lb_NN ._.
of_IN bagomolasses_NNS and_CC the_DT same_JJ wheat-bhusa_JJ fed_NN ad_NN lib_NN ._.
The_DT mixture_NN of_IN bran_NN and_CC bagomolasses_NNS was_VBD fed_VBN after_IN soaking_VBG in_IN water_NN ._.
In_IN both_DT the_DT periods_NNS ,_, the_DT animals_NNS had_VBD free_JJ access_NN to_TO common_JJ salt_NN ._.
Each_DT test-ration_NN fed_NN in_IN periods_NNS 1_CD and_CC 2_CD was_VBD continued_VBN first_RB for_IN a_DT prelimi-_JJ nary_JJ period_NN of_IN four_CD to_TO six_CD weeks_NNS followed_VBN by_IN a_DT ten-day_JJ quantitative_JJ collection_NN of_IN excreta_NN and_CC of_IN any_DT food_NN residue_NN left_VBD ,_, for_IN subsequent_JJ chemical_NN analysis_NN ._.

E_NNP USE_NNP OF_NNP BAGOMOLASSES_NNP FOR_NNP FEEDING_NNP WORKING_NNP BULLOCKS_NNP By_IN N._NNP K._NNP AYYAR_NNP and_CC A._NNP W._NNP ZUBERY_NNP ,_, Animal_NNP Nutrition_NNP Section_NNP ,_, Imperial_NNP Veterinary_NNP Research_NNP Institute_NNP Izatnagar_NNP (_( Received_VBN for_IN publication_NN on_IN 29_CD January_NNP 1945_CD )_) IN_VBZ the_DT U._NNP S._NNP A._NN and_CC other_JJ countries_NNS ,_, cane-mo-_JJ lasses_NNS is_VBZ being_VBG used_VBN for_IN feeding_VBG cattle_NNS ,_, particularly_RB dairy_NN and_CC beef_NN stocks_NNS ._.
Morrison_NNP [_NN 1937_CD ]_NN ,_, after_IN a_DT critical_JJ review_NN of_IN a_DT large_JJ number_NN of_IN reports_NNS ,_, has_VBZ summarized_VBN the_DT position_NN as_IN follows_VBZ :_: When_WRB mo-_NN lasses_NNS is_VBZ added_VBN to_TO the_DT ration_NN of_IN dairy_NN cows_NNS ,_, their_PRP$ milk_NN yield_NN is_VBZ slightly_RB increased_VBN due_RB more_RBR to_TO the_DT higher_JJR total_JJ food_NN consumption_NN induced_VBN by_IN the_DT appetizing_JJ nature_NN of_IN molasses_NNS than_IN to_TO any_DT signi-_JJ ficant_JJ contribution_NN of_IN available_JJ nutrients_NNS by_IN the_DT added_JJ feed_NN ._.
Cane-molasses_NNS is_VBZ also_RB widely_RB used_VBN for_IN feeding_VBG beef-cattle_NN in_IN the_DT sugarcane_JJ districts_NNS of_IN Southern_NNP States_NNPS of_IN America_NNP ._.
It_PRP has_VBZ been_VBN shown_VBN that_IN in_IN a_DT ration_NN ,_, half_NN of_IN the_DT concentrate_NN which_WDT consists_VBZ of_IN corn_NN and_CC other_JJ grains_NNS can_MD be_VB replaced_VBN by_IN molasses_NNS ._.
Apparently_RB ,_, in_IN such_JJ re-_JJ placement_NN ,_, no_DT consideration_NN is_VBZ made_VBN of_IN the_DT in-_JJ evitable_JJ withdrawal_NN of_IN a_DT portion_NN of_IN the_DT digestible_JJ protein_NN present_NN in_IN the_DT grains_NNS ._.
It_PRP has_VBZ been_VBN further_RB observed_VBN that_IN the_DT total_JJ quantity_NN of_IN digestible_JJ nutrients_NNS in_IN molasses_NNS is_VBZ 30_CD per_IN cent_NN less_JJR than_IN in_IN an_DT equivalent_JJ amount_NN of_IN maize_NN ,_, so_IN that_DT ,_, in_IN feeding_VBG value_NN ,_, 2_CD lb_NN ._.
of_IN molasses_NNS should_MD be_VB the_DT equivalent_NN to_TO 1.4_CD lb_NN ._.
of_IN maize_NN ._.
In_IN Hawaii_NNP ,_, Henke_NNP [_NNP 1933_CD ]_NN in_IN his_PRP$ study_NN of_IN cane-_JJ molasses_NNS as_IN a_DT supplement_NN to_TO fattening_VBG rations_NNS for_IN swine_NN observed_VBD that_IN cane-molasses_NNS could_MD replace_VB up_RB to_TO 20_CD per_IN cent_NN of_IN rolled_JJ barley_NN in_IN the_DT ration_NN for_IN fattening_VBG pigs_NNS ._.
A_DT study_NN of_IN cane-molas-_JJ ses_NNS as_IN feed_NN for_IN dairy_NN cows_NNS by_IN the_DT same_JJ author_NN [_NN 1934_CD ]_NN showed_VBD that_IN when_WRB properly_RB supplemented_VBN with_IN high_JJ protein_NN foods_NNS ,_, cane-molasses_NNS may_MD safely_RB be_VB substituted_VBN for_IN 25_CD per_IN cent_NN of_IN other_JJ con-_JJ centrates_NNS ._.
Also_RB ,_, there_EX was_VBD no_DT indication_NN of_IN decreased_JJ reproductive_JJ efficiency_NN or_CC increase_NN in_IN abortion_NN ._.
In_IN Louisiana_NNP ,_, Snell_NNP and_CC Taggart_NNP [_NNP 1932_CD ,_, 1933_CD ]_NN in_IN their_PRP$ study_NN of_IN blackstrap_NN molasses_NNS as_IN a_DT feed_NN for_IN working_VBG mules_NNS observed_VBD that_IN molasses_NNS was_VBD equivalent_JJ to_TO corn_NN grain_NN and_CC that_IN it_PRP could_MD be_VB sub-_JJ stituted_VBN up_IN to_TO 9_CD lb_NN ._.
for_IN corn_NN in_IN a_DT ration_NN containing_VBG ground_NN whole_JJ corn_NN ,_, alfalfa_NN hay_NN and_CC soybean_NN hay_NN ._.
Heavy_NNP molasses_NNS feeding_VBG seemed_VBD to_TO increase_VB sweating_NN and_CC 'winding_VBG '_'' of_IN mules_NNS ._.
In_IN India_NNP ,_, Singh_NNP and_CC Singh_NNP [_NNP 1934_CD ,_, 1935_CD ]_NN have_VBP carried_VBN out_RP feeding_VBG experiments_NNS with_IN molasse_NNS obtained_VBN from_IN the_DT open-pan_JJ system_NN of_IN manufac_NN turing_VBG white_JJ sugar_NN (_( Khandasari_NNP molasses_VBZ )_) ._.
In_IN these_DT experiments_NNS both_DT working_VBG bullocks_NNS and_CC dairy_NN cows_NNS were_VBD used_VBN and_CC the_DT main_JJ conclusion_NN arrived_VBN at_IN were_VBD :_: (_( a_DT )_) 2_CD lb_NN ._.
of_IN molasses_NNS could_MD successfully_RB re-_VB place_NN 2_CD lb_NN ._.
of_IN maize_NN in_IN the_DT ration_NN of_IN bullocks_NNS ._.
(_( b_NN )_) 1_CD lb_NN ._.
molasses_NNS could_MD replace_VB 1_CD lb_NN ._.
of_IN bran_NN in_IN the_DT ration_NN of_IN dairy_NN cows_NNS without_IN affecting_VBG the_DT quantity_NN or_CC the_DT quality_NN of_IN milk_NN ,_, and_CC (_( c_NN )_) the_DT replacement_NN of_IN the_DT grain_NN with_IN molasses_NNS was_VBD possible_JJ only_RB during_IN winter_NN N._NNP K._NNP AYYAR_NNP AND_NNP A._NNP W._NNP ZUBERY_NNP 141_CD months_NNS ;_: in_IN summar_NN ,_, the_DT feeding_NN of_IN molasses_NNS had_VBD a_DT deleterious_JJ effect_NN on_IN the_DT health_NN of_IN the_DT animals_NNS ._.
In_IN a_DT later_JJ publication_NN these_DT authors_NNS [_VBP Singh_NNP and_CC Singh_NNP ,_, 1937_CD ]_NN have_VBP further_VBN shown_VBN that_IN as_IN a_DT feed_NN for_IN working_VBG bullocks_NNS ,_, the_DT factory_NN molasses_NNS was_VBD as_RB good_JJ as_IN the_DT khandasari_NN variety_NN ._.
The_DT conclusions_NNS drawn_VBN by_IN Singh_NNP and_CC Singh_NNP are_VBP ,_, however_RB ,_, open_JJ to_TO serious_JJ criticism_NN ._.
A_DT careful_JJ perusal_NN of_IN their_PRP$ data_NNS shows_NNS that_WDT nutrients_NNS in_IN the_DT control_NN ration_NN of_IN the_DT working_VBG bullocks_NNS were_VBD significantly_RB more_JJR than_IN those_DT re-_JJ quired_JJ for_IN maintenance_NN and_CC the_DT type_NN of_IN work_NN performed_VBN ._.
The_DT experimental_JJ animals_NNS ,_, more-_NN over_IN ,_, were_VBD adults_NNS and_CC one_CD could_MD reasonably_VB assume_VB that_IN the_DT body-weights_NNS of_IN these_DT animals_NNS would_MD not_RB vary_VB significantly_RB even_RB when_WRB they_PRP were_VBD fed_VBN at_IN a_DT higher_JJR level_NN ._.
Apparently_RB ,_, the_DT change_NN in_IN body-weight_NN ,_, which_WDT took_VBD place_NN in_IN their_PRP$ experiment_NN was_VBD of_IN little_JJ value_NN as_IN an_DT index_NN to_TO the_DT influence_NN of_IN rations_NNS ._.
It_PRP would_MD have_VB been_VBN quite_RB possible_JJ for_IN the_DT animals_NNS to_TO maintain_VB the_DT same_JJ trend_NN of_IN body_NN weight_NN ,_, if_IN 2_CD lb_NN ._.
of_IN maize_NN had_VBD been_VBN altogether_RB absent_NN from_IN the_DT control_NN ration_NN ._.
As_IN such_JJ ,_, the_DT replacement_NN of_IN the_DT superfluous_JJ 2_CD lb_NN ._.
of_IN maize_NN by_IN 2_CD lb_NN ._.
of_IN molasses_NNS in_IN the_DT experimental_JJ ration_NN can_MD not_RB be_VB regarded_VBN as_IN evidence_NN of_IN the_DT nutritive_JJ values_NNS of_IN maize_NN and_CC molasses_NNS being_VBG equivalent_JJ ._.
This_DT ,_, together_RB ,_, with_IN the_DT fact_NN that_IN the_DT total_JJ diges-_JJ tible_JJ nutrients_NNS in_IN molasses_NNS are_VBP 30_CD per_IN cent_NN lower_JJR than_IN in_IN an_DT equivalent_JJ amount_NN of_IN maize_NN [_NNP Morrison_NNP ,_, 1937_CD ]_NN ,_, affords_NNS strong_JJ arguments_NNS against_IN the_DT con-_JJ clusion_NN reached_VBN by_IN Singh_NNP and_CC Singh_NNP ._.
A_DT further_JJ point_NN to_TO be_VB considered_VBN in_IN this_DT connection_NN is_VBZ ,_, how_WRB far_RB one_CD can_MD justify_VB ,_, particularly_RB under_IN Indian_JJ conditions_NNS of_IN feeding_NN ,_, the_DT ignoring_NN of_IN the_DT digestible_JJ protein_NN in_IN maize_NN and_CC bran_NN ,_, while_IN advocating_VBG their_PRP$ replacement_NN by_IN molasses_NNS which_WDT does_VBZ not_RB contain_VB any_DT digestible_JJ protein_NN ._.
In_IN this_DT communication_NN are_VBP reported_VBN the_DT results_NNS of_IN an_DT investigation_NN carried_VBD out_IN to_TO throw_VB light_NN on_IN the_DT following_JJ points_NNS ._.
(_( 1_CD )_) Whether_JJR a_DT molassed_VBN feed_NN has_VBZ any_DT dele-_JJ terious_JJ effect_NN on_IN the_DT health_NN and_CC work-_JJ ing_NN capacity_NN of_IN the_DT animals_NNS ,_, and_CC ,_, (_( 2_CD )_) Whether_IN the_DT molassed_JJ feed_NN is_VBZ suitable_JJ for_IN working_VBG stock_NN ._.
In_IN order_NN to_TO secure_VB information_NN on_IN the_DT above_JJ points_NNS ,_, experiments_NNS were_VBD carried_VBN out_RP on_IN three_CD lines_NNS to_TO study_VB (_( a_DT )_) the_DT effect_NN of_IN the_DT addition_NN of_IN bagomolasses_NNS to_TO an_DT inadequate_JJ village_NN ration_NN ,_, (_( b_NN )_) the_DT effect_NN of_IN the_DT addition_NN of_IN bagomolasses_NNS to_TO the_DT village_NN ration_NN enriched_VBN by_IN a_DT supplement_NN and_CC (_( c_NN )_) the_DT effect_NN of_IN replacement_NN of_IN gram_NN husk_NN by_IN bagomolasses_NNS from_IN an_DT adequate_JJ ration_NN for_IN work-_JJ ing_NN bullocks_NNS ._.

0.13_CD A_DT perusal_NN of_IN the_DT data_NNS given_VBN above_RB would_MD show_VB that_IN the_DT protein_NN content_NN of_IN molasses_NNS feed_VBP is_VBZ low_JJ and_CC comparable_JJ to_TO that_DT of_IN a_DT dry_JJ roughage_NN such_JJ as_IN wheat_NN bhusa_NN ._.
Unlike_IN the_DT dry_JJ roughages_NNS ,_, however_RB ,_, the_DT crude_NN fibre_NN in_IN bagomolasses_NNS is_VBZ prac-_JJ tically_RB one-third_NN of_IN what_WP is_VBZ present_JJ in_IN the_DT former_JJ feeds_NNS ._.
The_DT outstanding_JJ feature_NN in_IN bagomolasses_NNS is_VBZ the_DT presence_NN of_IN a_DT large_JJ percentage_NN of_IN nitrogen-_JJ free_JJ extract_NN which_WDT is_VBZ mainly_RB composed_VBN of_IN easily_RB absorbable_JJ sugars_NNS ._.
The_DT amount_NN of_IN ether-ex-_JJ tract_NN present_NN in_IN molasses_NNS feed_VBP is_VBZ negligible_JJ ._.
Turn-_JJ ing_NN to_TO mineral_JJ constituents_NNS ,_, it_PRP may_MD be_VB seen_VBN that_DT bagomolasses_VBZ is_VBZ rather_RB rich_JJ in_IN total_JJ ash_NN nearly_RB 68_CD per_IN cent_NN of_IN which_WDT is_VBZ acid_JJ soluble_JJ ._.
In_IN the_DT acid-_JJ soluble_JJ ash_NN constituents_NNS ,_, there_EX is_VBZ an_DT extraordinary_JJ preponderance_NN of_IN lime_NN over_IN phosphate_NN ,_, the_DT former_JJ being_VBG ten_JJ times_NNS the_DT latter_NN ._.
The_DT chemical_JJ composition_NN of_IN bagomolasses_NNS as_IN set_VBN out_RP above_IN indicates_NNS that_IN this_DT material_NN can_MD not_RB be_VB put_VBN in_IN any_DT definite_JJ category_NN of_IN feeding-stuffs_NNS available_JJ in_IN this_DT country_NN ._.
Because_IN of_IN its_PRP$ low_JJ fibre-content_NN ,_, it_PRP can_MD not_RB be_VB considered_VBN as_IN a_DT roughage_NN although_IN it_PRP resembles_VBZ a_DT roughage_NN in_IN its_PRP$ poor_JJ protein_NN content_NN ._.
For_IN its_PRP$ rather_RB large_JJ nitrogen-free_JJ extract_NN content_NN ,_, bagomolasses_NNS can_MD be_VB assigned_VBN a_DT place_NN with_IN gram_NN or_CC oats_NNS ._.
EXPERIMENTAL_NNP Twenty-four_NNP healthy_JJ working_VBG bullocks_NNS of_IN the_DT Hariana_NNP and_CC Dhani_NNP breeds_NNS were_VBD selected_VBN and_CC divided_VBN into_IN three_CD groups_NNS of_IN eight_CD for_IN each_DT of_IN the_DT three_CD experiments_NNS planned_VBN above_IN ._.
Each_DT group_NN was_VBD again_RB divided_VBN into_IN two_CD sub-groups_NNS of_IN four_CD each_DT ,_, so_IN that_DT while_IN one_CD sub-group_NN was_VBD receiving_VBG the_DT control_NN ration_NN ,_, the_DT other_JJ received_VBD the_DT experi-_JJ mental_JJ ration_NN ._.
In_IN order_NN to_TO make_VB the_DT two_CD rations_NNS strictly_RB comparable_JJ ,_, one_CD animal_NN of_IN each_DT group_NN had_VBD a_DT mate_NN in_IN the_DT other_JJ of_IN the_DT same_JJ breed_NN and_CC F2_NNP 142_CD Bagomolasses_NNP as_IN Cattle_NNP Feed_NNP closely_RB approximating_VBG in_IN age_NN ,_, live_JJ weight_NN ,_, and_CC general_JJ condition_NN ._.
Furthermore_RB ,_, to_TO avoid_VB any_DT disparity_NN in_IN the_DT work_NN performed_VBD ,_, one_CD animal_NN from_IN each_DT group_NN was_VBD combined_VBN to_TO form_VB a_DT pair_NN for_IN the_DT yoke_NN ._.
The_DT animals_NNS performed_VBD medium_JJ type_NN of_IN work_NN ,_, i.e_NN ._.
about_IN six_CD hours_NNS a_DT day_NN ._.
The_DT work_NN mostly_RB consisted_VBN of_IN ploughing_VBG and_CC occasionally_RB carting_VBG ._.
Feeding_VBG experiments_NNS were_VBD started_VBN on_IN 2_CD April_NNP 1942_CD ._.
Towards_IN the_DT beginning_NN of_IN May_NNP ,_, there_EX was_VBD an_DT outbreak_NN of_IN foot-and-mouth_JJ disease_NN amongst_VBZ the_DT cattle_NNS at_IN Izatnagar_NNP ._.
The_DT animals_NNS under_IN this_DT investigation_NN were_VBD also_RB affected_VBN and_CC it_PRP was_VBD necessary_JJ to_TO discontinue_VB them_PRP from_IN work_NN ._.
The_DT scheduled_JJ rationing_NN was_VBD ,_, however_RB ,_, maintained_VBD ,_, although_IN in_IN considerably_RB restricted_VBN amounts_NNS ._.
Towards_IN the_DT end_NN of_IN June_NNP ,_, all_PDT the_DT ex-_JJ perimental_JJ animals_NNS recovered_VBN from_IN foot-and-_JJ mouth_NN disease_NN and_CC the_DT routine_JJ drawn_NN up_RP under_IN the_DT different_JJ investigations_NNS was_VBD restored_VBN immediate-_JJ ly_NN ._.
By_IN the_DT middle_NN of_IN September_NNP ,_, a_DT series_NN of_IN 10-_JJ day_NN metabolism_NN experiments_NNS was_VBD completed_VBN for_IN the_DT different_JJ groups_NNS of_IN animals_NNS ._.
The_DT experi-_JJ ments_NNS continued_VBD up_RB to_TO 22_CD November_NNP 1942_CD ,_, when_WRB the_DT investigation_NN was_VBD stopped_VBN ._.
During_IN these_DT experiments_NNS observations_NNS were_VBD recorded_VBN on_IN the_DT following_JJ points_NNS :_: (_( 1_CD )_) Food_NN consumption_NN ._.
(_( 2_CD )_) Change_NN in_IN body_NN weight_NN ._.
(_( 3_CD )_) Working_NNP capacity_NN and_CC general_JJ health_NN ._.
In_IN the_DT metabolism_NN experiments_NNS observations_NNS were_VBD made_VBN on_IN the_DT nitrogen_JJ balance_NN of_IN both_DT con-_JJ trol_NN and_CC experimental_JJ groups_NNS of_IN animals_NNS in_IN each_DT of_IN the_DT three_CD lines_NNS of_IN investigations_NNS planned_VBN ._.
The_DT nitrogen-balance_JJ studies_NNS were_VBD considered_VBN necessary_JJ to_TO supply_VB a_DT more_RBR exact_JJ information_NN regarding_VBG the_DT usefulness_NN of_IN bagomolasses_NNS either_CC as_IN an_DT added_JJ item_NN or_CC a_DT substitute_NN in_IN the_DT rations_NNS for_IN working_VBG animals_NNS ._.
During_IN the_DT course_NN of_IN metabolism_NN ex-_JJ periments_NNS ,_, some_DT of_IN the_DT ainmals_NNS had_VBD to_TO be_VB dropped_VBN out_RP as_IN they_PRP became_VBD indifferent_JJ to_TO their_PRP$ food_NN on_IN account_NN of_IN a_DT peculiar_JJ sensitiveness_NN to_TO the_DT meta-_JJ bolism_NN harnesses_NNS ._.
In_IN the_DT metabolism_NN studies_NNS ,_, therefore_RB ,_, actually_RB 18_CD animals_NNS were_VBD used_VBN six_CD for_IN each_DT investigation_NN ._.
The_DT introduction_NN of_IN bagomolasses_NNS into_IN the_DT diet_NN of_IN all_PDT the_DT experimental_JJ groups_NNS of_IN animals_NNS was_VBD made_VBN gradually_RB and_CC within_IN a_DT short_JJ time_NN the_DT animals_NNS could_MD be_VB easily_RB induced_VBN to_TO consume_VB 4.5_CD lb_NN ._.
of_IN it_PRP ._.
RESULTS_NNP AND_CC DISCUSSION_NNP I_PRP ._.
The_DT effect_NN of_IN the_DT addition_NN of_IN bagomolasses_NNS to_TO the_DT inadequate_JJ village_NN ration_NN The_DT rations_NNS for_IN the_DT control_NN and_CC experimental_JJ groups_NNS are_VBP shown_VBN below_IN :_: N._NNP K._NNP AYYAR_NNP AND_NNP A._NNP W._NNP ZUBERY_NNP 143_CD The_DT data_NN show_NN that_IN the_DT animals_NNS receiving_VBG experi-_JJ mental_JJ ration_NN containing_VBG bagomolasses_NNS apparent-_JJ ly_NN consumed_VBD more_RBR dry_JJ matter_NN than_IN the_DT animals_NNS receiving_VBG control_NN ration_NN ._.
However_RB ,_, this_DT increased_VBN consumption_NN was_VBD found_VBN on_IN statistical_JJ analysis_NN to_TO be_VB insignificant_JJ ._.
Live_JJ weight_NN ._.
The_DT animals_NNS on_IN control_NN ration_NN were_VBD found_VBN to_TO lose_VB weight_NN gradually_RB as_IN the_DT time_NN of_IN feeding_VBG progressed_VBN ._.
Their_PRP$ average_JJ weight_NN at_IN the_DT start_NN of_IN the_DT experiment_NN was_VBD 785_CD lb_NN ._.
and_CC decreased_VBN by_IN the_DT end_NN of_IN the_DT experiment_NN to_TO an_DT average_NN of_IN 736_CD lb_NN ._.
On_IN the_DT other_JJ hand_NN the_DT animals_NNS on_IN experimental_JJ ration_NN maintained_VBD a_DT more_RBR or_CC less_RBR constant_JJ body-weight_NN ._.
Their_PRP$ average_JJ body_NN weight_NN at_IN the_DT beginning_NN of_IN the_DT experiment_NN was_VBD 801_CD lb_NN ._.
and_CC at_IN the_DT end_NN ,_, 809_CD lb_NN ._.
However_RB ,_, when_WRB the_DT change_NN in_IN live_JJ weight_NN of_IN the_DT two_CD groups_NNS was_VBD statistically_RB examined_VBN the_DT difference_NN between_IN the_DT two_CD groups_NNS was_VBD not_RB significant_JJ ._.
