HEALTH_NN AND_CC WORKING_NNP CAPACITY_NNP OF_IN THE_NNP ANIMALS_NNP The_DT health_NN of_IN the_DT experimental_JJ animals_NNS fed_VBN with_IN and_CC without_IN bagomolasses_NNS was_VBD apparently_RB normal_JJ ._.
As_IN has_VBZ already_RB been_VBN stated_VBN ,_, all_DT the_DT molasses-fed_JJ animals_NNS maintained_VBD their_PRP$ live-weights_NNS during_IN this_DT short_JJ period_NN but_CC whether_IN they_PRP would_MD have_VB done_VBN so_RB for_IN longer_JJR periods_NNS could_MD only_RB be_VB determined_VBN by_IN carrying_VBG out_RP long-term_JJ experiments_NNS ._.
A_DT close_JJ watch_NN was_VBD kept_VBN on_IN the_DT working_VBG capacity_NN of_IN the_DT experimental_JJ animals_NNS and_CC controls_NNS ._.
The_DT conclusion_NN drawn_NN from_IN this_DT short-period_JJ and_CC admittedly_RB empirical_JJ observation_NN is_VBZ that_IN the_DT groups_NNS of_IN animals_NNS receiving_VBG bagomolasses_NNS exhibit-_JJ ed_VBP a_DT working_NN capacity_NN which_WDT was_VBD comparable_JJ ,_, if_IN not_RB superior_JJ ,_, to_TO that_DT of_IN their_PRP$ yoke_NN mates_VBZ not_RB receiving_JJ bagomolasses_NNS ._.
In_IN spite_NN of_IN the_DT animals_NNS getting_VBG a_DT fairly_RB large_JJ amount_NN of_IN salt_NN (_( 2_CD oz_NN ._.
a_DT day_NN )_) ,_, the_DT urinary_JJ excretion_NN as_IN shown_VBN in_IN Table_NNP VII_NNP was_VBD significantly_RB higher_JJR in_IN the_DT bagomolasses_NNS groups_NNS than_IN in_IN the_DT control_NN groups_NNS ._.
TABLE_NNP VII_NNP Total_NNP urinary_JJ excretion_NN per_IN animal_NN per_IN day_NN 146_CD Incidence_NN of_IN Helminth_NNP Infection_NNP in_IN India_NNP But_CC ,_, since_IN the_DT animals_NNS maintained_VBD their_PRP$ live_JJ weights_NNS and_CC general_JJ condition_NN of_IN health_NN ,_, this_DT slight_JJ diuresis_NN seems_VBZ of_IN no_DT consequence_NN ._.
SUMMARY_NNP An_DT inadequate_JJ village_NN ration_NN for_IN working_VBG bullocks_NNS can_MD be_VB improved_VBN by_IN supplementing_VBG with_IN bago-_JJ molasses_NNS without_IN inducing_VBG any_DT bad_JJ effect_NN on_IN the_DT health_NN ._.
The_DT higher_JJR retention_NN of_IN nitrogen_NN in_IN the_DT supplemented_JJ feeding_NN suggests_VBZ that_IN when_WRB the_DT energy-deficient_JJ typical_JJ village_NN ration_NN is_VBZ fortified_VBN by_IN adequate_JJ amounts_NNS of_IN energy-giving_JJ food_NN like_IN bagomolasses_NNS ,_, the_DT necessity_NN for_IN the_DT costly_JJ protein_NN concentrate_NN can_MD be_VB considerably_RB curtailed_VBN ._.
In_IN an_DT adequate_JJ ration_NN of_IN working_VBG bullocks_NNS gram_JJ husk_NN can_MD be_VB economically_RB substituted_VBN with_IN bagomolasses_NNS without_IN any_DT ill-effects_NNS on_IN the_DT animals_NNS ._.
The_DT health_NN and_CC working_VBG capacity_NN of_IN animals_NNS receiving_VBG bagomolasses_NNS to_TO the_DT extent_NN of_IN 18_CD per_IN cent_NN to_TO 27_CD per_IN cent_NN dry_JJ matter_NN in_IN the_DT ration_NN com-_NN pared_VBD well_RB with_IN those_DT of_IN the_DT control_NN groups_NNS during_IN a_DT short-term_JJ experiment_NN ._.

2_CD ,_, 5_CD and_CC 6_CD are_VBP taken_VBN from_IN a_DT case_NN in_IN which_WDT the_DT disease_NN was_VBD transmitted_VBN hereditarily_RB by_IN the_DT second_JJ generation_NN adults_NNS of_IN Hyalomma_NNP aegyptium_NN ,_, at_IN the_DT Imperial_NNP Veterinary_NNP Research_NNP Institute_NNP ,_, Mukteswar_NNP ._.
CONTROL_NNP OF_NNP ACUTE_NNP THEILERIASIS_NNP IN_NNP CALVES_NNP IN_NNP THE_NNP PUNJAB_NNP By_IN K._NNP RAGHAVACHARI_NNP ,_, Research_NNP Assistant_NNP ,_, Imperial_NNP Veterinary_NNP Research_NNP Institute_NNP ,_, ABBAS_NNP ALI_NNP SHAH_NNP ,_, Veterinary_NNP Assistant_NNP Surgeon_NNP ,_, Multan_NNP ,_, and_CC H._NNP N._NNP RAY_NNP ,_, Protozoologist_NNP ,_, Imperial_NNP Veterinary_NNP Research_NNP Institute_NNP ,_, Mukteswar_NNP (_( Received_VBN for_IN publication_NN on_IN 1_CD November_NNP 1944_CD )_) (_( With_IN Plate_NNP V_NNP )_) IN_NNP May_NNP 1940_CD ,_, we_PRP were_VBD called_VBN to_TO attend_VB a_DT severe_JJ outbreak_NN of_IN acute_JJ theileriasis_NN in_IN calves_NNS of_IN less_JJR than_IN three_CD months_NNS in_IN age_NN on_IN a_DT farm_NN in_IN the_DT Multan_NNP district_NN ._.
On_IN previous_JJ occasions_NNS the_DT malady_NN was_VBD recognized_VBN to_TO have_VB caused_VBN heavy_JJ death_NN among_IN calves_NNS on_IN the_DT farm_NN ._.
Locally_RB the_DT disease_NN is_VBZ known_VBN as_IN kanpher_NN ki_NN bimari_NN ,_, i.e_NN ._.
illness_NN with_IN marked_JJ swel-_JJ ling_NN of_IN the_DT parotid_NN glands_NNS ._.
It_PRP is_VBZ produced_VBN by_IN an_DT endoglobular_JJ parasite_NN ,_, provisionally_RB identified_VBN as_IN Theileria_NNP annulata_NN ._.
The_DT disease_NN is_VBZ prevalent_JJ from_IN March_NNP to_TO September_NNP ,_, and_CC the_DT rate_NN of_IN mortality_NN from_IN 1936_CD to_TO 1939_CD ranged_VBD between_IN 13_CD and_CC 23_CD per_IN cent_NN ._.
Up_RB to_TO June_NNP 1940_CD ,_, the_DT rate_NN had_VBD reached_VBN 10_CD per_IN cent_NN ._.
Since_IN the_DT chemotherapy_NN of_IN theileriasis_NN has_VBZ not_RB yet_RB been_VBN developed_VBN to_TO a_DT satisfactory_JJ stage_NN ,_, it_PRP is_VBZ merely_RB intended_VBN in_IN this_DT article_NN to_TO deal_VB with_IN the_DT control_NN measures_VBZ adopted_VBN in_IN endeavouring_VBG to_TO eradicate_VB the_DT disease_NN ._.
A_DT brief_JJ description_NN of_IN the_DT symptoms_NNS as_RB well_RB as_IN post-mortem_JJ lesions_NNS is_VBZ given_VBN so_RB that_IN methods_NNS of_IN diagnosis_NN may_MD be_VB more_RBR widely_RB known_VBN ._.
SYMPTOMS_NNP The_DT disease_NN occurs_VBZ in_IN acute_NN and_CC in_IN subacute_JJ forms_NNS ._.
In_IN the_DT former_JJ ,_, the_DT characteristic_JJ symptoms_NNS are_VBP dullness_JJ ,_, discharge_NN from_IN the_DT eyes_NNS and_CC nose_JJ ,_, raised_VBD body_NN temperature_NN (_( 103ºF_CD ._.
to_TO 106ºF_CD ._.
)_) ,_, marked_VBD swelling_NN of_IN the_DT parotid_NN ,_, suprascapular_JJ and_CC pre-_JJ crural_JJ lymphatic_JJ glands_NNS (_( Plate_NNP V_NNP ,_, figs_NNS ._.
2_CD and_CC 3_CD )_) ,_, frothy_JJ salivation_NN ,_, constipation_NN followed_VBN by_IN diar-_JJ rhoea_NN ,_, ulcerated_JJ gums_NNS (_( as_IN a_DT result_NN of_IN which_WDT the_DT calves_NNS can_MD not_RB suckle_VB )_) and_CC a_DT subsequent_JJ shrouding_NN of_IN the_DT teeth_NN (_( Plate_NNP V_NNP ,_, fig_NN ._.
1_CD )_) ._.
About_IN the_DT third_JJ week_NN ,_, most_JJS of_IN the_DT calves_NNS die_VBP and_CC in_IN the_DT remainder_NN symptoms_VBZ become_VBN subacute_NN ._.
In_IN some_DT fatal_JJ cases_NNS ,_, respiratory_NN troubles_NNS ,_, such_JJ as_IN bronchitis_NN and_CC catarrh_NN of_IN the_DT lungs_NNS have_VBP been_VBN observed_VBN ._.
In_IN the_DT sub-_JJ acute_JJ form_NN ,_, the_DT above_NN symptoms_NNS are_VBP milder_NN ._.
Ailing_VBG calves_NNS continue_VBP to_TO suckle_VB ._.
The_DT body_NN tem-_JJ perature_NN usually_RB remains_VBZ below_IN 104ºF_CD ._.
Faeces_NNS are_VBP soft_JJ and_CC yellowish_JJ in_IN colour_NN ._.
Visible_JJ mucous_JJ membranes_NNS are_VBP pale_JJ and_CC anaemic_JJ ._.
The_DT eyelids_NNS and_CC the_DT surrounding_NN regions_NNS are_VBP oedematous_JJ ._.
Such_JJ cases_NNS ,_, with_IN proper_JJ care_NN and_CC nursing_NN ,_, are_VBP likely_JJ to_TO recover_VB after_IN four_CD weeks_NNS from_IN the_DT onset_NN of_IN the_DT disease_NN ._.
It_PRP may_MD be_VB mentioned_VBN that_IN gingivitis_NN and_CC stoma-_JJ titis_NN are_VBP the_DT most_RBS severe_JJ complications_NNS and_CC render_VB the_DT animals_NNS unable_JJ to_TO suckle_VB ._.
This_DT results_NNS in_IN loss_NN of_IN condition_NN and_CC progressive_JJ emaciation_NN ,_, leading_VBG finally_RB to_TO death_NN ._.
Another_DT and_CC less_RBR common_JJ complication_NN is_VBZ pneumonia_VBN ._.
LESIONS_VB The_DT condition_NN of_IN the_DT carcase_NN is_VBZ poor_JJ ,_, mucous_JJ membranes_NNS are_VBP pale_JJ and_CC in_IN the_DT majority_NN of_IN cases_NNS subcutaneous_JJ tissues_NNS ,_, including_VBG fat_NN ,_, are_VBP stained_VBN deep_JJ yellow_NN ._.
The_DT gums_NNS are_VBP red_JJ and_CC ulcerated_JJ and_CC show_VB a_DT light-grey_JJ gangrenous_JJ deposit_NN ._.
There_EX may_MD be_VB pneumonia_NN ._.
The_DT pericardial_JJ fat_NN is_VBZ deep-_JJ yellow_JJ and_CC the_DT heart_NN muscle_NN pale_NN ._.
The_DT liver_NN is_VBZ soft_JJ and_CC icteric_JJ ,_, petechiated_JJ and_CC greatly_RB enlarged_VBD (_( Plate_NNP V_NNP ,_, fig_NN ._.
6_CD )_) ._.
The_DT gall_NN bladder_NN is_VBZ usually_RB distended_VBN and_CC contains_NNS coagulated_VBN bile_IN of_IN dark-_JJ green_JJ colour_NN ._.
The_DT spleen_NN is_VBZ soft_JJ and_CC much_JJ en-_NN larged_VBD ._.
The_DT urinary_JJ bladder_NN often_RB contains_VBZ yellow_JJ coloured_VBD urine_JJ ._.
The_DT abomasum_NN shows_VBZ charac-_JJ teristic_JJ ulcerations_NNS (_( Plate_NNP V_NNP ,_, fig_NN ._.
5_CD )_) ._.
It_PRP may_MD be_VB emphasized_VBN here_RB that_IN prognosis_NN is_VBZ favourable_JJ only_RB in_IN cases_NNS where_WRB the_DT mouth_NN lesions_NNS are_VBP not_RB severe_JJ ._.
CONTROL_NNP MEASURES_NNP Sen_NNP and_CC Sreenivasan_NNP [_NNP 1937_CD ]_NNP tried_VBD several_JJ drugs_NNS for_IN the_DT treatment_NN of_IN experimental_JJ cases_NNS of_IN the-_JJ ileriasis_NN in_IN hill_NN bulls_NNS ._.
Of_IN these_DT ,_, atebrin_NN (_( Bayer_NNP )_) was_VBD the_DT only_JJ one_CD which_WDT cured_VBD as_RB many_JJ as_IN 55_CD to_TO 57_CD per_IN cent_NN of_IN infected_JJ cases_NNS ,_, but_CC they_PRP also_RB noted_VBD that_IN natural_JJ recovery_NN took_VBD place_NN to_TO about_IN the_DT same_JJ extent_NN ._.
Since_IN so_RB far_RB no_DT drug_NN treatment_NN has_VBZ proved_VBN satisfactory_JJ for_IN this_DT disease_NN ,_, an_DT attempt_NN was_VBD made_VBN to_TO control_VB the_DT arthropod_NN vector_NN ,_, viz_NN ._.
Hyalomma_NNP aegyptium_NN ,_, with_IN which_WDT the_DT farm_NN was_VBD found_VBN to_TO be_VB extensively_RB infested_VBN ._.
It_PRP has_VBZ been_VBN proved_VBN to_TO our_PRP$ satisfaction_NN by_IN one_CD of_IN us_PRP (_( H._NNP N._NNP R._NNP )_) that_IN this_DT tick_NN is_VBZ responsible_JJ for_IN transmitting_VBG acute_JJ theileriasis_NN to_TO 149_CD G_NNP 2_CD 150_CD Control_NN of_IN Acute_NNP Theileriasis_NNP in_IN Calves_NNP in_IN the_DT Punjab_NNP young_JJ calves_NNS and_CC that_IN the_DT infection_NN is_VBZ transmitted_VBN hereditarily_RB only_RB in_IN the_DT adult_NN stage_NN of_IN the_DT tick_NN and_CC not_RB in_IN the_DT larval_NN or_CC nymphal_JJ stages_NNS ._.
As_IN found_VBN by_IN Fotheringham_NNP and_CC Lewis_NNP [_NNP 1937_CD ]_NNP ,_, this_DT is_VBZ quite_RB different_JJ from_IN what_WP has_VBZ been_VBN experienced_VBN in_IN T._NNP parva_NN infection_NN ._.
The_DT first_JJ object_NN was_VBD to_TO save_VB the_DT new-born_JJ calves_NNS ._.
For_IN this_DT purpose_NN ,_, they_PRP were_VBD divided_VBN into_IN two_CD groups_NNS ,_, viz_NN ._.
weaned_VBN at_IN birth_NN and_CC unweaned_JJ ._.
For_IN the_DT former_JJ ,_, an_DT area_NN was_VBD rendered_VBN tick-proof_JJ by_IN first_JJ digging_VBG up_RP the_DT earth_NN to_TO a_DT depth_NN of_IN about_RB 18_CD in_IN ._.
and_CC then_RB burning_VBG dry_JJ leaves_NNS and_CC grass_NN over_IN the_DT dug-up_JJ area_NN ._.
Subsequently_RB ,_, a_DT moat_NN about_IN 9_CD in_IN ._.
wide_JJ and_CC 6_CD in_IN ._.
deep_JJ surrounding_VBG the_DT area_NN was_VBD filled_VBN with_IN water_NN ._.
Attendants_NNS were_VBD engaged_VBN exclusively_RB for_IN this_DT tick-proof_JJ paddock_NN ._.
It_PRP was_VBD observed_VBN that_IN calves_NNS ,_, which_WDT were_VBD detained_VBN here_RB for_IN three_CD months_NNS ,_, were_VBD susceptible_JJ to_TO infection_NN when_WRB removed_VBN to_TO an_DT infected_JJ area_NN ,_, though_IN none_NN died_VBD ._.
For_IN the_DT calves_NNS of_IN the_DT second_JJ group_NN ,_, more_JJR elaborate_JJ arrangements_NNS were_VBD made_VBN ._.
Cows_NNS in_IN advanced_JJ pregnancy_NN were_VBD isolated_VBN from_IN the_DT main_JJ herd_NN at_IN a_DT place_NN about_IN half-a-mile_JJ away_RB ._.
Before_IN removing_VBG them_PRP to_TO this_DT segregation_NN camp_NN ,_, all_DT ticks_NNS on_IN the_DT animals_NNS were_VBD hand-picked_JJ ,_, their_PRP$ tails_NNS and_CC ears_NNS clipped_VBN in_IN ,_, and_CC rest_NN of_IN the_DT body_NN sprayed_VBD every_DT third_JJ day_NN with_IN an_DT arsenical_JJ solution_NN con-_JJ sisting_NN of_IN soft_JJ soap_NN 11_CD oz._NN ,_, liquid_JJ paraffin_NN 1_CD lb_NN ._.
2½_CD oz._NN ,_, sodium_NN arsenite_RB 1_CD lb_NN ._.
1_CD oz_NN ._.
and_CC water_NN 50_CD gallons_NNS ._.
Separate_JJ attendants_NNS and_CC grazing_VBG pas-_JJ tures_NNS were_VBD arranged_VBN ._.
There_EX were_VBD also_RB several_JJ calves_NNS which_WDT were_VBD weaned_VBN at_IN birth_NN ,_, but_CC were_VBD below_IN two_CD months_NNS in_IN age_NN ._.
All_PDT these_DT calves_NNS were_VBD dipped_VBN in_IN the_DT arsenical_JJ solution_NN using_VBG a_DT Cooper_NNP 's_POS portable_JJ swim-bath_NN and_CC housed_VBN in_IN a_DT paddock_NN at_IN some_DT dis-_JJ tance_NN from_IN the_DT main_JJ farm_NN ._.
Dipping_VBG was_VBD done_VBN every_DT third_JJ day_NN as_IN before_RB ._.
A_DT few_JJ of_IN these_DT calves_NNS developed_VBD the_DT disease_NN ,_, but_CC at_IN the_DT first_JJ appearance_NN of_IN symptoms_NNS they_PRP were_VBD returned_VBN to_TO the_DT sick_JJ ward_NN where_WRB they_PRP were_VBD given_VBN symptomatic_JJ treatment_NN ,_, along_IN with_IN good_JJ nursing_NN ._.
The_DT floor_NN of_IN the_DT sick_JJ ward_NN was_VBD covered_VBN with_IN hay_JJ bedding_VBG about_RB 4_CD to_TO 6_CD in_IN ._.
thick_NN ,_, to_TO afford_VB comfort_NN and_CC at_IN the_DT same_JJ time_NN to_TO prevent_VB them_PRP from_IN licking_VBG the_DT earth_NN ._.
Control_NN by_IN vaccination_NN In_IN 1940_CD ,_, one_CD of_IN us_PRP (_( H._NNP N._NNP R._NNP )_) observed_VBD that_IN the_DT introduction_NN of_IN dead_JJ parasites_NNS rendered_VBD healthy_JJ animals_NNS immune_VBP to_TO subsequent_JJ inoculation_NN of_IN virulent_JJ blood_NN containing_VBG Koch_NNP 's_POS bodies_NNS ._.
In_IN the_DT light_NN of_IN this_DT observation_NN ,_, a_DT vaccine_NN was_VBD pre-_JJ pared_VBN by_IN making_VBG a_DT suspension_NN in_IN 5_CD per_IN cent_NN for-_JJ malin_NN of_IN lymph_JJ glands_NNS and_CC spleen_NN from_IN a_DT heavily_RB infected_JJ case_NN on_IN the_DT farm_NN ._.
Soon_RB after_IN bi_JJ calves_NNS were_VBD vaccinated_VBN subcutaneously_RB with_IN c.c_NN ._.
of_IN this_DT vaccine_NN and_CC kept_NN in_IN the_DT tick-free_JJ padd_NN for_IN 14_CD days_NNS before_IN being_VBG transferred_VBN to_TO the_DT t_NN infested_VBD area_NN ._.
Between_NNP May_NNP 23_CD and_CC June_NNP 1940_CD ,_, 19_CD calves_NNS (_( 7_CD females_NNS and_CC 12_CD males_NNS )_) were_VBD treated_VBN in_IN this_DT maimer_NN ._.
Of_IN these_DT ,_, 16_CD were_VBD trans-_JJ ferred_VBN to_TO the_DT tick-infested_JJ areaS_NN ._.
N._NNP SAPRE_NNP 151_CD Further_NNP stress_NN the_DT importance_NN of_IN tick_NN control_NN measures_NNS ._.
SUMMARY_NNP Methods_NNP adopted_VBD for_IN the_DT control_NN of_IN acute_JJ the-_JJ eriasis_NN in_IN calves_NNS due_JJ to_TO Theileria_NNP annulata_NNS are_VBP described_VBN ._.
Calves_NNS less_RBR than_IN three_CD months_NNS of_IN age_NN were_VBD the_DT most_RBS susceptible_JJ ,_, mortality_JJ rate_NN among_IN such_JJ calves_NNS between_IN 1936_CD and_CC 1939_CD ranging_VBG from_IN 13_CD to_TO 23_CD per_IN cent_NN ._.
The_DT vector_NN of_IN the_DT disease_NN is_VBZ tick_JJ ,_, Hyalomma_NNP aegyptium_NN ._.
Control_NNP measures_VBZ consisted_VBN in_IN keeping_VBG calves_NNS weaned_VBD at_IN birth_NN in_IN tick-proof_JJ paddocks_NNS for_IN at_IN least_JJS three_CD months_NNS ._.
The_DT liberal_JJ use_NN of_IN tick-dip_NN was_VBD practised_VBN both_DT for_IN young_JJ calves_NNS and_CC their_PRP$ mothers_NNS in_IN order_NN to_TO keep_VB down_RP the_DT number_NN of_IN ticks_NNS in_IN the_DT farm_NN ._.
ACKNOWLEDGEMENTS_NNP Our_PRP$ thanks_NNS are_VBP due_JJ to_TO the_DT farm_NN authorities_NNS for_IN their_PRP$ hearty_JJ cooperation_NN ;_: to_TO Mr_NNP Jalal_NNP Moham-_NNP mad_NN Khan_NNP ,_, the_DT then_RB Deputy_NNP Superintendent_NNP of_IN Grantee_NNP Farms_NNP in_IN the_DT Punjab_NNP ,_, and_CC to_TO Mr_NNP Wali_NNP Mohammad_NNP Khan_NNP ,_, M.R.C.V.S._NNP ,_, the_DT then_RB Veteri-_NNP nary_JJ Investigation_NNP Officer_NNP of_IN that_DT province_NN ,_, for_IN lending_VBG great_JJ assistance_NN in_IN carrying_VBG out_RP our_PRP$ obser-_JJ vations_NNS ._.
REFERENCES_NNP Fotheringham_NNP ,_, W._NNP and_CC Lewis_NNP ,_, E._NNP A_NNP ._.

7_CD ,_, 16_CD TRANSMISSION_NNP OF_IN PASTEURELLOSIS_NNP BY_NNP THE_NNP FLEAS_NNP (_( CTENOCEPHALIDES_NNP FELIS_NNP )_) By_IN S._NNP N._NNP SAPRE_NNP ,_, Imperial_NNP Veterinary_NNP Research_NNP Institute_NNP ,_, Mukteswar_NNP (_( Received_VBN for_IN publication_NN on_IN 13_CD April_NNP 1944_CD )_) THE_NNP general_JJ association_NN of_IN pasteurellosis_NN with_IN the_DT seasonal_JJ flare-up_NN of_IN fleas_NN has_VBZ been_VBN stressed_VBN by_IN Mehra_NNP [_NNP 1943_CD ]_NNP in_IN an_DT article_NN presented_VBN to_TO the_DT 30th_JJ session_NN of_IN Indian_JJ Science_NNP Congress_NNP ._.
Sen_NNP [_NN 1925_CD ]_NN suggested_VBD the_DT possibility_NN of_IN fleas_JJ acting_NN as_IN mechanical_JJ transmitters_NNS of_IN haemorrhagic_JJ sep-_JJ ticaemia_NN because_IN of_IN the_DT morphological_JJ resemblance_NN between_IN the_DT organism_NN of_IN human_JJ plague_NN and_CC that_IN of_IN haemorrhagic_JJ septicaemia_NN and_CC also_RB because_IN fleas_NNS are_VBP active_JJ agents_NNS in_IN the_DT transmission_NN of_IN the_DT former_JJ from_IN rat_NN to_TO rat_VB and_CC from_IN rat_NN to_TO man_NN ._.
Daubney_NNP ,_, Hudson_NNP and_CC Roberts_NNP [_NNP 1934_CD ]_NNP succeeded_VBD in_IN trans-_JJ mitting_VBG the_DT disease_NN experimentally_RB from_IN mouse_NN to_TO mouse_VB with_IN Ctenocephalus_NNP felis_NNS ._.
Mehra_NNP [_NN 1941_CD ]_NN ,_, while_IN working_VBG at_IN this_DT Institute_NNP ,_, found_VBD that_IN the_DT disease_NN could_MD be_VB transmitted_VBN from_IN rabbit_NN to_TO rabbit_VB by_IN this_DT species_NNS of_IN flea_NN ._.
The_DT main_JJ object_NN of_IN the_DT present_JJ investigation_NN has_VBZ been_VBN (_( 1_CD )_) to_TO confirm_VB the_DT findings_NNS of_IN previous_JJ workers_NNS as_IN regards_NNS the_DT transmission_NN of_IN pasteurellosis_NN by_IN fleas_NNS in_IN rabbits_NNS and_CC (_( 2_CD )_) to_TO test_VB the_DT possibility_NN of_IN the_DT disease_NN being_VBG reproduced_VBN in_IN buffaloes_NNS through_IN the_DT agency_NN of_IN these_DT insects_NNS ._.
PASTEURELLOSIS_NNP IN_NNP RABBITS_NNP Preliminary_NNP experiments_NNS were_VBD undertaken_VBN to_TO determine_VB the_DT course_NN of_IN bacteriaemia_NN following_VBG an_DT artificial_JJ infection_NN of_IN rabbits_NNS with_IN Pasteurella_NNP septica_NN ,_, to_TO find_VB the_DT best_JJS time_NN for_IN liberating_VBG fleas_NNS on_IN the_DT infected_JJ animal_NN ,_, and_CC to_TO determine_VB the_DT most_RBS suitable_JJ time_NN for_IN inoculating_VBG the_DT donor_NN rabbits_NNS ._.
While_IN fever_NN is_VBZ usually_RB a_DT reliable_JJ index_NN of_IN bacteriæ-_JJ mia_NN ,_, microscopical_JJ examination_NN of_IN suitably_RB stained_VBN blood_NN smears_NNS would_MD be_VB a_DT more_RBR positive_JJ proof_NN ._.
Kraneveld_NNP and_CC Djaenoedin_NNP [_NNP 1928_CD ]_NNP ,_, working_VBG on_IN Pasteurella_NNP septica_JJ infection_NN in_IN buffaloes_NNS have_VBP shown_VBN that_IN rabbit_NN inoculations_NNS arc_VBP often_RB positive_JJ when_WRB microscopical_JJ findings_NNS are_VBP negative_JJ ._.
In_IN order_NN to_TO determine_VB the_DT points_NNS at_IN issue_NN ,_, three_CD adult_NN rabbits_NNS were_VBD used_VBN ._.
After_IN ascertaining_VBG that_IN their_PRP$ temperatures_NNS were_VBD normal_JJ ,_, they_PRP were_VBD in-_JJ oculated_VBN subcutancously_RB with_IN 1.0_CD c.c_NNS ._.
of_IN a_DT 24_CD hour_NN broth_JJ culture_NN of_IN a_DT virulent_NN strain_NN of_IN P._NNP septica_NNP (_( of_IN bovine_NN origin_NN )_) at_IN 10-4_JJ dilution_NN ._.
Blood_NN cultures_NNS were_VBD made_VBN at_IN various_JJ intervals_NNS after_IN inoculation_NN ,_, and_CC at_IN the_DT same_JJ time_NN rectal_JJ temperatures_NNS were_VBD recorded_VBN and_CC blood_NN smears_NNS stained_VBN by_IN Leish-_NNP man_NN 's_POS method_NN ._.

blood_NN from_IN the_DT ear_NN vain_NN was_VBD taken_VBN into_IN 9.9_CD c.c_NN ._.

Secondly_RB ,_, to_TO obtain_VB an_DT enduring_NN and_CC comparatively_RB high_JJ level_NN of_IN bac-_JJ tereamia_NN in_IN the_DT peripheral_JJ circulation_NN ,_, such_JJ as_IN would_MD be_VB essential_JJ for_IN assuring_VBG infection_NN through_IN a_DT transmitting_NN agent_NN ,_, is_VBZ difficult_JJ with_IN buffaloes_NNS ._.
Rabbits_NNS however_RB are_VBP suitable_JJ animals_NNS since_IN they_PRP can_MD be_VB easily_RB housed_VBN and_CC handled_VBN ,_, and_CC when_WRB they_PRP are_VBP kept_VBN in_IN glass_NN containers_NNS ,_, the_DT infected_JJ fleas_NNS can_MD easily_RB be_VB collected_VBN after_IN death_NN of_IN the_DT donor_NN ._.
Since_IN the_DT housing_NN arrangements_NNS for_IN the_DT donor_NN and_CC receptor_NN are_VBP separate_JJ ,_, the_DT possibility_NN of_IN in-_JJ fection_NN through_IN infective_JJ excreta_NN of_IN the_DT donor_NN can_MD be_VB easily_RB avoided_VBN ._.
The_DT 11_CD experiments_NNS carried_VBD out_RP may_MD be_VB con-_JJ veniently_RB divided_VBN into_IN three_CD groups_NNS ._.
All_DT buffaloes_NNS were_VBD under_IN one_CD year_NN of_IN age_NN ._.
Group_NNP I_PRP (_( One_CD experiment_NN )_) ._.
In_IN this_DT an_DT attempt_NN was_VBD made_VBN to_TO transmit_VB pasteurollosis_NN from_IN one_CD buffalo_NN calf_NN to_TO another_DT ._.
The_DT donor_NN ,_, however_RB ,_, failed_VBD to_TO show_VB Pasteurella_NNP in_IN the_DT peripheral_JJ cir-_JJ culation_NN till_NN death_NN ._.
Neverthless_NN when_WRB a_DT rise_NN in_IN temperature_NN (_( 2ºF_CD ._. )_)
was_VBD observed_VBN ,_, 400_CD fleas_NNS were_VBD liberated_VBN and_CC left_VBN till_JJ death_NN of_IN the_DT animal_NN ._.
Fleas_NNS collected_VBN from_IN the_DT dead_JJ animal_NN were_VBD negative_JJ bacteriologically_RB ._.
The_DT receptor_NN failed_VBD to_TO show_VB definite_JJ infection_NN although_IN it_PRP was_VBD left_VBN in_IN the_DT closed_JJ room_NN used_VBN for_IN the_DT experiment_NN and_CC which_WDT presum-_NN ably_RB still_RB contained_VBN infected_JJ fleas_NNS hiding_VBG in_IN cre-_JJ vices_NNS ,_, debris_NN ,_, etc_FW ._.
Discharges_NNS and_CC other_JJ contam-_NN inated_VBD articles_NNS only_RB were_VBD removed_VBN and_CC no_DT attempt_NN was_VBD made_VBN at_IN disinfection_NN ._.
This_DT experiment_NN can_MD not_RB be_VB considered_VBN satisfactory_JJ ,_, since_IN for_IN an_DT unknown_JJ reason_NN ,_, the_DT receptor_NN died_VBD 15_CD days_NNS after_IN exposure_NN to_TO the_DT fleas_NNS ._.
A_DT careful_JJ cultural_JJ examination_NN of_IN its_PRP$ bone-marrow_JJ gave_VBD negative_JJ results_NNS ._.
Group_NNP II_NNP (_( Three_NNP experiments_NNS )_) ._.
Rabbits_NNS were_VBD used_VBN as_IN donors_NNS and_CC buffalo-calves_NNS as_IN receptors_NNS ._.
About_IN 500_CD fleas_NNS were_VBD used_VBN in_IN each_DT of_IN the_DT three_CD experiments_NNS ._.
They_PRP were_VBD liberated_VBN on_IN the_DT donors_NNS when_WRB a_DT rise_NN of_IN temperature_NN of_IN 2ºF_CD ._.
had_VBD occurred_VBN ._.
The_DT Pasteurella-infected_JJ fleas_NNS ,_, after_IN fasting_VBG for_IN one-and-a-half_JJ to_TO two_CD hours_NNS ,_, were_VBD fed_VBN on_IN the_DT recep-_JJ tors_NNS (_( one_CD buffalo_NN in_IN each_DT experiment_NN )_) for_IN one_CD hour_NN on_IN a_DT closely_RB clipped_JJ circumscribed_JJ area_NN of_IN skin_NN under_IN a_DT funnel_NN and_CC then_RB finally_RB liberated_VBN ._.
Fleas_NNS collected_VBN from_IN the_DT receptor_NN buffaloes_NNS on_IN the_DT following_JJ day_NN were_VBD shown_VBN to_TO contain_VB Pasteurella_NNP ._.
None_NN of_IN the_DT three_CD receptor_NN buffaloes_NNS showed_VBD clinical_JJ symptoms_NNS and_CC were_VBD liberated_VBN from_IN the_DT experiment_NN a_DT fortnight_NN later_RB ._.
Group_NNP III_NNP (_( Seven_NNP experiments_NNS )_) ._.
The_DT number_NN of_IN fleas_NNS used_VBN in_IN the_DT experiments_NNS were_VBD 808_CD ,_, 1,600_CD ,_, 1,600_CD ,_, 160_CD ,_, 2,000_CD ,_, 340_CD and_CC 3,000_CD respectively_RB ._.
As_RB soon_RB as_IN Pasteurella_NNP were_VBD observed_VBN in_IN the_DT donor_NN fleas_NN which_WDT had_VBD been_VBN fasted_VBN for_IN about_RB 24_CD hours_NNS were_VBD allowed_VBN to_TO feed_VB till_VB half-an-hour_JJ after_IN the_DT donor_NN 's_POS death_NN ._.
In_IN six_CD out_IN of_IN the_DT seven_CD experiments_NNS the_DT fleas_NNS got_VBD an_DT infective_JJ feed_NN for_IN a_DT period_NN of_IN nearly_RB five_CD hours_NNS ,_, while_IN in_IN the_DT seventh_JJ it_PRP was_VBD two_CD hours_NNS ._.
In_IN one_CD case_NN only_RB (_( experiment_JJ 2_CD ,_, with_IN 1,600_CD fleas_NNS )_) was_VBD transmission_JJ successful_JJ ._.
In_IN experiment_JJ 5_CD the_DT receptor_NN died_VBD after_IN three_CD days_NNS ._.
There_EX was_VBD slight_JJ oedema_NN where_WRB the_DT infected_JJ fleas_NNS had_VBD fed_VBN ,_, but_CC blood_NN smears_NNS taken_VBN after_IN death_NN showed_VBD no_DT bipolar_JJ organisms_NNS ._.
Heart_NNP blood_NN and_CC bone_NN marrow_NN examined_VBD bacteriologically_RB also_RB yielded_VBN negative_JJ results_NNS ._.
The_DT spleen_NN was_VBD slightly_RB haemorrhagic_JJ ,_, endocarditis_NN was_VBD present_JJ and_CC also_RB slight_VBD haemorr-_JJ hagic_NN gastritis_NN and_CC enteritis_NN ._.
INFECTIVITY_NNP OF_NNP FLEAS_NNP AFTER_NNP VARYING_NNP PERIODS_NNP OF_IN FASTING_NNP Thirty-four_NNP lots_NNS of_IN infected_JJ fleas_NNS ,_, each_DT containing_VBG about_IN 10_CD individuals_NNS ,_, were_VBD examined_VBN bacteriolo-_JJ gically_RB after_IN fasting_VBG for_IN 1_CD hour_NN to_TO 120_CD hours_NNS ._.

EXCRETION_NN OF_NNP P._NNP boviseptica_NN IN_NNP THE_NNP FAECES_NNP OF_NNP FLEAS_NNP Eskey_NNP and_CC Haas_NNP [_NNP 1940_CD ]_NNP determined_VBD the_DT pre-_JJ sence_NN or_CC absence_NN of_IN infection_NN in_IN the_DT fleas_NNS by_IN in-_JJ oculating_VBG their_PRP$ faeces_NNS into_IN guinea-pigs_NNS ._.
The_DT role_NN of_IN infected_JJ faeces_NNS in_IN transmission_NN from_IN animal_NN to_TO ani-_JJ mal_NN or_CC from_IN animal_JJ to_TO man_NN by_IN the_DT rubbing_NN of_IN faecal_JJ droplets_NNS into_IN abrasions_NNS or_CC wounds_NNS has_VBZ been_VBN pointed_VBN out_RP by_IN several_JJ investigators_NNS ._.
In_IN the_DT present_JJ experiments_VBZ the_DT infectivity_NN of_IN six_CD faecal_JJ samples_NNS was_VBD determined_VBN by_IN cultural_JJ examination_NN ._.
Three_CD samples_NNS collected_VBN from_IN infected_VBN fleas_NNS at_IN the_DT time_NN of_IN their_PRP$ second_JJ feed_NN after_IN 24_CD hours_NNS fasting_VBG were_VBD negative_JJ ,_, while_IN two_CD out_IN of_IN three_CD samples_NNS collected_VBN after_IN 48_CD hours_NNS fasting_VBG were_VBD positive_JJ ._.
EXPERIMENTS_NNS TO_NNP DETERMINE_NNP WHETHER_NNP INFEC-_NNP TION_NNP CAN_NNP OCCUR_NNP BY_NNP INOCULATION_NNP OF_NNP INFECTIVE_NNP FAECES_NNP THROUGH_NNP WOUNDS_NNP ARISING_NNP FROM_NNP BITES_NNP OF_NNP HEALTHY_NNP FLEAS_NNP Sample_NNP of_IN infected_JJ faeces_NNS was_VBD collected_VBN from_IN about_IN 200_CD fleas_NNS at_IN the_DT time_NN they_PRP were_VBD used_VBN for_IN a_DT second_JJ feed_NN after_IN 24_CD hours_NNS fasting_VBG ._.
The_DT sample_NN was_VBD found_VBN positive_JJ on_IN cultural_JJ examination_NN after_IN it_PRP had_VBD been_VBN allowed_VBN to_TO remain_VB at_IN room_NN temperature_NN for_IN 24_CD hours_NNS ._.
In_IN the_DT second_JJ part_NN of_IN the_DT experiment_NN about_IN 100_CD healthy_JJ fleas_NNS ,_, previously_RB fasted_VBN ,_, were_VBD allowed_VBN to_TO bite_VB healthy_JJ rabbit_NN for_IN one_CD hour_NN on_IN a_DT closely_RB clipped_JJ area_NN on_IN its_PRP$ belly_NN and_CC a_DT suspension_NN of_IN the_DT infected_JJ faecal_JJ sample_NN was_VBD then_RB rubbed_VBN into_IN the_DT bites_NNS with_IN a_DT pestle_NN ._.
The_DT movements_NNS of_IN the_DT rabbit_NN were_VBD then_RB restricted_VBN so_RB that_IN the_DT area_NN could_MD not_RB be_VB licked_VBN ._.
The_DT rabbit_NN died_VBD after_IN 24_CD hours_NNS of_IN pasteurellosis_NN ._.
DISCUSSION_NNP Out_NNP of_IN the_DT 15_CD experiments_NNS using_VBG a_DT virulent_NN Pasteurella_NNP strain_NN in_IN rabbits_NNS ,_, 12_CD gave_VBD positive_JJ results_NNS and_CC under_IN these_DT conditions_NNS evidently_RB very_RB few_JJ fleas_NNS were_VBD necessary_JJ for_IN transmission_NN ._.
In_IN young_JJ buffaloes_NNS ,_, eight_CD transmission_NN experi-_JJ ments_NNS were_VBD negative_JJ ,_, one_CD was_VBD positive_JJ and_CC two_CD must_MD be_VB put_VBN as_IN doubtful_NN ._.
Since_IN the_DT method_NN em-_JJ ployed_NN with_IN buffaloes_NNS was_VBD the_DT same_JJ as_IN with_IN rabbits_NNS ,_, there_EX appears_VBZ to_TO be_VB no_DT reason_NN for_IN the_DT failure_NN with_IN buffaloes_NNS unless_IN the_DT vectors_NNS were_VBD incapable_JJ of_IN in-_JJ oculating_VBG a_DT sufficient_JJ number_NN of_IN organisms_NNS ._.
If_IN this_DT is_VBZ so_RB the_DT species_NNS of_IN fleas_NNS used_VBN must_MD be_VB consi-_JJ dered_VBN an_DT inefficient_JJ vector_NN ._.
From_IN cultural_JJ exa-_JJ mination_NN of_IN infected_JJ batches_NNS of_IN fleas_NNS which_WDT have_VBP taken_VBN an_DT infective_JJ meal_NN it_PRP seems_VBZ likely_JJ that_IN only_RB a_DT certain_JJ proportion_NN of_IN fleas_NNS are_VBP capable_JJ of_IN imbibing_VBG infection_NN ._.
According_VBG to_TO Eskey_NNP and_CC Haas_NNP [_NNP 1940_CD ]_NNP only_RB 38_CD per_IN cent_NN of_IN X._NNP cheopis_NN and_CC 20_CD per_IN cent_NN of_IN D._NNP montanus_NN became_VBD infected_VBN in_IN spite_NN of_IN multiple_JJ infective_JJ feeds_NNS ._.
On_IN the_DT other_JJ hand_NN ,_, Douglas_NNP and_CC Wheeler_NNP [_NNP 1943_CD ]_NN who_WP determined_VBD the_DT percentage_NN of_IN infected_VBN fleas_NNS by_IN cultural_JJ and_CC histological_JJ ex-_JJ amination_NN report_NN that_IN 96_CD per_IN cent_NN of_IN these_DT species_NNS became_VBD infected_JJ ._.
Douglas_NNP and_CC Wheeler_NNP ,_, however_RB ,_, consider_VB that_IN the_DT efficiency_NN as_IN a_DT vector_NN of_IN a_DT given_VBN species_NNS of_IN flea_NN is_VBZ not_RB solely_RB determined_VBN by_IN the_DT proportion_NN of_IN fleas_NNS infected_VBN but_CC is_VBZ dependent_JJ on_IN the_DT multiplication_NN of_IN bacilli_NN in_IN the_DT alimentary_JJ canal_NN of_IN the_DT insect_NN ._.
It_PRP would_MD be_VB of_IN some_DT interest_NN to_TO ascertain_VB the_DT percentage_NN of_IN infectivity_NN in_IN C._NNP felis_NN and_CC also_RB whether_IN P._NNP septica_NN multiplies_NNS in_IN its_PRP$ alimen-_JJ tary_JJ canal_NN ._.
Daubney_NNP ,_, Hudson_NNP and_CC Roberts_NNP [_NNP 1934_CD ]_NNP have_VBP shown_VBN that_IN pasteurellosis_NN could_MD be_VB experimentally_RB transmitted_VBN in_IN mice_NN and_CC rabbits_NNS ._.
So_RB far_RB ,_, the_DT experiments_NNS recorded_VBN here_RB corroborate_VB their_PRP$ find-_JJ ings_NNS ._.
Mehra_NNP [_NN 1943_CD ]_NN reports_VBZ a_DT heavy_JJ mortality_NN amongst_JJ rodents_NNS in_IN a_DT locality_NN where_WRB an_DT outbreak_NN of_IN haemorrhagic_JJ septicaemia_NN occurred_VBD and_CC also_RB the_DT presence_NN of_IN a_DT large_JJ number_NN of_IN fleas_NNS in_IN the_DT burrows_NNS of_IN rats_NNS ._.
He_PRP further_RB showed_VBD by_IN ex-_JJ perimental_JJ field_NN investigations_NNS that_IN the_DT fleas_JJ trans-_JJ mit_NN the_DT disease_NN through_IN their_PRP$ bites_NNS ,_, but_CC if_IN ,_, as_IN suggested_VBN above_IN ,_, the_DT inefficiency_NN of_IN C._NNP felis_NN as_IN a_DT vector_NN is_VBZ established_VBN ,_, there_EX remains_VBZ little_JJ or_CC no_DT doubt_NN that_IN the_DT flea_NN in_IN question_NN ,_, which_WDT in-_JJ cidentally_NN is_VBZ the_DT common_JJ flea_NN found_VBN on_IN cattle_NNS and_CC young_JJ buffaloes_NNS ,_, can_MD not_RB be_VB held_VBN responsible_JJ for_IN outbreaks_NNS of_IN haemorrhagic_JJ septicaemia_NN ._.
As_IN an_DT alternative_JJ vector_NN ,_, X._NNP cheopis_NN ,_, the_DT common_JJ rat_NN flea_NN ,_, which_WDT has_VBZ been_VBN proved_VBN to_TO be_VB efficient_JJ in_IN human_JJ plague_NN ,_, suggests_VBZ itself_PRP ._.
However_RB ,_, even_RB if_IN this_DT flea_NN is_VBZ proved_VBN to_TO be_VB equally_RB efficient_JJ in_IN the_DT case_NN of_IN haemorrhagic_NN septicaemia_NN ,_, it_PRP would_MD be_VB dif-_JJ ficult_NN to_TO incriminate_VB it_PRP ,_, since_IN this_DT species_NNS is_VBZ not_RB normally_RB found_VBN on_IN cattle_NNS ._.
And_CC assuming_VBG that_IN it_PRP may_MD occasionally_RB attack_VB cattle_NNS ,_, it_PRP would_MD then_RB have_VB to_TO be_VB ascertained_VBN whether_IN rodents_NNS carry_VBP the_DT organ-_JJ isms_NN in_IN question_NN ._.
It_PRP is_VBZ of_IN interest_NN in_IN this_DT connec-_JJ tion_NN to_TO note_VB that_IN Neumann_NNP [_NNP 1903_CD ]_NNP isolated_VBD a_DT supposed_JJ representative_NN of_IN the_DT Pasteurella_NNP group_NN from_IN a_DT wild_JJ rat_NN ._.
Smillie_NNP [_NN 1920_CD ]_NN also_RB encountered_VBD S._NNP GANAPATHY_NNP IYER_NNP AND_NNP Z_NNP ._.
A._NN HASHMI_NNP 155_CD pastcurella_NN organisms_NNS in_IN normal_JJ rats_NNS ,_, while_IN Meyer_NNP and_CC Batchelder_NNP [_NNP 1926_CD ]_NNP isolated_VBD 34_CD strains_NNS of_IN paste-_JJ urella_NN from_IN wild_JJ rats_NNS during_IN plague_JJ eradication_NN measures_NNS along_IN the_DT Pacific_NNP Coast_NNP ._.
In_IN India_NNP ,_, Raj-_NNP gopalan_NN and_CC Gopalkrishnan_NNP [_NNP 1939_CD ]_NNP recorded_VBD an_DT outbreak_NN of_IN pasteurellosis_NN in_IN white_JJ mice_NN ._.
There_EX is_VBZ ,_, however_RB ,_, no_DT proof_NN that_IN these_DT Pasteurella_NNP strains_NNS were_VBD pathogenic_JJ to_TO cattle_VB ._.
In_IN absence_NN of_IN any_DT direct_JJ evidence_NN of_IN this_DT type_NN ,_, X._NNP cheopis_NN could_MD not_RB be_VB accepted_VBN as_IN a_DT vector_NN in_IN haemorrhagic_JJ septicaemia_NN ._.
For_IN the_DT present_JJ ,_, therefore_RB ,_, it_PRP can_MD only_RB be_VB stated_VBN that_IN C._NNP felis_VBP appears_VBZ to_TO be_VB an_DT in-_JJ efficient_NN vector_NN and_CC is_VBZ normally_RB incapable_JJ of_IN trans-_JJ mitting_VBG haemarrhagic_JJ septicaemia_NN in_IN buffaloes_NNS ._.
SUMMARY_NNP Experiments_NNS on_IN transmission_NN of_IN P._NNP septica_NN from_IN rabbit_NN to_TO rabbit_VB and_CC from_IN rabbit_NN to_TO buffalo_VB were_VBD tried_VBN using_VBG C._NNP felis_NN ,_, the_DT common_JJ dog_NN flea_NN ._.
The_DT experiments_NNS in_IN rabbits_NNS were_VBD positive_JJ and_CC a_DT very_RB small_JJ number_NN of_IN fleas_NNS was_VBD effective_JJ ._.
On_IN the_DT other_JJ hand_NN ,_, in_IN 11_CD experiments_NNS with_IN buffalo-_JJ es_NN and_CC up_RB to_TO 3,000_CD fleas_NNS as_IN transmitting_VBG agents_NNS eight_CD failed_VBD completely_RB ,_, one_CD was_VBD positive_JJ and_CC two_CD were_VBD doubtful_JJ ._.
Since_IN most_JJS of_IN the_DT experiments_NNS with_IN buffaloes_NNS were_VBD negative_JJ in_IN spite_NN of_IN optimum_JJ conditions_NNS as_IN regards_NNS the_DT number_NN of_IN fleas_NNS and_CC high_JJ virulence_NN of_IN the_DT organism_NN ,_, it_PRP seems_VBZ unlikely_JJ that_IN in_IN practice_NN Pasteurella_NNP in_IN bovines_NNS is_VBZ trans-_JJ mitted_VBN by_IN the_DT class_NN of_IN insect_NN ._.
Pasteurella_NN was_VBD found_VBN in_IN the_DT faeces_NNS of_IN fleas_NNS fed_VBN on_IN infected_JJ rabbits_NNS and_CC then_RB fasted_VBD for_IN 48_CD hours_NNS ._.
The_DT orga-_JJ nism_NN was_VBD also_RB found_VBN in_IN the_DT bodies_NNS of_IN infected_JJ fleas_NNS which_WDT have_VBP been_VBN fasted_VBN for_IN at_IN least_JJS 72_CD hours_NNS ._.

Two_CD strains_NNS ,_, Lines_NNPS i_NN and_CC iii_NN showed_VBD no_DT evidence_NN of_IN attenuation_NN after_IN 69_CD and_CC 32_CD passages_NNS respectively_RB ,_, while_IN a_DT third_JJ ,_, Line_NNP ii_NN ,_, was_VBD attenuated_VBN after_IN 19_CD passages_NNS ._.
2_CD ._.
From_IN 19th_CD to_TO 28th_CD passages_NNS Line_NNP ii_NN virus_NN had_VBD no_DT apparent_JJ harmful_JJ effect_NN when_WRB injected_VBN into_IN fowls_NN and_CC rendered_VBD them_PRP immune_VB to_TO test_VB doses_NNS of_IN different_JJ strains_NNS of_IN virulent_NN Ranikhet_NNP disease_NN virus_NN ._.
3_CD ._.
From_IN the_DT 29th_CD passage_NN onward_NN ,_, the_DT atten-_JJ uated_JJ virus_NN gave_VBD irregular_JJ results_NNS ._.
Frequently_RB out_IN of_IN two_CD fowls_NNS receiving_VBG a_DT similar_JJ inoculum_NN one_CD died_VBD and_CC the_DT other_JJ survived_VBD ,_, suggesting_VBG resus-_JJ citation_NN of_IN latent_JJ conditions_NNS and_CC indicating_VBG the_DT necessity_NN of_IN further_JJ work_NN ._.
ACKNOWLEDGEMENT_IN The_DT authors_NNS wish_VBP to_TO express_VB their_PRP$ indebtedness_NN to_TO Messrs_NNP J._NNP R._NNP Haddow_NNP and_CC A._NNP J._NNP Macdonald_NNP for_IN help_NN and_CC criticism_NN in_IN this_DT study_NN ._.
REFERENCE_NNP Iyer_NNP ,_, S._NNP G._NNP and_CC Dobson_NNP ,_, N._NNP (_( 1940_CD )_) ._.
Vet_NNP ._.
Rec._NNP ,_, 52_CD ,_, 889_CD THE_NNP OCCURRENCE_NNP AND_NNP SPREAD_NNP OF_NNP FOWL_NNP CHOLERA_NNP IN_NNP INDIA_NNP By_IN S._NNP GANAPATHY_NNP IYER_NNP and_CC Z_NNP ._.
A._NN HASHMI_NNP ,_, Poultry_NNP Research_NNP Section_NNP ,_, Imperial_NNP Veterinary_NNP Research_NNP Institute_NNP ,_, Izatnagar_NNP (_( Received_VBN for_IN publication_NN on_IN 12_CD January_NNP 1945_CD )_) Early_JJ records_NNS of_IN poultry_NN mortality_NN in_IN India_NNP are_VBP the_DT Jessore_NNP and_CC Madras_NNP outbreaks_NNS (_( 1817_CD and_CC 1828_CD )_) mentioned_VBN by_IN Raymond_NNP [_NNP 1911_CD ]_NNP and_CC the_DT Calcutta_NNP outbreak_NN (_( fowl_JJ cholera_NN )_) reported_VBN by_IN the_DT Indian_JJ Cattle_NNP Plague_NNP 's_POS Commission_NNP [_FW 1871_CD ]_NN ._.
Until_IN the_DT outbreak_NN of_IN Ranikhet_NNP disease_NN in_IN 1927_CD [_NN Edwards_NNP ,_, 1928_CD ]_NN ,_, fowl_NN cholera_NN was_VBD being_VBG reported_VBN as_IN the_DT chief_NN cause_NN of_IN fowl_NN mortality_NN in_IN this_DT country_NN ,_, though_IN fowl_JJ spirochetosis_NN was_VBD also_RB well_RB known_VBN ._.
Since_IN the_DT diagnosis_NN of_IN Ranikhet_NNP disease_NN ,_, much_RB less_JJR prominence_NN has_VBZ been_VBN given_VBN to_TO outbreaks_NNS of_IN fowl_NN cholera_NN ._.
In_IN the_DT course_NN of_IN a_DT three-year_JJ 's_POS disease_NN survey_NN of_IN the_DT greater_JJR part_NN of_IN this_DT country_NN ,_, it_PRP was_VBD not_RB possible_JJ to_TO find_VB fowl_JJ cholera_NN infection_NN even_RB in_IN a_DT single_JJ widespread_JJ epizootic_JJ among_IN fowls_JJ ._.
Further_RB ,_, all_PDT the_DT materials_NNS suspected_VBD for_IN fowl_NN cholera_NN when_WRB tested_VBN in_IN this_DT section_NN have_VBP proved_VBN negative_JJ ._.
However_RB ,_, in_IN two_CD localities_NNS ,_, relatively_RB near_IN the_DT laboratory_NN ,_, limited_JJ enzootics_NNS of_IN fowl_NN cholera_NN ,_, causing_VBG insignificant_JJ mortality_NN ,_, were_VBD observed_VBN ,_, and_CC authentic_JJ strains_NNS of_IN Past_NNP aviseptica_NN recovered_VBD ._.
From_IN this_DT survey_NN two_CD significant_JJ conclusions_NNS emerge_NN :_: (_( i_NN )_) that_WDT contrary_JJ to_TO common_JJ belief_NN ,_, fowl_NN cholera_NN occurs_VBZ infrequently_RB ;_: and_CC (_( ii_NN )_) that_IN ,_, in_IN this_DT country_NN ,_, widespread_JJ epizootics_NNS are_VBP not_RB a_DT feature_NN of_IN fowl_NN cholera_NN ._.
The_DT fact_NN ,_, that_IN Past_NNP aviseptica_NN could_MD be_VB isolated_VBN in_IN outbreaks_NNS from_IN two_CD nearby_JJ localities_NNS ,_, led_VBD us_PRP to_TO scrutinize_VB the_DT present_JJ methods_NNS employed_VBN by_IN field_NN workers_NNS for_IN diagnosing_VBG the_DT disease_NN and_CC to_TO investigate_VB the_DT various_JJ factors_NNS affecting_VBG the_DT viability_NN of_IN the_DT organism_NN in_IN the_DT suspected_JJ material_NN during_IN transit_NN ._.
The_DT results_NNS of_IN our_PRP$ investigations_NNS suggest_VBP a_DT pos-_JJ sibility_NN that_IN the_DT disease_NN ,_, in_IN its_PRP$ enzootic_JJ form_NN may_MD be_VB somewhat_RB more_RBR prevalent_JJ than_IN has_VBZ been_VBN indicated_VBN by_IN our_PRP$ survey_NN ._.
EPIZOOTIOLOGY_NNP Little_NNP attention_NN has_VBZ been_VBN paid_VBN in_IN this_DT country_NN to_TO the_DT epizootiology_NN of_IN this_DT disease_NN ._.
Sporadic_JJ outbreaks_NNS have_VBP occasionally_RB been_VBN recorded_VBN ,_, many_JJ of_IN which_WDT were_VBD probably_RB wrongly_RB diagnosed_VBN on_IN the_DT strength_NN of_IN naked-eye_JJ and_CC microscopical_JJ examination_NN of_IN autopsied_JJ birds_NNS ._.
Information_NN regarding_VBG sources_NNS of_IN infection_NN and_CC methods_NNS of_IN spread_NN of_IN fowl_NN cholera_NN is_VBZ scanty_RB ,_, although_IN these_DT constitute_JJ pre-requisites_NNS for_IN eradication_NN or_CC control_NN of_IN the_DT disease_NN ._.
Past_NNP aviseptica_NN possesses_NNS low_JJ powers_NNS of_IN resis-_JJ tance_NN to_TO inimical_JJ agencies158_NN Occurrence_NNP and_CC Spread_NNP of_IN Fowl_NNP Cholera_NNP in_IN India_NNP organisms_NN ,_, both_DT virulent_NN and_CC avirulent_NN ,_, from_IN the_DT mucous_JJ membranes_NNS of_IN apparently_RB healthy_JJ animals_NNS ._.
Hughes_NNP and_CC Pritchett_NNP [_NNP 1930_CD ]_NNP could_MD not_RB produce_VB the_DT disease_NN by_IN the_DT oral_JJ administration_NN of_IN virulent_JJ Past_NNP ._.
aviseptica_NN in_IN capsules_NNS and_CC found_VBD that_IN the_DT usual_JJ channel_NN of_IN infection_NN was_VBD through_IN the_DT upper_JJ respiratory_NN tract_NN ._.
Webster_NNP [_NN 1924_CD ,_, 1_CD and_CC 2_CD ]_NN ,_, working_VBG with_IN rabbit_NN pasteurellosis_NN ,_, found_VBD that_IN preceding_VBG an_DT outbreak_NN ,_, there_EX was_VBD a_DT fall_NN in_IN resis-_JJ tance_NN due_JJ to_TO adverse_VB environment_NN ,_, and_CC a_DT cor-_JJ responding_NN rise_NN in_IN the_DT number_NN of_IN the_DT organism_NN which_WDT ultimately_RB led_VBD to_TO an_DT outbreak_NN of_IN the_DT disease_NN ._.
It_PRP would_MD appear_VB from_IN the_DT existing_VBG work_NN that_IN the_DT more_RBR resistant_JJ are_VBP not_RB affected_VBN ,_, those_DT less_RBR resistant_JJ become_NN carriers_NNS ,_, while_IN hypersusceptible_JJ birds_NNS die_NN of_IN infection_NN ._.
EXPERIMENTAL_NNP An_DT outbreak_NN of_IN fowl_NN cholera_NN provided_VBD the_DT opportunity_NN to_TO study_VB certain_JJ epizootiological_JJ aspects_NNS of_IN the_DT disease_NN ._.
This_DT occurred_VBD in_IN the_DT Institute_NNP farm_NN which_WDT is_VBZ self-contained_JJ as_IN no_DT eggs_NNS ,_, chicks_NNS or_CC fowls_NNS are_VBP brought_VBN from_IN outside_NN ,_, and_CC every_DT possible_JJ precaution_NN is_VBZ taken_VBN to_TO prevent_VB the_DT introduction_NN of_IN diseases_NNS ._.
The_DT disease_NN broke_VBD out_RP in_IN 1940_CD in_IN a_DT group_NN of_IN 40_CD cockerels_NNS causing_VBG the_DT death_NN of_IN six_CD only_RB ._.
The_DT source_NN of_IN infection_NN was_VBD undetermined_VBN ._.
A_DT further_JJ outbreak_NN occurred_VBD in_IN two_CD adjoining_VBG pens_NNS in_IN mid-summer_NN ,_, 1941_CD ,_, with_IN sporadic_JJ cases_NNS over_IN a_DT period_NN of_IN a_DT month_NN ._.
Out_IN of_IN a_DT flock_NN of_IN 2,000_CD birds_NNS ,_, only_RB 11_CD died_VBD ._.
The_DT organisms_NNS recovered_VBN were_VBD of_IN the_DT 'blue_NNP colony_NN '_'' type_JJ [_NN Hughes_NNP ,_, 1930_CD ]_NN associated_VBN with_IN enzootic_JJ fowl_NN cholera_NN ._.
The_DT recurrence_NN of_IN the_DT disease_NN on_IN the_DT farm_NN ,_, the_DT type_NN of_IN organisms_JJ re-_NN covered_VBD ,_, the_DT insignificant_JJ morbidity_NN and_CC mortality_NN and_CC the_DT course_NN of_IN the_DT outbreak_NN led_VBD us_PRP to_TO suspect_VB the_DT existence_NN of_IN carrier_NN fowls_NN in_IN the_DT flock_NN ,_, such_PDT a_DT possibility_NN being_VBG in_IN accord_NN with_IN the_DT findings_NNS of_IN Manninger_NNP [_NNP 1921_CD ]_NNP ,_, Van_NNP Es_NNP [_NNP 1937_CD ]_NNP and_CC Shook_NNP and_CC Bunyea_NNP [_NNP 1939_CD ]_NNP ._.
Therefore_RB ,_, soon_RB after_IN the_DT second_JJ outbreak_NN ,_, it_PRP was_VBD decided_VBN to_TO examine_VB the_DT flock_NN for_IN the_DT presence_NN of_IN carriers_NNS ._.
METHODS_NNP (_( 1_CD )_) Agglutination_NNP test_NN ._.
The_DT rapid_JJ whole-blood_NN ,_, stained-antigen_JJ method_NN ,_, employed_VBN by_IN Shook_NNP and_CC Bunyea_NNP [_NNP 1939_CD ]_NNP ,_, was_VBD tested_VBN using_VBG serum_NN from_IN fowls_NN and_CC rabbits_VBZ previously_RB immunized_VBN with_IN Past_NNP ._.
aviseptica_NN ._.
The_DT serum_NN had_VBD a_DT titre_NN of_IN 1/320_CD ._.
Crystal_JJ violet-stained_JJ antigens_NNS of_IN homologous_JJ and_CC heterologous_JJ strains_NNS were_VBD used_VBN ._.
The_DT re-_JJ action_NN was_VBD unsatisfactory_JJ and_CC the_DT results_NNS were_VBD not_RB clear-cut_JJ ._.
However_RB ,_, the_DT strains_NNS of_IN fowls_NN cholera_NN used_VBN by_IN us_PRP were_VBD perhaps_RB not_RB quite_RB suit-_JJ able_JJ for_IN the_DT test_NN ._.
(_( 2_CD )_) Bacteriological_NNP ._.
Webster_NNP [_NN 1924_CD ,_, 1_CD ]_NN working_VBG with_IN rabbit_NN pasteurellosis_NN ,_, and_CC Pritchett_NNP et_VBP al_NN [_NN 1930_CD ]_NN working_VBG with_IN fowl_JJ pasteurellosis_NN ,_, recovered_VBD the_DT organisms_NNS from_IN carriers_NNS by_IN culturing_VBG the_DT upper_JJ respiratory_NN tracts_NNS ._.
Preliminary_JJ tests_NNS were_VBD conducted_VBN to_TO standardize_VB the_DT technique_NN ._.
The_DT following_JJ methods_NNS for_IN obtain-_JJ ing_VBG material_NN from_IN nasal_JJ passages_NNS of_IN fowls_NN were_VBD compared_VBN :_: (_( a_DT )_) nasal_NN washings_NNS obtained_VBN by_IN syring_VBG ing_VBG the_DT nose_NN with_IN saline_NN or_CC broth_NN ;_: (_( b_NN )_) swabbing_VBG the_DT nasal_JJ cavity_NN with_IN dry_JJ cotton_NN swabs_NNS ;_: and_CC (_( c_NN )_) swabbing_VBG the_DT cavity_NN with_IN a_DT wet_JJ cotton_NN wool_NN swab_NN ._.
Nasal_NNP washings_VBZ invariably_RB gave_VBD a_DT profuse_NN growth_NN of_IN contaminating_VBG bacteria_NNS ._.
Swabs_NNP and_CC especially_RB wet_JJ swabs_NNS gave_VBD better_JJR results_NNS and_CC isolated_JJ colonies_NNS of_IN Pasteurella_NNP could_MD easily_RB be_VB obtained_VBN ._.
With_IN regard_NN to_TO culture_NN media_NNS ,_, Webster_NNP and_CC Baudisch_NNP [_NNP 1925_CD ]_NN showed_VBD that_IN the_DT growth_NN of_IN Pasteurella_NNP was_VBD more_RBR profuse_JJ under_IN a_DT reduced_JJ oxygen_NN pressure_NN and_CC on_IN media_NNS with_IN a_DT trace_NN of_IN rabbit_NN blood_NN or_CC an_DT iron_NN compound_NN with_IN strongly_RB catalytic_JJ properties_NNS ._.
Schütze_NNP and_CC Hassanein_NNP [_NNP 1929_CD ]_NNP also_RB got_VBD better_JJR results_NNS by_IN adding_VBG small_JJ amounts_NNS of_IN blood_NN or_CC sodium_NN sulphite_NN ._.
A_DT test_NN was_VBD therefore_RB run_VBN to_TO compare_VB routine_JJ laboratory_NN media_NNS and_CC certain_JJ other_JJ enriched_JJ media_NNS ._.
The_DT following_NN were_VBD used_VBN :_: (_( a_DT )_) nutrient_NN agar_NN ,_, (_( b_NN )_) plain_NN broth_NN ,_, (_( c_NN )_) agar_NN with_IN 5.0_CD per_IN cent_NN ox_NN blood_NN ,_, (_( d_NN )_) agar_NN with_IN 1.0_CD per_IN cent_NN ox_NN blood_NN (_( e_NN )_) agar_NN with_IN 0.5_CD per_IN cent_NN sodium_NN sulphite_NN ,_, (_( f_NN )_) agar_NN with_IN haemo_NN lyzed_VBN rabbit_NN blood_NN ,_, (_( g_NN )_) Fielde_NNP 's_POS medium_NN ,_, and_CC (_( h_NN )_) peptone_NN broth_NN with_IN 10.0_CD per_IN cent_NN inactivate_NN ox_NN serum_NN ._.
Serum_NNP broth_CC gave_VBD thicker_NN growth_NN than_IN plain_VB broth_DT ._.
The_DT counts_NNS on_IN nutrient_JJ agar_NN were_VBD signi-_JJ ficantly_RB lower_JJR ._.
All_PDT the_DT other_JJ enriched_JJ media_NNS gave_VBD uniformly_RB good_JJ results_NNS ,_, with_IN little_JJ difference_NN in_IN counts_NNS ._.
As_IN to_TO the_DT relative_JJ value_NN of_IN liquid_NN and_CC solid_JJ media_NNS ,_, swabs_NN from_IN the_DT nasal_JJ cavity_NN were_VBD sown_VBN as_IN follows_VBZ :_: (_( a_DT )_) into_IN a_DT tube_NN of_IN broth_NN which_WDT was_VBD incubated_VBN for_IN 24_CD hours_NNS at_IN 37ºC_CD ._.
and_CC then_RB plated_VBN ,_, (_( b_NN )_) into_IN a_DT tube_NN of_IN broth_NN ,_, which_WDT was_VBD incubated_VBN for_IN one_CD hour_NN and_CC then_RB plated_VBD ,_, and_CC (_( c_NN )_) on_IN to_TO a_DT blood-agar_JJ plate_NN ._.
Initial_JJ incubation_NN in_IN the_DT liquid_JJ medium_NN invariably_RB led_VBD to_TO an_DT over_IN growth_NN of_IN contaminants_NNS ._.
Direct_JJ sowing_VBG on_IN blood_NN agar_NN gave_VBD discrete_JJ colonies_NNS from_IN which_WDT Pasteurella_NNP colonies_NNS could_MD be_VB easily_RB picked_VBN ._.
S._NNP GANAPATHY_NNP IYER_NNP AND_NNP Z_NNP ._.
A._NN HASHMI_NNP 159_CD SURVEY_NNP OF_NNP FLOCK_NNP FOR_NNP CARRIERS_NNP The_DT first_JJ test_NN for_IN carriers_NNS was_VBD conducted_VBN soon_RB after_IN the_DT second_JJ outbreak_NN ,_, which_WDT lasted_VBD from_IN May_NNP 18_CD to_TO June_NNP 13_CD ,_, 1941_CD ._.
Between_NNP August_NNP and_CC December_NNP ,_, cultures_NNS were_VBD made_VBN from_IN the_DT nasal_JJ passages_NNS of_IN all_DT fowls_NN in_IN the_DT affected_JJ pens_NNS as_RB well_RB as_IN the_DT two_CD adjoining_NN pens_NNS ._.
In_IN all_DT ,_, 273_CD fowls_NN were_VBD examined_VBN ,_, 11_CD of_IN which_WDT (_( 4.06_CD per_IN cent_NN )_) yielded_VBD Past_NNP ._.
aviseptica_NN on_IN culture_NN ._.
The_DT organisms_NNS were_VBD typed_VBN and_CC studied_VBN in_IN detail_NN ._.
Morphology_NNP ,_, etc_NN ._.
In_IN morphology_NN ,_, staining_VBG ,_, colony_NN form_NN ,_, etc_FW ._.
the_DT organisms_NN conformed_VBD to_TO the_DT genus_NN Pasteurella_NNP trevisan_NN ._.
The_DT 11_CD strains_NNS were_VBD identical_JJ in_IN cultural_JJ and_CC biochemical_JJ charac-_NN ters_NNS ._.
All_DT were_VBD of_IN the_DT 'blue-colony_JJ '_POS type_NN [_NN Hughes_NNP ,_, 1930_CD ]_NN ,_, produced_VBN turbidity_NN and_CC a_DT heavy_JJ viscid_NN sediment_NN in_IN broth_NN ,_, thin_JJ glistening_VBG white_JJ growth_NN on_IN plain_NN agar_NN ,_, viscid_JJ varnish_JJ drop-like_JJ growth_NN on_IN blood-agar_NN and_CC no_DT growth_NN on_IN MacConkey_NNP 's_POS medium_NN ._.
Gelatin_NNP was_VBD not_RB liquified_VBN ,_, methyl-red_JJ and_CC Voges-Proskauer_JJ reactions_NNS were_VBD negative_JJ ,_, and_CC no_DT change_NN was_VBD produced_VBN in_IN litmus_JJ milk_NN ._.
Ammonia_NNP ,_, indol_NN and_CC catalase_NN were_VBD formed_VBN and_CC nitrates_NNS were_VBD reduced_VBN ._.
Acid_NNP was_VBD produced_VBN in_IN dextrose_NN ,_, sucrose_RB ,_, laevulose_JJ and_CC mannitol_NN ._.
Lactose_NNP ,_, glycerol_NN and_CC rhamnose_VB were_VBD not_RB fermented_VBN ._.
Serological_NNP ._.
Tables_NNS I_PRP and_CC II_NNP show_VBP the_DT results_NNS of_IN agglutination_NN reactions_NNS ._.
More_JJR than_IN two_CD serologi-_JJ cal_JJ groups_NNS are_VBP suggested_VBN ._.

574_CD )_) could_MD not_RB be_VB classified_VBN as_IN it_PRP failed_VBD to_TO produce_VB agglutinins_NNS on_IN repeated_JJ inoculations_NNS ._.

The_DT virulence_NN of_IN freshly-isolated_JJ carrier_NN strains_NNS for_IN fowls_NN and_CC rabbits_NNS is_VBZ shown_VBN in_IN Table_NNP III_NNP ._.
The_DT organisms_NNS were_VBD grown_VBN on_IN blood-_JJ agar_NN for_IN 24_CD hours_NNS ,_, and_CC washed_VBD off_RP with_IN serum-_JJ saline_NN ._.

of_IN this_DT bacterial_JJ suspension_NN standardized_VBD to_TO contain_VB about_IN 200_CD million_CD bacteria_NNS per_IN c.c_NN ._.
was_VBD inoculated_VBN subcutaneously_RB ._.
The_DT period_NN of_IN observation_NN extended_VBN over_IN seven_CD days_NNS ._.
Table_JJ III_NNP shows_VBZ that_IN the_DT strains_NNS varied_VBD consider-_NN ably_RB in_IN their_PRP$ virulence_NN ._.

S_NNP Do_NNP NOTES.ANIMAL_NNP NUTRITION_NNP PROBLEM_NNP IN_NNP BENGAL_NNP By_IN INDUBHUSAN_NNP CHATTERJEE_NNP ,_, M.Sc._NNP ,_, (_( AGR_NNP )_) ._. ,_, L._NNP AG_NNP ._.
Late_RB Physiological_JJ Chemist_NNP ,_, Bengal_NNP (_( Received_VBN for_IN publication_NN on_IN 29_CD December_NNP 1944_CD )_) IN_NNP order_NN that_IN the_DT position_NN of_IN animal_JJ nutrition_NN in_IN Bengal_NNP may_MD be_VB properly_RB judged_VBN ,_, it_PRP is_VBZ necessary_JJ to_TO realize_VB the_DT limitations_NNS forming_VBG the_DT special_JJ feature_NN of_IN this_DT province_NN ._.
Bengal_NNP presents_VBZ a_DT melancholy_JJ spectacle_NN in_IN that_DT its_PRP$ food_NN output_NN whether_IN for_IN man_NN or_CC beast_NN is_VBZ as_RB much_JJ deficient_NN in_IN quality_NN as_IN in_IN quantity_NN ._.
Of_IN the_DT total_NN cropped_VBD area_NN of_IN nearly_RB 30_CD million_CD acres_NNS (_( net_JJ cropped_VBN area_NN 23_CD million_CD acres_NNS )_) ,_, only_RB about_IN 0.1_CD million_CD acres_NNS are_VBP under_IN fodder_NN crops_NNS ._.
Even_RB of_IN this_DT nearly_RB half_NN is_VBZ in_IN one_CD single_JJ district_NN ,_, viz_NN ._.
Mymen-_JJ singh_NN ._.
In_IN other_JJ words_NNS the_DT area_NN in_IN the_DT remai-_JJ ning_NN 26_CD districts_NNS is_VBZ so_RB small_JJ that_IN its_PRP$ effective_JJ value_NN is_VBZ negligible_JJ ._.
Of_IN other_JJ Indian_JJ provinces_NNS ,_, we_PRP find_VBP that_IN the_DT Punjab_NNP has_VBZ five_CD million_CD acres_NNS for_IN 15.8_CD million_CD cattle_NNS ,_, Bombay_NNP 2.5_CD million_CD acres_NNS for_IN 9.96_CD million_CD cattle_NNS and_CC U.P_NNP ._.
1.48_CD million_CD acres_NNS for_IN 32_CD million_CD cattle_NNS ._.
In_IN contrast_NN with_IN these_DT ,_, the_DT only_JJ practical_JJ expression_NN Bengal_NNP has_VBZ given_VBN as_IN a_DT mark_NN of_IN her_PRP$ cattle_JJ conscience_NN or_CC reverence_NN for_IN the_DT cow_NN is_VBZ the_DT meagre_JJ allotment_NN of_IN a_DT nominal_JJ acreage_NN of_IN fodder_NN (_( as_IN stated_VBN above_IN )_) and_CC of_IN the_DT residues_NNS (_( straw_NN )_) left_VBD over_RP after_IN the_DT harvest_NN of_IN rice_NN crop_NN from_IN 22_CD to_TO 23_CD million_CD acres_NNS ,_, giving_VBG an_DT estimated_JJ yield_NN of_IN 400_CD to_TO 500_CD million_CD maunds_NNS of_IN straw_NN ._.
Even_RB if_IN the_DT whole_NN of_IN it_PRP is_VBZ available_JJ (_( it_PRP is_VBZ well_RB known_VBN it_PRP is_VBZ not_RB ,_, as_IN a_DT part_NN of_IN it_PRP is_VBZ used_VBN as_IN matting_NN ,_, a_DT part_NN as_IN thatching_NN ,_, etc_FW ._.

In_IN the_DT case_NN of_IN concentrates_NNS the_DT position_NN is_VBZ not_RB better_RBR ._.
The_DT area_NN under_IN rape_NN and_CC mustard_NN is_VBZ 0.76_CD million_CD acres_NNS ,_, til_NN (_( sesame_NN )_) 0.18_CD million_CD acres_NNS ,_, linseed_VBD 0.19_CD million_CD acres_NNS ._.
The_DT area_NN under_IN rape_NN and_CC mustard_NN has_VBZ gone_VBN down_RB considerably_RB ,_, as_IN in_IN 1911-12_JJ it_PRP was_VBD 1.32_CD million_CD acres_NNS ,_, There_EX was_VBD a_DT slow_JJ decrease_NN up_RB to_TO 1920-21_NNS after_IN which_WDT there_EX was_VBD an_DT abrupt_JJ shrinkage_NN ._.
The_DT present_JJ area_NN (_( 764,000_CD acres_NNS )_) is_VBZ about_IN three-fifths_NNS of_IN the_DT area_NN 30_CD years_NNS ago_RB ._.
The_DT by-products_NNS available_JJ from_IN these_DT and_CC from_IN wheat_NN (_( 0.17_CD million_CD acres_NNS )_) ,_, barley_NN (_( 0.12_CD million_CD acres_NNS )_) ,_, maize_FW (_( 0.10_CD million_CD acres_NNS )_) ,_, gram_NN (_( 0.41_CD million_CD acres_NNS )_) ,_, and_CC a_DT sprinkling_NN of_IN jowar_NN and_CC bajra_VB all_DT taken_VBN together_RB do_VBP not_RB provide_VB more_JJR than_IN a_DT chatak_NN per_IN head_NN per_IN day_NN ._.

To_TO these_DT may_MD be_VB added_VBN the_DT variable_JJ by-products_NNS of_IN rice_NN manufacturers_NNS and_CC a_DT small_JJ supply_NN of_IN imported_VBN cakes_NNS as_RB well_RB as_IN by-products_NNS from_IN imported_VBN oil-_JJ seeds_NNS and_CC pulses_NNS ._.
It_PRP is_VBZ difficult_JJ to_TO ascertain_VB from_IN the_DT crop_NN reports_VBZ the_DT amount_NN available_JJ after_IN meeting_VBG exports_NNS and_CC imports_NNS ._.
It_PRP appears_VBZ from_IN earlier_JJR reports_NNS that_IN about_RB 3_CD to_TO 4_CD million_CD maunds_NNS of_IN linseed_NN were_VBD imported_VBN and_CC about_IN the_DT same_JJ amount_NN exported_VBD from_IN Calcutta_NNP ._.
Regarding_VBG wheat_NN ,_, rape_NN ,_, mustard_NN and_CC pulses_NNS ,_, there_EX is_VBZ apparently_RB a_DT surplus_NN of_IN im-_JJ ports_NNS ._.
