5,055,661_CD It_PRP will_MD thus_RB be_VB seen_VBN that_IN our_PRP$ problem_NN is_VBZ not_RB merely_RB 161_CD 162_CD Animal_NNP Nutrition_NNP Problem_NNP in_IN Bengal_NNP a_DT case_NN of_IN deficient_JJ supply_NN but_CC of_IN the_DT barest_JJS need_NN of_IN subsistence_NN ._.
The_DT matter_NN is_VBZ further_RB complicated_VBN on_IN account_NN of_IN the_DT fact_NN that_IN the_DT feeding_NN of_IN rice_NN straw_NN is_VBZ followed_VBN by_IN certain_JJ complexities_NNS in_IN which_WDT almost_RB all_PDT the_DT essential_JJ nutrients_NNS suffer_VBP from_IN faulty_JJ assimilation_NN ._.
THE_DT GENERAL_NNP FEEDING_NNP VALUE_NNP OF_NNP RICE_NNP STRAW_NNP A_NNP short-term_JJ feeding_NN trial_NN conducted_VBN at_IN Karnal_NNP (_( Punjab_NNP )_) suggested_VBD that_IN rice_NN straw_NN when_WRB fed_NN with_IN concentrate_NN was_VBD superior_JJ to_TO wheat_VB straw_JJ and_CC was_VBD as_RB good_JJ as_IN jowar_NN (_( sorghum_NN )_) ._.
Later_RB on_IN when_WRB work_NN on_IN a_DT more_RBR comprehensive_JJ scale_NN was_VBD undertaken_VBN in_IN Bengal_NNP ,_, it_PRP was_VBD revealed_VBN that_IN under_IN rice_NN straw_NN feeding_VBG not_RB only_RB the_DT assimilation_NN of_IN more_RBR essential_JJ nutrients_NNS like_IN protein_NN ,_, lime_NN ,_, phosphorus_NN and_CC potash_NN was_VBD generally_RB interfered_VBN with_IN ,_, but_CC in_IN some_DT regions_NNS ,_, specially_RB in_IN saline_JJ tracts_NNS ,_, even_RB other_JJ minerals_NNS suffered_VBD from_IN disturbed_JJ equilibrium_NN ._.
The_DT Animal_NNP Nutrition_NNP Section_NNP ,_, Bengal_NNP ,_, started_VBD under_IN the_DT grant_NN of_IN the_DT Imperial_NNP Council_NNP of_IN Agricultural_NNP Research_NNP ,_, carried_VBD out_IN these_DT ex-_JJ periments_NNS when_WRB the_DT present_JJ author_NN was_VBD in_IN charge_NN of_IN it_PRP ._.
The_DT work_NN was_VBD directed_VBN towards_IN the_DT examina-_JJ tion_NN of_IN the_DT existing_VBG food_NN sources_NNS in_IN order_NN that_IN an_DT economic_JJ formula_NN of_IN rationing_VBG might_MD be_VB devised_VBN in_IN due_JJ regard_NN to_TO quality_NN and_CC quantity_NN of_IN feed_NN ._.
The_DT first_JJ step_NN towards_NNS it_PRP was_VBD to_TO study_VB how_WRB these_DT foodstuffs_NNS behaved_VBD within_IN the_DT animal_NN system_NN and_CC what_WDT were_VBD their_PRP$ specific_JJ characters_NNS for_IN or_CC against_IN proper_JJ nutrition_NN ._.
The_DT work_NN followed_VBD broadly_RB on_IN two_CD specific_JJ lines_NNS ,_, one_CD in_IN reference_NN to_TO the_DT direct_JJ practical_JJ problems_NNS and_CC the_DT other_JJ of_IN more_RBR technical_JJ nature_NN mainly_RB arising_VBG as_IN a_DT corollary_JJ towards_IN the_DT solution_NN of_IN many_JJ such_JJ problems_NNS ._.
This_DT note_NN deals_VBZ with_IN the_DT former_JJ aspect_NN ._.
Protein_NNP ._.
It_PRP was_VBD found_VBN that_IN when_WRB the_DT straw_NN was_VBD fed_VBN alone_RB ,_, there_EX was_VBD an_DT uneconomic_JJ wastage_NN of_IN protein_NN fraction_NN which_WDT was_VBD least_RBS digested_JJ (_( re-_JJ maining_NN largely_RB on_IN the_DT negative_JJ side_NN )_) ,_, but_CC when_WRB supplemented_VBN with_IN cake_NN or_CC concerntrates_NNS ._.
the_DT digestibility_NN and_CC assimilation_NN of_IN protein_NN were_VBD remarkably_RB increased_VBN ._.
This_DT was_VBD also_RB the_DT case_NN with_IN the_DT bulk_NN of_IN organic_JJ nutrients_NNS ._.
Phosphorus_NNP ._.
In_IN the_DT case_NN of_IN phosphorus_NN the_DT actual_JJ content_NN is_VBZ initially_RB low_JJ and_CC even_RB this_DT is_VBZ of_IN doubtful_JJ availability_NN ._.
Lime_NNP ._.
In_IN the_DT case_NN of_IN lime_NN ,_, although_IN the_DT amount_NN ordinarily_RB present_JJ is_VBZ apparently_RB more_JJR than_IN adequate_NN from_IN maintenance_NN standpoint_NN ,_, the_DT level_NN necessary_JJ for_IN ensuring_VBG a_DT favourable_JJ or_CC positive_JJ equilibrium_NN is_VBZ much_RB higher_JJR than_IN in_IN many_JJ other_JJ straws_NNS and_CC green_JJ fodders_NNS ._.
There_EX appear_VB to_TO be_VB four_CD factors_NNS responsible_JJ for_IN this_DT complication_NN ,_, viz_NN ._.
(_( 1_CD )_) presence_NN of_IN oxalic_JJ acid_NN and_CC possibly_RB other_JJ allied_VBD substances_NNS which_WDT prevent_VBP the_DT solubility_NN of_IN lime_NN ,_, without_IN which_WDT assimilation_NN can_MD not_RB proceed_VB ,_, (_( 2_CD )_) high_JJ fibre_NN content_NN ,_, (_( 3_CD )_) high_JJ potash_NN content_NN and_CC (_( 4_CD )_) complete_JJ absence_NN of_IN vitamin_NN ._.
Potash_NNP ._.
As_IN straw_JJ contains_VBZ a_DT very_RB large_JJ per-_JJ centage_NN of_IN potash_NN ,_, a_DT very_RB large_JJ potash_NN ingestion_NN (_( far_RB more_JJR than_IN is_VBZ necessary_JJ )_) is_VBZ an_DT inevitable_JJ accompaniment_NN of_IN rice_NN straw_JJ feeding_NN ;_: but_CC the_DT puzzling_JJ factor_NN is_VBZ that_IN ,_, in_IN spite_NN of_IN such_JJ heavy_JJ ingestion_NN ,_, more_JJR potash_NN is_VBZ excreted_VBN through_IN faeces_NNS and_CC urine_NN than_IN is_VBZ supplied_VBN in_IN the_DT feed_NN ._.
The_DT result_NN is_VBZ that_IN when_WRB the_DT data_NNS are_VBP measured_VBN on_IN a_DT balance_NN sheet_NN ,_, a_DT negative_JJ balance_NN for_IN potash_NN is_VBZ recorded_VBN ._.
In_IN actual_JJ fact_NN the_DT excess_JJ potash_NN is_VBZ drained_VBN out_RP from_IN body_NN resources_NNS ._.
There_EX are_VBP indications_NNS that_IN in_IN this_DT phenomenon_NN the_DT nature_NN and_CC quality_NN of_IN cake_NN and_CC possibly_RB other_JJ concentrates_NNS play_VBP a_DT significant_JJ role_NN ._.
Thus_RB when_WRB the_DT straw_NN was_VBD fed_VBN with_IN linseed_JJ cake_NN ,_, the_DT attain-_JJ ment_NN of_IN a_DT positive_JJ balance_NN between_IN intake_NN and_CC outgo_NN was_VBD a_DT usual_JJ feature_NN ,_, but_CC when_WRB mustard_JJ cake_NN (_( which_WDT is_VBZ the_DT main_JJ concentrate_NN in_IN these_DT parts_NNS )_) was_VBD fed_VBN ,_, there_EX was_VBD a_DT general_JJ tendency_NN to_TO a_DT negative_JJ balance_NN in_IN spite_NN of_IN the_DT fact_NN that_IN the_DT potash_NN ingestion_NN was_VBD distinctly_RB higher_JJR (_( in_IN some_DT cases_NNS 60_CD per_IN cent_NN over_IN the_DT other_JJ )_) ._.
In_IN a_DT recent_JJ trial_NN the_DT combination_NN of_IN til_NN or_CC sesame_NN cake_NN has_VBZ also_RB exhibited_VBN a_DT similar_JJ feature_NN ._.
Soda_NNP ,_, chlorine_NN and_CC magnesia_NN ._.
So_RB far_RB reference_NN has_VBZ been_VBN made_VBN to_TO the_DT more_RBR essential_JJ nutrients_NNS such_JJ as_IN lime_NN ,_, phosphorus_NN and_CC potash_NN which_WDT have_VBP recorded_VBN disturbed_JJ equilibrium_NN under_IN rice-straw_JJ feeding_NN ._.
It_PRP has_VBZ since_IN been_VBN found_VBN from_IN more_RBR recent_JJ work_NN that_IN the_DT straws_NNS specially_RB from_IN saline_NN belts_NNS (_( and_CC in_IN some_DT cases_NNS from_IN non-saline_JJ areas_NNS also_RB )_) have_VBP in_IN addition_NN new_JJ complexities_NNS ._.
Thus_RB ,_, with_IN Barisal_NNP straw_FW (_( from_IN saline_NN tract_NN )_) chlorine_NN recorded_VBN negative_JJ balance_NN in_IN spite_NN of_IN feeding_VBG common_JJ salt_NN ,_, while_IN in_IN the_DT case_NN of_IN another_DT saline_JJ tract_NN of_IN Diamond_NNP Harbour_NNP (_( District_NNP 24_CD Parganas_NNP )_) ,_, magnesia_NN ,_, soda_NN and_CC chlorine_VB all_DT exhibited_JJ adverse_JJ equilibrium_NN in_IN spite_NN of_IN the_DT fact_NN that_IN all_PDT these_DT components_NNS were_VBD more_JJR than_IN adequately_RB provided_VBN ._.
It_PRP is_VBZ just_RB possible_JJ that_IN some_DT of_IN these_DT features_NNS are_VBP endemic_JJ in_IN respect_NN to_TO certain_JJ regions_NNS ._.
Proper_NNP utilization_NN of_IN straw_NN ._.
The_DT straw_NN while_IN serving_VBG as_IN a_DT roughage_NN ,_, its_PRP$ main_JJ function_NN is_VBZ to_TO supply_VB energy_NN ._.
Here_RB also_RB the_DT most_RBS efficient_JJ utilization_NN occurs_VBZ when_WRB it_PRP is_VBZ supplemented_VBN with_IN cake_NN ._.
It_PRP is_VBZ a_DT fact_NN that_IN an_DT unbalanced_JJ food_NN is_VBZ INDUBHUSAN_NNP CHATTERJEE_NNP 163_CD not_RB properly_RB utilized_VBN ,_, and_CC since_IN the_DT straw_NN is_VBZ highly_RB unbalanced_JJ ,_, it_PRP also_RB behaves_VBZ similarly_RB unless_IN it_PRP is_VBZ fed_VBN with_IN more_RBR nutritious_JJ supplement_NN ._.
Results_NNS have_VBP shown_VBN that_WDT weight_NN for_IN weight_WP the_DT digestibility_NN and_CC energy_NN efficacy_NN of_IN straw_NN is_VBZ liable_JJ to_TO be_VB reduced_VBN to_TO half_NN ,_, while_IN protein_JJ metabolism_NN is_VBZ severely_RB upset_JJ when_WRB the_DT straw_NN is_VBZ fed_VBN alone_RB ._.
On_IN the_DT other_JJ hand_NN the_DT addition_NN of_IN cakes_NNS and_CC concentrates_NNS does_VBZ not_RB only_RB arrest_VB such_JJ a_DT wasteful_JJ process_NN ,_, but_CC operates_VBZ in_IN a_DT highly_RB economic_JJ way_NN in_IN stimulating_VBG maximum_JJ utilization_NN of_IN energy_NN ,_, protein_NN and_CC other_JJ nutrients_NNS ._.
Varieties_NNS and_CC strains_NNS of_IN straw_NN ._.
According_VBG to_TO the_DT statistics_NNS on_IN crop_NN report_NN ,_, the_DT rice_NN in_IN Bengal_NNP has_VBZ been_VBN divided_VBN into_IN three_CD varieties_NNS ,_, viz_NN ._.
amon_NN or_CC winter_NN rice_NN ,_, aus_NN or_CC autumn_NN rice_NN and_CC boro_NN or_CC spring_NN or_CC summer_NN rice_NN ._.
In_IN actual_JJ fact_NN ,_, although_IN amon_JJ mainly_RB belongs_VBZ to_TO transplanted_VB variety_NN ,_, there_EX are_VBP broadcasted_VBN and_CC deep_JJ water_NN varieties_NNS also_RB ._.
The_DT trials_NNS so_RB far_RB conducted_VBN in_IN Bengal_NNP were_VBD with_IN the_DT straw_NN from_IN transplanted_JJ amon_NN ,_, broad-_JJ casted_VBN aus_NN and_CC transplanted_VBD boro_NN ._.
Time_NN and_CC facilities_NNS were_VBD both_DT limited_VBN to_TO permit_VB wide_JJ scale_NN work_NN embracing_VBG all_DT soil_NN and_CC climatic_JJ belts_NNS ._.
From_IN the_DT results_NNS so_RB far_RB obtained_VBN it_PRP appears_VBZ that_IN the_DT energy_NN output_NN of_IN all_DT straws_NN is_VBZ more_RBR or_CC less_JJR similar_JJ ,_, but_CC in_IN many_JJ other_JJ respects_NNS each_DT is_VBZ markedly_RB different_JJ ._.
Thus_RB lime_NN requirement_NN which_WDT is_VBZ general-_JJ ly_JJ high_JJ under_IN all_DT kinds_NNS of_IN rice_NN straw_NN feeding_NN ,_, is_VBZ comparatively_RB less_RBR with_IN amon_NN ,_, intermediate_JJ with_IN aus_NN and_CC highest_JJS with_IN boro_NN in_IN which_WDT the_DT quantity_NN of_IN oxalic_JJ acid_NN is_VBZ also_RB very_RB high_JJ ._.
The_DT earlier_JJR work_NN was_VBD mainly_RB done_VBN with_IN straw_NN from_IN Dacca_NNP and_CC Nadia_NNP ,_, and_CC it_PRP was_VBD tacitly_RB assumed_VBN that_IN the_DT characteristic_JJ features_NNS of_IN straw_NN from_IN differ-_JJ ent_NN soil_NN belts_NNS would_MD probably_RB be_VB the_DT same_JJ ._.
Thus_RB while_IN lime_NN ,_, phosphorus_NN and_CC potash_NN presented_VBD a_DT picture_NN of_IN complex_JJ metabolism_NN ,_, on_IN feeding_NN of_IN straws_NN from_IN other_JJ tracts_NNS ,_, in_IN the_DT case_NN of_IN straws_NN from_IN the_DT saline_NN belts_NNS of_IN Barisal_NNP and_CC Diamond_NNP Harbour_NNP ,_, it_PRP was_VBD found_VBN that_IN other_JJ components_NNS such_JJ as_IN magnesia_NN ,_, soda_NN and_CC chlorine_VB present_JJ similar_JJ complexities_NNS ._.
It_PRP has_VBZ been_VBN further_RB found_VBN that_IN in_IN the_DT amon_NN varieties_NNS ,_, the_DT amount_NN of_IN oxalic_JJ acid_NN is_VBZ lowest_JJS in_IN Barisal_NNP straw_NN ,_, considerable_JJ in_IN Diamond_NNP Harbour_NNP straw_NN and_CC heaviest_JJS in_IN Chin-_NNP surah_NN straw_NN ._.
The_DT results_NNS suggest_VBP that_IN (_( 1_CD )_) soil_NN condition_NN and_CC the_DT environment_NN exercise_NN a_DT pro-_NN found_VBN influence_NN on_IN general_JJ as_RB well_RB as_IN some_DT specific_JJ characters_NNS of_IN the_DT straw_JJ grown_NN in_IN an_DT area_NN ,_, and_CC (_( 2_CD )_) in_IN order_NN to_TO get_VB dependable_JJ results_NNS ,_, feeding_VBG and_CC metabolic_JJ tests_NNS should_MD be_VB conducted_VBN with_IN local_JJ animals_NNS under_IN local_JJ conditions_NNS of_IN feeding_NN ._.
It_PRP should_MD be_VB stated_VBN that_DT so_RB far_RB the_DT work_NN was_VBD done_VBN with_IN mixed_JJ straws_NNS as_IN were_VBD obtained_VBN from_IN the_DT different_JJ localities_NNS ,_, but_CC comparison_NN will_MD be_VB more_RBR valid_JJ and_CC helpful_JJ if_IN such_JJ work_NN is_VBZ conducted_VBN with_IN straw_NN of_IN pure_NN strains_NNS grown_VBN in_IN the_DT different_JJ soil_NN belts_NNS ._.
Here_RB it_PRP will_MD be_VB relevant_JJ to_TO refer_VB to_TO some_DT experiments_NNS conducted_VBN with_IN pure_NN strains_NNS ,_, viz_NN ._.
indrasail_NN and_CC lattisail_NN ._.
The_DT point_NN of_IN interest_NN lies_NNS in_IN the_DT fact_NN that_IN although_IN chemical_NN analyses_NNS did_VBD not_RB reveal_VB any_DT marked_JJ difference_NN in_IN their_PRP$ composition_NN ,_, nutritional_JJ tests_NNS definitely_RB established_VBD the_DT superiority_NN of_IN indrasail_NN over_IN lattisail_JJ straw_NN ._.
Not_RB only_RB does_VBZ it_PRP emphasize_VB the_DT need_NN of_IN conducting_VBG work_NN with_IN other_JJ strains_NNS but_CC also_RB with_IN strains_NNS from_IN typically_RB different_JJ soil_NN belts_NNS ._.
LIME_JJ ASSIMILATION_NNP UNDER_NNP RICE_NNP STRAW_NNP FEEDING_NNP Rice_NNP straw_NN contains_VBZ an_DT appreciable_JJ amount_NN of_IN oxalic_JJ acid_NN which_WDT has_VBZ the_DT property_NN of_IN keeping_VBG lime_NN in_IN an_DT insoluble_JJ form_NN ._.
This_DT substance_NN ,_, which_WDT in_IN a_DT soluble_JJ form_NN is_VBZ also_RB a_DT poison_NN ,_, has_VBZ been_VBN also_RB found_VBN to_TO vary_VB according_VBG to_TO soil_NN and_CC climate_NN as_IN reflected_VBN in_IN a_DT high_JJ percentage_NN in_IN Chinsura_NNP straw_NN and_CC lowest_JJS in_IN Barisal_NNP straw_NN ._.
In_IN the_DT case_NN of_IN boro_JJ variety_NN of_IN rice_NN straw_NN as_RB well_RB as_IN in_IN amon_JJ variety_NN of_IN Chinsurah_NNP straw_JJ oxalic_JJ acid_NN is_VBZ found_VBN in_IN such_JJ a_DT large_JJ quantity_NN that_IN it_PRP is_VBZ theoretically_RB capable_JJ of_IN rendering_VBG insoluble_JJ not_RB only_RB the_DT entire_JJ lime_NN present_NN in_IN the_DT straw_NN but_CC it_PRP is_VBZ also_RB potentially_RB able_JJ to_TO render_VB infructuous_JJ the_DT efficacy_NN of_IN lime_NN from_IN other_JJ food_NN sources_NNS ._.
A_DT striking_JJ feature_NN however_RB is_VBZ that_IN a_DT large_JJ part_NN of_IN soluble_JJ oxalate_NN in_IN the_DT straw_NN seems_VBZ to_TO undergo_VB decomposition_NN in_IN the_DT rumen_NNS of_IN cattle_NNS ._.
By_IN this_DT ,_, the_DT directly_RB harmful_JJ effect_NN of_IN this_DT substance_NN is_VBZ minimized_VBN but_CC the_DT possibility_NN of_IN some_DT direct_JJ absorption_NN also_RB exists_VBZ with_IN its_PRP$ harmful_JJ effect_NN ._.
Apart_RB from_IN this_DT the_DT presence_NN of_IN other_JJ (_( still_RB unidentified_VBN )_) interfer-_JJ ing_VBG substances_NNS against_IN lime_JJ assimilation_NN has_VBZ also_RB been_VBN detected_VBN ._.
A_DT large_JJ amount_NN of_IN potash_NN as_IN found_VBN in_IN rice_NN straw_NN is_VBZ another_DT factor_NN causing_VBG disturbance_NN in_IN lime_JJ metabolism_NN ._.
Both_DT potassium_NN and_CC oxalic_JJ acid_NNS have_VBP loomed_VBN large_JJ in_IN the_DT recent_JJ investigations_NNS with_IN rice_NN straw_NN feeding_NN ._.
As_IN a_DT matter_NN of_IN fact_NN their_PRP$ effect_NN on_IN metabolism_NN is_VBZ not_RB merely_RB of_IN theoretical_JJ interest_NN ,_, but_CC has_VBZ a_DT far-reaching_JJ practical_JJ significance_NN ._.
Evidences_NNS suggest_VBP that_IN where_WRB oxalic_JJ acid_NN is_VBZ present_JJ in_IN large_JJ quantities_NNS ,_, the_DT potash_NN content_NN too_RB is_VBZ high_JJ ._.
The_DT soluble_JJ oxalates_NNS exist_VBP chiefly_NN as_IN potassium_NN oxalate_NN ._.
In_IN the_DT rumen_NNS of_IN cattle_NNS the_DT oxalate_NN undergoes_JJ decomposition_NN with_IN the_DT produc-_JJ tion_NN of_IN carbonates_NNS and_CC bicarbonates_NNS with_IN which_WDT I_PRP 164_CD Animal_NNP Nutrition_NNP Problem_NNP in_IN Bengal_NNP potash_NN forms_NNS new_JJ compounds_NNS and_CC exercises_NNS such_JJ influence_NN on_IN the_DT acid-base_JJ equilibrium_NN of_IN body_NN fluid_NN that_IN the_DT urine_NN of_IN rice_NN straw_NN feeders_NNS is_VBZ invariably_RB alkaline_JJ ._.
This_DT also_RB indirectly_RB reacts_VBZ on_IN the_DT lime_JJ assimilation_NN as_IN alkaline_JJ reaction_NN is_VBZ unfavourable_JJ to_TO the_DT maintenance_NN of_IN optimum_JJ solubility_NN of_IN lime_NN ,_, without_IN which_WDT its_PRP$ assimilation_NN is_VBZ retarded_VBN ._.
A_DT further_JJ complication_NN lies_VBZ in_IN the_DT fact_NN that_IN although_IN a_DT very_RB heavy_JJ potash_NN ingestion_NN follows_VBZ rice_NN straw_NN feeding_NN ,_, more_JJR potash_NN is_VBZ ex-_JJ creted_VBN through_IN faeces_NNS and_CC urine_NN than_IN is_VBZ provided_VBN in_IN the_DT feed_NN ._.
This_DT phenomenon_NN seems_VBZ to_TO be_VB related_VBN also_RB with_IN the_DT kind_NN and_CC quality_NN of_IN cake_NN ,_, as_IN in_IN the_DT investigations_NNS conducted_VBD linseed_JJ cake_NN had_VBD a_DT beneficient_JJ effect_NN ,_, but_CC mustard_RB cake_VB had_VBD not_RB ._.
At_IN present_JJ there_EX is_VBZ not_RB sufficient_JJ information_NN explaining_VBG the_DT excess_JJ drain_NN of_IN potash_NN from_IN the_DT body_NN ._.
PRE-TREATMENT_NN OF_NNP RICE_NNP STRAW_NNP In_IN order_NN that_IN the_DT removal_NN of_IN these_DT substances_NNS could_MD be_VB efficiently_RB carried_VBN out_RP several_JJ methods_NNS have_VBP been_VBN tried_VBN ._.
The_DT straw_NN was_VBD subjected_VBN to_TO the_DT treatment_NN of_IN lime_NN ,_, caustic_JJ soda_NN and_CC simply_RB water_NN ,_, by_IN keeping_VBG it_PRP soaked_VBD in_IN the_DT respective_JJ liquids_NNS for_IN about_RB 24_CD hours_NNS ._.
After_IN this_DT period_NN the_DT straw_NN was_VBD washed_VBN and_CC fed_VBN to_TO animals_NNS ._.
The_DT results_NNS suggest_VBP that_IN while_IN caustic_JJ soda_NN treat-_JJ ment_NN is_VBZ most_RBS efficient_JJ ,_, its_PRP$ cost_NN is_VBZ a_DT serious_JJ factor_NN against_IN its_PRP$ adoption_NN ._.
Lime_NNP treatment_NN involves_VBZ much_RB less_JJR cost_NN ,_, but_CC water_NN treatment_NN has_VBZ the_DT merit_NN of_IN simplicity_NN ,_, is_VBZ least_JJS costly_JJ and_CC is_VBZ able_JJ to_TO remove_VB 90_CD per_IN cent_NN of_IN potash_NN ._.
Moreover_RB ,_, the_DT loss_NN of_IN organic_JJ matter_NN which_WDT is_VBZ appreciable_JJ under_IN caustic_JJ soda_NN treatment_NN is_VBZ the_DT least_JJS under_IN water_NN treatment_NN ._.
Yet_RB by_IN this_DT simple_JJ procedure_NN ,_, the_DT feeding_VBG quality_NN of_IN straw_NN is_VBZ improved_VBN to_TO such_PDT an_DT extent_NN that_WDT protein_NN and_CC minerals_NNS are_VBP better_RB assimilated_VBN and_CC even_RB the_DT otherwise_RB high_JJ lime_NN requirement_NN under_IN rice_NN straw_NN feeding_NN is_VBZ appreci-_JJ ably_RB reduced_VBN ._.
FEEDING_NN OF_NNP CONCENTRATES_NNP WITH_NNP RICE_NNP STRAW_NNP As_IN mustard_NN cake_NN forms_VBZ a_DT very_RB important_JJ source_NN of_IN concentrates_NNS in_IN Bengal_NNP ,_, various_JJ trials_NNS were_VBD conducted_VBN with_IN this_DT feed_NN in_IN combination_NN with_IN rice_NN straw_NN ._.
The_DT results_NNS have_VBP been_VBN generally_RB satisfactory_JJ with_IN protein_NN and_CC many_JJ other_JJ com-_JJ ponents_NNS ._.
But_CC ,_, as_IN already_RB stated_VBN ,_, the_DT excess_JJ drainage_NN of_IN potash_NN under_IN its_PRP$ combination_NN is_VBZ an_DT unsatisfactory_JJ feature_NN for_IN which_WDT the_DT cause_NN still_RB remains_VBZ to_TO be_VB ascertained_VBN ._.
Meanwhile_RB tentative_JJ remedies_NNS lie_VBP in_IN giving_VBG a_DT better_JJR combination_NN in_IN which_WDT the_DT feed_NN should_MD be_VB supplemented_VBN with_IN a_DT number_NN of_IN concentrates_NNS such_JJ as_IN linseed_NN or/and_VBP other_JJ cakes_NNS ,_, pulse_JJ by-products_NNS ,_, green_JJ forages_NNS ,_, etc_FW ._.
This_DT will_MD ensure_VB the_DT supply_NN of_IN essential_JJ pro-_JJ teins_NNS as_IN absence_NN of_IN these_DT ingredients_NNS from_IN the_DT diet_NN is_VBZ likely_JJ to_TO bring_VB about_RP a_DT corresponding_JJ breakdown_NN of_IN body_NN proteins_NNS ,_, and_CC as_IN cell_NN tissues_NNS (_( which_WDT are_VBP composed_VBN of_IN proteins_NNS )_) also_RB contain_VBP potash_NN ,_, an_DT excess_JJ drainage_NN of_IN the_DT latter_NN will_MD be_VB avoided_VBN by_IN feeding_VBG rice_NN straw_NN with_IN other_JJ con-_JJ centrates_NNS than_IN mustard_RB cake_NN ._.
RICE-KURA_JJ AND_NNP RICE_NNP BY-PRODUCT_NNP The_DT rice_NN by-product_NN of_IN good_JJ quality_NN is_VBZ half_JJ as_IN rich_JJ in_IN proteins_NNS as_IN cakes_NNS ;_: it_PRP contains_VBZ a_DT large_JJ quantity_NN of_IN high_JJ quality_NN oil_NN and_CC is_VBZ exception-_JJ ally_NN rich_JJ in_IN phosphorus_NN ,_, but_CC a_DT considerable_JJ part_NN of_IN this_DT phosphorus_NN is_VBZ in_IN a_DT complex_JJ combina-_JJ tion_NN chemically_RB known_VBN as_IN phytin_NN which_WDT is_VBZ not_RB generally_RB assimilable_JJ ._.
A_DT collection_NN of_IN sample_NN from_IN different_JJ sources_NNS was_VBD made_VBN and_CC analysed_VBN ._.
It_PRP was_VBD found_VBN that_IN the_DT product_NN consisted_VBN of_IN a_DT variable_JJ mixture_NN ranging_VBG from_IN pure_NN husk_NN to_TO diverse_VB grades_NNS of_IN intermediate_JJ products_NNS ._.
This_DT is_VBZ mainly_RB due_JJ to_TO the_DT various_JJ processes_NNS used_VBN in_IN the_DT production_NN of_IN rice_NN and_CC rice_NN by-products_NNS ._.
In_IN the_DT manufacture_NN of_IN rice_NN whether_IN by_IN country_NN process_NN or_CC mills_NNS ,_, the_DT nutrients_NNS are_VBP ultimately_RB distributed_VBN between_IN rice_NN ,_, broken_JJ rice_NN and_CC husks_NNS ._.
Since_IN rice_NN and_CC broken_VB rice_NN go_VB for_IN human_JJ consump-_JJ tion_NN ,_, the_DT ingredients_NNS necessary_JJ for_IN cattle_NNS food_NN have_VBP to_TO be_VB derived_VBN from_IN the_DT residual_JJ nutrients_NNS left_VBN in_IN the_DT husk_NN ._.
The_DT husk_NN produced_VBN by_IN the_DT country_NN process_NN and_CC smaller_JJR mills_NNS are_VBP obtained_VBN in_IN a_DT mixed_JJ condition_NN and_CC form_NN approximately_RB 25_CD per_IN cent_NN of_IN parboiled_JJ paddy_NN of_IN which_WDT little_RB more_JJR than_IN one-third_JJ ,_, i.e_NN ._.
9_CD per_IN cent_NN are_VBP capable_JJ of_IN being_VBG separated_VBN as_IN finer_JJ material_NN ._.
The_DT husks_NNS from_IN Marshalls_NNP machine_NN are_VBP broadly_RB obtained_VBN at_IN two_CD stages_NNS ,_, viz_NN ._.
ara_NN and_CC chanta_NN ._.
The_DT ara_NN husk_NN is_VBZ too_RB coarse_JJ and_CC contains_VBZ a_DT very_RB large_JJ proportion_NN of_IN fibre_NN and_CC silica_NN ,_, whereas_IN the_DT chanta_NN husk_NN is_VBZ finer_JJ and_CC forms_VBZ 21.25_CD per_IN cent_NN of_IN parboiled_JJ paddy_NN ._.
By_IN careful_JJ fractionation_NN about_IN half_NN of_IN it_PRP can_MD be_VB separated_VBN into_IN more_RBR suitable_JJ cattle_JJ food_NN ._.
The_DT main_JJ point_NN to_TO be_VB noted_VBN in_IN reference_NN to_TO the_DT distribution_NN of_IN nutrients_NNS is_VBZ that_IN the_DT bulk_NN of_IN protein_NN and_CC starchy_NN parts_NNS go_VBP to_TO rice_VB ,_, while_IN oil_NN (_( ether_CC extract_NN )_) ,_, soluble_JJ ash_NN ,_, phosphorus_NN ,_, potash_NN and_CC magnesia_NN go_VBP to_TO rice_VB by-products_NNS ._.
Both_DT rice_NN and_CC rice_NN by-products_NNS are_VBP particularly_RB S._NNP GANAPATHY_NNP IYER_NNP 165_CD poor_JJ in_IN lime_NN ,_, but_CC finished_JJ rice_NN is_VBZ poorer_JJR still_RB having_VBG one-fourth_NN of_IN the_DT percentage_NN in_IN kura_NN ._.
Of_IN the_DT total_JJ phosphorus_NN in_IN rice_NN and_CC its_PRP$ by-products_NNS as_RB much_RB as_IN 51_CD to_TO 94_CD per_IN cent_NN consist_NN of_IN phytin_NN ._.
Several_JJ processes_NNS for_IN stimulating_VBG its_PRP$ better_JJR utiliza-_JJ tion_NN were_VBD tried_VBN but_CC the_DT work_NN could_MD not_RB be_VB pursued_VBN further_JJ due_JJ to_TO the_DT retirement_NN of_IN the_DT author_NN from_IN service_NN ._.
Work_NN on_IN this_DT highly_RB important_JJ and_CC interesting_JJ problem_NN deserves_VBZ further_JJ attention_NN ._.
SUMMARY_NNP The_DT limitations_NNS forming_VBG the_DT special_JJ feature_NN of_IN Bengal_NNP with_IN regard_NN to_TO the_DT problems_NNS of_IN animal_JJ nutrition_NN have_VBP been_VBN discussed_VBN ._.
The_DT general_JJ feeding_VBG value_NN of_IN rice_NN straw_NN has_VBZ been_VBN dealt_VBN with_IN ._.
Since_IN the_DT straw_NN is_VBZ highly_RB unbalanced_JJ ,_, it_PRP is_VBZ not_RB properly_RB utilized_JJ unless_IN it_PRP is_VBZ fed_VBN with_IN more_RBR nutritious_JJ supplement_NN ._.
The_DT soil_NN condition_NN and_CC environment_NN exercise_NN a_DT profound_JJ influence_NN on_IN general_JJ as_RB well_RB as_IN specific_JJ characters_NNS of_IN the_DT straw_NN in_IN an_DT area_NN ._.
In_IN order_NN to_TO get_VB dependable_JJ results_NNS ,_, feeding_VBG and_CC metabolic_JJ tests_NNS should_MD be_VB conducted_VBN with_IN local_JJ animals_NNS under_IN local_JJ conditions_NNS of_IN feeding_NN ._.
Rice_NNP straw_NN contains_VBZ an_DT appreciable_JJ amount_NN of_IN oxalic_JJ acid_NN which_WDT has_VBZ the_DT property_NN of_IN keeping_VBG lime_NN in_IN an_DT insoluble_JJ form_NN ._.
This_DT substance_NN has_VBZ been_VBN found_VBN to_TO vary_VB according_VBG to_TO soil_NN and_CC climate_NN ._.
A_DT large_JJ amount_NN of_IN potash_NN as_IN found_VBN in_IN rice_NN straw_NN is_VBZ another_DT factor_NN causing_VBG disturbance_NN in_IN lime_JJ metabolism_NN ._.
In_IN order_NN that_IN removal_NN of_IN these_DT substances_NNS could_MD be_VB efficiently_RB carried_VBN out_RP several_JJ methods_NNS have_VBP been_VBN suggested_VBN ._.
Mustard_NNP cake_NN in_IN combination_NN with_IN rice_NN straw_NNS gave_VBD satisfactory_JJ results_NNS as_IN regards_NNS protien_NN and_CC many_JJ other_JJ components_NNS ._.
But_CC the_DT excess_JJ drainage_NN of_IN potash_NN under_IN its_PRP$ combination_NN is_VBZ an_DT unsatis-_JJ factory_NN feature_NN ._.
An_DT excess_JJ drainage_NN of_IN potash_NN will_MD be_VB avoided_VBN by_IN feeding_VBG rice_NN straw_NN with_IN other_JJ concentrates_NNS than_IN mustard_RB cake_NN ._.
Preliminary_JJ work_NN on_IN the_DT utilizability_NN of_IN rice-_JJ kura_NN and_CC rice_NN by-products_NNS as_IN cattle_NNS feed_NN was_VBD also_RB undertaken_JJ ._.
THE_DT SUSCEPTIBILITY_NNP OF_NNP DUCKS_NNP TO_NNP NEWCASTLE_NNP (_( RANIKHET_NNP )_) DISEASE_NNP By_IN S._NNP GANAPATHY_NNP IYER_NNP ,_, Research_NNP Officer_NNP (_( Pathology_NNP )_) ,_, Poultry_NNP Research_NNP Section_NNP ,_, Imperial_NNP Veterinary_NNP Research_NNP Institute_NNP ,_, Izatnagar_NNP (_( Received_VBN for_IN publication_NN on_IN 28_CD November_NNP 1944_CD )_) NEWCASTLE_NNP (_( or_CC Ranikhet_NNP )_) disease_NN has_VBZ been_VBN reported_VBN in_IN a_DT variety_NN of_IN birds_NNS ,_, both_DT domesticated_VBN and_CC wild_JJ ,_, but_CC is_VBZ most_JJS common_JJ in_IN fowls_NN ._.
Workers_NNS in_IN India_NNP and_CC other_JJ countries_NNS have_VBP reported_VBN that_IN ducks_NNS are_VBP susceptible_JJ to_TO the_DT virus_NN [_NNP Doyle_NNP ,_, 1927_CD ;_: Farinas_NNP ,_, 1930_CD ;_: Cooper_NNP ,_, 1931_CD and_CC Picard_NNP ,_, 1934_CD ]_NN ._.
Cooper_NNP ,_, however_RB ,_, stated_VBD that_IN 'although_IN occasion-_JJ ally_NN ducks_NNS became_VBD affected_JJ by_IN artificial_JJ inocula-_JJ tion_NN and_CC the_DT virus_NN could_MD be_VB recovered_VBN from_IN them_PRP ,_, those_DT birds_NNS were_VBD found_VBN to_TO be_VB relatively_RB highly_RB resistant_JJ '_POS ._.
Dobson_NNP [_NN 1939_CD ]_NN is_VBZ apparently_RB the_DT only_JJ worker_NN to_TO have_VB reported_VBN that_IN ducks_NNS are_VBP resistant_JJ to_TO both_DT experimental_JJ and_CC natural_JJ infec-_JJ tion_NN ._.
The_DT writer_NN has_VBZ frequently_RB heard_VBN from_IN breeders_NNS and_CC disease_NN investigation_NN officers_NNS in_IN this_DT country_NN that_WDT ducks_VBZ in_IN infected_JJ localities_NNS have_VBP remained_VBN free_JJ from_IN the_DT disease_NN ._.
In_IN view_NN ,_, therefore_RB ,_, of_IN the_DT diversity_NN of_IN opinion_NN regarding_VBG the_DT susceptibility_NN of_IN ducks_NNS to_TO the_DT Newcastle_NNP virus_NN ,_, the_DT writer*_NN ,_, decided_VBD to_TO inaugurate_VB a_DT series_NN of_IN experiments_NNS ._.
*_NN This_DT work_NN was_VBD carried_VBN out_RP at_IN the_DT Ministry_NNP of_IN Agriculture_NNP ,_, Veterinary_NNP Laboratory_NNP ,_, Weybridge_NNP ,_, England_NNP ,_, under_IN a_DT scheme_NN financed_VBN by_IN the_DT Imperial_NNP Council_NNP of_IN Agricultural_NNP Research_NNP ,_, New_NNP Delhi_NNP ._.
EXPERIMENTAL_NNP Mature_NNP Pennine_NNP ducks_NNS and_CC ducklings_NNS were_VBD used_VBN ._.
Fowl-passaged_JJ Newcastle_NNP virus_NN ,_, prepared_VBN by_IN suspending_VBG in_IN 1.0_CD per_IN cent_NN saline_NN a_DT mixture_NN of_IN infected_VBN liver_NN and_CC spleen_NN in_IN equal_JJ quantities_NNS ,_, was_VBD used_VBN for_IN subcutaneous_JJ inoculation_NN ._.
One_CD c.c_NN ._.
of_IN this_DT suspension_NN contained_VBD one_CD million_CD M.L.D_NNP ._.
The_DT experimental_JJ birds_NNS were_VBD kept_VBN individually_RB in_IN coops_NNS during_IN the_DT entire_JJ period_NN of_IN observation_NN ._.
RESULTS_NNP ._.
Experiment_NN I_PRP (_( Table_JJ I_PRP )_) Transmission_NN experiments_NNS ._.
(_( 1_CD )_) On_IN 10_CD November_NNP 1939_CD ,_, two_CD ducks_NNS were_VBD injected_VBN each_DT with_IN 1_CD c.c_NNS ._.
virus_NN ._.
As_IN no_DT reaction_NN occurred_VBD ,_, they_PRP were_VBD injected_VBN 26_CD days_NNS later_RB with_IN 10_CD c.c_NNS ._.
virus_NN ._.
They_PRP remained_VBD healthy_JJ ._.
To_TO complete_VB the_DT observation_NN ,_, they_PRP were_VBD bled_VBN for_IN serum_NN and_CC killed_VBD 40_CD days_NNS after_IN the_DT first_JJ injection_NN ._.
(_( 2_CD )_) On_IN 17_CD November_NNP 1939_CD ,_, two_CD ducks_NNS were_VBD exposed_VBN to_TO infection_NN by_IN placing_VBG them_PRP in_IN a_DT contaminated_JJ coop_NN ._.
They_PRP remained_VBD healthy_JJ though_IN fowls_JJ had_VBD previously_RB died_VBN of_IN the_DT infection_NN K_NNP 166_CD Susceptibility_NNP of_IN Ducks_NNP to_TO Newcastle_NNP in_IN the_DT coop_NN ,_, and_CC ,_, on_IN the_DT 19th_CD day_NN ,_, the_DT infection_NN was_VBD implemented_VBN by_IN injecting_VBG them_PRP each_DT with_IN 10_CD c.c_NNS ._.
virus_NN ._.
As_IN they_PRP showed_VBD no_DT reaction_NN they_PRP were_VBD bled_VBN and_CC killed_VBN 33_CD days_NNS after_IN the_DT first_JJ injection_NN ._.
(_( 3_CD )_) Two_CD more_JJR ducks_NNS were_VBD injected_VBN with_IN 10_CD c.c_NNS ._.
virus_NN on_IN 21_CD November_NNP 1939_CD ._.
One_CD of_IN these_DT died_VBN as_IN a_DT result_NN of_IN helminthic_JJ infection_NN on_IN the_DT 14th_CD day_NN ,_, while_IN the_DT other_JJ showed_VBD no_DT reaction_NN and_CC was_VBD reinjected_VBN with_IN 10_CD c.c_NNS ._.
virus_NN on_IN the_DT 15th_JJ day_NN ._.
It_PRP remained_VBD well_RB and_CC was_VBD bled_VBN and_CC killed_VBN on_IN the_DT 29th_CD day_NN after_IN the_DT first_JJ inoculation_NN ._.
(_( 4_CD )_) Two_CD eight_CD weeks-old_JJ ducklings_NNS were_VBD injected_VBN each_DT with_IN 1_CD c.c_NNS ._.
virus_NN ._.
They_PRP showed_VBD no_DT reaction_NN ;_: on_IN the_DT fifth_JJ day_NN one_CD was_VBD killed_VBN and_CC an_DT emulsion_NN of_IN its_PRP$ liver_NN and_CC spleen_NN was_VBD subinoculated_VBN into_IN a_DT fowl_NN to_TO test_VB the_DT infectivity_NN of_IN the_DT tissues_NNS ._.
The_DT fowl_NN remained_VBD healthy_JJ and_CC was_VBD later_RB shown_VBN to_TO be_VB susceptible_JJ to_TO Newcastle_NNP virus_NN infection_NN ._.
The_DT tissues_NNS from_IN the_DT duckling_NN ,_, therefore_RB ,_, contained_VBD no_DT virus_NN capable_JJ of_IN infecting_VBG the_DT fowls_NN ._.
The_DT second_JJ duckling_NN also_RB showed_VBD no_DT reaction_NN to_TO the_DT inoculation_NN and_CC was_VBD killed_VBN on_IN the_DT 20th_JJ day_NN ._.
The_DT autopsy_NN of_IN this_DT bird_NN revealed_VBD nothing_NN unusual_JJ ._.

Experiment_NNP II_NNP (_( Table_NNP II_NNP )_) Serum-virus_NNP neutralization_NN ._.
Serum_NNP samples_NNS ,_, col-_JJ lected_VBN from_IN ducks_NNS that_WDT had_VBD been_VBN treated_VBN with_IN the_DT virus_NN were_VBD pooled_VBN and_CC examined_VBN for_IN the_DT presence_NN of_IN neutralizing_VBG antibodies_NNS by_IN the_DT in_IN vitro_JJ method_NN ._.
Tubes_NNS were_VBD put_VBN up_RP containing_VBG serum_NN and_CC virus_NN and_CC ,_, after_IN two_CD hours_NNS contact_VBP at_IN room_NN temperature_NN (_( 18ºC_CD ._.
)_) ,_, or_CC after_IN 18_CD hours_NNS contact_NN at_IN 37ºC._CD ,_, were_VBD inoculated_VBN into_IN susceptible_JJ fowls_NN and_CC fertile_JJ 11_CD day-incubated_JJ hen_NN eggs_NNS (_( only_RB fowl_NN inoculation_NN has_VBZ been_VBN shown_VBN in_IN Table_NNP II_NNP )_) ._.
Suitable_JJ control_NN tubes_NNS were_VBD also_RB prepared_JJ using_VBG the_DT serum_NN of_IN ducks_NNS that_WDT had_VBD not_RB been_VBN inoculated_VBN with_IN the_DT virus_NN ._.
In_IN no_DT case_NN was_VBD the_DT virus_NN neutralized_VBN ,_, since_IN the_DT test_NN fowls_NN and_CC chick_NN embryos_NN died_VBD of_IN the_DT infection_NN ._.

The_DT serum_NN from_IN ducks_NNS inoculated_VBN with_IN virus_NN revealed_VBD no_DT antibodies_NNS ._.

15_CD ,_, 184_CD KNOWLEDGE_NNP concerning_VBG the_DT fundamental_JJ principles_NNS of_IN the_DT physiology_NN of_IN reproduction_NN owes_RB much_RB to_TO the_DT painstaking_VBG observations_NNS of_IN laboratory_NN animals_NNS such_JJ as_IN rabbits_NNS and_CC guinea-_JJ pigs_NNS ,_, but_CC relatively_RB recently_RB a_DT few_JJ attempts_NNS have_VBP been_VBN made_VBN to_TO obtain_VB that_DT information_NN concerning_VBG the_DT larger_JJR farm_NN ani-_NN mals_NNS ._.
It_PRP has_VBZ been_VBN inferred_VBN commonly_RB that_IN what_WP has_VBZ been_VBN observed_VBN in_IN small_JJ animals_NNS also_RB occurs_VBP in_IN other_JJ species_NNS ._.
The_DT anterior_JJ lobe_NN of_IN the_DT pituitary_JJ gland_NN activates_VBZ the_DT gonads_NNS alike_RB in_IN birds_NNS and_CC man_NN and_CC therefore_RB in_IN broad_JJ principles_NNS the_DT above_JJ inference_NN is_VBZ justified_JJ ._.
Although_IN in_IN the_DT rabbit_NN ovulation_NN is_VBZ induced_VBN by_IN coitus_NN and_CC even_RB by_IN mechanical_JJ irritation_NN of_IN a_DT like_JJ nature_NN it_PRP would_MD be_VB quite_RB incorrect_JJ to_TO infer_VB that_IN this_DT is_VBZ so_RB for_IN the_DT ewe_NN in_IN which_WDT ovulation_NN is_VBZ quite_RB independent_JJ of_IN such_JJ a_DT stimulus_NN ._.
In_IN the_DT ewe_NN oestrus_NN is_VBZ the_DT first_JJ phase_NN of_IN the_DT reproductive_JJ function_NN ._.
Oestrus_NN by_IN itself_PRP is_VBZ not_RB a_DT sign_NN of_IN fertility_NN though_IN it_PRP is_VBZ a_DT necessary_JJ preliminary_NN to_TO conception_NN ._.
There_EX is_VBZ little_JJ interbreed_JJ variation_NN in_IN the_DT duration_NN of_IN dioes-_JJ trus_NN in_IN domestic_JJ ewes_NN ._.
The_DT normal_JJ period_NN is_VBZ 17_CD days_NNS ._.
A_DT range_NN 16-18_CD is_VBZ common_JJ ,_, however_RB 15_CD or_CC 19_CD days_NNS interval_NN must_MD also_RB be_VB regarded_VBN as_IN normal_JJ ._.
The_DT so-called_JJ 'silent_NN heat_NN '_'' occurs_VBZ most_JJS frequently_RB in_IN Merino_NNP ewes_NN ._.
In_IN these_DT cases_NNS oestrus_VBP usually_RB reappears_NNS after_IN a_DT period_NN which_WDT is_VBZ a_DT multiple_NN of_IN the_DT normal_JJ ._.
During_IN silent_JJ heat_NN no_DT odoriferous_JJ substances_NNS attractive_JJ to_TO the_DT ram_NN are_VBP produced_VBN ._.
Recurrent_JJ intervals_NNS of_IN sexual_JJ excitement_NN alternating_VBG with_IN a_DT period_NN of_IN dioestrus_NN constitute_NN a_DT breeding_NN season_NN ._.
The_DT long_JJ break_NN between_IN these_DT seasons_NNS is_VBZ known_VBN as_IN the_DT period_NN of_IN anoestrus_NN or_CC sexual_JJ inactivity_NN ._.
According_VBG to_TO Marshall_NNP ,_, sexual_JJ periodicity_NN is_VBZ primarily_RB a_DT function_NN of_IN the_DT gonads_NNS ._.
In_IN England_NNP most_JJS breeds_NNS of_IN sheep_NN have_VBP an_DT extended_VBN breeding_NN season_NN during_IN late_JJ summer_NN ,_, autumn_NN and_CC winter_NN ._.
In_IN Scotland_NNP it_PRP is_VBZ later_RB ._.
While_IN the_DT breeding_NN season_NN is_VBZ more_RBR limited_JJ in_IN countries_NNS further_RBR north_RB than_IN Scotland_NNP ,_, a_DT continual_JJ activity_NN is_VBZ approached_VBN within_IN the_DT tropics_NNS ._.
Marshall_NNP also_RB observed_VBD that_IN Dorset_NNP Horned_NNP and_CC Merino_NNP breeds_NNS of_IN sheep_NN are_VBP peculiar_VBN in_IN that_DT they_PRP come_VBP on_IN heat_NN throughout_IN the_DT year_NN ._.
The_DT author_NN 's_POS observations_NNS on_IN three_CD groups_NNS of_IN Merino_NNP ewes_NN and_CC a_DT group_NN of_IN Border_NNP Leicester_NNP x_NNP Merino_NNP cross-bred_JJ ewes_NN showed_VBD a_DT well-defined_JJ periodicity_NN in_IN the_DT percentage_NN of_IN ewes_NN coming_VBG into_IN oestrus_NN ._.
In_IN these_DT four_CD groups_NNS there_RB was_VBD a_DT decrease_NN in_IN the_DT incidence_NN of_IN oestrus_NN during_IN the_DT spring_NN followed_VBN by_IN an_DT increase_NN in_IN the_DT summer_NN months_NNS and_CC higher_JJR levels_NNS maintained_VBD during_IN late_JJ summer_NN ,_, autumn_NN and_CC winter_NN ._.
The_DT importance_NN of_IN periodicity_NN in_IN sexual_JJ activity_NN can_MD not_RB be_VB over-estimated_JJ in_IN Australia_NNP where_WRB the_DT statements_NNS of_IN Mar-_NNP shall_MD and_CC others_NNS are_VBP accepted_VBN ,_, since_IN ,_, if_IN there_EX is_VBZ a_DT definite_JJ pe-_JJ riodicity_NN as_IN observed_VBN above_IN then_RB brief_JJ paddock_NN matings_NNS will_MD give_VB unsatisfactory_JJ results_NNS ._.
Again_NNP genetic_JJ factors_NNS play_VBP an_DT important_JJ part_NN in_IN the_DT periodicity_NN ._.
Some_DT wild_JJ types_NNS and_CC domestic_JJ breeds_NNS of_IN sheep_NN (_( the_DT Scottish_NNP Blackface_NNP )_) are_VBP either_DT monoestrus_NN or_CC nearly_RB so_RB ;_: and_CC others_NNS (_( Merinos_NNP )_) approximate_VBP a_DT completely_RB polyoestrus_JJ condition_NN ._.
The_DT long_JJ wool_NN breeds_NNS have_VBP a_DT marked_JJ autumnal_JJ periodicity_NN in_IN sexual_JJ activity_NN and_CC this_DT is_VBZ accepted_VBN as_IN due_JJ to_TO hereditary_JJ make_VB up_RP ._.
It_PRP is_VBZ further_RBR suggested_VBD that_IN the_DT observed_JJ periodicity_NN of_IN sexual_JJ activity_NN within_IN the_DT Australian_JJ Merinos_NNP is_VBZ the_DT result_NN of_IN out-_JJ crossing_VBG with_IN long_JJ wool_JJ sheep_NN during_IN the_DT foundation_NN of_IN the_DT breed_NN ._.
Marshall_NNP attributes_VBZ the_DT reproductive_JJ rhythm_NN to_TO three_CD things_NNS (_( 1_CD )_) Metabolical_NNP (_( 2_CD )_) general_JJ environment_NN and_CC (_( 3_CD )_) exter-_NN oceptive_JJ stimuli_NN ._.
The_DT observations_NNS of_IN the_DT author_NN do_VBP not_RB support_VB the_DT first_JJ two_CD points_NNS of_IN Marshall_NNP and_CC other_JJ workers_NNS ._.
It_PRP has_VBZ been_VBN observed_VBN that_IN light_NN has_VBZ a_DT marked_VBN ,_, if_IN indirect_JJ ,_, effect_NN upon_IN the_DT gonads_NNS and_CC that_IN the_DT essential_JJ stimulation_NN is_VBZ of_IN the_DT anterior_JJ lobe_NN of_IN the_DT pituitary_NN ._.
The_DT effect_NN of_IN daylight_NN on_IN sexual_JJ activity_NN is_VBZ discussed_VBN and_CC according_VBG to_TO the_DT obser-_JJ vations_NNS of_IN the_DT author_NN ,_, increased_VBD sexual_JJ activity_NN in_IN ewes_NN was_VBD observed_VBN during_IN decreasing_VBG hours_NNS of_IN daylight_NN ._.
The_DT funda-_JJ mental_JJ phenomenon_NN of_IN reproduction_NN is_VBZ discussed_VBN showing_VBG its_PRP$ complexity_NN and_CC indicating_NN that_WDT reduced_VBD fertility_NN results_NNS from_IN a_DT number_NN of_IN causes_NNS ._.
Fertility_NN is_VBZ defined_VBN as_IN the_DT ability_NN of_IN a_DT male_NN or_CC female_NN to_TO beget_VB or_CC bear_VB progeny_NN ._.
Fertility_NN may_MD be_VB high_JJ or_CC low_JJ and_CC it_PRP is_VBZ determined_VBN by_IN the_DT number_NN of_IN off-springs_NNS they_PRP produce_VBP during_IN their_PRP$ breeding_JJ life_NN ._.
(_( The_DT breeding_VBG life_NN of_IN a_DT Merino_NNP ewe_NN is_VBZ divisible_JJ into_IN three_CD periods_NNS ,_, youth_NN ,_, maturity_NN and_CC old_JJ age_NN ._.

of_IN diet_NN ._.

101_CD ,_, 146_CD and_CC 178_CD THE_NNP disease_NN is_VBZ prevalent_JJ in_IN regions_NNS widely_RB separated_VBN and_CC proximity_NN has_VBZ no_DT relation_NN to_TO prevalence_NN ._.
The_DT majority_NN of_IN 'red_JJ water_NN '_POS farms_NNS consisted_VBD of_IN land_NN partially_RB cleared_VBN of_IN timber_NN ,_, and_CC deficient_NN in_IN pasturage_NN ._.
The_DT soil_NN was_VBD coarse_JJ ,_, sandy_JJ and_CC deficient_NN in_IN organic_JJ matter_NN ._.
The_DT disease_NN was_VBD found_VBN to_TO be_VB associated_VBN with_IN certain_JJ farms_NNS rather_RB than_IN the_DT type_NN of_IN soil_NN ._.
Manuring_VBG the_DT land_NN for_IN years_NNS with_IN lime_NN and_CC superphosphate_NN did_VBD not_RB prevent_VB the_DT disease_NN ,_, nor_CC did_VBD the_DT addi-_JJ tion_NN of_IN mineral_JJ supplements_NNS to_TO the_DT diet_NN ._.
On_IN a_DT few_JJ farms_NNS top-dressing_NN of_IN the_DT soil_NN with_IN gypsum_NN together_RB with_IN crop_NN ro-_JJ tation_NN is_VBZ said_VBD to_TO have_VB controlled_VBN the_DT disease_NN ._.
Plant_NNP surveys_NNS failed_VBD to_TO incriminate_VB any_DT particular_JJ regional_JJ flora_NNS incidental_JJ to_TO the_DT disease_NN ._.
Great_NNP variation_NN was_VBD observed_VBN in_IN the_DT incidence_NN in_IN different_JJ herds_NNS maintained_VBN under_IN identical_JJ conditions_NNS ._.
The_DT introduction_NN of_IN sick_JJ animals_NNS into_IN clean_JJ areas_NNS neither_RB resulted_VBD in_IN spread_NN of_IN the_DT disease_NN nor_CC retarded_VBD the_DT clinical_JJ course_NN ._.
The_DT disease_NN is_VBZ characterized_VBN by_IN the_DT presence_NN of_IN a_DT haema-_JJ turia_NN intermittent_NN in_IN the_DT early_JJ stage_NN and_CC of_IN short_JJ duration_NN ._.
The_DT quantity_NN of_IN blood_NN increased_VBN after_IN each_DT successive_JJ attack_NN and_CC coagulated_VBD blood_NN voided_NNS ._.
Sometimes_RB blood_NN clots_NNS caused_VBD retention_NN of_IN urine_JJ and_CC death_NN from_IN uraemia_NN ._.
No_DT systemic_JJ disturbance_NN was_VBD noticed_VBN unless_IN the_DT loss_NN of_IN blood_NN was_VBD heavy_JJ ._.
Age_NNP ,_, breed_NN ,_, sex_NN and_CC heredity_NN had_VBD no_DT bearing_NN on_IN the_DT incidence_NN of_IN the_DT disease_NN :_: animals_NNS from_IN 18_CD months_NNS to_TO 13_CD years_NNS were_VBD equally_RB affected_VBN ._.
The_DT lesions_NNS were_VBD confined_VBN to_TO the_DT inner_JJ surface_NN of_IN the_DT urinary_JJ bladder_NN ,_, and_CC varied_VBD from_IN petechiation_NN to_TO small_JJ pedunculated_JJ vascular_JJ growths_NNS extending_VBG to_TO the_DT lumen_NNS of_IN the_DT bladder_NN or_CC to_TO excessive_JJ granulations_NNS resembling_VBG papilloma_NN ._.
The_DT vertex_NN of_IN the_DT bladder_NN was_VBD rarely_RB involved_JJ ,_, The_DT coagulation_NN time_NN of_IN the_DT blood_NN and_CC the_DT pH_NN and_CC sp_NN ._.
gr_NN ._.
of_IN the_DT urine_JJ were_VBD normal_JJ ._.
The_DT findings_NNS of_IN Datta_NNP were_VBD not_RB confirmed_VBN ._.
Feeding_VBG experiments_NNS conducted_VBN on_IN haematuria_NNS farms_NNS failed_VBD to_TO incriminate_VB water_NN supply_NN ,_, pasture_NN and_CC feeds_NNS as_IN causal_NN factors_NNS ,_, but_CC when_WRB the_DT animals_NNS were_VBD supplied_VBN with_IN feeds_NNS from_IN non-redwater_JJ areas_NNS the_DT onset_NN and_CC the_DT progress_NN of_IN the_DT disease_NN were_VBD considerably_RB delayed_VBN ._.
However_RB ,_, the_DT feeding_NN trials_NNS as_RB well_RB as_IN field_NN observations_NNS indicated_VBD that_IN the_DT disease_NN was_VBD in_IN some_DT way_NN associated_VBN with_IN the_DT soil_NN content_NN of_IN red-water_JJ farms_NNS ._.
No_DT essential_JJ difference_NN was_VBD noticed_VBN in_IN the_DT output_NN of_IN urinary_JJ inorganic_JJ sulphate_NN in_IN animals_NNS supplied_VBN with_IN feeds_NNS from_IN red-water_NN and_CC non-redwater_JJ farms_NNS ._.
These_DT results_NNS fail_VBP to_TO confirm_VB the_DT Australian_JJ findings_NNS ._.

P._NNP ]_NNP Storage_NNP changes_NNS in_IN spray-dried_JJ whole_JJ egg_NN powder_NN ._.

48_CD ,_, 629_CD BACTERIAL_NNP and_CC chemical_NN analyses_NNS were_VBD made_VBN of_IN samples_NNS of_IN spray-dried_JJ whole_JJ egg_NN powder_NN immediately_RB upon_IN receipt_NN from_IN the_DT driers_NNS ._.
They_PRP were_VBD then_RB stored_VBN at_IN 30ºC_CD ._.
at_IN relative_JJ humi-_JJ dities_NNS varying_VBG from_IN 20_CD to_TO 100_CD per_IN cent_NN for_IN a_DT period_NN of_IN 60_CD days_NNS ,_, the_DT analyses_NNS repeated_VBN ,_, and_CC the_DT changes_NNS undergone_VBP during_IN storage_NN studied_VBN ._.
The_DT results_NNS of_IN these_DT experiments_NNS indicated_VBD that_IN spray-_JJ dried_JJ whole_JJ egg_NN powder_NN which_WDT had_VBD been_VBN properly_RB dried_VBN would_MD not_RB mould_VB if_IN stored_VBN at_IN relative_JJ humidities_NNS of_IN 85_CD per_IN cent_NN or_CC less_JJR at_IN 30ºC_CD ._.
or_CC below_NN ,_, as_RB well_RB as_IN that_DT bacterial_JJ growth_NN would_MD not_RB occur_VB in_IN stored_JJ samples_NNS of_IN similar_JJ material_NN unless_IN the_DT relative_JJ humidity_NN of_IN the_DT storage_NN atmosphere_RB exceeded_VBD 90_CD per_IN cent_NN at_IN 30ºC_CD ._.
Changes_NNS in_IN the_DT solubility_NN of_IN the_DT egg_NN powder_NN during_IN storage_NN were_VBD found_VBN to_TO be_VB much_RB more_RBR pronounced_JJ when_WRB the_DT moisture_NN content_NN of_IN the_DT powder_NN exceeded_VBD 5.0_CD per_IN cent_NN ._.
Bacteria_NNS of_IN the_DT coliform_NN group_NN ,_, if_IN present_JJ ,_, tended_VBD to_TO remain_VB viable_JJ during_IN storage_NN ._.
Changes_NNS in_IN the_DT total_JJ bacte-_JJ rial_NN count_NN ,_, as_IN measured_VBN by_IN the_DT dilution_NN plate_NN method_NN ,_, were_VBD influenced_VBN by_IN the_DT amount_NN of_IN moisture_NN initially_RB present_JJ in_IN the_DT sample_NN ._.
When_WRB the_DT moisture_NN concentration_NN was_VBD 5_CD per_IN cent_NN or_CC less_JJR bacterial_JJ death_NN appeared_VBD to_TO be_VB greater_JJR as_IN the_DT moisture_NN content_NN was_VBD reduced_VBN ._.
With_IN moisture_NN concentrations_NNS greater_JJR than_IN 5.0_CD per_IN cent_NN ,_, the_DT reverse_NN seemed_VBD to_TO be_VB true_JJ ._.
i.e_NN ._.
until_IN it_PRP became_VBD high_JJ enough_RB to_TO allow_VB of_IN bacterial_JJ growth_NN ._.
Death_NN of_IN bacteria_NNS in_IN powdered_JJ dried_JJ egg_NN at_IN moisture_NN concentrations_NNS higher_JJR than_IN 5.0_CD per_IN cent_NN seemed_VBD to_TO be_VB associated_VBN with_IN the_DT chemical_NN changes_NNS involved_VBN in_IN the_DT loss_NN of_IN solubility_NN ._.
It_PRP was_VBD observed_VBN that_IN marked_JJ decreases_NNS in_IN the_DT solubility_NN of_IN the_DT stored_VBN material_NN might_MD occur_VB independently_RB of_IN the_DT changes_NNS in_IN the_DT free_JJ fat_NN acid_NN content_NN ,_, formol_JJ nitrogen_NN value_NN or_CC total_JJ free_JJ car-_NN boxyl_NN groups_NNS ._.
That_DT pronounced_VBD increases_NNS in_IN the_DT content_NN of_IN these_DT latter_JJ chemical_NN constituents_NNS might_MD be_VB brought_VBN about_RB as_IN a_DT result_NN of_IN bacterial_NN or_CC mould_JJ growth_NN during_IN storage_NN at_IN high_JJ relative_JJ humidities_NNS was_VBD also_RB noticed_VBN ._.
Changes_NNS in_IN the_DT pH_NN values_NNS of_IN stored_VBN dried_JJ eggs_NNS became_VBD more_RBR pronounced_JJ as_IN the_DT moisture_NN content_NN of_IN the_DT samples_NNS increased_VBD from_IN 1.94_CD per_IN cent_NN to_TO 9.96_CD per_IN cent_NN ._.
The_DT fact_NN that_IN solubility_NN changes_NNS ,_, decreases_NNS in_IN the_DT total_JJ bacterial_JJ plate_NN count_NN and_CC decreases_NNS in_IN pH_NN values_NNS were_VBD influenced_VBN by_IN the_DT moisture_NN content_NN of_IN the_DT stored_VBN spray-dried_JJ whole_JJ egg_NN powder_NN indicated_VBD that_IN the_DT most_RBS important_JJ single_JJ factor_NN in_IN the_DT preservation_NN of_IN good_JJ quality_NN during_IN storage_NN may_MD be_VB control_NN of_IN the_DT moisture_NN content_NN of_IN the_DT product_NN ._.
This_DT would_MD then_RB involve_VB the_DT initial_JJ pro_NN ._.

Although_IN a_DT number_NN of_IN tests_NNS were_VBD made_VBN ,_, there_EX is_VBZ but_CC one_CD case_NN in_IN which_WDT tuberculosis_NN of_IN the_DT mammary_JJ gland_NN was_VBD established_VBN by_IN cultural_JJ and_CC biological_JJ tests_NNS ._.
6_CD ._.

SECTION_NNP II_NNP ._.
SYSTEMATIC_NNP SURVEY_NNP After_IN Str_NNP ._.
agalactiae_RB as_IN a_DT cause_NN of_IN bovine_NN mastitis_NN in_IN India_NNP had_VBD been_VBN definitely_RB established_VBN ,_, it_PRP was_VBD decided_VBN to_TO institute_VB a_DT general_JJ survey_NN of_IN the_DT incidence_NN of_IN udder_JJ infections_NNS due_JJ to_TO this_DT organism_NN in_IN a_DT few_JJ organized_VBN dairy_NN herds_NNS ._.
The_DT results_NNS are_VBP shown_VBN in_IN Table_NNP I_PRP ._.
MATERIAL_NNP AND_NNP METHODS_NNP A_NNP total_NN of_IN 541_CD cows_NNS ,_, including_VBG four_CD buffaloes_NNS ,_, belonging_VBG to_TO 15_CD dairy_NN herds_NNS in_IN different_JJ parts_NNS of_IN the_DT northern_JJ India_NNP ,_, were_VBD examined_VBN ._.
The_DT 16_CD cows_NNS included_VBD as_IN Herd_NNP 13_CD really_RB consisted_VBN of_IN animals_NNS admitted_VBN to_TO the_DT Punjab_NNP Veterinary_NNP College_NNP from_IN various_JJ parts_NNS of_IN Lahore_NNP ;_: they_PRP are_VBP herded_VBN in_IN this_DT way_NN for_IN descriptive_JJ purposes_NNS ._.
Milk_NN samples_NNS were_VBD taken_VBN from_IN the_DT individual_JJ quarters_NNS of_IN nearly_RB all_DT cows_NNS available_JJ in_IN the_DT different_JJ herds_NNS ._.
In_IN a_DT few_JJ cases_NNS ,_, one_CD or_CC more_JJR teats_NNS were_VBD 'blind_NNP '_POS ,_, and_CC in_IN each_DT of_IN two_CD animals_NNS only_RB one_CD quarter_NN was_VBD available_JJ ._.
As_IN the_DT main_JJ object_NN was_VBD to_TO determine_VB the_DT incidence_NN of_IN Str_NNP ._.
agalactiae_JJ infections_NNS and_CC since_IN it_PRP was_VBD also_RB desired_VBN to_TO make_VB some_DT simultaneous_JJ observations_NNS on_IN the_DT incidence_NN of_IN Staph_NNP ._.
pyogenes_NNS infections_NNS ,_, the_DT cultural_JJ technique_NN employed_VBN was_VBD essentially_RB the_DT same_JJ as_IN that_DT used_VBN by_IN the_DT English_JJ workers_NNS [_JJ Minett_NNP ,_, 1934_CD ]_NN ,_, ._.
viz_NN ._.
to_TO centrifuge_VB about_IN 10_CD c.c_NN ._.
of_IN foremilk_NN collected_VBN cleanly_RB from_IN individual_JJ quarters_NNS and_CC to_TO sow_VB the_DT ._.
deposit_NN in_IN 5_CD per_IN cent_NN ox-blood_NN agar_NN plates_NNS ._.
As_IN a_DT rule_NN ,_, two_CD plates_NNS were_VBD made_VBN from_IN each_DT sample_NN ._.
In_IN the_DT first_JJ half_NN of_IN the_DT deposit_NN and_CC in_IN the_DT second_JJ one-tenth_NN of_IN this_DT amount_NN was_VBD taken_VBN ._.

Unless_IN otherwise_RB stated_VBN ,_, observations_NNS were_VBD made_VBN during_IN one_CD week_NN at_IN 37ºC_CD ._.

(_( a_DT )_) Str_NNP ._.

agalactiae_NN was_VBD not_RB encountered_VBN ._.

agalactiae_NNS were_VBD recovered_VBN from_IN five_CD of_IN 83_CD cows_NNS examined_VBN ._.

176_CD Bacteriology_NNP of_IN Bovine_NNP Mastitis_NNP in_IN India_NNP Haemolysis_NNP ._.
Str_NNP ._.
agalactiae_NN was_VBD easily_RB recognized_VBN ,_, by_IN the_DT comparatively_RB small_JJ width_NN ,_, and_CC weak_JJ charac-_JJ ter_NN of_IN the_DT ß-haemolytic_JJ zones_NNS about_IN the_DT deep_JJ colonies_NNS in_IN ox-blood_JJ agar_NN plates_NNS after_IN 24_CD hours_NNS incubation_NN ._.
Growth_NNP ._.
Growth_NN in_IN one_CD or_CC 5_CD per_IN cent_NN serum_NN broth_DT was_VBD moderately_RB abundant_JJ ,_, with_IN clear_JJ supernatant_NN and_CC floccular_JJ sediment_NN ,_, sometimes_RB faintly_RB pigmented_VBN ._.
The_DT sediment_NN was_VBD composed_VBN of_IN medium_NN to_TO long_JJ chains_NNS of_IN Gram-positive_JJ cocci_NN ._.
Hydrolysis_NN of_IN sodium_NN hippurate_NN ._.
This_DT reagent_NN was_VBD unmistakably_RB hydrolysed_VBN (_( usual_JJ ferric_NN chloride_NN test_NN ,_, with_IN unsown_JJ hippurate_NN broth_NN controls_NNS )_) ._.
Final_NNP pH_NN in_IN one_CD per_IN cent_NN glucose_NN broth_NN ._.
This_DT was_VBD generally_RB low_JJ ,_, towards_NNS 4.2_CD ._.
Litmus-milk_NN ._.
Fair_NNP inocula_NN produced_VBD rapid_JJ acidity_NN with_IN firm_NN clot_NN formation_NN within_IN 24_CD hours_NNS ,_, with_IN some_DT decolourization_NN at_IN the_DT bottom_NN ._.
On_IN further_JJ incu-_JJ bation_NN ,_, a_DT clear_JJ reddish_NN whey_NN was_VBD expressed_VBN ._.
Methylene_NNP blue-milk_NN ._.
Generally_RB ,_, the_DT results_NNS varied_VBD with_IN the_DT size_NN of_IN the_DT inoculum_NN ._.
Small_JJ inocula_NN failed_VBD to_TO grow_VB ._.
Heavy_NNP inocula_NN caused_VBD a_DT complete_JJ reduction_NN and_CC clot_NN formation_NN within_IN 24_CD hours_NNS ,_, followed_VBD later_RB by_IN progressive_JJ oxidation_NN from_IN the_DT top_NN ._.
Sugar_NNP reactions_NNS ._.

(_( b_NN )_) Str_NNP ._.

COMPARATIVE_NNP GENITAL_NNP ANATOMY_NNP Uterus_NNP ._.
Plate_NNP VI_NNP depicts_VBZ the_DT uterus_NN and_CC adjacent_JJ organs_NNS of_IN the_DT cow_NN and_CC buffalo_NN ._.
As_IN the_DT average_JJ Punjab_NNP buffalo_NN (_( Murrah_NNP type_NN )_) is_VBZ larger_JJR than_IN the_DT Punjab_NNP cow_NN (_( Sahiwal_NNP type_NN )_) ,_, so_RB is_VBZ the_DT former_JJ 's_POS uterus_NN generally_RB larger_JJR than_IN the_DT latter_NN 's_POS ._.
Table_JJ I_PRP gives_VBZ some_DT comparative_JJ mean_JJ measurement_NN of_IN these_DT organs_NNS The_DT organs_NNS also_RB differ_VBP considerably_RB in_IN their_PRP$ coloum_NN and_CC texture_NN ._.

The_DT tubes_NNS were_VBD hardened_VBN and_CC thickened_VBN suggesting_VBG chronicity_NN ._.

Five_CD other_JJ fallopian_JJ lesions_NNS were_VBD found_VBN in_IN the_DT buffalo_NN ;_: in_IN all_DT ,_, one_CD or_CC both_DT tubes_NNS were_VBD blind_RB at_IN the_DT ovarian_JJ end_NN ._.
In_IN four_CD the_DT uteri_NN were_VBD congested_VBN ,_, their_PRP$ horn_JJ tips_NNS being_VBG indurated_VBN and_CC cartilaginous_JJ with_IN the_DT lumen_NNS constricted_VBD (_( 2-3_JJ mm_NN ._.
diameter_NN )_) and_CC tortuous_JJ ._.
The_DT induration_NN formed_VBD a_DT separ-_JJ able_JJ core_NN in_IN the_DT horn_JJ tip_NN ._.
Ovarian_JJ abnorma-_JJ lities_NNS occurred_VBD in_IN four_CD of_IN these_DT specimens_NNS ._.
Williams_NNP [_NNP 1921_CD ]_NNP describing_VBG salpingitis_NN says_VBZ that_IN as_IN the_DT disease_NN progresses_VBZ ,_, the_DT pavilion_NN is_VBZ always_RB involved_VBN and_CC may_MD be_VB closed_VBN ,_, either_RB by_IN adhesions_NNS within_IN the_DT funnel_NN or_CC with_IN the_DT ovary_JJ ;_: the_DT ovary_NN may_MD then_RB become_VB encap-_JJ sulated_VBN in_IN the_DT ovarian_JJ pocket_NN ,_, and_CC the_DT tube_NN dis-_NN tended_VBD with_IN fluid_NN ._.
Williams_NNP denotes_VBZ the_DT condition_NN as_IN 'hydrosalpinx_NNP '_POS ._.
He_PRP believes_VBZ the_DT lesion_NN results_NNS from_IN metritis_NN and_CC associates_VBZ it_PRP with_IN cystic_JJ corpora_NNS lutea_NN ._.
The_DT authors_NNS '_POS specimens_NNS agree_VBP with_IN Williams_NNP '_POS description_NN as_IN to_TO the_DT occurrence_NN of_IN metritis_NN in_IN four_CD ,_, luteal_NN cysts_NNS in_IN one_CD and_CC encapsulation_NN of_IN the_DT ovary_JJ in_IN two_CD cases_NNS ._.
But_CC ,_, in_IN all_DT five_CD ,_, no_DT obvious_JJ inflam-_JJ mation_NN ,_, either_CC past_NN or_CC present_NN could_MD be_VB detected_VBN in_IN the_DT tubes_NNS ;_: the_DT blind_NN ends_NNS were_VBD usually_RB attached_VBN to_TO the_DT ovary_JJ normally_RB whilst_VBP ,_, on_IN resection_NN ,_, they_PRP were_VBD lined_VBN by_IN apparently_RB normal_JJ fimbriæ_NN ._.
This_DT is_VBZ unlike_IN Quinlan_NNP 's_POS [_NN 1929_CD ]_NNP description_NN who_WP writes_VBZ of_IN 'enlongated_VBN mucous_JJ folds_NNS occluding_VBG the_DT tube_NN and_CC forming_VBG septa_NN '_'' ._.

The_DT inflated_JJ portion_NN resembled_VBD ,_, in_IN miniature_NN ,_, a_DT child_NN 's_POS toy_JJ sausage_NN balloon_NN ,_, and_CC pneumosalpinx_NN seems_VBZ a_DT more_RBR descrip-_JJ tive_JJ name_NN ._.

6_CD BLOOD_NNP CHANGES_NNP IN_NNP CATTLE_NNP FED_NNP ON_NNP A_NNP PROTEIN-DEFICIENT_NNP DIET_NNP By_IN NARAIN_NNP DAS_NNP Kehar_NNP and_CC V.V.S_NNP ._.
MURTY_NNP ,_, Animal_NNP Nutrition_NNP Section_NNP ,_, Imperial_NNP Veterinary_NNP Research_NNP Institute_NNP ,_, Izatnagar_NNP (_( Received_VBN for_IN publication_NN on_IN 25_CD January_NNP 1945_CD )_) DEFICIENCY_NNP in_IN the_DT supply_NN of_IN protein_NN is_VBZ one_CD of_IN the_DT thief_NN limiting_VBG factors_NNS in_IN formulating_VBG balanced_JJ rations_NNS ._.
According_VBG to_TO Wright_NNP 's_POS [_JJ 1937_CD ]_JJ estimate_NN ,_, only_RB 0.079_CD lb_NN ._.
of_IN digestible_JJ crude_NN protein_NN is_VBZ available_JJ per_IN day_NN for_IN an_DT animal_JJ weighing_VBG 500_CD lb_NN ._.
as_IN compared_VBN with_IN the_DT normal_JJ requirements_NNS of_IN 0.3_CD lb_NN ._.
This_DT deficiency_NN is_VBZ aggravated_VBN in_IN times_NNS of_IN famine_NN and_CC war_NN ._.
During_IN the_DT first_JJ great_JJ war_NN ,_, oedema_NN ,_, which_WDT has_VBZ been_VBN ascribed_VBN by_IN Knack_NNP and_CC Neumann_NNP [_NNP 1917_CD ]_NNP ,_, Kohman_NNP [_VBZ 1920_CD ]_NN and_CC Maver_NNP [_NNP 1920_CD ]_NN to_TO lack_NN of_IN protein_NN in_IN the_DT diet_NN ,_, occurred_VBD among_IN the_DT famine-stricken_JJ population_NN of_IN Central_NNP Europe_NNP [_NNP Peters_NNP and_CC Van_NNP Slyke_NNP ,_, 1932_CD ]_NN ._.
Krishnan_NNP [_NN 1944_CD ]_NN also_RB observed_VBD it_PRP during_IN the_DT 1943_CD Bengal_NNP famine_NN ._.
In_IN our_PRP$ experimental_JJ animals_NNS ,_, oedema_NN of_IN the_DT feet_NNS and_CC eyelids_NNS was_VBD observed_VBN when_WRB they_PRP had_VBD been_VBN kept_VBN on_IN a_DT protein-deficient_JJ ration_NN for_IN about_IN three_CD months_NNS ._.
In_IN view_NN of_IN the_DT common_JJ prevalence_NN of_IN protein_JJ deficiency_NN in_IN livestock_NN in_IN India_NNP and_CC the_DT lack_NN of_IN information_NN on_IN blood_NN changes_NNS which_WDT could_MD be_VB used_VBN for_IN the_DT diagnosis_NN of_IN this_DT condition_NN ,_, a_DT systematic_JJ study_NN was_VBD made_VBN of_IN the_DT various_JJ blood_NN components_NNS of_IN cattle_NNS maintained_VBN on_IN a_DT low-nitrogen_JJ ration_NN for_IN a_DT considerable_JJ period_NN as_IN compared_VBN with_IN those_DT of_IN cattle_NNS on_IN a_DT normal_JJ ration_NN ._.
Details_NNS of_IN the_DT low-nitrogen_NN and_CC the_DT nitrogen-free_JJ rations_NNS used_VBN are_VBP given_VBN in_IN a_DT previous_JJ article_NN [_NNP Kehar_NNP Mukherjee_NNP and_CC Sen_NNP ,_, 1943_CD ]_NN ._.
Nine_NNP Hariana_NNP bullock_NN were_VBD maintained_VBN on_IN a_DT low-nitrogen_JJ ration_NN for_IN 29_CD day_NN and_CC subsequently_RB on_IN a_DT nitrogen-free_JJ ration_NN for_IN 2_CD days_NNS ._.
Prior_RB to_TO this_DT ,_, the_DT animals_NNS had_VBD been_VBN kep_VBN on_IN a_DT sub-maintenance_JJ level_NN of_IN protein_JJ allowance_NN for_IN about_RB two_CD months_NNS ._.
The_DT control_NN animals_NNS were_VBD fed_VBN on_IN a_DT balanced_JJ ration_NN ._.
Animals_NNS of_IN both_DT groups_NNS were_VBD adults_NNS and_CC apparently_RB in_IN good_JJ health_NN ._.
Blood_NN was_VBD drawn_VBN by_IN jugular_JJ puncture_NN after_IN 12_CD hours_NNS fasting_VBG ._.
The_DT following_JJ morphological_JJ and_CC chemical_JJ constituents_NNS were_VBD studied_VBN :_: Total_JJ red_JJ cells_NNS ,_, total_JJ and_CC differential_JJ white_JJ cell_NN counts_NNS ,_, cell_NN volume_NN ,_, hæmo_NN globin_NN ,_, iron_NN ,_, sugar_NN ,_, cholesterol_NN ,_, inorganic_JJ phosphorus_NN calcium_NN ,_, magnesium_NN ,_, total_JJ nitrogen_NN ,_, non-protein_JJ nitrogen_NN and_CC the_DT protein_NN fractions_NNS ._.
All_PDT the_DT mor_NN phological_JJ constituents_NNS were_VBD studied_VBN by_IN Napie_NNP and_CC Das_NNP Gupta_NNP 's_POS [_NN 1941_CD ]_NN methods_NNS ._.
Observations_NNS were_VBD made_VBN in_IN duplicate_NN and_CC the_DT average_JJ values_NNS are_VBP given_VBN in_IN Tables_NNP I_PRP to_TO III_NNP ._.
TABLE_NN I_PRP Blood_VBD constituents_NNS in_IN normal_JJ and_CC protein-deficient_JJ bullocks_NNS 184_CD Blood_NNP Changes_NNS in_IN Cattle_NNP fed_VBD on_IN protein-deficient_JJ diet_JJ Red_NNP cells_NNS ._.
The_DT average_JJ red_JJ cell_NN count_NN in_IN the_DT control_NN group_NN (_( Table_NNP I_PRP )_) was_VBD 7.7_CD millions_NNS (_( minimum_JJ 5.8_CD ;_: maximum_JJ 9.8_CD )_) ,_, while_IN that_DT in_IN the_DT protein-deficient_JJ group_NN was_VBD 6.48_CD millions_NNS (_( minimum_JJ 5.8_CD ;_: maximum_JJ 8.4_CD )_) per_IN c.mm_NN ._.
These_DT observations_NNS are_VBP in_IN confor-_JJ mity_NN with_IN those_DT of_IN Weech_NNP et_FW al_NN [_NN 1937_CD ]_NN on_IN dogs_NNS and_CC of_IN Kyer_NNP and_CC Bethal_NNP [_NNP 1938_CD ]_NN on_IN rats_NNS ,_, though_RB Orten_NNP and_CC Orten_NNP [_NNP 1940_CD ]_NNP found_VBD the_DT erythrocyte_NN count_NN to_TO be_VB nearly_RB normal_JJ in_IN rats_NNS fed_VBP on_IN a_DT low_JJ nitrogen_NN diet_NN from_IN the_DT time_NN of_IN weaning_VBG up_RP to_TO 100_CD days_NNS of_IN age_NN ._.

(_( minimum_JJ 5.7_CD :_: maximum_JJ 9.7_CD )_) in_IN normal_JJ animals_NNS as_IN compared_VBN with_IN 7.14_CD thousands_NNS (_( minimum_JJ 6.4_CD ;_: maximum_JJ 8.0_CD )_) in_IN the_DT low-protein_JJ group_NN (_( Table_NNP I_PRP )_) ._.
White_NNP cell_NN per_IN cent_NN distribution_NN ._.
From_IN a_DT perusal_NN of_IN the_DT differential_JJ leucocytic_JJ counts_NNS in_IN Table_NNP I_PRP ,_, it_PRP appears_VBZ that_IN there_EX is_VBZ no_DT significant_JJ difference_NN between_IN the_DT normal_JJ and_CC the_DT protein-deficient_JJ group_NN except_IN in_IN eosinophiles_NNS ._.
Ordinarily_RB ,_, it_PRP might_MD indicate_VB helminthiasis_NN ,_, but_CC repeated_VBD examinations_NNS of_IN the_DT faeces_NNS of_IN the_DT animals_NNS revealed_VBD no_DT helminth_JJ ova_NN ._.
Cell_NNP volume_NN ._.
The_DT average_JJ cell_NN volume_NN per_IN cent_NN (_( Table_NNP I_PRP )_) was_VBD 50.6_CD (_( minimum_JJ 43_CD ;_: maximum_JJ 57_CD )_) in_IN the_DT normal_JJ animals_NNS and_CC 45.4_CD (_( minimum_JJ 37_CD ;_: maximum_JJ 58_CD )_) in_IN the_DT protein-deficient_JJ animals_NNS ._.
The_DT results_NNS obtained_VBN by_IN Shelburne_NNP [_NNP 1934_CD ]_NNP and_CC Weech_NNP et_VBP al_NN [_NN 1937_CD ]_NN in_IN dogs_NNS ,_, Kyer_NNP and_CC Bethall_NNP [_NNP 1938_CD ]_NNP in_IN rats_NNS are_VBP in_IN agreement_NN with_IN our_PRP$ findings_NNS on_IN bullocks_NNS ._.
Corpuscular_JJ values_NNS ._.
The_DT average_JJ values_NNS for_IN mean_JJ corpuscular_JJ volume_NN ,_, mean_JJ corpuscular_NN hæmoglobin_NN ,_, and_CC mean_VB corpuscular_JJ hæmoglobin_NN concentration_NN (_( Table_NNP I_PRP )_) are_VBP 68.7_CD Cu_NNP µ_NNP (_( minimum_JJ 43.8_CD ;_: maximum_JJ 86.2_CD )_) ,_, 14.9_CD NARAIN_NNP DAS_NNP KEHAR_NNP AND_NNP V._NNP V._NNP S._NNP MURTY_NNP 185_CD Total_NNP cholesterol_NN ._.
For_IN cholesterol_NN estimation_NN the_DT technique_NN described_VBN by_IN Banerji_NNP [_NNP 1933_CD ]_NNP was_VBD followed_VBN ._.
The_DT average_JJ values_NNS for_IN cholesterol_NN (_( Table_NNP II_NNP )_) fell_VBD from_IN 186_CD mg._NNS per_IN cent_NN in_IN the_DT control_NN group_NN to_TO 115_CD mg._NN in_IN the_DT low_JJ protein_NN group_NN ._.
Shelburne_NNP [_NN 1934_CD ]_NN and_CC Page_NNP et_VBD al_NN ._.
[_NN 1937_CD ]_NN ,_, however_RB ,_, found_VBD that_IN the_DT change_NN from_IN normal_JJ to_TO low_JJ protein_NN diet_NN had_VBD no_DT consistent_JJ effect_NN on_IN the_DT cholesterol_NN content_NN of_IN the_DT blood_NN ._.
Calcium_NN ._.
Serum_NNP calcium_NN was_VBD determined_VBN by_IN Clark_NNP and_CC Collip_NNP 's_POS [_NN 1925_CD ]_NNP modification_NN of_IN Kramer_NNP and_CC Tisdall_NNP 's_POS [_NN 1921_CD ]_NN method_NN ._.
The_DT average_JJ values_NNS for_IN serum_NN calcium_NN as_IN shown_VBN in_IN Table_NNP II_NNP are_VBP 10.4_CD (_( minimum_JJ 9.4_CD ;_: maximum_JJ 11.2_CD )_) mg._NN per_IN cent_NN in_IN the_DT control_NN group_NN and_CC 9.7_CD (_( minimum_JJ 8.2_CD ;_: maximum_JJ 10.3_CD )_) mg._NN per_IN cent_NN in_IN the_DT protein-deficient_JJ group_NN ._.

[_JJ 1930-_JJ 31_CD ]_NN with_IN young_JJ women_NNS on_IN low-nitrogen_JJ diet_NN ._.

Protein_NNP fractions_NNS ._.
Serum_NNP protein_NN fractions_NNS were_VBD estimated_VBN by_IN the_DT method_NN devised_VBN by_IN Campbell_NNP and_CC Hanna_NNP [_NNP 1937_CD ]_NN with_IN slight_JJ modifications_NNS adopted_VBN by_IN Kehar_NNP et_CC al_NN ._.
[_NN 1940_CD ]_NN ._.
TABLE_NNP III_NNP Serum-protein_NNP fractions_NNS in_IN normal_JJ and_CC protein-deficient_JJ bullocks_NNS (_( gm_NN ._.
per_IN cent_NN )_) 186_CD Methods_NNS of_IN Yoking_VBG Bullocks_NNP both_CC the_DT euglobulin_NN and_CC pseudoglobulin_NN I_PRP farctions_NNS are_VBP less_RBR in_IN the_DT protein-deficient_NN than_IN in_IN the_DT control_NN group_NN ._.
Since_IN globulins_NNS are_VBP associated_VBN with_IN the_DT maintenance_NN of_IN body_NN integrity_NN ,_, it_PRP may_MD be_VB that_IN the_DT decreased_JJ amounts_NNS of_IN these_DT immunologically_RB active_JJ fractions_NNS in_IN protein_JJ deficiency_NN render_VB the_DT animals_NNS more_RBR susceptible_JJ to_TO infection_NN ._.
SUMMARY_NNP Observations_NNS on_IN the_DT morphological_JJ and_CC chemical_JJ constituents_NNS of_IN the_DT blood_NN of_IN normal_JJ cattle_NNS and_CC of_IN those_DT fed_VBN on_IN a_DT protein-deficient_JJ diet_NN are_VBP presented_VBN ._.
It_PRP has_VBZ been_VBN found_VBN that_IN the_DT red_JJ cells_NNS ,_, white_JJ cells_NNS ,_, cell_NN volume_NN ,_, sugar_NN ,_, haemoglobin_NN ,_, iron_NN ,_, total_JJ choleste-_JJ rol_NN ,_, calcium_NN ,_, inorganic_JJ phosphorus_NN ,_, magnesium_NN ,_, non-_JJ protein_NN nitrogen_NN and_CC the_DT protein_NN fractions_NNS are_VBP decreased_VBN in_IN protein-deficient_JJ animals_NNS ._.

This_DT was_VBD done_VBN by_IN gearing_VBG the_DT rear_NN wheels_NNS to_TO a_DT rotary_JJ pump_NN and_CC then_RB regulating_VBG the_DT discharge_NN from_IN the_DT pump_NN to_TO produce_VB the_DT desired_JJ resistance_NN ._.
This_DT regulation_NN was_VBD made_VBN automatic_JJ by_IN connecting_VBG the_DT valve_NN so_IN that_IN it_PRP is_VBZ operated_VBN by_IN a_DT change_NN in_IN the_DT height_NN of_IN the_DT weights_NNS relative_VBP to_TO the_DT frame_NN ._. '_''
'When_'' the_DT weights_NNS are_VBP at_IN the_DT bottom_NN the_DT valve_NN is_VBZ closed_VBN and_CC the_DT rear_NN wheels_NNS are_VBP locked_VBN ._.
As_IN the_DT weights_NNS are_VBP lifted_VBN the_DT valve_NN gradually_RB opens_VBZ until_IN at_IN the_DT top_JJ it_PRP is_VBZ wide_JJ open_JJ and_CC the_DT pump_NN furnishes_VBZ a_DT minimum_NN of_IN resistance_NN ._.
In_IN action_NN this_DT automatic_JJ control_NN allows_VBZ the_DT dynamometer_NN to_TO move_VB just_RB fast_RB enough_RB to_TO keep_VB the_DT weights_NNS suspended_VBD whenever_WRB the_DT team_NN is_VBZ moving_VBG ._.
The_DT condition_NN of_IN the_DT road_NN surface_NN or_CC the_DT grade_NN does_VBZ not_RB affect_VB the_DT amount_NN of_IN work_NN done_VBN by_IN the_DT team_NN but_CC merely_RB requires_VBZ that_IN more_RBR or_CC less_JJR resistance_NN must_MD be_VB furnished_VBN by_IN the_DT pump_NN ._.
The_DT tractive_JJ pull_NN exerted_VBN by_IN the_DT team_NN is_VBZ constant_JJ and_CC equal_JJ to_TO the_DT sum_NN of_IN the_DT weights_NNS which_WDT are_VBP held_VBN sus-_JJ pended_VBN ._. '_''
'In_POS action_NN ,_, then_RB ,_, the_DT tractive_JJ force_NN required_VBN to_TO move_VB the_DT dynamometer_NN (_( variable_JJ )_) plus_CC the_DT resistance_NN furnished_VBN by_IN the_DT pump_NN (_( governed_VBN by_IN position_NN of_IN weights_NNS )_) is_VBZ equal_JJ to_TO the_DT tractive_JJ pull_NN exerted_VBN by_IN the_DT team_NN (_( constant_JJ )_) ._.
The_DT dynamometer_NN ,_, of_IN course_NN ,_, has_VBZ practical_JJ limits_NNS ._.
On_IN slippery_NN roads_NNS it_PRP is_VBZ difficult_JJ to_TO get_VB enough_JJ traction_NN for_IN the_DT wheels_NNS ,_, in_IN which_WDT case_NN the_DT weights_NNS would_MD not_RB be_VB lifted_VBN and_CC the_DT team_NN would_MD be_VB exerting_VBG a_DT tractive_JJ force_NN something_NN less_JJR than_IN the_DT weights_NNS ._.

This_DT may_MD readily_RB occur_VB if_IN only_RB a_DT light_JJ load_NN were_VBD applied_VBN ._.

5_CD and_CC 6_CD ._.

This_DT machine_NN has_VBZ a_DT maximum_JJ capacity_NN of_IN 4,100_CD pounds_NNS tractive_JJ pull_NN and_CC a_DT total_JJ weight_NN of_IN 10,000_CD pounds_NNS ._. '_''
'The_CD machine_NN shown_VBN in_IN figs_NNS ._.

The_DT large_JJ weights_NNS used_VBN are_VBP cast_JJ iron_NN disks_NNS weighing_VBG 250_CD pounds_NNS each_DT ._.
As_IN many_JJ of_IN these_DT as_IN desired_NN may_MD be_VB attached_VBN to_TO the_DT lifting_VBG cable_NN ._.

A_DT special_JJ sprocket_NN attaches_NNS to_TO the_DT rear_NN of_IN the_DT worm_NN shaft_NN and_CC drives_VBZ the_DT pump_NN by_IN means_NNS of_IN a_DT roller_NN chain_NN ._.
The_DT lever_NN operating_VBG the_DT pump_NN discharge-valve_NN is_VBZ connected_VBN to_TO the_DT weights_NNS ,_, so_IN that_IN the_DT valve_NN is_VBZ closed_VBN when_WRB the_DT weights_NNS are_VBP resting_VBG on_IN the_DT frame_NN and_CC wide_JJ -open_NN when_WRB the_DT weights_NNS are_VBP at_IN the_DT top_NN of_IN their_PRP$ guides_NNS ._.

The_DT height_NN at_IN which_WDT the_DT weights_NNS are_VBP carried_VBN depends_VBZ upon_IN the_DT speed_NN of_IN the_DT team_NN ,_, the_DT amount_NN of_IN weights_NNS attached_VBN and_CC the_DT road_NN surface_NN ,_, but_CC is_VBZ of_IN no_DT importance_NN as_RB long_RB as_IN the_DT weights_NNS are_VBP not_RB touching_VBG either_CC the_DT top_JJ or_CC bottom_NN of_IN the_DT guides_NNS ._. This_DT pro-_JJ vides_NNS six_CD forward_RB speeds_NNS for_IN transporting_VBG the_DT machine_NN ,_, and_CC the_DT power_NN take_VB off_RP provides_VBZ a_DT more_RBR suitable_JJ method_NN of_IN driving_VBG the_DT pump_NN ;_: otherwise_RB no_DT important_JJ changes_NNS have_VBP been_VBN made_VBN ._.

It_PRP will_MD be_VB noted_VBN that_IN the_DT first_JJ dynamometer_NN car_NN described_VBN by_IN Collins_NNP and_CC Caine_NNP and_CC those_DT described_VBN by_IN European_JJ workers_NNS are_VBP designed_VBN to_TO give_VB working_VBG loads_NNS ._.
The_DT two_CD latter_NN described_VBN by_IN Collins_NNP and_CC Caine_NNP are_VBP designed_VBN primarily_RB to_TO test_VB maximum_JJ draft_NN ability_NN ,_, though_IN by_IN suitable_JJ adjustment_NN it_PRP is_VBZ possible_JJ to_TO use_VB them_PRP for_IN smaller_JJR loads_NN also_RB ._.
Broady_NNP and_CC fellow_JJ workers_NNS used_VBD a_DT tread_NN mill_NN apparatus_VBN instead_RB of_IN a_DT loading_NN car_NN ,_, which_WDT they_PRP have_VBP described_VBN in_IN Missouri_NNP Bulletins_NNP 209_CD and_CC 383_CD ._.
The_DT principle_NN of_IN the_DT tread_NN mill_NN is_VBZ that_IN the_DT backward_NN push_NN of_IN the_DT animal_NN 's_POS feet_NNS tends_VBZ to_TO move_VB the_DT travelling_NN belt_NN on_IN which_WDT the_DT animal_NN stands_NNS ._.
This_DT allows_VBZ the_DT animal_NN to_TO stand_VB in_IN one_CD place_NN ,_, which_WDT may_MD be_VB under_IN a_DT shelter_NN ._.
In_IN this_DT way_NN it_PRP is_VBZ possible_JJ to_TO have_VB a_DT uniform_JJ unvarying_JJ footing_NN on_IN which_WDT the_DT animal_NN works_NNS and_CC which_WDT is_VBZ independent_JJ of_IN weather_JJ conditions_NNS ._.
They_PRP first_RB experimented_VBD with_IN loading_VBG the_DT animal_NN by_IN using_VBG the_DT tread_NN mill_NN to_TO drive_VB an_DT oil_NN pump_NN in_IN the_DT same_JJ way_NN as_IN was_VBD used_VBN on_IN the_DT Iowa_NNP loading_NN car_NN by_IN Collins_NNP and_CC Caine_NNP ._.

They_PRP later_RB loaded_VBD the_DT animal_NN by_IN making_VBG it_PRP lift_JJ weights_NNS ._.
M._NNP A_NNP ._.
Sharp_JJ described_VBD a_DT simple_JJ traction_NN dyna-_JJ mometer_NN for_IN maximum_JJ draft_NN tests_NNS in_IN Vol_NNP ._.
22_CD ,_, No_DT ._.
1_CD ,_, dated_VBN January_NNP 1941_CD ,_, of_IN the_DT Agricultural_NNP Engineering_NNP Journal_NNP ._.
This_DT consists_VBZ essentially_RB of_IN a_DT two-wheeled_JJ cart_NN made_VBN from_IN the_DT back_JJ axle_NN of_IN a_DT lorry_NN or_CC car_NN with_IN a_DT platform_NN and_CC draft_NN rig_NN added_VBD to_TO it_PRP ._.
It_PRP also_RB carries_VBZ a_DT roller_NN ,_, on_IN which_WDT a_DT rope_NN can_MD be_VB wound_VBN ,_, fitted_VBN with_IN brake_NN drums_NNS and_CC brakes_NNS ,_, which_WDT ,_, when_WRB tightened_VBN ,_, resist_VB the_DT rotation_NN of_IN the_DT roller_NN ._.
The_DT roller_NN is_VBZ also_RB geared_VBN to_TO a_DT device_NN ,_, such_JJ as_IN a_DT car_NN jack_NN ,_, which_WDT can_MD be_VB used_VBN to_TO progressively_RB set_VB the_DT brakes_NNS as_IN the_DT roller_NN revolves_NNS ._.
Rotation_NN of_IN the_DT roller_NN is_VBZ secured_VBN by_IN un-_JJ winding_VBG the_DT rope_NN ,_, the_DT other_JJ end_NN of_IN which_WDT is_VBZ fastened_VBN to_TO a_DT tree_NN or_CC stake_NN ._.
The_DT apparatus_NN is_VBZ prepared_VBN for_IN a_DT test_NN by_IN winding_VBG the_DT rope_NN on_IN the_DT roller_NN with_IN the_DT brakes_NNS slack_NN and_CC the_DT team_NN or_CC single_JJ animal_NN hitched_VBD to_TO the_DT C_NNP 190_CD Methods_NNP of_IN Yoking_VBG Bullocks_NNP car_NN ._.
As_IN the_DT animal_JJ moves_NNS forward_RB ,_, the_DT rope_NN is_VBZ pulled_VBN off_RP the_DT roller_NN ,_, setting_VBG the_DT brakes_NNS and_CC increasing_VBG the_DT resistance_NN to_TO rotation_NN of_IN the_DT roller_NN ._.
As_IN the_DT car_NN can_MD only_RB move_VB forward_RB as_IN the_DT rope_NN is_VBZ allowed_VBN to_TO unwind_VB from_IN the_DT roller_NN ,_, increasing_VBG the_DT resistance_NN to_TO rotation_NN of_IN the_DT roller_NN also_RB increases_VBZ the_DT resistance_NN to_TO forward_VB movement_NN of_IN the_DT car_NN ._.
The_DT animal_NN or_CC animals_NNS continue_VBP to_TO go_VB forward_RB till_VB the_DT resistance_NN of_IN the_DT car_NN equals_VBZ the_DT effort_NN they_PRP can_MD or_CC will_MD exert_VB under_IN the_DT degree_NN of_IN urging_VBG applied_VBN ._.
In_IN this_DT case_NN the_DT pull_NN rises_VBZ continuously_RB to_TO a_DT maximum_JJ and_CC must_MD be_VB measured_VBN by_IN some_DT indicating_NN or_CC recording_VBG device_NN interposed_VBN in_IN the_DT hitch_NN from_IN the_DT animals_NNS to_TO the_DT car_NN ._.
There_EX is_VBZ somewhat_RB more_JJR literature_NN on_IN recording_VBG apparatus_NN for_IN measuring_VBG draft_NN ._.
Most_JJS commercial_JJ apparatus_NN available_JJ is_VBZ very_RB expensive_JJ and_CC not_RB avail-_JJ able_JJ in_IN India_NNP and_CC difficult_JJ to_TO import_VB in_IN wartime_NN ._.

The_DT bibliography_NN at_IN the_DT end_NN of_IN this_DT report_NN gives_VBZ references_NNS to_TO various_JJ articles_NNS on_IN recording_VBG apparatus_NN ._.
EXPERIMENTAL_JJ PROCEDURE_NNP The_DT decision_NN as_IN to_TO which_WDT type_NN of_IN apparatus_NN to_TO use_VB was_VBD difficult_JJ ._.
It_PRP was_VBD finally_RB decided_VBN to_TO use_VB two_CD types_NNS of_IN apparatus_NN for_IN the_DT different_JJ parts_NNS of_IN the_DT ex-_JJ periment_NN ._.

It_PRP was_VBD recognised_VBN that_IN animals_NNS do_VBP not_RB ,_, when_WRB doing_VBG ordinary_JJ work_NN ,_, continuously_RB exert_VBZ the_DT maximum_JJ power_NN of_IN which_WDT they_PRP are_VBP capable_JJ ._.
A_DT commonly_RB accepted_JJ standard_NN for_IN loading_VBG horses_NNS is_VBZ that_IN the_DT ordinary_JJ draft_NN should_MD not_RB exceed_VB one-tenth_NN of_IN the_DT live_JJ weight_NN ._.

'_''

We_PRP found_VBD no_DT method_NN of_IN testing_VBG the_DT state_NN of_IN fatigue_NN and_CC no_DT standard_JJ maximum_NN state_NN of_IN fatigue_NN which_WDT an_DT animal_NN could_MD bear_VB ._.

Such_JJ effects_NNS ordinarily_RB only_RB show_VB up_RP after_IN long_RB periods_NNS ,_, too_RB long_RB at_IN least_JJS for_IN us_PRP to_TO use_VB them_PRP for_IN purposes_NNS of_IN this_DT research_NN ._.

'_'' ._.

VAUGH_NNP 191_CD The_DT applicability_NN of_IN the_DT maximum_JJ pull_NN to_TO testing_VBG of_IN yokes_NNS seems_VBZ even_RB more_RBR definite_JJ ._.

No_DT ._.

These_DT measurements_NNS do_VBP not_RB give_VB any_DT very_RB clear_JJ clue_NN to_TO why_WRB one_CD yoke_NN is_VBZ better_RBR or_CC worse_JJR than_IN another_DT ._.
The_DT two_CD worst_JJS yokes_NNS according_VBG to_TO these_DT tests_NNS showed_VBD the_DT largest_JJS and_CC the_DT smallest_JJS areas_NNS in_IN contact_NN with_IN the_DT neck_NN ._.

Various_JJ methods_NNS were_VBD tried_JJ and_CC none_NN was_VBD found_VBN very_RB satisfactory_JJ ._.
The_DT method_NN finally_RB adopted_VBN was_VBD to_TO smear_VB the_DT yoke_NN with_IN lamp_JJ black_JJ mixed_JJ with_IN oil_NN ;_: then_RB the_DT yoke_NN was_VBD carefully_RB placed_VBN on_IN the_DT neck_NN and_CC pressed_VBD firmly_RB down_RB and_CC back_RB to_TO get_VB an_DT impression_NN ._.

CONCLUSIONS_NNP 1_CD ._.

3_CD ._.
