[_NN 1908_CD ]_NN observed_VBD that_IN when_WRB calcium_NN and_CC phosphorus_NN were_VBD deficient_JJ in_IN quantity_NN in_IN food_NN ,_, the_DT skeletal_JJ tissues_NNS appeared_VBD to_TO be_VB the_DT ready_JJ source_NN of_IN supply_NN for_IN milk_NN secreted_VBN and_CC there_EX was_VBD consider-_JJ able_JJ output_NN of_IN these_DT elements_NNS from_IN the_DT gut_NN ._.
If_IN conditions_NNS of_IN negative_JJ balances_NNS continued_VBD for_IN a_DT long_JJ time_NN a_DT slow_JJ shrinkage_NN in_IN milk_NN flow_NN results_NNS ,_, but_CC there_EX was_VBD no_DT physiological_JJ disturbance_NN ._.
In_IN their_PRP$ later_JJ observations_NNS [_VBP 1920_CD ]_NN ,_, they_PRP reported_VBD a_DT serious_JJ effect_NN on_IN reproduction_NN ._.
Even_RB though_IN Forbes_NNP et_CC al_NN ._.
[_JJ 1916-18_JJ ]_NN in_IN their_PRP$ experiments_NNS provided_VBN for_IN an_DT ample_JJ intake_NN of_IN calcium_NN and_CC phosphorus_NN in_IN rich_JJ diet_JJ containing_VBG S._NNP V._NNP DESAI_NNP AND_NNP M._NNP L._NNP MATHUR_NNP 199_CD alfalfa_NN hay_NN and_CC salts_NNS ,_, larger_JJR amounts_NNS were_VBD eliminated_VBN than_IN were_VBD ingested_VBN ._.
Meigs_NNP ,_, Blatherwick_NNP ,_, and_CC Cary_NNP [_NNP 1919_CD ]_NNP found_VBD that_IN dry_JJ pregnant_JJ cows_NNS were_VBD not_RB assi-_JJ milating_VBG calcium_NN from_IN calcium-rich_JJ rations_NNS ,_, but_CC were_VBD actually_RB transferring_VBG calcium_NN ,_, salts_NNS from_IN their_PRP$ skeleton_NN for_IN building_VBG the_DT foetal_JJ skeleton_NN ._.
Hart_NNP ,_, Steenbock_NNP and_CC Hoppert_NNP [_NNP 1921_CD ]_NNP observed_VBD that_IN in_IN dry_JJ and_CC milking_VBG goats_NNS calcium_JJ assimilation_NN was_VBD greater_JJR when_WRB green_JJ instead_RB of_IN dry_JJ oats_NNS were_VBD fed_VBN ._.
Cod_NNP liver_NN oil_NN (_( 5-10_JJ c.c_NN ._.
per_IN day_NN )_) consistently_RB changed_VBN a_DT negative_JJ to_TO a_DT positive_JJ balance_NN ._.
Hart_NNP el_VBZ al_NN ._.
[_NN 1922_CD ]_NN found_VBD that_IN high-yielding_JJ cows_NNS were_VBD maintained_VBN in_IN positive_JJ calcium_NN and_CC phosphorus_NN balance_NN on_IN dry_JJ alfalfa_NN hay_NN ,_, corn_NN silage_NN and_CC grain_NN mixture_NN ._.
Their_PRP$ subsequent_JJ findings_NNS [_IN 1922_CD ]_NN ,_, in_IN which_WDT timothy_JJ hay_NN was_VBD used_VBN ,_, are_VBP not_RB in_IN harmony_NN with_IN the_DT observations_NNS quoted_VBN above_IN ._.
Bone-meal_JJ supplement_NN did_VBD not_RB bring_VB about_RB positive_JJ balance_NN ._.
Forbes_NNP et_CC al_NN ._.
[_NN 1922_CD ]_NN found_VBD that_IN the_DT calcium_NN of_IN the_DT bones_NNS was_VBD more_RBR readily_RB available_JJ for_IN purposes_NNS of_IN milk_NN elaboration_NN than_IN the_DT calcium_NN of_IN the_DT rations_NNS and_CC the_DT mineral_JJ supplement_NN ._.
They_PRP came_VBD to_TO the_DT conclusion_NN that_IN calcium_NN meta-_JJ bolism_NN was_VBD characterized_VBN by_IN its_PRP$ rapid_JJ loss_NN from_IN the_DT body_NN during_IN early_JJ period_NN of_IN lactation_NN and_CC its_PRP$ reten-_JJ tion_NN during_IN the_DT dry_JJ period_NN with_IN most_JJS rapid_JJ storage_NN at_IN the_DT end_NN of_IN the_DT period_NN of_IN gestation_NN ._.
At_IN the_DT time_NN of_IN high_JJ milk_NN production_NN ,_, if_IN the_DT food_NN was_VBD sufficient_JJ to_TO maintain_VB the_DT life_NN of_IN the_DT cow_NN ,_, she_PRP would_MD produce_VB milk_NN ,_, even_RB though_IN this_DT involved_VBN an_DT extensive_JJ drain_NN upon_IN the_DT tissues_NNS of_IN her_PRP$ body_NN ._.
Hart_NNP et_CC al_NN ._.
[_JJ 1922-23_JJ ]_NN took_VBD up_RP the_DT work_NN again_RB and_CC found_VBD phosphorus_RB equi-_JJ librium_NN was_VBD maintained_VBN without_IN ,_, and_CC calcium_NN equilibrium_NN with_IN ,_, bone-meal_JJ and_CC green_JJ grass_NN supple-_JJ ment_NN ._.
The_DT cows_NNS of_IN the_DT Sahiwal_NNP herd_NN at_IN our_PRP$ dairy_NN farm_NN were_VBD reported_VBN to_TO be_VB licking_VBG earth_NN while_IN grazing_VBG ._.
As_IN the_DT cows_NNS were_VBD fed_VBN with_IN protein-rich_JJ concentrates_NNS ,_, green_JJ fodder_NN and_CC mineral_JJ mixture_NN as_IN 'Churn_FW Flour_NNP '_POS this_DT habit_NN of_IN theirs_NNS could_MD not_RB be_VB explained_VBN ._.
The_DT earth_NN was_VBD analysed_VBN ,_, but_CC nothing_NN particular_NN was_VBD discovered_VBN ,_, which_WDT could_MD account_VB for_IN this_DT peculiar_JJ habit_NN and_CC it_PRP was_VBD suspected_VBN that_IN probably_RB more_JJR calcium_NN and_CC phosphorus_NN were_VBD excreted_VBN by_IN our_PRP$ cows_NNS than_IN they_PRP were_VBD ingesting_VBG from_IN the_DT feeds_NNS ._.
The_DT present_JJ investigation_NN was_VBD undertaken_VBN to_TO ascertain_VB if_IN there_EX was_VBD variation_NN in_IN the_DT percentage_NN ratio_NN and_CC total_JJ output_NN of_IN calcium_NN and_CC phosphorus_NN in_IN relation_NN to_TO the_DT yield_NN of_IN milk_NN ,_, age_NN and_CC stage_NN of_IN lactation_NN in_IN the_DT case_NN of_IN the_DT Sahiwal_NNP breed_NN of_IN cows_NNS and_CC if_IN so_RB to_TO what_WP extent_NN ._.
The_DT above_JJ factors_NNS in_IN relation_NN to_TO dry_VB and_CC green_JJ fodder_NN were_VBD also_RB examined_VBN ._.
EXPERIMENTAL_NNP Preliminary_NNP experiments_NNS were_VBD carried_VBN out_IN to_TO study_VB the_DT suitability_NN of_IN methods_NNS of_IN analysis_NN and_CC to_TO ascer-_JJ tain_NN (_( i_NN )_) whether_IN there_EX was_VBD any_DT variation_NN in_IN the_DT per-_JJ centage_NN of_IN calcium_NN and_CC phosphorus_NN in_IN the_DT different_JJ milkings_NNS of_IN the_DT day_NN and_CC whether_IN these_DT differed_VBN from_IN that_DT found_VBN in_IN a_DT composite_JJ sample_NN of_IN the_DT day_NN 's_POS milk_NN ,_, (_( ii_NN )_) whether_IN the_DT total_JJ amount_NN of_IN calcium_NN and_CC phosphorus_NN in_IN all_DT four_CD milkings_NNS differed_VBN from_IN that_DT calculated_VBN from_IN the_DT composite_JJ sample_NN ,_, (_( iii_NN )_) whether_IN the_DT ratio_NN CaO_NNP :_: P2O5_NNP was_VBD constant_JJ ,_, and_CC (_( iv_NN )_) whether_IN there_EX was_VBD any_DT change_NN in_IN the_DT percentage_NN of_IN calcium_NN and_CC phosphorus_NN in_IN the_DT day-to-day_JJ milk_NN ._.
For_IN this_DT purpose_NN ,_, three_CD high_NN and_CC three_CD low_JJ milk-_JJ ing_NN cows_NNS ,_, first_RB calver_NN ,_, second_JJ calver_NN and_CC adult_NN ,_, all_DT in_IN the_DT same_JJ stages_NNS of_IN lactation_NN (_( 8th_CD week_NN )_) ,_, were_VBD selected_VBN ._.

per_IN lb_NN ._.

milk_NN was_VBD taken_VBN out_RP with_IN a_DT pipette_NN in_IN a_DT 100_CD c.c_NN ._.

was_VBD weighed_VBN in_IN a_DT tared_JJ weighing_NN bottle_NN ._.

of_IN milk_NN was_VBD used_VBN ,_, as_IN the_DT difference_NN in_IN day-to-day_JJ weight_NN was_VBD not_RB very_RB much_RB ._.

For_IN comprehensive_JJ studies_NNS ,_, 12_CD high-milking_NN and_CC 12_CD low-milking_JJ cows_NNS of_IN different_JJ ages_NNS and_CC in_IN the_DT various_JJ stages_NNS of_IN lactation_NN were_VBD selected_VBN ._.
The_DT lactation_NN of_IN some_DT of_IN these_DT cows_NNS commenced_VBD before_IN they_PRP calved_VBD ._.

DISCUSSION_NNP Premilkers_NNP ._.
In_IN the_DT case_NN of_IN 'Felbir_NNP '_POS (_( first_JJ calver_NN )_) ,_, the_DT percentage_NN of_IN calcium_NN was_VBD low_JJ in_IN the_DT premilk_NN and_CC it_PRP tended_VBD to_TO increase_VB up_RP to_TO the_DT time_NN of_IN calving_VBG ._.
The_DT tendency_NN to_TO increase_VB continued_VBN for_IN about_RB a_DT week_NN after_IN calving_VBG and_CC then_RB it_PRP remained_VBD constant_JJ ._.
On_IN the_DT other_JJ hand_NN ,_, the_DT percentage_NN of_IN phosphorus_NN was_VBD very_RB high_JJ in_IN the_DT premilk_NN and_CC the_DT tendency_NN was_VBD to_TO fall_VB immediately_RB after_IN calving_VBG ;_: the_DT decrease_NN continued_VBD for_IN about_IN a_DT week_NN or_CC two_CD and_CC then_RB it_PRP tended_VBD to_TO remain_VB stable_JJ ._.
The_DT percentage_NN of_IN calcium_NN in-_NN creased_VBD from_IN 0.165_CD to_TO 0.187_CD in_IN four_CD weeks_NNS time_NN whereas_IN the_DT percentage_NN of_IN phosphorus_NN fell_VBD from_IN 0.33_CD to_TO 0.225_CD ._.
The_DT ratio_NN in_IN the_DT premilk_NN was_VBD as_RB high_JJ as_IN 1_CD :_: 2.0_CD ;_: when_WRB the_DT percentage_NN of_IN calcium_NN and_CC phosphorus_NN tended_VBD to_TO remain_VB constant_JJ after_IN calving_VBG ,_, the_DT ratio_NN was_VBD 1_CD :_: 1.2_CD ._.
The_DT yield_NN of_IN premilk_NN was_VBD from_IN 4.5_CD to_TO 16_CD pounds_NNS per_IN day_NN ._.
In_IN case_NN of_IN second_JJ calver_NN ,_, 'Narajkhati_'' '_'' ,_, the_DT exami-_JJ nation_NN of_IN milk_NN was_VBD started_VBN from_IN the_DT very_RB first_JJ day_NN of_IN taking_VBG out_RP the_DT premilk_NN ._.
In_IN the_DT beginning_VBG the_DT yield_NN was_VBD half_PDT a_DT pound_NN only_RB ,_, but_CC later_RB rose_VBD to_TO 8_CD pounds_NNS per_IN day_NN before_IN calving_VBG ._.
The_DT percentage_NN of_IN calcium_NN was_VBD very_RB low_JJ in_IN the_DT beginning_NN and_CC tended_VBD to_TO increase_VB as_IN the_DT time_NN of_IN calving_VBG approached_VBN ;_: it_PRP continued_VBD to_TO increase_VB gradually_RB for_IN a_DT week_NN or_CC two_CD and_CC tended_VBD to_TO remain_VB constant_JJ ._.
On_IN the_DT other_JJ hand_NN the_DT percentage_NN of_IN phosphorus_NN was_VBD high_JJ in_IN the_DT begin-_JJ ning_NN ,_, increased_VBN and_CC reached_VBN the_DT highest_JJS two_CD days_NNS before_IN calving_VBG and_CC then_RB decreased_VBD ._.

The_DT percentage_NN of_IN cal-_JJ cium_NN increased_VBD from_IN 0.054_CD to_TO 0.191_CD in_IN four_CD weeks_NNS ;_: whereas_IN the_DT percentage_NN of_IN phosphorus_NN rose_VBD from_IN 0.186_CD to_TO 0.321_CD before_IN calving_NN ,_, then_RB falling_VBG gradually_RB reached_VBN 0.225_CD ._.

Two_CD high_JJ milkers_NNS and_CC five_CD medium_NN and_CC low_JJ milkers_NNS in_IN the_DT first_JJ ,_, second_JJ and_CC third_JJ hundred_JJ days_NNS of_IN lacta-_JJ tion_NN were_VBD selected_VBN ._.

In_IN the_DT individual_JJ cows_NNS ,_, there_EX was_VBD not_RB much_JJ variation_NN in_IN the_DT percentages_NNS of_IN calcium_NN and_CC phosphorus_NN in_IN the_DT course_NN of_IN four_CD weeks_NNS ._.
In_IN all_PDT the_DT first_JJ calvers_VBZ the_DT composition_NN of_IN each_DT cow_NN 's_POS milk_NN was_VBD different_JJ from_IN that_DT of_IN the_DT other_JJ ._.

In_IN all_PDT the_DT cows_NNS except_IN diseased_JJ ones_NNS ,_, there_EX was_VBD not_RB much_JJ variation_NN in_IN the_DT percent-_JJ ages_NNS of_IN calcium_NN and_CC phosphorus_NN in_IN the_DT course_NN of_IN four_CD weeks_NNS ._.

In_IN 'Rajudhina_NNP '_POS the_DT calcium_NN and_CC phosphorus_NN percentage_NN was_VBD rather_RB high_JJ for_IN some_DT time_NN when_WRB she_PRP was_VBD suffering_VBG from_IN foot-and-mouth_JJ disease_NN ._.

In_IN some_DT cases_NNS ,_, with_IN the_DT decrease_NN in_IN yield_NN in_IN the_DT later_JJ part_NN of_IN lactation_NN ,_, the_DT calcium_NN percentage_NN increased_VBD ._.

The_DT percentage_NN of_IN calcium_NN and_CC phosphorus_NN fell_VBD later_RB on_IN when_WRB the_DT cow_NN was_VBD normal_JJ ._.
A_DT comparison_NN of_IN the_DT data_NNS of_IN two_CD cows_NNS 'Rajsam_POS '_POS and_CC 'Lakroochi_NNP '_'' in_IN the_DT first_JJ 100_CD days_NNS and_CC second_JJ 100_CD days_NNS of_IN lactation_NN (_( in_IN Table_NNP IX_NNP )_) revealed_VBD that_IN :_: (_( 1_CD )_) During_IN the_DT flush_NN (_( peak_JJ )_) period_NN when_WRB the_DT yield_NN reached_VBD the_DT maximum_NN ,_, the_DT percentages_NNS of_IN calcium_NN and_CC phosphorus_NN were_VBD appreciably_RB lower_JJR than_IN those_DT at_IN a_DT later_JJ period_NN when_WRB the_DT yield_NN fell_VBD by_IN 12-16_JJ pounds_NNS ;_: (_( 2_CD )_) The_DT ratio_NN of_IN calcium_NN to_TO phosphorus_VB was_VBD practi-_JJ cally_RB the_DT same_JJ ;_: and_CC (_( 3_CD )_) The_DT total_JJ amount_NN of_IN calcium_NN and_CC phosphorus_NN output_NN in_IN the_DT milk_NN per_IN day_NN also_RB fell_VBD with_IN the_DT yield_NN ._.

ChorengGOBIND_NNP SINGH_NNP THAPAR_NNP AND_NNP BIPIN_NNP BIHARI_NNP SINGHA_NNP 219_CD SUMMARY_NNP The_DT percentages_NNS of_IN calcium_NN and_CC phosphorus_NN in_IN the_DT different_JJ milkings_NNS of_IN a_DT particular_JJ day_NN in_IN a_DT cow_NN showed_VBD no_DT variation_NN ._.
There_EX was_VBD practically_RB no_DT variation_NN in_IN the_DT per-_JJ centages_NNS of_IN calcium_NN and_CC phosphorus_NN in_IN the_DT course_NN of_IN four_CD weeks_NNS except_IN in_IN the_DT premilkers_NNS or_CC those_DT cows_NNS which_WDT reached_VBD or_CC passed_VBD the_DT peak_JJ period_NN ._.
When_WRB the_DT cow_NN was_VBD in_IN the_DT peak_JJ period_NN the_DT per-_JJ centages_NNS of_IN calcium_NN and_CC phosphorus_NN in_IN the_DT milk_NN decreased_VBN and_CC when_WRB that_DT period_NN passed_VBD ,_, the_DT per-_JJ centages_NNS of_IN these_DT elements_NNS in_IN the_DT milk_NN increased_VBN ._.
When_WRB the_DT yield_NN was_VBD below_IN 10_CD pounds_NNS ,_, in_IN the_DT last_JJ days_NNS of_IN lactation_NN ,_, the_DT percentage_NN of_IN CaO_NNP and_CC P2O5_NNP increased_VBD ._.

The_DT percentage_NN of_IN calcium_NN in_IN the_DT premilk_NN gradually_RB increased_VBD and_CC continued_VBD to_TO do_VB so_RB till_VB a_DT week_NN or_CC two_CD after_IN calving_VBG when_WRB the_DT tendency_NN towards_IN stabiliza-_JJ tion_NN appeared_VBD ._.
On_IN the_DT other_JJ hand_NN ,_, the_DT percentage_NN of_IN phosphorus_NN increased_VBN for_IN some_DT time_NN ,_, reached_VBD the_DT maximum_JJ before_IN calving_VBG and_CC then_RB decreased_VBD ._.
It_PRP continued_VBD to_TO do_VB so_RB for_IN a_DT week_NN or_CC so_RB after_IN calving_VBG and_CC then_RB the_DT tendency_NN towards_NNS stabilization_NN appeared_VBD ._.
The_DT ratio_NN of_IN calcium_NN to_TO phosphorus_VB was_VBD different_JJ in_IN individual_JJ cows_NNS ._.

by_IN 0.075-0.119_JJ mm_NN ._.
in_IN size_NN ._.

INCIDENCE_NNP OF_NNP INFECTION_NNP I_PRP have_VBP already_RB emphasized_VBN that_IN the_DT purpose_NN of_IN this_DT survey_NN was_VBD to_TO obtain_VB mainly_RB statistical_JJ data_NNS on_IN the_DT relative_JJ degree_NN of_IN infection_NN by_IN the_DT various_JJ para-_JJ sites_NNS ._.

A._NN MOGHE_NNP 229_CD TABLE_NNP VIII_NNP Seasonal_NNP variation_NN in_IN the_DT incidence_NN of_IN infection230_JJ Nature_NNP and_CC Incidence_NNP of_IN Helminth_NNP Infection_NNP in_IN Cattle_NNP SOME_NNP IMPORTANT_NNP CONCLUSIONS_NNP Goats_NNP ._.
In_IN the_DT Central_NNP Provinces_NNPS and_CC Berar_NNP ,_, goats_NNS are_VBP found_VBN to_TO be_VB very_RB heavily_RB infected_VBN with_IN Trematodes_NNP in_IN Nagpur_NNP and_CC the_DT percentage_NN of_IN in-_NN fected_VBN animals_NNS is_VBZ greatest_JJS in_IN winter_NN season_NN from_IN December_NNP to_TO February_NNP ._.
Amphistome_NNP infection_NN is_VBZ the_DT highest_JJS in_IN all_DT seasons_NNS and_CC in_IN winter_NN as_RB many_JJ as_IN 76_CD per_IN cent_NN of_IN animals_NNS are_VBP infected_VBN with_IN them_PRP ._.
Coty-_NNP lophoron_NN cotylophorum_NN and_CC Gastrothylax_NNP crumenifer_NN are_VBP the_DT commonest_JJS amphistomes_NNS ._.
Fasciola_NNP hepatica_NN and_CC species_NNS of_IN Schistosoma_NNP are_VBP not_RB very_RB common_JJ and_CC the_DT incidence_NN of_IN infection_NN is_VBZ also_RB low_JJ ._.
In_IN Central_NNP India_NNP ,_, the_DT only_JJ trematodes_NNS found_VBN are_VBP species_NNS of_IN Schistosoma_NNP and_CC that_IN too_RB only_RB in_IN 16_CD per_IN cent_NN animals_NNS ._.
Amphistomes_NNS are_VBP conspicuous_JJ by_IN their_PRP$ absence_NN ._.
In_IN the_DT ._.
Central_JJ Provinces_NNS and_CC Berar_NNP ,_, species_NNS of_IN Aviteleina_NNP and_CC Stilesia_NNP occur_VBP very_RB commonly_RB ._.
In_IN Central_NNP India_NNP Stilesia_NNP vittata_NN is_VBZ very_RB common_JJ but_CC the_DT percentage_NN of_IN infected_JJ animals_NNS is_VBZ only_RB 24_CD ._.
Hæmonchus_NNP contortus_NN is_VBZ found_VBN in_IN the_DT Central_NNP Provinces_NNPS and_CC Berar_NNP in_IN about_RB 73_CD per_IN cent_NN of_IN animals_NNS in_IN the_DT rainy_NN season_NN but_CC the_DT percentage_NN falls_VBZ to_TO 33_CD in_IN summer_NN and_CC the_DT average_JJ infection_NN also_RB falls_VBZ down_RB from_IN 75_CD to_TO 31_CD per_IN animal_NN ._.
Trichocephalus_NNP ovis_NN also_RB occurs_VBZ in_IN a_DT large_JJ number_NN of_IN animals_NNS but_CC the_DT infection_NN is_VBZ not_RB heavy_JJ ._.
In_IN Central_NNP India_NNP ,_, Trichocephalus_NNP ovis_FW is_VBZ more_RBR abundant_JJ occurring_VBG in_IN as_RB many_JJ as_IN 81_CD per_IN cent_NN animals_NNS ._.
Bunostomum_NNP trigonocephalum_NN is_VBZ also_RB more_RBR common_JJ than_IN in_IN the_DT Central_NNP Provinces_NNPS and_CC Berar_NNP ._.
Sheep_NNP ._.
In_IN the_DT Central_NNP Provinces_NNPS and_CC Berar_NNP ,_, sheep_NN are_VBP more_RBR ,_, heavily_RB infected_VBN at_IN Raipur_NNP than_IN at_IN other_JJ places_NNS ._.
Cotylophoron_NNP cotylophorum_NN is_VBZ the_DT most_RBS common_JJ parasite_NN occurring_VBG in_IN Central_NNP Provinces_NNPS in_IN 51_CD per_IN cent_NN of_IN sheep_NN with_IN an_DT average_JJ load_NN of_IN 984_CD per_IN infected_VBN animal_NN ._.
Species_NNS of_IN Schistosoma_NNP and_CC Fasciola_NNP hepatica_NN are_VBP more_RBR abundant_JJ in_IN sheep_NN than_IN in_IN goats_NNS ._.
But_CC it_PRP is_VBZ interesting_VBG to_TO note_VB that_IN Cotylo-_NNP phoron_NN cotylophorum_NN is_VBZ more_RBR abundant_JJ in_IN the_DT rainy_NN season_NN than_IN in_IN winter_NN ._.
In_IN Central_NNP India_NNP ,_, the_DT only_JJ two_CD trematodes_NNS infecting_JJ sheep_NN are_VBP Cotylophoron_NNP ovatum_NN and_CC species_NNS of_IN Schistosoma_NNP ;_: but_CC the_DT infection_NN is_VBZ low_JJ ;_: only_RB 16_CD per_IN cent_NN of_IN animals_NNS are_VBP infected_VBN ._.
Commonly_RB the_DT same_JJ cestodes_NNS which_WDT infect_VBP goat_NN also_RB infect_VBP the_DT sheep_NN ._.
In_IN the_DT Central_NNP Provinces_NNPS and_CC Berar_NNP ,_, Stilesia_NNP globipunctata_NN occurs_VBZ in_IN about_RB 17_CD per_IN cent_NN of_IN the_DT animals_NNS showing_VBG heavy_JJ infection_NN ._.
In_IN Central_NNP India_NNP ,_, the_DT cestode_NN infection_NN is_VBZ slightly_RB more_JJR than_IN the_DT trematode_JJ infection_NN ._.
Trichocephalus_NNP ovis_NN and_CC Hæmonchus_NNP contortus_NN are_VBP the_DT commonest_JJS Nematodes_NNS in_IN sheep_NN in_IN Central_NNP Pro-_NNP vinces_NNS ._.
Bunoslomum_NNP trigonocephalum_NN and_CC Gaigeria_NNP pachyscelis_VBP occur_VBP in_IN 32_CD per_IN cent_NN and_CC 16_CD per_IN cent_NN animals_NNS respectively_RB but_CC the_DT degree_NN of_IN infection_NN is_VBZ low_JJ ._.
Gongylonema_NNP pulchrum_NN and_CC G._NNP verrucosum_VBP occur_NN less_RBR frequently_RB in_IN sheep_NN than_IN in_IN goats_NNS ._.
In_IN Central_NNP India_NNP ,_, nematode_JJ infection_NN is_VBZ low_JJ and_CC less_RBR varied_JJ ._.
The_DT only_JJ common_JJ nematodes_NNS are_VBP Hæmon-_NNP chus_NN Contortus_NNP and_CC Trichocephalus_NNP ovis_NN ._.
Cattle_NNP ._.
In_IN Central_NNP Provinces_NNPS and_CC Berar_NNP ,_, Raipur_NNP is_VBZ the_DT most_RBS heavily_RB infected_JJ area_NN ;_: as_RB many_JJ as_IN 75_CD per_IN cent_NN of_IN cattle_NNS are_VBP infected_VBN with_IN Cotylophoron_NNP cotylophorum_NN ,_, and_CC at_IN Nagpur_NNP 72_CD per_IN cent_NN are_VBP infected_VBN with_IN this_DT parasite_NN ._.
Gastrothylax_NNP crumenifer_NN is_VBZ found_VBN in_IN 88_CD per_IN cent_NN cattle_NNS at_IN Raipur_NNP and_CC in_IN 54_CD per_IN cent_NN cattle_NNS at_IN Nagpur_NNP ._.
The_DT infection_NN by_IN Paramphisto-_NNP mum_NN cervi_NN is_VBZ also_RB heavy_JJ in_IN Raipur_NNP but_CC not_RB so_RB heavy_JJ as_IN in_IN Nagpur_NNP ._.
The_DT cattle_NNS in_IN Central_NNP India_NNP are_VBP less_RBR heavily_RB infected_VBN ._.
Only_RB 30_CD per_IN cent_NN of_IN them_PRP har-_JJ boured_VBD Paramphistomum_NNP Cervi_NNP ,_, cotylophoron_VBD cotylo-_JJ phorum_NN and_CC Fasciola_NNP hepatica_NN ._.
The_DT cestode_NN infection_NN in_IN cattle_NNS in_IN the_DT Central_NNP Provinces_NNPS and_CC Berar_NNP is_VBZ confined_VBN only_RB to_TO Moniezia_NNP expansa_NN and_CC M._NNP benedini_NN and_CC cysts_NNS of_IN Echinococcus_NNP granulosus_NN ._.
The_DT cattle_NNS at_IN Mhow_NNP are_VBP also_RB infected_VBN by_IN these_DT cysts_NNS ._.
The_DT nematode_JJ infection_NN in_IN cattle_NNS in_IN the_DT Central_NNP Provinces_NNPS and_CC Berar_NNP is_VBZ fairly_RB varied_VBN but_CC the_DT inci-_JJ dence_NN is_VBZ low_JJ except_IN for_IN Bunostomum_NNP trigonocephalum_NN which_WDT occurs_VBZ in_IN 43_CD per_IN cent_NN of_IN animals_NNS ._.
In_IN Central_NNP India_NNP Mecistocirrus_NNP digitatus_NN is_VBZ found_VBN in_IN 50_CD per_IN cent_NN cattle_NNS and_CC Gongylonema_NNP pulchrum_NN and_CC COMPOSITION_NNP OF_NNP VANASPATI_NNP (_( HYDROGENATED_NNP EDIBLE_NNP FATS_NNP )_) AND_NNP MARGARINE_NNP MANUFACTURED_NNP IN_NNP INDIA_NNP By_IN B._NNP VASUDEVA_NNP RAO_NNP and_CC C._NNP P._NNP ANANTAKRISHNAN_NNP ,_, Imperial_NNP Dairy_NNP Research_NNP Institute_NNP ,_, Bangalore_NNP (_( Received_VBN for_IN publication_NN on_IN 29_CD February_NNP 1944_CD )_) THE_DT establishment_NN of_IN hydrogenated_JJ oil_NN factories_NNS broughout_IN India_NNP during_IN the_DT past_JJ decade_NN and_CC the_DT rapid_JJ development_NN of_IN this_DT industry_NN that_WDT has_VBZ taken_VBN place_NN in_IN recent_JJ years_NNS has_VBZ greatly_RB contributed_VBN to_TO the_DT increase_NN in_IN the_DT production_NN of_IN edible_JJ fats_NNS and_CC also_RB their_PRP$ preservation_NN and_CC consumption_NN in_IN a_DT better_JJR state_NN ._.
Even_RB though_IN large_JJ quantities_NNS of_IN vanaspati_NNS are_VBP manufactured_VBN in_IN India_NNP from_IN several_JJ vegetable_JJ oils_NNS and_CC are_VBP being_VBG sold_VBN in_IN the_DT Indian_JJ market_NN under_IN various_JJ brands_NNS ,_, no_DT data_NN regarding_VBG the_DT composition_NN of_IN vanaspati_NN as_IN a_DT commercial_JJ product_NN seem_VBP to_TO have_VB appeared_VBN in_IN the_DT literature_NN which_WDT would_MD give_VB an_DT idea_NN of_IN the_DT usual_JJ ranges_NNS of_IN analytical_JJ values_NNS in_IN the_DT different_JJ samples_NNS ._.
The_DT present_JJ investigation_NN was_VBD undertaken_JJ and_CC analyses_NNS of_IN the_DT various_JJ brands_NNS of_IN vanaspati_NN available_JJ in_IN India_NNP have_VBP been_VBN made_VBN with_IN the_DT above_JJ object_NN in_IN view_NN ._.
EXPERIMENTAL_NNP Vanaspati_NNP samples_NNS were_VBD obtained_VBN from_IN the_DT various_JJ manufacturers_NNS in_IN ._.
different_JJ parts_NNS of_IN India_NNP through_IN the_DT courtesy_NN of_IN The_DT Vanaspati_NNP Manufacturers_NNP '_POS Association_NNP of_IN India_NNP ._.
Most_JJS of_IN the_DT values_NNS were_VBD determined_VBN by_IN the_DT standard_JJ methods_NNS of_IN fat_JJ analysis_NN as_IN described_VBN by_IN the_DT A._NNP O_NNP ._.
A._NN C._NNP Iodine_NNP value_NN was_VBD determined_VBN by_IN the_DT pyridine_JJ sul-_JJ phate_NN method_NN and_CC butyro-refractometer_NN reading_NN was_VBD taken_VBN at_IN 40°C_CD ._.
Vitamin_NNP A._NN was_VBD estimated_VBN in_IN the_DT unsaponifiable_JJ matter_NN by_IN the_DT Carr-Price_NNP reaction_NN ,_, In_IN all_DT 26_CD vanaspati_NNS samples_NNS have_VBP been_VBN analysed_VBN and_CC except_IN for_IN the_DT Lion_NNP Brand_NNP (_( G_NNP )_) ,_, prepared_VBN by_IN the_DT Indian_NNP Vegetable_NNP Products_NNPS ,_, Limited_NNP ,_, as_IN a_DT special_JJ product_NN from_IN coconut_JJ oil_NN ,_, they_PRP are_VBP all_DT available_JJ in_IN the_DT market_NN for_IN the_DT general_JJ public_NN ._.
In_IN addition_NN to_TO vanaspati_VB ,_, Blue_NNP Brand_NNP margarine_NN ,_, manufactured_VBD as_IN a_DT substitute_NN for_IN butter_NN has_VBZ also_RB been_VBN included_VBN in_IN the_DT investigation_NN ._.
The_DT results_NNS of_IN these_DT analyses_NNS are_VBP presented_VBN in_IN Table_NNP I_PRP ._.

Trace_NN 7_CD 232_CD Composition_NN of_IN Vanaspati_NNP (_( Hydrogenated_NNP Edible_NNP Fats_NNP )_) and_CC Margarine_NNP It_PRP will_MD be_VB seen_VBN from_IN Table_JJ I_PRP that_IN the_DT butyro-refrac-_JJ tometer_NN reading_NN in_IN all_DT cases_NNS ranges_VBP from_IN 48.1_CD to_TO 52.6_CD with_IN the_DT exception_NN of_IN Lion_NNP Brand_NNP vanaspati_NN (_( G_NNP )_) which_WDT gives_VBZ a_DT very_RB low_JJ figure_NN of_IN 34.6_CD ,_, and_CC Blue_NNP Brand_NNP margarine_NN ,_, which_WDT gives_VBZ a_DT reading_NN of_IN 39.9_CD ._.
Except_IN for_IN the_DT last_JJ two_CD samples_NNS ,_, the_DT range_NN obtained_VBN is_VBZ much_RB above_IN the_DT figures_NNS for_IN genuine_JJ butterfat_NN (_( 40.0-43.5_JJ )_) ._.
The_DT saponification_NN value_NN ranges_VBZ from_IN 188.5_CD to_TO 194.8_CD with_IN the_DT exception_NN of_IN three_CD samples_NNS ,_, viz_NN ._.
Swastik_NNP Brand_NNP vanaspati_POS Lion_NNP Brand_NNP vanaspati_NN (_( G_NNP )_) and_CC Blue_NNP Brand_NNP margarine_NN ,_, which_WDT give_VBP rather_RB high_JJ figures_NNS of_IN 203.7_CD ,_, 257.4_CD and_CC 45.6_CD respectively_RB ._.
The_DT last_JJ two_CD figures_NNS are_VBP very_RB much_RB above_IN the_DT values_NNS obtainable_JJ for_IN pure_JJ ghee_NN ._.
Iodine_NNP value_NN ranges_VBZ from_IN 45.6_CD to_TO 68.8_CD with_IN the_DT exception_NN of_IN Lion_NNP Brand_NNP vanaspati_NN (_( G_NNP )_) and_CC Blue_NNP Brand_NNP margarine_NN which_WDT give_VBP values_NNS of_IN 1.0_CD and_CC 22.6_CD respectively_RB ._.
It_PRP is_VBZ rather_RB striking_VBG that_IN the_DT Lion_NNP Brand_NNP vanaspati_NN (_( G_NNP )_) gives_VBZ such_JJ an_DT exceedingly_RB low_JJ value_NN which_WDT is_VBZ no_DT doubt_NN due_JJ to_TO a_DT higher_JJR degree_NN of_IN hydrogenation_NN and_CC also_RB to_TO the_DT fact_NN that_IN it_PRP is_VBZ made_VBN from_IN coconut_JJ oil_NN of_IN low_JJ iodine_NN value_NN ._.
For_IN almost_RB all_PDT the_DT samples_NNS ,_, the_DT R._NNP M._NNP value_NN varies_NNS from_IN 0.0_CD to_TO 0.85_CD ._.
But_CC Lion_NNP Brand_NNP vanaspati_NN (_( G_NNP )_) gives_VBZ a_DT divergent_JJ figure_NN of_IN 8.05_CD and_CC Blue_NNP Brand_NNP margarine_NN 6.60_CD ._.
Polenske_NNP value_NN ranges_VBZ from_IN 0.0_CD to_TO 0.85_CD in_IN all_PDT the_DT cases_NNS except_IN Lion_NNP Brand_NNP ,_, vanaspati_FW Blue_NNP Brand_NNP margarine_NN (_( G_NNP )_) which_WDT give_VBP very_RB high_JJ figure_NN of_IN 15.24_CD and_CC 9.77_CD respectively_RB ._.
Krishchner_NNP value_NN is_VBZ zero_CD for_IN all_DT samples_NNS with_IN the_DT exception_NN of_IN the_DT last_JJ ._.
two_CD ._.
It_PRP was_VBD also_RB observed_VBN that_IN none_NN of_IN the_DT samples_NNS examined_VBN gave_VBD even_RB a_DT trace_NN of_IN colourto_NN the_DT unsaponifiable_JJ matter_NN with_IN the_DT Carr-Price_NNP reagent_NN thus_RB indicating_VBG absence_NN of_IN Vitamin_NNP A_NNP ._.
Nor_CC could_MD any_DT traces_NNS of_IN nickel_NN be_VB detected_VBN by_IN the_DT dimethylglyoxime_JJ test_NN ._.
In_IN chemical_JJ analysis_NN fats_NNS are_VBP generally_RB characteriz-_JJ ed_NN by_IN the_DT determination_NN of_IN certain_JJ analytical_JJ con-_NN stants_NNS by_IN standard_JJ methods_NNS ._.
However_RB ,_, since_IN oils_NNS and_CC fats_NNS are_VBP natural_JJ products_NNS ,_, these_DT values_NNS are_VBP subject_JJ to_TO variations_NNS ._.
The_DT existence_NN of_IN a_DT wide_JJ range_NN of_IN values_NNS in_IN the_DT case_NN of_IN certain_JJ constants_NNS in_IN fats_JJ admits_NNS of_IN their_PRP$ easy_JJ adulteration_NN with_IN other_JJ fats_NNS without_IN detection_NN ._.
The_DT Avelallemant_NNP process_NN is_VBZ considered_VBN to_TO be_VB a_DT valuable_JJ auxiliary_NN to_TO the_DT Reinchert-Meissl_NNP value_NN in_IN deciding_VBG whether_IN butter_NN fat_NN is_VBZ adulterated_VBN or_CC not_RB ,_, and_CC is_VBZ based_VBN on_IN the_DT relative_JJ solubilities_NNS in_IN water_NN of_IN the_DT barium_NN salts_NNS of_IN the_DT fatty_JJ acids_NNS ._.
The_DT total_JJ barium_NN value_NN (_( A_NNP )_) of_IN a_DT fat_NN is_VBZ the_DT equivalent_NN of_IN the_DT saponification_NN number_NN expressed_VBN as_IN barium_NN oxide_NN ._.
The_DT insoluble_JJ barium_NN value_NN (_( B_NNP )_) is_VBZ that_DT portion_NN of_IN the_DT total_JJ barium_NN value_NN which_WDT represents_VBZ the_DT equivalent_NN as_IN barium_NN oxide_NN of_IN the_DT insoluble_JJ barium_NN salts_NNS from_IN 1_CD gm_NN ._.
of_IN fat_NN ._.
In_IN other_JJ words_NNS ,_, it_PRP is_VBZ the_DT amount_NN of_IN soluble_JJ barium_NN salt_NN (_( as_IN barium_NN oxide_NN )_) to_TO be_VB added_VBN to_TO the_DT potash_NN soap_NN from_IN 1_CD gm_NN ._.
of_IN fat_JJ necessary_JJ to_TO precipitate_VB completely_RB the_DT in-_JJ soluble_JJ barium_NN soap_NN ._.
The_DT soluble_JJ barium_NN vali_NN is_VBZ (_( A-B_NNP )_) ,_, which_WDT is_VBZ equal_JJ to_TO say_VB C_NNP ,_, from_IN which_WDT calculated_VBD the_DT value_NN of_IN BB_NNP ._.
VASUDEVA_NNP RAO_NNP AND_NNP C._NNP P._NNP ANANTHAKRISHNAN_NNP 233_CD TABLE_NNP II_NNP Barium_NNP values_NNS of_IN vanaspati_JJ Sample_NNP No_NNP ._.
Details_NNS of_IN the_DT Sample_NNP Saponifi-_NNP cation_NN value_NN Barium_NNP value_NN BAVIAN_NNP TUBERCULOSIS_NNP IN_NNP A_NNP GOOSE_NNP By_IN S._NNP NURUL_NNP MOHTEDA_NNP ,_, G.M.V.C._NNP ,_, P.G_NNP ._.

was_VBD injected_VBN into_IN the_DT web_NN of_IN the_DT feet_NNS in_IN the_DT geese_JJ and_CC ducks_NNS but_CC none_NN reacted_VBD positively_RB to_TO this_DT test_NN ._.

It_PRP is_VBZ far_RB from_IN easy_JJ to_TO show_VB experimentally_RB that_IN ,_, adverse_JJ environmental_JJ conditions_NNS will_MD cause_VB the_DT onset_NN of_IN pneumonia_NN ,_, but_CC all_DT clinical_JJ observers_NNS appear_VBP to_TO agree_VB that_IN they_PRP are_VBP of_IN great_JJ importance_NN in_IN preci-_JJ pitating_NN attacks_NNS of_IN equine_JJ respiratory_NN diseases_NNS ._.
In_IN a_DT very_RB fine_JJ clinical_JJ article_NN on_IN '_POS Pneumonia_NNP and_CC Pleurisy_NNP in_IN the_DT Horse_NNP ,_, '_'' the_DT late_JJ Sir_NNP Frederick_NNP Smith_NNP [_NNP 1897_CD ]_NNP quotes_VBZ Hunting_NNP as_IN saying_VBG that_IN '_'' want_NN of_IN condition_NN ,_, plus_CC fast_JJ work_NN ,_, causes_VBZ exhaustion_NN ,_, and_CC then_RB we_PRP only_RB want_VBP cold_JJ ,_, changeable_JJ weather_NN to_TO produce_VB diseases_NNS of_IN the_DT lungs_NNS ._. '_''
Smith_NNP believed_VBD ex-_JJ haustion_NN to_TO be_VB a_DT '_'' direct_JJ exciting_VBG '_'' cause_NN of_IN pneumonia_NN ,_, especially_RB in_IN young_JJ ,_, soft_JJ horses_NNS ,_, whereas_NNS older_VBP horses_NNS seem_VBP to_TO possess_VB a_DT comparative_JJ immunity_NN against_IN some_DT of_IN the_DT '_POS causes_NNS or_CC conditions_NNS '_POS which_WDT so_RB freely_RB contribute_JJ to_TO the_DT production_NN of_IN the_DT disease_NN in_IN the_DT young_JJ ._.
Smith_NNP realized_VBD that_IN the_DT febrile_JJ attacks_NNS from_IN which_WDT nearly_RB all_DT young_JJ horses_NNS suffer_VBP when_WRB first_JJ brought_VBD into_IN stables_NNS may_MD be_VB associated_VBN with_IN the_DT process_NN of_IN acquiring_VBG immunity_NN to_TO the_DT '_'' pneumonia_NN microbe_NN ._. '_''
Pneumonia_NNP chiefly_NN affects_NNS stabled_VBN horses_NNS and_CC the_DT great_JJ importance_NN of_IN good_JJ hygienic_JJ conditions_NNS is_VBZ shown_VBN by_IN the_DT fact_NN that_IN five_CD years_NNS after_IN the_DT introduction_NN of_IN '_'' sanitary_JJ science_NN '_'' into_IN the_DT French_JJ Army_NNP the_DT annual_JJ incidence_NN of_IN pneu-_JJ monia_NN had_VBD dropped_VBN from_IN 110_CD to_TO 46_CD per_IN thousand_NN horses_NNS ,_, and_CC four_CD years_NNS later_RB to_TO little_VB more_JJR than_IN 3½_CD per_IN thousand_NN ._.
Long_JJ rail_NN and_CC sea_NN journeys_NNS also_RB predispose_VBP to_TO pneumonia_VB ._.
Coleman_NNP (_( Principal_NNP of_IN the_DT Royal_NNP Veterinary_NNP College_NNP ,_, 1794-1839_JJ )_) laid_VBD great_JJ emphasis_NN on_IN the_DT importance_NN of_IN well-ventilated_JJ stables_NNS ,_, but_CC unfortunately_RB he_PRP did_VBD not_RB display_VB equally_RB good_JJ judgement_NN on_IN many_JJ other_JJ subjects_NNS ._.
In_IN parentheses_NNS ,_, it_PRP may_MD be_VB said_VBD that_IN the_DT clinical_JJ methods_NNS of_IN examining_VBG the_DT chest_NN and_CC the_DT '_'' respiratory_JJ sounds_NNS ,_, '_'' described_VBN by_IN Smith_NNP will_MD be_VB of_IN great_JJ interest_NN 236_CD Respiratory_NNP Diseases_NNP of_IN the_DT Horse_NNP to_TO all_DT clinicians_NNS working_VBG with_IN large_JJ domestic_JJ animals_NNS ._.
He_PRP found_VBD the_DT phonendoscope_NN to_TO be_VB by_IN far_RB the_DT best_JJS instrument_NN as_IN an_DT aid_NN to_TO diagnosis_NN ,_, and_CC the_DT extreme_JJ care_NN with_IN which_WDT he_PRP conducted_VBD his_PRP$ examinations_NNS can_MD be_VB judged_VBN from_IN the_DT fact_NN that_IN they_PRP were_VBD carried_VBN out_RP at_IN night_NN with_IN sawdust_NN as_IN bedding_VBG to_TO '_'' insure_JJ quietude_NN ._. '_''
The_DT best_JJS types_NNS of_IN modern_JJ stethoscopes_NNS have_VBP been_VBN described_VBN in_IN the_DT Lancet_NNP [_NN 1941_CD ]_NN ._.

Hignett_NNP [_NN 1940_CD ]_NNP isolated_VBD group_NN '_'' C_NNP '_POS streptococci_NN from_IN the_DT nasal_JJ cávity_NN of_IN normal_JJ horses_NNS ._.
There_EX can_MD be_VB little_JJ doubt_NN that_IN one_CD or_CC other_JJ of_IN a_DT number_NN of_IN bacterial_JJ species_NNS may_MD be_VB present_JJ in_IN the_DT nasopharynx_NN and_CC produce_VB disease_NN when_WRB host_NN resistance_NN is_VBZ lowered_VBN ._.
Sporadic_JJ cases_NNS of_IN pneumonia_NN ,_, nasal_JJ catarrh_NN or_CC strangles_VBZ probably_RB arise_VB in_IN this_DT way_NN ,_, but_CC severe_JJ outbreaks_NNS usually_RB occur_VBP only_RB when_WRB large_JJ numbers_NNS of_IN young_JJ horses_NNS ,_, or_CC horses_NNS which_WDT have_VBP not_RB previously_RB been_VBN exposed_VBN to_TO infection_NN ,_, are_VBP brought_VBN to_TO remount_VB depots_NNS or_CC sales_NNS yards_NNS ._.
The_DT infectious_JJ nature_NN of_IN these_DT outbreaks_NNS is_VBZ probably_RB due_JJ to_TO a_DT virus_NN and_CC ,_, although_IN the_DT uncomplicated_JJ disease_NN usually_RB produces_VBZ immunity_NN ,_, all_DT observers_NNS agree_VBP that_IN in_IN itself_PRP it_PRP is_VBZ very_RB mild_JJ and_CC may_MD pass_VB unnoticed_JJ ._.
The_DT severity_NN of_IN the_DT symptoms_NNS and_CC the_DT mortality_NN probably_RB depend_VBP ,_, therefore_RB ,_, on_IN the_DT virulence_NN of_IN the_DT secondary_JJ organisms_NNS and_CC above_IN all_DT on_IN the_DT care_NN which_WDT is_VBZ taken_VBN of_IN the_DT horses_NNS as_RB soon_RB as_IN the_DT first_JJ rise_NN of_IN temperature_NN occurs_NNS ._.
This_DT was_VBD fully_RB realized_VBN by_IN Fitzwygram_NNP [_NN 1894_CD ]_NN ,_, who_WP showed_VBD that_IN the_DT '_POS incipient_JJ attack_NN '_POS could_MD be_VB most_RBS readily_RB detected_VBN by_IN the_DT use_NN of_IN a_DT clinical_JJ thermometer_NN ._.
The_DT Royal_NNP Army_NNP Veterinary_NNP Corps_NNP made_VBD use_NN of_IN this_DT fact_NN during_IN the_DT last_JJ war_NN ,_, and_CC as_IN a_DT result_NN the_DT losses_NNS from_IN respiratory_NN diseases_NNS were_VBD greatly_RB reduced_VBN [_JJ Edwards_NNP ,_, 1935b_CD ]_NN ._.
It_PRP will_MD be_VB seen_VBN from_IN the_DT foregoing_VBG summary_NN that_IN outbreaks_NN of_IN disease_NN caused_VBN by_IN any_DT one_CD virus_NN may_MD differ_VB greatly_RB in_IN their_PRP$ severity_NN and_CC also_RB in_IN the_DT clinical_JJ symptoms_NNS presented_VBN ,_, and_CC this_DT is_VBZ probably_RB why_WRB there_EX is_VBZ confusion_NN regarding_VBG the_DT clinical_JJ classifica-_JJ tion_NN of_IN equine_JJ respiratory_NN diseases_NNS ;_: a_DT confusion_NN which_WDT was_VBD not_RB apparently_RB diminished_VBN by_IN the_DT experience_NN of_IN the_DT last_JJ war_NN ._.
At_IN that_DT time_NN ,_, however_RB ,_, knowledge_NN of_IN human_JJ respiratory_NN diseases_NNS was_VBD in_IN no_DT better_JJR state_NN ,_, and_CC in_IN 1918-19_JJ influenza_NN killed_VBD ten_NNS to_TO twenty_VB million_CD people_NNS [_JJ Geddes-Smith_NNP ,_, 1941_CD ]_NN ._.
On_IN the_DT other_JJ hand_NN ,_, it_PRP is_VBZ well_RB known_VBN that_IN human_NN '_'' influenza_NNS '_POS may_MD be_VB a_DT very_RB mild_JJ disease_NN ,_, and_CC the_DT only_JJ satisfactory_JJ method_NN of_IN classification_NN is_VBZ on_IN an_DT ætiological_JJ basis_NN ._.
Con-_NNP siderable_JJ progress_NN has_VBZ already_RB been_VBN made_VBN in_IN this_DT direction_NN [_NNP Francis_NNP ,_, T._NNP ,_, 1941_CD ]_NN ._.
Our_PRP$ knowledge_NN of_IN equine_JJ respiratory_NN diseases_NNS will_MD probably_RB only_RB become_VB clarified_VBN when_WRB they_PRP can_MD be_VB classified_VBN on_IN an_DT ætiological_JJ basis_NN ,_, and_CC it_PRP can_MD be_VB definitely_RB ascertained_VBN that_IN a_DT given_VBN outbreak_NN of_IN disease_NN is_VBZ due_JJ to_TO a_DT certain_JJ '_POS virus_NN '_'' ,_, EQUNIE_NNP INFLUENZA_NNP (_( Pink_NNP eye_NN ,_, influenza_JJ catarrhalis_NN ,_, typhoid_JJ fever_NN ,_, pferdestaupe_NN )_) '_POS Malignant_JJ epidemics_NNS '_POS which_WDT occurred_VBD about_IN ,_, 1815_CD and_CC the_DT stringent_NN methods_NNS which_WDT were_VBD employed_VBN to_TO control_VB them_PRP have_VBP been_VBN described_VBN by_IN Youatt_NNP [_NNP 1831_CD ]_NNP ._.
Three_CD out_IN of_IN five_CD horses_NNS which_WDT were_VBD attacked_VBN died_VBN ._.
and_CC the_DT clinical_JJ symptoms_NNS indicate_VBP that_IN the_DT disease_NN was_VBD a_DT severe_JJ form_NN of_IN equine_JJ influenza_NN ._.
He_PRP also_RB describes_VBZ equine_JJ influenza_NN as_IN it_PRP existed_VBD in_IN this_DT country_NN during_IN the_DT latter_JJ part_NN of_IN the_DT nineteenth_JJ century_NN ._.
Law_NN [_NN 1902_CD ]_NN has_VBZ described_VBN in_IN great_JJ detail_NN the_DT epizootic_JJ which_WDT paralyzed_VBD horse_NN transport_NN in_IN the_DT U.S.A._NNP in_IN 1872-73_CD ._.
Williams_NNP [_NNP 1924_CD ]_NNP discussed_VBD other_JJ early_JJ epidemics_NNS and_CC also_RB described_VBD a_DT severe_JJ outbreak_NN in_IN India_NNP in_IN which_WDT the_DT mortality_NN in_IN most_JJS groups_NNS of_IN horses_NNS varied_VBN from_IN 1_CD to_TO 10_CD per_IN cent_NN but_CC was_VBD occasionally_RB as_RB high_JJ as_IN 20_CD per_IN cent_NN ._.
Equine_NNP influenza_NN caused_VBD serious_JJ inconvenience_NN and_CC loss_NN during_IN the_DT last_JJ war_NN [_NNP Todd_NNP and_CC Soutar_NNP 1938_CD ;_: Udall_NNP ,_, 1938_CD ;_: Anon._NNP ,_, 1941_CD ]_NN ,_, and_CC it_PRP is_VBZ still_RB fairly_RB prevalent_JJ in_IN India_NNP ._.
Equine_NNP influenza_NN and_CC contagious_JJ penumonia_NN were_VBD confused_VBN by_IN the_DT early_JJ workers_NNS ._.
The_DT confusion_NN that_WDT existed_VBD in_IN the_DT Army_NNP veterinary_NN services_NNS was_VBD described_VBN by_IN M_NNP '_POS Fadyean_NNP [_NN 1889_CD ]_NN ._.
The_DT two_CD diseases_NNS had_VBD ,_, however_RB ,_, been_VBN '_POS clearly_RB differentiated_VBN by_IN Falke_NNP ,_, 1862_CD [_NNP see_VBP Friedberger_NNP and_CC Fröhner_NNP ,_, 1908_CD ]_NN ._.
The_DT position_NN was_VBD again_RB confused_VBN by_IN the_DT work_NN of_IN Ligniers_NNP [_NNP see_VB Nocard_NNP and_CC Leclainche_NNP ,_, 1903_CD ]_NN ,_, who_WP claimed_VBD that_IN both_DT diseases_NNS were_VBD primarily_RB due_JJ to_TO pasteurella_VB organisms_NNS ._.
Bemelmans_NNS [_VBP 1921_CD ]_NNP also_RB distinguished_VBD clearly_RB between_IN the_DT two_CD diseases_NNS ,_, but_CC emphasized_VBD that_IN equine_VBP contagious_JJ pneumonia_NN closely_RB resembled_JJ human_JJ influenza_NN ._.
This_DT similarity_NN has_VBZ also_RB been_VBN described_VBN by_IN Edwards_NNP [_NNP 1935a_CD ]_NN ._.
It_PRP is_VBZ felt_VBN ,_, however_RB ,_, that_IN no_DT change_NN should_MD be_VB made_VBN in_IN the_DT nomenclature_NN of_IN the_DT equine_NN diseases_NNS ._.
The_DT clinical_JJ manifestations_NNS of_IN influenza_JJ vary_JJ considerably_RB ,_, and_CC detailed_JJ descriptions_NNS have_VBP been_VBN given_VBN by_IN Law_NNP [_NN 1902_CD ]_NN ,_, Friedberger_NNP and_CC Fröhner_NNP [_NNP 1908_CD ]_NNP ._.
A_DT characteristic_JJ feature_NN is_VBZ the_DT marked_JJ prostration_NN ,_, and_CC muscular_JJ and_CC cardiac_JJ weakness_NN during_IN the_DT early_JJ febrile_NN stage_NN ._.
The_DT temperature_NN curve_NN is_VBZ much_RB more_RBR erratic_JJ than_IN in_IN equine_JJ pneumonia_NN ._.
There_EX is_VBZ usually_RB a_DT harsh_JJ cough_NN ,_, the_DT muccus_NN mem-_JJ brances_NNS are_VBP reddened_VBN and_CC there_EX may_MD be_VB some_DT nasal_JJ discharge_NN ._.

GRAM-NEGATIVE_JJ hæmolytic_JJ cocco-bacilli_NNS have_VBP been_VBN recovered_VBN from_IN pneumonic_JJ conditions_NNS in_IN sheep_NN and_CC cattle_NNS ,_, both_DT in_IN Great_NNP Britain_NNP and_CC America_NNP ._.

Corps_NNP 16_CD ,_, 108-18_JJ ATTEMPTS_NNP have_VBP been_VBN made_VBN by_IN a_DT few_JJ workers_NNS to_TO create_VB new_JJ species_NNS classification_NN of_IN Cryptococcus_NNP ;_: the_DT author_NN is_VBZ ,_, however_RB ,_, of_IN the_DT opinion_NN that_IN there_EX is_VBZ no_DT justification_NN for_IN this_DT ,_, until_IN more_RBR substantial_JJ evidence_NN for_IN the_DT creation_NN of_IN new_JJ species_NNS is_VBZ forthcoming_VBG ;_: and_CC that_IN ,_, until_IN this_DT question_NN is_VBZ decided_VBN ,_, all_DT cryptococci_VBP causing_VBG suppurative_JJ infections_NNS in_IN equidæ_NN should_MD be_VB regarded_VBN as_IN that_DT of_IN C._NNP farciminosus_NN only_RB ._.

Microscopic_NNP examination_NN of_IN pus_NN smears_NNS is_VBZ the_DT only_JJ sure_JJ means_NNS of_IN diagnosing_VBG the_DT disease_NN and_CC the_DT author_NN advocates_VBZ more_RBR general_JJ use_NN of_IN the_DT microscope_NN in_IN diagnosis_NN ,_, even_RB though_IN the_DT lesion_NN in_IN no_DT way_NN resembles_VBZ the_DT textbook_NN description_NN of_IN the_DT disease_NN ._.
In_IN the_DT absence_NN of_IN such_JJ examination_NN ,_, the_DT real_JJ nature_NN of_IN the_DT infection_NN is_VBZ likely_JJ to_TO be_VB missed_VBN and_CC such_JJ cases_NNS act_VBP as_IN dangerous_JJ carriers_NNS of_IN the_DT disease_NN ._.
The_DT discharge_NN from_IN recently_RB dressed_VBN open_JJ wounds_NNS may_MD not_RB show_VB the_DT specific_JJ organisms_NNS ._.
Experimental_JJ evidence_NN shows_NNS that_IN the_DT incubation_NN period_NN in_IN this_DT disease_NN is_VBZ shorter_JJR than_IN has_VBZ hitherto_VBN been_VBN stated_VBN :_: undiagnosed_JJ and_CC atypical_JJ cases_NNS ,_, such_JJ as_IN cryptococcal_JJ con-_NN junctivitis_NN ,_, represent_VBP the_DT '_'' missing_VBG link_NN '_'' ,_, and_CC the_DT writer_NN describes_VBZ a_DT few_JJ cases_NNS in_IN his_PRP$ experience_NN in_IN support_NN of_IN this_DT view_NN ._.

37_CD ,_, 142-64_CD THE_NNP work_NN was_VBD undertaken_VBN to_TO test_VB the_DT contemporary_JJ theory_NN that_IN when_WRB urea_JJ is_VBZ fed_VBN to_TO ruminants_NNS with_IN a_DT suitable_JJ diet_NN it_PRP is_VBZ converted_VBN to_TO protein_VB in_IN the_DT rumen_NNS and_CC is_VBZ thus_RB digested_VBN by_IN the_DT animal_NN ._.
The_DT first_JJ article_NN is_VBZ concerned_VBN with_IN the_DT details_NNS of_IN the_DT methods_NNS adopted_VBN for_IN estimating_VBG non-protein_JJ nitrogen_NN ,_, urea_JJ and_CC ammo-_JJ nia_NN ,_, with_IN the_DT heterogeneity_NN of_IN the_DT rumen_NNS ingesta_NN of_IN a_DT steer_NN and_CC with_IN some_DT preliminary_JJ in_IN vivo_JJ experiments_NNS ._.
Compara-_NNP tive_JJ study_NN of_IN trichloracetic_JJ acid_NN ,_, sodium_NN tungstate_NN with_IN sulphuric_JJ acid_NN and_CC alcohol_NN as_IN protein_NN precipitants_NNS showed_VBD that_IN the_DT alcohol_NN and_CC sodium_NN tungstate_NN methods_NNS give_VBP similar_JJ results_NNS ,_, whereas_JJ trichloracetic_JJ acid_NN gives_VBZ much_RB higher_JJR values_NNS ._.
Details_NNS of_IN the_DT sodium_NN tungstate_NN method_NN finally_RB adopted_VBN are_VBP also_RB given_VBN ._.
Heterogeneity_NN of_IN the_DT rumen_NNS ingesta_NN is_VBZ described_VBN and_CC illustrated_VBN by_IN analyses_NNS ._.
Determinations_NNS of_IN nitrogen_JJ distribution_NN values_NNS on_IN samples_NNS taken_VBN at_IN the_DT same_JJ time_NN from_IN different_JJ positions_NNS in_IN the_DT rumen_NNS showed_VBD a_DT variation_NN between_IN extremes_NNS of_IN almost_RB 20_CD per_IN cent_NN ._.
Sampling_VBG difficulties_NNS are_VBP also_RB described_VBN ._.
Determinations_NNS of_IN protein_NN and_CC non-protein_JJ nitrogen_NN in_IN the_DT rumen_NNS ingesta_VBP after_IN meals_NNS with_IN and_CC without_IN urea_JJ showed_VBD no_DT significant_JJ difference_NN between_IN protein_NN values_NNS in_IN the_DT two_CD cases_NNS ,_, though_IN there_EX was_VBD a_DT change_NN in_IN the_DT non-_JJ protein_NN nitrogen_NN fraction_NN ._.
The_DT average_JJ results_NNS gave_VBD no_DT satisfactory_JJ evidence_NN for_IN the_DT synthesis_NN of_IN protein_NN from_IN urea_JJ ,_, The_DT in_IN vivo_NN programme_NN was_VBD abandoned_VBN owing_VBG to_TO its_PRP$ inherent_JJ difficulties_NNS ._.
Similar_JJ in_IN vivo_NN experiments_NNS by_IN Wegner_NNP ,_, Booth_NNP ,_, Bohsted_NNP and_CC Hart_NNP are_VBP described_VBN and_CC discussed_VBN ._.
The_DT second_JJ article_NN deals_NNS with_IN in_IN vitro_JJ experiments_NNS ._.
Pre-_JJ liminary_JJ incubation_NN experiments_NNS showed_VBD that_IN rumen_NNS con-_JJ tents_NNS were_VBD able_JJ to_TO convert_VB urea_JJ to_TO ammonia_VB ._.
So_IN it_PRP was_VBD thought_VBN probable_JJ that_IN utilization_NN of_IN urea_JJ by_IN ruminants_NNS involved_VBN the_DT conversion_NN of_IN urea_JJ to_TO ammonia_VB at_IN the_DT first_JJ stage_NN of_IN the_DT process_NN ._.
A_DT detailed_JJ study_NN of_IN this_DT conversion_NN was_VBD made_VBN ._.
Methods_NNS of_IN obtaining_VBG the_DT sample_NN of_IN rumen_NNS contents_NNS and_CC incubation_NN of_IN the_DT rumen_NNS liquor_CC are_VBP described_VBN ._.
Results_NNS showed_VBD that_IN the_DT rate_NN of_IN conversion_NN of_IN urea_JJ to_TO ammonia_VB was_VBD much_RB the_DT same_JJ with_IN carbon_NN dioxide_NN ,_, nitrogen_NN ,_, and_CC air_NN ._.
Carbon_NNP dioxide_NN in_IN presence_NN of_IN starch_NN accelerated_VBD the_DT rate_NN of_IN conversion_NN slightly_RB ._.
Potassium_NNP dihydrogen_NN phosphate_NN had_VBD a_DT retarding_JJ effect_NN ._.
The_DT rate_NN of_IN conversion_NN was_VBD found_VBN to_TO increase_VB with_IN increase_NN in_IN temperature_NN till_NN it_PRP reached_VBD a_DT maximum_JJ af_NN 49°C_CD ,_, thereafter_JJR it_PRP decreased_VBD ._.
The_DT urease_JJ activity_NN of_IN the_DT rumen_NNS liquor_NN was_VBD found_VBN to_TO be_VB at_IN its_PRP$ maximum_NN between_IN the_DT pH_NN ._.
values_NNS 7_CD and_CC 9_CD ._.
There_EX was_VBD a_DT slight_JJ increase_NN in_IN the_DT conversion_NN of_IN urea_JJ with_IN increased_JJ urea_JJ concentration_NN ,_, Time_NNP of_IN sampling_NN was_VBD found_VBN immaterial_JJ ._.
It_PRP is_VBZ remarked_VBN that_IN the_DT urease_JJ activity_NN of_IN the_DT rumen_NNS ingesta_NN is_VBZ great_JJ at_IN all_DT times_NNS of_IN the_DT day_NN ,_, whatever_WDT the_DT time_NN of_IN feeding_NN ,_, and_CC remains_VBZ so_RB little_JJ affected_JJ by_IN relatively_RB large_JJ amounts_NNS of_IN urea_JJ ,_, that-_JJ all_PDT the_DT urea_NN over_IN likely_JJ to_TO be_VB fed_VBN ,_, even_RB to_TO a_DT high_JJ yielding_NN cow_NN in_IN full_JJ lactation_NN ,_, will_MD readily_RB be_VB converted_VBN to_TO ammonia_VB within_IN one_CD hr_NN ._.
The_DT inhibitory_JJ effect_NN of_IN sodium_NN fluoride_NN ,_, quinone_NN ,_, cysteine_NN ,_, boric_JJ acid_NN and_CC borax_NN on_IN the_DT urease_JJ activity_NN of_IN the_DT rumen_NNS liquor_NN was_VBD also_RB studied_VBN ._.
Toluene_NNP was_VBD found_VBN to_TO be_VB without_IN effect_NN ._.
It_PRP is_VBZ pointed_VBN out_RP that_IN the_DT urease_JJ activity_NN of_IN rumen_NNS liquor_FW is_VBZ similar_JJ to_TO urease_VB from_IN jack-bean_JJ meal_NN ,_, and_CC that_IN the_DT enzymes_NNS from_IN these_DT two_CD very_RB different_JJ sources_NNS have_VBP much_JJ in_IN common_JJ and_CC may_MD be_VB identical_JJ ._.
The_DT third_JJ article_NN deals_NNS with_IN the_DT conversion_NN of_IN ammonia_NN to_TO protein_VB in_IN the_DT rumen_NNS ._.
Here_RB again_RB ,_, incubation_NN of_IN rumen_NNS contents_NNS was_VBD carried_VBN out_RP under_IN a_DT variety_NN of_IN different_JJ condi-_JJ tions_NNS and_CC with_IN different_JJ substances_NNS ._.
The_DT microbiological_JJ condition_NN of_IN rumen_NNS ingesta_NN was_VBD found_VBN to_TO remain_VB practically_RB constant_JJ during_IN the_DT first_JJ 2-4_JJ hr_NN ._.
incubation_NN ._.
During_IN this_DT period_NN of_IN incubation_NN the_DT non-protein_JJ nitrogen_NN of_IN the_DT medium_NN diminished_VBN while_IN the_DT total_JJ nitrogen_NN remained_VBD unchanged_JJ ,_, suggesting_VBG that_IN synthesis_NN of_IN protein_NN took_VBD place_NN ._.

The_DT amount_NN of_IN synthesis_NN occurring_VBG in_IN two_CD hours_NNS in_IN the_DT presence_NN of_IN 0.3_CD gm_NN ._.
starch_NN per_IN 100_CD gm_NN ._.
rumen_NNS liquor_NN was_VBD usually_RB equivalent_JJ to_TO about_IN 8_CD mg._NNS nitrogen_JJ per_IN 100_CD gm_NN ._.
rumen_NNS liquor_NN ._.
A_DT study_NN of_IN the_DT influence_NN of_IN sodium_NN fluoride_NN ,_, quinone_NN ,_, boric_JJ acid_NN ,_, borax_NN ,_, toluene_NN ,_, temperature_NN and_CC the_DT effects_NNS of_IN filtration_NN and_CC fractionation_NN by_IN centrifuge_NN on_IN the_DT synthesis_NN of_IN protein_JJ re-_NN vealed_VBD that_IN ,_, when_WRB rumen_NNS liquor_VBP is_VBZ incubated_VBN with_IN starch_NN and_CC urea_NN at_IN 39°C_CD ,_, the_DT nitrogen_JJ metabolism_NN of_IN the_DT system_NN involved_VBN both_DT synthetic_JJ and_CC hydrolytic_JJ processes_NNS which_WDT probably_RB proceed_VBD simultaneously_RB ._.
These_DT processes_NNS are_VBP mi-_JJ crobiological_JJ in_IN origin_NN and_CC the_DT equilibrium_NN between_IN them_PRP is_VBZ very_RB readily_RB changed_VBN ,_, so_IN that_IN either_CC synthesis_NN or_CC hydrolysis_NN ABSTRACTS_NNP 245_CD predominates_NNS according_VBG to_TO the_DT conditions_NNS during_IN incuba-_JJ tion_NN ._.
The_DT possible_JJ bearing_NN of_IN this_DT on_IN the_DT utilization_NN of_IN non-_JJ protein_NN nitrogen_NN and_CC on_IN the_DT biological_JJ value_NN of_IN the_DT proteins_NNS for_IN ruminants_NNS is_VBZ briefly_NN discussed_VBN ._.

To_TO over-_JJ come_VB the_DT difficulties_NNS of_IN breeders_NNS in_IN the_DT United_NNP Kingdom_NNP in_IN rearing_VBG all_PDT their_PRP$ bull_NN calves_NNS to_TO breeding_VBG age_NN ,_, it_PRP is_VBZ suggested_VBN that_IN either_CC the_DT bull_NN calves_NNS should_MD be_VB reared_VBN on_IN the_DT War_NNP Agricultural_NNP Executive_NNP Committee_NNP 's_POS farm_NN (_( if_IN suitable_JJ faci-_JJ lities_NNS are_VBP available_JJ )_) or_CC week-old_JJ calves_NNS should_MD be_VB supplied_VBN to_TO the_DT commercial_JJ dairy_NN farmer_NN to_TO rear_VB for_IN himself_PRP ._.
(_( b_NN )_) The_DT means_NNS by_IN which_WDT the_DT commercial_JJ milk_NN producer_NN can_MD grade_VB up_RP his_PRP$ herd_NN by_IN the_DT use_NN of_IN such_JJ bulls_NNS ._.

Maternal_JJ inheritance_NN in_IN survival_NN of_IN embryos_NN from_IN reciprocal_JJ crosses_NNS involving_VBG the_DT creeper_NN factor_NN RECIPROCAL_NNP brother-sister_NN matings_NNS between_IN creeper_NN and_CC normal_JJ chickens_NNS were_VBD arranged_VBN in_IN order_NN to_TO determine_VB whether_IN creeper-laid_JJ eggs_NNS hatched_VBD less_JJR well_RB than_IN normal_JJ laid_VBN eggs_NNS ._.
Owing_VBG to_TO the_DT fact_NN that_IN the_DT effect_NN was_VBD slight_JJ ,_, elaborate_JJ pre-_JJ cautions_NNS were_VBD taken_VBN against_IN errors_NNS ._.
The_DT results_NNS showed_VBD that_IN there_EX was_VBD a_DT significantly_RB larger_JJR mortality_NN for_IN creeper-_NN laid_NN eggs_NNS in_IN the_DT 18-22_JJ day_NN incubation_NN period_NN ,_, but_CC not_RB earlier_RBR ._.
The_DT ratio_NN of_IN creeper-normal_JJ chicks_NNS hatching_VBG was_VBD not_RB affected_VBN ._.
The_DT explanation_NN given_VBN is_VBZ that_IN ,_, owing_VBG to_TO defective_VB endosteal_JJ bone_NN trabeculae_NN of_IN the_DT hens_NNS caused_VBN by_IN the_DT creeper_NN factor_NN ,_, less_JJR calcium_NN can_MD be_VB stored_VBN ,_, thus_RB causing_VBG eggs_NNS laid_VBN to_TO have_VB too_RB thick_JJ or_CC too_RB thin_JJ shells_NNS ._.

MGIPCORIGINAL_NNP ARTICLES_NNP A_NNP COMPARATIVE_NNP STUDY_NNP OF_NNP RINDERPEST_NNP BULL-GOAT-VIRUSES_NNP ,_, WITH_NNP A_NNP BRIEF_NNP SURVEY_NNP OF_IN THE_NNP WORK_NNP DONE_NNP WITH_NNP RINDERPEST_NNP GOAT_NNP VIRUS_NNP IN_NNP MADRAS_NNP By_IN R._NNP KRISHNAMURTI_NNP ,_, G.M.V.C._NNP ,_, Veterinary_NNP Assistant_NNP Surgeon_NNP ,_, Serum_NNP Institute_NNP (_( Madras_NNP )_) ,_, Coimbatore_NNP (_( Received_VBN for_IN publication_NN on_IN 24_CD March_NNP 1945_CD )_) WITH_VBD the_DT inauguration_NN of_IN a_DT Serum_NNP Institute_NNP at_IN Madras_NNP ,_, much_JJ work_NN has_VBZ been_VBN done_VBN to_TO evolve_VB a_DT safe_JJ ,_, efficient_JJ and_CC cheap_JJ method_NN of_IN combating_VBG rinderpest_NN in_IN this_DT province_NN ._.
Rinderpest_NNP virus_NN ,_, modified_VBN by_IN serial_JJ passage_NN through_IN goats_NNS ,_, was_VBD given_VBN an_DT extensive_JJ trial_NN both_DT at_IN the_DT laboratory_NN and_CC in_IN the_DT field_NN and_CC such_JJ modified_VBN virus_NN has_VBZ now_RB been_VBN employed_VBN for_IN the_DT last_JJ ten_JJ years_NNS ._.
*_NN Saunders_NNS and_CC Ayyar_NNP [_NNP 1936_CD ]_NNP were_VBD among_IN the_DT first_JJ to_TO put_VB the_DT method_NN of_IN immu-_JJ nizing_JJ cattle_NNS by_IN the_DT goat_NN virus_NN alone_RB method_NN to_TO a_DT critical_JJ and_CC controlled_JJ test_NN with_IN a_DT view_NN to_TO deter-_NN mine_NN whether_IN successive_JJ passages_NNS of_IN virus_NN through_IN goats_NNS would_MD so_RB alter_VB the_DT virus_NN as_IN to_TO make_VB it_PRP safe_JJ for_IN use_NN as_IN a_DT vaccine_NN for_IN protecting_VBG cattle_NNS against_IN the_DT disease_NN without_IN anti-serum_NN ._.
D'Costa_NNP [_NN 1938_CD ]_NNP says_VBZ that_IN goat_NN virus_NN causes_VBZ a_DT 70_CD per_IN cent_NN mortality_NN in_IN hill_NN bulls_NNS and_CC recommends_VBZ that_DT highly_RB susceptible_JJ animals_NNS should_MD be_VB immunized_VBN by_IN the_DT sero-virus_JJ method_NN ,_, employing_VBG '_'' fixed_VBN '_POS goat_NN virus_NN as_IN the_DT in-_JJ fective_JJ agent_NN and_CC slightly_RB reducing_VBG the_DT dose_NN of_IN pro-_JJ tective_JJ serum_NN ;_: while_IN Bachan_NNP Singh_NNP [_NNP 1939_CD ]_NNP states_NNS that_IN the_DT '_'' fixed_VBN '_POS virus_NN from_IN Mukteswar_NNP possesses_VBZ a_DT low_JJ virulence_NN for_IN cattle_NNS of_IN indigenous_JJ breed_NN and_CC that_IN it_PRP has_VBZ been_VBN found_VBN to_TO be_VB safe_JJ for_IN local-breed_JJ buffaloes_NNS of_IN Central_NNP Provinces_NNPS and_CC Berar_NNP ._.
Workers_NNS in_IN other_JJ provinces_NNS have_VBP reported_VBN favour-_JJ ably_RB on_IN the_DT use_NN of_IN the_DT goat_NN virus_NN alone_RB method_NN in_IN combating_VBG rinderpest_NN ,_, but_CC the_DT experience_NN gained_VBN in_IN this_DT province_NN goes_VBZ to_TO show_VB that_IN this_DT method_NN could_MD not_RB be_VB advocated_VBN for_IN wide_JJ use_NN ,_, as_IN it_PRP produces_VBZ undesirable_JJ reactions_NNS and_CC other_JJ bad_JJ effects_NNS after_IN inoculation_NN ._.
The_DT object_NN of_IN this_DT paper_NN is_VBZ to_TO place_VB on_IN record_NN a_DT brief_JJ survey_NN of_IN the_DT work_NN done_VBN in_IN this_DT province_NN with_IN goat_NN virus_NN and_CC to_TO make_VB a_DT comparative_JJ study_NN of_IN rinderpest_JJ bull_NN virus_NN and_CC rinderpest_VB goat_NN virus_NN ,_, with_IN a_DT view_NN to_TO find_VB out_RP whether_IN there_EX is_VBZ any_DT attenuation_NN of_IN the_DT virus_NN when_WRB maintained_VBN in_IN succes-_JJ sive_JJ passages_NNS through_IN goats_NNS ._.
RINDERPEST_NNP GOAT_NNP VIRUS_NNP The_DT goat_NN virus_NN is_VBZ maintained_VBN at_IN the_DT Serum_NNP Institute_NNP by_IN successive_JJ passages_NNS in_IN local_JJ breed_NN of_IN goats_NNS ._.
Two_CD strains_NNS of_IN virus_NN ,_, viz_NN ._.

Civil_NNP Veterinary_NNP Department_NNP ,_, Madras_NNP ,_, 1932.33_CD to_TO 1943-44._CD more_JJR than_IN 400_CD passages_NNS of_IN each_DT strain_NN were_VBD comp-_JJ leted_VBN ,_, the_DT two_CD were_VBD amalgamated_VBN together_RB and_CC maintained_VBD as_IN a_DT single_JJ strain_NN ,_, Madras_NNP strain_VBP No_NNP ._.
2_CD ,_, as_IN it_PRP was_VBD found_VBN that_IN there_EX was_VBD not_RB much_JJ difference_NN in_IN the_DT degree_NN and_CC percentage_NN of_IN reactions_NNS set_VBN up_RP by_IN them_PRP in_IN the_DT control_NN buffalo-calves_NNS ._.
In_IN the_DT mean-_NN while_IN a_DT quantity_NN of_IN '_'' fixed_VBN goat_NN virus_NN '_'' was_VBD obtained_VBN from_IN Mukteswar_NNP and_CC that_DT is_VBZ also_RB now_RB being_VBG main-_JJ tained_VBN as_IN '_'' Mukteswar_NNP strain_VBP No_NNP ._.

It_PRP is_VBZ the_DT general_JJ experience_NN that_IN the_DT administra-_JJ tion_NN of_IN goat_NN virus_NN ,_, either_RB blood_NN virus_NN or_CC tissue_NN virus_NN ,_, which_WDT produces_VBZ a_DT reliable_JJ immunity_NN ,_, is_VBZ attended_VBN with_IN a_DT considerable_JJ amount_NN of_IN risk_NN and_CC that_IN a_DT certain_JJ proportion_NN of_IN animals_NNS so_RB inoculated_JJ ,_, especially_RB buffaloes_NNS ,_, develop_VB a_DT severe_JJ reaction_NN and_CC in_IN some_DT cases_NNS mortality_NN also_RB occurs_VBZ ._.

alone_RB method_NN of_IN inoculation_NN in_IN the_DT Madras_NNP Province_NNP is_VBZ given_VBN ._.
Two_CD strains_NNS of_IN goat_NN virus_NN ,_, the_DT Mukteswar_NNP strain_NN and_CC the_DT Madras_NNP strain_NN ,_, are_VBP maintained_VBN at_IN the_DT Serum_NNP Institute_NNP ,_, Madras_NNP ,_, and_CC there_EX is_VBZ not_RB much_JJ difference_NN in_IN the_DT nature_NN and_CC percentage_NN of_IN reactions_NNS set_VBN up_RP by_IN them_PRP in_IN the_DT control_NN calves_VBZ ._.
It_PRP was_VBD found_VBN both_DT from_IN experiments_NNS conducted_VBN in_IN the_DT laboratory_NN and_CC in_IN the_DT field_NN that_IN the_DT method_NN of_IN protecting_VBG cattle_NNS against_IN rinderpest_NN by_IN the_DT goat_NN virus_NN alone_RB was_VBD not_RB quite_RB a_DT safe_JJ one_CD ._.
The_DT reactions_NNS set_VBD up_RP by_IN this_DT method_NN in_IN the_DT control_NN calves_VBZ were_VBD severe_JJ resulting_VBG in_IN a_DT mortality_NN of_IN 21.5_CD per_IN cent_NN amongst_IN them_PRP ._.
In_IN the_DT field_NN ,_, though_IN the_DT percentage_NN of_IN mortality_NN was_VBD negligible_JJ ,_, the_DT severity_NN of_IN reactions_NNS set_VBN up_RP by_IN this_DT method_NN ,_, especially_RB in_IN buffaloes_NNS ,_, was_VBD such_JJ that_IN it_PRP became_VBD unpopular_JJ among_IN the_DT ryots_NNS who_WP could_MD ill-afford_VB to_TO have_VB some_DT of_IN their_PRP$ animals_NNS incapacitated_VBN for_IN work_NN and_CC their_PRP$ milk_NN yield_NN reduced_VBD even_RB for_IN a_DT short_JJ period_NN ._.
The_DT spleen_JJ tissue_NN emulsion_NN in_IN normal_JJ saline_JJ solu-_JJ tion_NN also_RB behaved_VBD in_IN the_DT same_JJ manner_NN as_IN the_DT blood_NN virus_NN ;_: hence_NN it_PRP could_MD not_RB also_RB be_VB advocated_VBN for_IN use_NN without_IN anti-serum_NN ._.
From_IN experience_NN gained_VBN in_IN this_DT province_NN it_PRP may_MD be_VB said_VBD that_IN the_DT ideal_JJ attenuation_NN of_IN the_DT virus_NN for_IN use_NN as_IN such_JJ without_IN anti-serum_NN ,_, in_IN bovines_NNS ,_, can_MD not_RB be_VB said_VBD to_TO have_VB been_VBN obtained_VBN by_IN successive_JJ pas-_NN sages_NNS through_IN goats_NNS ._.
The_DT percentage_NN of_IN mortality_NN among_IN goat_JJ virus_NNS control_NN calves_VBZ was_VBD observed_VBN to_TO be_VB much_RB less_JJR ,_, less_JJR than_IN even_RB half_NN of_IN that_DT which_WDT occurred_VBD among_IN the_DT calves_NNS used_VBN for_IN the_DT production_NN of_IN bull_NN virus_NN ,_, though_IN appreciable_JJ difference_NN was_VBD not_RB noticed_VBN in_IN the_DT degree_NN and_CC nature_NN of_IN other_JJ reactions_NNS ._.

RinderpestIMMUNIZATION_NNP OF_NNP BUFFALOES_NNP AGAINST_NNP RINDEEPEST_NNP IN_NNP ASSAM*_NNP By_IN V._NNP R._NNP GOPALAKRISHNAN_NNP ,_, Veterinary_NNP Investigation_NNP Officer_NNP ,_, Assam_NNP (_( Received_VBN for_IN publication_NN on_IN 24_CD April_NNP 1945_CD )_) RINDERPEST_NN in_IN buffaloes_NNS is_VBZ of_IN common_JJ occurrence_NN in_IN Assam_NNP and_CC heavy_JJ mortality_NN is_VBZ often_RB observed_VBN ._.
The_DT technique_NN of_IN goat_NN virus_NN vaccination_NN ,_, with_IN or_CC without_IN serum_NN ,_, has_VBZ been_VBN adopted_VBN for_IN the_DT control_NN of_IN outbreaks_NNS ._.
The_DT object_NN of_IN this_DT paper_NN is_VBZ to_TO present_VB a_DT brief_JJ description_NN of_IN certain_JJ features_NNS observed_VBN in_IN the_DT course_NN of_IN immunization_NN of_IN the_DT local_JJ types_NNS of_IN buffaloes_NNS and_CC those_DT in_IN different_JJ localities_NNS of_IN the_DT province_NN ._.
It_PRP may_MD be_VB stated_VBN that_DT vaccination_NN with_IN goat_NN tissue_NN virus_NN (_( 1_CD c.c_NN ._.
of_IN 1_CD :_: 200_CD spleen_JJ emulsion_NN in_IN saline_NN )_) ,_, has_VBZ been_VBN adopted_VBN as_IN a_DT routine_NN ,_, both_CC as_IN a_DT prophylactic_JJ and_CC for_IN control_NN of_IN outbreaks_NNS in_IN cattle_NNS and_CC this_DT method_NN has_VBZ given_VBN very_RB encouraging_JJ results_NNS for_IN some_DT years_NNS now_RB ._.
In_IN regard_NN to_TO buffaloes_NNS ,_, immunization_NN is_VBZ usually_RB undertaken_JJ in_IN actual_JJ outbreaks_NNS of_IN rinderpest_NN and_CC not_RB as_IN a_DT prophylactic_JJ measure_NN ._.
This_DT is_VBZ mainly_RB lue_JJ to_TO the_DT fact_NN that_IN there_EX is_VBZ evidence_NN of_IN a_DT wide_JJ ange_NN in_IN the_DT degree_NN of_IN reaction_NN in_IN the_DT local_JJ types_NNS of_IN buffaloes_NNS and_CC also_RB in_IN buffaloes_NNS in_IN different_JJ areas_NNS ._.
A._JJ standard_NN routine_NN for_IN vaccination_NN of_IN buffaloes_NNS could_MD not_RB be_VB fixed_VBN as_IN the_DT dosage_NN of_IN serum_NN is_VBZ variable_JJ and_CC has_VBZ to_TO be_VB regulated_VBN in_IN accordance_NN with_IN these_DT two_CD factors_NNS ._.
Field_NNP observations_NNS indicate_VBP that_IN the_DT reaction_NN is_VBZ more_RBR severe_JJ in_IN buffaloes_NNS than_IN in_IN cattle_NNS ._.
As_IN a_DT result_NN of_IN such_JJ severe_JJ reaction_NN ,_, partial_JJ reduc-_JJ tion_NN or_CC complete_JJ cessation_NN of_IN milk_NN yield_NN and_CC diarrh254_JJ Immunization_NNP of_IN Buffaloes_NNP against_IN Rinderpest_NNP in_IN Assam_NNP in_IN milk_NN yield_NN ,_, in_IN some_DT cases_NNS even_RB by_IN one-half_NN ._.
They_PRP recover_VBP in_IN the_DT course_NN of_IN a_DT fortnight_NN and_CC mortality_NN is_VBZ very_RB rare_JJ ._.
Animals_NNS of_IN mixed_JJ breed_NN (_( local_JJ and_CC hill_JJ types_NNS )_) in_IN this_DT locality_NN are_VBP given_VBN 0.5_CD c.c_NN ._.
of_IN vac-_JJ cine_NN and_CC a_DT flat_JJ dose_NN of_IN 40_CD c.c_NN ._.
of_IN ordinary_JJ anti-_JJ rinderpest_NN serum_NN simultaneously_RB ._.
The_DT reaction_NN mani-_NN fested_VBN in_IN several_JJ cases_NNS is_VBZ mild_JJ with_IN slight_JJ decrease_NN in_IN milk_NN yield_NN ;_: a_DT few_JJ develop_NN diarrhF_NN ._.
W._NNP PRIESTLEY_NNP AND_NNP D._NNP ARTIOLI_NNP 255_CD anxiety_NN to_TO the_DT owner_NN and_CC the_DT operator_NN alike_RB ._.
The_DT most_RBS satisfactory_JJ method_NN appears_VBZ to_TO be_VB the_DT use_NN of_IN adequate_JJ quantity_NN of_IN serum_NN which_WDT inhibits_VBZ severe_JJ reaction_NN and_CC thus_RB causes_VBZ a_DT minimum_JJ loss_NN in_IN milk_JJ yield_NN ._.
Such_JJ loss_NN is_VBZ inevitable_JJ as_IN inoculation_NN ,_, operation_NN or_CC even_RB any_DT physical_JJ interference_NN with_IN the_DT buffaloes_NNS affects_VBZ these_DT temperamentally_RB and_CC usually_RB reduces_VBZ their_PRP$ milk-yield_NN for_IN one_CD or_CC two_CD days_NNS ._.
It_PRP may_MD ,_, however_RB ,_, be_VB mentioned_VBN in_IN this_DT con-_JJ nection_NN that_IN in_IN the_DT Central_NNP Provinces_NNPS and_CC Berar_NNP the_DT method_NN of_IN blood_NN virus-cum-serum_NN was_VBD experi-_JJ mentally_RB found_VBN to_TO be_VB the_DT safest_JJS ;_: the_DT loss_NN in_IN milk_NN yield_NN being_VBG lowest_JJS ,_, viz_NN ._.
25_CD per_IN cent_NN [_NN Singh_NNP ,_, 1939_CD ]_NN ._.
Fall_NN in_IN condition_NN or_CC general_JJ health_NN has_VBZ also_RB been_VBN observed_VBN following_VBG vaccination_NN in_IN the_DT field_NN ._.
Although_IN severe_JJ reaction_NN is_VBZ likely_JJ to_TO bring_VB about_RP this_DT condi-_JJ tion_NN ,_, the_DT absence_NN of_IN green_JJ fodder_NN aggravates_VBZ it_PRP ._.
It_PRP would_MD be_VB preferable_JJ as_RB far_RB as_IN possible_JJ to_TO undertake_VB vaccination_NN as_RB far_RB as_IN at_IN a_DT time_NN when_WRB there_EX is_VBZ ample_JJ green_JJ fodder_NN ._.
SUMMARY_VB A_DT brief_JJ description_NN of_IN the_DT types_NNS of_IN buffaloes_NNS in_IN Assam_NNP and_CC their_PRP$ distribution_NN in_IN different_JJ localities_NNS ,_, is_VBZ given_VBN ._.
Rinderpest_NNP is_VBZ of_IN common_JJ occurrence_NN in_IN Assam_NNP ,_, causing_VBG heavy_JJ mortality_NN among_IN buffaloes_NNS ._.
Details_NNS are_VBP given_VBN of_IN the_DT field_NN experiments_NNS conducted_VBD to_TO evolve_VB the_DT most_RBS suitable_JJ method_NN of_IN immunization_NN of_IN buffaloes_NNS against_IN the_DT disease_NN in_IN the_DT province_NN ._.
Particulars_NNS of_IN the_DT type_NN and_CC degree_NN of_IN reaction_NN in_IN the_DT methods_NNS adopted_VBN to_TO control_VB the_DT disease_NN are_VBP described_VBN ._.
There_EX is_VBZ evidence_NN of_IN a_DT wide_JJ variation_NN in_IN the_DT degree_NN of_IN reaction_NN in_IN the_DT local_JJ types_NNS of_IN buffaloes_NNS and_CC also_RB in_IN buffaloes_NNS in_IN different_JJ areas_NNS ,_, viz_NN ._.
plains_NNS ,_, hills_NNS and_CC forests_NNS ._.
Vaccination_NN with_IN goat-tissue_JJ virus_NN ,_, along_IN with_IN 30_CD to_TO 40_CD c.c_NN ._.
of_IN serum_NN ,_, appears_VBZ to_TO be_VB the_DT safest_JJS method_NN ,_, as_IN it_PRP obviates_VBZ to_TO a_DT large_JJ extent_NN the_DT risk_NN of_IN mortality_NN and_CC loss_NN in_IN milk_JJ yield_NN ._.

Census_NNP of_IN India_NNP ,_, 1911_CD ,_, 3_CD (_( Assam_NNP )_) STREPTOCOCCUS_NNP MASTITIS_NNP IN_NNP BUFFALOES_NNP By_IN F._NNP W._NNP PRIESTLEY_NNP and_CC D._NNP ARTIOLI_NNP ,_, Military_NNP Veterinary_NNP Laboratory_NNP ,_, Lahore_NNP (_( Received_VBN for_IN publication_NN on_IN 27_CD March_NNP 1945_CD )_) IT_NNP has_VBZ been_VBN generally_RB assumed_VBN locally_RB that_DT mastitis_NN in_IN buffaloes_NNS is_VBZ of_IN little_JJ importance_NN ._.
Since_IN relatively_RB slight_JJ experience_NN convinced_VBD us_PRP that_IN this_DT view_NN was_VBD incorrect_JJ ,_, work_NN on_IN the_DT problem_NN was_VBD begun_VBN with_IN the_DT results_NNS outlined_VBD below_IN ._.
It_PRP was_VBD soon_RB realized_VBN that_IN the_DT examination_NN of_IN several_JJ hundred_CD milk_NN samples_NNS by_IN a_DT plating_NN technique_NN was_VBD beyond_IN the_DT capacity_NN of_IN this_DT laboratory_NN ._.
It_PRP was_VBD therefore_RB decided_JJ to_TO adopt_VB the_DT incubated_JJ milk_NN technique_NN described_VBN fully_RB by_IN van_NN Rensburgh_NNP [_NN 1941_CD ]_NN and_CC since_IN reported_VBN with_IN some_DT favour_NNS by_IN Rowlands_NNP and_CC Field_NNP [_NNP 1943_CD ]_NNP and_CC by_IN Field_NNP and_CC Smith_NNP [_NNP 1944_CD ]_NNP ._.
Briefly_NNP ,_, this_DT technique_NN consists_VBZ of_IN incubating_VBG mixed_JJ quarter_NN samples_NNS of_IN milk_NN from_IN each_DT animal_NN at_IN 37°C_CD ._.
and_CC examining_VBG stained_JJ smears_NNS for_IN the_DT presence_NN of_IN streptococci_$ 18_CD to_TO 24_CD hours_NNS later_RB ._.
No_DT attempt_NN has_VBZ been_VBN made_VBN here_RB to_TO compare_VB the_DT van_NN Rensburgh_NNP technique_NN with_IN any_DT other_JJ ,_, but_CC it_PRP is_VBZ worth_JJ mentioning_VBG that_IN ,_, when_WRB occasion_NN has_VBZ demanded_VBN the_DT isolation_NN of_IN mastitis_NN streptococci_NN ,_, these_DT organisms_NNS have_VBP invariably_RB been_VBN isolated_VBN from_IN van_JJ Rensburgh_NNP positive_JJ samples_NNS ._.
Our_PRP$ work_NN is_VBZ recorded_VBN under_IN the_DT three_CD headings_NNS ,_, general_JJ epidemiology_NN ,_, vaccination_NN and_CC eradication_NN ._.
GENERAL_NNP EPIDEMIOLOGY_NNP Bacteriology_NNP The_DT vast_JJ majority_NN of_IN infected_JJ buffaloes_NNS examined_VBN by_IN us_PRP have_VBP been_VBN infected_VBN with_IN streptococci_NN and_CC this_DT work_NN has_VBZ been_VBN concerned_VBN entirely_RB with_IN that_DT type_NN of_IN organism_NN ._.
The_DT number_NN of_IN samples_NNS containing_VBG staphylococci_NN has_VBZ been_VBN relatively_RB low_JJ ,_, although_IN a_DT certain_JJ number_NN of_IN clinical_JJ cases_NNS have_VBP been_VBN associated_VBN with_IN Staph_NNP ,_, aureus_NN ._.
The_DT number_NN of_IN C._NNP pyogenes_NNS cases_NNS has_VBZ been_VBN even_RB lower_JJR ,_, though_IN this_DT organism_NN too_RB has_VBZ been_VBN isolated_VBN occasionally_RB ._.
No_DT case_NN of_IN tuberculous_JJ mastitis_NN in_IN buffaloes_NNS has_VBZ been_VBN met_VBN with_IN ,_, but_CC serious_JJ search_NN for_IN this_DT organism_NN has_VBZ not_RB been_VBN made_VBN ._.
We_PRP have_VBP not_RB carried_VBN out_RP serological_JJ tests_NNS in_IN this_DT laboratory_NN on_IN mastitis_NN streptococci_NN but_CC ,_, judging_NN by_IN the_DT biochemical_JJ reactions_NNS ,_, they_PRP would_MD nearly_RB always_RB fall_VB into_IN Lancefield_NNP 's_POS group_NN B_NNP ,_, as_IN might_MD be_VB expected_VBN ._.
These_DT local_JJ strains_NNS give_VBP ß-haemolysis_NN in_IN horse-blood_NN agar_NN ,_, a_DT final_JJ pH_NN in_IN glucose-broth_NN of_IN about_IN 4.3_CD after_IN four_CD days_NNS incubation_NN ,_, hydrolyse_JJ sodium_NN hippurate_NN ,_, fail_VBP to_TO reduce_VB 1_CD in_IN 5000_CD methylene_NN blue_NN in_IN milk_NN ,_, produce_VBP acid_NN in_IN lactose_JJ and_CC trehalose_JJ ,_, B_NNP 256_CD Streptococcus_NNP Mastitis_NNP in_IN Buffaloes_NNP sometimes_RB in_IN salicin_NN ,_, but_CC not_RB as_IN a_DT rule_NN in_IN mannitol_NN or_CC sorbitol_NN ._.
General_NNP incidence_NN Before_IN any_DT policy_NN concerning_VBG mastitis_NN could_MD be_VB suggested_VBN ,_, it_PRP was_VBD necessary_JJ to_TO be_VB convinced_VBN that_IN the_DT disease_NN was_VBD in_IN fact_NN widespread_JJ and_CC of_IN importance_NN ._.
Between_NNP May_NNP and_CC October_NNP ,_, 1944_CD ,_, a_DT preliminary_JJ survey_NN was_VBD therefore_RB undertaken_JJ on_IN three_CD different_JJ farms_NNS ;_: during_IN the_DT same_JJ period_NN ,_, another_DT laboratory_NN working_VBG in_IN cooperation_NN with_IN us_PRP undertook_VBP the_DT examination_NN of_IN two_CD more_JJR farms_NNS ._.
*_IN The_DT results_NNS are_VBP recorded_VBN in_IN Table_JJ I_PRP from_IN which_WDT it_PRP may_MD ._.
be_VB seen_VBN that_IN the_DT incidence_NN of_IN infection_NN varied_VBN from_IN 13.1_CD to_TO 18.5_CD per_IN cent_NN ,_, and_CC that_IN of_IN the_DT total_JJ number_NN of_IN 3,322_CD animals_NNS examined_VBD 16.0_CD per_IN cent_NN were_VBD infected_VBN ._.
Since_IN the_DT original_JJ survey_NN ,_, other_JJ examinations_NNS have_VBP been_VBN carried_VBN out_RP on_IN some_DT of_IN these_DT farms_NNS and_CC the_DT results_NNS have_VBP confirmed_VBN the_DT finding_NN of_IN a_DT fairly_RB high_JJ incidence_NN of_IN infection_NN ._.
The_DT indications_NNS were_VBD therefore_RB that_IN streptococcus_NN mastitis_NN was_VBD fairly_RB widespread_JJ and_CC it_PRP was_VBD to_TO be_VB assumed_VBN that_IN it_PRP was_VBD the_DT cause_NN of_IN considerable_JJ economic_JJ loss_NN ._.

Our_PRP$ results_NNS indicate_VBP a_DT similar_JJ finding_NN in_IN buffaloes_NNS ,_, though_IN our_PRP$ numbers_NNS were_VBD too_RB small_JJ to_TO be_VB statistically_RB significant_JJ ._.
It_PRP may_MD be_VB briefly_NN stated_VBN that_IN at_IN all_DT ages_VBZ up_RP to_TO 10_CD years_NNS there_RB was_VBD a_DT greater_JJR incidence_NN of_IN mastitis_NN during_IN the_DT first_JJ hundred_JJ days_NNS of_IN lactation_NN than_IN at_IN later_JJ stages_NNS ._.

Milk_NN yields_NNS of_IN infected_JJ and_CC non-infected_JJ buffaloes_NNS It_PRP is_VBZ accepted_VBN that_IN cows_VBZ give_VB a_DT reduced_VBN milk_NN yield_NN when_WRB they_PRP become_VBP infected_JJ with_IN mastitis_NN strep-_JJ tococci_NN but_CC very_RB few_JJ workers_NNS have_VBP actually_RB demons-_JJ trated_VBD this_DT with_IN figures_NNS ._.
Minett_NNP and_CC Martin_NNP [_NNP 1936_CD ]_NNP studied_VBN by_IN statistical_JJ methods_NNS the_DT relationship_NN of_IN milk_NN yield_NN to_TO infection_NN by_IN Br_NNP ._.
abortus_NN and_CC Str_NNP ._.

In_IN the_DT case_NN of_IN the_DT latter_NN they_PRP found_VBD that_IN with_IN Ayrshire_NNP cows_NNS in_IN one_CD herd_NN the_DT corrected_JJ yield_NN was_VBD reduced_VBN by_IN 10.8_CD per_IN cent_NN ,_, with_IN Friesian_JJ cows_NNS in_IN two_CD herds_NNS the_DT percentage_NN reductions_NNS in_IN corrected_JJ yields_NNS amounted_VBD to_TO 16.5_CD and_CC 19.5_CD ._.
We_PRP obtained_VBD milk_JJ yield_NN data_NNS for_IN a_DT small_JJ number_NN of_IN buffaloes_NNS seven_CD years_NNS old_JJ ._.
and_CC over_IN ._.

Again_RB ,_, it_PRP is_VBZ to_TO be_VB noted_VBN that_DT at_IN all_DT stages_NNS of_IN lactation_NN the_DT infected_JJ animals_NNS have_VBP given_VBN less_JJR milk_NN than_IN non-infected_JJ animals_NNS ._.
We_PRP think_VBP that_IN these_DT results_NNS ,_, perhaps_RB inconclusive_JJ by_IN themselves_PRP ,_, lend_VB support_NN to_TO the_DT general_JJ belief_NN that_IN mastitis_NN infection_NN leads_VBZ to_TO a_DT lowering_NN of_IN milk_NN yield_NN ._.
Vaccination_NN In_IN September_NNP 1944_CD ,_, there_EX was_VBD an_DT opportunity_NN to_TO carry_VB out_RP a_DT controlled_JJ vaccination_NN experiment_NN ._.
While_IN we_PRP did_VBD not_RB expect_VB vaccination_NN to_TO be_VB beneficial_JJ ,_, the_DT opportunity_NN seemed_VBD too_RB good_JJ to_TO miss_VB and_CC experi-_JJ mental_JJ work_NN was_VBD therefore_RB commenced_JJ ._.
Vaccine_NNP was_VBD prepared_VBN from_IN five_CD strains_NNS of_IN streptococci_NN isolated_VBN from_IN buffaloes_NNS in_IN the_DT herd_NN concerned_VBN ._.
All_DT strains_NNS gave_VBD 258_CD Streptococcus_NNP Mastitis_NNP in_IN Buffaloes_NNP The_DT total_JJ weekly_JJ yield_NN in_IN lb_NN ._.
for_IN each_DT of_IN the_DT animals_NNS is_VBZ shown_VBN in_IN Table_NNP V._NNP It_PRP may_MD be_VB seen_VBN that_IN the_DT total_JJ yield_NN of_IN the_DT ten_NN animals_NNS for_IN the_DT week_NN pre-_JJ ceding_NN vaccination_NN was_VBD 699_CD lb._NN ,_, for_IN the_DT week_NN follow-_JJ ing_VBG the_DT first_JJ inoculation_NN 680_CD lb._NN ,_, and_CC for_IN the_DT week_NN after_IN the_DT second_JJ inoculation_NN 732_CD lb_NN ._.
From_IN these_DT results_NNS it_PRP was_VBD concluded_VBN that_IN vaccination_NN would_MD have_VB no_DT appreciable_JJ effect_NN on_IN milk_NN yield_NN ._.

First_NNP week_NN Milk_NNP yield_NN (_( in_IN lb_NN ._. )_)

DISCUSSION_NNP The_DT data_NN presented_VBN in_IN this_DT paper_NN suggest_VBP that_IN streptococcus_JJ infection_NN of_IN the_DT buffalo_NN udder_NN is_VBZ a_DT good_JJ deal_NN more_RBR prevalent_NN than_IN is_VBZ generally_RB suspected_VBN ._.
It_PRP would_MD seem_VB that_DT infection_NN is_VBZ spread_VBN primarily_RB by_IN the_DT milkers_NNS ._.
It_PRP is_VBZ the_DT practice_NN here_RB for_IN one_CD gawala_NN to_TO attend_VB to_TO and_CC milk_VB about_IN twelve_NN or_CC thirteen_JJ animals_NNS ._.
When_WRB infection_NN appears_VBZ ,_, it_PRP arises_VBZ in_IN groups_NNS of_IN animals_NNS standing_VBG in_IN adjacent_JJ standings_NNS ;_: as_IN a_DT rule_NN these_DT foci_NNS of_IN infection_NN are_VBP within_IN a_DT particular_JJ gawala_NN 's_POS domain_NN and_CC do_VBP not_RB overlap_VB to_TO the_DT next_JJ one_NN ._.
A_DT factor_NN which_WDT may_MD be_VB of_IN prime_JJ importance_NN in_IN treating_VBG or_CC eliminating_VBG mastitis_NN is_VBZ the_DT intermittency_NN of_IN excretion_NN of_IN streptococci_NN ;_: this_DT is_VBZ perhaps_RB especial-_JJ ly_NN the_DT case_NN in_IN buffaloes_NNS ._.
It_PRP is_VBZ clear_JJ that_IN a_DT single_JJ test_NN of_IN the_DT van_NN Rensburgh_NNP type_NN will_MD not_RB be_VB sufficient_JJ to_TO pick_VB out_RP all_DT infected_JJ animals_NNS ._.
Referring_VBG to_TO Table_NNP II_NNP ,_, for_IN instance_NN ,_, it_PRP may_MD be_VB seen_VBN that_IN of_IN the_DT 561_CD animals_NNS negative_JJ at_IN the_DT second_JJ test_NN ,_, 62_CD (_( 11.0_CD per_IN cent_NN )_) were_VBD in_IN fact_NN known_VBN to_TO be_VB infected_VBN from_IN the_DT result_NN of_IN a_DT previous_JJ test_NN ._.
This_DT is_VBZ a_DT serious_JJ difficulty_NN and_CC its_PRP$ only_JJ solution_NN at_IN the_DT moment_NN lies_VBZ in_IN repeated_JJ examinations_NNS of_IN negative_JJ animals_NNS ._.
In_IN spite_NN of_IN the_DT many_JJ difficulties_NNS our_PRP$ results_NNS tend_VBP to_TO show_VB that_IN mastitis_NN control_NN in_IN buffaloes_NNS is_VBZ a_DT practical_JJ and_CC probably_RB an_DT economic_JJ proposition_NN ._.
By_IN rela-_JJ tively_RB simple_JJ methods_NNS ,_, we_PRP have_VBP managed_VBN to_TO limit_VB the_DT spread_NN of_IN the_DT disease_NN for_IN the_DT short_JJ period_NN that_IN the_DT animals_NNS were_VBD under_IN our_PRP$ control_NN ._.

negative_JJ animals_NNS ,_, we_PRP could_MD presumably_RB have_VB reduced_VBN the_DT incidence_NN of_IN the_DT disease_NN still_RB more_RBR ._.

This_DT technique_NN not_RB only_RB simple_JJ but_CC quick_JJ ;_: as_IN an_DT example_NN ,_, it_PRP ay_RB be_VB noted_VBN that_IN in_IN this_DT laboratory_NN on_IN one_CD occasion_NN wo_MD workers_NNS prepared_VBD ,_, starned_VBD and_CC examined_VBD 561_CD nears_NNS in_IN one_CD day_NN (_( under_IN eight_CD hours_NNS )_) ;_: incidentally_RB II_NNP the_DT smears_NNS were_VBD examined_VBN by_IN one_CD man_NN ._.

We_PRP feel_VBP that_IN this_DT is_VBZ an_DT important_JJ observation_NN hich_NN needs_VBZ emphasis_NN ,_, particularly_RB in_IN areas_NNS from_IN hich_JJ laboratory_NN facilities_NNS are_VBP distant_JJ ._.

SUMMARY_NNP Examination_NNP of_IN 3,322_CD milk_NN buffaloes_NNS on_IN five_CD ifferent_JJ farms_NNS by_IN the_DT technique_NN of_IN incubated_JJ milk_NN samples_NNS revealed_VBD an_DT average_NN of_IN 16.0_CD per_IN cent_NN strepto_NN coccus_NN infection_NN ._.
2_CD ._.
Infected_VBN buffaloes_NNS apparently_RB excrete_VBP strepto_JJ cocci_NN intermittently_RB ._.
As_RB many_JJ as_IN 50_CD per_IN cent_NN known_VBN infected_JJ animals_NNS may_MD be_VB negative_JJ at_IN a_DT given_VBN test_NN 3_CD ._.
Additional_JJ evidence_NN is_VBZ brought_VBN in_IN favour_NN of_IN the_DT general_JJ belief_NN that_IN the_DT incidence_NN of_IN mastitis_NN increases_NNS with_IN the_DT age_NN of_IN the_DT animal_NN ,_, and_CC that_IN the_DT early_JJ period_NN of_IN lactation_NN is_VBZ the_DT period_NN of_IN greates_NNS susceptibility_NN ._.
4_CD ._.
Some_DT evidence_NN is_VBZ adduced_VBN in_IN favour_NN of_IN the_DT belief_NN that_IN non-infected_JJ animals_NNS give_VBP a_DT higher_JJR milk_NN yield_NN than_IN do_VB infected_JJ ones_NNS ._.
5_CD ._.
In_IN our_PRP$ hands_NNS vaccination_NN as_IN a_DT means_NN of_IN pre-_JJ venting_NN or_CC of_IN curing_VBG the_DT disease_NN has_VBZ been_VBN quite_RB without_IN effect_NN ._.
6_CD ._.
Eradication_NN by_IN the_DT removal_NN of_IN infected_JJ animals_NNS is_VBZ indicated_VBN as_IN a_DT practical_JJ proposition_NN ._.
To_TO be_VB successful_JJ strict_JJ adherence_NN to_TO commonsense_VB principles_NNS must_MD be_VB enforced_VBN ;_: any_DT relaxation_NN of_IN these_DT principles_NNS is_VBZ likely_JJ to_TO lead_VB to_TO disaster_NN ._.
7_CD ._.
It_PRP has_VBZ been_VBN noted_VBN that_IN the_DT spread_NN of_IN the_DT disease_NN is_VBZ materially_RB affected_VBN by_IN the_DT number_NN of_IN infected_JJ animals_NNS present_JJ ,_, at_IN least_JJS when_WRB these_DT are_VBP above_IN a_DT certain_JJ minimum_NN ._.
