KEEPING_NNP QUALITY_NNP OF_IN FARM-PRODUCED_NNP AND_NNP PROCESSED_NNP MILK_NNP By_IN K._NNP K._NNP DESAI_NNP ,_, G._NNP S._NNP THAKRE_NNP AND_NNP K._NNP C._NNP SEN.Imperial_NNP Dairy_NNP Research_NNP Institute_NNP ,_, Bangalore_NNP (_( Received_VBN for_IN publication_NN on_IN 17_CD September_NNP 1945_CD )_) IT_NNP is_VBZ now_RB recognized_VBN that_IN in_IN hygienic_JJ supply_NN of_IN milk_NN from_IN rural_JJ areas_NNS to_TO urban_JJ population_NN refri-_NN gerated_JJ system_NN of_IN transport_NN occupies_NNS a_DT most_RBS promi-_JJ nent_JJ position_NN ._.
Unfortunately_RB under_IN present_JJ con-_JJ ditions_NNS ,_, this_DT involves_VBZ high_JJ initial_JJ cost_NN as_RB well_RB as_IN high_JJ recurring_VBG expenditure_NN ._.
Since_IN the_DT chief_NN cause_NN of_IN spoilage_NN of_IN milk_NN is_VBZ bacterial_JJ contamination_NN ,_, it_PRP is_VBZ desirable_JJ to_TO find_VB out_RP if_IN other_JJ methods_NNS of_IN treat-_JJ ment_NN such_JJ as_IN heating_VBG the_DT milk_NN to_TO the_DT pasteurizing_NN temperature_NN ,_, which_WDT destroys_VBZ a_DT major_JJ portion_NN of_IN the_DT organisms_NNS ,_, coupled_VBN with_IN its_PRP$ transportation_NN in_IN a_DT hot_JJ condition_NN would_MD be_VB successful_JJ in_IN preventing_VBG the_DT spoilage_NN ._.
The_DT idea_NN is_VBZ not_RB a_DT new_JJ one_CD as_IN Bern-_NNP stein_NN [_NN 1893_CD ]_NN claimed_VBD good_JJ results_NNS in_IN the_DT ._.
transport_NN of_IN hot_JJ milk_NN at_IN 70ºC_CD ._.
between_IN Hamburg_NNP and_CC Berlin_NNP ,_, a_DT railway_NN journey_NN of_IN 10_CD hours_NNS ._.
On_IN the_DT other_JJ hand_NN ,_, Ayers_NNP and_CC Johnson_NNP [_NNP 1923_CD ]_NN reviewed_VBD the_DT position_NN and_CC came_VBD to_TO the_DT conclusion_NN that_IN milk_NN could_MD not_RB be_VB kept_VBN in_IN a_DT good_JJ condition_NN for_IN 24_CD hours_NNS at_IN a_DT tem-_JJ perature_NN of_IN 50°-60°C_JJ ._.
because_IN of_IN the_DT growth_NN of_IN ther-_JJ mophilic_JJ bacteria_NNS ._.
No_DT record_NN of_IN similar_JJ work_NN carried_VBD out_RP in_IN India_NNP under_IN controlled_JJ conditions_NNS is_VBZ available_JJ ,_, but_CC it_PRP is_VBZ reported_VBN that_IN it_PRP is_VBZ a_DT common_JJ practice_NN adopt-_JJ ed_NN by_IN some_DT Military_NNP Dairy_NNP Farms_NNP to_TO issue_VB hot_JJ milk_NN (_( 145ºF_CD ._. )_)
to_TO customers_NNS during_IN summer_NN months_NNS ._.
*_IN The_DT milk_NN handled_VBN in_IN this_DT way_NN is_VBZ probably_RB consumed_VBN in_IN a_DT few_JJ hours_NNS '_POS time_NN ._.
Another_DT method_NN ,_, practised_VBN by_IN the_DT halvais_NN ,_, specially_RB in_IN northern_JJ India_NNP ,_, is_VBZ to_TO keep_VB the_DT milk_NN simmering_VBG for_IN 7-8_JJ hours_NNS and_CC then_RB dispose_VB it_PRP of_IN as_IN demanded_VBN by_IN the_DT customers_NNS ._.
In_IN this_DT method_NN ,_, there_EX is_VBZ no_DT doubt_NN that_IN considerable_JJ chemical_JJ changes_NNS are_VBP brought_VBN about_IN ._.
*_JJ Report_NNP on_IN the_DT marketing_NN of_IN milk_NN ,_, 1943_CD As_IN the_DT ._.
'holding_VBG '_'' method_NN of_IN pasteurization_NN ,_, in_IN which_WDT milk_NN is_VBZ heated_VBN to_TO 145ºF_CD ._.
and_CC held_VBD at_IN that_DT temperature_NN for_IN half_PDT an_DT hour_NN ,_, is_VBZ considered_VBN to_TO be_VB suitable_JJ for_IN destroying_VBG most_JJS of_IN the_DT organisms_NNS ,_, it_PRP is_VBZ probable_JJ that_IN if_IN this_DT heated_VBN milk_NN is_VBZ kept_VBN at_IN more_RBR or_CC less_RBR the_DT same_JJ temperature_NN ,_, the_DT stability_NN of_IN the_DT milk_NN will_MD be_VB prolonged_VBN for_IN a_DT sufficiently_RB long_JJ period_NN ,_, so_IN that_IN it_PRP can_MD be_VB transported_VBN over_IN long_JJ distances_NNS without_IN giving_VBG rise_NN to_TO undesirable_JJ chemical_NN changes_NNS ,_, If_IN this_DT is_VBZ so_RB ,_, much_JJ of_IN the_DT expenditure_NN on_IN refrigeration_NN could_MD be_VB avoided_VBN and_CC the_DT cost_NN of_IN transport_NN is_VBZ likely_JJ to_TO be_VB reduced_VBN ._.
In_IN order_NN to_TO obtain_VB some_DT definite_JJ information_NN on_IN the_DT subject_NN ,_, systematic_JJ experi-_JJ ments_NNS have_VBP been_VBN started_VBN in_IN these_DT laboratories_NNS and_CC in_IN the_DT present_JJ communication_NN ,_, some_DT results_NNS on_IN the_DT keeping_VBG quality_NN of_IN farm-produced_JJ milk_NN at_IN elevated_JJ temperature_NN as_IN compared_VBN to_TO milk_VB heated_VBN to_TO 150ºF_CD ._.
and_CC retained_VBN at_IN that_DT temperature_NN for_IN half_PDT an_DT hour_NN ,_, cooled_VBD and_CC then_RB stored_VBD at_IN low_JJ (_( 48º-50ºF_JJ ._. )_)
temperature_NN ,_, are_VBP given_VBN ._.
EXPERIMENTAL_JJ Experiments_NNS were_VBD carried_VBN out_RP on_IN a_DT laboratory_NN scale_NN and_CC then_RB some_DT trials_NNS were_VBD made_VBN on_IN a_DT large_JJ scale_NN ._.
The_DT experimental_JJ work_NN was_VBD divided_VBN as_IN follows_VBZ :266_JJ Studies_NNPS in_IN the_DT Transport_NNP of_IN Milk_NNP in_IN Warm_NNP Condition_NNP (_( iii_NN )_) Storage_NN of_IN processed_VBN milk_NN at_IN room_NN temperature_NN (_( 80°-90°F_JJ ._. )_)
and_CC low_JJ temperature_NN (_( 48º-50ºF_JJ :_: )_) for_IN 20_CD hours_NNS in_IN small_JJ aluminium_NN cans_NNS ._.
(_( iv_NN )_) Storage_NN of_IN processed_JJ milk_NN in_IN bulk_NN at_IN a_DT fluc-_JJ tuating_NN storage_NN temperature_NN (_( 130°-150°F_JJ ._. )_)
for_IN eight_CD hours_NNS in_IN large_JJ tinned_JJ steel_NN milk_NN cans_NNS ._.
PLAN_NN OF_NNP WORK_NNP Required_NNP quantities_NNS of_IN raw_JJ ,_, mixed_JJ milk_NN as_IN detailed_JJ under_IN different_JJ sections_NNS were_VBD collected_VBN and_CC heated_VBN to_TO 150ºF_CD ._.
and_CC retained_VBN at_IN that_DT temperature_NN for_IN 30_CD minutes_NNS in_IN a_DT specially_RB constructed_VBN milk_NN pasteur-_JJ izing_NN can_MD ,_, provided_VBN with_IN a_DT stirrer_NN ,_, a_DT tight-fitting_JJ lid_NN and_CC an_DT arrangement_NN for_IN inserting_VBG the_DT thermometer_NN to_TO record_VB the_DT temperature_NN of_IN the_DT milk_NN without_IN opening_VBG the_DT lid_NN ._.
This_DT can_MD was_VBD inserted_VBN in_IN a_DT bigger_JJR vessel_NN containing_VBG water_NN which_WDT was_VBD directly_RB put_VBN over_RP a_DT charcoal_NN fire_NN ._.
The_DT milk_NN while_IN being_VBG heated_VBN was_VBD stirred_VBN at_IN five_CD minutes_NNS intervals_NNS to_TO attain_VB uniform_JJ temperature_NN ._.
After_IN the_DT process_NN of_IN heating_NN and_CC retaining_VBG the_DT milk_NN at_IN the_DT temperature_NN was_VBD comple-_JJ ted_JJ ,_, it_PRP was_VBD immediately_RB distributed_VBN in_IN containers_NNS ,_, which_WDT were_VBD previously_RB sterilized_VBN ._.
After_IN filling_VBG the_DT containers_NNS ,_, they_PRP were_VBD closed_VBN with_IN tight-fitting_JJ lids_NNS ._.
Those_DT samples_NNS which_WDT were_VBD to_TO be_VB maintained_VBN at_IN an_DT elevated_JJ temperature_NN were_VBD at_IN once_RB transferred_VBN to_TO a_DT hot_JJ chamber_NN maintained_VBD at_IN 150°F_CD ._.
and_CC the_DT sam-_JJ ples_NNS were_VBD immediately_RB cooled_VBN down_RP to_TO between_IN 48º-50ºF_JJ ._.
by_IN immersing_VBG the_DT containers_NNS in_IN cold_JJ brine_NN solution_NN and_CC then_RB transferred_VBD to_TO cold_VB storage_NN (_( 48º-50ºF_JJ ._. )_) ._.
Section_NN I_PRP Eight_NNP pounds_NNS of_IN milk_NN were_VBD taken_VBN ,_, heated_VBN ,_, re-_JJ tained_VBN at_IN the_DT temperature_NN and_CC then_RB distributed_VBN in_IN glass_NN milk_NN bottles_NNS as_IN detailed_VBN above_IN ._.
These_DT were_VBD stored_VBN at_IN 150ºF_CD ._.
and_CC 48º-50ºF_JJ ._.
for_IN the_DT total_JJ period_NN of_IN eight_CD hours_NNS ._.
Section_NN II_NNP In_IN this_DT section_NN the_DT experimental_JJ treatment_NN to_TO the_DT milk_NN was_VBD the_DT same_JJ as_IN described_VBN above_IN ,_, the_DT modi-_JJ fications_NNS being_VBG (_( i_NN )_) the_DT use_NN of_IN 12_CD lb_NN ._.
of_IN milk_NN (_( ii_NN )_) the_DT use_NN of_IN aluminium_NN milk_NN cans_NNS of_IN 5_CD lb_NN ._.
capacity_NN as_IN containers_NNS and_CC (_( iii_NN )_) the_DT storing_NN of_IN milk_NN for_IN a_DT total_JJ period_NN of_IN 16_CD hours_NNS ,_, Section_NNP III_NNP To_TO study_VB the_DT behaviour_NN on_IN processed_JJ milk_NN ,_, held_VBD at_IN room_NN temperature_NN (_( 80°-90°F_JJ ._. )_)
versus_NN that_WDT held_VBD in_IN cold_JJ storage_NN (_( 48º-50ºF_JJ ._.
)_) ,_, this_DT part_NN of_IN the_DT work_NN was_VBD done_VBN ._.
The_DT modification_NN made_VBD was_VBD the_DT holding_NN of_IN one_CD lot_NN of_IN milk_NN ,_, after_IN heating_VBG and_CC retaining_VBG at_IN 150°F_CD ._.
for_IN half_PDT an_DT hour_NN ,_, at_IN room_NN temperature_NN while_IN holding_VBG the_DT other_JJ lot_NN of_IN samples_NNS ,_, after_IN cooling_VBG ,_, at_IN cold_JJ storage_NN temperature_NN (_( 48º-50ºF_JJ ._. )_) ._.
Section_NN IV_NNP These_DT trials_NNS were_VBD made_VBN to_TO study_VB the_DT effect_NN of_IN high_JJ storage_NN temperature_NN ,_, within_IN a_DT certain_JJ fluctuating_NN limit_NN ,_, which_WDT may_MD be_VB obtainable_JJ under_IN field_NN conditions_NNS on_IN a_DT large_JJ quantity_NN of_IN milk_NN ._.
Sixty_NNP pounds_NNS of_IN milk_NN were_VBD employed_VBN for_IN the_DT trials_NNS ._.
The_DT method_NN of_IN heating_VBG followed_VBN here_RB was_VBD slightly_RB different_JJ ._.
The_DT whole_JJ milk_NN can_MD was_VBD immersed_VBN in_IN hot_JJ water_NN and_CC the_DT milk_NN heated_VBN to_TO 150°F_CD ._.
and_CC held_VBD at_IN that_DT temperature_NN for_IN half_PDT an_DT hour_NN ._.
After_IN com-_JJ pletion_NN the_DT can_MD was_VBD removed_VBN and_CC transferred_VBN to_TO an_DT insulated_JJ chamber_NN which_WDT was_VBD heated_VBN by_IN a_DT char-_JJ coal_NN fire_NN ._.
The_DT inside_JJ temperature_NN was_VBD not_RB cons-_JJ tant_NN but_CC fluctuated_VBD between_IN 130°_CD and_CC 150°F_CD ._.

*_NN M._NNP B._NNP R._NNP K._NNP K._NNP DESAI_NNP ,_, G._NNP S._NNP THAKRE_NNP AND_NNP K._NNP C._NNP SEN_NNP 269_CD TABLE_NNP III_NNP Results_NNP of_IN fermentation_NN tests_NNS Sample_NNP number_NN Row_NNP milk_NN Milk_NNP heated_VBD to_TO 150ºF_CD ._.
for_IN 30_CD minutes_NNS Milk_NNP heated_VBD to_TO 150°F.for_CD 30_CD minutes_NNS ._.
immediately_RB cooled_VBN to_TO 48°-50°F_CD ._.
and_CC stored_VBN at_IN 48°-50°F_JJ ._.
for_IN the_DT period_NN of_IN Milk_NNP heatedto_$ 150°F_CD ._.
for_IN 30_CD minutes_NNS and_CC then_RB Kept_NNP at_IN 150ºF_CD ._.
for_IN the_DT period_NN of_IN Kept_NNP between_IN 130º_CD -150º_NNS F._NNP for_IN the_DT period_NN of_IN Kept_NNP at_IN room_NN temperature_NN (_( 80º-90º_JJ F._NNP )_) for_IN the_DT period_NN of_IN B._NNP coli*_VBP Fermen-_NNP tation_NN Fermen-_NNP tation_NN 8_CD hours_NNS 16_CD hours_NNS 20_CD hours_NNS 8_CD hours_NNS 16_CD hours_NNS 4_CD hours_NNS 8_CD hours_NNS 3_CD hours_NNS 6_CD hours_NNS 1_CD 1_CD :_: 100_CD SG.SW.SC270_NNP Studies_NNPS in_IN the_DT Transport_NNP of_IN Milk_NNP in_IN Warm_NNP Condition_NNP high_JJ temperature_NN (_( 150°F_CD ._. )_)
and_CC at_IN low_JJ temperature_NN (_( 48°-50°F_JJ ._. )_) ._.
With_IN regard_NN to_TO acidity_NN there_RB was_VBD a_DT slight_JJ decrease_NN on_IN heating_VBG which_WDT may_MD be_VB due_JJ to_TO the_DT expulsion_NN of_IN CO2_NNP during_IN the_DT process_NN ._.
The_DT acidity_NN then_RB remained_VBD fairly_RB constant_JJ in_IN the_DT case_NN of_IN milk_NN stored_VBN at_IN high_JJ temperature_NN ,_, while_IN in_IN the_DT case_NN of_IN milk_NN in_IN cold_JJ storage_NN ,_, there_EX was_VBD a_DT very_RB slight_JJ decrease_NN ._.
Naturally_RB the_DT milk_NN stored_VBN at_IN room_NN tem-_JJ perature_NN showed_VBD a_DT decided_JJ increase_NN in_IN acidity_NN after_IN three_CD hours_NNS and_CC still_RB greater_JJR increase_NN was_VBD noticed_VBN after_IN six_CD hours_NNS ._.
In_IN fact_NN this_DT milk_NN actually_RB curdled_VBD when_WRB stored_VBN for_IN 20_CD hours_NNS ,_, thus_RB proving_VBG that_IN processed_VBN milk_NN can_MD not_RB be_VB stored_VBN at_IN ordinary_JJ room_NN temperature_NN for_IN more_JJR than_IN about_RB six_CD hours_NNS ._.
But_CC samples_NNS of_IN milk_NN stored_VBN at_IN 150°F_CD ._.
and_CC 48°-50°F_JJ ._.
for_IN 16_CD hours_NNS showed_VBD more_RBR or_CC less_RBR the_DT same_JJ acidity_NN ,_, proving_VBG that_IN hot_JJ storage_NN at_IN 150°F_CD ._.
is_VBZ just_RB as_RB efficient_JJ as_IN cold_JJ storage_NN from_IN this_DT point_NN of_IN view_NN ,_, but_CC it_PRP was_VBD noticed_VBN in_IN the_DT field_NN scale_NN trials_NNS that_IN ,_, even_RB if_IN 150°F_CD ._.
storage_NN temperature_NN was_VBD not_RB rigidly_RB maintained_VBN but_CC allowed_VBN to_TO fluctuate_VB between_IN 150°F_CD ._.
and_CC 130°F._CD ,_, there_EX was_VBD very_RB little_JJ increase_NN in_IN acidity_NN within_IN eight_CD hours_NNS of_IN storage_NN ._.
The_DT bacteriological_JJ data_NN show_NN that_IN the_DT total_JJ number_NN of_IN organisms_NNS in_IN raw_JJ milk_NN decreased_VBN con-_JJ siderably_RB on_IN heating_NN ._.
The_DT samples_NNS stored_VBD at_IN 48°_CD -50°F_NN ._.
at_IN the_DT temperature_NN and_CC retaining_VBG the_DT milk_NN for_IN 8_CD ,_, 16_CD ,_, and_CC 20_CD hours_NNS showed_VBD that_IN there_EX was_VBD neither_DT increase_NN nor_CC decrease_NN in_IN the_DT total_JJ count_NN as_IN compared_VBN to_TO the_DT total_JJ count_NN in_IN milk_NN after_IN heating_VBG ._.
The_DT total_JJ count_NN of_IN milk_NN stored_VBN at_IN 150°F_CD ._.
for_IN 8_CD and_CC 16_CD hours_NNS showed_VBD a_DT decrease_NN when_WRB compared_VBN to_TO the_DT bacterial_JJ count_NN obtained_VBN after_IN heating_VBG and_CC retaining_VBG the_DT milk_NN at_IN the_DT temperature_NN as_IN referred_VBN to_TO previously_RB ._.
The_DT same_JJ decrease_NN is_VBZ noticeable_JJ in_IN field_NN scale_NN trials_NNS ._.
This_DT proves_VBZ that_IN hot_JJ storage_NN from_IN the_DT point_NN of_IN view_NN of_IN growth_NN of_IN surviving_VBG organisms_NNS after_IN processing_VBG the_DT milk_NN ,_, brought_VBD about_IN not_RB only_RB in-_JJ hibition_NN of_IN growth_NN of_IN the_DT organisms_NNS but_CC it_PRP did_VBD actually_RB destroy_VB them_PRP to_TO a_DT certain_JJ extent_NN ,_, while_IN the_DT cold_JJ storage_NN only_RB inhibited_VBD their_PRP$ further_JJ multiplication_NN ._.
This_DT appears_VBZ to_TO show_VB that_IN either_CC the_DT farm_NN milk_NN ,_, which_WDT is_VBZ produced_VBN under_IN hygienic_JJ condition_NN ,_, did_VBD not_RB contain_VB many_JJ thermophilic_JJ organisms_NNS ,_, or_CC even_RB if_IN they_PRP were_VBD present_JJ ,_, they_PRP would_MD not_RB affect_VB the_DT storage_NN quality_NN of_IN heated_VBN milk_NN at_IN a_DT temperature_NN of_IN 150°F_CD ._.
for_IN at_IN least_JJS 16_CD hours_NNS ._.
Storage_NN of_IN the_DT processed_JJ milk_NN at_IN the_DT ordinary_JJ temperature_NN kept_VBD it_PRP in_IN good_JJ condition_NN only_RB for_IN about_RB four_CD hours_NNS ._.
As_IN regards_NNS B._NNP coli_NN ,_, raw_JJ milk_NN which_WDT showed_VBD the_DT presence_NN of_IN B._NNP coli_NNS in_IN 1_CD :_: 100_CD and_CC 1_CD :_: 1000_CD dilutions_NNS showed_VBD its_PRP$ absence_NN in_IN even_RB 1_CD ml_NNS ._.
of_IN milk_NN just_RB after_IN processing_VBG and_CC it_PRP continued_VBD to_TO remain_VB absent_JJ even_RB after_IN storage_NN periods_NNS ,_, thus_RB proving_VBG that_IN milk_NN once_RB processed_VBN ,_, if_IN not_RB recontaminated_VBN ,_, would_MD show_VB complete_JJ absence_NN of_IN B._NNP coli_NNS ._.
The_DT methylene_NN blue_JJ reduction_NN time_NN shown_VBN by_IN raw_JJ milk_NN was_VBD considerably_RB increased_VBN from_IN about_RB two_CD hours_NNS to_TO six_CD hours_NNS after_IN processing_NN ._.
In_IN case_NN of_IN milks_NNS stored_VBN at_IN 150ºF_CD ._.
and_CC 48º-50ºF_JJ ._.
for_IN eight_CD hours_NNS ,_, the_DT reduction_NN time_NN was_VBD more_RBR or_CC less_RBR the_DT same_JJ ,_, while_IN in_IN case_NN of_IN 16_CD hours_NNS '_POS storage_NN ,_, milk_NN stored_VBN at_IN 150°F_CD ._.
showed_VBD a_DT longer_RBR reduction_NN time_NN than_IN the_DT milk_NN stored_VBN at_IN 48°-50°F_JJ ._.
This_DT observation_NN is_VBZ further_RB supported_VBN by_IN the_DT fact_NN that_IN the_DT total_JJ number_NN of_IN organisms_NNS in_IN milk_NN stored_VBN at_IN 150ºF_CD ._.
after_IN 16_CD hours_NNS showed_VBD a_DT greater_JJR reduction_NN than_IN the_DT count_NN in_IN milk_NN stored_VBN at_IN 48°-50°F_JJ ._.
Milk_NN stored_VBN at_IN atmospheric_JJ tem-_JJ perature_NN curdled_VBN at_IN the_DT end_NN of_IN a_DT '20_JJ hours_NNS '_POS storage_NN period_NN ,_, while_IN that_DT stored_VBD at_IN 48°-50°F_JJ ._.
at_IN the_DT end_NN of_IN 20_CD hours_NNS showed_VBD a_DT total_JJ reduction_NN time_NN of_IN 3½_CD hours_NNS ._.
Similar_JJ results_NNS for_IN methylene_JJ blue_JJ reduction_NN were_VBD noticeable_JJ both_DT in_IN case_NN of_IN storage_NN of_IN eight_CD hours_NNS at_IN 150°F_CD ._.
in_IN laboratory_JJ scale_NN as_RB well_RB as_IN in_IN case_NN of_IN field_NN trials_NNS ._.
The_DT fermentation_NN test_NN results_NNS showed_VBD that_IN in_IN the_DT raw_JJ milk_NN curd_NN ,_, there_EX was_VBD presence_NN of_IN slight_JJ gas_NN and_CC a_DT slight_JJ separation_NN of_IN whey_NN ._.
The_DT curd_NN formed_VBD after_IN processing_NN and_CC storage_NN periods_NNS did_VBD not_RB show_VB the_DT above_JJ defects_NNS and_CC the_DT curd_NN formed_VBD was_VBD more_RBR palatable_JJ ._.
A_DT slight_JJ cooked_JJ odour_NN was_VBD observed_VBN in_IN all_DT samples_NNS stored_VBN at_IN 150°F_CD ._.
for_IN different_JJ storage_NN periods_NNS ,_, while_IN samples_NNS stored_VBN at_IN 48°-50°F_JJ ._.
retained_VBN their_PRP$ natural_JJ odour_NN ._.
There_EX was_VBD practically_RB no_DT appreciable_JJ difference_NN in_IN the_DT taste_NN of_IN milk_NN ._.
The_DT effects_NNS of_IN storage_NN at_IN an_DT elevated_JJ temperature_NN on_IN the_DT mineral_NN and_CC vitamin_JJ contents_NNS of_IN milk_NN as_RB well_RB as_IN the_DT behaviour_NN of_IN village_NN produced_VBN milk_NN under_IN these_DT conditions_NNS ,_, are_VBP being_VBG studied_VBN ._.
If_IN these_DT re-_JJ sults_NNS prove_VBP satisfactory_JJ and_CC the_DT nutritive_JJ quality_NN of_IN milk_NN remains_NNS unimpaired_JJ ,_, large_JJ scale_JJ field_NN trials_NNS on_IN the_DT transportation_NN of_IN milk_NN at_IN an_DT elevated_JJ tem-_JJ perature_NN will_MD be_VB made_VBN ._.
SUMMARY_NNP (_( 1_CD )_) An_DT investigation_NN has_VBZ been_VBN carried_VBN out_RP on_IN the_DT keeping_VBG quality_NN of_IN farm-produced_JJ milk_NN ,_, processed_VBN at_IN a_DT temperature_NN of_IN 150°F_CD ._.
and_CC held_VBN at_IN about_IN that_DT temperature_NN for_IN prolonged_JJ periods_NNS ._.
(_( 2_CD )_) It_PRP has_VBZ been_VBN observed_VBN that_IN there_EX is_VBZ no_DT change_NN either_RB in_IN acidity_NN of_IN milk_NN or_CC fat_JJ percentage_NN when_WRB the_DT milk_NN is_VBZ kept_VBN in_IN hot_JJ condition_NN up_RB to_TO 16_CD hours_NNS ._.
(_( 3_CD )_) Bacteriological_NNP examination_NN shows_VBZ that_IN there_EX is_VBZ a_DT definite_JJ decrease_NN in_IN the_DT number_NN of_IN organisms_NNS when_WRB the_DT milk_NN is_VBZ kept_VBN at_IN an_DT elevated_JJ termperature_NN as_IN compared_VBN to_TO that_DT in_IN cold_JJ storage_NN ._.
REFERENCES_JJ Ayers_NNP ,_, S._NNP H._NNP and_CC Johnson_NNP Jr._NNP ,_, W._NNP T._NNP (_( 1923_CD )_) ._.
J_NNP ._.
Dairy_NNP Sci_NNP 6_CD ,_, 608-615_JJ Bernstein_NNP (_( 1893_CD )_) ._.
Cited_VBN by_IN Ayers_NNS and_CC Johnson_NNP ,_, J_NNP ._.
Dairy_NNP Sci_NNP THE_NNP FATTY_NNP ACID_NNP COMPONENTS_NNP OF_NNP INDIAN_NNP BUFFALO_NNP GHEES_NNP By_IN K._NNP T._NNP ACHAYA_NNP and_CC B._NNP N._NNP BANERJEE_NNP ,_, Department_NNP of_IN Biochemistry_NNP ,_, Indian_NNP Institute_NNP of_IN Science_NNP ,_, Bangalore_NNP (_( Received_VBN for_IN publication_NN on_IN 17_CD September_NNP 1945_CD )_) THE_DT work_NN consists_VBZ of_IN the_DT analyses_NNS by_IN ester-fractiona-_JJ tion_NN methods_NNS of_IN Indian_JJ ghee_NN ._.
In_IN the_DT choice_NN of_IN buffalo_NN ghee_NN for_IN analysis_NN ,_, several_JJ factors_NNS were_VBD considered_VBN ._.
Firstly_RB this_DT product_NN is_VBZ by_IN far_RB the_DT most_RBS widely_RB used_VBN type_NN of_IN ghee_NN in_IN India_NNP ._.
Secondly_RB the_DT literature_NN reveals_VBZ only_RB three_CD former_JJ analyses_NNS of_IN buffalo_NN ghee_NN [_NNP Bhattacharya_NNP and_CC Hilditch_NNP ,_, 1931_CD ;_: Heiduschka_NNP and_CC Cicekdagi_NNP ,_, 1940_CD ]_NN of_IN which_WDT two_CD were_VBD Indian_JJ and_CC even_RB these_DT were_VBD chosen_VBN at_IN random_NN and_CC were_VBD not_RB specially_RB characteristic_JJ in_IN any_DT way_NN ._.
These_DT three_CD analyses_NNS have_VBP been_VBN quoted_VBN later_RBR in_IN the_DT course_NN of_IN the_DT discussion_NN ._.
In_IN the_DT choice_NN of_IN typical_JJ specimens_NNS the_DT basis_NN used_VBN was_VBD the_DT content_NN of_IN lower_JJR fatty_JJ acids_NNS as_IN reflected_VBN in_IN the_DT Reichert-Meissl_NNP and_CC Polenske_NNP values_NNS ._.
The_DT sum_NN of_IN these_DT two_CD values_NNS for_IN buffalo_NN ghee_NN varies_NNS from_IN about_RB 15_CD to_TO about_IN 40_CD ,_, and_CC so_IN it_PRP was_VBD thought_VBN desirable_JJ to_TO study_VB three_CD specimens_NNS of_IN normal_JJ (_( 30.8_CD )_) ,_, high_JJ (_( 37.4_CD )_) and_CC low_JJ (_( 20.7_CD )_) R.M_NNP ._.
respectively_RB ._.
This_DT would_MD not_RB only_RB be_VB merely_RB representative_JJ and_CC indicative_JJ of_IN any_DT constancy_NN of_IN feature_NN wherewith_NN to_TO detect_VB adulteration_NN with_IN foreign_JJ fats_NNS ,_, but_CC interesting_VBG from_IN the_DT theoretical_JJ point_NN of_IN view_NN in_IN that_IN it_PRP would_MD indicate_VB which_WDT acid_NN or_CC acids_NNS ,_, if_IN any_DT ,_, compensated_VBN for_IN this_DT ._.
high_JJ or_CC low_JJ content_NN of_IN lower_JJR acids_NNS ._.
EXPERIMENT_NNP The_DT sample_NN of_IN low_JJ R.M_NNP ._.
ghee_NN obtained_VBN from_IN the_DT Porbandar_NNP State_NNP had_VBD been_VBN stored_VBN for_IN a_DT long_JJ time_NN and_CC was_VBD rancid_VBN at_IN the_DT time_NN of_IN analysis_NN ,_, and_CC hence_RB another_DT fresh_JJ sample_NN was_VBD procured_VBN and_CC analysed_VBN ._.
The_DT fresh_JJ samples_NNS have_VBP been_VBN recorded_VBN as_IN 1_CD ,_, 2_CD and_CC 3_CD and_CC the_DT rancid_NN sample_NN as_IN 4_CD ._.
The_DT ghees_NNS were_VBD dried_VBN with_IN anhydrous_JJ sodium_NN sulphate_NN ,_, filtered_VBN and_CC stored_VBN in_IN glass-stoppered_JJ brown_JJ bottles_NNS in_IN an_DT ice-box_JJ till_NN required_VBN ._.
The_DT analyses_NNS were_VBD carried_VBN out_RP by_IN the_DT ester-frac-_JJ tionation_NN method_NN with_IN an_DT electrically_RB heated_VBN and_CC packed_VBN column_NN using_VBG the_DT method_NN employed_VBN by_IN Smith_NNP and_CC Dastur_NNP [_NNP 1938_CD ]_NNP of_IN direct_JJ methanolysis_NN and_CC separation_NN of_IN the_DT lower_JJR acids_NNS in_IN some_DT quantity_NN before_IN undertaking_VBG the_DT Twitchell_NNP separation_NN ._.
The_DT separation_NN of_IN the_DT esters_NNS is_VBZ illustrated_VBN by_IN the_DT detailed_JJ statement_NN of_IN results_NNS (_( Table_JJ I_PRP ,_, A_NNP ,_, B_NNP ,_, C_NNP ,_, D_NNP )_) obtained_VBD in_IN the_DT case_NN of_IN the_DT normal_JJ R.M_NNP ._.
ghee_NN sample_NN 2_CD ._.
Con-_JJ siderations_NNS of_IN space_NN do_VBP not_RB permit_VB of_IN the_DT full_JJ details_NNS of_IN the_DT other_JJ analyses_NNS ._.

TABLE_NNP II_NNP (_( A_NNP )_) Characteristios_NNP of_IN the_DT samples_NNS of_IN ghee_NN analysed_VBN K._NNP T._NNP ACHAYA_NNP AND_NNP B._NNP N._NNP BANERJEE_NNP 275_CD were_VBD considered_VBN sufficient_JJ warrant_NN for_IN the_DT assump-_JJ tion_NN ._.
The_DT molar_JJ percentages_NNS for_IN decenoic_NN ,_, dodece-_JJ noic_NN ,_, tetradecenoic_NN and_CC hexadecenoic_JJ acids_NNS came_VBD out_RP as_IN about_RB 0.1_CD ,_, 0.1_CD ,_, 0.7_CD and_CC 3.0_CD respectively_RB ,_, which_WDT agree_VBP fairly_RB well_RB with_IN the_DT values_NNS 0.3_CD ,_, 0.3_CD ,_, 1.0_CD and_CC 3.0_CD of_IN Smith_NNP and_CC Dastur_NNP [_NNP 1938_CD ]_NNP for_IN cow_JJ milk-fats_NNS of_IN generally_RB greater_JJR unsaturation_NN ._.
The_DT percentages_NNS now_RB indicated_VBN must_MD ,_, however_RB ,_, be_VB regarded_VBN only_RB in_IN the_DT nature_NN of_IN an_DT approximation_NN of_IN the_DT true_JJ propor-_JJ tions_NNS of_IN these_DT acids_NNS in_IN buffalo_JJ milk-fat_JJ though_IN not_RB far_RB from_IN them_PRP ._.
A_DT further_JJ interesting_JJ feature_NN of_IN these_DT analyses_NNS is_VBZ the_DT presence_NN of_IN an_DT acid_NN higher_JJR than_IN linoleic_JJR ,_, cal-_JJ culated_VBN here_RB as_IN a_DT C20_NNP acid_NN with_IN one_CD double_JJ bond_NN (_( gadoleic_NN )_) ,_, in_IN the_DT absence_NN of_IN material_NN for_IN more_JJR detailed_JJ analysis_NN ._.
The_DT other_JJ three_CD analyses_NNS (_( loc_NN ._.
cit_NN ._. )_)
in_IN the_DT literature_NN recorded_VBD the_DT highest_JJS unsaturated_JJ acids_NNS as_IN linoleic_NN and_CC the_DT molar_JJ percentages_NNS as_IN 2.2_CD and_CC 0.2_CD ._.
The_DT most_RBS striking_JJ feature_NN of_IN the_DT present_JJ results_NNS is_VBZ the_DT gradually_RB rising_VBG contents_NNS of_IN oleic_JJ acid_NN as_IN the_DT amounts_NNS of_IN the_DT lower_JJR acids_NNS decrease_NN ,_, a_DT relation-_JJ ship_NN reflected_VBN in_IN a_DT more_RBR general_JJ way_NN in_IN the_DT R.M_NNP ._.
and_CC iodine_NN values_NNS ._.
This_DT is_VBZ the_DT more_RBR marked_JJ in_IN that_DT samples_VBZ 1_CD and_CC 2_CD ,_, of_IN about_IN the_DT same_JJ iodine_NN value_NN ,_, could_MD be_VB expected_VBN to_TO contain_VB the_DT same_JJ amounts_NNS of_IN oleic_JJ acid_NN ;_: actually_RB ,_, the_DT proportions_NNS are_VBP quite_RB different_JJ and_CC the_DT low_JJ iodine_NN value_NN of_IN sample_JJ 2_CD is_VBZ accounted_VBN for_IN by_IN its_PRP$ low_JJ linoleic_NN ,_, rather_RB than_IN oleic_VB ,_, content_NN ._.
Smith_NNP and_CC Dastur_NNP [_NNP 1938_CD ]_NNP observed_VBD very_RB similar_JJ results_NNS with_IN the_DT cow_NN in_IN their_PRP$ work_NN on_IN inanition_NN ._.
They_PRP indicated_VBD there_EX that_IN several_JJ theories_NNS of_IN the_DT origin_NN of_IN these_DT lower_JJR acids_NNS could_MD account_VB for_IN the_DT features_NNS observed_VBD among_IN which_WDT was_VBD the_DT theory_NN of_IN Hilditch_NNP and_CC his_PRP$ colleagues_NNS [_VBP 1941_CD ]_NN that_IN the_DT lower_JJR acids_NNS are_VBP formed_VBN by_IN the_DT breakdown_NN of_IN preformed_JJ oleo-glycerides_NNS in_IN the_DT mammary_JJ gland_NN ._.
The_DT general_JJ nature_NN of_IN the_DT present_JJ results_NNS strongly_RB favours_VBP this_DT view_NN ,_, since_IN it_PRP postulates_VBZ a_DT direct_JJ relationship_NN between_IN the_DT two_CD components_NNS in_IN question_NN ._.
Moreover_RB ,_, the_DT presence_NN of_IN lower_JJR unsaturated_JJ acids_NNS probably_RB iden-_JJ tical_JJ with_IN those_DT of_IN cow_NNS and_CC goat_NN milk-fat_NN is_VBZ satis-_JJ factorily_RB accounted_VBN for_IN in_IN that_DT they_PRP represent_VBP 'frag-_JJ ments_NNS of_IN transformed_VBN oleo-glycerides_NNS which_WDT have_VBP escaped_VBN complete_JJ saturation_NN to_TO lower_VB saturated_JJ acids_NNS '_POS ._.
The_DT recent_JJ tentative_JJ postulate_NN of_IN Hilditch_NNP and_CC Meara_NNP [_NNP 1944_CD ]_NN that_IN the_DT precursor_NN in_IN blood_NN might_MD well_RB be_VB a_DT linoleo-glyceride_JJ does_VBZ not_RB affect_VB the_DT results_NNS since_IN the_DT production_NN of_IN an_DT oleo-glyceride_JJ from_IN a_DT linoleo-glyceride_JJ represents_VBZ a_DT comparatively_RB simple_JJ hydrogenation_NN ._.
While_IN the_DT first_JJ two_CD ghees_NNS analysed_VBN are_VBP of_IN a_DT pattern_NN ,_, samples_VBZ 3_CD and_CC 4_CD fall_NN into_IN another_DT class_NN by_IN reason_NN of_IN their_PRP$ high_JJ percentages_NNS of_IN stearic_JJ acid_NN ._.
That_IN there_RB appear_VB to_TO be_VB two_CD such_JJ fairly_RB distinct_JJ types_NNS of_IN buffalo_NN milk-fats_NNS is_VBZ supported_VBN by_IN the_DT three_CD other_JJ analyses_NNS extant_VBP ,_, which_WDT are_VBP quoted_VBN below_IN (_( Table_NNP III_NNP )_) after_IN conversion_NN in_IN all_DT cases_NNS to_TO molar_JJ percentages_NNS ._.
TABLE_NNP III_NNP Fatty_NNP acid_JJ composition_NN of_IN ghee_NN (_( as_IN molar_NN percentages_NNS )_) 276_CD Fatty_NNP Acid_NNP Components_NNP of_IN Indian_JJ Buffalo_NNP Ghees_NNP the_DT stearic_JJ acid_NN content_NN [_NNP Hilditch_NNP and_CC Thompson_NNP ,_, 1936_CD ]_NN ;_: yet_CC it_PRP has_VBZ a_DT fatty-acid_JJ and_CC glyceride_JJ structure_NN almost_RB identical_JJ with_IN cotton_NN seed_NN oil_NN ._.
Nor_CC can_MD the_DT matter_NN be_VB explained_VBN by_IN direct_JJ infiltration_NN of_IN the_DT acid_NN from_IN cottonseed_VBN oil_NN ,_, since_IN the_DT latter_NN has_VBZ a_DT molar_JJ content_NN of_IN stearic_JJ acid_NN of_IN only_RB 2_CD per_IN cent_NN ._.
Whatever_WDT may_MD be_VB the_DT causes_NNS of_IN differences_NNS of_IN mobilization_NN of_IN different_JJ oils_NNS ,_, the_DT source_NN of_IN stearic_JJ acid_NN in_IN this_DT case_NN is_VBZ almost_RB certainly_RB dietary_JJ oleic_NN or_CC linoleic_JJ acid_NN ._.
Since_IN the_DT effects_NNS are_VBP produced_VBN both_DT in_IN depot_NN fats_NNS and_CC in_IN milk-fats_NNS ,_, it_PRP may_MD seem_VB attractive_JJ to_TO consider_VB the_DT hydrogenation_NN as_IN having_VBG occurred_VBN before_IN passage_NN of_IN glycerides_NNS into_IN the_DT blood_NN ._.
But_CC in_IN view_NN of_IN the_DT simultaneously_RB lowered_VBN produc-_JJ tion_NN of_IN lower_JJR acids_NNS [_VBP Brown_NNP and_CC Deck_NNP ,_, 1930_CD ;_: Brown_NNP ,_, 1931_CD ]_NN in_IN milk-fats_NNS ,_, it_PRP seems_VBZ more_RBR probable_JJ that_IN the_DT hydrogenation_NN process_NN takes_VBZ place_NN during_IN selective_JJ withdrawal_NN of_IN glycerides_NNS in_IN the_DT depot_NN tissues_NNS on_IN the_DT one_CD hand_NN and_CC in_IN the_DT mammary_JJ gland_NN on_IN the_DT other_JJ ._.
There_EX is_VBZ another_DT aspect_NN of_IN the_DT question_NN :_: part_NN of_IN the_DT excessive_JJ fat_NN in_IN the_DT diet_NN probably_RB passes_VBZ into_IN the_DT liver_NN as_IN fatty_JJ acids_NNS ,_, and_CC these_DT exert_VBP their_PRP$ modi-_JJ fying_NN influence_NN on_IN fat_NN being_VBG synthesized_VBN from_IN car-_JJ bohydrate_NN material_NN ._.
Two_CD other_JJ features_NNS of_IN interest_NN in_IN the_DT analytical_JJ figures_NNS are_VBP (_( 1_CD )_) the_DT high_JJ proportions_NNS of_IN arachidic_JJ acid_NN in_IN the_DT three_CD fats_NNS conforming_VBG to_TO the_DT high-stearic_JJ type_NN ;_: (_( 2_CD )_) the_DT high_JJ gadoleic_NN acid_NN content_NN of_IN ghee_JJ 1_CD ._.
This_DT may_MD be_VB an_DT infiltration_NN from_IN the_DT groundnut_NN cake_NN that_WDT partly_RB comprised_VBD the_DT feed_NN of_IN the_DT animal_NN but_CC too_RB much_JJ stress_NN can_MD not_RB be_VB laid_VBN on_IN the_DT slender_NN evidence_NN drawn_NN from_IN a_DT single_JJ ester_NN fraction_NN ._.
The_DT practical_JJ implications_NNS of_IN the_DT three_CD present_JJ analyses_NNS taken_VBN in_IN the_DT light_NN of_IN the_DT detection_NN of_IN adul-_JJ teration_NN are_VBP suggestive_JJ in_IN the_DT following_JJ way_NN ._.
The_DT two_CD features_NNS with_IN any_DT claim_NN to_TO constancy_NN are_VBP the_DT C16_NNP unsaturated_JJ acid_NN content_NN and_CC the_DT C14+C16+C18_NNP saturated_VBD acid_JJ percentages_NNS ._.
The_DT difficulties_NNS in_IN the_DT way_NN of_IN estimation_NN of_IN the_DT former_JJ are_VBP immense_JJ ;_: the_DT latter_JJ feature_NN is_VBZ also_RB of_IN little_JJ value_NN since_IN the_DT C16+C18_NNP contents_NNS of_IN many_JJ oils_NNS and_CC hydrogenated_VBN oils_NNS are_VBP in_IN the_DT neighbourhood_NN of_IN the_DT 53_CD per_IN cent_NN for_IN the_DT sum_NN just_RB mentioned_VBN ._.
The_DT only_JJ other_JJ figure_NN of_IN any_DT in-_JJ terest_NN is_VBZ the_DT linoleic_JJ acid_NN content_NN ,_, a_DT determination_NN of_IN which_WDT is_VBZ possible_JJ by_IN the_DT iodine_NN and_CC thiocyanogen_NN values_NNS together_RB ._.
This_DT is_VBZ not_RB because_IN the_DT percentage_NN of_IN this_DT acid_NN is_VBZ by_IN any_DT chance_NN constant_JJ ,_, but_CC because_IN of_IN the_DT high_JJ linoleic_NN content_NN of_IN common_JJ oils_NNS which_WDT is_VBZ well_RB known_VBN ;_: fortunately_RB the_DT only_JJ exception_NN (_( coconut_JJ oil_NN having_VBG a_DT linoleic_JJ acid_NN content_NN of_IN about_IN 1.5_CD per_IN cent_NN )_) can_MD easily_RB be_VB detected_VBN by_IN the_DT R.M.-_NNP P.V_NNP ._.
relationship_NN ._.
An_DT addition_NN of_IN as_RB little_JJ of_IN 10_CD per_IN cent_NN of_IN other_JJ oils_NNS should_MD greatly_RB raise_VB the_DT small_JJ linoleic_JJ content_NN of_IN samples_NNS of_IN ghee_NN ._.

relationship_NN ._.
SUMMARY_NNP 1_CD ._.
The_DT analyses_NNS of_IN four_CD samples_NNS of_IN Indian_JJ buffalo_NN ghee_NN of_IN high_JJ ,_, normal_JJ and_CC low_JJ R.M_NNP ._.
value_NN (_( two_CD samples_NNS )_) are_VBP given_VBN in_IN full_JJ ._.
2_CD ._.
The_DT presence_NN of_IN the_DT lower_JJR unsaturated_JJ acids_NNS ,_, decenoic_NN ,_, dodecenoic_NN ,_, tetradecenoic_NN and_CC hexade-_JJ cenoic_NN ,_, has_VBZ been_VBN tentatively_RB postulated_VBN and_CC their_PRP$ rough_JJ proportions_NNS indicated_VBD ._.
3_CD ._.
The_DT presence_NN of_IN an_DT acid_NN higher_JJR than_IN linoleic_NN has_VBZ been_VBN indicated_VBN and_CC calculated_VBN as_IN gadoleic_JJ acid_NN ._.
4_CD ._.
A_DT striking_JJ inverse_NN relationship_NN between_IN the_DT lower_JJR acids_NNS and_CC oleic_JJ acid_NN ,_, similar_JJ to_TO the_DT results_NNS obtained_VBD on_IN inanition_NN by_IN Smith_NNP and_CC Dastur_NNP ,_, is_VBZ discussed_VBN ._.
5_CD ._.
The_DT effect_NN of_IN ingesting_VBG cottonseed_NN oil_NN has_VBZ been_VBN shown_VBN to_TO be_VB a_DT greatly_RB increased_VBN stearic_JJ acid_NN content_NN ,_, The_DT mechanism_NN of_IN this_DT high_JJ production_NN has_VBZ been_VBN discussed_VBN ._.
6_CD ._.
The_DT determination_NN of_IN the_DT linoleic_JJ acid_NN content_NN has_VBZ been_VBN theoretically_RB postulated_VBN as_IN likely_JJ to_TO help_VB in_IN the_DT determination_NN of_IN the_DT genuineness_NN or_CC otherwise_NN of_IN a_DT sample_NN of_IN buffalo_NN butterfat_NN ._.

C._NNP BASU_NNP ,_, D_NNP ._.
Sc._NNP ,_, Imperial_NNP Veterinary_NNP Research_NNP Institute_NNP ,_, Izatnagar_NNP (_( Received_VBN for_IN publication_NN on_IN 29_CD October_NNP 1945_CD )_) (_( With_IN three_CD text-figures_NNS )_) THE_NNP data_NN ,_, which_WDT form_VBP the_DT subject_NN of_IN this_DT note_NN ,_, were_VBD obtained_VBN from_IN directors_NNS of_IN veterinary_JJ services_NNS of_IN provinces_NNS and_CC states_NNS and_CC pertain_NN to_TO a_DT period_NN of_IN three_CD years_NNS from_IN January_NNP 1940_CD to_TO December_NNP 1942_CD ._.
The_DT figures_NNS are_VBP shown_VBN in_IN Table_NNP I_PRP ._.
A_DT map_NN (_( Fig_NNP ._.
3_LS )_) has_VBZ been_VBN prepared_VBN from_IN these_DT figures_NNS showing_VBG the_DT intensity_NN of_IN surra_NN in_IN various_JJ parts_NNS of_IN India_NNP ._.
Of_IN the_DT Indian_JJ States_NNP ,_, only_RB Hydera-_NNP bad_JJ ,_, Baroda_NNP ,_, Gwalior_NNP ,_, Alwar_NNP ,_, Travancore_NNP and_CC Mysore_NNP furnished_VBD detailed_JJ information_NN ;_: Kashmir_NNP sent_VBD some_DT figures_NNS ,_, but_CC no_DT details_NNS were_VBD available_JJ ;_: no_DT informa-_JJ tion_NN was_VBD available_JJ from_IN the_DT remaining_VBG Indian_JJ States_NNS or_CC from_IN Ajmer_NNP ._.
It_PRP will_MD be_VB seen_VBN from_IN the_DT map_NN that_IN many_JJ infected_VBN areas_NNS are_VBP isolated_VBN ,_, in_IN reality_NN they_PRP may_MD have_VB been_VBN found_VBN to_TO be_VB continuous_JJ with_IN the_DT main_JJ areas_NNS if_IN more_JJR detailed_JJ information_NN had_VBD been_VBN avail-_JJ able_JJ ;_: that_WDT is_VBZ ,_, discontinuity_NN of_IN distribution_NN in_IN most_JJS cases_NNS is_VBZ probably_RB more_RBR apparent_JJ than_IN real_JJ ._.
The_DT map_NN also_RB gives_VBZ the_DT impression_NN that_IN the_DT disease_NN is_VBZ more_RBR prevalent_JJ in_IN the_DT areas_NNS where_WRB rainfall_NN is_VBZ scanty_JJ and_CC the_DT camel_JJ population_NN is_VBZ high_JJ ._.
Unfortunately_RB almost_RB no_DT information_NN is_VBZ available_JJ from_IN Rajputana_NNP ,_, a_DT camel-rearing_JJ area_NN with_IN scanty_JJ rainfall_NN ._.
It_PRP will_MD also_RB be_VB seen_VBN that_IN the_DT disease_NN is_VBZ prevalent_JJ through-_JJ out_IN India_NNP ._.

2_CD )_) ._.
In_IN the_DT case_NN of_IN bovine_NN surra_NN ,_, the_DT curve_NN is_VBZ at_IN a_DT low_JJ level_NN from_IN January_NNP to_TO June_NNP ;_: from_IN July_NNP it_PRP rises_VBZ ,_, reaching_VBG a_DT peak_NN in_IN August_NNP and_CC falls_VBZ again_RB in_IN October_NNP with_IN a_DT slight_JJ rise_NN in_IN November_NNP ,_, after_IN which_WDT it_PRP falls_VBZ again_RB ._.
In_IN the_DT case_NN of_IN equine_NN surra_VBP the_DT curve_NN is_VBZ at_IN a_DT low_JJ level_NN from_IN January_NNP to_TO July_NNP ;_: from_IN August_NNP it_PRP rises_VBZ reaching_VBG a_DT peak_NN in_IN October_NNP after_IN which_WDT it_PRP continues_VBZ to_TO fall_VB till_JJ December_NNP ._.
With_IN camel_NN ,_, etc._NN ,_, the_DT curve_NN is_VBZ at_IN a_DT low_JJ level_NN from_IN January_NNP to_TO July_NNP ;_: from_IN August_NNP onward_IN it_PRP rises_VBZ ,_, reaching_VBG a_DT peak_NN in_IN September_NNP and_CC gradually_RB falls_VBZ until_IN December_NNP ._.
There_EX are_VBP thus_RB peaks_NNS in_IN three_CD different_JJ months_NNS with_IN the_DT three_CD surra_NN groups_NNS (_( Fig_NNP ._.
2_CD )_) ._.
Of_IN course_NN ,_, this_DT does_VBZ not_RB provide_VB a_DT conclusive_JJ proof_NN that_WDT bovines_VBZ ,_, camel_NN ,_, etc_FW ._.
are_VBP serving_VBG as_IN healthy_JJ reservoirs_NN for_IN the_DT acute_JJ equine_NN surra_NN ._.

2_CD )_) showing_VBG total_JJ of_IN bovine_NN ,_, equine_NN and_CC other_JJ surra_NN cases_NNS it_PRP will_MD be_VB seen_VBN that_IN the_DT curve_NN is_VBZ at_IN a_DT low_JJ level_NN between_IN January_NNP and_CC July_NNP ;_: from_IN August_NNP it_PRP rises_VBZ ,_, reaching_VBG a_DT peak_NN in_IN September_NNP and_CC then_RB declining_VBG until_IN December_NNP ._.

2_CD ._.
The_DT occurrence_NN of_IN surra_NN is_VBZ seasonal_JJ ._.

it_PRP is_VBZ in_IN September_NNP ._.

3_CD ._.

of_IN the_DT adult_NN bovine_JJ population_NN ._.
This_DT does_VBZ not_RB take_VB into_IN account_NN the_DT requirements_NNS of_IN growing_VBG animals_NNS ,_, of_IN equines_NNS and_CC of_IN the_DT 47.9_CD million_CD sheep_NN and_CC 37.7_CD million_CD goats_NNS ._.
Although_IN ,_, during_IN post-war_JJ developments_NNS ,_, it_PRP is_VBZ considered_VBN that_IN there_EX will_MD be_VB an_DT all-round_JJ increase_NN in_IN the_DT yield_NN of_IN foodgrains_NNS and_CC fodder_NN ,_, it_PRP will_MD be_VB some_DT time_NN before_IN developmental_JJ plans_NNS can_MD materialize_VB ._.

It_PRP may_MD be_VB pointed_VBN out_RP that_IN mango-seeds_NNS are_VBP at_IN present_JJ thrown_JJ away_RB as_IN waste_NN and_CC ,_, according_VBG to_TO a_DT rough_JJ estimate_NN ,_, the_DT amount_NN available_JJ may_MD be_VB about_IN two_CD million_CD tons_NNS per_IN annum_NN ,_, which_WDT would_MD yield_VB about_IN one_CD million_CD tons_NNS of_IN the_DT kernel_NN ._.

46_CD 16_CD 38_CD *_JJ Date_NNP of_IN first_JJ feeding_VBG It_PRP will_MD be_VB observed_VBN from_IN Table_NNP VII_NNP that_IN the_DT mean_JJ percentage_NN digestibility_NN of_IN crude_NN protein_NN ,_, ether_CC extract_JJ and_CC nitrogen-free_JJ extract_NN are_VBP 72.1_CD ,_, 56.3_CD and_CC 70.6_CD ,_, respectively_RB ._.

gives_VBZ a_DT wide_JJ positive_JJ nitrogen_NN balance_NN and_CC suggests_VBZ that_IN further_JJ economy_NN can_MD be_VB effected_VBN by_IN reducing_VBG the_DT quantity_NN of_IN oil-cake_NN ._.

of_IN dry_JJ matter_NN as_IN compared_VBN with_IN those_DT other_JJ common_JJ grains_NNS is_VBZ given_VBN in_IN Table_NNP VIII_NNP ._.

14_CD ,_, 40_CD A_NNP NOTE_NNP ON_NNP A_NNP NEW_NNP METHOD_NNP OF_NNP TESTING_NNP WOOL_NNP FOR_NNP MEDULLATION_NNP By_IN P._NNP N._NNP NANDA_NNP ,_, M.R.C.V.S._NNP ,_, GURBAX_NNP SINGH_NNP ,_, L.V.P_NNP ._.
and_CC S._NNP B._NNP MOGRE_NNP ,_, M_NNP ._.
Sc._NNP ,_, Government_NNP Livestock_NNP Farm_NNP ,_, Hissar_NNP (_( Received_VBN for_IN publication_NN on_IN 21_CD October_NNP 1944_CD )_) (_( With_IN Plate_NNP XIV_NNP )_) OF_IN the_DT recognized_VBN methods_NNS of_IN determining_VBG the_DT percentage_NN medullation_NN in_IN wool_NN ,_, only_RB McMahon_NNP 's_POS Medullometer_NNP can_MD be_VB of_IN use_NN if_IN a_DT large_JJ number_NN of_IN samples_NNS from_IN individual_JJ animals_NNS are_VBP to_TO be_VB dealt_VBN with_IN ._.
The_DT other_JJ methods_NNS are_VBP too_RB lengthy_JJ and_CC require_VB several_JJ days_NNS to_TO analyse_VB a_DT single_JJ fleece_NN ._.
The_DT use_NN of_IN the_DT medullometer_NN too_RB is_VBZ restricted_VBN to_TO labora-_JJ tories_NNS where_WRB electric_JJ current_JJ and_CC technically_RB trained_JJ staff_NN are_VBP available_JJ ._.
With_IN a_DT view_NN to_TO guide_VB field_NN workers_NNS ,_, the_DT authors_NNS have_VBP devised_VBN a_DT simple_JJ rapid_JJ test_NN to_TO estimate_VB approximately_RB the_DT medullation_NN in_IN wool_NN ._.
It_PRP is_VBZ based_VBN on_IN Elphick_NNP 's_POS benzol_NN method_NN ._.
It_PRP is_VBZ known_VBN that_IN a_DT clean_JJ sample_NN of_IN wool_NN when_WRB placed_VBN under_IN benzol_NN exhibits_VBZ an_DT intensity_NN of_IN whiteness_NN in_IN proportion_NN to_TO the_DT amount_NN of_IN medullation_NN in_IN the_DT sample_NN ._.
Marked_VBN difference_NN in_IN whiteness_NN can_MD easily_RB be_VB judged_VBN with_IN the_DT naked_JJ eye_NN ._.
For_IN selecting_VBG sheep_JJ carrying_VBG good_JJ quality_NN wool_NN ,_, the_DT easiest_JJS course_NN is_VBZ to_TO make_VB small_JJ samples_NNS from_IN these_DT sheep_NN ,_, wash_VBP the_DT amples_NNS in_IN petrol_NN ,_, take_VBP an_DT equal_JJ quantity_NN by_IN weight_NN of_IN all_DT of_IN them_PRP and_CC place_VB them_PRP side_RB by_IN side_NN ,_, under_IN benzol_NN ,_, in_IN a_DT black_JJ enamelled_JJ tray_NN ._.
From_IN the_DT in-_JJ censity_NN of_IN whiteness_NN in_IN the_DT samples_NNS ,_, one_CD can_MD at_IN once_RB pick_VBN out_RP the_DT samples_NNS from_IN sheep_JJ carrying_VBG better_JJR wool_NN ._.
This_DT method_NN can_MD be_VB used_VBN to_TO pick_VB out_RP better_JJR quality_NN sheep_NN ,_, but_CC for_IN recording_VBG the_DT percentage_NN of_IN medullation_NN in_IN individual_JJ animals_NNS ,_, which_WDT is_VBZ so_RB essential_JJ for_IN breeding_VBG on_IN scientific_JJ lines_NNS ,_, it_PRP does_VBZ not_RB serve_VB the_DT purpose_NN ._.
To_TO overcome_VB this_DT ,_, certain_JJ standards_NNS have_VBP been_VBN devised_VBN ._.
These_DT standards_NNS show_VBP samples_NNS under_IN benzol_NN with_IN different_JJ amounts_NNS of_IN medullation_NN ,_, varying_VBG from_IN zero_CD to_TO 100_CD per_IN cent_NN ._.
For_IN studying_VBG the_DT approximate_JJ percentage_NN of_IN medul_JJ lation_NN in_IN a_DT sample_NN ,_, the_DT same_JJ weight_NN of_IN the_DT sample_NN ,_, as_IN in_IN the_DT standards_NNS ,_, is_VBZ placed_VBN under_IN benzol_NN and_CC its_PRP$ percentage_NN determined_VBN by_IN comparison_NN ._.
The_DT method_NN ,_, therefore_RB ,_, involves_VBZ two_CD main_JJ operations_NNS :_: (_( a_DT )_) Making_NN of_IN standard_JJ samples_NNS from_IN different_JJ breeds_NNS of_IN sheep_NN and_CC (_( b_NN )_) Studying_NN of_IN samples_NNS in_IN the_DT field_NN in_IN comparison_NN with_IN the_DT standard_NN samples_NNS ._.
Making_VBG of_IN standard_JJ samples_NNS ._.
Two_CD hundred_CD small_JJ shoulder_NN samples_NNS are_VBP taken_VBN from_IN a_DT particular_JJ breed_NN of_IN sheep_NN ._.
After_IN getting_VBG rid_JJ of_IN the_DT free_JJ vegetable_JJ matter_NN ,_, each_DT sample_NN is_VBZ first_RB washed_VBN with_IN a_DT 1_CD per_IN cent_NN ._.
neutral_JJ soap_NN solution_NN at_IN 50°C_CD ._.
and_CC then_RB rinsed_VBD twice_RB in_IN petrol_NN at_IN the_DT same_JJ temperature_NN ._.
After_IN drying_VBG them_PRP at_IN the_DT room_NN temperature_NN ,_, 100_CD milligrams_NNS of_IN each_DT sample_NN are_VBP taken_VBN for_IN making_VBG the_DT standards_NNS ._.
All_PDT these_DT samples_NNS are_VBP put_VBN under_IN benzol_NN in_IN an_DT enamelled_JJ tray_NN which_WDT can_MD accommodate_VB about_RB 20_CD to_TO 30_CD at_IN a_DT time_NN ._.
Judging_VBG from_IN the_DT intensity_NN of_IN whiteness_NN shown_VBN ,_, some_DT samples_NNS showing_VBG varying_VBG amounts_NNS of_IN hairiness_NN ,_, can_MD be_VB picked_VBN out_RP ._.
These_DT selected_VBN samples_NNS are_VBP then_RB arranged_VBN in_IN series_NN according_VBG to_TO percentage_NN of_IN the_DT medullation_NN in_IN them_PRP ._.
The_DT first_JJ one_CD represents_VBZ zero_CD per_IN cent_NN and_CC the_DT last_JJ one_CD 100_CD per_IN cent_NN ._.
The_DT intervening_NN samples_NNS are_VBP then_RB allotted_VBN arbitrary_JJ per-_JJ centage_NN medullation_NN in_IN an_DT ascending_VBG order_NN to_TO indicate_VB increased_JJ hairiness_NN ._.
The_DT percentages_NNS fixed_VBN for_IN the_DT samples_NNS are_VBP according_VBG to_TO the_DT intensity_NN of_IN whiteness_NN exhibited_VBN by_IN them_PRP ._.
To_TO obtain_VB sharp_JJ contrasts_NNS ,_, the_DT first_JJ sample_NN should_MD consist_VB of_IN pure_JJ wool_NN and_CC the_DT last_JJ of_IN pure_JJ hair_NN ._.
The_DT estimation_NN of_IN medullation_NN would_MD be_VB more_JJR accurate_JJ if_IN a_DT large_JJ number_NN of_IN samples_NNS are_VBP taken_VBN to_TO make_VB up_RP the_DT standards_NNS ._.
For_IN more_RBR reliable_JJ results_NNS the_DT percentage_NN medullation_NN in_IN the_DT series_NN may_MD be_VB fixed_VBN by_IN actually_RB ascertaining_VBG the_DT exact_JJ amount_NN of_IN medullation_NN by_IN the_DT microprojec-_JJ tion_NN method_NN ._.
These_DT standards_NNS can_MD then_RB be_VB used_VBN for_IN the_DT estimation_NN of_IN medullation_NN in_IN any_DT given_VBN sample_NN of_IN wool_NN by_IN comparison_NN ._.
To_TO have_VB standards_NNS handy_VBN in_IN the_DT field_NN ,_, photographs_NN of_IN prepared_JJ sets_NNS can_MD be_VB used_VBN with_IN equal_JJ efficiency_NN ._.
The_DT technique_NN consists_VBZ in_IN first_JJ taking_VBG a_DT small_JJ sample_NN from_IN the_DT sheep_NN as_IN close_NN to_TO the_DT skin_NN as_IN possible_JJ ._.
After_IN cleaning_VBG it_PRP to_TO get_VB rid_JJ of_IN all_DT free_JJ vegetable_JJ matter_NN and_CC dirt_NN ,_, it_PRP is_VBZ given_VBN a_DT free_JJ rinsing_NN in_IN petrol_NN for_IN one_CD to_TO two_CD minutes_NNS ._.
It_PRP is_VBZ then_RB allowed_VBN to_TO dry_VB ._.
One_CD hundred_CD milligrams_NNS of_IN the_DT sample_NN are_VBP then_RB weighed_VBN out_RP by_IN means_NNS of_IN the_DT portable_JJ balance_NN ._.
This_DT quantity_NN is_VBZ spread_VBN out_RP a_DT little_JJ between_IN the_DT 284_CD S._NNP G._NNP IYER_NNP AND_NNP Z_NNP ._.
A._NN HASHMI_NNP thumbs_NN and_CC fingers_NNS and_CC all_PDT the_DT fibres_NNS are_VBP brought_VBN parallel_RB to_TO one_CD another_DT ._.
The_DT spreading_VBG out_RP is_VBZ done_VBN to_TO the_DT same_JJ extent_NN as_IN in_IN the_DT standard_JJ print_NN (_( Plate_NNP XIV_NNP )_) ._.
This_DT resultant_JJ sample_NN must_MD present_VB an_DT homogeneous_JJ appearance_NN ._.
It_PRP is_VBZ placed_VBN in_IN an_DT enamelled_JJ tray_NN and_CC covered_VBN by_IN glass_NN to_TO press_VB down_RP the_DT fibres_NNS ._.
Benzol_NNP is_VBZ then_RB poured_VBN in_IN the_DT tray_NN ,_, till_VB the_DT sample_NN is_VBZ immersed_VBN ._.
By_IN comparing_VBG the_DT intensity_NN of_IN whiteness_NN of_IN the_DT sample_NN with_IN the_DT standards_NNS ,_, the_DT medullation_NN is_VBZ estimated_VBN ._.
By_IN using_VBG a_DT suitable_JJ size_NN of_IN tray_NN (_( 8_CD in_IN ._.
×10_NN in_IN ._.
×_$ 1_CD in_IN ._.
)_) ,_, 10_CD to_TO 15_CD samples_NNS can_MD be_VB examined_VBN at_IN a_DT time_NN ._.
A_DT single_JJ hand_NN can_MD easily_RB test_VB 100_CD to_TO 150_CD samples_NNS in_IN a_DT day_NN ._.
Average_JJ medullation_NN in_IN a_DT single_JJ fleece_NN can_MD be_VB worked_VBN out_RP by_IN testing_VBG eight_CD to_TO ten_VB representative_JJ samples_NNS taken_VBN from_IN different_JJ parts_NNS of_IN the_DT body_NN of_IN a_DT sheep_NN ._.
To_TO begin_VB with_IN ,_, testing_VBG of_IN the_DT shoulder_NN sample_NN is_VBZ enough_JJ for_IN classing_VBG and_CC culling_VBG sheep_JJ under_IN village_NN conditions_NNS ._.
SUMMARY_NN With_IN a_DT view_NN to_TO guide_VB field_NN workers_NNS a_DT simple_JJ rapid_JJ test_NN to_TO estimate_VB approximately_RB the_DT medullation_NN in_IN wool_NN has_VBZ been_VBN devised_VBN ._.
The_DT test_NN is_VBZ based_VBN on_IN the_DT fact_NN that_IN a_DT clean_JJ sample_NN of_IN wool_NN ,_, when_WRB placed_VBN under_IN benzol_NN exhibits_VBZ an_DT intensity_NN of_IN whiteness_NN in_IN proportion_NN to_TO the_DT amount_NN of_IN medullation_NN in_IN the_DT sample_NN ._.
AVIAN_NNP LEUCOSIS_NNP COMPLEX_NNP (_( FOWLD-PARALYSIS_NNP )_) IN_NNP INDIA_NNP By_IN S._NNP 6_CD ._.

A._NN HASHMI_NNP ,_, Poultry_NNP Research_NNP Section_NNP ,_, Imperial_NNP Veterinary_NNP Research_NNP Institute_NNP Izatnagar_NNP (_( Received_VBN for_IN publication_NN on_IN 17_CD September_NNP 1945_CD )_) (_( With_IN Plates_NNP XV-XVII_NNP )_) THE_NNP veterinary_JJ literature_NN in_IN this_DT country_NN contains_VBZ records_NNS of_IN paralysis_NN in_IN fowls_NN attributed_VBN to_TO a_DT number_NN of_IN different_JJ causes_NNS ,_, such_JJ as_IN nutritional_JJ deficiencies_NNS [_VBP Mohey-Deen_NNP ,_, 1933_CD ;_: Bachan_NNP Singh_NNP ,_, 1940_CD ;_: Mahajan_NNP ,_, 1934_CD ]_NN ,_, neurolymphomatosis_NN [_NN Krishniengar_NNP ,_, 1937_CD ;_: Naidu_NNP ,_, 1938_CD ]_NN ,_, and_CC Ranikhet_NNP disease_NN [_NNP Kaura_NNP and_CC Iyer_NNP ,_, 1937_CD ]_NN ._.
While_IN reviewing_VBG these_DT cases_NNS ,_, Kaura_NNP [_NNP 1941_CD ]_NNP remarked_VBD that_IN 'unfortunately_RB very_RB little_JJ trouble_NN has_VBZ been_VBN taken_VBN to_TO differentiate_VB and_CC classify_VB the_DT various_JJ types_NNS of_IN paralysis_NN and_CC that_IN the_DT simul-_JJ taneous_JJ occurrence_NN of_IN true_JJ fowld-paralysis_NN in_IN the_DT same_JJ bird_NN where_WRB some_DT other_JJ diagnosis_NN has_VBZ been_VBN given_VBN has_VBZ been_VBN overlooked_VBN '_POS ._.
A_DT systematic_JJ survey_NN was_VBD ,_, there-_JJ fore_NN ,_, undertaken_JJ to_TO investigate_VB the_DT incidence_NN and_CC distribution_NN of_IN this_DT disease_NN in_IN the_DT country_NN ._.
SURVEY_NNP The_DT first_JJ case_NN diagnosed_VBN was_VBD a_DT hen_NN received_VBN in_IN the_DT laboratory_NN for_IN post-mortem_JJ examination_NN in_IN April_NNP 1941_CD ._.
Since_IN then_RB ,_, the_DT disease_NN in_IN its_PRP$ diverse_NN forms_NNS has_VBZ been_VBN diagnosed_VBN in_IN Bombay_NNP ,_, the_DT Punjab_NNP ,_, Hydera-_NNP bad_JJ (_( Dn_NNP )_) ,_, the_DT United_NNP Provinces_NNPS ,_, Central_NNP Provinces_NNPS ,_, Cochin_NNP ,_, Mysore_NNP and_CC Madras_NNP ._.
Both_DT sexes_NNS and_CC all_PDT the_DT common_JJ breeds_NNS as_RB well_RB as_IN their_PRP$ crosses_NNS were_VBD seen_VBN to_TO be_VB affected_VBN ._.
The_DT survey_NN was_VBD ,_, however_RB ,_, confined_VBD to_TO the_DT organized_VBN farms_NNS only_RB and_CC little_JJ information_NN is_VBZ available_JJ about_IN the_DT incidence_NN in_IN village_NN flocks_NNS ._.
FIELD_NNP OBSERVATIONS_NNP The_DT prevalence_NN of_IN the_DT disease_NN was_VBD first_RB investigated_VBN on_IN a_DT small_JJ commercial_JJ farm_NN ,_, which_WDT was_VBD started_VBN in_IN 1936_CD with_IN about_RB 100_CD birds_NNS ,_, and_CC has_VBZ been_VBN subjected_VBN to_TO considerable_JJ in-breeding_JJ ._.
In_IN 1942_CD ,_, there_EX were_VBD about_IN 60_CD birds_NNS ,_, mostly_RB of_IN White_NNP Leghorn_NNP and_CC Rhode_NNP Island_NNP Red_NNP breeds_NNS ._.
The_DT fertility_NN ,_, hatchability_NN and_CC viability_NN records_NNS were_VBD unsatisfactory_JJ ._.
Mortality_NNP was_VBD high_JJ ,_, deaths_JJ occurring_VBG at_IN irregular_JJ intervals_NNS Typical_JJ cases_NNS of_IN leucosis_NN were_VBD diagnosed_VBN which_WDT were_VBD later_RB confirmed_VBN as_IN (_( lymphoid_NN )_) leucosis_NN on_IN histolo-_JJ gical_JJ examination_NN ._.
The_DT affected_JJ fowls_JJ went_VBD light_JJ and_CC ultimately_RB lost_VBD control_NN of_IN their_PRP$ limbs_NNS ._.
Lanieness_RB started_VBN as_IN a_DT jerky_NN walk_NN ,_, followed_VBN by_IN inability_NN to_TO use_VB one_CD or_CC both_DT limbs_NNS ,_, with_IN the_DT characteristic_JJ clutching_NN appearance_NN of_IN the_DT claws_NN ._.
As_IN the_DT disease_NN advanced_VBD the_DT fowls_NN were_VBD unable_JJ to_TO move_VB and_CC lay_VB in_IN a_DT helpless_JJ condition_NN ,_, often_RB with_IN one_CD leg_NN stretched_VBN in_IN front_NN and_CC the_DT other_JJ behind_IN (_( Plate_NNP XV_NNP ,_, fig_NN ._.
1_CD )_) ._.
Drooping_VBG of_IN on_IN or_CC both_DT wings_NNS and_CC twitching_NN of_IN the_DT neck_NN and_CC head_NN were_VBD also_RB seen_VBN ._.
Occasionally_RB the_DT eyes_NNS were_VBD affected_VBN the_DT pupil_NN in_IN such_JJ cases_NNS becoming_VBG distorted_VBN and_CC the_DT iris_NN losing_VBG its_PRP$ pigment_NN and_CC power_NN to_TO expand_VB or_CC con_VB tract_NN ._.
The_DT appetite_NN and_CC general_JJ appearance_NN wen_NN unaltered_VBD even_RB in_IN the_DT last_JJ stages_NNS of_IN the_DT disease_NN ._.

Liver_NNP studded_VBD with_IN tumours_NNS Avian_JJ Leucosis_NNP Complex_NNP in_IN India_NNP 285_CD PATHOLOGY_NNP The_DT following_JJ description_NN is_VBZ based_VBN on_IN a_DT study_NN of_IN naterial_JJ from_IN 154_CD natural_JJ cases_NNS of_IN the_DT disease_NN from_IN ll_NN over_IN the_DT country_NN ._.
Gross_NNP lesions_NNS ._.
Frequently_RB the_DT most_RBS striking_JJ hange_NN noticed_VBD post-mortem_NN was_VBD a_DT uniform_JJ enlarge_NN ment_NN of_IN the_DT liver_NN and_CC spleen_JJ due_JJ to_TO a_DT soft_JJ ,_, greyish-_JJ yellow_JJ infiltrating_NN tissue_NN (_( Plate_NNP XV_NNP ,_, fig_NN ._.
2_CD )_) ._.
The_DT liver_NN was_VBD swollen_VBN to_TO several_JJ times_NNS its_PRP$ normal_JJ size_NN ,_, weighing_VBG in_IN some_DT cases_NNS as_RB much_RB as_IN 1¼_CD lb_NN ._.
(_( normal_JJ weight_NN 2_CD oz_NN ._. )_) ._.
The_DT borders_NNS were_VBD rounded_VBN and_CC there_EX were_VBD small_JJ grey_JJ areas_NNS on_IN the_DT surface_NN and_CC dipping_VBG Into_NNP the_DT organ_JJ producing_VBG a_DT greyish_JJ roughened_VBN hob-_NN hailed_VBD appearance_NN ._.
The_DT liver_NN was_VBD friable_JJ ,_, resulting_VBG occasionally_RB in_IN upture_NN and_CC internal_JJ haemorrhage_NN ._.
In_IN many_JJ such_JJ cases_NNS ,_, the_DT kidneys_NNS (_( Plate_NNP XVI_NNP ,_, fig_NN ._.
5_CD )_) were_VBD also_RB affected_VBN ._.
The_DT bone-marrow_NN was_VBD constantly_RB involved_VBN ,_, being_VBG swollen_VBN ,_, pale-grey_JJ or_CC brick-red_JJ in_IN colour_NN and_CC abnormally_RB solid_JJ ._.
Anaemic_JJ changes_NNS were_VBD indicated_VBN by_IN pallor_NN of_IN the_DT comb_NN ,_, skin_NN and_CC visible_JJ mucous_JJ membranes_NNS ._.
The_DT commonest_JJS manifestation_NN ,_, however_RB ,_, was_VBD the_DT occurrence_NN of_IN tumour-like_JJ masses_NNS in_IN the_DT internal_JJ organs_NNS ._.
In_IN order_NN of_IN frequency_NN in_IN which_WDT the_DT viscera_NN were_VBD affected_VBN was_VBD liver_RB ,_, ovary_JJ ,_, mesentery_NN ,_, spleen_NN ,_, pancreas_NNS ,_, kidney_NN ,_, intestine_NN ,_, gizzard_NN ,_, proventriculus_NN ,_, voluntary_JJ muscle_NN and_CC skin_NN ._.
The_DT tumours_NNS were_VBD well_RB embedded_VBN ,_, white_JJ or_CC pink-grey_JJ ,_, friable_JJ and_CC varied_VBN in_IN size_NN from_IN that_DT of_IN a_DT pea_NN to_TO that_DT of_IN a_DT hen_NN 's_POS egg_NN (_( Plate_NNP XV_NNP ,_, fig_NN ._.
3_CD and_CC Plate_NNP XVI_NNP ,_, fig_NN ._.
4_CD )_) ._.
Often_RB the_DT affection_NN was_VBD localized_VBN ,_, but_CC sometimes_RB the_DT in-_JJ volvement_NN of_IN adjacent_JJ organs_NNS rendered_VBD it_PRP difficult_JJ to_TO demarcate_VB the_DT boundaries_NNS of_IN different_JJ structures_NNS ._.
In_IN the_DT nervous_JJ form_NN of_IN the_DT disease_NN ,_, characterized_VBN by_IN paralytic_JJ symptoms_NNS during_IN life_NN ,_, changes_NNS were_VBD seen_VBN mostly_RB in_IN the_DT sciatic_JJ ,_, vagus_JJ ,_, brachial_JJ and_CC lumbo-_JJ sacral_JJ nerves_NNS ._.
Instead_RB of_IN having_VBG a_DT healthy_JJ glistening_NN white_JJ colour_NN ,_, they_PRP were_VBD greyish_JJ yellow_NN ,_, oedematous_JJ and_CC enlarged_VBD to_TO several_JJ times_NNS their_PRP$ original_JJ thickness_NN (_( Plate_NNP XVI_NNP ,_, fig_NN ._.
6_CD )_) ._.
The_DT normal_JJ transverse_JJ striations_NNS were_VBD often_RB indistinct_JJ ._.
Growths_NNS ,_, millet-seed_NN in_IN size_NN ,_, were_VBD occasionally_RB seen_VBN on_IN the_DT surface_NN of_IN such_JJ nerves_NNS ._.
The_DT posterior_JJ root_NN ganglia_NN of_IN the_DT cord_NN were_VBD found_VBN symetrically_RB enlarged_VBN in_IN a_DT few_JJ cases_NNS ._.
In_IN the_DT ocular_JJ form_NN shown_VBN by_IN blindness_NN during_IN life_NN ,_, the_DT iris_NN was_VBD thickened_VBN ,_, oedematous_JJ and_CC depigmented_VBN ,_, the_DT pupil_NN being_VBG distorted_VBN ._.
Thickening_NN of_IN the_DT long_JJ bones_NNS ,_, particularly_RB the_DT shanks_NNS ,_, was_VBD seen_VBN in_IN two_CD localities_NNS in_IN fowls_NN which_WDT also_RB showed_VBD other_JJ forms_NNS of_IN the_DT diease_NN (_( Plate_NNP XVI_NNP ,_, fig_NN ._.
7_CD )_) ._.
Histology_NNP ._.
The_DT enlargement_NN of_IN the_DT liver_NN was_VBD usually_RB due_JJ to_TO massive_JJ infiltration_NN of_IN the_DT stroma_NN with_IN immature_NN blood_NN cells_NNS which_WDT predominated_VBD in_IN the_DT peripheral_JJ blood_NN and_CC abounded_VBD in_IN the_DT bone_NN marrow_NN ,_, liver_RB ,_, spleen_JJ ,_, kidneys_NNS ,_, etc_FW ._.
In_IN the_DT liver_NN ,_, which_WDT is_VBZ the_DT commonest_JJS site_NN of_IN infiltration_NN ,_, both_DT intravascular_JJ and_CC perivascular_JJ accumulations_NNS were_VBD seen_VBN ._.
The_DT visceral_JJ tumours_NNS were_VBD usually_RB composed_VBN of_IN closely_RB packed_VBN small_JJ and_CC large_JJ basic-staining_JJ non-_JJ granular_JJ mono-nuclear_JJ cells_NNS (_( lymphocytes_NNS and_CC lym-_JJ phoblasts_NNS )_) ._.
The_DT invading_NN cells_NNS infiltrated_VBD the_DT parenchyma_NN ,_, and_CC in_IN some_DT cases_NNS ultimately_RB replaced_VBD it_PRP ._.
There_EX were_VBD no_DT degenerative_JJ changes_NNS in_IN the_DT normal_JJ elements_NNS and_CC these_DT remained_VBN intact_NN until_IN entirely_RB replaced_VBN by_IN the_DT infiltrating_NN cells_NNS ._.
In_IN the_DT liver_NN the_DT distribution_NN of_IN these_DT cells_NNS varied_VBD from_IN mild_JJ periportal_JJ accumulations_NNS to_TO massive_JJ infiltrations_NNS ,_, completely_RB masking_VBG the_DT normal_JJ tissue_NN (_( Plate_NNP XVII_NNP ,_, figs_NNS ._.
8_CD and_CC 9_CD )_) ._.
The_DT lesions_NNS in_IN the_DT nerves_NNS consisted_VBD essentially_RB of_IN similar_JJ cellular_JJ infiltrations_NNS among_IN the_DT nerve_NN fibres_NNS (_( Plate_NNP XVII_NNP ,_, figs_NNS ._.
10_CD and_CC 11_CD )_) ._.
The_DT brain_NN ,_, however_RB ,_, was_VBD unaffected_VBN even_RB in_IN the_DT nervous_JJ form_NN ._.
In_IN the_DT eyes_NNS ,_, the_DT iris_NN showed_VBD lymphoidal_JJ cell_NN infiltra-_JJ tions_NNS ;_: the_DT cornea_NN was_VBD normal_JJ in_IN structure_NN ,_, the_DT retina_NN usually_RB unaltered_JJ and_CC the_DT optic_JJ nerve_NN showed_VBD only_RB slight_JJ cellular_JJ infiltration_NN ._.
DISCUSSION_NNP The_DT consensus_NN of_IN expert_JJ opinion_NN [_NNP Bullis_NNP ,_, 1944_CD ]_NN groups_NNS the_DT several_JJ manifestations_NNS of_IN this_DT disease_NN under_IN the_DT term_NN 'avian_JJ leucosis_NN complex_NN '_POS ._.
As_IN the_DT disease_NN is_VBZ characterized_VBN by_IN definite_JJ tissue_NN changes_NNS and_CC as_IN its_PRP$ transmission_NN is_VBZ difficult_JJ or_CC uncertain_JJ [_JJ Stubbs_NNP ,_, 1938_CD ]_NN ,_, histopathological_JJ evidence_NN alone_RB is_VBZ considered_VBN sufficient_JJ for_IN diagnosis_NN ._.
In_IN this_DT country_NN ,_, the_DT clinical_JJ syndrome_NN ,_, gross_JJ lesions_NNS and_CC histological_JJ features_NNS of_IN the_DT prevailing_JJ disease_NN were_VBD seen_VBN to_TO be_VB typical_JJ of_IN avian_JJ leucosis_NN complex_NN and_CC comparable_JJ strictly_RB with_IN the_DT disease_NN existing_VBG in_IN Great_NNP Britain_NNP ._.
All_PDT the_DT different_JJ manifestations_NNS were_VBD encountered_VBN ,_, but_CC a_DT striking_JJ feature_NN was_VBD the_DT preponderance_NN of_IN the_DT visceral_JJ form_NN of_IN the_DT disease_NN compared_VBN with_IN the_DT neural_JJ and_CC ocular_JJ forms_NNS which_WDT are_VBP more_RBR commonly_JJ met_NN with_IN in_IN other_JJ countries_NNS ._.
The_DT reasons_NNS for_IN this_DT are_VBP not_RB known_VBN ._.
All_PDT the_DT common_JJ breeds_NNS were_VBD seen_VBN to_TO be_VB affected_VBN ,_, but_CC ,_, as_IN the_DT survey_NN was_VBD confined_VBN to_TO organized_VBN poultry_NN farms_NNS maintaining_VBG chiefly_NN fowls_NN of_IN exotic_JJ breeds_NNS ,_, information_NN on_IN the_DT incidence_NN in_IN indigenous_JJ breeds_NNS is_VBZ scanty_JJ ._.
This_DT is_VBZ an_DT urgent_JJ question_NN for_IN investiga-_JJ tion_NN and_CC warrants_NNS an_DT extension_NN of_IN the_DT survey_NN to_TO village_VB flocks_NNS ._.
It_PRP was_VBD observed_VBN in_IN the_DT course_NN of_IN this_DT survey_NN that_IN the_DT advent_NN of_IN the_DT disease_NN may_MD be_VB hardly_RB noticed_VBN in_IN a_DT flock_NN and_CC the_DT danger_NN of_IN its_PRP$ presence_NN rarely_RB appreciated_VBD ,_, as_IN only_RB a_DT small_JJ percentage_NN of_IN birds_NNS seemed_VBN to_TO be_VB affected_VBN at_IN a_DT time_NN ._.
The_DT appearance_NN of_IN other_JJ epidemic-_JJ diseases_NNS ,_, such_JJ as_IN Ranikhet_NNP disease_NN ,_, is_VBZ a_DT spectacular_JJ event_NN ,_, calling_VBG for_IN urgent_JJ measures_NNS ,_, whereas_NNS in_IN this_DT disease_NN accurate_JJ mortality_NN records_NNS alone_RB reveal_VBP the_DT true_JJ measure_NN of_IN its_PRP$ import_NN ._.
In_IN one_CD of_IN the_DT flocks_NNS the_DT disease_NN has_VBZ been_VBN held_VBN to_TO be_VB responsible_JJ for_IN 25.6_CD per_IN cent_NN of_IN losses_NNS in_IN mature_JJ fowls_NN during_IN a_DT period_NN of_IN three_CD years_NNS ._.
In_IN some_DT flocks_NNS it_PRP may_MD be_VB far_RB worse_JJR ,_, as_IN the_DT following_JJ statement_NN from_IN the_DT Report_NNP U._NNP S._NNP Department_NNP of_IN Agriculture_NNP [_NNP Winton_NNP ,_, 1943_CD ]_NN 286_CD M._NNP M._NNP SARWAR_NNP shows_VBZ ,_, '_'' Lymphomatosis_NNP ,_, one_CD form_NN of_IN '_'' avian_JJ leucosis_NN complex_NN '_'' manifested_VBN by_IN paralysis_NN ,_, grey_JJ eyes_NNS leading_VBG to_TO blindness_VB ,_, and_CC enlarged_VBD livers_NNS ,_, continues_VBZ to_TO be_VB the_DT cause_NN of_IN close_NN to_TO 40.0_CD per_IN cent_NN ._.
of_IN the_DT total_JJ loss_NN ._.
Thus_RB the_DT yearly_JJ loss_NN from_IN this_DT disease_NN complex_JJ alone_RB amounts_VBZ to_TO more_JJR than_IN 52_CD million_CD dollars_NNS '_POS ._.
For_IN the_DT institution_NN of_IN prompt_JJ control_NN measures_VBZ the_DT importance_NN of_IN detecting_VBG the_DT disease_NN in_IN a_DT flock_NN at_IN an_DT early_JJ stage_NN is_VBZ evident_JJ ._.
SUMMARY_NNP (_( 1_CD )_) The_DT existence_NN of_IN '_'' avian_JJ leucosis_NN complex_NN '_'' (_( fowld-paralysis_NN )_) in_IN widely-separated_JJ localities_NNS in_IN India_NNP has_VBZ been_VBN established_VBN on_IN histopathological_JJ grounds_NNS ._.
(_( 2_CD )_) All_PDT the_DT common_JJ breeds_NNS were_VBD noticed_VBN to_TO be_VB affected_VBN ,_, but_CC the_DT survey_NN was_VBD confined_VBN to_TO organized_VBN poultry_NN farms_NNS primarily_RB maintaining_VBG exotic_JJ breeds_NNS ._.
The_DT incidence_NN of_IN the_DT disease_NN in_IN desi_NN fowls_NN in_IN rural_JJ flocks_NNS remains_VBZ to_TO be_VB investigated_VBN ._.
(_( 3_CD )_) In_IN one_CD flock_NN the_DT disease_NN persisted_VBD year_NN after_IN year_NN and_CC prevailed_VBN in_IN all_DT seasons_NNS ._.
It_PRP was_VBD responsible_JJ for_IN 25.6_CD per_IN cent_NN ._.
of_IN losses_NNS in_IN adult_NN birds_NNS during_IN a_DT period_NN of_IN three_CD years_NNS ._.
(_( 4_CD )_) In_IN at_IN least_JJS one_CD area_NN the_DT disease_NN seemed_VBD to_TO have_VB been_VBN spread_VBN through_IN the_DT distribution_NN of_IN stock_NN from_IN a_DT central_JJ farm_NN ._.
(_( 5_CD )_) The_DT clinical_JJ syndrome_NN ,_, gross_JJ lesions_NNS and_CC his-_JJ tology_NN of_IN the_DT disease_NN prevailing_NN in_IN this_DT country_NN are_VBP described_VBN ._.
These_DT are_VBP typical_JJ of_IN '_POS avian_JJ leucosis_NN complex_NN '_POS and_CC strictly_RB comparable_JJ with_IN those_DT of_IN the_DT disease_NN seen_VBN in_IN Great_NNP Britain_NNP ._.

10_CD showing_VBG cell_NN ,_, infiltration_NN DEMODECTIC_NNP MANGE_NNP OF_NNP GOATS_NNP IN_NNP INDIA_NNP By_IN M._NNP K._NNP SREENIVASAN_NNP ,_, G.M.V.C._NNP ,_, and_CC S._NNP W._NNP H._NNP RIZVI_NNP ,_, G.B.V.C._NNP ,_, Imperial_NNP Veterinary_NNP Research_NNP Institute_NNP ,_, Mukteswar_NNP (_( Received_VBN for_IN publication_NN on_IN 8_CD September_NNP 1945_CD )_) (_( With_IN Plate_NNP XVIII_NNP )_) DEMODECTIC_NNP mange_NN of_IN goats_NNS has_VBZ been_VBN known_VBN in_IN Europe_NNP since_IN 1881_CD when_WRB Niederhausern_NNP [_NNP 1881_CD ]_NNP re-_NN corded_VBD the_DT first_JJ case_NN at_IN Berne_NNP ._.
Nocard_NNP and_CC Railliet_NNP [_NNP 1885_CD ]_NNP recorded_VBD the_DT second_JJ case_NN at_IN Alfort_NNP ,_, and_CC Railliet_NNP [_NNP 1895_CD ]_NNP described_VBD the_DT mite_NN and_CC named_VBD it_PRP Demodex_NNP folliculorum_VBD var_NN ._.
caprae_NN ._.
Thereafter_RB different_JJ work-_JJ ers_NNS reported_VBD the_DT occurrence_NN of_IN this_DT infection_NN in_IN other_JJ parts_NNS of_IN Europe_NNP ._.
In_IN U.S.A._NNP the_DT first_JJ case_NN was_VBD re-_NN corded_VBN by_IN Cram_NNP [_NN 1925_CD ]_NN ,_, and_CC recently_RB Durant_NNP [_NN 1944_CD ]_NN has_VBZ recorded_VBN some_DT more_RBR ._.
To_TO our_PRP$ knowledge_NN demo-_JJ dectic_JJ mange_NN of_IN goats_NNS has_VBZ not_RB so_RB far_RB been_VBN reported_VBN in_IN India_NNP ._.
HISTORY_VB A_NNP batch_NN of_IN 50_CD female_JJ goats_NNS was_VBD purchased_VBN in_IN March_NNP 1944_CD from_IN a_DT goat_NN market_NN in_IN Bareilly_NNP district_NN of_IN the_DT United_NNP Provinces_NNPS ._.
All_PDT these_DT goats_NNS were_VBD picked_VBN out_RP from_IN different_JJ herds_NNS of_IN far_RB off_IN localities_NNS arriving_VBG at_IN the_DT market_NN on_IN the_DT same_JJ day_NN ._.
They_PRP were_VBD brought_VBN to_TO Mukteswar_NNP and_CC housed_VBN in_IN an_DT out-kraal_NN ,_, where_WRB there_EX was_VBD no_DT previous_JJ history_NN of_IN such_JJ infection_NN ._.
The_DT number_NN of_IN goats_NNS purchased_VBN from_IN any_DT one_CD herd_NN did_VBD not_RB exceed_VB five_CD ._.
All_PDT the_DT animals_NNS are_VBP of_IN non-descript_JJ plains_NNS breed_VBN with_IN short-haired_JJ coats_NNS ,_, and_CC are_VBP being_VBG maintained_VBN by_IN the_DT Institute_NNP for_IN breeding_VBG ._.
In_IN July_NNP 1944_CD ,_, some_DT of_IN the_DT kids_NNS of_IN this_DT herd_NN were_VBD found_VBN having_VBG mangy_JJ eruptions_NNS on_IN and_CC under_IN the_DT ears_NNS ,_, but_CC scrapings_NNS of_IN the_DT affected_JJ parts_NNS were_VBD negative_JJ for_IN mites_NNS ._.
The_DT non-_JJ specific_JJ nature_NN of_IN the_DT lesions_NNS in_IN kids_NNS prompted_VBD us_PRP to_TO examine_VB all_PDT the_DT goats_NNS thoroughly_RB with_IN the_DT result_NN that_WDT two_CD goats_NNS were_VBD found_VBN with_IN a_DT squamous_JJ type_NN of_IN itch_NN on_IN the_DT surface_NN and_CC border_NN of_IN the_DT ears_NNS ,_, while_IN one_CD goat_NN showed_VBD nodules_NNS on_IN the_DT face_NN and_CC neck_NN ._.
The_DT material_NN from_IN both_DT types_NNS of_IN lesions_NNS was_VBD found_VBN to_TO contain_VB Demodex_NNP ._.
One_CD of_IN us_PRP (_( S.W.H.R_NNP ._. )_)
has_VBZ an_DT opportunity_NN to_TO examine_VB about_IN 500_CD goats_NNS at_IN the_DT same_JJ market_NN recently_RB and_CC was_VBD able_JJ to_TO detect_VB a_DT few_JJ suffering_NN from_IN demodectic_JJ mange_NN ._.
This_DT diagnosis_NN was_VBD confirmed_VBN microscopically_RB ._.
The_DT infection_NN appears_VBZ to_TO exist_VB in_IN Farukhabad_NNP and_CC Etah_NNP districts_NNS of_IN United_NNP Provinces_NNPS from_IN where_WRB these_DT goats_NNS had_VBD come_VBN ._.
CLINICAL_NNP FEATURES_NNP Three_NNP types_NNS of_IN lesion_NN were_VBD encountered_VBN ,_, viz_NN ._.
(_( 1_CD )_) discrete_NN ,_, nodules_NNS ,_, (_( 2_CD )_) squamous_JJ dermatitis_NN and_CC (_( 3_CD )_) acute_NN dermatitis_NN over_IN coalesced_JJ nodules_NNS with_IN slight_JJ matting_NN of_IN the_DT hair_NN ._.
The_DT goat_NN showing_VBG the_DT nodular_JJ form_NN was_VBD rather_RB weak_JJ and_CC had_VBD two_CD kids_NNS to_TO suckle_VB ._.
The_DT nodules_NNS varied_VBN in_IN size_NN from_IN a_DT millet_NN seed_NN to_TO that_DT of_IN a_DT pea_NN and_CC were_VBD quite_RB common_JJ and_CC discrete_JJ on_IN the_DT face_NN ,_, neck_NN and_CC shoulders_NNS (_( Plate_NNP XVIII_NNP ,_, fig_NN ._.
1_CD )_) ;_: a_DT few_JJ were_VBD noticed_VBN on_IN other_JJ parts_NNS of_IN the_DT body_NN ._.
On_IN pressing_VBG the_DT nodules_NNS a_DT thick_NN ,_, greyish_JJ ,_, ribbon-like_JJ material_NN oozed_VBN out_RP ._.
This_DT material_NN was_VBD a_DT mass_NN of_IN mites_NNS at_IN all_DT develop-_JJ mental_JJ stages_NNS with_IN nymphal_JJ casts_NNS ._.
The_DT contents_NNS of_IN a_DT pea-sized_JJ nodule_NN might_MD roughly_RB contain_VB 22,000_CD mites_NNS ._.
Very_RB little_JJ loss_NN of_IN hair_NN was_VBD noticed_VBN in_IN this_DT form_NN but_CC there_EX was_VBD occasional_JJ itching_NN ._.
In_IN the_DT squamous_JJ type_NN ,_, loss_NN of_IN hair_NN was_VBD well_RB marked_VBN ._.
The_DT lesions_NNS varied_VBD in_IN size_NN from_IN a_DT silver_JJ two-anna_JJ bit_NN to_TO an_DT eight-anna_JJ piece_NN and_CC even_RB bigger_JJR in_IN some_DT cases_NNS ._.
The_DT lesions_NNS were_VBD more_RBR or_CC less_JJR circular_JJ and_CC covered_VBN with_IN dry_JJ reddish-grey_NN discharge_NN which_WDT made_VBD them_PRP appear_VB raised_VBN ._.
Scraping_VBG the_DT lesion_NN was_VBD quite_RB pain-_JJ ful_JJ and_CC revealed_VBD a_DT vascular_JJ base_NN ._.
The_DT mites_NNS were_VBD not_RB numerous_JJ in_IN lesions_NNS of_IN this_DT type_NN and_CC no_DT nodules_NNS could_MD be_VB detected_VBN in_IN the_DT affected_JJ area_NN ._.
The_DT lesions_NNS were_VBD confined_VBN mostly_RB to_TO the_DT ears_NNS and_CC in_IN some_DT cases_NNS to_TO the_DT back_NN and_CC face_NN (_( Plate_NNP XVIII_NNP ,_, fig_NN ._.
2_CD )_) ._.
Harden-_NNP bergh_NN and_CC Schlotthauer_NNP [_NNP 1925_CD ]_NNP reported_VBD a_DT case_NN of_IN the_DT squamous_JJ type_NN of_IN Demodex_NNP infection_NN in_IN goats_NNS in_IN U.S.A_NNP ._.
In_IN the_DT acute_JJ form_NN ,_, nodules_NNS of_IN small_JJ size_NN coalesced_VBN together_RB and_CC burst_VB releasing_VBG a_DT discharge_NN which_WDT caused_VBD matting_NN of_IN the_DT hair_NN ._.
There_EX was_VBD more_JJR itching_NN in_IN this_DT form_NN and_CC the_DT goats_NNS lost_VBN condition_NN ._.
Probably_RB the_DT hair_NN follicles_NNS were_VBD not_RB affected_VBN as_IN there_EX was_VBD no_DT loss_NN of_IN hair_NN ._.
Sometimes_RB the_DT lesion_NN also_RB extended_VBD to_TO the_DT teats_NNS (_( Plate_NNP XVIII_NNP ,_, fig_NN ._.
3_LS )_) ._.
The_DT course_NN of_IN the_DT disease_NN in_IN its_PRP$ nodular_JJ form_NN appears_VBZ to_TO be_VB indefinite_JJ ,_, but_CC in_IN the_DT squamous_JJ and_CC acute_JJ diffuse_NN forms_NNS it_PRP is_VBZ shorter_JJR and_CC can_MD perhaps_RB be_VB con-_JJ trolled_VBN ._.
It_PRP is_VBZ necessary_JJ to_TO mention_VB that_RB ,_, as_RB soon_RB as_IN the_DT disease_NN was_VBD detected_VBN ,_, all_DT goats_NNS with_IN the_DT slightest_JJS suspicion_NN of_IN infection_NN were_VBD removed_VBN from_IN the_DT healthy_JJ stock_NN but_CC on_IN subsequent_JJ examinations_NNS of_IN the_DT '_POS healthy_JJ '_'' lot_NN it_PRP was_VBD possible_JJ to_TO pick_VB out_RP a_DT few_JJ more_JJR infected_JJ animals_NNS ._.
In_IN all_DT six_CD out_IN of_IN 45_CD goats_NNS were_VBD declared_VBN diseased_VBN ._.
The_DT youngest_JJS animal_NN found_VBD naturally_RB affected_VBN was_VBD one_CD and_CC half_JJ year_NN of_IN age_NN ._.
No_DT kid_NN ,_, even_RB though_IN in_IN contact_NN with_IN an_DT infected_JJ mother_NN ,_, has_VBZ so_RB far_RB been_VBN found_VBN to_TO be_VB affected_VBN and_CC this_DT is_VBZ in_IN conformity_NN with_IN the_DT observations_NNS of_IN Hardenbergh_NNP and_CC Schlott-_NNP hauer_NN [_NN 1925_CD ]_NN ._.
TRANSMISSION_NNP Experimental_NNP transmission_NN of_IN demodectic_JJ mange_NN is_VBZ said_VBD to_TO be_VB very_RB difficult_JJ and_CC no_DT positive_JJ results_NNS appear_VBP to_TO have_VB been_VBN reported_VBN ._.
Mohler_NNP [_NN 1940_CD ]_NN mentions_NNS that_WDT attempts_VBP to_TO transfer_VB the_DT Demodex_NNP of_IN cattle_NNS by_IN 287_CD F_NNP 288_CD M._NNP K._NNP SREENIVASAN_NNP AND_NNP S._NNP W._NNP H._NNP RIZVI_NNP bringing_VBG infected_JJ nodules_NNS into_IN direct_JJ contact_NN with_IN healthy_JJ skin_NN ,_, as_RB well_RB as_IN by_IN all_DT other_JJ possible_JJ methods_NNS ,_, failed_VBD ._.
We_PRP have_VBP succeeded_VBN ,_, however_RB ,_, in_IN transmit-_JJ ting_VBG the_DT goat_NN Demodex_NNP to_TO four_CD out_IN of_IN six_CD healthy_JJ goats_NNS in_IN the_DT following_JJ ways_NNS ._.
Group_NNP 1_CD ._.
Three_CD young_JJ goats_NNS (_( two_CD females_NNS and_CC one_CD male_NN )_) and_CC one_CD hill-bull_NN were_VBD used_VBN ._.
Fresh_JJ infec-_JJ tive_JJ material_NN ,_, obtained_VBN from_IN a_DT goat_NN ,_, was_VBD applied_VBN on_IN both_DT sides_NNS of_IN the_DT neck_NN up_RB to_TO the_DT bases_NNS of_IN the_DT ears_NNS after_IN closely_RB clipping_VBG the_DT hair_NN ._.
A_DT second_JJ application_NN was_VBD similarly_RB made_VBN a_DT week_NN later_RB ._.
Group_NNP 2_CD ._.
Three_CD young_JJ goats_NNS (_( two_CD females_NNS and_CC one_CD male_NN )_) and_CC one_CD hill-bull_NN received_VBD the_DT same_JJ material_NN as_IN Group_NNP 1_CD ,_, but_CC the_DT skin_NN was_VBD shaved_VBN before_IN applying_VBG the_DT infective_JJ material_NN ._.
A_DT second_JJ application_NN was_VBD made_VBN a_DT week_NN later_RB ._.
Hill-bulls_NNS were_VBD included_VBN in_IN these_DT experiments_NNS to_TO see_VB whether_IN the_DT mites_NNS of_IN one_CD species_NNS affected_VBD another_DT ,_, as_IN supposed_VBN by_IN Zurn_NNP ,_, Babes_NNP ,_, Lewandowsky_NNP and_CC Scott_NNP [_NNP quoted_VBN by_IN Hirst_NNP ,_, 1921_CD ]_NN ._.
All_PDT the_DT experimental_JJ animals_NNS were_VBD kept_VBN under_IN strict_JJ isolation_NN to_TO avoid_VB any_DT chance_NN infection_NN ._.
A_DT month_NN later_RB none_NN was_VBD showing_VBG signs_NNS of_IN the_DT disease_NN ._.
Later_JJ examinations_NNS were_VBD made_VBN at_IN weekly_JJ intervals_NNS and_CC at_IN the_DT end_NN of_IN four_CD months_NNS one_CD goat_NN in_IN Group_NNP 1_CD showed_VBD a_DT few_JJ milletIndian_JJ J._NNP vet_NN ._.

Asselin_NNP et_CC Houzeau_NNP ,_, Paris_NNP MENINGO-ENCEPHALITIS_NNP IN_NNP A_NNP BITCH_NNP By_IN G._NNP K._NNP SHARMA_NNP ,_, P.V.S._NNP ,_, Punjab_NNP Veterinary_NNP College_NNP ,_, Lahore_NNP (_( Received_VBN for_IN publication_NN on_IN 29_CD September_NNP 1945_CD )_) A_DT BITCH_NNP was_VBD admitted_VBN as_IN in-patient_NN on_IN 12_CD Novem-_JJ ber_NN 1944_CD ._.
History_NN ._.
She_PRP had_VBD whelped_VBN normally_RB on_IN the_DT 10_CD November_NNP 1944_CD and_CC suddenly_RB went_VBD blind_IN two_CD days_NNS later_RB ._.
Symptoms_NNS ._.
When_WRB let_NN loose_VB she_PRP kept_VBD walking_VBG round_NN in_IN an_DT anti-clockwise_JJ direction_NN ._.
The_DT pupils_NNS were_VBD dilated_VBN and_CC there_EX was_VBD complete_JJ loss_NN of_IN vision_NN without_IN any_DT evident_JJ abnormality_NN (_( amaurosis_NN )_) ._.
She_PRP had_VBD periodic_JJ fits_NNS of_IN excitement_NN accompanied_VBN by_IN loud_JJ cries_NNS ._.
There_EX was_VBD staggering_VBG gait_NN in_IN the_DT hind_NN limbs_NN and_CC the_DT head_NN was_VBD occasionally_RB pushed_VBN into_IN the_DT corner_NN of_IN the_DT kennel_NN ._.
Marked_VBN spasms_NNS and_CC stiffness_NN of_IN the_DT neck_NN muscles_NNS were_VBD also_RB observed_VBN ._.
Later_RB on_IN the_DT circle_NN in_IN which_WDT she_PRP walked_VBD became_VBD narrower_JJR and_CC narrower_JJR till_NN at_IN last_JJ she_PRP used_VBD to_TO rotate_VB around_RP her_PRP$ own_JJ axis_NN ._.
After_IN walking_VBG a_DT few_JJ steps_NNS the_DT head_NN was_VBD depressed_VBN and_CC a_DT complete_JJ sommersault_NN was_VBD performed_VBN ._.
Her_PRP$ body_NN temperature_NN ranged_VBD between_IN 103°_CD and_CC 104°F_CD ._.
but_CC in_IN the_DT last_JJ stages_NNS it_PRP came_VBD down_RB to_TO 102°F_CD ._.
Paralytic_JJ symptoms_NNS set_VBN in_IN so_IN that_IN she_PRP was_VBD unable_JJ to_TO stand_VB ._.
She_PRP died_VBD on_IN 20_CD November_NNP 1944_CD under_IN general_JJ paralysis_NN ._.
Post-mortem_NN ._.
The_DT meninges_NNS were_VBD found_VBN congested_VBN ,_, adherent_NN to_TO the_DT brain_NN substance_NN and_CC studded_VBD with_IN small_JJ haemorrhages_NNS ._.
The_DT uterus_NN contained_VBD a_DT small_JJ quantity_NN of_IN brownish_JJ discharge_NN and_CC the_DT uterine_JJ mucosa_NN was_VBD inflamed_VBN ._.
It_PRP appears_VBZ that_IN the_DT primary_JJ focus_NN of_IN infection_NN was_VBD the_DT uterus_JJ which_WDT gave_VBD rise_NN to_TO meningo-encephalitis_NN ._.
The_DT histopathological_JJ examination_NN of_IN the_DT cerebral_JJ cortex_NN showed_VBD acute_JJ congestion_NN of_IN the_DT blood_NN vessels_NNS with_IN perivascular_JJ cellular_JJ infiltration_NN ._.
No_DT other_JJ degenerative_JJ changes_NNS were_VBD seen_VBN ._.
A_DT culture_NN from_IN the_DT cerebral_JJ cortex_NN was_VBD prepared_VBN on_IN agar_NN and_CC blood_NN agar_NN media_NNS and_CC subcultures_NNS were_VBD made_VBN on_IN the_DT same_JJ media_NNS which_WDT were_VBD sent_VBN to_TO the_DT Imperial_NNP Veterinary_NNP Research_NNP Institute_NNP ,_, Mukteswar_NNP ,_, for_IN determinative_JJ bacteriology_NN ._.
The_DT organisms_NNS were_VBD found_VBN to_TO be_VB gram-negative_JJ rods_NNS fermenting_VBG dextrose_NN ,_, lactose_JJ and_CC mannite_JJ with_IN the_DT production_NN of_IN acid_NN and_CC gas_NN ._.
It_PRP was_VBD therefore_RB concluded_VBD that_IN the_DT organisms_NNS belonged_VBD to_TO B._NNP coli_NNS group_NN ._.
SUMMARY_VB A_DT case_NN of_IN meningo-encephalitis_NN in_IN a_DT bitch_NN has_VBZ been_VBN described_VBN ._.
It_PRP appeared_VBD from_IN a_DT post-mortem_JJ examination_NN that_IN the_DT primary_JJ focus_NN of_IN infection_NN was_VBD the_DT uterus_NN ._.
From_IN a_DT study_NN of_IN cultures_NNS from_IN cerebral_JJ cortex_NN for_IN determinative_JJ bacteriology_NN ,_, it_PRP was_VBD concluded_VBN that_IN the_DT organism_NN belonged_VBD to_TO B._NNP coli_NNS group_NN ._.
