F_NNP 2_CD SELECTED_NNP ARTICLES_NNP IN_NNP VITRO_NNP STUDIES_NNP OF_IN THE_NNP BASIS_NNP FOR_NNP SULFANILAMIDE_NNP THERAPY_NNP IN_NNP BOVINE_NNP MASTITIS_NNP By_IN J._NNP C._NNP KAKAVAS_NNP ,_, PH.D._NNP ,_, Newark_NNP ,_, Delaware_NNP (_( With_IN two_CD charts_NNS )_) THE_VBP subject_NN of_IN sulfanilamide_NN therapy_NN in_IN bovine_NN mastitis_NN has_VBZ received_VBN considerable_JJ attention_NN in_IN recent_JJ years_NNS ._.
Although_IN the_DT early_JJ reports_NNS show_VBP contradic-_JJ tory_NN results_NNS ,_, more_JJR recent_JJ controlled_VBN studies_NNS have_VBP revealed_VBN that_IN sulfanilamide_RB administered_VBN orally_RB to_TO a_DT cow_NN is_VBZ of_IN little_JJ or_CC no_DT curative_JJ value_NN in_IN permanently_RB eradicating_VBG the_DT streptococci_NN from_IN the_DT udders_NNS of_IN cows_NNS suffering_VBG from_IN acute_NN or_CC chronic_JJ mastitis_NN ._.
A_DT new_JJ approach_NN to_TO the_DT problem_NN of_IN sulfanilamide_JJ therapy_NN in_IN bovine_NN mastitis_NN has_VBZ been_VBN made_VBN in_IN this_DT laboratory_NN ,_, and_CC the_DT results_NNS of_IN the_DT findings_NNS have_VBP been_VBN reported.1_VBP It_PRP was_VBD shown_VBN that_IN where_WRB sulfanilamide_NN is_VBZ introduced_VBN in_IN large_JJ amounts_NNS directly_RB into_IN the_DT udder_NN via_IN the_DT teat_NN duct_NN ,_, mastitis_NN streptococci_NN are_VBP destroyed_VBN in_IN most_JJS cases_NNS ._.
The_DT purpose_NN of_IN this_DT report_NN is_VBZ to_TO present_VB a_DT study_NN of_IN some_DT of_IN the_DT fundamental_JJ principles_NNS which_WDT govern_VBP the_DT activity_NN of_IN sulfanilamide_NN in_IN respect_NN to_TO the_DT infecting_VBG organism_NN ._.
Cultures_NNS and_CC mediums_VB The_DT strains_NNS of_IN Streptococcus_NNP agalactiae_VBP employed_VBN in_IN this_DT study_NN ,_, with_IN the_DT exception_NN of_IN three_CD cultures_NNS ,_, had_VBD been_VBN isolated_VBN in_IN this_DT laboratory_NN from_IN chronic_JJ cases_NNS of_IN mastitis_NN ._.
Cultures_NNS 090R_CD ,_, V-8_NNP and_CC K-151A_NNP were_VBD supplied_VBN by_IN the_DT Lederle_NNP Laboratories_NNPS and_CC represent_NN ,_, respectively_RB ,_, types_NNS I_PRP ,_, II_NNP ,_, and_CC III_NNP of_IN Lance-_NNP field_NN group_NN B_NNP ._.
The_DT identity_NN of_IN the_DT cultures_NNS as_IN Str-_NNP agalactiae_NN was_VBD established_VBN by_IN means_NNS of_IN physiologic_JJ tests_NNS and_CC serologic_JJ reactions_NNS ,_, using_VBG the_DT precipitin_NN method_NN of_IN Lancefield_NNP and_CC the_DT rapid_JJ agglutination_NN test_NN ._.
Some_DT of_IN the_DT cultures_NNS had_VBD been_VBN carried_VBN on_IN stock_NN culture_NN medium_NN for_IN some_DT time_NN previous_JJ to_TO this_DT study_NN ,_, while_IN others_NNS were_VBD of_IN recent_JJ isolation_NN ._.
The_DT test_NN organisms_NNS were_VBD transferred_VBN every_DT twenty-four_JJ hours_NNS for_IN two_CD to_TO three_CD days_NNS to_TO insure_VB rapid_JJ growth_NN ._.
Each_DT culture_NN was_VBD then_RB diluted_VBN in_IN sterile_JJ water_NN blanks_NNS sufficiently_RB so_IN that_IN 1_CD c.c_NN ._.
contained_VBN approximately_RB 500_CD to_TO 2,000_CD living_NN organisms_NNS ._.
As_IN will_MD be_VB shown_VBN later_RB in_IN this_DT paper_NN ,_, the_DT number_NN of_IN organisms_JJ present_NN in_IN the_DT inoculum_NN influences_VBZ the_DT degree_NN and_CC rapidity_NN of_IN their_PRP$ destruction_NN by_IN the_DT sulfanilamide_NN ._.
The_DT mediums_NNS employed_VBN in_IN these_DT studies_NNS were_VBD tryptose_JJ broth_NNS and_CC tryptose_JJ agar_NN ._.

ABSTRACTS_$ 297_CD (_( 3_CD )_) P-aminobenzoic_NNP acid_NN has_VBZ been_VBN found_VBN to_TO counteract_VB the_DT germicidal_NN properties_NNS of_IN sulfanilamide_NN on_IN the_DT Lancefield_NNP group_NN B_NNP streptococci_NN ._.
Under_IN the_DT conditions_NNS of_IN these_DT experiments_NNS ,_, it_PRP was_VBD found_VBN that_IN one_CD part_NN by_IN weight_NN of_IN p-aminobenzoic_JJ acid_NN nullified_VBD the_DT germicidal_JJ effect_NN of_IN 25_CD parts_NNS by_IN weight_NN of_IN sul-_JJ fanilamide_NN for_IN strain_JJ F-12a-4_NNP ._.
(_( 4_CD )_) It_PRP appears_VBZ from_IN the_DT results_NNS of_IN these_DT experi-_JJ ments_NNS that_IN the_DT therapeutic_JJ basis_NN of_IN sulfanilamide_NN for_IN Lancefield_NNP group_NN B_NNP mastitis_NN streptococci_NN is_VBZ based_VBN on_IN at_IN least_JJS three_CD factors_NNS :_: the_DT temperature_NN of_IN the_DT animal_NN at_IN the_DT time_NN of_IN treatment_NN ;_: the_DT concentration_NN of_IN the_DT drug_NN at_IN the_DT focus_NN of_IN infection_NN ;_: and_CC the_DT sulfanilamide-_JJ inhibiting_NN substances_NNS which_WDT may_MD be_VB present_JJ in_IN the_DT infected_JJ area_NN ._.

I._NNP LEITCH_NNP and_CC J._NNP S._NNP THOMSON_NNP (_( 1944_CD )_) ._.
Nutrition_NN Abstracts_NNS and_CC Reviews_NNP 14_CD (_( 2_CD )_) ,_, 197-223_JJ ALTHOUGH_NNP water_NN metabolism_NN is_VBZ an_DT important_JJ physiological_JJ factor_NN having_VBG considerable_JJ bearing_NN on_IN animal_JJ production_NN ,_, the_DT subject_NN has_VBZ not_RB received_VBN the_DT attention_NN it_PRP deserves_VBZ from_IN research_NN workers_NNS ._.
In_IN the_DT published_JJ literature_NN ,_, most_JJS of_IN the_DT reference_NN is_VBZ concerned_VBN with_IN cattle_NNS ,_, references_NNS being_VBG very_RB few_JJ on_IN other_JJ farm_NN stock_NN ._.
Since_IN the_DT dry_JJ matter_NN of_IN a_DT ration_NN is_VBZ generally_RB ad-_JJ justed_VBN to_TO the_DT metabolic_JJ needs_NNS of_IN the_DT consumer_NN ,_, the_DT existence_NN of_IN a_DT relationship_NN of_IN total_JJ water_NN intake_NN to_TO the_DT dry_JJ matter_NN of_IN feed_NN might_MD be_VB considered_VBN probable_JJ ._.
The_DT available_JJ data_NNS ,_, however_RB ,_, show_VBP the_DT lack_NN of_IN such_JJ straightforward_NN relationship_NN ._.
The_DT absence_NN naturally_RB suggests_VBZ several_JJ ascertainable_JJ causes_NNS which_WDT may_MD influence_VB water_NN intake_NN ._.
A_DT close_JJ examination_NN of_IN several_JJ methods_NNS of_IN disposal_NN of_IN ingested_JJ water_NN should_MD furnish_VB data_NNS on_IN which_WDT the_DT requirement_NN can_MD be_VB based_VBN ._.
The_DT disposal_NN of_IN water_NN from_IN the_DT body_NN takes_VBZ place_NN through_IN faeces_NNS and_CC urine_NN ._.
A_DT portion_NN is_VBZ vaporized_VBN to_TO dissipate_VB heat_NN increment_JJ incident_NN to_TO food_NN consumption_NN ._.
In_IN growing_VBG or_CC fatten-_JJ ing_NN animal_NN ,_, water_NN is_VBZ retained_VBN for_IN the_DT newly-built_JJ tissues_NNS ._.
In_IN milch_NN cows_NNS ,_, water_NN is_VBZ disposed_VBN of_IN in_IN the_DT milk_NN ._.
The_DT water_NN content_NN of_IN the_DT faeces_NNS is_VBZ independent_JJ of_IN the_DT protein_NN content_NN in_IN the_DT ration_NN and_CC of_IN plane_NN of_IN nutrition_NN ._.
When_WRB ,_, however_RB ,_, the_DT ration_NN includes_VBZ a_DT roughage_NN of_IN lower_JJR digestibility_NN ,_, the_DT faeces_NNS voided_VBD is_VBZ more_RBR moist_JJ Although_IN data_NNS are_VBP few_JJ to_TO study_VB the_DT possible_JJ correlation_NN between_IN the_DT moisture_NN and_CC other_JJ constituents_NNS of_IN faces_VBZ ,_, it_PRP is_VBZ noted_VBN that_IN moisture_NN content_NN increases_NNS with_IN increasing_VBG crude_NN fibre_NN and_CC nitrogen-_JJ free_JJ extract_NN ,_, but_CC by_IN no_DT semblance_NN of_IN mathematical_JJ proportion_NN ._.
The_DT fæcal_JJ moisture_NN in_IN cattle_NNS can_MD be_VB approximately_RB reckoned_VBN as_IN 80_CD per_IN cent_NN in_IN steers_NNS and_CC dry_JJ cows_NNS ,_, and_CC 85_CD per_IN cent_NN for_IN milch_NN animals_NNS ._.
In_IN percentage_NN the_DT water_NN content_NN in_IN the_DT faeces_NNS of_IN cows_NNS in_IN milk_NN seems_VBZ only_RB slightly_RB higher_JJR than_IN that_DT of_IN dry_JJ animals_NNS ,_, but_CC as_IN the_DT total_JJ weight_NN of_IN faeces_NNS voided_VBN by_IN the_DT former_JJ is_VBZ much_RB greater_JJR ,_, the_DT difference_NN becomes_VBZ highly_RB significant_JJ from_IN the_DT standpoint_NN of_IN water_NN requirement_NN ._.
The_DT quantity_NN of_IN urine_NN in_IN cattle_NNS is_VBZ determined_VBN primarily_RB by_IN the_DT amount_NN of_IN some_DT non-_JJ nitrogenous_JJ substance_NN or_CC substances_NNS derived_VBN from_IN roughages_NNS ._.
If_IN the_DT protein_NN ingestion_NN is_VBZ high_JJ ,_, the_DT urinary_JJ volume_NN goes_VBZ above_IN that_DT determined_VBN by_IN the_DT roughage_NN intake_NN ._.

at_IN 5°_CD C._NNP or_CC 6°C_CD ._.
and_CC increases_VBZ slowly_RB to_TO about_IN 2.5-4_JJ kg_NN ._.

at_IN 21°C_CD ._.

When_WRB water_NN lost_VBN by_IN vaporization_NN is_VBZ plotted_VBN against_IN total_JJ heat_NN emission_NN the_DT curve_NN obtained_VBN is_VBZ roughly_RB S-shaped_NNP ,_, which_WDT is_VBZ predictable_JJ also_RB on_IN theoretical_JJ grounds_NNS ._.
Pulse_NNP and_CC respiration_NN rates_NNS are_VBP intimately_RB connected_VBN with_IN the_DT burden_NN of_IN heat_NN disposal_NN by_IN radiation_NN and_CC evaporation_NN ._.
Records_NNS of_IN pulse_NN and_CC respiration_NN counts_NNS in_IN several_JJ breeds_NNS of_IN cows_NNS in_IN relation_NN to_TO milk_VB production_NN and_CC summer_NN and_CC winter_NN temperatures_NNS show_VBP that_IN both_DT rates_NNS are_VBP capable_JJ of_IN great_JJ change_NN ._.
The_DT data_NN when_WRB properly_RB interpreted_VBN indicate_NN that_IN both_DT pulse_JJ and_CC respiration_NN rates_NNS are_VBP higher_JJR in_IN breeds_NNS of_IN higher_JJR average_JJ milk_NN yields_NNS ;_: that_DT high_JJ respiration_NN rate_NN is_VBZ not_RB always_RB associated_VBN with_IN higher_JJR milk_NN yield_NN ,_, while_IN higher_JJR pulse_NN rate_NN always_RB is_VBZ ._.
Acceleration_NN of_IN pulse_JJ rate_NN allows_VBZ dissipation_NN of_IN heat_NN both_DT by_IN radiation_NN and_CC evaporation_NN whereas_NNS acceleration_NN of_IN respiration_NN helps_VBZ heat_VB emission_NN by_IN evaporation_NN only_RB ._.

I_PRP (_( Orig_NNP ._. )_)
148_CD ,_, 1-15_CD THE_NNP adsorbate_NN vaccines_NNS are_VBP characterized_VBN by_IN the_DT active_JJ principle_NN (_( toxin_NN ,_, anatoxin_NN ,_, virus_NN )_) being_VBG attached_VBN to_TO the_DT surface_NN of_IN a_DT finely_RB divided_VBN substance_NN ,_, thereby_RB suffering_VBG a_DT peculiar_JJ change_NN in_IN its_PRP$ antigenic_JJ action_NN ._.
The_DT authors_NNS review_VBP the_DT use_NN of_IN adsorption_NN in_IN enzymology_NN ,_, diphtheria_NN immunization_NN and_CC the_DT field_NN of_IN virus_NN diseases_NNS ._.
The_DT results_NNS so_RB far_RB obtained_VBN in_IN studying_VBG the_DT effect_NN of_IN adsorption_NN on_IN viruses_NNS ,_, with_IN particular_JJ reference_NN to_TO their_PRP$ antigenic_JJ properties_NNS ,_, are_VBP summarized_VBN as_IN follows_VBZ :_: 1_CD ._.
Adsorption_NNP has_VBZ no_DT effect_NN on_IN the_DT virus_NN ._.
Example_NN :_: Equine_NN encephalomyelitis_NN (_( must_MD be_VB accepted_VBN with_IN reserve_NN as_IN it_PRP is_VBZ based_VBN on_IN meagre_JJ work_NN )_) ._.
2_CD ._.
Non-infectious_JJ or_CC weakly_JJ infectious_JJ virus_NN sets_VBZ up_RP good_JJ immunity_NN as_IN adsorbate_NN ._.
Example_NNS :_: fowl-pest_JJS (_( Nieschulz_NNP strain_NN )_) ._.
3_CD ._.
Fully_RB virulent_JJ virus_NN loses_VBZ its_PRP$ infectivity_NN through_IN adsorption_NN without_IN losing_VBG its_PRP$ immunizing_VBG power_NN ._.
Examples_NNS :_: poliomyelitis_NN and_CC fowl_JJ leucosis_NN ._.
These_DT results_NNS are_VBP however_RB based_VBN on_IN laboratory_NN experiments_NNS and_CC have_VBP not_RB been_VBN tried_VBN out_RP extensively_RB in_IN practice_NN ._.
The_DT only_JJ adsorbate_NN vaccine_NN against_IN a_DT virus_NN disease_NN which_WDT has_VBZ been_VBN so_RB tried_JJ out_RP is_VBZ the_DT one_NN used_VBN in_IN the_DT control_NN of_IN foot-and-mouth_JJ disease_NN ._.
300_CD ABSTRACTS_NNP Earlier_NNP work_NN on_IN vaccination_NN against_IN foot-and-_JJ mouth_NN disease_NN ,_, though_IN extensive_JJ ,_, was_VBD quite_RB un-_JJ successful_JJ ._.
The_DT use_NN of_IN formolized_VBN virus_NN by_IN French_JJ workers_NNS ,_, however_RB ,_, showed_VBD that_IN the_DT prospect_NN was_VBD not_RB altogether_RB hopeless_NN ._.
This_DT vaccine_NN was_VBD intensively_RB studies_NNS by_IN workers_NNS in_IN various_JJ countries_NNS and_CC in_IN Germany_NNP it_PRP was_VBD found_VBN that_IN the_DT vaccine_NN could_MD protect_VB 100_CD per_IN cent_NN of_IN guinea-pigs_NNS and_CC 66_CD per_IN cent_NN of_IN cattle_NNS against_IN generalization_NN of_IN the_DT infection_NN ._.
This_DT method_NN was_VBD ,_, however_RB ,_, unsuitable_JJ for_IN field_NN application_NN as_IN a_DT considerable_JJ proportion_NN of_IN batches_NNS of_IN the_DT vaccine_NN were_VBD infective_JJ ._.
The_DT optimum_JJ concentration_NN of_IN formol_JJ lay_NN within_IN such_PDT a_DT narrow_JJ range_NN that_WDT on_IN one_CD side_NN the_DT vaccine_NN was_VBD often_RB infective_JJ and_CC on_IN the_DT other_JJ it_PRP failed_VBD to_TO protect_VB ;_: this_DT optimum_NN could_MD not_RB be_VB constantly_RB attained_VBN ._.
Recently_RB ,_, some_DT Danish_JJ workers_NNS studied_VBD the_DT adsorption_NN of_IN this_DT virus_NN on_IN aluminium_NN hydroxide_NN and_CC found_VBD that_IN ,_, under_IN certain_JJ conditions_NNS ,_, the_DT adsorp-_JJ tion_NN was_VBD so_RB strong_JJ that_IN the_DT virus_NN could_MD not_RB generally_RB be_VB eluted_VBN by_IN chemical_NN means_NNS ;_: and_CC ,_, by_IN subcutaneous_JJ inoculation_NN in_IN guinea-pigs_JJ no_DT disease_NN ,_, but_CC immunity_NN ,_, was_VBD set_VBN up_RP ,_, the_DT degree_NN of_IN which_WDT corresponded_VBD with_IN the_DT quantity_NN of_IN adsorbate_NN injected_VBN ._.
On_IN intracuta-_JJ neous_JJ inoculation_NN into_IN the_DT foot-pads_NNS ,_, however_RB ,_, the_DT adsorbate_NN was_VBD still_RB infective_JJ but_CC this_DT infectivity_NN could_MD be_VB removed_VBN by_IN heating_VBG at_IN 25°-37°C_JJ ._.
without_IN loss_NN of_IN immunizing_VBG property_NN ._.
When_WRB used_VBN in_IN cattle_NNS such_JJ a_DT vaccine_NN set_VBN up_RP the_DT disease_NN instead_RB of_IN immu-_JJ nizing_NN and_CC the_DT results_NNS could_MD have_VB no_DT practical_JJ appli-_JJ cation_NN ._.
Such_JJ was_VBD the_DT state_NN of_IN affairs_NNS when_WRB work_NN on_IN the_DT problem_NN was_VBD begun_VBN at_IN Riems_NNP (_( The_DT German_JJ Foot-and-_NNP mouth_NN Disease_NNP Research_NNP Station_NNP is_VBZ situated_VBN at_IN the_DT Baltic_NNP island_NN of_IN Riems_NNP ,_, off_IN the_DT coast_NN of_IN Greifswald_NNP )_) ._.
Earlier_RBR Work_NNP confirmed_VBD the_DT findings_NNS of_IN Danish_JJ workers_NNS and_CC a_DT constantly_RB safe_JJ and_CC useful_JJ vaccine_NN for_IN cattle_NNS could_MD not_RB be_VB made_VBN even_RB by_IN more_JJR prolonged_JJ incuba-_JJ tion_NN ._.
This_DT difficulty_NN was_VBD overcome_VBN by_IN the_DT addition_NN of_IN 0.05_CD per_IN cent_NN formalin_NN and_CC 48-hour_JJ incubation_NN at_IN 25°C_CD ._.
which_WDT sufficed_VBD to_TO make_VB a_DT constantly_RB safe_JJ and_CC efficient_JJ vaccine_NN ._.
This_DT work_NN showed_VBD that_IN a_DT solution_NN of_IN this_DT difficult_JJ problem_NN had_VBD been_VBN provided_VBN by_IN the_DT action_NN of_IN formalin_NN on_IN the_DT virus_NN stabilized_VBN by_IN adsorp-_JJ tion_NN ._.
The_DT vaccine_NN has_VBZ been_VBN used_VBN on_IN over_IN three_CD million_CD animals_NNS in_IN the_DT field_NN ;_: none_NN of_IN them_PRP developed_VBD the_DT disease_NN ._.
Some_DT of_IN the_DT inoculated_JJ animals_NNS when_WRB infected_VBN 10-14_JJ days_NNS afterwards_NNS proved_VBD immune_JJ to_TO massive_JJ infection_NN ._.
The_DT method_NN of_IN preparation_NN of_IN the_DT vaccine_NN is_VBZ des-_JJ cribed_NNS in_IN detail_NN under_IN the_DT following_JJ headings_NNS ._.
The_DT interested_JJ reader_NN should_MD refer_VB to_TO the_DT original_JJ :_: (_( 1_CD )_) Ob-_CD taining_VBG the_DT virus_NN including_VBG choice_NN of_IN production_NN strains_NNS and_CC method_NN of_IN infecting_VBG the_DT virus-producer_JJ animals_NNS ;_: (_( 2_CD )_) Preparation_NN of_IN the_DT virus_NN containing_VBG material_NN for_IN incorporation_NN in_IN the_DT vaccine_NN ;_: (_( 3_CD )_) Mixing_NN ,_, drawing_VBG off_RP and_CC incubation_NN of_IN the_DT vaccine_NN ;_: (_( 4_CD )_) Chemical_NNP test_NN of_IN the_DT various_JJ reagents_NNS required_VBN and_CC the_DT vaccine_NN itself_PRP ;_: and_CC (_( 5_CD )_) Biological_NNP test_NN of_IN the_DT vaccine_NN for_IN safety_NN ,_, bacterial_JJ contamination_NN and_CC immunizing_NN capacity_NN ._.

A_DT ._. ]_NN
Fertility_NN and_CC hatchability_NN when_WRB the_DT environ-_JJ mental_JJ temperature_NN of_IN chickens_NNS is_VBZ high_JJ ._.
BURT_NNP W._NNP HEYWANG_NNP (_( 1944_CD )_) ._.
Poultry_NNP Science_NNP 23_CD ,_, 334_CD THE_NNP influence_NN of_IN high_JJ environmental_JJ temperature_NN on_IN the_DT fertility_NN and_CC hatchability_NN of_IN eggs_NNS laid_VBN by_IN White_NNP Leghorn_NNP pullets_NNS has_VBZ been_VBN investigated_VBN ._.
The_DT birds_NNS were_VBD kept_VBN at_IN normal_JJ ,_, rather_RB than_IN at_IN artificially_RB controlled_VBN ,_, temperature_NN conditions_NNS ._.
They_PRP were_VBD trapnested_VBN and_CC the_DT eggs_NNS ,_, collected_VBN from_IN the_DT nests_NNS at_IN hourly_JJ intervals_NNS ,_, were_VBD kept_VBN in_IN a_DT refrigerator_NN at_IN 55°F_CD ._.
till_NN incubated_VBN ._.
They_PRP were_VBD saved_VBN for_IN incubation_NN on_IN the_DT six_CD week_NN days_NNS and_CC placed_VBN in_IN the_DT incubator_NN the_DT following_VBG Monday_NNP ,_, during_IN 12_CD periods_NNS between_IN March_NNP 29_CD and_CC August_NNP 21_CD ,_, 1943_CD ._.
During_IN this_DT entire_JJ period_NN the_DT same_JJ White_NNP Leghorn_NNP cockerels_NNS remained_VBD with_IN the_DT different_JJ groups_NNS of_IN pullets_NNS ._.
The_DT data_NN on_IN fertility_NN and_CC hatchability_NN were_VBD grouped_VBN into_IN six_CD lots_NNS depending_VBG upon_IN whether_IN the_DT eggs_NNS were_VBD saved_VBN during_IN a_DT period_NN when_WRB the_DT maximum_JJ tempera-_JJ ture_NN was_VBD between_IN 80°-84.9°_JJ ,_, 85°-89.9°_JJ ,_, 90°-94.9°_JJ 95°-99.9°_CD ,_, 100°-104.9°_CD or_CC 105°-109.9°F_CD ._.
The_DT average_NN for_IN each_DT of_IN the_DT ranges_NNS was_VBD determined_VBN from_IN the_DT individual_JJ figures_NNS of_IN the_DT period_NN ._.
The_DT figures_NNS for_IN eggs_NNS laid_VBN by_IN 108_CD pullets_NNS ,_, when_WRB examined_VBN ,_, showed_VBD that_IN when_WRB the_DT average_NN maximum_JJ environmental_JJ temperature_NN was_VBD 82.8°_CD ._.
86.2°_CD ,_, 93.0°_CD ,_, 97.5°_CD and_CC 101.8°F._CD ,_, the_DT fertility_NN of_IN their_PRP$ eggs_NNS was_VBD ,_, respectively_RB ,_, 91.9_CD ,_, 93.6_CD ,_, 91.8_CD ,_, 88.8_CD and_CC 82.9_CD per_IN cent_NN ,_, and_CC the_DT percentage_NN of_IN chicks_NNS hatched_VBN from_IN their_PRP$ fertile_NN eggs_NNS was_VBD ,_, respectively_RB ,_, 78.9_CD ,_, 77.7_CD ,_, 78.4_CD ,_, 71.8_CD and_CC 68.0_CD ._.
The_DT eggs_NNS laid_VBN by_IN 63_CD pullets_NNS of_IN the_DT above_JJ group_NN ,_, when_WRB the_DT average_JJ maximum_JJ air_NN temperature_NN was_VBD 106.8°F._CD ,_, were_VBD also_RB incubated_VBN ._.
The_DT average_JJ figures_NNS of_IN fertility_NN and_CC hatchability_NN for_IN this_DT set_NN of_IN birds_NNS ,_, when_WRB the_DT average_NN maximum_JJ environmental_JJ tempera-_JJ ture_NN was_VBD 82.8°_CD ,_, 86.2°_CD ,_, 93.0°_CD ,_, 97.5°_CD ,_, 101.8°_CD and_CC 106.8°F._CD ,_, were_VBD ,_, respectively_RB ,_, 92.5_CD ,_, 92.4_CD ,_, 91.6_CD ,_, 86.8_CD ,_, 80.4_CD and_CC 73.8_CD per_IN cent_NN for_IN fertility_NN ,_, and_CC 78.8_CD ,_, 79.3_CD ,_, 78.5_CD ,_, 72.2_CD ,_, 67.9_CD and_CC 55.1_CD per_IN cent_NN for_IN hatchability_NN from_IN fertile_JJ eggs_NNS ._.
The_DT experimental_JJ results_NNS were_VBD analysed_VBN statistically_RB and_CC p_NN was_VBD determined_VBN for_IN the_DT fertility_NN and_CC hatchabi-_JJ lity_NN of_IN the_DT eggs_NNS laid_VBN at_IN different_JJ environmental_JJ temperatures_NNS ._.
This_DT showed_VBD that_IN at_IN the_DT average_JJ maximum_JJ temperatures_NNS of_IN 101.8°_CD and_CC 106.8°F_CD ._.
fertility_NN and_CC hatchability_NN were_VBD significantly_RB lower_JJR than_IN those_DT of_IN the_DT eggs_NNS laid_VBN at_IN the_DT average_JJ maximum_JJ temperatures_NNS of_IN 82.8°_CD ,_, 86.2°_CD and_CC 93.0°F_CD ._.
It_PRP is_VBZ therefore_RB concluded_JJ that_IN fertility_NN and_CC hatch-_JJ ability_NN are_VBP lowered_VBN when_WRB chickens_NNS are_VBP kept_VBN under_IN high_JJ environmental_JJ temperatures_NNS ._.

Studies_NNS in_IN bovine_NN mastitisABSTRACTS_NN 301_CD the_DT Agricultural_NNP Research_NNP Council_NNP of_IN the_DT United_NNP Kingdom_NNP ._.

2_CD THIS_NNP report_NN deals_NNS with_IN the_DT researches_NNS that_WDT were_VBD carried_VBN out_IN in_IN 20_CD dairy_NN herds_NNS consisting_VBG of_IN various_JJ breeds_NNS of_IN cows_NNS ,_, in_IN five_CD different_JJ centres_NNS extending_VBG from_IN Ayrshire_NNP to_TO Kent_NNP over_IN a_DT period_NN of_IN 21_CD months_NNS ._.
The_DT important_JJ cause_NN of_IN bovine_NN mastitis_NN which_WDT reduces_VBZ the_DT milk_NN yield_NN of_IN dairy_NN herds_NNS is_VBZ Streptococcus_NNP agalactiae_RB though_IN other_JJ streptococci_NN ,_, staphylococci_NN and_CC diph-_JJ theroid_NN bacilli_NN cause_NN mastitis_NN in_IN cattle_NNS ._.
Mastitis_NN due_JJ to_TO staphylococci_VB is_VBZ more_RBR frequent_JJ and_CC important_JJ than_IN was_VBD once_RB supposed_VBN ._.
The_DT observations_NNS described_VBN in_IN this_DT report_NN indicate_VBP clearly_RB the_DT routes_NNS by_IN which_WDT infection_NN occurs_NNS and_CC the_DT cause_NN of_IN persistent_JJ herd_JJ infection_NN ._.
The_DT methods_NNS of_IN collection_NN ,_, sampling_VBG and_CC examina-_JJ tion_NN of_IN both_DT milk_NN and_CC teat_NN swabs_NNS that_WDT were_VBD adopted_VBN as_IN a_DT standard_NN throughout_IN the_DT investigation_NN have_VBP been_VBN described_VBN in_IN detail_NN ._.
These_DT examinations_NNS have_VBP shown_VBN that_IN Sir_NNP ._.
agalactiae_NN is_VBZ a_DT common_JJ inhabitant_NN of_IN the_DT bovine_NN udder_NN or_CC teat_NN canal_NN ,_, even_RB in_IN the_DT absence_NN of_IN clinical_JJ symptoms_NNS ._.
Various_JJ workers_NNS have_VBP recorded_VBN the_DT incidence_NN of_IN mastitis_NN due_JJ to_TO Str_NNP ._.
agalactiae_NN ._.
Minett_NNP reported_VBD its_PRP$ isolation_NN from_IN milk_NN of_IN 38.3_CD per_IN cent_NN of_IN cows_NNS the_DT infection_NN varying_VBG from_IN 10_CD per_IN cent_NN to_TO 71_CD per_IN cent_NN in_IN different_JJ herds_NNS ._.
But_CC there_EX is_VBZ no_DT recorded_JJ information_NN regarding_VBG the_DT occurrence_NN of_IN this_DT organism_NN on_IN the_DT exterior_NN of_IN the_DT teat_NN ._.
In_IN this_DT investigation_NN of_IN 16,482_CD samples_NNS of_IN milk_NN examined_VBN Str_NNP ._.
agalactiae_NN was_VBD isolated_VBN from_IN 38.8_CD per_IN cent_NN ._.
The_DT results_NNS of_IN examination_NN of_IN milk_NN and_CC teat_NN swabs_NNS of_IN different_JJ herds_NNS are_VBP given_VBN in_IN tabular_JJ form_NN ._.
It_PRP was_VBD noticed_VBN that_IN some_DT cows_NNS which_WDT gave_VBD consistently_RB positive_JJ milk_NN tests_NNS gave_VBD very_RB irregular_JJ results_NNS from_IN teat_JJ swabs_NNS ,_, while_IN in_IN others_NNS ,_, where_WRB milk_NN tests_NNS were_VBD negative_JJ ,_, positive_JJ teat-swab_JJ tests_NNS were_VBD obtained_VBN ._.
The_DT relation_NN between_IN positive_JJ milk_NN samples_NNS and_CC positive_JJ teat_NN swabs_NNS are_VBP given_VBN ._.
Of_IN the_DT 2177_CD positive_JJ milk_NN samples_NNS 816_CD or_CC 37.5_CD per_IN cent_NN were_VBD positive_JJ for_IN teat_NN swabs_NNS ._.
On_IN the_DT other_JJ hand_NN of_IN the_DT 3599_CD negative_JJ milk_NN samples_NNS only_RB 526_CD or_CC 14.6_CD per_IN cent_NN were_VBD positive_JJ for_IN teat_NN swabs_NNS ._.
But_CC of_IN the_DT total_JJ positive_JJ teat_NN swabs_NNS ,_, 61.5_CD per_IN cent_NN were_VBD associated_VBN with_IN positive_JJ milk_NN samples_NNS ._.
It_PRP was_VBD proved_VBN that_IN the_DT successive_JJ positive_JJ teat_NN swabs_NNS may_MD not_RB be_VB due_JJ to_TO true_JJ skin_JJ infection_NN but_CC to_TO repeated_VBN contamination_NN by_IN milkers_NNS '_POS hands_NNS ._.
Sores_NNS ,_, cracks_NNS and_CC other_JJ blemishes_NNS on_IN the_DT teats_NNS become_VBP infected_JJ very_RB frequently_RB with_IN Str_NNP ._.
agalactiae_NN ._.
It_PRP was_VBD also_RB noted_VBN that_IN heavy_JJ skin_JJ infection_NN may_MD also_RB occur_VB in_IN the_DT absence_NN of_IN any_DT lesions_NNS on_IN the_DT teats_NNS ._.
It_PRP was_VBD also_RB proved_VBN that_IN Str_NNP ._.
agalactiae_JJ infection_NN often_RB persists_VBZ in_IN the_DT dry_JJ udder_NN and_CC also_RB on_IN the_DT teats_NNS during_IN the_DT dry_JJ period_NN ._.
The_DT persistent_JJ infection_NN in_IN dry_JJ cow_NN is_VBZ a_DT factor_NN in_IN the_DT maintenance_NN of_IN infection_NN in_IN the_DT herd_NN ._.
A_DT search_NN for_IN Str_NNP ._.

agalactiae_RB frequently_RB appears_VBZ in_IN the_DT milk_NN of_IN first-calf_JJ heifers_NNS during_IN their_PRP$ initial_JJ lactation_NN ._.
2_CD ._.
Str_NNP ._.
agalactiae_NN could_MD not_RB be_VB isolated_VBN from_IN the_DT throat_NN and_CC nostrils_NNS of_IN calves_NNS or_CC from_IN the_DT vagina_NN of_IN cows_NNS ._.
Some_DT workers_NNS ,_, have_VBP claimed_VBN isolation_NN of_IN this_DT organism_NN from_IN the_DT mouths_NNS of_IN calves_NNS suckling_VBG infected_JJ cows_NNS about_IN eight_CD hours_NNS after_IN suckling_VBG ._.

Sir_NNP ._.

P._NNP G._NNP MILLER_NNP and_CC G._NNP H._NNP WISE_NNP (_( 1944_CD )_) ._.

27_CD ,_, 275-279_CD THE_NNP object_NN of_IN the_DT experiment_NN was_VBD to_TO determine_VB the_DT effect_NN of_IN feeding_VBG cottonseed_JJ meal_NN as_IN the_DT only_JJ con-_JJ centrate_NN on_IN several_JJ properties_NNS of_IN milk_NN to_TO a_DT group_NN of_IN Holstein_NNP herd_NN ._.
This_DT was_VBD compared_VBN with_IN a_DT control_NN group_NN of_IN an_DT equal_JJ number_NN of_IN similar_JJ animals_NNS which_WDT was_VBD fed_VBN on_IN a_DT concentrate_JJ mixture_NN consisting_VBG of_IN four_CD parts_NNS of_IN corn_NN gluten_NNS meal_VBP ,_, two_CD of_IN wheat_NN bran_NN ,_, two_CD of_IN ground_NN corn_NN and_CC two_CD of_IN ground_NN oats_NNS ._.
The_DT roughage_NN allowed_VBN to_TO both_DT the_DT groups_NNS was_VBD the_DT same_JJ and_CC com-_NN prised_VBD either_CC corn_NN or_CC soybean_NN silage_NN or_CC pasture_NN ._.
In_IN addition_NN ,_, both_CC the_DT groups_NNS were_VBD given_VBN an_DT allowance_NN of_IN 2_CD per_IN cent_NN bone_NN meal_NN and_CC 1_CD per_IN cent_NN salt_NN ._.
The_DT experimental_JJ observation_NN extended_VBD to_TO a_DT period_NN of_IN 16_CD consecutive_JJ months_NNS ._.
The_DT data_NN presented_VBD showed_VBD that_IN four_CD months_NNS after_IN the_DT animals_NNS were_VBD placed_VBN on_IN their_PRP$ respective_JJ feed_NN ,_, the_DT milk_NN yielded_VBN by_IN the_DT experimental_JJ group_NN had_VBD com-_NN paratively_RB a_DT lower_JJR percentage_NN of_IN total_JJ solids_NNS ,_, fat_NN and_CC 302_CD ABSTRACTS_NNP solids-not-fat_JJ than_IN that_DT of_IN the_DT control_NN group_NN ._.
There_EX was_VBD a_DT decrease_NN in_IN the_DT ash_NN content_NN also_RB which_WDT ,_, however_RB ,_, followed_VBD later_RB ._.
[_JJ T.A_NNP ._. ]_NN
Toxaemie_NNP jaundice_NN in_IN sheep_NN ._.
Australian_JJ Agricul-_NNP tural_JJ Newsletter_NNP ,_, Release_NNP No_NNP ._.
AGN/104_NNP ,_, October_NNP ,_, 1945_CD ,_, Canberra_NNP IT_NNP is_VBZ expected_VBN that_IN results_NNS of_IN observations_NNS and_CC experiments_NNS begun_VBN during_IN the_DT past_JJ 12_CD months_NNS will_MD point_VB the_DT way_NN to_TO satisfactory_JJ methods_NNS of_IN control_NN of_IN toxaemic_JJ jaundice_NN in_IN sheep_NN ._.
The_DT investigation_NN is_VBZ being_VBG conducted_VBN by_IN the_DT Toxaemic_NNP Jaundice_NNP Committee_NNP ,_, representing_VBG the_DT Council_NNP for_IN Scientific_NNP and_CC Industrial_NNP Research_NNP ,_, the_DT Departments_NNS of_IN Agriculture_NNP of_IN Victoria_NNP and_CC New_NNP South_NNP Wales_NNP ,_, and_CC the_DT Melbourne_NNP University_NNP Veteri-_NNP nary_JJ Research_NNP Institute_NNP ._.
It_PRP is_VBZ financed_VBN jointly_RB by_IN the_DT Australia_NNP Wool_NNP Board_NNP and_CC the_DT Australian_JJ Meat_NNP Board_NNP ._.
Results_NNS at_IN the_DT experimental_JJ farm_NN suggest_NN that_IN proteins_VBZ of_IN high_JJ biological_JJ value_NN ,_, such_JJ as_IN casein_NN ,_, have_VBP a_DT protective_JJ action_NN against_IN the_DT damage_NN to_TO the_DT liver_NN associated_VBN with_IN toxaemic_JJ jaundice_NN ._.
It_PRP is_VBZ also_RB suggested_VBN that_IN the_DT low_JJ intake_NN of_IN protein_NN during_IN late_JJ summer_NN and_CC autum_NN contributes_NNS to_TO the_DT liver_NN damage_NN ,_, associated_VBN with_IN storage_NN of_IN high_JJ amounts_NNS of_IN copper_NN to_TO be_VB found_VBN in_IN the_DT area_NN in_IN which_WDT the_DT disease_NN occurs_VBZ ._.
Grazing_VBG on_IN heliotrope_NN (_( Heliotropium_NNP europaeum_NN )_) increased_VBD the_DT death_NN rate_NN in_IN the_DT flock_NN by_IN almost_RB 300_CD per_IN cent_NN ,_, and_CC deaths_NNS with_IN signs_NNS of_IN jaundice_NN 21_CD fold_NN ._.
Strain_NN due_JJ to_TO shortage_VB of_IN food_NN contri-_NN buted_VBD to_TO the_DT deaths_NNS in_IN the_DT flock_NN from_IN all_DT causes_NNS ._.
It_PRP would_MD appear_VB that_IN heliotrope_NN causes_NNS such_JJ adverse_JJ effects_NNS because_IN it_PRP favours_VBZ a_DT higher_JJR intake_NN of_IN copper_NN by_IN the_DT sheep_NN than_IN a_DT grass_NN pasture_NN ._.
Surveys_NNS of_IN soil_NN and_CC pasture_NN are_VBP being_VBG determined_VBN ._.
Results_NNS ,_, it_PRP is_VBZ expected_VBN ,_, will_MD suggest_VB possible_JJ means_NNS of_IN preventing_VBG intake_NN of_IN copper_NN by_IN the_DT sheep_NN ,_, or_CC of_IN preventing_VBG excess_JJ storage_NN of_IN copper_NN in_IN the_DT liver_NN ._.
There_EX is_VBZ evidence_NN to_TO suggest_VB that_IN the_DT assimilation_NN and_CC storage_NN of_IN copper_NN by_IN sheep_NN is_VBZ regulated_VBN by_IN the_DT mineral_NN in_IN the_DT soil_NN and_CC in_IN the_DT plant_NN ._.
Molybdenum_NNP is_VBZ one_CD mineral_NN element_NN which_WDT can_MD reduce_VB copper_NN storage_NN in_IN the_DT grazing_NN animal_NN ._.
It_PRP occurs_VBZ in_IN widely_RB varying_VBG concentrations_NNS in_IN plants_NNS ._.
When_WRB present_NN in_IN high_JJ concentration_NN in_IN the_DT plant_NN it_PRP may_MD cause_VB copper_NN deficiency_NN in_IN the_DT sheep_NN although_IN the_DT copper_NN con-_JJ centration_NN in_IN the_DT plant_NN remains_VBZ normal_JJ ._.
It_PRP seems_VBZ possible_JJ that_IN ,_, if_IN molybdenum_NN is_VBZ in_IN very_RB low_JJ concen-_JJ tration_NN in_IN the_DT plant_NN ,_, a_DT very_RB high_JJ storage_NN of_IN copper_NN may_MD be_VB built_VBN up_RP by_IN the_DT grazing_NN sheep_NN ._.
THE_DT MAYNARD_NNP GANGA_NNP RAM_NNP PRIZE_NNP ._.
APPLICATIONS_NNS are_VBP invited_VBN for_IN the_DT award_NN of_IN the_DT Maynard_NNP Ganga_NNP Ram_NNP Prize_NNP of_IN Rs_NNP ._.
3,000_CD for_IN a_DT discovery_NN or_CC an_DT invention_NN or_CC a_DT new_JJ practical_JJ method_NN which_WDT will_MD tend_VB to_TO increase_VB argicultural_JJ production_NN in_IN the_DT Punjab_NNP on_IN a_DT paying_VBG basis_NN ._.
The_DT prize_NN is_VBZ open_JJ to_TO all_DT ,_, irrespective_NN of_IN caste_NN ,_, creed_NN or_CC nationality_NN and_CC Government_NNP servants_NNS are_VBP also_RB eligible_JJ for_IN it_PRP ._.
Essays_NNS and_CC theses_NNS are_VBP not_RB accepted_VBN ._.
The_DT prize_NN will_MD be_VB awarded_VBN for_IN something_NN practi-_JJ cally_RB achieved_VBN as_IN a_DT result_NN of_IN work_NN done_VBN after_IN the_DT prize_NN was_VBD founded_VBN in_IN 1925_CD ._.
Competitors_NNS in_IN their_PRP$ applications_NNS must_MD give_VB a_DT clear_JJ account_NN of_IN the_DT his-_JJ tory_NN of_IN their_PRP$ invention_NN or_CC discovery_NN and_CC must_MD produce_VB clear_JJ evidence_NN that_IN it_PRP is_VBZ the_DT result_NN of_IN their_PRP$ own_JJ work_NN ._.

209_CD ORIGINAL_NNP ARTICLES_NNP CONTAGIOUS_NNP PLEUROPNEUMONIA_NNP OF_NNP GOATS_NNP WITH_NNP SPECIAL_NNP REFERENCE_NNP TO_NNP IMMUNIZATION_NNP By_IN H._NNP S._NNP BAWA_NNP ,_, M._NNP R._NNP C._NNP V._NNP S._NNP ,_, Director_NNP of_IN Veterinary_NNP Services_NNPS ,_, Sind_NNP ,_, Karachi_NNP (_( Received_VBN for_IN publication_NN on_IN 16_CD July_NNP 1945_CD )_) (_( With_IN Plates_NNP I_PRP and_CC II_NNP )_) ACCORDING_NN to_TO Hutyra_NNP and_CC Marek_NNP [_NNP 1938_CD ]_VBD the_DT earliest_JJS record_NN of_IN the_DT disease_NN is_VBZ by_IN Thomas_NNP in_IN 1873_CD ,_, from_IN Algeria_NNP and_CC afterwards_VBZ the_DT disease_NN was_VBD recorded_VBN in_IN various_JJ localities_NNS of_IN Germany_NNP during_IN the_DT years_NNS 1894_CD and_CC 1895_CD ._.
Two_CD years_NNS later_RB the_DT disease_NN was_VBD recorded_VBN by_IN Mazzmi_NNP in_IN Italy_NNP ._.
The_DT prevalence_NN of_IN the_DT disease_NN in_IN India_NNP has_VBZ been_VBN reported_VBN from_IN different_JJ provinces_NNS ,_, viz_NN ._.
Sind_NNP ,_, Bombay_NNP ,_, Punjab_NNP ,_, the_DT United_NNP Provinces_NNPS and_CC the_DT North-West_NNP Frontier_NNP Province_NNP ,_, some_DT 25_CD years_NNS ago_RB ._.
Shirlaw_NNP [_NN 1939_CD ]_NN reports_NNS that_IN the_DT research_NN on_IN this_DT condition_NN was_VBD started_VBN as_RB early_RB as_IN 19.9_CD ._.
Mettam_NNP [_NN 1929_CD ]_NN and_CC Gilbert_NNP [_NNP 1937_CD ]_NNP report_VBP the_DT occurrence_NN of_IN contagious_JJ pleuro-pneumonia_NN of_IN goats_NNS in_IN East_NNP Africa_NNP and_CC Palestine_NNP ._.
Sporadic_JJ research_NN at_IN Imperial_NNP Vetetinary_NNP Research_NNP Institute_NNP ,_, Mukteswar_NNP ,_, has_VBZ been_VBN going_VBG on_IN for_IN many_JJ years_NNS ,_, with_IN a_DT view_NN to_TO transmitting_VBG the_DT disease_NN ,_, using_VBG the_DT material_NN preserved_VBN in_IN glycerine_NN received_VBN from_IN the_DT Veterinary_NNP Investigation_NNP Officers_NNP from_IN field_NN outbreaks_NNS ;_: but_CC no_DT transmission_NN experiments_NNS were_VBD successful_JJ ,_, as_IN the_DT material_NN used_VBN to_TO lose_VB its_PRP$ potency_NN during_IN transit_NN ._.
Viswanathan_NNP [_VBZ 1935-36_JJ ]_NN and_CC Bawa_NNP [_NNP 1937-38_JJ ]_NN under_IN the_DT research_NN scheme_NN financed_VBN by_IN the_DT Imperial_NNP Council_NNP of_IN Agricultural_NNP Research_NNP took_VBD up_RP investigation_NN into_IN the_DT incidence_NN of_IN this_DT condition_NN in_IN Madras_NNP and_CC Sind_NNP res-_JJ pectively_RB ._.
SYMPTOMS_NNP Affected_NNP goats_NNS separate_VBP from_IN the_DT flock_NN ,_, lie_VB about_IN and_CC are_VBP not_RB keen_JJ to_TO grazed_VB Dullness_NNP ,_, partial_JJ inappetence_NN ,_, discharge_NN from_IN the_DT nostrils_NNS which_WDT varies_NNS in_IN amount_NN an-_JJ viscidity_NN ,_, watery_NN at_IN first_JJ becoming_VBG mucous_JJ later_RB on_IN and_CC finally_RB mucopurulent_JJ accoms_NNS panied_VBN by_IN cough_NN especially_RB on_IN exertion_NN ,_, and_CC occasional_JJ sneezing_NN are_VBP the_DT chief_NN symptoms_NNS noticed_VBN in_IN natural_JJ outbreaks_NNS ._.
The_DT appetite_NN is_VBZ lost_VBN and_CC rumination_NN ceases_NNS ._.
Rise_NN of_IN tempera-_JJ ture_NN to_TO 106º_CD to_TO 107º_CD is_VBZ invariably_RB seen_VBN in_IN naturally_RB and_CC experimentally_RB affected_JJ cases_NNS ._.
The_DT respiration_NN is_VBZ difficult_JJ and_CC accelerated_VBN ._.
Later_RB on_IN abdominal_JJ breathing_NN is_VBZ noticed_VBN ._.
The_DT animal_JJ stands_NNS with_IN its_PRP$ front_NN legs_NNS close_RB together_RB ,_, its_PRP$ head_NN and_CC neck_NN stretched_VBD forward_RB ,_, mouth_PRP half_PDT open_JJ showing_VBG indications_NNS of_IN dyspnoea_NN (_( Plate_NNP I_PRP ,_, fig_NN ._.
1_CD )_) ._.
The_DT bleat_NN assumes_VBZ peculiar_JJ timbre_NN on_IN which_WDT mzidars_NNS greatly_RB rely_VBP for_IN diagnosis_NN ._.
Auscultation_NN and_CC percussion_NN reveal_NN consolidation_NN of_IN the_DT lungs_NNS ._.
The_DT animal_NN drops_VBZ down_RB and_CC dies_NNS ._.
The_DT loss_NN of_IN condition_NN ,_, weakness_NN and_CC staring_NN coat_NN are_VBP constant_JJ symptoms_NNS ._.
Generally_RB the_DT course_NN of_IN the_DT disease_NN is_VBZ acute_JJ and_CC the_DT duration_NN is_VBZ from_IN three_CD to_TO eight_CD days_NNS ._.
There_EX are_VBP a_DT few_JJ instances_NNS in_IN which_WDT animals_NNS have_VBP remained_VBN alive_JJ for_IN two_CD weeks_NNS and_CC then_RB died_VBD ._.
Very_RB rarely_RB affected_JJ animals_NNS recover_NN ._.
The_DT outbreak_NN continues_VBZ for_IN a_DT month_NN or_CC two_CD till_IN the_DT majority_NN of_IN the_DT animals_NNS in_IN the_DT flock_NN die_NN ._.
Abortion_NN up_RB to_TO 20_CD and_CC 40_CD per_IN cent_NN is_VBZ seen_VBN among_IN the_DT naturally_RB and_CC experimentally_RB affected_VBD pregnant_JJ goats_NNS respectively_RB in_IN Sind_NNP ._.
Gilbert_NNP [_NNP 1937_CD ]_NNP reports_NNS that_IN in_IN acute_JJ outbreaks_NNS in_IN Palestine_NNP ,_, abortion_NN is_VBZ stated_VBN to_TO have_VB occurred_VBN in_IN practically_RB all_DT pregnant_JJ infected_VBN animals_NNS ._.
On_IN the_DT basis_NN of_IN experimental_JJ transmission_NN ,_, the_DT incubation_NN period_NN is_VBZ 11_CD to_TO 14_CD days_NNS as_IN against_IN 8_CD to_TO 28_CD days_NNS reported_VBN by_IN Longley_NNP [_NN 1940_CD ]_NN and_CC less_JJR than_IN 48_CD hours_NNS by_IN Gilbert_NNP [_NNP 1937_CD ]_NNP and_CC 4_CD to_TO 16_CD days_NNS by_IN Mettam_NNP [_NNP 1929_CD ]_NNP ._.
EPIZOOTIOLOGY_NNP As_IN regards_NNS the_DT epizootiology_NN of_IN the_DT disease_NN ,_, it_PRP has_VBZ been_VBN observed_VBN in_IN Sind_NNP that_IN the_DT disease_NN occurs_VBZ all_PDT the_DT year_NN round_NN ,_, but_CC its_PRP$ incidence_NN is_VBZ more_RBR common_JJ during_IN the_DT months_NNS 2_CD Contagious_NNP Pleuropneumonia_NNP of_IN Goats_NNP of_IN July_NNP ,_, August_NNP ,_, October_NNP ,_, January_NNP and_CC February_NNP ._.
Rains_NNP generally_RB start_VBP in_IN Sind_NNP during_IN the_DT middle_NN of_IN June_NNP ;_: parhaps_NNS ,_, therefore_RB ,_, the_DT incidence_NN reaches_VBZ its_PRP$ peak_NN during_IN July_NNP and_CC August_NNP due_JJ to_TO inclement_VB weather_NN ._.
Viswanathan_NNP [_VBZ 1937-38_JJ ]_NN records_NNS that_IN the_DT greater_JJR number_NN of_IN deaths_NNS occurred_VBN in_IN Madras_NNP during_IN the_DT period_NN from_IN July_NNP to_TO September_NNP ._.
Districts_NNS of_IN Karachi_NNP ,_, Sukkur_NNP and_CC Larkana_NNP are_VBP particularly_RB free_JJ from_IN the_DT disease_NN ;_: no_DT explanation_NN can_MD be_VB offered_VBN to_TO clear_VB this_DT point_NN as_IN meteorologically_RB and_CC climatically_RB these_DT districts_NNS do_VBP not_RB differ_VB much_RB from_IN the_DT adjoining_VBG districts_NNS Highest_NNP incidence_NN has_VBZ been_VBN recorded_VBN in_IN Thatparkar_NNP district_NN and_CC next_JJ comes_VBZ Nawabshah_NNP ._.
Mortality_NN may_MD be_VB as_RB high_JJ as_IN 60_CD to_TO 100_CD per_IN cent_NN ._.
Recovery_NN confers_NNS immunity_NN and_CC relapses_NNS are_VBP never_RB reported_VBN ._.
SUSCEPTIBILITY_NNP The_DT disease_NN is_VBZ quite_RB specific_JJ for_IN goats_NNS ._.
In_IN natural_JJ outbreaks_NNS it_PRP has_VBZ been_VBN seen_VBN that_IN sheep_JJ and_CC cattle_JJ though_IN grazing_VBG together_RB with_IN affected_JJ goats_NNS do_VBP not_RB contract_NN the_DT disease_NN ._.
Every_DT attempt_NN to_TO transmit_VB the_DT disease_NN to_TO cattle_VB ,_, sheep_NN and_CC the_DT usual_JJ laboratory_NN animals_NNS has_VBZ always_RB failed_VBN ._.
Longley_NNP [_NN 1940_CD ]_NN has_VBZ been_VBN able_JJ to_TO produce_VB fatal_JJ local_JJ reaction_NN in_IN five_CD out_IN of_IN six_CD ewes_NNS inoculated_VBD intramuscularly_RB with_IN affected_JJ muscle_NN effusion_NN ,_, but_CC he_PRP was_VBD unable_JJ to_TO convey_VB the_DT disease_NN by_IN intranasal_JJ insufflation_NN of_IN pneumonic_JJ lung_NN emulsion_NN ._.
Gilbert_NNP [_NNP 1937_CD ]_NNP reports_NNS that_IN the_DT disease_NN is_VBZ caused_VBN by_IN a_DT filterable_JJ virus_NN and_CC is_VBZ communicable_JJ to_TO sheep_VB experimentally_RB as_RB well_RB as_IN in_IN natur_JJ al_NN outbreaks_NNS and_CC that_DT sheep_NN are_VBP less_RBR susceptible_JJ than_IN goats_NNS ._.
Mettam_NNP [_NN 1929_CD ]_NN reports_NNS specificity_NN of_IN the_DT virus_NN only_RB for_IN goats_NNS ._.
The_DT virus_NN found_VBD in_IN Palestine_NNP must_MD be_VB different_JJ to_TO that_DT found_VBN in_IN East_NNP Africa_NNP and_CC India_NNP ,_, as_IN the_DT former_JJ is_VBZ communicable_JJ to_TO sheep_VB and_CC is_VBZ not_RB specific_JJ only_RB for_IN goats_NNS as_IN in_IN the_DT case_NN of_IN the_DT latter_NN ,_, PATHOLOGICAL_NNP ANATOMY_NNP Autopsy_NNP on_IN 49_CD affected_JJ goats_NNS in_IN actual_JJ outbreaks_NNS and_CC on_IN four_CD experimental_JJ goats_NNS was_VBD conducted_VBN and_CC no_DT difference_NN in_IN the_DT lesions_NNS of_IN natural_JJ and_CC experimental_JJ cases_NNS was_VBD found_VBN ._.
The_DT post-mortem_NN appearances_NNS are_VBP very_RB characteristic_JJ and_CC are_VBP readily_RB recogniz-_JJ able_JJ when_WRB a_DT few_JJ cases_NNS have_VBP been_VBN seen_VBN ._.
The_DT presence_NN of_IN pleurisy_NN and_CC pneumonia_NN has_VBZ been_VBN a_DT constant_JJ feature_NN of_IN this_DT disease_NN ._.
The_DT visceral_JJ pleura_NN over_IN a_DT pneumonic_JJ lesion_NN is_VBZ constantly_RB involved_VBN ._.
In_IN early_JJ and_CC rare_JJ cases_NNS a_DT small_JJ focus_NN of_IN dry_JJ pleurisy_NN is_VBZ seen_VBN but_CC generally_RB there_EX is_VBZ pleural_JJ exudate_NN ,_, which_WDT may_MD measure_VB as_RB much_RB as_IN 300_CD c.c_NN ._.
It_PRP is_VBZ clear_JJ ,_, citron_RB yellow_JJ in_IN colour_NN ,_, odourless_NN and_CC free_JJ from_IN blood_NN and_CC pus_NN ._.
The_DT exudate_JJ readily_NN coagulates_NNS within_IN five_CD minutes_NNS of_IN opening_VBG the_DT thorax_NN Pneumonia_NNP may_MD be_VB bilateral_JJ or_CC unilateral_JJ ._.
Incidence_NN of_IN bilateral_JJ involvement_NN is_VBZ 76_CD per_IN cent_NN and_CC unilateral_JJ 25_CD per_IN cent_NN ._.
Lobar_NNP distribution_NN shows_VBZ that_IN diaphragmatic_JJ lobe_NN is_VBZ most_RBS frequently_RB affected_VBN (_( 87.0_CD per_IN cent_NN )_) cardiac_NN lobe_NN is_VBZ affected_VBN to_TO the_DT extent_NN of_IN 75_CD per_IN cent_NN and_CC a_DT pical_JJ lobe_NN 62.5_CD per_IN cent_NN ._.
Entire_NNP lungs_NNS involvement_NN comes_VBZ to_TO 28_CD per_IN cent_NN ._.
In_IN all_PDT the_DT cases_NNS ,_, consolidation_NN of_IN the_DT lungs_NNS is_VBZ observed_VBN The_DT hepatization_NN is_VBZ either_RB red_JJ or_CC grey_NN in_IN colour_NN and_CC it_PRP may_MD be_VB partial_JJ or_CC complete_JJ ,_, involving_VBG one_CD or_CC all_PDT the_DT lobes_NNS ._.
Two_CD kinds_NNS of_IN lesions_NNS are_VBP noticed_VBN ,_, the_DT focal_JJ (_( Plate_NNP I_PRP ,_, fig_RB 2_CD )_) and_CC the_DT diffuse_NN ._.
(_( Plate_NNP II_NNP ,_, fig_RB 3_CD )_) ._.
The_DT diffuse_NN lesion_NN is_VBZ more_RBR common_JJ and_CC is_VBZ highly_RB characteristic_JJ ;_: almost_RB invariably_RB involves_VBZ the_DT apical_JJ or_CC cardiac_JJ lobes_NNS in_IN part_NN or_CC entirely_RB ._.
The_DT lung_NN is_VBZ hard_JJ and_CC on_IN incision_NN exudes_NNS clear_JJ ,_, citron_RB yellow_JJ coloured_VBD fluid_NN ._.
In_IN the_DT majority_NN of_IN cases_NNS the_DT diaphragmatic_JJ lobe_NN has_VBZ been_VBN found_VBN to_TO be_VB generally_RB affected_VBN and_CC it_PRP may_MD be_VB taken_VBN that_DT infection_NN invariably_RB starts_VBZ from_IN that_DT lobe_NN ._.
In_IN advanced_JJ cases_NNS the_DT lobes_NN of_IN the_DT lung_NN are_VBP found_VBN adherent_JJ to_TO costal_JJ pleura_NN ,_, diaphragm_NN and_CC heart_NN ._.
In_IN old_JJ and_CC extensive_JJ cases_NNS ,_, portions_NNS of_IN the_DT affected_JJ lungs_NNS become_VBP friable_JJ ,_, dry_JJ and_CC necrotic_JJ ._.
In_IN one_CD experimental_JJ goat_NN the_DT lesions_NNS were_VBD found_VBN to_TO be_VB undergoing_JJ fibrosis_NN and_CC encapsulation_NN ._.
The_DT mediastinal_JJ lymphatic_JJ glands_NNS are_VBP usually_RB enlarged_VBN and_CC on_IN sectioning_VBG somewhat_RB swollen_JJ and_CC moist_NN ;_: no_DT enlargement_NN of_IN spleen_NN and_CC liver_NN has_VBZ been_VBN noticed_VBN ;_: pericarditis_NN has_VBZ been_VBN seen_VBN in_IN very_RB few_JJ cases_NNS ._.

4_CD ._.
Experimental_JJ goat_NN No_NNP ._.
14_CD showing_VBG severe_JJ local_JJ reaction_NN after_IN intramuscular_JJ injection_NN of_IN virulent_JJ inocula_NN into_IN shoulder_NN and_CC thigh_JJ H._NNP S._NNP BAWA_NNP 3_CD internal_JJ parasites_NNS have_VBP ever_RB been_VBN found_VBN in_IN the_DT lungs_NNS of_IN the_DT cases_NNS examined_VBD at_IN autopsy_NN ._.
No_DT pathogenic_JJ organisms_NNS have_VBP ever_RB been_VBN isolated_VBN or_CC found_VBN on_IN smear_JJ examination_NN from_IN these_DT cases_NNS ._.
ETIOLOGY_IN The_DT disease_NN is_VBZ due_JJ to_TO an_DT ultra-microscopic_JJ and_CC filterable_JJ virus_NN which_WDT is_VBZ present_JJ in_IN the_DT pneumonic_JJ areas_NNS of_IN the_DT affected_JJ lungs_NNS and_CC in_IN the_DT pleural_JJ exudate_NN Every_NNP attempt_NN to_TO cultivate_VB the_DT etiological_JJ agent_NN by_IN previous_JJ works_NNS has_VBZ always_RB failed_VBN ._.
Only_RB recently_RB Longley_NNP [_NN 1940_CD ]_NN was_VBD able_JJ to_TO isolate_VB the_DT causative_JJ agent_NN and_CC described_VBD it_PRP as_IN a_DT highly_RB pleumorphic_JJ organism_NN ,_, which_WDT in_IN fresh_JJ material_NN examined_VBN by_IN dark_JJ illumination_NN bears_NNS close_RB resemblance_NN to_TO the_DT organism_NN of_IN contagious_JJ bovine_NN pleuro-pneumonia_NN ,_, viz_NN ._.
Asterococcus_NNP mycoides_NNS and_CC gave_VBD the_DT name_NN Borrelomyces_NNP peripneumoniae_NN capri_NN ._.
NATURAL_NNP INFECTION_NNP It_PRP is_VBZ not_RB exactly_RB known_VBN how_WRB the_DT disease_NN is_VBZ spread_VBN under_IN natural_JJ conditions_NNS ;_: mostly_RB the_DT disease_NN is_VBZ aerogenic_JJ in_IN origin_NN ._.
It_PRP is_VBZ most_RBS probable_JJ that_IN the_DT etiological_JJ agent_NN of_IN all_PDT the_DT specific_JJ pneumoniae_NNS primarily_RB reach_VBP the_DT lungs_NNS through_IN the_DT bronchial_JJ tubes_NN ._.
The_DT experimental_JJ transmission_NN of_IN the_DT disease_NN carried_VBD out_RP at_IN Karachi_NNP supports_VBZ the_DT view_NN that_IN infection_NN is_VBZ bronchogenic_JJ ._.
EXPERIMENTAL_NNP WORK_NNP These_DT experiments_NNS were_VBD conducted_VBN with_IN a_DT view_NN to_TO determine_VB if_IN the_DT specific_JJ pneumonia_NN of_IN goats_NNS found_VBN in_IN Sind_NNP is_VBZ identical_JJ to_TO that_DT of_IN Madras_NNP described_VBN by_IN Longley_NNP [_NN 1940_CD ]_NN ._.
For_IN experimental_JJ purposes_NNS live_VBP affected_JJ goats_NNS were_VBD brought_VBN from_IN outside_NN for_IN the_DT supply_NN of_IN ineffective_JJ agent_NN as_IN previous_JJ experience_NN had_VBD shown_VBN that_IN the_DT etiological_JJ agent_NN is_VBZ very_RB fragile_JJ and_CC does_VBZ not_RB reach_VB the_DT laboratory_NN in_IN potent_JJ stage_NN ._.
PREPARATION_NN OF_NNP INOCULA_NNP The_DT goat_NN was_VBD killed_VBN by_IN cutting_VBG the_DT throat_NN ._.
After_IN clipping_VBG the_DT skin_NN over_IN the_DT throat_NN ,_, it_PRP was_VBD washed_VBN with_IN lysol_NN or_CC dettol_JJ lotion_NN ._.
The_DT fore_NN limbs_NNS were_VBD detached_VBN from_IN the_DT throat_NN and_CC deflected_VBD then_RB and_CC the_DT skin_NN covering_VBG the_DT sternum_NN was_VBD reflected_VBN ._.
The_DT ribs_NN were_VBD then_RB cut_VBN through_IN proximally_RB and_CC distally_RB and_CC the_DT flap_NN so_RB produced_VBD reflected_JJ forwards_NNS thus_RB exposing_VBG the_DT lungs_NNS in_IN situ_NN ._.
The_DT pleural_JJ exudate_NN was_VBD collected_VBN by_IN meant_NN of_IN a_DT sterile_JJ syringe_NN ,_, into_IN a_DT sterile_JJ glass_NN flask_NN containing_VBG glass_NN beads_NNS to_TO prevens_VB coagulation_NN ._.
The_DT suitable_JJ portions_NNS of_IN the_DT affected_JJ lungs_NNS (_( avoiding_VBG portion_NN of_IN lungs_NNS which_WDT had_VBD become_VBN friable_JJ ,_, dry_JJ and_CC necrotic_JJ )_) were_VBD collected_VBN into_IN a_DT sterile_JJ vessel_NN and_CC cut_VB into_IN small_JJ bits_NNS ;_: these_DT were_VBD then_RB transferred_VBN to_TO a_DT sterile_JJ mortar_NN and_CC made_VBD into_IN a_DT fine_JJ pulp_NN ._.
The_DT pleural_JJ exudate_NN is_VBZ added_VBN to_TO the_DT lung_NN pulp_NN and_CC is_VBZ then_RB mixed_JJ with_IN equal_JJ volume_NN of_IN cold_JJ normal_JJ saline_NN ._.
TECHNIQUE_NN FOR_NNP INTRANASAL_NNP INSUFFLATION_NNP For_IN nasal_JJ insufflation_NN the_DT De_NNP Vilbiss_NNP No_NNP ._.
15_CD atomiser_NN was_VBD used_VBN with_IN the_DT nozzle_NN inserted_VBD some_DT 2_CD to_TO 3_CD inches_NNS into_IN the_DT nasal_JJ cavity_NN ,_, the_DT source_NN of_IN pressure_NN being_VBG the_DT hand_NN ;_: about_IN 10_CD c._NNS c_NN of_IN the_DT prepared_JJ inocula_NN was_VBD sprayed_VBN into_IN each_DT nostril_NN and_CC intermittent_JJ pressure_NN on_IN the_DT chest_JJS wall_NN was_VBD applied_VBN during_IN insufflation_NN to_TO enforce_VB deep_JJ respirations_NNS ._.

IMMUNIZATION_NN For_IN the_DT first_JJ time_NN during_IN the_DT year_NN 1938_CD experimental_JJ vaccination_NN was_VBD carried_VBN out_RP in_IN the_DT face_NN of_IN an_DT outbreak_NN among_IN 20_CD goats_NNS out_IN of_IN a_DT flock_NN of_IN 173_CD ._.
The_DT material_NN used_VBN for_IN vaccination_NN was_VBD a_DT saline_JJ emulsion_NN of_IN hepatized_JJ lung_NN removed_VBN from_IN a_DT naturally_RB infected_VBN goat_NN sacrificed_VBN in_IN extremis_NN ._.
The_DT emulsion_NN was_VBD formalized_VBN to_TO the_DT extent_NN of_IN one_CD per_IN cent_NN and_CC kept_VBD at_IN the_DT room_NN temperature_NN for_IN 36_CD hours_NNS before_IN it_PRP was_VBD used_VBN ._.
Dose_NNP of_IN 1_CD c_NNS c._NN in_IN the_DT region_NN of_IN neck_NN was_VBD given_VBN to_TO each_DT animal_JJ irrespective_NN of_IN age_NN ._.
Vaccine_NNP was_VBD prepared_VBN according_VBG to_TO Kolayli_NNP ,_, Raif_NNP ,_, Esim_NNP and_CC Arayici_NNP [_NNP 1935_CD ]_NNP ._.
The_DT temperature_NN of_IN the_DT goats_NNS at_IN the_DT time_NN of_IN inoculation_NN varied_VBD between_IN 102°_CD and_CC 03°F_CD ._.
Twenty-four_CD hours_NNS after_IN the_DT vaccination_NN ,_, two_CD goats_NNS registered_VBD temperatures_NNS 104.2°_CD and_CC 106°_CD respectively_RB ._.
Three_CD of_IN the_DT vaccinated_JJ goats_NNS died_VBD on_IN the_DT 5th_CD ,_, 6th_CD and_CC 7th_CD day_NN after_IN inoculation_NN ._.
These_DT goats_NNS probably_RB were_VBD in_IN the_DT incubative_JJ stage_NN at_IN the_DT time_NN of_IN vaccination_NN ._.
Among_IN the_DT unvaccinated_JJ lot_NN ,_, 25_CD goats_NNS died_VBD ._.
As_IN this_DT field_NN experiment_NN was_VBD inconclusive_JJ but_CC showed_VBD some_DT signs_NNS of_IN success_NN ,_, it_PRP was_VBD decided_VBN to_TO vaccinate_VB the_DT 8_CD Contagious_NNP Pleuropneumonia_NNP of_IN Goats_NNP entire_JJ flock_NN in_IN the_DT next_JJ outbreak_NN in_IN order_NN to_TO see_VB if_IN it_PRP was_VBD ._.
possible_JJ to_TO check_VB the_DT spread_NN of_IN the_DT disease_NN by_IN this_DT method_NN ._.
During_IN the_DT year_NN 1938-1939_CD only_RB one_CD outbreak_NN of_IN the_DT disease_NN was_VBD reported_VBN ;_: 82_CD goats_NNS had_VBD died_VBN of_IN the_DT disease_NN ,_, before_IN the_DT experimental_JJ vaccination_NN could_MD be_VB undertaken_VBN ._.
Fifty-two_NNP healthy_JJ incontact_NN goat_NN 's_POS were_VBD inoculated_VBN with_IN formalized_VBN diseased_JJ lung_NN emulsion_NN which_WDT was_VBD kept_VBN for_IN 24_CD hours_NNS at_IN room_NN tempe-_JJ rature_NN before_IN being_VBG used_VBN for_IN vaccination_NN ._.
Only_RB two_CD deaths_NNS among_IN the_DT vaccinated_JJ goats_NNS were_VBD recorded_VBN and_CC the_DT disease_NN was_VBD brought_VBN under_IN control_NN ._.
The_DT results_NNS of_IN this_DT experiment_NN were_VBD very_RB encouraging_JJ ._.
Experience_NN gained_VBD during_IN the_DT period_NN 1937-1939_JJ showed_VBD that_IN the_DT reaction_NN among_IN the_DT vaccinated_JJ goats_NNS was_VBD not_RB at_IN all_DT severe_JJ ;_: it_PRP was_VBD ,_, therefore_RB ,_, decided_VBD to_TO inoculate_VB the_DT goats_NNS immediately_RB after_IN the_DT preparation_NN of_IN the_DT vaccine_NN instead_RB of_IN keeping_VBG it_PRP at_IN room_NN temperature_NN for_IN 24_CD to_TO 36_CD hours_NNS before_IN its_PRP$ use_NN ._.
During_IN the_DT year_NN 1939-1940_JJ seventy-two_JJ goats_NNS were_VBD inoculated_VBN ;_: there_EX were_VBD three_CD deaths_NNS among_IN the_DT vaccinated_JJ goats_NNS ._.
The_DT maldars_NNS gained_VBD confidence_NN in_IN this_DT method_NN of_IN control_NN and_CC became_VBD eager_JJ to_TO report_VB the_DT disease_NN and_CC were_VBD not_RB indifferent_JJ as_IN they_PRP used_VBD to_TO be_VB when_WRB no_DT preventive_JJ vacci-_JJ nation_NN for_IN this_DT scourage_NN was_VBD known_VBN ._.
During_IN the_DT year_NN 1939-40_JJ eight_CD outbreaks_NNS were_VBD reported_VBN and_CC a_DT total_JJ number_NN of_IN 831_CD goats_NNS were_VBD vaccinated_VBN with_IN an_DT average_JJ mortality_NN of_IN 3.4_CD per_IN cent_NN among_IN the_DT vaccinated_VBN During_IN the_DT year_NN 1941-42_CD a_DT team_NN of_IN veterinary_JJ assistant_NN surgeons_NNS was_VBD trained_VBN in_IN the_DT technique_NN of_IN the_DT preparation_NN of_IN this_DT vaccine_NN and_CC its_PRP$ use_NN ;_: and_CC from_IN the_DT year_NN 1942_CD onwards_IN this_DT mode_NN of_IN vaccination_NN has_VBZ been_VBN adopted_VBN by_IN the_DT Civil_NNP Veterinary_NNP Department_NNP ,_, Sind_NNP ,_, as_IN a_DT routine_JJ measure_NN to_TO check_VB the_DT spread_NN of_IN contagious_JJ pleuro-_JJ pneumonia_NN in_IN goats_NNS ._.
Table_JJ VIII_NNP shows_VBZ the_DT number_NN of_IN inoculations_NNS performed_VBN during_IN the_DT years_NNS 1937_CD to_TO 1945_CD ._.
TABLE_NNP VIII_NNP Number_NNP of_IN inooculations_NNS performed_VBN during_IN the_DT years_NNS 1937H_CD ._.
S._NNP BAWA_NNP 9_CD While_IN investigating_VBG the_DT causes_NNS of_IN failures_NNS in_IN certain_JJ outbreaks_IN it_PRP was_VBD found_VBN that_IN the_DT veterinary_JJ assistant_NN surgeons_NNS were_VBD using_VBG a_DT very_RB little_JJ quantity_NN of_IN diseased_JJ lung_NN tissue_NN and_CC thus_RB preparing_VBG a_DT higher_JJR dilution_NN which_WDT did_VBD not_RB give_VB satisfactory_JJ results_NNS ._.
In_IN one_CD outbreak_NN unformalized_VBD diseased_JJ lung_NN emulsion_NN was_VBD used_VBN but_CC the_DT results_NNS were_VBD not_RB superior_JJ in_IN any_DT way_NN to_TO those_DT obtained_VBN with_IN formalized_JJ one_CD ._.
As_IN the_DT formalized_JJ emulsion_NN gives_VBZ some_DT protection_NN from_IN external_JJ contamination_NN in_IN the_DT field_NN it_PRP has_VBZ been_VBN kept_VBN in_IN vogue_NN ._.
Formalized_VBN vaccine_NN prepared_VBN from_IN the_DT lung_NN tissue_NN has_VBZ been_VBN used_VBN by_IN Viswanathan_NNP [_NNP 1940_CD ]_NNP in_IN Madras_NNP with_IN similar_JJ results_NNS as_IN reported_VBN by_IN the_DT author_NN ._.
Results_NNS of_IN the_DT vaccination_NN in_IN the_DT field_NN ,_, in_IN the_DT face_NN of_IN outbreaks_NNS ,_, of_IN 30,765_CD goats_NNS ,_, clearly_RB show_VBP that_IN goats_NNS do_VBP develop_VB some_DT immunity_NN which_WDT is_VBZ strong_JJ enough_RB to_TO ward_VB off_RP natural_JJ attack_NN but_CC is_VBZ not_RB strong_JJ enough_RB to_TO stand_VB test_NN doses_NNS of_IN virulent_NN inocula_NN when_WRB given_VBN by_IN insufflation_NN ._.
Longley_NNP [_NN 1940_CD ]_NN has_VBZ tried_VBN active_JJ immunization_NN in_IN experimental_JJ goats_NNS with_IN (_( 1_CD )_) formalized_VBN vaccine_NN ,_, (_( 2_CD )_) carbolized_VBN vaccine_NN and_CC (_( 3_CD )_) living_NN virus_NN and_CC found_VBD that_IN living_VBG virus_NN in_IN doses_NNS of_IN 5_CD c._JJ c._NN of_IN 1:1_CD pneumonic_JJ lung_NN emulsion_NN gives_VBZ the_DT best_JJS results_NNS when_WRB given_VBN subcutaneously_RB in_IN the_DT ear_NN ;_: he_PRP further_RB noted_VBD that_IN formalized_JJ vaccine_NN is_VBZ superior_JJ to_TO carbolized_JJ vaccine_NN ._.
The_DT present_JJ author_NN did_VBD not_RB have_VB the_DT opportunity_NN of_IN trying_VBG living_VBG virus_NN in_IN such_JJ a_DT high_JJ concentration_NN ,_, viz_NN ._.
1:1_CD pneumonic_JJ lung_NN emulsion_NN ,_, firstly_RB on_IN account_NN of_IN the_DT danger_NN of_IN severe_JJ reaction_NN and_CC secondly_RB because_IN as_IN large_JJ quantity_NN of_IN material_NN is_VBZ required_VBN to_TO vaccinate_VB hundreds_NNS and_CC thousands_NNS of_IN goats_NNS in_IN a_DT flock_NN which_WDT is_VBZ not_RB possible_JJ to_TO obtain_VB from_IN one_CD goat_NN when_WRB slaughtered_VBN in_IN extremis_NN ._.
DIAGNOSIS_NNP It_PRP is_VBZ not_RB always_RB easy_JJ to_TO diagnose_VB the_DT disease_NN correctly_RB because_IN one_CD can_MD easily_RB confuse_VB it_PRP with_IN infectious_JJ pneumonia_NN of_IN caprine_NN septicaemia_NN ,_, haemorrhagica_NN or_CC patho-_JJ logical_JJ changes_NNS met_VBD with_IN in_IN the_DT lungs_NNS due_JJ to_TO rinderpest_VB Pneumonia_NNP due_JJ to_TO haemorrhagica_VB septicaemia_JJ organism_NN can_MD be_VB successfully_RB inoculated_VBN into_IN sheep_NN ,_, rabbits_NNS and_CC mice_NN ,_, but_CC the_DT material_NN from_IN contagious_JJ pleuro-pneumonia_JJ cases_NNS fail_VBP to_TO infect_VB such_JJ animals_NNS According_VBG to_TO Bawa_NNP [_NNP 1940_CD ]_NNP pneumonic_JJ lesions_NNS are_VBP met_VBN in_IN 35_CD to_TO 45_CD per_IN cent_NN of_IN cases_NNS in_IN natural_JJ outbreaks_NNS of_IN rinderpest_NN in_IN sheep_NN and_CC goats_NNS ;_: these_DT pneumonic_JJ lesions_NNS are_VBP generally_RB accompanied_VBN by_IN gastro-intestinal_JJ lesions_NNS ._.
Rinderpest_NNP outbreak_NN is_VBZ never_RB confined_VBN to_TO goats_NNS only_RB but_CC numerous_JJ cases_NNS are_VBP seen_VBN in_IN sheep_NN as_IN well_RB ._.
In_IN the_DT case_NN of_IN contagious_JJ pleuro-pneumonia_NN the_DT disease_NN is_VBZ always_RB confined_VBN to_TO goats_NNS ._.
The_DT injection_NN of_IN pleural_JJ exudate_JJ intra-muscularly_JJ or_CC subcutaneously_RB into_IN the_DT shoulder_NN or_CC thigh_NN of_IN a_DT goat_NN produces_VBZ severe_JJ local_JJ reaction_NN in_IN 2_CD to_TO 3_CD days_NNS which_WDT is_VBZ typical_JJ and_CC proves_VBZ the_DT specificity_NN of_IN caprine_NN contagious_JJ pleuro-pneumonia_JJ virus_NN ._.
In_IN Sind_NNP up_RP till_RB now_RB not_RB a_DT single_JJ outbreak_NN of_IN infectious_JJ pneumonia_NN ,_, due_JJ to_TO organisms_NNS of_IN septicaemia_NN haemorrhagica_NN ,_, has_VBZ been_VBN confirmed_VBN ._.
TREATMENT_NNP Viswanathan_NNP [_NN 1940_CD ]_NNP treated_VBD 68_CD goats_NNS suffering_VBG from_IN contagious_JJ pleuro-pnemonia_NN in_IN different_JJ stages_NNS of_IN the-disease_NN with_IN Bayer_NNP 's_POS Neosalvarsan_NNP (_( the_DT dose_NN varying_VBG from_IN 0.0375_CD to_TO 0.3_CD gms_NN ,_, depending_VBG upon_IN the_DT stage_NN of_IN the_DT disease_NN )_) resulting_VBG in_IN 65_CD recoveries_NNS and_CC 3_CD deaths_NNS ._.
SUMMARY_NNP 1_CD ._.
Contagious_JJ pleuro-pneumonia_NN of_IN goats_NNS is_VBZ a_DT specific_JJ caprine_NN disease_NN and_CC is_VBZ responsible_JJ for_IN a_DT mortality_NN of_IN 60_CD to_TO 100_CD per_IN cent_NN and_CC shows_VBZ some_DT seasonal_JJ variations_NNS ._.
2_CD The_DT symptoms_NNS ,_, course_NN ,_, pathology_NN and_CC epizootology_NN of_IN the_DT disease_NN are_VBP des-_JJ cribed_NNS ._.
3_CD ._.
The_DT etiological_JJ agent_NN appears_VBZ to_TO be_VB a_DT filterable_JJ virus_NN ,_, since_IN the_DT disease_NN is_VBZ infectious_JJ and_CC no_DT specific_JJ pathogenic_JJ organism_NN could_MD be_VB isolated_VBN ._.
4_CD ._.
The_DT causative_JJ agent_NN is_VBZ destroyed_VBN by_IN heat_NN at_IN 60°C_CD ._.
for_IN half_PDT an_DT hour_NN ._.
5_CD ._.
The_DT inoculation_NN of_IN fresh_JJ pneumonic_JJ material_NN either_CC subcutaneously_RB or_CC intra-_JJ 10_CD Contagious_NNP Pleuropneumonia_NNP of_IN Goats_NNP muscularly_RB gives_VBZ rise_NN to_TO an_DT acute_NN ,_, progressive_JJ ,_, and_CC usually_RB fatal_JJ oedema_NN at_IN the_DT site_NN of_IN the_DT inoculation_NN ,_, with_IN death_NN in_IN 3_CD to_TO 10_CD days_NNS 6_CD ._.
The_DT inoculation_NN of_IN effusions_NNS from_IN these_DT lesions_NNS give_VBP rise_NN to_TO similar_JJ lesions_NNS in_IN ._.
other_JJ healthy_JJ goats_NNS 7_CD ._.
Pleuritic_JJ and_CC pneumonic_JJ lesions_NNS can_MD be_VB induced_VBN by_IN direct_JJ extension_NN from_IN similar_JJ lesions_NNS in_IN the_DT musculature_NN and_CC connective_JJ tissues_NNS in_IN the_DT thoracic_NN wall_NN ._.
8_CD ._.
The_DT pneumonia_NN can_MD regularly_RB be_VB induced_VBN by_IN the_DT intra-nasal_JJ insufflation_NN of_IN either_DT pneumonic_JJ lung_NN emulsion_NN or_CC effusion_NN from_IN local_JJ reactions_NNS ._.
9_CD ._.
Guineapigs_NNP and_CC rabbits_NNS have_VBP in_IN no_DT instance_NN evidenced_VBD any_DT reaction_NN to_TO inoculation_NN ._.
10_CD ._.
Immunization_NN with_IN formalized_JJ vaccine_NN in_IN the_DT face_NN of_IN outbreaks_NNS have_VBP given_VBN very_RB good_JJ results_NNS in_IN checking_VBG the_DT spread_NN of_IN the_DT disease_NN ._.
11_CD ._.
Five_CD goats_NNS out_IN of_IN twelve_NN experimental_JJ goats_NNS ,_, receiving_VBG virulent_JJ inocula_JJ intra-_JJ nasally_RB ,_, subcutaneously_RB or_CC intra-muscularly_RB aborted_JJ ,_, i.e_NN ._.
there_EX were_VBD 4l.6_CD per_IN cent_NN abortions_NNS ._.
Only_RB in_IN one_CD case_NN the_DT serum_NN was_VBD found_VBN to_TO be_VB doubtful_JJ against_IN A_NNP and_CC positive_JJ against_IN M_NNP for_IN Brucella_NNP infection_NN ;_: all_DT other_JJ samples_NNS of_IN the_DT serum_NN were_VBD found_VBN to_TO be_VB negative_JJ for_IN Brucella_NNP infection_NN ._.
12_CD ._.
All_PDT the_DT experimental_JJ evidence_NN tend_NN to_TO show_VB that_IN the_DT contagious_JJ pleuro-pneumonia_NN as_IN found_VBN in_IN Sind_NNP is_VBZ identical_JJ to_TO that_DT of_IN Madras_NNP described_VBN by_IN Longley_NNP ._.

REFERENCES_NNP Bawa_NNP ,_, H._NNP S._NNP (_( 1937-38_JJ )_) ._.
Annual_JJ report_NN of_IN the_DT Vetrinary_NNP Investigation_NNP Officer_NNP ,_, Sind_NNP REFINING_NNP OF_NNP HIGH_NNP ACID_NNP GHEE_NNP By_IN M._NNP A._NN SAMUEL_NNP ,_, K._NNP C._NNP SEN_NNP ,_, ZAL_NNP R._NNP KOTHAWALLA_NNP and_CC NOSHIR_NNP N._NNP DASTUR_NNP Imperial_NNP Dairy_NNP Research_NNP Institute_NNP ,_, Bangalore_NNP (_( Received_VBN for_IN publication_NN on_IN 27_CD December_NNP 1945_CD )_) GHEE_NNP produced_VBN under_IN clean_JJ conditions_NNS contains_VBZ very_RB little_JJ of_IN free_JJ fatty_JJ acids_NNS ._.
The_DT Agmark_NNP standards_NNS allow_VBP free_JJ fatty_JJ acids_NNS to_TO the_DT extent_NN of_IN 2.5_CD per_IN cent_NN oleic_NN ._.
It_PRP is_VBZ ,_, however_RB ,_, found_VBD that_IN under_IN commercial_JJ conditions_NNS of_IN production_NN this_DT limit_NN is_VBZ often_RB exceeded_VBN and_CC ghee_JJ with_IN as_RB much_JJ as_IN 12_CD per_IN cent_NN oleic_NN acid_NN is_VBZ not_RB uncommon_JJ ._.
In_IN the_DT trade_NN such_JJ ghee_NN is_VBZ used_VBN to_TO blend_VB good_JJ ghee_NN and_CC bring_VB the_DT free_JJ fatty_NN acid_NN content_NN to_TO the_DT prescribed_JJ limits_NNS ._.
This_DT practice_NN is_VBZ not_RB sound_JJ because_IN ultimately_RB it_PRP results_NNS in_IN lowering_VBG the_DT quality_NN of_IN the_DT good_JJ product_NN also_RB ._.
By_IN removing_VBG the_DT free_JJ fatty_JJ acids_NNS from_IN ghee_NN ,_, it_PRP is_VBZ possible_JJ to_TO put_VB an_DT wholesome_JJ product_NN on_IN the_DT market_NN ._.
Such_JJ a_DT practice_NN is_VBZ regularly_RB followed_VBN in_IN case_NN of_IN vegetable_NN oils_NNS which_WDT even_RB when_WRB fresh_JJ often_RB contain_VBP rather_RB large_JJ amounts_NNS of_IN free_JJ fatty_JJ acids_NNS ._.
In_IN the_DT present_JJ investigations_NNS the_DT possibility_NN of_IN using_VBG such_JJ methods_NNS as_IN can_MD be_VB applicable_JJ to_TO ghee_VB ,_, under_IN the_DT existing_VBG trade_NN conditions_NNS have_VBP been_VBN investigated_VBN ._.
The_DT work_NN has_VBZ been_VBN divided_VBN for_IN the_DT sake_NN of_IN convenience_NN into_IN two_CD parts_NNS ._.
The_DT first_JJ part_NN deals_NNS mainly_RB with_IN alkali_NN refining_NN and_CC the_DT second_JJ part_NN with_IN refining_NN by_IN the_DT use_NN of_IN basic_JJ adsorbents_NNS ._.
PART_NN I_PRP Before_IN taking_VBG up_RP trials_NNS with_IN alkali_NN refining_NN ,_, work_NN was_VBD carried_VBN out_RP to_TO see_VB if_IN a_DT simpler_NN process_NN could_MD be_VB adopted_VBN ._.
As_IN these_DT trials_NNS did_VBD not_RB give_VB very_RB encouraging_JJ results_NNS they_PRP have_VBP only_RB been_VBN briefly_VBN described_VBN here_RB ._.
(_( a_DT )_) Heating_NN to_TO 120°C_CD ._.
did_VBD not_RB lower_VB the_DT content_NN of_IN free_JJ fatty_JJ acids_NNS ,_, though_IN it_PRP helped_VBD to_TO improve_VB the_DT flavour_NN of_IN high_JJ acid_NN ghee_NN ._.
(_( b_NN )_) Washing_VBG with_IN hot_JJ water_NN ,_, four_CD times_NNS ,_, reduced_VBD the_DT acidity_NN of_IN ghee_NN t_NN o_IN the_DT extent_NN of_IN about_IN 13_CD per_IN cent_NN ._.
The_DT first_JJ wash_NN was_VBD most_RBS effective_JJ in_IN reducing_VBG the_DT acidity_NN ._.
Both_DT the_DT colour_NN and_CC the_DT flavour_NN of_IN ghee_NN were_VBD improved_VBN by_IN washing_VBG ._.
(_( c_NN )_) Washing_VBG with_IN hot_JJ 3_CD per_IN cent_NN and_CC 5_CD per_IN cent_NN solutions_NNS of_IN commercial_JJ salt_NN gave_VBD the_DT same_JJ results_NNS as_IN when_WRB hot_JJ water_NN was_VBD used_VBN ._.
(_( d_NN )_) Steaming_VBG high_JJ acid_NN ghee_NN for_IN an_DT hour_NN reduced_VBD the_DT acidity_NN by_IN about_IN 2_CD per_IN cent_NN and_CC steaming_VBG for_IN two_CD hours_NNS by_IN about_IN 3_CD per_IN cent_NN ._.
(_( e_NN )_) Washing_VBG ghee_NN three_CD times_NNS with_IN an_DT equal_JJ volume_NN of_IN ethyl_NN alcohol_NN reduced_VBD the_DT acidity_NN by_IN about_IN 77_CD per_IN cent_NN ._.
(_( f_NN )_) Trials_NNS were_VBD carried_VBN out_IN to_TO neutralize_VB the_DT acidity_NN with_IN soda_JJ ash_JJ solution_NN ._.
For_IN laboratory_NN trials_NNS 10_CD lb_NN ._.
of_IN high_JJ acid_NN ghee_NN was_VBD used_VBN each_DT time_NN ._.
Ghee_NNP was_VBD warmed_VBN to_TO about_IN 65°C_CD and_CC transferred_VBD to_TO a_DT butter-churn_NN ._.
The_DT requisite_JJ amount_NN of_IN 4.0_CD N_NNP soda_NN ash_NN solution_NN was_VBD added_VBN and_CC the_DT mixture_NN churned_VBD for_IN 15_CD minutes_NNS ._.
The_DT contents_NNS of_IN the_DT churn_NN were_VBD then_RB transferred_VBN to_TO a_DT cream_NN separator_NN ,_, the_DT cream-screw_JJ having_VBG been_VBN adjusted_VBN for_IN maximum_JJ fat_JJ output_NN ._.
The_DT ghee_NN thus_RB obtained_VBN was_VBD given_VBN three_CD further_JJ washings_NNS with_IN warm_JJ water_NN to_TO take_VB out_RP all_PDT the_DT alkali_NN ._.
Addition_NN of_IN soda_NN ash_JJ solution_NN all_DT at_IN once_RB and_CC in_IN two_CD instalments_NNS was_VBD tried_VBN but_CC no_DT striking_JJ difference_NN in_IN the_DT reduction_NN of_IN acidity_NN or_CC in_IN handling_VBG losses_NNS was_VBD noticed_VBN between_IN the_DT two_CD methods_NNS ._.
The_DT results_NNS obtained_VBD are_VBP given_VBN in_IN Table_NNP I_PRP ._.
11_CD 12_CD Refining_NN of_IN high_JJ acid_NN ghee_VBD It_PRP was_VBD found_VBN that_IN by_IN neutralizing_VBG with_IN soda_NN ash_NN ,_, there_EX was_VBD a_DT decrease_NN of_IN about_IN 87_CD per_IN cent_NN in_IN the_DT acidity_NN of_IN original_JJ ghee_NN ._.
On_IN refining_NN ,_, the_DT ghee_NN improved_VBN in_IN colour_NN but_CC had_VBD a_DT flat_JJ flavour_NN ._.
It_PRP was_VBD noticed_VBN that_IN refining_VBG tended_VBD to_TO raise_VB the_DT Reichert_NNP value_NN to_TO a_DT small_JJ extent_NN ._.
A_DT few_JJ samples_NNS of_IN refined_JJ ghee_NNS were_VBD stored_VBN at_IN 37°C_CD ._.
to_TO study_VB if_IN there_EX was_VBD any_DT increase_NN in_IN acidity_NN ._.
The_DT results_NNS obtained_VBD are_VBP given_VBN in_IN Table_NNP II_NNP ._.
It_PRP was_VBD found_VBN that_IN refined_JJ ghe_NN e_NN was_VBD quite_RB stable_JJ and_CC did_VBD not_RB again_RB develop_VB acidity_NN rapidly_RB ._.

Commercial_JJ quality_NN sodium_NN hydroxide_NN was_VBD used_VBN for_IN these_DT trials_NNS ._.

2_CD per_IN cent_NN ,_, 5_CD per_IN cent_NN ,_, 10_CD per_IN cent_NN ,_, 15_CD per_IN cent_NN ,_, 20_CD per_IN cent_NN and_CC 25_CD per_IN cent_NN sodium_NN hydroxide_NN ,_, were_VBD used_VBN ._.

It_PRP was_VBD found_VBN that_IN the_DT strength_NN of_IN sodium_NN hydroxide_NN solution_NN had_VBD a_DT marked_JJ influence_NN on_IN the_DT degree_NN of_IN reduction_NN in_IN acidity_NN ._.

(_( d_NN )_) Filtering_VBG refined_VBN ghee_NN ._.
Studies_NNS reported_VBD so_RB far_RB were_VBD carried_VBN out_RP by_IN filtering_VBG the_DT refined_VBN ghee_NN through_IN a_DT filter_JJ paper_NN ._.
It_PRP was_VBD felt_VBN that_IN this_DT type_NN of_IN filteration_NN may_MD not_RB be_VB possible_JJ under_IN existing_VBG trade_NN conditions_NNS and_CC some_DT modification_NN of_IN the_DT process_NN was_VBD necessary_JJ ._.

When_WRB this_DT happened_VBD ,_, ghee_NN could_MD be_VB easily_RB filtered_VBN through_IN a_DT piece_NN of_IN flannel_NN or_CC muslin_NN ._.

Any_DT temperature_NN below_IN 106°C_CD ._.
was_VBD not_RB effective_JJ ._.
Ghee_NN filtered_VBD through_IN cloth_NN was_VBD found_VBN to_TO have_VB a_DT slight_JJ turbidity_NN on_IN account_NN of_IN suspended_JJ calcium_NN soaps_VBZ The_DT amount_NN of_IN calcium_NN ,_, estimated_VBN as_IN CaO_NNP ,_, on_IN three_CD samples_NNS of_IN refined_JJ ghee_NN was_VBD 0.01_CD ,_, 0.03_CD and_CC 0.03_CD per_IN cent_NN ._.

Particulars_NNS of_IN samples_NNS Interval_NNP in_IN days_NNS Original_NNP 5_CD 8_CD 13_CD 16_CD 20_CD 24_CD 26_CD 31_CD 33_CD Peroxide_NNP value_NN I_PRP Unrefined_VBD ghee_RB 2.58_CD 4.25_CD 6.51_CD 10.02_CD 9.87_CD 12.84_CD 16.64_CD 19.03_CD Refined_VBN ghee_NN 1.12_CD 1.37_CD 1.93_CD 3.80_CD 2.66_CD 3.33_CD 4.27_CD 6.90_CD 2_CD Unrefined_VBD ghee_NN 1.36_CD 5.08_CD 8.69_CD 9.58_CD 10.96_CD Refined_VBN ghee_NN 0.54_CD 0.99_CD 1.33_CD 1.97_CD 2.74_CD Free_JJ fatty_JJ acids_NNS 1_CD Unrefined_VBD ghee_NN 5.48_CD 5.58_CD 5.58_CD 5.60_CD 5.82_CD 5.54_CD 5.65_CD 5.71_CD Refined_VBN ghee_NN 0.03_CD 0.03_CD 0.03_CD 0.03_CD 0.04_CD 0.03_CD 0.06_CD 0.05_CD 2_CD Unrefined_VBD ghee_NN 7.78_CD 7.88_CD 7.99_CD Refined_VBN ghee_NN 0.05_CD 0.05_CD 0.05_CD (_( 2_CD )_) A_DT study_NN was_VBD made_VBN of_IN various_JJ adsorbents_NNS for_IN removing_VBG free_JJ fatty_JJ acids_NNS ._.
Calcium_NNP oxide_NN ,_, calcium_NN hydroxide_NN and_CC magnesium_NN oxide_NN were_VBD found_VBN quite_RB efficient_JJ in_IN this_DT respect_NN ._.
Use_NNP of_IN lime_NN is_VBZ recommended_VBN on_IN account_NN of_IN its_PRP$ ready_JJ availability_NN and_CC low_JJ cost_NN ._.
The_DT use_NN of_IN lime_NN has_VBZ another_DT great_JJ advantage_NN in_IN that_DT its_PRP$ emulsion_NN with_IN ghee_NN is_VBZ easily_RB broken_VBN by_IN heating_VBG to_TO 108°C._CD ,_, thus_RB rendering_VBG unnecessary_JJ the_DT employment_NN of_IN any_DT special_JJ equipment_NN ._.
Ghee_NNP after_IN heating_VBG with_IN lime_NN ,_, requires_VBZ mere_JJ filteration_NN ;_: the_DT flavour_NN and_CC grain_NN structure_NN as_RB well_RB as_IN the_DT keeping_VBG quality_NN is_VBZ considerably_RB improved_VBN ._.

REFERENCE_NNP Dastur_NNP ,_, N._NNP N._NNP and_CC Lea_NNP ,_, C._NNP H._NNP (_( 1941_CD )_) ._.
Analyst_NN 66_CD ,_, 90_CD TUBERCULIN_NNP TESTING_NNP IN_NNP BUFFALOES_NNP WITH_NNP A_NNP DESCRIPTION_NNP OF_IN SOME_NNP DIFFERENCES_NNP IN_NNP THE_NNP MACROSCOPIC_NNP LESIONS_NNP OF_IN THE_NNP COW_NNP AND_NNP THE_NNP BUFFALO_NNP By_IN H._NNP K._NNP LALL_NNP ,_, B.Sc._NNP ,_, M._NNP R._NNP C._NNP V._NNP S._NNP ,_, Government_NNP Cattle_NNP Farm_NNP ,_, Hissar_NNP (_( Received_VBN for_IN publication_NN on_IN 2_CD March_NNP 1945_CD )_) (_( With_IN Plate_NNP III_NNP )_) VETERINARIANS_NNP and_CC laymen_NNS usually_RB think_VBP that_IN tuberculosis_NN is_VBZ rare_JJ in_IN buffaloes_NNS ,_, But_CC this_DT belief_NN does_VBZ not_RB appear_VB to_TO be_VB wholly_RB based_VBN upon_IN scientific_JJ observations_NNS ._.
Soparkar_NNP [_NN 1925_CD ]_NNP says_VBZ that_IN the_DT buffalo_NN is_VBZ as_RB susceptible_JJ to_TO tuberculosis_VB as_IN the_DT cow_NN ,_, perhaps_RB more_RBR susceptible_JJ ,_, because_IN they_PRP are_VBP heavier_JJR than_IN cows_NNS ._.
The_DT same_JJ observer_NN ,_, in_IN collaboration_NN with_IN Dhillon_NNP [_NN 1931_CD ]_NN ,_, records_NNS that_WDT at_IN Lahore_NNP at_IN least_JJS 23.6_CD per_IN cent_NN of_IN buffaloes_NNS showed_VBD either_CC tubercular_JJ lesions_NNS on_IN postmortem_NN or_CC reacted_VBN to_TO the_DT tuberculin_JJ test_NN ._.
Naik_NNP [_NN 1932_CD ]_NN has_VBZ recorded_VBN a_DT case_NN of_IN generalized_JJ tuberculosis_NN in_IN a_DT Jaffarabadi_NNP buffalo_NN ._.
Tuberculin_NNP tests_NNS carried_VBD out_RP in_IN the_DT province_NN since_IN 1935_CD have_VBP shown_VBN that_IN the_DT disease_NN in_IN buffaloes_NNS in_IN the_DT Punjab_NNP is_VBZ not_RB uncommon_JJ ._.
The_DT following_JJ figures_NNS (_( Table_NNP I_PRP )_) have_VBP been_VBN taken_VBN from_IN the_DT reports_NNS of_IN the_DT Punjab_NNP Veterinary_NNP Investigation_NNP Officers_NNP for_IN the_DT years_NNS 1935-42_JJ :_: H._NNP K._NNP LALL_NNP 25_CD In_IN one_CD of_IN the_DT tuberculin_NN tests_NNS in_IN the_DT year_NN 194226_CD An_DT outbreak_NN of_IN Tuberclosis_NNP in_IN Ducks_NNP laminae_NN ,_, more_RBR accentuated_VBN on_IN the_DT edge_NN in_IN the_DT case_NN of_IN the_DT buffalo_NN than_IN in_IN that_DT of_IN the_DT cow_NN ._.
It_PRP was_VBD usual_JJ to_TO find_VB a_DT big_JJ lesion_NN in_IN the_DT centre_NN and_CC other_JJ smaller_JJR satellites_NNS on_IN the_DT priphery_NN ._.
This_DT arrangement_NN was_VBD generally_RB not_RB seen_VBN in_IN bovines_NNS ._.
A_DT strain_NN of_IN the_DT organism_NN from_IN the_DT lesions_NNS was_VBD isolated_VBN by_IN Mr_NNP L._NNP Sahai_NNP and_CC was_VBD found_VBN to_TO be_VB of_IN the_DT bovine_NN type_NN ._.
SUMMARY_NNP An_DT account_NN of_IN the_DT reaction_NN to_TO be_VB tuberculin_JJ test_NN in_IN buffaloes_NNS is_VBZ described_VBN ._.
It_PRP is_VBZ more_RBR pronounced_JJ in_IN buffaloes_NNS than_IN in_IN cows_NNS ;_: the_DT oedema_NN is_VBZ much_RB more_RBR extensive_JJ ._.
The_DT lesions_NNS in_IN the_DT buffalo_NN differ_NN from_IN those_DT in_IN the_DT cow_NN they_PRP are_VBP creamy_JJ white_JJ and_CC not_RB yellowish_VB ._.
The_DT nature_NN of_IN the_DT caseation_NN also_RB differs_VBZ ;_: it_PRP is_VBZ arranged_VBN in_IN concentric_JJ layers_NNS ._.
Calcification_NN ,_, which_WDT is_VBZ accentuated_VBN at_IN edges_NNS ,_, is_VBZ not_RB so_RB marked_JJ but_CC there_EX is_VBZ an_DT increased_JJ tendency_NN towards_NNS capsulation_NN ._.
The_DT incidence_NN of_IN tuberculosis_NN in_IN buffaloes_NNS in_IN some_DT farms_NNS and_CC villages_NNS is_VBZ given_VBN ._.
