353_CD AN_NNP OUTBREAK_NNP OF_NNP TUBERCULOSIS_NNP IN_NNP DUCKS_NNP By_IN S._NNP L._NNP ZARGAR_NNP ,_, G.B.V.C._NNP ,_, Assistant_NNP Investigation_NNP Officer_NNP (_( Poultry_NNP )_) ,_, Central_NNP Provinces_NNPS and_CC Berar_NNP ,_, Nagpur_NNP (_( Recefved_NNP for_IN publication_NN 10_CD December_NNP 1945_CD )_) (_( With_IN Plate_NNP IV_NNP )_) WE_NNP owe_VBP our_PRP$ earlier_JJR knowledge_NN of_IN tuberculosis_NN in_IN ducks_NNS to_TO Christien_NNP ,_, Germain_NNP and_CC Raymond_NNP [_NNP 1923_CD ]_NNP ,_, Volker_NNP [_NNP 1924_CD ]_NNP ,_, Eber_NNP [_NNP 1925_CD ]_NNP ,_, Klimmer_NNP [_NNP 1930_CD ]_NNP and_CC Feldman_NNP [_NNP 1938_CD ]_NNP ._.
These_DT authors_NNS encountered_VBD isolated_JJ cases_NNS ._.
An_DT outbreak_NN of_IN tuberculosis_NN was_VBD described_VBN by_IN Gordon_NNP ,_, Garside_NNP ,_, Dobson_NNP ,_, etc._NN ,_, [_JJ 1940_CD ,_, 1941_CD ]_NN ._.
But_CC our_PRP$ knowledge_NN of_IN this_DT disease_NN in_IN ducks_NNS in_IN India_NNP is_VBZ very_RB limited_JJ ._.
Naidu_NNP [_NN 1943_CD ]_NN ,_, while_IN giving_VBG a_DT list_NN of_IN specimens_NNS collected_VBN ,_, just_RB mentions_NNS a_DT case_NN in_IN which_WDT the_DT liver_NN of_IN a_DT duck_NN showed_VBD tubercular_JJ nodules_NNS ._.
Mohteda_NNP [_NN 1944_CD ]_NN ,_, however_RB ,_, records_NNS two_CD cases_NNS of_IN generalized_JJ tuberculosis_NN in_IN goose_NN ._.
In_IN fact_NN ,_, tuberculosis_NN has_VBZ always_RB been_VBN regarded_VBN as_IN rare_NN in_IN ducks_NNS in_IN this_DT country_NN and_CC this_DT note_NN is_VBZ just_RB to_TO put_VB on_IN record_NN the_DT observations_NNS made_VBN in_IN an_DT outbreak_NN of_IN tuberculosis_NN in_IN a_DT flock_NN of_IN about_IN 1000_CD ducks_NNS kept_VBD at_IN the_DT Military_NNP Duck_NNP Farm_NNP ,_, Nagpur_NNP The_DT subject_NN under_IN reference_NN assumes_NNS importance_NN and_CC invites_VBZ more_JJR attention_NN for_IN the_DT simple_JJ reason_NN that_IN about_IN 500_CD ducks_NNS of_IN the_DT above_JJ flock_NN were_VBD purchased_VBN by_IN contractors_NNS from_IN typical_JJ Indian_JJ villages_NNS and_CC immediately_RB after_IN their_PRP$ arrival_NN at_IN Nagpur_NNP ,_, cases_NNS of_IN generalized_JJ tuberculosis_NN were_VBD noticed_VBN in_IN an_DT appreciable_JJ number_NN among_IN very_RB young_JJ ducks_NNS ._.
Furthermore_RB ,_, even_RB to-day_JJ our_PRP$ knowledge_NN regarding_VBG tuberculin_JJ testing_NN of_IN ducks_NNS is_VBZ imperfect_JJ and_CC unhelpful_JJ and_CC we_PRP do_VBP not_RB yet_RB know_VB how_WRB to_TO eradicate_VB the_DT disease_NN from_IN an_DT infected_JJ flock_NN ._.
During_IN the_DT past_JJ ten_JJ months_NNS the_DT various_JJ aspects_NNS of_IN the_DT disease_NN were_VBD studied_VBN in_IN the_DT affected_JJ flock_NN and_CC the_DT observations_NNS are_VBP summarized_VBN below_IN ._.
Symptoms_NNS ._.
The_DT main_JJ signs_NNS observed_VBN in_IN infected_JJ ducks_NNS ,_, while_IN alive_JJ ,_, were_VBD progressive_JJ emaciation_NN ,_, anaemia_NN and_CC lameness_NN ._.
Affected_JJ ducks_NNS had_VBD ,_, in_IN the_DT later_JJ stages_NNS of_IN the_DT disease_NN ,_, very_RB dull_JJ look_NN and_CC showed_VBD no_DT inclination_NN to_TO move_VB ._.
They_PRP usually_RB lagged_VBD behind_IN the_DT flock_NN and_CC were_VBD very_RB light_JJ Invariably_NNP breast_NN muscles_NNS were_VBD completely_RB atrophied_VBN with_IN corresponding_VBG prominence_NN of_IN the_DT sternum_NN which_WDT was_VBD very_RB evident_JJ on_IN handling_VBG the_DT birds_NNS ._.
The_DT average_JJ weight_NN of_IN ducks_NNS dying_VBG consequent_NN to_TO this_DT infection_NN was_VBD 1.85_CD lb._NN ,_, whereas_IN the_DT average_JJ weight_NN of_IN a_DT duck_NN in_IN the_DT flock_NN is_VBZ about_IN 3.85_CD lb_NN ._.
Post-mortem_JJ lesions_NNS ._.
So_RB far_RB ,_, 61_CD carcasses_NNS of_IN ducks_NNS have_VBP been_VBN examined_VBN and_CC Indian_JJ J._NNP vet_NN ._.
Sci._NNP ,_, Vol_NNP ._.
XVI_NN ,_, Part_NNP I_PRP ]_VBP PLATE_NNP III_NNP [_NNP NLS_NNP note_NN :_: a_DT graphic_JJ appears_VBZ here_RB -_: see_VBP image_NN of_IN page_NN ]_FW A_NNP severe_JJ tuberculin_NN reaction_NN in_IN a_DT buffalo_NN PLATE_NNP IV_NNP [_NNP Indian_NNP J._NNP vet_NN ._.
Sci._NNP ,_, Vol_NNP ._.
XVI_NN ,_, Part_NNP I_PRP [_VBP NLS_JJ note_NN :_: a_DT graphic_JJ appears_VBZ here_RB -_: see_VBP image_NN of_IN page_NN ]_JJ Showing_NNP Tubercular_NNP Lesions_NNP in_IN 1_CD ,_, Liver_NNP 2_CD ,_, Spleen_NNP 3_CD ,_, Kidney_NNP S._NNP L._NNP ZARGAR_NNP 27_CD tuberculosis_NN was_VBD confirmed_VBN in_IN 33_CD cases_NNS ,_, the_DT percentage_NN of_IN infection_NN being_VBG 54.1_CD ._.
A_DT detailed_JJ study_NN of_IN all_PDT the_DT carcasses_NNS showed_VBD that_IN liver_NN was_VBD affected_VBN in_IN 32_CD cases_NNS (_( 97_CD per_IN cent_NN )_) ,_, spleen_JJ in_IN 27_CD (_( 81_CD 8_CD per_IN cent_NN )_) ,_, intestines_NNS in_IN 14_CD instances_NNS (_( 42_CD 4_CD per_IN cent_NN )_) kidneys_NNS in_IN 12_CD (_( 36.4_CD per_IN cent_NN )_) ,_, lungs_NNS in_IN 5_CD (_( 15.2_CD per_IN cent_NN )_) and_CC peritonium_NN and_CC gizzard_NN in_IN 4_CD (_( 12.1_CD per_IN cent_NN )_) ._.
From_IN seven_CD cases_NNS (_( 21.2_CD per_IN cent_NN )_) straw-coloured_JJ abnominal_JJ fluid_NN varying_VBG in_IN quantity_NN from_IN 75_CD to_TO 250_CD c.c_NN ._.
was_VBD recovered_VBN ._.
The_DT lesions_NNS (_( Plate_NNP IV_NNP )_) consisted_VBD of_IN roundish_JJ yellow_JJ nodules_NNS ,_, varying_VBG in_IN size_NN from_IN a_DT pinhead_NN toabout_IN 0.8_CD inches_NNS ._.
In_IN well_RB developed_JJ cases_NNS ,_, caseation_NN had_VBD developed_VBN ._.
The_DT cheesy_NN material_NN could_MD easily_RB be_VB shelled_VBN out_RP ._.
In_IN the_DT beginning_NN small_JJ and_CC scattered_JJ lesions_NNS were_VBD whitish_JJ or_CC pearly_RB in_IN appearance_NN and_CC crystalline_NN in_IN nature_NN ._.
When_WRB the_DT lesions_NNS were_VBD numerous_JJ ,_, the_DT affected_JJ organs_NNS ,_, usually_RB spleen_JJ and_CC liver_NN ,_, were_VBD greatly_RB increased_VBN in_IN dimensions_NNS ._.
The_DT affected_JJ and_CC enlarged_VBD liver_NN had_VBD invariably_RB hard_JJ and_CC leathery_JJ texture_NN ._.
The_DT lesions_NNS in_IN kidneys_NNS were_VBD very_RB prominent_JJ and_CC mostly_RB only_RB one_CD kidney_NN was_VBD involved_VBN ,_, the_DT other_JJ remaining_VBG apparently_RB quite_RB normal_JJ ._.
Diagnosis_NN in_IN each_DT case_NN was_VBD made_VBN by_IN demonstrating_VBG acid-alcohol-fast_JJ bacilli_NN in_IN each_DT affected_JJ organ_NN ._.
The_DT strain_NN of_IN the_DT acid-fast_JJ organism_NN under_IN observation_NN grew_VBD well_RB on_IN plain_NN egg_NN and_CC glycerine_NN egg_NN media_NNS ._.
It_PRP did_VBD not_RB appear_VB to_TO be_VB of_IN quite_RB the_DT usual_JJ virulence_NN of_IN the_DT avian_JJ strain_NN ,_, but_CC its_PRP$ appearence_NN was_VBD typically_RB avian_JJ and_CC it_PRP did_VBD not_RB conform_VB to_TO Dobson_NNP 's_POS description_NN of_IN powdery_NN pitted_VBN colonies_NNS ._.
It_PRP also_RB types_VBZ avian_JJ Biological_NNP transmission_NN experiments_NNS ._.
Animal_JJ inoculation_NN tests_NNS were_VBD carried_VBN out_RP on_IN ducks_NNS ,_, fowls_NN ,_, pigeons_NNS and_CC rabbits_NNS ._.
It_PRP was_VBD observed_VBN that_IN the_DT morbid_NN material_NN was_VBD innocuous_JJ to_TO pigeons_NNS and_CC rabbits_VBZ The_DT two_CD ducks_NNS which_WDT were_VBD injected_VBN intra-muscularly_RB died_VBN on_IN the_DT 39th_CD and_CC 109th_CD day_NN after_IN inoculation_NN ._.
One_CD duck_NN and_CC a_DT fowl_NN ,_, which_WDT were_VBD injected_VBN subcutaneously_RB ,_, died_VBD on_IN the_DT 49th_CD and_CC 103rd_CD day_NN after_IN inoculation_NN respectively_RB ._.
One_CD of_IN the_DT four_CD ducks_NNS ,_, which_WDT was_VBD fed_VBN with_IN one_CD gram_NN of_IN the_DT material_NN from_IN tubercular_JJ lesions_NNS ,_, obtained_VBN from_IN a_DT duck_NN destroyed_VBN in_IN extremis_NN died_VBD on_IN the_DT 114th_JJ day_NN ._.
In_IN each_DT experimental_JJ bird_NN varying_VBG degrees_NNS of_IN macroscopic_NN lesions_NNS were_VBD noticed_VBN only_RB in_IN the_DT liver_NN and_CC the_DT spleen_NN ._.
Acid-alcohol-fast_JJ bacilli_NN were_VBD demonstrated_VBN in_IN each_DT case_NN ._.
Other_JJ experimental_JJ birds_NNS are_VBP under_IN observation_NN ._.
Tuberculin_NNP test_NN ._.
Eighty-two_JJ ducks_NNS in_IN the_DT flock_NN were_VBD tested_VBN by_IN various_JJ routes_NNS with_IN avian_JJ tuberculin_NN received_VBD from_IN the_DT Imperial_NNP Veterinary_NNP Research_NNP Institute_NNP ._.
The_DT observations_NNS made_VBD so_RB far_RB were_VBD not_RB very_RB encouraging_JJ and_CC the_DT avian_JJ tuberculin_NN did_VBD not_RB appear_VB to_TO be_VB of_IN any_DT value_NN in_IN the_DT diagnosis_NN However_RB ,_, attempts_NNS are_VBP being_VBG made_VBN to_TO obtain_VB tuberculin_NN prepared_VBN from_IN the_DT strain_NN of_IN acid-alcohol-fast_JJ bacilli_NN encountered_VBN in_IN ducks_NNS at_IN Nagpur_NNP ._.
It_PRP is_VBZ likely_JJ that_IN this_DT tuberculin_NN may_MD give_VB us_PRP some_DT reliable_JJ results_NNS ._.
This_DT work_NN was_VBD carried_VBN out_IN and_CC is_VBZ being_VBG continued_VBN under_IN a_DT Poultry_NNP Research_NNP Scheme_NNP ,_, financed_VBD jointly_RB by_IN the_DT Imperial_NNP Council_NNP of_IN Agricultural_NNP Research_NNP and_CC the_DT Government_NNP of_IN Central_NNP Provinces_NNPS and_CC Berar_NNP ._.

Quoted_VBN by_IN Gordon_NNP ECHINOCOCCOSIS_NNP IN_NNP BOVINES_NNP By_IN M._NNP MAQSOOD_NNP ,_, Punjab_NNP Veterinary_NNP College_NNP ,_, Lahore_NNP (_( Received_VBN for_IN publication_NN on_IN 15_CD September_NNP 1945_CD )_) (_( With_IN Plate_NNP V_NNP )_) ECHINOCOCCUS_NNP cysts_NNS (_( E._NNP polymorphus_RB and_CC E._NNP multilocularis_NNP )_) ,_, the_DT so-called_JJ hydatids_NNS representing_VBG the_DT asexual_JJ stage_NN of_IN Echinococcus_NNP granulosus_NN [_NNP Batsch_NNP ,_, 1786_CD ]_NN ,_, a_DT cestode_NN inhabiting_VBG principally_RB the_DT small_JJ intestine_NN of_IN the_DT dog_NN ,_, occurs_VBZ frequently_RB in_IN the_DT liver_NN ,_, lungs_NNS ,_, spleen_NN and_CC rarely_RB in_IN other_JJ organs_NNS of_IN herbivora_NN ,_, man_NN ,_, etc._FW ,_, but_CC most_JJS often_RB in_IN ruminants_NNS and_CC the_DT pig_NN ._.
According_VBG to_TO Neumann_NNP [_NNP 1905_CD ]_NNP ,_, Ostertag_NNP [_NNP 1907_CD ]_NNP and_CC Cameron_NNP [_NNP 1934_CD ]_NNP ,_, the_DT cysts_NNS are_VBP met_VBN with_IN in_IN various_JJ organs_NNS ,_, the_DT liver_NN being_VBG the_DT most_RBS favourite_JJ seat_NN ,_, then_RB lungs_NNS ,_, spleen_NN and_CC after_IN them_PRP kidneys_NNS ,_, heart_NN muscle_NN ,_, intestinal_JJ wall_NN ,_, serous_JJ membranes_NNS ,_, bone_NN marrow_NN ,_, lymph_JJ glands_NNS ,_, thyroid_NN ,_, uterus_NN ,_, udder_NN and_CC very_RB rarely_RB in_IN the_DT brain_NN ,_, skeleton_JJ muscle_NN and_CC eyes_NNS ._.
Hemann_NNP [_NN 1934_CD ]_NN recorded_VBD echinococcus_JJ cysts_NNS in_IN almost_RB every_DT organ_JJ including_VBG most_JJS of_IN the_DT lymph_JJ glands_NNS of_IN a_DT cow_NN which_WDT was_VBD diagnosed_VBN as_IN a_DT case_NN of_IN tuberculosis_NN during_IN life_NN ._.
Monnig_NNP [_NN 1941_CD ]_NN in_IN South_NNP Africa_NNP ,_, states_VBZ that_IN in_IN cattle_NNS harbouring_VBG hydatids_NNS only_RB 10_CD per_IN cent_NN of_IN the_DT cysts_NNS are_VBP fertile_JJ ,_, the_DT rest_NN being_VBG sterile_JJ (_( without_IN brood_NN capsules_NNS and_CC scolices_NNS )_) ._.
In_IN most_JJS countries_NNS ,_, it_PRP has_VBZ been_VBN found_VBN that_IN as_RB many_JJ as_IN 75_CD per_IN cent_NN of_IN cattle_NNS are_VBP infested_VBN with_IN hydatids_NNS [_NNP Cameron_NNP ,_, 1934_CD :_: Monnig_NNP ,_, 1941_CD ]_NN ._.
INCIDENCE_NNP OF_NNP BOVINE_NNP ECHINCOCCOSIS_NNP IN_NNP INDIA_NNP In_IN India_NNP the_DT available_JJ literature_NN shows_VBZ that_IN 70_CD to_TO 80_CD per_IN cent_NN or_CC even_RB higher_JJR [_JJ Pease_NNP ,_, 1902_CD ;_: Enwards_NNS ,_, 1927_CD ]_NN of_IN bovines_NNS harbour_PRP$ hydatids_NNS of_IN Taenia_NNP echinococcus_NNP usually_RB without_IN exhibiting_VBG clinical_JJ symptoms_NNS ,_, and_CC that_IN the_DT cysts_NNS are_VBP frequently_RB seen_VBN in_IN the_DT liver_NN ,_, lungs_NNS ,_, spleen_NN and_CC rarely_RB in_IN other_JJ organs_NNS [_JJ Gaiger_NNP ,_, 1915_CD ;_: Bhalerao_NNP ,_, 1935_CD ]_NN ._.
Ganguley_NNP [_NN 1923_CD ]_NN in_IN Bengal_NNP ,_, Rahimuddin_NNP [_NNP 1943_CD ]_NNP in_IN Madras_NNP and_CC Maqsood_NNP [_NNP 1944_CD ]_NN at_IN Lahore_NNP have_VBP recorded_VBN echinococcus_NN cysts_NNS in_IN the_DT heart_NN muscle_NN of_IN a_DT cow_NN ,_, a_DT bullock_NN and_CC a_DT buffalo-cow_JJ respectively_RB ._.
Ayyar_NNP [_NN 1941_CD ]_NN recorded_VBN multiple_JJ hydatids_NNS in_IN the_DT lungs_NNS ,_, liver_RB ,_, spleen_JJ and_CC two_CD on_IN the_DT trachea_NN of_IN a_DT cow_NN that_WDT died_VBD suddenly_RB ._.
With_IN a_DT view_NN to_TO ascertaining_VBG the_DT percentage_NN of_IN infestation_NN in_IN bovines_NNS ,_, post-mortem_JJ examination_NN were_VBD performed_VBN on_IN 34_CD cattle_NNS and_CC 57_CD buffaloes_NNS dying_VBG of_IN various_JJ diseases_NNS ,_, at_IN the_DT Punjab_NNP Veterinary_NNP College_NNP Hospital_NNP ,_, Lahore_NNP ,_, from_IN 15_CD October_NNP 1942_CD to_TO 15_CD March_NNP ,_, 1945_CD ,_, while_IN carcases_NNS of_IN 28_CD cattle_NNS and_CC 283_CD buffaloes_NNS were_VBD examined_VBN at_IN the_DT Lahore_NNP Corporation_NNP Beef_NNP Slaughter_NNP House_NNP during_IN the_DT years_NNS 1943-44_RB ._.
It_PRP was_VBD observed_VBN that_IN 66.1_CD per_IN cent_NN of_IN cattle_NNS and_CC 68.8_CD per_IN cent_NN of_IN buffaloes_NNS harboured_VBN hydatids_NNS (_( Table_NNP I_PRP )_) ._.
Cysts_NNS varying_VBG in_IN size_NN from_IN that_DT of_IN a_DT pea_NN to_TO a_DT medium-sized_JJ football_NN ,_, were_VBD seen_VBN in_IN animals_NNS of_IN all_DT ages_NNS and_CC were_VBD often_RB numerous_JJ in_IN older_JJR animals_NNS ._.
This_DT high_JJ percentage_NN of_IN infestation_NN in_IN bovines_NNS is_VBZ associated_VBN with_IN the_DT large_JJ number_NN of_IN stray_JJ dogs_NNS in_IN Lahore_NNP ,_, 24_CD per_IN cent_NN of_IN which_WDT are_VBP infested_VBN with_IN granulosus_NN [_NN Pease_NNP ,_, 1902_CD ]_NN ._.
Existing_VBG conditions_NNS are_VBP such_JJ that_IN stray_JJ dogs_NNS have_VBP easy_JJ access_NN to_TO slaughter_NN houses_NNS ,_, meat_NN shops_NNS ,_, etc._NN ,_, and_CC are_VBP fed_VBN by_IN butchers_NNS on_IN con-_NN demned_VBN organs_NNS containing_VBG hydatids_NNS ,_, etc_FW ._.
with_IN the_DT result_NN that_IN in_IN due_JJ time_NN the_DT scolices_NNS of_IN the_DT fertile_JJ cysts_NNS develop_VBP into_IN adult_NN worms_NNS in_IN their_PRP$ intestines_NNS ._.
Consequently_RB ,_, this_DT cycle_NN of_IN infestation_NN goes_VBZ on_IN in_IN the_DT intermediate_JJ hosts_NNS and_CC the_DT dog_NN ._.
The_DT importance_NN of_IN hydatids_NNS in_IN domestic_JJ animals_NNS is_VBZ mainly_RB due_JJ to_TO the_DT condemnation_NN of_IN edible_JJ organs_NNS ,_, but_CC when_WRB in_IN large_JJ numbers_NNS ,_, they_PRP interfere_VBP with_IN the_DT functions_NNS of_IN various_JJ organs_NNS as_IN well_RB and_CC at_IN times_NNS may_MD cause_VB death_NN (_( vide_IN infra_NN )_) 28_CD M._NNP MAQSOOD_NNP 29_CD TABLE_NNP 1_CD Incidence_NNP and_CC relative_JJ distribution_NN of_IN hydatids_NNS in_IN the_DT organs_NNS of_IN cattle_NNS and_CC buffaloes_NNS ,_, Lahore_NNP Hydatids_NNP in_IN Species_NNP No_NNP ._.
of_IN animals_NNS examin-_JJ ed_NN ._.
No_DT ._.
in-_JJ fested_VBD Extent_NNP of_IN infesta-_JJ tion_NN Liver_NNP ,_, and_CC lungs_NNS Liver_NNP ,_, lungs_NNS and_CC spleen_JJ Lungs_NNP Liver_NNP Liver_NNP ,_, lungs_VBZ spleen_NN and_CC heart_NN Liver_NNP ,_, lungs_NNS ,_, spleen_NN ,_, heart_NN ,_, and_CC kidneys_NNS Liver_NNP ,_, lungs_NNS and_CC heart_NN Liver_NNP ,_, lungs_NNS ,_, spleen_NN and_CC kidneys_NNS Per_NNP cent-_JJ age_NN in-_JJ fested_VBD Light_NNP 10_CD 8_CD 5_CD 4_CD ..._: ..._: ..._: ..._: Cattle_NNP 62_CD 41_CD Heavy_NNP 4_CD 3_CD 2_CD 2_CD 2_CD 1_CD ..._: 66.1_CD Light_NNP 54_CD 32_CD 40_CD 45_CD 1_CD ..._: ..._: ..._: Buffaloes_VBZ 340_CD 234_CD Heavy_NNP 19_CD 9_CD 13_CD 15_CD 2_CD 1_CD 2_CD 1_CD 68.8_CD CARDIAC_NNP ECHINOCOCCOSIS_NNP Cardiac_NNP hydatids_NNS produce_VBP no_DT clinical_JJ symptoms_NNS during_IN life_NN by_IN which_WDT their_PRP$ presence_NN may_MD be_VB suspected_VBN ._.
Very_RB large_JJ ones_NNS may_MD give_VB rise_NN to_TO cardiac_JJ disturbances_NNS but_CC mostly_RB attract_JJ attention_NN when_WRB they_PRP cause_VBP sudden_JJ death_NN from_IN cardiac_JJ paralysis_NN ,_, rupture_NN of_IN the_DT heart_NN or_CC compression_NN of_IN the_DT vessels_NNS and_CC obstructed_JJ circulation_NN ._.
Ganguley_NNP [_NN 1942_CD ]_NN described_VBD a_DT case_NN of_IN cardiac_JJ echinococcosis_NN in_IN a_DT bullock_NN that_WDT died_VBD suddenly_RB due_JJ to_TO the_DT rupture_NN of_IN a_DT degenerated_JJ cyst_NN ._.
Rahimuddin_NNP [_NN 1943_CD ]_NN recorded_VBD a_DT case_NN of_IN heart_NN failure_NN in_IN a_DT cow_NN due_JJ to_TO the_DT presence_NN of_IN a_DT goose-egg_JJ sized_JJ fertile_NN echinococcus_NN cyst_NN in_IN the_DT wall_NN of_IN the_DT left_JJ ventricle_NN ._.
Out_IN of_IN nine_CD cases_NNS seen_VBN by_IN the_DT author_NN ,_, death_NN occurred_VBD suddenly_RB in_IN five_CD from_IN heart_NN failure_NN ._.
Site_NNP and_CC size_NN of_IN echinococcus_NN cysts_NNS in_IN the_DT heart_NN The_DT cysts_NNS may_MD develop_VB in_IN any_DT part_NN of_IN the_DT heart_NN but_CC usually_RB either_RB on_IN its_PRP$ external_JJ or_CC internal_JJ surface_NN or_CC in_IN the_DT ventricular_JJ septum_NN near_IN the_DT base_NN or_CC point_NN of_IN the_DT heart_NN ,_, though_IN more_RBR frequently_RB in_IN the_DT walls_NNS of_IN the_DT ventricles_NNS ,_, especially_RB the_DT left_JJ one_NN ._.
Cysts_NNS were_VBD distributed_VBN in_IN the_DT heart_NN muscle_NN as_IN follows_VBZ :_: Left_NNP ventricular_NN wall_NN ..._: ..._: ..._: ..._: ..._: 5_CD cases_NNS Right_RB do_VBP do_VB ..._: ..._: ..._: ..._: ..._: ._. 3_CD do_NN ._.
Interventricular_JJ septum_NN ..._: ..._: ..._: 1_CD do_VBP ._.
The_DT hydatids_NNS vary_VBP greatly_RB in_IN size_NN from_IN that_DT of_IN a_DT marble_NN to_TO a_DT tennis_NN ball_NN ,_, or_CC excep-_JJ tionally_RB larger_JJR ._.
Number_NNP and_CC nature_NN of_IN echinococcus_NN cysts_NNS in_IN the_DT heart_NN In_IN all_PDT the_DT cases_NNS of_IN cardiac_JJ echinococcosis_NN there_EX is_VBZ only_RB one_CD vesicle_NN which_WDT is_VBZ simple_JJ ,_, i._JJ e._NN it_PRP has_VBZ no_DT secondary_JJ vesicles_NNS ,_, either_DT internal_JJ or_CC external_JJ to_TO it_PRP ._.
Out_IN of_IN nine_CD cysts_NNS found_VBN in_IN the_DT heart_NN ,_, six_CD were_VBD fertile_NN ._.
Case_NNP reports_VBZ 1_CD ._.
The_DT subject_NN was_VBD a_DT black_JJ Murrah_NNP buffalo-cow_NN ,_, age_NN about_IN seven_CD years_NNS ._.
According_VBG to_TO the_DT owner_NN ,_, the_DT buffalo_NN was_VBD feeding_VBG well_RB on_IN 26_CD September_NNP 1943_CD but_CC suddenly_RB trembl-_JJ ed_NN ,_, fell_VBD down_RB and_CC died_VBD within_IN a_DT few_JJ minutes_NNS ._.
There_EX was_VBD no_DT history_NN of_IN previous_JJ disease_NN ._.
On_IN post-mortem_JJ examination_NN ,_, the_DT carcase_NN was_VBD found_VBN to_TO be_VB in_IN excellent_JJ condition_NN ._.
Microscopical_JJ examination_NN of_IN blood_NN films_NNS was_VBD negative_JJ for_IN Bacillus_NNP anthracis_NN ._.
No_DT lesion_NN of_IN pathological_JJ significance_NN was_VBD seen_VBN in_IN the_DT abdominal_JJ organs_NNS except_IN the_DT rumen_NNS ,_, which_WDT was_VBD 30_CD Echinococcosis_NNP in_IN Bovines_NNP distended_VBD with_IN undigested_JJ food-stuff_NN ,_, and_CC the_DT liver_NN which_WDT contained_VBD numerous_JJ echinococcus_NN cysts_NNS ._.
The_DT lungs_NNS also_RB contained_VBD hydatids_NNS ._.
The_DT pericardium_NN over_IN the_DT left_JJ ventricle_NN was_VBD distended_VBN but_CC was_VBD not_RB adherent_JJ to_TO the_DT myocardium_NN ._.
The_DT left_NN ventricular_NN wall_NN was_VBD distended_VBN and_CC a_DT simple_JJ fertile_JJ echinococcus_NN cysts_NNS ,_, about_IN the_DT size_NN of_IN a_DT tennis_NN ball_NN ,_, was_VBD embedded_VBN in_IN it_PRP ._.
The_DT auricles_NNS and_CC the_DT ventricles_NNS were_VBD practically_RB empty_JJ ._.
The_DT cause_NN of_IN sudden_JJ death_NN in_IN this_DT animal_NN was_VBD cessation_NN of_IN cardiac_JJ function_NN ,_, evidently_RB resulting_VBG from_IN the_DT increased_JJ pressure_NN caused_VBN by_IN the_DT distended_JJ rumen_NNS on_IN the_DT echinococcos-_JJ ed_JJ heart_NN [_NNP Maqsood_NNP ,_, 1944_CD ]_NN ._.
2_CD ._.
An_DT aged_JJ black_JJ spotted_VBD cow_NN was_VBD being_VBG treated_VBN for_IN metritis_NN in_IN the_DT College_NNP Hospital_NNP ,_, and_CC on_IN 7_CD February_NNP 1914_CD ,_, she_PRP looked_VBD practically_RB normal_JJ ._.
The_DT following_JJ day_NN the_DT owner_NN reported_VBD that_IN during_IN the_DT night_NN the_DT cow_NN suddenly_RB fell_VBD down_RB and_CC died_VBD ._.
On_IN post-mortem_JJ examination_NN ,_, a_DT few_JJ calcified_JJ and_CC a_DT number_NN of_IN sterile_JJ hydatids_NNS were_VBD seen_VBN in_IN the_DT liver_NN and_CC two_CD in_IN the_DT spleen_NN ._.
Hydatids_NNS were_VBD also_RB seen_VBN in_IN the_DT lungs_NNS ._.
Both_DT auricles_NNS and_CC ventricles_NNS were_VBD practically_RB empty_JJ and_CC an_DT egg-sized_JJ fertile_NN E._NNP polymorphus_RB cyst_NN was_VBD present_JJ in_IN the_DT ventricular_JJ septum_NN near_IN the_DT apex_NN of_IN the_DT heart_NN (_( Plate_NNP V_NNP ,_, fig_NN ._.
1_CD )_) ._.
The_DT mucous_JJ membrane_NN of_IN the_DT uterus_NN was_VBD thickened_VBN and_CC the_DT horns_NNS slightly_RB congested_VBN ._.
3_CD ._.
An_DT aged_JJ black_JJ buffalo-cow_NN was_VBD brought_VBN to_TO the_DT College_NNP Hospital_NNP ,_, for_IN anti-_JJ rinderpest_NN inoculation_NN on_IN 16_CD February_NNP 1944_CD The_DT buffalo_NN was_VBD tethered_VBN with_IN other_JJ cases_NNS but_CC within_IN a_DT short_JJ time_NN ,_, she_PRP shivered_VBD ,_, fell_VBD down_RB and_CC died_VBD ._.
On_IN post-mortem_JJ examination_NN ,_, the_DT carcase_NN appeared_VBD in_IN good_JJ bodily_JJ condition_NN ._.
Miscroscopic_NNP examination_NN of_IN the_DT blood_NN films_NNS was_VBD negative_JJ for_IN any_DT pathogenic_JJ bacteria_NNS or_CC protozoa_NN ._.
Numerous_JJ sterile_JJ and_CC a_DT few_JJ calcified_JJ hydatids_NNS were_VBD seen_VBN in_IN the_DT liver_NN ,_, lungs_NNS ,_, and_CC spleen_NN ._.
A_DT ruptured_JJ hydatid_NN about_IN the_DT size_NN of_IN a_DT walnut_NN was_VBD seen_VBN in_IN the_DT internal_JJ surface_NN of_IN the_DT left_NN ventricular_NN wall_NN ,_, at_IN about_IN its_PRP$ middle_NN ._.
4_CD ._.
A_DT six_CD year_NN old_JJ Dhani_NNP bullock_NN was_VBD being_VBG used_VBN in_IN the_DT cart_NN ._.
As_IN narrated_VBN by_IN the_DT cart_NN driver_NN ,_, on_IN 27_CD February_NNP 1945_CD ,_, the_DT bullock_NN exerted_VBD much_RB more_JJR than_IN normal_JJ and_CC while_IN doing_VBG so_IN it_PRP shivered_VBD ,_, staggered_VBD ,_, fell_VBD down_RB and_CC died_VBD at_IN the_DT spot_NN ._.
On_IN post-mortem_JJ examination_NN ,_, the_DT blood_NN was_VBD negative_JJ for_IN any_DT pathogenic_JJ bacteria_NNS or_CC protozoa_NN ._.
Numerous_JJ echinococcus_NN cysts_NNS were_VBD seen_VBN in_IN the_DT liver_NN ,_, lungs_NNS ,_, spleen_NN and_CC three_CD (_( one_CD fertile_NN and_CC two_CD degenerated_VBD )_) in_IN the_DT right_JJ kidney_NN ._.
A_DT fertile_NN E._NNP polymorphus_RB cyst_VBZ about_IN the_DT size_NN of_IN a_DT hen_NN 's_POS egg_NN was_VBD seen_VBN in_IN the_DT left_NN ventricular_JJ wall_NN just_RB below_IN the_DT auricule_NN ventricular_JJ junction_NN ._.
Both_DT auricles_NNS and_CC ventricles_NNS were_VBD empty_JJ ._.
As_IN the_DT bullock_NN over-exerted_JJ ,_, its_PRP$ heart_NN ,_, which_WDT was_VBD already_RB diseased_VBN ,_, ultimately_RB ceased_VBD functioning_NN and_CC death_NN occurred_VBD from_IN heart_NN failure_NN ._.
5_CD ._.
An_DT emaciated_VBN aged_JJ black_JJ buffalo-cow_NN suddenly_RB died_VBD in_IN the_DT College_NNP Hospital_NNP on_IN 7_CD March_NNP 1945_CD ._.
Previously_RB ,_, the_DT animal_NN had_VBD been_VBN feeding_VBG and_CC ruminating_VBG well_RB ._.
On_IN post-mortem_JJ examination_NN ,_, hydatids_NNS were_VBD seen_VBN in_IN the_DT liver_NN ,_, lungs_NNS and_CC spleen_NN and_CC one_CD in_IN the_DT right_JJ kidney_NN ._.
In_IN the_DT internal_JJ surface_NN of_IN the_DT right_JJ ventricular_NN wall_VB a_DT ruptured_JJ hydatid_NN about_IN one_CD inch_NN in_IN diameter_NN was_VBD seen_VBN in_IN its_PRP$ upper_JJ third_NN ._.
HEPATIC_NNP AND_NNP PULMONARY_NNP ECHINOCOCCOSIS_NNP Echinococcus_NNP costs_NNS ,_, mostly_RB sterile_JJ ,_, are_VBP commonly_RB seen_VBN in_IN the_DT liver_NN and_CC lungs_NNS of_IN bovines_NNS and_CC these_DT organs_NNS are_VBP enlarged_VBN in_IN proportion_NN to_TO the_DT number_NN and_CC size_NN of_IN cysts_NNS ._.
At_IN any_DT stage_NN of_IN development_NN ,_, dath_NN of_IN the_DT hydatid_NN with_IN subsequent_JJ inspissation_NN ,_, caseation_NN ,_, calcification_NN or_CC rarely_RB suppuration_NN of_IN its_PRP$ contents_NNS may_MD occur_VB ._.
In_IN an_DT old-standing_JJ cyst_NN ,_, its_PRP$ walls_NNS may_MD be_VB thickened_VBN due_JJ to_TO the_DT deposition_NN of_IN calcium_NN salts_NNS ,_, etc_FW ._.
the_DT liquid_NN contents_NNS diminish_JJ and_CC its_PRP$ walls_NNS approximate_VBP ._.
Finally_RB ,_, the_DT vesicle_NN disappears_VBZ and_CC the_DT hydatid_NN is_VBZ transformed_VBN into_IN a_DT calcareous_JJ mass_NN ,_, a_DT stage_NN generally_RB seen_VBN in_IN the_DT liver_NN of_IN ruminants_NNS ._.
A_DT few_JJ hydatids_NNS may_MD not_RB give_VB rise_NN to_TO clinical_JJ symptoms_NNS ._.
However_RB ,_, at_IN times_NNS ,_, it_PRP was_VBD observed_VBN that_IN the_DT liver_NN and_CC lung_NN tissues_NNS were_VBD practically_RB replaced_VBN by_IN the_DT cysts_NNS and_CC the_DT animals_NNS suffered_VBD from_IN chronic_JJ digestive_NN and_CC respiratory_NN disturbances_NNS during_IN life_NN ._.
In_IN two_CD buffaloes_NNS and_CC three_CD cows_NNS ,_, death_NN occurred_VBD suddenly_RB and_CC on_IN post-mortem_JJ examination_NN large_JJ numbers_NNS of_IN hydatids_NNS were_VBD present_JJ in_IN the_DT lungs_NNS ,_, liver_NN and_CC spleen_NN ._.
In_IN another_DT cow_NN ,_, death_NN occurred_VBD from_IN septic_JJ peritonitis_NN caused_VBN by_IN rupture_NN of_IN a_DT suppurating_JJ cyst_NN situated_VBD superficially_RB in_IN Indian_JJ J._NNP vet_NN ._.
Sci._NNP ,_, Vol_NNP ._.

Sci._NNP ,_, Vol_NNP ._.
XVI_NN ,_, Part_NNP I_PRP [_VBP NLS_JJ note_NN :_: a_DT graphic_JJ appears_VBZ here_RB -_: see_VBP image_NN of_IN page_NN ]_NNP F._NNP medinensis_NN migrating_VBG from_IN the_DT right_JJ metatarsus_NN of_IN a_DT bull-terrier_JJ M._NNP MAQSOOD_NNP 31_CD the_DT liver_NN parenchyma_NN ,_, while_IN numerous_JJ other_JJ sterile_JJ unruptured_JJ hydatids_NNS were_VBD present_JJ in_IN the_DT rest_NN of_IN the_DT liver_NN and_CC in_IN the_DT lungs_NNS ._.
SUMMARY_NNP 1_CD ._.
The_DT incidence_NN and_CC relative_JJ distribution_NN of_IN echirrococcus_NN cysts_NNS in_IN the_DT liver_NN ,_, lungs_NNS ,_, spleen_NN ,_, heart_NN ,_, and_CC kidneys_NNS of_IN cattle_NNS and_CC buffaloes_NNS at_IN Lahore_NNP is_VBZ recorded_VBN ._.
2_CD ._.
The_DT hydatids_NNS in_IN the_DT liver_NN and_CC lungs_NNS vary_VBP greatly_RB in_IN size_NN from_IN that_DT of_IN a_DT pea_NN to_TO a_DT medium-sized_JJ football_NN and_CC are_VBP mostly_RB sterile_JJ ._.
In_IN cases_NNS of_IN heavy_JJ infestation_NN where_WRB the_DT lung_NN and_CC liver_NN tissue_NN is_VBZ practically_RB replaced_VBN by_IN these_DT cysts_NNS ,_, death_NN may_MD supervene_VB ._.
3_CD ._.
Generally_RB fertile_JJ E._NNP polymorphus_NN cysts_NNS of_IN variable_JJ size_NN appear_IN more_RBR commonly_RB in_IN the_DT left_NN ventricular_NN wall_NN than_IN in_IN other_JJ parts_NNS of_IN the_DT heart_NN ,_, and_CC when_WRB they_PRP are_VBP of_IN large_JJ size_NN ,_, sudden_JJ death_NN may_MD result_VB from_IN cardiac_JJ disturbances_NNS ._.

EQUINE_NNP INFLUENZA_NNP (_( Pink_NNP eye_NN ,_, influenza_JJ catarrhalis_NN ,_, typhoid_JJ fever_NN ,_, pferdestaupe_NN )_) 'Malignant_POS epidemics_NNS '_POS which_WDT occurred_VBD about_IN 1815_CD and_CC the_DT stringent_NN methods_NNS which_WDT were_VBD em-_JJ ployed_NNS to_TO control_VB them_PRP have_VBP been_VBN described_VBN by_IN Youatt_NNP [_NNP 1831_CD ]_NNP ._.

1941_CD ]_NN ,_, and_CC it_PRP is_VBZ still_RB fairly_RB prevalent_JJ in_IN India_NNP ._.

A_DT characteristic_JJ feature_NN is_VBZ the_DT marked_JJ prostration_NN ,_, and_CC muscular_JJ and_CC cardiac_JJ weakness_NN during_IN the_DT early_JJ febrile_NN stage_NN ._.
The_DT temperature_NN curve_NN is_VBZ much_RB more_RBR erratic_JJ than_IN in_IN equine_JJ pneumonia_NN ._.

The_DT conjunctiv_NN assumes_VBZ a_DT deep_JJ red_JJ to_TO mahogany_VB colour_NN ,_, the_DT eyelids_NNS are_VBP usually_RB swollen_VBN and_CC JOHN_NNP FRANCIS_NNP 35_CD Research_NNP work_NN on_IN the_DT aetiology_NN of_IN influenza_NN has_VBZ been_VBN reviewed_VBN by_IN Edwards_NNP [_NNP 1935a_CD ]_NN and_CC by_IN Todd_NNP and_CC Souter_NNP [_NNP 1938_CD ]_NNP ._.
It_PRP is_VBZ a_DT highly_RB infectious_JJ virus_NN disease_NN and_CC may_MD be_VB set_VBN up_RP by_IN the_DT subcutaneous_JJ inoculation_NN of_IN infected_JJ blood_NN [_NN this_DT fact_NN has_VBZ been_VBN confirmed_VBN by_IN Dale_NNP and_CC Dollahite_NNP ,_, 1939_CD ]_NN or_CC by_IN direct_JJ or_CC indirect_JJ contact_NN ._.

DISCUSSION_NNP The_DT four_CD respiratory_NN diseases_NNS have_VBP been_VBN described_VBN as_IN though_IN they_PRP were_VBD separate_JJ entities_NNS ,_, and_CC some_DT of_IN their_PRP$ main_JJ features_NNS are_VBP summarized_VBN in_IN Table_NNP I_PRP ,_, but_CC it_PRP must_MD be_VB admitted_VBN that_IN ,_, whilst_VBD the_DT typical_JJ diseases_NNS can_MD be_VB recognized_VBN ,_, there_EX are_VBP many_JJ outbreaks_NNS which_WDT even_RB experienced_VBD workers_NNS are_VBP unable_JJ to_TO classify_VB [_NNP Theiler_NNP ,_, 1918_CD ]_NN ._.
JOHN_NNP FRANCIS_NNP 39_CD TABLE_NNP I_PRP 40_CD Respirntory_NNP Diseases_NNP of_IN the_DT Horse_NNP also_RB discussed_VBD the_DT difficulty_NN of_IN differentiating_VBG strangles_NNS from_IN the_DT various_JJ catarrhal_JJ affections_NNS of_IN horses_NNS ._.
Beller_NNP and_CC Traub_NNP [_NNP 1941_CD ]_NNP noted_VBD that_IN strangles_NNS and_CC infectious_JJ catarrh_NN might_MD occur_VB together_RB in_IN the_DT same_JJ horse_NN and_CC after_IN a_DT very_RB careful_JJ study_NN put_VBD forward_RB the_DT interesting_JJ suggestion_NN that_IN they_PRP are_VBP both_DT primarily_RB due_JJ to_TO the_DT same_JJ virus_NN and_CC that_IN the_DT different_JJ symptoms_NNS are_VBP due_JJ to_TO different_JJ secondary_JJ invaders_NNS or_CC predisposition_NN of_IN the_DT horse_NN ._.
Rexroth_NNP [_NNP 1941_CD ]_NNP ,_, as_IN a_DT result_NN of_IN clinical_JJ and_CC patholygical_JJ investigations_NNS ,_, supported_VBD this_DT view_NN ._.
Luhrs_NNP [_NN 1933_CD ]_NN ._.
whilst_NN admitting_VBG that_IN no_DT one_NN can_MD mistake_VB true_JJ epidemic_JJ equine_NN influenza_NN ,_, states_VBZ that_IN there_EX are_VBP many_JJ outbreaks_NNS of_IN disease_NN which_WDT one_CD can_MD not_RB easily_RB classify_VB and_CC Law_NNP [_NN 1902_CD ]_NN ,_, who_WP was_VBD obviously_RB familiar_JJ with_IN the_DT epidemic_JJ disease_NN ,_, says_VBZ that_IN in_IN the_DT slighter_NN cases_NNS the_DT lesions_NNS are_VBP often_RB confined_VBN to_TO the_DT anterior_JJ part_NN of_IN the_DT respiratory_NN organs_NNS which_WDT are_VBP congested_VBN and_CC red_JJ ,_, the_DT lesions_NNS may_MD extend_VB to_TO the_DT bronchi_NN ._.
In_IN human_JJ medicine_NN there_EX are_VBP similar_JJ differences_NNS between_IN epidemic_JJ and_CC sporadic_JJ influenza_NN ,_, and_CC ,_, although_IN in_IN some_DT outbreaks_NNS influenza_VBP '_'' A_NNP '_POS or_CC '_POS B_NNP '_POS virus_NN can_MD be_VB identified_VBN ,_, in_IN other_JJ clinically_RB identical_JJ outbreaks_NNS no_DT virus_NN can_MD be_VB isolated_VBN ._.

105_CD ,_, 39_CD RECENT_NNP work_NN at_IN the_DT University_NNP of_IN Wisconsin_NNP shows_NNS that_WDT faulty_VBP nutrition_NN of_IN calves_NNS is_VBZ largely_RB responsible_JJ for_IN the_DT high_JJ incidence_NN and_CC fatalities_NNS in_IN scours_NN ,_, pneumonias_NN ,_, navel_JJ infections_NNS and_CC general_JJ unthriftiness_NN and_CC that_IN the_DT situation_NN radically_RB improves_VBZ with_IN proper_JJ nutrition_NN of_IN calves_NNS ._.
Insufficiency_NN of_IN vitamin_NN A_NNP and_CC nicotinic_JJ acid_NN in_IN the_DT diet_NN is_VBZ said_VBD to_TO be_VB one_CD important_JJ cause_NN of_IN scour_NN in_IN calves_NNS (_( British_JJ workers_NNS have_VBP shown_VBN ,_, however_RB ,_, that_DT lack_NN of_IN vitamin_NN A_NNP is_VBZ not_RB a_DT causal_NN but_CC a_DT predisposing_JJ factor_NN )_) ._.
Calves_NNS are_VBP lacking_VBG or_CC deficient_NN in_IN vitamin_NN A_NN at_IN birth_NN ,_, and_CC it_PRP is_VBZ vital_JJ to_TO their_PRP$ well-being_JJ and_CC growth_NN that_IN colostrum_NN be_VB available_JJ in_IN adequate_JJ amounts_NNS not_RB only_RB as_IN a_DT rich_JJ source_NN of_IN vitamin_NN A_NNP but_CC also_RB of_IN ascorbic_JJ acid_NN (_( vitamin_JJ C_NNP )_) ,_, vitamin_JJ D_NNP and_CC riboflavin_NN ._.
Severe_NNP vitamin_VBZ A_DT deficiency_NN is_VBZ exhibited_VBN in_IN symptoms_NNS of_IN '_'' cold_NN in_IN the_DT head_NN '_POS with_IN cough_NN and_CC scour_VB initially_RB mild_JJ but_CC often_RB progressing_VBG rapidly_RB to_TO a_DT fatal_JJ outcome_NN within_IN 10_CD days_NNS of_IN onset_NN of_IN symptoms_NNS ;_: mild_JJ deficiency_NN is_VBZ shown_VBN in_IN retarded_JJ growth_NN ,_, a_DT rough_JJ coat_NN and_CC general_JJ unthriftiness_NN ._.
The_DT reserve_NN of_IN nicotinic_JJ acid_NN in_IN the_DT new-born_JJ calf_NN is_VBZ just_RB sufficient_JJ for_IN the_DT first_JJ few_JJ days_NNS of_IN life_NN ._.
Colostrum_NNP is_VBZ poor_JJ in_IN this_DT factor_NN ,_, and_CC as_IN some_DT little_JJ time_NN must_MD elapse_VB before_IN rumen_NNS synthesis_NN of_IN the_DT vitamin_NN B_NNP group_NN is_VBZ established_VBN in_IN the_DT growing_VBG calf_NN ,_, and_CC as_IN the_DT absorption_NN of_IN vitamin_NN A_NNP is_VBZ to_TO a_DT large_JJ extent_NN governed_VBN by_IN an_DT adequate_JJ supply_NN of_IN nicotinic_JJ acid_NN in_IN the_DT diet_NN ,_, the_DT latter_JJ factor_NN must_MD be_VB supplied_VBN in_IN adequate_JJ amounts_NNS to_TO calves_NNS at_IN birth_NN ._.
Further_RB nicotinic_JJ acid_NN maintains_VBZ the_DT muscular_JJ tonus_NN of_IN the_DT digestive_JJ tract_NN and_CC thereby_RB blood_JJ circulation_NN tonus_NN of_IN all_PDT the_DT organs_NNS of_IN digestion_NN ._.
Although_IN the_DT blood_NN level_NN of_IN ascorpic_JJ acid_NN is_VBZ high_JJ at_IN birth_NN ,_, this_DT factor_NN is_VBZ rapidly_RB utilised_JJ within_IN the_DT first_JJ few_JJ days_NNS of_IN life_NN and_CC the_DT calf_NN must_MD then_RB rely_VB on_IN such_JJ supplies_NNS of_IN this_DT factor_NN as_IN are_VBP available_JJ in_IN colostrum_NN until_IN ,_, at_IN about_IN the_DT third_JJ week_NN of_IN life_NN ,_, the_DT animal_JJ commences_NNS to_TO make_VB this_DT essential_JJ factor_NN within_IN its_PRP$ own_JJ tissues_NNS ._.
The_DT blood_NN level_NN of_IN ascorbic_JJ acid_NN is_VBZ low_JJ in_IN scours_NN ,_, calf_NN pneumonias_NNS and_CC navel-ill_JJ and_CC a_DT liberal_JJ supplement_NN to_TO the_DT diet_NN is_VBZ essential_JJ for_IN the_DT prevention_NN and_CC control_NN of_IN these_DT diseases_NNS ._.
Rickets_NNS is_VBZ occasionally_RB seen_VBN in_IN calves_NNS born_VBP the_DT year_NN when_WRB the_DT available_JJ sunshine_NN is_VBZ insufficient_JJ to_TO irradiate_VB the_DT skin_NN ergosterol_VBZ the_DT precursor_NN of_IN vitamin_NN D._NNP The_DT regular_JJ provision_NN of_IN the_DT essential_JJ vitamins_NNS in_IN the_DT correct_JJ proportions_NNS is_VBZ considered_VBN an_DT effec-_JJ tive_JJ insurance_NN against_IN the_DT common_JJ diseases_NNS to_TO which_WDT the_DT new-born_JJ calf_NN is_VBZ subject_JJ withine_IN the_DT first_JJ day_NN of_IN life_NN ._.
[_NN J._NNP F._NNP S_NNP ]_NNP Spread_NNP of_IN Strptococcus_NNP Agalaetiae_NNP (_( Imperial_NNP Bureau_NNP of_IN Animal_NNP Health_NNP ,_, New_NNP Haw_NNP ,_, Weybridge_NNP ,_, Surrey_NNP EnglandABSTRACTS_NNP 43_CD Str_NNP ._.
agalactiae_NN was_VBD found_VBN in_IN 6,406_CD (_( 38.8_CD per_IN cent_NN )_) of_IN the_DT group_NN of_IN samples_NNS previously_RB mentioned_VBN ._.
Clinical_JJ mastitis_NN was_VBD present_JJ in_IN 1_CD ,_, 284_CD (_( 7.8_CD per_IN cent_NN )_) of_IN these_DT cases_NNS ,_, but_CC 31_CD ._.
3_CD per_IN cent_NN of_IN these_DT clinical_JJ cases_NNS failed_VBD to_TO yield_VB the_DT organism_NN ._.
Another_DT disturbing_VBG factor_NN brought_VBD out_RP was_VBD the_DT fact_NN that_IN examinations_NNS vary_VBP so_RB widely_RB from_IN week_NN to_TO week_NN even_RB when_WRB conducted_VBN regularly_RB by_IN the_DT same_JJ workers_NNS ._.
In_IN any_DT group_NN of_IN cows_NNS subjected_VBN to_TO weekly_JJ examination_NN of_IN the_DT milk_NN and_CC of_IN teat_NN swabs_NNS ,_, a_DT very_RB high_JJ percentage_NN showed_VBD the_DT organism_NN to_TO be_VB present_JJ at_IN one_CD or_CC more_JJR examinations_NNS ._.
The_DT best_JJS group_NN of_IN cows_NNS in_IN this_DT respect_NN showed_VBD 45.7_CD per_IN cent_NN of_IN infection_NN ,_, while_IN the_DT poorest_JJS group_NN showed_VBD 100_CD per_IN cent_NN ._.
Some_DT cows_NNS showed_VBD positive_JJ milk_NN samples_NNS repeatedly_RB without_IN skin_JJ infection_NN ,_, while_IN others_NNS consistently_RB showed_VBD skin_JJ infection_NN without_IN any_DT positive_JJ results_NNS in_IN the_DT milk_NN ._.
It_PRP is_VBZ clear_JJ that_IN other_JJ factors_NNS may_MD be_VB concerned_VBN ,_, and_CC that_IN a_DT more_RBR adequate_JJ knowledge_NN of_IN the_DT pathogenesis_NN of_IN bovine_NN mastitis_NN is_VBZ needed_VBN before_IN a_DT successful_JJ attack_NN can_MD be_VB launched_VBN ._.
Segregation_NN and_CC elimination_NN is_VBZ too_RB slow_JJ ,_, too_RB uncertain_JJ ,_, and_CC too_RB costly_JJ ._.
[_JJ USIS_NNP No_NNP ._.
23_CD ]_JJ Fluctuations_NNS in_IN Numbers_NNP of_IN Trichomonas_NNP Foetus_NNP ._.
HAMMOND_NNP ,_, DATUS_NNP MAND_NNP BARLETT_NNP ,_, DAIRD_NNP E._NNP Amer_NNP ._.
J._NNP vet_NN ._.
Res_NNP ._.
6_CD ,_, 19_CD ._.
INITIAL_NNP infections_NNS ,_, when_WRB induced_VBN by_IN coitus_NN with_IN infected_JJ bulls_NNS ,_, resulted_VBD in_IN the_DT appearance_NN of_IN Trichomonas_NNP in_IN the_DT vagina_NN in_IN about_IN one_CD week_NN ._.
Counts_NNS ran_VBD consistently_RB high_JJ for_IN ten_JJ days_NNS ,_, then_RB the_DT numbers_NNS declined_VBD gradually_RB ,_, and_CC most_JJS cases_NNS were_VBD negative_JJ in_IN 80_CD days_NNS ._.
Early_RB return_NN to_TO ostrum_VB was_VBD characteristic_JJ of_IN all_DT cases_NNS that_WDT did_VBD not_RB develop_VB pyometra_NN ,_, and_CC all_DT during_IN this_DT later_JJ period_NN of_IN infection_NN Trichomonas_NNP were_VBD scarce_JJ early_JJ in_IN the_DT cycle_NN ,_, became_VBD abundant_JJ two_CD or_CC three_CD days_NNS before_IN ostrum_NN ,_, and_CC then_RB receded_VBD abruptly_RB ._.
The_DT authors_NNS (_( Hammond_NNP and_CC Bartlett_NNP ,_, Boltsville_NNP ,_, Maryland_NNP )_) believe_VBP that_IN when_WRB Trichomonas_NNP does_VBZ not_RB appear_VB in_IN the_DT vagina_NN until_IN several_JJ weeks_NNS or_CC months_NNS following_VBG exposure_NN ,_, then_RB the_DT females_NNS involved_VBN have_VBP been_VBN previously_RB infected_VBN one_CD or_CC more_JJR times_NNS ._.
This_DT is_VBZ also_RB true_JJ of_IN females_NNS that_WDT become_VBP pregnant_JJ and_CC than_IN about_RB in_IN two_CD to_TO five_CD months_NNS ,_, or_CC else_RB complete_VB the_DT pregnancy_NN uninterrupted_VBD ._.
Initial_JJ infection_NN is_VBZ followed_VBN by_IN rapid_JJ multiplication_NN in_IN the_DT vagina_NN ,_, corvix_NN and_CC uterus_NN ,_, because_IN these_DT organs_NNS are_VBP susceptible_JJ ._.
This_DT infection_NN induces_VBZ a_DT resistance_NN in_IN the_DT tissues_NNS involved_VBN in_IN the_DT course_NN of_IN two_CD or_CC three_CD weeks_NNS ._.
Thereafter_RB they_PRP no_RB longer_RBR support_VB multiplication_NN ._.
The_DT infection_NN in_IN the_DT uterus_JJ persists_NNS for_IN a_DT longer_JJR time_NN ,_, because_IN more_JJR time_NN is_VBZ required_VBN to_TO render_VB the_DT uterus_NN resistant_NN ,_, and_CC possibly_RB because_IN the_DT uterus_NN does_VBZ not_RB always_RB become_VBN infected_VBN at_IN the_DT time_NN of_IN exposure_NN ,_, but_CC only_RB later_RB as_IN a_DT result_NN of_IN invasion_NN by_IN organisms_NNS from_IN the_DT vagina_NN ._.
Periodic_JJ appearance_NN of_IN Trichomonas_NNP in_IN the_DT vagina_NN in_IN the_DT later_JJ stages_NNS of_IN infection_NN is_VBZ due_JJ to_TO contraction_NN of_IN the_DT uterus_NN at_IN the_DT onset_NN of_IN ostrum_NN ,_, and_CC a_DT consequent_JJ discharge_NN of_IN its_PRP$ contents_NNS ._.
On_IN this_DT basis_NN ,_, examinations_NNS are_VBP made_VBN to_TO best_JJS advantage_NN in_IN from_IN 7_CD to_TO 19_CD days_NNS following_VBG initial_JJ exposure_NN ,_, but_CC should_MD be_VB made_VBN two_CD or_CC three_CD days_NNS before_IN the_DT expected_JJ onset_NN of_IN ostrum_NN in_IN animals_NNS that_WDT have_VBP been_VBN previously_RB infected_VBN (_( USIS_NNP ,_, No_NNP ._.
32_CD )_) ._.
Hormonal_JJ Stimulution_NNP of_IN Estrus_NNP and_CC Ovulation_NNP in_IN Sheep_NNP and_CC Goats_NNP (_( a_DT Review_NNP )_) ._.
RALPH_NNP W._NNP PHILLIPS_NNP ,_, PH_NNP ._.

D._NNP ,_, AND_NNP ARCHIE_NNP H._NNP FRANK_NNP ,_, D._NNP V._NNP M._NNP ,_, M._NNP A_NNP ._.
(_( 1945_CD )_) ._.
Amer_NNP J._NNP Vet_NNP ._.
Res._NNP ,_, 6_CD ,_, 165-179_CD THE_NNP results_NNS of_IN the_DT many_JJ attempts_NNS to_TO induce_VB estrus_NN and_CC ovulation_NN in_IN anestrous_JJ sheep_NN and_CC goats_NNS by_IN the_DT use_NN of_IN gonadotropic_NN hormones_NNS may_MD be_VB summarized_VBN as_IN follows_VBZ :_: (_( 1_CD )_) Follicular_NNP growth_NN and_CC ovulation_NN can_MD be_VB induced_VBN in_IN a_DT high_JJ percentage_NN of_IN animals_NNS injected_VBN with_IN gonadotropins_NNS ._.
(_( 2_CD )_) Induction_NN of_IN estrus_NN in_IN conjunction_NN with_IN ovulation_NN ,_, as_IN a_DT result_NN of_IN treatments_NNS with_IN gonadotropins_NNS ,_, has_VBZ been_VBN quite_RB erratic_JJ ,_, and_CC no_DT satisfactory_JJ explanation_NN of_IN the_DT variable_JJ results_NNS has_VBZ been_VBN found_VBN ._.
ABSTRACTS_$ 44_CD (_( 3_CD )_) Fertility_NN ,_, as_IN measured_VBN by_IN percentage_NN of_IN conceptions_NNS ,_, is_VBZ generally_RB lower_JJR in_IN animals_NNS in_IN which_WDT estrus_NN has_VBZ been_VBN induced_VBN or_CC in_IN those_DT forcemated_VBN after_IN induction_NN of_IN ovulation_NN ,_, than_IN in_IN animals_NNS bred_VBD during_IN natural_JJ estrus_NN ._.
However_RB ,_, satisfactory_JJ fertility_NN has_VBZ been_VBN reported_VBN in_IN some_DT cases_NNS ._.
Estrogens_NNS ,_, used_VBD either_CC alone_RB or_CC with_IN gonadotropins_NNS ,_, have_VBP given_VBN variable_JJ results_NNS ._.
Results_NNS of_IN trials_NNS with_IN gonadotropins_NNS and_CC or_CC estrogens_NNS during_IN the_DT natural_JJ breeding_NN season_NN have_VBP also_RB been_VBN quite_RB variable_JJ ._.
In_IN some_DT cases_NNS ,_, apparent_JJ increases_NNS in_IN fertility_NN ,_, as_IN judged_VBN by_IN percentage_NN of_IN conceptions_NNS or_CC lambing_VBG percentages_NNS ,_, have_VBP resulted_VBN ._.
In_IN other_JJ cases_NNS ,_, no_DT incsease_NN or_CC an_DT actual_JJ lowering_NN of_IN fertility_NN has_VBZ resulted_VBN The_DT variable_JJ results_NNS are_VBP difficult_JJ to_TO explain_VB ._.
The_DT indentity_NN of_IN hormone_NN preparations_NNS can_MD never_RB be_VB assured_VBN in_IN the_DT absence_NN of_IN chemical_NN purity_NN ,_, and_CC no_DT protein_NN gonadotropin_NN is_VBZ now_RB marketed_VBN in_IN this_DT form_NN It_PRP does_VBZ not_RB appear_VB probable_JJ that_IN this_DT accounts_NNS in_IN any_DT large_JJ measure_NN for_IN the_DT inconstancy_NN of_IN estrus_JJ response_NN in_IN ewes_NN and_CC does_VBZ ,_, owing_VBG to_TO the_DT relatively_RB uniform_JJ response_NN of_IN laboratory_NN animals_NNS to_TO these_DT same_JJ gonadotropes_NNS ._.
Constitutional_NNP and_CC environmental_JJ factors_NNS may_MD play_VB a_DT considerable_JJ part_NN in_IN determin-_JJ ing_VBG the_DT response_NN to_TO specific_JJ hormone_NN treatments_NNS ._.
These_DT factors_NNS ,_, if_IN they_PRP do_VBP play_VB an_DT important_JJ part_NN ,_, are_VBP easily_RB overcome_VBN in_IN the_DT induction_NN of_IN follicular_JJ growth_NN and_CC ovulation_NN ._.
The_DT extent_NN to_TO which_WDT they_PRP influence_VBP expression_NN of_IN estrus_NN is_VBZ not_RB clear_JJ ,_, and_CC can_MD not_RB be_VB fully_RB understood_JJ until_IN the_DT mechanism_NN of_IN induction_NN of_IN estrus_NN is_VBZ determined_VBN in_IN ewes_NN and_CC does_VBZ ._.
A_DT working_JJ basis_NN for_IN approaching_VBG this_DT problem_NN is_VBZ furnished_VBN by_IN Dempsey_NNP ,_, Hertz_NNP and_CC Young_NNP ,_, who_WP advance_VBP the_DT hypothesis_NN that_WDT after_IN the_DT animal_NN has_VBZ been_VBN conditioned_VBN with_IN ,_, estrogens_NNS of_IN ovarian_JJ origin_NN ,_, estrus_NN is_VBZ brought_VBN about_RB by_IN the_DT immediate_JJ action_NN of_IN progesterone_NN which_WDT is_VBZ elaborated_VBN in_IN the_DT preovulatory_NN follicles_NNS shortly_RB before_IN ovulation_NN ,_, as_IN a_DT result_NN of_IN release_NN of_IN luteinizing_VBG hormone_NN by_IN the_DT anterior_JJ pituitary_NN ._.
The_DT occurrence_NN of_IN estrus_NN after_IN two_CD injections_NNS of_IN pms_NN ._.
at_IN an_DT interval_NN approximating_VBG the_DT normal_JJ cycle_NN ,_, indicates_VBZ that_IN the_DT corpus_NN luteum_NN induced_VBN by_IN the_DT first_JJ injection_NN of_IN pms_NN may_MD have_VB a_DT regulatory_JJ role_NN ._.
Also_RB it_PRP has_VBZ been_VBN observed_VBN (_( McKenzie_NNP and_CC Terrill_NNP )_) that_IN most_JJS ewes_JJ ovulate_NN at_IN least_JJS once_RB before_IN the_DT first_JJ estrous_JJ period_NN of_IN a_DT natural_JJ breedpms_NN season_NN ._.
Hammond_NNP ,_, Hammond_NNP ,_, and_CC Parkes_NNP state_NN that_WDT horse_NN ap_NN and_CC pms_NN induce_NN estring_VBG only_RB in_IN animals_NNS having_VBG a_DT regressing_VBG corpus_NN luteum_NN ;_: that_IN in_IN the_DT absence_NN of_IN a_DT corpus_NN luteum_NN ovulation_NN occurs_VBZ without_IN estrus_NN ,_, and_CC that_IN in_IN the_DT presence_NN of_IN an_DT active_JJ corpius_NN luteum_NN both_DT ovulation_NN and_CC estrus_NN are_VBP usually_RB suppressed_VBN ._.
Work_NN by_IN Zavadovskii_NNP ,_, Paduceva_NNP ,_, and_CC Wunder_NNP indicates_VBZ that_IN corpora_NN lutea_NN ,_, induced_VBN by_IN injection_NN of_IN prola_NN no_DT ,_, pms_NN ,_, are_VBP not_RB in_IN all_DT cases_NNS similar_JJ to_TO spontaneous_JJ cyclic_JJ ones_NNS as_IN regards_NNS function_NN and_CC capacity_NN to_TO regulate_VB the_DT sexual_JJ cycle_NN ._.
From_IN work_NN with_IN laboratory_JJ animals_NNS ,_, and_CC the_DT results_NNS with_IN sheep_JJ and_CC goats_NNS ,_, it_PRP seems_VBZ certain_JJ that_IN time_NN sequences_NNS in_IN hormonal_JJ action_NN are_VBP involved_VBN critically_RB in_IN the_DT expression_NN of_IN normal_JJ and_CC induced_JJ estrus_NN ._.
There_EX is_VBZ obvious_JJ need_NN for_IN further_JJ work_NN to_TO determine_VB (_( 1_CD )_) The_DT endocrine_JJ physiology_NN of_IN normal_JJ and_CC experimentally_RB induced_JJ estrus_NN in_IN sheep_NN and_CC goats_NNS and_CC (_( 2_CD )_) the_DT specific_JJ doses_NNS and_CC time_NN sequences_NNS of_IN hormones_NNS that_WDT will_MD induce_VB estrus_NN and_CC ovulation_NN in_IN anestrous_JJ ewes_NNS and_CC does_VBZ ._.

A._NN IDNANI_NNP ,_, Imperial_NNP Veterinary_NNP Research_NNP Institute_NNP ,_, Mukteswar_NNP (_( Received_VBN for_IN publication_NN on_IN 2_CD April_NNP 1946_CD )_) DURING_VBZ the_DT last_JJ three_CD years_NNS we_PRP have_VBP been_VBN exploring_VBG different_JJ methods_NNS of_IN preparing_VBG Ranikhet_NNP disease_NN vaccine_NN ,_, and_CC the_DT results_NNS are_VBP surveyed_VBN in_IN the_DT present_JJ paper_NN ._.

I._JJ GEL-ADSORBED_NNP VACCINE_NNP In_IN a_DT preliminary_JJ report_NN [_NNP Haddow_NNP and_CC Idnani_NNP ,_, 1941_CD ]_VBD an_DT account_NN was_VBD given_VBN of_IN the_DT pre-_JJ paration_NN of_IN a_DT vaccine_NN by_IN adsorbing_VBG virus_NN from_IN a_DT spleen_JJ pulp_NN emulsion_NN on_IN an_DT aluminium_NN gel_NN ._.
We_PRP have_VBP since_IN made_VBN modifications_NNS which_WDT have_VBP given_VBN better_JJR results_NNS ._.
In_IN the_DT first_JJ place_NN ,_, since_IN different_JJ brews_NNS of_IN gel_NN ,_, prepared_VBN by_IN the_DT method_NN previously_RB described_VBN ,_, did_VBD not_RB give_VB constant_JJ results_NNS ,_, we_PRP adopted_VBD the_DT following_JJ technique_NN ,_, mainly_RB according_VBG to_TO Willstatter_NNP ,_, Kraut_NNP and_CC Erbacher_NNP [_NNP 1925_CD ]_NN :_: One_CD hundred_VBD c._JJ c._NN of_IN 10_CD per_IN cent_NN ammonia_NN solution_NN (_( accurately_RB prepared_VBN )_) were_VBD poured_VBN into_IN 600_CD c._JJ c._NN of_IN water_NN at_IN 63°C_CD ._.
containing_VBG 22_CD gm_NN ._.
of_IN ammonium_NN sulphate_NN and_CC the_DT tempera-_JJ ture_NN was_VBD quickly_RB brought_VBN to_TO 58°C_CD ._.
The_DT solution_NN was_VBD stirred_VBN vigorously_RB ,_, and_CC 150_CD c._NN c._NN of_IN water_NN at_IN 58°C_CD ._.
containing_VBG 76.7_CD gm_NN ._.
of_IN ammonium_NN alum_NN (_( Baker_NNP Chemical_NNP Co._NNP )_) were_VBD poured_VBN in_IN rapidly_RB as_IN one_CD lot_NN ._.
The_DT mixture_NN was_VBD shaken_VBN in_IN a_DT stoppered_JJ bottle_NN for_IN 15_CD minutes_NNS at_IN 60°C._CD ,_, care_NN being_VBG taken_VBN to_TO keep_VB the_DT temperature_NN constant_NN during_IN the_DT process_NN ._.
It_PRP was_VBD then_RB transferred_VBN to_TO a_DT tall_JJ jar_NN and_CC was_VBD washed_VBN each_DT time_NN with_IN about_RB five_CD litres_NNS of_IN distilled_JJ water_NN by_IN decantation_NN and_CC not_RB by_IN certrifugation_NN ._.
At_IN the_DT fourth_JJ washing_NN ,_, 80_CD c._NN c._NN of_IN 20_CD per_IN cent_NN ammonia_NN solution_NN were_VBD added_VBN to_TO the_DT wash_NN water_NN ,_, before_IN it_PRP was_VBD used_VBN ._.
The_DT washings_NNS were_VBD repeated_VBN about_IN 20_CD times_NNS ,_, until_IN the_DT supernatant_JJ fluid_NN no_RB longer_RBR became_VBD clear_JJ ._.
The_DT last_JJ two_CD or_CC three_CD washings_NNS occupied_VBD several_JJ days_NNS ._.
The_DT final_JJ suspension_NN of_IN 1000_CD c._NN c._NN was_VBD left_VBN at_IN room_NN temperature_NN for_IN at_IN least_JJS two_CD months_NNS before_IN use_NN ._.
Vaccines_NNS prepared_VBN from_IN such_JJ gels_NNS have_VBP not_RB varied_VBN greatly_RB ._.
It_PRP appeared_VBD ,_, however_RB ,_, that_IN the_DT spleen_JJ emulsion_NN introduced_VBD a_DT very_RB variable_JJ factor_NN into_IN the_DT manufacturing_NN process_NN ,_, and_CC it_PRP was_VBD ,_, therefore_RB ,_, decided_VBD to_TO use_VB instead_RB of_IN spleen_JJ allanto-amniotic_JJ fluid_NN from_IN hens_NNS '_POS eggs_NNS ,_, the_DT fluid_NN being_VBG collected_VBN 48_CD hours_NNS after_IN the_DT inoculation_NN of_IN 9_CD or_CC 10_CD day_NN embryo_NN ._.
This_DT fluid_NN has_VBZ a_DT more_RBR constant_JJ virus_NN content_NN and_CC is_VBZ much_JJ cleaner_JJR to_TO work_VB with_IN ._.
Using_VBG this_DT method_NN ,_, the_DT following_JJ experiments_NNS were_VBD tried_VBN :_: (_( 1_CD )_) diluting_VBG the_DT virus_NN before_IN adsorption_NN ;_: dilutions_NNS even_RB at_IN 1/10_CD ,_, however_RB ,_, greatly_RB reduced_VBD the_DT immunizing_NN capacity_NN ;_: (_( 2_CD )_) using_VBG eluates_NNS of_IN prepared_JJ vaccine_NN ,_, 46_CD Vaccination_NNP against_IN Ranikhet_NNP Disease_NNP TABLE_NNP I_PRP Vaccination_VBP with_IN gel_JJ vaccine_NN Date_NNP Type_NNP of_IN vaccine_NN Dose_NNP (_( c._JJ c._NN )_) No_DT of_IN fowls_JJ Result_NNP of_IN test_NN 10_CD days_NNS later_RB 1943_CD 1_CD ._.

A._NN IDNANI_NNP 47_CD From_NNP Table_NNP II_NNP it_PRP will_MD be_VB observed_VBN that_IN all_DT adult_NN fowls_RB vaccinated_VBD proved_VBN to_TO be_VB solid-_JJ ly_NN immune_NN for_IN five_CD months_NNS ._.
In_IN tests_NNS at_IN longer_JJR intervals_NNS the_DT immunity_NN appeared_VBD to_TO be_VB waning_VBG ._.
In_IN chicks_NNS ,_, the_DT period_NN of_IN complete_JJ immunity_NN was_VBD two_CD to_TO three_CD months_NNS after_IN which_WDT the_DT results_NNS were_VBD variable_JJ ._.

The_DT experi-_JJ ments_NNS covered_VBN over_IN 100_CD adult_NN birds_NNS ._.

As_IN expected_VBN ,_, the_DT number_NN of_IN healthy_JJ birds_NNS infected_VBN varied_JJ with_IN the_DT ratio_NN of_IN vaccinated_VBN :_: healthy_JJ ,_, e._JJ g._NN in_IN one_CD experiment_NN where_WRB the_DT ratio_NN was_VBD 1_CD :_: 1_CD (_( ten_JJ birds_NNS in_IN each_DT group_NN )_) ,_, only_RB two_CD healthy_JJ birds_NNS were_VBD later_RB found_VBN to_TO be_VB immune_JJ ._.
In_IN another_DT experiment_NN where_WRB the_DT ratio_NN was_VBD 4_CD :_: 1_CD (_( 16_CD vaccinated_VBN fowls_NN )_) ,_, all_DT four_CD healthy_JJ were_VBD silently_RB immunized_VBN ._.
Chickens_NNS were_VBD also_RB vaccinated_VBN and_CC it_PRP was_VBD found_VBN that_IN those_DT under_IN ten_JJ days_NNS old_JJ reacted_VBD violently_RB with_IN an_DT occasional_JJ death_NN and_CC a_DT high_JJ percentage_NN permanently_RB maimed_VBN ._.
From_IN ten_JJ days_NNS to_TO a_DT month_NN the_DT death-rate_NN rapidly_RB diminishes_NNS but_CC the_DT proportion_NN of_IN paralysis_NN cases_NNS remains_VBZ rather_RB high_JJ ._.
After_IN one_CD month_NN vaccination_NN can_MD be_VB satisfactorily_RB applied_VBN and_CC the_DT casualty_NN rates_NNS are_VBP nearly_RB comparable_JJ to_TO those_DT in_IN adult_NN fowls_NN ,_, provided_VBN there_EX is_VBZ no_DT intercurrent_JJ coccidial_JJ infection_NN ._.
Field_NNP trials_NNS Frequent_NNP titrations_NNS of_IN the_DT amniotic_JJ fluid_NN in_IN fowls_NN and_CC chicks_NNS have_VBP shown_VBN that_IN an_DT im-_JJ munizing_NN dose_NN was_VBD contained_VBN in_IN a_DT 1_CD ×_JJ 10-6_JJ dilution_NN ,_, Also_RB the_DT virus_NN dies_VBZ rapidly_RB when_WRB diluted_VBN or_CC if_IN exposed_VBN to_TO heat_VB It_PRP was_VBD ,_, therefore_RB ,_, considered_VBN expedient_NN to_TO carry_VB out_RP the_DT first_JJ field_NN trials_NNS using_VBG virus_NN stored_VBN on_IN ice_NN and_CC freshly_RB diluted_VBN at_IN 1/1000_CD at_IN the_DT time_NN of_IN inoculation_NN ._.
The_DT dose_NN given_VBN was_VBD 0.5_CD c._NN c._VBD The_DT results_NNS of_IN the_DT first_JJ field_NN inoculation_NN ,_, which_WDT was_VBD carried_VBN out_RP on_IN the_DT poultry_NN farm_NN at_IN Izatnagar_NNP ,_, are_VBP recorded_VBN in_IN Table_NNP VI_NNP ._.
1492_CD birds_NNS ,_, mostly_RB pullets_NNS ,_, were_VBD vaccinated_VBN ,_, and_CC control_NN pens_NNS were_VBD kept_VBN to_TO study_VB the_DT effect_NN on_IN growth_NN and_CC egg_NN laying_NN ._.

TABLE_NNP VI_NNP Field_NNP trials_NNS with_IN egg-passaged_JJ vaccine_NN on_IN 1492_CD birds_NNS Days_NNPS after_IN vacci-_JJ nation_NN Dull_NNP Camatose_NNP or_CC ill_VB Lame_NNP Paralysed_VBD Destroyed_NNP as_IN useless_JJ 1_CD 2_CD 3_CD 1_CD 4_CD Approx_NNP 50_CD per_IN cent_NN 4_CD 3_CD 2_CD 5_CD ``_`` 75_CD per_IN cent_NN 65_CD 8_CD 7_CD 6_CD ``_`` 75_CD per_IN cent_NN 87_CD 10_CD 10_CD 7_CD ``_`` 75_CD per_IN cent_NN 29_CD 18_CD 13_CD 8_CD ``_`` 50_CD per_IN cent_NN 6_CD 27_CD 11_CD 9_CD 10_CD 23_CD 12_CD 10_CD 2_CD 30_CD 14_CD 1_CD 11_CD 28_CD 14_CD 12_CD 32_CD 12_CD 13_CD 33_CD 11_CD 14_CD 32_CD 9_CD 21_CD 22_CD 6_CD 25_CD 8_CD The_DT results_NNS show_VBP that_IN quite_PDT a_DT large_JJ percentage_NN of_IN them_PRP were_VBD mopy_VBN and_CC about_IN 6_CD per_IN cent_NN actually_RB comatose_JJ ._.
The_DT symptoms_NNS pass_VBP off_IN rapidly_RB and_CC usually_RB leave_VBP no_DT ill_JJ effects_NNS ._.
Mild_NNP cases_NNS of_IN lameness_NN also_RB tend_VBP to_TO recover_VB rapidly_RB unless_IN intercurrent_JJ coccidial_JJ infection_NN is_VBZ present_JJ ._.
The_DT common_JJ helminthic_JJ infections_NNS are_VBP not_RB affected_VBN ,_, nor_CC do_VBP they_PRP affect_VB the_DT degree_NN of_IN reaction_NN during_IN vaccination_NN ._.
Except_IN for_IN a_DT few_JJ severe_JJ cases_NNS amount-_JJ ing_NN to_TO 0.5_CD per_IN cent_NN ,_, all_DT birds_NNS had_VBD recovered_VBN within_IN a_DT month_NN ._.
As_IN in_IN practice_NN it_PRP is_VBZ not_RB convenient_JJ or_CC economical_JJ to_TO nurse_VB ailing_VBG birds_NNS for_IN long_RB ,_, we_PRP consider_VBP that_IN all_DT birds_NNS which_WDT are_VBP definitely_RB lame_JJ or_CC paralysed_VBN on_IN the_DT 14th_CD day_NN after_IN vaccination_NN should_MD be_VB destroyed_VBN for_IN food_NN ._.
This_DT procedure_NN gives_VBZ a_DT total_JJ casualty_NN rate_NN of_IN about_IN 2.5_CD per_IN cent_NN ,_, a_DT rate_NN which_WDT varies_VBZ within_IN small_JJ limits_NNS according_VBG to_TO breed_NN ._.
In_IN heavy_JJ placid_NN birds_NNS ,_, e._VBP g._JJ Rhode_NNP Islands_VBZ the_DT rate_NN is_VBZ lower_JJR than_IN in_IN light_JJ and_CC more_RBR nervous_JJ breeds_NNS such_JJ as_IN White_NNP Leghorn_NNP or_CC Indian_NNP ._.
Vaccination_NNP has_VBZ no_DT effect_NN on_IN subsequent_JJ growth_NN rate_NN either_CC in_IN chicks_NNS or_CC pullets_NNS ,_, but_CC it_PRP markedly_RB interferes_VBZ with_IN egg-laying_NN ._.
About_IN the_DT sixth_JJ or_CC seventh_JJ day_NN after_IN vaccina-_JJ tion_NN ,_, egg-laying_JJ decreases_NNS and_CC usually_RB entirely_RB ceases_NNS by_IN the_DT tenth_JJ day_NN ._.
Birds_NNS which_WDT have_VBP no_DT visible_JJ reaction_NN start_NN laying_VBG gradually_RB about_IN the_DT 14th_CD day_NN ,_, and_CC full_JJ 52_CD Vaccination_NNP against_IN Ranikhet_NNP Disease_NNP production_NN in_IN all_DT except_IN those_DT seriously_RB affected_VBN is_VBZ resumed_VBN after_IN 21_CD days_NNS ._.
A_DT number_NN of_IN not_RB less_JJR than_IN 1000_CD birds_NNS forms_VBZ a_DT suitable_JJ basis_NN for_IN a_DT day_NN 's_POS work_NN and_CC for_IN convenience_NN the_DT virus_NN is_VBZ diluted_VBN at_IN 1:500_CD ._.
Thus_RB one_CD ampoule_NN of_IN virus_NN provided_VBN vaccine_NN for_IN the_DT day_NN ._.
Actually_RB ,_, experiments_NNS have_VBP shown_VBN that_IN there_EX is_VBZ no_DT noticeable_JJ difference_NN in_IN the_DT severity_NN of_IN reaction_NN between_IN an_DT undiluted_JJ and_CC a_DT diluted_JJ virus_NN ._.

In_IN one_CD small_JJ flock_NN of_IN 210_CD birds_NNS ,_, distributed_VBN in_IN an_DT isolated_JJ pen_NN of_IN 32_CD birds_NNS and_CC in_IN three_CD contiguous_JJ pens_NNS ,_, the_DT results_NNS were_VBD as_IN follows_VBZ :_: Isolated_VBN pen_NN (_( 32_CD birds_NNS )_) 1_CD dead_JJ and_CC 3_CD sick_NN at_IN the_DT time_NN of_IN vaccination_NN 18_CD were_VBD protected_VBN Contiguous_NNP pens_VBZ No_DT ._.

Although_IN preventive_JJ vaccination_NN has_VBZ always_RB been_VBN our_PRP$ objective_JJ ,_, in_IN several_JJ outbreaks_NNS on_IN large_JJ farms_NNS where_WRB separate_JJ attendants_NNS are_VBP available_JJ our_PRP$ results_NNS indicate_VBP that_IN it_PRP is_VBZ possible_JJ to_TO save_VB 70_CD per_IN cent_NN of_IN birds_NNS in_IN pens_NNS in_IN which_WDT the_DT disease_NN is_VBZ not_RB evident_JJ ,_, about_RB 50_CD per_IN cent_NN in_IN pens_NNS in_IN which_WDT the_DT disease_NN has_VBZ clearly_RB just_RB started_VBN and_CC only_RB about_RB 10_CD per_IN cent_NN in_IN pens_NNS where_WRB the_DT disease_NN has_VBZ obtained_VBN a_DT firm_NN hold_NN ._.

Approximately_RB 250_CD birds_NNS ,_, vaccinated_VBN at_IN ages_NNS between_IN one_CD and_CC seven_CD months_NNS ,_, have_VBP been_VBN tested_VBN nine_CD to_TO fifteen_VB months_NNS later_RB and_CC all_DT have_VBP proved_VBN solidly_RB immune_JJ ._.
J._NNP R._NNP HADDOW_NNP AND_NNP J_NNP ._.
A._NN IDNANI_NNP 53_CD One_CD or_CC two_CD outbreaks_NNS of_IN the_DT disease_NN have_VBP occurred_VBN on_IN farms_NNS which_WDT possessed_VBD vaccinated_VBN fowls_NN and_CC in_IN all_DT cases_NNS the_DT vaccinated_JJ birds_NNS resisted_VBN infection_NN ._.

AND_NNP DURING_NNP ACUTE_NNP THEILERIASIS*_NNP By_IN B._NNP M._NNP PRASAD_NNP ,_, G._NNP B._NNP V._NNP C._NNP ,_, Imperial_NNP Veterinary_NNP Research_NNP Institute_NNP ,_, Mukteswar_NNP (_( Received_VBN for_IN publication_NN on_IN 7_CD July_NNP 1944_CD )_) THE_NNP purpose_NN of_IN the_DT present_JJ study_NN was_VBD to_TO obtain_VB precise_JJ data_NNS on_IN the_DT total_JJ red-cell_NN and_CC white-cell_NN counts_NNS ,_, the_DT differential_JJ white-cell_NN counts_NNS and_CC the_DT haemoglobin_NN content_NN of_IN the_DT blood_NN of_IN Indian_JJ cattle_NNS in_IN health_NN and_CC during_IN acute_JJ theileriasis_NN and_CC thereby_RB ,_, if_IN possible_JJ ,_, to_TO discover_VB any_DT factor_NN involved_VBN in_IN the_DT biological_JJ behaviour_NN of_IN the_DT causative_JJ agent_NN that_WDT might_MD be_VB utilized_VBN for_IN evolving_VBG a_DT method_NN of_IN effective_JJ treatment_NN ._.
Literature_NN on_IN the_DT haematology_NN of_IN bovine_NN blood_NN is_VBZ rather_RB scanty_JJ and_CC reference_NN may_MD be_VB made_VBN to_TO articles_NNS by_IN Delaune_NNP [_NNP 1940_CD ]_NNP ,_, Manresa_NNP and_CC Reyes_NNP [_NNP 1934_CD ]_NNP ,_, Sankarnarayan_NNP [_NNP 1937_CD ]_NNP and_CC Sen_NNP and_CC Srinivasan_NNP [_NNP 1937_CD ]_NNP ._.
The_DT only_JJ publication_NN available_JJ specifically_RB on_IN a_DT similar_JJ problem_NN is_VBZ that_IN of_IN Steck_NNP [_NNP 1928_CD ]_NN who_WP studied_VBD the_DT blood_NN of_IN cattle_NNS in_IN South_NNP Africa_NNP in_IN some_DT detail_NN during_IN health_NN and_CC during_IN theileriasis_NN (_( East_NNP Coast_NNP fever_NN )_) ._.
Summarizing_VBG the_DT results_NNS of_IN his_PRP$ studies_NNS on_IN 13_CD animals_NNS ,_, he_PRP states_VBZ that_IN with_IN the_DT onset_NN of_IN fever_NN the_DT leucocytes_NNS decrease_VBP in_IN number_NN progressively_RB until_IN death_NN and_CC that_IN all_PDT the_DT cells_NNS take_VBP part_NN in_IN this_DT decrease_NN ._.
From_IN the_DT tables_NNS and_CC charts_NNS illustrating_VBG Steck_NNP 's_POS paper_NN it_PRP appears_VBZ that_IN from_IN an_DT average_NN of_IN about_IN 13,000B_CD ._.
M._NNP PRASAD_NNP 55_CD method_NN recommended_VBN by_IN Piney_NNP [_NN 1931_CD ]_NN was_VBD generally_RB followed_VBN ._.
Immediately_RB after_IN air-_JJ drying_VBG films_NNS were_VBD put_VBN in_IN a_DT glass-stoppered_JJ jar_NN containing_VBG two_CD per_IN cent_NN osmic_JJ acid_NN and_CC allowed_VBN to_TO stand_VB for_IN 30_CD seconds_NNS for_IN complete_JJ fixation_NN ._.
They_PRP were_VBD then_RB washed_VBN thoroughly_RB with_IN distilled_JJ water_NN and_CC stained_VBD for_IN 10_CD minutes_NNS with_IN a_DT mixture_NN of_IN equal_JJ parts_NNS of_IN a_DT 1_CD per_IN cent_NN solution_NN of_IN alphanaphthol_NN and_CC para-phenylenediamical_JJ ._.
They_PRP were_VBD then_RB washed_VBN in_IN dis-_NN tilled_JJ water_NN and_CC mounted_VBD without_IN drying_VBG on_IN water_NN glass_NN ,_, oxidase_NN granules_NNS being_VBG stained_VBN blue_NN ._.
The_DT absence_NN of_IN peroxidase_NN granules_NNS together_RB with_IN sharper_JJR outlining_NN of_IN the_DT nucleus_NN differentiated_VBD the_DT pathological_JJ lymphocytes_NNS from_IN myeloblasts_NNS ._.
The_DT results_NNS obtained_VBN by_IN the_DT two_CD methods_NNS were_VBD found_VBN to_TO agree_VB ._.
Haemoglobin_NNP was_VBD estimated_VBN by_IN the_DT Sahli_NNP method_NN ._.
OBSERVATIONS_NNP During_IN the_DT sub-clinical_JJ period_NN following_VBG the_DT infective_JJ inoculation_NN ,_, there_EX was_VBD a_DT slight_JJ leucocytosis_NN ,_, all_PDT the_DT cells_NNS taking_VBG part_NN in_IN the_DT increase_NN but_CC with_IN a_DT slight_JJ tendency_NN towards_NNS lymphocytosis_NN ._.
On_IN an_DT average_NN ,_, an_DT increase_NN of_IN about_IN 8_CD per_IN cent_NN was_VBD recorded_VBN ._.
From_IN the_DT onset_NN of_IN clinical_JJ symptoms_NNS ,_, characterized_VBN by_IN a_DT sudden_JJ rise_NN of_IN temperature_NN usually_RB 13_CD or_CC 14_CD days_NNS after_IN giving_VBG the_DT infected_JJ blood_NN ,_, leucocytes_VBZ decreased_VBN ,_, ultimately_RB reach-_JJ ing_VBG a_DT marked_JJ leucopenia_NN persisting_VBG for_IN two_CD or_CC three_CD days_NNS during_IN the_DT post-clinical_JJ period_NN or_CC until_IN recovery_NN was_VBD under_IN way_NN ._.
The_DT average_JJ total_JJ white-cell_JJ count_NN worked_VBD out_RP at_IN about_RB 16,000_CD per_IN c._NN mm_NN ._.
of_IN blood_NN ;_: a_DT drop_NN to_TO 3,400_CD and_CC in_IN one_CD case_NN to_TO 1,840_CD is_VBZ worthy_JJ of_IN notice_NN ._.
But_CC ,_, although_IN the_DT number_NN of_IN leucocytes_NNS was_VBD appreciably_RB reduced_VBN ,_, there_EX was_VBD a_DT marked_JJ monocytosis_NN at_IN the_DT expense_NN of_IN other_JJ cells_NNS ._.
The_DT mean_JJ percentage_NN of_IN the_DT various_JJ types_NNS of_IN cells_NNS ,_, as_IN shown_VBN by_IN the_DT differential_JJ counts_NNS made_VBN on_IN the_DT animals_NNS used_VBN in_IN the_DT investigation_NN ,_, was_VBD as_IN follows_VBZ :_: lymphocytes_VBZ 54_CD per_IN cent_NN ,_, neutrophiles_VBZ 28_CD per_IN cent_NN ,_, eosinophiles_VBZ 6_CD per_IN cent_NN and_CC mono-_JJ nuclears_NNS about_IN 8_CD per_IN cent_NN ._.
One_CD bull_NN showed_VBD a_DT high_JJ percentage_NN of_IN eosinophiles_NNS which_WDT may_MD have_VB been_VBN due_JJ to_TO helminthic_JJ infection_NN ._.
The_DT average_JJ percentages_NNS ,_, as_IN shown_VBN during_IN the_DT period_NN of_IN full_JJ clinical_JJ manifestations_NNS ,_, were_VBD as_IN follows_VBZ :_: lymphocytes_VBZ 6_CD per_IN cent_NN ,_, neutrophiles_VBZ 2_CD per_IN cent_NN ,_, mononuclears_VBZ 91.5_CD per_IN cent_NN and_CC eosinophiles_VBZ 0.5_CD per_IN cent_NN ._.
These_DT figures_NNS show_VBP a_DT marked_JJ increase_NN in_IN monocytes_NNS and_CC a_DT relative_JJ decrease_NN of_IN lymphocytes_NNS ,_, neutrophiles_NNS and_CC eosinophiles_NNS ._.
Of_IN the_DT monocytes_NNS ,_, a_DT certain_JJ percentage_NN appeared_VBD to_TO be_VB myeloblasts_NNS ._.
Karyorrhexis_NNP in_IN the_DT white_JJ corpuscles_NNS belonging_VBG to_TO the_DT hyaline_NN series_NN ,_, as_IN observed_VBN by_IN Steck_NNP [_NNP 1928_CD ]_NN in_IN the_DT blood_NN of_IN animals_NNS with_IN East_NNP Coast_NNP fever_NN ,_, was_VBD rarely_RB encountered_VBN in_IN the_DT peripheral_JJ circulation_NN suggesting_VBG that_IN the_DT accumulated_JJ cells_NNS do_VBP not_RB undergo_VB rapid_JJ destruction_NN in_IN the_DT various_JJ organs_NNS ._.
There_EX was_VBD also_RB a_DT slight_JJ decrease_NN in_IN the_DT number_NN of_IN red_JJ blood_NN corpuscles_NNS ._.
From_IN about_RB six_CD to_TO eight_CD millions_NNS per_IN c._NN mm_NN ._.
prior_RB to_TO infection_NN ,_, a_DT decline_NN to_TO four_CD millions_NNS and_CC in_IN one_CD case_NN to_TO three_CD millions_NNS was_VBD observed_VBN ._.
Thus_RB a_DT drop_NN of_IN 33_CD per_IN cent_NN to_TO 50_CD per_IN cent_NN in_IN red_JJ cells_NNS may_MD occur_VB when_WRB the_DT disease_NN has_VBZ sufficiently_RB advanced_VBN ._.
No_DT variation_NN ,_, however_RB ,_, took_VBD place_NN during_IN the_DT sub-clinical_JJ period_NN ,_, hut_VBD the_DT decrease_NN became_VBD manifest_JJS from_IN the_DT onset_NN of_IN clinical_JJ symptoms_NNS and_CC ,_, as_IN in_IN the_DT case_NN of_IN the_DT white_JJ corpuscles_NNS ,_, persists_NNS until_IN signs_NNS of_IN recovery_NN appear_NN ._.
It_PRP was_VBD also_RB apparent_JJ that_IN there_EX is_VBZ no_DT appreciable_JJ drop_NN in_IN blood_NN haemoglobin_NN during_IN the_DT disease_NN ._.
Healthy_JJ animals_NNS in_IN good_JJ condition_NN appear_VBP to_TO be_VB more_RBR resistant_JJ to_TO the_DT disease_NN than_IN those_DT previously_RB used_VBN for_IN other_JJ work_NN ,_, e._JJ g._NN on_IN rinderpest_NN This_DT observation_NN emerges_VBZ from_IN the_DT fact_NN that_IN of_IN twelve_NN animals_NNS discontinued_VBN from_IN rinderpest_NN experiments_NNS and_CC inoculated_VBN with_IN 20_CD c._NNS c._NN of_IN theileriasis_NN blood_NN ten_NN succumbed_VBD to_TO the_DT disease_NN ,_, whereas_RB ,_, as_IN already_RB stated_VBN ,_, the_DT disease_NN was_VBD not_RB fatal_JJ in_IN the_DT six_CD healthy_JJ hill_NN bulls_NNS used_VBN in_IN the_DT present_JJ investigation_NN after_IN inoculation_NN with_IN equal_JJ quantities_NNS of_IN blood_NN obtained_VBN from_IN the_DT same_JJ control_NN animals_NNS ._.
It_PRP has_VBZ been_VBN observed_VBN by_IN Sen_NNP and_CC Srinivasan_NNP [_NNP 1937_CD ]_NN that_IN the_DT changes_NNS occurring_VBG in_IN the_DT blood_NN of_IN an_DT affected_JJ animal_NN following_VBG the_DT appearance_NN of_IN schizonts_NNS in_IN the_DT peripheral_JJ blood_NN afford_NN a_DT reliable_JJ clue_NN to_TO its_PRP$ chances_NNS of_IN recovery_NN ._.
In_IN all_DT four_CD reactors_NNS in_IN the_DT present_JJ inves-_JJ tigation_NN the_DT first_JJ noticeable_JJ change_NN in_IN the_DT blood_NN was_VBD the_DT occurrence_NN of_IN anisocytosis_NN ,_, dominated_VBN later_RB by_IN polychromatophilia_NNS and_CC usually_RB associated_VBN with_IN basophilia_NN ,_, whilst_VBD it_PRP was_VBD not_RB un-_JJ common_JJ to_TO find_VB punctate_JJ degeneration_NN of_IN the_DT nucleated_JJ red_JJ cells_NNS ._.
It_PRP would_MD appear_VB that_IN the_DT sequence_NN of_IN anaemic_JJ changes_NNS is_VBZ of_IN a_DT rapidly_RB progressive_JJ type_NN ,_, since_IN all_PDT the_DT changes_NNS des-_JJ cribed_NNS above_IN can_MD be_VB seen_VBN within_IN a_DT week_NN or_CC less_CC from_IN the_DT beginning_NN of_IN anisocytosis_NN ._.
The_DT restoration_NN to_TO normal_JJ of_IN the_DT blood_NN picture_NN is_VBZ also_RB rapid_JJ ._.
Samples_NNS of_IN urine_NN during_IN the_DT clinical_JJ and_CC post-clinical_JJ periods_NNS were_VBD now_RB and_CC then_RB examined_VBD for_IN the_DT presence_NN of_IN haemoglobinuria_NN ,_, but_CC in_IN no_DT instance_NN was_VBD any_DT trace_NN of_IN haemog-_JJ lobin_NN found_VBD on_IN chemical_NN examination_NN nor_CC were_VBD intact_JJ erythrocytes_NNS seen_VBN microscopically_RB ._.
Somewhat_RB voluminous_JJ tables_NNS showing_VBG the_DT figures_NNS for_IN blood_NN counts_NNS are_VBP withheld_VBN for_IN reasons_NNS of_IN space_NN but_CC are_VBP available_JJ for_IN scrutiny_NN at_IN Mukteswar_NNP ._.
56_CD Distribution_NN of_IN Fat_NNP in_IN Dahi_NNP Since_IN in_IN previously_RB unused_JJ animals_NNS the_DT disease_NN was_VBD not_RB fatal_JJ ,_, the_DT white_JJ cell_NN and_CC differen-_JJ tial_NN counts_VBZ up_RP to_TO the_DT time_NN of_IN death_NN were_VBD made_VBN on_IN rinderpest_NN discontinued_VBN animals_NNS ,_, which_WDT to_TO all_DT appearances_NNS were_VBD in_IN good_JJ condition_NN and_CC which_WDT were_VBD being_VBG used_VBN for_IN maintaining_VBG the_DT strain_NN of_IN theileria_NN ._.
In_IN three_CD good_JJ reactants_NNS ,_, white_JJ cell_NN counts_NNS were_VBD taken_VBN when_WRB the_DT animals_NNS were_VBD in_IN extremis_NN ._.
There_EX was_VBD found_VBN to_TO be_VB considerable_JJ increase_NN in_IN the_DT number_NN of_IN leucocytes_NNS ,_, the_DT count_NN in_IN one_CD case_NN being_VBG as_RB high_JJ as_IN 145,140_CD per_IN c._NN mm_NN ._.
of_IN blood_NN ._.
It_PRP would_MD therefore_RB appear_VB that_IN a_DT condition_NN of_IN marked_JJ leucoponia_NN ,_, which_WDT persists_VBZ during_IN the_DT larger_JJR part_NN of_IN the_DT clinical_JJ period_NN ,_, suddenly_RB develops_VBZ into_IN one_CD of_IN marked_JJ leucocytosis_NN ._.
In_IN the_DT differential_JJ white-_NN cell_NN counts_NNS there_EX was_VBD practically_RB no_DT variation_NN from_IN that_DT recorded_VBD during_IN the_DT clinical_JJ period_NN ,_, except_IN that_IN a_DT few_JJ more_JJR immature_JJ mononuclears_NNS were_VBD noticed_VBN ._.
The_DT increase_NN in_IN the_DT number_NN of_IN leucocytes_NNS in_IN the_DT peripheral_JJ blood_NN immediately_RB before_IN death_NN may_MD be_VB accounted_VBN for_IN as_IN follows_VBZ ._.
Numerous_JJ leucocytes_NNS were_VBD found_VBN to_TO stagnate_VB in_IN the_DT vascular_JJ system_NN ;_: apparently_RB they_PRP stuck_VBP to_TO the_DT walls_NNS of_IN the_DT vessels_NNS ,_, perhaps_RB due_JJ to_TO some_DT alteration_NN in_IN the_DT normal_JJ ionic_JJ charge_NN of_IN the_DT blood_NN elements_NNS and_CC were_VBD thus_RB prevented_VBN from_IN leaving_VBG the_DT organs_NNS by_IN the_DT veins_NNS ._.
It_PRP may_MD be_VB that_IN immediately_RB or_CC shortly_RB before_IN death_NN ,_, prevailing_VBG ionic_JJ conditions_NNS were_VBD disturbed_VBN and_CC the_DT leucocytes_NNS were_VBD no_RB longer_RBR able_JJ to_TO remain_VB adherent_JJ to_TO the_DT vessel_NN wall_NN and_CC hence_NN were_VBD carried_VBN into_IN the_DT circulation_NN ._.
SUMMARY_NNP In_IN experimental_JJ theileriasis_NN slight_VBD leucocytosis_NN was_VBD observed_VBN during_IN the_DT sub-clinical_JJ period_NN ,_, with_IN increase_NN in_IN the_DT number_NN of_IN lymphocytes_NNS ,_, followed_VBN by_IN a_DT marked_JJ leucopenia_NN ._.
Differential_NNP white_JJ cell_NN counts_NNS showed_VBD a_DT marked_JJ relative_JJ monocytosis_NN ,_, indicating_VBG that_IN monocytes_VBZ play_VBP an_DT important_JJ part_NN in_IN the_DT blood_NN pathology_NN of_IN theileriasis_NN as_IN met_NN with_IN in_IN this_DT country_NN ._.
There_EX was_VBD no_DT noteworthy_JJ reduction_NN in_IN haemoglobin_NN values_NNS ._.
Animals_NNS in_IN good_JJ condition_NN were_VBD comparatively_RB resistant_JJ to_TO the_DT disease_NN ._.
The_DT sequence_NN of_IN anaemic_JJ changes_NNS occurring_VBG in_IN the_DT blood_NN of_IN an_DT infected_JJ animal_NN afforded_VBD a_DT fairly_RB reliable_JJ indication_NN as_IN to_TO its_PRP$ chances_NNS of_IN recovery_NN ._.
The_DT morphological_JJ changes_NNS occurring_VBG in_IN the_DT blood_NN do_VBP not_RB afford_VB a_DT clue_NN for_IN evolving_VBG a_DT method_NN of_IN effective_JJ treatment_NN ._.
Further_RB study_NN to_TO find_VB out_RP the_DT exact_JJ nature_NN of_IN the_DT agents_NNS causing_VBG death_NN is_VBZ desirable_JJ ._.

12_CD and_CC 13_CD (_( Part_NNP 1_CD )_) ,_, 243-82_JJ DISTRIBUTION_NNP OF_NNP FAT_NNP IN_NNP DAHI_NNP By_IN C._NNP P._NNP ANANTAKRISHNAN_NNP AND_NNP ZAL_NNP R._NNP KOTHAVALLA_NNP ,_, imperial_JJ Dairy_NNP Research_NNP Institute_NNP ,_, Bangalore_NNP (_( Received_VBN for_IN publication_NN on_IN 29_CD October_NNP 1945_CD )_) SINCE_NNP milk_NN is_VBZ a_DT highly_RB perishable_JJ article_NN of_IN food_NN various_JJ methods_NNS of_IN preserving_VBG it_PRP for_IN various_JJ lengths_NNS of_IN time_NN have_VBP been_VBN adopted_VBN in_IN a_DT tropical_JJ country_NN like_IN India_NNP Like_IN yoghurt_NN of_IN Balkans_NNPS ,_, koumiss_VB of_IN Russia_NNP and_CC lebum_NN of_IN Egypt_NNP khoa_NNP ,_, chinna_NN and_CC dahi_NN are_VBP some_DT of_IN the_DT various_JJ forms_NNS in_IN which_WDT milk_NN is_VBZ preserved_VBN in_IN India_NNP ._.
Of_IN all_PDT these_DT dahi_NN ,_, though_IN having_VBG a_DT comparatively_RB short_JJ life_NN ,_, forms_NNS part_NN of_IN the_DT daily_JJ menu_NN in_IN Indian_JJ household_NN and_CC is_VBZ immensely_RB popular_JJ ._.
Besides_IN possessing_VBG bacterial_JJ flora_NNS which_WDT are_VBP helpful_JJ to_TO the_DT human_JJ system_NN during_IN digestion_NN ,_, it_PRP is_VBZ found_VBN to_TO be_VB acceptable_JJ to_TO even_RB those_DT who_WP are_VBP more_RBR or_CC less_RBR intolerant_JJ to_TO all_DT other_JJ forms_NNS of_IN milk_NN product_NN even_RB to_TO ordinary_JJ milk_NN ._.
It_PRP is_VBZ also_RB a_DT marketable_JJ product_NN of_IN great_JJ importance_NN ._.
The_DT Indian_JJ dahi_NN or_CC curd_NN is_VBZ prepared_VBN by_IN boiling_VBG milk_NN ,_, cooling_VBG it_PRP to_TO about_IN 104°F_CD ._.
and_CC then_RB inoculating_VBG it_PRP with_IN a_DT small_JJ amount_NN of_IN curdled_JJ milk_NN as_IN a_DT 'starter_NN '_POS ._.
Whole_JJ milk_NN from_IN cows_NNS or_CC buffaloes_NNS or_CC a_DT mixture_NN of_IN the_DT two_CD is_VBZ fermented_VBN in_IN this_DT way_NN with_IN C._NNP P._NNP ANANTAKRISHNAN_NNP AND_NNP ZAL_NNP R._NNP KOTHAVALLA_NNP 57_CD lactic_JJ acid_NN bacteria_NNS for_IN the_DT preparation_NN of_IN dahi_NN ._.
Since_IN butterfat_NN is_VBZ the_DT most_RBS valuable_JJ constituent_NN of_IN milk_NN ,_, it_PRP is_VBZ a_DT matter_NN of_IN interest_NN to_TO know_VB how_WRB the_DT fat_JJ globules_NNS are_VBP distributed_VBN as_IN a_DT result_NN of_IN the_DT setting_NN of_IN milk_NN for_IN dahi_NN making_NN ._.
The_DT distribution_NN of_IN fat_NN in_IN dahi_NN would_MD affect_VB its_PRP$ food_NN value_NN as_IN dahi_NN is_VBZ generally_RB served_VBN out_RP in_IN layers_NNS when_WRB offered_VBN for_IN sale_NN ._.
It_PRP was_VBD with_IN the_DT idea_NN of_IN finding_VBG out_RP the_DT distribution_NN of_IN fat_NN in_IN dahi_NN and_CC the_DT reasons_NNS thereof_VBP that_IN this_DT study_NN was_VBD undertaken_VBN ._.
EXPERIMENTAL_NNP Since_IN milk_NN used_VBN for_IN making_VBG dahi_NN is_VBZ processed_VBN in_IN various_JJ ways_NNS ,_, some_DT of_IN the_DT common_JJ methods_NNS were_VBD adopted_VBN in_IN this_DT study_NN ._.
Distribution_NN of_IN fat_NN in_IN dahi_NN from_IN boiled_VBN milk_NN The_DT milk_NN used_VBN was_VBD secured_VBN from_IN the_DT farm_NN herd_NN of_IN the_DT Institute_NNP ._.
Uniform_NNP quality_NN was_VBD maintained_VBN as_RB far_RB as_IN possible_JJ by_IN using_VBG milk_NN from_IN the_DT same_JJ animals_NNS in_IN all_DT experiments_NNS in_IN which_WDT mixed_JJ milk_NN was_VBD used_VBN ._.
The_DT milk_NN was_VBD boiled_VBN for_IN two_CD minutes_NNS ,_, cooled_VBD to_TO 98°F._CD ,_, mixed_VBD a_DT starter_NN at_IN the_DT rate_NN of_IN 5_CD per_IN cent_NN ._.
;_: definite_NN amounts_NNS (_( 250_CD gm_NN )_) of_IN it_PRP were_VBD placed_VBN in_IN glass_NN beakers_NNS of_IN uniform_JJ type_NN and_CC provided_VBN with_IN lids_NNS ._.
They_PRP were_VBD kept_VBN undisturbed_JJ at_IN the_DT room_NN temperature_NN (_( 75°F_CD )_) overnight_NN ,_, when_WRB the_DT product_NN attained_VBD the_DT form_NN of_IN a_DT coagulated_JJ mass_NN ,_, even_RB though_IN it_PRP was_VBD only_RB a_DT weak_JJ gel_NN ._.
The_DT top_JJ layer_NN ,_, amounting_VBG to_TO exactly_RB one_CD fourth_JJ of_IN the_DT total_JJ weight_NN of_IN the_DT dahi_NN ,_, was_VBD removed_VBN with_IN a_DT nickel_JJ skimmer_NN into_IN a_DT beaker_NN ._.
The_DT second_JJ layer_NN amounting_VBG to_TO another_DT one-fourth_NN of_IN the_DT total_JJ weight_NN of_IN dahi_NN ,_, was_VBD scooped_VBN out_RP into_IN another_DT beaker_NN ._.
Similarly_RB the_DT third_JJ and_CC the_DT bottom_JJ layers_NNS were_VBD removed_VBN separately_RB ._.
These_DT four_CD parts_NNS of_IN dahi_NN of_IN equal_JJ weights_NNS were_VBD dissolved_VBN in_IN strong_JJ ammonia_NN (_( 5_CD ml_NN ._.
for_IN every_DT 100_CD gm_NN ._.
of_IN curd_NN )_) and_CC made_VBD up_RP to_TO known_VB volume_NN and_CC the_DT fat_JJ percentages_NNS in_IN each_DT sample_NN was_VBD estimated_VBN by_IN the_DT usual_JJ Gerber_NNP method_NN ._.
The_DT results_NNS obtained_VBN were_VBD always_RB corrected_VBN for_IN the_DT dilution_NN effected_VBD ._.
Fat_NNP was_VBD also_RB estimated_VBN by_IN the_DT Rose-Gottlieb_NNP method_NN for_IN a_DT few_JJ samples_NNS and_CC these_DT results_NNS were_VBD in_IN close_JJ agreement_NN with_IN those_DT obtained_VBN with_IN the_DT Gerber_NNP s_NN method_NN ._.
Since_IN the_DT latter_JJ method_NN was_VBD more_RBR convenient_JJ ,_, it_PRP was_VBD adopted_VBN for_IN all_PDT the_DT estimations_NNS ._.
Six_CD trials_NNS were_VBD conducted_VBN on_IN each_DT lot_NN of_IN cow_NN and_CC buffalo_NN milk_NN and_CC the_DT results_NNS obtained_VBN are_VBP presented_VBN in_IN Table_NNP I_PRP ._.

cm_NN ._.

The_DT same_JJ experiments_NNS were_VBD repeated_VBN with_IN the_DT same_JJ containers_NNS ,_, but_CC varying_VBG the_DT height_NN to_TO 6_CD cm_NN ._.
and_CC also_RB to_TO 3_CD cm_NN ._.
