On_IN the_DT other_JJ hand_NN there_EX is_VBZ a_DT relation_NN between_IN the_DT percentage_NN distribution_NN of_IN fat_NN and_CC the_DT depth_NN of_IN milk_NN kept_NN for_IN dahi_JJ setting_NN ._.
As_IN the_DT depth_NN dec-_JJ reases_VBZ the_DT percentage_NN of_IN fat_NN in_IN the_DT top_JJ layer_NN progressively_RB increases_VBZ irrespective_NN of_IN the_DT surface_NN area_NN ,_, with_IN the_DT result_NN that_WDT up_RB to_TO 90.0_CD per_IN cent_NN of_IN the_DT total_JJ fat_NN could_MD be_VB recovered_VBN in_IN the_DT top_JJ quarter_NN layer_NN ._.
When_WRB the_DT depth_NN of_IN milk_NN kept_NN for_IN dahi_NN making_NN was_VBD 9_CD cm_NN ._.
the_DT percentage_NN dis-_JJ tribution_NN for_IN the_DT top_JJ layer_NN was_VBD found_VBN to_TO be_VB 52.7_CD ,_, 21.0_CD ,_, 18.6_CD ,_, and_CC 6.8_CD respectively_RB ._.
But_CC when_WRB this_DT depth_NN was_VBD only_RB 6_CD cm_NN ._.
the_DT distribution_NN of_IN the_DT same_JJ was_VBD 63.4_CD ,_, 19.6_CD ,_, 13.3_CD ,_, and_CC 3.5_CD res-_JJ pectively_RB ._.
When_WRB the_DT depth_NN was_VBD still_RB further_RB reduced_VBN to_TO 3_CD cm_NN ,_, the_DT top_JJ layer_NN contained_VBD 89.9_CD ,_, second_JJ layer_NN 6.3_CD ,_, third_JJ layer_NN 2.5_CD and_CC bottom_VB layer_NN 1.2_CD per_IN cent_NN of_IN the_DT total_JJ fat_NN in_IN the_DT curds_NNS ._.
Thus_RB ,_, if_IN two_CD layers_NNS from_IN the_DT top_NN are_VBP taken_VBN into_IN consideration_NN about_IN 96.2_CD per_IN cent_NN of_IN the_DT total_JJ fat_NN could_MD be_VB recovered_VBN without_IN disturbing_VBG the_DT last_JJ two_CD bottom_JJ layers_NNS ._.
This_DT means_VBZ that_IN only_RB the_DT top_JJ half_NN layer_NN of_IN dahi_NN could_MD be_VB utilized_VBN if_IN butter_NN is_VBZ to_TO be_VB made_VBN by_IN the_DT desi_NN method_NN and_CC the_DT amount_NN of_IN material_NN for_IN churning_VBG could_MD thus_RB be_VB reduced_VBN to_TO half_NN which_WDT would_MD ultimately_RB mean_VB a_DT saving_NN of_IN labour_NN and_CC time_NN ._.
Effect_NN of_IN added_JJ substances_NNS to_TO milk_VB on_IN the_DT fat_JJ distribution_NN in_IN dahi_NN Rahn_NNP [_NN 1921_CD ]_NN found_VBD that_IN when_WRB the_DT viscosity_NN of_IN milk_NN was_VBD increased_VBN ,_, the_DT rate_NN of_IN creaming_VBG instead_RB of_IN slowing_VBG down_RP was_VBD actually_RB accelerated_VBN ._.
An_DT addition_NN of_IN gelatin_NN causes_VBZ a_DT quick_JJ cream-rise_NN ,_, a_DT thicker_NN cream_NN layer_NN and_CC a_DT much_RB more_RBR complete_JJ separation_NN of_IN fat_NN as_IN cream_NN ,_, in_IN spite_NN of_IN the_DT fact_NN that_IN the_DT viscosity_NN exceeds_VBZ the_DT maximum_NN of_IN normal_JJ milk_NN (_( 2.4_CD )_) ._.
The_DT ad-_JJ dition_NN of_IN crystalloids_NNS like_IN sugar_NN delays_NNS creaming_VBG whereas_IN the_DT addition_NN of_IN colloids_NNS like_IN gum_NN arabic_NN ,_, peptone_NN and_CC albumin_NN accelerates_NNS creaming_VBG ._.
Dam_NNP and_CC Sirks_NNP [_NNP 1922_CD ]_NNP found_VBD that_IN addi-_JJ tion_NN of_IN colloids_NNS like_IN starch_NN ,_, gelatin_NN and_CC gum_JJ tragacanth_NN to_TO milk_VB gave_VBD a_DT 15_CD to_TO 25_CD per_IN cent_NN increase_NN in_IN the_DT volume_NN of_IN cream_NN ._.
Hammer_NNP [_NN 1916_CD ]_NN added_VBD viscogen_NN and_CC found_VBD very_RB deep_JJ cream_NN layers_NNS ,_, often_RB extending_VBG nearly_RB to_TO the_DT bottom_NN of_IN the_DT creaming_VBG cylinder_NN ._.
But_CC all_PDT these_DT authors_NNS refer_VBP only_RB to_TO milk_NN or_CC cream_NN and_CC no_DT work_NN appears_VBZ to_TO have_VB been_VBN done_VBN on_IN the_DT effect_NN of_IN added_JJ substances_NNS on_IN the_DT ascent_NN of_IN fat_NN in_IN dahi_NN ._.
In_IN the_DT present_JJ investigation_NN the_DT effect_NN of_IN colloids_NNS and_CC crystalloids_NNS on_IN the_DT percentage_NN of_IN distribution_NN of_IN fat_NN in_IN dahi_NN was_VBD investigated_VBN ._.
C._NNP P._NNP ANANTAKRISHNAN_NNP AND_NNP ZAL_NNP R._NNP KOTHAVALLA_NNP 61_CD Milk_NNP (_( 250_CD ml_NN ._. )_)
was_VBD boiled_VBN in_IN a_DT vessel_NN (_( degchi_NN )_) with_IN the_DT required_JJ amount_NN of_IN various_JJ sub-_JJ stances_NNS ,_, cooled_VBD down_RB to_TO 98°F_CD and_CC brought_VBD to_TO the_DT original_JJ volume_NN by_IN the_DT addition_NN of_IN water_NN ._.

of_IN milk_NN with_IN 0.1_CD per_IN cent_NN agar_NN agar_NN ._.

Thus_RB ,_, it_PRP is_VBZ clear_JJ that_IN ,_, if_IN agar_JJ agar_NN is_VBZ added_VBN to_TO milk_VB before_IN boiling_VBG the_DT volume_NN of_IN curd_NN to_TO be_VB churned_VBN ,_, and_CC consequently_RB the_DT labour_NN involved_VBN could_MD be_VB reduced_VBN by_IN half_NN without_IN affecting_VBG the_DT yield_NN of_IN butter_NN to_TO a_DT consider-_JJ able_JJ extent_NN ._.
Effect_NN of_IN temperature_NN on_IN the_DT distribution_NN of_IN fat_NN in_IN dahi_NN In_IN order_NN to_TO verify_VB to_TO what_WP extent_NN stirring_NN of_IN milk_NN before_IN coagulation_NN set_VBN in_IN affected_JJ the_DT distribution_NN of_IN fat_NN in_IN dahi_NN ,_, milk_NN was_VBD boiled_VBN and_CC after_IN inoculation_NN placed_VBN in_IN a_DT glass_NN container_NN to_TO a_DT depth_NN of_IN 9_CD cm_NN ._.
and_CC kept_VBD at_IN 98°F_CD ._.

with_IN starter_NN added_VBN to_TO it_PRP at_IN the_DT rate_NN of_IN 10_CD per_IN cent_NN ._.

Effect_NN of_IN stirring_VBG on_IN the_DT distribution_NN of_IN fat_NN in_IN dahi_NN To_TO study_VB the_DT effect_NN of_IN stirring_VBG on_IN the_DT distribution_NN of_IN fat_NN in_IN dahi_NN the_DT following_JJ experi-_JJ ments_NNS were_VBD conducted_VBN ._.

One_CD of_IN the_DT containers_NNS was_VBD kept_VBN as_IN a_DT control_NN without_IN disturbing_VBG ._.
C._NNP P._NNP ANANTAKRISHNAN_NNP AND_NNP ZAL_NNP R._NNP KOTHAVALLA_NNP 63_CD The_DT second_JJ ,_, third_JJ and_CC the_DT fourth_JJ containers_NNS were_VBD stirred_VBN well_RB with_IN a_DT glass_NN rod_NN one_CD and_CC a_DT half_NN ,_, two_CD and_CC three_CD hours_NNS respectively_RB after_IN inoculation_NN ._.
After_IN this_DT ,_, the_DT samples_NNS were_VBD allowed_VBN to_TO remain_VB in_IN the_DT incubator_NN undisturbed_VBD for_IN 12_CD hours_NNS and_CC were_VBD then_RB separated_VBN into_IN four_CD equal_JJ layers_NNS and_CC analysed_VBD for_IN fat_NN ._.
Six_CD trials_NNS were_VBD conducted_VBN and_CC the_DT results_NNS obtained_VBN are_VBP presented_VBN in_IN Table_NNP IX_NNP ._.
The_DT data_NN in_IN Table_NNP IX_NNP indicates_VBZ clearly_RB that_IN stirring_VBG the_DT product_NN two_CD or_CC three_CD hours_NNS after_IN inoculation_NN brings_VBZ about_IN a_DT better_JJR uniformity_NN in_IN the_DT distribution_NN of_IN fat_NN in_IN different_JJ layers_NNS ._.
In_IN samples_NNS stirred_VBD one_CD and_CC a_DT half_NN hours_NNS after_IN inoculation_NN ,_, the_DT fat_JJ percentage_NN of_IN the_DT top_JJ layer_NN was_VBD generally_RB more_JJR than_IN those_DT stirred_JJ two_CD or_CC three_CD hours_NNS after_IN inoculation_NN ._.
In_IN all_PDT the_DT above_JJ samples_NNS visible_JJ coagulation_NN was_VBD observed_VBN only_RB 4.5_CD to_TO 5.5_CD hours_NNS after_IN in-_JJ oculation_NN ._.

Three_CD trials_NNS were_VBD conducted_VBN using_VBG boiled_JJ cow_NN milk_NN and_CC the_DT results_NNS obtained_VBN are_VBP presented_VBN in_IN Table_NNP X_NNP ._.

The_DT stirring_NN before_IN coagulation_NN effects_NNS an_DT uniform_JJ distribution_NN of_IN fat_NN in_IN different_JJ layers_NNS and_CC the_DT coagulated_JJ mass_NN prevents_VBZ the_DT fat_JJ globules_NNS from_IN moving_VBG upwards_NNS ._.
The_DT texture_NN of_IN dahi_NN is_VBZ not_RB very_RB much_RB altered_VBN by_IN the_DT stirring_VBG within_IN four_CD hours_NNS of_IN the_DT inoculation_NN ._.
The_DT dahi_NN kept_VBD for_IN sale_NN should_MD have_VB an_DT uniform_JJ composition_NN and_CC if_IN this_DT is_VBZ to_TO be_VB insisted_VBN upon_IN ,_, the_DT best_JJS procedure_NN would_MD be_VB to_TO stir_VB the_DT mass_NN of_IN milk_NN four_CD hours_NNS after_IN inoculation_NN and_CC then_RB to_TO keep_VB it_PRP overnight_RP when_WRB a_DT fairly_RB uniform_JJ composition_NN could_MD be_VB achieved_VBN ._.
SUMMARY_NNP During_IN the_DT formation_NN of_IN dahi_NN butterfat_NN has_VBZ a_DT tendency_NN to_TO rise_VB and_CC concentrate_VB in_IN the_DT top_JJ quarter_NN layer_NN ._.
This_DT phenomenon_NN is_VBZ somewhat_RB similar_JJ to_TO the_DT fat_JJ rising_NN in_IN milk_NN or_CC cream_NN ._.
When_WRB the_DT depth_NN of_IN milk_NN kept_NN for_IN dahi_NN making_NN was_VBD 9_CD cm_NN ._.
as_IN in_IN the_DT experiments_NNS reported_VBN in_IN the_DT paper_NN the_DT top_JJ ,_, second_JJ ,_, third_JJ and_CC bottom_JJ layers_NNS were_VBD found_VBN to_TO contain_VB about_IN 49.0_CD ,_, 23.5_CD ,_, 19.9_CD and_CC 7.6_CD per_IN cent_NN respectively_RB of_IN the_DT total_JJ fat_NN ._.
When_WRB the_DT depth_NN of_IN milk_NN kept_NN for_IN dahi_NN making_NN was_VBD the_DT same_JJ there_EX was_VBD no_DT difference_NN between_IN dahi_NN from_IN pasteurized_VBN or_CC boiled_VBN milk_NN ,_, whether_IN of_IN cow_NN or_CC buffalo_NN ,_, as_RB far_RB as_IN the_DT percent-_JJ age_NN distribution_NN of_IN fat_NN was_VBD concerned_VBN ._.
The_DT dahi_NN obtained_VBN from_IN raw_JJ milk_NN was_VBD generally_RB loose_JJ in_IN texture_NN and_CC therefore_RB there_EX was_VBD more_JJR fat_JJ rising_NN in_IN raw_JJ milk_NN as_IN compared_VBN to_TO that_DT in_IN boiled_JJ milk_NN ._.
The_DT depth_NN of_IN milk_NN kept_NN for_IN dahi_JJ making_VBG remaining_VBG the_DT same_JJ the_DT surface_NN area_NN of_IN dahi_NN had_VBD no_DT effect_NN on_IN the_DT fat_JJ distribution_NN ._.
There_EX was_VBD definite_JJ relationship_NN between_IN the_DT depth_NN of_IN dahi_NN and_CC the_DT upward_JJ movement_NN of_IN fat_NN ._.
As_IN the_DT depth_NN of_IN milk_NN kept_NN for_IN dahi_NN making_NN decreased_VBD the_DT percentage_NN of_IN fat_NN in_IN the_DT top_JJ layer_NN increased_VBD ,_, irrespective_NN of_IN the_DT surface_NN area_NN ,_, with_IN the_DT result_NN that_WDT even_RB up_VBP to_TO 90.0_CD per_IN cent_NN of_IN the_DT total_JJ fat_NN could_MD be_VB recovered_VBN in_IN the_DT top_JJ quarter_NN layer_NN when_WRB the_DT depth_NN of_IN the_DT column_NN kept_VBD for_IN dahi_NN setting_NN was_VBD 3_CD cm_NN ._.
The_DT addition_NN of_IN colloids_NNS like_IN agar_NN agar_NN to_TO milk_NN before_IN the_DT addition_NN of_IN starter_NN appreciably_RB accelerated_VBD creaming_VBG in_IN dahi_NN ,_, whereas_JJ crystalloids_NNS like_IN cane_NN sugar_NN delay_NN creaming_NN ._.
It_PRP was_VBD found_VBN that_IN by_IN incorporating_VBG agar_NN agar_NN in_IN milk_NN for_IN the_DT indigenous_JJ method_NN of_IN butter_NN making_NN ,_, about_RB 80.0_CD per_IN cent_NN of_IN the_DT total_JJ butter_NN fat_NN could_MD be_VB recovered_VBN from_IN the_DT top_JJ layer_NN of_IN the_DT curd_NN ._.
A_DT fairly_RB uniform_JJ distribution_NN of_IN fat_NN in_IN dahi_NN could_MD be_VB secured_VBN if_IN dahi_NN is_VBZ stirred_VBN within_IN three_CD to_TO four_CD hours_NNS after_IN inoculation_NN of_IN the_DT milk_NN with_IN the_DT starter_JJ culture_NN ._.

Milchereiw_NNP 1_CD ,_, 133_CD STUDIES_NNP ON_NNP THE_NNP METHODS_NNP OF_NNP PREPARATION_NNP OF_NNP GHEE*_NNP I._NNP ACIDITY_NNP IN_NNP GHEE_NNP By_IN K._NNP S._NNP RANGAPPA_NNP and_CC B._NNP N._NNP BANERJEE_NNP ,_, Department_NNP of_IN Biochemistry_NNP ,_, Indian_NNP Institutue_NNP of_IN Science_NNP ,_, Bangalore_NNP (_( Received_VBN for_IN publication_NN on_IN 13_CD November_NNP 1945_CD ._. )_)
ACIDITY_NNP in_IN butter_NN fat_NN or_CC ghee_NN is_VBZ responsible_JJ for_IN a_DT number_NN of_IN undesirable_JJ changes_NNS in_IN it_PRP ,_, and_CC should_MD be_VB prevented_VBN or_CC reduced_VBN to_TO a_DT minimum_NN ._.
Unfortunately_RB ,_, however_RB ,_, in_IN the_DT pre-_JJ paration_NN of_IN butter_NN and_CC ghee_NN by_IN the_DT indigenous_JJ process_NN (_( curd_JJ process_NN )_) or_CC the_DT creamery_NN process_NN ,_, souring_VBG takes_VBZ place_NN ,_, and_CC this_DT gives_VBZ rise_NN to_TO the_DT incorporation_NN of_IN acids_NNS in_IN butter_NN and_CC ghee_NN ._.
The_DT souring_NN is_VBZ practised_VBN as_IN it_PRP imparts_VBZ certain_JJ desirable_JJ properties_NNS to_TO butter_VB and_CC ghee_VB ,_, such_JJ as_IN taste_NN ,_, flavour_NN and_CC the_DT like_JJ ._.
Butter_NNP and_CC ghee_NN can_MD be_VB made_VBN directly_RB from_IN milk_NN without_IN souring_VBG or_CC without_IN any_DT acids_NNS developing_VBG in_IN them_PRP [_VBP Banerjee_NNP and_CC Doctor_NNP ,_, 1938_CD ]_NN ,_, but_CC such_JJ products_NNS taste_VBP like_IN granulated_VBN oil_NN with_IN a_DT slight_JJ milky_NN flavour_NN and_CC do_VBP not_RB possess_VB any_DT of_IN the_DT valuable_JJ pro-_JJ perties_NNS for_IN which_WDT butter_NN or_CC ghee_NN is_VBZ prized_VBN ._.
Lately_RB ,_, in_IN Western_JJ countries_NNS ,_, neutralization_NN of_IN cream_NN after_IN souring_VBG is_VBZ being_VBG resorted_VBN to_TO in_IN order_NN to_TO produce_VB low_JJ acid_NN butter_NN ._.
Nothing_NN is_VBZ done_VBN ,_, however_RB ,_, in_IN the_DT indigenous_JJ process_NN to_TO reduce_VB acidity_NN ,_, or_CC minimize_VB the_DT effect_NN of_IN acidity_NN in_IN ghee_NN ._.
In_IN this_DT paper_NN only_RB the_DT role_NN of_IN acidity_NN in_IN ghee_NN or_CC butter_NN ,_, by_IN the_DT desi_NN (_( curd_NN )_) process_NN has_VBZ been_VBN studied_VBN ._.
Acidity_NNP is_VBZ developed_VBN in_IN two_CD ways_NNS ;_: first_VBZ it_PRP develops_VBZ during_IN the_DT process_NN of_IN manufacture_NN from_IN milk_NN to_TO ghee_VB ,_, and_CC secondly_RB in_IN course_NN of_IN storage_NN before_IN consumption_NN ._.
A_DT number_NN of_IN factors_NNS come_VBP into_IN play_NN in_IN the_DT two_CD processes_NNS of_IN the_DT development_NN of_IN acidity_NN ._.
There_EX is_VBZ a_DT third_JJ factor_NN which_WDT develops_VBZ acidity_NN in_IN butter_NN or_CC ghee_JJ lipase_NN ,_, present_JJ in_IN milk_NN ,_, and_CC microflora_NNS of_IN souring_VBG or_CC of_IN contamination_NN ;_: but_CC this_DT part_NN of_IN the_DT subject_NN is_VBZ reserved_VBN for_IN a_DT separate_JJ study_NN and_CC is_VBZ not_RB included_VBN in_IN the_DT present_JJ one_CD ._.
Microflora_NNP present_NN in_IN milk_NN from_IN the_DT time_NN of_IN milking_VBG to_TO the_DT time_NN of_IN processing_VBG produce_NN acids_NNS in_IN milk_NN ._.
This_DT is_VBZ a_DT preventible_JJ factor_NN ;_: and_CC if_IN the_DT healthy_JJ practice_NN of_IN sterilizing_VBG or_CC boil-_JJ ing_VBG milk_NN as_RB soon_RB as_IN possible_JJ after_IN milking_VBG is_VBZ followed_VBN ,_, this_DT defect_NN can_MD be_VB removed_VBN ._.
Besides_IN ,_, this_DT is_VBZ an_DT important_JJ item_NN in_IN the_DT problem_NN of_IN supply_NN of_IN clean_JJ and_CC healthy_JJ milk_NN and_CC is_VBZ therefore_RB omitted_VBN from_IN this_DT study_NN ._.
Generally_RB ,_, milk_NN is_VBZ processed_VBN by_IN boiling_VBG to_TO reduce_VB microbial_JJ damage_NN ._.
There_EX is_VBZ ,_, still_RB ,_, a_DT lapse_NN of_IN time_NN between_IN the_DT process_NN of_IN boiling_NN and_CC seeding_VBG with_IN curd_NN for_IN souring_VBG ._.
In_IN the_DT process_NN of_IN souring_NN ,_, a_DT number_NN of_IN factors_NNS come_VBP into_IN play_NN ;_: the_DT length_NN of_IN souring_NN ,_, temperature_NN ,_, microflora_NN ,_, acidity_NN and_CC quantity_NN of_IN seed_NN curd_NN ._.
Without_IN entering_VBG into_IN the_DT study_NN of_IN the_DT souring_NN process_NN the_DT formation_NN of_IN acidity_NN during_IN souring_NN has_VBZ been_VBN recorded_VBN in_IN a_DT number_NN of_IN expriments_NNS to_TO follow_VB up_RP the_DT development_NN of_IN acidity_NN in_IN curd_NN ,_, butter_NN ,_, ghee_NN and_CC its_PRP$ control_NN ._.
Acidity_NNP development_NN in_IN souring_NN and_CC manufacture_NN In_IN order_NN to_TO study_VB this_DT factor_NN ,_, milk_NN obtained_VBN within_IN two_CD hours_NNS of_IN milking_VBG from_IN a_DT dairy_NN was_VBD heated_VBN in_IN an_DT autoclave_NN for_IN 20_CD minutes_NNS ,_, cooled_VBN ,_, and_CC then_RB incubated_VBN with_IN seed_NN curd_NN ._.
Buffalo_NNP milk_NN was_VBD used_VBN ,_, and_CC its_PRP$ fat_JJ content_NN varied_VBD from_IN 7.0_CD to_TO 8.5_CD per_IN cent_NN ._.
The_DT quantity_NN of_IN seed_NN curd_NN added_VBD was_VBD 2.5_CD per_IN cent_NN and_CC its_PRP$ acidity_NN ,_, about_RB 1.4_CD per_IN cent_NN ._.
lactic_JJ acid_NN ._.
The_DT seed_NN curd_NN was_VBD maintained_VBN in_IN the_DT laboratory_NN from_IN day_NN to_TO day_NN inoculations_NNS in_IN culture_NN tubes_NNS ._.
The_DT acidity_NN of_IN the_DT milk_NN to_TO start_VB with_IN was_VBD 0.09_CD to_TO 0.11_CD per_IN cent_NN lactic_JJ acid_NN ._.
Two_CD litres_NNS of_IN milk_NN were_VBD soured_VBN at_IN 24°C._CD ,_, 30°C._CD ,_, 35°C._CD ,_, 40°C._CD ,_, and_CC 45°C_CD ._.
At_IN the_DT end_NN of_IN 6_CD ,_, 8_CD ,_, 12_CD ,_, 24_CD ,_, 36_CD ,_, and_CC 48_CD hours_NNS samples_NNS were_VBD drawn_VBN ,_, and_CC the_DT acidity_NN of_IN the_DT curd_NN determined_VBD ._.
Ten_CD cubic_JJ centimeters_NNS of_IN homogeneous-_JJ ly_NN mixed_JJ curd_NN was_VBD mixed_JJ with_IN 10_CD c._NNS c._NN of_IN water_NN and_CC titrated_VBN against_IN N/10_NNP NaOH_NNP with_IN phenolphthalene_NN as_IN an_DT indicator_NN ._.
The_DT curd_NN was_VBD then_RB churned_VBN in_IN a_DT domestic_JJ bottle_NN churn_NN to_TO prepare_VB butter_NN ._.
Wäter_NNP was_VBD added_VBN from_IN time_NN to_TO time_NN equal_JJ to_TO the_DT volume_NN of_IN the_DT curd_NN for_IN separation_NN of_IN the_DT fat_NN ._.
The_DT butter_NN was_VBD washed_VBN three_CD times_NNS with_IN twice_JJ its_PRP$ volume_NN of_IN water_NN ,_, and_CC then_RB its_PRP$ acid_NN value_NN was_VBD determined_VBN ._.
Ghee_NNP was_VBD prepared_VBN from_IN the_DT butter_NN in_IN *In_NN this_DT paper_NN the_DT quality_NN and_CC constants_NNS of_IN ghee_NN are_VBP expressed_VBN as_IN follows_VBZ :66_NNP Methods_NNP of_IN Preparation_NNP of_IN Ghee_NNP two_CD ways_NNS ,_, the_DT decantation_NN process_NN and_CC the_DT boiling_NN process_NN ._.
In_IN the_DT former_JJ process_NN the_DT butter_NN was_VBD maintained_VBN for_IN about_IN an_DT hour_NN at_IN 100°C_CD ._.
in_IN an_DT electric_JJ oven_NN when_WRB scum_NN ,_, fat_JJ and_CC butter-milk_NN separated_VBN in_IN three_CD clear_JJ layers_NNS ._.
The_DT clear_JJ fat_JJ layer_NN was_VBD separated_VBN and_CC heated_VBN to_TO 110°C_CD ._.
for_IN five_CD minutes_NNS to_TO remove_VB the_DT adhering_JJ moisture_NN ._.
In_IN the_DT latter_JJ process_NN the_DT butter_NN was_VBD heated_VBN on_IN a_DT low_JJ flame_NN till_NN all_PDT the_DT moisture_NN was_VBD driven_VBN off_RP and_CC filtered_VBD to_TO remove_VB casein_NN particles_NNS ._.

On_IN a_DT laboratory_NN scale_NN the_DT choice_NN of_IN a_DT proper_JJ alkali_NN and_CC its_PRP$ strength_NN were_VBD determined_VBN in_IN the_DT following_JJ way_NN ._.
Caustic_JJ soda_NN 0.16_CD N_NNP ,_, hot_JJ and_CC cold_JJ ,_, 16_CD N_NNP and_CC 3.2_CD N_NNP ,_, ammonia_VBZ 0.1_CD N_NNP ,_, hot_JJ and_CC cold_JJ ,_, 1.6_CD N_NNP ,_, and_CC 3.2_CD N_NNP ,_, sodium_NN carbonate_NN 0.16_CD N_NNP ,_, hot_JJ and_CC cold_JJ ,_, 1.6_CD N_NNP ,_, and_CC 3.2_CD N_NNP ,_, and_CC caustic_JJ lime_NN in_IN saturated_JJ solution_NN ,_, paste_NN and_CC in_IN cream_JJ form_NN were_VBD tried_VBN ._.
The_DT neutralizations_NNS were_VBD effected_VBN in_IN the_DT following_JJ manner_NN :_: (_( a_DT )_) The_DT calculated_JJ quantity_NN of_IN alkali_NN was_VBD added_VBN in_IN bulk_NN ,_, mixed_JJ and_CC washed_JJ with_IN hot_JJ water_NN ._.
(_( b_NN )_) The_DT calculated_JJ quantity_NN of_IN alkali_NN was_VBD added_VBN in_IN four_CD to_TO six_CD instalments_NNS ,_, mixed_JJ ,_, washed_VBD each_DT time_NN and_CC finally_RB the_DT adhering_VBG soap_NN was_VBD washed_VBN off_RP ._.
(_( c_NN )_) Ghee_NNP was_VBD first_RB washed_VBN with_IN hot_JJ water_NN two_CD or_CC three_CD times_NNS and_CC then_RB the_DT acidity_NN was_VBD neutralized_VBN as_IN in_IN (_( b_NN )_) above_IN ._.
(_( d_NN )_) The_DT calculated_JJ quantity_NN of_IN alkali_NN was_VBD added_VBN in_IN bulk_NN ,_, and_CC the_DT whole_JJ maintained_VBN at_IN about_RB 60°_CD to_TO 70°C_CD ._.
for_IN about_RB six_CD hours_NNS ,_, the_DT soap_NN run_VB off_RB and_CC washed_VBD ._.
Ghee_NNP was_VBD washed_VBN with_IN hot_JJ water_NN at_IN about_IN 90°C._CD ,_, so_RB that_IN ,_, on_IN cooling_VBG during_IN the_DT process_NN ,_, the_DT temperature_NN of_IN the_DT mass_NN was_VBD not_RB below_IN 60°C_CD ._.
Due_JJ to_TO emulsification_VB it_PRP was_VBD found_VBN that_IN there_EX was_VBD a_DT residual_JJ acidity_NN when_WRB the_DT calculated_JJ quantity_NN of_IN alkali_NN was_VBD added_VBN ._.
An_DT excess_NN of_IN alkali_NN over_IN the_DT calculated_JJ amount_NN was_VBD always_RB necessary_JJ to_TO completely_RB neutralize_VB the_DT acidity_NN ._.
The_DT results_NNS are_VBP given_VBN in_IN a_DT tabular_NN (_( Table_NNP IV_NNP )_) form_NN with_IN the_DT effect_NN of_IN the_DT treatment_NN on_IN the_DT colour_NN ,_, flavour_NN ,_, and_CC texture_NN of_IN ghee_NN ._.
Variations_NNS in_IN ghee_NN on_IN neutralization_NN Sample_NNP Carotene_NNP yellow_JJ units_NNS Vitamin_VBP A_NNP R._NNP M._NNP Sapopifica-_NNP tion_NN value_NN Acidity_NNP (_( oleio_JJ acid_NN )_) Peroxide_NNP value_NN Bangalore_NNP ..._: 0.5_CD 1.0_CD 24.2_CD 223_CD 4.3_CD 0.25_CD do_NN ._.
after_IN neutralization_NN 0.4_CD 0.6_CD 21.7_CD 212_CD 0.2_CD 0.30_CD Peshawar_NNP (_( S_NNP )_) ..._: 0.4_CD 1.2_CD 25.5_CD 230_CD 10.5_CD 72_CD Methods_NNS of_IN Preparation_NNP of_IN Ghee_NNP It_PRP has_VBZ been_VBN observed_VBN that_IN an_DT alkali_NN neither_RB too_RB strong_JJ nor_CC too_RB weak_JJ is_VBZ suitable_JJ for_IN the_DT neutralization_NN of_IN ghee_NN ._.
This_DT fact_NN has_VBZ been_VBN observed_VBN in_IN the_DT case_NN of_IN cream_NN neutralization_NN as_IN well_RB ._.
An_DT alkali_JJ strength_NN ,_, one_CD part_NN of_IN which_WDT neutralizes_VBZ the_DT free_JJ fatty_JJ acids_NNS in_IN 10_CD parts_NNS of_IN ghee_NN ,_, works_VBZ best_JJS ._.
Caustic_JJ soda_NN works_VBZ better_RBR than_IN the_DT other_JJ alkalies_NNS tried_VBN ._.
It_PRP is_VBZ better_RBR to_TO add_VB the_DT neutralizer_NN in_IN 4_CD to_TO 6_CD instalments_NNS than_IN in_IN one_CD and_CC wash_VB each_DT time_NN with_IN water_NN about_IN twice_RB the_DT volume_NN of_IN ghee_NN ._.
Finally_RB ,_, ghee_NN should_MD be_VB washed_VBN thoroughly_RB until_IN the_DT fat_NN clears_VBZ up_RP into_IN a_DT clear_JJ yellow_JJ liquid_NN ._.
Vigorous_JJ agitation_NN should_MD be_VB avoided_VBN and_CC sufficient_JJ time_NN should_MD be_VB allowed_VBN for_IN the_DT wash_JJ water_NN to_TO drain_VB to_TO the_DT bottom_NN of_IN the_DT vessel_NN ._.
In_IN a_DT test_NN case_NN 1450_CD gm_NN ._.
of_IN ghee_NN of_IN acidity_NN 4.2_CD per_IN cent_NN oleic_NN acid_NN ,_, were_VBD neutralized_VBN as_IN described_VBN above_IN ._.
The_DT neutralized_JJ ghee_NN weighed_VBD 1350_CD gm_NN ._.
and_CC was_VBD of_IN acidity_NN 0.4_CD per_IN cent_NN oleic_NN acid_NN ._.
The_DT time_NN taken_VBN was_VBD 6½_CD hours_NNS and_CC 18_CD litres_NNS of_IN water_NN were_VBD used_VBN ._.
The_DT process_NN resulted_VBD in_IN a_DT loss_NN of_IN 100_CD gm_NN ._.
of_IN which_WDT 61_CD gm_NN ._.
were_VBD free_JJ fatty_JJ acids_NNS calculated_VBD as_IN oleic_JJ acid_NN ,_, Two_CD more_JJR samples_NNS from_IN Peshawar_NNP were_VBD similarly_RB treated_VBN and_CC the_DT effect_NN of_IN the_DT process_NN on_IN the_DT carotene_NN ,_, vitamin_FW A_NNP ,_, R._NNP M._NNP and_CC saponification_NN value_NN were_VBD determined_VBN ._.
The_DT results_NNS are_VBP given_VBN in_IN Table_NNP IV_NNP ._.
High_JJ acid_NN ghee_NN can_MD thus_RB be_VB neutralized_VBN ,_, and_CC a_DT product_NN of_IN better_JJR quality_NN made_VBN ._.
The_DT fat_JJ loss_NN is_VBZ not_RB high_JJ but_CC the_DT carotene_NN and_CC vitamin_VB A_DT contents_NNS are_VBP partly_RB lost_VBN ._.
Other_JJ con-_JJ stants_NNS of_IN ghee_NNS are_VBP not_RB much_RB affected_VBN ._.

SOURING_NN PROCESS_NN By_IN M._NNP R._NNP SRINIVASAN_NNP AND_NNP B._NNP N._NNP BANERJEE_NNP ,_, Department_NNP of_IN Biochemistry_NNP ,_, Indian_NNP Institute_NNP of_IN Science_NNP ,_, Bangalore_NNP (_( Received_VBN for_IN publication_NN on_IN 13_CD November_NNP 1945_CD )_) (_( With_IN four_CD text_NN figures_NNS )_) PROCESSING_NN OF_NNP MILK_NNP WHILE_IN the_DT problems_NNS of_IN production_NN and_CC handling_NN of_IN milk_NN are_VBP outside_IN the_DT scope_NN of_IN ghee_JJ manufacture_NN ,_, still_RB ,_, in_IN a_DT country_NN like_IN India_NNP ,_, with_IN a_DT tropical_JJ climate_NN and_CC inadequate_JJ com-_JJ munication_NN ,_, it_PRP is_VBZ important_JJ that_IN milk_NN should_MD be_VB produced_VBN with_IN as_RB little_JJ contamination_NN as_IN possible_JJ in_IN order_NN to_TO ensure_VB storage_NN quality_NN ._.
Otherwise_RB there_EX is_VBZ a_DT grave_JJ risk_NN of_IN souring_VBG and_CC spoilage_NN ._.
A_DT sour_JJ and_CC spoilt_JJ milk_NN can_MD not_RB be_VB expected_VBN to_TO give_VB a_DT sweet_JJ curd_NN nor_CC a_DT fine_JJ butter_NN and_CC ghee_NN ._.
Butter_NNP and_CC ghee_NN ,_, made_VBN in_IN summer_NN and_CC rainy_JJ seasons_NNS ,_, are_VBP generally_RB bad_JJ and_CC of_IN poor_JJ quality_NN ._.
In_IN a_DT tropical_JJ climate_NN the_DT temperature_NN seriously_RB affects_VBZ the_DT keeping_VBG quality_NN of_IN the_DT product_NN ._.
It_PRP has_VBZ been_VBN found_VBN that_IN milk_NN stored_VBN at_IN 100°_CD F._NNP will_MD only_RB keep_VB sweet_NN for_IN about_IN quarter_NN of_IN the_DT time_NN of_IN milk_NN kept_VBN at_IN 60°_CD F._NNP [_NNP Wright_NNP ,_, 1937_CD ]_NN ._.
It_PRP follows_VBZ that_IN under_IN Indian_JJ conditions_NNS ,_, any_DT processing_NN of_IN milk_NN ,_, which_WDT may_MD be_VB necessary_JJ ,_, should_MD take_VB place_NN as_RB soon_RB as_IN possible_JJ after_IN production_NN ._.
While_IN as_IN a_DT result_NN of_IN ignorance_NN and_CC poverty_NN of_IN gowalas_NNS and_CC farmers_NNS milk_NN is_VBZ not_RB produced_VBN in_IN a_DT clean_JJ condition_NN still_RB ,_, in_IN India_NNP ,_, the_DT problem_NN of_IN milk-borne_JJ disease_NN does_VBZ not_RB arise_VB ._.
This_DT is_VBZ due_JJ to_TO the_DT almost_RB universal_JJ custom_NN of_IN boiling_VBG the_DT milk_NN before_IN it_PRP is_VBZ consumed_VBN ._.
This_DT does_VBZ not_RB mean_VB that_IN all_DT milk_NN is_VBZ sold_VBN or_CC used_VBN only_RB after_IN boiling_VBG ._.
However_RB ,_, by_IN processing_VBG the_DT maximum_NN of_IN germ_JJ destruction_NN with_IN a_DT minimum_NN of_IN heat_NN flavour_NN is_VBZ what_WP is_VBZ aimed_VBN at_IN ._.
Modern_JJ processing_NN methods_NNS ,_, based_VBN on_IN heat_NN treatment_NN or_CC on_IN refrigeration_NN or_CC both_DT ,_, add_VBP to_TO the_DT costs_NNS of_IN milk_NN ._.
The_DT existing_VBG types_NNS of_IN equipment_NN are_VBP expensive_JJ and_CC are_VBP not_RB designed_VBN to_TO 'In_VB this_DT paper_NN the_DT quality_NN and_CC constants_NNS of_IN ghee_NN are_VBP expressed_VBN as_IN follows_VBZ :_: 1_CD ._.
Acidity_NNP as_IN percentage_NN of_IN lactic_JJ acid_NN ,_, unless_IN otherwise_RB mentioned_VBN ._.
2_CD ._.
Vitamin_VB A_NNP as_IN Lovibond_NNP blue_JJ units_NNS per_IN gram_NN with_IN Carr_NNP and_CC Price_NNP reagent_NN ,_, 3_CD ._.
Carotene_NNP as_IN Lovibond_NNP yellow_JJ units_NNS per_IN gram_NN ,_, 4_CD ._.
Quality_NN of_IN ghee_NN denotes_NNS ,_, flavour_NN ,_, texture_NN and_CC colour_NN ,_, (_( a_DT )_) Flavour_CD can_MD be_VB expressed_VBN as_IN clean_NN ,_, pronounced_VBD ,_, pleasant_JJ ,_, aromatic_JJ with_IN no_DT taint_NN and_CC free_JJ from_IN yeasty_NN ,_, cheesy_NN ,_, curdy_NN and_CC other_JJ flavours_NNS ._.
(_( b_NN )_) Texture_NN can_MD be_VB expressed_VBN as_IN firm_NN ,_, granular_JJ pasty_NN and_CC semi-liquid_NN ._.
(_( c_NN )_) Colour_NNP is_VBZ yellow_JJ ,_, but_CC may_MD be_VB pale_JJ ,_, greenish_JJ ,_, or_CC deep_JJ with_IN an_DT orange_NN tint_NN ._.
M._NNP R._NNP SRINIVASAN_NNP AND_NNP B._NNP N._NNP BANERJEE_NNP 73_CD meet_VBD the_DT needs_NNS of_IN a_DT primitive_JJ village_NN producer_NN ._.
We_PRP were_VBD ,_, therefore_RB ,_, left_VBD with_IN the_DT problem_NN of_IN finding_VBG out_RP the_DT temperature_NN and_CC time_NN of_IN boiling_NN of_IN milk_NN that_WDT would_MD suit_VB Indian_JJ conditions_NNS ._.
Milk_NN was_VBD heated_VBN to_TO boiling_VBG in_IN the_DT villager_NN 's_POS vessel_NN (_( curd_JJ pot_NN )_) and_CC the_DT bacterial_JJ count_NN was_VBD noted_VBN as_IN also_RB the_DT quality_NN of_IN the_DT resultant_JJ curd_NN and_CC ghee_NN ._.
Experimental_NNP ._.
Processing_NN of_IN milk_NN by_IN boiling_VBG was_VBD tried_VBN in_IN the_DT following_JJ way_NN :_: heating_NN milk_NN to_TO boiling_VBG point_NN and_CC continuing_VBG boiling_VBG for_IN five_CD and_CC ten_VB minutes_NNS as_IN also_RB boiling_VBG of_IN milk_NN till_IN the_DT volume_NN was_VBD reduced_VBN by_IN 5_CD and_CC 10_CD per_IN cent_NN ._.
Villagers_NNS can_MD judge_VB the_DT temperature_NN from_IN ebullition_NN time_NN by_IN counting_VBG from_IN 1_CD to_TO 100_CD for_IN a_DT minute_NN ,_, and_CC evaporation_NN loss_NN from_IN reduction_NN in_IN volume_NN ._.
Fresh_JJ buffalo_NN milk_NN from_IN a_DT nearby_JJ dairy_NN was_VBD used_VBN for_IN the_DT experiments_NNS ._.
Its_PRP$ acidity_NN ,_, fat_NN and_CC lactose_JJ contents_NNS were_VBD determined_VBN ._.
Its_PRP$ bacterial_JJ content_NN as_IN determined_VBN by_IN plating_VBG method_NN was_VBD found_VBN to_TO be_VB 1,20,000_CD per_IN c._NN c._VBP The_DT milk_NN was_VBD then_RB boiled_VBN (_( 96°C_CD ._.
at_IN 3,000_CD ft._NN above_IN sea_NN level_NN )_) in_IN an_DT open_JJ aluminium_NN vessel_NN for_IN five_CD and_CC ten_VB minutes_NNS ,_, cooled_VBD and_CC plated_VBD for_IN bacterial_JJ count_NN ._.

Experiment_NN ._.
Buffalo_NNP milk_NN has_VBZ been_VBN used_VBN for_IN the_DT experiments_NNS ._.
The_DT acidity_NN of_IN fresh_JJ milk_NN varied_VBN from_IN 0.07_CD to_TO 0.09_CD per_IN cent_NN lactic_JJ acid_NN ,_, lactose_JJ content_NN between_IN 4.4_CD and_CC 4.8_CD per_IN cent_NN ,_, and_CC pH_RB 6.4_CD to_TO 6.9_CD ._.
Half_PDT a_DT litre_NN of_IN milk_NN was_VBD sterilized_VBN for_IN 60_CD minutes_NNS in_IN steam_NN ,_, cooled_VBD down_RB ,_, seeded_VBD with_IN 2½_CD per_IN cent_NN of_IN seed_NN curd_NN of_IN firm_NN texture_NN and_CC sweet_VB flavour_NNS for_IN souring_VBG studies_NNS ._.
Souring_VBG experiments_NNS were_VBD carried_VBN out_RP at_IN temperatures_NNS of_IN 6°-8°C._JJ ,_, and_CC at_IN 10°_CD ,_, 17°_CD ,_, 25°_CD ,_, 30°_CD ,_, 35°_CD ,_, 40°_CD and_CC 45°C_CD ._.
Samples_NNS were_VBD taken_VBN out_RP at_IN intervals_NNS of_IN 2_CD ,_, 4_CD ,_, 6_CD ,_, 8_CD ,_, 12_CD ,_, 16_CD ,_, 18_CD ,_, 24_CD ,_, 36_CD ,_, and_CC 48_CD hours_NNS ._.
In_IN the_DT case_NN of_IN the_DT cold_JJ temperature_NN studies_NNS samples_NNS were_VBD taken_VBN up_RB to_TO 96_CD hours_NNS and_CC at_IN longer_JJR intervals_NNS as_IN the_DT rate_NN of_IN souring_NN was_VBD slow_JJ ._.
The_DT pH_NN ,_, lactose_JJ content_NN ,_, and_CC acidity_NN were_VBD determined_VBN as_IN before_RB ._.
Lactic_JJ acid_NN was_VBD determined_VBN according_VBG to_TO Friedman_NNP et_FW al_NN ._.
[_NN 1930_CD ]_NN ,_, Well_NNP mixed_NNP curd_VBD 10_CD c._NN c._NN in_IN quantity_NN was_VBD diluted_VBN to_TO 500_CD c._NNS c._NN with_IN distilled_JJ water_NN and_CC warmed_VBD to_TO 40°-50°C_JJ ._.
when_WRB the_DT casein_NN coagulated_VBD in_IN lumps_NNS ._.
Then_RB the_DT solution_NN was_VBD filtered_VBN and_CC 10_CD c._NN c._NN of_IN the_DT filtrate_NN was_VBD extracted_VBN thrice_NN with_IN 30_CD c._NNS c._NN of_IN ether_NN ._.
Ether_DT was_VBD evaporated_VBN off_RP from_IN the_DT combined_VBN ether_NN extracts_NNS and_CC the_DT acid_NN left_VBD behind_RP was_VBD estimated_VBN by_IN oxidation_NN to_TO acetaldehyde_VB and_CC trapped_VBN in_IN bisulphite_JJ solution_NN ._.
The_DT results_NNS are_VBP given_VBN in_IN Tables_NNP ,_, IV_NNP ,_, V_NNP and_CC VI_NNP ._.

with_IN mixed_JJ flora_NNS (_( seed_NN curd_NN )_) Discussion_NN ._.
The_DT H_NNP ion_NN of_IN the_DT curd_NN falls_VBZ steadily_RB with_IN souring_NN and_CC stops_NNS at_IN pH_JJ 4.4_CD ;_: there_EX it_PRP remains_VBZ stationary_JJ ,_, though_IN the_DT acidity_NN goes_VBZ on_IN increasing_VBG with_IN time_NN ._.
The_DT acidity_NN of_IN curd_NN increases_NNS with_IN the_DT time_NN of_IN souring_VBG and_CC the_DT rate_NN is_VBZ higher_JJR as_IN the_DT temperature_NN is_VBZ higher_JJR ._.
But_CC below_IN 20°C_CD ._.
the_DT rate_NN of_IN increase_NN of_IN acidity_NN in_IN curd_NN slows_NNS down_RP very_RB much_JJ ,_, so_IN that_DT at_IN about_RB 10°C_CD ._.
the_DT souring_NN process_NN is_VBZ very_RB slow_JJ and_CC requires_VBZ artificial_JJ heating_NN to_TO complete_VB the_DT process_NN of_IN curdling_VBG within_IN reasonable_JJ limits_NNS of_IN time_NN ._.
In_IN cold_JJ winter_NN days_NNS ,_, therefore_RB ,_, it_PRP is_VBZ the_DT practice_NN in_IN the_DT Indian_JJ household_NN to_TO warm_VB the_DT souring_VBG vessel_NN by_IN keeping_VBG it_PRP near_IN the_DT kitchen_NN fire_NN ._.
The_DT rise_NN of_IN acidity_NN is_VBZ regular_JJ up_IN to_TO about_IN 1_CD per_IN cent_NN ,_, and_CC then_RB it_PRP slows_VBZ down_RP ._.
With_IN pure_JJ culture_NN of_IN Acidophilus_NNP lactobacillus_CC the_DT rise_NN of_IN acidity_NN is_VBZ up_IN to_TO 1.4_CD per_IN cent_NN ,_, and_CC then_RB it_PRP stops_VBZ ._.
With_IN a_DT mixed_JJ flora_NN the_DT rise_NN in_IN acidity_NN does_VBZ not_RB stop_VB but_CC continues_VBZ until_IN half_PDT the_DT lactose_JJ content_NN of_IN milk_NN is_VBZ used_VBN up_RP ._.
By_IN that_DT time_NN putrefaction_NN sets_NNS in_IN and_CC the_DT curd_NN is_VBZ unfit_JJ for_IN consumption_NN ._.
The_DT ratio_NN of_IN lactic_JJ acidity_NN to_TO total_JJ acidity_NN is_VBZ unity_JJ up_RB to_TO 0.6_CD per_IN cent_NN acidity_NN of_IN the_DT curd_NN ,_, and_CC thereafter_RB it_PRP makes_VBZ up_RP about_RB 90_CD per_IN cent_NN in_IN the_DT case_NN of_IN pure_NN cultures_NNS ,_, 80_CD per_IN cent_NN in_IN the_DT case_NN 82_CD Methods_NNS of_IN Preparaiion_NNP of_IN Ghee_NNP of_IN good_JJ seed_NN curd_NN ,_, and_CC less_RBR with_IN a_DT mixed_JJ flora_NN [_NNP Suzuki_NNP ,_, Hastings_NNP and_CC Hart_NNP ,_, 1910_CD ]_NN ._.

The_DT rise_NN in_IN acidity_NN and_CC lactose_JJ loss_NN in_IN curd_NN is_VBZ a_DT measure_NN of_IN the_DT nature_NN of_IN the_DT souring_NN process_NN ._.
The_DT resultant_JJ butter_NN on_IN churning_VBG carries_VBZ with_IN it_PRP the_DT products_NNS of_IN souring_NN ,_, the_DT acidity_NN ,_, flavour_NN ,_, texture_NN ,_, etc_FW ._.
The_DT texture_NN of_IN the_DT curd_NN (_( slimy_JJ ,_, ropy_NN ,_, uniformly_RB firm_NN )_) determines_VBZ the_DT quality_NN of_IN the_DT curd_NN and_CC of_IN the_DT butter_NN ._.
The_DT presence_NN or_CC absence_NN of_IN gas_NN bubbles_NNS or_CC cracks_NNS in_IN the_DT mass_NN of_IN the_DT curd_NN denotes_VBZ the_DT activity_NN of_IN gas-forming_JJ bacteria_NNS ._.
A_DT sweet_JJ aromatic_JJ flavour_NN indicates_VBZ a_DT good_JJ souring_NN process_NN and_CC its_PRP$ absence_NN the_DT activity_NN of_IN undesirable_JJ microflora_NNS ._.
Acidity_NN of_IN butter_NN from_IN properly_RB soured_VBN curd_NN is_VBZ about_IN 0.2_CD per_IN cent_NN lactic_JJ acid_NN or_CC less_JJR ._.
Any_DT rise_NN in_IN acidity_NN above_IN this_DT figure_NN indicates_VBZ unsatisfactory_JJ souring_NN and_CC lipolysis_NN of_IN butterfat_NN ._.
M._NNP R._NNP SRINIVASAN_NNP AND_NNP B._NNP N._NNP BANERJEE_NNP 83_CD Again_NNP the_DT acidity_NN of_IN ghee_NN compared_VBN to_TO butter_VB on_IN clarification_NN provides_VBZ a_DT picture_NN of_IN the_DT acid_NN developed_VBD in_IN the_DT souring_NN process_NN ._.

Therefore_RB ,_, it_PRP is_VBZ exported_VBN and_CC sold_VBN as_IN butter_NN to_TO the_DT consumer_NN ._.
The_DT consumer_NN melts_VBD the_DT butter_NN into_IN ghee_NN before_IN use_NN or_CC storage_NN ._.
The_DT animals_NNS are_VBP milked_VBN twice_RB a_DT day_NN ._.
The_DT times_NNS of_IN milking_VBG are_VBP soon_RB after_IN sunrise_NN (_( 5_CD to_TO 7_CD a.m._NN )_) and_CC sunset_VBN (_( 7_CD to_TO 9_CD p._NNS m._NN )_) ._.
Tinned_VBN brass_NN ,_, or_CC similar_JJ metallic_NN vessels_NNS are_VBP used_VBN for_IN drawing_VBG milk_NN ._.
Samples_NNS of_IN raw_JJ milk_NN were_VBD taken_VBN immediately_RB after_IN the_DT milking_NN was_VBD over_RB ._.
Acidity_NNP was_VBD determined_VBN without_IN delay_NN at_IN the_DT spot_NN ._.
Milk_NN is_VBZ not_RB processed_VBN for_IN butter_NN making_NN ._.
In_IN the_DT evening_NN it_PRP is_VBZ seeded_VBN with_IN half_NN to_TO one_CD ounce_NN of_IN buttermilk_NN from_IN the_DT previous_JJ batch_NN ._.
The_DT volume_NN of_IN seed_NN curd_NN remains_VBZ the_DT same_JJ irrespective_NN of_IN the_DT quantity_NN of_IN milk_NN or_CC season_NN The_DT interval_NN of_IN time_NN between_IN milking_VBG and_CC seeding_VBG is_VBZ one_CD half_NN to_TO two_CD hours_NNS ._.
Samples_NNS of_IN buttermilk_NN used_VBN for_IN seeding_VBG were_VBD tested_VBN for_IN acidity_NN ._.
Souring_VBG takes_VBZ place_NN for_IN 8_CD to_TO 12_CD hours_NNS over_IN night_NN ._.
Souring_VBG is_VBZ done_VBN in_IN an_DT earthen-_JJ ware_NN vessel_NN or_CC chatty_NN and_CC the_DT top_NN is_VBZ covered_VBN with_IN a_DT lid_NN ._.
In_IN all_DT houses_NNS clay_VBP pots_NNS are_VBP used_VBN for_IN this_DT purpose_NN ,_, except_IN in_IN one_CD in_IN which_WDT a_DT tinned_VBN copper_NN vessel_NN was_VBD used_VBN ._.
The_DT vessel_NN is_VBZ only_RB washed_JJ after_IN use_NN and_CC may_MD be_VB scrubbed_VBN with_IN straw_NN ._.
The_DT morning_NN milk_NN after_IN meeting_VBG other_JJ demands_NNS is_VBZ seeded_VBN ,_, or_CC laid_VBN aside_RB ,_, and_CC mixed_JJ with_IN evening_VBG milk_NN and_CC seeded_VBD ._.
Sometimes_RB the_DT morning_NN milk_NN is_VBZ placed_VBN in_IN the_DT clay_NN vessel_NN over_IN the_DT smouldering_NN remains_VBZ of_IN the_DT kitchen_NN fire_NN after_IN cooking_VBG to_TO warm_VB up_RP for_IN one_CD to_TO two_CD hours_NNS ._.
The_DT temperature_NN of_IN the_DT milk_NN never_RB exceeded_VBD 70°C_CD ._.
in_IN this_DT treatment_NN ._.
Generally_RB ,_, the_DT animals_NNS ,_, cattle-shed_JJ ,_, housing_NN ,_, milking_VBG and_CC souring_VBG vessels_NNS are_VBP very_RB unclean_JJ ,_, a_DT condition_NN which_WDT calls_VBZ for_IN better_JJR attention_NN and_CC improvement_NN ._.
Even_RB the_DT udders_NNS and_CC the_DT milkman_NN 's_POS hands_NNS are_VBP not_RB properly_RB washed_VBN before_IN milking_NN ._.
The_DT curd_NN is_VBZ churned_VBN next_JJ morning_NN in_IN a_DT village_NN churn_NN for_IN butter_NN ._.
The_DT texture_NN of_IN the_DT curd_NN is_VBZ ropy_VBN with_IN enclosed_JJ gas_NN bubbles_NNS inside_IN and_CC separated_VBD into_IN two_CD layers_NNS ,_, the_DT curd_NN on_IN the_DT top_JJ ,_, and_CC the_DT serum_NN at_IN the_DT bottom_NN ._.
The_DT flavour_NN is_VBZ not_RB very_RB sweet_JJ ._.
Samples_NNS of_IN curd_NN were_VBD taken_VBN before_RB churning_VBG ._.
The_DT volume_NN of_IN water_NN added_VBD during_IN churning_VBG depends_NNS on_IN whether_IN it_PRP is_VBZ to_TO be_VB used_VBN by_IN the_DT farmer_NN or_CC offered_VBN for_IN sale_NN ._.
In_IN the_DT former_JJ case_NN 25_CD per_IN cent_NN to_TO 30_CD per_IN cent_NN of_IN water_NN was_VBD added_VBN and_CC in_IN the_DT latter_JJ case_NN 100_CD per_IN cent_NN ._.
Butter_NNP is_VBZ never_RB washed_VBN after_IN it_PRP is_VBZ taken_VBN out_IN of_IN the_DT butter_NN milk_NN ._.
The_DT daily_JJ yield_NN of_IN butter_NN is_VBZ stored_VBN in_IN buttermilk_NN ,_, which_WDT is_VBZ changed_VBN daily_RB ,_, till_VB it_PRP is_VBZ taken_VBN away_RB by_IN the_DT Mandya_NNP merchant_NN ._.
The_DT merchant_NN who_WP generally_RB advances_VBZ money_NN to_TO the_DT villager_NN sends_VBZ his_PRP$ agent_NN once_RB a_DT week_NN to_TO collect_VB the_DT butter_NN from_IN the_DT villager_NN 's_POS home_NN ._.
Samples_NNS of_IN butter_NN were_VBD taken_VBN immediately_RB after_IN churning_VBG ._.

Storage_NN of_IN butter_NN ._.

86_CD Methods_NNS of_IN Preparation_NNP of_IN Ghee_NNP SEASONAL_NNP VARIATION_NNP IN_NNP MANDYA_NNP WINTER_NNP In_IN order_NN to_TO study_VB seasonal_JJ variations_NNS in_IN the_DT methods_NNS of_IN manufacture_NN as_RB well_RB as_IN in_IN the_DT quality_NN of_IN butter_NN and_CC ghee_NN ,_, experiments_NNS were_VBD repeated_VBN in_IN Mandya_NNP villages_NNS (_( Bilideglu_NNP and_CC Kothathi_NNP in_IN the_DT month_NN of_IN December_NNP ._.
The_DT temperature_NN then_RB ranged_VBD between_IN 20°_CD and_CC 24°C_CD ._.
and_CC the_DT animals_NNS were_VBD being_VBG fed_VBN on_IN the_DT freely_RB available_JJ green_JJ herbage_NN ._.
There_EX was_VBD no_DT change_NN in_IN the_DT method_NN of_IN preparation_NN of_IN butter_NN due_JJ to_TO season_NN ,_, except_IN that_DT in_IN the_DT village_NN of_IN Kothathi_NNP the_DT time_NN of_IN souring_VBG was_VBD increased_VBN to_TO 24_CD hours_NNS as_IN against_IN 12_CD hours_NNS in_IN summer_NN ._.
Experiment_NN ._.
Pooled_VBN milk_NN was_VBD divided_VBN into_IN three_CD villager_NN 's_POS pots_NNS and_CC treated_VBN in_IN the_DT same_JJ way_NN as_IN is_VBZ the_DT practice_NN in_IN the_DT village_NN ._.
In_IN Kothathi_NNP ,_, milk_NN was_VBD collected_VBN in_IN the_DT morning_NN ,_, and_CC in_IN Bilideglu_NNP ,_, in_IN the_DT evening_NN ._.
The_DT milk_NN in_IN two_CD of_IN the_DT pots_NNS was_VBD boiled_VBN for_IN 10_CD minutes_NNS ,_, and_CC that_IN in_IN the_DT third_NN was_VBD left_VBN unpro_JJ ._.
cessed_VBN ._.
One_CD lot_NN of_IN boiled_JJ milk_NN was_VBD seeded_VBN with_IN the_DT curd_NN obtained_VBN from_IN boiled_VBN milk_NN ._.
The_DT other_JJ two_CD lots_NNS were_VBD seeded_VBN with_IN the_DT village_NN seed_NN ._.

The_DT results_NNS are_VBP given_VBN in_IN Tables_NNP V_NNP and_CC VI_NNP ._.

Observations_NNS ._.
The_DT quality_NN of_IN curd_NN is_VBZ about_IN the_DT same_JJ as_IN in_IN summer_NN except_IN that_IN there_EX was_VBD no_DT gas_NN bubbles_VBZ in_IN the_DT mass_NN of_IN curd_NN which_WDT was_VBD lump_NN like_IN in_IN texture_NN ._.
The_DT acidity_NN developed_VBD and_CC lactose_JJ consumed_VBN is_VBZ lower_JJR than_IN before_RB ._.
This_DT is_VBZ due_JJ to_TO the_DT lower_JJR temperature_NN prevailing_NN in_IN the_DT season_NN but_CC is_VBZ complicated_VBN by_IN the_DT use_NN of_IN uncontrolled_JJ seed_NN curd_NN ._.
Thus_RB in_IN Kothathi_NNP ,_, where_WRB the_DT seed_NN had_VBD deteriorated_VBN ,_, though_IN the_DT time_NN of_IN souring_NN is_VBZ double_JJ ,_, the_DT acid_NN development_NN is_VBZ not_RB as_RB high_JJ as_IN before_RB ._.
Again_RB ,_, there_EX is_VBZ a_DT higher_JJR destruction_NN of_IN lactose_JJ as_IN com-_JJ pared_VBD to_TO the_DT rise_NN in_IN acidity_NN ._.

Name_NN of_IN sample_NN Acidity_NNP Quality_NNP Induction_NNP period_NN 10_CD Koduru_NNP 0.51_CD Overcooked_NNP but_CC good_JJ ghee_NN flavour_VBP 11_CD 92_CD Methods_NNS of_IN Preparation_NNP of_IN Ghee_NNP cess_NN is_VBZ 70°C.-80°C_JJ ._.
Souring_VBG takes_VBZ place_NN for_IN 20-22_JJ hours_NNS for_IN the_DT morning_NN batch_NN and_CC 10.12_CD hours_NNS for_IN the_DT evening_NN ._.
The_DT morning_NN and_CC evening_NN curds_NNS are_VBP mixed_VBN up_RP the_DT following_JJ morning_NN and_CC then_RB churned_VBD ._.
Usually_RB the_DT curd_NN is_VBZ very_RB sour_JJ in_IN flavour_NN but_CC has_VBZ a_DT firm_JJ texture_NN ._.
The_DT volume_NN of_IN water_NN added_VBD during_IN churning_VBG varied_VBN from_IN 100-200_JJ per_IN cent_NN ._.
The_DT daily_JJ yield_NN of_IN butter_NN is_VBZ accumulated_VBN in_IN dry_JJ aluminium_NN or_CC tinned-brass_NN vessels_NNS until_IN a_DT quantity_NN enough_RB to_TO yield_VB half_NN to_TO one_CD seer_NN of_IN ghee_NN is_VBZ gathered_VBN ._.
The_DT collected_JJ butter_NN is_VBZ then_RB washed_VBN once_RB or_CC twice_RB with_IN water_NN and_CC melted_VBD into_IN ghee_NN ._.
Butter_NNP is_VBZ boiled_VBN over_IN a_DT low_JJ fire_NN in_IN tinned-brass_NN vessels_NNS until_IN the_DT crackling_VBG sound_NN stops_NNS ._.
In_IN some_DT houses_NNS the_DT boiling_NN is_VBZ continued_VBN until_IN the_DT casein_JJ gets_VBZ blackened_VBN ._.
The_DT maximum_JJ temperature_NN varied_VBN from_IN 130°C.-_JJ 145°C_CD ._.
There_EX was_VBD not_RB much_JJ difference_NN in_IN the_DT texture_NN of_IN the_DT control_NN curd_NN and_CC that_IN of_IN the_DT village_NN ,_, but_CC the_DT flavour_NN was_VBD very_RB sour_JJ in_IN the_DT case_NN of_IN the_DT village_NN samples_NNS ._.
Butter_NNP used_VBD for_IN ghee-making_NN in_IN this_DT area_NN is_VBZ about_IN one_CD to_TO seven_CD days_NNS old_JJ ._.
During_IN these_DT investigations_NNS the_DT temperature_NN was_VBD 48°C.-38°C_JJ ._.
PREPARATION_NN OF_NNP ghee_NN IN_NNP HOGENICAL_NNP ,_, NORTH_NNP SALEM_NNP FOREST_NNP DIVISION_NNP In_IN the_DT Madras_NNP Presidency_NNP there_EX are_VBP certain_JJ areas_NNS in_IN the_DT forest_NN divisions_NNS where_WRB very_RB large_JJ herds_NNS of_IN cattle_NNS are_VBP maintained_VBN ._.
Herds_NNS of_IN 600-1500_JJ animals_NNS are_VBP kept_VBN in_IN different_JJ blocks_NNS very_RB near_IN to_TO Hogenical_NNP in_IN the_DT Cauvery_NNP River_NNP valley_NN ,_, (_( 70_CD miles_NNS by_IN the_DT nearest_JJS rail_NN head_NN and_CC 30_CD miles_NNS from_IN the_DT taluk_NN centre_NN )_) ._.
In_IN this_DT area_NN cows_NNS are_VBP the_DT only_JJ milch_NN animal_NN reared_VBD ._.
These_DT animals_NNS live_VBP only_RB on_IN the_DT grass_NN ,_, tender_NN green_JJ leaves_NNS and_CC twigs_NNS available_JJ in_IN the_DT forest_NN ,_, and_CC get_VB no_DT concentrate_NN as_IN food_NN ._.
They_PRP represent_VBP typical_JJ hill_NN cattle_NNS (_( Kangayam_NNP breed_NN )_) ,_, thin_JJ ,_, stunted_VBN in_IN size_NN ,_, very_RB poor_JJ milkers_NNS ,_, not_RB very_RB well-fed_JJ or_CC looked_VBN after_IN ._.
The_DT cows_NNS yield_VBP 2-3_JJ lb_NN ._.
of_IN milk_NN per_IN day_NN and_CC are_VBP milked_VBN only_RB once_RB in_IN the_DT morning_NN between_IN 6_CD and_CC 8_CD a.m_NN ._.
The_DT milking_NN is_VBZ done_VBN in_IN earthen_NN vessels_NNS ._.
Milk_NN is_VBZ usually_RB processed_VBN as_IN follows_VBZ for_IN making_VBG curd_NN ,_, butter_NN and_CC ghee_NN ,_, the_DT only_JJ milk_NN pro-_JJ ducts_NNS made_VBN in_IN this_DT area_NN ._.
Fresh_JJ milk_NN within_IN 1-2_JJ hours_NNS after_IN milking_VBG is_VBZ brought_VBN to_TO boil_VB vigorously_RB and_CC then_RB allowed_VBD to_TO remain_VB over_IN the_DT smouldering_NN remains_VBZ of_IN the_DT kitchen_NN fire_NN ,_, when_WRB a_DT thick_JJ layer_NN of_IN skin_NN is_VBZ formed_VBN on_IN the_DT top_NN ._.
The_DT milk_NN remains_VBZ hot_JJ on_IN the_DT fire_NN till_NN even-_JJ ing_NN ,_, when_WRB it_PRP is_VBZ removed_VBN and_CC allowed_VBN to_TO cool_VB ._.
The_DT boiling_NN is_VBZ done_VBN in_IN an_DT earthen_NN chatti_NN ,_, which_WDT is_VBZ daily_JJ cleaned_VBN by_IN boiling_VBG water_NN in_IN it_PRP ._.
It_PRP is_VBZ seeded_VBN with_IN 1-2_JJ oz_NN ._.
of_IN butter_NN milk_NN in_IN the_DT evening_NN ._.
The_DT most_RBS noteworthy_JJ point_NN observed_VBN in_IN this_DT area_NN is_VBZ that_IN milk_NN is_VBZ vigorously_RB boiled_VBN ,_, till_VB a_DT thick_JJ skin_NN forms_NNS on_IN the_DT top_JJ ,_, and_CC also_RB that_IN it_PRP is_VBZ maintained_VBN hot_JJ for_IN the_DT whole_JJ day_NN ._.
Another_DT point_NN is_VBZ that_IN the_DT souring_VBG vessel_NN is_VBZ sterilized_VBN every_DT day_NN by_IN boiling_VBG water_NN in_IN it_PRP ._.
If_IN this_DT was_VBD not_RB done_VBN ,_, it_PRP was_VBD reported_VBN ,_, the_DT curd_NN developed_VBD an_DT undesirable_JJ flavour_NN ._.
Milk_NN is_VBZ usually_RB soured_VBN for_IN 10-12_JJ hours_NNS in_IN the_DT night_NN and_CC churned_VBD early_RB in_IN the_DT morning_NN ._.
The_DT texture_NN of_IN the_DT curd_NN is_VBZ firm_JJ and_CC the_DT flavour_JJ sweet_NN and_CC good_JJ ._.
The_DT volume_NN of_IN water_NN added_VBD during_IN churning_VBG varied_VBN usually_RB from_IN 50_CD to_TO 100_CD per_IN cent_NN of_IN the_DT volume_NN of_IN the_DT curd_NN ._.
Butter_NNP thus_RB obtained_VBD is_VBZ usually_RB stored_VBN for_IN anything_NN from_IN 7_CD to_TO 15_CD days_NNS in_IN earthen_JJ chatties_NNS ._.
When_WRB a_DT quantity_NN sufficient_NN to_TO yield_VB half_PDT a_DT seer_NN or_CC more_JJR of_IN ghee_NN is_VBZ collected_VBN ,_, the_DT butter_NN is_VBZ melted_VBN into_IN ghee_NN over_IN a_DT controlled_VBN fire_NN by_IN boiling_VBG until_IN the_DT crackling_VBG sound_NN stops_NNS ._.
As_IN the_DT method_NN of_IN processing_VBG milk_NN followed_VBN in_IN these_DT parts_NNS gave_VBD perfectly_RB satisfactory_JJ sterilization_NN of_IN milk_NN and_CC the_DT time_NN of_IN souring_VBG milk_NN was_VBD also_RB normal_JJ ,_, no_DT control_NN experiment_NN was_VBD conducted_VBN ._.
Certain_VB very_RB remarkable_JJ observations_NNS were_VBD made_VBN in_IN this_DT area_NN ._.
Though_IN the_DT cattle_NN owners_NNS are_VBP very_RB poor_JJ and_CC ignorant_JJ ,_, and_CC live_VBP far_RB away_RB from_IN civilisation_NN without_IN any_DT outside_JJ help_NN or_CC expert_VB advice_NN they_PRP make_VBP first_JJ class_NN curd_NN and_CC butter_NN ._.
In_IN their_PRP$ own_JJ way_NN they_PRP are_VBP sterilizing_VBG milk_NN to_TO a_DT thoroughly_JJ satisfactory_JJ stage_NN ,_, maintain_VBP the_DT quality_NN till_NN it_PRP is_VBZ seeded_VBN and_CC do_VBP not_RB sour_VB it_PRP longer_JJR than_IN circumstances_NNS require_VBP ._.
One_CD can_MD not_RB but_CC admire_VBP their_PRP$ obser-_JJ vation_NN that_WDT unless_IN the_DT souring_NN vessel_NN (_( earthenware_NN )_) is_VBZ washed_VBN thoroughly_RB by_IN boiling_VBG water_NN in_IN it_PRP every_DT day_NN ,_, the_DT curd_NN obtained_VBN is_VBZ liable_JJ to_TO go_VB bad_JJ ._.
As_IN a_DT matter_NN of_IN fact_NN except_IN for_IN a_DT faint_NN barn_NN or_CC smoky_VB flavour_NN ,_, there_EX was_VBD no_DT other_JJ defect_NN in_IN the_DT samples_NNS of_IN their_PRP$ curd_JJ examin-_JJ ed_NN by_IN us_PRP ._.
The_DT lactose_NN lost_VBD and_CC acidity_NN development_NN pointed_VBD to_TO an_DT almost_RB pure_JJ lactic_JJ fer-_JJ mentation_NN ._.
Butter_NNP and_CC ghee_JJ acidities_NNS were_VBD as_RB low_JJ as_IN could_MD be_VB desired_VBN ._.
The_DT colour_NN ,_, flavour_NN and_CC texture_NN of_IN butter_NN and_CC ghee_NN were_VBD the_DT best_JJS seen_VBN in_IN the_DT Madras_NNP Presidency_NNP ._.
The_DT caro-_JJ tenoid_JJ pigment_NN of_IN the_DT butter_NN and_CC ghee_NN were_VBD the_DT highest_JJS recorded_VBN ,_, and_CC the_DT flavour_NN of_IN the_DT ghee_NN the_DT best_JJS and_CC sweetest_VB recorded_VBN by_IN us_PRP ._.
The_DT quality_NN is_VBZ also_RB reflected_VBN in_IN the_DT induction_NN period_NN ,_, the_DT R._NNP M._NNP value_NN ,_, P._NNP V._NNP ,_, I._NNP V._NNP ,_, and_CC the_DT saponification_NN value_NN ,_, This_DT observation_NN emphasizes_VBZ the_DT important_JJ relation_NN between_IN feed_NN ,_, storage_NN property_NN ,_, colour_NN ,_, vitamin_FW A_DT and_CC flavour_NN of_IN butter_NN and_CC ghee_NN ._.
The_DT only_RB serious_JJ defect_NN was_VBD that_IN the_DT butter_NN was_VBD stored_VBN in_IN used_VBN earthenware_NN vessels_NNS for_IN a_DT long_JJ time_NN instead_RB of_IN being_VBG melted_VBN into_IN ghee_NN at_IN once_RB ,_, and_CC this_DT brought_NN about_IN degradation_NN in_IN the_DT quality_NN and_CC property_NN of_IN both_DT butter_NN and_CC ghee_NN ._.
The_DT practice_NN is_VBZ due_JJ to_TO the_DT K._NNP S._NNP RANGAPPA_NNP ,_, M._NNP R._NNP SRINIVASAN_NNP AND_NNP B._NNP N._NNP BANERJEE_NNP 93_CD TABLE_NNP X._NNP Lactose94_NNP Methods_NNP of_IN Preparation_NNP of_IN Ghee_NNP TABLE_NNP XI_NNP Quality_NNP of_IN bazaar_NN samples_NNS of_IN ghee_NN ,_, Guntur_NNP Serial_NNP number_NN Name_NN of_IN place_NN of_IN collection_NN Acidity_NNP of_IN ghee_JJ Quality_NNP of_IN ghee_NN Remarks_NNP Vitamin_NNP A_NNP blue_JJ units_NNS Induction_NNP period_NN 13_CD (_( 1_CD )_) Kolakaluru_NNP 0.32_CD Pasty_NNP ,_, slightly_RB off_IN Usually_RB from_IN 24_CD hours_NNS soured_VBD curd_NNS ,_, butter_RB 3_CD days_NNS 9.5_CD 14_CD (_( 2_CD )_) Reddipalayam_NNP 0.18_CD Pasty_NNP but_CC good_JJ Mixture_NN of_IN butter_NN from_IN 12_CD and_CC 24_CD hours_NNS soured_VBD curd_JJ ,_, 1-4_JJ days_NNS old_JJ butter_NN 9.0_CD 4_CD hours_NNS 15_CD (_( 3_CD )_) Gannavaram_NNP 0.35_CD Fair_NNP Mostly_RB 3_CD days_NNS old_JJ K._NNP S._NNP RANGAPPA_NNP ,_, M._NNP R._NNP SRINIVASAN_NNP AND_NNP B._NNP N._NNP BANERJEE_NNP 95_CD TABLE_NNP XIII_NNP Lactose-acidity_NNP relationship_NN ,_, Hogenical_NNP Sample_NNP Milk_NNP Seed_NNP curd_VBZ acidity_NN Souring_NNP Curd_NNP Acidity_NNP Acidity_NNP Lactose_NNP Tempe-_NNP rature_NN °C_NN Time_NNP in_IN hours_NNS Acidity_NNP Lactose_NNP Butter_NNP Ghee_NNP (_( decan-_JJ tation_NN process_NN )_) Billigundlu_NNP (_( A_NNP )_) 0.12_CD 4.0_CD 0.7_CD 32_CD 10_CD 1.4_CD 2.6_CD 0.18_CD 0.06_CD do_NN ._.

PREPARATION_NN OF_NNP GHEE_NNP IN_NNP DHINOJ_NNP ,_, BARODA*_NNP Dhinoj_NNP is_VBZ situated_VBN in_IN north_JJ Gujerat_NNP ._.
It_PRP is_VBZ an_DT important_JJ ghee_NN centre_NN in_IN the_DT Baroda_NNP state_NN (_( Mehsana_NNP district_NN ._. )_)
Large_JJ quantities_NNS of_IN ghee_NN are_VBP collected_VBN ,_, refined_VBN and_CC exported_VBN from_IN this_DT place_NN ._.
It_PRP has_VBZ also_RB a_DT large_JJ population_NN of_IN some_DT of_IN the_DT best_JJS buffaloes_NNS of_IN Gujerat_NNP ._.
Samples_NNS were_VBD taken_VBN and_CC experiments_NNS were_VBD carried_VBN out_RP in_IN Dhinoj_NNP proper_NN ._.
Butter_NNP as_IN such_JJ is_VBZ not_RB prepared_JJ ,_, sold_VBD or_CC consumed_VBN in_IN this_DT area_NN ;_: and_CC hence_RB in_IN a_DT few_JJ hours_NNS after_IN churning_VBG ,_, butter_NN is_VBZ usually_RB melted_VBN into_IN ghee_NN ._.
The_DT animals_NNS are_VBP milked_VBN twice_RB a_DT day_NN ,_, at_IN 7_CD or_CC 7-30_JJ a.m._NN ,_, and_CC at_IN about_IN the_DT same_JJ hour_NN in_IN the_DT evening_NN ._.
Untinned_VBN brass_NN vessels_NNS are_VBP invariably_RB used_VBN for_IN drawing_VBG milk_NN ._.
Samples_NNS were_VBD taken_VBN immediately_RB after_IN milking_VBG ,_, and_CC the_DT acidity_NN and_CC lactose_NN determined_VBN ._.
Milk_NN is_VBZ neither_DT heat-treated_JJ nor_CC processed_VBN in_IN any_DT way_NN ,_, nor_CC even_RB seeded_VBD with_IN any_DT starter_NN such_JJ as_IN curd_NN or_CC buttermilk_NN ._.
Only_RB in_IN winter_NN ,_, for_IN about_IN three_CD months_NNS or_CC so_RB ,_, is_VBZ any_DT starter_NN used_VBN ._.
The_DT morning_NN milk_NN ,_, left_VBD over_RP after_IN the_DT household_NN and_CC other_JJ demands_NNS are_VBP met_VBN ,_, is_VBZ kept_VBN in_IN an_DT earthen_NN pot_NN and_CC laid_JJ aside_RB in_IN a_DT corner_NN or_CC in_IN a_DT cupboard_NN ._.
The_DT evening_NN milk_NN is_VBZ also_RB poured_VBN into_IN the_DT same_JJ vessel_NN and_CC allowed_VBN to_TO curdle_VB ._.
The_DT milk_NN curdles_NNS in_IN about_RB 10_CD hours_NNS at_IN a_DT room_NN temperature_NN of_IN 33°-35°C_JJ ._.
The_DT same_JJ process_NN is_VBZ followed_VBN on_IN the_DT second_JJ day_NN in_IN a_DT separate_JJ pot_NN ._.
The_DT curd_NN is_VBZ churned_VBN on_IN the_DT third_JJ day_NN early_RB in_IN the_DT morning_NN ,_, between_IN 4_CD and_CC 5_CD a.m._NN ,_, by_IN the_DT usual_JJ village_NN method_NN ._.
The_DT texture_NN of_IN the_DT curd_NN is_VBZ generally_RB gassy_JJ ,_, with_IN a_DT solid_JJ crust_NN on_IN the_DT surface_NN and_CC some_DT serum_NN at_IN the_DT bottom_NN ._.
The_DT flavour_NN and_CC taste_NN are_VBP sharply_RB acid_JJ but_CC not_RB unpleasant_JJ ._.
The_DT curd_NN in_IN the_DT case_NN of_IN the_DT control_NN sample_NN ,_, though_IN mild_NN in_IN taste_NN and_CC flavour_NN as_IN compared_VBN to_TO other_JJ samples_NNS ,_, was_VBD slightly_RB lumpy_JJ ._.
At_IN the_DT commencement_NN of_IN the_DT churning_VBG no_DT water_NN is_VBZ added_VBN ,_, but_CC when_WRB the_DT curd_NN is_VBZ about_IN to_TO break_VB ,_, cold_JJ water_NN about_IN equal_JJ in_IN volume_NN to_TO that_DT of_IN the_DT curd_NN is_VBZ added_VBN ._.
The_DT butter_NN is_VBZ not_RB washed_VBN ,_, but_CC it_PRP is_VBZ melted_VBN over_IN a_DT very_RB low_JJ fire_NN into_IN ghee_NN within_IN 2-3_JJ hours_NNS after_IN churning_VBG ._.
During_IN the_DT process_NN the_DT butterfat_NN or_CC ghee_NN does_VBZ not_RB boil_VB ,_, care_NN being_VBG taken_VBN to_TO see_VB that_IN the_DT casein_NN does_VBZ not_RB get_VB charred_VBN but_CC retains_VBZ a_DT white_JJ colour_NN ._.
The_DT degree_NN of_IN heating_NN butter_NN for_IN conversion_NN into_IN ghee_JJ varies_NNS with_IN different_JJ agricultural_JJ communities_NNS ._.
The_DT Anjanas_NNP or_CC the_DT Chowdharies_NNPS see_VBP that_IN the_DT butterfat_NN does_VBZ not_RB boil_VB and_CC that_IN the_DT casein_NN remains_VBZ white_JJ ;_: with_IN the_DT Patidars_NNP ,_, the_DT scum_NN or_CC casein_NN takes_VBZ up_RP a_DT light_JJ brown_JJ tint_NN ;_: with_IN the_DT Thakardas_NNP ,_, it_PRP becomes_VBZ dark_JJ brown_NN and_CC the_DT ghee_NN takes_VBZ on_IN a_DT cooked_JJ flavour_NN ._.
The_DT earthenware_NN used_VBN in_IN the_DT process_NN is_VBZ first_JJ scrubbed_VBN with_IN hot_JJ water_NN and_CC a_DT rag_NN and_CC then_RB steamed_VBD for_IN about_IN 10-15_JJ minutes_NNS by_IN inverting_VBG it_PRP over_IN a_DT small_JJ brass_NN vessel_NN in_IN which_WDT water_NN is_VBZ kept_VBN boiling_VBG over_IN a_DT fire_NN ._.
The_DT cleanliness_NN of_IN the_DT cattle_NNS ,_, housing_NN ,_, milking_NN and_CC other_JJ processes_NNS left_VBD much_JJ to_TO be_VB desired_VBN ._.
Experiments_NNS were_VBD carried_VBN out_RP in_IN the_DT laboratory_NN following_VBG the_DT Dhinoj_NNP practice_NN of_IN using_VBG unprocessed_JJ milk_NN and_CC allowing_VBG the_DT milk_NN to_TO sour_VB by_IN itself_PRP for_IN two_CD days_NNS ._.
Even_RB if_IN ghee_VBN be_VB prepared_VBN by_IN the_DT decantation_NN process_NN ,_, there_EX is_VBZ a_DT partial_JJ loss_NN of_IN vitamin_NN A_NNP and_CC great_JJ reduction_NN in_IN storage_NN property_NN (_( induction_JJ period_NN )_) ._.

Nowadays_RB even_RB in_IN cold_JJ countries_NNS ,_, for_IN export_NN and_CC storage_NN ,_, there_EX is_VBZ a_DT tendency_NN to_TO dehydrate_VB butter_NN to_TO prevent_VB rancidity_NN and_CC then_RB to_TO homogenize_VB it_PRP into_IN butter_NN again_RB before_IN consumption_NN ._.
It_PRP is_VBZ a_DT pity_NN that_IN ,_, due_JJ to_TO ignorance_NN and_CC other_JJ causes_NNS ,_, milk_NN fat_NN should_MD be_VB stored_VBN or_CC consumed_VBN in_IN India_NNP in_IN a_DT form_NN other_JJ than_IN ghee_NNS ._.
The_DT following_JJ causes_NNS are_VBP responsible_JJ for_IN the_DT development_NN of_IN rancidity_NN in_IN butter_NN on_IN storage_NN and_CC the_DT resultant_JJ ghee_NN ._.
It_PRP is_VBZ well_RB known_VBN that_IN oils_NNS and_CC fats_NNS are_VBP prone_JJ to_TO develop_VB rancidity_NN ;_: and_CC in_IN the_DT case_NN of_IN butter_NN the_DT following_VBG five_CD causes_NNS play_VBP their_PRP$ part_NN :100_VBZ Methods_NNP of_IN Preparation_NNP of_IN Ghee_NNP a_DT comparison_NN of_IN the_DT acidity_NN of_IN butter_NN and_CC ghee_NN made_VBN by_IN the_DT boiling_NN and_CC decantation_NN process_NN is_VBZ very_RB significant_JJ ._.
It_PRP has_VBZ been_VBN found_VBN that_IN butter_NN acidity_NN is_VBZ about_RB twice_RB as_RB high_JJ as_IN ghee_NN acidity_NN made_VBN by_IN the_DT boiling_NN process_NN and_CC at_IN least_JJS four_CD times_NNS higher_JJR than_IN that_DT of_IN ghee_NN by_IN the_DT decantation_NN process*_NN ._.
Even_RB with_IN curd_JJ acidity_NN as_RB high_JJ as_IN 2.8_CD per_IN cent_NN lactic_JJ and_CC butter_JJ acidity_NN ,_, 0.28_CD per_IN cent_NN ,_, the_DT ghee_NN acidity_NN by_IN the_DT decantation_NN process_NN is_VBZ only_RB 0.06_CD per_IN cent_NN ._.
The_DT acidity_NN of_IN village_NN ghee_NN of_IN Mandya_NNP ,_, Kodur_NNP ,_, Guntur_NNP and_CC Hogenical_NNP are_VBP all_DT high_JJ ;_: this_DT point_NN is_VBZ brought_VBN out_RP from_IN experiments_NNS carried_VBN out_RP on_IN storage_NN of_IN butter_NN before_IN being_VBG melted_VBN into_IN gheet_NN ._.
While_IN in_IN ghee_NN melted_VBN from_IN fresh_JJ butter_NN the_DT ratio_NN of_IN acidity_NN is_VBZ at_IN least_JJS 4_CD :_: 1_CD by_IN the_DT decantation_NN process_NN ,_, in_IN the_DT case_NN of_IN stored_VBN butter_NN the_DT ratio_NN is_VBZ reduced_VBN to_TO 1_CD :_: 1_CD or_CC 1_CD :_: 0.09_CD ._.
This_DT demonstrates_VBZ that_IN the_DT high_JJ acidity_NN is_VBZ due_JJ to_TO the_DT breakdown_NN of_IN the_DT fatty_JJ acid_NN glycerides_NNS ._.
It_PRP is_VBZ ,_, therefore_RB ,_, necessary_JJ to_TO study_VB this_DT increase_NN of_IN acidity_NN in_IN butter_NN and_CC ghee_NN due_JJ to_TO storage_VB of_IN butter_NN ,_, before_IN its_PRP$ clarification_NN into_IN ghee_NN ._.
This_DT also_RB raises_VBZ the_DT point_NN as_IN to_TO when_WRB and_CC how_WRB butter_NN should_MD be_VB clarified_VBN under_IN village_NN conditions_NNS ._.
Apart_RB from_IN the_DT factors_NNS mentioned_VBD before_IN lipase_NN of_IN milk_NN (_( in_IN the_DT case_NN of_IN butter_NN made_VBN from_IN unboiled_JJ milk_NN )_) and_CC that_IN from_IN microflora_NN (_( milk_NN and_CC seed_NN curd_NN )_) are_VBP mostly_RB responsible_JJ for_IN this_DT increase_NN of_IN acidity_NN ._.
Acidity_NN in_IN butter_NN due_JJ to_TO souring_VBG also_RB autocatalytically_RB saponifies_VBZ the_DT butter_NN ._.
Experiments_NNS were_VBD therefore_RB designed_VBN to_TO study_VB the_DT effect_NN of_IN these_DT factors_NNS separately_RB ._.
Infection_NN can_MD be_VB killed_VBN by_IN adding_VBG formalin_NN to_TO butter_NN ,_, which_WDT will_MD not_RB affect_VB adversely_RB the_DT catalytic_JJ activity_NN of_IN free_JJ acids_NNS or_CC the_DT activity_NN of_IN lipolytic_JJ enzymes_NNS ._.
Again_RB ,_, sterilization_NN stops_VBZ the_DT enzyme_JJ action_NN ,_, but_CC not_RB the_DT effect_NN of_IN acidity_NN ._.
In_IN this_DT way_NN the_DT effect_NN of_IN each_DT of_IN the_DT three_CD factors_NNS can_MD be_VB deduced_VBN ._.
Experimental_NNP ._.
A_DT number_NN of_IN trials_NNS were_VBD performed_VBN to_TO find_VB out_RP the_DT amount_NN of_IN formalin_NN necessary_JJ to_TO stop_VB bacterial_JJ growth_NN ._.
Addition_NN of_IN 5_CD per_IN cent_NN by_IN volume_NN of_IN formalin_NN to_TO curd_VB before_IN churning_VBG did_VBD not_RB incorporate_VB it_PRP sufficiently_RB in_IN the_DT resulting_VBG butter_NN to_TO stop_VB bacterial_JJ growth_NN in_IN it_PRP for_IN more_RBR than_IN three_CD days_NNS at_IN 37°C_CD ._.
Sterility_NN was_VBD tested_VBN by_IN seeding_VBG butter_NN in_IN milk_NN agar_NN in_IN sterile_JJ petri_NN dishes_NNS and_CC incubating_VBG them_PRP at_IN 37°C_CD ._.
It_PRP was_VBD found_VBN that_IN 0.5_CD ,_, 1.0_CD and_CC 1.5_CD c._NN c._NN formalin_NN in_IN 100_CD gm_NN ._.
of_IN butter_NN kept_VBD down_RB bacterial_JJ growth_NN for_IN 3_CD to_TO 5_CD ,_, 6_CD to_TO 8_CD and_CC over_RB 15_CD days_NNS respectively_RB ._.
Butter_NN with_IN 2_CD to_TO 3_CD c._NNS c._JJ formalin_NN remained_VBD sterile_JJ for_IN all_DT pur-_JJ poses_NNS ._.
Formalin_NNP was_VBD added_VBN to_TO butter_VB in_IN the_DT molten_JJ condition_NN (_( 40°C_CD )_) ._.
It_PRP was_VBD mixed_JJ thorough-_JJ ly_NN and_CC then_RB allowed_VBD to_TO set_VB ._.
Eight_CD litres_NNS of_IN unboiled_JJ buffalo_NN milk_NN were_VBD seeded_VBN with_IN 50_CD c._NNS c._NN of_IN unboiled_JJ milk_NN seed_NN curd_NN of_IN 1.2_CD per_IN cent_NN lactic_JJ acidity_NN in_IN an_DT earthen_NN pot_NN of_IN about_IN 20_CD litres_NNS ,_, as_IN is_VBZ the_DT practice_NN in_IN villages_NNS ._.
The_DT seed_NN curd_NN was_VBD specially_RB propagated_VBN in_IN unboiled_JJ milk_NN from_IN a_DT sample_NN of_IN butter_NN from_IN Mandya_NNP village_NN that_WDT had_VBD been_VBN obtained_VBN from_IN untreated_JJ milk_NN ._.
The_DT flavour_NN of_IN the_DT seed_NN curd_NN was_VBD non-aromatic_JJ and_CC it_PRP was_VBD slightly_RB mouldy_JJ ._.
After_IN 24_CD hours_NNS of_IN souring_VBG the_DT acidity_NN was_VBD 1.2_CD per_IN cent_NN when_WRB it_PRP was_VBD churned_VBN ._.
The_DT temperature_NN varied_VBD during_IN the_DT experiment_NN between_IN 20°_CD and_CC 28°C_CD ._.
The_DT resulting_VBG butter_NN was_VBD used_VBN as_IN a_DT stock_NN for_IN the_DT experiments_NNS ._.
Fifty-gram_JJ samples_NNS (_( two_CD )_) from_IN the_DT stock_NN butter_NN were_VBD transferred_VBN to_TO 250_CD c._NNS c._JJ conical_JJ flasks_NNS and_CC one_CD was_VBD treated_VBN with_IN formalin_NN and_CC the_DT other_JJ sterilized_VBN ._.

for_IN one_CD hour_NN for_IN three_CD days_NNS ._.
The_DT flasks_NNS were_VBD all_DT plugged_VBN with_IN cotton_NN wool_NN and_CC maintained_VBD at_IN 30°C_CD ._.
It_PRP was_VBD found_VBN that_IN at_IN 37°C_CD ._.
the_DT acidities_NNS developed_VBN were_VBD irre-_JJ gular_NN as_IN the_DT fat_NN and_CC aqueous_JJ layers_NNS separated_VBD out_RP ._.
The_DT H-ion_NNP and_CC acidity_NN of_IN the_DT stock_NN butter_NN were_VBD determined_VBN when_WRB it_PRP was_VBD made_VBN ._.
Then_RB ,_, after_IN 4_CD ,_, 7_CD ,_, 14_CD and_CC 21_CD days_NNS samples_NNS were_VBD drawn_VBN from_IN the_DT stock_NN and_CC the_DT experiment_NN repeated_VBD as_IN described_VBN above_IN ._.
Acidity_NNP and_CC H-ion_NNP determinations_NNS of_IN the_DT samples_NNS were_VBD made_VBN at_IN every_DT interval_NN ._.
The_DT acidity_NN of_IN the_DT sterilized_JJ samples_NNS were_VBD determined_VBN only_RB at_IN the_DT beginning_NN and_CC end_NN of_IN the_DT storage_NN period_NN of_IN 21_CD days_NNS ,_, A_NNP sample_NN of_IN unprocessed-milk_JJ butter_NN bought_VBD from_IN the_DT bazaar_NN was_VBD similarly_RB treated_VBN and_CC experimented_VBN with_IN ._.

1_CD ._.
Again_RB ,_, unwashed_JJ butter_NN contains_NNS about_IN 14_CD per_IN cent_NN milk_NN serum_NN or_CC buttermilk_NN ._.
On_IN storage_NN the_DT protein_NN content_NN of_IN butter_NN may_MD undergo_VB decomposition_NN and_CC give_VB rise_NN to_TO a_DT putrid_NN smell_NN ,_, but_CC the_DT smell_NN may_MD not_RB always_RB be_VB evident_JJ ._.
During_IN the_DT process_NN of_IN decomposition_NN the_DT insoluble_JJ protein_NN is_VBZ converted_VBN into_IN the_DT water-soluble_JJ non-protein_JJ nitrogen_NN ._.
The_DT latter_NN was_VBD ,_, therefore_RB ,_, determined_VBD in_IN butter_NN at_IN the_DT beginning_NN and_CC at_IN intervals_NNS of_IN storage_NN ._.
The_DT determina-_JJ tion_NN was_VBD made_VBN with_IN a_DT slight_JJ modification_NN of_IN Ling_NNP 's_POS method_NN [_NN 1940_CD ]_NN ._.
The_DT protein_NN content_NN is_VBZ coagulated_VBN with_IN trichloracetic_JJ acid_NN at_IN 70°C_CD ._.
and_CC the_DT soluble_JJ protein_NN extracted_VBD with_IN water_NN after_IN cooling_VBG ._.
The_DT increase_NN in_IN the_DT percentage_NN nitrogen_NN content_NN of_IN the_DT extract_NN ,_, if_IN any_DT ,_, in-_JJ dicates_VBZ the_DT extent_NN of_IN decomposition_NN of_IN the_DT protein_NN in_IN the_DT butter_NN ._.

1_CD ._.
Lipase_NNP activity_NN in_IN unprocessed-milk_JJ (_( Mandya_NNP )_) butter_NN ._.
The_DT rise_NN of_IN acidity_NN in_IN butter_NN on_IN storage_NN varies_NNS with_IN the_DT seasonal_JJ temperature_NN and_CC flora_NN ._.
The_DT addition_NN of_IN formalin_NN does_VBZ not_RB increase_VB the_DT initial_JJ acidity_NN of_IN butter_NN ._.
But_CC sterilization_NN increases_VBZ the_DT initial_JJ acidity_NN slightly_RB and_CC the_DT increase_NN is_VBZ more_RBR in_IN high_JJ acid_NN butters_NNS ._.
This_DT is_VBZ due_JJ to_TO the_DT action_NN of_IN heat_NN of_IN sterilization_NN and_CC the_DT free_JJ acidity_NN of_IN butter_NN ._.
Growing_VBG flora_NNS (_( infection_NN )_) causes_VBZ the_DT increase_NN of_IN acidity_NN in_IN butter_NN ._.
The_DT period_NN for_IN which_WDT village_NN butter_NN can_MD be_VB stored_VBN at_IN about_RB 22°K_CD ._.
S._NNP RANGAPPA_NNP ,_, AND_NNP B._NNP N._NNP BANERJEE_NNP 103_CD THE_NNP EFFECT_NNP OF_NNP STORAGE_NNP VESSELS_NNP ON_NNP THE_NNP KEEPING_NNP QUALITY_NNP OF_NNP GHEE_NNP As_NNP discussed_VBD before_IN ,_, it_PRP was_VBD felt_VBN necessary_JJ to_TO compare_VB the_DT changes_NNS that_WDT would_MD take_VB place_NN when_WRB clarified_VBN butter_NN was_VBD stored_VBN under_IN similar_JJ conditions_NNS ._.
For_IN this_DT purpose_NN ,_, ghee_NN was_VBD stored_VBN in_IN a_DT villager_NN 's_POS earthenware_NN ,_, (_( an_DT old_JJ and_CC used_JJ vessel_NN )_) 'that_WDT was_VBD smeared_VBN with_IN butter_NN and_CC ghee_NN ,_, another_DT similar_JJ vessel_NN that_WDT was_VBD heated_VBN to_TO 100°C_CD ._.
for_IN 12_CD hoars_NNS to_TO kill_VB the_DT microflora_JJ present_NN ;_: a_DT new_JJ and_CC unused_JJ vessel_NN ,_, and_CC a_DT glass_NN conical_JJ flask_NN ._.
These_DT vessels_NNS were_VBD loosely_RB covered_VBN and_CC there_EX was_VBD exposure_NN to_TO air_NN ;_: they_PRP were_VBD stored_VBN at_IN 37°C_CD ._.
for_IN a_DT month_NN ._.
The_DT results_NNS are_VBP given_VBN in_IN Table_NNP III_NNP ._.
TABLE_NNP III_NNP Effect_NNP of_IN storage_NN on_IN ghee_JJ Storage_NNP vessel_NN Acidity_NNP and_CC flavour_NN of_IN ghee_NN ._.
Days_NNS of_IN storage_NN At_IN the_DT end_NN of_IN the_DT storage_NN 0_CD 7_CD 14_CD 30_CD Vitamin_NNP A_NNP Lovibond_NNP B_NNP units_NNS Carotene_NNP Lovibond_NNP Y_NNP units_NNS Induction_NNP period_NN in_IN hours_NNS Old_NNP pot_NN 0.089_CD Good_NNP flavour_NN 0.11_CD Faintly_NNP oily_RB 0.11_CD Faintly_NNP oily_RB 0.25_CD Oily_RB 8.2_CD 2.2_CD 6_CD Hented_VBD pot_NN 104_CD Methods_NNS of_IN Preparation_NNP of_IN Ghee_NNP culture_NN the_DT rise_NN in_IN acidity_NN on_IN storage_NN is_VBZ less_JJR than_IN one_CD tenth_NN in_IN a_DT week_NN ._.
This_DT high_JJ acidity_NN makes_VBZ it_PRP unfit_JJ for_IN consumption_NN as_IN butter_NN and_CC also_RB ruins_VBZ the_DT ghee_NN if_IN clarified_VBN from_IN stored_VBN butter_NN ._.
Under_IN tropical_JJ conditions_NNS ,_, lipolytic_JJ microflora_NNS thrive_VBP at_IN an_DT alarming_VBG rate_NN in_IN unwashed_JJ butter_NN prepared_VBN from_IN uncontrolled_JJ seed_NN culture_NN ,_, unboiled_JJ milk_NN or_CC unpasteurized_JJ cream_NN ,_, making_VBG it_PRP unfit_JJ for_IN consumption_NN on_IN storage_NN ._.
In_IN cold_JJ climates_NNS ,_, the_DT growth_NN is_VBZ not_RB altogether_RB stopped_VBN ,_, but_CC the_DT rate_NN of_IN growth_NN is_VBZ slow_JJ enough_RB to_TO permit_VB storage_NN and_CC consumption_NN as_IN butter_NN for_IN a_DT certain_JJ length_NN of_IN time_NN ._.
Once_RB lipolysis_NN has_VBZ taken_VBN place_NN in_IN butter_NN ,_, the_DT free_JJ fatty_JJ acids_NNS pass_NN into_IN the_DT ghee_NN on_IN clarification_NN ,_, and_CC it_PRP is_VBZ very_RB difficult_JJ to_TO get_VB rid_JJ of_IN it_PRP ._.
Fortunately_RB for_IN the_DT ghee_NN trade_NN ,_, lipolysis_NN in_IN the_DT milk_NN and_CC curd_JJ stages_NNS is_VBZ very_RB small_JJ and_CC negligible_JJ ._.
But_CC once_RB butter_NN is_VBZ churned_VBN out_RP from_IN curd_NN and_CC the_DT lactic_JJ acid_NN solution_NN removed_VBD ,_, undesirable_JJ microflora_NNS have_VBP their_PRP$ full_JJ play_NN ._.
The_DT total_JJ acidity_NN of_IN curd_NN and_CC lactose_NN consumed_VBN give_VBP a_DT picture_NN of_IN the_DT action_NN of_IN microflora_NN in_IN curd_NN and_CC ,_, to_TO a_DT certain_JJ extent_NN ,_, determine_VB the_DT quality_NN of_IN butter_NN ,_, especially_RB its_PRP$ storage_NN property_NN ._.
If_IN butter_RB be_VB at_IN once_RB melted_VBN into_IN ghee_NN ,_, then_RB further_RBR development_NN of_IN acidity_NN is_VBZ stopped_VBN and_CC a_DT low_JJ acid_NN ghee_NN results_NNS with_IN good_JJ storage_NN property_NN ._.
On_IN neglect_NN ,_, that_WDT is_VBZ ,_, delay_NN in_IN melting_VBG butter_NN into_IN ghee_NN ,_, acidity_NN goes_VBZ on_IN increasing_VBG at_IN an_DT increasing_VBG rate_NN and_CC it_PRP can_MD not_RB be_VB removed_VBN on_IN clarification_NN ,_, and_CC it_PRP proportionately_RB shortens_VBZ the_DT storage_NN property_NN of_IN ghee_NN ._.
High_JJ acidity_NN in_IN ghee_NN on_IN storage_NN also_RB destroys_VBZ vitamin_NN A_NNP and_CC carotene_NN B_NNP quickly_RB ._.
Acidity_NN in_IN butter_NN ,_, that_WDT is_VBZ not_RB derived_VBN from_IN the_DT fat_JJ phase_NN ,_, is_VBZ not_RB markedly_RB harmful_JJ to_TO the_DT vitamin_NN A_DT or_CC carotene_NN of_IN butter_NN ._.
Its_PRP$ effect_NN as_IN a_DT catalyst_NN on_IN the_DT development_NN of_IN rancidity_NN in_IN fat_NN ,_, or_CC rise_NN in_IN acidity_NN of_IN butter_NN fat_NN is_VBZ very_RB little_JJ ._.
The_DT slight_JJ rise_NN of_IN acidity_NN in_IN ghee_NN on_IN clarification_NN is_VBZ a_DT measure_NN of_IN this_DT cause_NN ._.
But_CC the_DT free_JJ fatty_NN acid_NN in_IN butter_NN or_CC ghee_NN ,_, that_WDT is_VBZ derived_VBN from_IN lipolysis_NN ,_, is_VBZ autocatalytic_JJ and_CC is_VBZ proportional_JJ to_TO its_PRP$ strength_NN ._.
However_RB ,_, broadly_RB speaking_VBG ,_, the_DT small_JJ quantity_NN of_IN free_JJ fatty_JJ acid_NN that_WDT finds_VBZ its_PRP$ way_NN into_IN butter_NN and_CC ghee_NN ,_, (_( up_IN to_TO 0.2_CD per_IN cent_NN in_IN butter_NN and_CC 0.1_CD per_IN cent_NN in_IN ghee_NN )_) is_VBZ not_RB very_RB harmful_JJ ,_, and_CC its_PRP$ effect_NN is_VBZ negligible_JJ ._.
This_DT can_MD be_VB achieved_VBN if_IN the_DT milk_NN is_VBZ not_RB soured_VBN beyond_IN an_DT acidity_NN of_IN 1.2_CD per_IN cent_NN and_CC the_DT butter_NN is_VBZ then_RB churned_VBN out_RP and_CC at_IN once_RB melted_VBN into_IN ghee_NN by_IN the_DT decantation_NN process_NN ,_, but_CC the_DT same_JJ is_VBZ not_RB true_JJ of_IN high_JJ acidity_NN in_IN butter_NN or_CC ghee_NN resulting_VBG from_IN lipolysis_NN ._.
CAUSATIVE_NNP ORGANISM_NNP OF_NNP HIGH_NNP ACIDITY_NNP IN_NNP MANDYA_NNP (_( UNPROCESSED_NNP MILK_NNP )_) BUTTER_VBD The_DT investigations_NNS on_IN acidity_NN in_IN Mandya_NNP butter_NN ,_, described_VBN before_IN ,_, showed_VBD that_IN lipolytic_JJ enzymes_NNS elaborated_VBN by_IN the_DT uncontrolled_JJ microflora_NN of_IN the_DT untreated_JJ milk_NN and_CC of_IN the_DT seed_NN curd_NN are_VBP almost_RB entirely_RB responsible_JJ for_IN the_DT enormously_RB high_JJ acidity_NN developed_VBN in_IN butter_NN on_IN storage_NN ._.
No_DT attempt_NN had_VBD ,_, however_RB ,_, been_VBN made_VBN to_TO trace_VB the_DT cause_NN to_TO any_DT particular_JJ flora_NN ,_, but_CC the_DT fact_NN had_VBD been_VBN noted_VBN that_IN the_DT same_JJ butter_NN ,_, when_WRB raised_VBN to_TO 40°C_CD ._.
K._NNP S._NNP RANGAPPA_NNP AND_NNP B._NNP N._NNP BANERJEE_NNP 105_CD roughly_RB in_IN equal_JJ portions_NNS of_IN 50_CD gm_NN ._.

EFFECT_NN OF_NNP FLUOROSIS_NNP ON_NNP MINERAL_NNP METABOLISM_NNP By_IN B._NNP N._NNP MAJUMDAR_NNP AND_NNP S._NNP N._NNP RAY_NNP Animal_NNP Nutrition_NNP Section_NNP ,_, Imperial_NNP Veterinary_NNP Research_NNP Institute_NNP ,_, Izatnagar_NNP (_( Received_VBN for_IN publication_NN on_IN 24_CD January_NNP 1946_CD )_) IN_VBZ a_DT previous_JJ paper_NN [_NNP Majumdar_NNP ,_, Ray_NNP and_CC Sen_NNP ,_, 1943_CD ]_NN ,_, evidence_NN has_VBZ been_VBN advanced_VBN to_TO identify_VB the_DT so-called_JJ cases_NNS of_IN osteomalacia_JJ [_NNP Mahajan_NNP ,_, 1934-35_JJ ]_NN and_CC rheumatoid_VB arthritis_NN [_NNP Viswanathan_NNP ,_, 1934-35_JJ ]_NN of_IN cattle_NNS in_IN India_NNP with_IN fluorosis_NN ._.
Symptoms_NNS seen_VBN in_IN these_DT field_NN cases_NNS could_MD be_VB experimentally_RB produced_VBN in_IN normal_JJ cattle_NNS by_IN administering_VBG sodium_JJ fluo-_JJ ride_NN ._.
To_TO study_VB further_RB whether_IN the_DT symptoms_NNS produced_VBD follow_IN the_DT metabolism_NN in_IN a_DT phos-_JJ phorosis_NN ,_, a_DT series_NN of_IN mineral_JJ balance_NN studies_NNS was_VBD carried_VBN out_IN and_CC the_DT results_NNS are_VBP presented_VBN in_IN this_DT paper_NN ._.
EXPERIMENTAL_VB The_DT effect_NN of_IN feeding_VBG fluorine_NN to_TO animals_NNS has_VBZ been_VBN studied_VBN in_IN two_CD sets_NNS of_IN metabolism_NN trials_NNS ._.
In_IN the_DT first_JJ set_NN ,_, the_DT animals_NNS used_VBD consisted_VBN of_IN four_CD groups_NNS ,_, each_DT containing_VBG three_CD adult_NN hills_NNS bulls_NNS ._.
All_PDT these_DT animals_NNS were_VBD on_IN a_DT low_JJ phosphorus_NN basal_NN ration_NN ,_, composed_VBN of_IN wheat_NN bhoosa_NN as_IN roughage_NN and_CC a_DT concentrate_JJ mixture_NN of_IN groundnut_JJ cake_NN and_CC barley_NN ._.
The_DT ani-_JJ mals_NNS of_IN the_DT first_JJ group_NN (_( control_VB group_NN )_) received_VBD the_DT basal_NN ration_NN only_RB ,_, while_IN those_DT of_IN groups_NNS 2_CD and_CC 3_CD (_( respectively_RB called_VBN low_JJ and_CC high_JJ fluorine_NN groups_NNS )_) received_VBN in_IN addition_NN 0.1_CD gm_NN ._.
and_CC 1.0_CD gm_NN ._.
of_IN sodium_JJ fluoride_JJ daily_JJ per_IN animal_NN ._.
The_DT animals_NNS of_IN the_DT final_JJ group_NN (_( henceforth_NN called_VBN the_DT calcium_NN group_NN )_) received_VBD in_IN addition_NN to_TO their_PRP$ daily_JJ ration_NN ,_, 1_CD gm_NN ._.
of_IN sodium_NN fluoride_NN and_CC 2_CD oz_NN ._.
of_IN calcium_NN phosphate_NN ._.
Five_CD months_NNS after_IN the_DT experiments_NNS had_VBD started_VBN ,_, the_DT stock_NN of_IN calcium_NN phosphate_NN was_VBD exhausted_VBN and_CC calcium_JJ carbonate_NN was_VBD given_VBN instead_RB ._.
The_DT basal_JJ ration_NN of_IN these_DT animals_NNS was_VBD so_RB selected_VBN as_IN to_TO resemble_VB that_IN given_VBN under_IN field_NN conditions_NNS in_IN the_DT suspected_JJ fluorosis_NN zones_NNS ._.
In_IN the_DT second_JJ set_NN of_IN metabolism_NN trials_NNS ,_, the_DT basal_NN ration_NN was_VBD formulated_VBN to_TO supply_VB the_DT animals_NNS with_IN adequate_JJ calcium_NN and_CC phosphorus_NN ._.
It_PRP consisted_VBD of_IN wheat_NN bhoosa_NN as_IN rough-_JJ age_NN and_CC a_DT concentrate_JJ mixture_NN of_IN rape-cake_NN and_CC wheat-bran_NN ._.
Four_CD groups_NNS ,_, each_DT contain-_NN ing_VBG three_CD adult_NN hills_NNS bulls_NNS ,_, were_VBD used_VBN ,_, and_CC all_PDT the_DT animals_NNS received_VBD the_DT basal_JJ ration_NN sup-_NN plemented_VBD with_IN 3_CD mg._NNS of_IN fluorine_NN per_IN kg_NN ._.
body_NN weight_NN ._.
The_DT first_JJ group_NN (_( fluorine-alone_JJ group_NN )_) received_VBD this_DT ration_NN ,_, while_IN the_DT other_JJ three_CD groups_NNS received_VBD in_IN addition_NN 2_CD oz_NN ._.

sodium_NN phosphate_NN (_( phosphate_JJ group_NN )_) and_CC 1_CD oz_NN ._.
alu-_JJ minium_NN phosphate_NN (_( aluminium_JJ group_NN )_) ,_, respectively_RB ._.
The_DT last_JJ group_NN was_VBD included_VBN ,_, as_IN some_DT workers_NNS [_VBP Marcovitch_NNP and_CC Stanley_NNP ,_, 1942_CD ]_NN have_VBP reported_VBN that_IN aluminium_NN salts_NNS protect_VBP small_JJ animals_NNS against_IN fluorosis_NN ._.
The_DT condition_NN of_IN the_DT animals_NNS in_IN the_DT first_JJ trial_NN has_VBZ been_VBN given_VBN in_IN detail_NN in_IN a_DT previous_JJ paper_NN [_NNP Majumdar_NNP et_FW al._NN ,_, 1943_CD ]_NN ._.
The_DT animals_NNS of_IN the_DT high_JJ fluorine_NN group_NN started_VBD losing_VBG con-_JJ dition_NN immediately_RB fluorine_JJ feeding_NN was_VBD started_VBN and_CC died_VBD within_IN nine_CD months_NNS after_IN show-_JJ ing_NN severe_JJ symptoms_NNS of_IN fluorosis_NN ._.
At_IN this_DT period_NN ,_, the_DT calcium_NN group_NN animals_NNS showed_VBD definite_JJ but_CC much_JJ less_JJR aggravated_JJ symptoms_NNS ,_, while_IN the_DT bulls_NNS in_IN the_DT other_JJ two_CD groups_NNS remained_VBD quite_RB normal_JJ ._.
It_PRP may_MD also_RB be_VB mentioned_VBN here_RB that_IN the_DT weights_NNS of_IN the_DT calcium_NN group_NN animals_NNS ,_, after_IN an_DT initial_JJ fall_NN ,_, remained_VBD steady_JJ as_RB long_RB as_IN calcium_NN phosphate_NN was_VBD fed_VBN ,_, but_CC a_DT month_NN after_IN calcium_NN carbonate_NN was_VBD substituted_VBN the_DT animals_NNS started_VBD losing_VBG weight_NN rapidly_RB ._.
In_IN contrast_NN to_TO these_DT findings_NNS ,_, the_DT animals_NNS in_IN the_DT second_JJ trial_NN were_VBD in_IN much_JJ better_JJR condition_NN at_IN the_DT end_NN of_IN nine_CD months_NNS on_IN the_DT experimental_JJ feed_NN ._.
The_DT animals_NNS of_IN the_DT 'fluorine-alone_NNP '_POS group_NN were_VBD showing_VBG only_RB mild_JJ symptoms_NNS of_IN fluorosis_NN ,_, viz_NN ._.

The_DT animals_NNS of_IN the_DT 'phosphate_NNP group_NN '_'' also_RB showed_VBD similar_JJ symptoms_NNS ,_, whereas_IN the_DT animals_NNS of_IN the_DT aluminium_NN group_NN ,_, though_IN ingesting_JJ high_JJ doses_NNS of_IN fluorine_NN ,_, remained_VBD normal_JJ in_IN appearance_NN ._.
The_DT weights_NNS of_IN animals_NNS of_IN these_DT groups_NNS remained_VBD more_RBR or_CC less_RBR constant_JJ throughout_IN the_DT experiment_NN ._.
The_DT worst_JJS sufferers_NNS were_VBD ,_, however_RB ,_, the_DT animals_NNS of_IN the_DT 'calcium_NNP group_NN '_POS ._.

The_DT fall_NN in_IN weight_NN started_VBN from_IN the_DT seventh_JJ month_NN and_CC continued_VBD until_IN all_PDT the_DT three_CD animals_NNS died_VBD within_IN 10-11_JJ months_NNS after_IN the_DT commencement_NN of_IN the_DT experiment_NN It_PRP may_MD be_VB mentioned_VBN that_IN ,_, even_RB after_IN two_CD years_NNS on_IN the_DT experimental_JJ ration_NN ,_, the_DT 'aluminium_NN group_NN '_'' of_IN animals_NNS has_VBZ exhibited_VBN only_RB minor_JJ symptoms_NNS ,_, whereas_IN the_DT animals_NNS in_IN the_DT other_JJ groups_NNS had_VBD all_DT died_VBN of_IN fluorosis_NN ._.
