DISCUSSION_NN It_PRP will_MD be_VB seen_VBN from_IN Table_JJ I_PRP that_IN when_WRB fluorine_NN is_VBZ administered_VBN in_IN small_JJ doses_NNS the_DT balance_NN of_IN both_DT calcium_NN and_CC phosphorus_NN improves_NNS ._.
This_DT supports_VBZ recent_JJ findings_NNS that_WDT fluorine_VBP in_IN small_JJ quantities_NNS helps_VBZ in_IN the_DT prevention_NN of_IN caries_NNS ._.
High_JJ fluorine_NN intake_NN ,_, how-_JJ ever_RB ,_, brings_VBZ about_IN a_DT definitely_RB negative_JJ balance_NN of_IN calcium_NN and_CC the_DT phosphorus_NN balance_NN ,_, already_RB negative_JJ ,_, becomes_VBZ more_RBR pronounced_JJ ._.
The_DT increased_JJ negative_JJ balance_NN of_IN phospho-_JJ rus_NN is_VBZ mainly_RB due_JJ to_TO the_DT highly_RB increased_JJ elimination_NN of_IN this_DT mineral_NN in_IN urine_NN ._.
A_DT simul-_JJ taneous_JJ greater_JJR excretion_NN of_IN nitrogen_NN through_IN the_DT kidneys_NNS may_MD be_VB taken_VBN to_TO signify_VB ex-_JJ tensive_JJ muscular_JJ degeneration_NN ._.
This_DT breakdown_NN of_IN the_DT soft_JJ tissues_NNS is_VBZ also_RB apparent_JJ from_IN the_DT great_JJ loss_NN in_IN body_NN weight_NN of_IN the_DT animals_NNS of_IN the_DT high_JJ fluorine_NN group_NN ._.
A_DT simi-_JJ lar_JJ loss_NN of_IN phosphorus_NN by_IN dairy_NN cattle_NNS on_IN fluorine_JJ administration_NN was_VBD found_VBN by_IN Du_NNP Toit_NNP ,_, et_RB al_NN ._.
[_NN 1937_CD ]_NN who_WP considered_VBD that_IN fluorine_NN produced_VBN symptoms_NNS of_IN osteomalacia_JJ by_IN induc-_JJ ing_VBG a_DT condition_NN of_IN phosphorus_JJ shortage_NN ._.
This_DT hypothesis_NN can_MD not_RB ,_, however_RB ,_, be_VB substan_VBN ._.
tiated_VBN in_IN view_NN of_IN our_PRP$ finding_NN that_IN the_DT animals_NNS in_IN the_DT fluorine_NN alone_RB group_NN of_IN the_DT second_JJ trial_NN were_VBD actually_RB in_IN positive_JJ phosphorus_NN balance_NN when_WRB symptoms_NNS of_IN fluorosis_NN were_VBD clearly_RB observable_JJ ._.
This_DT is_VBZ further_JJ confirmed_VBN from_IN the_DT blood_NN anylysis_NN [_NNP Majumdar_NNP et_FW al_NN ._.
1943_CD ]_NN of_IN the_DT experimental_JJ animals_NNS ,_, where_WRB no_DT lowering_NN of_IN blood_NN inorganic_JJ phospho-_JJ rus_NN ,_, characteristic_NN of_IN aphosphorosis_NN ,_, could_MD be_VB recorded_VBN ._.
In_IN the_DT absence_NN of_IN nitrogen_JJ balance_NN data_NNS ,_, the_DT possibility_NN of_IN negative_JJ phosphorus_NN balance_NN in_IN the_DT animals_NNS of_IN Du_NNP Toit_NNP et_FW al_NN ._.
[_NN 1937_CD ]_NN being_VBG due_JJ to_TO the_DT breakdown_NN of_IN soft_JJ tissues_NNS can_MD not_RB be_VB ruled_VBN out_RP ._.
There_EX seems_VBZ ,_, however_RB ,_, to_TO be_VB some_DT apparent_JJ connection_NN between_IN the_DT level_NN of_IN feed_NN phosphorus_NN and_CC the_DT production_NN of_IN fluorotic_JJ symptoms_NNS ._.
These_DT symptoms_NNS were_VBD precipitated_VBN in_IN animals_NNS kept_VBD on_IN a_DT low_JJ phosporus_NN diet_NN (_( first_JJ trial_NN )_) ;_: but_CC were_VBD delayed_VBN when_WRB adequate_JJ phosphorus_NN was_VBD supplied_VBN (_( second_JJ trial_NN )_) ._.
The_DT effect_NN of_IN the_DT level_NN of_IN intake_NN of_IN phosphorus_NN was_VBD very_RB clearly_RB exhibited_VBN by_IN the_DT animals_NNS of_IN the_DT calcium_NN group_NN in_IN the_DT first_JJ set_NN of_IN ex-_JJ periments_NNS ._.
Here_RB so_RB long_RB as_IN the_DT supplement_NN of_IN calcium_NN phosphate_NN was_VBD given_VBN ,_, the_DT ani-_JJ mals_NNS remained_VBN in_IN good_JJ condition_NN ._.
The_DT supplement_NN helped_VBD to_TO maintain_VB the_DT ration_NN adequate_NN in_IN phosphorus_NN ._.
When_WRB calcium_NN phosphate_NN was_VBD replaced_VBN by_IN calcium_NN carbonate_NN ,_, the_DT animals_NNS started_VBD losing_VBG weight_NN and_CC their_PRP$ condition_NN thereafter_RB rapidly_RB deteriorated_VBN ._.
These_DT experi-_JJ ments_NNS apparently_RB support_VBP the_DT view_NN of_IN Du_NNP Toit_NNP et_FW al_NN ._.
[_NN 1937_CD ]_NN that_WDT fluorosis_NN brings_VBZ about_IN osteoma-_JJ lacia_NN by_IN phosphorus_NN deprivation_NN and_CC may_MD be_VB corrected_VBN by_IN adequate_JJ phosphorus_NNS intake_VBP ._.
But_CC this_DT contention_NN has_VBZ been_VBN proved_VBN untenable_JJ from_IN the_DT metabolic_JJ evidences_NNS already_RB dis_VBP cussed_VBN ._.
It_PRP is_VBZ not_RB the_DT adequacy_NN of_IN phosphorus_NN alone_RB but_CC that_IN of_IN both_DT calcium_NN and_CC phos-_JJ phorus_NN ,_, and_CC also_RB their_PRP$ proper_JJ proportion_NN ,_, which_WDT can_MD afford_VB some_DT protection_NN against_IN fluo-_JJ rosis_NN ._.
It_PRP should_MD ,_, however_RB ,_, be_VB stressed_VBN that_IN adequate_JJ supply_NN of_IN calcium_NN and_CC phosphorus_NN offers_NNS only_RB a_DT temporary_JJ relief_NN and_CC is_VBZ useless_JJ to_TO save_VB a_DT victim_NN against_IN prolonged_JJ high_JJ in-_JJ take_NN of_IN fluorine_NN ._.
The_DT importance_NN of_IN supplying_VBG the_DT minerals_NNS in_IN correct_JJ proportion_NN is_VBZ exemplified_VBN in_IN the_DT second_JJ set_NN of_IN experiments_NNS ._.
Here_RB ,_, though_IN the_DT animals_NNS were_VBD on_IN a_DT negative_JJ calcium_NN balance_NN ,_, a_DT supplement_NN of_IN calcium_NN carbonate_NN ,_, instead_RB of_IN proving_VBG helpful_NN ,_, brought_VBD about_IN more_RBR rapid_JJ deterioration_NN of_IN the_DT animals_NNS ._.
The_DT addition_NN of_IN extra_JJ phosphorus_NN ,_, as_IN sodium_NN phosphate_NN ,_, was_VBD also_RB of_IN no_DT avail_NN ,_, because_IN the_DT condition_NN of_IN the_DT phosphorus_NN group_NN of_IN ani-_JJ mals_NNS was_VBD more_RBR or_CC less_RBR the_DT same_JJ as_IN that_DT of_IN the_DT animals_NNS of_IN the_DT fluorine-alone_JJ group_NN ._.
The_DT Ca_NNP :_: P_NNP ratios_NNS of_IN the_DT control_NN ,_, high_JJ fluorine_NN and_CC calcium_NN (_( calcium_JJ phosphate_NN supplement_NN )_) ,_, groups_NNS of_IN animals_NNS in_IN the_DT first_JJ experiment_NN ,_, and_CC of_IN fluorine_JJ alone_NN ,_, calcium_NN and_CC phosphorus_NN groups_NNS of_IN the_DT animals_NNS in_IN the_DT second_JJ experiment_NN were_VBD respectively_RB 3:1_CD ,_, 2:1_CD ,_, 2:1_CD ,_, 1:1.2_CD ,_, 4.3_CD :_: 1_CD and_CC 1_CD :_: 2.2_CD ._.
It_PRP will_MD thus_RB be_VB seen_VBN that_IN the_DT syndromes_NNS of_IN fluorosis_NN were_VBD precipitated_VBN only_RB in_IN those_DT groups_NNS ,_, where_WRB either_RB there_EX was_VBD a_DT gross_JJ deficiency_NN of_IN phosphorus_NN or_CC where_WRB the_DT ratios_NNS were_VBD widely_RB divergent_VBN from_IN the_DT physiological_JJ optimum_JJ range_NN of_IN 2:1_CD to_TO 1:1_CD ._.
From_IN what_WP has_VBZ been_VBN stated_VBN above_IN ,_, it_PRP may_MD also_RB be_VB concluded_VBN that_IN a_DT low_JJ calcium_NN diet_NN will_MD similarly_RB precipitate_VB fluorotic_JJ symptoms_NNS at_IN a_DT very_RB early_JJ date_NN ._.
On_IN account_NN of_IN the_DT difficulty_NN of_IN devising_VBG a_DT cattle_JJ ration_NN very_RB poor_JJ in_IN calcium_NN content_NN ,_, this_DT experiment_NN could_MD not_RB be_VB taken_VBN B._NNP N._NNP MAJUMDAR_NNP AND_NNP S._NNP N._NNP RAY_NNP 111_CD up_RB ;_: but_CC this_DT assumption_NN is_VBZ supported_VBN by_IN the_DT work_NN of_IN Ranganathan_NNP [_NNP 1941_CD ]_NN with_IN rats_NNS ,_, in_IN which_WDT he_PRP has_VBZ shown_VBN that_IN the_DT withdrawal_NN of_IN calcium_NN from_IN a_DT high_JJ fluorine_NN diet_NN led_VBD to_TO early_JJ death_NN of_IN the_DT animals_NNS and_CC that_IN the_DT toxic_JJ effect_NN of_IN fluorine_NN was_VBD inversely_RB proportional_JJ to_TO the_DT calcium_NN intake_NN ._.
Like_IN Ramiah_NNP [_NNP 1941_CD ]_NNP and_CC Du_NNP Toit_NNP et_FW al_NN ._.
[_NN 1937_CD ]_NN ,_, we_PRP also_RB found_VBD that_IN large_JJ amounts_NNS of_IN fluorine_NN were_VBD being_VBG retained_VBN from_IN rations_NNS containing_VBG an_DT appreciable_JJ quantity_NN of_IN this_DT mineral_NN ._.
In_IN the_DT present_JJ experiment_NN ,_, the_DT kidneys_NNS proved_VBD to_TO be_VB the_DT main_JJ channel_NN of_IN fluo-_JJ rine_NN excretion_NN which_WDT ,_, however_RB ,_, was_VBD contrary_JJ to-what_NN was_VBD observed_VBN by_IN Du_NNP Toit_NNP et_FW al_NN ._.
[_NN 1937_CD ]_NN ._.
Supplementation_NN of_IN calcium_NN and_CC aluminium_NN salts_NNS in_IN the_DT diet_NN increased_VBD the_DT amount_NN of_IN fluorine_NN excreted_VBN in_IN faeces_NNS ,_, but_CC by_IN only_RB a_DT small_JJ amount_NN ,_, the_DT greater_JJR portion_NN being_VBG still_RB excreted_VBN in_IN urine_NN ._.
This_DT shows_VBZ that_IN the_DT beneficial_JJ effect_NN of_IN calcium_NN phosphate_NN supple-_JJ ment_NN in_IN the_DT first_JJ experiment_NN and_CC the_DT protecting_VBG action_NN of_IN calcium_NN and_CC phosphorus_NN in_IN pro-_JJ per_IN ratio_NN in_IN three_CD groups_NNS of_IN the_DT second_JJ set_NN of_IN experiments_NNS were_VBD not_RB due_JJ to_TO the_DT precipi-_JJ tation_NN of_IN fluorine_NN by_IN calcium_NN in_IN the_DT alimentary_JJ canal_NN ._.
On_IN the_DT other_JJ hand_NN ,_, it_PRP will_MD be_VB noticed_VBN that_IN although_IN more_JJR fluorine_NN was_VBD being_VBG retained_VBN by_IN the_DT calcium_NN group_NN of_IN animals_NNS in_IN the_DT first_JJ experiment_NN ,_, these_DT bulls_NNS were_VBD better_RBR in_IN condition_NN than_IN these_DT in_IN the_DT high_JJ fluorine_NN group_NN ._.
That_IN the_DT evaluation_NN of_IN net_JJ retention_NN of_IN fluorine_NN does_VBZ not_RB give_VB any_DT idea_NN about_IN the_DT condition_NN of_IN an_DT animal_NN is_VBZ also_RB seen_VBN from_IN the_DT results_NNS of_IN the_DT second_JJ set_NN of_IN experi-_JJ ments_NNS ._.
Here_RB the_DT animals_NNS of_IN the_DT calcium_NN group_NN ,_, while_IN losing_VBG condition_NN rapidly_RB ,_, were_VBD re-_JJ taining_VBG about_IN the_DT same_JJ quantity_NN of_IN fluorine_NN as_IN the_DT animals_NNS in_IN the_DT other_JJ groups_NNS of_IN this_DT set_NN ._.
It_PRP seems_VBZ further_JJ that_IN bovines_NNS behave_VBP differently_RB from_IN rats_NNS ,_, as_IN in_IN the_DT latter_JJ species_NNS the_DT retention_NN of_IN fluorine_NN is_VBZ depressed_VBN by_IN 10_CD to_TO 12_CD per_IN cent_NN ,_, when_WRB the_DT calcium_NN intake_NN is_VBZ increased_VBN [_JJ Lawrenz_NNP and_CC Mitchell_NNP ,_, 1941_CD ]_NN ._.
The_DT question_NN now_RB arises_VBZ as_IN to_TO how_WRB calcium_NN and_CC phosphorus_NN in_IN adequate_JJ quantity_NN and_CC right_JJ proportion_NN help_NN in_IN checking_VBG the_DT rapid_JJ onset_NN of_IN the_DT toxic_JJ effects_NNS of_IN fluorine_JJ compounds_NNS ._.
The_DT absence_NN of_IN precipitation_NN in_IN the_DT alimentary_JJ canal_NN in_IN any_DT significant_JJ quantity_NN suggests_VBZ that_IN the_DT ingested_JJ fluorine_NN must_MD be_VB mobolised_VBN somewhere_RB inside_IN the_DT body_NN ._.
It_PRP has_VBZ already_RB been_VBN stated_VBN in_IN our_PRP$ previous_JJ paper_NN [_NNP Majumdar_NNP et_FW al_NN ,_, 1943_CD ]_NN that_WDT extensive_JJ periosteal_NN deposits_NNS were_VBD met_VBN with_IN in_IN the_DT fluorine-fed_JJ animals_NNS ._.
The_DT formation_NN of_IN these_DT deposits_NNS may_MD be_VB nature_NN 's_POS attempt_NN to_TO detoxicate_VB the_DT ingested_JJ fluorine_NN by_IN an_DT increased_JJ activity_NN of_IN osteoid_JJ tissue_NN ._.
This_DT osteogenic_JJ action_NN of_IN fluorine_NN is_VBZ evident_JJ from_IN the_DT better_JJR balance_NN of_IN calcium_NN and_CC phosphorus_NN in_IN our_PRP$ low-_JJ fluorine_NN group_NN of_IN animals_NNS in_IN the_DT first_JJ set_NN ,_, and_CC has_VBZ also_RB been_VBN revealed_VBN by_IN the_DT histological_JJ examination_NN of_IN bones_NNS of_IN animals_NNS suffering_VBG from_IN fluorosis_NN [_NNP Pande_NNP ,_, 1944_CD ]_NN ._.
It_PRP was_VBD also_RB found_VBN by_IN us_PRP [_VBP Majumdar_NNP et_FW al_NN ,_, 1943_CD ]_NN that_IN these_DT exostoses_NNS contain_VBP a_DT very_RB high_JJ concentration_NN of_IN fluorine_NN ._.
The_DT new_JJ bone_NN formed_VBN under_IN the_DT influence_NN of_IN fluorine_NN feeding_NN is_VBZ considered_VBN to_TO have_VB the_DT com-_JJ position_NN of_IN calcium_NN fluorapatite_NN and_CC is_VBZ deposited_VBN on_IN the_DT outer_JJ surface_NN of_IN the_DT pre_NN existing_VBG skeletal_JJ tissue_NN ._.
So_RB long_RB as_IN bone-forming_JJ minerals_NNS ,_, such_JJ as_IN calcium_NN and_CC phosphorus_NN ,_, are_VBP supplied_VBN in_IN adequate_JJ quantities_NNS and_CC in_IN proper_JJ proportion_NN ,_, the_DT new_JJ bone_NN formation_NN and_CC conse-_JJ quent_NN removal_NN (_( detoxication_NN )_) of_IN fluorine_NN will_MD proceed_VB smoothly_RB ._.
A_DT metabolism_NN trial_NN in_IN such_JJ circumstances_NNS will_MD indicate_VB a_DT high_JJ retention_NN of_IN fluorine_NN in_IN a_DT non-toxic_JJ form_NN ._.
This_DT was_VBD actually_RB the_DT case_NN in_IN our_PRP$ calcium_NN group_NN of_IN animals_NNS (_( first_JJ experiment_NN )_) ,_, as_RB well_RB as_IN in_IN the_DT animals_NNS of_IN the_DT various_JJ groups_NNS in_IN the_DT second_JJ experiment_NN ._.
When_WRB ,_, however_RB ,_, fluorine_NN is_VBZ fed_VBN at_IN a_DT very_RB high_JJ level_NN for_IN long_JJ periods_NNS or_CC when_WRB sufficient_JJ bone-forming_NN minerals_NNS are_VBP not_RB present_JJ in_IN the_DT feed_NN ,_, or_CC when_WRB these_DT minerals_NNS are_VBP not_RB in_IN correct_JJ proportion_NN ,_, body_NN reserves_NNS of_IN calcium_NN and_CC phosphorus_NN are_VBP used_VBN up_RP in_IN an_DT attempt_NN to_TO detoxicate_VB the_DT ingested_JJ fluorine_NN ._.
This_DT leads_VBZ to_TO a_DT weakening_NN of_IN bones_NNS ,_, resulting_VBG in_IN fractures_NNS and_CC other_JJ skeletal_JJ deformities_NNS so_RB often_RB seen_VBN in_IN cases_NNS of_IN fluorosis_NN ._.
If_IN fluorine_JJ feeding_NN is_VBZ still_RB persisted_VBN in_IN and_CC it_PRP no_DT attempt_NN is_VBZ made_VBN to_TO correct_VB the_DT deficiency_NN or_CC imbalance_NN of_IN calcium_NN and_CC phosphorus_NN ,_, this_DT rate_NN of_IN bone_NN deposition_NN will_MD slow_VB down_RP due_JJ to_TO gradual_JJ saturation_NN of_IN bony_NN tissues_NNS with_IN fluorine_NN ,_, and_CC consequently_RB much_JJ of_IN the_DT ingested_JJ fluorine_NN will_MD escape_VB detoxication_NN ,_, and_CC the_DT concentration_NN of_IN this_DT mineral_NN in_IN the_DT blood_NN will_MD go_VB up_RP ._.
A_DT portion_NN of_IN this_DT excess_JJ fluorine_NN will_MD be_VB excreted_VBN through_IN urine_NN ,_, but_CC with_IN the_DT increase_NN in_IN the_DT blood_NN fluorine_NN concentration_NN ,_, the_DT various_JJ soft_JJ organs_NNS of_IN the_DT body_NN will_MD be_VB acted_VBN upon_IN destruc-_JJ tively_RB with_IN the_DT production_NN of_IN syndromes_NNS of_IN fluorosis_NN and_CC resulting_VBG finally_RB in_IN death_NN ._.
This_DT is_VBZ presumably_RB what_WP had_VBD happened_VBN to_TO the_DT animals_NNS of_IN the_DT high_JJ fluorine_NN (_( first_JJ experiment_NN )_) and_CC calcium_NN (_( second_JJ experiment_NN )_) groups_NNS ,_, as_RB well_RB as_IN in_IN Ranganathan_NNP 's_POS [_NN 1941_CD ]_NN rats_NNS on_IN a_DT low_JJ calcium_NN diet_NN ._.
It_PRP will_MD also_RB be_VB noticed_VBN from_IN Tables_NNP I_PRP and_CC II_NNP that_IN the_DT groups_NNS showing_VBG the_DT most_RBS aggravated_JJ 112_CD Fluorine_NNP Intoxication_NNP of_IN Cattle_NNP in_IN India_NNP symptoms_NNS were_VBD also_RB excreting_VBG very_RB high_JJ amounts_NNS of_IN fluorine_NN in_IN urine_NN ._.
We_PRP can_MD even_RB say_VB that_IN the_DT intensity_NN of_IN fluorine_JJ intoxication_NN is_VBZ proportional_JJ to_TO the_DT amount_NN of_IN fluorine_NN passed_VBN out_RP in_IN urine_NN ._.
That_IN the_DT urinary_JJ output_NN of_IN fluorine_NN is_VBZ a_DT good_JJ index_NN of_IN fluorosis_NN was_VBD also_RB noticed_VBN by_IN Brun_NNP ,_, Buchwald_NNP and_CC Roholm_NNP [_NNP 1941_CD ]_NNP in_IN cryolite_JJ workers_NNS ._.
In_IN the_DT light_NN of_IN our_PRP$ present_JJ knowledge_NN ,_, it_PRP is_VBZ not_RB possible_JJ as_IN yet_RB to_TO explain_VB the_DT beneficial_JJ action_NN of_IN aluminium_NN ingestion_NN ._.
As_IN aluminium_NN does_VBZ dot_VB help_NN in_IN the_DT elimination_NN of_IN fluorine_NN by_IN precipitating_VBG it_PRP to_TO any_DT great_JJ extent_NN in_IN the_DT alimentary_JJ canal_NN ,_, it_PRP may_MD be_VB assumed_VBN that_IN here_RB too_RB the_DT detoxication_NN is_VBZ proceeding_VBG inside_IN the_DT body_NN ._.
The_DT exact_JJ mechanism_NN ,_, however_RB ,_, is_VBZ not_RB under_IN ._.

SUMMARY_NNP The_DT addition_NN of_IN fluorine_NN in_IN small_JJ doses_NNS helps_VBZ in_IN the_DT better_JJR retention_NN of_IN calcium_NN and_CC phosphorous_JJ ._.
Fluorosis_NN can_MD be_VB rapidly_RB produced_VBN in_IN hill_NN bulls_NNS by_IN administering_VBG a_DT high_JJ amount_NN of_IN fluorine_NN to_TO animals_NNS on_IN a_DT low_JJ phosphorus_NN ration_NN or_CC on_IN a_DT ration_NN in_IN which_WDT the_DT ratio_NN between_IN calcium_NN and_CC phosphorous_JJ is_VBZ very_RB wide_JJ ._.
Addition_NN of_IN calcium_NN or_CC phosphorus_NN salts_NNS in_IN amounts_NNS adequate_VBP to_TO bring_VB the_DT quantity_NN of_IN and_CC the_DT ratio_NN between_IN the_DT two_CD minerals_NNS to_TO optimum_JJ levels_NNS helped_VBN in_IN protecting_VBG the_DT animals_NNS for_IN long_JJ periods_NNS against_IN fluorine_JJ intoxication_NN ._.
A_DT theory_NN as_IN to_TO the_DT mechanism_NN of_IN detoxication_NN of_IN the_DT system_NN against_IN fluorosis_NN is_VBZ advanced_JJ and_CC discussed_VBN ._.
A_DT large_JJ positive_JJ balance_NN of_IN fluorine_NN was_VBD observed_VBN in_IN all_DT animals_NNS given_VBN high_JJ quantities_NNS of_IN this_DT element_NN ._.
The_DT estimation_NN of_IN net_JJ retention_NN of_IN fluorine_NN gave_VBD no_DT indication_NN of_IN the_DT condition_NN of_IN the_DT animal_NN ._.
On_IN the_DT other_JJ hand_NN ,_, the_DT poorer_JJR the_DT condition_NN of_IN an_DT animal_NN ,_, the_DT greater_JJR the_DT quantity_NN of_IN this_DT mireral_JJ excreted_VBN in_IN urine_NN ._.
Hence_NNP ,_, urinary_JJ output_NN of_IN fluorine_NN was_VBD a_DT good_JJ index_NN of_IN the_DT intensity_NN of_IN fluorine_JJ intoxication_NN ._.
Ingestion_NN of_IN aluminium_NN sulphate_NN was_VBD very_RB effective_JJ in_IN preventing_VBG fluorosis_NN ,_, ACKNOWLEDGEMENT_NNP Our_PRP$ thanks_NNS are_VBP due_JJ to_TO Dr_NNP K._NNP C._NNP Sen_NNP ,_, Officer-in-Charge_NNP ,_, Animal_NNP Nutrition_NNP Section_NNP ,_, for_IN his_PRP$ interest_NN and_CC guidance_NN throughout_IN this_DT work_NN ._.

As_IN fluorides_NNS are_VBP known_VBN to_TO inhibit_VB in_IN vitro_JJ various_JJ enzymic_JJ reactions_NNS ,_, it_PRP is_VBZ surprising_JJ that_IN so_RB little_JJ work_NN has_VBZ been_VBN done_VBN as_IN yet_RB to_TO study_VB blood_NN changes_NNS in_IN fluorosis_NN ._.
An_DT attempt_NN was_VBD ,_, therefore_RB ,_, made_VBD to_TO investigate_VB the_DT changes_NNS in_IN some_DT haematological_JJ and_CC chemical_JJ constituents_NNS in_IN the_DT blood_NN of_IN cattle_NNS under_IN conditions_NNS of_IN sub-acute_JJ fluorine_JJ poisonings_NNS ._.
The_DT results_NNS of_IN this_DT investigation_NN are_VBP discussed_VBN in_IN the_DT present_JJ paper_NN ._.

The_DT fluctuation_NN in_IN the_DT value_NN all_PDT the_DT while_NN ,_, how-_JJ ever_RB ,_, lay_VBD within_IN the_DT normal_JJ range_NN [_NNP Dukes_NNP ,_, 1943_CD ]_NN ._.
No_DT systematic_JJ examinations_NNS ''_'' were_VBD done_VBN with_IN the_DT adult_NN animals_NNS ,_, but_CC a_DT few_JJ occasional_JJ estimations_NNS revealed_VBD no_DT change_NN in_IN the_DT sugar_NN content_NN ._.
From_IN the_DT findings_NNS of_IN Pal_NNP ,_, Mullick_NNP and_CC Momin_NNP [_NNP 1945_CD ]_NNP ,_, it_PRP seems_VBZ that_IN the_DT fluctua-_JJ tion_NN of_IN sugar_NN content_NN in_IN the_DT blood_NN of_IN calves_NNS can_MD not_RB be_VB ascribed_VBN to_TO seasonal_JJ variation_NN ._.
Gol-_NNP demoerg_NN [_NN 1928_CD ]_NN found_VBD transient_JJ byper-glycaemia_NN in_IN a_DT kid_NN given_VBN sodium_JJ fluoride_NN at_IN 0.06_CD g./kg_NN ._.
while_IN Magenta_NNP [_NNP 1921_CD ]_NNP found_VBD a_DT similar_JJ effect_NN in_IN a_DT dog_NN injected_VBD intravenously_RB with_IN sodium_NN fluoride_NN ._.
Under_IN acute_JJ intoxication_NN of_IN rabbits_NNS ,_, Foit_NNP [_NNP 1931_CD ]_NNP observed_VBD hyper_JJR glycaemia_NN which_WDT reached_VBD a_DT maximum_JJ one_CD hour_NN after_IN intravenous_JJ injection_NN ._.
On_IN the_DT other_JJ hand_NN ,_, Luy_NNP and_CC Thormahlen_NNP [_NNP 1932_CD ]_NNP noticed_VBD no_DT change_NN in_IN the_DT blood_NN sugar_NN of_IN a_DT cow_NN given_VBN fluoric_JJ factory_NN dust_NN in_IN its_PRP$ food_NN ._.
In_IN vitro_NN ,_, fluorides_NNS are_VBP known_VBN to_TO inhibit_VB glycolysis_NN ._.
As_IN only_RB slight_JJ changes_NNS were_VBD found_VBN in_IN the_DT sugar_NN contents_NNS ,_, it_PRP appears_VBZ that_IN the_DT system_NN rapidly_RB adjusts_VBZ itself_PRP and_CC prevents_VBZ the_DT occurrence_NN of_IN hyper-glycemia_NN ._.
The_DT figures_NNS for_IN lactic_JJ acid_NN showed_VBD wide_JJ individual_JJ variations_NNS ,_, as_RB well_RB as_IN considerable_JJ fluctuations_NNS from_IN one_CD period_NN to_TO another_DT ._.
As_IN ,_, however_RB ,_, no_DT definite_JJ trend_NN was_VBD noticeable_JJ ,_, it_PRP is_VBZ not_RB surprising_JJ that_IN satistical_JJ analyses_NNS yielded_VBD significant_JJ conclusion_NN either_RB in_IN the_DT case_NN of_IN the_DT calves_NNS or_CC the_DT hill_NN bulls_NNS ._.
The_DT only_JJ reference_NN on_IN record_NN is_VBZ that_IN of_IN Foit_NNP [_NNP 1931_CD ]_NNP ,_, who_WP found_VBD in_IN rabbits_NNS a_DT rise_NN in_IN blood_NN lactic_JJ acid_NN after_IN intravenous_JJ injections_NNS of_IN sodium_NN fluoride_NN ._.
Total_JJ protein_NN No_NNP significant_JJ difference_NN from_IN the_DT normal_JJ was_VBD found_VBN in_IN animals_NNS of_IN any_DT group_NN ._.
Creatinine_VB The_DT results_NNS regarding_VBG the_DT creatinine_NN content_NN of_IN blood_NN were_VBD rather_RB peculiar_JJ ._.
In_IN calves_NNS ,_, the_DT values_NNS showed_VBD an_DT increase_NN immediately_RB after_IN fluorine_JJ feeding_NN was_VBD started_VBN ._.
The_DT values_NNS ,_, however_RB ,_, remained_VBD more_RBR or_CC less_RBR unchanged_JJ at_IN this_DT high_JJ level_NN all_DT through_IN the_DT experimental_JJ period_NN ._.
In_IN the_DT case_NN of_IN most_JJS of_IN the_DT adults_NNS no_DT such_JJ change_NN was_VBD observed_VBN ,_, except_IN for_IN the_DT high_JJ phosphorus_NN group_NN ._.
In_IN these_DT animals_NNS statistically_RB significant_JJ decrease_NN in_IN blood_NN creatin-_JJ ine_NN was_VBD seen_VBN from_IN the_DT sixth_JJ month_NN onward_NN ._.
Chlorides_NNS ._.
In_IN calves_NNS ,_, the_DT chloride_NN content_NN of_IN blood_NN was_VBD found_VBN to_TO show_VB a_DT significant_JJ increase_NN from_IN the_DT fourth_JJ month_NN ._.
This_DT upward_JJ trend_NN was_VBD maintained_VBN but_CC for_IN an_DT inexplicable_JJ drop_NN in_IN the_DT eighth_JJ month_NN ._.
In_IN adults_NNS ,_, no_DT variations_NNS could_MD be_VB noticed_VBN ,_, but_CC ,_, as_IN estimations_NNS were_VBD started_VBN after_IN the_DT animals_NNS were_VBD on_IN experiment_NN for_IN four_CD months_NNS ,_, it_PRP is_VBZ difficult_JJ to_TO say_VB whether_IN a_DT rise_NN similar_JJ to_TO those_DT seen_VBN in_IN calves_NNS had_VBD taken_VBN place_NN ._.
It_PRP must_MD ,_, however_RB ,_, be_VB mentioned_VBN that_IN all_PDT the_DT values_NNS for_IN creatinine_NN and_CC chlorides_NNS were_VBD within_IN the_DT normal_JJ range_NN [_NNP Dukes_NNP ,_, 1943_CD ]_NN ._.
The_DT trend_NN towards_VBZ higher_JJR values_NNS indicates_VBZ abnormal_JJ excretion_NN due_JJ to_TO renal_JJ oysfunction_NN ._.
In_IN the_DT present_JJ case_NN the_DT increase_NN in_IN values_NNS was_VBD very_RB slight_JJ ,_, and_CC impairment_NN of_IN function_NN ,_, therefore_RB ,_, was_VBD not_RB pronounced_VBN ._.
Pathological_JJ changes_NNS in_IN the_DT kidney_NN have_VBP been_VBN found_VBN in_IN fluorosis_NN [_NNP Kick_NNP ,_, Bethke_NNP and_CC Edgington_NNP ,_, 1933_CD ,_, Marconi_NNP ,_, 1930_CD ,_, Slagsvold_NNP ,_, 1934_CD ]_NN ._.
Calcium_NN and_CC phosphorus_NN Neither_NNP in_IN the_DT calves_NNS nor_CC in_IN the_DT adults_NNS was_VBD any_DT significant_JJ difference_NN noticed_VBN in_IN blood_NN calcium_NN ._.
In_IN the_DT adults_NNS ,_, the_DT same_JJ was_VBD true_JJ for_IN blood_NN inorganic_JJ phosphorus_NN ._.
These_DT results_NNS support_VBD our_PRP$ earlier_JJR observations_NNS [_VBP Majumdar_NNP ,_, Ray_NNP and_CC Sen_NNP ,_, 1943_CD ]_NN ._.
In_IN the_DT calves_NNS ,_, however_RB ,_, as_RB soon_RB as_IN they_PRP took_VBD to_TO fluorotic_JJ diet_NN ,_, blood_NN inorganic_JJ phosphorus_NN began_VBD to_TO fall_VB rather_RB sharply_RB at_IN first_JJ and_CC gradually_RB later_RB until_IN the_DT second_JJ month_NN ._.
Thereafter_RB ,_, it_PRP started_VBD to_TO rise_VB again_RB and_CC got_VBD stabilized_VBN to_TO a_DT slightly_RB lower_JJR value_NN than_IN the_DT initial_JJ and_CC was_VBD within_IN the_DT normal_JJ limits_NNS found_VBN by_IN Mullick_NNP and_CC Pal_NNP [_NNP 1943_CD ]_NNP ._.
In_IN acute_JJ fluorine_NN intoxication_NN ,_, produced_VBN by_IN intravenous_JJ injection_NN of_IN large_JJ quantities_NNS of_IN fluoride_NN salts_NNS ,_, a_DT considerable_JJ reduction_NN of_IN calcium_NN content_NN of_IN blood_NN was_VBD seen_VBN in_IN dogs_NNS [_JJ Gers-_NNP chmann_NN ,_, 1930_CD ;_: Pavlovic_NNP and_CC Bogdanovic_NNP ,_, 1932_CD ]_NN and_CC in_IN rabbits_NNS [_NNP Jodlvauer_NNP ,_, 1931_CD ;_: Foid_NNP ,_, 1931_CD ]_NN ,_, Gerschmann_NNP [_NNP 1930_CD ]_NNP found_VBD an_DT increase_NN in_IN the_DT inorganic_JJ phosphorus_NN of_IN the_DT experimental_JJ animals_NNS ,_, whereas_NNS Pavlovic_NNP and_CC Bogdanovic_NNP [_NNP 1932_CD ]_NNP observed_VBD a_DT definite_JJ reduction_NN ._.
In_IN chronic_JJ in-_JJ toxication_NN ,_, however_RB ,_, the_DT differences_NNS recorded_VBN by_IN these_DT workers_NNS were_VBD less_JJR pronounced_JJ ._.
Hauck_NNP ,_, Steenbock_NNP and_CC Parsons_NNP [_NNP 1933_CD ]_NNP and_CC Chaimeles_NNP [_NNP 1930_CD ]_NNP found_VBD no_DT definite_JJ changes_NNS in_IN the_DT serum_JJ calcium_NN of_IN the_DT rat_NN ,_, even_RB on_IN prolonged_JJ feeding_NN ,_, Phillips_NNP [_NNP 1932_CD ]_NNP found_VBD a_DT tendency_NN towards_IN a_DT fall_NN in_IN serum_JJ calcium_NN in_IN heifers_NNS ,_, and_CC Bogdanovic_NNP [_NNP 1935_CD ]_NNP found_VBD an_DT increase_NN in_IN the_DT serum_NN calcium_NN in_IN dogs_NNS fed_VBP small_JJ quantities_NNS of_IN fluorine_NN ._.
The_DT recorded_JJ observations_NNS in_IN the_DT change_NN 120_CD Fluorine_NNP Intoxication_NNP of_IN Cattle_NNP in_IN India_NNP of_IN blood_NN inorganic_JJ phosphorus_NN are_VBP likewise_RB not_RB uniform_JJ ._.
Thus_RB ,_, in_IN some_DT observations_NNS the_DT phosphorus_NN value_NN shows_VBZ a_DT tendency_NN to_TO rise_VB [_NNP Phillips_NNP ,_, 1932_CD in_IN heifers_NNS ]_VBP ,_, in_IN others.to_JJ decline_NN [_NN Pavlovic_NNP :_: and_CC Bogdanovic_NNP ,_, 1932_CD in_IN dogs_NNS ]_NNP ,_, and_CC in_IN few_JJ others_NNS to_TO remain_VB unaffected_JJ [_NNP Hauck_NNP et_FW al_NN ,_, 1933_CD in_IN rats_NNS ;_: Lny_NNP and_CC Thormahlen_NNP ,_, 1932_CD in_IN cattle_JJ ]_NN ._.
It_PRP should_MD ,_, however_RB ,_, be_VB stressed_VBN that_IN the_DT fluctuations_NNS in_IN either_DT serum_JJ calcium_NN or_CC phosphorus_NN reported_VBN by_IN various_JJ workers_NNS are_VBP ,_, very_RB slight_JJ and_CC it_PRP is_VBZ doubtful_JJ whether_IN such_JJ changes_NNS are_VBP significant_JJ ._.
In_IN Part_NNP I_PRP of_IN this_DT series_NN [_NNP Majum-_NNP dar_NN et_NN al_NN ._.
1943_CD ]_NN ,_, it_PRP has_VBZ been_VBN shown_VBN that_IN no_DT changes_NNS in_IN serum_NN calcium_NN and_CC phosphorus_NN could_MD be_VB recorded_VBN in_IN the_DT field_NN cases_NNS of_IN fluorosis_NN ._.
The_DT changes_NNS in_IN phosphorus_NN content_NN in_IN the_DT blood_NN of_IN calves_NNS are_VBP interesting_JJ ,_, as_IN it_PRP brings_VBZ to_TO light_VB some_DT influence_NN of_IN fluorine_NN on_IN phosphorus_NN metabolism_NN in_IN growing_VBG animals_NNS ,_, but_CC as_IN all_PDT the_DT figures_NNS were_VBD well_RB within_IN the_DT normal_JJ range_NN of_IN values_NNS given_VBN for_IN blood_NN phosphorus_NN ,_, such_JJ changes_NNS can_MD not_RB be_VB considered_VBN to_TO indicate_VB aphosphorosis_NN ._.
Phosphatase_NNP Like_IN haemoglobin_NN and_CC red_JJ cells_NNS ,_, the_DT phosphatase_NN value_NN of_IN serum_NN was_VBD found_VBN to_TO be_VB great-_JJ ly_NN affected_VBN by_IN fluorine_JJ feeding_NN ._.
In_IN both_DT adult_NN and_CC young_JJ animals_NNS ,_, the_DT values_NNS at_IN the_DT end_NN of_IN the_DT experimental_JJ period_NN were_VBD greatly_RB diminished_VBN ._.
In_IN calves_NNS ,_, however_RB ,_, the_DT trend_NN was_VBD not_RB uniform_JJ ;_: at_IN first_JJ it_PRP showed_VBD a_DT sharp_JJ rise_NN but_CC after_IN a_DT month_NN started_VBD to_TO decline_VB and_CC the_DT final_JJ value_NN fell_VBD significantly_RB lower_JJR than_IN the_DT initial_JJ figures_NNS ._.
Phillips_NNS [_VBP 1932_CD ]_NNP observed_VBD ,_, a_DT simi-_JJ lar_JJ rise_NN in_IN phosphatase_NN content_NN in_IN heifers_NNS on_IN feeding_VBG fluorine_NN ,_, but_CC as_IN his_PRP$ experiments_NNS were_VBD not_RB continued_VBN for_IN long_RB ,_, the_DT decline_NN observed_VBN in_IN the_DT present_JJ experiments_NNS was_VBD not_RB recorded_VBN ._.
It_PRP was_VBD interesting_VBG to_TO observe_VB in_IN adult_NN animals_NNS that_WDT aluminium_VBP supplements_NNS helped_VBD to_TO delay_VB the_DT decline_NN in_IN serum_JJ phosphatase_NN ,_, and_CC the_DT final_JJ value_NN was_VBD also_RB not_RB significantly_RB lower_JJR than_IN the_DT initial_JJ figures_NNS ._.
High_JJ serum_NN phosphatase_NN is_VBZ a_DT manifestation_NN of_IN rapid_JJ growth_NN of_IN bones_NNS ._.
The_DT increased_VBN initial_JJ phosphatase_NN concentration_NN ,_, therefore_RB ,_, points_NNS to_TO growth-promoting_JJ activity_NN of_IN fluorine_JJ compounds_NNS on_IN bony_NN tissues_NNS ._.
The_DT formation_NN of_IN extensive_JJ deposits_NNS on_IN the_DT long_JJ bones_NNS support_NN this_DT theory_NN ._.
In_IN course_NN of_IN time_NN ,_, due_JJ to_TO the_DT poisonous_JJ effects_NNS of_IN fluorites_NNS ,_, the_DT osteoblasts_NNS are_VBP degenerated_VBN ,_, resulting_VBG thereby_RB in_IN a_DT diminished_JJ bone_NN formation_NN which_WDT is_VBZ reflected_VBN in_IN the_DT lowering_NN of_IN phosphatase_NN content_NN in_IN the_DT serum_NN ._.
Histological_JJ examination_NN of_IN bony_NN materials_NNS also_RB supports_VBZ this_DT hypothesis_NN ,_, as_IN extensive_JJ degeneration_NN of_IN osteoblasts_NNS has_VBZ been_VBN found_VBN to_TO occur_VB in_IN fluorosis_NN [_NN Pande_NNP ,_, 1944_CD ]_NN ._.
SUMMARY_VB A_DT severe_JJ anaemia_NN with_IN low_JJ red_JJ cell_NN count_NN and_CC haemoglobin_NN was_VBD produced_VBN in_IN animals_NNS suffering_VBG from_IN chronic_JJ fluorine_NN intoxication_NN ._.
Serum_NNP calcium_NN and_CC blood_NN inorganic_JJ phosphorus_NN in_IN adult_NN animals_NNS were_VBD not_RB affected_VBN by_IN fluorine_JJ feeding_NN ._.
In_IN growing_VBG animals_NNS ,_, the_DT blood_NN phosphorus_NN showed_VBD an_DT initial_JJ fall_NN and_CC then_RB remained_VBD more_RBR or_CC less_RBR steady_JJ during_IN an_DT experimental_JJ period_NN of_IN one_CD year_NN ._.
Serum_NNP phosphatase_NN content_NN was_VBD greatly_RB diminished_VBN in_IN fluorosis_NN ,_, and_CC the_DT significance_NN of_IN this_DT is_VBZ discussed_VBN ._.
Fluorine_JJ ingestion_NN at_IN the_DT level_NN of_IN 3_CD mg._NNS per_IN kg_NN ._.
body-weight_NN seemed_VBD to_TO have_VB little_JJ effect_NN on_IN the_DT concentration_NN of_IN the_DT other_JJ constitutents_NNS examined_VBN ._.
A._JJ trend_NN towards_NNS increased_VBD value_NN in_IN the_DT case_NN of_IN chlorides_NNS and_CC creatinine_NN was_VBD observed_VBN ;_: but_CC the_DT final_JJ values_NNS all_DT lay_VBP within_IN the_DT normal_JJ ranges_NNS found_VBN for_IN cattle_NNS ._.

ABSTRACT_NNP ._.
Sheep_JJ Breedings_NNS ._.
Australian_JJ Agricultural_NNP News_NNP ;_: letter_NN ,_, Release_NNP No_NNP ._.
AGN/114_NNP ,_, January_NNP ,_, 1946_CD ._.
AT_IN the_DT Werribee_NNP (_( Victoria_NNP Field_NNP Station_NNP of_IN the_DT Australian_JJ Council_NNP for_IN Scientific_NNP and_CC Industrial_NNP Research_NNP a_DT comprehensive_JJ experiment_NN has_VBZ been_VBN conducted_VBN for_IN 3½_CD years_NNS to_TO determine_VB the_DT effect_NN of_IN seasonal_JJ availability_NN of_IN green_JJ feed_NN on_IN the_DT periodicity_NN and_CC incidence_NN of_IN oestrus_NN (_( heat_NN )_) in_IN Merino_NNP ewes_NN ._.
There_EX were_VBD six_CD groups_NNS ._.
One_CD was_VBD grazed_VBN continuously_RB on_IN natural_JJ pasture_NN ,_, and_CC another_DT continuously_RB on_IN irrigated_JJ pasture_NN ._.
The_DT other_JJ four_CD groups_NNS had_VBD access_NN to_TO green_VB feed_NN in_IN the_DT form_NN of_IN irrigated_JJ pasture_NN for_IN periods_NNS of_IN three_CD months_NNS ,_, each_DT at_IN four_CD different_JJ periods_NNS of_IN the_DT year_NN ._.
One_CD group_NN had_VBD the_DT pasture_NN during_IN December-February_NNP ,_, one_CD for_IN March-May_NNP ,_, another_DT for_IN June_NNP August_NNP and_CC the_DT fourth_JJ for_IN September-November_NNP ._.
For_IN the_DT remaining_VBG nine_CD months_NNS each_DT group_NN was_VBD maintained_VBN on_IN dry_JJ conserved_VBN fodder_NN ._.
In_IN all_DT groups_NNS the_DT highest_JJS occurrence_NN of_IN oestrus_NN was_VBD observed_VBN in_IN those_DT months_NNS of_IN the_DT years_NNS ,_, January-June_NNP ,_, which_WDT have_VBP been_VBN shown_VBN by_IN earlier_JJR experiments_NNS to_TO be_VB the_DT normal_JJ breeding_NN season_NN following_VBG access_NN to_TO green_VB feed_JJ irrespective_NN of_IN the_DT time_NN of_IN the_DT year_NN when_WRB such_JJ feed_NN become_VBN avail-_JJ able_JJ ._.
The_DT fundamental_JJ seasonal_JJ rhythm_NN of_IN sexual_JJ activity_NN was_VBD not_RB affected_VBN ._.
Observations_NNS also_RB showed_VBD the_DT importance_NN of_IN adequate_JJ nutrition_NN at_IN the_DT weaner_NN stage_NN in_IN accelerating_VBG the_DT devolopment_NN of_IN sexual_JJ maturity_NN and_CC in_IN increasing_VBG the_DT intensity_NN of_IN sexual_JJ activity_NN of_IN the_DT mature_NN sheep_NN ._.
NOTES_NNS ._.
A_DT MEASURE_NN FOR_IN THE_NNP FERTILITY_NNP OF_NNP SPERM_NNP Skandinavisk_NNP Veterinartidskrift_NNP ,_, Uppsala_NNP ,_, 1942_CD THE_NNP usual_JJ measures_NNS employed_VBN in_IN estimating_VBG the_DT concentration_NN and_CC the_DT motility_NN of_IN spermatozoa_NN often_RB have_VBP resulted_VBN in_IN misleading_JJ conclusions_NNS ,_, because_IN ,_, while_IN it_PRP is_VBZ fairly_RB easy_JJ to_TO use_VB a_DT counting_NN chamber_NN to_TO determine_VB concentration_NN ,_, it_PRP is_VBZ very_RB difficult_JJ to_TO make_VB an_DT accurate_JJ estimate_NN of_IN the_DT number_NN of_IN cells_NNS that_WDT are_VBP truly_RB motile_JJ ._.
Recent_JJ investigations_NNS indicate_VBP that_IN the_DT energy_NN needed_VBN by_IN the_DT spermatozoa_NN for_IN movement_NN is_VBZ derived_VBN chiefly_NN from_IN the_DT process_NN of_IN anaerobic_JJ metabolism_NN ,_, and_CC that_IN the_DT intensity_NN of_IN this_DT metabolism_NN can_MD be_VB measured_VBN by_IN the_DT dehydrogenization_NN power_NN of_IN the_DT cells_NNS ._.
Most_JJS cells_NNS derive_VBP the_DT greater_JJR part_NN of_IN their_PRP$ energy_NN through_IN aerobic_JJ metabolism_NN ._.
Because_IN anaerobic_JJ metabolism_NN consists_VBZ of_IN hydrolysis_NN of_IN glucose_NN into_IN lactic_JJ acid_NN ,_, which_WDT undergoes_VBZ further_RBR anaerobic_JJ cleavage_NN it_PRP does_VBZ not_RB result_VB in_IN the_DT production_NN of_IN carbon_NN dioxide_NN and_CC water_NN but_CC the_DT oxidation_NN takes_VBZ place_NN through_IN liberation_NN of_IN hydrogen_NN ._.
The_DT rate_NN of_IN anaerobic_JJ metabolism_NN can_MD not_RB be_VB measured_VBN by_IN the_DT usual_JJ gasometric_JJ methods_NNS ,_, but_CC can_MD be_VB computed_VBN from_IN the_DT 'acceptor_NN method_NN '_'' which_WDT uses_VBZ a_DT dye_NN that_WDT is_VBZ highly_RB colored_VBN when_WRB oxidized_VBN ,_, while_IN possessing_VBG little_JJ or_CC no_DT color_NN when_WRB reduced_VBD or_CC hydrogenized_VBN to_TO the_DT so-called_JJ leuco-form_NN ._.
The_DT decoloration_NN time_NN of_IN methylene_NN blue_NN affords_NNS an_DT excellent_JJ indicator_NN of_IN the_DT dehydrogeni-_JJ zation_NN power_NN of_IN the_DT sperm_NN ._.
A_DT highly_RB fertile_JJ semen_NNS with_IN an_DT abundance_NN of_IN motile_NN spermatozoa_NN will_MD decolorize_VB more_RBR rapidly_RB than_IN semen_NNS of_IN poorer_JJR quality_NN ._.
Dr_NNP Ed_NNP ._.
Soren_NNP sen_NN developed_VBD a_DT test_NN using_VBG special_JJ glassware_NN and_CC a_DT gelation_NN dilution_NN fluid_NN ,_, and_CC by_IN placing_VBG the_DT semen_NNS under_IN test_NN in_IN a_DT water_NN bath_IN the_DT decoloration_NN time_NN gave_VBD him_PRP an_DT accurate_JJ estimate_NN of_IN its_PRP$ fertility_NN ._.
A_DT really_RB fertile_JJ semen_NNS containing_VBG about_IN one_CD million_CD spermatozoa_NN per_IN c._NN c_NN ,_, of_IN which_WDT 50_CD to_TO 60_CD per_IN cent_NN are_VBP actively_RB motile_JJ ,_, will_MD decolorize_VB his_PRP$ test_NN material_NN in_IN ten_JJ minutes_NNS ._.
A_DT semen_JJ con_NN ._.
taining_VBG 700,000_CD to_TO 800,000_CD sperm_NN cells_NNS ,_, or_CC which_WDT has_VBZ a_DT smaller_JJR percentage_NN of_IN active_JJ sperm_NN ,_, will_MD decolorize_VB in_IN fifteen_JJ to_TO twenty_VB minutes_NNS ._.
A_DT slightly_RB fertile_JJ semen_NNS with_IN a_DT low_JJ concentration_NN of_IN spermatozoa_JJ and/or_JJ many_JJ dead_JJ cells_NNS will_MD decolorize_VB in_IN twenty-five_JJ to_TO thirty_VB minutes_NNS ,_, while_IN any_DT sample_NN that_WDT requires_VBZ more_JJR than_IN thirty_NN minutes_NNS to_TO accomplish_VB complete_JJ decoloration_NN is_VBZ con-_JJ sidered_JJ unfertile_NN ._.
FOURTH_NNP INTERNATIONAL_NNP CONGRESS_NNP FOR_NNP MICROBIOLOGY_NNP ._.
NEWS_NNP has_VBZ been_VBN received_VBN at_IN the_DT office_NN of_IN the_DT Indian_JJ National_NNP Committee_NNP of_IN the_DT Inter_NNP ._.
national_JJ Association_NNP of_IN Microbiologists_NNPS that_IN the_DT Fourth_NNP International_NNP Congress_NNP for_IN Micro-_NNP biology_NN will_MD be_VB held_VBN at_IN Copenhagen_NNP ,_, Denmark_NNP ,_, from_IN July_NNP 20-25_CD ,_, 1947_CD ._.
The_DT business_NN of_IN the_DT Congrees_NNP will_MD be_VB conducted_VBN through_IN 9_CD sections_NNS ._.
The_DT office_NN of_IN the_DT Fourth_NNP International_NNP Con-_NNP gress_NN is_VBZ located_VBN at_IN Kommunehospitalet_NNP ,_, Copenhagen_NNP ,_, Denmark_NNP ._.
The_DT office_NN of_IN the_DT Honorary_NNP Secretary_NNP ,_, Indian_NNP National_NNP Committee_NNP (_( Dr._NNP A._NNP C._NNP Ukil_NNP )_) ,_, is_VBZ located_VBN at_IN the_DT All_NNP India_NNP Institute_NNP of_IN Hygiene_NNP and_CC Public_NNP Health_NNP ,_, 110_CD ,_, Chittaranjan_NNP Avenue_NNP ,_, Calcutta_NNP ,_, from_IN whom_WP further_JJ informa-_JJ tion_NN on_IN the_DT subject_NN can_MD be_VB obtained_VBN ._.
For_IN the_DT information_NN of_IN those_DT who_WP will_MD contribute_VB Papers_NNS ,_, it_PRP is_VBZ stated_VBN that_IN a_DT summary_JJ not_RB exceeding_VBG 200_CD words_NNS should_MD be_VB in_IN the_DT hands_NNS of_IN The_DT General_NNP Secretary_NNP of_IN the_DT Congrese_NNP at_IN Copenhagen_NNP not_RB later_RB than_IN the_DT 1st_CD January_NNP ,_, 1947_CD ._.
ORIGINAL_NNP ARTICLES_NNP MORTALITY_NNP IN_NNP YOUNG_NNP CALVES_NNP IN_NNP INDIA_NNP By_IN F._NNP C._NNP MINETT_NNP ,_, Imperial_NNP Veterinary_NNP Research_NNP Institute_NNP ,_, Mukteswar-Kumaun_NNP (_( Received_VBN for_IN publication_NN on_IN 15_CD March_NNP 1946_CD )_) (_( With_IN four_CD text-figures_NNS )_) THERE_NNP does_VBZ not_RB exist_VB any_DT large-scale_JJ ,_, precise_JJ estimate_NN of_IN mortality_NN among_IN young_JJ cattle_NNS stock_NN in_IN India_NNP ._.
There_EX are_VBP vague_JJ suggestions_NNS that_IN the_DT mortality_NN is_VBZ much_RB higher_JJR than_IN it_PRP ought_MD to_TO be_VB ,_, and_CC no_DT doubt_NN there_EX could_MD be_VB found_VBN here_RB and_CC there_JJ collections_NNS of_IN ngures_NNS or_CC statements_NNS which_WDT would_MD fai_VB f_VB the_DT local_JJ situation_NN ._.
It_PRP would_MD be_VB of_IN great_JJ value_NN to_TO amass_VB and_CC analyse_VB comprehensive_JJ are_VBP ata_VBN in_IN this_DT connection_NN ,_, for_IN one_CD thing_NN because_IN it_PRP would_MD focus_VB public_JJ attention_NN on_IN a_DT pro-_NN b_NN which_WDT strikes_VBZ at_IN the_DT very_RB root_NN of_IN the_DT livestock_NN industry_NN ._.
An_DT example_NN of_IN the_DT sort_NN of_IN survey_NN re-_NN quired_VBD is_VBZ that_IN recently_RB published_VBN by_IN Lovell_NNP and_CC Bradford_NNP Hill_NNP [_NNP 1940_CD ]_NN on_IN calf_NN mortality_NN in_IN Great_NNP Britain_NNP ._.
Their_PRP$ results_NNS will_MD be_VB referred_VBN to_TO again_RB but_CC at_IN the_DT moment_NN it_PRP is_VBZ enough_JJ to_TO say_VB their_PRP$ data_NNS ,_, extended_VBN over_IN two_CD years_NNS ,_, 1936_CD and_CC 1937_CD ,_, dealt_VBD with_IN 382_CD herds_NNS and_CC nearly_RB 28,000_CD births_NNS ._.
The_DT present_JJ contribution_NN ,_, which_WDT concerns_VBZ two_CD Military_JJ Farms_NNS at_IN Secunderabad_NNP and_CC Lahore_NNP (_( Airfield_NNP )_) ,_, is-but_JJ a_DT small_JJ beginning_NN ._.
The_DT enquiry_NN should_MD be_VB greatly_RB extended_VBN when_WRB circumstances_NNS permit_VBP ;_: such_JJ extension_NN has_VBZ not_RB been_VBN possible_JJ in_IN war-time_JJ ,_, apart_RB from_IN which_WDT it_PRP must_MD be_VB emphasized_VBN that_IN there_EX is_VBZ only_RB one_CD way_NN to_TO get_VB satisfactory_JJ data_NNS and_CC that_DT is_VBZ by_IN personal_JJ visit_NN and_CC enquiry_NN ._.
Since_IN weather_NN conditions_NNS might_MD not_RB be_VB without_IN influence_NN ,_, it_PRP was_VBD resolved_VBN to_TO examine_VB the_DT mortality-rates_NNS at_IN two_CD centres_NNS ,_, one_CD in_IN the_DT north_NN and_CC the_DT other_JJ in_IN the_DT south_NN ._.
Information_NN ,_, covering_VBG approximately_RB the_DT same_JJ period_NN ,_, was_VBD accordingly_RB obtained_VBN from_IN Military_JJ Farms_NNS at_IN Lahore_NNP (_( Punjab_NNP )_) and_CC Secunderabad_NNP (_( Deccan_NNP )_) ._.
At_IN both_DT places_NNS the_DT animal_JJ management_NN is_VBZ good_JJ ,_, but_CC at_IN Secunderabad_NNP there_EX has_VBZ been_VBN a_DT shortage_NN of_IN green_JJ feed_NN ._.
As_IN will_MD be_VB seen_VBN ,_, however_RB ,_, the_DT climatic_JJ and_CC farm_JJ conditions_NNS at_IN the_DT two_CD places_NNS are_VBP quite_RB different_JJ ._.
The_DT following_JJ information_NN was_VBD provided_VBN by_IN the_DT India_NNP Meteorological_NNP Department_NNP :_: Station_NNP Period_NNP Data_NNP Begumpet_NNP (_( 4_CD miles_NNS from_IN Secunderabad_NNP )_) 1938-44_JJ Mean_NNP daily_JJ maximum_NN and_CC minimum_JJ temperatures_NNS ._.

SECUNDERABAD_NNP The_DT farm_NN is_VBZ one_CD of_IN 480_CD acres_NNS ,_, situated_VBD about_IN five_CD miles_NNS from_IN Secunderabad_NNP city_NN at_IN an_DT altitude_NN of_IN 2,000_CD ft_NN ._.
The_DT cows_NNS are_VBP Friesian-Sindhi_NNP ,_, the_DT cow_NN stock_NN numbering_VBG about_RB 200_CD from_IN 1938_CD to_TO 1941_CD and_CC about_IN 240_CD since_IN 1941_CD ._.
Average_JJ numbers_NNS of_IN other_JJ cattle_JJ stock_NN between_IN 1938-1944_JJ are_VBP :_: calves_NNS up_IN to_TO one_CD year_NN 63_CD ,_, between_IN one_CD and_CC two_CD years_NNS 56_CD ,_, over_IN two_CD years_NNS 56_CD ._.
The_DT size_NN of_IN the_DT buffalo_NN herd_NN has_VBZ been_VBN increasing_VBG since_IN 1941_CD ,_, the_DT yearly_JJ stock_NN figures_NNS from_IN 1939_CD being_VBG 280_CD ,_, 318_CD ,_, 280_CD ,_, 407_CD ,_, 505_CD ,_, and_CC (_( in_IN 1944_CD )_) 1,325_CD ._.
The_DT land_NN is_VBZ poor_JJ and_CC unirrigated_JJ ._.
The_DT nature_NN of_IN the_DT soil_NN and_CC the_DT low_JJ rainfall_NN preclude_VBP the_DT abundant_JJ growth_NN of_IN fodder_NN grasses_NNS ,_, so_IN that_IN there_EX are_VBP only_RB three_CD or_CC four_CD acres_NNS of_IN fodder_NN grasses_NNS ._.
Silage_NN was_VBD fed_VBN up_RP to_TO 1943_CD ._.
Green_JJ grass_NN is_VBZ cut_VBN during_IN the_DT monsoon_NN when_WRB about_IN two_CD feet_NNS high_JJ and_CC fed_VBN at_IN 10-15_JJ pounds_NNS '_POS daily_NN to_TO the_DT milking_NN cows_NNS ._.
After_IN cutting_VBG ,_, the_DT pasture_NN is_VBZ also_RB grazed_VBN to_TO some_DT extent_NN ._.
No_DT green_JJ stuff_NN is_VBZ provided_VBN for_IN the_DT dry_JJ cows_NNS or_CC the_DT buffaloes_NNS ._.
The_DT cows_NNS are_VBP tied_VBN in_IN the_DT shed_JJ and_CC bedded_VBD 123_CD B_NNP 124_CD Mortality_NNP in_IN Young_NNP Calves_NNPS in_IN India_NNP down_RB if_IN the_DT rain_NN happens_VBZ to_TO be_VB heavy_JJ during_IN the_DT monsoon_NN ._.
Buffaloes_NNP stay_VB out_RB in_IN paddocks_NNS ._.
There_EX is_VBZ one_CD cement_NN wallow_NN on_IN the_DT farm_NN for_IN the_DT buffaloes_NNS ,_, and_CC through_IN this_DT they_PRP are_VBP passed_VBN once_RB daily_JJ throughout_IN the_DT year_NN in_IN lots_NNS of_IN 150_CD every_DT 10_CD minutes_NNS ,_, at_IN 8_CD a.m._NN for_IN the_DT milking_NN herd_NN and_CC at_IN 1-30_JJ p.m._NN for_IN the_DT dry_JJ herd_NN ._.
After_IN wallowing_VBG ,_, the-buffaloes_NNS are_VBP taken_VBN to_TO a_DT water_NN trough_IN where_WRB their_PRP$ udders_NNS are_VBP washed_VBN ,_, and_CC then_RB to_TO the_DT milking_NN shed_VBD ._.
Milking_NN is_VBZ at_IN midnight_NN and_CC 10_CD a.m._NN ,_, heavy_JJ milkers_NNS are_VBP also_RB milked_VBN at_IN 5_CD p.m._NN Of_IN the_DT cow_NN herd_NN ,_, some_DT 33_CD to_TO 35_CD per_IN cent_NN are_VBP dry_VBN at_IN one_CD time_NN ._.
Calf_NNP husbandry_NN ._.
The_DT chief_NN calving_VBG season_NN for_IN cows_NNS is_VBZ September-December_NNP and_CC for_IN buffaloes_NNS July-September_NNP ._.
As_IN a_DT rule_NN ,_, female_NN calves_NNS only_RB are_VBP kept_VBN ,_, the_DT males_NNS being_VBG slaughtered_JJ weekly_RB ;_: with_IN buffaloes_NNS ,_, undersized_JJ females_NNS or_CC females_NNS from_IN low_JJ yielders_NNS (_( below_IN 3,500-4,000_CD lb_NN ._.
per_IN annum_NN )_) are_VBP also_RB not_RB kept_VB ._.
The_DT mean_JJ weight_NN at_IN birth_NN is_VBZ 59_CD lb_NN ._.
for_IN cow_NN calves_NNS and_CC 62_CD lb_NN ._.
for_IN buffaloes_NNS ._.
Calves_NNS are_VBP weaned_VBN at_IN birth_NN and_CC fed_NN from_IN a_DT bucket_NN with_IN colostrum_NN of_IN the_DT dam_NN which_WDT is_VBZ milked_VBN f_JJ our_PRP$ thrice_JJ daily_RB during_IN the_DT first_JJ three_CD days_NNS ._.
Colostrum_NNP is_VBZ fed_VBN at_IN 1._CD lb_NN ._.
per_IN 10_CD lb_NN ._.
body_NN weight_VBD fte_JJ colostral_JJ period_NN the_DT calves_NNS are_VBP put_VBN on_IN a_DT definite_JJ ration_NN schedule_NN ,_, which_WDT is_VBZ not_RB given_VBN in_IN detail_NN here_RB which_WDT involves_VBZ the_DT usual_JJ replacement_NN of_IN whole_JJ milk_NN by_IN skim_NN and_CC concentrates_NNS (_( gram_NN ,_, wheat_NN bran_NN ._.

death-rate_NN ._.
Relative_JJ humidity_NN ._.
There_EX is_VBZ some_DT direct_JJ relationship_NN with_IN death-rate_NN ._.

Rainfall_NN ._.

Wind_NNP velocity_NN ._.
There_EX is_VBZ a_DT tendency_NN for_IN the_DT relationship_NN to_TO be_VB inverse_JJ ,_, The_DT wind_NN velocity_NN ,_, how-_JJ ever_RB ,_, is_VBZ fairly_RB uniform_JJ throughout_IN the_DT year_NN ,_, at_IN 1.1_CD to_TO 3.1_CD miles_NNS per_IN hour_NN ._.
The_DT death-rate_NN is_VBZ low_JJ from_IN March-August_NNP when_WRB the_DT velocity_NN varies_NNS from_IN 2.0-3.1_JJ m.p.h._NN ,_, and_CC high_JJ in_IN September-February_NNP (_( except_IN November_NNP )_) when_WRB the_DT wind_NN velocity_NN is_VBZ 1.1-2.4_JJ m.p.h_NN ._.

From_IN December-April_NNP the_DT prevailing_NN wind_NN is_VBZ from_IN the_DT NE_NNP and_CC NW_NNP ,_, in_IN June-_NNP September_NNP from_IN the_DT SE_NNP ._.

The_DT first_JJ question_NN that_WDT may_MD be_VB put_VBN is_VBZ what_WP should_MD be_VB considered_VBN a_DT '_'' normal_JJ death-rate_NN in_IN cow_NN calves_NNS ._.
Lovell_NNP and_CC Bradford_NNP Hill_NNP [_NNP 1940_CD ]_NNP ,_, in_IN the_DT article_NN mentioned_VBD above_IN ,_, state_NN that_IN in_IN 335_CD milk-recorded_JJ and_CC thus_RB somewhat_RB selected_JJ herds_NNS in_IN England_NNP and_CC Wales_NNP out_IN of_IN 12,544_CD female_JJ calves_NNS born_VBN alive_JJ ,_, 693_CD (_( 5.5_CD per_IN cent_NN )_) died_VBD before_IN the_DT age_NN of_IN six_CD months_NNS ._.
If_IN calves_NNS of_IN both_DT sexes_NNS are_VBP included_VBN ,_, and_CC still-births_NNS or_CC abortions_NNS added_VBN ._.
then_RB of_IN 27.970_CD pregnancies_NNS 14.9_CD per_IN cent_NN failed_VBD to_TO produce_VB a_DT calf_NN surviving_VBG to_TO the_DT age_NN of_IN six_CD months_NNS ._.

158_CD (_( 11.4_CD per_IN cent_NN )_) out_IN of_IN 1,383_CD females_NNS born_VBN ._.
This_DT figure_NN is_VBZ not_RB as_RB high_JJ as_IN that_DT given_VBN by_IN Jordan_NNP [_NNP 193,3_CD ]_NN in_IN another_DT enquiry_NN in_IN Ayrshire_NNP (_( Scotland_NNP )_) ,_, who_WP found_VBD that_IN of_IN 78,4_CD females_NNS born_VBN ,_, 169_CD (_( 21.6_CD per_IN cent_NN )_) died_VBD ._.
The_DT death-rates_NNS of_IN calves_NNS born_VBN in_IN the_DT spring_NN of_IN two_CD consecutive_JJ years_NNS were_VBD 24_CD and_CC 27_CD per_IN cent_NN compared_VBN with_IN only_RB 8_CD per_IN cent_NN for_IN calves_NNS born_VBN in_IN the_DT autumn_NN ,_, the_DT difference_NN being_VBG ributed_VBN by_IN Jordan_NNP to_TO the_DT extra_JJ green_JJ food_NN consumed_VBN by_IN the_DT pregnant_JJ cows_NNS during_IN the_DT summer_NN ._.
In_IN the_DT observations_NNS of_IN Lovell_NNP and_CC Bradford_NNP Hill_NNP ,_, the_DT mortality_NN in_IN calves_NNS born_VBP alive_JJ showed_VBD a_DT seasonal_JJ swing_NN ,_, being_VBG significantly_RB higher_RBR in_IN the_DT first_JJ half_NN than_IN in_IN the_DT second_JJ half_NN of_IN the_DT year_NN ._.
There_EX is_VBZ an_DT advantage_NN in_IN allowing_VBG calves_NNS to_TO take_VB the_DT colostrum_NN naturally_RB from_IN the_DT mother_NN compared_VBN with_IN feeding_VBG it_PRP from_IN the_DT bucket_NN ._.
In_IN the_DT females_NNS ,_, nearly_RB half_PDT the_DT deaths_NNS took_VBD place_NN in_IN the_DT first_JJ week_NN of_IN life_NN and_CC three-quarters_NNS of_IN them_PRP in_IN the_DT first_JJ month_NN ,_, and_CC the_DT probable_JJ cause_NN of_IN death_NN in_IN most_JJS cases_NNS was_VBD '_'' white_JJ scours_NNS '_POS ._.
The_DT following_JJ figures_NNS from_IN the_DT United_NNP States_NNPS ,_, referring_VBG to_TO calves_NNS of_IN both_DT ,_, sexes_NNS ,_, may_MD be_VB noted_VBN ._.
Wing_VBG [_JJ 1933_CD ]_JJ gives_VBZ figures_NNS relating_VBG to_TO forty_VB years_NNS '_POS (_( 1889_CD to_TO 1928_CD )_) working_VBG in_IN the_DT University_NNP herd_NN at_IN Cornell_NNP ._.
Of_IN 644_CD conceptions_NNS during_IN this_DT period_NN ,_, there_EX were_VBD 120_CD (_( 18.6_CD per_IN cent_NN )_) which_WDT died_VBD at_IN or_CC before_IN birth_NN ,_, and_CC 61_CD (_( 9.5_CD per_IN cent_NN )_) which_WDT died_VBD within-three_JJ months_NNS ._.
Slack_NN and_CC Harrison_NNP [_NNP quoted_VBN by_IN Savage_NNP and_CC McCay_NNP ,_, 1942_CD ]_NN add_NN figures_NNS for_IN the_DT Cornell_NNP herd_NN for_IN the_DT years_NNS ,_, 1932-42_JJ ._.
From_IN 1,352_CD conceptions_NNS ,_, there_EX were_VBD 169_CD (_( 12.5_CD per_IN cent_NN )_) which_WDT died_VBD at_IN or_CC before_IN birth_NN ,_, and_CC 144_CD (_( 10.7_CD per_IN cent,136_NN Mortality_NNP in_IN Young_NNP Calves_NNPS in_IN India_NNP no_DT sign_NN of_IN vitamin-A_JJ deficiency_NN in_IN the_DT cow_NN calves_NNS such_JJ as_IN night_NN blindness_NN had_VBD been_VBN noticed_VBN ,_, but_CC such_JJ signs_NNS might_MD easily_RB have_VB been_VBN overlooked_VBN without_IN a_DT special_JJ examination_NN ._.
Although_IN the_DT buffalo_NN dry_JJ stock_NN also_RB get_VB no_DT green_JJ fodder_NN ,_, deaths_NNS in_IN the_DT buffalo_NN calves_NNS were_VBD mostly_RB due_JJ to_TO other_JJ causes_NNS than_IN pneumonia_NN ._.
The_DT most_RBS likely_JJ explanation_NN of_IN the_DT difference_NN is_VBZ that_IN buffaloes_NNS are_VBP ._.

In_IN the_DT same_JJ connection_NN ,_, it_PRP may_MD be_VB observed_VBN that_DT at_IN the_DT Military_JJ Farm_NN at_IN Quetta_NNP ,_, where_WRB no_DT green_JJ fodder_NN at_IN all_DT was_VBD grown_VBN ,_, blindness_NN in_IN cow_NN calves_NNS was_VBD at_IN one_CD time_NN common_JJ whereas_IN the_DT buffalo_NN calves_NNS were_VBD unaffected_JJ ._.
Seasonal_JJ effects_NNS ._.
The_DT mortality_NN rates_NNS at_IN the_DT two_CD centres_NNS have_VBP a_DT definite_JJ seasonal_JJ swing_NN ,_, being_VBG higher_RBR in_IN the_DT winter_NN ,_, both_DT in_IN the_DT gross_JJ and_CC in_IN the_DT special_JJ case_NN of_IN pneumonia_NN at_IN Secunderabad_NNP ._.
Although_IN certain_JJ relationships_NNS have_VBP been_VBN established_VBN between_IN seasonal_JJ mortality_NN rates_NNS and_CC weather_NN factors_NNS ,_, it_PRP does_VBZ not_RB of_IN course_NN follow_VBP that_IN these_DT factors_NNS contribute_VBP directly_RB to_TO the_DT deaths_NNS ._.
Any_DT direct_JJ influence_NN in_IN fact_NN seems_VBZ to_TO be_VB unlikely_JJ ,_, except_IN just_RB possibly_RB in_IN the_DT case_NN of_IN the_DT minimum_JJ air_NN temperature_NN at_IN Air-_NNP field_NN ,_, though_RB even_RB here_RB there_EX was_VBD not_RB undue_JJ exposure_NN ._.
It_PRP might_MD be_VB thought_VBN that_IN ,_, since_IN the_DT number_NN of_IN calves_NNS born_VBN in_IN the_DT winter_NN is_VBZ relatively_RB greater_JJR than_IN the_DT number_NN born_VBN in_IN the_DT summer_NN ,_, the_DT higher_JJR winter_NN death-rate_NN is_VBZ simply_RB due_JJ to_TO crowding_VBG ._.
This_DT ,_, however_RB ,_, does_VBZ not_RB seem_VB to_TO be_VB the_DT case_NN ._.
since_IN examination_NN of_IN the_DT total_JJ births_NNS and_CC deaths_NNS for_IN the_DT period_NN October_NNP to_TO March_NNP of_IN different_JJ years_NNS shows_VBZ no_DT significant_JJ association_NN between_IN the_DT numbers_NNS of_IN births_NNS and_CC deaths_NNS ._.
With_IN buffalo-calves_NNS ,_, this_DT relationship_NN between_IN births_NNS and_CC deaths_NNS could_MD not_RB be_VB studied_VBN because_IN of_IN the_DT animals_NNS born_VBP so_RB few_JJ are_VBP retained_VBN ._.
This_DT is_VBZ not_RB the_DT place_NN to_TO attempt_VB a_DT full_JJ discussion_NN of_IN the_DT difficult_JJ subject_NN of_IN seasonal_JJ variation_NN of_IN disease_NN ._.
A_DT few_JJ points_NNS were_VBD briefly_RB referred_VBN to_TO in_IN a_DT former_JJ paper_NN on_IN the_DT incidence_NN of_IN equine_JJ strangles_NNS [_VBP Minett_NNP ,_, 1944_CD ]_NN ,_, and_CC an_DT interesting_JJ recent_JJ discussion_NN of_IN the_DT subject_NN as_IN a_DT whole_NN is_VBZ given_VBN by_IN Aycock_NNP and_CC others_NNS [_VBP 1945_CD ]_NN ._.

unless_IN it_PRP is_VBZ shown_VBN that_IN the_DT changes_NNS in_IN question_NN occur_NN with_IN regular_JJ sequence_NN in_IN the_DT same_JJ direction_NN at_IN corresponding_VBG periods_NNS of_IN successive_JJ years_NNS ._.
Unfortunately_RB ,_, my_PRP$ figures_NNS for_IN annual_JJ deaths_NNS are_VBP too_RB small_JJ for_IN statistical_JJ examination_NN in_IN the_DT sense_NN of_IN Wilson_NNP 's_POS definition_NN ,_, but_CC the_DT combined_JJ figures_NNS for_IN the_DT period_NN do_VBP show_VB significantly_RB higher_JJR death-rates_NNS in_IN winter_NN ._.
The_DT most_RBS likely_JJ explanation_NN is_VBZ a_DT greater_JJR susceptibility_NN of_IN the_DT calves_NNS in_IN winter_NN ,_, which_WDT may_MD arise_VB through_IN dietary_JJ causes_NNS or_CC through_IN lowered_VBN activity_NN of_IN the_DT tissues_NNS physiological_VBP in_IN origin_NN (_( '_'' fluctuating_VBG immunity_NN '_'' of_IN non-specific_JJ kind_NN )_) ._.

In_IN amplification_NN of_IN this_DT ,_, the_DT following_JJ references_NNS may_MD be_VB quoted_VBN ._.
Brown_NNP and_CC others_NNS [_VBP Brown_NNP ,_, 1929_CD ]_NN have_VBP shown_VBN that_IN the_DT body_NN undergoes_JJ seasonal_JJ variations_NNS in_IN its_PRP$ physical_JJ and_CC chemical_JJ constitution_NN ,_, which_WDT are_VBP related_VBN to_TO (_( a_DT )_) variations_NNS in_IN functional_JJ activity_NN ,_, rendered_VBN necessary_JJ by_IN a_DT changing_VBG environment_NN ,_, and_CC (_( b_NN )_) suscepti-_NN bility_NN to_TO disease_VB ,_, infectious_JJ or_CC otherwise_RB ._.
An_DT example_NN of_IN (_( a_DT )_) is_VBZ that_IN the_DT weights_NNS of_IN the_DT endocrine_NN organs_NNS are_VBP at_IN an_DT overall_JJ maximum_NN in_IN summer_NN ._.

Reduction_NN of_IN calf_NN mortality_NN ._.

Savage_NN and_CC McCay_NNP [_NNP 1942_CD ]_NNP refer_NN to_TO some_DT observations_NNS by_IN Harrison_NNP in_IN the_DT Cornell_NNP University_NNP herd_NN ._.

the_DT stability_NN of_IN the_DT dye_NN ,_, had_VBD been_VBN ignored_VBN hitherto_NN ._.

nil_JJ nil_JJ nil_NN nil_NN nil_JJ D_NNP 2_CD 142_CD Colouring_NN of_IN Vanaspati_NNP Ghee_NNP CONCLUSION_NNP A_NNP careful_JJ examination_NN of_IN the_DT results_NNS has_VBZ brought_VBN forth_RP the_DT interesting_JJ results_NNS that_IN there_EX is_VBZ not_RB a_DT single_JJ dye_NN (_( harmless_NN or_CC otherwise_RB )_) that_WDT can_MD not_RB be_VB removed_VBN from_IN ghee_NN by_IN simple_JJ treatments_NNS which_WDT require_VBP no_DT elaborate_JJ knowledge_NN of_IN chemistry_NN ._.
Activated_JJ charcoal_NN for_IN instance_NN can_MD bleach_VB all_PDT the_DT dyes_NNS ,_, simpler_NN still_RB ,_, light_JJ can_MD remove_VB practically_RB the_DT entire_JJ quantity_NN of_IN natural_JJ dye_NN ._.
It_PRP is_VBZ ,_, therefore_RB ,_, clear_JJ that_IN we_PRP are_VBP up_RP against_IN practically_RB an_DT unsurmountable_JJ difficulty_NN in_IN the_DT problem_NN of_IN clouring_VBG artificial_JJ ghee_NN ._.
There_EX is_VBZ no_DT doubt_NN that_IN every_DT organic_JJ chemist_NN will_MD endorse_VB the_DT view_NN that_IN it_PRP would_MD be_VB impossible_JJ to_TO find_VB a_DT dye_NN that_WDT would_MD be_VB absolutely_RB stable_JJ in_IN fat_JJ solution_NN ._.
The_DT bleaching_NN of_IN even_RB fast_JJ c_NN lours_NNS in_IN sunlight_NN is_VBZ well_RB known_VBN and_CC every_DT one_NN must_MD have_VB noticed_VBN the_DT fading_VBG away_RB of_IN beautiful_JJ colours_NNS on_IN garments_NNS which_WDT owed_VBD their_PRP$ attractiveness_NN to_TO the_DT pleasing_VBG combination_NN of_IN colours_NNS ._.
The_DT Government_NNP must_MD ,_, therefore_RB ,_, drop_NN this_DT legislation_NN as_IN will_MD never_RB be_VB the_DT faintest_JJS hope_NN of_IN finding_VBG any_DT dye_NN that_WDT would_MD be_VB fast_RB enough_RB to_TO last_JJ any_DT length_NN of_IN time_NN under_IN normal_JJ conditions_NNS of_IN exposure_NN even_RB if_IN it_PRP is_VBZ not_RB subjected_VBN to_TO simple_VB treatments_NNS that_WDT would_MD remove_VB them_PRP entirely_RB ._.
In_IN view_NN of_IN these_DT results_NNS research_NN on_IN the_DT physiological_JJ effect_NN of_IN any_DT one_CD of_IN these_DT dyes_NNS would_MD be_VB utterly_JJ useless_NN for_IN the_DT purpose_NN in_IN hand_NN ._.
In_IN fact_NN any_DT new_JJ dye_NN not_RB listed_VBN in_IN here_RB ,_, and_CC which_WDT might_MD be_VB suggested_VBN as_IN possible_JJ colouring_NN for_IN artificial_JJ ghee_NN ,_, should_MD be_VB tested_VBN first_RB for_IN stability_NN before_IN its_PRP$ claims_NNS for_IN harmlessness_NN are_VBP gone_VBN into_IN ._.
By_IN the_DT very_JJ nature_NN of_IN things_NNS all_DT possible_JJ dyes_NNS must_MD be_VB of_IN organic_JJ origin_NN and_CC without_IN knowledge_NN of_IN the_DT general_JJ properties_NNS of_IN such_JJ dyes_NNS it_PRP would_MD be_VB futile_JJ to_TO consider_VB any_DT new_JJ dye_NN unless_IN the_DT advocates_NNS are_VBP prepared_VBN to_TO bring_VB forth_JJ proof_NN of_IN their_PRP$ stability_NN on_IN lines_NNS detailed_VBN in_IN the_DT present_JJ investigation_NN ._.
It_PRP is_VBZ not_RB merely_RB a_DT question_NN of_IN the_DT stability_NN of_IN a_DT dye_NN ,_, we_PRP have_VBP also_RB to_TO consider_VB the_DT possibility_NN of_IN the_DT decomposition_NN of_IN an_DT organic_JJ dye_NN on_IN heating_NN and_CC the_DT production_NN of_IN harmful_JJ bye-products_NNS ._.
Arti-_JJ ficial_JJ ghee_NN has_VBZ come_VBN to_TO be_VB regarded_VBN as_IN a_DT valuable_JJ article_NN of_IN food_NN ._.
In_IN any_DT case_NN there_EX is_VBZ not_RB enough_JJ natural_JJ ghee_NN in_IN the_DT country_NN to_TO supply_VB the_DT demand_NN of_IN even_RB 10_CD per_IN cent_NN of_IN the_DT population_NN ._.

APPENDIX_NNP I_PRP Experimental_NNP details_NNS of_IN the_DT preparation_NN of_IN various_JJ natural_JJ dyes_NNS 1_CD ._.
Ratanjot_NNP ,_, Onosma_NNP echioides_VBZ Linn_NNP ._.
This_DT substance_NN has_VBZ been_VBN used_VBN as_IN a_DT substitute_NN for_IN alkanet_NN as_IN it_PRP imparts_VBZ a_DT rich_JJ red_JJ colour_NN to_TO oils_NNS and_CC fats_NNS ,_, and_CC for_IN this_DT reason_NN it_PRP is_VBZ most_RBS suited_JJ as_IN also_RB due_JJ to_TO its_PRP$ harmless_JJ nature_NN ._.
Preparation_NN of_IN the_DT dye_NN Method_NNP I_PRP ._.
One_CD hundred_CD grams_NNS of_IN root_NN bark_NN is_VBZ well_RB extracted_VBN in_IN amyl_JJ alcohol_NN ._.
The_DT amyl_NN alcohol_NN solution_NN is_VBZ concentrated_VBN under_IN vacuum_NN (_( Maximum_JJ temperature_NN 110°C_CD ._. )_) ._.
The_DT thick_JJ mass_NN is_VBZ dissolved_VBN in_IN alcohol_NN and_CC filtered_VBD ,_, concentrated_VBN under_IN vacuum_NN and_CC last_JJ traces_NNS of_IN amyl_JJ alcohol_NN removed_VBN by_IN boiling_VBG with_IN water_NN ._.
Crude_NNP dye_NN recovered=6_NN gm_NN ._.
Method_NNP II_NNP ._.
One_CD hundred_CD grams_NNS of_IN root_NN bark_NN is_VBZ extracted_VBN with_IN acetone_NN by_IN refluxing_VBG for_IN three_CD hours_NNS ._.
The_DT acetone_NN is_VBZ distilled_VBN and_CC the_DT dye_NN extracted_VBN by_IN alcohol_NN ._.
The_DT alcohol_NN is_VBZ distilled_VBN ._.
Crude_NNP dye_NN recovered=9_NN gm_NN ._.
Purification_NN of_IN the_DT dye_NN The_DT dye_NN is_VBZ precipitated_VBN as_IN copper_NN salt_NN by_IN adding_VBG copper_NN sulphate_NN in_IN boiling_VBG condition_NN ._.
The_DT copper_NN salt_NN of_IN the_DT dye_NN is_VBZ slightly_RB soluble_JJ in_IN alcohol_NN ,_, so_IN dilution_NN of_IN the_DT alcoholic_JJ solution_NN of_IN the_DT dye_NN after_IN adding_VBG copper_NN sulphate_NN ,_, but_CC before_IN heating_NN ,_, facilitates_VBZ the_DT precipitation_NN of_IN the_DT dye_NN salt_NN ._.
The_DT pre-_NN cipitated_VBD copper_NN salt_NN is_VBZ filtered_VBN and_CC washed_VBN with_IN water_NN ._.

[_JJ NLS_NNP note_NN :_: a_DT graphic_JJ appears_VBZ here_RB -_: see_VBP image_NN of_IN page_NN ]_NNP Method_NNP of_IN preparation_NN Two_CD hundred_VBD grams_NNS of_IN turmeric_JJ powder_NN is_VBZ well_RB boiled_VBN with_IN 70_CD per_IN cent_NN alcohol_NN for_IN two_CD hours_NNS ._.

of_IN lead_JJ acetate_NN ._.

of_IN 92_CD per_IN cent_NN alcohol_NN ._.

THE_DT VARIATIONS_NNP IN_NNP THE_NNP CONSTANTS_NNP OF_NNP GHEE_NNP Of_IN the_DT many_JJ causes_NNS that_WDT are_VBP responsible_JJ for_IN variations_NNS in_IN ghee_NN ,_, the_DT most_RBS important_JJ will_MD be_VB briefly_NN mentioned_VBN ._.

``_`` While_IN the_DT idiosyncrasies_NNS of_IN western_JJ breeds_NNS of_IN animals_NNS ,_, such_JJ as_IN the_DT well-_JJ known_JJ peculiarity_NN of_IN cows_NNS of_IN the_DT Channel_NNP Isles_NNP of_IN excluding_VBG colouring_VBG matters_NNS to_TO a_DT smaller_JJR extent_NN from_IN entering_VBG their_PRP$ milk_NN fat_NN ,_, are_VBP widely_RB realized_VBN ,_, Indian_JJ breeds_NNS of_IN animals_NNS have_VBP not_RB received_VBN much_JJ attention_NN ._.

Agricultural_JJ Chemist_NNP and_CC JIWAN_NNP DAS_NNP CHOPRA_NNP ,_, Assistant_NNP Agricultural_NNP Chemist_NNP ,_, Punjab_NNP Agricultural_NNP College_NNP ,_, Lyallpur_NNP (_( Received_VBN for_IN publication_NN on_IN 26_CD October_NNP 1945_CD )_) AS_IN regards_NNS cow_VBP 's_POS milk_NN the_DT observations_NNS of_IN Banerjee_NNP and_CC Kothavalla_NNP [_NNP 1940_CD ]_NN are_VBP that_IN the_DT carotene_NN and_CC vitamin-A_JJ contents_NNS of_IN butter_NN fat_JJ decrease_NN slightly_RB on_IN feeding_VBG oilcakes_NNS and_CC increase_VB with_IN food_NN rich_NNS in_IN carbohydrates_NNS and_CC with_IN green_JJ grass_NN ._.
Seshan_NNP and_CC Sen_NNP [_NNP 1942_CD ]_NNP have_VBP shown_VBN that_IN the_DT in-_NN creased_VBD carotene_NN in_IN feed_NN is_VBZ followed_VBN by_IN increased_VBN carotene_NN and_CC vitamin-A_JJ potency_NN of_IN cow_NN 's_POS milks_NNS whereas_VBP Dalip_NNP Singh_NNP and_CC Fateh_NNP Mohammad_NNP have_VBP observed_VBN that_IN vitamin-A_JJ value_NN of_IN cow_NN 's_POS milk_NN can_MD not_RB be_VB increased_VBN beyond_IN a_DT certain_JJ limit_NN ._.
The_DT average_JJ vitamin-A_JJ value_NN of_IN cow_NN 's_POS butter_NN was_VBD found_VBN 17.7_CD I.U_NNP ._.
per_IN gram_NN of_IN fat_NN and_CC for_IN ghee_JJ 14.1_CD I.U_NNP ._.
by_IN Majumdar_NNP [_NNP 1941_CD ]_NNP ._.
In_IN India_NNP the_DT buffalo_NN supplies_VBZ the_DT bulk_NN of_IN the_DT milk_NN and_CC milk_NN products_NNS and_CC is_VBZ the_DT main_JJ dairy_NN animal_NN of_IN the_DT country_NN ._.
Much_JJ information_NN about_IN the_DT vitamin-A_JJ content_NN of_IN buffalo_NN 's_POS milk_NN does_VBZ not_RB exist_VB ._.
The_DT results_NNS given_VBN in_IN this_DT paper_NN are_VBP the_DT outcome_NN of_IN the_DT work_NN conducted_VBN on_IN the_DT vitamin-A_JJ potency_NN of_IN the_DT milk_NN during_IN the_DT entire_JJ lactation_NN of_IN 12_CD buffaloes_NNS ._.
EXPERIMENTAL_NNP Twelve_NNP buffaloes_NNS of_IN Nili_NNP breed_NN were_VBD selected_VBN and_CC were_VBD divided_VBN into_IN three_CD groups_NNS ,_, A_NNP ,_, B_NNP and_CC C_NNP ,_, with_IN four_CD animals_NNS in_IN each_DT group_NN ._.

Records_NNS were_VBD kept_VBN of_IN (_( a_DT )_) the_DT live_JJ weight_NN and_CC food_NN intake_NN of_IN the_DT buffaloes_NNS ,_, (_( b_NN )_) the_DT yield_NN and_CC the_DT fat_JJ percentage_NN of_IN milk_NN and_CC (_( c_NN )_) the_DT nutritive_JJ value_NN of_IN milk_NN in_IN vitamin-A_JJ potency_NN ._.

METHODS_NNP OF_NNP ANALYSIS_NNP Vitamin-A_NNP ._.
Since_IN the_DT spectrographic_JJ equipment_NN was_VBD not_RB available_JJ ,_, the_DT vitamin-A_JJ determina_NN tions_NNS were_VBD based_VBN on_IN the_DT Carr_NNP and_CC Price_NNP antimony_NN trichloride_NN reaction_NN ._.
The_DT method_NN followed_VBD was_VBD of_IN Willsteadt_NNP and_CC With_IN ._.
To_TO 100_CD c.c_NN ._.
of_IN well-shaken_JJ milk_NN 1/10_CD of_IN its_PRP$ volume_NN of_IN 60_CD per_IN cent_NN potassium_NN hydroxide_JJ solution_NN was_VBD added_VBN ._.
The_DT flask_NN was_VBD filled_VBN with_IN nitrogen_NN ._.
stoppered_VBN and_CC vigorously_RB shaken_VBN and_CC kept_VBD aside_RB for_IN 48_CD hours_NNS with_IN occasional_JJ shaking_NN ._.
After_IN that_DT 20_CD c.c_NN ._.
alcohol_NN were_VBD added_VBN and_CC LAL_NNP CHAND_NNP DHARMANI_NNP AND_NNP JIWAN_NNP DAS_NNP CHOPRA_NNP 161_CD the_DT mixture_NN was_VBD extracted_VBN with_IN peroxide-free_JJ ether_NN three_CD times_NNS ._.
The_DT combined_JJ ether_NN extracts_NNS were_VBD first_RB washed_VBN twice_RB with_IN water_NN ,_, dried_VBN through_IN anhydrous_JJ sodium_NN sulphate_NN and_CC the_DT ether_NN evaporated_VBD in_IN an_DT atmosphere_NN of_IN nitrogen_NN ._.
The_DT residue_NN was_VBD taken_VBN up_RP in_IN chloroform_NN and_CC made_VBD to_TO a_DT suitable_JJ volume_NN for_IN colour_NN comparison_NN in_IN Lovibond_NNP Tintometer_NNP ._.
Carotene_NNP ._.
The_DT carotene_NN in_IN green_JJ fodders_NNS was_VBD estimated_VBN by_IN Ferguson_NNP and_CC Bishop_NNP 's_POS method_NN [_NN 1936_CD ]_NN ._.
The_DT finely_RB chopped_JJ material_NN was_VBD hydrolysed_VBN with_IN 20_CD per_IN cent_NN aqueous_JJ potash_NN and_CC the_DT caro-_JJ tene_NN and_CC xanthophyll_NN were_VBD extracted_VBN by_IN means_NNS of_IN ethyl_NN ether_NN ._.
From_IN this_DT solution_NN the_DT pigments_NNS were_VBD taken_VBN up_RP with_IN petroleum_NN ether_NN from_IN which_WDT the_DT xanthophyll_NN was_VBD washed_VBN out_RP with_IN methyl_JJ alcohol_NN ._.
The_DT carotene_NN was_VBD then_RB determined_VBN tintometerically_RB ._.
RESULTS_VB The_DT vitamin-A_JJ value_NN was_VBD determined_VBN once_RB a_DT week_NN in_IN a_DT composite_JJ sample_NN of_IN the_DT morning_NN and_CC evening_NN milk_NN ._.

of_IN milk_NN are_VBP shown_VBN in_IN Table_NNP IV_NNP ,_, while_IN Table_JJ V_NNP gives_VBZ the_DT percentage_NN of_IN fat_NN in_IN milk_NN ._.

3.5_CD 3.5_CD 5.0_CD 4.7_CD 4.0_CD 4.4_CD 4.7_CD 3.2_CD 4.4_CD 4.7_CD 3.7_CD 4.4_CD G_NNP 2_CD 166_CD A_NNP Study_NNP of_IN Vitamin-A_NNP in_IN Buffaloes_NNP '_POS Milk_NN throughout_IN a_DT Lactation_NNP The_DT average_JJ output_NN of_IN vitamin-A_NN in_IN milk_NN is_VBZ 4_CD to_TO 5_CD milligrams_NNS per_IN day_NN ._.

SUMMARY_VB A_DT full_JJ lactation_NN period_NN of_IN a_DT herd_NN of_IN 12_CD buffaloes_NNS in_IN their_PRP$ fourth_JJ lactation_NN is_VBZ described_VBN ._.
The_DT buffaloes_NNS were_VBD fed_VBN definite_JJ amounts_NNS of_IN fuzzy_NN ,_, delinted_JJ American_JJ cottonseed_NN and_CC Indian_JJ cottonseeds_NNS with_IN green_JJ fodder_NN ad_NN libitum_NN ._.
There_EX was_VBD no_DT difference_NN in_IN the_DT quality_NN and_CC the_DT quantity_NN of_IN milk_NN produced_VBN when_WRB the_DT buffaloes_NNS were_VBD fed_VBN with_IN the_DT three_CD different_JJ types_NNS of_IN cottonseeds_NNS ._.
There_EX was_VBD a_DT general_JJ ,_, though_IN by_IN no_DT means_NNS an_DT exact_JJ ,_, relationship_NN between_IN the_DT butter_NN fat_NN and_CC vitamin-A_JJ potency_NN of_IN the_DT milk_NN ._.
The_DT vitamin-A_JJ value_NN per_IN gram_NN of_IN butter_NN fat_NN in_IN the_DT buffalo_NN 's_POS milk_NN was_VBD 23_CD to_TO 27_CD in_IN Moore_NNP blue_JJ units_NNS ,_, which_WDT is_VBZ identical_JJ with_IN that_DT of_IN cow_NN 's_POS milk_NN ._.
Carotene_NNP was_VBD almost_RB absent_JJ in_IN the_DT buffalo_NN milk_NN ,_, but_CC the_DT milk_NN had_VBD a_DT higher_JJR vitamin-A_NN potency_NN than_IN cow_NN 's_POS milk_NN ._.
Increased_VBN carotene_NNS intake_VBP by_IN the_DT buffaloes_NNS was_VBD followed_VBN by_IN the_DT increased_VBN vitamin-A_JJ potency_NN of_IN milk_NN ._.
The_DT amount_NN of_IN vitamin-A_NN transmitted_VBN to_TO buffalo_VB 's_POS milk_NN was_VBD very_RB small_JJ as_IN compared_VBN with_IN the_DT intake_NN of_IN carotene_NN ,_, when_WRB green_JJ fodder_NN was_VBD fed_VBN ad_NN libitum_NN ._.

253_CD ,_, 133_CD THE_NNP CHEMICAL_NNP COMPOSITION_NNP OF_NNP COLOSTRUM_NNP BUTTERFAT_NNP By_IN C._NNP P._NNP ANANTAKRISHNAN_NNP and_CC ZAL_NNP R._NNP KOTHAVALLA_NNP ,_, Imperial_NNP Dairy_NNP Research_NNP Institute_NNP ,_, Bangalore_NNP (_( Received_VBN for_IN publication_NN on_IN 29_CD October_NNP 1945_CD )_) THE_DT first_JJ secretion_NN which_WDT can_MD be_VB drawn_VBN from_IN the_DT udder_NN immediately_RB after_IN parturition_NN (_( colostrum_NN )_) is_VBZ a_DT thick_JJ viscous_JJ liquid_NN differing_VBG greatly_RB in_IN composition_NN from_IN that_DT of_IN the_DT normal_JJ milk_NN obtained_VBN a_DT week_NN after_IN calving_VBG and_CC is_VBZ known_VBN to_TO have_VB an_DT important_JJ function_NN in_IN the_DT nutrition_NN of_IN the_DT newly_RB born_VBN offspring_NN ._.
This_DT has_VBZ been_VBN ascribed_VBN partly_RB to_TO the_DT antibodies_NNS supplied_VBD to_TO counteract_VB pathogenic_JJ bacteria_NNS in_IN the_DT intestinal_JJ tract_NN ,_, and_CC partly_RB to_TO the_DT vitamin-A_JJ potency_NN of_IN the_DT colostrum_NN ._.
Colostrum_NN is_VBZ generally_RB characterized_VBN by_IN a_DT higher_JJR proportion_NN of_IN globulin_NN and_CC albumin_NN ,_, a_DT higher_JJR percentage_NN of_IN ash_NN and_CC chloride_NN and_CC a_DT lower_JJR those_DT content_JJ ._.
Mostly_RB the_DT colostral_JJ period_NN varies_NNS from_IN four_CD to_TO six_CD days_NNS [_NNP Shah_NNP ,_, 1936_CD ;_: Sivasubran_NNP am_VBP and_CC Dover_NNP ,_, 1938_CD ]_NN ._.
Some_DT years_NNS ago_RB ,_, Drummond_NNP et_CC al_RB [_JJ 1921_CD ]_NN pointed_VBD out_RP that_IN cow_NN 's_POS colostrum_NN contained_VBD more_RBR vitamin-A_JJ than_IN the_DT normal_JJ milk_NN produced_VBN later_RB in_IN lactation_NN ._.
Dann_NNP [_NN 1933_CD ]_NNP studied_VBD the_DT vitamin-A_JJ content_NN of_IN colostrum_NN samples_NNS from_IN 14_CD milking_VBG Shorthorn_NNP cows_NNS ,_, using_VBG colori-_JJ metric_JJ methods_NNS ,_, and_CC for_IN the_DT richest_JJS samples_NNS biological_JJ tests_NNS also_RB ._.
He_PRP concluded_VBD that_IN the_DT vitamin-A_JJ concentration_NN in_IN colostrum_NN may_MD be_VB from_IN 10_CD to_TO 100_CD times_NNS greater_JJR than_IN in_IN later_JJ milk_NN from_IN the_DT same_JJ cow_JJ independent_JJ of_IN the_DT season_NN ._.
Semb_NNP et_CC al_RB [_JJ 1934_CD ]_NN using_VBG spectroscopic_JJ methods_NNS have_VBP stated_VBN that_IN the_DT high_JJ vitamin-A_JJ potency_NN of_IN the-colostral_JJ milk_NN persists_VBZ only_RB for_IN a_DT few_JJ days_NNS after_IN the_DT calf_NN is_VBZ born_VBN before_IN dropping_VBG to_TO the_DT normal_JJ value_NN ,_, a_DT fact_NN which_WDT is_VBZ confirmed_VBN by_IN Gillam_NNP et_CC al_RB [_JJ 1936_CD ]_NN and_CC Kunerth_NNP et_VBP al_NN [_NN 1935_CD ]_NN ._.
Henry_NNP et_CC al_RB [_JJ 1940_CD ]_NN concluded_VBD as_IN a_DT result_NN of_IN a_DT study_NN from_IN four_CD Shorthorn_NNP cows_NNS and_CC nine_CD heifers_NNS ,_, that_IN the_DT concentration_NN of_IN vitamin-A_NN in_IN the_DT first_JJ colostrum_NN ranged_VBN from_IN 8160_CD to_TO 820_CD Moore_NNP blue_JJ units_NNS per_IN 100_CD gm_NN ._.
and_CC that_DT of_IN carotene_NN from_IN 2026_CD to_TO 411_CD Moore_NNP yellow_JJ units_NNS per_IN 100_CD gm_NN ._.
Dann_NNP [_NN 1933_CD ]_NN and_CC Henry_NNP et_VBP al_NN [_NN 1940_CD ]_NN obtained_VBD higher_JJR values_NNS of_IN vitamin-A_NN in_IN colostrum_NN from_IN heifers_NNS than_IN that_DT from_IN cows_NNS ._.
But_CC ,_, Steward_NNP and_CC McCallum_NNP [_NNP 1938_CD ]_NNP working_VBG with_IN 100_CD animals_NNS reported_VBD that_IN the_DT colostrum_NN from_IN heifers_NNS did_VBD not_RB contain_VB more_JJR vitamin-A_NN than_IN that_DT from_IN cows_NNS ._.
They_PRP established_VBD that_IN the_DT wide_JJ range_NN in_IN values_NNS was_VBD not_RB due_JJ to_TO any_DT differences_NNS in_IN dietary_JJ ,_, breed_VBD or_CC date_NN of_IN calving_VBG in_IN animals_NNS kept_VBD under_IN the_DT same_JJ conditions_NNS of_IN management_NN ._.
It_PRP was_VBD also_RB suggested_VBN that_IN the_DT vitamin-A_JJ content_NN of_IN the_DT colostrum_NN might_MD be_VB greatly_RB affected_VBN by_IN the_DT length_NN of_IN non-lactating_JJ period_NN between_IN successive_JJ calvings_NNS ._.
It_PRP is_VBZ clear_JJ that_IN though_IN much_JJ work_NN has_VBZ been_VBN done_VBN abroad_RB ,_, no_DT examination_NN of_IN the_DT colostrum_NN from_IN indigenous_JJ breeds_NNS of_IN cattle_NNS appears_VBZ to_TO have_VB been_VBN made_VBN ._.
As_IN regards_NNS the_DT chemical_NN composition_NN of_IN colostrum_NN butterfat_NN Tchetcheroff_NNP [_NN 1931_CD ]_NN states_NNS that_IN the_DT colostral_JJ fat_NN shows_VBZ the_DT same_JJ characteristics_NNS as_IN milk_NN fat_NN but_CC generally_RB contains_VBZ more_RBR capryllic_JJ and_CC capric_JJ acids_NNS ._.
However_RB ,_, Kurochkin_NNP [_NNP 1927_CD ]_NNP reported_VBD that_IN the_DT R.M_NNP ._.
and_CC saponification_NN values_NNS of_IN the_DT colostral_JJ fat_NN collected_VBD 3.5_CD hours_NNS after_IN delivery_NN were_VBD lower_JJR than_IN those_DT samples_NNS collected_VBD 48_CD hours_NNS after_IN parturition_NN ._.
Engel_NNP et_CC al_NNS have_VBP also_RB recorded_VBN similar_JJ results_NNS ._.
It_PRP is_VBZ ,_, therefore_RB ,_, obvious_JJ from_IN the_DT above_NN that_IN the_DT change_NN or_CC the_DT transition_NN from_IN colostrum_NN to_TO milk_NN ,_, which_WDT takes_VBZ place_NN during_IN the_DT first_JJ few_JJ days_NNS after_IN calving_VBG ,_, is_VBZ a_DT gradual_JJ one_CD ._.
Though_IN this_DT change_NN in_IN composition_NN of_IN colostrum_NN has_VBZ been_VBN observed_VBN by_IN many_JJ workers_NNS abroad_RB ,_, no_DT work_NN appears_VBZ to_TO have_VB been_VBN done_VBN to_TO note_VB the_DT changes_NNS ,_, if_IN any_DT ,_, in_IN the_DT chemical_NN composition_NN of_IN colostral_JJ butterfat_NN of_IN indigenous_JJ breed_NN of_IN cattle_NNS ,_, and_CC it_PRP has_VBZ been_VBN thought_VBN desirable_JJ to_TO carry_VB out_RP some_DT investigation_NN along_IN this_DT line_NN ._.
Therefore_RB ,_, attempts_NNS have_VBP been_VBN made_VBN to_TO study_VB the_DT chemical_NN composition_NN ,_, carotene_NN and_CC vitamin-A_JJ content_NN of_IN colostral_JJ butterfat_NN from_IN Sindhi_NNP and_CC Gir_NNP cows_NNS under_IN the_DT usual_JJ feeding_NN conditions_NNS ._.
EXPERIMENTAL_NNP Colostrum_NNP and_CC milk_NN samples_NNS for_IN the_DT experiments_NNS were_VBD obtained_VBN from_IN five_CD Sindhi_NNP and_CC two_CD Gir_NNP cows_NNS of_IN the_DT Institute_NNP farm_NN fed_VBD the_DT regular_JJ dairy_NN herd_NN ration_NN ._.
Only_RB animals_VBZ No_DT ._.
426_CD and_CC 424_CD were_VBD in_IN the_DT first_JJ lactation_NN ._.
Seven_CD samples_NNS were_VBD collected_VBN from_IN each_DT cow_NN ._.
The_DT first_JJ sample_NN was_VBD taken_VBN a_DT few_JJ hours_NNS after_IN calving_VBG ,_, the_DT second_JJ at_IN the_DT following_VBG morning_NN milking_NN ,_, and_CC the_DT others_NNS at_IN the_DT succes-_JJ sive_JJ day_NN milkings_NNS ._.
Butter_NN was_VBD made_VBN separately_RB from_IN the_DT colostrum_NN and_CC milk_NN samples_NNS by_IN the_DT desi_NN method_NN without_IN the_DT addition_NN of_IN any_DT colouring_JJ matter_NN ._.
The_DT process_NN of_IN butter_NN making_NN adopted_VBN was_VBD the_DT same_JJ in_IN all_DT cases_NNS and_CC the_DT time_NN taken_VBN in_IN its_PRP$ preparation_NN was_VBD also_RB the_DT same_JJ ._.
It_PRP was_VBD always_RB found_VBN to_TO be_VB difficult_JJ to_TO separate_VB out_RP the_DT butter_NN from_IN the_DT first_JJ and_CC second_JJ day_NN 's_POS colostrum_NN samples_NNS ._.
As_IN 167_CD 168_CD The_DT Chemical_NNP Composition_NNP of_IN Colostrum_NNP Butterfat_NNP the_DT fat_JJ content_NN of_IN the_DT colostrum_NN varied_VBD erratically_RB from_IN day_NN to_TO day_NN and_CC since_IN it_PRP was_VBD not_RB proposed_VBN to_TO measure_VB the_DT total_JJ output_NN of_IN fat_JJ ,_, vitamin-A_JJ and_CC carotene_NN ,_, the_DT colostrum_NN was_VBD not_RB removed_VBN quanta-_JJ tively_RB ,_, the_DT results_NNS of_IN vitamin-A_JJ and_CC carotene_NN were_VBD expressed_VBN in_IN colour_JJ units_NNS per_IN gm_NN ._.
of_IN fat_NN ._.
Butter_NN samples_NNS were_VBD melted_VBN into_IN ghee_NN at_IN 116°C_CD ._.
and_CC were_VBD analysed_VBN for_IN their_PRP$ specific_JJ values_NNS ,_, namely_RB ,_, R.M._NNP ,_, Polenske_NNP ,_, Kirschner_NNP ,_, Iodine_NNP value_NN and_CC butyro_VB refractometer_JJR readings_NNS at_IN 40°C_CD ._.
by_IN the_DT standard_JJ procedure_NN cited_VBD before_IN ._.
