48_CD 26_CD 14_CD 9_CD 8_CD .._NN From_IN Table_JJ I_PRP it_PRP will_MD be_VB observed_VBN that_IN there_EX is_VBZ a_DT striking_JJ difference_NN in_IN the_DT composition_NN of_IN day-_JJ to-day_JJ colostral_JJ butterfat_NN ._.
The_DT saponification_NN number_NN of_IN the_DT butterfat_NN of_IN individual_JJ animals_NNS col-_JJ lected_VBN on_IN the_DT first_JJ day_NN after_IN parturition_NN varies_NNS from_IN 213.2_CD to_TO 221.3_CD ._.
This_DT value_NN increases_VBZ as_IN the_DT days_NNS advance_NN and_CC tend_NN to_TO become_VB normal_JJ after_IN the_DT fifth_JJ day_NN ._.
The_DT butyro_NN refractometer_NN reading_NN at_IN 40°C_CD ._.
decreases_NNS till_VBP the_DT fifth_JJ day_NN after_IN which_WDT it_PRP tends_VBZ to_TO become_VB normal_JJ ._.
The_DT R.M_NNP ._.
value_NN of_IN the_DT fat_JJ pro-_JJ gressively_JJ increases_NNS day_NN by_IN day_NN starting_VBG from_IN as_IN low_JJ figures_NNS as_IN 7.1_CD ,_, 7.8_CD and_CC 10.5_CD in_IN some_DT cases_NNS till_VBP it_PRP comes_VBZ to_TO the_DT maximum_NN during_IN the_DT fifth_JJ day_NN ,_, after_IN which_WDT it_PRP decreases_VBZ ,_, reaching_VBG a_DT fairly_RB constant_JJ figure_NN ._.
The_DT Polenske_NNP and_CC Kirschner_NNP values_NNS also_RB behave_VBP similarly_RB ._.
In_IN most_JJS of_IN the_DT samples_NNS there_EX is_VBZ a_DT tendency_NN for_IN the_DT iodine_NN value_NN to_TO decrease_VB progressively_RB till_IN the_DT fifth_JJ day_NN ._.
The_DT barium_NN values_NNS were_VBD taken_VBN for_IN the_DT samples_NNS having_VBG very_RB low_JJ R.M_NNP ._.
values_NNS on_IN the_DT first_JJ day_NN and_CC they_PRP were_VBD found_VBN to_TO be_VB highly_RB positive_JJ (_( +24.2_JJ and_CC +22.1_NNP )_) ;_: the_DT values_NNS were_VBD negative_JJ on_IN the_DT fifth_NN and_CC twelfth_JJ day_NN ._.
If_IN the_DT R.M_NNP ._.
and_CC saponification_NN values_NNS were_VBD taken_VBN into_IN consideration_NN for_IN judging_VBG the_DT purity_NN of_IN butterfat_NN the_DT samples_NNS collected_VBN on_IN the_DT first_JJ and_CC second_JJ day_NN after_IN parturition_NN could_MD be_VB mistaken_VBN as_IN adulterated_VBN ._.
No_DT appre-_JJ ciable_JJ difference_NN in_IN composition_NN is_VBZ observed_VBN between_IN the_DT colostral_JJ fats_NNS from_IN the_DT Sindhi_NNP and_CC Gir_NNP cows_NNS ._.
When_WRB the_DT concentration_NN of_IN vitamin-A_NN is_VBZ considered_VBN there_EX is_VBZ a_DT marked_JJ variation_NN from_IN cow_NN to_TO cow_VB in_IN the_DT highest_JJS value_NN recorded_VBN on_IN the_DT first_JJ day_NN 's_POS fat_NN ._.
There_EX is_VBZ a_DT rapid_JJ day-to-day_JJ lowering_NN in_IN the_DT vitamin-A_JJ value_NN of_IN the_DT colostral_JJ fat_NN from_IN individual_JJ animals_NNS and_CC this_DT process_NN seems_VBZ to_TO proceed_VB very_RB slowly_RB from_IN the_DT fifth_JJ day_NN onwards_NNS ._.
Some_DT of_IN the_DT samples_NNS were_VBD followed_VBN till_IN the_DT 30th_JJ day_NN and_CC it_PRP was_VBD found_VBN that_IN the_DT vitamin-A_NN was_VBD only_RB slightly_RB lowered_VBN as_IN compared_VBN to_TO the_DT initial_JJ days_NNS after_IN parturition_NN ._.
The_DT ratio_NN of_IN the_DT amount_NN of_IN vitamin-A_NN in_IN the_DT first_JJ day_NN 's_POS colostral_JJ fat_NN to_TO that_DT of_IN the_DT fifth_JJ day_NN sample_NN was_VBD found_VBN to_TO be_VB about_RB 5_CD ._.
This_DT confirms_VBZ the_DT findings_NNS of_IN Semb_NNP et_FW al_NN [_NN 1934_CD ]_NN who_WP observed_VBD the_DT value_NN to_TO be_VB ranging_VBG from_IN 5_CD to_TO 10_CD ._.
Apparently_RB ,_, first_JJ day_NN 's_POS colostral_JJ fat_NN of_IN heifers_NNS contains_NNS more_RBR vitamin-A_JJ than_IN that_DT of_IN cows_NNS ._.
This_DT is_VBZ probably_RB due_JJ to_TO the_DT heifer_NN having_VBG greater_JJR reserves_NNS of_IN vitamin-A_JJ ,_, be-_JJ cause_NN the_DT reserves_NNS have_VBP not_RB been_VBN depleted_VBN by_IN previous_JJ lactation_NN as_IN with_IN cows_NNS ._.
170_CD The_DT Chemical_NNP Composition_NNP of_IN Colostrum_NNP Butterfat_NNP The_DT carotene_NN content_NN of_IN butterfat_NN is_VBZ known_VBN to_TO change_VB with_IN the_DT type_NN of_IN feed_NN ,_, but_CC in_IN the_DT present_JJ experiment_NN the_DT feed_NN was_VBD the_DT same_JJ throughout_IN for_IN all_DT animals_NNS ._.
Here_RB too_RB ,_, there_EX is_VBZ a_DT good_JJ deal_NN of_IN in-_JJ dividual_JJ variation_NN and_CC the_DT concentration_NN decreases_VBZ rapidly_RB till_VB the_DT fifth_JJ day_NN ._.
No_DT marked_JJ variation_NN is_VBZ noticeable_JJ in_IN the_DT concentration_NN of_IN carotene_NN between_IN the_DT first_JJ day_NN 's_POS colostral_JJ fat_NN of_IN heifers_NNS and_CC cows_NNS ._.
Breed_NNP variations_NNS were_VBD also_RB not_RB appreciable_JJ ,_, but_CC these_DT results_NNS can_MD not_RB be_VB taken_VBN as_RB conclusive_JJ as_IN only_RB few_JJ animals_NNS were_VBD tested_VBN ._.
The_DT relative_JJ importance_NN of_IN colostrum_NN in_IN providing_VBG the_DT young_JJ of_IN the_DT species_NNS with_IN a_DT reserve_NN of_IN vitamin-A_NN is_VBZ quite_RB evident_JJ from_IN the_DT high_JJ concentration_NN of_IN this_DT vitamin_NN and_CC its_PRP$ precursor_NN found_VBN in_IN colostrum_NN ._.
SUMMARY_NNP 1_CD ._.
The_DT changes_NNS in_IN the_DT physical_JJ and_CC chemical_JJ composition_NN of_IN the_DT colostral_JJ butte_NN from_IN 7_CD cows_NNS were_VBD tested_VBN ._.
In_IN general_JJ the_DT R.M._NNP ,_, Polenske_NNP value_NN and_CC saponification_NN number_NN tend_VBP ise_NN as_IN days_NNS advance_IN whereas_IN the_DT iodine_NN value_NN and_CC refractometer_NN reading_VBG fall_NN gradually_RB ._.
2_CD ._.
The_DT colour_NN of_IN the_DT colostral_JJ butterfat_NN especially_RB in_IN the_DT first_JJ two_CD days_NNS after_IN parturition_NN was_VBD deep_JJ orange_NN ._.
3_CD ._.
Colostral_NNP fat_NN was_VBD about_RB five_CD to_TO six_CD ._.
times_NNS richer_VBP in_IN carotene_NN and_CC vitamin-A_JJ than_IN normal_JJ butterfat_NN ._.
4_CD ._.
Both_DT carotene_NN and_CC vitamin-A_NN decreased_VBD rapidly_RB during_IN the_DT first_JJ five_CD days_NNS ,_, after_IN which_WDT the_DT decrease_NN was_VBD relatively_RB slow_JJ ._.
5_CD ._.
The_DT amount_NN of_IN vitamin-A_NN in_IN the_DT colostral_JJ fat_NN from_IN heifers_NNS appeared_VBD to_TO be_VB higher_JJR than_IN that_DT in_IN the_DT colostral_JJ fat_NN of_IN cows_NNS ._.

Gras._NNP ,_, 23_CD ,_, 9198_CD VARIATIONS_NNP IN_NNP THE_NNP CHEMICAL_NNP CONSTANTS_NNP OF_IN THE_NNP BUTTERFAT_NNP OF_NNP FOUR_NNP BREEDS_NNP OF_NNP INDIAN_NNP CATTLE_NNP By_IN I._NNP P._NNP SINGH_NNP ,_, T._NNP M._NNP PAUL_NNP ,_, C._NNP P._NNP ANANTAKRISHNAN_NNP and_CC M._NNP C._NNP RANGASWAMY_NNP ,_, Imperial_NNP Dairy_NNP Research_NNP Institute_NNP ,_, Bangalore_NNP (_( Received_VBN for_IN publication_NN on_IN 5_CD November_NNP 1945_CD )_) VARIOUS_NNP factors_NNS cause_VBP variation_NN in_IN the_DT composition_NN of_IN butterfats_NNS [_VBP Hagland_NNP et_FW al._NN ,_, 1930_CD ;_: Kilde_NNP and_CC Winther_NNP ,_, 1930_CD ;_: Mpolomovsky_NNP and_CC Thomas_NNP ,_, 1933_CD ;_: Maynard_NNP et_FW al_NN ,_, 1936_CD ;_: Groh_NNP ,_, 1937_CD ]_NN ._.
The_DT effect_NN of_IN feed_NN is_VBZ an_DT established_JJ factI_NN ._.
P._NNP SINGH_NNP ,_, T._NNP M._NNP PAUL_NNP C._NNP P._NNP ANANTAKRISHNAN_NNP and_CC M._NNP C._NNP RANGASWAMY_NNP ,_, 171_CD constants_NNS ._.
No_DT data_NN seems_VBZ to_TO be_VB available_JJ regarding_VBG the_DT effect_NN of_IN the_DT stage_NN of_IN lactation_NN and_CC season_NN of_IN the_DT year_NN on_IN the_DT composition_NN of_IN butterfat_NN of_IN different_JJ breeds_NNS of_IN Indian_JJ cattle_NNS ._.
This_DT information_NN is_VBZ of_IN considerable_JJ importance_NN in_IN India_NNP particularly_RB in_IN view_NN of_IN the_DT fact_NN that_IN adulteration_NN of_IN ghee_NN is_VBZ a_DT very_RB common_JJ practice_NN and_CC that_DT ghee_NN has_VBZ to_TO be_VB judged_VBN by_IN the_DT analytical_JJ constants_NNS ._.
The_DT variation_NN of_IN the_DT analytical_JJ constants_NNS is_VBZ fairly_RB large_JJ and_CC for_IN a_DT proper_JJ interpretation_NN of_IN the_DT analytical_JJ results_NNS it_PRP is_VBZ necessary_JJ that_IN one_CD should_MD know_VB the_DT effects_NNS of_IN various_JJ factors_NNS on_IN the_DT constants_NNS of_IN the_DT butterfat_NN ._.
Therefore_RB ,_, the_DT present_JJ investigation_NN was_VBD undertaken_VBN to_TO study_VB the_DT variations_NNS in_IN the_DT constants_NNS of_IN the_DT butterfat_NN of_IN the_DT different_JJ breeds_NNS of_IN Indian_JJ cattle_NNS available_JJ at_IN this_DT Institute_NNP ._.
EXPERIMENTAL_NNP Three_CD animals_NNS each_DT of_IN almost_RB the_DT same_JJ age_NN ,_, body_NN weight_NN ,_, lactation_NN and_CC milk_NN yeild_NNS were_VBD selected_VBN from_IN the_DT Sindhi_NNP ,_, Gir_NNP ,_, Tharparkar_NNP and_CC Murrah_NNP breeds_NNS of_IN the_DT Imperial_NNP Dairy_NNP Research_NNP Institute_NNP herd_NN ._.
All_PDT the_DT animals_NNS were_VBD almost_RB in_IN the_DT same_JJ stage_NN of_IN lactation_NN ,_, i.e_NN ._.
within_IN two_CD and_CC three_CD weeks_NNS after_IN parturition_NN ._.
The_DT animals_NNS were_VBD fed_VBN the_DT usual_JJ ration_NN that_WDT is_VBZ given_VBN to_TO the_DT animals_NNS of_IN the_DT Institute_NNP herd_NN ._.
The_DT concentrated_JJ ration_NN consisted_VBD of_IN wheat_NN bran_NN ,_, groundnut_JJ cake_NN ,_, gram_NN and_CC gram_NN husk_NN mixed_VBN in_IN the_DT proportion_NN of_IN 4.0_CD :_: 2.5_CD :_: 1.5_CD :_: 2.0_CD ._.
This_DT mixture_NN was_VBD fed_VBN at_IN the_DT rate_NN of_IN one_CD pound_NN for_IN every_DT 2_CD lb_NN ._.
of_IN milk_NN yielded_VBN by_IN the_DT animals_NNS ._.
The_DT roughage_NN consisted_VBD of_IN a_DT mixture_NN 55_CD lb_NN ._.
of_IN Guinea_NNP and_CC Napier_NNP grasses_NNS and_CC 3_CD lb_NN ._.
of_IN ragi_JJ straw_NN for_IN cows_NNS and_CC 70_CD lb_NN ._.
of_IN green_JJ grass_NN mixture_NN and_CC 3_CD lb_NN ._.
of_IN ragi_JJ straw_NN for_IN buffaloes_NNS ._.
A_DT day_NN 's_POS milk_NN was_VBD collected_VBN from_IN each_DT animal_NN separately_RB once_RB a_DT week_NN ._.
The_DT cream_NN was_VBD separated_VBN for_IN butter_NN making_NN ._.
The_DT butter_NN was_VBD melted_VBN into_IN ghee_NN at_IN 115°C_CD ._.
and_CC filtered_VBN and_CC analysed_VBN for_IN R._NNP M._NNP ,_, (_( Reichert_NNP Meissl_NNP )_) ,_, iodine_JJ and_CC Polenske_NNP values_NNS and_CC B._NNP R._NNP (_( Butyro_NNP refractometer_NN )_) reading_NN ._.
This_DT was_VBD continued_VBN for_IN about_RB nine_CD months_NNS ,_, i.e_NN ._.
till_NN most_JJS of_IN the_DT animals_NNS went_VBD dry_JJ ._.
Tables_NNS I_PRP to_TO IV_NNP give_VB the_DT R._NNP M._NNP values_NNS ,_, Polenske_NNP values_VBZ ,_, iodine_VB values_NNS and_CC B._NNP R._NNP readings_VBZ respectively_RB ._.

P._NNP SINGH_NNP ,_, T._NNP M._NNP PAUL_NNP 173_CD TABLE_NNP II174_NNP Variations_NNP in_IN the_DT Chemical_NNP Constants_NNP of_IN the_DT Butterfat_NNP TABLE_NNP IIII_NNP ._.
P._NNP SINGH_NNP ,_, T._NNP M._NNP PAUL_NNP 175_CD TABLE_NNP IV176_NNP Variations_NNP in_IN the_DT Chemical_NNP Constants_NNP of_IN the_DT Butterfat_NNP from_IN Murrah_NNP buffaloes_NNS gave_VBD the_DT highest_JJS R._NNP M._NNP value_NN when_WRB compared_VBN to_TO the_DT butterfat_NN from_IN the_DT three_CD breeds_NNS of_IN cows_NNS studied_VBN ,_, and_CC among_IN the_DT cows_NNS ,_, Shindhi_NNP gave_VBD the_DT lowest_JJS R._NNP M._NNP ,_, whereas_JJ Gir_NNP and_CC Thar-_NNP parkar_NN gave_VBD almost_RB similar_JJ R._NNP M._NNP values_NNS ._.
Polenske_NNP values_NNS did_VBD not_RB show_VB any_DT significant_JJ change_NN throughout_IN the_DT lactation_NN ._.
Sindhi_NNP cows_NNS produced_VBD ghee_JJ having_VBG a_DT Polenske_NNP figure_NN averaging_VBG 1.8_CD ,_, while_IN it_PRP was_VBD 1.6_CD for_IN Gir_NNP ,_, 1.5_CD for_IN Tharparkar_NNP and_CC 1.4_CD for_IN Murrah_NNP buffaloes_NNS ._.
Individual_JJ figures_NNS have_VBP always_RB been_VBN well_RB within_IN the_DT legal_JJ limits_NNS at_IN all_DT times_NNS ._.
The_DT iodine_NN values_NNS also_RB did_VBD not_RB show_VB any_DT sudden_JJ change_NN that_WDT could_MD be_VB attributed_VBN to_TO season_NN ._.
But_CC there_EX was_VBD a_DT gradual_JJ increase_NN in_IN the_DT iodine_NN value_NN in_IN the_DT case_NN of_IN all_DT breeds_NNS as_IN the_DT lactation_NN advanced_VBD ._.
In_IN Sindhi_NNP cows_VBZ the_DT iodine_JJ value_NN increased_VBD from_IN 29.8_CD to_TO 31.8_CD ,_, in_IN Gir_NNP it_PRP increased_VBD fr_RB 30.8_CD to_TO ._.
32.7_CD ,_, in_IN Tharparkar_NNP 31.2_CD to_TO 32.7_CD and_CC in_IN Murrah_NNP from_IN 28.6_CD to_TO 30.9_CD ._.
Another_DT point_NN made_VBN from_IN Table_JJ III_NNP is_VBZ that_IN the_DT Murrah_NNP buffaloes_NNS produced_VBD ghee_NN with_IN the_DT lowest_JJS iodine_NN values_NNS ._.
Sindhi_NNP having_VBG a_DT little_JJ greater_JJR iodine_NN value_NN ,_, Gir_NNP and_CC Tharparkar_NNP being_VBG almost_RB equal_JJ but_CC greater_JJR than_IN both_DT Sindhi_NNP and_CC Murrah_NNP ._.
The_DT B._NNP R._NNP reading_VBG did_VBD not_RB show_VB any_DT significant_JJ change_NN due_JJ to_TO advance_NN of_IN lactation_NN ._.
The_DT average_JJ B._NNP R._NNP reading_NN was_VBD 43.0_CD for_IN Sindhi_NNP ;_: 43.7_CD for_IN Gir_NNP ,_, 43.7_CD for_IN Tharparkar_NNP and_CC 42.5_CD for_IN Murrah_NNP ._.
Probably_RB due_JJ to_TO the_DT fairly_RB uniform_JJ climatic_JJ conditions_NNS of_IN Bangalore_NNP the_DT experiment_NN does_VBZ not_RB throw_VB any_DT light_NN on_IN the_DT possible_JJ changes_NNS in_IN the_DT analytical_JJ constants_NNS of_IN ghee_NN from_IN different_JJ breeds_NNS that_WDT may_MD be_VB brought_VBN about_IN by_IN climatic_JJ changes_NNS ._.
But_CC the_DT effects_NNS of_IN the_DT advance_NN of_IN lactation_NN on_IN the_DT chemical_NN constants_NNS of_IN the_DT ghee_NN of_IN the_DT four_CD breeds_NNS of_IN animals_NNS under_IN investigation_NN are_VBP quite_RB clearly_RB brought_VBN out_RP by_IN the_DT present_JJ study_NN ._.
Of_IN the_DT four_CD analytical_JJ constants_NNS studied_VBN R._NNP M._NNP decreases_VBZ with_IN advance_NN of_IN lactation_NN while_IN iodine_JJ value_NN increases_NNS at_IN the_DT same_JJ time_NN ._.
Polenske_NNP value_NN and_CC B._NNP R._NNP read-_NN ing_VBG do_VBP not_RB seem_VB to_TO be_VB affected_VBN by_IN advance_NN in_IN lactation_NN ._.
Even_RB R._NNP M._NNP and_CC Iodine_NNP values_NNS that_WDT are_VBP affect-_JJ ed_NNS do_VBP not_RB fall_VB outside_IN their_PRP$ legal_JJ limits_NNS ._.
Therefore_RB ,_, it_PRP is_VBZ clear_JJ that_IN at_IN least_JJS in_IN the_DT case_NN of_IN ghee_NN from_IN the_DT four_CD breeds_NNS studied_VBN ,_, any_DT abnorma_JJ y_NN in_IN the_DT analytical_JJ constants_NNS can_MD not_RB be_VB attributed_VBN to_TO advance_VB in_IN lactation_NN ._.
Sudden_NNP and_CC drastic_JJ changes_NNS in_IN weather_NN and_CC feed_NN may_MD affect_VB the_DT composition_NN of_IN ghee_NN as_IN reported_VBN by_IN Plymen_NNP and_CC Iyer_NNP [_NNP 1921_CD ]_NN but_CC that_IN requires_VBZ further_JJ study_NN under_IN more_RBR favourable_JJ cir-_JJ cumstances_NNS ._.
Since_IN the_DT animals_NNS in_IN the_DT present_JJ investigation_NN were_VBD receiving_VBG the_DT same_JJ diet_NN all_DT through_IN the_DT experimental_JJ period_NN the_DT changes_NNS observed_VBN in_IN R._NNP M._NNP and_CC iodine_NN values_NNS have_VBP to_TO be_VB attributed_VBN only_RB to_TO advance_NN of_IN lactation_NN and_CC not_RB to_TO any_DT change_NN in_IN feed_NN which_WDT also_RB produces_VBZ certain_JJ changes_NNS in_IN the_DT composition_NN of_IN the_DT butterfat_NN according_VBG to_TO Moghul_NNP et_FW al_NN [_NN 1945_CD ]_NN ._.
Again_RB no_DT breed_NN variation_NN is_VBZ observed_VBN in_IN the_DT effect_NN of_IN the_DT advance_NN of_IN lactation_NN on_IN the_DT composition_NN of_IN the_DT butterfat_NN ,_, all_PDT the_DT four_CD breeds_NNS studied_VBN being_VBG affected_JJ almost_RB in_IN a_DT similar_JJ way_NN ._.
SUMMARY_NNP (_( 1_CD )_) Experiments_NNS were_VBD conducted_VBN to_TO study_VB the_DT seasonal_JJ variation_NN ,_, if_IN any_DT ,_, in_IN the_DT constants_NNS of_IN the_DT butterfat_NN of_IN Sindhi_NNP ,_, Gir_NNP and_CC Tharparkar_NNP cows_NNS and_CC Murrah_NNP buffaloes_NNS ._.
(_( 2_CD )_) The_DT milk_NN of_IN three_CD animals_NNS of_IN each_DT breed_NN was_VBD collected_VBN separately_RB once_RB a_DT week_NN for_IN the_DT dura-_JJ tion_NN of_IN one_CD complete_JJ lactation_NN and_CC ghee_NN made_VBD out_IN of_IN it_PRP and_CC analysed_VBD for_IN R._NNP M._NNP ,_, Polenske_NNP and_CC Iodine_NNP values_NNS and_CC B._NNP R._NNP reading_NN ._.
(_( 3_CD )_) No_DT effect_NN was_VBD observed_VBN on_IN the_DT composition_NN of_IN the_DT ghee_NN that_WDT could_MD be_VB attributed_VBN to_TO change_VB in_IN season_NN ._.
(_( 4_CD )_) Advance_NN in_IN lactation_NN is_VBZ found_VBN to_TO affect_VB some_DT of_IN the_DT chemical_NN constants_NNS of_IN ghee_NN considerably_RB while_IN some_DT others_NNS remain_VBP unaffected_JJ ._.
The_DT R._NNP M._NNP value_NN decreased_VBD and_CC Iodine_NNP value_NN increased_VBD with_IN the_DT advance_NN in_IN lactation_NN while_IN Polenske_NNP value_NN and_CC B._NNP R._NNP reading_NN remained_VBD unaffected_JJ throughout_IN the_DT lactation_NN ._.
(_( 5_CD )_) No_DT breed_NN variation_NN is_VBZ observed_VBN in_IN the_DT effect_NN of_IN advance_NN of_IN lactation_NN on_IN the_DT chemical_NN con-_JJ stants_NNS of_IN ghee_NN all_DT breeds_NNS behaving_VBG in_IN a_DT similar_JJ way_NN ._.
(_( 6_CD )_) There_EX is_VBZ no_DT significant_JJ difference_NN in_IN the_DT analytical_JJ constants_NNS of_IN the_DT ghee_NN from_IN the_DT four_CD breeds_NNS studied_VBN ._.

Unpublished_JJ NATURE_NNP OF_NNP CALCIUM_NNP IN_NNP BUFFALO_NNP MILK_NNP By_IN I._NNP P._NNP SINGH_NNP VERMA_NNP and_CC C._NNP P._NNP ANANTHAKRISHNAN_NNP ,_, Imperial_NNP Dairy_NNP Research_NNP Institute_NNP ,_, Ban-_NNP galore_NN (_( Received_VBN for_IN publication_NN on_IN 24_CD December_NNP 1945_CD )_) ONE_CD of_IN the_DT main_JJ reasons_NNS for_IN the_DT heat_NN coagulation_NN of_IN evaporated_JJ milk_NN during_IN sterilization_NN is_VBZ the_DT salt_JJ balance_NN ._.
Rogers_NNS et_VBP al_RB [_JJ 1921_CD ]_NN have_VBP explained_VBN that_IN thickening_VBG in_IN condensed_JJ milk_NN as_IN due_JJ to_TO high_JJ calcium_NN and_CC magnesium_NN contents_NNS ._.
These_DT workers_NNS have_VBP also_RB shown_VBN that_IN the_DT use_NN of_IN citrates_NNS and_CC phosphates_NNS has_VBZ a_DT stabilizing_VBG effect_NN by_IN counteracting_VBG the_DT effect_NN of_IN high_JJ calcium_NN and_CC magnesium_NN contents_NNS ._.
The_DT difficulty_NN in_IN overcoming_VBG thickening_NN has_VBZ been_VBN found_VBN to_TO e_VB more_RBR pronounced_JJ in_IN the_DT manufac-_JJ ture_NN of_IN evaporated_JJ buffalo_NN milk_NN than_IN in_IN the_DT case_NN of_IN evaporated_JJ cow_NN milk_NN ._.
It_PRP is_VBZ likely_JJ that_IN this_DT is_VBZ cor-_JJ related_JJ with_IN the_DT state_NN of_IN the_DT calcium_NN present_NN ._.
Calcium_NN in_IN milk_NN is_VBZ found_VBN in_IN both_DT soluble_JJ and_CC colloidal_JJ forms_NNS and_CC also_RB in_IN organic_JJ and_CC inorganic_JJ combinations_NNS and_CC their_PRP$ proportions_NNS exercise_VBP considerable_JJ effect_NN on_IN heat_NN coagulation_NN of_IN evaporated_JJ milk_NN ._.
Apart_RB from_IN the_DT data_NNS reported_VBN by_IN Acharya_NNP and_CC Devadatta_NNP [_NNP 1939_CD ]_NNP no_DT further_JJ attention_NN has_VBZ been_VBN paid_VBN to_TO this_DT aspect_NN of_IN the_DT problem_NN ._.
For_IN the_DT present_JJ studies_NNS ten_VBP Murrah_NNP buffaloes_NNS at_IN about_IN the_DT same_JJ stage_NN of_IN lactation_NN were_VBD selected_VBN ._.
Individual_JJ samples_NNS from_IN each_DT animal_NN were_VBD collected_VBN once_RB a_DT week_NN and_CC analysed_VBD ._.
Also_RB one_CD composite_JJ sample_NN was_VBD prepared_JJ and_CC analysed_VBD once_RB a_DT week_NN by_IN mixing_VBG equal_JJ quantities_NNS of_IN milk_NN from_IN each_DT animal_NN ._.
Similarly_RB a_DT composite_JJ sample_NN from_IN ten_JJ cows_NNS was_VBD prepared_VBN and_CC analysed_VBN ._.
Whey_NNP was_VBD prepared_VBN from_IN all_PDT these_DT samples_NNS by_IN the_DT use_NN of_IN rennet_NN and_CC the_DT amount_NN of_IN calcium_NN was_VBD calculated_VBN by_IN subtracting_VBG the_DT whey_JJ calcium_NN from_IN the_DT total_JJ calcium_NN of_IN the_DT milk_NN ._.
With_IN whey_PDT a_DT correction_NN was_VBD made_VBN to_TO bring_VB the_DT results_NNS from_IN whey_JJ percentage_NN to_TO milk_VB percentage_NN by_IN using_VBG the_DT correction_NN factor_NN as_IN 9.48_CD ._.
In_IN all_DT 120_CD samples_NNS of_IN milk_NN were_VBD analysed_VBN including_VBG 100_CD individual_JJ samples_NNS from_IN ten_JJ animals_NNS and_CC 20_CD composite_JJ samples_NNS from_IN cows_NNS and_CC buffaloes_NNS ._.
The_DT total_JJ calcium_NN was_VBD estimated_VBN by_IN precipitating_VBG with_IN calcium_NN oxalate_NN and_CC then_RB titrating_VBG with_IN potassium_NN permanganate_NN in_IN sulphuric_JJ acid_JJ solution_NN ._.
Whey_NNP calcium_NN was_VBD estimated_VBN by_IN coagulating_VBG 100_CD ml_NN ._.
of_IN milk_NN at_IN 30°C_CD ._.
with_IN 0.7_CD ml_NNS ._.
of_IN liquid_JJ rennet_NN ._.
The_DT curd_NN was_VBD cut_VBN with_IN stainless_JJ steel_NN knife_NNS and_CC the_DT whey_NN allowed_VBD to_TO drain_VB off_RP ._.
The_DT whey_NN was_VBD filtered_VBN through_IN Whatman_NNP No_NNP ._.
40_CD filter_JJ paper_NN ._.
To_TO 25_CD ml_NNS ._.
of_IN this_DT whey_NN were_VBD added_VBN 100_CD ml_NN ._.
of_IN 10_CD per_IN cent_NN trichloroacetic_JJ acid_JJ solution_NN with_IN constant_JJ stirring_NN ._.
100_CD ml_NN ._.
of_IN the_DT filtrate_NN were_VBD neutralized_VBN with_IN ammonia_NN and_CC acidified_VBN with_IN dilute_JJ acetic_JJ acid_NN ._.
Ammonium_NNP chloride_NN was_VBD added_VBN and_CC the_DT calcium_NN precipitated_VBN from_IN the_DT hot_JJ solution_NN with_IN solid_JJ ammonium_NN oxalate_NN and_CC estimated_VBN by_IN titrating_VBG with_IN permanganate_NN as_IN for_IN total_JJ calcium_NN ._.
For_IN converting_VBG whey_JJ percentage_NN figures_NNS to_TO milk_VB percentage_NN figures_NNS the_DT value_NN was_VBD multiplied_VBN by_IN the_DT factor_NN 100_CD [_NN fat_JJ percentage_NN +_NN (_( protein_JJ percentage178_JJ Nature_NN of_IN Calcium_NNP in_IN Buffalo_NNP Milk_NNP TABLE_NNP I_PRP Calcium_NNP distribution_NN in_IN the_DT milk_NN of_IN buffaloes_NNS and_CC cows_NNS (_( gm_NN ._.

Averages_NNS of_IN composite_JJ cow_NN samples_NNS ._.
._.
0.1526_CD 0.0502_CD 0.1024_CD 67.09_CD From_IN the_DT tables_NNS it_PRP will_MD be_VB observed_VBN that_IN the_DT colloidal_JJ calcium_NN in_IN buffalo_NN milk_NN amounted_VBD to_TO 76.95_CD per_IN cent_NN while_IN the_DT rest_NN is_VBZ accounted_VBN for_IN as_IN soluble_JJ calcium_NN ._.
This_DT is_VBZ confirmed_VBN by_IN the_DT results_NNS obtained_VBD from_IN the_DT analysis_NN of_IN the_DT composite_JJ weekly_JJ samples_NNS of_IN milk_NN wherein_VBP the_DT colloidal_JJ form_NN of_IN calcium_NN accounted_VBD for_IN 77.49_CD per_IN cent_NN of_IN the_DT total_JJ calcium_NN ._.
The_DT composite_JJ samples_NNS of_IN cow_NN milk_NN obtained_VBN from_IN Sindhi_NNP cows_NNS and_CC analysed_VBN in_IN a_DT similar_JJ manner_NN were_VBD found_VBN to_TO contain_VB on_IN an_DT average_JJ 67.09_CD per_IN cent_NN of_IN total_JJ calcium_NN in_IN colloidal_JJ form_NN ._.
The_DT results_NNS show_VBP that_IN buffalo_NN milk_NN contains_VBZ a_DT higher_JJR percentage_NN of_IN calcium_NN ,_, about_RB 77.2_CD per_IN cent_NN of_IN which_WDT is_VBZ in_IN colloidal_JJ form_NN ._.
This_DT probably_RB explains_VBZ the_DT comparatively_RB low_JJ heat_NN stability_NN of_IN eva-_JJ porated_JJ buffalo_NN milk_NN as_IN compared_VBN to_TO cow_VB milk_NN ._.

10_CD ,_, 221181_CD GOAT_NNP DERMATITIS_NNP :_: A_DT NEW_NNP VIRUS_NNP DISEASE_NNP OF_NNP GOATS_NNP IN_NNP INDIA_NNP By_IN J._NNP R._NNP HADDOW_NNP and_CC J_NNP ._.
A._NN IDNANI_NNP ,_, Imperial_NNP Veterinary_NNP Research_NNP Institute_NNP ,_, Mukteswar_NNP (_( Received_VBN for_IN publication_NN on_IN 2_CD April_NNP 1946_CD )_) (_( With_IN Plates_NNP VII_NNP and_CC VIII_NNP )_) THIS_NNP article_NN describes_VBZ the_DT circumstances_NNS under_IN which_WDT the_DT disease_NN was_VBD discovered_VBN ,_, the_DT main_JJ clinical_JJ features_NNS and_CC post-mortem_JJ findings_NNS ,_, the_DT aetiology_NN and_CC possible_JJ means_NNS of_IN control_NN ._.
Although_IN the_DT investigation_NN is_VBZ not_RB complete_JJ ,_, the_DT present_JJ moment_NN seems_VBZ opportune_JJ to_TO draw_VB attention_NN to_TO the_DT disease_NN ,_, so_IN that_IN it_PRP may_MD be_VB recognized_VBN and_CC its_PRP$ incidence_NN and_CC epizootiology_NN recorded_VBN ,_, as_IN at_IN present_NN we_PRP have_VBP no_DT information_NN these_DT points_NNS ._.
OCCURRENCE_NNP During_IN studies_NNS on_IN cross-immunity_NN reactions_NNS using_VBG sheep_JJ and_CC goat-pox_JJ virus_NN strains_NNS ,_, we_PRP observed_VBD that_IN some_DT of_IN our_PRP$ discarded_JJ stock_NN goat_NN immunes_NNS were_VBD dying_VBG from_IN an_DT infection_NN which_WDT was_VBD reported_VBN to_TO be_VB goat-pox_JJ ._.
On_IN going_VBG into_IN the_DT matter_NN we_PRP found_VBD that_IN ,_, though_IN this_DT condition_NN on_IN casual_JJ examina-_JJ tion_NN might_MD be_VB mistaken_VBN for_IN an_DT aberrant_JJ type_NN of_IN goat-pox_JJ such_JJ as_IN has_VBZ not_RB infrequently_RB been_VBN reported_VBN in_IN India_NNP ,_, there_EX were_VBD several_JJ easily_RB recognized_VBN clinical_JJ features_NNS which_WDT made_VBD us_PRP doubt_VB the_DT accuracy_NN of_IN the_DT original_JJ diagnosis_NN ._.
Simultaneously_RB we_PRP discovered_VBD the_DT same_JJ disease_NN in_IN goats_NNS which_WDT were_VBD being_VBG used_VBN on_IN experimental_JJ work_NN other_JJ than_IN goat-pox_JJ ,_, and_CC reference_NN to_TO records_NNS yielded_VBN the_DT additional_JJ information_NN that_IN a_DT similar_JJ condition_NN had_VBD existed_VBN at_IN Mukteswar_NNP in_IN the_DT healthy_JJ goat_NN stocks_NNS on_IN two_CD previous_JJ years_NNS during_IN the_DT monsoon_NN period_NN ._.
Since_IN the_DT investigation_NN started_VBD ,_, two_CD outbreaks_NNS of_IN goat_NN dermatitis_NN have_VBP been_VBN observed_VBN in_IN the_DT healthy_JJ stocks_NNS ;_: both_DT apparently_RB arose_VBP from_IN outside_JJ sources_NNS and_CC both_DT occurred_VBD during_IN the_DT monsoon_NN ._.
Also_RB out_IN of_IN a_DT number_NN of_IN specimens_NNS received_VBN at_IN this_DT Institute_NNP for_IN confirmation_NN of_IN the_DT diagnosis_NN of_IN goat-_JJ pox_NN ,_, one_CD originating_NN in_IN the_DT United_NNP Provinces_NNPS and_CC ,_, one_CD reported_VBD to_TO be_VB from_IN an_DT outbreak_NN of_IN pneu-_JJ monia_NN in_IN goats_NNS in_IN Sind_NNP proved_VBD to_TO be_VB aetiologically_RB identical_JJ with_IN the_DT condition_NN which_WDT was_VBD under_IN study_NN at_IN Mukteswar_NNP ._.
CLINICAL_NNP SYMPTOMS_NNP In_IN natural_JJ cases_NNS the_DT first_JJ symptoms_NNS observed_VBN are_VBP general_JJ malaise_NN accompanied_VBN by_IN a_DT high_JJ tem-_JJ perature_NN and_CC rough_JJ staring_NN coat_NN ._.
On_IN examination_NN ,_, the_DT skin_NN is_VBZ found_VBN to_TO be_VB studded_VBN with_IN numerous_JJ round_NN elevated_VBD areas_NNS distributed_VBN over_IN the_DT body_NN surface_NN (_( Plate_NNP VII_NNP ,_, figs_NNS ._.
1_CD and_CC 2_CD )_) and_CC extending_VBG on_IN to_TO the_DT lips_NNS ,_, gums_NNS and_CC tongue_NN ._.
Simultaneously_RB or_CC within_IN a_DT day_NN or_CC two_CD ,_, symptoms_NNS of_IN pneumonia_NN appear_NN and_CC death_NN follows_VBZ invariably_RB ._.
In_IN cases_NNS artificially_RB produced_VBN by_IN rubbing_VBG dilute_JJ emulsions_NNS of_IN tissue_NN from_IN the_DT stud-like_JJ nodules_NNS on_IN to_TO the_DT scarified_JJ skin_NN of_IN healthy_JJ goats_NNS there_EX is_VBZ an_DT incubation_JJ period_NN of_IN seven_CD to_TO ten_VB days_NNS ,_, after_IN which_WDT the_DT scarified_JJ area_NN shows_NNS sharply_RB circumscribed_VBD circular_JJ hyperaemic_JJ areas_NNS and_CC simultaneously_RB the_DT temperature_NN rises_VBZ two_CD to_TO three_CD degrees_NNS ._.
The_DT hyperaemia_NN rapidly_RB increases_VBZ ,_, the_DT area_NN becomes_VBZ thick-_JJ ened_JJ and_CC elevated_VBN ,_, and_CC within_IN 48_CD hours_NNS there_EX is_VBZ a_DT hard_JJ stud_NN of_IN rubbery_NN consistence_NN and_CC black_JJ colour_NN ._.
The_DT nodules_NNS are_VBP approximately_RB 4-12_JJ mm_NN ._.
in_IN diameter_NN and_CC raised_VBD about_IN 1182_CD Goat_NNP Dermatitis_NNP ._.
A_DT new_JJ Virus_NNP Disease_NNP of_IN Goats_NNP in_IN India_NNP MORBID_NNP ANATOMY_NNP The_DT skin_JJ lesions_NNS previously_RB described_VBN are_VBP a_DT constant_JJ feature_NN ._.
On_IN opening_VBG the_DT carcase_NN ,_, typical_JJ lesions_NNS can_MD in_IN almost_RB all_DT cases_NNS be_VB observed_VBN in_IN the_DT alimentary_JJ tract_NN ,_, lungs_NNS and_CC kidneys_NNS ._.
The_DT internal_JJ lesions_NNS are_VBP essentially_RB similar_JJ to_TO those_DT seen_VBN on_IN the_DT skin_NN ._.
In_IN the_DT alimentary_JJ tract_NN ,_, the_DT abomasum_NN is_VBZ almost_RB invariably_RB affected_JJ ._.
The_DT duodenum_NN ,_, lips_NNS ,_, gum_NN and_CC tongue_NN ,_, oesophagus_NN ,_, large_JJ intestine_NN and_CC rectum_NN are_VBP also_RB frequently_RB affected_VBN ,_, the_DT frequency_NN being_VBG in_IN that_DT order_NN ._.
In_IN these_DT locations_NNS the_DT nodules_NNS are_VBP greyish-white_JJ or_CC yellow_JJ in_IN colour_NN and_CC usually_RB smaller_JJR in_IN diameter_NN than_IN those_DT seen_VBN on_IN the_DT skin_NN ._.
In_IN the_DT later_JJ stages_VBZ the_DT mucous_JJ membrane_NN is_VBZ desquamated_VBN leaving_VBG a_DT bright_JJ red_JJ punched-out_NN ulcer_NN ._.
The_DT liver_NN is_VBZ more_RBR rarely_RB affected_JJ and_CC the_DT lesions_NNS present_VBP the_DT appearance_NN of_IN in_IN cts_NNS ._.
In_IN the_DT respiratory_NN tract_NN ,_, lesions_NNS are_VBP as_RB frequent_JJ as_IN in_IN the_DT abomasum_NN and_CC are_VBP present_JJ on_IN the_DT face_NN of_IN the_DT trachea_NN and_CC larger_JJR bronchiIndian_JJ J._NNP vet_NN ._.

6_CD ._.
Lung_NNP lesion_NN ._.
(_( Low_JJ power_NN )_) J._NNP R._NNP HADDOW_NNP AND_NNP J_NNP ._.
A._NN IDNANI_NNP 183_CD Blood_NNP is_VBZ also_RB infective_JJ from_IN the_DT time_NN the_DT temperature_NN rises_VBZ until_IN the_DT temperature_NN drops_VBZ in_IN chronic_JJ cases_NNS ._.
We_PRP have_VBP also_RB to_TO record_VB negative_JJ results_NNS in_IN transmission_NN experiments_NNS with_IN four_CD Bhutia_NNP goats_NNS (_( a_DT long-haired_JJ variety_NN from_IN the_DT Himalayan_NNP hinterland_NN )_) ._.
Whether_IN these_DT goats_NNS were_VBD naturally_RB immune_JJ can_MD not_RB be_VB said_VBD ,_, as_IN these_DT goats_NNS are_VBP only_RB supplied_VBN to_TO the_DT Institute_NNP during_IN the_DT winter_JJ months_NNS ._.
We_PRP have_VBP also_RB no_DT information_NN as_IN to_TO the_DT natural_JJ method_NN of_IN transmission_NN in_IN local_JJ breeds_NNS of_IN goats_NNS ._.
It_PRP is_VBZ peculiar_JJ that_IN ,_, although_IN in_IN nature_NN the_DT disease_NN seems_VBZ to_TO spread_VB readily_RB enough_RB ,_, healthy_JJ goats_NNS have_VBP been_VBN left_VBN in_IN contact_NN with_IN artificially_RB infected_VBN ones_NNS at_IN all_DT stages_NNS of_IN the_DT disease_NN for_IN long_JJ periods_NNS without_IN acquiring_VBG the_DT disease_NN ._.
Later_RB ,_, they_PRP were_VBD found_VBN to_TO be_VB fully_RB susecp_JJ ble_JJ to_TO artificial_JJ inoculation_NN ._.
AETIOLOGY_IN The_DT circumstances_NNS in_IN which_WDT the_DT disease_NN was_VBD found_VBN led_VBD us_PRP to_TO suspect_VB a_DT virus_NN as_IN the_DT probable_JJ cause_NN ,_, and_CC filtration_NN experiments_NNS with_IN emulsions_NNS of_IN nodules_NNS confirmed_VBN this_DT suspicion_NN ._.
Infective_JJ bacteria-_JJ free_JJ filtrates_NNS were_VBD readily_RB obtained_VBN from_IN Berkefeld_NNP V_NNP ,_, Chamberland_NNP L1_NNP ,_, L2_NNP ,_, L3_NNP candles_NNS ._.
Cultural_JJ examination_NN for_IN bacteria_NNS at_IN the_DT early_JJ stages_NNS of_IN the_DT lesions_NNS was_VBD also_RB uniformly_RB negative_JJ ._.
The_DT virus_NN is_VBZ present_JJ in_IN the_DT skin_NN lesions_NNS throughout_IN the_DT course_NN and_CC has_VBZ been_VBN recovered_VBN from_IN the_DT scabs_NNS more_RBR than_IN three_CD weeks_NNS after_IN the_DT original_JJ inoculation_NN ._.
Virus_NNP in_IN dried_JJ scabs_NN or_CC in_IN tissues_NNS stored_VBN in_IN 50_CD per_IN cent_NN glycerol_NN remains_VBZ viable_JJ for_IN at_IN least_JJS 16_CD months_NNS at_IN 0184_CD Goat_NNP Dermatitis_NNP ._.
A_DT new_JJ Virus_NNP Disease_NNP of_IN Goats_NNP in_IN India_NNP Following_NNP intravenous_JJ inoculation_NN with_IN skin_JJ material_NN ,_, symptoms_NNS of_IN general_JJ malaise_NN with_IN high_JJ temperature_NN ,_, 104°-106°F._JJ ,_, and_CC rough_JJ staring_NN coat_NN mark_NN the_DT onset_NN of_IN the_DT disease_NN ._.
On_IN careful_JJ exami-_JJ nation_NN the_DT skin_NN is_VBZ studded_VBN with_IN small_JJ circular_NN ,_, elevated_VBD nodules_NNS distributed_VBN all_DT over_IN the_DT surface_NN ex-_JJ tending_NN to_TO the_DT lips_NNS ,_, eyelids_NNS and_CC tongue_NN ._.
Simultaneously_RB or_CC within_IN a_DT day_NN or_CC two_CD ,_, symtoms_NNS of_IN pneu-_JJ monia_NN appear_NN and_CC death_NN follows_VBZ invariably_RB ._.
At_IN no_DT stage_NN of_IN development_NN of_IN the_DT skin_JJ nodules_NNS does_VBZ vesiculation_NN or_CC pustule_NN formation_NN occur_NN ._.
Extension_NN of_IN lesions_NNS takes_VBZ place_NN into_IN the_DT respiratory_NN and_CC alimentary_JJ tracts_NNS ._.
Greyish_JJ white_JJ nodules_NNS are_VBP mainly_RB seen_VBN in_IN the_DT lungs_NNS ,_, abomasum_NN and_CC often_RB through-_JJ out_IN the_DT intestines_NNS ._.
The_DT foci_NN in_IN the_DT lungs_NNS set_VBD up_RP an_DT apparently_RB secondary_JJ pneumonia_NN almost_RB as_RB quickly_RB as_IN they_PRP appear_VBP and_CC produce_VBP early_JJ death_NN ._.
The_DT disease_NN was_VBD easily_RB transmitted_VBN with_IN blood_NN or_CC material_NN from_IN skin_JJ lesions_NNS subcutaneously_RB ,_, intravenously_RB or_CC by_IN scarification_NN to_TO pox_VB mune_JJ goats_NNS ._.
Bulls_NNS ,_, sheep_NN ,_, rabbits_NNS and_CC guinea-pigs_NNS proved_VBD refractory_NN ._.
Light_JJ scarification_NN on_IN the_DT incrase_NN of_IN the_DT ear_NN with_IN the_DT virus_NN sets_VBZ up_RP a_DT localized_JJ lesion_NN and_CC is_VBZ suggested_VBN as_IN possible_JJ means_NNS for_IN prophylaxis_NN ._.
ACKNOWLEDGEMENT_IN The_DT authors_NNS desire_VBP to_TO record_VB their_PRP$ thanks_NNS to_TO Dr_NNP F._NNP C._NNP Minett_NNP for_IN his_PRP$ interest_NN and_CC encouragement_NN during_IN the_DT course_NN of_IN the_DT investigation_NN ._.
REFERENCE_NNP Wallace_NNP ,_, W._NNP R._NNP (_( 1935_CD )_) ._.
Annual_JJ Report_NNP of_IN the_DT Director_NNP of_IN Veterinary_NNP Department_NNP ,_, Federated_NNP Malay_NNP States_NNPS ,_, 39_CD DEFINITION_NNP OF_NNP BARODA_NNP WOOL_NNP GRADES_NNP by_IN N._NNP L._NNP NARAYAN_NNP ,_, G._NNP V_NNP ._.
Sc._NNP ,_, Wool_NNP Improvement_NNP Officer_NNP and_CC SUNANDA_NNP ._.

Sc._NNP ,_, Wool_NNP Analysis_NNP Laboratory_NNP ,_, Baroda_NNP State_NNP (_( Received_NNP for_IN Publication_NNP on_IN 16_CD February_NNP 1945_CD )_) THE_DT Indian_JJ Wood_NNP trade-names_NNS like_IN Joria_NNP and_CC Bikaneri_NNP denote_VBP the_DT tract_NN from_IN which_WDT the_DT wool_NN is_VBZ collected_VBN ._.
At_IN present_JJ there_EX are_VBP different_JJ breeds_NNS of_IN sheep_JJ coexisting_NN ._.
Nomadic_NNP sheep_NN which_WDT have_VBP to_TO move_VB far_RB in_IN search_NN of_IN pasture_NN are_VBP shorn_VBN at_IN different_JJ places_NNS at_IN different_JJ season_NN ._.
Also_RB there_EX is_VBZ a_DT great_JJ deel_NN of_IN variation_NN from_IN sheep_NN to_TO sheep_VB and_CC region_NN to_TO region_NN of_IN a_DT fleece_NN so_RB that_IN the_DT wool_NN produced_VBN in_IN an_DT area_NN is_VBZ a_DT mixture_NN of_IN different_JJ types_NNS and_CC qualities_NNS ._.
Added_VBN to_TO this_DT natural_JJ dis-_JJ advantage_NN ,_, the_DT crude_NN methods_NNS of_IN shearing_VBG and_CC collection_NN further_RB deteriorate_VB the_DT value_NN of_IN the_DT wool_NN resulting_VBG in_IN great_JJ financial_JJ loss_NN to_TO all_DT concerned_VBN ._.
The_DT producer_NN is_VBZ too_RB ignorant_JJ to_TO improve_VB upon_IN this_DT state_NN of_IN marketing_NN of_IN his_PRP$ product_NN ._.
The_DT middlemen_NNS are_VBP not_RB interested_JJ as_IN they_PRP are_VBP satisfied_VBN with_IN the_DT commission_NN they_PRP are_VBP already_RB earning_VBG ._.
The_DT manufacturers_NNS though_IN interested_JJ are_VBP too_RB far_RB removed_VBN from_IN the_DT wool_NN growers_NNS and_CC the_DT primary_JJ collecting_NN centres_NNS of_IN wool_NN to_TO exercise_VB proper_JJ control_NN over_IN it_PRP ,_, especially_RB as_IN alternative_JJ products_NNS are_VBP available_JJ ._.
The_DT duty_NN therefore_NN falls_VBZ upon_IN the_DT State_NNP to_TO take_VB up_RP this_DT question_NN and_CC make_VB a_DT systematic_JJ and_CC effective_JJ start_NN in_IN this_DT line_NN ._.
Accordingly_RB ,_, the_DT Baroda_NNP Government_NNP had_VBD a_DT survey_NN of_IN the_DT whole_JJ State_NNP carried_VBD out_RP under_IN the_DT following_JJ heads_NNS :_: 1_CD ._.
Sheep_JJ breeds_NNS and_CC their_PRP$ distribution_NN ;_: 2_CD ._.
Wool_NNP quality_NN of_IN sheep_NN of_IN different_JJ areas_NNS ;_: 3_CD ._.
Local_JJ conditions_NNS of_IN sheep_JJ husbandry_NN ;_: and_CC 4_CD ._.
System_NN of_IN collection_NN and_CC sale_NN of_IN wool_NN ._.
This_DT survey_NN not_RB only_RB pointed_VBD out_RP that_IN the_DT conditions_NNS of_IN sheep_JJ husbandry_NN and_CC wool_NN collection_NN were_VBD backward_RB ,_, but_CC also_RB brought_VBD to_TO light_VB the_DT existance_NN of_IN large_JJ numbers_NNS of_IN fine_NN woolled_VBN sheep_NN in_IN northern_JJ Gujrat_NNP and_CC Kathiawad_NNP which_WDT guaranteed_VBD an_DT increased_JJ income_NN to_TO the_DT producers_NNS immediately_RB if_IN only_RB their_PRP$ wool_NN could_MD be_VB sorted_VBN out_RP and_CC sold_VBN in_IN a_DT pure_JJ form_NN ._.
N._NNP L._NNP NARAYAN_NNP AND_NNP SUNANDA_NNP 185_CD Following_VBG this_DT discovery_NN a_DT marketing_NN organization_NN was_VBD included_VBN in_IN the_DT Wool_NNP Improvement_NNP Scheme_NNP to_TO conduct_VB experiments_NNS on_IN shearing_NN ,_, garding_NN ,_, collection_NN and_CC sale_NN of_IN wool_NN on_IN a_DT large_JJ scale_NN ,_, along_IN with_IN other_JJ developmental_JJ activities_NNS ,_, to_TO work_VB on_IN Pattanwadi_NNP sheep_NN in_IN northern_JJ Gujerat_NNP to_TO start_VB with_IN ._.
The_DT number_NN of_IN sheep_JJ dealt_NN with_IN by_IN this_DT section_NN rose_VBD from_IN 11,000_CD in_IN the_DT first_JJ year_NN to_TO 65,000_CD in_IN the_DT third_JJ year_NN ._.
The_DT Australian_JJ system_NN of_IN grading_VBG was_VBD adopted_VBN as_IN the_DT model_NN and_CC skirting_NN and_CC classing_NN were_VBD carried_VBN out_RP immediately_RB after_IN shearing_VBG at_IN the_DT shearing_VBG yard_NN ._.
Taking_VBG into_IN consideration_NN both_DT individual_JJ and_CC regional_JJ variations_NNS in_IN the_DT wool_JJ quality_NN of_IN the_DT sheep_NN of_IN the_DT whole_JJ tract_NN ,_, it_PRP was_VBD possible_JJ to_TO form_VB five_CD distinct_JJ classes_NNS ,_, '_'' super_NN '_'' ,_, '_'' first_JJ '_POS and_CC '_POS second_JJ '_'' in_IN white_JJ and_CC 'colour_POS '_'' and_CC 'skirtings_NNS '_'' in_IN coloured_JJ wool_NN ._.
There_EX is_VBZ doubt_NN that_IN the_DT distinctness_NN and_CC uniformity_NN within_IN each_DT grade_NN depends_VBZ much_RB on_IN the_DT efficiency_NN of_IN assers_NNS ._.
To_TO find_VB out_RP how_WRB far_RB this_DT was_VBD successful_JJ and_CC in_IN what_WP directions_VBZ the_DT quality_NN of_IN ._.
each_DT class_NN and_CC be_VB controlled_VBN ,_, systematic_JJ laboratory_NN analysis_NN was_VBD conducted_VBN of_IN the_DT two_CD top_JJ grades_NNS for_IN two_CD consecutive_JJ collections_NNS ._.
The_DT qualities_NNS of_IN various_JJ types_NNS of_IN cotton_NN have_VBP been_VBN standardized_VBN and_CC agmarking_VBG has_VBZ been_VBN introduced_VBN ,_, but_CC so_RB far_RB no_DT such_JJ attempts_NNS have_VBP been_VBN made_VBN to_TO classify_VB wool_NN ._.
This_DT study_NN explores_VBZ the_DT possibilities_NNS and_CC suggests_VBZ a_DT method_NN of_IN such_JJ standardization_NN and_CC agmarking_NN of_IN Indian_JJ wools_NNS and_CC in_IN particular_JJ Pattanwadi_NNP wools_NNS in_IN Baroda_NNP State_NNP ._.
Samples_NNS were_VBD collected_VBN from_IN four_CD different_JJ corners_NNS of_IN ten_NN ._.
bags_NNS selected_VBN at_IN random_NN of_IN each_DT quality_NN of_IN two_CD consecutive_JJ collections_NNS and_CC each_DT of_IN these_DT four_CD samples_NNS was_VBD brought_VBN down_RP to_TO a_DT few_JJ hundred_CD fibres_NNS by_IN dividing_VBG and_CC discarding_VBG and_CC these_DT four_CD bunches_NNS of_IN fibres_NNS were_VBD combined_VBN to_TO form_VB one_CD sample_NN representing_VBG a_DT bag_NN and_CC the_DT ten_JJ samples_NNS representing_VBG the_DT entire_JJ consignment_NN of_IN one_CD quality_NN ._.
Table_JJ I_PRP gives_VBZ the_DT results_NNS of_IN analysis_NN of_IN these_DT samples_NNS for_IN the_DT two_CD collections_NNS ._.
TABLE_NN I_PRP Length_NNP (_( in_IN inches_NNS )_) ,_, crimp_NN ,_, diameter_NN (_( in_IN microns_NNS )_) and_CC medullation_NN records_NNS of_IN wools_NNS of_IN autumn_NN 1944_CD and_CC spring_NN 1945_CD 1_CD 2_CD 3_CD 4_CD 5_CD 6_CD 7_CD 8_CD 9_CD 10_CD Mean_NNP Coefficient_NNP of_IN variation_NN Mean_NNP Coefficient_NNP of_IN variation_NN Mean_NNP Coefficient_NNP of_IN variation_NN Mean_NNP Coefficient_NNP of_IN variation_NN Mean_NNP Coefficient_NNP of_IN variation_NN Mean_NNP Coefficient_NNP of_IN variation_NN Mean_NNP Coefficient_NNP of_IN variation_NN Mean_NNP Coefficient_NNP of_IN variation_NN Mean_NNP Coefficient_NNP of_IN variation_NN Mean_NNP Coefficient_NNP of_IN variation_NN Autumn_NNP Super186_NNP Definition_NNP of_IN Baroda_NNP Wool_NNP Grade_NNP 1_CD 2_CD 3_CD 4_CD 5_CD 6_CD 7_CD 8_CD 9_CD 10_CD Mean_NNP Coefficient_NNP of_IN variation_NN Mean_NNP Coefficient_NNP of_IN variation_NN Mean_NNP Coefficient_NNP of_IN variation_NN Mean_NNP Coefficient_NNP of_IN variation_NN Mean_NNP Coefficient_NNP of_IN variation_NN Mean_NNP Coefficient_NNP of_IN variation_NN Mean_NNP Coefficient_NNP of_IN variation_NN Mean_NNP Coefficient_NNP of_IN variation_NN Mean_NNP Coefficient_NNP of_IN variation_NN Mean_NNP Coefficient_NNP of_IN variation_NN Spring_NNP FirstN_NNP ._.
L._NNP NARAYAH_NNP AND_NNP SUNANDA_NNP 187_CD While_IN the_DT difference_NN between_IN the_DT two_CD classes_NNS is_VBZ not_RB marked_VBN ,_, the_DT difference_NN between_IN the_DT two_CD collections_NNS in_IN both_DT the_DT classes_NNS is_VBZ apparent_JJ ._.
The_DT difference_NN in_IN length_NN between_IN wools_NNS of_IN two_CD seasons_NNS ,_, Autumn_NNP and_CC Spring_NNP has_VBZ ,_, been_VBN observed_VBN on_IN individual_JJ sheep_NN also_RB taking_VBG into_IN account_NN exactly_RB six_CD months_NNS '_POS clip_NN ._.
Keeping_VBG in_IN view_NN that_IN both_DT these_DT classes_NNS of_IN wool_NN are_VBP clothing_VBG types_NNS ,_, it_PRP does_VBZ not_RB seem_VB to_TO be_VB profitable_JJ to_TO introduce_VB distinctness_NN in_IN length_NN until_IN the_DT breed_NN is_VBZ highly_RB developed_VBN as_IN it_PRP will_MD thin_VB down_RP the_DT quantity_NN ,_, but_CC different_JJ standards_NNS will_MD have_VB to_TO be_VB adopted_VBN for_IN the_DT clips_NNS of_IN different_JJ seasons_NNS as_IN 2.5_CD in_IN and_CC above_IN for_IN spring_NN and_CC 3.5_CD in_IN ._.
and_CC above_IN for_IN autumn_NN ._.
The_DT coefficient_NN of_IN variation_NN should_MD be_VB restricted_VBN to_TO 20_CD per_FW cent_NN as_IN shown_VBN by_IN the_DT majority_NN of_IN the_DT samples_NNS ._.

35_CD to_TO 40_CD RAM_NNP NARAIN_NNP MOHAN_NNP 189_CD Some_DT were_VBD found_VBN prostrate_NN and_CC comatose_NN ;_: their_PRP$ temperature_NN was_VBD within_IN normal_JJ limits_NNS and_CC blood_NN smears_NNS revealed_VBD nothing_NN of_IN significance_NN ._.
Most_JJS of_IN these_DT died_VBN within_IN three_CD to_TO four_CD days_NNS of_IN arriving_VBG in_IN Calcutta_NNP ;_: in_IN others_NNS the_DT course_NN was_VBD more_RBR protracted_JJ ._.
POST-MORTEM_NNP There_EX was_VBD general_JJ emaciation_NN and_CC various_JJ parasites_NNS were_VBD found_VBN ,_, such_JJ as_IN Haemonchus_NNP contortus_NN ,_, Oesophagostomes_NNP ,_, Cysticercus_NNP tenuicollis_NN ,_, Gongylonema_NNP pulchrum_NN ,_, Cotylophoron_NNP cotylophorum_NN ._.
Oestrus_NNP ocis_MD larvae_VB were_VBD present_JJ ,_, often_RB in_IN large_JJ numbers_NNS ,_, in_IN the_DT nasal_JJ cavity_NN and_CC in_IN the_DT paranasal_NN (_( especially_RB frontal_JJ )_) sinuses_NNS but_CC none_NN was_VBD found_VBN actually_RB lodged_VBN in_IN the_DT brain_NN or_CC in_IN the_DT cranial_JJ cavity_NN ._.
Coenurus_NNP cerebralis_NN was_VBD not_RB found_VBN ._.
In_IN two_CD cases_NNS brownish-red_JJ mottling_NN ,_, and_CC in_IN one_CD case_NN ecchymotic_JJ haemorrha-_NN ges_NNS were_VBD found_VBN in_IN the_DT brain_NN tissue_NN ._.
A_DT few_JJ cases_NNS of_IN suspicious_JJ fatty_JJ changes_NNS in_IN the_DT liver_NN were_VBD also_RB seen_VBN ._.
Of_IN the_DT 13_CD uteri_NN examined_VBD ,_, 11_CD were_VBD gravid_NNS ,_, the_DT foetuses_NNS being_VBG usually_RB past_JJ midterm_NN ._.
DIAGNOSIS_NNP No_NNP bacteriological_NN or_CC biological_JJ transmission_NN experiments_NNS could_MD be_VB carried_VBN out_RP ._.
Histopatholo-_NNP gical_JJ examination_NN of_IN two_CD brains_NNS showed_VBD no_DT noteworthy_JJ abnormalities_NNS ._.
DISCUSSION_NNP The_DT measures_NNS which_WDT were_VBD adopted_VBN and_CC which_WDT reduced_VBD the_DT mortality_NN to_TO almost_RB nil_VB in_IN subsequent_JJ batches_NNS were_VBD (_( 1_CD )_) purchasing_NN of_IN healthy-looking_JJ non-pregnant_JJ sheep_NN only_RB ,_, (_( 2_CD )_) proper_NN feeding_NN ,_, watering_VBG and_CC general_JJ care_NN during_IN transport_NN ,_, (_( 3_CD )_) suitable_JJ housing_NN facilities_NNS and_CC nourishing_VBG feed_NN provided_VBN on_IN arrival_NN at_IN Calcutta_NNP ._.
The_DT syndrome_NN of_IN nervous_JJ symptoms_NNS in_IN some_DT cases_NNS ,_, when_WRB considered_VBN along_IN with_IN the_DT fact_NN that_IN quite_PDT a_DT few_JJ pregnant_JJ sheep_NN were_VBD affected_VBN ,_, led_VBD us_PRP to_TO suspect_VB pregnancy_NN toxaemia_NN ,_, but_CC due_JJ to_TO lack_VB of_IN confirmatory_JJ evidence_NN ,_, it_PRP is_VBZ not_RB possible_JJ to_TO be_VB dogmatic_JJ on_IN the_DT point_NN ._.
Other_JJ possibilities_NNS such_JJ as_IN hypocalcaemia_NN ,_, hookworms_NNS ,_, etc_FW ._.
were_VBD o_RB considered_VBN ._.
Elder_NNP [_NN 1942_CD ]_NN states_NNS that_IN hypocalcaemia_NN may_MD cause_VB death_NN after_IN driving_VBG or_CC travelling_VBG long_JJ distances_NNS or_CC yarding_VBG for_IN a_DT long_JJ period_NN without_IN food_NN ._.
The_DT fact_NN that_WDT improvement_NN in_IN feeding_VBG reduced_VBD the_DT mortality_NN shows_VBZ that_IN the_DT cause_NN was_VBD some_DT metabolic_JJ disturbance_NN due_JJ to_TO temporary_JJ enforced_JJ fasting_NN and_CC its_PRP$ cumulative_JJ effects_NNS ._.
Franklin_NNP and_CC MacGregor_NNP [_NNP 1944_CD ]_NNP ,_, while_IN investigating_VBG the_DT causes_NNS of_IN the_DT death_NN of_IN merino_NN rams_NNS after_IN long_JJ journeys_NN by_IN rail_NN ,_, found_VBD that_IN the_DT rams_NNS on_IN arrival_NN have_VBP inflex_VBN appearance_NN ,_, depressed_VBN and_CC fickle_JJ appetite_NN with_IN loss_NN of_IN condition_NN and_CC a_DT characteristic_JJ stance_NN with_IN back_RB arched_VBN ,_, the_DT hind_NN legs_VBZ fairly_RB well_RB forward_RB beneath_IN the_DT body_NN and_CC the_DT head_NN held_VBD low_JJ and_CC disinclination_NN to_TO move_VB ._.
They_PRP concluded_VBD that_IN adequate_JJ roughage_NN and_CC preliminary_JJ education_NN in_IN trough_JJ feeding_NN would_MD assist_VB rams_NNS to_TO withstand_VB the_DT conditions_NNS of_IN transport_NN including_VBG the_DT primary_JJ and_CC secondary_JJ effects_NNS of_IN unavoidable_JJ periods_NNS of_IN fasting_VBG during_IN transit_NN ._.
In_IN an_DT experiment_NN in_IN which_WDT a_DT group_NN of_IN 100_CD rams_NNS was_VBD fed_VBN for_IN a_DT period_NN of_IN 10_CD days_NNS on_IN a_DT mixture_NN of_IN chaff_NN and_CC concentrates_NNS before_IN being_VBG trucked_VBN ,_, all_DT of_IN them_PRP arrived_VBD at_IN their_PRP$ destination_NN in_IN excellent_JJ condition_NN after_IN a_DT journey_NN of_IN 17_CD days_NNS ._.
This_DT sustained_VBD the_DT belief_NN that_IN hypocalcaemia_NN does_VBZ not_RB play_VB a_DT major_JJ part_NN in_IN the_DT syndrome_NN but_CC it_PRP is_VBZ possible_JJ that_IN some_DT of_IN the_DT sporadic_JJ cases_NNS which_WDT occur_VBP in_IN the_DT trucks_NNS may_MD result_VB from_IN acute_JJ hypocalcaemia_NN or_CC so-called_JJ transit_NN tetany_NN ._.
Franklin_NNP and_CC Reid_NNP [_NNP 1944_CD ]_NNP state_NN that_WDT care_NN should_MD be_VB exercised_VBN in_IN feeding_VBG linseed_NN nuts_NNS as_IN in_IN some_DT cases_NNS sheep_VBP may_MD arrive_VB in_IN a_DT healthy_JJ condition_NN yet_RB by_IN consuming_VBG these_DT in_IN large_JJ quantities_NNS a_DT sufficient_JJ amount_NN of_IN HCN_NNP may_MD be_VB produced_VBN to_TO cause_VB death_NN ._.

20_CD ,_, 332_CD MGIPCORIGINAL_NNP ARTICLES_NNP STUDIES_NNP ON_NNP CONTAGIOUS_NNP BOVINE_NNP PLEUROPNEUMONIA_NNP IN_NNP ASSAM_NNP By_IN J._NNP F._NNP SHIRLAW_NNP AND_NNP P._NNP R._NNP KRISHNA_NNP IYER_NNP ,_, Imperial_NNP Veterinary_NNP Research_NNP Institute_NNP ,_, Izatnagar_NNP (_( Received_VBN for_IN publication_NN on_IN 18th_CD April_NNP 1946_CD )_) (_( With_IN Plate_NNP IX_NNP )_) IN_VBZ a_DT previous_JJ article_NN [_NNP Shirlaw_NNP ,_, 1939_CD ]_NNP summarized_VBD reports_NNS on_IN contagious_JJ bovine_NN pleuropneumonia_NN from_IN the_DT provinces_NNS ,_, extending_VBG over_RP a_DT period_NN of_IN 50_CD years_NNS ,_, and_CC stated_VBD ,_, in_IN conclusion_NN ,_, that_IN no_DT direct_JJ evidence_NN of_IN the_DT existence_NN of_IN the_DT disease_NN in_IN India_NNP was_VBD availabe_RB ._.
Further_JJ work_NN now_RB shows_VBZ the_DT disease_NN to_TO exist_VB in_IN Assam_NNP ._.
The_DT disease_NN has_VBZ acquired_VBN the_DT name_NN 'Brahmaputra_POS Valley_NNP Disease_NNP '_POS owing_NN to_TO its_PRP$ prevalence_NN in_IN the_DT area_NN ._.
It_PRP is_VBZ sporadic_JJ and_CC occasional_JJ in_IN this_DT area_NN ,_, the_DT probable_JJ explanation_NN being_VBG that_IN the_DT country_NN is_VBZ divided_VBN by_IN the_DT river_NN into_IN numerous_JJ small_JJ islands_NNS ,_, each_DT with_IN its_PRP$ groups_NNS of_IN villages_NNS ._.
These_DT isolated_JJ agricultural_JJ settlements_NNS ,_, called_VBD chars_NNS afford_IN no_DT contact_NN between_IN cattle_NNS of_IN adjoining_VBG chars_NNS except_IN through_IN occasional_JJ cattle_NNS fairs_NNS ,_, which_WDT ,_, apparently_RB ,_, are_VBP the_DT origin_NN of_IN fresh_JJ outbreaks_NNS and_CC new_JJ centres_NNS of_IN infection_NN ._.
The_DT disease_NN runs_VBZ an_DT acute_JJ course_NN ,_, usually_RB of_IN one_CD to_TO three_CD weeks_NNS with_IN a_DT mortality_NN said_VBD to_TO be_VB 100_CD per_IN cent_NN ._.
The_DT carrier_NN problem_NN does_VBZ not_RB ,_, apparently_RB ,_, exist_JJ and_CC this_DT may_MD account_VB for_IN the_DT periodicity_NN of_IN the_DT disease_NN in_IN char_JJ lands_NNS ._.
Buffaloes_NNS are_VBP not_RB affected_VBN ._.
The_DT statement_NN that_IN the_DT disease_NN has_VBZ spread_VBN rapidly_RB in_IN Assam_NNP in_IN recent_JJ years_NNS is_VBZ somewhat_RB conflicting_JJ and_CC such_JJ figures_NNS as_IN are_VBP available_JJ would_MD hardly_RB support_VB the_DT statement_NN ._.
During_IN some_DT years_NNS the_DT incidence_NN may_MD be_VB higher_JJR than_IN in_IN others_NNS ,_, but_CC accurate_JJ data_NNS are_VBP not_RB available_JJ ._.
The_DT neighbouring_JJ province_NN of_IN Bengal_NNP is_VBZ said_VBD to_TO be_VB free_JJ ,_, largely_RB because_IN there_EX is_VBZ little_JJ movement_NN of_IN cattle_NNS between_IN the_DT two_CD provinces_NNS ._.
STRAINS_NN OF_IN THE_NNP VIRUS_NNP The_DT original_JJ Assam_NNP strain_NN (_( Assam_NNP 1_CD virus_NN )_) came_VBD as_IN crude_NN lymph_NN virus_NN from_IN an_DT outbreak_NN of_IN contagious_JJ bovine_NN pleuropneumonia_NN (_( October_NNP ,_, 1939_CD )_) in_IN district_NN Balishapara_NNP ._.

2_CD Brown_NNP opacity_NN tube_NN ._.

and_CC again_RB after_IN the_DT tubes_NN had_VBD stood_VBN at_IN 37º.5_CD C._NNP for_IN 24_CD and_CC 48_CD hours_NNS ._.
Agglutination_NN was_VBD usually_RB indefinite_JJ at_IN two_CD hours_NNS and_CC complete_JJ at_IN the_DT 24th_CD hour_NN with_IN no_DT variation_NN in_IN titre_NN at_IN the_DT 48th_CD hour_NN ._.
The_DT results_NNS of_IN the_DT second_JJ test_NN ,_, using_VBG formalinised_VBN antigen_NN ,_, are_VBP given_VBN in_IN J._NNP F._NNP SHIRLAW_NNP AND_NNP P._NNP R._NNP KRISHNA_NNP IYER_NNP 205_CD Table_NNP III_NNP ._.
The_DT sera_NN were_VBD tested_VBN 12_CD and_CC 30_CD days_NNS after_IN vaccination_NN ._.
It_PRP will_MD be_VB seen_VBN that_IN the_DT results_NNS with_IN carbolized_JJ antigen_NN were_VBD ,_, on_IN the_DT whole_NN ,_, more_RBR critical_JJ than_IN those_DT with_IN formalinised_JJ antigen_NN ._.
Further_RB ,_, Australian_JJ strains_VBZ 264_CD and_CC 173_CD ,_, Assam_NNP and_CC Kenya_NNP Narok_NNP show_VBP some_DT serological_JJ affinity_NN not_RB shared_VBN by_IN Kenya_NNP V4_NNP and_CC ML_NNP strains_NNS ._.
The_DT serological_JJ reactions_NNS in_IN animals_NNS 4_CD and_CC 8_CD in_IN Table_JJ II_NNP are_VBP contradictory_JJ and_CC can_MD not_RB be_VB explained_VBN ;_: both_DT these_DT animals_NNS showed_VBD an_DT equal_JJ immunity_NN on_IN test_NN ._.
The_DT results_NNS conform_NN in_IN general_JJ with_IN experience_NN recorded_VBN by_IN Daubney_NNP ,_, Dahmen_NNP ,_, Walker_NNP ,_, and_CC Ito_NNP and_CC his_PRP$ colleagues_NNS ._.

206_CD Bovine_NNP Pleuropneumonia_NNP DISCUSSION_NNP The_DT chief_JJ consideration_NN in_IN this_DT investigation_NN has_VBZ been_VBN to_TO determine_VB simple_JJ and_CC practical_JJ methods_NNS of_IN field_NN diagnosis_NN and_CC control_NN by_IN vaccination_NN ._.
In_IN India_NNP ,_, where_WRB the_DT cost_NN of_IN cattle_NNS is_VBZ low_JJ ,_, there_EX can_MD be_VB no_DT objection_NN to_TO the_DT destruction_NN of_IN a_DT few_JJ clinical_JJ cases_NNS when_WRB the_DT disease_NN is_VBZ suspected_VBN in_IN a_DT herd_NN or_CC in_IN an_DT area_NN ;_: lesions_NNS to_TO be_VB taken_VBN as_IN strongly_RB suspicious_JJ include_VBP a_DT tendency_NN for_IN pneumonia_NN to_TO be_VB un-_JJ ilateral_JJ ,_, marked_VBD pleurisy_NN with_IN a_DT rapidly_RB clotting_VBG exudate_NN and_CC marbling_NN of_IN the_DT pneumonic_JJ areas_NNS with_IN variegation_NN of_IN the_DT affected_JJ lobules_NNS ._.
In_IN all_DT fresh_JJ centres_NNS ,_, the_DT diagnosis_NN should_MD be_VB clinched_VBN by_IN sub-_JJ cutaneous_JJ inoculation_NN of_IN exudate_NN or_CC lung_NN mash_NN in_IN two_CD ,_, six_CD to_TO twelve-month_JJ old_JJ cattle_NNS ._.
The_DT resultant_JJ syndrome_NN and_CC lesions_NNS are_VBP fully_RB diagnostic_JJ ,_, a_DT fact_NN of_IN great_JJ importance_NN in_IN the_DT field_NN where_WRB laboratory_NN facilities_NNS do_VBP not_RB exist_VB ._.
Fortunately_RB ,_, in_IN Assam_NNP ,_, which_WDT in_IN our_PRP$ present_JJ knowledge_NN is_VBZ the_DT only_JJ area_NN in_IN India_NNP affected_VBD ,_, the_DT disease_NN runs_VBZ a_DT rapid_JJ course_NN and_CC is_VBZ always_RB fatal_JJ ._.
It_PRP is_VBZ not_RB necessary_JJ ,_, therefore_RB ,_, at_IN this_DT juncture_NN ,_, to_TO evolve_VB a_DT method_NN of_IN tracking_VBG down_RP carrier_NN animals_NNS ,_, without_IN which_WDT ordinarily_RB progress_NN in_IN the_DT control_NN of_IN the_DT disease_NN is_VBZ hardly_RB possible_JJ ._.
If_IN the_DT position_NN changes_NNS ,_, serological_JJ means_NNS of_IN diagnosis_NN will_MD have_VB to_TO be_VB considered_VBN ,_, but_CC it_PRP is_VBZ evident_JJ that_IN no_DT great_JJ reliance_NN can_MD be_VB placed_VBN on_IN the_DT agglutination_NN test_NN ._.
It_PRP is_VBZ felt_VBN ,_, however_RB ,_, that_IN a_DT more_RBR positive_JJ and_CC direct_JJ approach_NN to_TO diagnosis_VB ,_, at_IN least_JJS ,_, in_IN acute_NN or_CC recent_JJ cases_NNS ,_, can_MD often_RB be_VB achieved_VBN by_IN tapping_VBG the_DT chest_NN and_CC submitting_VBG the_DT exudate_NN so_RB obtained_VBN to_TO biological_JJ and_CC cultural_JJ test_NN ;_: this_DT should_MD be_VB a_DT first_JJ step_NN and_CC ,_, at_IN the_DT same_JJ time_NN ,_, the_DT pos-_JJ sibility_NN of_IN obtaining_VBG positive_JJ cultures_NNS from_IN the_DT blood_NN should_MD not_RB be_VB forgotten_VBN ._.
A_DT survey_NN of_IN the_DT literature_NN indicates_VBZ that_IN general_JJ agreement_NN has_VBZ not_RB been_VBN reached_VBN on_IN the_DT problem_NN of_IN immunity_NN ._.
The_DT criterion_NN of_IN success_NN must_MD depend_VB on_IN field_NN results_NNS assessed_VBD over_IN a_DT sufficiently_RB long_JJ period_NN ,_, and_CC these_DT are_VBP not_RB yet_RB available_JJ ._.
The_DT use_NN of_IN attenuated_JJ culture_NN vaccine_NN is_VBZ fairly_RB general_JJ in_IN Africa_NNP and_CC Australia_NNP ,_, but_CC infrequent_JJ references_NNS in_IN official_JJ reports_NNS leave_VBP an_DT impression_NN that_IN this_DT method_NN has_VBZ not_RB ,_, as_IN anticipated_VBN ,_, brought_VBD the_DT disease_NN under_IN control_NN ;_: rigorous_JJ quarantine_NN and_CC control_NN of_IN cattle_NNS movement_NN seem_VBP still_RB as_RB necessary_JJ as_IN ever_RB in_IN affected_JJ territories_NNS ._.
The_DT report_NN of_IN the_DT Tanganyika_NNP Terri-_NNP tory_NN Veterinary_NNP administration_NN [_NN 1937_CD ]_NN states_NNS that_IN no_DT efficient_NN or_CC feasible_JJ policy_NN for_IN the_DT eradication_NN of_IN the_DT disease_NN has_VBZ yet_RB been_VBN formulated_VBN ._.
Is_VBZ it_PRP possible_JJ that_IN existing_VBG methods_NNS of_IN vaccination_NN ,_, parti-_JJ cularly_NN with_IN attenuated_JJ culture_NN vaccine_NN ,_, are_VBP not_RB wholly_RB satisfactory_JJ ?_.
There_EX are_VBP pointers_NNS in_IN this_DT direction_NN ._.
For_IN example_NN ,_, of_IN six_CD cattle_NNS vaccinated_VBD with_IN 16th_CD generation_NN Assam_NNP culture_NN ,_, two_CD reacted_VBD severely_RB and_CC died_VBD whilst_IN the_DT remainder_NN were_VBD solidly_RB immune_JJ to_TO a_DT relatively_RB large_JJ dose_NN of_IN lymph_JJ virus_NN given_VBN subcutaneously_RB at_IN the_DT point_NN of_IN the_DT shoulder_NN ._.
Using_VBG a_DT somewhat_RB further_JJ attenuated_VBD Assam_NNP culture_NN ,_, i.e_NN ._.
20th_JJ generation_NN ,_, none_NN of_IN six_CD cattle_NNS vaccinated_VBD showed_VBD any_DT reaction_NN ,_, obviously_RB because_IN of_IN a_DT greater_JJR attenuation_NN of_IN the_DT culture_NN ,_, and_CC on_IN a_DT subsequent_JJ immunity_NN test_NN none_NN had_VBD the_DT same_JJ level_NN of_IN immunity_NN ._.
The_DT inference_NN seems_VBZ that_IN some_DT loss_NN of_IN immunizing_VBG power_NN follows_VBZ attenua-_JJ tion_NN of_IN the_DT culture_NN ,_, even_RB within_IN narrow_JJ limits_NNS ,_, and_CC it_PRP would_MD appear_VB that_IN ,_, within_IN the_DT limits_NNS of_IN safety_NN ,_, it_PRP is_VBZ desirable_JJ to_TO use_VB a_DT potent_JJ culture_NN if_IN a_DT strong_JJ degree_NN of_IN immunity_NN is_VBZ to_TO be_VB established_VBN ._.
In_IN the_DT experience_NN of_IN most_JJS workers_NNS ,_, the_DT experimental_JJ work_NN on_IN immunity_NN has_VBZ not_RB been_VBN capable_JJ of_IN exact_JJ analysis_NN ,_, on_IN account_NN of_IN the_DT difficulty_NN in_IN deciding_VBG on_IN the_DT type_NN of_IN immunity_NN test_NN that_WDT should_MD be_VB employed_VBN ._.
It_PRP is_VBZ generally_RB stated_VBN that_IN the_DT subcutaneous_JJ inoculation_NN of_IN lymph_NN virus_NN is_VBZ too_RB drastic_JJ a_DT test_NN ._.
The_DT results_NNS recorded_VBD in_IN this_DT paper_NN plainly_RB show_VBP that_IN ,_, if_IN an_DT animal_NN has_VBZ been_VBN successfully_RB immunized_VBN ,_, it_PRP can_MD certainly_RB withstand_VB this_DT test_NN ._.
On_IN this_DT criterion_NN ,_, the_DT degree_NN and_CC durability_NN of_IN immunity_NN con-_NN ferred_VBN by_IN the_DT 20th_JJ generation_NN Assam_NNP culture_NN is_VBZ relatively_RB slight_JJ compared_VBN with_IN that_DT following_VBG tail-_JJ tip_JJ vaccination_NN with_IN a_DT 5th-8th_JJ generation_NN culture_NN which_WDT inevitably_RB provokes_VBZ a_DT fatal_JJ reaction_NN if_IN ino-_JJ culated_VBD subcutaneously_RB at_IN the_DT point_NN of_IN the_DT shoulder_NN in_IN the_DT same_JJ cattle_NNS ._.
The_DT same_JJ remarks_NNS apply_VBP to_TO the_DT use_NN of_IN lymph_NN virus_NN somewhat_RB attenuated_VBN by_IN storage_NN at_IN +5ºC_NNP ._.
It_PRP appears_VBZ from_IN the_DT results_NNS recorded_VBD that_IN either_DT of_IN these_DT methods_NNS can_MD be_VB expected_VBN to_TO give_VB reliable_JJ results_NNS in_IN the_DT field_NN ,_, and_CC each_DT has_VBZ the_DT advantage_NN of_IN only_RB one_CD vaccination_NN being_VBG necessary_JJ ._.
Little_JJ evidence_NN is_VBZ as_RB yet_RB available_JJ in_IN India_NNP to_TO assess_VB the_DT value_NN of_IN vaccination_NN on_IN these_DT lines_NNS ,_, but_CC of_IN approximately_RB 200_CD cattle_NNS vaccinated_VBD tail-tip_JJ with_IN virulent_JJ 8th_CD generation_NN Assam_NNP culture_NN in_IN one_CD of_IN the_DT worst_JJS affected_JJ areas_NNS in_IN Assam_NNP ,_, none_NN had_VBD contracted_VBN the_DT disease_NN 19_CD months_NNS later_RB ._.
Adapting_VBG the_DT original_JJ Willem_NNP 's_POS technique_NN of_IN vac-_JJ cination_NN to_TO a_DT fully_RB virulent_JJ culture_NN seems_VBZ a_DT dicided_JJ improvement_NN in_IN vaccination_NN technique_NN ._.
It_PRP is_VBZ quite_RB clear_JJ from_IN the_DT literature_NN that_IN the_DT original_JJ technique_NN ,_, using_VBG fresh_JJ virulent_NN lymph_NN ,_, is_VBZ unsafe_JJ ,_, although_IN productive_NN of_IN a_DT high_JJ order_NN of_IN immunity_NN ._.
It_PRP has_VBZ not_RB been_VBN therefore_RB ,_, generally_RB employed_VBN ,_, J._NNP F._NNP SHIRSAW_NNP AND_NNP P._NNP R._NNP KRISHNA_NNP IYER_NNP 207_CD save_NN in_IN continental_JJ countries_NNS where_WRB the_DT losses_NNS incurred_VBN by_IN the_DT method_NN are_VBP presumably_RB justified_VBN by_IN the_DT results_NNS as_IN a_DT whole_NN ._.
The_DT modification_NN of_IN the_DT method_NN is_VBZ free_JJ from_IN any_DT objection_NN ,_, so_RB much_RB so_IN that_IN it_PRP has_VBZ been_VBN reported_VBN from_IN Assam_NNP that_WDT cattle_VBZ so_RB vaccinated_JJ are_VBP in_IN no_DT way_NN incapacitated_VBN from_IN full_JJ work_NN ,_, which_WDT is_VBZ a_DT very_RB pertinent_JJ consideration_NN in_IN India_NNP ._.
If_IN vaccination_NN camps_NNS staffed_VBN by_IN competent_JJ men_NNS can_MD be_VB provided_VBN ,_, and_CC cattle_NNS owners_NNS be_VB persuaded_VBN to_TO bring_VB their_PRP$ cattle_NNS for_IN vaccination_NN ,_, the_DT method_NN is_VBZ one_CD that_WDT could_MD immediately_RB be_VB put_VBN in_IN operation_NN ._.
Otherwise_RB ,_, any_DT method_NN of_IN vaccination_NN that_WDT entails_VBZ the_DT use_NN of_IN a_DT fragile_JJ culture_NN vaccine_NN is_VBZ inoperable_JJ ._.
It_PRP is_VBZ conceivable_JJ that_IN this_DT difficulty_NN could_MD be_VB overcome_VBN by_IN the_DT use_NN of_IN lymph_NN virus_NN attenuated_VBN by_IN storage_NN at_IN 5ºC_CD ._.
One_CD virus_NN producer_NN will_MD yield_VB sufficient_JJ vaccine_NN to_TO immunize_VB over_IN 1,000_CD head_NN of_IN cattle_NNS at_IN a_DT trifling_NN cost_NN ,_, and_CC the_DT upkeep_NN of_IN labora-_JJ tories_NNS and_CC trained_JJ personnel_NNS ,_, which_WDT would_MD be_VB necessary_JJ if_IN the_DT first_JJ method_NN were_VBD generally_RB adopted_VBN ,_, could_MD be_VB dispensed_VBN with_IN ._.
Lastly_RB ,_, very_RB little_JJ attention_NN has_VBZ been_VBN paid_VBN by_IN workers_NNS to_TO the_DT possibility_NN of_IN an_DT antitoxic_JJ immunity_NN ._.
Nocard_NNP [_NN 1898_CD ]_NN observed_VBD that_IN ,_, when_WRB the_DT organism_NN of_IN pleuropneumonia_NN was_VBD grown_VBN in_IN collodion_NN sacs_NN placed_VBN in_IN the_DT abdominal_JJ cavity_NN of_IN rabbits_NNS ,_, these_DT animals_NNS usually_RB became_VBD cachectic_JJ and_CC died_VBD ._.
Since_IN no_DT lesions_NNS were_VBD present_JJ at_IN autopsy_NN ,_, and_CC the_DT organism_NN could_MD not_RB be_VB isolated_VBN from_IN any_DT of_IN the_DT tissues_NNS ,_, this_DT worker_NN concluded_VBD that_IN the_DT phenomenon_NN was_VBD due_JJ to_TO the_DT diffusion_NN of_IN toxins_NNS through_IN the_DT collodion_NN membrane_NN ._.
At_IN the_DT same_JJ time_NN ,_, he_PRP commented_VBD on_IN the_DT fact_NN that_IN the_DT rabbit_NN is_VBZ quite_RB refractory_JJ to_TO infection_NN with_IN virulent_JJ cultures_NNS of_IN the_DT organism_NN ._.
Sabin_NNP [_NN 1938_CD ]_NN states_NNS ,_, in_IN refer-_JJ ence_NN to_TO the_DT foregoing_NN observation_NN ,_, 'in_'' keeping_VBG with_IN this_DT is_VBZ the_DT observation_NN that_IN cattle_NNS may_MD die_VB after_IN subcutaneous_JJ injection_NN of_IN infected_JJ lymph_NN or_CC culture_NN ,_, although_IN the_DT only_JJ lesion_NN is_VBZ at_IN the_DT site_NN of_IN inocu-_JJ lation_NN '_POS and_CC comments_NNS on_IN the_DT fact_NN that_IN the_DT possible_JJ production_NN of_IN an_DT exotoxin_NN by_IN the_DT bovine_JJ pleuro-_JJ pneumonia_NN organism_NN is_VBZ a_DT neglected_JJ field_NN of_IN study_NN ,_, especially_RB since_IN it_PRP has_VBZ been_VBN lately_RB shown_VBN that_IN at_IN least_JJS one_CD other_JJ member_NN of_IN the_DT genus_NN produces_VBZ a_DT true_JJ toxin_NN in_IN vivo_NN and_CC in_IN vitro_NN ._.
Curasson_NNP [_NN 1936_CD ]_NN comments_NNS that_IN the_DT problem_NN has_VBZ never_RB been_VBN really_RB studied_VBN ,_, and_CC quots_VB the_DT work_NN of_IN Arloing_NNP [_NN 1888_CD ]_NN ,_, who_WP claimed_VBD to_TO have_VB isolated_VBN ,_, from_IN lymph_JJ virus_NN ,_, a_DT relatively_RB thermostable_JJ toxin_NN with_IN a_DT specific_JJ effect_NN on_IN bovine_NN tissues_NNS ._.
Certainly_RB ,_, no_DT work_NN has_VBZ been_VBN done_VBN ,_, in_IN our_PRP$ knowledge_NN ,_, on_IN the_DT feasibility_NN of_IN an_DT antitoxic_JJ immunity_NN ._.
In_IN one_CD experiment_NN recorded_VBN in_IN this_DT paper_NN ,_, three_CD cattle_NNS were_VBD subcutaneously_RB inoculated_VBN with_IN a_DT Berkefeld_NNP N_NNP filtrate_NN of_IN virulent_NN lymph_NN ,_, no_DT reaction_NN ensuing_VBG ._.
Twenty-four_CD days_NNS later_RB ,_, these_DT animals_NNS were_VBD put_VBN to_TO a_DT standard_JJ immunity_NN test_NN and_CC none_NN proved_VBD immune_JJ ._.
The_DT experi-_JJ ment_NN was_VBD repeated_VBN in_IN two_CD cattle_NNS ,_, but_CC in_IN this_DT case_NN the_DT immunity_NN test_NN was_VBD delayed_VBN for_IN 112_CD days_NNS ,_, both_DT animals_NNS proving_VBG solidly_RB immune_JJ ._.
In_IN this_DT experiment_NN there_EX are_VBP three_CD factors_NNS to_TO consider_VB ,_, (_( a_DT )_) the_DT pleuropneumonia_JJ organism_NN does_VBZ not_RB ,_, in_IN our_PRP$ experience_NN ,_, pass_VBP a_DT Berkefeld_NNP N_NNP filter_NN ,_, (_( b_NN )_) further_RBR proof_NN of_IN this_DT is_VBZ the_DT negative_JJ reaction_NN in_IN cattle_NNS subcutaneously_RB inoculated_VBN with_IN such_JJ filtrates_NNS (_( c_NN )_) immunity_NN develops_VBZ slowly_RB ,_, the_DT time_NN lag_NN being_VBG apparently_RB parallel_VBN with_IN the_DT virulence_NN of_IN the_DT vaccine_NN used_VBN [_JJ Pur-_JJ chase_NN ,_, 1939_CD ]_NN ._.
It_PRP is_VBZ possible_JJ that_IN an_DT antitoxic_JJ immunity_NN was_VBD established_VBN in_IN animals_NNS used_VBN in_IN the_DT second_JJ test_NN and_CC the_DT evidence_NN so_RB obtained_JJ indicates_NNS that_IN a_DT full_JJ investigation_NN into_IN this_DT aspect_NN of_IN the_DT problem_NN of_IN immunity_NN might_MD be_VB well_RB repaid_VBN ._.
SUMMARY_NNP 1_CD ._.
Contagious_JJ bovine_NN pleuropneumonia_NN exists_VBZ in_IN the_DT province_NN of_IN Assam_NNP ._.
2_CD ._.
The_DT two_CD strains_NNS of_IN virus_NN that_WDT have_VBP been_VBN studied_VBN show_VBP an_DT immunological_JJ relationship_NN with_IN each_DT other_JJ and_CC with_IN strains_NNS received_VBN from_IN Australia_NNP and_CC Kenya_NNP ._.
3_CD ._.
The_DT Assam_NNP virus_NN when_WRB inoculated_VBN subcutaneously_RB at_IN the_DT point_NN of_IN the_DT shoulder_NN in_IN Kumaoni_NNP cattle_VBP causes_VBZ 90_CD per_IN cent_NN mortality_NN ,_, specific_JJ lesions_NNS ,_, hitherto_NN undescribed_JJ ,_, in_IN the_DT spleen_NN and_CC the_DT abo-_JJ masum_NN ,_, and_CC ,_, in_IN some_DT cases_NNS ,_, pleuropneumonia_NN ._.
4_CD ._.
The_DT Indian_JJ buffalo_NN seems_VBZ insusceptible_JJ to_TO the_DT disease_NN in_IN the_DT field_NN and_CC of_IN two_CD buffaloes_NNS sub-_JJ cutaneously_RB inoculated_VBN with_IN fully_RB virulent_JJ virus_NN ,_, one_CD reacted_VBD and_CC recovered_VBD ._.
The_DT goat_NN is_VBZ slightly_RB susceptible_JJ to_TO subcutaneous_JJ inoculation_NN with_IN the_DT virus_NN and_CC sheep_JJ refractory_NN and_CC small_JJ laboratory_NN animals_NNS resistant_VBP ._.
5_CD ._.
The_DT virus_NN uniformly_JJ passes_VBZ a_DT Berkefeld_NNP V_NNP but_CC not_RB a_DT Berkefeld_NNP N_NNP filter_NN ._.
It_PRP will_MD also_RB pass_VB L3_NNP and_CC L5_NNP but_CC not_RB L7_NNP ;_: occasionally_RB it_PRP passes_VBZ a_DT Seitz_NNP E._NNP K._NNP filter_NN ._.
6_CD ._.
Immunity_NN experiments_NNS with_IN formalinised_JJ virus_NN vaccine_NN gave_VBD negative_JJ results_NNS ._.
In_IN two_CD im-_JJ munity_NN experiments_NNS with_IN a_DT muscle_NN powder_NN vaccine_NN attenuated_VBN by_IN exposure_NN to_TO 70ºC_CD ,_, for_IN 2_CD hours_NNS or_CC C_NNP 208_CD Studies_NNPS on_IN Pleuropneumonia_NNP 55ºC_CD ._.
for_IN 2_CD days_NNS ,_, the_DT first_JJ test_NN indicated_VBD that_IN a_DT strong_JJ immunity_NN was_VBD conferred_VBN by_IN the_DT vaccine_NN ._.
These_DT results_NNS were_VBD not_RB repeated_VBN in_IN a_DT second_JJ test_NN ,_, although_IN the_DT conditions_NNS of_IN this_DT test_NN were_VBD somewhat_RB different_JJ from_IN the_DT first_JJ ._.
A_DT modification_NN of_IN Willem_NNP 's_POS tail_NN tip_NN vaccination_NN ,_, using_VBG slightly_RB attenuated_VBN cultures_NNS ,_, produces_VBZ a_DT high_JJ grade_NN immunity_NN superior_JJ to_TO that_DT produced_VBN by_IN cultures_NNS attenuated_VBN so_RB as_IN to_TO be_VB safe_JJ on_IN subcutaneous_JJ inoculation_NN ._.
An_DT equally_RB good_JJ immunity_NN can_MD be_VB produced_VBN by_IN subcutaneous_JJ ino-_JJ culation_NN of_IN lymph_JJ virus_NN refrigerated_VBD at_IN 5°C_CD ._.
for_IN just_RB over_IN three_CD months_NNS ._.
7_CD ._.
The_DT direct_JJ agglutination_NN test_NN did_VBD not_RB give_VB clear-cut_JJ reactions_NNS in_IN assessing_VBG immunity_NN or_CC in_IN serological_JJ identification_NN of_IN strains_NNS ._.
8_CD ._.
The_DT morphological_JJ and_CC cultural_JJ characters_NNS of_IN the_DT organism_NN isolated_VBN from_IN cases_NNS of_IN bovine_NN pleuropneumonia_NN in_IN Assam_NNP are_VBP described_VBN ._.

36_CD ,_, 196_CD A_NNP PRELIMINARY_NNP NOTE_NNP ON_NNP VACCINATION_NNP AGAINST_NNP BOVINE_NNP CONTAGIOUS_NNP PLEUROPNEUMONIA_NNP IN_NNP ASSAM*_NNP By_IN V._NNP R._NNP GOPALAKRISHNAN_NNP ,_, Veterinary_NNP Investigation_NNP Officer_NNP ,_, Assam_NNP (_( Received_VBN for_IN publication_NN on_IN 10th_CD April_NNP 1946_CD )_) IN_VBZ a_DT previous_JJ article_NN [_NNP Gopalakrishnan_NNP ,_, 1943_CD ]_VBD an_DT account_NN was_VBD given_VBN of_IN the_DT occurrence_NN of_IN bovine_NN contagious_JJ pleuropneumonia_NN in_IN Assam_NNP ,_, as_IN a_DT specific_JJ epizootic_JJ with_IN a_DT tendency_NN to_TO spread_VB in_IN a_DT slow_JJ and_CC insidious_JJ manner_NN ._.
The_DT high_JJ rate_NN of_IN mortality_NN ,_, ranking_VBG almost_RB next_JJ to_TO that_DT of_IN rinderpest_NN ,_, was_VBD recorded_VBN and_CC the_DT necessity_NN for_IN taking_VBG effective_JJ control_NN measures_NNS was_VBD emphasized_VBN ._.
The_DT im-_JJ portance_NN of_IN vaccination_NN in_IN the_DT control_NN of_IN the_DT disease_NN was_VBD also_RB indicated_VBN ._.
In_IN the_DT present_JJ paper_NN an_DT attempt_NN is_VBZ made_VBN to_TO give_VB the_DT details_NNS of_IN the_DT preliminary_JJ field_NN trials_NNS with_IN contagious_JJ pleuropneumonia_NNS vaccine_NN prepared_VBN at_IN the_DT Imperial_NNP Veterinary_NNP Research_NNP Institute_NNP ,_, Izatnagar_NNP ._.
The_DT product_NN used_VBN was_VBD a_DT culture-virus-vaccine_JJ tested_VBN by_IN tail_NN tip_NN inoculation_NN (_( Willem_NNP 's_POS method_NN )_) ._.
EXPERIMENTAL_NNP VACCINATION_NNP Arrangement_NNP was_VBD made_VBN to_TO stage_VB a_DT field_NN test_NN of_IN pleuropneumonia_NN vaccine_NN at_IN Gauhati_NNP ._.
Five_CD local_JJ indigenous_JJ cattle210_NN Against_NNP Bovine_NNP Pleuropneumonia_NNP Vaccination_NNP Out_NNP of_IN the_DT five_CD vaccinated_VBD cattle_NNS ,_, one_CD bullock_NN died_VBD of_IN distomatosis_NN and_CC anaemia_NN in_IN July_NNP 1943_CD and_CC a_DT cow_NN strayed_VBN away_RB in_IN May_NNP 1944_CD and_CC could_MD not_RB be_VB traced_VBN ._.
The_DT remaining_VBG three_CD animals_NNS and_CC a_DT healthy_JJ bull_NN as_IN control_NN ,_, were_VBD injected_VBN subcutaneously_RB with_IN 0.5_CD c.c_NNS ._.
of_IN pneumonic_JJ lung_NN emulsion_NN and_CC pleuritic_JJ effusion_NN on_IN the_DT 24th_CD November_NNP 1944_CD ._.
Reaction_NNP The_DT vaccinated_JJ animals_NNS showed_VBD slight_JJ local_JJ swelling_NN ._.
It_PRP was_VBD hard_RB ,_, slightly_RB painful_JJ and_CC localized_VBN ._.
It_PRP remained_VBD almost_RB the_DT same_JJ size_NN for_IN about_IN a_DT week_NN and_CC then_RB gradually_RB disappeared_VBN ._.
In_IN one_CD animal_NN the_DT local_JJ swelling_NN was_VBD slightly_RB bigger_JJR than_IN those_DT of_IN the_DT other_JJ two_CD and_CC also_RB subsided_VBD a_DT few_JJ days_NNS later_RB ._.
There_EX was_VBD no_DT thermal_JJ reaction_NN and_CC the_DT animals_NNS appeared_VBD normal_JJ and_CC healthy_JJ during_IN the_DT observed_JJ period_NN of_IN three_CD months_NNS ._.
The_DT reaction_NN in_IN the_DT control_NN bull_NN was_VBD typical_JJ and_CC similar_JJ to_TO those_DT previously_RB observed_VBN in_IN the_DT transmission_NN experiments_NNS ._.
The_DT animal_NN appeared_VBD dull_NN on_IN the_DT 8th_CD day_NN and_CC the_DT local_JJ swelling_NN began_VBD to_TO extend_VB from_IN the_DT seat_NN of_IN inoculation_NN to_TO the_DT region_NN of_IN the_DT left_JJ shoulder_NN ._.
There_EX was_VBD rise_NN of_IN tempe-_JJ rature_NN up_IN to_TO 105.2ºF_CD ._.
(_( 10th_CD day_NN )_) and_CC later_RBR it_PRP was_VBD a_DT degree_NN or_CC two_CD more_JJR than_IN the_DT normal_JJ ._.
At_IN first_RB ,_, the_DT swelling_VBG at_IN the_DT seat_NN of_IN inoculation_NN was_VBD hot_JJ ,_, painful_JJ and_CC oedematous_JJ ._.
Then_RB ,_, it_PRP increased_VBD in_IN size_NN ,_, progressively_RB extending_VBG further_RBR and_CC involving_VBG the_DT neighbouring_NN tissues_NNS ._.
There_EX was_VBD no_DT indication_NN of_IN abscess_JJ formation_NN ._.
The_DT swelling_VBG extended_VBD to_TO more_JJR than_IN half_JJ way_NN in_IN the_DT region_NN of_IN the_DT neck_NN ,_, down_RB to_TO the_DT dew-lap_NN and_CC to_TO the_DT sternal_JJ region_NN ,_, presenting_VBG a_DT contiguous_JJ extensive_JJ swelling_NN ._.
Appetite_NNP was_VBD impaired_VBN and_CC the_DT bull_NN was_VBD very_RB dull_JJ with_IN staring_VBG coat_NN ._.
The_DT general_JJ condition_NN was_VBD poor_JJ ._.
During_IN the_DT early_JJ stage_NN it_PRP was_VBD lame_JJ and_CC subsequently_VBD it_PRP limped_VBD on_IN three_CD legs_NNS and_CC finally_RB assumed_VBD recumbent_JJ position_NN for_IN about_IN three_CD days_NNS before_IN it_PRP died_VBD on_IN the_DT 19th_CD December_NNP 1944_CD (_( 25th_CD day_NN )_) ._.
Post-mortem_JJ lesions_NNS at_IN the_DT seat_NN of_IN inoculation_NN were_VBD extensive_JJ ._.
The_DT cut_NN surface_NN was_VBD reddish-_JJ yellow_NN in_IN colour_NN ,_, firm_NN and_CC hard_RB in_IN consistency_NN ._.
There_EX was_VBD oedema_NN with_IN pronounced_JJ serous_JJ infiltra-_JJ tion_NN of_IN the_DT subcutaneous_JJ and_CC intramuscular_JJ connective_JJ tissues_NNS ._.
The_DT prescapular_JJ lymph_NN gland_NN was_VBD enlarged_VBN and_CC oedematous_JJ ._.
There_EX was_VBD nothing_NN note-worthy_JJ in_IN the_DT lungs_NNS ._.
DISCUSSION_NNP Cattle_NNP vaccinated_VBD on_IN the_DT 12th_CD January_NNP 1943_CD were_VBD tested_VBN for_IN immunity_NN on_IN the_DT 24th_CD November_NNP 1944_CD with_IN a_DT fresh_JJ and_CC virulent_JJ strain_NN obtained_VBN from_IN a_DT seat_NN of_IN outbreak_NN of_IN bovine_NN contagious_JJ pleuro-_JJ pneumonia_NN ._.
The_DT control_NN bull_NN reacted_VBD typically_RB and_CC died_VBD ,_, manifesting_VBG specific_JJ lesions_NNS ._.
Out_IN of_IN the_DT three_CD vaccinated_VBD cattle_NNS ,_, one_CD showed_VBD slight_JJ reaction_NN or_CC rather_RB more_JJR local_JJ reaction_NN than_IN the_DT other_JJ two_CD ,_, and_CC all_PDT the_DT three_CD survived_VBD ._.
Although_IN the_DT number_NN of_IN animals_NNS tested_VBN is_VBZ small_JJ for_IN drawing_VBG definite_JJ conclusions_NNS ,_, yet_RB there_RB seems_VBZ to_TO be_VB evidence_NN that_IN the_DT duration_NN of_IN immunity_NN is_VBZ nearabout_RB 22_CD months_NNS ._.
The_DT fresh_JJ material_NN used_VBN for_IN the_DT immunity_NN test_NN ,_, was_VBD also_RB sent_VBN to_TO the_DT Imperial_NNP Veterinary_NNP Research_NNP Institute_NNP ,_, Izatnagar_NNP ,_, from_IN which_WDT the_DT virus_NN was_VBD obtained_VBN ._.
In_IN this_DT connection_NN ,_, it_PRP is_VBZ interesting_VBG to_TO refer_VB to_TO the_DT work_NN in_IN Australia_NNP ._.
A_DT different_JJ technique_NN has_VBZ been_VBN developed_VBN and_CC is_VBZ now_RB employed_VBN for_IN experimentally_RB reproducing_VBG the_DT typical_JJ pulmonary_JJ disease_NN in_IN cattle_NNS as_RB well_RB as_IN for_IN testing_VBG the_DT value_NN of_IN immunization_NN procedures_NNS (_( private_JJ communication_NN dated_VBD the_DT 4th_CD December_NNP 1944_CD from_IN Dr_NNP A._NNP W._NNP Turner_NNP )_) ._.
Campbell_NNP [_NNP 1938_CD ]_NN has_VBZ reported_VBN that_IN the_DT disease_NN produced_VBD experimentally_RB in_IN cattle_NNS ,_, by_IN the_DT atomization_NN technique_NN ,_, is_VBZ in_IN all_DT respects_NNS identical_JJ with_IN the_DT naturally_RB occurring_VBG disease_NN ._.
The_DT exposure_NN of_IN animals_NNS to_TO finely_RB atomized_JJ culture_NN is_VBZ also_RB used_VBN as_IN a_DT method_NN of_IN testing_VBG cattle_NNS for_IN resistance_NN produced_VBN following_VBG vaccination_NN ._.
The_DT results_NNS of_IN experimental_JJ tests_NNS by_IN this_DT method_NN are_VBP reported_VBN to_TO indicate_VB that_DT immunity_NN is_VBZ maintained_VBN for_IN more_JJR than_IN twelve_JJ months_NNS ._.
Further_RB ,_, he_PRP suggested_VBD that_IN animals_NNS vaccinated_VBN with_IN a_DT strain_NN of_IN the_DT organism_NN ,_, possessing_VBG a_DT relatively_RB high_JJ degree_NN of_IN virulence_NN ,_, maintain_VBP a_DT high_JJ and_CC lasting_JJ immunity_NN ._.
In_IN case_NN of_IN comparatively_RB avirulent_JJ strain_NN ,_, the_DT immunity_NN is_VBZ said_VBD to_TO wane_VB after_IN two_CD months_NNS ._.
In_IN regard_NN to_TO single_JJ and_CC double_JJ vaccinated_JJ cattle_NNS ,_, there_EX appears_VBZ to_TO be_VB no_DT significant_JJ difference_NN in_IN the_DT immunity_NN set_VBN up_RP when_WRB exposed_VBN at_IN an_DT interval_NN of_IN twelve_JJ months_NNS after_IN vaccination_NN ._.
SUMMARY_NN Details_NNS are_VBP given_VBN of_IN the_DT experimental_JJ vaccination_NN carried_VBD out_RP in_IN two_CD localitiesV_NN ._.
R._NNP GOPALAKRISHNAN_NNP 211_CD A_NNP preliminary_JJ ,_, small-scale_JJ experimental_JJ test_NN of_IN the_DT vaccinated_JJ cattle_NNS ,_, undertaken_JJ to_TO determine_VB the_DT degree_NN and_CC duration_NN of_IN immunity_NN by_IN using_VBG fresh_JJ field_NN strain_NN of_IN the_DT virus_NN for_IN the_DT test_NN ,_, is_VBZ described_VBN ._.
There_EX is_VBZ evidence_NN of_IN sufficient_JJ degree_NN of_IN immunity_NN ,_, the_DT duration_NN of_IN which_WDT appears_VBZ to_TO be_VB about_IN 22_CD months_NNS ._.

S._NNP PRABHU_NNP AND_NNP V._NNP N._NNP AMBLE_NNP 215_CD TABLE_NNP II216_NNP Weaned_VBD Versus_NNP Unweaned_NNP TABLE_NNP IIS_NNP ._.
S._NNP PRABHU_NNP AND_NNP V._NNP N._NNP AMBLE_NNP 217_CD The_DT differences_NNS now_RB obtained_VBN were_VBD tested_VBN for_IN significance_NN ,_, by_IN carrying_VBG out_RP the_DT analysis_NN of_IN residual_JJ variance_NN for_IN each_DT lactation_NN (_( Table_JJ II_NNP C_NNP )_) ._.

143.37_CD 73.03_CD The_DT relatively-high_JJ values_NNS of_IN experimental_JJ error_NN given_VBN above_IN ,_, even_RB after_IN making_VBG the_DT adjust-_JJ ments_NNS ,_, point_NN out_RP that_IN there_EX had_VBD been_VBN effects_NNS on_IN the_DT experimental_JJ animals_NNS not_RB properly_RB accounted_VBN for_IN in_IN this_DT analysis_NN ._.
