As_IN the_DT error_NN due_JJ to_TO these_DT causes_NNS ,_, is_VBZ seen_VBN to_TO be_VB considerable_JJ to_TO that_DT extent_NN the_DT sensitiveness_NN of_IN the_DT statistical_JJ test_NN employed_VBN has_VBZ been_VBN reduced_VBN ._.
(_( II_NNP )_) Effect_NNP of_IN weaning_VBG on_IN the_DT male_NN and_CC female_JJ kids_NNS Year-wise_JJ enumeration_NN of_IN the_DT kids_NNS employed_VBD for_IN the_DT study_NN ,_, during_IN the_DT entire_JJ experimental_JJ period_NN of_IN five_CD years_NNS ,_, is_VBZ given_VBN in_IN Table_NNP III_NNP ._.
In_IN all_DT ,_, a_DT total_NN of_IN 128_CD kids_NNS were_VBD used_VBN ;_: 67_CD in_IN Group_NNP A_NNP (_( 32_CD males_NNS ;_: 35_CD females_NNS )_) and_CC 61_CD in_IN Group_NNP B_NNP (_( 30_CD males_NNS ;_: 31_CD females_NNS )_) ._.
In_IN computing_VBG the_DT above_JJ figures_NNS ,_, as_IN also_RB in_IN the_DT analysis_NN ,_, no_DT account_NN was_VBD taken_VBN of_IN kids_NNS whose_WP$ monthly_JJ live_JJ weight_NN data_NNS were_VBD not_RB available_JJ for_IN a_DT full_JJ year_NN ._.
Average_JJ weights_NNS and_CC growth_NN rates_NNS were_VBD obtained_VBN by_IN fitting_VBG straight_JJ lines_NNS to_TO the_DT 12_CD monthly_JJ live_JJ weight_NN observations_NNS ._.

29.06_CD 27.63_CD +_NN 1.43_CD 26.06_CD 26.73_CD 222_CD Weaned_VBD Versus_NNP Unweaned_VBD such_PDT a_DT basis_NN would_MD under-estimate_VB the_DT actual_JJ yields_NNS ._.
No_DT doubt_NN this_DT method_NN would_MD be_VB to_TO the_DT dis-_JJ advantage_NN of_IN the_DT dams_NNS in_IN Group_NNP B_NNP ._.
Even_RB than_IN ,_, statistical_JJ analysis_NN shows_NNS ,_, that_IN the_DT average_JJ difference_NN in_IN lactation_NN yields_NNS ,_, after_IN correcting_VBG for_IN the_DT length_NN of_IN the_DT wet_JJ period_NN ,_, between_IN the_DT weaned_JJ and_CC un-_JJ weaned_JJ groups_NNS of_IN animals_NNS ,_, is_VBZ not_RB significant_JJ ._.
This_DT finding_NN has_VBZ to_TO be_VB read_VBN in_IN conjunction_NN with_IN what_WP is_VBZ said_VBD at_IN (_( b_NN )_) above_IN ._.
Though_IN no_DT definite_JJ conclusions_NNS are_VBP justifiable_JJ ,_, it_PRP would_MD appear_VB that_IN probably_RB the_DT animals_NNS get_VBP used_VBN to_TO the_DT treatment_NN after_IN some_DT time_NN and_CC hence_RB no_DT appreciable_JJ difference_NN is_VBZ introduced_VBN through_IN the_DT 'holding_VBG back_RP '_CD of_IN the_DT milk_NN by_IN the_DT dams_NNS ._.
Secondly_RB ,_, in_IN any_DT case_NN the_DT part_NN played_VBN by_IN suckling_VBG would_MD not_RB be_VB large_JJ after_IN the_DT fourth_JJ month_NN when_WRB the_DT kids_NNS in_IN Group_NNP B_NNP too_RB were_VBD weaned_VBN ._.
The_DT average_JJ length_NN of_IN lactation_NN of_IN the_DT does_VBZ in_IN Group_NNP B_NNP was_VBD 220_CD days_NNS which_WDT means_VBZ that_IN the_DT effect_NN of_IN suckling_VBG would_MD be_VB felt_VBN only_RB during_IN the_DT first_JJ 120_CD days_NNS of_IN the_DT total_JJ 220_CD days_NNS ._.
As_IN regards_NNS item_VBP v_NN does_VBZ whose_WP$ kids_NNS were_VBD weaned_VBN at_IN birth_NN ,_, appear_VBP to_TO give_VB on_IN an_DT average_NN (_( at_IN any_DT rate_NN in_IN case_NN of_IN does_VBZ in_IN I_PRP ,_, III_NNP and_CC IV_NNP lactations_NNS )_) larger_JJR yields_NNS of_IN milk_NN than_IN the_DT does_VBZ whose_WP$ kids_NNS were_VBD not_RB so_RB weaned_JJ ._.
The_DT lactation_NN lengths_NNS also_RB were_VBD greater_JJR ._.
Statistical_JJ tests_NNS showed_VBD that_IN the_DT increased_JJ yields_NNS were_VBD due_JJ to_TO increased_JJ lengths_NNS of_IN lactations_NNS ._.
With_IN the_DT information_NN at_IN our_PRP$ disposal_NN ,_, it_PRP is_VBZ difficult_JJ to_TO say_VB ,_, whether_IN the_DT enhanced_JJ wet_JJ period_NN is_VBZ a_DT direct_JJ consequence_NN of_IN weaning_NN ._.
On_IN an_DT average_NN ,_, there_EX was_VBD an_DT increase_NN of_IN 56_CD days_NNS in_IN the_DT wet_JJ period_NN ._.
The_DT average_JJ increase_NN in_IN milk_JJ yield_NN was_VBD 126_CD lb_NN ._.
i.e._NN ,_, about_RB 2_CD lb_NN ._.
increase_NN per_IN day_NN increase_NN in_IN wet_JJ period_NN ._.
Actually_RB ,_, this_DT figure_NN would_MD be_VB very_RB much_JJ less_RBR ._.
An_DT adult_NN doe_NN in_IN milk_NN would_MD take_VB 1_CD lb_NN ._.
of_IN concentrates_NNS and_CC 4_CD lb_NN ._.
of_IN fodder_NN ._.
Ignoring_VBG the_DT housing_NN and_CC labour_NN charges_NNS the_DT cost_NN of_IN producing_VBG 2_CD lb_NN ._.
of_IN milk_NN works_VBZ out_RP (_( at_IN the_DT present_JJ rates_NNS )_) to_TO about_RB 3_CD to_TO 4_CD annas_NNS ,_, which_WDT appears_VBZ to_TO be_VB advantageous_JJ to_TO the_DT villager_NN ,_, when_WRB we_PRP consider_VBP the_DT price_NN and_CC quality_NN (_( especially_RB the_DT latter_JJ )_) of_IN the_DT milk_NN sold_VBN in_IN the_DT market_NN ._.
Against_IN this_DT advantage_NN has_VBZ to_TO be_VB set_VBN the_DT cor-_JJ responding_NN delay_NN in_IN getting_VBG the_DT new_JJ kid_NN ,_, and_CC also_RB the_DT delay_NN in_IN proving_VBG of_IN sires_NNS ._.

Characteristic_JJ lesions_NNS in_IN the_DT fourth_JJ stomach_NN A_DT NOTE_NN OF_NNP CLINICAL_NNP ASPECTS_NNP OF_NNP '_POS KHERWAN_NNP DISEASE_NNP '_POS By_IN P._NNP N._NNP NANDA_NNP ,_, M.R.C.V.S._NNP ,_, and_CC H._NNP K._NNP LALL_NNP ,_, B.Sc._NNP ,_, M.R.C.V.S._NNP ,_, Government_NNP Cattle_NNP Farm_NNP ,_, Hissar_NNP (_( Received_VBN for_IN publication_NN on_IN 8th_CD April_NNP 1946_CD ._. )_)
(_( With_IN Plate_NNP X_NNP and_CC two_CD text-figures_NNS )_) THIS_NNP disease_NN first_RB occurred_VBD in_IN 1940_CD in_IN the_DT form_NN of_IN an_DT outbreak_NN causing_VBG heavy_JJ mortality_NN at_IN the_DT Government_NNP Cattle_NNP Farm_NNP ,_, Hissar_NNP at_IN Kherwan_NNP block_NN and_CC was_VBD named_VBN after_IN the_DT place_NN of_IN its_PRP$ occurrence_NN ._.
In_IN the_DT year_NN 1941_CD and_CC 1942_CD there_EX were_VBD negligible_JJ number_NN of_IN deaths_NNS caused_VBN by_IN this_DT disease_NN ._.
In_IN the_DT year_NN 1944_CD another_DT outbreak_NN occurred_VBD in_IN which_WDT the_DT mortality_NN figures_NNS exceeded_VBD the_DT peak_NN reached_VBN in_IN 1940_CD ._.
The_DT disease_NN remained_VBD confined_VBN to_TO Thaska_NNP and_CC Chaoni_NNP blocks_NNS of_IN the_DT farm_NN while_IN a_DT few_JJ cases_NNS occurred_VBD at_IN Salli_NNP and_CC the_DT Home_NNP farm_NN ._.
(_( For_IN the_DT situation_NN of_IN the_DT places_NNS mentioned_VBN in_IN the_DT text_NN ,_, see_VBP the_DT Plate_NNP X_NNP ,_, fig_NN ._.
1_CD )_) ._.
The_DT other_JJ two_CD blocks_NNS of_IN the_DT farm_NN ,_, namely_RB the_DT Stables_NNP and_CC the_DT Kherwan_NNP ,_, remained_VBD absolutely_RB free_JJ ._.
Seasonal_JJ incidence_NN ._.
The_DT disease_NN has_VBZ a_DT seasonal_JJ incidence_NN ;_: each_DT year_NN it_PRP has_VBZ started_VBN in_IN the_DT months_NNS of_IN December_NNP or_CC January_NNP and_CC persisted_VBN upto_NN or_CC the_DT middle_NN of_IN May_NNP ,_, the_DT peak_NN having_VBG reached_VBN in_IN the_DT last_JJ week_NN of_IN March_NNP and_CC the_DT first_JJ week_NN of_IN April_NNP ._.
It_PRP was_VBD observed_VBN that_IN in_IN the_DT year_NN 1940_CD and_CC 1944_CD the_DT maximum_NN and_CC minimum_JJ temperatures_NNS during_IN these_DT months_NNS were_VBD low_JJ as_IN compared_VBN with_IN those_DT in_IN the_DT years_NNS 1941_CD ,_, 1942_CD and_CC 1943_CD and_CC the_DT rainfall_NN was_VBD higher_JJR during_IN the_DT months_NNS of_IN January_NNP ,_, February_NNP and_CC March_NNP ,_, the_DT months_NNS during_IN which_WDT the_DT maximum_JJ number_NN of_IN cases_NNS were_VBD recorded_VBN (_( see_VB Table_NNP I_PRP and_CC Figs_NNP ._.
1_CD and_CC 2_CD )_) ._.
[_JJ NLS_NNP note_NN :_: a_DT graphic_JJ appears_VBZ here_RB -_: see_VBP image_NN of_IN page_NN ]_NNP FIG_NNP ._.
1_CD ._.

Average_JJ rainfall_NN and_CC mean_JJ temperature_NN during_IN the_DT Outbreak_NNP years_NNS '_POS The_DT rainfall_NN was_VBD badly_RB distributed_VBN in_IN years_NNS 1939_CD and_CC 1943_CD thus_RB there_EX was_VBD a_DT very_RB negligible_JJ amount_NN of_IN grazing_NN left_VBN at_IN the_DT end_NN of_IN the_DT year_NN and_CC the_DT beginning_NN of_IN the_DT new_JJ year_NN and_CC it_PRP is_VBZ possible_JJ that_IN it_PRP may_MD have_VB had_VBD an_DT important_JJ bearing_NN on_IN the_DT occurrence_NN of_IN the_DT disease_NN ._.
The_DT present_JJ (_( 1944_CD )_) outbreak_NN ,_, similar_JJ to_TO previous_JJ ones_NNS ,_, was_VBD expected_VBN to_TO subside_VB by_IN the_DT end_NN of_IN March_NNP but_CC the_DT unusual_JJ rains_NNS in_IN that_DT month_NN made_VBD the_DT weather_NN cool_NN and_CC it_PRP continued_VBD for_IN a_DT longer_JJR period_NN ._.
Method_NNP of_IN spread_NN ._.
The_DT disease_NN seemed_VBD to_TO spread_VB rather_RB abruptly_RB from_IN one_CD yard_NN of_IN the_DT block_NN to_TO another_DT yard_NN and_CC from_IN one_CD block_NN to_TO another_DT block_NN in_IN a_DT sporadic_JJ mannerP_NN ._.

N._NNP NANDA_NNP AND_NNP H._NNP K._NNP LALL_NNP 227_CD The_DT temperature_NN was_VBD no_DT guide_NN to_TO diagnosis_NN ._.
There_EX was_VBD no_DT rise_NN in_IN temperature_NN ;_: but_CC in_IN quite_RB a_DT few_JJ cases_NNS the_DT temperature_NN was_VBD subnormal_JJ ._.
Some_DT of_IN the_DT animals_NNS showed_VBD oedema_IN of_IN the_DT sub-maxi-_JJ llary_JJ space_NN but_CC it_PRP seemed_VBD to_TO bear_VB no_DT relation_NN to_TO the_DT stage_NN of_IN the_DT disease_NN in_IN which_WDT the_DT animal_NN was_VBD ,_, because_IN some_DT animals_NNS had_VBD almost_RB recovered_VBN and_CC had_VBD this_DT oedema_NN just_RB the_DT same_JJ ._.
Lesions_NNS ._.
The_DT cattle_NNS were_VBD emaciated_VBN and_CC some_DT had_VBD lost_VBN hair_NN round_IN the_DT flanks_NNS ._.
What_WP fat_VBD there_EX was_VBD seemed_VBN to_TO be_VB degenerated_VBN (_( gelatinous_JJ or_CC myxomatous_JJ degeneration_NN )_) ._.
On_IN opening_VBG the_DT abdominal_JJ cavity_NN oedematous_JJ fluid_NN came_VBD out_RP ,_, its_PRP$ quantity_NN varying_NN from_IN a_DT few_JJ ounces_NNS to_TO a_DT gallon_NN ,_, though_IN there_EX was_VBD none_NN in_IN some_DT cases_NNS ._.
There_EX were_VBD no_DT lesions_NNS on_IN the_DT tongue_NN ,_, pharynx_NN or_CC oesophagous_JJ ._.
Only_RB in_IN one_CD case_NN were_VBD there_RB some_DT punched_VBD out_RP ulcers_NNS in_IN the_DT pharyngeal_JJ region_NN and_CC on_IN the_DT mucous_JJ membrane_NN of_IN the_DT oeso-_JJ phagous_JJ ._.
The_DT rumen_NNS ,_, reticulum_NN and_CC omasum_NN did_VBD not_RB show_VB any_DT lesions_NNS usually_RB ;_: however_RB ,_, in_IN one_CD case_NN the_DT rumen_NNS wall_NN was_VBD very_RB oedematous_JJ and_CC thickened_JJ and_CC showed_VBD an_DT extensive_JJ haemorrhage_NN on_IN its_PRP$ outer_NN surface_NN ._.
The_DT most_RBS characteristic_JJ lesions_NNS were_VBD present_JJ in_IN the_DT fourth_JJ stomach_NN (_( Plate_NNP X_NNP ,_, fig_NN ._.
2_CD )_) ._.
In_IN about_RB 50_CD per_IN cent_NN of_IN the_DT cases_NNS there_EX were_VBD some_DT petechial_JJ haemorrhages_NNS in_IN between_IN and_CC on_IN the_DT edges_NNS of_IN the_DT folds_NNS ._.
In_IN some_DT instances_NNS ,_, however_RB ,_, when_WRB there_EX was_VBD no_DT oedema_NN ,_, there_EX was_VBD very_RB severe_JJ con-_JJ gestion_NN of_IN abomasum_NN with_IN ulcers_NNS :_: such_JJ cases_NNS were_VBD few_JJ ._.
On_IN the_DT whole_NN of_IN the_DT inner_JJ surface_NN of_IN the_DT small_JJ intestine_NN minute_NN haemorrhages_NNS had_VBD occurred_VBN or_CC the_DT mucous_JJ membrane_NN was_VBD so_RB much_RB congested_VBN as_IN to_TO suggest_VB a_DT very_RB severe_JJ enteritis_NN ._.
This_DT congestion_NN was_VBD patchy_VBN in_IN the_DT caecum_NN giving_VBG the_DT appearance_NN of_IN zebra_NN markings_NNS ._.
By_IN passing_VBG a_DT finger_NN over_IN the_DT surface_NN of_IN the_DT intestines_NNS a_DT whitish_JJ mucous_JJ would_MD collect_VB on_IN the_DT edges_NNS of_IN the_DT finger_NN ._.
In_IN some_DT cases_NNS the_DT whitish_JJ fluid_NN was_VBD found_VBN in_IN the_DT intestine_NN with_IN small_JJ particles_NNS of_IN fibrin_NN in_IN it_PRP ._.
The_DT rectum_NN was_VBD also_RB congested_VBN in_IN some_DT ._.
In_IN one_CD instance_NN the_DT rectum_NN was_VBD prolapsed_VBN to_TO a_DT minor_JJ degree_NN ._.
The_DT tissues_NNS in_IN the_DT perineal_JJ region_NN were_VBD also_RB oedematous_JJ as_IN were_VBD the_DT mesenteric_JJ lymph_NN glands_NNS ._.
In_IN some_DT cases_NNS there_EX was_VBD slight_JJ peritonitis_NN as_RB well_RB ._.
The_DT liver_NN was_VBD appa-_JJ rently_RB normal_JJ ,_, but_CC on_IN cutting_VBG into_IN it_PRP ,_, it_PRP bled_VBD easily_RB ;_: the_DT bile_NN was_VBD very_RB thick_JJ ,_, dark_JJ and_CC inspissated_JJ and_CC the_DT gall_NN bladder_NN considerably_RB distended_VBN in_IN most_JJS of_IN the_DT cases_NNS ._.
Whitish_JJ granular_JJ spots_NNS ,_, not_RB of_IN parasitic_JJ origin_NN ,_, were_VBD visible_JJ in_IN the_DT parenchyma_NN of_IN the_DT pancreas_NNS ._.
The_DT kidneys_NNS were_VBD normal_JJ ,_, apart_RB from_IN showing_VBG congestion_NN in_IN some_DT cases_NNS ._.
The_DT spleen_NN was_VBD crenated_VBN but_CC otherwise_RB normal_JJ ,_, and_CC the_DT bladder_NN was_VBD found_VBN dilated_VBN in_IN some_DT cases_NNS while_IN contracted_VBN in_IN others_NNS ._.
Some_DT haemorrhagic_JJ areas_NNS were_VBD found_VBN in_IN the_DT lungs_NNS which_WDT bled_VBD easily_RB on_IN pressure_NN in_IN some_DT cases_NNS ._.
The_DT quantity_NN of_IN the_DT fluid_NN in_IN the_DT pericardial_JJ cavity_NN was_VBD excessive_JJ and_CC the_DT fat_JJ round_NN the_DT coronary_JJ art-_JJ eries_NNS was_VBD almost_RB absent_JJ ._.
Haemorrhages_NNS were_VBD found_VBN in_IN a_DT few_JJ cases_NNS on_IN the_DT myocardium_NN and_CC endo-_JJ cardium_NN ._.
The_DT brain_NN was_VBD congested_VBN and_CC haemorrhages_NNS were_VBD to_TO be_VB seen_VBN in_IN quite_RB a_DT number_NN of_IN cases_NNS ,_, the_DT piameter_NN covering_VBG the_DT frontal_JJ lobes_NN of_IN the_DT brain_NN and_CC the_DT base_NN of_IN the_DT brain_NN was_VBD almost_RB black_JJ ._.
But_CC in_IN quite_RB a_DT number_NN of_IN brains_NNS from_IN animals_NNS that_WDT died_VBD due_JJ to_TO other_JJ diseases_NNS blackishness_NN of_IN the_DT piameter_NN was_VBD observed_VBN ._.
The_DT spinal_JJ cord_NN and_CC the_DT cerebrospinal_JJ fluid_NN were_VBD normal_JJ macroscopically_RB ._.
During_IN the_DT outbreak_JJ some_DT other_JJ animals_NNS (_( more_RBR aged_VBN )_) which_WDT died_VBD from_IN traumatic_JJ pericarditis_NN and_CC generalized_VBN tuberculosis_NN showed_VBD ulcers_NNS in_IN the_DT fourth_JJ stomach_NN and_CC the_DT congestion_NN of_IN the_DT brain_NN and_CC the_DT blackish_JJ piameter_NN as_IN seen_VBN in_IN the_DT Kherwan_NNP disease_NN ._.
It_PRP is_VBZ possible_JJ that_IN either_CC the_DT two_CD condi-_JJ tions_NNS co-existed_JJ or_CC the_DT older_JJR animals_NNS had_VBD got_VBN over_IN the_DT disease_NN thus_RB leaving_VBG only_RB some_DT scars_NNS of_IN the_DT disease_NN in_IN their_PRP$ organs_NNS ._.
Etiology_NN ._.
The_DT histopathology_NN was_VBD studied_VBN at_IN the_DT Imperial_NNP Veterinary_NNP Research_NNP Institute_NNP ,_, and_CC transmission_NN experiments_NNS were_VBD also_RB carried_VBN there_RB as_RB well_RB as_IN at_IN Hissar_NNP ._.
The_DT results_NNS of_IN the_DT experiments_NNS at_IN the_DT Imperial_NNP Veterinary_NNP Research_NNP Institute_NNP and_CC the_DT study_NN of_IN its_PRP$ histopathology_NN will_MD probably_RB form_VB a_DT separate_JJ paper_NN to_TO be_VB published_VBN at_IN a_DT later_JJ date_NN ._.
A_DT brief_JJ report_NN on_IN the_DT histopathology_NN of_IN the_DT disease_NN received_VBD from_IN G._NNP D._NNP I_PRP ._.
Section_NN ,_, Imperial_NNP Veterinary_NNP Research_NNP Institute_NNP ,_, is_VBZ included_VBN here_RB for_IN the_DT sake_NN of_IN completeness_NN ._.
'The_MD most_RBS important_JJ lesions_NNS are_VBP centred_VBN in_IN the_DT brain_NN and_CC spinal_JJ cord_NN ;_: these_DT consist_VBP in_IN intense_JJ congestion_NN and_CC occasional_JJ haemorrhage_NN of_IN capillaries_NNS throughout_IN the_DT brain_NN and_CC cord_NN with_IN some_DT de-_JJ position_NN of_IN blood_NN pigment_NN ;_: some_DT degree_NN of_IN perivascular_JJ infiltration_NN and_CC necrosis_NN and_CC neuronophagia_NN of_IN nerve_NN cells_NNS ._. '_''
In_IN one_CD case_NN the_DT meninges_NNS (_( piameter_NN )_) of_IN the_DT spinal_JJ cord_NN showed_VBD considerable_JJ oedema_RB 228_CD Clinical_JJ Aspects_NNS of_IN Kherwan_NNP Disease_NNP with_IN proliferation_NN of_IN fixed_JJ connective_JJ tissue_NN elements_NNS ,_, and_CC acute_JJ congestion_NN of_IN capillaries_NNS with_IN purely_RB monocytic_JJ infiltration_NN ,_, i.e._FW ,_, leptomeningitis_NN ._.
'The_POS mucous_JJ coat_NN of_IN the_DT gastro-ontestinal_JJ tract_NN was_VBD normal_JJ in_IN cases_NNS examined_VBN ,_, although_IN capi-_JJ llaries_NNS in_IN sub-mucous_JJ coat_NN were_VBD highly_RB injected_VBN and_CC in_IN one_CD case_NN there_EX was_VBD considerable_JJ sub-mucous_JJ oedema_NN with_IN loosening_NN and_CC necrosis_NN of_IN the_DT overlying_VBG mucous_JJ coat_NN ._. '_''
Efforts_NNS were_VBD made_VBN to_TO transmit_VB the_DT disease_NN by_IN (_( i_NN )_) subcutaneous_JJ injection_NN of_IN blood_NN from_IN the_DT diseased_JJ animals_NNS in_IN the_DT acute_JJ stages_NNS to_TO healthy_JJ ones_NNS ;_: (_( ii_NN )_) injecting_VBG subcutaneously_RB an_DT emulsion_NN of_IN intestines_NNS on_IN fourth_JJ stomach_NN ;_: (_( iii_NN )_) drenching_NN with_IN the_DT emulsion_NN of_IN intestines_NNS and_CC fourth_JJ stomach_NN ;_: (_( iv_NN )_) intranasal_NN insuffulation_NN (_( v_NN )_) Injection_NN of_IN brain_NN emulsion_NN into_IN temporal_JJ fossa_NN and_CC anterior_JJ chamber_NN of_IN the_DT eye_NN ._.
The_DT disease_NN could_MD not_RB be_VB transmitted_VBN ._.
As_IN all_PDT the_DT animals_NNS in_IN which_WDT the_DT disease_NN appeared_VBD particularly_RB in_IN 1944_CD outbreak_NN were_VBD thin_JJ ,_, it_PRP was_VBD thought_VBN that_IN it_PRP might_MD be_VB due_JJ to_TO some_DT nutritional_JJ cause_NN ._.
A_DT very_RB significant_JJ fact_NN which_WDT has_VBZ been_VBN mentioned_VBN before_RB has_VBZ to_TO be_VB repeated_VBN here_RB ,_, i.e._FW ,_, the_DT grazing_NN was_VBD very_RB poor_JJ in_IN 1940_CD as_RB well_RB as_IN in_IN 1944_CD and_CC due_JJ to_TO this_DT the_DT animals_NNS had_VBD to_TO be_VB fed_VBN solely_RB on_IN ensilage_NN and_CC Kurbi_NNP jowar_NN of_IN the_DT crop_NN of_IN the_DT previous_JJ year_NN and_CC the_DT one_CD before_IN that_DT ._.
Some_DT of_IN this_DT had_VBD become_VBN mouldy_NN ._.
Samples_NNS of_IN the_DT feed_NN were_VBD sent_VBN to_TO the_DT Imperial_NNP Veterinary_NNP Research_NNP Institute_NNP for_IN analysis_NN ,_, etc._NN ,_, but_CC no_DT conculsions_NNS could_MD be_VB derived_VBN ._.
Vitamin_NNP A_NNP and_CC serum_JJ calcium_NN were_VBD also_RB determined_VBN in_IN the_DT last_JJ outbreak_NN and_CC were_VBD found_VBN to_TO be_VB normal_JJ but_CC the_DT vitamin_NN A_NNP content_NN of_IN some_DT of_IN the_DT livers_NNS sent_VBD during_IN 1944_CD was_VBD subnormal_JJ ._.
'It_NN may_MD also_RB be_VB mentioned_VBN here_RB parenthetically_RB that_IN there_EX were_VBD 48_CD deaths_NNS in_IN 1945_CD and_CC that_DT 20_CD (_( 16_CD per_IN cent_NN )_) calves_VBZ out_IN of_IN these_DT were_VBD weaned_VBN between_IN 3_CD to_TO 4_CD months_NNS as_IN they_PRP were_VBD from_IN tuberculous_JJ mothers_NNS and_CC were_VBD thus_RB weaker_JJR than_IN those_DT weaned_VBN normally_RB at_IN 9_CD months_NNS of_IN age_NN ._. '_''
When_WRB the_DT disease_NN appeared_VBD the_DT quantity_NN of_IN the_DT green_JJ feed_NN given_VBN to_TO all_PDT the_DT animals_NNS was_VBD increased_VBN but_CC it_PRP did_VBD not_RB seem_VB to_TO alter_VB the_DT course_NN of_IN the_DT disease_NN to_TO any_DT great_JJ extent_NN ._.
Whether_IN it_PRP was_VBD the_DT accumulative_JJ effect_NN of_IN the_DT absence_NN of_IN certain_JJ food_NN substances_NNS which_WDT reduced_VBD the_DT absorption_NN of_IN food_NN is_VBZ not_RB certain_JJ ._.
The_DT ration_NN fed_NN to_TO the_DT animals_NNS at_IN Chaoni_NNP and_CC Thaska_NNP for_IN the_DT four_CD months_NNS during_IN which_WDT disease_NN occurred_VBD is_VBZ tabulated_VBN in_IN Appendix_NNP II_NNP ._.
With_IN a_DT view_NN to_TO determining_VBG the_DT effect_NN of_IN prolonged_JJ feeding_NN of_IN Kurbi_NNP jowar_NN and_CC its_PRP$ ensilage_NN ,_, four_CD animals_NNS were_VBD purchased_VBN from_IN villages_NNS and_CC were_VBD fed_VBN on_IN Kurbi_NNP jowar_NN and_CC ensilage_NN only_RB ._.
One_CD animal_NN was_VBD destroyed_VBN after_IN 3½_CD months_NNS ,_, but_CC it_PRP did_VBD not_RB show_VB any_DT typical_JJ lesions_NNS of_IN Kherwan_NNP disease_NN ._.
One_CD which_WDT died_VBD eight_CD months_NNS afterwards_NNS showed_VBD some_DT doubtful_JJ lesions_NNS only_RB ._.
Serum_NNP protein_NN estimation_NN in_IN 10_CD animals_NNS was_VBD made_VBN but_CC no_DT definite_JJ conclusions_NNS could_MD be_VB drawn_VBN from_IN the_DT results_NNS obtained_VBD ._.
Only_RB some_DT of_IN the_DT animals_NNS which_WDT were_VBD being_VBG fed_VBN on_IN green_JJ fodder_NN and_CC grains_NNS died_VBD ,_, but_CC ,_, none_NN of_IN the_DT prime_JJ young_JJ bulls_NNS being_VBG fed_VBN on_IN a_DT special_JJ grain_NN ration_NN was_VBD affected_VBN ._.
Effect_NN of_IN magnesium_NN sulphate_NN drench_NN ._.
Some_DT animals_NNS were_VBD given_VBN a_DT drench_JJ consisting_NN of_IN magne-_JJ sium_NN sulphate_NN with_IN a_DT view_NN to_TO eliminate_VB toxins_NNS from_IN the_DT intestines_NNS ._.
It_PRP did_VBD not_RB have_VB any_DT profound_JJ effect_NN in_IN the_DT course_NN of_IN the_DT disease_NN ._.
Out_IN of_IN eight_CD animals_NNS which_WDT were_VBD given_VBN this_DT treatment_NN ,_, three_CD reco-_NN vered_VBD and_CC five_CD died_NNS (_( see_VB Table_NNP IV_NNP )_) ._.

17-4-44_JJ .._NNP .._NNP 5-5-44_JJ Recovered_NNP P._NNP N._NNP NANDA_NNP AND_NNP H._NNP K._NNP LALL_NNP 229_CD TABLE_NNP IV230_NNP Clinical_NNP Aspects_NNP of_IN Kherwan_NNP Disease_NNP APPENDIX_NNP IP_NNP ._.
N._NNP NANDA_NNP AND_NNP H._NNP K._NNP LALL_NNP 231_CD APPENDIX_NNP IISUBACUTE_NNP ANTHRAX_NNP IN_NNP CATTLE_NNP IN_NNP MADRAS_NNP By_IN G._NNP R._NNP VISWANATHAN_NNP ,_, G.M.V.C._NNP ,_, Veterinary_NNP Investigation_NNP Officer_NNP (_( Madras_NNP )_) and_CC S._NNP VENKATRAMA_NNP AYYAR_NNP ,_, G.M.V.C._NNP ,_, Assistant_NNP to_TO the_DT Veterinary_NNP Investigation_NNP Officer_NNP ,_, Madras_NNP (_( Received_VBN for_IN publication_NN on_IN 2_CD April_NNP 1945_CD )_) ANTHRAX_NNP is_VBZ sporadic_JJ in_IN Madras_NNP ,_, occurring_VBG all_DT over_IN the_DT province_NN and_CC at_IN all_DT times_NNS of_IN the_DT year_NN in_IN an_DT acute_JJ form_NN ._.
In_IN any_DT one_CD outbreak_NN ,_, it_PRP is_VBZ rare_JJ for_IN more_JJR than_IN one_CD or_CC two_CD animals_NNS to_TO be_VB affected_VBN ._.
The_DT onset_NN is_VBZ sudden_JJ and_CC ends_VBZ fatally_RB without_IN symptoms_NNS being_VBG seen_VBN ._.
This_DT paper_NN concerns_VBZ anthrax_NN in_IN bovines_NNS ,_, especially_RB in_IN cattle_NNS belonging_VBG to_TO the_DT Corporation_NNP of_IN Madras_NNP ._.
In_IN this_DT outbreak_JJ many_JJ animals_NNS were_VBD affected_VBN and_CC most_JJS of_IN them_PRP suffered_VBD from_IN a_DT subacute_JJ form_NN of_IN the_DT disease_NN ._.
Hutyra_NNP and_CC Marek_NNP [_NNP 1938_CD ]_NNP state_NN that_WDT outbreaks_NNS of_IN subacute_JJ cases_NNS of_IN anthrax_NN do_VBP occur_NNS ._.
In_IN Central_NNP Provinces_NNPS ,_, Bachan_NNP Singh_NNP [_NNP 1938_CD ]_NNP recorded_VBD an_DT outbreak_NN of_IN anthrax_NN of_IN subacute_NN type_NN ,_, which_WDT occurred_VBD in_IN Raipur_NNP ._.
Viswanathan_NNP [_NN 1938_CD and_CC 1942_CD ]_NN recorded_VBD similar_JJ type_NN of_IN outbreaks_NNS in_IN bovines_NNS at_IN Villupuram_NNP Taluk_NNP of_IN South_NNP Arcot_NNP ,_, Madagasira_NNP Taluk_NNP of_IN Anantapur_NNP ,_, and_CC in_IN Tiruvellore_NNP Taluk_NNP of_IN Chingleput_NNP ._.
Thus_RB in_IN village_NN M._NNP thirteen_NN animals_NNS were_VBD affected_JJ ,_, of_IN which_WDT five_CD died_VBD and_CC eight_CD recovered_VBN ;_: in_IN village_NN S._NNP thirty-_JJ three_CD animals_NNS were_VBD affected_JJ ,_, of_IN which_WDT thirtytwo_NN died_VBD and_CC one_CD recovered_NN ._.
These_DT outbreaks_NNS also_RB were_VBD confirmed_VBN as_IN anthrax_NN by_IN examination_NN of_IN blood_NN smears_NNS ._.
HISTORY_NN OF_NNP PRESENT_NNP OUTBREAK_NNP This_DT occurred_VBD in_IN epizootic_JJ form_NN in_IN June_NNP ,_, 1944_CD ,_, reaching_VBG its_PRP$ maximum_NN about_IN the_DT fourth_JJ week_NN ._.
Two_CD animals_NNS were_VBD found_VBN dead_JJ on_IN the_DT morning_NN of_IN June_NNP 18_CD ._.
Blood_NN smears_NNS were_VBD positive_JJ for_IN anthrax_NN ._.
On_IN the_DT same_JJ day_NN ,_, anthrax_NN serum_NN was_VBD used_VBN at_IN the_DT rate_NN of_IN 15_CD c.c_NN ._.
for_IN the_DT healthy_JJ and_CC 40_CD to_TO 60_CD c.c._NN ,_, according_VBG to_TO the_DT size_NN ,_, for_IN the_DT ailing_JJ animals_NNS ._.
Sixtyfour_NNP healthy_JJ and_CC five_CD ailing_VBG animals_NNS were_VBD treated_VBN ._.
These_DT animals_NNS were_VBD stationed_VBN at_IN A._NNP Depot_NNP of_IN the_DT Madras_NNP Corporation_NNP ,_, which_WDT for_IN the_DT past_JJ two_CD months_NNS had_VBD been_VBN used_VBN as_IN a_DT foot_NN and_CC mouth_NN disease_NN segregation_NN camp_NN ._.
A_DT and_CC B_NNP Depot_NNP animals_NNS before_IN they_PRP were_VBD segregated_VBN here_RB were_VBD in_IN the_DT habit_NN of_IN going_VBG to_TO the_DT dumping_NN ground_NN ,_, where_WRB street_NN refuse_NN and_CC rubbish_NN are_VBP deposited_VBN and_CC where_WRB dead_JJ animals_NNS are_VBP usually_RB buried_VBN ._.
Of_IN the_DT five_CD animals_NNS treated_VBN on_IN June_NNP 18_CD ,_, two_CD were_VBD found_VBN dead_JJ of_IN anthrax_NN two_CD days_NNS later_RB ._.
On_IN June_NNP 20_CD ,_, the_DT other_JJ three_CD animals_NNS were_VBD given_VBN intravenously_RB 20_CD c.c_NN ._.
of_IN antianthrax_NN serum_NN ._.
On_IN June_NNP 21_CD ,_, two_CD animals_NNS were_VBD found_VBN dead_JJ of_IN anthrax_NN ,_, one_CD of_IN them_PRP being_VBG a_DT treated_VBN animal_NN and_CC the_DT other_JJ a_DT newly_RB purchased_VBN one_CD ._.
Before_IN the_DT actual_JJ investigation_NN began_VBD on_IN June_NNP 21_CD ,_, six_CD animals_NNS had_VBD died_VBN of_IN anthrax_NN ,_, diagnosed_VBN by_IN examination_NN of_IN blood_NN smears_NNS ._.
THE_DT PRESENT_NNP INVESTIGATION_NNP On_IN June_NNP 20_CD ,_, when_WRB the_DT outbreak_NN was_VBD first_RB reported_VBN ,_, it_PRP was_VBD decided_VBN to_TO vaccinate_VB with_IN anthrax_NN spore_NN vaccine_NN ._.
During_IN the_DT previous_JJ years_NNS ,_, six_CD cases_NNS of_IN anthrax_NN had_VBD occurred_VBN in_IN Corporation_NNP animals_NNS ._.
During_IN the_DT month_NN before_IN the_DT present_JJ outbreak_NN ,_, there_EX had_VBD been_VBN an_DT outbreak_NN of_IN foot_NN and_CC mouth_NN disease_NN and_CC this_DT appeared_VBD to_TO be_VB a_DT predisposing_NN cause_NN ,_, as_IN many_JJ of_IN the_DT animals_NNS were_VBD weak_JJ and_CC debi-_JJ litated_VBN and_CC also_RB had_VBD wounds_NNS between_IN the_DT digits_NNS ._.
Moreover_RB ,_, as_IN stated_VBN ,_, these_DT animals_NNS were_VBD in_IN the_DT habit_NN of_IN going_VBG to_TO a_DT dumping_NN ground_NN ,_, where_WRB previous_JJ anthrax_NN cases_NNS and_CC other_JJ animals_NNS had_VBD been_VBN buried_VBN ._.
Further_RB due_JJ to_TO careless_VB handling_NN and_CC disposal_NN of_IN carcases_NNS ,_, it_PRP is_VBZ possible_JJ that_IN the_DT water_NN tub_NN and_CC food_NN stuffs_NNS may_MD have_VB been_VBN contaminated_VBN ._.
It_PRP is_VBZ also_RB possible_JJ ,_, that_IN biting_VBG flies_NNS such_JJ as_IN Tabanus_NNP may_MD have_VB transmitted_VBN the_DT infection_NN ._.
On_IN June_NNP 21_CD ,_, the_DT temperature_NN of_IN all_PDT the_DT animals_NNS in_IN the_DT Depot_NNP were_VBD taken_VBN before_IN vaccination_NN ,_, in_IN order_NN to_TO detect_VB the_DT ones_NNS in_IN the_DT incubation_NN stage_NN ._.
Fifteen_JJ animals_NNS were_VBD then_RB showing_VBG high_JJ tem-_JJ perature_NN ._.
Of_IN these_DT ,_, 11_CD belonged_VBD to_TO the_DT B._NNP Depot_NNP and_CC 4_CD to_TO the_DT A._NNP Depot_NNP ._.
Period_NN of_IN incubation_NN ._.
According_VBG to_TO Gaiger_NNP and_CC Davis_NNP [_NNP 1938_CD ]_VBD the_DT period_NN of_IN incubation_NN is_VBZ 24_CD hours_NNS to_TO 2_CD or_CC 3_CD days_NNS or_CC may_MD even_RB be_VB as_RB long_RB as_IN 14_CD days_NNS ._.
From_IN the_DT details_NNS collected_VBN in_IN this_DT outbreak_NN ,_, five_CD animals_NNS have_VBP shown_VBN a_DT period_NN of_IN incubation_NN of_IN 12_CD hours_NNS ,_, but_CC this_DT was_VBD probably_RB not_RB correct_VB for_IN the_DT first_JJ two_CD deaths_NNS ,_, as_IN they_PRP were_VBD not_RB observed_VBN probably_RB till_VB the_DT disease_NN was_VBD confirmed_VBN as_IN anthrax_NN on_IN 232_CD G._NNP R._NNP VISWANATHAN_NNP AND_NNP S.V_NNP ._.
AYYAR_$ 233_CD 18-6-1944_JJ ._.
Fourteen_JJ animals_NNS were_VBD ill_JJ for_IN three_CD days_NNS from_IN the_DT commencement_NN of_IN the_DT outbreak_NN ;_: seven_CD animals_NNS showed_VBD symptoms_NNS after_IN four_CD days_NNS ;_: two_CD animals_NNS began_VBD to_TO show_VB symptoms_NNS after_IN five_CD days_NNS ,_, five_CD animals_NNS after_IN a_DT lapse_NN of_IN six_CD days_NNS and_CC only_RB one_CD after_IN seven_CD days_NNS ._.
Thus_RB it_PRP will_MD be_VB seen_VBN that_IN most_JJS affected_JJ animals_NNS showed_VBD symptoms_NNS after_IN an_DT incubation_NN period_NN of_IN three_CD to_TO four_CD days_NNS ._.
Symptoms_NNS ._.
These_DT were_VBD similar_JJ to_TO those_DT seen_VBN in_IN the_DT out_RP breaks_NNS recorded_VBN by_IN the_DT first_JJ author_NN in_IN 1938_CD and_CC in_IN 1940_CD ._.
One_CD or_CC two_CD cases_NNS died_VBD suddenly_RB in_IN a_DT peracute_JJ form_NN without_IN showing_VBG any_DT symptoms_NNS ,_, but_CC in_IN other_JJ cases_NNS there_EX were_VBD definite_JJ symptoms_NNS ._.
As_IN a_DT rule_NN ,_, in_IN animals_NNS ,_, which_WDT died_VBD suddenly_RB or_CC were_VBD found_VBN dead_JJ ,_, symptoms_NNS were_VBD acute_JJ and_CC took_VBD the_DT form_NN of_IN a_DT septicaemia_NN ,_, accompanied_VBN by_IN a_DT sudden_JJ apopletic_JJ attack_NN resulting_VBG in_IN death_NN in_IN a_DT few_JJ minutes_NNS after_IN the_DT appearance_NN of_IN the_DT first_JJ symptoms_NNS ._.
In_IN most_JJS subacute_JJ cases_NNS ,_, the_DT symptoms_NNS consisted_VBN of_IN high_JJ fever_NN ,_, staring_VBG coat_NN ,_, dullness_NN ,_, loss_NN of_IN appetite_NN ,_, etc_FW ._.
The_DT cattle_NN fell_VBD down_RB and_CC died_VBD ._.
In_IN one_CD or_CC two_CD instances_NNS there_EX were_VBD swellings_NNS ,_, in_IN one_CD case_NN in_IN the_DT throat_NN region_NN extending_VBG to_TO the_DT dewlap_NN ;_: in_IN another_DT in_IN the_DT neck_NN extending_VBG downwards_NNS to_TO the_DT sternum_NN ._.
It_PRP may_MD be_VB remarked_VBN that_IN in_IN one_CD cow_NN ,_, which_WDT died_VBD in_IN village_NN M._NNP in_IN the_DT previous_JJ outbreak_NN ,_, swelling_VBG was_VBD noticed_VBN in_IN the_DT perineal_JJ region_NN extending_VBG to_TO the_DT udder_NN ._.
All_DT animals_NNS died_VBD ,_, if_IN no_DT treatment_NN was_VBD given_VBN ._.
In_IN a_DT few_JJ cases_NNS blood_NN was_VBD oozing_VBG out_RP from_IN the_DT natural_JJ orifices_NNS ._.
The_DT duration_NN of_IN the_DT disease_NN was_VBD from_IN one_CD to_TO four_CD days_NNS ._.
Out_IN of_IN the_DT 24_CD animals_NNS that_WDT died_VBD 16_CD suffered_VBD from_IN one_CD to_TO four_CD days_NNS ,_, 5_CD for_IN twelve_NN hours_NNS and_CC less_JJR ,_, 2_CD for_IN five_CD days_NNS and_CC only_RB one_CD for_IN six_CD days_NNS ._.
Thus_RB in_IN this_DT outbreak_NN ,_, the_DT period_NN of_IN illness_NN ranged_VBN from_IN a_DT few_JJ hours_NNS to_TO six_CD days_NNS ._.
Duration_NN of_IN the_DT outbreak_NN ._.
The_DT outbreak_NN began_VBD on_IN June_NNP 18_CD ,_, reached_VBD its_PRP$ climax_NN on_IN June_NNP 22_CD and_CC the_DT last_JJ death_NN occurred_VBD on_IN June_NNP 29_CD ._.
The_DT outbreak_JJ thus_RB lasted_VBN for_IN 12_CD days_NNS ._.
Control_NNP ._.
The_DT outbreak_NN was_VBD controlled_VBN by_IN (_( a_DT )_) Disinfection_NN and_CC proper_JJ disposal_NN of_IN carcases_NNS ._.
(_( b_NN )_) Prophylactic_NNP vaccination_NN of_IN the_DT healthy_JJ ._.
(_( c_NN )_) Treatment_NN of_IN affected_JJ ._.
(_( a_DT )_) Disinfection_NN and_CC proper_JJ disposal_NN of_IN carcases_NNS The_DT usual_JJ hygienic_NN and_CC disinfectant_JJ measures_NNS were_VBD adopted_VBN ._.
Every_DT precaution_NN was_VBD taken_VBN to_TO avoid_VB contamination_NN of_IN the_DT stall_NN feeding_NN troughs_NNS ,_, water_NN tubs_NN ,_, fodder_NN ,_, grains_NNS ,_, etc._FW ,_, from_IN blood_NN or_CC other_JJ fluid_JJ excreta_NN from_IN dead_JJ animals_NNS ;_: carcases_NNS were_VBD destroyed_VBN by_IN burning_VBG ._.
Before_IN the_DT removal_NN of_IN car-_JJ cases_NNS ,_, natural_JJ orifices_NNS were_VBD plugged_VBN and_CC the_DT whole_JJ carcase_NN was_VBD covered_VBN with_IN disinfectants_NNS and_CC then_RB removed_VBD in_IN a_DT cart_NN for_IN disposal_NN ._.
At_IN first_RB ,_, the_DT carcases_NNS were_VBD cremated_VBN ,_, later_RBR they_PRP were_VBD buried_VBN at_IN a_DT depth_NN of_IN six_CD feet_NNS with_IN quicklime_NN ._.
The_DT ground_NN area_NN ,_, stalls_NNS ,_, etc._FW ,_, were_VBD scraped_VBN with_IN disinfectants_NNS and_CC then_RB sprinkled_VBD with_IN powdered_JJ quicklime_NN ._.
Stalls_NNS occupied_VBN by_IN the_DT affected_JJ animals_NNS were_VBD thoroughly_RB disinfected_VBN ._.
All_DT food_NN and_CC straw_NN that_WDT had_VBD come_VBN in_IN contact_NN with_IN affected_JJ animals_NNS or_CC carcases_NNS or_CC which_WDT was_VBD contaminated_VBN by_IN their_PRP$ excrements_NNS or_CC blood_NN was_VBD burnt_JJ ._.
The_DT conservancy_NN cart_NN in_IN which_WDT the_DT car-_NN cases_NNS were_VBD removed_VBN ,_, and_CC the_DT manure_NN ,_, etc._FW ,_, were_VBD burnt_VBN ._.
The_DT whole_JJ Depot_NNP was_VBD thoroughly_RB disinfected_VBN ._.
(_( b_NN )_) Prophylactic_NNP vaccination_NN of_IN healthy_JJ animals_NNS Since_IN anthrax_NN serum_NN failed_VBD to_TO protect_VB ,_, anthrax_NN spore_NN vaccination_NN was_VBD adopted_VBN ._.
This_DT was_VBD done_VBN on_IN 21_CD June_NNP ,_, using_VBG vaccine_NN prepared_VBN at_IN the_DT Imperial_NNP Veterinary_NNP Research_NNP Institute_NNP ._.
The_DT dose_NN given_VBN was_VBD 1_CD c.c_NN ._.
subcutaneously_RB on_IN the_DT left_JJ side_NN of_IN the_DT neck_NN ._.
In_IN all_DT 51_CD bovines_NNS were_VBD treated_VBN ._.
Re-_JJ actions_NNS were_VBD as_IN follows_VBZ ._.
There_EX was_VBD no_DT local_JJ reaction_NN except_IN in_IN three_CD cases_NNS ,_, where_WRB there_EX was_VBD oedema_JJ extending_VBG to_TO the_DT dewlap_NN ._.
Most_JJS vaccinated_JJ animals_NNS showed_VBD no_DT temperature_NN reaction_NN ._.
When_WRB present_JJ the_DT temperature_NN reaction_NN was_VBD usually_RB noticed_VBN between_IN the_DT fourth_JJ and_CC tenth_JJ day_NN ._.
Of_IN the_DT nine_CD deaths_NNS among_IN the_DT vaccinated_JJ animals_NNS ,_, five_CD died_VBD before_IN the_DT vaccination_NN reaction_NN and_CC of_IN the_DT remaining_VBG four_CD ,_, two_CD were_VBD confirmed_VBN positive_JJ for_IN anthrax_NN and_CC the_DT other_JJ two_CD were_VBD declared_VBN negative_JJ ._.
They_PRP died_VBD of_IN old_JJ age_NN and_CC debility_NN ._.
Thus_RB only_RB two_CD deaths_NNS occurred_VBD among_IN fifty-one_NN vaccinated_VBN animals_NNS giving_VBG a_DT mortality_NN of_IN 3.9_CD per_IN cent_NN ._.
There_EX were_VBD no_DT deaths_NNS in_IN the_DT Depot_NNP after_IN 29_CD June_NNP ,_, i.e._NN ,_, nine_CD days_NNS after_IN vaccination_NN the_DT disease_NN was_VBD controlled_VBN effectively_RB ._.
In_IN this_DT outbreak_NN ,_, where_WRB the_DT cases_NNS were_VBD declared_VBN positive_JJ for_IN anthrax_NN ,_, the_DT premises_NNS were_VBD more_RBR or_CC less_RBR isolated_JJ ._.
All_PDT the_DT healthy_JJ stock_NN were_VBD vaccinated_VBN ._.
(_( c_NN )_) Treatment_NN of_IN affected_JJ with_IN novarsenobillon_JJ Hutyra_NNP and_CC Marek_NNP [_NNP 1938_CD ]_NNP state_NN that_WDT favourable_JJ results_NNS may_MD be_VB obtained_VBN by_IN symptomatic_JJ treat-_JJ ment_NN with_IN camphor_NN ,_, ether_RB ,_, etc_FW ._.
Pande_NNP [_NN 1937_CD ]_NN reported_VBD successful_JJ treatment_NN of_IN anthrax_NN with_IN camphor_NN ,_, F2_NNP 234_CD Subacute_NNP Anthrax_NNP in_IN Cattle_NNP in_IN Madras_NNP if_IN it_PRP is_VBZ administered_VBN during_IN the_DT early_JJ stage_NN of_IN the_DT disease_NN ._.
He_PRP advises_VBZ the_DT use_NN of_IN one_CD dram_NN of_IN camphor_NN in_IN 20_CD c.c_NN ._.
of_IN olive_JJ oil_NN subcutaneously_RB and_CC orally_RB with_IN treacle_NN administered_VBN every_DT three_CD hours_NNS ._.
In_IN view_NN of_IN some_DT encouraging_JJ results_NNS obtained_VBD previously_RB in_IN Madras_NNP with_IN novarsenobillon_NN (_( May_NNP and_CC Baker_NNP )_) ,_, this_DT drug_NN was_VBD used_VBN in_IN the_DT present_JJ outbreak_NN both_DT for_IN affected_JJ animals_NNS among_IN the_DT non-_JJ vaccinated_JJ and_CC also_RB for_IN animals_NNS showing_VBG temperature_NN from_IN the_DT second_JJ day_NN after_IN vaccination_NN ._.
Of_IN the_DT 15_CD affected_VBD non-vaccinated_JJ animals_NNS treated_VBD ,_, 9_CD died_VBD ._.
Among_IN the_DT vaccinated_JJ animals_NNS 15_CD were_VBD treated_VBN and_CC of_IN these_DT 7_CD died_VBD and_CC 8_CD recovered_VBN ._.
Thus_RB out_IN of_IN 30_CD animals_NNS treated_VBD ,_, 16_CD died_VBD and_CC 14_CD recovered_VBN ,_, indicating_VBG that_IN novarsenobillon_NN has_VBZ some_DT value_NN ._.
Before_IN the_DT investigation_NN started_VBD ,_, all_PDT the_DT anthrax_NN cases_NNS died_VBD ._.
There_EX were_VBD no_DT natural_JJ recoveries_NNS in_IN the_DT outbreak_NN of_IN 1941_CD ._.
An_DT initial_JJ dose_NN of_IN at_IN least_JJS one_CD gram_NN of_IN the_DT drug_NN is_VBZ essential_JJ and_CC it_PRP has_VBZ a_DT definite_JJ curative_JJ value_NN when_WRB given_VBN intravenously_RB in_IN time_NN ._.
SUMMARY_NNP An_DT account_NN is_VBZ given_VBN of_IN an_DT outbreak_NN of_IN subacute_JJ anthrax_NN among_IN cattle_NNS in_IN Madras_NNP ._.
The_DT outbreak_NN occurred_VBD in_IN June_NNP among_IN animals_NNS which_WDT had_VBD recently_RB suffered_VBN from_IN foot_NN and_CC mouth_NN disease_NN and_CC it_PRP lasted_VBD for_IN twelve_NN days_NNS ._.
The_DT period_NN of_IN incubation_NN appeared_VBD to_TO be_VB about_IN three_CD or_CC four_CD days_NNS ,_, and_CC an_DT illness_NN of_IN one_CD to_TO four_CD days_NNS was_VBD followed_VBN by_IN death_NN ._.
Anthrax_NNP serum_NN was_VBD found_VBN to_TO be_VB valueless_JJ for_IN control_NN ,_, but_CC anthrax_RB spore_RB vaccine_JJ brought_VBD the_DT outbreak_NN to_TO an_DT end_NN and_CC this_DT in_IN most_JJS animals_NNS caused_VBD no_DT local_JJ or_CC thermal_JJ reaction_NN ._.
Treatment_NN of_IN affected_JJ animals_NNS with_IN novarsenobillon_NN appeared_VBD to_TO be_VB effective_JJ when_WRB the_DT drug_NN was_VBD given_VBN in_IN the_DT early_JJ stages_NNS ._.

I_PRP Pande_NNP P._NNP G._NNP (_( 1937-38_JJ )_) ._.
Annual_JJ Report_NNP of_IN Veterinary_NNP Investigation_NNP Officer_NNP ,_, Assam_NNP Viswanathan_NNP ,_, G._NNP R._NNP (_( 1938-39_JJ )_) Annual_JJ Report_NNP of_IN Veterinary_NNP Investigation_NNP Officer_NNP ,_, Madras_NNP THE_NNP INFLUENCE_NNP OF_NNP DIETARY_NNP FAT_NNP ON_NNP THE_NNP YIELD_NNP AND_NNP COMPOSITION_NNP OF_NNP BUTTERFAT_NNP ._.
By_IN I._NNP P._NNP SINGHVERMA_NNP ,_, T._NNP M._NNP PAUL_NNP ,_, C._NNP P._NNP ANANTAKRISHNAN_NNP and_CC M._NNP C._NNP RANGASWAMY_NNP ,_, IMperial_NNP Dairy_NNP Research_NNP Institute_NNP ,_, Bangalore_NNP (_( Received_VBN for_IN publication_NN on_IN 5_CD November_NNP 1946_CD )_) BUTTERFAT_NNP ,_, being_VBG the_DT most_RBS valuable_JJ constituent_NN of_IN milk_NN ,_, determines_VBZ the_DT quality_NN of_IN milk_NN and_CC numerous_JJ investigations_NNS have_VBP been_VBN made_VBN to_TO study_VB the_DT various_JJ factors_NNS affecting_VBG its_PRP$ yield_NN ._.
Although_IN there_EX is_VBZ a_DT certain_JJ amount_NN of_IN disagreement_NN among_IN the_DT findings_NNS of_IN the_DT various_JJ workers_NNS ,_, the_DT concensus_NN of_IN opinion_NN is_VBZ that_IN fat_JJ percentage_NN in_IN milk_NN is_VBZ an_DT inherited_JJ quality_NN of_IN the_DT particular_JJ indi-_JJ vidual_JJ animal_NN and_CC the_DT breed_NN to_TO which_WDT it_PRP belongs_VBZ ._.
In_IN countries_NNS where_WRB large_JJ amounts_NNS of_IN milk_NN are_VBP utilized_VBN for_IN the_DT manufacture_NN of_IN butter_NN ,_, this_DT has_VBZ led_VBN to_TO the_DT selective_JJ breeding_NN of_IN certain_JJ strains_NNS of_IN animals_NNS with_IN higher_JJR fat_JJ percentage_NN ._.
Of_IN the_DT English_NNP breeds_NNS of_IN cows_NNS ,_, Jersey_NNP and_CC Guernsey_NNP give_VB higher_JJR fat_NN percentage_NN in_IN milk_NN than_IN Freisian_JJ or_CC Shorthorn_NNP ._.
In_IN India_NNP Scindhi_NNP and_CC Gir_NNP cows_NNS give_VBP milk_NN richer_NN in_IN butterfat_NN as_IN compared_VBN to_TO many_JJ of_IN the_DT English_NNP breeds_NNS and_CC the_DT Indian_JJ buffalo_NN is_VBZ unrivaled_VBN in_IN this_DT respect_NN among_IN the_DT dairy_NN animals_NNS of_IN the_DT world_NN ,_, so_RB much_RB so_IN that_IN it_PRP has_VBZ been_VBN called_VBN a_DT veritable_JJ butter_NN producing_VBG machine_NN ._.
This_DT being_VBG the_DT case_NN there_EX is_VBZ no_DT wonder_NN if_IN buffaloes_NNS are_VBP prefered_VBN in_IN India_NNP where_WRB ghee_NN is_VBZ the_DT most_RBS important_JJ dairy_NN product_NN ._.
But_CC even_RB among_IN animals_NNS of_IN the_DT same_JJ breed_NN variation_NN in_IN the_DT fat_JJ content_NN of_IN milk_NN has_VBZ been_VBN observed_VBN from_IN time_NN to_TO time_NN ._.
This_DT has_VBZ led_VBN to_TO many_JJ investigations_NNS into_IN the_DT causes_NNS of_IN the_DT fluctuation_NN in_IN the_DT fat_JJ percentage_NN of_IN the_DT milk_NN and_CC it_PRP has_VBZ been_VBN found_VBN that_IN factors_NNS like_IN individuality_NN ,_, the_DT interval_NN between_IN two_CD successive_JJ milkings_NNS ,_, time_NN of_IN milking_NN ,_, stage_NN of_IN lactation_NN ,_, season_NN of_IN the_DT year_NN ,_, and_CC the_DT age_NN of_IN the_DT animal_NN are_VBP mainly_RB responsible_JJ for_IN the_DT fluctuations_NNS in_IN the_DT fat_JJ percentage_NN of_IN the_DT milk_NN of_IN the_DT same_JJ animal_NN at_IN different_JJ periods_NNS or_CC between_IN the_DT milks_NNS of_IN different_JJ animals_NNS of_IN the_DT same_JJ breed_NN ._.
The_DT influence_NN of_IN the_DT feed_NN consumed_VBN by_IN the_DT animal_NN on_IN the_DT yield_NN of_IN milkfat_NN was_VBD recognized_VBN only_RB later_RB ,_, but_CC now_RB it_PRP is_VBZ definitely_RB known_VBN that_IN the_DT food_NN consumed_VBN by_IN the_DT animal_NN plays_VBZ an_DT important_JJ part_NN in_IN the_DT yield_NN of_IN both_DT milk_NN and_CC milkfat_NN ._.
The_DT ordinary_JJ farmer_NN knows_VBZ the_DT importance_NN of_IN the_DT concentrate_NN cattle_NNS feeds_NNS like_IN oil_NN cakes_NNS as_IN food_NN for_IN dairy_NN cattle_NNS ._.
The_DT albuminoids_NNS of_IN the_DT cakes_NNS primarily_RB contribute_VBP to_TO the_DT increased_VBN production_NN of_IN milk_NN ._.
It_PRP is_VBZ quite_RB natural_JJ that_IN the_DT cakes_NNS might_MD contain_VB considerable_JJ amounts_NNS of_IN oils_NNS but_CC the_DT function_NN of_IN these_DT oils_NNS in_IN the_DT cattle_NNS feeds_NNS has_VBZ not_RB been_VBN fully_RB realized_VBN ._.
Numerous_JJ investigations_NNS have_VBP been_VBN made_VBN both_DT in_IN Europe_NNP and_CC in_IN America_NNP to_TO study_VB the_DT effect_NN of_IN various_JJ oils_NNS on_IN the_DT yields_NNS of_IN milk_NN and_CC butterfat_NN ._.
In_IN the_DT case_NN of_IN a_DT supplementary_JJ ration_NN of_IN fat_NN in_IN addition_NN to_TO an_DT already_RB adequate_JJ ration_NN ,_, a_DT peculiar_JJ situation_NN is_VBZ created_VBN whereby_RB an_DT additional_JJ amount_NN of_IN fat_NN is_VBZ made_VBN available_JJ to_TO the_DT mammary_JJ glands_NNS of_IN the_DT animal_NN for_IN conversion_NN into_IN milkfat_NN ._.
If_IN this_DT hypothesis_NN is_VBZ correct_JJ ,_, one_CD can_MD naturally_RB expect_VB an_DT increase_NN in_IN the_DT fat_JJ content_NN of_IN milk_NN when_WRB oils_NNS are_VBP fed_VBN to_TO dairy_VB animals_NNS ._.
Depending_VBG upon_IN the_DT nature_NN of_IN the_DT fat_JJ fed_NN ,_, the_DT effect_NN may_MD be_VB qualitative_JJ or_CC quantitative_JJ or_CC even_RB both_DT ._.
It_PRP is_VBZ more_RBR than_IN clear_JJ that_IN the_DT analytical_JJ constants_NNS of_IN ghee_NN (_( butterfat_NN )_) may_MD be_VB affected_VBN within_IN a_DT very_RB short_JJ time_NN by_IN a_DT supple-_JJ mentary_JJ feed_NN of_IN any_DT fat_JJ to_TO the_DT animal_NN ._.
This_DT is_VBZ particularly_RB important_JJ in_IN view_NN of_IN the_DT fact_NN that_IN butter_NN and_CC ghee_NN are_VBP judged_VBN for_IN purity_NN by_IN the_DT analytical_JJ constants_NNS ._.
India_NNP produces_VBZ large_JJ amounts_NNS of_IN a_DT variety_NN of_IN edible_JJ oils_NNS and_CC hydrogenation_NN of_IN these_DT oils_NNS is_VBZ also_RB becoming_VBG very_RB popular_JJ ._.
In_IN the_DT near_JJ future_NN ,_, large_JJ amounts_NNS of_IN hydrogenated_VBN oils_NNS may_MD become_VB avail-_JJ able_JJ at_IN a_DT cheap_JJ rate_NN ._.
If_IN the_DT untreated_JJ oil_NN has_VBZ some_DT effect_NN on_IN the_DT yield_NN and_CC composition_NN of_IN the_DT butter-_JJ fat_NN as_IN reported_VBN by_IN Moghul_NNP et_CC al_RB [_JJ 1945_CD ]_NN ,_, it_PRP is_VBZ to_TO be_VB naturally_RB expected_VBN that_IN hydrogenated_VBD oils_NNS also_RB should_MD exert_VB some_DT influence_NN on_IN the_DT yield_NN and_CC composition_NN of_IN butterfat_NN ._.
Owing_VBG to_TO the_DT change_NN in_IN the_DT degree_NN of_IN unsaturation_NN when_WRB an_DT oil_NN is_VBZ hydrogenated_VBN ,_, it_PRP is_VBZ expected_VBN that_IN the_DT effect_NN of_IN vanaspati_NN feeding_NN would_MD be_VB different_JJ from_IN that_DT of_IN the_DT untreated_JJ oil_NN ._.
Again_RB if_IN the_DT hydrogenated_VBN oils_NNS can_MD be_VB economically_RB converted_VBN into_IN the_DT more_RBR nutritious_JJ butterfat_NN through_IN the_DT medium_NN of_IN the_DT dairy_NN animal_NN it_PRP will_MD really_RB be_VB an_DT achievement_NN ._.
But_CC so_RB far_RB no_DT systematic_JJ work_NN has_VBZ been_VBN done_VBN to_TO study_VB this_DT aspect_NN of_IN the_DT problem_NN ._.
Dustman_NNP et_CC al_RB [_JJ 1941_CD ]_NN observed_VBD that_IN when_WRB one_CD pound_NN of_IN hydrogenated_JJ soyabean_JJ oil_NN was_VBD fed_VBN to_TO cows_NNS ,_, the_DT iodine_JJ number_NN increased_VBD slightly_RB ,_, showing_VBG a_DT slight_JJ desaturation_NN by_IN the_DT cow_NN ._.
Hilditch_NN and_CC Jasper-_NNP son_NN [_NN 1943_CD ]_NN ,_, supplemented_VBD the_DT basal_JJ ration_NN of_IN dairy_NN cows_NNS with_IN groundnut_JJ oil_NN ,_, hydrogenated_VBD groundnut_NN 235_CD 236_CD Influence_NN of_IN Dietary_NNP Fat_NNP on_IN yield_NN and_CC Composition_NNP of_IN Butterfat_NNP oils_NNS of_IN iodine_NN values_NNS 45_CD and_CC 17_CD respectively_RB and_CC peanut_JJ oil_NN of_IN iodine_NN value_NN 17_CD ._.
The_DT untreated_JJ ground-_JJ nut_JJ oil_NN of_IN iodine_NN value_NN 85_CD increased_VBD the_DT iodine_JJ value_NN of_IN the_DT butterfat_NN by_IN 4.6_CD and_CC lowered_VBD the_DT R._NNP M._NNP and_CC Polenske_NNP values_NNS by_IN 6.6_CD and_CC 0.6_CD respectively_RB ._.
Hydrogenated_VBN groundnut_JJ oil_NN of_IN iodine_NN value_NN 45_CD had_VBD more_RBR or_CC less_RBR the_DT same_JJ effect_NN ._.
But_CC in_IN the_DT case_NN of_IN hydrogenated_VBN groundnut_JJ oil_NN of_IN iodine_NN value_NN 17_CD ,_, the_DT change_NN in_IN composition_NN was_VBD less_JJR marked_JJ ,_, butterfat_NN being_VBG almost_RB of_IN similar_JJ composition_NN as_IN the_DT control_NN butter_NN ._.
Palm-kernel_JJ oil_NN of_IN iodine_NN value_NN 17_CD lowered_VBD the_DT iodine_NN and_CC R._NNP M._NNP values_NNS by_IN 5_CD and_CC 1.2_CD units_NNS respectively_RB and_CC increased_VBD the_DT Polenske_NNP value_NN slightly_RB ._.
In_IN neither_DT of_IN the_DT cases_NNS was_VBD there_EX any_DT signi-_JJ ficant_JJ increase_NN in_IN the_DT milk_NN yield_NN or_CC fat_JJ output_NN ._.
Moghul_NNP et_CC al_RB [_JJ 1945_CD ]_NN have_VBP reported_VBN that_IN 1½_CD lb_NN ._.
of_IN cotton-_JJ seed_NN oil_NN had_VBD a_DT beneficial_JJ effect_NN on_IN the_DT milk_NN yield_NN of_IN Scindhi_NNP cows_NNS and_CC sesame_NN and_CC coconut_NN oils_NNS had_VBD more_RBR pronounced_JJ effect_NN on_IN the_DT milk_NN yield_NN and_CC fat_JJ output_NN of_IN Murrah_NNP buffaloes_NNS at_IN the_DT same_JJ time_NN affect-_JJ ing_VBG the_DT composition_NN of_IN the_DT resulting_VBG butterfat_NN considerably_RB in_IN all_DT cases_NNS ._.
But_CC no_DT work_NN seems_VBZ to_TO have_VB been_VBN done_VBN to_TO study_VB the_DT effect_NN of_IN feeding_VBG hydrogenated_VBN oils_NNS on_IN the_DT milk_NN yield_NN and_CC fat_JJ output_NN of_IN the_DT indigenous_JJ breed_NN of_IN cattle_NNS ._.
Therefore_RB ,_, a_DT series_NN of_IN experiments_NNS was_VBD conducted_VBN to_TO study_VB the_DT effect_NN of_IN feeding_VBG oils_NNS of_IN two_CD diffent_JJ degrees_NNS of_IN saturation_NN on_IN the_DT milk_NN yield_NN and_CC butterfat_NN output_NN of_IN Scindhi_NNP cows_NNS and_CC Murrah_NNP buffaloes_NNS and_CC the_DT results_NNS obtained_VBN are_VBP presented_VBN in_IN this_DT paper_NN ._.
EXPERIMENTAL_NNP Nine_NNP Scindhi_NNP cows_NNS and_CC nine_CD Murrah_NNP buffaloes_NNS of_IN almost_RB the_DT same_JJ age_NN ,_, body_NN weight_NN ,_, stage_NN of_IN lactation_NN and_CC milk_NN yield_NN were_VBD selected_VBN for_IN the_DT experiment_NN from_IN the_DT herd_NN of_IN the_DT Imperial_NNP Dairy_NNP Research_NNP Institute_NNP ._.
These_DT were_VBD divided_VBN into_IN three_CD equal_JJ groups_NNS ,_, one_CD for_IN control_NN and_CC the_DT other_JJ two_CD for_IN experi-_JJ mental_JJ purposes_NNS ._.
The_DT control_NN group_NN received_VBD only_RB the_DT normal_JJ ration_NN fed_VBN to_TO the_DT Institute_NNP herd_NN through-_NN out_IN the_DT period_NN ._.
The_DT normal_JJ concentrate_JJ ration_NN of_IN the_DT Institute_NNP herd_NN consisted_VBD of_IN a_DT mixture_NN of_IN wheat_NN bran_NN ,_, gram_NN ,_, gram_JJ husk_NN and_CC groundnut_JJ cake_NN in_IN the_DT proportion_NN of_IN 4.0_CD :_: 1.5_CD :_: 2.0_CD :_: 2.5_CD ._.
This_DT mixture_NN was_VBD fed_VBN at_IN the_DT rate_NN of_IN one_CD pound_NN for_IN every_DT two_CD pounds_NNS of_IN milk_NN yielded_VBN by_IN the_DT animal_NN ._.
The_DT roughage_NN consisted_VBD of_IN 50_CD lb_NN ._.
of_IN green_JJ grass_NN (_( mixture_NN of_IN Guinea_NNP and_CC Napier_NNP grasses_NNS )_) and_CC 3_CD lb_NN ._.
of_IN ragi_JJ straw_NN in_IN the_DT case_NN of_IN cows_NNS and_CC 70_CD lb_NN ._.
green_JJ grass_NN and_CC 3_CD lb_NN ._.
of_IN ragi_JJ straw_NN for_IN buffaloes_NNS ._.
Till_VB the_DT actual_JJ feeding_NN of_IN the_DT vanaspati_NN was_VBD started_VBN ,_, all_PDT the_DT animals_NNS ,_, both_DT control_NN and_CC experimental_JJ ,_, were_VBD receiving_VBG only_RB this_DT ration_NN ._.
The_DT milk_NN yield_NN and_CC fat_JJ percentage_NN were_VBD noted_VBN for_IN all_PDT the_DT animals_NNS for_IN a_DT week_NN ,_, at_IN the_DT end_NN of_IN which_WDT a_DT day_NN 's_POS yield_NN of_IN milk_NN was_VBD separately_RB collected_VBN from_IN each_DT animal_NN for_IN butter_NN making_NN ._.
After_IN this_DT initial_JJ control_NN period_NN for_IN all_PDT the_DT animals_NNS ,_, including_VBG the_DT experimental_JJ ones_NNS ,_, one_CD group_NN of_IN cows_NNS and_CC buffaloes_NNS was_VBD fed_VBN ½_JJ lb_NN ._.
of_IN hydrogenated_VBN coconut_NN oil_NN and_CC the_DT other_JJ group_NN of_IN cows_NNS and_CC buffaloes_NNS ½_NNP lb_NN ._.
groundnut_NN oil_NN vanaspati_NN per_IN head_NN on_IN the_DT first_JJ day_NN ._.
This_DT was_VBD increased_VBN to_TO 1_CD lb_NN ._.
on_IN the_DT second_JJ day_NN and_CC thereafter_RB 1½_CD lb_NN ._.
were_VBD fed_VBN per_IN head_NN per_IN day_NN for_IN a_DT fortnight_JJ besides_IN the_DT normal_JJ ration_NN which_WDT the_DT animals_NNS were_VBD already_RB receiving_VBG ._.
The_DT control_NN animals_VBZ received_VBN only_RB the_DT normal_JJ ration_NN all_PDT the_DT time_NN ._.
The_DT milk_NN yield_NN and_CC the_DT percentage_NN of_IN fat_NN in_IN milk_NN were_VBD recorded_VBN systematically_RB every_DT day_NN ._.
Every_DT 5th_CD day_NN a_DT day_NN 's_POS milk_NN was_VBD separately_RB collected_VBN from_IN each_DT animal_NN for_IN butter_NN making_NN and_CC this_DT butter_NN was_VBD then_RB melted_VBN into_IN ghee_NN at_IN 115ºC_CD ._.
filtered_VBN and_CC analysed_VBN for_IN R._NNP M._NNP ,_, Polenske_NNP and_CC Iodine_NNP Values_NNP and_CC B._NNP R._NNP reading_NN ._.

(_( 3_CD )_) Composition_NN of_IN the_DT butterfat_NN ._.
The_DT change_NN in_IN the_DT composition_NN of_IN the_DT butterfat_NN of_IN buffaloes_NNS during_IN coconut_NN vanaspathi_NNS feeding_VBG were_VBD almost_RB the_DT same_JJ as_IN those_DT of_IN the_DT butterfat_NN of_IN cows_NNS during_IN the_DT coconut_NN vanaspathi_NN feeding_NN ._.
The_DT R._NNP M._NNP value_NN and_CC Iodine_NNP values_NNS decreased_VBD slightly_RB ,_, the_DT Polenske_NNP value_NN increased_VBD and_CC the_DT B._NNP R._NNP reading_NN remained_VBD almost_RB stationary_JJ ._.
After_IN stopping_VBG the_DT supplemen-_JJ tary_JJ feed_NN of_IN the_DT vanaspathi_NN ,_, the_DT composition_NN came_VBD back_RB to_TO very_RB near_IN the_DT normal_JJ within_IN a_DT week_NN and_CC in_IN the_DT case_NN of_IN the_DT control_NN animals_NNS there_EX was_VBD no_DT considerable_JJ change_NN in_IN any_DT of_IN the_DT analytical_JJ constants_NNS throughout_IN the_DT period_NN under_IN observation_NN ._.

1_CD 33.7_CD 24.2_CD 1.3_CD 41.4_CD 2_CD 33.5_CD 23.8_CD 1.4_CD 41.3_CD 3_CD 33.9_CD 23.8_CD 1.4_CD 41.5_CD 4_CD 33.8_CD 24.0_CD 1.3_CD 41.4_CD 5_CD 33.5_CD 23.9_CD 1.4_CD 41.6_CD The_DT general_JJ condition_NN of_IN the_DT animals_NNS in_IN all_PDT the_DT four_CD experimental_JJ groups_NNS remained_VBD quite_RB satis-_JJ factory_NN throughout_IN the_DT experiment_NN ._.
The_DT animals_NNS did_VBD not_RB show_VB any_DT reluctance_NN to_TO take_VB 1½_CD lb_NN ._.
of_IN the_DT oil_NN along_IN with_IN their_PRP$ concentrate_NN ration_NN ._.
No_DT digestive_JJ disturbance_NN nor_CC any_DT laxative_JJ effect_NN was_VBD observed_VBN during_IN the_DT experimental_JJ period_NN ._.
DISCUSSION_NNP Neither_NNP of_IN the_DT vanaspathi_NN had_VBD any_DT favourable_JJ action_NN on_IN the_DT milk_NN yield_NN of_IN cows_NNS ,_, but_CC on_IN the_DT con-_JJ trary_NN ,_, there_EX was_VBD considerable_JJ depression_NN in_IN the_DT milk_NN yield_NN in_IN the_DT case_NN of_IN cows_NNS which_WDT received_VBD a_DT supple-_JJ mentary_JJ feed_NN of_IN groundnut_NN vanaspathi_NN ._.
In_IN the_DT case_NN of_IN coconut_NN vanaspathi_NN too_RB there_EX was_VBD a_DT decrease_NN in_IN the_DT milk_NN yield_NN of_IN the_DT cows_NNS but_CC it_PRP was_VBD less_RBR marked_JJ than_IN in_IN the_DT groundnut_NN vanaspathi_NN group_NN ._.
Moghul_NNP et_CC al_RB [_JJ 1945_CD unpublished_JJ ]_NN have_VBP reported_VBN that_IN feeding_NN of_IN untreated_JJ oils_NNS like_IN coconut_NN ,_, groundnut_NN or_CC sesame_NN maintained_VBD the_DT milk_NN yield_NN and_CC cottonseed_JJ oil_NN increased_VBD the_DT milk_NN yield_NN of_IN cows_NNS ._.
Therefore_RB the_DT findings_NNS of_IN the_DT present_JJ investigation_NN leads_VBZ to_TO the_DT conclusion_NN that_IN hydrogenation_NN lowers_VBZ the_DT quality_NN of_IN the_DT oils_NNS as_RB far_RB as_IN their_PRP$ suitability_NN as_IN feed_NN for_IN milch_NN cattle_NNS is_VBZ concerned_VBN ._.
Probably_RB this_DT has_VBZ to_TO be_VB attributed_VBN to_TO the_DT saturation_NN and_CC consequent_JJ rise_NN in_IN the_DT melting_NN point_NN of_IN vanaspathi_NN ._.
In_IN the_DT case_NN of_IN buffaloes_NNS ,_, groundnut_NN vanaspathi_NN showed_VBD the_DT same_JJ effect_NN as_IN in_IN the_DT case_NN of_IN cows_NNS ,_, viz._NN ,_, a_DT depression_NN in_IN the_DT milk_NN yield_NN but_CC it_PRP was_VBD not_RB so_RB marked_JJ as_IN in_IN the_DT case_NN of_IN cows_NNS ._.
The_DT effect_NN of_IN the_DT supplementary_JJ feed_NN of_IN coconut_NN vanaspathi_NN on_IN buffaloes_NNS was_VBD ,_, however_RB ,_, different_JJ from_IN that_DT on_IN cows_NNS ._.
Buffaloes_NNP recorded_VBD an_DT increase_NN in_IN the_DT average_JJ daily_JJ milk_NN yield_NN on_IN being_VBG fed_VBN with_IN coconut_NN vanaspathi_NN ._.
The_DT finding_NN of_IN the_DT previous_JJ workers_NNS who_WP fed_VBP untreated_JJ coconut_NN oil_NN is_VBZ also_RB the_DT same_JJ with_IN the_DT difference_NN that_IN there_EX was_VBD a_DT slight_JJ depression_NN in_IN the_DT yield_NN in_IN the_DT beginning_NN ,_, which_WDT later_RB on_IN increased_VBN considerably_RB even_RB after_IN stopping_VBG the_DT feeding_NN of_IN the_DT untreated_JJ oil_NN ._.
In_IN the_DT case_NN of_IN the_DT hydrogenated_JJ coconut_NN oil_NN the_DT increase_NN is_VBZ more_RBR pronounced_JJ in_IN the_DT first_JJ few_JJ days_NNS ,_, and_CC on_IN stopping_VBG the_DT feeding_VBG the_DT yield_NN comes_VBZ almost_RB to_TO the_DT normal_JJ in_IN a_DT week_NN 's_POS time_NN ._.
I._NNP P._NNP SINGH_NNP VERMA_NNP ,_, T._NNP M._NNP PAUL_NNP ,_, ETC_NNP ._.
243_CD With_IN regard_NN to_TO the_DT effect_NN on_IN the_DT yield_NN of_IN butterfat_NN also_RB hydrogenated_VBD oils_NNS differ_VBP from_IN the_DT untreated_JJ oil_NN ._.
The_DT findings_NNS of_IN the_DT present_JJ investigation_NN are_VBP that_IN groundnut_JJ vanaspathi_NN lowers_VBZ the_DT fat_JJ percen-_JJ tage_NN of_IN the_DT milk_NN of_IN cows_NNS considerably_RB and_CC coconut_VB vanaspathi_NN increases_NNS it_PRP slightly_RB ._.
This_DT ,_, along_IN with_IN a_DT fall_NN in_IN the_DT milk_NN yield_NN had_VBD led_VBN to_TO a_DT net_JJ decrease_NN in_IN the_DT average_JJ daily_JJ output_NN of_IN fat_NN ,_, more_RBR pronounced_JJ in_IN the_DT case_NN of_IN cows_NNS fed_VBN on_IN groundnut_NN vanaspathi_NN ._.
In_IN the_DT case_NN of_IN buffaloes_NNS both_DT vanaspathis_NNS have_VBP produced_VBN an_DT increase_NN in_IN the_DT fat_JJ percentage_NN of_IN the_DT milk_NN ._.
Although_IN there_EX was_VBD a_DT decline_NN in_IN the_DT milk_NN yield_NN when_WRB groundnut_NN vanaspathi_NN was_VBD fed_VBN to_TO buffaloes_VB the_DT increase_NN in_IN fat_JJ percentage_NN has_VBZ more_JJR than_IN made_VBN up_RP for_IN that_DT which_WDT resulted_VBD in_IN a_DT net_JJ increase_NN in_IN the_DT average_JJ daily_JJ output_NN of_IN fat_NN ._.
In_IN the_DT case_NN of_IN coconut_NN vanaspathi_NN since_IN there_EX was_VBD no_DT fall_NN in_IN milk_NN yield_VBP the_DT increase_NN in_IN the_DT total_JJ daily_JJ fat_NN output_NN was_VBD more_RBR pronounced_JJ ._.
Thus_RB the_DT buffalo_NN is_VBZ found_VBN to_TO be_VB more_RBR suitable_JJ for_IN the_DT conversion_NN of_IN the_DT vanaspathi_NN into_IN butterfat_NN ._.
Even_RB with_IN the_DT untreated_JJ oils_NNS buffaloes_NNS produced_VBD better_JJR results_NNS according_VBG to_TO Moghul_NNP et_FW al_NN ._.
[_NN 1945_CD ]_NN ._.
The_DT composition_NN of_IN the_DT butterfat_NN was_VBD markedly_RB changed_VBN during_IN the_DT experimental_JJ period_NN when_WRB either_DT of_IN the_DT vanaspathis_NN was_VBD fed_VBN ._.
All_DT animals_NNS showed_VBD this_DT change_NN within_IN five_CD days_NNS of_IN feeding_VBG the_DT vanaspathi_NN and_CC gradually_RB the_DT composition_NN of_IN the_DT butterfat_NN returned_VBD to_TO normal_JJ within_IN a_DT week_NN after_IN stopping_VBG the_DT vanaspathi_NN feeding_NN ._.
There_EX was_VBD a_DT decrease_NN in_IN R._NNP M._NNP and_CC Polenske_NNP values_NNS and_CC a_DT rise_NN in_IN Iodine_NNP value_NN and_CC B._NNP E._NNP reading_NN of_IN the_DT butterfat_NN of_IN cows_NNS which_WDT received_VBD a_DT supplementary_JJ feed_NN of_IN ground-_JJ nut_JJ vanaspathi_NN ._.
In_IN the_DT case_NN of_IN coconut_NN vanaspathi_NN R._NNP M._NNP value_NN decreased_VBD but_CC to_TO a_DT less_RBR extent_JJ ,_, Polenske_NNP value_NN increased_VBD slightly_RB and_CC the_DT Iodine_NNP value_NN and_CC B._NNP R._NNP readings_NNS decreased_VBD ._.
This_DT difference_NN in_IN the_DT change_NN in_IN composition_NN is_VBZ perhaps_RB to_TO be_VB attributed_VBN to_TO the_DT difference_NN in_IN the_DT composition_NN of_IN the_DT two_CD different_JJ vanaspathis_NNS ._.
Buffaloes_NNP which_WDT received_VBD vanaspathis_NNS as_IN supplementary_JJ feed_NN produced_VBN butter_NN which_WDT differed_VBD very_RB much_JJ in_IN composition_NN from_IN the_DT butter_NN of_IN the_DT control_JJ period_NN of_IN the_DT same_JJ buffaloes_NNS and_CC from_IN the_DT butter_NN of_IN the_DT control_NN animals_NNS ._.
As_IN in_IN cows_NNS ,_, R._NNP M._NNP and_CC Polenske_NNP values_NNS decreased_VBN ,_, and_CC iodine_JJ value_NN and_CC the_DT B._NNP R._NNP reading_NN showed_VBD a_DT tendency_NN to_TO increase_VB in_IN the_DT case_NN of_IN the_DT butterfat_NN of_IN the_DT buffaloes_NNS which_WDT were_VBD receiving_VBG a_DT supplement_NN of_IN 1½_CD lb_NN ._.
of_IN groundnut_NN vanaspathi_NN ._.
Coconut_NNP vanaspathi_NN differed_VBD from_IN the_DT groundnut_NN vanaspathi_NN in_IN its_PRP$ effect_NN on_IN the_DT composition_NN of_IN the_DT butterfat_NN ,_, the_DT R._NNP M._NNP value_NN decreased_VBD just_RB as_IN in_IN the_DT case_NN of_IN groundnut_NN vanaspathi_NN but_CC the_DT Polenske_NNP value_NN increased_VBD ,_, and_CC Iodine_NNP value_NN decreased_VBN ,_, and_CC the_DT B._NNP R._NNP reading_NN remained_VBD almost_RB steady_JJ ._.
Only_RB the_DT buffaloes_NNS that_WDT received_VBD a_DT supplementary_JJ ration_NN of_IN coconut_NN vanaspathi_NN recorded_VBD an_DT increase_NN in_IN milk_JJ yield_NN ._.
Cows_NNP which_WDT received_VBD either_DT of_IN the_DT vanaspathis_NN and_CC buffaloes_NNS that_WDT received_VBD groundnut_NNS vanaspathi_IN all_DT recorded_VBD a_DT decrease_NN in_IN milk_NN yield_NN ._.
Apart_RB from_IN the_DT fall_NN of_IN milk_JJ yield_NN of_IN the_DT cows_NNS during_IN the_DT vanaspathi_NN the_DT fat_JJ content_NN of_IN the_DT milk_NN also_RB went_VBD down_RB resulting_VBG in_IN a_DT considerable_JJ decrease_NN in_IN the_DT output_NN of_IN fat_NN ._.
But_CC buffaloes_NNS gave_VBD richer_JJR milk_NN in_IN both_DT cases_NNS and_CC consequently_RB the_DT fat_JJ output_NN was_VBD increased_VBN slightly_RB ._.
Thus_RB buffaloes_NNS seem_VBP to_TO be_VB more_RBR responsive_JJ to_TO vanaspathi_VB feeding_NN ._.
But_CC further_RBR feeding_JJ trials_NNS extending_VBG over_IN a_DT longer_JJR period_NN preferably_RB one_CD complete_JJ lactation_NN will_MD be_VB necessary_JJ to_TO study_VB the_DT long_JJ range_NN effects_NNS of_IN such_JJ supplementary_JJ feeding_NN as_IN also_RB the_DT economic_JJ aspect_NN of_IN the_DT problem_NN ._.
Regarding_VBG the_DT composition_NN of_IN the_DT butterfat_NN of_IN animals_NNS receiving_VBG vanaspathi_NN supplements_NNS ,_, cows_NNS and_CC buffaloes_NNS seem_VBP to_TO react_VB almost_RB in_IN the_DT same_JJ way_NN ,_, but_CC different_JJ vanaspathis_NN produce_NN different_JJ effects_NNS ._.
The_DT R._NNP M._NNP value_NN is_VBZ decreased_VBN in_IN all_DT cases_NNS ,_, the_DT decrease_NN depending_VBG upon_IN the_DT E._NNP M._NNP value_NN of_IN the_DT vanas-_JJ pathi_NN fed_NN ._.
The_DT Iodine_NNP value_NN increased_VBD in_IN the_DT case_NN of_IN groundnut_NN vanaspathi_NN while_IN it_PRP decreased_VBD in_IN the_DT case_NN of_IN coconut_NN vanaspathi_NN ._.
Polenske_NNP value_NN increased_VBD in_IN the_DT case_NN of_IN coconut_NN vanaspathi_NN while_IN it_PRP decreased_VBD on_IN feeding_VBG groundnut_NN vanaspathi_NN ._.
All_PDT these_DT indicate_VBP the_DT possibility_NN of_IN altering_VBG the_DT compo-_JJ sition_NN of_IN the_DT butterfat_NN by_IN giving_VBG suitable_JJ feeds_NNS ._.
This_DT is_VBZ of_IN particular_JJ interest_NN in_IN the_DT testing_NN and_CC grading_NN of_IN ghee_NN ._.
Here_RB again_RB ,_, to_TO arrive_VB at_IN the_DT possible_JJ limits_NNS of_IN variation_NN of_IN the_DT chemical_NN constants_NNS due_JJ to_TO the_DT feeding_NN of_IN vanaspathi_NN ,_, further_JJ feeding_NN trials_NNS with_IN a_DT large_JJ number_NN of_IN cows_NNS and_CC extending_VBG over_RP an_DT entire_JJ lactation_NN are_VBP necessary_JJ ._.
SUMMARY_NNP (_( 1_CD )_) Coconut_NNP and_CC groundnut_VB vanaspathis_NNS were_VBD fed_VBN to_TO the_DT Scindhi_NNP cows_NNS and_CC Murrah_NNP buffaloes_NNS at_IN the_DT rate_NN of_IN 1½_CD lb_NN ._.
per_IN head_NN per_IN day_NN for_IN a_DT fortnight_NN ._.
244_CD Influence_NN of_IN Dietary_NNP Fat_NNP on_IN yield_NN and_CC Composition_NNP of_IN Butterfat_NNP (_( 2_CD )_) Milk_NNP yield_NN of_IN cows_NNS decreased_VBN in_IN both_DT cases_NNS but_CC buffaloes_NNS gave_VBD slightly_RB increased_VBN milk_NN yield_NN with_IN coconut_NN vanaspathi_NN and_CC slightly_RB ,_, decreased_VBD yield_NN on_IN groundnut_NN vanaspathi_NN ._.
(_( 3_CD )_) The_DT fat_JJ percentage_NN of_IN the_DT milk_NN of_IN cows_NNS fed_VBN on_IN groundnut_NN vanaspathi_NN went_VBD down_RB and_CC that_IN of_IN cows_NNS fed_VBN on_IN coconut_NN increased_VBD a_DT little_JJ but_CC both_CC the_DT vanaspathis_NN increased_VBD the_DT fat_JJ percentage_NN of_IN the_DT milk_NN of_IN buffaloes_NNS ._.
(_( 4_CD )_) Due_NNP to_TO the_DT fall_NN in_IN both_CC the_DT milk_NN yield_NN and_CC fat_JJ percentage_NN ,_, the_DT daily_JJ output_NN of_IN the_DT fat_NN of_IN cows_NNS decreased_VBN when_WRB either_DT of_IN the_DT vanaspathis_NN was_VBD fed_VBN ._.
But_CC buffaloes_NNS showed_VBD an_DT increase_NN in_IN the_DT daily_JJ output_NN of_IN fat_NN when_WRB receiving_VBG either_DT of_IN the_DT vanaspathis_NN due_JJ to_TO the_DT increase_NN in_IN both_CC the_DT yield_NN of_IN milk_NN and_CC the_DT fat_JJ percentage_NN of_IN milk_NN ._.
(_( 5_CD )_) The_DT composition_NN of_IN the_DT butterfat_NN was_VBD altered_VBN considerably_RB in_IN both_DT cows_NNS and_CC buffaloes_NNS due_JJ to_TO the_DT feeding_NN of_IN either_DT of_IN the_DT vanaspathis_NN ._.
Hence_NN in_IN both_CC the_DT cases_NNS the_DT butter_NN could_MD easily_RB be_VB suspected_VBN to_TO be_VB adulterated_VBN ._.

(_( 1945_CD ,_, unpublished_VBD )_) INVESTIGATIONS_NNP ON_NNP THE_NNP RESAZURIN_NNP TEST_NNP FOR_IN ASSESSING_NNP THE_NNP HYGIENIC_NNP QUALITY_NNP OF_NNP MILK_NNP IN_NNP INDIA_NNP An_DT enquiry_NN carried_VBD out_RP under_IN a_DT scheme_NN financed_VBN by_IN the_DT Imperial_NNP Council_NNP of_IN Agricultural_NNP Research_NNP ,_, New_NNP Delhi_NNP By_IN H._NNP LAXMINARAYANA_NNP ,_, Imperial_NNP Dairy_NNP Research_NNP Institute_NNP ,_, Bangalore_NNP (_( Received_VBN for_IN publication_NN on_IN 6_CD May_NNP 1946_CD )_) THE_DT resazurin_NN reduction_NN test_NN has_VBZ recently_RB come_VBN into_IN great_JJ prominence_NN in_IN some_DT of_IN the_DT western_JJ countries_NNS as_IN a_DT rapid_JJ and_CC discriminative_JJ method_NN of_IN judging_VBG the_DT hygienic_JJ quality_NN of_IN milk_NN ._.
Resa-_NNP zurin_NN passes_VBZ through_IN a_DT series_NN of_IN colour_JJ changes_NNS from_IN the_DT original_JJ blue_NN to_TO lilac_VB ,_, mauve_FW ,_, purple_JJ pink_NN and_CC pink_NN before_IN being_VBG finally_RB reduced_VBN to_TO a_DT colourless_NN stage_NN depending_VBG on_IN the_DT degree_NN of_IN activity_NN of_IN the_DT organisms_JJ present_NN in_IN milk_NN [_NNP Davis_NNP ,_, 1939_CD and_CC 1942_CD ]_NN and_CC it_PRP is_VBZ also_RB highly_RB sensitive_JJ to_TO leucocytes_NNS [_NNP Thomas_NNP and_CC Davis_NNP ,_, 1940_CD ]_NN ._.
For_IN the_DT routine_JJ testing_NN of_IN milk_NN supplies_NNS ,_, an_DT one-hour_JJ resazurin_NN reduction_NN test_NN has_VBZ been_VBN recommended_VBN in_IN which_WDT milk_NN is_VBZ graded_VBN according_VBG to_TO the_DT colour_NN shade_NN to_TO which_WDT resazurin_NN is_VBZ reduced_VBN at_IN the_DT end_NN of_IN an_DT hour_NN 's_POS incubation_NN at_IN 37ºC_CD ._.
Taking_VBG the_DT reduction_NN of_IN resazurin_NN to_TO a_DT purple_JJ pink_NN ,_, pink_VBP or_CC colourless_JJ stage_NN at_IN one_CD hour_NN as_IN an_DT indication_NN of_IN poor_JJ quality_NN ,_, Ramsdell_NNP et_CC al_RB [_JJ 1935_CD ]_NN and_CC Barrett_NNP et_VBP al_NN [_NN 1937_CD ]_NN obtained_VBD a_DT fairly_RB good_JJ rela-_JJ tionship_NN between_IN resazurin_NN and_CC methylene_NN blue_JJ reduction_NN tests_NNS ._.
There_EX was_VBD ,_, however_RB ,_, a_DT poor_JJ correla-_JJ tion_NN observed_VBD between_IN the_DT resazurin_JJ test_NN and_CC colony_NN counts_NNS ,_, although_IN milks_NNS which_WDT did_VBD not_RB reduce_VB resazurin_NN appreciably_RB within_IN one_CD hour_NN generally_RB had_VBD low_JJ counts_NNS whilst_VBP high_JJ count_NN milks_NNS usually_RB reduced_VBD it_PRP within_IN one_CD hour_NN ._.
These_DT workers_NNS also_RB claim_VBP that_IN the_DT one_CD hour_NN resazurin_NN test_NN gives_VBZ as_RB much_JJ information_NN as_IN the_DT longer_JJR methylene_JJ blue_JJ reduction_NN test_NN gives_VBZ in_IN 5_CD to_TO 7_CD hours_NNS and_CC that_IN the_DT test_NN is_VBZ very_RB valuable_JJ in_IN detecting_VBG physiologically_RB abnormal_JJ and_CC pathological_JJ milk_NN on_IN account_NN of_IN its_PRP$ great_JJ sensi-_JJ tiveness_NN to_TO leucocyte_VB action_NN ._.
Davis_NNP et_CC al_RB [_JJ 1939_CD ]_NN found_VBD that_IN of_IN 422_CD samples_NNS graded_VBD 'good_NN '_'' (_( blue_NN )_) by_IN the_DT one_CD hour_NN resazurin_NN test_NN ,_, 59_CD failed_VBD methylene_NN blue_JJ test_NN and_CC of_IN 396_CD samples_NNS graded_VBD 'good_NN '_'' by_IN methylene_JJ blue_JJ test_NN ,_, only_RB 5_CD graded_VBD 'poor_NN '_'' (_( pink_NN )_) and_CC 28_CD 'doubtful_NNS '_POS (_( purple_JJ pink_NN )_) by_IN the_DT resazurin_JJ test_NN ._.
Thomas_NNP and_CC Davies_NNP [_NNP 1940_CD ]_NNP found_VBD that_IN 81_CD per_IN cent_NN of_IN the_DT samples_NNS examined_VBN by_IN them_PRP passed_VBD or_CC failed_VBD both_DT resazurin_JJ test_NN (_( purple_JJ pink_VBP in_IN one_CD hour_NN )_) and_CC methylene_$ blue_JJ test_NN (_( accredited_VBN standards246_NN Investigations_NNS on_IN Resazurin_NNP Test_NNP EXPERIMENTAL_NNP The_DT one-hour_JJ resazurin_NN test_NN ,_, methylene_NN blue_JJ reduction_NN test_NN and_CC plate_NN counts_NNS were_VBD carried_VBN out_RP on_IN some_DT 650_CD samples_NNS of_IN cow_NN ,_, buffalo_NN and_CC mixed_JJ (_( cow_JJ and_CC buffalo_NN )_) milks_NNS ,_, drawn_NN from_IN different_JJ sources_NNS ,_, namely_RB ;_: (_( i_NN )_) farm_NN produced_VBN milk_NN (_( herd_JJ samples_NNS from_IN Imperial_NNP Dairy_NNP Research_NNP Institute_NNP and_CC a_DT private_JJ dairy_NN herd_NN nearby_RB )_) ,_, (_( ii_NN )_) village_NN produced_VBN milk_NN (_( from_IN producer-retailers_NNS and_CC street_NN hawkers_NNS )_) and_CC (_( iii_NN )_) milk_NN handled_VBN by_IN private_JJ dairies_NNS (_( individual_JJ producers_NNS '_POS supplies_NNS and_CC bulk_NN tank_NN samples_NNS )_) ._.
In_IN the_DT case_NN of_IN farm_NN produced_VBN milk_NN ,_, the_DT samples_NNS were_VBD obtained_VBN at_IN the_DT time_NN of_IN production_NN (_( morn-_JJ ing_NN )_) and_CC examined_VBD within_IN 2_CD to_TO 3_CD hours_NNS after_IN keeping_VBG them_PRP in_IN the_DT refrigerator_NN (_( 40º-50ºF_JJ ._. )_)
during_IN the_DT interval_NN ._.
Village_NN produced_VBD milk_NN samples_NNS and_CC those_DT from_IN private_JJ dairies_NNS were_VBD brought_VBN to_TO the_DT laboratory_NN in_IN ice_NN boxes_NNS and_CC examined_VBD immediately_RB ._.
The_DT latter_JJ class_NN of_IN milk_NN probably_RB included_VBD both_DT morning_NN and_CC previous_JJ evening_NN 's_POS productions_NNS and_CC came_VBD to_TO the_DT dairies_NNS from_IN city_NN stables_NNS as_RB well_RB as_IN from_IN moffusil_NN centres_NNS (_( 10_CD to_TO 12_CD miles_NNS )_) ._.
The_DT interval_NN between_IN the_DT times_NNS of_IN production_NN and_CC examination_NN in_IN the_DT case_NN of_IN village_NN samples_NNS was_VBD from_IN 5_CD to_TO 6_CD hours_NNS while_IN in_IN the_DT case_NN of_IN private_JJ dairies_NNS it_PRP varied_VBD from_IN 5_CD to_TO 16_CD hours_NNS ._.
During_IN this_DT interval_NN ,_, the_DT milk_NN was_VBD exposed_VBN to_TO atmospheric_JJ temperatures_NNS varying_VBG from_IN 68º_CD to_TO 95ºF_CD ._.
(_( average_JJ morning_NN temperatures_NNS in_IN the_DT late_JJ winter_NN and_CC early_JJ summer_NN months_NNS in_IN Bangalore_NNP )_) ._.
Methods_NNS ._.
The_DT plate_NN counts_NNS were_VBD determined_VBN on_IN milk_NN agar_NN at_IN 37ºC_CD ._.
[_JJ cf_NN ._.
Ministry_NNP of_IN Agriculture_NNP 1934_CD ]_NNP and_CC the_DT methylene_NN blue_JJ reduction_NN test_NN was_VBD carried_VBN out_RP according_VBG to_TO Wilson_NNP 's_POS modified_VBN technique_NN [_NNP Wilson_NNP ,_, 1935_CD ]_VBD The_DT method_NN recommended_VBN by_IN Davis_NNP [_NNP 1939_CD ]_NNP and_CC further_RB described_VBN by_IN Davis_NNP [_NNP 1943_CD ]_NNP and_CC Davis_NNP and_CC Newland_NNP [_NNP 1944_CD ]_NNP was_VBD followed_VBN for_IN the_DT one_CD hour_NN resazurin_NN test_NN ._.
One_CD ml_NN ._.
of_IN 0.005_CD per_IN cent_NN resazurin_NN solution_NN (_( prepared_VBN from_IN Eastman_NNP Kodak_NNP resazurin_VB powder_NN )_) was_VBD added_VBN to_TO 10_CD ml_NNS ._.
of_IN milk_NN and_CC the_DT tubes_NNS gently_RB inverted_VBN twice_RB to_TO ensure_VB proper_JJ mixing_NN and_CC placed_VBN in_IN a_DT water-bath_NN at_IN a_DT temperature_NN of_IN 37º±0.5ºC_CD ._.
The_DT methylene_NN blue_JJ reduction_NN tubes_NNS were_VBD also_RB prepared_JJ and_CC incubated_JJ and_CC the_DT samples_NNS plated_VBD out_RP at_IN the_DT same_JJ time_NN ._.
At_IN the_DT end_NN of_IN one_CD hour_NN the_DT resazurin_NN tubes_NNS were_VBD gently_RB inverted_VBN and_CC the_DT stage_NN of_IN reduction_NN (_( colour_NN of_IN resazurin_NN )_) noted_VBD ._.
The_DT colour_NN shades_NNS shown_VBN by_IN resazurin_NN were_VBD quite_RB distinct_JJ and_CC well-defined_JJ and_CC after_IN a_DT little_JJ experience_NN it_PRP was_VBD possible_JJ to_TO record_VB them_PRP subjectively_RB ._.
In_IN view_NN of_IN the_DT wide_JJ differences_NNS in_IN fat_JJ contents_NNS of_IN Indian_JJ milks_NNS (_( from_IN 3.5_CD per_IN cent_NN in_IN cow_NN 's_POS milk_NN to_TO 7.5_CD per_IN cent_NN in_IN buffalo_NN 's_POS milk_NN )_) ,_, the_DT exact_JJ matching_NN of_IN the_DT colours_NN presented_VBD some_DT difficulties_NNS ._.
Samples_NNS of_IN milk_NN having_VBG a_DT low_JJ fat_NN content_NN showed_VBD deeper_JJR tints_NNS than_IN those_DT with_IN high_JJ fat_NN content_NN and_CC in_IN addition_NN it_PRP is_VBZ possible_JJ that_IN the_DT slight_JJ yellow_JJ tinge_NN in_IN cow_NN 's_POS milk_NN due_JJ to_TO carotene_VB may_MD affect_VB the_DT shades_NNS to_TO some_DT extent_NN ._.
As_IN the_DT colour_NN shades_VBZ observed_VBN in_IN the_DT case_NN of_IN mixed_JJ (_( cow_JJ and_CC buffalo_NN )_) milk_NN with_IN 5_CD to_TO 5.5_CD per_IN cent_NN fat_NN were_VBD found_VBN to_TO agree_VB fairly_RB satis-_JJ factorily_RB with_IN those_DT shown_VBN by_IN all_DT types_NNS of_IN milk_NN ,_, they_PRP were_VBD taken_VBN as_IN standards_NNS and_CC painted_VBN on_IN glass_NN slides_NNS for_IN reference_NN in_IN cases_NNS of_IN doubt_NN ._.
It_PRP was_VBD observed_VBN in_IN several_JJ cases_NNS that_IN the_DT resazurin_NN reduction_NN was_VBD very_RB rapid_JJ at_IN first_JJ but_CC the_DT cor-_JJ responding_NN methylene_NN blue_JJ reduction_NN time_NN was_VBD fairly_RB long_RB ._.
In_IN such_JJ anomalous_JJ cases_NNS ,_, a_DT microscopic_JJ examination_NN of_IN the_DT milk_NN smears_NNS was_VBD carried_VBN out_RP ._.
RESULTS_VB The_DT results_NNS of_IN the_DT one_CD hour_NN resazurin_NN test_NN ,_, methylene_NN blue_JJ reduction_NN times_NNS and_CC plate_NN counts_NNS obtained_VBN for_IN the_DT different_JJ types_NNS of_IN milks_NNS examined_VBN are_VBP summarized_VBN in_IN Tables_NNP I_PRP to_TO IV_NNP below_NN ._.
DISCUSSION_NNP The_DT object_NN of_IN the_DT investigation_NN ,_, as_IN stated_VBN in_IN the_DT introduction_NN ,_, was_VBD to_TO find_VB out_RP the_DT applicability_NN of_IN the_DT resazurin_JJ test_NN for_IN determining_VBG the_DT hygienic_JJ quality_NN of_IN Indian_JJ milks_NNS ._.
Accordingly_RB the_DT results_NNS have_VBP been_VBN interpreted_VBN so_RB as_IN to_TO give_VB indications_NNS on_IN :_: (_( i_NN )_) the_DT stages_NNS of_IN resazurin_NN reduction_NN to_TO be_VB used_VBN for_IN grading_VBG Indian_JJ milks_NNS ;_: (_( ii_NN )_) the_DT comparative_JJ grading_NN efficiency_NN of_IN the_DT resazurin_JJ test_NN ;_: and_CC (_( iii_NN )_) the_DT effect_NN of_IN the_DT conditions_NNS of_IN production_NN on_IN the_DT resazurin_JJ test_NN ._.
H._NNP LAXMINARAYANA_NNP 247_CD (_( i_NN )_) Stages_NNP of_IN resazurin_NN reduction_NN for_IN grading_VBG Indian_JJ milks_NNS ._.

According_VBG to_TO Verma_NNP et_FW al_NN ._.
[_NN 1944_CD ]_NN and_CC further_JJ experi-_JJ mental_JJ evidence_NN obtained_VBN at_IN the_DT Imperial_NNP Dairy_NNP Research_NNP Institute_NNP ,_, a_DT standard_NN of_IN four_CD hours_NNS (_( methy-_JJ lene_NN blue_JJ reduction_NN time_NN )_) for_IN grading_VBG milks_NNS into_IN satisfactory_JJ and_CC unsatisfactory_JJ categories_NNS appears_VBZ to_TO be_VB more_RBR suitable_JJ for_IN conditions_NNS prevailing_VBG in_IN this_DT part_NN of_IN the_DT country_NN ._.
All_DT milks_NNS having_VBG methylene_NN blue_JJ reduction_NN times_NNS above_IN four_CD hours_NNS may_MD be_VB considered_VBN to_TO be_VB satisfactory_JJ ._.
It_PRP is_VBZ also_RB found_VBN that_IN methylene_NN blue_JJ reduction_NN times_NNS between_IN two_CD and_CC four_CD hours_NNS indicate_VBP an_DT average_JJ quality_NN while_IN those_DT below_IN two_CD hours_NNS indicate_VBP a_DT poor_JJ quality_NN ._.

.._RB 4_CD 103_CD 107_CD From_IN an_DT analysis_NN of_IN the_DT distribution_NN of_IN the_DT one_CD hour_NN resazurin_NN readings_NNS at_IN different_JJ levels_NNS of_IN methylene_NN blue_JJ reduction_NN times_NNS (_( Table_NNP I_PRP )_) ,_, it_PRP is_VBZ seen_VBN that_IN about_RB 70_CD per_IN cent_NN of_IN the_DT samples_NNS attaining_VBG the_DT blue_NN ,_, lilac_NN or_CC mauve_NN stages_NNS have_VBP passed_VBN the_DT methylene_NN blue_JJ standard_NN of_IN four_CD hours_NNS (_( 'good_NNP '_POS )_) with_IN 28_CD per_IN cent_NN falling_VBG in_IN the_DT two_CD to_TO four_CD hours_NNS class_NN (_( 'average_NNP '_POS )_) ._.

1943_CD ;_: Thomas_NNP and_CC Bowie_NNP ,_, 1944_CD ]_NN ._.
There_EX is_VBZ thus_RB close_JJ relationship_NN between_IN the_DT resazurin_NN reduction_NN up_IN to_TO mauve_VB stage_NN and_CC methylene_NN blue_JJ reduction_NN standard_NN of_IN four_CD hours_NNS (_( 'good_NNP '_POS )_) ._.
A_DT similar_JJ relationship_NN is_VBZ observed_VBN between_IN the_DT resazurin_NN reduction_NN up_RB to_TO the_DT fading_NN pink_NN or_CC colourless_NN stage_NN and_CC methylene_NN blue_JJ reduction_NN below_IN two_CD hours_NNS (_( 'poor_NNP '_POS )_) ._.
Almost_RB all_PDT the_DT samples_NNS H_NNP 248_CD Investigations_NNP on_IN Resazurin_NNP Test_NNP attaining_VBG a_DT fading_JJ pink_NN or_CC colourless_NN stage_NN show_NN methylene_VBZ blue_JJ reduction_NN times_NNS below_IN two_CD hours_NNS ,_, while_IN 72_CD per_IN cent_NN of_IN the_DT samples_NNS with_IN reduction_NN times_NNS below_IN two_CD hours_NNS have_VBP attained_VBN the_DT fading_NN pink_NN or_CC colourless_NN stage_NN with_IN 20_CD per_IN cent_NN reaching_VBG the_DT pink_NN stage_NN ._.
Samples_NNS with_IN reduction_NN times_NNS between_IN two_CD and_CC four_CD hours_NNS (_( 'average_VB '_POS )_) are_VBP found_VBN to_TO be_VB fairly_RB distributed_VBN over_IN all_PDT the_DT stages_NNS from_IN blue_JJ to_TO pink_VB in_IN a_DT decreasing_NN order_NN while_IN the_DT samples_NNS attaining_VBG the_DT pink_NN mauve_NN or_CC purple_JJ pink_JJ stages_NNS are_VBP distributed_VBN evenly_RB between_IN the_DT 'good_NNP '_POS and_CC 'average_POS '_POS categories_NNS and_CC those_DT attaining_VBG the_DT pink_NN stage_NN between_IN the_DT 'average_NN '_POS and_CC 'poor_NNP '_POS categories_NNS on_IN the_DT methylene_NN blue_JJ scale_NN ._.
