LAXMINARAYANA_$ 249_CD It_PRP will_MD be_VB seen_VBN from_IN Table_NNP II_NNP that_IN there_EX is_VBZ a_DT fairly_RB good_JJ agreement_NN between_IN the_DT one-hour_JJ resazurin_NN readings_NNS and_CC methylene_NN blue_JJ reduction_NN times_NNS ._.
About_IN 86_CD per_IN cent_NN of_IN cow_NN milk_NN samples_NNS ,_, 68_CD per_IN cent_NN of_IN buffalo_NN milk_NN samples_NNS and_CC 60_CD per_IN cent_NN of_IN mixed_JJ milk_NN samples_NNS that_WDT passed_VBD the_DT resazurin_NN test_NN (_( reduc-_JJ tion_NN up_IN to_TO mauve_VB stage_NN )_) have_VBP also_RB passed_VBN the_DT methylene_NN blue_JJ reduction_NN test_NN (_( above_IN four_CD hours_NNS )_) ,_, the_DT rest_NN of_IN them_PRP showing_VBG reduction_NN times_NNS between_IN two_CD and_CC four_CD hours_NNS ,_, while_IN almost_RB all_PDT the_DT samples_NNS (_( cow_NN ,_, buffalo_NN and_CC mixed_JJ )_) that_WDT have_VBP been_VBN graded_VBN 'poor_NNP '_POS or_CC 'bad_NNS '_POS by_IN the_DT resazurin_JJ test_NN (_( pink_NN or_CC colourless_NN at_IN one_CD hour_NN )_) have_VBP also_RB failed_VBN the_DT methylene_NN blue_JJ test_NN (_( below_IN four_CD hours_NNS )_) ._.
Further_RB ,_, the_DT samples_NNS reach-_JJ ing_VBG the_DT colourless_NN stage_NN show_NN methylene_VBZ blue_JJ reduction_NN times_NNS mostly_RB below_IN two_CD hours_NNS ._.
The_DT failure_NN of_IN some_DT 30_CD per_IN cent_NN of_IN the_DT above_NN samples_NNS ,_, mixed_JJ milks_NNS in_IN particular_JJ which_WDT were_VBD samples_NNS from_IN bulk_JJ milks_NNS and_CC exposed_VBN to_TO atmospheric_JJ temperatures_NNS for_IN a_DT longer_JJR time_NN ,_, to_TO pass_VB the_DT methylene_NN blue_JJ test_NN while_IN satisfying_VBG the_DT resazurin_JJ test_NN is_VBZ probably_RB due_JJ to_TO the_DT methylene_NN blue_JJ standard_NN of_IN four_CD hours_NNS being_VBG too_RB rigid_JJ ._.
According_VBG to_TO Thomas_NNP [_NNP 1943_CD ]_NNP ,_, this_DT apparently_RB faster_RBR methylene_JJ blue_JJ reduction_NN may_MD also_RB be_VB due_JJ to_TO the_DT different_JJ times_NNS at_IN which_WDT the_DT two_CD reductions_NNS are_VBP recorded_VBN ._.
Resazurin_NNP reduction_NN in_IN one_CD hour_NN is_VBZ influenced_VBN mainly_RB by_IN initial_JJ bacterial_JJ activity_NN and_CC accumulated_JJ products_NNS of_IN bacterial_JJ meta-_JJ bolism_NN while_IN methylene_NN blue_NN is_VBZ in_IN addition_NN affected_VBN by_IN bacterial_JJ activity_NN developed_VBD during_IN its_PRP$ longer_JJR incubation_NN period_NN ._.
This_DT closer_JJR relation_NN to_TO the_DT initial_JJ flora_NNS shown_VBN by_IN resazurin_NN is_VBZ one_CD of_IN the_DT advantages_NNS claimed_VBD for_IN it_PRP [_NNP Davis_NNP ,_, 1942_CD ]_NN ._.
As_IN regards_NNS the_DT samples_NNS that_WDT turned_VBD pink_VB mauve_NN or_CC purple_JJ pink_NN at_IN the_DT end_NN of_IN one_CD hour_NN (_( 'average_NN '_'' quality_NN )_) ,_, about_RB 67_CD per_IN cent_NN of_IN cow_JJ milks_NNS ,_, 37_CD per_IN cent_NN of_IN buffalo_JJ milks_NNS and_CC 14_CD per_IN cent_NN of_IN mixed_JJ milks_NNS have_VBP passed_VBN the_DT methylene_NN blue_JJ test_NN and_CC the_DT rest_NN show_NN reduction_NN times_NNS between_IN two_CD and_CC four_CD hours_NNS ._.
Looking_VBG at_IN the_DT results_NNS from_IN another_DT angle_NN it_PRP is_VBZ seen_VBN that_IN out_IN of_IN the_DT samples_NNS that_WDT stood_VBD the_DT methylene_NN blue_JJ test_NN ,_, only_RB 54_CD per_IN cent_NN of_IN the_DT cow_NN samples_NNS ,_, 85_CD per_IN cent_NN of_IN buffalo_JJ milks_NNS and_CC 82_CD per_IN cent_NN of_IN mixed_JJ milks_NNS have_VBP passed_VBN the_DT resazurin_NN test_NN ,_, the_DT rest_NN coming_VBG under_IN the_DT 'average_NN '_POS category_NN (_( pink_VB mauve_NN or_CC purple_JJ pink_NN )_) ._.
The_DT responsibility_NN for_IN the_DT down-grading_NN of_IN most_JJS of_IN these_DT samples_NNS ,_, particularly_RB cow_JJ milks_NNS ,_, on_IN the_DT resazurin_JJ scale_NN may_MD be_VB ascribed_VBN to_TO the_DT presence_NN of_IN numerous_JJ leucocyte_NN cells_NNS (_( colostrum_NN ,_, late_JJ lactation_NN milk_NN or_CC mastitis_NN infection_NN )_) and_CC other_JJ weak_JJ reducing_VBG substances_NNS in_IN milk_NN which_WDT have_VBP a_DT greater_JJR reducing_VBG effect_NN on_IN resazurin_NN [_NNP Thomas_NNP ,_, 1943_CD ;_: Davis_NNP et_FW al_NN ._.
1943_CD ]_NN ._.
This_DT effect_NN seems_VBZ to_TO be_VB least_VBN in_IN the_DT case_NN of_IN mixed_JJ milks_NNS which_WDT represent_VBP bulk_NN samples_NNS where_WRB the_DT leucocyte_NN content_NN would_MD have_VB been_VBN levelled_VBN out_RP or_CC inactivated_JJ due_JJ to_TO age_NN ._.
It_PRP is_VBZ also_RB seen_VBN that_IN out_IN of_IN the_DT ._.
samples_NNS that_WDT have_VBP failed_VBN the_DT methylene_NN blue_JJ test_NN ,_, only_RB about_IN 58_CD per_IN cent_NN of_IN cows_NNS milks_NNS ,_, 33_CD per_IN cent_NN of_IN buffalo_JJ milks_NNS and_CC 47_CD per_IN cent_NN of_IN mixed_JJ milks_NNS have_VBP been_VBN placed_VBN in_IN the_DT 'poor_NNP '_POS or_CC 'bad_POS '_'' categories_NNS by_IN the_DT resazurin_JJ test_NN ,_, the_DT rest_NN being_VBG placed_VBN either_CC in_IN the_DT 'good_NN '_POS or_CC 'average_VB '_'' category_NN by_IN the_DT latter_JJ test_NN ._.
As_IN explained_VBN above_IN the_DT high_JJ standard_NN of_IN four_CD hours_NNS as_RB well_RB as_IN the_DT difference_NN in_IN the_DT factors_NNS which_WDT influence_VBP the_DT two_CD reductions_NNS may_MD be_VB responsible_JJ for_IN a_DT larger_JJR number_NN of_IN samples_NNS belonging_VBG to_TO this_DT class_NN failing_VBG the_DT methylene_NN blue_JJ test_NN than_IN the_DT resazurin_JJ test_NN ._.
Another_DT significant_JJ point_NN that_WDT has_VBZ emerged_VBN is_VBZ the_DT comparatively_RB slower_JJR rate_NN of_IN resazurin_NN reduction_NN in_IN the_DT case_NN of_IN buffalo_NN milks_NNS up_RB to_TO the_DT mauve_NN or_CC pink_VB mauve_JJ stage_NN and_CC accordingly_RB the_DT above_JJ anomaly_NN is_VBZ shown_VBN to_TO the_DT greatest_JJS extent_NN in_IN their_PRP$ case_NN ._.
The_DT causes_NNS underlying_VBG some_DT of_IN these_DT anomalies_NNS can_MD be_VB fully_RB explained_VBN only_RB after_IN further_JJ investigations_NNS ,_, but_CC these_DT have_VBP not_RB detracted_VBN the_DT practical_JJ value_NN of_IN the_DT test_NN to_TO any_DT appreciable_JJ extent_NN ._.
In_IN any_DT case_NN ,_, a_DT good_JJ number_NN of_IN samples_NNS (_( about_IN 50_CD per_IN cent_NN )_) which_WDT would_MD be_VB condemned_VBN on_IN the_DT rigid_JJ methylene_NN blue_JJ standard_NN are_VBP found_VBN to_TO be_VB useful_JJ or_CC at_IN least_JJS of_IN an_DT average_JJ quality_NN by_IN the_DT resazurin_JJ test_NN on_IN account_NN of_IN its_PRP$ greater_JJR flexibility_NN in_IN grading_VBG milks_NNS while_IN a_DT large_JJ number_NN of_IN abnormal_JJ or_CC pathological_JJ samples_NNS (_( about_IN 30_CD per_IN cent_NN )_) ,_, which_WDT may_MD be_VB found_VBN unsuitable_JJ for_IN either_DT human_JJ consumption_NN or_CC manufacturing_NN purposes_NNS and_CC which_WDT are_VBP passed_VBN by_IN the_DT methylene_NN blue_JJ reduction_NN test_NN are_VBP weeded_VBN out_RP by_IN the_DT resazurin_JJ test_NN ._.

and_CC high_JJ count_NN (_( over_IN 1_CD million_CD per_IN ml_NN ._. )_)
samples_NNS and_CC that_IN the_DT resazurin_JJ test_NN is_VBZ as_RB reliable_JJ as_IN the_DT methylene_NN blue-reduction_NN test_NN in_IN detecting_VBG high_JJ count_NN milks_NNS [_VBP Thomas_NNP ,_, 1943_CD ]_NN ._.
In_IN the_DT case_NN of_IN low_JJ count_NN milks_NNS ,_, particularly_RB as_IN some_DT of_IN them_PRP were_VBD examined_VBN in_IN winter_NN when_WRB bacterial_JJ activity_NN is_VBZ less_RBR pronounced_JJ ,_, the_DT effect_NN of_IN cells_NNS becomes_VBZ more_JJR import-_JJ ant_NN which_WDT may_MD result_VB in_IN the_DT resazurin_JJ test_NN showing_VBG a_DT poorer_JJR correlation_NN with_IN the_DT plate_NN counts_NNS ._.
This_DT effect_NN is_VBZ practically_RB masked_VBN in_IN high_JJ count_NN samples_NNS ._.
The_DT above_JJ observation_NN serves_NNS to_TO demonstrate_VB the_DT superiority_NN of_IN methylene_NN blue_JJ reduction_NN as_IN a_DT measure_NN of_IN mere_JJ bacterial_JJ numbers_NNS ._.
If_IN ,_, however_RB ,_, the_DT term_NN 'sanitary_JJ quality_NN '_'' in_IN milk_NN is_VBZ to_TO denote_VB freedom_NN from_IN excessive_JJ bacterial_JJ contamination_NN as_RB well_RB as_IN any_DT abnormality_NN (_( physiological_JJ or_CC pathological_JJ )_) ,_, this_DT factor_NN should_MD not_RB militate_VB against_IN the_DT value_NN of_IN the_DT resazurin_JJ test_NN ._.
The_DT relationship_NN in_IN the_DT case_NN of_IN intermediate_JJ samples_NNS with_IN counts_NNS between_IN 200,000_CD and_CC one_CD million_CD per_IN ml_NN ._.
is_VBZ poor_JJ ._.

(_( iii_NN )_) Effect_NN of_IN conditions_NNS of_IN production_NN on_IN the_DT resazurin_JJ test_NN In_IN the_DT course_NN of_IN this_DT investigation_NN samples_VBZ drawn_VBN from_IN three_CD different_JJ sources_NNS namely_RB ,_, farm_NN produced_VBD milk_NN ,_, village_NN produced_VBN milk_NN and_CC milk_NN handled_VBN by_IN private_JJ dairies_NNS (_( which_WDT give_VBP a_DT fair_JJ representa-_JJ tion_NN of_IN the_DT usual_JJ conditions_NNS of_IN production_NN and_CC handling_NN in_IN this_DT part_NN of_IN the_DT country_NN )_) have_VBP been_VBN used_VBN ._.

348_CD 163_CD 147_CD An_DT examination_NN of_IN the_DT above_JJ data_NN (_( Table_NNP IV_NNP )_) reveals_VBZ that_IN about_IN 63_CD per_IN cent_NN of_IN farm_NN produced_VBN milks_NNS ,_, 43_CD per_IN cent_NN of_IN village_NN produced_VBN milks_NNS and_CC 16_CD per_IN cent_NN of_IN milks_NNS from_IN private_JJ dairies_NNS have_VBP been_VBN graded_VBN 'good_NN '_'' by_IN the_DT resazurin_JJ test_NN ._.
252_CD Investigations_NNS on_IN Resazurin_NNP Test_NNP Similarly_RB about_RB 7_CD per_IN cent_NN ,_, 35_CD per_IN cent_NN and_CC 58_CD per_IN cent_NN of_IN the_DT three_CD classes_NNS of_IN milk_NN respectively_RB have_VBP failed_VBN the_DT resazurin_JJ test_NN ,_, with_IN about_IN 30_CD per_IN cent_NN of_IN farm_NN produced_VBN milks_NNS and_CC 25_CD per_IN cent_NN of_IN the_DT other_JJ two_CD classes_NNS being_VBG placed_VBN in_IN the_DT 'average_NN '_POS category_NN ._.
Thus_RB the_DT test_NN has_VBZ clearly_RB brought_VBN out_RP the_DT marked_JJ gradation_NN in_IN the_DT bacteriological_JJ quality_NN of_IN milks_NNS drawn_VBN from_IN the_DT three_CD sources_NNS which_WDT is_VBZ in_IN conformity_NN with_IN their_PRP$ actual_JJ conditions_NNS of_IN production_NN and_CC handling_NN ._.
Farm_NN produced_VBN milk_NN is_VBZ obtain-_JJ ed_NN under_IN hygienic_JJ conditions_NNS and_CC is_VBZ least_RBS exposed_JJ to_TO atmospheric_JJ temperature_NN while_IN the_DT other_JJ two_CD classes_NNS of_IN milk_NN have_VBP been_VBN generally_RB produced_VBN under_IN unhygienic_JJ conditions_NNS and_CC carelessly_RB handled_VBN ._.
In_IN addition_NN ,_, the_DT milk_NN from_IN private_JJ dairies_NNS represents_VBZ bulk_JJ milks_NNS collected_VBN from_IN various_JJ sources_NNS and_CC is_VBZ most_RBS exposed_JJ to_TO atmospheric_JJ temperature_NN ._.
Accordingly_RB the_DT latter_JJ class_NN of_IN milk_NN has_VBZ a_DT high_JJ bacterial_JJ content_NN and_CC is_VBZ rich_JJ in_IN coliform_NN and_CC other_JJ actively_RB reducing_VBG types_NNS of_IN bacteria_NNS which_WDT bring_VBP about_IN a_DT rapid_JJ reduction_NN of_IN resazurin_NN ._.
The_DT down-grading_NN of_IN a_DT large_JJ number_NN of_IN samples_NNS in_IN the_DT case_NN of_IN farm_NN produced_VBN milk_NN to_TO the_DT 'average_NN '_POS (_( 30_CD per_IN cent_NN )_) and_CC 'unsatisfactory_$ '_'' (_( 7_CD per_IN cent_NN )_) categories_NNS can_MD not_RB be_VB explained_VBN on_IN the_DT basis_NN of_IN their_PRP$ conditions_NNS of_IN production_NN ._.
But_CC it_PRP has_VBZ already_RB been_VBN indicated_VBN ,_, while_IN comparing_VBG the_DT resazurin_JJ test_NN with_IN methylene_NN blue_JJ reduction_NN and_CC plate_NN count_NN ,_, that_IN most_JJS of_IN the_DT samples_NNS placed_VBN in_IN these_DT categories_NNS showed_VBD heavy_JJ leucocyte_NN contents_NNS associated_VBN with_IN abnormal_JJ milks_NNS (_( colostrum_NN ,_, late_JJ lactation_NN milk_NN or_CC mastitis_NN )_) and_CC accordingly_RB ,_, cellular_JJ activity_NN may_MD be_VB responsible_JJ for_IN the_DT rapid_JJ reduction_NN of_IN resazurin_NN in_IN the_DT case_NN of_IN these_DT samples_NNS ._.
A_DT separate_JJ investigation_NN carried_VBD out_RP into_IN the_DT cause_NN of_IN this_DT revealed_VBD that_IN nearly_RB 25_CD to_TO 30_CD per_IN cent_NN of_IN the_DT animals_NNS in_IN the_DT herds_NNS ,_, from_IN which_WDT the_DT samples_NNS were_VBD obtained_VBN ,_, were_VBD suffering_VBG from_IN mastitis_NN more_RBR or_CC less_JJR of_IN a_DT severe_JJ form_NN associated_VBN with_IN streptococci_NN ,_, staphylococci_NN or_CC corynebacteria_NN and_CC shedding_VBG numerous_JJ cells_NNS in_IN the_DT milk_NN ._.
It_PRP is_VBZ thus_RB evident_JJ that_IN the_DT resazurin_JJ test_NN is_VBZ fairly_RB reliable_JJ in_IN indicating_VBG bad_JJ methods_NNS of_IN produc-_JJ tion_NN ,_, but_CC in_IN the_DT case_NN of_IN milk_NN produced_VBN under_IN careful_JJ conditions_NNS and_CC therefore_RB having_VBG a_DT low_JJ bacterial_JJ content_NN ,_, the_DT effect_NN of_IN leucocytes_NNS becomes_NNS more_RBR pronounced_JJ and_CC a_DT misleading_JJ picture_NN may_MD sometimes_RB be_VB obtained_VBN ._.
In_IN actual_JJ practice_NN this_DT may_MD not_RB be_VB a_DT serious_JJ factor_NN since_IN cellular_JJ activity_NN in_IN milk_NN does_VBZ not_RB ordinarily_RB reduce_VB resazurin_NN beyond_IN the_DT pink_JJ stage_NN [_NNP Davis_NNP ,_, 1942_CD ]_NN and_CC a_DT producer_NN 's_POS supply_NN would_MD not_RB be_VB graded_VBN down_RB to_TO the_DT rejection_NN class_NN (_( colourless_NN )_) on_IN account_NN of_IN cell_NN content_NN only_RB ._.
On_IN the_DT other_JJ hand_NN it_PRP may_MD be_VB highly_RB advantageous_JJ in_IN drawing_VBG attention_NN to_TO the_DT presence_NN of_IN serious_JJ mastitis_NN in_IN a_DT herd_NN ._.

5_CD ._.

have_VB failed_VBN both_DT the_DT reduc-_JJ tion_NN tests_NNS and_CC the_DT reliability_NN of_IN resazurin_JJ test_NN in_IN detecting_VBG high_JJ count_NN milks_NNS has_VBZ been_VBN indicated_VBN ._.
In_IN the_DT case_NN of_IN samples_NNS with_IN plate_NN counts_NNS below_IN 200,000_CD per_IN mil_NN ._.
about_IN 90_CD per_IN cent_NN have_VBP passed_VBN the_DT methylene_NN blue_JJ test_NN with_IN only_RB 70_CD per_IN cent_NN passing_VBG the_DT resazurin_JJ test_NN ._.
A_DT higher_JJR degree_NN of_IN correlation_NN between_IN the_DT methylene_NN blue_JJ test_NN and_CC plate_NN count_NN has_VBZ thus_RB been_VBN shown_VBN ._.
The_DT causes_NNS for_IN this_DT have_VBP been_VBN attributed_VBN to_TO the_DT higher_JJR sensitiveness_NN of_IN resazurin_NN to_TO the_DT influence_NN of_IN leucocytes_NNS as_IN also_RB the_DT shorter_JJR period_NN of_IN its_PRP$ incubation_NN (_( one_CD hour_NN compared_VBN to_TO four_CD hours_NNS or_CC longer_JJR in_IN the_DT case_NN of_IN methylene_NN blue_JJ test_NN )_) ._.
6_CD ._.
The_DT resazurin_NN test_NN has_VBZ been_VBN found_VBN to_TO be_VB useful_JJ in_IN picking_VBG out_RP milk_NN produced_VBN under_IN insanitary_JJ conditions_NNS while_IN in_IN the_DT case_NN of_IN carefully_RB produced_VBN milks_NNS ,_, it_PRP may_MD give_VB misleading_VBG results_NNS due_JJ to_TO the_DT influence_NN of_IN cellular_JJ activity_NN on_IN resazurin_NN reduction_NN ._.
The_DT value_NN of_IN the_DT test_NN for_IN drawing_VBG attention_NN to_TO serious_JJ cases_NNS of_IN mastitis_NN in_IN a_DT herd_NN and_CC for_IN detecting_VBG admixture_NN of_IN colostral_JJ ,_, late_JJ lactation_NN and_CC mastitis_NN milks_NNS in_IN the_DT supplies_NNS has_VBZ also_RB been_VBN pointed_VBN out_RP ._.

A_DT first_JJ case_NN of_IN this_DT kind_NN was_VBD observed_VBN by_IN the_DT writer_NN in_IN 1943_CD in_IN Hyderabad_NNP State_NNP ._.
The_DT organisms_NNS are_VBP known_VBN to_TO produce_VB lesions_NNS ,_, sometimes_RB fatal_JJ ,_, in_IN the_DT upper_JJ digestive_JJ tract_NN of_IN birds_NNS ._.
The_DT similar_JJ disease_NN ,_, caused_VBN by_IN Tricho-_NNP monas_NNS columbae_NN ,_, is_VBZ reported_VBN to_TO exist_VB in_IN pigeons_NNS as_RB well_RB as_IN in_IN fowls_NN in_IN Europe_NNP ,_, Asia_NNP ,_, Africa_NNP and_CC America_NNP ,_, and_CC is_VBZ characterized_VBN by_IN the_DT presence_NN of_IN necrotic_JJ areas_NNS in_IN the_DT liver_NN ,_, pericardium_NN and_CC peritonium_NN ._.
In_IN some_DT instances_NNS the_DT lungs_NNS and_CC pancreas_NNS are_VBP also_RB involved_VBN ._.
The_DT flagellates_NNS are_VBP found_VBN in_IN the_DT mouth_NN ,_, oesophagus_JJ and_CC crop_NN of_IN older_JJR birds_NNS ._.
Recently_RB ,_, Levine_NNP and_CC Brandly_NNP [_NNP 1940_CD ]_NNP have_VBP shown_VBN that_IN T._NNP gallinae_VBD produces_NNS lesions_NNS in_IN the_DT upper_JJ digestive_JJ tract_NN of_IN baby_NN chicks_NNS ,_, appearing_VBG as_IN multiple_JJ caseous_JJ foci_NN of_IN the_DT mucous_JJ membrane_NN ._.
Young_NN pigeons_NNS are_VBP believed_VBN to_TO become_VB infected_JJ from_IN older_JJR carrier_NN birds_NNS through_IN the_DT medium_NN of_IN the_DT 'pigeon_NNP milk_NN '_'' [_JJ Brocklehurst_NNP ,_, 1944_CD ]_NN ._.
The_DT writer_NN [_NN 1946_CD ]_NN has_VBZ also_RB recorded_VBN the_DT existence_NN of_IN T._NNP columbae_NN in_IN the_DT upper_JJ digestive_JJ tract_NN of_IN young_JJ pigeons_NNS but_CC the_DT pathogenecity_NN of_IN these_DT flagellates_NNS is_VBZ yet_RB to_TO be_VB determined_VBN in_IN pigeons_NNS and_CC other_JJ birds_NNS ._.
The_DT clinical_JJ manifestations_NNS observed_VBN in_IN the_DT present_JJ case_NN were_VBD dullness_RB ,_, inappetence_NN ,_, emaciation_NN ,_, yellow_JJ diarrhoea_NN ,_, incoordination_NN of_IN movement_NN and_CC twitching_NN of_IN the_DT neck_NN ._.
Such_JJ symptoms_NNS however_RB are_VBP common_JJ to_TO many_JJ other_JJ poultry_NN diseases_NNS ._.
Microscopical_JJ examinations_NNS of_IN blood_NN and_CC faeces_NNS during_IN life_NN failed_VBD to_TO give_VB any_DT positive_JJ indication_NN of_IN the_DT cause_NN of_IN ailment_NN ._.
It_PRP was_VBD ,_, therefore_RB ,_, considered_VBN neces-_JJ sary_JJ to_TO destroy_VB the_DT bird_NN to_TO ensure_VB a_DT correct_JJ diagnosis_NN ._.
The_DT fowl_NN was_VBD a_DT desi_JJ pullet_NN and_CC had_VBD been_VBN ailing_VBG for_IN at_IN least_JJS a_DT week_NN ._.
On_IN autopsy_PDT the_DT changes_NNS noted_VBN were_VBD confined_VBN to_TO the_DT liver_NN ,_, which_WDT was_VBD enlarged_VBN and_CC which_WDT presented_VBD several_JJ extensive_JJ areas_NNS of_IN necrosis_NN ;_: among_IN these_DT were_VBD one_CD or_CC two_CD areas_NNS as_RB big_JJ as_IN marbles_NNS ._.
There_EX was_VBD a_DT sharp_JJ lines_NNS of_IN demarca-_JJ tion_NN between_IN the_DT affected_JJ and_CC the_DT normal_JJ tissues_NNS ._.
The_DT lesions_NNS were_VBD creamy-white_JJ in_IN colour_NN and_CC con-_NN tained_VBD caseous_JJ material_NN ,_, such_JJ as_IN might_MD be_VB found_VBN in_IN tuberculous_JJ lesions_NNS ._.
No_DT changes_NNS in_IN other_JJ internal_JJ organs_NNS were_VBD observed_VBN ,_, except_IN for_IN some_DT inflammation_NN of_IN the_DT mucous_JJ lining_NN of_IN the_DT intestine_NN and_CC en-_JJ largement_NN of_IN the_DT caeca_NN ._.
The_DT diagnosis_NN was_VBD made_VBN by_IN examining_VBG wet_JJ films_NNS of_IN tissue_NN from_IN the_DT lesions_NNS in_IN the_DT liver_NN ._.
Under_IN 1/6th_CD lens_NNS ,_, actively_RB motile_JJ flagellates_NNS were_VBD demonstrated_VBN ,_, pear-shaped_JJ organisms_NNS with_IN flagella_NN and_CC undulating_JJ membrane_NN (_( Plate_NNP XI_NNP )_) ._.
Further_RB microscopical_JJ studies_NNS were_VBD made_VBN on_IN impression_NN smears_NNS from_IN lesions_NNS ,_, stained_VBN by_IN Leishman_NNP 's_POS stain_NN ._.
Large_JJ numbers_NNS of_IN flagellates_NNS were_VBD then_RB seen_VBN in_IN two_CD forms_NNS ,_, spindle-shaped_JJ and_CC round_NN ._.
There_EX were_VBD three_CD free_JJ flagella_NN and_CC one_CD bordering_VBG the_DT undulating_JJ membrane_NN ._.
All_PDT the_DT four_CD flagella_NN originated_VBN from_IN a_DT blepharoplast_NN situated_VBN at_IN the_DT anterior_JJ end_NN of_IN the_DT para-_JJ site_NN ._.
The_DT undulating_JJ membrane_NN stained_VBD a_DT pinkish_JJ colour_NN ,_, while_IN the_DT basal_NN fibre_NN was_VBD deep_JJ blue_NN ._.
The_DT nucleus_NN was_VBD prominently_RB placed_VBN ,_, anterior_JJ to_TO the_DT middle_NN of_IN the_DT body_NN ,_, and_CC granular_JJ substance_NN was_VBD found_VBN scattered_VBN throughout_IN the_DT cytoplasm_NN (_( Plate_NNP XI_NNP ,_, fig_NN ._.
1_CD )_) ._.
Multiplication_NN by_IN longitudinal_JJ fission_NN ,_, with_IN components_NNS of_IN two_CD or_CC four_CD organisms_NNS ,_, was_VBD also_RB observed_VBN (_( Plate_NNP XI_NNP ,_, fig_NN ._.
2_CD )_) ._.
The_DT average_JJ size_NN of_IN the_DT protozoa_NN was_VBD 10_CD ×_JJ 8_CD microns_NNS ._.
The_DT material_NN collected_VBN from_IN this_DT case_NN ,_, viz._NN ,_, from_IN liver_NN ,_, lungs_NNS ,_, kidney_NN ,_, spleen_NN ,_, duodenum_NN and_CC caeca_NN ,_, and_CC also_RB impression_NN smears_NNS from_IN the_DT liver_NN lesions_NNS ,_, were_VBD sent_VBN to_TO the_DT Protozoologist_NNP ,_, Imperial_NNP Veterinary_NNP Research_NNP Institute_NNP ,_, Mukteswar_NNP ,_, for_IN examination_NN ,_, and_CC he_PRP identified_VBD the_DT protozoa_NN as_IN T._NNP gallinae_NN ._.
It_PRP was_VBD also_RB stated_VBN that_IN the_DT macroscopic_NN lesions_NNS in_IN the_DT liver_NN were_VBD typical_JJ of_IN trichomonas_JJ infection_NN but_CC that_DT histopathological_JJ examination_NN of_IN other_JJ specimens_NNS failed_VBD to_TO reveal_VB any_DT protozoal_NN infection_NN ._.
The_DT necrotic_JJ areas_NNS in_IN the_DT liver_NN showed_VBD numerous_JJ T._NNP gallinae_NN ._.
If_IN left_VBN uncontrolled_JJ ,_, this_DT disease_NN may_MD become_VB a_DT menace_NN to_TO poultry_VB under_IN existing_VBG conditions_NNS ,_, as_IN over-crowding_JJ ,_, insanitation_NN ,_, rapid_JJ exchange_NN of_IN poultry_NN population_NN between_IN rural_JJ and_CC urban_JJ areas_NNS ,_, and_CC rearing_NN of_IN chicks_NNS under_IN desi_NN carrier_NN brooder_NN hens_NNS ,_, may_MD help_VB to_TO disseminate_VB infection_NN ._.
It_PRP is_VBZ there-_JJ fore_RB necessary_JJ to_TO collect_VB reliable_JJ information_NN ,_, the_DT extent_NN of_IN mortality_NN and_CC damage_NN caused_VBN by_IN this_DT 254_CD Indian_JJ J._NNP vet_NN ._.

This_DT would_MD involve_VB laboratory_NN and_CC clinical_JJ research_NN ,_, which_WDT might_MD be_VB undertaken_VBN on_IN the_DT lines_NNS suggested_VBN by_IN Brocklehurst_NNP [_NNP 1944_CD ]_NNP ._.
She_PRP recommends_VBZ the_DT detection_NN of_IN carrier_NN birds_NNS by_IN examining_VBG scrapings_NNS from_IN the_DT oesophageal_NN mucosa_NN for_IN flagellates_NNS and_CC those_DT found_VBN infected_VBN could_MD be_VB treated_VBN with_IN 1_CD per_IN cent_NN trypaflavine_NN ._.
Hinshaw_NNP [_NN 1937_CD ]_NN states_NNS that_IN of_IN the_DT treatments_NNS tried_VBD ,_, the_DT substitution_NN of_IN a_DT 1_CD to_TO 2000_CD solution_NN of_IN copper_NN sulphate_NN ,_, prepared_VBN with_IN soft_JJ water_NN in_IN an_DT earthenware_JJ vessel_NN ,_, for_IN the_DT drinking_NN water_NN was_VBD the_DT only_JJ successful_JJ one_CD ._.
This_DT mixture_NN should_MD be_VB kept_VBN before_IN the_DT birds_NNS for_IN two_CD or_CC three_CD days_NNS and_CC the_DT procedure_NN repeated_VBN after_IN a_DT few_JJ days_NNS ._.
During_IN treatment_NN ,_, the_DT birds_NNS should_MD have_VB access_NN to_TO no_DT other_JJ water_NN supply_NN ._.
This_DT treatment_NN was_VBD recommended_VBN for_IN the_DT trichomonas_NN which_WDT invade_VBP the_DT upper_JJ digestive_JJ tract_NN while_IN those_DT which_WDT are_VBP found_VBN in_IN the_DT lower_JJR digestive_JJ tract_NN ,_, Olsen_NNP and_CC Allen_NNP [_NNP 1940_CD ]_NNP have_VBP attained_VBN success_NN in_IN treating_VBG the_DT disease_NN by_IN the_DT use_NN of_IN fever_NN therapy_NN ,_, which_WDT is_VBZ accomplished_VBN by_IN placing_VBG the_DT infected_JJ birds_NNS for_IN one_CD to_TO two_CD hours_NNS in_IN a_DT thermostatically_RB controlled_VBN cabinet_NN in_IN which_WDT the_DT internal_JJ temperatures_NNS of_IN the_DT birds_NNS were_VBD raised_VBN from_IN 2º_CD to_TO 6ºF_CD ._.
above_IN normal_JJ by_IN main-_JJ taining_VBG the_DT temperature_NN of_IN the_DT chamber_NN at_IN approximately_RB 104°F_CD ._.
with_IN a_DT relative_JJ humidity_NN of_IN 60_CD to_TO 70_CD per_IN cent_NN ._.
Three_CD treatments_NNS at_IN intervals_NNS of_IN every_DT other_JJ day_NN were_VBD sufficient_JJ to_TO check_VB the_DT disease_NN in_IN most_JJS cases_NNS ._.
To_TO control_VB the_DT disease_NN Oehlkers_NNP [_NNP 1937_CD ]_NNP suggests_VBZ elimination_NN of_IN carriers_NNS and_CC the_DT use_NN of_IN only_RB healthier_JJR birds_NNS for_IN hatching_VBG and_CC rearing_VBG ._.

45_CD ,_, 375_CD ABSTRACTS_NNP Salmonella_NNP infections_NNS of_IN the_DT domestic_JJ animals_NNS ._.
Their_PRP$ relationship_NN to_TO salmonellosis_NN (_( Food_NNP infection_NN in_IN man_NN )_) ._.
FRANK_NNP W._NNP SCHOFIELD_NNP (_( 1945_CD )_) Canadian_NNP J._NNP Comp_NNP ._.
Med_NNP ._.
9_CD ,_, 62_CD IN_NNP this_DT article_NN the_DT increasing_VBG importance_NN of_IN the_DT Salmonella_NNP group_NN and_CC of_IN Salmonella_NNP infections_NNS in_IN man_NN and_CC animals_NNS is_VBZ emphasized_VBN ._.
The_DT Salmonella_NNP group_NN is_VBZ already_RB a_DT large_JJ one_CD comprising_VBG numerous_JJ species_NNS ,_, and_CC new_JJ one_CD are_VBP being_VBG added_VBN ._.
Many_JJ of_IN the_DT members_NNS of_IN the_DT group_NN can_MD not_RB be_VB distinguished_VBN from_IN one_CD another_DT by_IN the_DT usual_JJ cultural_JJ methods_NNS ,_, but_CC only_RB by_IN means_NNS of_IN an_DT analysis_NN of_IN the_DT antigenic_JJ structure_NN ._.
At_IN present_JJ over_IN 60_CD different_JJ types_NNS of_IN animal_NN origin_NNS have_VBP been_VBN isolated_VBN from_IN human_JJ disease_NN which_WDT indicates_VBZ the_DT great_JJ importance_NN of_IN an_DT adequate_JJ knowledge_NN of_IN animal_JJ Salmonella_NNP infections_NNS and_CC their_PRP$ relationship_NN to_TO disease_VB in_IN man_NN ._.
The_DT important_JJ characteristics_NNS of_IN Salmonella_NNP infection_NN in_IN animals_NNS are_VBP :_: (_( 1_CD )_) The_DT great_JJ majority_NN of_IN Salmonella_NNP infections_NNS are_VBP of_IN the_DT gastro-intestinal_JJ tract_NN ,_, (_( 2_CD )_) In_IN most_JJS cases_NNS the_DT young_JJ are_VBP attacked_VBN more_RBR frequently_RB than_IN mature_NN or_CC old_JJ animals_NNS ,_, e.g._NN ,_, white_JJ diarrhoea_NN of_IN chicks_NNS ,_, paratyphoid_NN in_IN young_JJ pigs_NNS ,_, etc._FW ,_, (_( 3_CD )_) Salmonella_NN carriers_NNS are_VBP of_IN common_JJ occurrence_NN ,_, (_( 4_CD )_) Salmonella_NN infections_NNS are_VBP much_RB more_RBR common_JJ in_IN swine_NN and_CC poultry_NN than_IN in_IN other_JJ animal_JJ species_NNS ,_, (_( 5_CD )_) The_DT Salmonella_NNP cause_NN infections_NNS in_IN a_DT variety_NN of_IN animal_JJ species_NNS ,_, and_CC few_JJ of_IN the_DT many_JJ types_NNS isolated_VBN are_VBP limited_VBN to_TO a_DT single_JJ host_NN ._.
The_DT author_NN refers_NNS to_TO the_DT work_NN of_IN Edward_NNP and_CC Burnner_NNP who_WP isolated_VBD from_IN various_JJ sources_NNS 70_CD Sal-_JJ monella_NN types_NNS ,_, of_IN which_WDT 42_CD proved_VBD to_TO be_VB from_IN fowls_JJ and_CC 28_CD from_IN swine_NN ._.
However_RB ,_, the_DT author_NN emphasizes_VBZ that_IN while_IN many_JJ Salmonella_NNP types_NNS have_VBP been_VBN reported_VBN ,_, especially_RB from_IN poultry_NN ,_, not_RB more_RBR than_IN half-a-dozen_JJ types_NNS are_VBP serious_JJ animal_JJ pathogens_NNS causing_VBG widespread_JJ disease_NN and_CC serious_JJ economic_JJ loss_NN ._.
These_DT are_VBP :_: S._NNP cholerae-suis_NN ,_, S._NNP typhi-_JJ murium_NN ,_, S._NNP enteritidis_NN ,_, S._NNP pullorum_NN ,_, S._NNP anatis_NN ,_, S._NNP abortivo-equina_NN ,_, S._NNP schott-mülleri_NN ,_, S._NNP enteritidis_NN ._.
var_NN ._.
dublin_NN For_IN the_DT diseases_NNS caused_VBD in_IN animals_NNS by_IN these_DT organisms_NNS ,_, the_DT original_JJ should_MD be_VB consulted_VBN ._.
The_DT Salmonella_NNP infections_NNS in_IN man_NN can_MD be_VB divided_VBN clinically_RB into_IN three_CD types_NNS :_: Salmonella_NN fever_NN ,_, Salmonella_NNP septi-_JJ caemia_NN ,_, and_CC Salmonella_NNP gastro-enteritis_NN ._.
The_DT more_RBR important_JJ characteristics_NNS of_IN these_DT types_NNS are_VBP as_IN follows_VBZ :_: Salmonella_NN fever_NN ._.
This_DT resembles_VBZ the_DT typhoid_JJ state_NN but_CC is_VBZ of_IN shorter_JJR duration_NN lasting_VBG 1_CD to_TO 3_CD weeks_NNS ._.
Fever_NNP and_CC malaise_NN are_VBP the_DT dominant_JJ symptoms_NNS ._.
Blood_NN cultures_NNS are_VBP usually_RB positive_JJ in_IN the_DT early_JJ stages_NNS of_IN the_DT disease_NN ._.
Salmonella_NNP septicaemia_NN ._.
The_DT clinical_JJ picture_NN is_VBZ that_IN of_IN blood_NN infection_NN ._.
Localization_NN of_IN the_DT infection_NN may_MD occur_VB in_IN almost_RB any_DT part_NN of_IN the_DT body_NN ._.
The_DT meninges_NNS and_CC endocardium_NN seem_VBP to_TO be_VB tissues_NNS of_IN predilection_NN ._.
Salmonella_NNP gastro-enteritis_NN ._.
There_EX is_VBZ usually_RB an_DT interval_NN of_IN 8_CD to_TO 24_CD hours_NNS between_IN the_DT consumption_NN of_IN the_DT contaminated_VBN food_NN and_CC the_DT appearance_NN of_IN symptoms_NNS ._.
This_DT is_VBZ longer_JJR than_IN in_IN staphylococcal_JJ food_NN poisoning_NN ._.
Vomiting_VBG is_VBZ usually_RB the_DT first_JJ symptom_NN to_TO occur_VB followed_VBN by_IN diarrhoea_NN ._.
The_DT fever_NN subsides_VBZ in_IN 3_CD to_TO 4_CD days_NNS and_CC the_DT disease_NN rarely_RB lasts_VBZ longer_JJR than_IN one_CD week_NN ._.
Live_JJ bacteria_NNS are_VBP present_JJ in_IN the_DT intestinal_JJ tract_NN and_CC are_VBP responsible_JJ for_IN the_DT pathogenesis_NN of_IN the_DT disease_NN ._.
There_EX does_VBZ not_RB appear_VB to_TO be_VB much_JJ support_NN for_IN the_DT view_NN originally_RB put_VBD forward_RB by_IN Savage_NN that_IN the_DT symptoms_NNS can_MD also_RB result_VB from_IN the_DT heat-stable_JJ toxins_NNS liberated_VBN by_IN the_DT bacteria_NNS during_IN the_DT process_NN of_IN cooking_NN ._.
The_DT types_NNS of_IN Salmonella_NNP found_VBD in_IN different_JJ kinds_NNS of_IN food_NN are_VBP described_VBN ._.
Among_IN the_DT methods_NNS that_WDT should_MD be_VB adopted_VBN for_IN the_DT prevention_NN of_IN infection_NN in_IN man_NN the_DT author_NN discusses_VBZ meat_JJ inspection_NN ,_, both_DT ante-mortem_JJ and_CC post-_JJ mortem_NN ,_, prevention_NN of_IN '_'' emergency_NN slaughter_NN '_'' ,_, inspection_NN of_IN places_NNS where_WRB food_NN is_VBZ stored_VBN to_TO prevent_VB contamination_NN with_IN the_DT faeces_NNS of_IN carriers_NNS ,_, pasteurization_NN and_CC cooking_NN ,_, the_DT examination_NN of_IN personnel_NNS engaged_VBN in_IN the_DT preparation_NN and_CC cooking_NN of_IN food_NN ,_, refrigeration_NN ,_, etc_FW ._.
In_IN a_DT word_NN ,_, prevention_NN hinges_NNS on_IN adequate_JJ food_NN hygiene_NN ._.
[_JJ L._NNP S._NNP ]_VBZ The_DT Treatment_NNP of_IN caecal_JJ coccidiosis_NN with_IN sulfamethazine_NN ._.
PHILLIP_NNP A._NN HAWKINS_NNP AND_NNP E._NNP E._NNP KLINE_NNP (_( 1945_CD )_) ._.
Poultry_NNP Science_NNP 24_CD ,_, 277-281_JJ IN_NNP this_DT article_NN the_DT authors_NNS have_VBP demonstrated_VBN that_IN death_NN losses_NNS due_JJ to_TO caecal_JJ coccidiosis_NN can_MD be_VB greatly_RB diminished_VBN by_IN administering_VBG sulfamethazine_NN in_IN concentrations_NNS of_IN 0.4_CD to_TO 1.0_CD per_IN cent_NN in_IN the_DT feed_NN for_IN a_DT period_NN of_IN three_CD days_NNS after_IN the_DT fourth_JJ day_NN of_IN infection_NN ._.
Treatment_NN started_VBD five_CD days_NNS after_IN infection_NN results_NNS in_IN heavy_JJ mortality_NN ._.
To_TO prevent_VB loss_NN it_PRP is_VBZ necessary_JJ that_IN the_DT blood_NN levels_NNS of_IN the_DT drug_NN should_MD reach_VB 5.0_CD to_TO 6.0_CD mg._NNS per_IN cent_NN by_IN the_DT fifth_JJ day_NN ._.
Saturated_JJ solution_NN of_IN the_DT drug_NN in_IN water_NN served_VBN in_IN galvanized_JJ iron_NN containers_NNS is_VBZ ineffective_JJ ,_, while_IN in_IN paraffined_JJ vessels_NNS the_DT results_NNS are_VBP shown_VBN to_TO be_VB variable_JJ ._.
It_PRP has_VBZ ,_, however_RB ,_, been_VBN pointed_VBN out_RP that_IN sulfamethazine_JJ interferes_NNS with_IN the_DT normal_JJ weight_NN gains_NNS of_IN uninfected_JJ birds_NNS ._.
The_DT great_JJ value_NN of_IN this_DT drug_NN against_IN caecal_JJ coccidiosis_NN in_IN well_RB c_VB trolled_JJ battery_NN experi-_JJ ments_NNS is_VBZ recognized_VBN but_CC some_DT doubt_NN is_VBZ expressed_VBN on_IN its_PRP$ utility_NN under_IN farm_NN conditions_NNS where_WRB the_DT diagnosis_NN of_IN the_DT disease_NN at_IN the_DT required_JJ early_JJ stage_NN is_VBZ not_RB possible_JJ ._.
[_NN H._NNP N._NNP R._NNP ]_NNP Effect_NNP of_IN feeding_VBG iodinated_JJ casein_NN on_IN production_NN and_CC health_NN of_IN milking_VBG cows_NNS ._.
D._NNP M._NNP SEATH_NNP ,_, C._NNP BRANTON_NNP and_CC A._NNP H._NNP GROTH_NNP (_( 1945_CD )_) ._.
J_NNP ._.
Dairy_NNP Sci_NNP ._.
28_CD ,_, 509_CD THE_NNP experimental_JJ work_NN consists_VBZ in_IN examining_VBG the_DT effect_NN of_IN feeding_VBG milch_JJ cows_NNS with_IN iodinated_JJ casein_NN (_( Protamone_NNP ,_, manufactured_VBN by_IN Ccrophyl_NNP Laboratories_NNPS ,_, Kanasas_NNP City_NNP )_) ._.
The_DT influence_NN of_IN feeding_VBG on_IN the_DT fat_JJ percentage_NN of_IN of_IN milk_NN ,_, daily_JJ milk_NN yield_NN ,_, body_NN weight_VBD changes_NNS ,_, pulse_NN rate_NN and_CC body_NN temperature_NN was_VBD studied_VBN ._.
Two_CD sets_NNS of_IN experiment_NN were_VBD carried_VBN out_RP ._.
The_DT first_JJ ,_, which_WDT consisted_VBD of_IN short-term_JJ feeding_NN tests_NNS ,_, was_VBD based_VBN on_IN the_DT reversal_NN trial_NN procedure_NN ._.
Six_CD cows_NNS in_IN all_DT were_VBD used_VBN ,_, three_CD serving_VBG as_IN control_NN (_( Group_NNP II_NNP )_) ,_, the_DT rest_NN (_( Group_NNP I_PRP )_) received_VBD iodinated_JJ casein_NN for_IN eight_CD weeks_NNS ._.
After_IN the_DT first_JJ test_NN period_NN ,_, no_DT protamine_NN was_VBD given_VBN to_TO any_DT animal_NN for_IN throe_JJ weeks_NNS ._.
256_CD Abstracts_NNS ._.
257_CD Group_NNP II_NNP animals_NNS were_VBD then_RB given_VBN the_DT test_NN substance_NN for_IN seven_CD weeks_NNS ,_, Group_NNP I_PRP now_RB serving_VBG as_IN controls_NNS ._.
Iodinated_VBN casein_NN was_VBD fed_VBN during_IN both_DT the_DT test_NN period_NN at_IN the_DT rate_NN of_IN 15_CD gm_NN ._.
daily_JJ per_IN animal_NN ._.
Protamine_NNP feeding_VBG consistently_RB caused_VBN increased_JJ fat_JJ excretion_NN in_IN milk_NN as_RB well_RB as_IN higher_JJR daily_JJ milk_NN yield_NN ,_, but_CC the_DT animals_NNS lost_VBD weight_JJ heavily_RB ._.
Pulse_NNP rate_NN of_IN protamine-fed_JJ animals_NNS was_VBD always_RB 10-13_JJ beats_NNS higher_JJR than_IN the_DT control_NN cows_VBZ ._.
Their_PRP$ body_NN temperature_NN was_VBD also_RB higher_JJR and_CC more_RBR sensitive_JJ to_TO atmospheric_VB changes_NNS than_IN that_DT of_IN the_DT control_NN cows_VBZ ._.
In_IN the_DT second_JJ experiment_NN ,_, long-term_JJ feeding_NN with_IN iodinated_JJ casein_NN was_VBD studied_VBN ._.
Twelve_NN animals_NNS were_VBD divided_VBN into_IN two_CD groups_NNS of_IN six_CD each_DT ._.
The_DT cows_NNS in_IN the_DT experimental_JJ group_NN received_VBD iodinated_JJ casein_NNS ,_, usually_RB at_IN the_DT rate_NN of_IN 1.5_CD gm_NN ._.
daily_JJ per_IN 100_CD lb_NN body_NN weight_NN ,_, but_CC the_DT rates_NNS were_VBD changed_VBN in_IN some_DT cases_NNS after_IN the_DT first_JJ four_CD weeks_NNS in_IN an_DT effort_NN to_TO effect_NN increased_VBN production_NN without_IN causing_VBG large_JJ losses_NNS in_IN body_NN weight_NN ._.
The_DT total_JJ feeding_JJ period_NN lasted_VBD from_IN 10_CD to_TO 13_CD weeks_NNS ._.
In_IN contrast_NN to_TO the_DT previous_JJ experiment_NN ,_, iodinated_VBN casein_NN feeding_VBG showed_VBD higher_JJR fat_JJ excretion_NN for_IN the_DT first_JJ six_CD weeks_NNS only_RB and_CC increased_VBD milk_NN yield_NN for_IN the_DT first_JJ five_CD weeks_NNS ,_, but_CC following_VBG this_DT the_DT control_NN cows_VBZ averaged_VBD higher_JJR production_NN ._.
The_DT average_JJ weight_JJ loss_NN was_VBD 32_CD lb_JJ whereas_NNS control_NN animals_NNS showed_VBD an_DT increase_NN of_IN 36_CD lb_NN during_IN the_DT same_JJ period_NN ._.
Pulse_NNP rate_NN and_CC body_NN temperature_NN increases_VBZ in_IN the_DT iodinated_JJ casein-fed_JJ group_NN were_VBD similar_JJ to_TO those_DT seen_VBN in_IN the_DT first_JJ experiment_NN ._.
It_PRP is_VBZ doubtful_JJ whether_IN the_DT increased_VBN production_NN secured_VBN by_IN feeding_VBG iodinated_JJ casein_NN would_MD be_VB great_JJ enough_JJ or_CC would_MD continue_VB over_IN a_DT long_JJ enough_JJ period_NN to_TO justify_VB possible_JJ injury_NN to_TO milch_VB cows_NNS through_IN losses_NNS in_IN body_NN weight_NN ,_, increases_NNS in_IN pulse_JJ rates_NNS and_CC higher_JJR body_NN temperature_NN ._.

30_CD ,_, 57258_CD Abstracts_NNS ._.
Rinderpest_NNP in_IN game_NN ._.
A_DT description_NN of_IN an_DT outbreak_NN and_CC an_DT attempt_NN at_IN limiting_VBG its_PRP$ spread_NN by_IN means_NNS of_IN a_DT bush_JJ fence_NN ._.
A._NN D._NNP THOMAS_NNP and_CC N._NNP R._NNP REID_NNP ._.
(_( 1944_CD )_) ._.
Onderstepoort_NNP ._.
J._NNP vet_NN ._.

20_CD ,_, 7-20_CD ._.
A_DT BRIEF_NNP review_NN is_VBZ given_VBN of_IN the_DT history_NN of_IN rinderpest_NN in_IN Central_NNP East_NNP Africa_NNP and_CC measures_VBZ taken_VBN to_TO check_VB its_PRP$ spread_NN ._.
The_DT authors_NNS describe_VBP an_DT outbreak_NN of_IN what_WP they_PRP believed_VBD to_TO be_VB rinderpest_VBN in_IN game_NN in_IN the_DT lake_NN Rukwa_NNP area_NN in_IN Tanganyika_NNP Territory_NNP where_WRB it_PRP assumed_VBD a_DT state_NN of_IN epizooticity_NN ._.
The_DT animals_NNS affected_VBD were_VBD wild_JJ buffalo_NN ,_, eland_NN and_CC kudus_NN ._.
The_DT symptoms_NNS and_CC lesions_NNS as_IN seen_VBN in_IN these_DT animals_NNS while_IN suggestive_NN of_IN rinderpest_NN were_VBD not_RB very_RB typical_JJ ;_: but_CC subinoculation_NN from_IN affected_VBN buffaloes_NNS and_CC elands_VBZ into_IN susceptible_JJ young_JJ cattle_NNS and_CC goats_NNS proved_VBD that_IN these_DT animals_NNS suffered_VBD from_IN rinderpest_NN ._.
The_DT possibility_NN of_IN such_JJ game_NN areas_NNS acting_VBG as_IN reservoirs_NNS of_IN the_DT disease_NN with_IN the_DT probability_NN that_IN it_PRP may_MD spread_VB to-_JJ contiguous_JJ cattle_NNS or_CC game_NN ,_, particularly_RB in_IN the_DT dry_JJ season_NN ,_, is_VBZ suggested_VBN ._.
A_DT type_NN of_IN bush_NN fencing_VBG about_RB 8_CD to_TO 10_CD ft._NN high_JJ ,_, erected_VBN with_IN local_JJ labour_NN at_IN a_DT cost_NN of_IN approximately_RB £40_JJ to_TO £50_VB per_IN mile_NN ,_, is_VBZ reported_VBN to_TO be_VB effective_JJ in_IN preventing_VBG the_DT passage_NN of_IN game_NN from_IN affected_VBN areas_NNS to_TO the_DT adjacent_JJ healthy_JJ side_NN when_WRB built_NN with_IN care_NN and_CC if_IN properly_RB maintained_VBN ._.

Dried_VBN cow_JJ manure_NN and_CC dried_JJ rumen_NNS contents_NNS as_IN a_DT partial_JJ substitute_NN for_IN alfalfa_JJ leaf_JJ meal_NN ._.
J._NNP C._NNP HAMMOND_NNP (_( 1944_CD )_) ._.

23_CD ,_, 471-476_CD THE_NNP growth_NN rate_NN ,_, mortality_NN and_CC efficiency_NN of_IN feed_JJ utilization_NN of_IN 1,680_CD chicks_NNS were_VBD observed_VBN up_RB to_TO the_DT age_NN of_IN 6-10_JJ weeks_NNS ,_, with_IN a_DT view_NN to_TO compare_VB the_DT value_NN of_IN alfalfa_JJ leaf_JJ meal_NN and_CC several_JJ of_IN its_PRP$ substitutes_NNS in_IN supplementing_VBG a_DT simple_JJ wartime_NN diet_NN which_WDT was_VBD adequate_NN in_IN vitamin_NN A_NNP and_CC B2_NNP ._.
The_DT resultant_JJ rations_NNS were_VBD composed_VBN of_IN ground_NN wheat_NN (_( 50.55_CD per_IN cent_NN )_) ,_, soyabean_JJ meal_NN (_( 35.00_CD per_IN cent_NN )_) ,_, alfalfa_JJ leaf_NN meal_NN or_CC substitute_NN (_( 8.00_CD per_IN cent_NN )_) ,_, B-Y_NNP feed_NN (_( 2.00_CD per_IN cent_NN )_) ,_, steamed_VBD bone_NN meal_NN (_( 2.00_CD per_IN cent_NN )_) ,_, ground_NN limestone_NN (_( 1.25_CD per_IN cent_NN )_) ,_, manganized_VBN salt_NN (_( 1.00_CD per_IN cent_NN )_) and_CC vitamin_$ A_NNP and_CC D_NNP feeding_NN oil_NN (_( 0.20_CD per_IN cent_NN )_) ._.
Cow_NNP manure_NN dried_VBN at_IN 21°C-160°C_JJ ._.
and_CC rumen_NNS contents_NNS dried_VBD at_IN 47°C_CD ._.
were_VBD definitely_RB superior_JJ to_TO the_DT other_JJ substitutes_NNS and_CC even_RB to_TO alfalfa_VB leaf_JJ meal_NN ._.
When_WRB 2_CD per_IN cent_NN sardine_NN fish_JJ meal_NN was_VBD fed_VBN a_DT long_JJ with_IN the_DT latter_NN ,_, the_DT performance_NN of_IN the_DT birds_NNS was_VBD comparable_JJ to_TO that_DT of_IN the_DT chicks_NNS receiving_VBG cow_JJ manure_NN with_IN and_CC without_IN the_DT addition_NN of_IN fish_JJ meal_NN ._.
The_DT androgen_NN content_NN of_IN cow_JJ manure_NN ,_, which_WDT stimulates_VBZ comb_NN and_CC wattle_JJ growth_NN ,_, was_VBD apparent_JJ in_IN the_DT manure_NN dried_VBD at_IN 47°C_CD ._.
but_CC was_VBD destroyed_VBN by_IN slow_JJ drying_NN at_IN room_NN temperature_NN (_( 21°C_CD ._. )_)
and_CC by_IN drying_VBG at_IN 80°C_CD ._.
or_CC above_VB in_IN an_DT oven_NN ._.
Rumen_NNS contents_NNS were_VBD richer_RB in_IN riboflavin_NN than_IN cow_JJ manure_NN ._.
It_PRP is_VBZ considered_VBN necessary_JJ to_TO add_VB vitamin_FW A_NNP ,_, and_CC in_IN some_DT cases_NNS riboflavin_VBP ,_, to_TO the_DT ration_NN if_IN these_DT materials_NNS are_VBP used_VBN as_IN partial_JJ substitutes_NNS for_IN alfalfa_NN leaf_NN meal_NN ._.
[_JJ R._NNP M._NNP ]_VBZ The_DT effect_NN of_IN fat_JJ upon_IN the_DT digestion_NN of_IN nutrients_NNS by_IN dairy_NN cows_NNS ._.
H._NNP L._NNP LUCAS_NNP and_CC J._NNP K._NNP LOOSHI_NNP (_( 1944_CD )_) ._.
J._NNP of_IN Anim_NNP ._.
Sci_NNP ._.
3_CD ,_, 3-11_CD TWO_NNP series_NN of_IN digestion_NN trials_NNS were_VBD carried_VBN out_IN to_TO test_VB whether_IN different_JJ levels_NNS and_CC different_JJ sources_NNS of_IN fat_NN had_VBD any_DT effect_NN on_IN digestibility_NN and_CC production_NN value_NN of_IN the_DT various_JJ rations_NNS of_IN dairy_NN cows_NNS ._.
With_IN Timothy_NNP hay_NN and_CC dried_JJ beet_NN pulp_NN as_IN the_DT basic_JJ feeds_NNS ,_, the_DT differences_NNS in_IN fat_JJ intake_NN were_VBD adjusted_VBN by_IN using_VBG concentrates_NNS of_IN different_JJ ether_CC extract_JJ content_NN ._.
In_IN the_DT first_JJ series_NN of_IN experiments_NNS the_DT rations_NNS contained_VBD 1.6_CD per_IN cent_NN and_CC 2.6_CD per_IN cent_NN ether_NN extract_NN ._.
The_DT results_NNS of_IN the_DT feeding_NN trial_NN showed_VBD that_IN this_DT difference_NN in_IN fat_JJ level_NN of_IN the_DT rations_NNS had_VBD no_DT statistically_RB significant_JJ effect_NN on_IN the_DT digestibility_NN of_IN the_DT various_JJ nutrients_NNS except_IN of_IN ether_NN extract_NN ._.
In_IN the_DT second_JJ series_NN ,_, rations_NNS of_IN different_JJ fat_NN levels_NNS and_CC sources_NNS were_VBD formulated_VBN by_IN using_VBG several_JJ soyabean_JJ products_NNS of_IN varying_VBG fat_JJ content_NN ._.
Out_IN of_IN the_DT six_CD rations_NNS tested_VBN ,_, two_CD ,_, (_( 1_CD )_) partially_RB heated_VBN soyabean_JJ meal_NN and_CC (_( b_NN )_) toasted_VBD meal_NN contained_VBN about_IN 1.0_CD per_IN cent_NN ether_NN extract_NN ,_, the_DT other_JJ four_CD (_( a_DT )_) ground_NN beans_NNS ,_, (_( b_NN )_) toasted_VBD meal_JJ plus_CC soya_JJ oil_NN ,_, (_( c_NN )_) toasted_VBD meal_JJ plus_CC corn_NN oil_NN and_CC (_( d_NN )_) toasted_VBD meal_JJ plus_CC fatty_JJ acids_NNS contained_VBD about_IN 7.0_CD per_IN cent_NN ether_NN extract_NN ._.
The_DT results_NNS indicated_VBD that_IN (_( a_DT )_) digestibility_NN of_IN the_DT dry_JJ matter_NN ,_, nitrogen-free-extract_JJ and_CC crude_JJ fibre_NN in_IN the_DT rations_NNS containing_VBG ground_NN soyabeans_NNS and_CC toasted_VBD meal_JJ plus_JJ oil_NN was_VBD lower_JJR than_IN those_DT of_IN other_JJ rations_NNS and_CC (_( b_NN )_) the_DT ether_JJ extract_NN of_IN the_DT high_JJ fat_JJ rations_NNS was_VBD significantly_RB more_RBR digestible_JJ than_IN that_DT of_IN the_DT low_JJ fat_JJ rations_NNS ._.
Amongst_IN the_DT high_JJ fat_NN rations_NNS again_RB ,_, the_DT ether_NN extract_NN of_IN the_DT rations_NNS containing_VBG oil_NN and_CC fatty_JJ acids_NNS was_VBD significantly_RB more_RBR digestible_JJ than_IN the_DT ether_JJ extract_NN of_IN the_DT ration_NN con_NN taming_VBG ground_NN soyabeans_NNS ._.
As_IN regards_NNS protein_VBP digestibility_NN ,_, although_IN it_PRP was_VBD lowest_VBN on_IN the_DT soyabeans_NNS ration_NN and_CC highest_JJS on_IN the_DT ration_NN containing_VBG toasted_VBD meal_JJ plus_CC fatty_JJ acids_NNS ,_, the_DT differences_NNS were_VBD not_RB signi-_JJ ficant_NN ._.
In_IN regard_NN to_TO the_DT effect_NN on_IN milk_NN and_CC butter_NN fat_JJ production_NN ,_, the_DT feeding_NN of_IN ground_NN soyabeans_NNS caused_VBD marked_JJ in-_JJ crease_NN in_IN the_DT fat_JJ content_NN of_IN milk_NN with_IN practically_RB no_DT change_NN in_IN milk_NN yield_NN ._.
On_IN the_DT other_JJ hand_NN ,_, the_DT feeding_NN of_IN the_DT oils_NNS ,_, or_CC fatty_JJ acids_NNS ,_, caused_VBD a_DT marked_JJ drop_NN in_IN milk_NN flow_NN with_IN little_JJ change_NN in_IN fat_JJ percentage_NN ._.
It_PRP was_VBD also_RB found_VBN that_IN the_DT production_NN of_IN butter_NN fat_NN and_CC fat-corrected_JJ milk_NN had_VBD no_DT definite_JJ correlation_NN with_IN the_DT actual_JJ intakes_NNS of_IN ether_NN extract_NN and_CC total_JJ digestible_JJ nutrients_NNS ._.

259_CD FIRST_NNP INTERNATIONAL_NNP CONGRESS_NNP OF_IN PHYSIO-PATHOLOGY_NNP OF_NNP ANIMAL_NNP REPRODUCTION_NNP AND_NNP OF_NNP ARTIFICIAL_NNP INSEMINATION_NNP THE_NNP First_NNP International_NNP Congress_NNP of_IN Physio-Pathology_NNP of_IN Animal_NNP Reproduction_NNP and_CC artificial_JJ Insemination_NNP will_MD take_VB place_NN in_IN Milan_NNP from_IN 9th_CD to_TO 15th_CD April_NNP of_IN 1948_CD ._.

221_CD xviii_PDT THE_NNP INDIAN_NNP JOURNAL_NNP OF_NNP VETERINARY_NNP SCIENCE_NNP AND_NNP ANIMAL_NNP HUSBANDRY_NNP RINDEX_NNP TO_NNP SUBJECTS_NNP xix_NNP SXX_NNP THE_NNP INDIAN_NNP JOURNAL_NNP OF_NNP VETERINARY_NNP SCIENCE_NNP AND_NNP ANIMAL_NNP HUSBANDRY_NNP VORIGINAL_NNP ARTICLES_NNP THE_NNP VACCINATION_NNP OF_NNP HIGHLY_NNP SUSCEPTIBLE_NNP ANIMALS_NNP AGAINST_NNP RINDERPEST_NNP By_IN J._NNP R._NNP HADDOW_NNP and_CC J_NNP ._.
A._NN IDNANI_NNP ,_, Imperial_NNP Veterinary_NNP Research_NNP Institute_NNP ,_, Mukteswar_NNP (_( Received_VBN for_IN publication_NN on_IN 17_CD June_NNP 1946_CD )_) (_( With_IN two_CD text-figures_NNS )_) EDWARDS_NNP [_NN 1927_CD ]_NN by_IN attenuating_VBG and_CC fixing_VBG rinderpest_JJS virus_NN in_IN goats_NN has_VBZ provided_VBN India_NNP with_IN a_DT reliable_JJ and_CC safe_JJ means_NNS of_IN vaccinating_VBG plains_NNS cattle_NNS ._.
The_DT larger_JJR problem_NN being_VBG solved_VBN ,_, the_DT demand_NN for_IN providing_VBG for_IN the_DT more_RBR susceptible_JJ populations_NNS of_IN the_DT hills_NNS ,_, for_IN buffaloes_NNS ,_, particularly_RB those_DT in_IN milk_NN or_CC in-calf_NN ,_, and_CC for_IN sheep_JJ and_CC goats_NNS has_VBZ become_VBN more_RBR insistent_JJ ._.
This_DT demand_NN has_VBZ been_VBN accen-_RB tuated_VBN by_IN the_DT wider_NN movement_NN of_IN these_DT animals_NNS necessitated_VBN by_IN the_DT war_NN ._.
Vaccination_NN with_IN goat_NN virus_NN alone_RB in_IN these_DT species_NNS gives_VBZ rise_NN to_TO an_DT unpleasantly_RB large_JJ number_NN of_IN severe_JJ reactions_NNS ,_, which_WDT may_MD even_RB be_VB followed_VBN by_IN deaths_NNS varying_VBG in_IN extent_NN with_IN local_JJ conditions_NNS ._.
The_DT use_NN of_IN small_JJ doses_NNS of_IN serum_NN to_TO damp_VB down_RP such_JJ reactions_NNS is_VBZ now_RB almost_RB universal_JJ ,_, but_CC this_DT is_VBZ expensive_JJ and_CC unwieldy_JJ when_WRB large_JJ herds_NNS or_CC flocks_NNS have_VBP to_TO be_VB protected_VBN ._.
The_DT annual_JJ reports_NNS of_IN this_DT Institute_NNP contain_VBP many_JJ re-_JJ ferences_NNS to_TO attempts_NNS at_IN simplifying_VBG the_DT procedure_NN ,_, but_CC none_NN of_IN these_DT has_VBZ proved_VBN acceptable_JJ to_TO field_NN workers_NNS ._.
It_PRP was_VBD decided_VBN at_IN the_DT beginning_NN of_IN the_DT war_NN that_IN the_DT position_NN should_MD be_VB reviewed_VBN and_CC fresh_JJ efforts_NNS made_VBN to_TO find_VB a_DT satisfactory_JJ solution_NN ._.
Entirely_RB satisfactory_JJ results_NNS have_VBP not_RB been_VBN attained_VBN ,_, but_CC progress_NN in_IN certain_JJ directions_NNS was_VBD achieved_VBN and_CC this_DT is_VBZ now_RB recorded_VBN ._.
Three_CD different_JJ strains_NNS of_IN virus_NN were_VBD available_JJ for_IN experiment_NN ,_, (_( 1_CD )_) line_NN E_NNP ,_, a_DT highly_RB virulent_JJ epidemic_JJ ox_NN strain_NN causing_VBG about_IN 90_CD per_IN cent_NN mortality_NN in_IN hill-bulls_NNS ,_, (_( 2_CD )_) line_NN D_NNP ,_, and_CC old_JJ laboratory_NN passaged_VBD strain_NN of_IN ox_JJ origin_NN causing_VBG about_IN 12_CD per_IN cent_NN mortality_NN ,_, (_( 3_CD )_) line_NN W_NNP ,_, the_DT goat-fixed_JJ strain_NN causing_VBG about_IN 12_CD per_IN cent_NN mortality_NN ._.
As_IN buffaloes_NNS were_VBD seldom_RB available_JJ ,_, experiments_NNS were_VBD made_VBN on_IN hill-bulls_NNS ,_, the_DT mortality_NN in_IN which_WDT is_VBZ considerably_RB higher_JJR than_IN in_IN buffaloes_NNS ._.
ALUMINA-GEL_JJ VACCINE_NNP *_NNP Haddow_NNP and_CC Idnani_NNP [_NNP 1941_CD ]_NNP reported_VBD that_IN fowls_NN could_MD be_VB vaccinated_VBN against_IN Ranikhet_NNP disease_NN with_IN a_DT virus_NN adsorbed_VBN on_IN alumina-gels_NNS ._.
Small-scale_JJ experiments_NNS were_VBD carried_VBN out_RP on_IN similar_JJ lines_NNS on_IN goats_NNS using_VBG vaccines_NNS made_VBN separately_RB from_IN line_NN E_NNP and_CC line_NN W_NNP viruses_NNS ._.
Six_CD goats_NNS were_VBD vaccinated_VBN with_IN each_DT type_NN of_IN vaccine_NN ._.
Only_RB three_CD in_IN each_DT group_NN became_VBD available_JJ for_IN test_NN and_CC all_DT were_VBD found_VBN to_TO be_VB solidly_RB immune_JJ ._.
The_DT work_NN however_RB ,_, was_VBD not_RB continued_VBN ,_, because_IN the_DT difficulties_NNS of_IN preparing_NN and_CC transporting_VBG such_JJ a_DT vaccine_NN under_IN field_NN conditions_NNS in_IN India_NNP would_MD clearly_RB be_VB almost_RB insurmountable_JJ ._.
FORMALIZED_NNP VACCINE_NNP Formalized_NNP vaccines_NNS prepared_VBD with_IN line_NN E_NNP and_CC line_NN W_NNP viruses_NNS were_VBD also_RB tried_VBN on_IN a_DT small_JJ scale_NN in_IN goats_NNS ._.
These_DT were_VBD prepared_JJ somewhat_RB on_IN the_DT lines_NNS of_IN Daubney_NNP [_NNP 1928_CD ]_NNP ._.
Spleen_NNP pulp_NN was_VBD formalized_VBN 1_CD :_: 1000_CD in_IN nutrient_JJ broth_NN and_CC stored_VBD at_IN 5°C_CD ._.
Vaccine_NN prepared_VBN with_IN line_NN E_NNP virus_NN was_VBD tested_VBN after_IN three_CD and_CC seven_CD days_NNS on_IN six_CD goats_NNS each_DT time_NN ,_, and_CC that_IN prepared_JJ with_IN line_NN W_NNP was_VBD inoculated_VBN into_IN six_CD goats_NNS after_IN six_CD day_NN 's_POS storage_NN ._.
No_DT alteration_NN of_IN the_DT viruses_NNS was_VBD perceived_VBN and_CC owing_VBG to_TO the_DT high_JJ cost_NN of_IN such_JJ a_DT vaccine_NN the_DT work_NN was_VBD dropped_VBN ._.
GLYCEROLIZED_NNP VACCINE_NNP Since_IN the_DT year_NN 1918_CD when_WRB Kakizaki_NNP initiated_VBD the_DT method_NN ,_, several_JJ workers_NNS have_VBP made_VBN trails_NNS with_IN glycerolized_JJ vaccine_NN ._.
Bennett_NNP [_NN 1936_CD ]_NN reported_VBD a_DT series_NN of_IN experiments_NNS carried_VBD out_RP in_IN the_DT Sudan_NNP ._.
2_CD Vaccination_NNP Against_NNP Rinderpest_NNP ._.
Infected_VBN spleens_NNS collected_VBN at_IN the_DT height_NN of_IN reaction_NN were_VBD minced_VBN and_CC to_TO this_DT twice_RB the_DT quantity_NN (_( by_IN weight_NN )_) of_IN 60_CD per_IN cent_NN glycerol_NN was_VBD added_VBN ._.
This_DT product_NN was_VBD then_RB aged_VBN either_RB at_IN 37°C_CD ._.
or_CC at_IN 0°C_CD ._.

RABBIT_NNP VIRUS_NNP VACCINE_NNP Edwards_NNP [_NN 1924_CD ]_NN reported_VBD that_IN rinderpest_NN could_MD be_VB transmitted_VBN to_TO rabbits_NNS ,_, but_CC unfortunately_RB the_DT strain_NN obtained_VBN by_IN him_PRP died_VBD out_RP before_IN final_JJ conclusions_NNS could_MD be_VB drawn_VBN as_IN to_TO its_PRP$ vaccinating_NN properties_NNS ._.

1.6_CD Vaccination_NNP Against_NNP Rinderpest_NNP When_WRB a_DT newly-isolated_JJ epidemic_JJ strain_NN became_VBD available_JJ to_TO us_PRP ,_, fresh_JJ efforts_NNS were_VBD made_VBN to_TO passage_VB it_PRP in_IN rabbits_NNS ._.
In_IN two_CD attempts_NNS success_NN was_VBD immediately_RB achieved_VBN ._.

blood_NN subcutaneously_RB and_CC intra-venously_RB to_TO two_CD pairs_NNS of_IN rabbits_NNS ._.
The_DT pair_NN ino-_JJ culated_VBD intravenously_RB gave_VBD the_DT most_RBS marked_JJ reaction_NN ._.

Subsequent_JJ passages_NNS were_VBD carried_VBN out_RP with_IN pooled_JJ blood_NN subcutaneously_RB into_IN two_CD rabbits_NNS ._.
As_IN with_IN previous_JJ successful_JJ attempts_NNS ,_, the_DT only_JJ symptom_NN in_IN the_DT rabbit_NN was_VBD a_DT rise_NN of_IN temperature_NN on_IN third_JJ or_CC fourth_JJ day_NN ,_, which_WDT was_VBD not_RB very_RB marked_VBN in_IN the_DT first_JJ few_JJ passages_NNS but_CC later_RB was_VBD always_RB distinct_JJ (_( Fig_NNP ._.
1_CD )_) ._.
The_DT temperature_NN fell_VBD after_IN two_CD to_TO four_CD days_NNS and_CC the_DT rabbits_NNS invariably_RB recovered_VBD ._.
As_IN the_DT work_NN progressed_VBD ,_, it_PRP was_VBD discovered_VBN that_IN rabbits_VBZ four_CD or_CC five_CD months_NNS old_JJ are_VBP much_RB the_DT best_JJS material_NN for_IN passage_NN ,_, older_JJR rabbits_NNS giving_VBG variable_JJ reactions_NNS ._.
The_DT virus_NN may_MD persist_VB in_IN the_DT blood_NN for_IN fourteen_JJ days_NNS and_CC in_IN the_DT spleen_NN for_IN twelve_NN days_NNS ,_, though_IN the_DT virus_NN is_VBZ not_RB present_JJ in_IN large_JJ quantity_NN ._.

A._NN IDNANI_NNP 9_CD It_PRP will_MD be_VB seen_VBN from_IN Table_JJ VI_NNP that_IN the_DT virus_NN transmitted_VBD through_IN rabbits_NNS remained_VBN virulent_NN for_IN bulls_NNS up_RB to_TO about_IN the_DT 50th_JJ passage_NN ,_, in_IN which_WDT from_IN the_DT 55th_JJ passage_NN onwards_NNS there_EX was_VBD a_DT defi-_JJ nite_NN and_CC gradual_JJ decrease_NN in_IN virulence_NN ._.

2_CD )_) and_CC this_DT type_NN of_IN reaction_NN was_VBD obtained_VBN as_RB far_RB as_IN the_DT 154th_CD passage_NN ,_, after_IN which_WDT reactions_NNS were_VBD uncertain_JJ though_IN they_PRP remained_VBD typical_JJ in_IN rabbits_NNS ._.

of_IN 1_CD :_: 100_CD suspension_NN of_IN rabbit_NN spleen_NN ._.

There_EX was_VBD no_DT inter-_JJ ference_NN with_IN the_DT buffaloe_NN 's_POS milk_NN yield_NN ._.
(_( ii_NN )_) The_DT second_JJ test_NN was_VBD carried_VBN out_RP by_IN the_DT Indian_JJ Military_NNP Veterinary_NNP Laboratory_NNP ._.
From_IN passage_NN 161_CD a_DT few_JJ serial_JJ passages_NNS were_VBD continued_VBN at_IN that_DT laboratory_NN and_CC altogether_RB 469_CD buffaloes_NNS were_VBD inocu-_JJ lated_VBN ._.
The_DT dose_NN given_VBN was_VBD 1_CD c.c_NN ._.
of_IN a_DT 1_CD :_: 100_CD spleen_NN suspension_NN which_WDT was_VBD used_VBN on_IN the_DT day_NN of_IN pre-_JJ paration_NN ._.
The_DT temperature_NN and_CC milk_NN yield_NN of_IN sixty_JJ animals_NNS were_VBD recorded_VBN for_IN fourteen_JJ days_NNS after_IN vaccination_NN ._.
No_DT systemic_JJ disturbance_NN was_VBD observed_VBN and_CC milk_JJ yields_NNS were_VBD unaffected_JJ ._.
Sixteen_NN of_IN these_DT buffaloes_NNS chosen_VBP at_IN random_NN were_VBD tested_VBN 110_CD Vaccination_NNP Against_NNP Rinderpest_NNP six_CD showed_VBD a_DT more_RBR or_CC less_RBR severe_JJ reaction_NN and_CC recovered_VBD ,_, while_IN two_CD died_NNS of_IN acute_JJ rinderpest_NN ._.
As_IN some_DT of_IN these_DT buffaloes_NNS were_VBD probably_RB immune_JJ before_IN vaccination_NN ,_, it_PRP appears_VBZ that_IN at_IN best_RBS successful_JJ '_'' takes_VBZ '_POS occurred_VBN in_IN only_RB a_DT small_JJ percentage_NN ._.
(_( iii_NN )_) Owing_VBG to_TO the_DT hot_JJ weather_NN ,_, the_DT temperature_NN reactions_NNS in_IN rabbits_NNS at_IN the_DT Military_NNP Veterinary_NNP Laboratory_NNP were_VBD difficult_JJ to_TO define_VB and_CC it_PRP was_VBD therefore_RB decided_VBD to_TO repeat_VB the_DT trial_NN with_IN fresh_JJ material_NN from_IN Mukteswar_NNP and_CC to_TO use_VB stronger_JJR suspensions_NNS of_IN both_DT liver_NN and_CC spleen_NN ._.
Accordingly_RB ,_, the_DT 176th_CD passage_NN in_IN rabbits_NNS was_VBD sent_VBN in_IN live_JJ rabbits_NNS ,_, and_CC was_VBD passaged_VBN once_RB only_RB at_IN the_DT Laboratory_NNP ._.
Material_NN from_IN this_DT passage_NN was_VBD inoculated_VBN into_IN :_: Group_NNP 1.SOME_CD OBSERVATIONS_NNP ON_NNP THE_NNP IMMUNIZATION_NNP OF_NNP SHEEP_NNP AND_NNP GOATS_NNP AGAINST_NNP RINDERPEST_NNP By_IN H._NNP K._NNP LALL_NNP ,_, B_NNP ._.
Sc._NNP ,_, M.R.C.V.S._NNP ,_, Government_NNP Livestock_NNP Farm_NNP ,_, Hissar_NNP (_( Received_VBN for_IN publication_NN on_IN 4_CD July_NNP 1946_CD )_) OUTBREAKS_NNP of_IN rinderpest_NN have_VBP been_VBN observed_VBN in_IN sheep_NN and_CC goats_NNS from_IN time_NN to_TO time_NN in_IN various_JJ parts_NNS of_IN India_NNP by_IN Bawa_NNP [_NNP 1940_CD ]_NNP ,_, Chowdhry_NNP [_NNP 1941_CD ]_NNP and_CC various_JJ other_JJ workers_NNS (_( personal_JJ communica-_NN tion_NN )_) ._.
A_DT rise_NN in_IN the_DT incidence_NN of_IN the_DT disease_NN in_IN these_DT animals_NNS occurred_VBD during_IN recent_JJ years_NNS ._.
It_PRP was_VBD considered_VBN that_IN that_DT was_VBD due_JJ to_TO an_DT increase_NN in_IN the_DT animal_NN traffic_NN to_TO various_JJ battle_NN fronts_NNS in_IN and_CC outside_IN India_NNP ._.
Ten_CD outbreaks_NNS were_VBD recorded_VBN in_IN the_DT year_NN 1943-44_RB in_IN Ambala_NNP Division_NNP of_IN the_DT Punjab_NNP alone_RB ,_, causing_VBG very_RB heavy_JJ mortality_NN ._.
Cattle_NNS were_VBD not_RB affected_VBN in_IN these_DT outbreaks_NNS ._.
It_PRP became_VBD apparent_JJ that_IN some_DT definite_JJ steps_NNS were_VBD required_VBN to_TO devise_VB methods_NNS of_IN immunization_NN ._.
Anti-rinderpest_NNP serum_NN has_VBZ been_VBN tried_VBN by_IN various_JJ field_NN workers_NNS ,_, with_IN varying_VBG results_NNS in_IN affected_JJ animals_NNS but_CC it_PRP did_VBD not_RB prove_VB very_RB effective_JJ in_IN controlling_VBG the_DT outbreak_NN at_IN Hissar_NNP ._.
Bawa_NNP [_NNP ibid_NN ]_NN reported_VBD that_IN in_IN goats_NNS the_DT use_NN of_IN anti-serum_JJ alone_NN was_VBD not_RB very_RB satisfactory_JJ ,_, specially_RB because_IN of_IN the_DT short_JJ duration_NN of_IN immunity_NN ._.
In_IN sheep_NN ,_, however_RB ,_, Bawa_NNP [_NNP 1939_CD ]_NNP reported_VBD that_IN the_DT use_NN of_IN goatis_NN was_VBD a_DT success_NN as_IN a_DT prophylactic_JJ against_IN rinderpest_NN ._.
Srikantiah_NNP [_NN 1934_CD ]_NN and_CC Viswanathan_NNP [_NNP 1937_CD ]_NNP have_VBP mentioned_VBN the_DT use_NN of_IN anti-rinderpest_JJ serum_NN in_IN sheep_NN as_IN an_DT essential_JJ adjunct_NN to_TO goatis_VB to_TO avoid_VB severe_JJ reaction_NN ,_, but_CC Viswanathan_NNP reports_VBZ 3.6_CD per_IN cent_NN mortality_NN from_IN vaccination_NN ,_, in_IN spite_NN of_IN the_DT serum_NN ._.
These_DT authors_NNS do_VBP not_RB mention_VB the_DT breed_NN of_IN sheep_NN used_VBN in_IN their_PRP$ experiments_NNS ._.
Gopal_NNP Singh_NNP (_( personal_JJ communication_NN )_) tried_VBD goatis_NN on_IN sheep_NN and_CC goats_NNS as_IN a_DT prophylanis_NN in_IN face_NN of_IN outbreaks_NNS of_IN rinderpest_NN in_IN Gurgoan_NNP district_NN ._.
With_IN a_DT view_NN to_TO produce_VB immunity_NN against_IN rinderpest_NN ,_, some_DT experiments_NNS were_VBD conducted_VBN at_IN Hissar_NNP and_CC the_DT following_JJ observations_NNS were_VBD made_VBN ._.
In_IN this_DT note_NN the_DT term_NN '_POS goatis_NN '_'' has_VBZ been_VBN used_VBN for_IN goat_JJ tissue_NN vaccine_NN ;_: a_DT mild_JJ reaction_NN was_VBD determined_VBN by_IN the_DT fact_NN that_IN the_DT animal_NN had_VBD only_RB a_DT thermal_JJ reaction_NN but_CC normal_JJ in_IN its_PRP$ behaviour_NN and_CC feeding_NN and_CC a_DT severe_JJ one_CD ,_, by_IN high_JJ temperature_NN ,_, loss_NN of_IN appetite_NN ,_, dullness_NN ,_, sluggish_JJ movement_NN ,_, congested_VBD mucous_JJ membranes_NNS conjunctivitis_NN ,_, etc_FW ._.
A_DT thermal_JJ reaction_NN means_VBZ a_DT rise_NN in_IN the_DT temperature_NN as_IN compared_VBN to_TO the_DT normal_JJ temperature_NN under_IN similar_JJ conditions_NNS ._.
(_( A_DT )_) GOATS_NN It_PRP is_VBZ well_RB known_VBN that_IN the_DT goats_NNS used_VBN for_IN the_DT production_NN of_IN goatis_NN show_NN severe_JJ reaction_NN on_IN in-_JJ oculation_NN of_IN the_DT goat_NN virus_NN ._.
It_PRP is_VBZ also_RB believed_VBN that_IN if_IN they_PRP are_VBP allowed_VBN to_TO live_VB ,_, they_PRP succumb_VBP to_TO the_DT disease_NN ,_, or_CC ,_, in_IN cases_NNS of_IN recovery_NN ,_, they_PRP remain_VBP emaciated_JJ [_NN Saunders_NNP ,_, 1936_CD ]_NN ._.
A_DT series_NN of_IN experiments_NNS were_VBD performed_VBN to_TO produce_VB immunity_NN in_IN sheep_JJ and_CC goats_NNS by_IN use_NN of_IN goatis_NN alone_RB or_CC its_PRP$ following_JJ modifications_NNS ._.

Positive_JJ reaction_NN (_( two_CD died_VBN of_IN rinderpest_NN )_) Field_NNP trial_NN Rinderpest_NNP was_VBD prevalent_VBN in_IN the_DT Kangra_NNP and_CC Kulu_NNP valleys_NNS of_IN the_DT Punjab_NNP ,_, which_WDT are_VBP areas_NNS of_IN high_JJ rainfall_NN and_CC cool_JJ climate_NN ,_, because_IN of_IN the_DT high_JJ altitude_NN ._.
There_EX a_DT stock_NN of_IN 600_CD Himalayan_NNP Gaddi_NNP goats_NNS was_VBD immunized_VBN by_IN the_DT serum-goatis_NN method_NN ,_, 0.01_CD gm_NN ._.
of_IN goatis_NN and_CC 15_CD c.c_NN ._.
serum_NN ;_: a_DT few_JJ of_IN the_DT goats_NNS were_VBD not_RB inoculated_VBN so_RB that_IN they_PRP might_MD serve_VB as_IN controls_NNS ._.
It_PRP was_VBD possible_JJ to_TO keep_VB regular_JJ temperature_NN charts_NNS in_IN the_DT case_NN of_IN 10_CD animals_NNS only_RB eight_CD vaccinated_VBN and_CC two_CD controls_NNS ._.
The_DT controls_NNS died_VBD of_IN the_DT disease_NN while_IN the_DT vaccinated_JJ ones_NNS survived_VBD the_DT outbreak_NN ,_, thus_RB confirming_VBG the_DT results_NNS obtained_VBD at_IN Hissar_NNP farm_NN ,_, namely_RB that_IN a_DT combination_NN of_IN serum_NN and_CC goatis_NN can_MD be_VB safely_RB employed_VBN to_TO produce_VB immunity_NN in_IN goats_NNS against_IN rinderpest_NN ._.
(_( B_NNP )_) SHEEP_NNP The_DT experiments_NNS carried_VBD out_RP on_IN goats_NNS were_VBD repeated_VBN on_IN Lohi_NNP ,_, Hissari_NNP ,_, Merino-Bikaneri_NNP crosses_VBZ Bikaneri_NNP and_CC desi_JJ sheep_NN at_IN the_DT same_JJ time_NN ._.
Some_DT variations_NNS in_IN the_DT reaction_NN were_VBD observed_VBN in_IN the_DT different_JJ breeds_NNS ._.
Goatis_NN by_IN itself_PRP was_VBD used_VBN as_IN the_DT immunizing_NN agent_NN in_IN all_DT breeds_NNS except_IN the_DT Lohi_NNP ,_, in_IN which_WDT because_IN of_IN the_DT great_JJ susceptibility_NN of_IN sheep_NN of_IN that_DT breed_NN serum_NN was_VBD used_VBN with_IN the_DT goatis_NN H._NNP K._NNP LALL_NNP 17_CD Experiment_NNP No_NNP ._.
1_CD Three_CD Lohi_NNP (_( 497_CD ,_, 513_CD ,_, 712_CD )_) ,_, five_CD Hissari_NNP (_( 149_CD ,_, 888_CD ,_, 893_CD ,_, 706_CD ,_, 915_CD )_) and_CC five_CD Bikaneri_NNP (_( 523_CD ,_, 511_CD ,_, 592_CD ,_, 591_CD ,_, 515_CD )_) sheep_NN were_VBD inoculated_VBN with_IN 0.01_CD gm_NNS ._.
of_IN goatis_NN ;_: while_IN two_CD Lohis_NNP (_( No_NNP ._.
661_CD ,_, 521_CD )_) were_VBD given_VBN a_DT dose_NN of_IN serum_NN along_IN with_IN goatis_NN as_IN a_DT precautionary_JJ measure_NN ._.
The_DT reaction_NN in_IN Lohi_NNP ,_, except_IN for_IN the_DT two_CD which_WDT received_VBD serum_NN and_CC goatis_NN mixture_NN ,_, was_VBD more_RBR marked_JJ than_IN the_DT one_CD observed_VBN in_IN other_JJ two_CD breeds_NNS ._.
In_IN the_DT Hissari_NNP sheep_VBP the_DT reaction_NN was_VBD milder_JJR than_IN that_DT of_IN the_DT Bikaneri_NNP and_CC Lohi_NNP ,_, four_CD out_IN of_IN five_CD animals_NNS reacted_VBD ._.
Among_IN the_DT Bikaneri_NNP sheep_VBD the_DT reaction_NN was_VBD no_DT different_JJ in_IN those_DT that_WDT got_VBD serum_JJR than_IN in_IN the_DT others_NNS that_WDT did_VBD not_RB get_VB it_PRP ._.
As_IN the_DT virus_NN was_VBD attenuated_VBN ,_, due_JJ to_TO break-_JJ down_NN of_IN the_DT refrigerator_NN ,_, no_DT definite_JJ conclusion_NN could_MD be_VB arrived_VBN at_IN ._.
Most_JJS of_IN the_DT animals_NNS reacted_VBD on_IN the_DT sixth_JJ day_NN and_CC the_DT reaction_NN lasted_VBD for_IN three_CD or_CC four_CD days_NNS ;_: in_IN two_CD animals_NNS it_PRP continued_VBD for_IN about_IN a_DT week_NN ._.
Experiment_JJ No_NNP ._.
2_CD As_IN the_DT goatis_NN had_VBD been_VBN attenuated_VBN in_IN the_DT first_JJ experiment_NN ,_, six_CD Bikaneri_NNP ,_, two_CD Lohi_NNP and_CC two_CD Hissari_NNP were_VBD given_VBN fresh_JJ goatis_NN to_TO observe_VB the_DT difference_NN in_IN the_DT breed_NN reaction_NN if_IN any_DT ._.
All_PDT the_DT animals_NNS reacted_VBD on_IN the_DT fifth_NN or_CC sixth_JJ day_NN ._.
In_IN all_PDT the_DT animals_NNS the_DT reaction_NN subsided_VBD in_IN a_DT few_JJ days_NNS except_IN in_IN one_CD in_IN which_WDT it_PRP lasted_VBD for_IN more_JJR than_IN a_DT week_NN ._.
None_NN of_IN these_DT animals_NNS was_VBD dull_JJ ._.
This_DT showed_VBD that_IN goatis_NN could_MD be_VB used_VBN in_IN these_DT breeds_NNS as_IN immunizing_VBG agents_NNS without_IN any_DT fear_NN of_IN severe_JJ reaction_NN ._.
Experiment_JJ No_NNP ._.
3_CD Fifteen_JJ animals_NNS of_IN Hissari_NNP ,_, Lohi_NNP and_CC Bikaneri_NNP breeds_NNS were_VBD inoculated_VBN with_IN goatis_NN to_TO confirm_VB the_DT findings_NNS of_IN the_DT above_JJ experiment_NN ._.
Hissari_NNP ._.
Of_IN these_DT ,_, eight_CD reacted_VBN while_IN seven_CD (_( 46.6_CD per_IN cent_NN )_) did_VBD not_RB ._.
The_DT reaction_NN was_VBD observed_VBN on_IN the_DT fourth_JJ day_NN ._.
In_IN three_CD animals_NNS the_DT reaction_NN lasted_VBD for_IN one_CD day_NN (_( the_DT day_NN of_IN reaction_NN only_RB )_) ,_, in_IN three_CD for_IN two_CD days_NNS and_CC in_IN two_CD for_IN more_JJR than_IN three_CD days_NNS ._.
The_DT duration_NN of_IN the_DT reaction_NN can_MD not_RB be_VB definitely_RB stated_VBN ,_, as_IN the_DT temperature_NN was_VBD not_RB taken_VBN up_RP to_TO the_DT termination_NN of_IN the_DT period_NN because_IN the_DT animals_NNS were_VBD feeding_VBG normally_RB ._.
Only_RB one_CD was_VBD seen_VBN slightly_RB dull_JJ ._.
One_CD of_IN the_DT non-reactors_NNS (_( 808_CD )_) ,_, when_WRB being_VBG transported_VBN from_IN the_DT experimental_JJ yard_NN to_TO its_PRP$ pen_NN ,_, suddenly_RB died_VBD on_IN the_DT way_NN ._.
On_IN autopsy_NN haemorrhages_NNS in_IN the_DT duodenum_NN ,_, ulcers_NNS in_IN the_DT intestine_NN and_CC an_DT inflamed_JJ ileum_NN were_VBD discovered_VBN ._.
Parasitic_JJ nodules_NNS were_VBD also_RB found_VBN in_IN the_DT intestine_NN ._.
On_IN opening_VBG the_DT buccal_JJ cavity_NN ,_, it_PRP was_VBD noticed_VBN that_IN a_DT clump_NN of_IN green_JJ bersseem_NN which_WDT the_DT animal_NN had_VBD been_VBN chewing_VBG before_IN commencing_VBG its_PRP$ journey_NN was_VBD acting_VBG as_IN an_DT obstruction_NN in_IN the_DT larynx_NN ;_: this_DT probably_RB led_VBN to_TO aysphxia_VB ._.
The_DT presence_NN of_IN enteritis_NN and_CC ulceration_JJ typical_NN of_IN rinderpest_NN is_VBZ rather_RB interesting_JJ ,_, because_IN the_DT animal_NN was_VBD a_DT non-reactor_NN ._.
It_PRP suggested_VBD that_IN probably_RB other_JJ animals_NNS had_VBD the_DT disease_NN but_CC were_VBD naturally_RB so_RB resistant_JJ that_IN they_PRP did_VBD not_RB die_VB or_CC show_VB any_DT thermal_JJ reaction_NN ._.
This_DT accident_NN revealed_VBD something_NN as_IN to_TO what_WP was_VBD happening_VBG inside_IN the_DT body_NN of_IN the_DT sheep_NN ._.

This_DT observation_NN is_VBZ similar_JJ to_TO 18_CD Immunization_NNP of_IN Sheep_NNP and_CC Goats_NNP Against_NNP Rinderpest_NNP what_WP was_VBD observed_VBN in_IN goats_NNS ._.

It_PRP was_VBD also_RB found_VBN that_IN goatis_NN vaccinated_VBD sheep_JJ kept_NN in_IN better_JJR condition_NN with_IN grazing_VBG then_RB with_IN stall_JJ feeding_NN during_IN the_DT period_NN of_IN observation_NN ._.

4_CD To_TO confirm_VB the_DT above_JJ findings_NNS concerning_VBG the_DT variation_NN in_IN the_DT reaction_NN of_IN the_DT different_JJ breeds_NNS of_IN sheep_NN ,_, 10_CD more_JJR animals_NNS of_IN each_DT of_IN the_DT breeds_NNS mentioned_VBN above_IN and_CC eight_CD desi_NNS sheep_VBP were_VBD inoculated_VBN with_IN goatis_NN ._.

Hissari_NNP ._.
In_IN this_DT lot_NN one_CD animal_NN did_VBD not_RB react_VB ._.
Five_CD animals_NNS reacted_VBN on_IN the_DT third_JJ day_NN ,_, Two_CD animals_NNS reacted_VBD on_IN the_DT fourth_JJ day_NN ,_, One_CD animal_NN reacted_VBN on_IN the_DT second_JJ day_NN ,_, and_CC One_CD animal_NN reacted_VBN on_IN the_DT first_JJ day_NN ,_, i.e._FW ,_, one_CD day_NN after_IN inoculation_NN ._.
None_NN of_IN these_DT animals_NNS stopped_VBD grazing_VBG for_IN any_DT length_NN of_IN time_NN ._.
The_DT only_JJ sign_NN of_IN dullness_NN was_VBD the_DT fact_NN that_IN the_DT animals_NNS did_VBD not_RB feed_VB on_IN the_DT day_NN of_IN reaction_NN and_CC a_DT day_NN after_IN ._.
The_DT duration_NN of_IN the_DT reaction_NN was_VBD longer_RBR in_IN this_DT batch_NN than_IN in_IN the_DT previous_JJ one_CD ._.
One_CD animal_NN died_VBD with_IN haemorrhages_NNS in_IN the_DT abomasum_NN ,_, enteritis_NN ,_, pneumonia_NN of_IN the_DT anterior_JJ and_CC middle_JJ lobes_NN of_IN both_DT lungs_NNS and_CC congestion_NN of_IN the_DT larynx_NN ,_, thus_RB indicating_VBG that_IN the_DT reaction_NN in_IN Hissari_NNP may_MD not_RB always_RB be_VB as_RB mild_JJ as_IN was_VBD indicated_VBN by_IN the_DT previous_JJ experiment_NN ._.
Bikaneri_NNP ._.
None_NN of_IN the_DT animals_NNS had_VBD diarrhoea_NNS or_CC were_VBD dull_VBN in_IN spite_NN of_IN the_DT longer_JJR duration_NN of_IN the_DT thermal_JJ reaction_NN as_IN compared_VBN to_TO its_PRP$ duration_NN in_IN the_DT previous_JJ experiment_NN ._.
One_CD animal_NN reacted_VBN on_IN the_DT first_JJ day_NN ,_, Two_CD animals_NNS reacted_VBD on_IN the_DT second_JJ day_NN ,_, and_CC Seven_NNP animals_NNS reacted_VBD on_IN the_DT third_JJ day_NN ._.
Adult_NNP Lohi_NNP ._.

serum_NN and_CC goatis_NN ._.
All_DT were_VBD found_VBN to_TO be_VB more_RBR susceptible_JJ than_IN the_DT Bikaneris_NNP and_CC Hissaris_NNP as_IN observed_JJ previous-_JJ ly_NN ._.
Most_JJS of_IN the_DT animals_NNS reacted_VBD on_IN the_DT second_JJ day_NN and_CC the_DT reaction_NN lasted_VBD for_IN more_JJR than_IN a_DT week_NN ._.
In_IN the_DT animals_NNS which_WDT got_VBD serum_NNS ,_, the_DT reaction_NN was_VBD comparatively_RB mild_JJ ,_, though_IN it_PRP started_VBD in_IN most_JJS of_IN them_PRP on_IN the_DT third_JJ day_NN and_CC lasted_VBD for_IN more_JJR than_IN a_DT week_NN ._.
Lohi_NNP lambs_NN ._.
Two_CD of_IN these_DT died_VBN without_IN showing_VBG any_DT lesions_NNS of_IN rinderpest_NN ._.
The_DT others_NNS reacted_VBD severely_RB ,_, demonstrating_VBG that_IN the_DT lambs_NNS were_VBD more_RBR susceptible_JJ than_IN the_DT adults_NNS ._.
The_DT dose_NN of_IN serum_NN given_VBN did_VBD not_RB seem_VB to_TO reduce_VB the_DT severity_NN of_IN the_DT reaction_NN ,_, thus_RB showing_VBG that_IN a_DT higher_JJR dose_NN was_VBD required_VBN in_IN young_JJ lambs_NNS ._.
Desi_NNP ._.
These_DT were_VBD found_VBN to_TO be_VB more_RBR resistant_JJ than_IN the_DT others_NNS because_IN during_IN the_DT reaction_NN they_PRP were_VBD quite_RB active_JJ and_CC fed_VBN normally_RB ._.
One_CD died_VBD without_IN showing_VBG any_DT lesion_NN of_IN rinderpest_NN ._.
One_CD did_VBD not_RB react_VB ,_, while_IN the_DT remainder_NN reacted_VBD on_IN the_DT second_JJ day_NN ,_, the_DT reaction_NN lasting_VBG from_IN 3_CD to_TO 10_CD days_NNS ._.
The_DT old_JJ animals_NNS exhibited_VBD the_DT same_JJ degree_NN of_IN reaction_NN as_IN the_DT young_JJ ones_NNS thus_RB indicating_VBG that_IN no_DT immunity_NN is_VBZ conferred_VBN with_IN age_NN ._.
FIELD_NNP TRIAL_NNP At_IN the_DT time_NN when_WRB goatis_NN was_VBD being_VBG tried_VBN in_IN goats_NNS at_IN Kangra_NNP ,_, it_PRP was_VBD also_RB used_VBN in_IN sheep_NN ._.
It_PRP was_VBD observed_VBN that_IN Biangi_NNP sheep_NN were_VBD comparatively_RB more_RBR susceptible_JJ than_IN the_DT Gaddi_NNP and_CC other_JJ mixed_JJ bred_VBD local_JJ sheep_NN ._.
Haddow_NNP [_NN 1939_CD ]_NN on_IN the_DT other_JJ hand_NN ,_, has_VBZ stated_VBN that_IN sheep_NN from_IN Tibet_NNP and_CC Himalayan_NNP hinterland_NN are_VBP not_RB susceptible_JJ ._.
Of_IN the_DT Biangis_NNP ,_, 150_CD were_VBD given_VBN goatis_NN and_CC serum_NN while_IN 44_CD were_VBD given_VBN goatis_NN alone_RB ._.

Regular_JJ temperature_NN charts_NNS were_VBD kept_VBN in_IN the_DT case_NN of_IN ten_NN animals_NNS in_IN each_DT group_NN ;_: three_CD of_IN the_DT ten_NN animals_NNS which_WDT got_VBD goatis_NNS and_CC serum_NN (_( 10_CD c.c_NN ._. )_)
did_VBD not_RB react_VB (_( probably_RB examples_NNS of_IN blocked_JJ reaction_NN )_) ._.

Out_IN of_IN these_DT ten_JJ animals_NNS ,_, two_CD did_VBD not_RB react_VB ._.
The_DT day_NN and_CC the_DT duration_NN of_IN reactions_NNS are_VBP as_IN stated_VBN below_IN :_: Six_NNP reacted_VBD on_IN the_DT fourth_JJ day_NN ,_, One_CD reacted_VBN on_IN the_DT fifth_JJ day_NN ,_, and_CC One_CD reacted_VBN on_IN the_DT sixth_JJ day_NN ._.
One_CD animal_NN on_IN the_DT two_CD days_NNS ,_, Two_CD animals_NNS on_IN the_DT six_CD days_NNS ,_, and_CC One_CD animal_NN on_IN the_DT eight_CD days_NNS ._.
There_EX was_VBD a_DT slight_JJ loss_NN of_IN condition_NN amongst_IN the_DT reactors_NNS ,_, but_CC otherwise_RB the_DT results_NNS were_VBD satis-_JJ factory_NN ._.
In_IN one_CD lamb_NN there_EX were_VBD symptoms_NNS of_IN haemoglobinuria_NN ._.

From_IN the_DT results_NNS of_IN this_DT field_NN trial_NN it_PRP can_MD be_VB confidently_RB assumed_VBN that_IN goatis_NN can_MD safely_RB be_VB used_VBN in_IN Gaddi_NNP as_RB well_RB as_IN Biangi_NNP sheep_NN for_IN the_DT purpose_NN of_IN producing_VBG active_JJ immuniza-_JJ tion_NN against_IN rinderpest_NN ._.
In_IN the_DT case_NN of_IN Biangi_NNP sheep_VBP if_IN a_DT high_JJ thermal_JJ reaction_NN ,_, which_WDT causes_VBZ no_DT mortality_NN ,_, is_VBZ to_TO be_VB avoided_VBN ,_, serum_NN may_MD be_VB given_VBN in_IN addition_NN as_IN in_IN the_DT case_NN of_IN goats_NNS ._.
IMMUNITY_NNP TEST_NNP IN_NNP SHEEP_NNP The_DT immunity_NN of_IN the_DT sheep_NN which_WDT were_VBD immunized_VBN with_IN goatis_NN was_VBD tested_VBN with_IN bull_NN virus_NN ._.

(_( i_NN )_) Lohi_NNP ._.

After_IN human_JJ needs_NNS in_IN cereals_NNS are_VBP met_VBN ,_, 17_CD million_CD acres_NNS of_IN land_NN will_MD be_VB released_VBN from_IN these_DT crops_NNS and_CC simultaneously_RB the_DT production_NN of_IN cereal_NN by-products_NNS will_MD be_VB increased_VBN by_IN 0.13_CD million_CD tons_NNS ._.
