On_IN the_DT other_JJ hand_NN ,_, 12.4_CD million_CD extra_JJ acres_NNS will_MD be_VB needed_VBN for_IN oil_NN crops_NNS if_IN the_DT target_NN is_VBZ to_TO provide_VB for_IN even_RB half_NN of_IN the_DT present_JJ human_JJ deficiency_NN ,_, but_CC it_PRP will_MD provide_VB 3.1_CD million_CD tons_NNS of_IN extra_JJ oilcakes_NNS ._.
The_DT immediate_JJ need_NN of_IN 10.22_CD million_CD tons_NNS of_IN green_JJ fodder_NN should_MD be_VB covered_VBN in_IN a_DT 25_CD per_IN cent_NN increase_NN in_IN yield_NN of_IN the_DT present_JJ acreage_NN ._.
The_DT position_NN then_RB would_MD be_VB ,_, in_IN relation_NN to_TO the_DT limited_JJ target_NN set_VBN ,_, that_IN there_EX is_VBZ a_DT surplus_NN of_IN 2.27_CD million_CD tons_NNS of_IN oilcake_NN and_CC a_DT deficiency_NN of_IN 1.18_CD million_CD tons_NNS of_IN gram_NN and_CC pulses_NNS and_CC 1.21_CD million_CD tons_NNS of_IN cereal_NN by-products_NNS ,_, while_IN there_EX is_VBZ 5.22_CD million_CD acres_NNS of_IN land_NN available_JJ for_IN further_JJ use_NN ._.
It_PRP should_MD be_VB employed_VBN for_IN the_DT production_NN of_IN either_DT gram_NN ,_, pulses_VBZ or_CC cereals_NNS which_WDT will_MD approximately_RB meet_VB the_DT balance_NN of_IN requirements_NNS ._.
AN_DT ESTIMATE_NN OF_IN THE_NNP FOOD_NNP REQUIREMENTS_NNP OF_NNP MILCH_NNP AND_NNP OTHER_NNP CATTLE_NNP IN_NNP INDIA*_NNP By_IN L._NNP C._NNP SIKKA_NNP ,_, Assistant_NNP Director_NNP of_IN Agriculture_NNP (_( Livestock_NNP )_) ,_, Bengal_NNP (_( Received_VBN for_IN publication_NN on_IN 14_CD May_NNP 1946_CD )_) THE_DT Advisory_NNP Board_NNP of_IN the_DT Imperial_NNP Council_NNP of_IN Agricultural_NNP Research_NNP has_VBZ issued_VBN a_DT plan_NN for_IN the_DT development_NN of_IN Indian_JJ Agriculture_NNP and_CC Animal_NNP Husbandry_NNP ._.
In_IN order_NN to_TO achieve_VB national_JJ suffi-_JJ ciency_NN in_IN human_JJ foodstuffs_NNS (_( for_IN a_DT population_NN of_IN 400_CD millions_NNS )_) ,_, in_IN that_DT plan_NN ,_, the_DT minimum_JJ targets_NNS laid_VBN down_RB are_VBP to_TO increase_VB the_DT existing_VBG production_NN of_IN cereals_NNS by_IN 10_CD per_IN cent_NN ,_, pulses_NNS by_IN 20_CD per_IN cent_NN ,_, fats_NNS and_CC oils_NNS by_IN 250_CD per_IN cent_NN ,_, fruits_NNS by_IN 50_CD per_IN cent_NN ,_, vegetables_NNS by_IN 100_CD per_IN cent_NN ,_, milk_NN by_IN 300_CD per_IN cent_NN and_CC fish_NN and_CC eggs_NNS by_IN 300_CD per_IN cent_NN ._.
Furthermore_RB ,_, with_IN a_DT view_NN to_TO provide_VB adequate_JJ supplies_NNS of_IN animal_JJ foods_NNS neces-_JJ sary_JJ for_IN the_DT increased_JJ outturn_NN of_IN work_NN and_CC milk_NN ,_, it_PRP has_VBZ been_VBN stated_VBN that_IN the_DT present_JJ production_NN of_IN oil_NN cakes_NNS and_CC other_JJ concentrates_NNS (_( estimated_VBN at_IN 3.75_CD million_CD tons_NNS )_) must_MD be_VB increased_VBN by_IN 400_CD per_IN cent_NN and_CC of_IN roughages_NNS (_( estimated_VBN production_NN 175_CD million_CD tons_NNS )_) by_IN 55_CD per_IN cent_NN ._.
This_DT note_NN has_VBZ been_VBN written_VBN (_( a_DT )_) to_TO show_VB the_DT approximate_JJ requirements_NNS of_IN our_PRP$ bovine_JJ population_NN in_IN the_DT light_NN of_IN that_DT plan_NN ,_, and_CC (_( b_NN )_) to_TO broadly_RB indicate_VB the_DT adjustments_NNS ,_, which_WDT may_MD be_VB made_VBN in_IN the_DT existing_VBG agricultural_JJ practice_NN ,_, in_IN order_NN to_TO provide_VB these_DT requirements_NNS ._.
FOOD_NN REQUIREMENTS_NNP OF_IN THE_NNP INDIAN_NNP BOVINE_NNP STOCK_NNP Estimates_NNS have_VBP to_TO be_VB formulated_VBN of_IN requirements_NNS for_IN (_( a_DT )_) milk_NN production_NN ,_, (_( b_NN )_) work_NN ,_, and_CC (_( c_NN )_) growth_NN of_IN the_DT bovine_JJ stock_NN required_VBN to_TO attain_VB the_DT foregoing_JJ targets_NNS ._.
To_TO be_VB accurate_JJ such_JJ estimates_NNS must_MD be_VB based_VBN on_IN the_DT actual_JJ requirements_NNS of_IN different_JJ nutrients_NNS (_( digestible_JJ protein_NN ,_, starch_JJ equivalent_NN ,_, etc_FW ._. )_)
for_IN each_DT purpose_NN ,_, a_DT point_NN overlooked_VBN ,_, in_IN most_JJS cases_NNS ,_, in_IN the_DT past_JJ [_NN Burns_NNP ,_, 1944_CD ]_NN ._.
It_PRP should_MD be_VB obvious_JJ that_IN because_IN of_IN the_DT great_JJ variations_NNS in_IN the_DT quality_NN and_CC ,_, therefore_RB ,_, requirements_NNS of_IN animals_NNS in_IN different_JJ parts_NNS of_IN India_NNP ,_, the_DT all-India_JJ estimate_NN of_IN requirements_NNS ought_MD to_TO be_VB a_DT composite_JJ of_IN regional_JJ estimates_NNS ._.
Unfortunately_RB ,_, however_RB ,_, it_PRP is_VBZ not_RB possible_JJ to_TO prepare_VB regional_JJ estimates_NNS with_IN any_DT measure_NN of_IN accuracy_NN ._.
This_DT is_VBZ because_RB ,_, firstly_RB ,_, it_PRP is_VBZ not_RB easy_JJ to_TO judge_VB correctly_RB the_DT number_NN of_IN work_NN and_CC milch_NN animals_NNS and_CC youngstock_NN that_WDT will_MD be_VB required_VBN in_IN each_DT region_NN to_TO supply_VB its_PRP$ requirements_NNS ,_, since_IN that_DT must_MD depend_VB upon_IN the_DT improvement_NN which_WDT may_MD be_VB effected_VBN through_IN better_JJR feeding_NN ,_, improved_JJ management_NN ,_, proper_IN breeding_NN ,_, and_CC disease_VB control_NN in_IN the_DT existing_VBG stocks_NNS of_IN each_DT region_NN ;_: and_CC secondly_RB our_PRP$ knowledge_NN regarding_VBG the_DT optimum_NN food_NN requirements_NNS of_IN different_JJ types_NNS of_IN cattle_NNS of_IN each_DT region_NN is_VBZ extremely_RB imperfect_JJ ._.
It_PRP is_VBZ essential_JJ that_IN immediate_JJ steps_NNS be_VB taken_VBN to_TO obtain_VB this_DT information_NN ,_, so_IN that_IN the_DT regional_JJ estimates_NNS can_MD be_VB prepared_VBN accurately_RB ._.
Without_IN that_DT no_DT definite_JJ planning_NN can_MD be_VB possible_JJ ._.
An_DT all-India_JJ estimate_NN ,_, based_VBN on_IN average_NN estimated_VBN requirements_NNS for_IN all_DT regions_NNS ,_, must_MD ,_, therefore_RB ,_, be_VB of_IN somewhat_RB academic_JJ interest_NN ._.
However_RB ,_, it_PRP should_MD serve_VB as_IN a_DT first_JJ approximation_NN in_IN indicating_VBG the_DT total_JJ requirements_NNS for_IN the_DT country_NN ,_, and_CC thereby_RB showing_VBG the_DT lee-way_NN we_PRP will_MD have_VB to_TO make_VB up_RP to_TO provide_VB these_DT requirements_NNS ._.
It_PRP is_VBZ ,_, therefore_RB ,_, given_VBN here_RB for_IN what_WP it_PRP is_VBZ worth_JJ ._.
Because_IN of_IN the_DT paucity_NN of_IN the_DT required_VBN data_NNS only_RB an_DT estimate_NN for_IN the_DT British_JJ India_NNP is_VBZ presented_VBN in_IN this_DT note_NN ._.
The_DT total_JJ quantity_NN of_IN milk_NN required_VBN in_IN British_JJ India_NNP may_MD be_VB taken_VBN at_IN 44_CD million_CD tons_NNS ._.
Assuming_VBG that_IN the_DT existing_VBG annual_JJ production_NN per_IN animal_NN is_VBZ 750_CD lb._NN ,_, which_WDT may_MD be_VB increased_VBN by_IN 60_CD per_IN cent_NN [_NN Burns_NNP ,_, 1944_CD ]_NN through_IN improved_VBN feeding_NN ,_, management_NN and_CC disease_NN control_NN (_( thus_RB giving_VBG an_DT annual_JJ yield_NN of_IN 1200_CD lb_NN ._.
per_IN animal_NN )_) ,_, some_DT 82.3_CD million_CD milch_NN cattle_NNS will_MD be_VB required_VBN to_TO produce_VB the_DT required_JJ quantity_NN of_IN milk_NN ._.

ADJUSTMENTS_RB RECOMMENDED_NNP TO_NNP MEET_NNP THE_NNP DEFICIT_NNP It_PRP should_MD be_VB obvious_JJ that_IN there_EX can_MD not_RB be_VB a_DT uniform_JJ set_NN of_IN adjustments_NNS for_IN the_DT whole_NN of_IN India_NNP ._.
These_DT must_MD vary_VB from_IN area_NN to_TO area_NN in_IN accordance_NN with_IN the_DT requirements_NNS of_IN each_DT ,_, and_CC its_PRP$ agricultural_JJ conditions_NNS ._.
Furthermore_RB ,_, it_PRP is_VBZ unlikely_JJ that_IN each_DT area_NN will_MD prove_VB capable_JJ of_IN being_VBG made_VBN self_NN sufficient_NN ,_, although_IN like_IN the_DT deficit_NN areas_NNS ,_, there_EX are_VBP bound_VBN to_TO be_VB surplus_JJ areas_NNS as_RB well_RB ._.
The_DT surplus_NN produce_NN of_IN the_DT latter_NN should_MD be_VB available_JJ for_IN supplementing_VBG the_DT produce_NN of_IN the_DT former_JJ ._.
For_IN want_NN of_IN the_DT requisite_JJ information_NN ,_, it_PRP is_VBZ not_RB possible_JJ to_TO treat_VB the_DT subject_NN on_IN a_DT regional_JJ basis_NN ._.
Only_RB all-India_JJ adjustments_NNS are_VBP ,_, therefore_RB ,_, indicated_VBD in_IN what_WP follows_VBZ ._.
But_CC steps_NNS must_MD be_VB taken_VBN to_TO secure_VB the_DT required_JJ information_NN for_IN each_DT region_NN and_CC sub-region_NN ,_, and_CC detailed_JJ plans_NNS prepared_VBN on_IN the_DT basis_NN of_IN such_JJ information_NN to_TO secure_VB a_DT regional_JJ self-sufficiency_NN as_RB far_RB as_IN possible_JJ ._.
It_PRP is_VBZ well_RB known_VBN that_IN the_DT same_JJ land_NN cropped_VBD with_IN cereals_NNS and_CC pulses_NNS can_MD support_VB a_DT much_RB larger_JJR population_NN than_IN if_IN devoted_VBN to_TO stock_NN keeping_VBG ._.
Agriculturally_RB over_RB populated_JJ as_IN India_NNP is_VBZ ,_, with_IN its_PRP$ small_JJ 32_CD Food_NNP Requirements_NNS of_IN Milch_NNP and_CC other_JJ Cattle_NNP in_IN India_NNP ._.
holdings_NNS ,_, the_DT land_NN must_MD needs_VB be_VB cropped_VBN essentially_RB to_TO produce_VB human_JJ food_NN of_IN plant_NN origin_NN ._.
The_DT production_NN of_IN animal_JJ food_NN must_MD remain_VB largely_RB subservient_JJ to_TO that_DT system_NN ,_, only_RB surplus_JJ land_NN being_VBG devoted_VBN to_TO the_DT keeping_VBG of_IN livestock_NN ,_, that_IN in_IN the_DT absence_NN of_IN land_NN ,_, must_MD subsist_VB on_IN the_DT by-products_NNS of_IN human_JJ food_NN ._.
As_IN already_RB stated_VBN ,_, in_IN order_NN to_TO attain_VB self-sufficiency_NN in_IN human_JJ foodstuffs_NNS ,_, the_DT targets_NNS fixed_VBN are_VBP to_TO increase_VB the_DT production_NN of_IN cereals_NNS by_IN 10_CD per_IN cent_NN ,_, of_IN pulses_NNS by_IN 20_CD per_IN cent_NN and_CC of_IN fats_NNS and_CC oils_NNS (_( and_CC ,_, therefore_RB ,_, of_IN oil_NN seeds_NNS )_) by_IN 250_CD per_IN cent_NN ._.

It_PRP must_MD first_RB be_VB considered_VBN how_WRB this_DT projected_VBN increased_JJ production_NN of_IN human_JJ food_NN (_( and_CC ,_, therefore_RB ,_, of_IN animal_JJ food_NN )_) may_MD be_VB effected_VBN :_: whether_IN by_IN extending_VBG the_DT area_NN under_IN these_DT crops_NNS ,_, or_CC by_IN obtaining_VBG higher_JJR yields_NNS per_IN acre_NN ,_, or_CC by_IN a_DT combination_NN of_IN both_DT these_DT steps_NNS ._.
Burns_NNS [_JJ 1944_CD ]_NN ._.
Ibid_NNP has_VBZ already_RB indicated_VBN the_DT technological_JJ possibilities_NNS of_IN crop_NN improvement_NN in_IN India_NNP ._.
He_PRP has_VBZ shown_VBN that_IN by_IN adopting_VBG improved_JJ agricultural_JJ practices_NNS it_PRP is_VBZ possible_JJ to_TO improve_VB the_DT yield_NN of_IN cereals_NNS by_IN 20-50_JJ per_IN cent_NN ,_, of_IN grain_NN by_IN 20_CD per_IN cent_NN ,_, and_CC of_IN most_JJS oilseeds_NNS by_IN 15-25_JJ per_IN cent_NN ._.
In_IN view_NN of_IN these_DT results_NNS ,_, the_DT desired_NN increased_VBD production_NN of_IN cereals_NNS and_CC pulses_NNS should_MD be_VB obtainable_JJ from_IN the_DT existing_VBG areas_NNS under_IN such_JJ crops_NNS ;_: while_IN in_IN case_NN of_IN oilseeds_NNS their_PRP$ present_JJ area_NN (_( 18.5_CD million_CD acres_NNS )_) must_MD be_VB at_IN least_JJS doubled_JJ ._.
However_RB ,_, in_IN view_NN of_IN the_DT great_JJ possibility_NN for_IN increasing_VBG the_DT yield_NN of_IN cereals_NNS ,_, and_CC their_PRP$ large_JJ area_NN (_( 156_CD million_CD acres_NNS )_) ,_, there_EX should_MD be_VB ample_JJ scope_NN for_IN finding_VBG the_DT additional_JJ land_NN required_VBN for_IN growing_VBG oilseeds_NNS out_IN of_IN that_DT area_NN ._.
It_PRP should_MD also_RB be_VB stated_VBN that_IN the_DT use_NN of_IN edible_JJ oil-cakes_NNS as_IN manures_NNS must_MD be_VB discontinued_VBN ._.
Burns_NNS [_JJ 1944_CD ]_NNP Ibid_NNP has_VBZ estimated_VBN that_IN ,_, in_IN order_NN to_TO meet_VB only_RB one-fifth_JJ the_DT manurial_JJ needs_NNS of_IN paddy_NN (_( to_TO secure_VB increased_JJ yield_NN per_IN acre_NN )_) ,_, the_DT whole_NN of_IN the_DT existing_VBG supply_NN of_IN oilcakes_NNS is_VBZ required_VBN ._.
If_IN the_DT use_NN of_IN edible_JJ oilcakes_NNS as_IN manure_NN is_VBZ to_TO increase_VB ,_, the_DT animal_JJ food_NN supply_NN position_NN may_MD further_VB deteriorate_NN ._.
No_DT doubt_NN ,_, without_IN the_DT use_NN of_IN manures_NNS the_DT scope_NN for_IN increasing_VBG the_DT yield_NN of_IN our_PRP$ crops_NNS is_VBZ ,_, in_IN most_JJS cases_NNS ,_, very_RB little_JJ ;_: but_CC artificial_JJ fertilizers_NNS ,_, farm_NN yard_NN manure_NN ,_, compost_NN and_CC green_JJ manures_NNS ,_, rather_RB than_IN edible_JJ oilcakes_NNS ,_, must_MD be_VB looked_VBN upon_IN to_TO satisfy_VB that_DT need_NN ._.
It_PRP is_VBZ also_RB essential_JJ to_TO stop_VB the_DT export_NN of_IN oilseeds_NNS and_CC oilcakes_NNS ,_, and_CC develop_VB the_DT Indian_JJ oilseeds_NNS crushing_VBG industry_NN ._.
L._NNP C._NNP SIKKA_NNP 33_CD In_IN spite_NN of_IN the_DT foregoing_NN increased_VBD production_NN ,_, there_EX will_MD still_RB remain_VB a_DT deficit_NN of_IN some_DT 6.66_CD million_CD tons_NNS of_IN digestible_JJ protein_NN and_CC 40.50_CD million_CD tons_NNS of_IN starch_NN equivalent_NN ._.
How_WRB may_MD that_DT be_VB met_VBN ?_.
Obviously_RB ,_, the_DT first_JJ thing_NN to_TO do_VB would_MD be_VB to_TO increase_VB the_DT supplies_NNS from_IN the_DT existing_VBG sources_NNS ,_, as_RB much_JJ as_IN possible_JJ ,_, and_CC then_RB look_VB for_IN new_JJ sources_NNS ._.
The_DT waste_NN lands_VBZ ,_, aggregating_VBG some_DT 90_CD million_CD acres_NNS in_IN British_JJ India_NNP ,_, offer_VBP a_DT great_JJ scope_NN in_IN this_DT respect_NN ._.
These_DT should_MD be_VB surveyed_VBN ,_, and_CC working_VBG plans_NNS formulated_VBN for_IN their_PRP$ development_NN ._.
Such_JJ waste_NN lands_NNS ,_, as_IN can_MD be_VB brought_VBN under_IN cultivation_NN economi-_JJ cally_RB should_MD be_VB used_VBN for_IN that_DT purpose_NN ,_, if_IN possible_JJ ,_, for_IN growing_VBG fodder_JJ crops_NNS ;_: while_IN the_DT grass_NN produc-_JJ tion_NN from_IN the_DT rest_NN should_MD be_VB increased_VBN by_IN suitable_JJ management_NN ._.
That_DT there_EX is_VBZ a_DT very_RB great_JJ scope_NN in_IN the_DT latter_JJ direction_NN ,_, there_EX can_MD be_VB no_DT doubt_NN ._.
We_PRP have_VBP already_RB the_DT example_NN of_IN improvement_NN of_IN usar_JJ lands_NNS in_IN the_DT United_NNP Provinces*_NNP ,_, the_DT hay_JJ production_NN of_IN which_WDT was_VBD increased_VBN from_IN 2.75_CD maunds_NNS to_TO 15.0_CD maunds_NNS per_IN acre_NN over_IN a_DT period_NN of_IN 5½_CD years_NNS by_IN the_DT simple_NN and_CC inexpensive_JJ practice_NN of_IN protecting_VBG them_PRP from_IN grazing_VBG during_IN the_DT six_CD rainy_JJ months_NNS ,_, in_IN spite_NN of_IN grazing_VBG having_VBG been_VBN permitted_VBN after_IN the_DT hay_NN harvest_NN ._.
If_IN each_DT acre_NN of_IN waste_NN land_NN ,_, suitably_RB managed_VBN ,_, were_VBD to_TO yield_VB annually_RB even_RB half_PDT a_DT ton_NN (_( dry_JJ weight_NN )_) of_IN hay_NN more_JJR than_IN at_IN present_JJ (_( surely_RB ,_, not_RB an_DT impossible_JJ target_NN )_) ,_, the_DT extra_JJ quantity_NN of_IN grazing_VBG material_NN thus_RB obtained_VBN would_MD provide_VB nearly_RB 2¼_CD million_CD tons_NNS of_IN digestible_JJ protein_NN and_CC 18_CD million_CD tons_NNS of_IN starch_NN equivalent_NN ._.
In_IN order_NN to_TO produce_VB the_DT balanceA_NN SURVEY_NNP OF_IN THE_NNP FEEDS_NNP AND_NNP FODDERS_NNP AND_NNP THE_NNP REQUIREMENTS_NNP OF_IN THE_NNP LIVESTOCK_NNP IN_NNP THE_NNP UNITED_NNP PROVINCES*_NNP By_IN N._NNP C._NNP DAS_NNP GUPTA_NNP ,_, Research_NNP Officer_NNP ,_, Cattle_NNP Feeding_NNP Research_NNP Station_NNP ,_, Bharari_NNP ,_, Jhansi_NNP (_( Received_VBN for_IN publication_NN on_IN 14_CD May_NNP 1946_CD )_) THE_DT products_NNS of_IN the_DT field_NN which_WDT are_VBP inedible_JJ for_IN man_NN are_VBP the_DT main_JJ source_NN of_IN nutrients_NNS for_IN the_DT livestock_NN but_CC ,_, farm_NN animals_NNS can_MD not_RB produce_VB milk_NN ,_, meat_NN or_CC labour_NN efficiently_RB unless_IN some_DT edible_JJ food_NN is_VBZ also_RB included_VBN in_IN the_DT ration_NN ._.

+580.8_JJ N._NNP C._NNP DAS_NNP GUPTA_NNP 43_CD Another_DT important_JJ factor_NN also_RB requires_VBZ attention_NN ._.

This_DT point_NN has_VBZ already_RB been_VBN discussed_VBN by_IN Das_NNP Gupta_NNP [_NNP 1945_CD ]_NNP ._.
SUMMARY_NN It_PRP is_VBZ estimated_VBN that_IN out_IN of_IN 1,619.7_CD thousand_CD tons_NNS of_IN protein_NN and_CC 57,304,550_CD thousand_NN therms_NNS fuel_VBP available_JJ from_IN food_NN grains_NNS ,_, seeds_NNS and_CC milk_NN ,_, about_RB 1,219.3_CD thousand_CD tons_NNS of_IN protein_NN and_CC 48,370,000_CD thousand_NN therms_NNS fuel_NN are_VBP required_VBN per_IN year_NN for_IN 56_CD million_CD human_JJ population_NN of_IN the_DT province_NN ._.
The_DT balance_NN which_WDT is_VBZ equivalent_JJ to_TO 2,257_CD thousand_CD tons_NNS dry_JJ matter_NN ,_, 252.3_CD thousand_CD tons_NNS digestible_JJ protein_NN and_CC 4,481,960_CD thousand_NN therms_NNS net_JJ energy_NN ,_, can_MD be_VB spared_VBN for_IN the_DT livestock_NN ._.
The_DT total_JJ requirement_NN for_IN maintenance_NN ,_, growth_NN ,_, production_NN of_IN milk_NN or_CC work_NN for_IN 30,208,247_CD livestock_NN ,_, excluding_VBG sheep_NN ,_, goats_NNS and_CC swine_NN ,_, is_VBZ 74,294_CD thousand_JJ tons_NNS of_IN dry_JJ matter_NN ,_, 3,489.6_CD thousand_CD tons_NNS digestible_JJ protein_NN and_CC 69,128,997_CD thousand_NN therms_NNS net_JJ energy_NN per_IN year_NN ._.
The_DT present_JJ total_JJ yield_NN of_IN 3,047_CD thousand_CD tons_NNS of_IN milk_NN can_MD provide_VB ,_, on_IN an_DT average_NN ,_, 5.3_CD oz_NN ._.
per_IN head_NN per_IN day_NN ._.
If_IN the_DT consumption_NN is_VBZ to_TO be_VB increased_VBN to_TO 8.0_CD oz_NN ._.
about_IN 1,554_CD thousand_CD tons_NNS more_JJR milk_NN will_MD have_VB to_TO be_VB produced_VBN and_CC the_DT total_JJ requirement_NN for_IN livestock_NN will_MD increase_VB to_TO 3,569.9_CD thousand_CD tons_NNS digestible_JJ protein_NN and_CC 70,411,997_CD therms_NNS net_JJ energy_NN ._.
The_DT amount_NN of_IN nutrients_NNS available_JJ for_IN feeding_VBG livestock_NN is_VBZ 36,596_CD thousand_JJ tons_NNS dry_JJ matter_NN ,_, 813.6_CD thousand_CD tons_NNS digestible_JJ protein_NN and_CC 23,880,890_CD thousand_NN therms_NNS net_JJ energy_NN which_WDT is_VBZ only_RB 49_CD ,_, 23_CD ,_, and_CC 34_CD per_IN cent_NN respectively_RB of_IN the_DT requirement_NN ._.
Fodder_NNP crops_NNS provide_VBP nearly_RB twice_RB as_RB much_JJ net_JJ energy_NN as_IN grain_NN crops_NNS per_IN acre_NN ._.
Though_IN 4.8_CD times_NNS more_RBR protein_NNS and_CC 2.9_CD times_NNS fuel_NN is_VBZ necessary_JJ for_IN 30_CD million_CD livestock_NN than_IN what_WP is_VBZ required_VBN for_IN 56_CD million_CD human_JJ population_NN ,_, only_RB 3.6_CD per_IN cent_NN of_IN the_DT total_NN cropped_VBD area_NN is_VBZ under_IN fodder_NN ._.
With_IN the_DT present_JJ condition_NN of_IN poor_JJ yield_NN ,_, it_PRP is_VBZ not_RB possible_JJ to_TO meet_VB the_DT requirement_NN even_RB if_IN the_DT total_JJ area_NN corresponding_VBG to_TO the_DT excess_NN of_IN grains_NNS after_IN providing_VBG for_IN human_JJ population_NN is_VBZ put_VBN under_IN the_DT best_JJS fodder_NN crops_NNS ._.
The_DT shortage_NN can_MD be_VB met_VBN if_IN the_DT yield_NN can_MD be_VB increased_VBN by_IN 50_CD per_IN cent_NN and_CC about_IN one-fifth_NN of_IN the_DT total_JJ area_NN is_VBZ put_VBN under_IN fodder_NN crops_NNS ,_, mainly_RB legumes_VBZ ._.

Report_NN on_IN the_DT Development_NNP of_IN Cattle_NNP and_CC the_DT Dairy_NNP Industry_NNP in_IN India_NNP CATTLE_NNP FOOD_NNP POSITION_NNP IN_NNP DELHI_NNP PROVINCE_NNP By_IN RAM_NNP SWARUP_NNP ,_, I._NNP D._NNP D._NNP ,_, Assoc_NNP I._NNP D._NNP I._NNP ,_, Officer-in-Charge_NNP ,_, Animal_NNP Husbandry_NNP Bureau_NNP ,_, Imperial_NNP Council_NNP of_IN Agricultural_NNP Research_NNP (_( Received_VBN for_IN publication_NN on_IN 14_CD May_NNP 1946_CD )_) IN_NNP this_DT note_NN an_DT attempt_NN has_VBZ been_VBN made_VBN to_TO estimate_VB and_CC compare_VB the_DT amount_NN of_IN animal_NN feed_NN produced_VBN in_IN Delhi*_NNP with_IN the_DT amount_NN needed_VBD to_TO put_VB the_DT livestock_NN in_IN the_DT optimum_JJ nutritional_JJ condition_NN for_IN full_JJ production_NN ._.
The_DT computation_NN has_VBZ been_VBN based_VBN on_IN assumptions_NNS which_WDT appear_VBP to_TO be_VB ,_, and_CC probably_RB are_VBP ,_, reason-_JJ able_JJ but_CC might_MD nevertheless_RB be_VB erroneous_JJ and_CC on_IN data_NNS of_IN present_JJ production_NN and_CC animal_NN population_NN which_WDT are_VBP not_RB unquestionable_JJ ._.
The_DT note_NN has_VBZ been_VBN prepared_VBN more_RBR with_IN a_DT view_NN to_TO demonstrate_VB the_DT method_NN which_WDT might_MD be_VB employed_VBN for_IN making_VBG similar_JJ estimates_NNS rather_RB than_IN to_TO propound_VB an_DT estab-_JJ lished_JJ fact_NN ._.

32,030_CD SUITABILITY_NNP OF_NNP SUGARCANE_NNP TOPS_NNP FOR_NNP SILAGE_NNP MAKING_NNP By_IN T._NNP M._NNP PAUL_NNP and_CC M._NNP C._NNP RANGASAMY_NNP ,_, Imperial_NNP Dairy_NNP Research_NNP Institute_NNP ,_, Bangalore_NNP (_( Received_VBN for_IN publication_NN on_IN 25_CD October_NNP 1945_CD )_) SUGARCANE_NNP is_VBZ very_RB extensively_RB cultivated_VBN in_IN India_NNP ,_, the_DT estimated_VBN land_NN under_IN sugarcane_NN for_IN 1944-45_JJ being_VBG 4,134,000_CD acres_NNS ._.
The_DT yield_NN of_IN sugarcane_NN varies_NNS from_IN province_NN to_TO province_VB ,_, but_CC the_DT average_JJ yield_NN of_IN millable_JJ cane_NN is_VBZ estimated_VBN to_TO be_VB about_IN 20_CD tons_NNS per_IN acre_NN ._.
The_DT yield_NN of_IN sugarcane_NN tops_NNS available_JJ in_IN India_NNP is_VBZ roughly_RB 22_CD per_IN cent_NN of_IN the_DT millable_JJ cane_NN which_WDT amounts_VBZ to_TO a_DT little_JJ over_IN four_CD tons_NNS per_IN acre_NN ._.
This_DT amounts_VBZ to_TO 16,536,000_CD tons_NNS ,_, and_CC is_VBZ likely_JJ to_TO be_VB on_IN the_DT increase_NN ._.
Thus_RB very_RB large_JJ amounts_NNS of_IN sugarcane_NN tops_NNS are_VBP produced_VBN in_IN the_DT sugarcane_NN tracts_NNS during_IN the_DT sugarcane_NN milling_NN season_NN ._.
A_DT comparatively_RB negligible_JJ portion_NN of_IN it_PRP ,_, is_VBZ being_VBG utilized_VBN as_IN fodder_NN for_IN cattle_NNS while_IN the_DT rest_NN of_IN it_PRP is_VBZ allowed_VBN to_TO wither_VB and_CC dry_VB on_IN the_DT field_NN and_CC subsequently_RB utilized_VBN as_IN fuel_NN for_IN feeding_VBG the_DT furnaces_NNS during_IN the_DT concentration_NN of_IN the_DT sugarcane_NN juice_NN or_CC simply_RB burnt_VB off_RP on_IN the_DT fields_NNS ._.
Thus_RB it_PRP is_VBZ clear_JJ ,_, that_IN a_DT very_RB large_JJ proportion_NN of_IN the_DT sugarcane_NN tops_NNS produced_VBN in_IN India_NNP is_VBZ allowed_VBN to_TO go_VB to_TO waste_NN ._.
If_IN some_DT profitable_JJ means_NNS of_IN utilizing_VBG this_DT is_VBZ found_VBN ,_, that_WDT will_MD certainly_RB add_VB to_TO the_DT income_NN of_IN the_DT sugar-_JJ cane_NN cultivator_NN ._.
According_VBG to_TO 'Morrison_NNP Sugarcane_NNP tops_NNS make_VBP satisfactory_JJ forage_NN for_IN livestock_NN '_'' and_CC our_PRP$ own_JJ experience_NN is_VBZ that_IN cattle_JJ relish_VB them_PRP when_WRB they_PRP are_VBP fresh_JJ ,_, but_CC when_WRB they_PRP are_VBP wilted_VBN and_CC a_DT bit_NN dry_JJ ,_, cattle_NNS do_VBP not_RB relish_VB them_PRP much_RB ,_, possibly_RB due_JJ to_TO the_DT coarse_JJ nature_NN of_IN sugarcane_NN tops_NNS and_CC leaves_NNS ._.
Again_RB due_JJ to_TO the_DT local_JJ and_CC seasonal_JJ concentration_NN in_IN the_DT production_NN of_IN sugarcane_NN tops_NNS ,_, one_CD can_MD not_RB expect_VB that_IN any_DT considerable_JJ portion_NN of_IN it_PRP will_MD be_VB utilized_VBN as_IN cattle_NNS feed_VBP in_IN the_DT fresh_JJ state_NN ._.
Therefore_RB some_DT suitable_JJ method_NN of_IN preserving_VBG the_DT sugarcane_NN tops_VBZ with_IN or_CC without_IN processing_NN has_VBZ to_TO be_VB evolved_VBN ,_, if_IN all_PDT the_DT sugar_NN tops_NN is_VBZ to_TO be_VB utilized_VBN as_IN fodder_NN ._.
By_IN making_VBG silage_NN perhaps_RB ,_, its_PRP$ ,_, fodder_NN qualities_NNS may_MD improve_VB and_CC the_DT cattle_NNS may_MD relish_VB it_PRP just_RB like_IN any_DT other_JJ roughage_NN ._.
Moreover_RB silage_NN making_NN is_VBZ a_DT method_NN of_IN preservation_NN of_IN fodder_NN for_IN seasons_NNS of_IN fodder_NN shortage_NN ._.
Thus_RB ,_, if_IN silage_NN could_MD be_VB successfully_RB made_VBN out_IN of_IN sugarcane_NN tops_NNS and_CC if_IN cattle_NNS could_MD be_VB fed_VBN on_IN it_PRP safely_RB ,_, it_PRP may_MD go_VB a_DT great_JJ way_NN to_TO relieve_VB the_DT fodder_NN shortage_NN in_IN the_DT country_NN and_CC thus_RB contribute_NN to_TO the_DT solution_NN of_IN the_DT milk-_JJ problem_NN to_TO a_DT certain_JJ extent_NN ._.
Both_DT in_IN America_NNP and_CC Japan_NNP ,_, sugarcane_NN as_RB well_RB as_IN sugarcane_NN tops_NNS and_CC bagasse_NNS have_VBP been_VBN successfully_RB fed_VBN to_TO cattle_VB as_IN silage_NN and_CC otherwise_RB ._.
But_CC so_RB far_RB no_DT data_NN is_VBZ available_JJ as_IN to_TO the_DT suitability_NN of_IN the_DT sugarcane_NN tops_NNS for_IN silage_NN making_VBG under_IN the_DT Indian_JJ conditions_NNS and_CC how_WRB far_RB the_DT indigenous_JJ breeds_NNS of_IN cattle_NNS will_MD relish_VB it_PRP as_IN fodder_NN ._.
Therefore_RB an_DT attempt_NN was_VBD made_VBN at_IN the_DT Imperial_NNP Dairy_NNP Research_NNP Institute_NNP to_TO study_VB this_DT problem_NN ._.
EXPERIMENTAL_NNP Sugarcane_NNP tops_NNS were_VBD procured_VBN locally_RB in_IN as_RB fresh_JJ a_DT condition_NN as_IN possible_JJ ._.
Daily_JJ about_IN a_DT ton_NN of_IN the_DT material_NN was_VBD brought_VBN and_CC cut_VBN into_IN 1/3_CD to_TO ½_VB inch_JJ bits_NNS in_IN a_DT chaffing_NN machine_NN and_CC filled_VBD into_IN five_CD ft._JJ cube_NN silage_NN pits_NNS dug_NN in_IN the_DT ground_NN ._.
On_IN the_DT first_JJ day_NN the_DT sugarcane_NN tops_NNS were_VBD filled_VBN into_IN silo_JJ No_NNP ._.
I_PRP without_IN the_DT addition_NN of_IN any_DT thing_NN else_RB ,_, second_JJ day_NN 's_POS sample_NN was_VBD filled_VBN into_IN silo_JJ No_NNP ._.
II_NNP with_IN the_DT addition_NN of_IN molasses_NNS at_IN the_DT rate_NN of_IN 40_CD lb_NN ._.
per_IN ton_NN diluted_VBN with_IN an_DT equal_JJ amount_NN of_IN water_NN and_CC the_DT third_JJ day_NN 's_POS sample_NN was_VBD mixed_JJ with_IN an_DT equal_JJ amount_NN of_IN a_DT mixture_NN of_IN guinea_NN and_CC Napier_NNP grasses_NNS and_CC filled_VBN into_IN silo_JJ No_NNP ._.
III_NNP ._.
During_IN the_DT filling_NN of_IN the_DT silo_NN pits_NNS ,_, a_DT representative_JJ sample_NN was_VBD taken_VBN for_IN analysis_NN ._.
Care_NN was_VBD taken_VBN to_TO tramp_VB down_RP the_DT chopped_JJ matter_NN very_RB well_RB ,_, particularly_RB at_IN the_DT sides_NNS of_IN the_DT pit_NN to_TO drive_VB out_RP as_RB much_RB air_NN as_IN possible_JJ ._.
The_DT pits_NNS were_VBD filled_VBN upto_JJ two_CD feet_NNS above_IN the_DT ground_NN level_NN and_CC covered_VBN with_IN some_DT ragi_NN straw_JJ upto_JJ one_CD foot_NN thick_NN ._.
These_DT were_VBD then_RB covered_VBN with_IN mud_NN so_RB as_IN to_TO give_VB a_DT hemispherical_JJ shape_NN on_IN the_DT top_NN ._.
Finally_RB the_DT surface_NN was_VBD plastered_VBN with_IN a_DT wet_JJ mixture_NN of_IN mud_NN and_CC cowdung_NN so_RB that_IN the_DT pit_NN was_VBD almost_RB air_NN and_CC water_NN tight_NN ._.
All_PDT the_DT pits_NNS were_VBD daily_RB examined_VBN for_IN any_DT crevice_NN on_IN the_DT surface_NN and_CC the_DT crevices_NNS that_WDT appeared_VBD were_VBD immediately_RB repaired_VBN ._.
After_IN three_CD months_NNS the_DT pits_NNS were_VBD opened_VBN ,_, the_DT top_JJ layer_NN of_IN ragi_NN straw_NN was_VBD removed_VBN and_CC the_DT silage_NN examined_VBD for_IN texture_NN ,_, flavour_JJ etc_NN ._.
A_DT representative_JJ sample_NN was_VBD removed_VBN from_IN each_DT silo_NN pit_NN for_IN proximate_NN analysis_NN ._.
Table_JJ I_PRP gives_VBZ the_DT results_NNS of_IN the_DT analysis_NN before_IN and_CC after_IN making_VBG the_DT silage_NN ._.
48_CD T._NNP M._NNP PAUL_NNP AND_NNP M._NNP C._NNP RANGASWAMY_NNP 49_CD TABLE_NNP I_PRP Results_NNP of_IN analysis_NN before_IN and_CC after_IN silage_NN making_NN Constituents_NNP Silo_NNP I_PRP Silo_NNP II_NNP Silo_NNP III_NNP Cane_NNP tops_VBZ Silage_NNP Cane_NNP tops_VBZ Silage_NNP Cane_NNP tops_NNS and_CC grass_NN mixture_NN Silage_NNP Dry_NNP matter_NN ._.

1.4_CD 3.2_CD 1.3_CD 2.3_CD 1.5_CD 4.5_CD Feeding_VBG trial_NN ._.
Twelve_NNP cows_NNS of_IN almost_RB the_DT same_JJ stage_NN of_IN lactation_NN ,_, milk_NN yield_NN and_CC body_NN weight_NN were_VBD selected_VBN from_IN the_DT Institute_NNP herd_NN and_CC were_VBD divided_VBN into_IN four_CD groups_NNS of_IN three_CD each_DT ._.
The_DT normal_JJ concentrate_JJ ration_NN of_IN the_DT animals_NNS consisted_VBD of_IN a_DT mixture_NN of_IN ricebran_NN ,_, gram_NN ,_, gram_JJ husk_NN and_CC groundnut_JJ cake_NN in_IN the_DT ratio_NN of_IN 4:1.5:2.0:2.5_CD ._.
This_DT was_VBD fed_VBN at_IN the_DT rate_NN of_IN one_CD lb_NN ._.
for_IN every_DT two_CD lb_NN ._.
of_IN milk_NN yielded_VBN by_IN the_DT animal_NN ._.
The_DT roughage_NN ration_NN consisted_VBD of_IN 55_CD lb_NN ._.
of_IN green_JJ grass_NN (_( mixture_NN of_IN guinea_NN and_CC Napier_NNP grasses_NNS )_) and_CC three_CD lb_NN ._.
of_IN ragi_JJ straw_JJ per_IN animal_NN per_IN day_NN ._.
The_DT silage_NN was_VBD fed_VBN in_IN part_NN replacement_NN of_IN the_DT grass_NN mixture_NN in_IN the_DT normal_JJ roughage_NN ration_NN at_IN the_DT rate_NN of_IN two_CD lb_NN ._.
silage_NN for_IN every_DT three_CD lb_NN ._.
of_IN grass_NN ._.
Group_NNP I_PRP received_VBD silage_NN from_IN sugarcane_JJ tops_NNS alone_RB ,_, group_NN II_NNP silage_NN from_IN sugarcane_NN tops_NNS with_IN molasses_NNS and_CC group_NN III_NNP received_VBD silage_NN from_IN sugarcane_NN tops_NNS with_IN mixture_NN of_IN farm_NN grasses_NNS ,_, while_IN group_NN IV_NNP remained_VBD as_IN control_NN ,_, receiving_VBG the_DT normal_JJ ration_NN ._.
On_IN the_DT first_JJ day_NN of_IN the_DT feeding_VBG 15_CD lb_NN ._.
of_IN the_DT normal_JJ grass_NN ration_NN was_VBD replaced_VBN by_IN 10_CD lb_NN ._.

of_IN the_DT particular_JJ silage_NN in_IN each_DT ex-_JJ perimental_JJ group_NN ._.
Thereafter_RB 20_CD lb_NN ._.
of_IN the_DT particular_JJ silage_NN was_VBD fed_VBN in_IN replacement_NN of_IN 30_CD lb_NN ._.
of_IN the_DT grass_NN mixture_NN of_IN the_DT roughage_NN in_IN each_DT of_IN the_DT experimental_JJ groups_NNS for_IN one_CD month_NN ._.
The_DT control_NN animals_VBZ received_VBD the_DT normal_JJ ration_NN throughout_IN the_DT period_NN of_IN experiment_NN ._.
Also_RB the_DT dry_JJ matter_NN of_IN the_DT roughage_NN was_VBD maintained_VBN at_IN the_DT same_JJ level_NN in_IN all_PDT the_DT groups_NNS throughout_IN the_DT period_NN ._.
The_DT milk_NN yield_NN and_CC fat_JJ percentage_NN of_IN the_DT milk_NN was_VBD observed_VBN at_IN every_DT milking_NN and_CC the_DT average_JJ body_NN weight_NN of_IN the_DT animals_NNS were_VBD noted_VBN every_DT week_NN ._.
The_DT animals_NNS did_VBD not_RB show_VB any_DT reluctance_NN to_TO consume_VB 20_CD lb_NN ._.
of_IN either_DT of_IN the_DT silages_NNS per_IN day_NN ,_, but_CC they_PRP seemed_VBD to_TO like_IN the_DT silage_NN made_VBD with_IN the_DT addition_NN of_IN molasses_NNS better_JJR than_IN that_DT made_VBD without_IN molasses_NNS and_CC the_DT silage_NN made_VBD with_IN a_DT mixture_NN of_IN farm_NN grasses_NNS was_VBD liked_VBN best_RB by_IN the_DT animals_NNS ._.
The_DT molasses_NNS silage_NN had_VBD a_DT better_JJR aroma_NN ,_, while_IN mixed_JJ grass_NN silage_NN was_VBD more_JJR acidic_JJ and_CC softer_NN also_RB in_IN texture_NN ._.

721_CD 687_CD 595_CD 643_CD 590_CD 605_CD 685_CD 593_CD 635_CD 795_CD 780_CD 765_CD 1st_CD week_NN 715_CD 678_CD 587_CD 648_CD 597_CD 601_CD 098_CD 608_CD 642_CD 796_CD 788_CD 763_CD 2nd_CD THE_NNP PREPARTURIENT_NNP MILKING_NNP OF_NNP DAIRY_NNP ANIMALS_NNP By_IN ZAL_NNP R._NNP KOTHAVALLA_NNP and_CC A._NNP J._NNP LAZARUS_NNP ,_, Imperial_NNP Dairy_NNP Reserarch_NNP Institute_NNP ,_, Bangalore_NNP (_( Received_VBN for_IN publication_NN on_IN 22_CD January_NNP 1946_CD )_) THE_DT milking_NN of_IN a_DT cow_NN before_IN calving_VBG under_IN normal_JJ circumstances_NNS is_VBZ generally_RB resorted_VBN to_TO only_RB when_WRB the_DT animal_NN is_VBZ suffering_VBG from_IN some_DT udder_NN trouble_NN ,_, particularly_RB inflammation_NN of_IN the_DT udder_NN ,_, which_WDT commonly_RB occurs_VBZ in_IN high_JJ yielders_NNS and_CC first_JJ calvers_NNS ._.
As_IN a_DT rule_NN this_DT practice_NN is_VBZ objected_VBN to_TO on_IN mere_JJ sentimental_JJ grounds_NNS ,_, as_IN a_DT measure_NN counter_NN to_TO nature_NN and_CC because_IN it_PRP is_VBZ supposed_VBN to_TO make_VB calving_VBG more_RBR difficult_JJ ._.
Neither_CC the_DT merits_NNS nor_CC the_DT demerits_NNS of_IN preparturient_NN milking_NN have_VBP so_RB far_RB been_VBN put_VBN to_TO a_DT systematic_JJ test_NN on_IN a_DT scientific_JJ basis_NN ._.
Of_IN recent_JJ years_NNS increasing_VBG attention_NN has_VBZ been_VBN given_VBN to_TO this_DT subject_NN of_IN premilking_NN of_IN cows_NNS ._.
It_PRP has_VBZ been_VBN claimed_VBN by_IN its_PRP$ advocates_NNS that_IN the_DT practice_NN greatly_RB enhances_VBZ the_DT milk_NN yield_NN of_IN the_DT animal_NN and_CC also_RB reduces_VBZ the_DT chances_NNS of_IN subsequent_JJ udder_NN troubles_NNS ,_, such_JJ as_IN often_RB arise_VBZ in_IN heavy_JJ milkers_NNS ._.
Espe_NNP [_NN 1938_CD ]_NN states_NNS that_IN the_DT massaging_NN of_IN the_DT udder_NN is_VBZ quite_RB a_DT common_JJ practice_NN to_TO prevent_VB the_DT congestion_NN which_WDT frequently_RB occurs_VBZ at_IN the_DT time_NN of_IN parturition_NN ._.
Webber_NNP and_CC Turner_NNP [_NNP 1929_CD ]_NNP have_VBP studied_VBN the_DT in-_JJ fluence_NN of_IN milking_VBG pregnant_JJ animals_NNS before_IN calving_VBG on_IN their_PRP$ physical_JJ condition_NN and_CC the_DT well-being_NN of_IN the_DT progeny_NN ._.
Though_IN these_DT authors_NNS state_NN that_IN premilking_VBG increases_VBZ the_DT yield_NN of_IN milk_NN after_IN parturi-_JJ tion_NN ,_, they_PRP discourage_VBP the_DT practice_NN on_IN account_NN of_IN its_PRP$ having_VBG adverse_JJ effects_NNS on_IN the_DT secretion_NN of_IN colos-_JJ trum_NN ._.
The_DT investigations_NNS carried_VBD out_RP by_IN Sayer_NNP [_NNP 1934_CD ]_NN with_IN the_DT pedigree_JJ Sahiwal_NNP herd_NN at_IN Pusa_NNP is_VBZ the_DT only_JJ work_NN done_VBN on_IN the_DT subject_NN in_IN India_NNP so_RB far_RB ._.
This_DT herd_NN was_VBD established_VBN in_IN 1904_CD and_CC maintained_VBD under_IN normal_JJ dairy_NN conditions_NNS ._.
In_IN course_NN of_IN time_NN a_DT considerable_JJ amount_NN of_IN udder_NN trouble_NN arose_NN in_IN the_DT herd_NN ,_, which_WDT seriously_RB affected_VBD its_PRP$ performance_NN ._.
With_IN view_NN to_TO remedying_VBG this_DT evil_VBZ the_DT practice_NN of_IN massaging_VBG the_DT udder_NN and_CC milking_VBG the_DT cows_NNS before_IN calving_NN was_VBD introduced_VBN in_IN 1932_CD ;_: after_IN calving_VBG the_DT animals_NNS were_VBD milked_VBN four_CD times_NNS a_DT day_NN at_IN equal_JJ intervals_NNS instead_RB of_IN only_JJ twice_NN ._.
Further_RB ,_, in_IN the_DT case_NN of_IN heifers_NNS the_DT bag_NN was_VBD massaged_VBN from_IN about_IN two_CD months_NNS before_IN calving_VBG and_CC the_DT animals_NNS were_VBD thoroughly_RB accustomed_VBN to_TO milking_NN ;_: when_WRB the_DT milk_NN flow_NN started_VBD ,_, all_PDT the_DT milk_NN was_VBD drawn_VBN out_RP ._.
After_IN calving_VBG ,_, the_DT same_JJ animals_NNS were_VBD milked_VBN from_IN 7_CD to_TO 15_CD times_NNS a_DT day_NN until_IN they_PRP began_VBD to_TO let_VB down_RP all_DT the_DT milk_NN ._.
As_IN a_DT result_NN of_IN these_DT trials_NNS a_DT good_JJ many_JJ advantages_NNS have_VBP been_VBN claimed_VBN ,_, the_DT principal_JJ ones_NNS being_VBG that_IN the_DT udder_NN troubles_VBZ altogether_RB disappeared_VBN and_CC the_DT milk_NN yield_NN of_IN the_DT heifers_NNS and_CC cows_NNS increased_VBD on_IN an_DT average_JJ by_IN about_IN 47_CD per_JJ cent_NN as_IN compared_VBN with_IN the_DT pretreatment_JJ period_NN ._.
Whatever_WDT be_VB the_DT claims_NNS made_VBN for_IN the_DT adoption_NN of_IN premilking_NN ,_, one_CD outstanding_JJ disadvantage_NN of_IN the_DT practice_NN persists_NNS and_CC requires_VBZ further_JJ investigation_NN ,_, namely_RB that_IN the_DT calf_NN dropped_VBD by_IN the_DT pre-_JJ milked_JJ cow_NN does_VBZ not_RB receive_VB the_DT valuable_JJ colostrum_NN ,_, but_CC Sayer_NNP (_( loc_NN ._.
cit_NN ._. )_)
in_IN this_DT connection_NN claims_VBZ that_IN where_WRB the_DT premilking_NN of_IN animals_NNS is_VBZ adopted_VBN in_IN a_DT herd_NN ,_, the_DT precalving_NN colostrum_NN would_MD be_VB given_VBN to_TO calves_NNS born_VBN to_TO premilked_VB dams_NNS but_CC in_IN case_NN that_WDT is_VBZ not_RB available_JJ the_DT calf_NN should_MD be_VB given_VBN linseed_JJ oil_NN ._.
By_IN this_DT method_NN he_PRP asserts_VBZ that_IN mortality_NN amongst_VBP calves_NNS was_VBD decreased_VBN from_IN 4.3_CD to_TO 1.4_CD per_IN cent_NN within_IN a_DT year_NN of_IN the_DT adoption_NN of_IN this_DT practice_NN ._.
Dover_NNP and_CC Siva_NNP Subramanian_NNP [_NNP 1939_CD ]_NN from_IN an_DT inten-_JJ sive_NN study_NN of_IN the_DT chemical_NN analysis_NN of_IN colostrum_NN ,_, have_VBP drawn_VBN attention_NN to_TO the_DT fact_NN that_IN the_DT colostrum_NN obtained_VBN from_IN premilked_JJ animals_NNS is_VBZ deficient_JJ in_IN globulin_NN and_CC ash_NN to_TO a_DT considerable_JJ degree_NN and_CC they_PRP conclude_VBP from_IN their_PRP$ other_JJ observations_NNS that_IN the_DT practice_NN of_IN premilking_VBG animals_NNS is_VBZ a_DT harmful_JJ one_CD from_IN the_DT point_NN of_IN view_NN of_IN rearing_VBG the_DT newly_RB born_VBN calf_NN ._.
In_IN view_NN of_IN these_DT conflicting_VBG views_NNS it_PRP was_VBD considered_VBN that_IN fresh_JJ evidence_NN upon_IN which_WDT the_DT merits_NNS of_IN the_DT practice_NN of_IN preparturient_NN milking_NN could_MD be_VB judged_VBN was_VBD necessary_JJ and_CC the_DT investigation_NN which_WDT is_VBZ discussed_VBN below_IN was_VBD undertaken_VBN ._.
EXPERIMENTAL_NNP The_DT investigation_NN in_IN question_NN was_VBD carried_VBN out_RP for_IN two_CD to_TO three_CD lactations_NNS on_IN Sindhi_NNP cows_NNS and_CC Sindhi_NNP ,_, Gir_NNP and_CC cross-bred_JJ heifers_NNS maintained_VBD at_IN the_DT Imperial_NNP Dairy_NNP Research_NNP Institute_NNP ,_, Bangalore_NNP ._.
Premilking_VBG of_IN Cows_NNP ._.
(_( i_NN )_) Twelve_NNP Sindhi_NNP cows_NNS were_VBD taken_VBN for_IN the_DT experiment_NN and_CC an_DT equal_JJ number_NN of_IN animals_NNS were_VBD kept_VBN as_IN controls_NNS ._.
The_DT animals_NNS in_IN these_DT two_CD groups_NNS were_VBD nearly_RB of_IN the_DT same_JJ age_NN ,_, weight_NN and_CC stage_NN of_IN lactation_NN at_IN the_DT start_NN of_IN the_DT experiment_NN ._.
All_PDT the_DT animals_NNS were_VBD healthy_JJ 52_CD ZAL_NNP R._NNP KOTHAVALLA_NNP AND_NNP A._NNP J._NNP LAZARUS_NNP 53_CD and_CC free_JJ from_IN udder_NN and_CC other_JJ organic_JJ trouble_NN ._.
(_( ii_NN )_) The_DT animals_NNS in_IN the_DT experimental_JJ group_NN were_VBD taken_VBN to_TO the_DT calving_NN shed_VBD about_IN a_DT month_NN before_IN they_PRP were_VBD due_JJ to_TO calve_VB and_CC in_IN addition_NN to_TO the_DT daily_JJ grooming_NN and_CC brushing_NN ,_, etc._NN ,_, the_DT udders_NNS were_VBD massaged_VBN three_CD to_TO four_CD times_NNS a_DT day_NN ._.
(_( iii_NN )_) When_WRB the_DT udders_NNS began_VBD to_TO fill_VB out_RP with_IN milk_NN ,_, which_WDT occurred_VBD usually_RB about_RB 10_CD to_TO 15_CD days_NNS before_IN calving_NN ,_, the_DT milk_NN was_VBD drawn_VBN ._.
The_DT maximum_JJ quantity_NN of_IN milk_NN thus_RB obtained_VBN never_RB exceeded_VBD 6.5_CD lb_NN ._.
the_DT usual_JJ average_NN being_VBG 4.7_CD lb_NN ._.
per_IN day_NN ._.
(_( iv_NN )_) Four_CD days_NNS after_IN calving_VBG ,_, the_DT animals_NNS were_VBD removed_VBN to_TO the_DT milking_NN byre_NN and_CC milked_VBD twice_RB a_DT day_NN during_IN the_DT whole_JJ lactation_NN ._.
(_( v_NN )_) The_DT control_NN animals_NNS were_VBD treated_VBN in_IN a_DT similar_JJ manner_NN except_IN that_DT their_PRP$ udders_NNS were_VBD not_RB worked_VBN up_RP ,_, nor_CC was_VBD any_DT attempt_NN made_VBN to_TO draw_VB off_RP milk_NN before_IN calving_NN ._.
(_( vi_NN )_) Particulars_VBZ regarding_VBG milk_NN yields_NNS of_IN the_DT lactations_NNS before_IN and_CC during_IN the_DT experiment_NN and_CC the_DT birth-weight_NN of_IN calves_NNS in_IN respect_NN of_IN both_DT the_DT control_NN and_CC experimental_JJ cows_NNS ,_, etc_FW ._.
are_VBP given_VBN in_IN Table_NNP I_PRP ._.
One_CD of_IN the_DT cows_NNS in_IN the_DT experimental_JJ group_NN died_VBD after_IN completing_VBG one_CD lactation_NN before_IN further_JJ observations_NNS could_MD be_VB made_VBN ._.
A_DT few_JJ animals_NNS had_VBD to_TO be_VB disposed_VBN of_IN during_IN the_DT third_JJ year_NN of_IN the_DT experiment_NN for_IN various_JJ reasons_NNS ._.
(_( vii_NN )_) A_DT record_NN of_IN the_DT increase_NN in_IN the_DT monthly_JJ weight_NN of_IN some_DT of_IN the_DT calves_NNS during_IN the_DT first_JJ period_NN of_IN experiment_NN was_VBD kept_VBN and_CC the_DT figures_NNS obtained_VBN are_VBP shown_VBN in_IN Table_NNP III_NNP ._.
The_DT calves_NNS of_IN the_DT experimental_JJ animals_NNS were_VBD fed_VBN on_IN the_DT milk_NN drawn_NN from_IN the_DT respective_JJ dams_NNS ._.
No_DT separate_JJ colostrum_NN was_VBD fed_VBN to_TO them_PRP as_IN it_PRP was_VBD the_DT inten-_JJ tion_NN to_TO observe_VB incidentally_RB the_DT effect_NN of_IN the_DT preparturient_NN treatment_NN on_IN the_DT offspring_NN ._.

(_( i_NN )_) Forty_NNP heifers_NNS belonging_VBG to_TO the_DT Sindhi_NNP ,_, Gir_NNP and_CC cross-bred_JJ herds_NNS were_VBD taken_VBN for_IN study_NN and_CC after_IN dividing_VBG them_PRP into_IN control_NN and_CC experimental_JJ groups_NNS were_VBD subjected_VBN to_TO similar_JJ treatment_NN ,_, as_IN indicated_VBN above_IN for_IN the_DT cows_NNS ._.

(_( i_NN )_) In_IN the_DT case_NN of_IN heifers_NNS the_DT general_JJ conclusions_NNS are_VBP very_RB similar_JJ to_TO those_DT discussed_VBN above_IN ,_, for_IN all_PDT the_DT breeds_NNS studied_VBN ._.
(_( ii_NN )_) The_DT choice_NN of_IN the_DT animals_NNS for_IN the_DT control_NN and_CC ex-_JJ perimental_NN groups_NNS was_VBD made_VBN so_RB as_IN to_TO ensure_VB that_IN the_DT animals_NNS of_IN the_DT same_JJ age_NN and_CC weight_NN were_VBD evenly_RB distributed_VBN in_IN the_DT two_CD groups_NNS ._.
In_IN spite_NN of_IN this_DT ,_, the_DT average_JJ yields_NNS for_IN the_DT control_NN animals_NNS were_VBD in-_JJ variably_RB higher_JJR than_IN those_DT for_IN the_DT experimental_JJ ones_NNS ._.
(_( iii_NN )_) In_IN the_DT experiment_NN with_IN Sindhi_NNP heifers_NNS ,_, the_DT annual_JJ milk_NN yield_NN for_IN the_DT control_NN (_( over_IN the_DT whole_JJ period_NN studied_VBD )_) was_VBD 2,526_CD lb._NN ,_, as_IN against_IN 2,360_CD lb_NN ._.
for_IN the_DT experimental_JJ animals_NNS ._.
(_( iv_NN )_) When_WRB the_DT figures_NNS for_IN only_RB the_DT first_JJ experimental_JJ year_NN are_VBP compared_VBN ,_, it_PRP will_MD be_VB found_VBN that_IN the_DT yields_NNS for_IN the_DT control_NN and_CC experimental_JJ groups_NNS are_VBP 2,399_CD lb_NNS ._.
and_CC 2,225_CD lb_NN ._.
respectively_RB ,_, indicating_VBG a_DT slight_NN set_VBN back_RP instead_RB of_IN an_DT improvement_NN for_IN the_DT experimental_JJ animals_NNS ._.
(_( v_NN )_) Most_JJS of_IN the_DT Gir_NNP heifers_NNS were_VBD studied_VBN for_IN three_CD years_NNS consecutively_RB ._.
Here_RB also_RB the_DT average_JJ annual_JJ yield_NN of_IN 2,304_CD lb_NN ._.
for_IN the_DT experimental_JJ animals_NNS was_VBD found_VBN significantly_RB lower_JJR when_WRB compared_VBN to_TO the_DT figure_NN of_IN 2,943_CD lb_NN ._.
for_IN the_DT control_NN group_NN ._.
(_( vi_NN )_) The_DT average_JJ annual_JJ milk_NN yields_NNS in_IN the_DT case_NN of_IN cross-bred_JJ heifers_NNS for_IN the_DT control_NN and_CC the_DT experimental_JJ groups_NNS over_IN the_DT whole_JJ period_NN of_IN investigation_NN were_VBD 5,710_CD and_CC 4,677_CD lb_NN ._.
respectively_RB ,_, thus_RB corroborating_VBG the_DT results_NNS obtained_VBD with_IN Sindhi_NNP and_CC Gir_NNP heifers_NNS ._.
The_DT results_NNS of_IN the_DT experiment_NN bring_VBG out_RP very_RB significantly_RB the_DT following_JJ points_NNS (_( i_NN )_) Preparturient_NNP treatment_NN in_IN an_DT intensive_JJ form_NN and_CC premilking_NN of_IN cows_NNS and_CC heifers_NNS do_VBP not_RB in_IN any_DT way_NN tend_VBP to_TO improve_VB the_DT milk_NN yield_NN of_IN the_DT animals_NNS so_RB treated_JJ ._.
On_IN the_DT other_JJ hand_NN it_PRP has_VBZ an_DT adverse_JJ effect_NN especially_RB in_IN the_DT case_NN of_IN heifers_NNS ._.
The_DT animals_NNS studied_VBN here_RB might_MD be_VB regarded_VBN as_IN moderate_JJ yielders_NNS and_CC the_DT re-_JJ sults_NNS may_MD perhaps_RB be_VB slightly_RB different_JJ in_IN the_DT case_NN of_IN heavy_JJ yielders_NNS ._.
(_( ii_NN )_) In_IN the_DT present_JJ studies_NNS the_DT animals_NNS selected_VBN were_VBD in_IN good_JJ health_NN ,_, having_VBG no_DT udder_NN trouble_NN ,_, but_CC it_PRP is_VBZ quite_RB possible_JJ that_IN the_DT premilking_VBG treatment_NN may_MD prove_VB of_IN benefit_NN where_WRB the_DT animals_NNS are_VBP predisposed_VBN to_TO such_JJ trouble_NN as_IN reported_VBN by_IN Sayer_NNP [_NNP 1934_CD ]_NNP ._.
(_( iii_NN )_) A_DT very_RB significant_JJ point_NN brought_VBD out_RP as_IN a_DT result_NN of_IN the_DT present_JJ studies_NNS was_VBD the_DT weak_JJ health_NN of_IN the_DT calves_NNS born_VBN to_TO cows_NNS which_WDT had_VBD been_VBN premilked_VBN ._.
This_DT is_VBZ illustrated_VBN by_IN Table_JJ III_NNP ._.
(_( iv_NN )_) In_IN the_DT case_NN of_IN heifers_NNS it_PRP was_VBD observed_VBN that_IN during_IN the_DT whole_JJ period_NN of_IN study_NN the_DT death_NN rate_NN of_IN calves_NNS in_IN the_DT control_NN group_NN was_VBD 5_CD per_IN cent_NN lower_JJR than_IN that_DT of_IN those_DT in_IN the_DT experimental_JJ group_NN ._.
(_( v_NN )_) About_IN 73_CD per_IN cent_NN of_IN the_DT calves_NNS that_WDT died_VBD in_IN the_DT experimental_JJ group_NN did_VBD so_RB during_IN their_PRP$ first_JJ month_NN of_IN life_NN ;_: death_NN was_VBD mostly_RB due_JJ to_TO digestive_JJ trouble_NN ._.
This_DT demonstrates_VBZ the_DT importance_NN of_IN feeding_VBG colostrum_NN to_TO new_JJ born_JJ calves_NNS ._.
(_( vi_NN )_) Another_DT important_JJ feature_NN noticed_VBN in_IN the_DT case_NN of_IN all_PDT the_DT experi-_JJ mental_JJ animals_NNS (_( cows_NNS and_CC heifers_NNS )_) was_VBD retention_NN of_IN the_DT placenta_NN ._.
Probably_RB premilking_VBG causes_NNS weakness_NN of_IN muscular_JJ contraction_NN of_IN the_DT uterus_NN at_IN parturition_NN with_IN the_DT result_NN that_IN the_DT placenta_NN is_VBZ not_RB expelled_VBN ._.
(_( vii_NN )_) It_PRP was_VBD found_VBN that_IN premilking_VBG and_CC frequent_JJ massaging_NN of_IN the_DT udder_NN involved_VBD a_DT considerable_JJ increase_NN in_IN the_DT cost_NN of_IN maintaining_VBG the_DT herd_NN ._.
(_( viii_NN )_) Sometimes_VBZ animals_NNS used_VBN to_TO frequent_JJ milking_NN ,_, when_WRB removed_VBN from_IN the_DT calving_VBG shed_JJ and_CC put_VBN with_IN the_DT herd_NN and_CC milked_VBD only_RB twice_RB a_DT day_NN ,_, tended_VBD to_TO hold_VB their_PRP$ milk_NN ._.
This_DT can_MD be_VB attributed_VBN to_TO the_DT extra_JJ handling_NN which_WDT the_DT animals_NNS were_VBD accustomed_VBN to_TO during_IN the_DT preparturient_JJ treatment_NN ._.
SUMMARY_NNP The_DT practice_NN of_IN milking_VBG Sindhi_NNP ,_, Gir_NNP and_CC cross-bred_JJ cows_NNS and_CC heifers_NNS prior_RB to_TO calving_VBG was_VBD in_IN no_DT way_NN advantageous_JJ ._.
This_DT treatment_NN did_VBD not_RB increase_VB the_DT milk_NN yield_NN to_TO an_DT extent_NN which_WDT justified_VBD the_DT extra_JJ cost_NN involved_VBN ._.
The_DT calves_NNS of_IN cows_NNS subjected_VBN to_TO the_DT treatment_NN invariably_RB failed_VBD to_TO thrive_VB as_RB well_RB as_IN the_DT controls_NNS and_CC the_DT mortality_NN amongst_VBP them_PRP was_VBD very_RB high_JJ ._.

272_CD PRESERVATIVE_NNP EFFECT_NNP OF_NNP COMMON_NNP SALT_NNP ON_NNP THE_NNP DEVELOPMENT_NNP OF_NNP ACIDITY_NNP IN_NNP STORED_NNP GHEE_NNP By_IN LAL_NNP CHAND_NNP DHARMANI_NNP and_CC KARTAR_NNP SINGH_NNP LOHARA_NNP ,_, Punjab_NNP Agricultural_NNP College_NNP ,_, Lyallpur_NNP (_( Received_VBN for_IN Publication_NNP on_IN 15_CD May_NNP 1946_CD )_) IN_VBZ a_DT hot_JJ country_NN like_IN India_NNP where_WRB butter_NN can_MD not_RB be_VB stored_VBN for_IN a_DT long_JJ time_NN ,_, it_PRP is_VBZ melted_VBN into_IN ghee_NN to_TO prevent_VB decomposition_NN ._.
The_DT dehydrated_JJ and_CC clarified_JJ butter_NN fat_NN is_VBZ stored_VBN either_RB in_IN tins_NNS or_CC in_IN earthen_JJ pots_NNS ._.
Thousands_NNS of_IN maunds_NNS of_IN butter_NN are_VBP melted_VBN into_IN ghee_JJ every_DT day_NN in_IN India_NNP and_CC its_PRP$ storage_NN is_VBZ an_DT important_JJ problem_NN which_WDT requires_VBZ careful_JJ attention_NN ._.
Ghee_NNP ,_, when_WRB stored_VBN for_IN a_DT long_JJ time_NN ,_, developes_VBZ an_DT acrid_JJ taste_NN and_CC unpleasant_JJ aroma_NN which_WDT render_VBP it_PRP unfit_JJ for_IN edible_JJ purposes_NNS and_CC the_DT acidity_NN that_WDT finds_VBZ its_PRP$ way_NN into_IN ghee_NN during_IN its_PRP$ preparation_NN ,_, is_VBZ con-_JJ sidered_VBN to_TO be_VB the_DT most_RBS important_JJ ,_, if_IN not_RB the_DT main_JJ cause_NN of_IN these_DT developments_NNS ._.
Moisture_NN in_IN the_DT presence_NN of_IN heat_NN ,_, light_NN and_CC air_NN accelerates_VBZ the_DT development_NN of_IN acidity_NN ._.
Banerjee_NNP and_CC Doctor_NNP [_NNP 1938_CD ]_NNP found_VBD that_IN the_DT acidity_NN of_IN ghee_NN increased_VBN during_IN storage_NN from_IN 4_CD to_TO 36_CD days_NNS at_IN 0ºC_CD ._.
and_CC room_NN temperature_NN ._.
Paul_NNP Arup_NNP [_NNP 1929_CD ]_NNP found_VBD that_IN ghee_NN stored_VBN in_IN bottles_NNS fitted_VBN with_IN metal_NN screw_NN caps_NNS and_CC cork_NN discs_NN for_IN six_CD years_NNS showed_VBD a_DT marked_JJ decrease_NN in_IN R.M_NNP ._.
value_NN and_CC there_EX was_VBD a_DT close_JJ correlation_NN between_IN the_DT free_JJ fatty_JJ acids_NNS formed_VBN and_CC the_DT loss_NN in_IN volatile_JJ acids_NNS ._.
Khubchandani_NNP [_NN 1939_CD ]_NNP studied_VBD the_DT effect_NN of_IN citric_JJ acid_NN and_CC sodium_NN citrate_NN on_IN flavour_NN ,_, aroma_NN and_CC keeping_VBG quality_NN of_IN butter_NN and_CC ghee_NN ._.
He_PRP added_VBD these_DT compounds_NNS in_IN the_DT cream_NN ._.
The_DT keeping_VBG quality_NN was_VBD improved_VBN by_IN citric_JJ acid_NN ._.
Godbole_NNP and_CC Sad_NNP Gopal_NNP found_VBD ,_, in_IN one_CD sample_NN only_RB ,_, that_IN salt_JJ acts_NNS as_IN a_DT preservative_NN against_IN the_DT action_NN of_IN light_NN ,_, air_NN and_CC moisture_NN on_IN the_DT fat_NN ._.
People_NNS in_IN the_DT Punjab_NNP adopt_VB different_JJ methods_NNS of_IN storing_VBG ghee_NN in_IN villages_NNS ,_, the_DT most_RBS common_JJ being_VBG to_TO store_VB it_PRP in_IN tins_NNS or_CC earthen_JJ pots_NNS ._.
Common_JJ salt_NN is_VBZ used_VBN as_IN a_DT preservative_NN either_NN in_IN the_DT form_NN of_IN a_DT big_JJ lump_NN or_CC as_IN a_DT powder_NN ._.
With_IN a_DT view_NN to_TO studying_VBG the_DT preservative_JJ effect_NN of_IN common_JJ salt_NN on_IN the_DT development_NN of_IN acidity_NN in_IN ghee_NN during_IN storage_NN the_DT experiment_NN described_VBD below_IN was_VBD carried_VBN out_RP ._.
EXPERIMENTAL_NNP Ghee_NNP was_VBD prepared_VBN according_VBG to_TO the_DT country_NN method_NN which_WDT is_VBZ described_VBN in_IN Allen_NNP 's_POS Commercial_NNP Organic_NNP Analysis_NNP (_( Fifth_NNP Edition_NNP ,_, Volume_NN II_NNP ,_, page_NN 431_CD )_) ._.
It_PRP was_VBD further_RBR clarified_JJ and_CC made_VBD moisture-_NNS free_JJ in_IN the_DT laboratory_NN by_IN heating_VBG it_PRP over_IN a_DT sand_NN bath_NN ._.
Method_NNP of_IN storage_NN ._.
Tins_NNS of_IN about_IN 1¼_CD lb_NN ._.
capacity_NN with_IN air_NN tight_JJ covers_NNS were_VBD thoroughly_RB washed_VBN with_IN distilled_JJ water_NN and_CC dried_VBN in_IN the_DT air_NN oven_RB at_IN 105ºC_CD ._.
for_IN 24_CD hours_NNS ._.
Ghee_NNP was_VBD melted_VBN at_IN 40ºC_CD ._.
and_CC 400_CD gms_NN ._.
of_IN ghee_NNS were_VBD stored_VBN in_IN each_DT tin_NN ._.
Fresh_NNP distilled_VBD water_NN was_VBD added_VBN to_TO bring_VB the_DT moisture_NN contents_NNS of_IN the_DT stored_VBN samples_NNS up_RB to_TO 0.5_CD per_IN cent_NN ,_, 1.0_CD per_IN cent_NN and_CC 1.5_CD per_IN cent_NN ._.
Butter_NNP milk_NN was_VBD used_VBN at_IN the_DT rate_NN of_IN 0.25_CD per_IN cent_NN only_RB ._.
Ordinary_JJ common_JJ salt_NN was_VBD finely_RB powdered_VBN and_CC added_VBN at_IN the_DT rate_NN of_IN 2_CD per_IN cent_NN of_IN the_DT weight_NN of_IN ghee_NN ._.
The_DT tins_NNS were_VBD covered_VBN with_IN air_NN tight_JJ covers_NNS and_CC shaken_VB vigorously_RB for_IN a_DT sufficiently_RB long_JJ time_NN to_TO insure_VB dispersion_NN of_IN water_NN and_CC salt_NN ._.
Five_CD samples_NNS of_IN each_DT treatment_NN were_VBD kept_VBN ._.
The_DT experiment_NN was_VBD arranged_VBN as_IN follows_VBZ :_: Tin_NN No_UH ._.
Treatment_NN 1_CD to_TO 5_CD ..._: ..._: .._VBZ 0.5_CD per_IN cent_NN moisture_NN 6_CD to_TO 10_CD ..._: ..._: .._VBZ 1.0_CD per_IN cent_NN moisture_NN 11_CD to_TO 15_CD ..._: ..._: .._VBZ 1.5_CD per_IN cent_NN moisture_NN 16_CD to_TO 20_CD ..._: ..._: .._VBZ 0.5_CD per_IN cent_NN moisture_NN and_CC 2.0_CD per_IN cent_NN salt_NN 21_CD to_TO 25_CD ..._: ..._: .._VBZ 1.0_CD per_IN cent_NN moisture_NN and_CC 2.0_CD per_IN cent_NN salt_NN 26_CD to_TO 30_CD ..._: ..._: .._VBZ 1.5_CD moisture_NN and_CC 2.0_CD per_IN cent_NN salt_NN 31_CD to_TO 35_CD ..._: ..._: .._VBZ No_DT treatment_NN 36_CD to_TO 40_CD ..._: ..._: .._VBZ 0.25_CD per_IN cent_NN butter_NN milk_NN 41_CD to_TO 45_CD ..._: ..._: .._VBZ 0.25_CD per_IN cent_NN butter_NN milk_NN and_CC 2_CD per_IN cent_NN salt_NN 59_CD 60_CD Acidity_NN in_IN Stored_NNP Ghee_NNP All_NNP these_DT treatments_NNS were_VBD repeated_VBN using_VBG small_JJ earthen_JJ pots_NNS of_IN almost_RB of_IN the_DT same_JJ capacity_NN 1¼_CD lb_NN ._.
and_CC with_IN earthen_JJ lids_NNS except_IN that_DT butter_NN milk_NN was_VBD used_VBN at_IN the_DT rate_NN of_IN 1.0_CD per_IN cent_NN and_CC 2.0_CD per_IN cent_NN ._.
Before_IN filling_VBG the_DT earthen_NN pots_VBZ the_DT dispersion_NN of_IN water_NN and_CC salt_NN was_VBD effected_VBN by_IN putting_VBG melted_VBN ghee_NN in_IN a_DT stoppered_JJ glass_NN bottle_NN and_CC shaking_VBG it_PRP for_IN some_DT time_NN ._.
When_WRB the_DT water_NN and_CC salt_NN were_VBD well_RB dispersed_VBN the_DT sample_NN was_VBD quickly_RB poured_VBN in_IN the_DT pot_NN and_CC covered_VBN with_IN a_DT lid_NN and_CC cloth_NN was_VBD wrapped_VBN over_IN the_DT mouth_NN of_IN the_DT pot_NN ._.
The_DT butter_NN milk_NN used_VBN was_VBD obtained_VBN from_IN the_DT College_NNP dairy_NN and_CC contained_VBD 0.2_CD per_IN cent_NN lactic_JJ acid_NN acidity_NN ._.
All_PDT the_DT stored_VBN samples_NNS were_VBD kept_VBN in_IN the_DT laboratory_NN for_IN about_IN fifteen_JJ months_NNS ._.
The_DT temperature_NN of_IN the_DT laboratory_NN room_NN varied_VBD from_IN 34ºF_CD ._.
minimum_NN in_IN winter_NN to_TO 114ºF_CD ._.
maximum_NN in_IN summer_NN ._.
The_DT earthen_JJ pots_NNS were_VBD placed_VBN in_IN 500_CD c.c_NN ._.
capacity_NN porcelain_NN dishes_NNS ._.
The_DT samples_NNS were_VBD tested_VBN periodically_RB for_IN acid_JJ value_NN ,_, smell_NN ,_, colour_NN and_CC taste_NN ._.
Acid_NNP value_NN was_VBD determined_VBN by_IN the_DT method_NN described_VBN in_IN A.O.A.C_NNP ._.
and_CC the_DT taste_NN and_CC smell_NN were_VBD judged_VBN by_IN five_CD Research_NNP Assistants_NNPS working_VBG in_IN these_DT laboratories_NNS ._.
Sampling_VBG for_IN analysis_NN ._.
Ghee_NNP was_VBD melted_VBN by_IN placing_VBG the_DT tins_NNS in_IN hot_JJ water_NN (_( 40ºC_CD ._.
to_TO 45ºC_CD ._. )_) ._.
The_DT tin_NN was_VBD shaken_VBN well_RB and_CC opened_VBD ._.
The_DT smell_NN was_VBD noted_VBN ._.
It_PRP was_VBD then_RB filtered_VBN at_IN 40ºC_CD ._.
through_IN filter_JJ paper_NN (_( Whatman_NNP No_NNP ._.
1_CD )_) ._.
The_DT filtered_JJ sample_NN was_VBD tested_VBN for_IN smell_NN ,_, taste_NN and_CC acid_JJ value_NN ._.
The_DT results_NNS are_VBP given_VBN in_IN Tables_NNP No_NNP ._.
I_PRP and_CC II_NNP ._.
They_PRP are_VBP the_DT averages_NNS of_IN duplicate_NN readings_NNS and_CC in_IN certain_JJ cases_NNS triplicate_VBP determinations_NNS ._.
The_DT difference_NN between_IN the_DT duplicate_NN samples_NNS was_VBD very_RB little_JJ and_CC in_IN many_JJ cases_NNS there_EX was_VBD no_DT difference_NN at_IN all_DT ._.

1.12_CD 1.04_CD Acid_NNP value_NN was_VBD expressed_VBN as_IN milligrams_NNS of_IN KOH_NNP required_VBD to_TO neutralize_VB acids_NNS in_IN one_CD gram_NN of_IN ghee_NN ._.
DISCUSSION_NNP OF_NNP RESULTS_NNP Ghee_NNP was_VBD stored_VBN at_IN room_NN temperature_NN in_IN air_NN tight_JJ tins_NNS on_IN 28-7-1943_JJ ._.
The_DT acid_JJ value_NN of_IN the_DT original_JJ sample_NN was_VBD 0.50_CD (_( Table_NNP I_PRP )_) ._.
The_DT increase_NN in_IN the_DT acid_NN value_NN was_VBD very_RB slow_JJ both_DT in_IN the_DT salted_JJ and_CC unsalted_JJ samples_NNS ._.
After_IN a_DT period_NN of_IN 15_CD months_NNS the_DT increase_NN in_IN acid_JJ value_NN was_VBD from_IN 0.50_CD to_TO 0.73_CD ._.
There_EX was_VBD no_DT change_NN in_IN the_DT aroma_NN and_CC taste_NN of_IN the_DT samples_NNS ._.
These_DT results_NNS clearly_RB indicate_VBP that_IN ghee_NN can_MD be_VB stored_VBN in_IN air_NN tight_JJ containers_NNS for_IN a_DT period_NN of_IN 15_CD months_NNS without_IN undergoing_VBG any_DT deterioration_NN in_IN quality_NN ._.
In_IN the_DT absence_NN of_IN air_NN and_CC light_NN ,_, moisture_NN alone_RB does_VBZ not_RB affect_VB the_DT keeping_VBG quality_NN of_IN ghee_NN ._.
The_DT addition_NN of_IN salt_NN ,_, therefore_RB ,_, appears_VBZ to_TO be_VB unnecessary_JJ ._.
Commercial_JJ samples_NNS of_IN ghee_NN always_RB contain_VBP a_DT certain_JJ amount_NN of_IN butter_NN milk_NN (_( lassi_NN )_) and_CC there-_JJ fore_NN ,_, samples_NNS were_VBD also_RB stored_VBN with_IN 0.25_CD per_IN cent_NN butter_NN milk_NN ,_, and_CC it_PRP can_MD be_VB seen_VBN from_IN the_DT figures_NNS in_IN Table_NNP I_PRP that_IN this_DT amount_NN of_IN butter_NN milk_NN did_VBD increase_VB the_DT acid_JJ value_NN though_IN to_TO a_DT slight_JJ extent_NN ._.
Salt_NN in_IN the_DT presence_NN of_IN butter_NN milk_NN enhanced_VBD the_DT development_NN of_IN acidity_NN ._.
These_DT samples_NNS of_IN ghee_JJ deve-_NN loped_VBD a_DT rancid_NN smell_NN after_IN a_DT period_NN of_IN nine_CD months_NNS ._.
Earthen_NNP pots_NNS ._.
In_IN earthen_JJ pots_NNS ,_, the_DT addition_NN of_IN salt_NN checked_VBD the_DT development_NN of_IN acidity_NN ,_, in_IN ghee_NN ,_, but_CC ,_, as_IN the_DT pots_NNS could_MD not_RB be_VB made_VBN air_NN tight_JJ ,_, air_NN and_CC heat_NN played_VBD their_PRP$ part_NN fully_RB ._.
Samples_NNS of_IN ghee_NN kept_NN in_IN earthen_JJ pots_NNS developed_VBD a_DT very_RB bad_JJ smell_NN after_IN a_DT period_NN of_IN five_CD months_NNS ,_, inspite_NN of_IN the_DT fact_NN that_IN the_DT acid_NN value_NN was_VBD not_RB very_RB high_JJ ._.
Besides_IN the_DT ghee_NN oozed_VBD out_IN of_IN the_DT pots_NNS during_IN summer_NN and_CC considerable_JJ loss_NN occurred_VBD ._.
The_DT actual_JJ losses_NNS were_VBD not_RB determined_VBN but_CC from_IN the_DT amount_NN of_IN ghee_NN found_VBN in_IN the_DT dishes_NNS and_CC on_IN the_DT outer_JJ surface_NN of_IN the_DT pots_NNS ,_, it_PRP was_VBD judged_VBN that_IN the_DT storage_NN of_IN ghee_NN in_IN earthen_JJ pots_NNS during_IN summer_NN months_NNS is_VBZ not_RB to_TO be_VB recommended_VBN ._.
SUMMARY_NNP To_TO study_VB the_DT preservative_JJ effect_NN of_IN common_JJ salt_NN ,_, ghee_NN with_IN varying_VBG amounts_NNS of_IN moisture_NN and_CC butter_NN milk_NN (_( 0.5_CD to_TO 1.5_CD per_IN cent_NN )_) was_VBD kept_VBN in_IN 1¼_CD lb_NN ._.
tins_NNS and_CC earthen_JJ pots_NNS of_IN the_DT same_JJ capacity_NN ._.
Salt_NNP was_VBD used_VBN at_IN the_DT rate_NN of_IN 2_CD per_IN cent_NN of_IN the_DT weight_NN of_IN ghee_NN ._.
I_PRP 62_CD Acidity_NN in_IN Store_NNP d_NN Ghee_NNP ._.
The_DT development_NN of_IN rancidity_NN of_IN ghee_NN was_VBD judged_VBN by_IN the_DT characteristic_JJ aroma_NN ,_, acrid_JJ taste_NN and_CC increase_VB in_IN free_JJ fatty_JJ acids_NNS ._.
Samples_NNS were_VBD tested_VBN periodically_RB for_IN 15_CD months_NNS ._.
The_DT results_NNS so_RB for_IN obtained_VBN show_NN that_IN a_DT good_JJ quality_NN ghee_NN can_MD safely_RB be_VB stored_VBN in_IN air_NN tight_JJ tins_NNS upto_JJ 15_CD months_NNS without_IN showing_VBG any_DT signs_NNS of_IN deterioration_NN ._.
The_DT use_NN of_IN common_JJ salt_NN appears_VBZ to_TO be_VB unnecessary_JJ ._.
It_PRP is_VBZ not_RB advisable_JJ to_TO store_VB ghee_NN in_IN earthen_JJ pots_NNS because_IN the_DT acidity_NN developes_VBZ rapidly_RB and_CC because_IN the_DT ghee_NN oozes_VBZ out_IN of_IN the_DT pots_NNS during_IN summer_NN months_NNS and_CC thus_RB causes_VBZ considerable_JJ loss_NN ._.

The_DT Editorial_NNP Committee_NNP ,_, in_IN its_PRP$ work_NN of_IN examining_VBG papers_NNS received_VBN for_IN publica-_JJ tion_NN ,_, is_VBZ assisted_VBN in_IN an_DT honorary_JJ capacity_NN by_IN a_DT large_JJ number_NN of_IN scientists_NNS working_VBG in_IN various_JJ parts_NNS of_IN India_NNP ._.
