Instructions_NNS to_TO Authors_NNS Articles_NNP intended_VBD for_IN the_DT Indian_JJ Journal_NNP of_IN Veterinary_NNP Science_NNP and_CC Animal_NNP Husbandry_NNP should_MD be_VB accompanied_VBN by_IN short_JJ popular_JJ abstracts_NNS of_IN about_IN 300_CD words_NNS each_DT ._.
In_IN the_DT case_NN of_IN botanical_JJ and_CC zoological_JJ names_NNS the_DT International_NNP Rules_NNP of_IN Botani-_NNP cal_JJ Nom_NNP nclature_NN and_CC the_DT International_NNP Rules_NNP of_IN Zoological_NNP Nomenclature_NNP should_MD be_VB followed_VBN ._.
References_NNS to_TO literature_VB ,_, arranged_VBN alphabetically_RB according_VBG to_TO author_NN 's_POS names_NNS ,_, should_MD be_VB placed_VBN at_IN the_DT end_NN of_IN the_DT article_NN ,_, the_DT various_JJ references_NNS to_TO each_DT author_NN being_VBG arranged_VBN chronologically_RB ._.
Each_DT reference_NN should_MD contain_VB the_DT name_NN of_IN the_DT author_NN (_( with_IN initials_NNS )_) ,_, the_DT year_NN of_IN publication_NN ,_, title_NN of_IN the_DT article_NN ,_, the_DT abbreviated_JJ title_NN of_IN the_DT publication_NN ,_, volume_NN and_CC page_NN ._.
In_IN the_DT text_NN ,_, the_DT reference_NN should_MD be_VB indicated_VBN by_IN the_DT author_NN 's_POS name_NN ,_, followed_VBN by_IN the_DT year_NN of_IN publication_NN enclosed_VBN in_IN brackets_NNS ;_: when_WRB the_DT author_NN 's_POS name_NN occurs_VBZ in_IN the_DT text_NN ,_, the_DT year_NN of_IN publication_NN only_RB need_RB be_VB given_VBN in_IN brackets_NNS ._.
If_IN reference_NN is_VBZ made_VBN to_TO several_JJ articles_NNS published_VBN by_IN one_CD author_NN in_IN a_DT single_JJ year_NN ,_, these_DT should_MD be_VB numbered_VBN in_IN sequence_NN and_CC the_DT number_NN quoted_VBN after_IN year_NN both_DT in_IN the_DT text_NN and_CC in_IN the_DT collected_JJ references_NNS ._.
If_IN a_DT paper_NN has_VBZ not_RB been_VBN seen_VBN in_IN original_JJ it_PRP is_VBZ safe_JJ to_TO state_NN 'original_MD not_RB seen_VBN '_POS ._.
Sources_NNS of_IN information_NN should_MD be_VB speci-_JJ fically_RB acknowledged_VBN ._.
As_IN the_DT format_NN of_IN the_DT journals_NNS has_VBZ been_VBN standardized_VBN ,_, the_DT size_NN adopted_VBD being_VBG crown_VBN quarto_NN (_( about_IN 7ORIGINAL_CD ARTICLES_NNP CONJUNCTIVITIS_NNP OF_NNP SHEEP_NNP AND_NNP GOATS_NNP IN_NNP INDIA_NNP By_IN J._NNP F.SHIRLAWand_NNP N._NNP S._NNP SANKARNARAYAN_NNP ,_, Imperial_NNP Veterinary_NNP Research_NNP Institute_NNP ,_, Izatnagar_NNP (_( Received_VBN for_IN publication_NN on_IN 8_CD August_NNP 1946_CD )_) (_( With_IN Plate_NNP I_PRP )_) SPECIFIC_NNP conjunctivitis_NN of_IN sheep_NN and_CC goats_NNS is_VBZ known_VBN to_TO exist_VB in_IN North_NNP and_CC South_NNP Africa_NNP ,_, the_DT French_JJ Congo_NNP ,_, the_DT Levant_NNP ,_, France_NNP ,_, parts_NNS of_IN the_DT United_NNP States_NNPS of_IN America_NNP ,_, in_IN Uruguay_NNP and_CC in_IN Australia_NNP and_CC New_NNP Zealand_NNP ._.
Coles_NNS [_VBP 1931_CD ]_NN defined_VBD the_DT cause_NN of_IN the_DT condition_NN in_IN S._NNP Africa_NNP as_IN a_DT new_JJ species_NNS of_IN Rickettsia_NNP for_IN which_WDT he_PRP proposed_VBD the_DT name_NN R._NNP conjunctivæ_NN ,_, and_CC this_DT ætiological_JJ finding_NN is_VBZ accepted_VBN in_IN those_DT countries_NNS where_WRB the_DT disease_NN exists_VBZ ._.
According_VBG to_TO Donatien_NNP and_CC Lestoquard_NNP [_NNP 1939_CD ]_IN the_DT disease_NN is_VBZ highly_RB infectious_JJ and_CC presumably_RB air-borne_JJ ,_, spreading_VBG rapidly_RB through_IN flocks_NNS and_CC herds_NNS through_IN the_DT medium_NN of_IN ocular_JJ and_CC nasal_JJ discharges_NNS ._.
One_CD eye_NN is_VBZ usually_RB affected_VBN ,_, excep-_JJ tionally_RB both_DT ,_, the_DT chief_JJ signs_NNS of_IN the_DT disease_NN being_VBG intense_JJ conjunctivitis_NN with_IN lachrymation_NN and_CC pho-_JJ tophobia_NN ._.
The_DT conjunctivæ_NN of_IN the_DT swollen_JJ lids_NNS show_VBP either_DT sparse_NN or_CC numerous_JJ fine_JJ granulations_NNS ,_, and_CC within_IN a_DT few_JJ days_NNS of_IN the_DT onset_NN of_IN the_DT disease_NN ,_, muco-pus_JJ collects_NNS at_IN the_DT inner_JJ canthus_NN of_IN the_DT affected_JJ eye_NN ._.
In_IN spite_NN of_IN the_DT sudden_JJ and_CC somewhat_RB alarming_VBG early_JJ signs_NNS of_IN the_DT disease_NN ,_, it_PRP is_VBZ essentially_RB benign_JJ in_IN nature_NN and_CC the_DT great_JJ majority_NN of_IN cases_NNS tend_VBP to_TO recover_VB spontaneously_RB within_IN ten_JJ days_NNS or_CC so_RB from_IN the_DT onset_NN of_IN the_DT affection_NN ._.
In_IN some_DT cases_NNS ,_, however_RB ,_, keratitis_FW develops_NNS and_CC pannus-like_JJ lesions_NNS are_VBP seen_VBN ,_, i.e_NN ._.
invasion_NN of_IN the_DT cornea_NN by_IN vascular_JJ stems_NNS infiltrating_VBG from_IN the_DT corneo-sclerotic_JJ margin_NN ._.
Cor-_JJ neal_JJ opacity_NN is_VBZ a_DT fairly_RB common_JJ sequel_NN in_IN these_DT cases_NNS ,_, and_CC ,_, if_IN it_PRP be_VB accompanied_VBN by_IN ulceration_NN ,_, there_EX is_VBZ always_RB the_DT danger_NN of_IN a_DT secondary_JJ bacterial_JJ infection_NN of_IN the_DT inner_JJ eye_NN ._.
Diagnosis_NN is_VBZ said_VBD to_TO be_VB relatively_RB straightforward_JJ ._.
The_DT disease_NN is_VBZ usually_RB easily_RB transmitted_VBN to_TO healthy_JJ sheep_NN or_CC goats_NNS by_IN rubbing_VBG a_DT little_JJ of_IN the_DT infective_JJ eye_NN discharge_NN over_IN the_DT healthy_JJ eyeball_NN ._.
preferably_RB after_IN mild_JJ scarification_NN of_IN the_DT conjunctiva_NN ._.
The_DT incubation_NN period_NN is_VBZ 270_CD Conjunctivitis_NN of_IN Sheep_NNP and_CC Goats_NNP in_IN India_NNP existence_NN of_IN rickettsial_JJ conjunctivitis_NN in_IN sheep_NN and_CC goats_NNS in_IN the_DT Punjab_NNP ._.
The_DT present_JJ paper_NN outlines_VBZ the_DT work_NN undertaken_VBN by_IN us_PRP on_IN behalf_NN of_IN the_DT Veterinary_NNP Investigation_NNP Officer_NNP ,_, Bihar_NNP ._.
Two_CD goats_NNS were_VBD used_VBN in_IN the_DT test_NN of_IN material_NN received_VBN from_IN the_DT January_NNP 1941_CD outbreak_NN of_IN disease_NN in_IN goats_NNS ._.
The_DT left_JJS eyeball_NN of_IN each_DT goat_NN was_VBD anaesthetised_VBN with_IN 1_CD per_IN cent_NN cocaine_NN solution_NN ,_, the_DT corneal_NN surface_NN lightly_RB scarified_VBN ,_, and_CC a_DT few_JJ drops_NNS of_IN suspected_JJ infective_JJ ocular_JJ discharge_NN rubbed_VBN in_IN ._.
The_DT disease_NN could_MD not_RB be_VB transmitted_VBN and_CC no_DT rickettsiæ_NN were_VBD demonstrable_JJ in_IN conjunctival_JJ films_NNS of_IN field_NN cases_NNS ,_, stained_VBD Giemsa_NNP and_CC Wolbach-Pinkerton_NNP ._.
The_DT disease_NN again_RB appeared_VBD in_IN sheep_NN in_IN Bihar_NNP in_IN October_NNP ,_, 1941_CD ,_, and_CC two_CD sheep_NN were_VBD received_VBN at_IN Izatnagar_NNP as_IN described_VBN below_IN ._.
Sheep_JJ 1_CD ._.
This_DT animal_NN was_VBD affected_VBN with_IN a_DT severe_JJ ,_, bilateral_JJ conjunctivitis_NN with_IN keratitis_NN and_CC pannus_NN formation_NN ,_, the_DT cornea_NN of_IN both_DT eyes_NNS bulging_NN and_CC being_VBG quite_RB opaque_NN ._.
No_DT granulations_NNS were_VBD seen_VBN within_IN the_DT conjunctivæ_NN of_IN the_DT lids_NNS ,_, nor_CC could_MD rickettsiæ_VB be_VB demonstrated_VBN within_IN the_DT conjunctival_NN cells_NNS ._.
However_RB ,_, numerous_JJ polymorphs_NN and_CC Gram-positive_JJ diplococci_NN ,_, many_JJ phagocytosed_VBN ,_, were_VBD evident_JJ in_IN such_JJ concentration_NN as_IN to_TO suggest_VB a_DT pure_JJ bacterial_JJ infection_NN ._.
The_DT animal_NN was_VBD destroyed_VBN and_CC both_DT eyes_NNS dissected_VBN ._.
The_DT anterior_JJ chamber_NN contained_VBD a_DT few_JJ fibrin_NN shreds_NNS and_CC the_DT aqueous_JJ humour_NN was_VBD slightly_RB cloudy_JJ ,_, but_CC neither_DT cells_NNS nor_CC organisms_NNS could_MD be_VB detected_VBN on_IN film_NN examination_NN ._.
The_DT lens_NNS ,_, ciliary_JJ body_NN ,_, iris_JJ and_CC inner_JJ structure_NN of_IN the_DT eye_NN appeared_VBD normal_JJ ,_, and_CC the_DT vitreous_JJ was_VBD clear_JJ ._.
Sections_NNS of_IN the_DT eyeball_NN taken_VBN from_IN the_DT ora_JJ serrata_NN of_IN the_DT retinal_JJ coat_NN through_IN the_DT ciliary_JJ body_NN ,_, iris_JJ and_CC cornea_NN ,_, after_IN formalin_JJ fixation_NN and_CC staining_NN by_IN haematoxylin_NN and_CC eosin_NN ,_, showed_VBD irido-cyclitis_NN and_CC interstitial_JJ keratitis_NN with_IN intense_JJ eosinophilia_NN ,_, strongly_RB suggestive_JJ of_IN a_DT parasitic_JJ infection_NN ._.
How-_JJ ever_RB ,_, no_DT nematode_NN parasites_NNS could_MD be_VB detected_VBN in_IN sections_NNS stained_VBN by_IN Giemsa_NNP or_CC Læffler_NNP ._.
The_DT vitamin_NN A_NNP liver_NN reserve_NN of_IN this_DT case_NN was_VBD within_IN normal_JJ limits_NNS ._.
With_IN material_NN from_IN this_DT animal_NN ,_, two_CD sheep_NN ,_, with_IN apparently_RB normal_JJ eyes_NNS ,_, were_VBD inoculated_VBN in_IN the_DT anterior_JJ chamber_NN of_IN the_DT eye_NN with_IN a_DT few_JJ drops_NNS of_IN mixed_JJ aqueous-vitreous_JJ humour_NN ._.
No_DT reaction_NN occurred_VBD in_IN either_CC animal_NN over_IN 85_CD days_NNS of_IN observa-_JJ tion_NN ._.
Sheep_JJ 2_CD ._.
Both_DT eyes_NNS were_VBD equally_RB affected_VBN ,_, the_DT eyeballs_NNS bulging_NN ,_, and_CC the_DT cornea_NN cloudy_NN ,_, save_VBP at_IN the_DT margin_NN where_WRB pannus-like_JJ lesions_NNS were_VBD noted_VBN ._.
No_DT rickettsiæ_NN were_VBD observed_VBN in_IN Giemsa-stained_JJ films_NNS of_IN the_DT conjunctival_NN epithelium_NN ,_, while_IN by_IN Gram_NNP 's_POS stain_NN polymorphs_NN were_VBD seen_VBN to_TO be_VB very_RB numerous_JJ with_IN diplococcal_JJ organisms_NNS similar_JJ morphologically_RB to_TO those_DT seen_VBN in_IN the_DT first_JJ case_NN ._.
Cultures_NNS on_IN blood_NN agar_NN from_IN the_DT conjunctiva_NN ,_, after_IN swabbing_VBG with_IN warm_JJ normal_JJ saline_NN ,_, yielded_VBD a_DT Gram-positive_JJ dip-_JJ lococcus_NN morphologically_RB similar_JJ to_TO the_DT organism_NN seen_VBN on_IN direct_JJ film_NN examination_NN ,_, and_CC a_DT smooth_JJ strain_NN of_IN Bac_NNP ._.
subtilis_NNS ._.
Two_CD sheep_NN were_VBD inoculated_VBN immediately_RB under_IN the_DT bulbar_NN conjunctiva_NN of_IN the_DT left_NN eye_NN with_IN two_CD drops_NNS of_IN a_DT 48-hour_JJ serum_NN broth_DT culture_NN of_IN the_DT coccus_NN isolated_VBD ,_, which_WDT was_VBD also_RB liberally_RB rubbed_VBN over_IN the_DT conjunctival_JJ surfaces_NNS of_IN the_DT same_JJ eye_NN ._.
No_DT reaction_NN occurred_VBD over_IN a_DT period_NN of_IN two_CD months_NNS ._.
With_IN two_CD other_JJ sheep_NN ,_, the_DT bulbar_NN conjunctiva_NN of_IN the_DT left_NN eye_NN was_VBD lightly_RB scarified_VBN under_IN cocaine_NN anaesthesia_NN and_CC the_DT ocular_JJ discharge_NN from_IN Sheep_NNP 2_CD well_RB rubbed_VBN in_IN ._.
Observation_NN over_IN 82_CD days_NNS failed_VBD to_TO reveal_VB any_DT lesions_NNS ._.
Also_RB ,_, two_CD healthy_JJ sheep_NN were_VBD kept_VBN in_IN close_JJ contact_NN in_IN the_DT same_JJ shed_VBN with_IN Sheep_NNP 2_CD ,_, but_CC neither_RB contracted_VBD the_DT disease_NN during_IN 82_CD days_NNS contact_NN ;_: incidentally_RB ,_, flies_NNS were_VBD numerous_JJ in_IN the_DT shed_JJ during_IN this_DT time_NN ._.
During_IN the_DT interval_NN entailed_VBN by_IN these_DT transmission_NN tests_NNS in_IN sheep_NN ,_, very_RB considerable_JJ improvement_NN occurred_VBD in_IN the_DT eyes_NNS of_IN Sheep_NNP 2_CD ,_, and_CC after_IN about_RB ten_JJ weeks_NNS the_DT only_RB visible_JJ lesion_NN was_VBD some_DT haziness_NN of_IN the_DT cornea_NN and_CC increased_JJ vascularity_NN at_IN the_DT corneo-_JJ sclerotic_JJ margin_NN ;_: the_DT intra-ocular_JJ tension_NN had_VBD also_RB abated_VBN ._.
This_DT phase_NN was_VBD dramatically_RB interrupt-_JJ ed_NN by_IN a_DT sharp_JJ and_CC severe_JJ attack_NN of_IN conjunctivitis_NN affecting_VBG both_DT eyes_NNS ,_, but_CC no_DT granulations_NNS were_VBD seen_VBN within_IN the_DT bulbar_NN or_CC palpebral_JJ conjunctivæ_NN ._.
Films_NNS from_IN both_DT these_DT surfaces_NNS ,_, however_RB ,_, stained_VBN by_IN Giemsa_NNP and_CC thionin_NN blue_NN ,_, showed_VBD on_IN this_DT occasion_NN unmistakable_JJ rickettsiæ_NN within_IN the_DT majority_NN of_IN the_DT conjunctival_NN cells_NNS ,_, either_RB densely_RB packed_VBD or_CC disposed_VBN in_IN tight_JJ clusters_NNS within_IN the_DT cytoplasm_NN (_( Plate_NNP I_PRP ,_, fig_NN ._.
I_PRP )_) ._.
The_DT morphology_NN and_CC staining_VBG affinities_NNS of_IN these_DT organisms_NNS corresponded_VBD precisely_RB with_IN the_DT original_JJ description_NN of_IN R._NNP conjunctivæ_NN Coles_NNP ,_, 1931_CD ._.
At_IN the_DT same_JJ time_NN ,_, the_DT signs_NNS of_IN bacterial_JJ infection_NN ,_, originally_RB noted_VBN in_IN Sheep_NNP 2_CD ,_, again_RB came_VBD into_IN prominence_NN in_IN addition_NN to_TO the_DT rickettsial_JJ infection_NN ._.
We_PRP were_VBD disappointed_VBN in_IN our_PRP$ further_JJ efforts_NNS serially_RB to_TO transmit_VB the_DT disease_NN to_TO the_DT eyes_NNS of_IN healthy_JJ sheep_NN ._.
J._NNP F._NNP SHIRLAW_NNP AND_NNP N._NNP S._NNP SANKARNARAYAN_NNP 71_CD EXAMINATION_NNP FOR_NNP RICKETTSIAE_NNP OF_NNP NORMAL_NNP EYES_NNP OF_NNP SHEEP_NNP ,_, GOATS_NNP AND_NNP HILL_NNP CATTLE_NNP A_NNP flock_NN of_IN 36_CD sheep_NN and_CC a_DT herd_NN of_IN 29_CD goats_NNS maintained_VBD at_IN the_DT Institute_NNP were_VBD examined_VBN for_IN evidence_NN of_IN ocular_JJ disease_NN ;_: with_IN one_CD exception_NN ,_, a_DT goat_NN affected_VBN with_IN a_DT unilateral_JJ ,_, puru-_JJ lent_NN conjunctivitis_NN ,_, none_NN showed_VBD any_DT sign_NN of_IN active_JJ or_CC latent_JJ conjunctivitis_NN ,_, keratitis_NN or_CC granulations_NNS within_IN the_DT conjunctival_NN membrane_NN suggestive_NN of_IN rickettsial_JJ infection_NN ._.
Conjunctival_JJ films_NNS from_IN 32_CD of_IN the_DT goats_NNS (_( including_VBG the_DT case_NN of_IN purulent_NN conjunctivitis_NN )_) and_CC 10_CD of_IN the_DT sheep_NN were_VBD examined_VBN for_IN rickettsiæ_NN ._.
These_DT were_VBD demonstrable_JJ within_IN the_DT conjunctival_JJ cells_NNS of_IN every_DT case_NN ._.
The_DT extent_NN of_IN the_DT infection_NN was_VBD variable_JJ ;_: in_IN a_DT few_JJ cases_NNS ,_, it_PRP was_VBD well_RB marked_VBN ,_, up_RB to_TO 60_CD per_IN cent_NN of_IN conjunctival_NN cells_NNS harbouring_VBG the_DT organism_NN ._.
In_IN most_JJS cases_NNS ,_, the_DT organism_NN was_VBD found_VBN in_IN about_RB 10_CD per_IN cent_NN of_IN the_DT cells_NNS ._.
In_IN four_CD goats_NNS ,_, the_DT infection_NN was_VBD light_JJ and_CC some_DT search_NN was_VBD necessary_JJ to_TO demonstrate_VB the_DT orga-_JJ nism_NN ._.
The_DT extent_NN of_IN the_DT infection_NN within_IN the_DT cells_NNS was_VBD variable_JJ in_IN individual_JJ films_NNS ._.
Some_DT cells_NNS were_VBD densely_RB packed_VBN with_IN organisms_NNS (_( Plate_NNP I_PRP ,_, fig_NN ._.
II_NNP )_) ,_, or_CC they_PRP were_VBD present_JJ in_IN clusters_NNS chiefly_VBP at_IN the_DT margins_NNS of_IN cells_NNS ._.
Occasionally_RB ,_, a_DT few_JJ small_JJ clumps_NNS were_VBD found_VBN extracellularly_RB ,_, apparently_RB liberated_VBN by_IN the_DT degeneration_NN of_IN infected_JJ cells_NNS ._.
However_RB ,_, cell_NN degeneration_NN was_VBD not_RB a_DT conspicuous_JJ feature_NN ,_, and_CC even_RB a_DT massive_JJ cell_NN infection_NN seemed_VBD well_RB tolerated_VBN ._.
The_DT morphology_NN and_CC staining_VBG affinity_NN of_IN the_DT organism_NN conformed_VBN in_IN detail_NN to_TO the_DT classic_JJ description_NN of_IN R._NNP conjunctivæ_NN ._.
Neutrophils_NNS were_VBD occasionally_RB seen_VBN in_IN conjunctival_JJ films_NNS ,_, and_CC in_IN a_DT few_JJ cases_NNS Gram_NNP positive_JJ diplococci_NN ,_, many_JJ within_IN the_DT phagocytes_NNS ._.
In_IN the_DT solitary_JJ case_NN of_IN conjunctivitis_NN ,_, rickettsiæ_NN were_VBD evident_JJ within_IN the_DT conjunc-_JJ tival_NN cells_NNS but_CC this_DT finding_NN was_VBD overshadowed_VBN by_IN an_DT apparent_JJ bacterial_JJ infection_NN ._.
Whilst_NNP in_IN some_DT films_NNS ,_, neutrophils_NNS were_VBD present_JJ and_CC apparently_RB unaccompanied_VBN by_IN bacteria_NNS ,_, we_PRP did_VBD not_RB consider_VB that_IN such_JJ cells_NNS were_VBD a_DT concomitant_JJ feature_NN of_IN the_DT infection_NN ;_: and_CC ,_, when_WRB present_NN ,_, they_PRP appeared_VBD to_TO have_VB no_DT numerical_JJ relationship_NN with_IN the_DT extent_NN or_CC intensity_NN of_IN the_DT infection_NN ._.
In_IN two_CD of_IN five_CD hill_NNS cattle_NNS examined_VBD ,_, 30_CD per_IN cent_NN of_IN the_DT conjunctival_NN cells_NNS were_VBD infected_VBN with_IN rickettsiæ_NN ;_: in_IN the_DT remainder_NN ,_, cell_NN infection_NN was_VBD light_JJ but_CC definite_JJ ._.
No_DT morphological_JJ or_CC tinctorial_JJ differentiation_NN could_MD be_VB established_VBN between_IN the_DT cattle_NNS and_CC the_DT goat_NN organism_NN ._.
EXAMINATION_NN OF_NNP CASES_NNP OF_NNP HUMAN_NNP TRACHOMA_NNP This_DT was_VBD undertaken_VBN to_TO compare_VB the_DT morphology_NN and_CC staining_VBG affinities_NNS of_IN the_DT goat_NN organism_NN with_IN the_DT human_JJ one_CD ._.
Eight_CD cases_NNS were_VBD selected_VBN for_IN examination_NN ,_, one_CD an_DT early_JJ active_JJ infection_NN ,_, three_CD advanced_VBD and_CC chronic_JJ ,_, and_CC four_CD old_JJ and_CC active_JJ ._.
Rickettsiæ_NNP were_VBD determined_VBN within_IN the_DT conjunc-_JJ tival_NN cells_NNS in_IN every_DT case_NN ,_, the_DT intensity_NN of_IN the_DT infection_NN varying_VBG in_IN different_JJ cases_NNS ,_, apparently_RB inde-_JJ pendently_RB of_IN the_DT clinical_JJ activity_NN of_IN the_DT condition_NN ._.
No_DT distinction_NN was_VBD possible_JJ between_IN the_DT human_JJ and_CC the_DT goat_NN forms_NNS of_IN the_DT parasite_NN ._.
DISCUSSION_NNP The_DT scope_NN of_IN this_DT investigation_NN has_VBZ been_VBN limited_VBN ._.
Only_RB on_IN two_CD occasions_NNS have_VBP we_PRP been_VBN notified_VBN of_IN cases_NNS of_IN conjunctivitis_NN in_IN sheep_NN and_CC goats_NNS in_IN India_NNP ._.
Enquiries_NNS from_IN Veterinary_NNP Investigation_NNP Officers_NNP in_IN the_DT provinces_NNS (_( other_JJ than_IN the_DT Punjab_NNP )_) indicate_VBP that_IN the_DT disease_NN has_VBZ not_RB been_VBN observed_VBN and_CC a_DT careful_JJ survey_NN is_VBZ obviously_RB called_VBN for_IN ._.
During_IN the_DT war_NN years_NNS ,_, a_DT large_JJ number_NN of_IN goats_NNS and_CC sheep_NNS have_VBP passed_VBN through_IN veterinary_JJ inspection_NN at_IN meat_NN dehydration_NN plants_NNS and_CC army_JJ depots_NNS concerned_VBN with_IN the_DT collection_NN and_CC dispatch_NN of_IN these_DT animals_NNS for_IN the_DT supply_NN of_IN meat_NN in_IN the_DT eastern_JJ theatre_NN of_IN war_NN ._.
We_PRP had_VBD recently_RB an_DT opportunity_NN of_IN visiting_VBG one_CD of_IN these_DT goats_NNS and_CC sheep_JJ collecting_NN depots_NNS where_WRB among_IN thousands_NNS of_IN animals_NNS we_PRP saw_VBD no_DT evidence_NN of_IN the_DT disease_NN ._.
The_DT traffic_NN in_IN goats_NNS and_CC sheep_NN during_IN the_DT war_NN years_NNS throughout_IN northern_JJ India_NNP to_TO these_DT collecting_VBG depots_NNS has_VBZ been_VBN so_RB enormous_JJ that_IN the_DT animals_NNS in_IN the_DT depots_NNS have_VBP been_VBN a_DT fair_JJ random_JJ sample_NN of_IN the_DT goat_NN populations_NNS in_IN this_DT part_NN of_IN India_NNP ._.
We_PRP have_VBP had_VBN reports_NNS from_IN the_DT depots_NNS of_IN every_DT disease_NN to_TO which_WDT goats_NNS and_CC sheep_NN are_VBP subject_JJ ;_: yet_RB ,_, only_RB on_IN one_CD occasion_NN have_VBP we_PRP had_VBD a_DT report_NN of_IN conjunctivitis_NN ._.
A_DT diagnosis_NN of_IN rickettsial_JJ con-_JJ junctivitis_NN was_VBD made_VBN on_IN examination_NN of_IN conjunctival_JJ films_NNS from_IN a_DT few_JJ cases_NNS ,_, but_CC this_DT small_JJ outbreak_NN cleared_VBD up_RP before_IN a_DT field_NN investigation_NN could_MD be_VB undertaken_VBN ._.
We_PRP have_VBP also_RB seen_VBN a_DT few_JJ scattered_JJ cases_NNS of_IN keratitis_NN among_IN several_JJ thousand_CD goats_NNS passing_VBG through_IN a_DT large_JJ meat_NN dehydration_NN plant_NN in_IN the_DT North_NNP West_NNP Frontier_NNP Province_NNP ,_, but_CC nothing_NN in_IN the_DT nature_NN of_IN an_DT outbreak_NN of_IN the_DT disease_NN ;_: indeed_RB ,_, 72_CD Conjunctivitis_NN of_IN Sheep_NNP and_CC Goats_NNP in_IN India_NNP the_DT incidence_NN of_IN the_DT affection_NN was_VBD so_RB insignificant_JJ as_IN to_TO occasion_VB no_DT comment_NN by_IN the_DT local_JJ Veterinary_NNP Officers_NNPS and_CC it_PRP would_MD certainly_RB have_VB passed_VBN unnoticed_JJ had_VBD we_PRP not_RB been_VBN particularly_RB on_IN the_DT look_NN out_RP for_IN it_PRP ._.
Nor_CC have_VBP we_PRP encountered_VBD the_DT affection_NN in_IN the_DT many_JJ hundreds_NNS of_IN goats_NNS used_VBN in_IN experimental_JJ work_NN at_IN the_DT Institute_NNP over_IN the_DT last_JJ four_CD years_NNS ._.
In_IN our_PRP$ limited_JJ investigation_NN into_IN the_DT ætiology_NN of_IN conjunctivitis_NN and_CC keratitis_NN of_IN sheep_NN and_CC goats_NNS in_IN Bihar_NNP ,_, we_PRP arrived_VBD at_IN the_DT conclusion_NN that_IN the_DT condition_NN had_VBD much_JJ in_IN common_JJ with_IN the_DT similar_JJ disease_NN described_VBD in_IN these_DT animals_NNS by_IN Coles_NNP [_NNP 1931_CD ]_NNP ,_, and_CC that_IN the_DT cause_NN was_VBD R._NNP conjunctivæ_NN ._.
It_PRP is_VBZ true_JJ that_IN the_DT disease_NN we_PRP investigated_VBD was_VBD clinically_RB similar_JJ to_TO that_DT described_VBN by_IN Coles_NNP ,_, and_CC that_IN R._NNP conjunctivae_NN was_VBD identified_VBN in_IN one_CD of_IN the_DT sheep_NN from_IN Bihar_NNP and_CC in_IN several_JJ cases_NNS of_IN the_DT same_JJ disease_NN in_IN goats_NNS occur-_JJ ring_NN at_IN an_DT army_NN depot_NN in_IN 1945_CD ,_, but_CC we_PRP are_VBP now_RB by_IN no_DT means_NNS convinced_VBN of_IN the_DT ætiological_JJ relationship_NN of_IN these_DT organisms_NNS ._.
There_EX are_VBP two_CD main_JJ reasons_NNS for_IN our_PRP$ doubt_NN ._.
Organisms_NNP which_WDT can_MD not_RB be_VB different-_JJ tiated_VBN from_IN R._NNP conjunctivæ_NN on_IN morphological_JJ characters_NNS and_CC staining_VBG affinities_NNS have_VBP been_VBN demon-_JJ strated_VBN within_IN the_DT conjunctival_JJ cells_NNS of_IN every_DT goat_NN and_CC sheep_JJ and_CC of_IN the_DT few_JJ bovines_NNS that_IN we_PRP have_VBP examined_VBN ,_, and_CC ,_, with_IN one_CD exception_NN ,_, the_DT eyes_NNS of_IN all_PDT the_DT animals_NNS selected_VBN for_IN examination_NN were_VBD per-_JJ fectly_RB healthy_JJ ._.
We_PRP have_VBP no_DT doubt_NN that_IN ,_, if_IN we_PRP extended_VBD our_PRP$ examination_NN ,_, the_DT finding_NN would_MD be_VB practically_RB universal_JJ ._.
In_IN the_DT second_JJ place_NN we_PRP failed_VBD to_TO infect_VB the_DT conjunctival_JJ membrane_NN of_IN normal_JJ sheep_NN with_IN ocular_JJ discharge_NN from_IN a_DT frank_JJ case_NN of_IN conjunctivitis_NN in_IN a_DT sheep_NN from_IN Bihar_NNP in_IN which_WDT R._NNP conjunctivæ_NN was_VBD identified_VBN within_IN the_DT conjunctival_NN cells_NNS ._.
This_DT experience_NN confirmed_VBD the_DT work_NN of_IN the_DT field_NN workers_NNS in_IN Bihar_NNP and_CC is_VBZ contrary_JJ to_TO the_DT experience_NN of_IN workers_NNS in_IN other_JJ countries_NNS on_IN rickett-_JJ sial_JJ conjunctivitis_NN in_IN small_JJ ruminants_NNS ._.
One_CD possible_JJ explanation_NN of_IN our_PRP$ experience_NN is_VBZ that_IN the_DT infec-_JJ tion_NN is_VBZ really_RB ubiquitous_JJ and_CC latent_NN in_IN the_DT sheep_NN and_CC goats_NNS that_IN we_PRP have_VBP worked_VBN with_IN ,_, even_RB if_IN there_EX are_VBP no_DT apparent_JJ sub-clinical_JJ lesions_NNS ._.
Abdussalam_NNP [_NN 1944_CD ]_NN found_VBD rickettsiæ_RB similar_JJ to_TO R._NNP conjunctivæ_NN within_IN the_DT conjunctival_JJ cells_NNS of_IN a_DT buffalo_NN affected_VBN with_IN conjunctivitis_NN ,_, but_CC makes_VBZ no_DT comment_NN on_IN the_DT examination_NN of_IN healthy_JJ eyes_NNS of_IN the_DT same_JJ animal_JJ species_NNS ._.
He_PRP also_RB records_VBZ that_IN ,_, on_IN examination_NN of_IN the_DT eyes_NNS 24_CD of_IN Malvi_NNP goats_NNS ,_, chronic_JJ trachoma-like_JJ lesions_NNS were_VBD found_VBN in_IN every_DT case_NN and_CC rickettsiæ_NN identified_VBN within_IN the_DT conjunctival_NN cells_NNS ,_, although_IN there_EX was_VBD no_DT outward_JJ appearance_NN of_IN eye_NN affection_NN such_JJ as_IN keratitis_NN ._.
He_PRP considers_VBZ that_IN these_DT animals_NNS had_VBD suffered_VBN from_IN a_DT more_RBR acute_JJ form_NN of_IN the_DT disease_NN in_IN their_PRP$ kidhood_NN ,_, and_CC that_IN in_IN the_DT adult_NN this_DT had_VBD reached_VBN a_DT stage_NN of_IN chronicity_NN ._.
No_DT systematic_JJ examination_NN ,_, however_RB ,_, of_IN kids_NNS in_IN the_DT area_NN was_VBD undertaken_VBN ._.
It_PRP is_VBZ also_RB noteworthy_JJ that_IN no_DT transmission_NN experiments_VBZ with_IN materi-_JJ als_NNS from_IN the_DT Malvi_NNP goats_NNS could_MD be_VB carried_VBN out_RP ,_, as_IN 'unaffected_VBN goats_NNS could_MD not_RB be_VB made_VBN available_JJ '_POS ._.
It_PRP is_VBZ not_RB quite_RB clear_JJ from_IN this_DT statement_NN whether_IN all_PDT the_DT goats_NNS in_IN the_DT area_NN were_VBD affected_VBN with_IN specific_JJ conjunctivitis_NN ,_, or_CC simply_RB whether_IN R._NNP conjunctivæ_NN infection_NN could_MD be_VB determined_VBN within_IN the_DT conjunc-_JJ tival_NN cells_NNS of_IN these_DT goats_NNS ._.
If_IN the_DT latter_NN ,_, it_PRP agrees_VBZ with_IN our_PRP$ own_JJ observations_NNS ._.
In_IN the_DT eyes_NNS of_IN the_DT normal_JJ goats_NNS and_CC sheep_JJ which_WDT we_PRP examined_VBD ,_, and_CC in_IN which_WDT we_PRP found_VBD rickettsiæ_RB conforming_VBG in_IN type_NN to_TO R._NNP conjunctivæ_NN ,_, we_PRP have_VBP seen_VBN no_DT signs_NNS of_IN persistent_NN and_CC chronic_JJ trachoma-like_JJ lesions_NNS ._.
According_VBG to_TO information_NN received_VBN ,_, sub-clinical_JJ trachoma_NN is_VBZ a_DT prevalent_JJ affection_NN among_IN the_DT Indian_JJ population_NN ,_, and_CC ,_, even_RB in_IN apparently_RB normal_JJ eyes_NNS ,_, can_MD be_VB detected_VBN by_IN slit-lamp_JJ examination_NN of_IN the_DT vessels_NNS of_IN the_DT limbus_NN ._.
It_PRP may_MD well_RB be_VB that_IN a_DT more_RBR careful_JJ examination_NN of_IN the_DT eyes_NNS of_IN goats_NNS and_CC sheep_VB on_IN these_DT lines_NNS would_MD give_VB a_DT more_RBR accurate_JJ interpretation_NN of_IN the_DT finding_NN of_IN R._NNP conjunctivæ_NN ,_, within_IN the_DT conjunctival_JJ epithelium_NN of_IN these_DT animals_NNS though_RB ,_, on_IN naked_JJ eye_NN examination_NN ,_, there_EX is_VBZ no_DT evident_JJ abnormality_NN ._.
It_PRP may_MD well_RB be_VB that_IN the_DT latency_NN of_IN the_DT animal_JJ disease_NN is_VBZ similar_JJ to_TO what_WP has_VBZ been_VBN observed_VBN in_IN the_DT human_JJ population_NN ._.
In_IN this_DT connection_NN ,_, it_PRP seems_VBZ worth_IN emphasising_VBG the_DT statement_NN of_IN Beveridge_NNP [_NNP 1942_CD ]_NN that_IN ,_, although_IN it_PRP has_VBZ not_RB been_VBN possible_JJ to_TO prove_VB the_DT ætiological_JJ role_NN of_IN R._NNP conjunctivæ_NN in_IN con-_JJ tagious_JJ conjunctivitis_NN of_IN goats_NNS and_CC sheep_NN ,_, there_EX is_VBZ strong_JJ justification_NN for_IN accepting_VBG it_PRP as_IN a_DT working_JJ hypothesis_NN ._.
If_IN ,_, however_RB ,_, this_DT position_NN be_VB accepted_VBN in_IN respect_NN of_IN frank_JJ clinical_JJ cases_NNS of_IN the_DT disease_NN in_IN which_WDT the_DT organism_NN can_MD be_VB identified_VBN ,_, what_WP interpretation_NN can_MD be_VB vouchsafed_VBN for_IN the_DT identification_NN of_IN the_DT parasite_NN in_IN cases_NNS where_WRB no_DT clinical_JJ disease_NN exists_NNS ?_.
There_EX is_VBZ one_CD last_JJ point_NN ._.
Contagious_JJ conjunctivitis_NN of_IN sheep_NN and_CC goats_NN has_VBZ been_VBN described_VBN as_IN a_DT superficial_JJ infection_NN ,_, and_CC yet_RB ,_, although_IN little_JJ work_NN seems_VBZ to_TO have_VB done_VBN on_IN the_DT essential_JJ pathology_NN of_IN the_DT condition_NN ,_, there_EX is_VBZ some_DT evidence_NN that_IN the_DT deeper_JJR structures_NNS of_IN the_DT eye_NN may_MD be_VB involved_VBN ._.
Thus_RB ,_, Coles_NNP [_NNP 1931_CD ]_NNP describes_JJ lesions_NNS of_IN irido-cyclitis_NN ._.
It_PRP is_VBZ not_RB clear_JJ whether_IN this_DT lesion_NN is_VBZ considered_VBN a_DT direct_JJ J._NNP F.SHIRLAW_NNP AND_NNP N._NNP S._NNP SANKARNARAYAN_NNP 73_CD sequel_NN of_IN an_DT inward_JJ extension_NN of_IN a_DT superficial_JJ rickettsial_JJ infection_NN ,_, but_CC the_DT genesis_NN of_IN the_DT lesion_NN is_VBZ one_CD that_WDT requires_VBZ complete_JJ elucidation_NN ._.
As_IN stated_VBN ,_, we_PRP encountered_VBD this_DT lesion_NN in_IN one_CD case_NN examined_VBD pathologically_RB ._.
SUMMARY_NNP 1_CD ._.
A_DT sporadic_JJ disease_NN of_IN goats_NNS and_CC sheep_VB clinically_RB comparable_JJ with_IN rickettsial_JJ conjunctivitis_NN [_NN Coles_NNP ,_, 1931_CD ]_NN exists_NNS in_IN Bihar_NNP and_CC has_VBZ been_VBN detected_VBN ,_, in_IN a_DT minor_JJ outbreak_NN ,_, in_IN an_DT army_JJ live-stock_NN depot_NN in_IN India_NNP ._.
An_DT organism_NN identified_VBN as_IN R._NNP conjunctivæ_NN occurs_VBZ within_IN the_DT cells_NNS of_IN the_DT conjunctival_JJ epithe-_JJ lium_NN of_IN such_JJ cases_NNS ._.
2_CD ._.
An_DT organism_NN indifferentiable_JJ in_IN morphological_JJ characters_NNS and_CC staining_VBG affinities_NNS from_IN R._NNP conjunctivæ_NN was_VBD detected_VBN within_IN the_DT conjunctival_JJ cells_NNS of_IN 32_CD goats_NNS ,_, 10_CD sheep_NN and_CC five_CD hill_NN cattle_NNS selected_VBN at_IN random_NN ,_, and_CC in_IN which_WDT ,_, with_IN one_CD exception_NN ,_, viz_NN ._.
a_DT goat_NN affected_VBN with_IN purulent_JJ conjunctivitis_NN ,_, the_DT eyes_NNS showed_VBD no_DT outward_JJ sign_NN of_IN disease_NN ._.
3_CD ._.
An_DT identical_JJ form_NN of_IN rickettsia_NN was_VBD seen_VBN within_IN the_DT conjunctival_JJ cells_NNS of_IN eight_CD cases_NNS of_IN human_JJ trachoma_NN examined_VBD ._.
4_CD ._.
Lesions_NNS of_IN irido-cyclitis_NN were_VBD determined_VBN in_IN one_CD clinical_JJ case_NN in_IN a_DT sheep_NN ._.
5_CD ._.
The_DT disease_NN could_MD not_RB be_VB transmitted_VBN to_TO sheep_VB with_IN outwardly_RB healthy_JJ eyes_NNS by_IN means_NNS of_IN ocular_JJ discharge_NN from_IN a_DT diseased_VBN animal_NN or_CC by_IN close_JJ contact_NN in_IN a_DT small_JJ shed_VBN over_IN a_DT period_NN of_IN 82_CD days_NNS ._.
6_CD ._.
It_PRP is_VBZ doubtful_JJ whether_IN the_DT finding_NN of_IN R._NNP conjunctivæ_NN in_IN cases_NNS of_IN conjunctivitis_NN in_IN the_DT Indian_JJ goat_NN and_CC sheep_NN has_VBZ real_JJ ætiological_JJ significance_NN ._.

EFFECT_NNP OF_NNP FOUR_NNP TIMES_NNP MILKING_NNP AND_NNP HANDLING_NNP ON_NNP THE_NNP YIELD_NNP OF_NNP MILK_NNP IN_NNP COWS_NNP OF_IN THE_NNP THARPARKAR_NNP BREED_NNP By_IN C._NNP H._NNP PARR_NNP and_CC S._NNP SEN_NNP ,_, Imperial_NNP Agricultural_NNP Research_NNP Institute_NNP ,_, New_NNP Delhi_NNP (_( Received_VBN for_IN publication_NN on_IN 20_CD September_NNP 1946_CD )_) (_( With_IN Plate_NNP II_NNP and_CC three_CD text_NN figures_NNS )_) THE_VBP frequency_NN of_IN milking_NN has_VBZ considerable_JJ effect_NN on_IN the_DT secretion_NN of_IN milk_NN in_IN dairy_NN cows_NNS ._.
Ragsdale_NNP et_CC al_NN ._.
[_NN 1924_CD ]_NN observed_VBD that_IN the_DT longer_JJR the_DT interval_NN between_IN milkings_NNS ,_, the_DT less_JJR the_DT speed_NN of_IN milk_NN secretion_NN per_IN unit_NN of_IN time_NN ._.
They_PRP found_VBD that_IN if_IN the_DT amount_NN of_IN milk_NN secreted_VBN during_IN the_DT first_JJ hour_NN were_VBD represented_VBN as_IN 100_CD per_IN cent_NN ,_, the_DT amount_NN secreted_VBD in_IN each_DT succeeding_VBG hour_NN would_MD be_VB approximate-_JJ ly_JJ 95_CD per_IN cent_NN of_IN that_DT secreted_VBD during_IN the_DT previous_JJ hour_NN ._.
Woodward_NNP [_NN 1931_CD ]_NNP held_VBD that_DT relief_NN from_IN the_DT pressure_NN of_IN milk_NN within_IN the_DT udder_NN as_IN a_DT result_NN of_IN frequent_JJ milking_NN allowed_VBN secretion_NN to_TO proceed_VB more_RBR freely_RB ._.
Hammond_NNP [_NN 1936_CD ]_NN found_VBD that_IN the_DT retardation_NN of_IN the_DT rate_NN of_IN secretion_NN and_CC the_DT final_JJ cessation_NN of_IN milk_NN production_NN were_VBD caused_VBN by_IN the_DT pressure_NN created_VBN by_IN the_DT accumulated_JJ milk_NN rather_RB than_IN the_DT chemical_JJ effect_NN of_IN its_PRP$ constituents_NNS within_IN the_DT udder_NN ._.
Ispe_NNP [_NN 1941_CD ]_NN has_VBZ stressed_VBN the_DT necessity_NN for_IN in-_JJ termittent_NN periods_NNS of_IN intramammary_JJ pressure_NN in_IN order_NN to_TO stimulate_VB milk_NN secretion_NN and_CC advocates_VBZ that_IN the_DT maximum_JJ milk_NN production_NN can_MD be_VB secured_VBN by_IN frequent_JJ milking_NN and_CC thus_RB preventing_VBG an_DT accumulation_NN of_IN milk_NN in_IN the_DT udder_NN ._.
Ispe_NNP and_CC Hammond_NNP are_VBP also_RB of_IN the_DT opinion_NN that_IN the_DT possibility_NN of_IN milk_NN or_CC fat_JJ being_VBG secreted_VBN into_IN the_DT blood_NN stream_NN during_IN periods_NNS of_IN high_JJ intramammary_JJ pressure_NN appears_VBZ improbable_JJ ._.
Bartlett_NNP [_NN 1929_CD ]_NN showed_VBD that_IN the_DT yields_NNS of_IN milk_NN and_CC fat_NN at_IN morning_NN milkings_NNS after_IN a_DT long_JJ night_NN interval_NN ,_, although_IN greater_JJR in_IN amount_NN ,_, were_VBD not_RB in_IN proportion_NN to_TO the_DT interval_NN of_IN time_NN between_IN the_DT respective_JJ milkings_NNS ._.
He_PRP attributed_VBD the_DT cause_NN to_TO reabsorption_NN of_IN milk_NN taking_VBG place_NN during_IN the_DT long_JJ night_NN interval_NN ._.
To_TO avoid_VB this_DT depression_NN and_CC to_TO obtain_VB optimum_JJ results_NNS he_PRP suggested_VBD the_DT shortening_NN of_IN the_DT long_JJ night_NN milking_VBG interval_NN ._.
EXPERIMENT_NN WITH_NNP THARPARKAR_NNP COWS_NNP An_DT experiment_NN to_TO compare_VB four_CD and_CC two_CD times_NNS milking_VBG on_IN Tharparkar_NNP cows_NNS maintained_VBD at_IN the_DT Karnal_NNP Sub-station_NN of_IN the_DT Imperial_NNP Agricultural_NNP Research_NNP Institute_NNP was_VBD started_VBN in_IN 1939_CD ._.
Twenty-_JJ four_CD cows_NNS were_VBD selected_VBN for_IN this_DT purpose_NN ._.
Most_JJS of_IN the_DT cows_NNS had_VBD completed_VBN their_PRP$ first_JJ lactations_NNS when_WRB the_DT experiment_NN was_VBD started_VBN ._.
As_IN one_CD cow_NN died_VBD ,_, data_NNS were_VBD available_JJ pertaining_VBG to_TO eleven_VB cows_NNS under_IN four_CD times_NNS milking_VBG and_CC twelve_JJ cows_NNS under_IN two_CD times_NNS milking_VBG ._.
The_DT cows_NNS under_IN four_CD times_NNS milking_VBG were_VBD milked_VBN and_CC 'handled_VBN '_'' ,_, i.e._FW ,_, the_DT udder_NN was_VBD massaged_VBN before_IN calving_VBG for_IN about_RB ten_JJ minutes_NNS every_DT day_NN for_IN a_DT period_NN of_IN 15_CD to_TO 20_CD days_NNS and_CC regularly_JJ milked_VBN once_RB a_DT day_NN as_RB soon_RB as_IN milk_NN secretion_NN started_VBD ,_, following_VBG the_DT practice_NN introduced_VBN by_IN Sayer_NNP [_NNP 1934_CD ]_NN in_IN the_DT Sahiwal_NNP herd_NN at_IN Pusa_NNP and_CC subsequent_JJ continued_VBN with_IN the_DT same_JJ herd_NN at_IN Delhi_NNP as_IN a_DT standard_JJ practice_NN ._.
Rationing_VBG ._.

in_IN the_DT form_NN of_IN bhusa_NN (_( bruised_VBN oat_NN and_CC wheat_NN straw_NN )_) ,_, green_JJ sorghum_NN ,_, green_JJ cowpeas_NN ,_, green_JJ berseem_NN ,_, sorghum_JJ silage_NN and_CC berseem_VB hay_NN to_TO provide_VB the_DT nutri-_JJ ents_NNS required_VBN for_IN maintenance_NN of_IN animals_NNS of_IN weights_NNS varying_VBG from_IN 750_CD to_TO 1,200_CD lb_NN ._.

MILK_NNP YIELD_NNP AND_NNP LIVE-WEIGHT_NNP GRAPHS_NNP Graph_NNP I_PRP shows_VBP the_DT average_JJ milk_NN yields_NNS of_IN eleven_JJ 4-week_JJ periods_NNS of_IN cows_NNS under_IN two_CD and_CC four_CD times_NNS milking_VBG in_IN six_CD consecutive_JJ lactations_NNS ._.

It_PRP has_VBZ been_VBN our_PRP$ experience_NN ,_, working_VBG with_IN two_CD Indian_JJ breeds_NNS ,_, that_IN even_RB in_IN the_DT case_NN of_IN good_JJ milkers_NNS there_EX is_VBZ a_DT tendency_NN to_TO flatness_VB throughout_IN the_DT length_NN of_IN the_DT first_JJ lactation_NN curve_NN as_IN compared_VBN with_IN subsequent_JJ lactations_NNS ._.
The_DT daily_JJ yield_NN at_IN the_DT end_NN of_IN the_DT first_JJ lactation_NN of_IN good_JJ milkers_NNS is_VBZ about_IN half_NN that_IN given_VBN at_IN the_DT time_NN of_IN maximum_JJ production_NN during_IN the_DT lactation_NN ._.
The_DT difference_NN in_IN the_DT effects_NNS of_IN the_DT two_CD systems_NNS of_IN milking_NN is_VBZ clear_JJ from_IN the_DT form_NN of_IN the_DT curves_NNS obtained_VBD when_WRB the_DT subsequent_JJ yields_NNS are_VBP graphed_VBN ._.

It_PRP is_VBZ the_DT development_NN of_IN the_DT flush_JJ period_NN under_IN the_DT four_CD times_NNS milking_VBG which_WDT contributes_VBZ to_TO the_DT increases_NNS in_IN the_DT yields_NNS ,_, though_IN each_DT lactation_NN finishes_NNS at_IN about_IN the_DT same_JJ level_NN as_IN the_DT first_JJ lactation_NN ._.
Under_IN the_DT two_CD times_NNS milking_VBG ,_, on_IN the_DT other_JJ hand_NN ,_, no_DT development_NN of_IN the_DT flush_JJ period_NN takes_VBZ place_NN ._.
Although_IN yields_NNS in_IN the_DT early_JJ part_NN of_IN the_DT subsequent_JJ lactations_NNS are_VBP somewhat_RB higher_JJR than_IN those_DT of_IN the_DT first_JJ lactation_NN ,_, the_DT drop_NN in_IN yield_NN in_IN the_DT course_NN of_IN the_DT lactation_NN is_VBZ sudden_JJ ,_, and_CC this_DT rapid_JJ downward_JJ trend_NN results_NNS in_IN daily_JJ yields_NNS below_IN those_DT of_IN the_DT first_JJ lactation_NN and_CC a_DT lower_JJR final_JJ total_NN lactation_NN yield_NN ._.

There_EX is_VBZ a_DT definite_JJ fall_NN in_IN weight_NN of_IN those_DT under_IN four_CD times_NNS milking_VBG coinciding_VBG with_IN the_DT flush_JJ period_NN and_CC this_DT loss_NN may_MD amount_VB to_TO 100_CD lb_NN ._.
or_CC more_JJR which_WDT is_VBZ normal_JJ to_TO cows_NNS of_IN high_JJ milk_NN yield_NN ._.
DISCUSSION_NNP The_DT percentage_NN increases_NNS of_IN the_DT second_JJ and_CC third_JJ lactations_NNS over_IN the_DT first_JJ lactation_NN of_IN cows_NNS under_IN two_CD times_NNS milking_VBG in_IN the_DT first_JJ lactation_NN and_CC four_CD times_NNS milking_VBG in_IN the_DT subsequent_JJ lactations_NNS are_VBP com-_JJ pared_JJ with_IN those_DT of_IN the_DT cows_NNS which_WDT were_VBD retained_VBN on_IN two_CD times_NNS milking_VBG in_IN the_DT second_JJ and_CC third_JJ lac-_JJ tations_NNS (_( vide_IN Table_NNP 1_CD )_) ._.
There_EX is_VBZ an_DT increase_NN of_IN 41_CD per_IN cent_NN in_IN yield_NN which_WDT is_VBZ due_JJ alone_RB to_TO increasing_VBG the_DT frequency_NN of_IN milking_VBG from_IN two_CD to_TO four_CD times_NNS ._.
The_DT actual_JJ difference_NN between_IN the_DT average_JJ yields_NNS of_IN the_DT 'four-time_JJ milkers_NNS '_POS and_CC 'two-time_JJ milkers_NNS '_POS in_IN their_PRP$ second_JJ and_CC third_JJ lactations_NNS in_IN this_DT group_NN shows_VBZ an_DT increase_NN of_IN 36_CD per_IN cent_NN of_IN milk_NN yield_NN in_IN favour_NN of_IN the_DT four-time_JJ milking_NN ._.
Similarly_RB ,_, when_WRB the_DT percentage_NN increases_NNS of_IN the_DT second_JJ ,_, third_JJ and_CC fourth_JJ lactations_NNS over_IN the_DT first_JJ lactation_NN of_IN cows_NNS under_IN four_CD times_NNS milking_VBG in_IN the_DT first_JJ lactation_NN and_CC continued_VBD on_IN four_CD times_NNS milking_VBG in_IN the_DT subsequent_JJ lactations_NNS are_VBP compared_VBN with_IN the_DT percentage_NN decreases_VBZ in_IN the_DT second_JJ ,_, third_JJ and_CC fourth_JJ lactations_NNS over_IN the_DT first_JJ lactation_NN of_IN cows_NNS under_IN four_CD times_NNS milking_VBG in_IN the_DT first_JJ lactation_NN and_CC two_CD times_NNS milking_VBG 82_CD Four_NNP Times_NNPS Milking_NNP in_IN Cows_NNP of_IN Tharparkar_NNP Breed_NNP in_IN the_DT subsequent_JJ lactations_NNS (_( vide_IN Table_NNP II_NNP )_) ,_, a_DT decrease_NN of_IN 41_CD per_IN cent_NN of_IN yield_NN is_VBZ observed_VBN which_WDT is_VBZ attributed_VBN to_TO reducing_VBG the_DT frequency_NN of_IN milking_VBG from_IN four_CD to_TO two_CD times_NNS ,_, since_IN all_DT other_JJ conditions_NNS so_RB far_RB as_IN these_DT are_VBP controlable_JJ were_VBD the_DT same_JJ ._.
The_DT actual_JJ difference_NN between_IN the_DT average_JJ yields_NNS of_IN the_DT 'four-time_JJ milkers_NNS '_POS and_CC 'two-time_JJ milkers_NNS '_POS in_IN their_PRP$ second_JJ ,_, third_JJ and_CC fourth_JJ lactations_NNS is_VBZ 51_CD per_IN cent_NN ._.
All_PDT these_DT increases_NNS and_CC decreases_NNS are_VBP statistically_RB significant_JJ ._.
Taking_VBG all_DT cows_NNS under_IN two_CD times_NNS milking_VBG and_CC four_CD times_NNS milking_VBG separately_RB the_DT percentage_NN increases_NNS due_JJ to_TO four_CD times_NNS milk-_JJ ing_NN are_VBP 74_CD per_IN cent_NN for_IN lactation_NN yield_NN ,_, 47_CD per_IN cent_NN for_IN average_JJ daily_JJ milk_NN yield_NN and_CC 61_CD per_IN cent_NN for_IN average_JJ overall_JJ daily_JJ milk_NN yield_NN ._.
The_DT lower_JJR percentage_NN for_IN daily_JJ yield_NN as_IN compared_VBN with_IN lactation_NN yield_NN is_VBZ due_JJ to_TO the_DT effect_NN two-time_JJ milking_NN has_VBZ in_IN decreasing_VBG the_DT number_NN of_IN days_NNS in_IN milk_NN ._.
These_DT striking_JJ increases_NNS due_JJ to_TO four_CD times_NNS milking_VBG coupled_VBN with_IN 'handling_VBG '_'' are_VBP far_RB in_IN excess_NN of_IN results_NNS obtained_VBN with_IN other_JJ breeds_NNS abroad_RB ._.
Ragsdale_NNP et_CC al_NN ._.

The_DT average_JJ calving_NN interval_NN for_IN cows_NNS under_IN four_CD times_NNS milking_VBG is_VBZ 442_CD days_NNS ,_, which_WDT is_VBZ about_IN 28_CD days_NNS longer_JJR than_IN that_DT of_IN cows_NNS under_IN two_CD times_NNS milking_VBG ._.

2-2_JJ per_IN day_NN ._.
There_EX can_MD be_VB no_DT doubt_NN that_IN the_DT practice_NN of_IN two_CD times_NNS milking_VBG with_IN many_JJ Indian_JJ breeds_NNS results_NNS in_IN the_DT country_NN having_VBG to_TO maintain_VB a_DT larger_JJR number_NN of_IN animals_NNS than_IN is_VBZ necessary_JJ for_IN the_DT production_NN of_IN the_DT same_JJ amount_NN of_IN milk_NN ._.
The_DT experimental_JJ results_NNS referred_VBD to_TO suggest_VB that_IN this_DT is_VBZ not_RB less_JJR than_IN 47_CD per_IN cent_NN and_CC that_IN probably_RB 61_CD per_IN cent_NN is_VBZ a_DT nearer_JJ figure_NN for_IN the_DT Tharparkar_NNP cows_NNS under_IN the_DT ex-_JJ periment_NN ._.
In_IN a_DT country_NN where_WRB labour_NN is_VBZ not_RB an_DT expensive_JJ item_NN there_EX is_VBZ here_RB a_DT case_NN of_IN increased_VBN reward_NN out_IN of_IN proportion_NN to_TO the_DT cost_NN of_IN labour_NN involved_VBN ._.
There_EX has_VBZ been_VBN no_DT decrease_NN in_IN the_DT fat_JJ percentage_NN in_IN milk_NN which_WDT has_VBZ remained_VBN at_IN about_RB five_CD per_IN cent_NN in_IN both_CC the_DT herds_NNS since_IN the_DT introduction_NN of_IN four_CD times_NNS milking_VBG ._.
Experience_NN in_IN the_DT general_JJ management_NN of_IN the_DT herds_NNS in_IN question_NN suggests_VBZ that_IN three_CD times_NNS milk-_JJ ing_NN has_VBZ an_DT effect_NN similar_JJ in_IN manner_NN ,_, if_IN not_RB to_TO the_DT same_JJ degree_NN ,_, as_IN four_CD times_NNS milking_VBG ._.
SUMMARY_NN At_IN the_DT Agricultural_NNP Substation_NNP ,_, Karnal_NNP ,_, H._NNP Tharparkar_NNP cows_NNS were_VBD milked_VBN four_CD times_NNS in_IN a_DT day_NN and_CC 'haudled_VBD '_'' i.e._NN ,_, udder_NN massaged_VBD 15_CD to_TO 20_CD days_NNS before_IN calving_VBG and_CC milked_VBN as_IN secretion_NN started_VBD ,_, while_IN 12_CD cows_NNS were_VBD milked_VBN twice_RB a_DT day_NN and_CC not_RB 'handled_VBN '_POS ._.
The_DT increase_NN in_IN the_DT average_JJ yield_NN per_IN day_NN for_IN the_DT wet_JJ period_NN due_JJ to_TO four_CD times_NNS milking_VBG and_CC handling_VBG '_'' was_VBD 47_CD per_IN cent_NN over_IN cows_NNS milked_VBN twice_RB a_DT day_NN ._.
The_DT overall_JJ average_NN and_CC lactation_NN yield_NN showed_VBD 61_CD per_IN cent_NN and_CC 74_CD per_IN cent_NN increases_NNS respectively_RB ._.
The_DT calving_NN interval_NN for_IN cows_NNS under_IN four_CD times_NNS milking_VBG was_VBD 442_CD days_NNS and_CC that_DT for_IN cows_NNS under_IN two_CD times_NNS milking_VBG was_VBD 414_CD days_NNS ._.
This_DT variation_NN was_VBD due_JJ to_TO the_DT slightly_RB longer_JJR service_NN period_NN neces-_JJ sitated_VBN by_IN the_DT longer_JJR lactation_NN period_NN in_IN the_DT case_NN of_IN cows_NNS under_IN four_CD times_NNS milking_VBG ._.
But_CC this_DT longer_RBR interval_NN has_VBZ not_RB affected_VBN the_DT overall_JJ average_NN which_WDT was_VBD 61_CD per_IN cent_NN more_JJR than_IN the_DT cows_NNS milked_VBD twice_RB daily_RB ._.
When_WRB the_DT yields_NNS of_IN cows_NNS under_IN the_DT two_CD and_CC four_CD times_NNS milking_VBG were_VBD graphed_VBN ,_, the_DT latter_NN showed_VBD a_DT definite_JJ upward_JJ trend_NN of_IN the_DT curves_NNS with_IN each_DT succeeding_VBG lactation_NN and_CC a_DT development_NN of_IN flush_JJ period_NN ._.
Under_IN the_DT two_CD times_NNS milking_VBG no_DT development_NN of_IN the_DT flush_JJ period_NN took_VBD place_NN ,_, and_CC the_DT yield_NN curves_VBZ showed_VBD a_DT rapid_JJ downward_JJ trend_NN in_IN the_DT later_JJ lactations_NNS ._.

180_CD THE_DT EFFECT_NNP OF_NNP CALCIUM_NNP SUPPLEMENT_NNP ON_NNP THE_NNP DIGESTION_NNP OF_NNP ORGANIC_NNP NUTRI-_NNP ENTS_NNP IN_NNP FODDERS_NNP IN_NNP WHICH_NNP LIME_NNP CONTENT_NNP IS_NNP EITHER_NNP LOW_NNP OR_NNP HAS_VBZ A_DT TENDENCY_NNP OF_NNP POOR_NNP ASSIMILATION_NNP By_IN RAMESWAR_NNP MUKHERJEE_NNP ,_, M.Sc._NNP ,_, Late_NNP Assistant_NNP Physiological_NNP Chemist_NNP and_CC INDUBHUSAN_NNP CHAT-_NNP TERJEE_NNP ,_, M.Sc_NNP ._.
(_( AGR_NNP ._.
)_) ,_, L_NNP ._.
Ag._NNP ,_, Formerly_RB Physiological_JJ Chemist_NNP ,_, Department_NNP of_IN Agriculture_NNP ,_, Bengal_NNP (_( Received_VBN for_IN publication_NN on_IN 27_CD May_NNP 1946_CD )_) THE_DT study_NN of_IN the_DT possible_JJ effect_NN of_IN a_DT deficiency_NN or_CC deprivation_NN of_IN mineral_JJ elements_NNS on_IN the_DT diges-_JJ tibility_NN and_CC utilization_NN of_IN organic_JJ nutrients_NNS of_IN feed_NN does_VBZ not_RB seem_VB to_TO have_VB received_VBN much_JJ atten-_JJ tion_NN ._.
Ranganathan_NNP and_CC Rao_NNP [_NNP 1938_CD ]_NNP studied_VBD the_DT influence_NN of_IN calcium_NN intake_NN and_CC found_VBD that_IN an_DT in-_JJ crease_NN in_IN the_DT ingestion_NN of_IN calcium_NN of_IN rats_NNS improved_VBN both_DT the_DT digestibility_NN and_CC biological_JJ value_NN of_IN protein_NN ._.
In_IN similar_JJ experiment_NN Swaminathan_NNP [_NN 1931_CD ]_NN did_VBD not_RB observe_VB any_DT effect_NN of_IN calcium_NN intake_NN on_IN the_DT biological_JJ value_NN of_IN protein_NN ._.
Henry_NNP et_CC al_RB [_JJ 1940_CD ]_NN working_VBG on_IN rats_NNS found_VBD the_DT same_JJ value_NN for_IN the_DT biological_JJ value_NN and_CC true_JJ digestibility_NN at_IN two_CD widely_RB different_JJ levels_NNS of_IN calcium_NN ingestion_NN ,_, viz_NN ._.
0.07_CD per_IN cent_NN and_CC 0.86_CD per_IN cent_NN calcium_NN ._.
Earlier_RBR work_NN of_IN Woodman_NNP and_CC Evans_NNP [_VBP 1930_CD ]_NN supports_VBZ the_DT find-_JJ ing_NN of_IN the_DT latter_JJ worker_NN ,_, and_CC their_PRP$ results_NNS on_IN sheeps_NNS showed_VBD that_IN the_DT digestibility_NN of_IN organic_JJ nutrients_NNS was_VBD not_RB affected_VBN by_IN the_DT deficiency_NN of_IN minerals_NNS (_( specially_RB calcium_NN and_CC phosphorous_JJ )_) in_IN the_DT feed_NN ._.
The_DT investigation_NN forming_VBG the_DT subject_JJ matter_NN of_IN this_DT paper_NN arose_NN from_IN the_DT following_VBG considera-_JJ tion_NN ._.
A_DT feeding_NN and_CC metabolic_JJ test_NN was_VBD initiated_VBN with_IN Napier_NNP silage_NN which_WDT was_VBD however_RB found_VBN to_TO be_VB very_RB poor_JJ in_IN lime_NN (_( 0.29_CD per_IN cent_NN CaO_NNP on_IN dry_JJ basis_NN and_CC 0.07_CD per_IN cent_NN on_IN fresh_JJ basis_NN )_) ._.
It_PRP should_MD be_VB noted_VBN that_IN Napier_NNP grass_NN is_VBZ the_DT recommended_JJ fodder_NN from_IN Bengal_NNP Agricultural_NNP Department_NNP and_CC silage_NN was_VBD made_VBN from_IN this_DT grass_NN ._.
The_DT experiment_NN was_VBD therefore_RB designed_VBN with_IN a_DT view_NN to_TO see_VB amongst_JJ others_NNS how_WRB far_RB the_DT addition_NN of_IN calcium_NN supplement_NN given_VBN as_IN CaCO3_NNP was_VBD likely_JJ to_TO be_VB reflected_VBN on_IN the_DT digestibility_NN of_IN organic_JJ nutrients_NNS ._.
This_DT represented_VBD an_DT experiment_NN in_IN which_WDT the_DT fodder_NN was_VBD admit-_JJ tedly_RB deficient_NN in_IN lime_NN ._.
It_PRP has_VBZ been_VBN found_VBN in_IN a_DT series_NN of_IN previous_JJ trials_NNS that_IN the_DT lime_JJ present_NN in_IN rice_NN straw_NN has_VBZ a_DT tendency_NN of_IN poor_JJ assimilation_NN ._.
An_DT experiment_NN with_IN Boro_NNP variety_NN of_IN rice_NN straw_NN with_IN and_CC without_IN lime_RB given_VBN as_IN CaCO3_NNP provided_VBD the_DT material_NN for_IN studying_VBG their_PRP$ effect_NN on_IN the_DT digestibility_NN of_IN the_DT same_JJ nutrients_NNS ._.
EXPERIMENTAL_NNP Both_NNP under_IN Napier_NNP silage_NN as_RB well_RB as_IN Boro_NNP straw_JJ eight_CD bullocks_NNS of_IN approximately_RB same_JJ age_NN and_CC ive_JJ weight_NN were_VBD selected_VBN four_CD being_VBG placed_VBN under_IN 'No_POS lime_NN '_'' and_CC four_CD under_IN 'Lime_NN '_POS ._.
The_DT animals_NNS under_IN 'Lime_NN '_'' were_VBD each_DT given_VBN 25_CD gm_NN ._.
of_IN CaCO3_NNP daily_RB ._.
The_DT Napier_NNP Silage_NNP was_VBD made_VBN at_IN Dacca_NNP Farm_NNP silo_NN pit_NN and_CC was_VBD fed_VBN ad_NN lib_NN ._.
to_TO all_PDT the_DT eight_CD animals_NNS ._.
Linseed_NNP cake_NN at_IN the_DT rate_NN of_IN 0.5_CD gm_NN ._.
per_IN lb_NN ._.
of_IN live_JJ weight_NN was_VBD fed_VBN as_IN concentrate_NN to_TO the_DT silage_NN animals_NNS ._.
The_DT animals_NNS were_VBD watered_JJ twice_RB daily_RB ._.
The_DT feeding_NN lasted_VBD altogether_RB for_IN 50_CD days_NNS and_CC the_DT metabolic_JJ collection_NN commenced_VBD after_IN 29_CD days_NNS and_CC continued_VBD for_IN 13_CD days_NNS ._.
In_IN the_DT case_NN of_IN Boro_NNP straw_NN also_RB it_PRP was_VBD fed_VBN ad_NN lib_NN ._.
The_DT concentrate_NN given_VBN was_VBD mustard_JJ cake_NN at_IN the_DT rate_NN of_IN 10_CD per_IN cent_NN on_IN the_DT straw_JJ actually_RB consumed_VBN ._.
The_DT feeding_NN lasted_VBD for_IN a_DT total_JJ period_NN of_IN 83_CD clays_NNS and_CC the_DT metabolic_JJ collection_NN commenced_VBD after_IN a_DT preparatory_JJ feeding_NN of_IN 59_CD days_NNS and_CC continued_VBD for_IN 10_CD days_NNS ._.
In_IN both_DT the_DT groups_NNS common_JJ salt_NN was_VBD given_VBN at_IN the_DT rate_NN of_IN 25_CD to_TO 40_CD gm_NN ._.
per_IN animal_JJ per_IN day_NN ._.

63.71_CD 56.45_CD N._NNP F._NNP extract_VBD 45.86_CD 44.93_CD The_DT results_NNS of_IN Tables_NNP III_NNP and_CC IV_NNP first_RB require_VBZ to_TO be_VB compared_VBN amongst_JJ themselves_PRP and_CC then_RB with_IN those_DT of_IN Tables_NNP I_PRP and_CC II_NNP ._.
Judged_VBN ,_, whether_IN on_IN the_DT basis_NN of_IN combined_JJ digestibilities_NNS (_( Table_NNP III_NNP )_) or_CC on_IN the_DT digestibilities_NNS of_IN straw_JJ components_NNS (_( Table_NNP IV_NNP )_) ,_, lime_JJ feeding_NN has_VBZ definitely_RB depressed_VBN the_DT digesti-_JJ bility_NN of_IN organic_JJ matter_NN mainly_RB from_IN the_DT share_NN of_IN ether-extract_JJ and_CC crude_JJ fibre_NN ._.
It_PRP should_MD be_VB noted_VBN also_RB that_IN unlike_IN under_IN Napier_NNP silage_NN (_( Table_NNP I_PRP )_) the_DT addition_NN of_IN lime_JJ supplement_NN under_IN Boro_NNP has_VBZ not_RB contributed_VBN in_IN any_DT way_NN towards_IN a_DT better_JJR lime_JJ assimilation_NN ;_: but_CC the_DT effect_NN has_VBZ been_VBN well_RB reflected_VBN in_IN depressing_VBG the_DT digestibility_NN of_IN both_DT ether-extract_JJ and_CC crude_JJ fibre_NN ._.
In_IN so_RB far_RB as_IN ether_JJ extract_NN is_VBZ concerned_VBN ,_, THE_DT VALUE_NNP OF_NNP BORO_NNP RICE_NNP STRAW_NNP AS_IN A_NNP CATTLE_NNP FEED_NNP INDUBHUSHAN_NNP CHATTERJEE_NNP ,_, M._NNP Sc_NNP ._.
(_( AGR_NNP ._.
)_) ,_, L_NNP ._.
AG._NNP ,_, Formerly_RB Physiological_JJ Chemist_NNP ,_, Department_NNP of_IN Agriculture_NNP ,_, Bengal_NNP ,_, and_CC SACHINDRA_NNP NATH_NNP SARKAR_NNP ,_, M._NNP Sc_NNP ._.
Ph_NNP ._.
D._NNP (_( Received_NNP for_IN publication_NN on_IN 27_CD May_NNP 1946_CD )_) IN_NNP Bengal_NNP the_DT rice_NN crop_NN is_VBZ known_VBN by_IN Amon_NNP ,_, Aus_NNP and_CC Boro_NNP ._.
The_DT Amon_NNP on_IN winter_NN variety_NN is_VBZ harvested_VBN during_IN winter_NN (_( November_NNP to_TO January_NNP )_) and_CC the_DT Aus_NNP variety_NN is_VBZ harvested_VBN in_IN August-_NNP September_NNP ._.
The_DT Boro_NNP variety_NN is_VBZ generally_RB a_DT summer_NN or_CC spring_NN crop_NN ._.
But_CC a_DT second_JJ or_CC what_WP may_MD be_VB called_VBN kharif_JJ crop_NN ,_, is_VBZ also_RB taken_VBN in_IN some_DT places_NNS ._.
The_DT summer_NN variety_NN is_VBZ sown_VBN in_IN seed_NN bed_NN in_IN October_NNP or_CC November_NNP ,_, transplanted_VBN in_IN December-January_NNP and_CC harvested_VBN in_IN March_NNP to_TO June_NNP ._.
The_DT kharif_NN variety_NN is_VBZ sown_VBN in_IN seed_NN bed_NN in_IN June_NNP or_CC July_NNP ,_, transplanted_VBN in_IN July-August_NNP and_CC harvested_VBN in_IN September-_NNP October_NNP ._.
The_DT crop_NN is_VBZ grown_VBN by_IN artificial_JJ irrigation_NN in_IN low_JJ lying_VBG lands_NNS adjoining_VBG beels_NNS ,_, streamlets_NNS and_CC rivers_NNS ._.
The_DT total_JJ area_NN of_IN Boro_NNP crop_NN in_IN Bengal_NNP is_VBZ a_DT little_JJ over_IN 400,000_CD acres_NNS being_VBG about_IN 1.75_CD per_IN cent_NN of_IN the_DT total_JJ rice_NN area_NN of_IN the_DT province_NN ._.
Of_IN this_DT the_DT district_NN of_IN Mymensing_VBG occupies_NNS nearly_RB half_NN followed_VBN by_IN Dacca_NNP (_( about_IN 45,000_CD acres_NNS )_) ,_, Malda_NNP 40,000_CD acres_NNS ,_, Tiperah_NNP 30,000_CD acres_NNS ,_, Khulna_NNP 25,000_CD acres_NNS ,_, Midnapur_NNP 17,400_CD acres_NNS and_CC Rajshahi_NNP 13,500_CD acres_NNS ._.
In_IN the_DT other_JJ districts_NNS it_PRP varies_VBZ from_IN 300_CD to_TO 8,000_CD acres_NNS whereas_VBP the_DT districts_NNS of_IN Birbhum_NNP ,_, Jalpaigury_NNP and_CC Chittagong_NNP hill_NN tract_NN have_VBP no_DT Boro_NNP area_NN ._.
Judged_VBN from_IN the_DT standpoint_NN of_IN the_DT acreage_NN it_PRP is_VBZ a_DT comparatively_RB minor_JJ crop_NN and_CC is_VBZ mainly_RB distri-_JJ buted_VBN in_IN the_DT eastern_JJ districts_NNS ,_, but_CC neither_CC the_DT grain_NN nor_CC the_DT straw_NN can_MD be_VB a_DT matter_NN of_IN neglect_NN under_IN the_DT existing_VBG shortage_NN of_IN our_PRP$ food_NN and_CC fodder_NN ._.
The_DT straw_NN obtained_VBN from_IN this_DT crop_NN is_VBZ generally_RB liked_VBN by_IN animals_NNS and_CC as_RB will_MD appear_VB from_IN the_DT investigation_NN on_IN it_PRP ,_, it_PRP compares_VBZ well_RB with_IN other_JJ straws_NNS in_IN its_PRP$ feeding_NN values_NNS ._.
As_IN this_DT crop_NN is_VBZ harvested_VBN at_IN a_DT time_NN when_WRB the_DT monsoon_NN does_VBZ not_RB permit_VB efficient_JJ drying_NN ,_, the_DT straw_JJ suffers_NNS from_IN somewhat_RB greater_JJR disadvantage_NN than_IN that_DT from_IN Aus_NNP crop_NN ._.
There_EX can_MD not_RB be_VB any_DT doubt_NN that_IN every_DT year_NN a_DT large_JJ percentage_NN of_IN both_DT these_DT straws_NNS have_VBP to_TO pay_VB a_DT heavy_JJ toll_NN to_TO the_DT vagaries_NNS of_IN monsoon_NN ._.
Yet_CC a_DT considerable_JJ part_NN of_IN it_PRP can_MD be_VB saved_VBN if_IN suitable_JJ ensiling_NN could_MD be_VB adopted_VBN ._.
Here_RB of_IN course_NN great_JJ propaganda_NN is_VBZ needed_VBN to_TO impress_VB it_PRP on_IN the_DT minds_NNS of_IN the_DT people_NNS and_CC also_RB to_TO overcome_VB their_PRP$ inherent_JJ disinclination_NN and_CC inertia_NN ._.
Turning_VBG how_WRB to_TO the_DT experiment_NN ,_, the_DT Boro_NNP straw_NN was_VBD obtained_VBN from_IN the_DT riverine_NN tracts_NNS of_IN the_DT Mirpur_NNP side_NN of_IN the_DT Dacca_NNP district_NN ._.
About_IN 200_CD maunds_NNS were_VBD obtained_VBN and_CC feeding_VBG was_VBD commenced_VBN from_IN the_DT 30_CD June_NNP ,_, 1936_CD and_CC terminated_VBN on_IN the_DT 23_CD September_NNP of_IN the_DT same_JJ year_NN thus_RB lasting_VBG for_IN about_RB 12_CD weeks_NNS ._.
Before_IN describing_VBG the_DT details_NNS of_IN the_DT experiment_NN it_PRP may_MD be_VB well_RB to_TO examine_VB the_DT composition_NN of_IN Boro_NNP straw_JJ side_NN by_IN side_NN with_IN that_DT of_IN the_DT other_JJ straws_NN ._.
This_DT is_VBZ given_VBN in_IN Table_NNP I_PRP ._.
It_PRP will_MD be_VB noted_VBN from_IN Table_JJ I_PRP that_IN the_DT straw_NN contains_VBZ a_DT much_RB higher_JJR percentage_NN of_IN nitrogen_NN as_IN compared_VBN to_TO that_DT of_IN Amon_NNP or_CC Aus_NNP ._.
It_PRP has_VBZ recorded_VBN the_DT lowest_JJS percentage_NN of_IN crude_NN fibre_NN as_RB well_RB as_IN nitrogen-free_JJ extract_NN ._.
This_DT has_VBZ been_VBN mainly_RB due_JJ to_TO the_DT fact_NN that_IN its_PRP$ mineral_JJ content_NN (_( ash_NN )_) is_VBZ very_RB high_JJ (_( Nearly_RB 22_CD per_IN cent_NN )_) as_IN compared_VBN to_TO 11_CD to_TO 16_CD per_IN cent_NN in_IN the_DT case_NN of_IN the_DT other_JJ straws_NN ._.
The_DT striking_JJ feature_NN is_VBZ that_IN the_DT major_JJ part_NN of_IN this_DT ash_NN consists_VBZ of_IN acid_NN insoluble_JJ residue_NN (_( over_IN 18_CD per_IN cent_NN )_) so_IN that_IN the_DT actual_JJ soluble_JJ matter_NN is_VBZ about_IN the_DT same_JJ (_( 3.8_CD per_IN cent_NN )_) as_IN in_IN others_NNS ._.
It_PRP is_VBZ poorer_VBN in_IN lime_NN than_IN both_DT Amon_NNP and_CC Aus_NNP ,_, but_CC the_DT potash_NN content_NN is_VBZ similar_JJ ._.
As_IN will_MD be_VB seen_VBN later_RB it_PRP contains_VBZ an_DT ._.
appreciable_JJ quantity_NN of_IN oxalic_JJ acid_NN ._.
Previous_JJ experiments_NNS have_VBP shown_VBN that_IN the_DT lime_JJ assimilation_NN under_IN rice_NN straw_JJ feeding_NN from_IN the_DT share_NN of_IN lime_JJ present_NN in_IN the_DT straw_NN is_VBZ generally_RB low_JJ ._.
It_PRP was_VBD therefore_RB decided_VBD to_TO divide_VB the_DT feeding_NN and_CC digestion_NN trails_NNS under_IN two_CD heads_NNS ,_, viz_NN ._.
(_( 1_CD )_) with_IN no_DT lime_NN and_CC (_( 2_CD )_) with_IN lime_JJ supplement_NN as_IN CaCO3_NNP ._.
The_DT latter_NN was_VBD given_VBN mixed_JJ with_IN cake_NN at_IN the_DT rate_NN of_IN 25_CD gm_NN ._.
to_TO each_DT animals_NNS ._.
Mustard_NNP cake_NN was_VBD fed_VBN as_IN concentrate_NN on_IN the_DT basis_NN of_IN 10_CD per_IN cent_NN on_IN the_DT wieght_NN of_IN straw_NN consumed_VBN ._.

B._NNP CHATTERJEE_NNP AND_NNP S._NNP N._NNP SARKAR_NNP 93_CD The_DT above_JJ results_NNS show_VBP that_IN the_DT oxalic_JJ acid_NN present_NN in_IN Boro_NNP straw_NN is_VBZ considerably_RB more_JJR than_IN in_IN Aus_NNP and_CC Amon_NNP straws_NN and_CC further_RB that_IN it_PRP is_VBZ theoretically_RB capable_JJ of_IN rendering_VBG insoluble_JJ nearly_RB twice_RB the_DT amount_NN of_IN lime_NN actually_RB present_JJ ._.
Recent_JJ work_NN by_IN Talapatra_NNP et_CC al_RB [_JJ 1942_CD ]_NN suggests_VBZ that_IN the_DT soluble_JJ oxalic_JJ acid_NN is_VBZ probably_RB largely_RB decomposed_VBN in_IN the_DT reumen_NNS ._.
Nevertheless_RB the_DT presence_NN of_IN a_DT large_JJ amount_NN of_IN a_DT substance_NN which_WDT is_VBZ both_DT toxic_JJ and_CC precipitant_NN of_IN lime_NN is_VBZ an_DT unsatisfactory_JJ feature_NN ._.

live_JJ weight_NN under_IN Boro_NNP straw_NN is_VBZ highest_JJS (_( not_RB less_JJR than_IN 30_CD gm_NN ._.
CaO_NNP )_) ,_, Aus_NNP comes_VBZ next_JJ with_IN 24_CD to_TO 25_CD gm_NN ._.
CaO_NNP and_CC Amon_NNP still_RB less_RBR (_( about_IN 18_CD to_TO 20_CD gm_NNS ._. )_) ._.
If_IN we_PRP leave_VBP aside_RB the_DT unsatisfactory_JJ behaviour_NN of_IN lime_JJ metabolism_NN as_RB well_RB as_IN the_DT high_JJ content_NN of_IN potash_NN and_CC oxalic_JJ acid_NN ,_, this_DT straw_NN like_IN Aus_NNP variety_NN is_VBZ superior_JJ to_TO Amon_NNP ._.
Moreover_RB it_PRP is_VBZ the_DT richest_JJS amongst_NN all_PDT the_DT rice_NN straw_JJ varieties_NNS in_IN protein_NN content_NN and_CC in_IN this_DT respect_NN it_PRP is_VBZ even_RB superior_JJ to_TO Aus_NNP ._.
It_PRP has_VBZ been_VBN already_RB pointed_VBN out_RP that_IN this_DT straw_NN contains_VBZ a_DT large_JJ percentage_NN of_IN insoluble_JJ siliceous_JJ matter_NN ._.
It_PRP means_VBZ that_IN a_DT very_RB large_JJ ingestion_NN of_IN such_JJ material_NN is_VBZ inseparable_JJ with_IN its_PRP$ feeding_NN ._.
The_DT trial_NN which_WDT was_VBD conducted_VBN for_IN a_DT few_JJ weeks_NNS does_VBZ not_RB permit_VB any_DT inference_NN as_IN to_TO how_WRB far_RB a_DT continuous_JJ feeding_NN of_IN this_DT nature_NN can_MD have_VB a_DT cumulative_JJ effect_NN ._.
It_PRP should_MD also_RB be_VB stated_VBN here_RB that_IN the_DT animals_NNS were_VBD fed_JJ sodium_JJ chloride_NN at_IN the_DT rate_NN of_IN 25_CD gm_NN ._.
of_IN sodium_NN chloride_NN per_IN animal_NN ._.
There_EX was_VBD no_DT reason_NN for_IN a_DT deficiency_NN of_IN chlorine_NN ._.

At_IN present_JJ no_DT explanation_NN can_MD be_VB offered_VBN for_IN such_JJ a_DT phenomenon_NN ._.
SUMMARY_NNP 1_CD ._.
The_DT feeding_VBG value_NN of_IN Boro_NNP variety_NN of_IN rice_NN straw_NN has_VBZ been_VBN investigated_VBN and_CC comparative_JJ data_NNS have_VBP been_VBN presented_VBN ._.
2_CD ._.
The_DT experiment_NN was_VBD conducted_VBN with_IN 'No_JJ lime_NN '_'' ,_, and_CC 'Lime_POS '_'' ._.
The_DT lime_NN was_VBD given_VBN a_DT calcium_NN carbonate_NN ._.
The_DT feeding_NN of_IN lime_NN did_VBD not_RB offer_VB any_DT advantage_NN ._.
On_IN the_DT other_JJ hand_NN there_EX was_VBD a_DT depression_NN of_IN digestibility_NN which_WDT was_VBD well_RB marked_VBN in_IN ether-extract_JJ and_CC crude_JJ fibre_NN ,_, the_DT former_JJ also_RB exhibiting_VBG great_JJ fluctuation_NN ._.
3_CD ._.
The_DT main_JJ feature_NN of_IN this_DT straw_NN is_VBZ a_DT large_JJ percentage_NN (_( compared_VBN to_TO other_JJ rice_NN straws_NNS )_) of_IN protein_NN content_NN ,_, a_DT lower_JJR percentage_NN of_IN fibre_NN ,_, a_DT very_RB large_JJ percentage_NN of_IN insoluble_JJ silica_NN and_CC also_RB a_DT high_JJ per-_JJ centage_NN of_IN oxalic_JJ acid_NN ._.
4_CD ._.
Like_IN Aus_NNP rice_NN straw_NN ,_, Boro_NNP rice_NN straw_NN is_VBZ definitely_RB superior_JJ to_TO Amon_NNP rice_NN straw_NN in_IN its_PRP$ nutritive_JJ value_NN on_IN the_DT organic_JJ side_NN ._.
As_IN it_PRP contains_VBZ the_DT highest_JJS percentage_NN of_IN protein_NN compared_VBN to_TO the_DT other_JJ two_CD straws_NNS ,_, it_PRP definitely_RB economises_VBZ protein_JJ requirement_NN and_CC from_IN that_DT standpoint_NN is_VBZ superior_JJ even_RB to_TO Aus_NNP straw_NN ._.
5_CD ._.
Its_PRP$ unsatisfactory_JJ feature_NN is_VBZ that_IN ,_, its_PRP$ oxalic_JJ acid_NN content_NN is_VBZ highest_JJS for_IN which_WDT its_PRP$ lime_NN require-_JJ ment_NN is_VBZ highest_JJS (_( amongst_IN all_DT rice_NN straws_NN )_) ;_: and_CC for_IN reasons_NNS still_RB unknown_IN the_DT chlorine_NN balance_NN has_VBZ also_RB exhibited_VBN a_DT negative_JJ tendency_NN besides_IN lime_NN ,_, potash_NN and_CC phosphate_NN which_WDT are_VBP usually_RB so_RB found_VBN in_IN other_JJ rice_NN straws_NNS ._.
6_CD ._.
Further_JJ experiments_NNS are_VBP required_VBN to_TO devise_VB correctives_NNS for_IN the_DT unsatisfactory_JJ lime_NN ,_, potash_NN and_CC chlorine_JJ metabolism_NN as_RB well_RB as_IN for_IN high_JJ content_NN of_IN oxalic_JJ acid_NN and_CC also_RB to_TO see_VB how_WRB the_DT large_JJ quantity_NN of_IN insoluble_JJ siliceous_JJ matter_NN as_IN found_VBN in_IN Boro_NNP straws_NN ,_, is_VBZ likely_JJ to_TO react_VB on_IN the_DT animal_NN system_NN specially_RB under_IN a_DT prolonged_JJ feeding_NN ._.
REFERENCES_JJ Carbery_NNP ,_, M._NNP Chatterjee_NNP I_PRP ,_, and_CC Talapatra_NNP S._NNP K._NNP (_( 1937_CD )_) Studies_NNPS on_IN the_DT mineral_JJ requirement_NN of_IN cattle_NNS in_IN North_NNP East_NNP India_NNP with_IN special_JJ reference_NN to_TO rice_VB straw_JJ feeding_NN ._.
Indian_JJ vet_NN ._.
Sci_NNP ._.
7155-211_JJ Talapatra_NNP S._NNP K._NNP ,_, Roy_NNP S._NNP C._NNP ,_, Kehar_NNP N._NNP D._NNP and_CC Sen_NNP K._NNP C._NNP (_( 1942_CD )_) ._.
Oxalic_JJ acid_NN in_IN food_NN stuffs_NNS ._.
Science_NN and_CC Culture_NNP ,_, 8209-213_JJ G_NNP COMPOSITION_NNP OF_NNP FREE_NNP FATTY_NNP ACIDS_NNP IN_NNP HIGH_NNP ACID_NNP GHEE_NNP By_IN T._NNP M._NNP PAUL_NNP ,_, V._NNP R._NNP BHALERAO_NNP ,_, C._NNP P._NNP ANANTAKRISHNAN_NNP AND_NNP M._NNP C._NNP RANGASWAMY_NNP ,_, Imperial_NNP Dairy_NNP Research_NNP Institute_NNP ,_, Bangalore_NNP (_( Received_VBN for_IN publication_NN on_IN 23_CD September_NNP 1946_CD )_) CLARIFIED_NNP butterfat_NN is_VBZ commonly_RB known_VBN as_IN ghee_NN in_IN India_NNP and_CC it_PRP is_VBZ a_DT very_RB popular_JJ article_NN of_IN diet_JJ among_IN the_DT people_NNS ._.
More_JJR than_IN 50_CD per_IN cent_NN of_IN all_PDT the_DT milk_NN produced_VBN in_IN the_DT country_NN is_VBZ utilized_VBN for_IN the_DT manufacture_NN of_IN ghee_NN ._.
Possibly_RB due_JJ to_TO faulty_VB methods_NNS of_IN manufacture_NN ,_, collection_NN and_CC storage_NN conditions_NNS ,_, very_RB often_RB ghee_JJ containing_VBG considerable_JJ amounts_NNS of_IN free_JJ fatty_JJ acids_NNS ,_, are_VBP come_VBN across_IN in_IN the_DT market_NN ._.
These_DT are_VBP often-times_NNS condemned_VBN as_IN unfit_NN for_IN human_JJ consumption_NN ._.
During_IN the_DT course_NN of_IN an_DT investigation_NN into_IN the_DT causes_NNS of_IN the_DT development_NN of_IN acidity_NN in_IN ghee_NN ,_, it_PRP was_VBD thought_VBN interesting_VBG to_TO know_VB the_DT nature_NN of_IN the_DT free_JJ fatty_JJ acids_NNS present_NN in_IN ghee_NN ._.
Therefore_RB ,_, attempts_NNS were_VBD made_VBN to_TO separate_VB the_DT free_JJ fatty_JJ acids_NNS from_IN high_JJ acid_NN ghee_NN and_CC to_TO study_VB their_PRP$ chemical_JJ composition_NN ._.
In_IN India_NNP butter_NN is_VBZ mostly_RB prepared_JJ in_IN small_JJ amounts_NNS and_CC accumulated_VBN for_IN various_JJ lengths_NNS of_IN time_NN before_IN converting_VBG into_IN ghee_NN ._.
It_PRP is_VBZ possible_JJ that_IN acidity_NN is_VBZ produced_VBN during_IN this_DT storage_NN period_NN ._.
It_PRP was_VBD found_VBN that_IN butter_NN prepared_VBN from_IN raw_JJ milk_NN developed_VBN acidity_NN in_IN a_DT shorter_JJR time_NN compared_VBN to_TO butter_VB prepared_JJ from_IN boiled_VBN milk_NN ._.
Therefore_RB ,_, butter_NN was_VBD prepared_VBN from_IN raw_JJ cow_NN 's_POS milk_NN by_IN the_DT indigenous_JJ method_NN of_IN souring_VBG the_DT milk_NN by_IN addition_NN of_IN small_JJ amount_NN of_IN starter_NN and_CC then_RB churning_VBG it_PRP ._.
This_DT butter_NN was_VBD kept_VBN at_IN room_NN temperature_NN for_IN about_IN a_DT month_NN ._.
By_IN that_DT time_NN the_DT butter_NN had_VBD developed_VBN about_IN 20.0_CD per_IN cent_NN acidity_NN calculated_VBD as_IN oleic_JJ acid_NN ._.
The_DT butter_NN was_VBD then_RB melted_VBN and_CC converted_VBN into_IN ghee_NN by_IN the_DT 'boiling_VBG off_RP '_'' method_NN ._.
About_IN 300_CD gm_NNS ._.
of_IN this_DT ghee_NN was_VBD set_VBN apart_RB to_TO study_VB the_DT chemical_NN composition_NN ._.
This_DT is_VBZ referred_VBN to_TO as_IN Sample_NNP I_PRP ._.
The_DT rest_NN of_IN the_DT ghee_NN was_VBD boiled_VBN with_IN twice_RB its_PRP$ weight_NN of_IN 95.0_CD per_IN cent_NN alcohol_NN ,_, and_CC the_DT free_JJ fatty_JJ acids_NNS neutralized_VBN with_IN dilute_NN alkali_NN ._.
After_IN separating_VBG the_DT residual_JJ fat_NN (_( Sample_NNP II_NNP )_) ,_, as_RB far_RB as_IN possible_JJ ,_, the_DT soap_NN solution_NN was_VBD distilled_VBN to_TO remove_VB most_JJS of_IN the_DT alcohol_NN ._.
The_DT alcoholic_JJ residue_NN was_VBD diluted_VBN with_IN water_NN and_CC extracted_VBN with_IN successive_JJ portions_NNS of_IN ether_NN to_TO ensure_VB the_DT removal_NN of_IN all_DT fat_NN from_IN the_DT soap_NN ._.
It_PRP was_VBD then_RB acidified_VBN with_IN hydrochloric_JJ acid_NN and_CC the_DT liberated_JJ fatty_JJ acids_NNS were_VBD extraced_VBN exhaustively_RB with_IN ether_NN ._.
The_DT ether_NN extracts_NNS were_VBD washed_VBN free_JJ from_IN acids_NNS and_CC the_DT washings_NNS were_VBD collected_VBN (_( Solution_NNP K_NNP )_) ._.
The_DT washed_JJ ether_NN extracts_NNS were_VBD dehydrated_VBN ,_, filtered_VBN and_CC solvent_JJ (_( Solution_NNP Y_NNP )_) distilled_VBD off_RP ._.
The_DT fatty_JJ acids_NNS (_( Sample_NNP III_NNP )_) were_VBD then_RB converted_VBN into_IN methyl_NN esters_NNS by_IN refluxing_VBG for_IN one_CD hour_NN with_IN 1,000_CD ml_NNS ._.
of_IN methyl_NN alcohol_NN containing_VBG 3_CD sulphuric_JJ acid_NN ._.
Most_JJS of_IN the_DT alcohol_NN was_VBD then_RB distilled_VBN off_RP ,_, the_DT distillate_NN made_VBD up_RP to_TO a_DT known_VBN volume_NN (_( Solution_NNP W_NNP )_) and_CC preserved_VBN for_IN subsequent_JJ analysis_NN ._.
The_DT residue_NN was_VBD cooled_VBN ,_, transferred_VBN to_TO a_DT separating_JJ funnel_NN and_CC diluted_VBN with_IN water_NN ._.
It_PRP was_VBD extracted_VBN exhaustively_RB with_IN ether_NN ._.
The_DT ether_NN extracts_NNS were_VBD washed_VBN free_JJ from_IN acid_NN ._.
The_DT washings_NNS were_VBD then_RB mixed_JJ with_IN solution_NN K_NNP ,_, made_VBD alkaline_NN with_IN KOH_NNP ,_, and_CC the_DT volume_NN was_VBD reduced_VBN at_IN atmospheric_JJ pressure_NN ._.
The_DT residue_NN was_VBD acidified_VBN and_CC steam_NN distilled_VBN and_CC the_DT distillate_NN (_( Solution_NNP X_NNP )_) titrated_VBD against_IN 0.1_CD N_NNP alkali_NN and_CC expressed_VBD as_IN methyl_NN butyrate_NN ._.
The_DT washed_JJ ether_NN extracts_NNS were_VBD dehydrated_VBN filtered_JJ and_CC solvent_JJ distilled_VBN off_RP ._.
(_( The_DT distillate_NN was_VBD mixed_JJ with_IN solution_NN Y_NNP and_CC made_VBD to_TO known_VB volume_NN )_) ._.
Aliquots_NNS were_VBD then_RB taken_VBN from_IN solution_NN W_NNP and_CC Y_NNP distillates_NNS and_CC saponified_VBN with_IN potash_NN and_CC the_DT results_NNS expressed_VBD as_IN methyl_NN butyrate_NN ._.
Total_NN of_IN these_DT determinations_NNS gave_VBD the_DT amount_NN of_IN C4_NNP acid_VBP originally_RB present_JJ in_IN the_DT fat_NN ._.
The_DT methyl_NN esters_NNS of_IN the_DT fatty_JJ acids_NNS now_RB obtained_VBN and_CC the_DT methyl_NN esters_NNS prepared_VBD from_IN samples_NNS I_PRP and_CC II_NNP were_VBD subjected_VBN to_TO detailed_VB ester_JJ fractionation_NN in_IN an_DT EHP_NNP column_NN according_VBG to_TO the_DT method_NN of_IN Hilditch_NNP as_IN modified_VBN by_IN Smith_NNP and_CC Dastur_NNP [_NNP 1938_CD ]_NNP ._.

(_( per-_JJ centage_NN )_) Sample_NN I_PRP 33.2_CD 40.2_CD 246.8_CD 29.55_CD 25.85_CD 1.65_CD 19.31_CD Sample_NNP II_NNP 41.8_CD 40.8_CD 251.1_CD 21.38_CD 21.96_CD 1.45_CD 0.02_CD 95_CD H_NNP 96_CD Composition_NNP of_IN Free_NNP Fatty_NNP Acids_NNP in_IN High-acid_NNP Ghee_NNP The_DT data_NN indicates_VBZ that_IN the_DT refined_JJ sample_NN possesses_NNS comparatively_RB high_JJ melting_VBG point_NN ,_, possibly_RB due_JJ to_TO the_DT presence_NN of_IN more_JJR of_IN higher_JJR saturated_JJ glycerides_NNS ._.

.._JJ .._VBD 2.49_CD 2.49_CD 2.5_CD 1.9_CD Total_JJ 2.61_CD 1.91_CD 53.89_CD 58.41_CD 58.8_CD 51.0_CD Sum_NNP of_IN the_DT saturated_VBN and_CC unsaturated_JJ acid_NN 18.97_CD 21.70_CD 59.32_CD 99.99_CD 100.0_CD 100.00_CD The_DT proportions_NNS of_IN the_DT lower_JJR unsaturated_JJ acids_NNS in_IN high_JJ acid_NN ghee_NN appear_VBP to_TO be_VB of_IN the_DT same_JJ order_NN as_IN is_VBZ found_VBN in_IN normal_JJ butterfat_NN ,_, from_IN cow_NN 's_POS milk_NN ._.
It_PRP must_MD be_VB pointed_VBN out_RP however_RB ,_, that_IN while_IN there_EX is_VBZ little_JJ doubt_NN (_( from_IN the_DT trend_NN of_IN iodine_JJ value_NN (_( of_IN the_DT lower_JJR ester_NN fractions_NNS )_) that_IN these_DT minor_JJ unsaturated_JJ acid_NN components_NNS exist_VBP ,_, their_PRP$ quantitative_JJ percentage_NN must_MD be_VB regarded_VBN only_RB in_IN the_DT nature_NN of_IN a_DT general_JJ indication_NN of_IN their_PRP$ true_JJ proportions_NNS ,_, though_IN not_RB far_RB from_IN them_PRP ._.
Sample_NNP II_NNP also_RB gives_VBZ the_DT same_JJ proportion_NN of_IN these_DT lower_JJR unsaturated_JJ acids_NNS ._.
Normally_RB the_DT free_JJ fatty_JJ acids_NNS are_VBP expressed_VBN in_IN terms_NNS of_IN oleic_JJ acid_NN as_IN this_DT acid_NN accounts_VBZ for_IN a_DT large_JJ proportion_NN of_IN the_DT free_JJ fatty_JJ acids_NNS ._.
Davies_NNS [_VBP 1941_CD ]_NN from_IN a_DT preliminary_JJ study_NN of_IN the_DT free_JJ fatty_JJ acids_NNS in_IN high_JJ acid_NN butterfat_NN surmised_VBD that_IN these_DT are_VBP mostly_RB composed_VBN of_IN C16_NNP and_CC C18_NNP acids_NNS ,_, oleic_JJ acid_NN appearing_VBG in_IN the_DT free_JJ form_NN in_IN the_DT largest_JJS amount_NN ._.
The_DT results_NNS reported_VBD herein_JJ show_NN that_IN the_DT C18_NNP and_CC C16_NNP acids_NNS account_VBP for_IN 59.1_CD and_CC 15.5_CD per_IN cent_NN respectively_RB of_IN the_DT free_JJ fatty_JJ acids_NNS of_IN high_JJ acid_NN ghee_NN ,_, the_DT balance_NN being_VBG made_VBN up_IN of_IN other_JJ acids_NNS from_IN C4_NNP to_TO C20_NNP ._.
The_DT sum_NN of_IN all_PDT the_DT acids_NNS up_IN to_TO C1_NNP is_VBZ 20.8_CD per_IN cent_NN ,_, which_WDT is_VBZ a_DT little_JJ lower_JJR than_IN in_IN the_DT case_NN of_IN the_DT original_JJ sample_NN ;_: while_IN the_DT C16_NNP content_NN is_VBZ markedly_RB lower_JJR ._.
The_DT sum_NN of_IN the_DT myristopalmito-stearic_JJ group_NN is_VBZ only_RB 29.7_CD per_IN cent_NN ._.
The_DT lower_JJR unsaturated_JJ acids_NNS are_VBP also_RB of_IN the_DT same_JJ order_NN as_IN are_VBP found_VBN in_IN cow_NN ghee_NN ._.
The_DT existence_NN of_IN other_JJ acids_NNS ,_, besides_IN oleic_JJ acid_NN ,_, in_IN the_DT free-fatty_JJ acids_NNS is_VBZ confirmed_VBN by_IN the_DT Iodine_NNP Value_NNP (_( 54.21_CD )_) of_IN Sample_NNP III_NNP ._.
Comparing_VBG the_DT component_JJ acids_NNS of_IN all_DT ._.
the_DT samples_NNS tested_VBN ,_, it_PRP can_MD ,_, therefore_RB ,_, be_VB concluded_VBN that_IN the_DT I_PRP 100_CD Composition_NN of_IN Free_NNP Fatty_NNP Acids_NNP in_IN High-acid_NNP Ghee_NNP trend_NN of_IN the_DT fatty_JJ acid_JJ composition_NN of_IN the_DT unrefined_JJ sample_NN is_VBZ midway_RB between_IN the_DT composition_NN of_IN the_DT refined_JJ sample_NN and_CC that_IN of_IN the_DT free_JJ fatty_JJ acids_NNS ._.
SUMMARY_NNP 1_CD ._.
A_DT sample_NN of_IN ghee_NN (_( clarified_JJ cow_NN butterfat_NN )_) containing_VBG 19.13_CD per_IN cent_NN free_JJ fatty_JJ acids_NNS ,_, the_DT natural_JJ ghee_NN and_CC the_DT free_JJ fatty_JJ acids_NNS separated_VBN from_IN the_DT high_JJ acid_NN ghee_NNS were_VBD subjected_VBN to_TO detailed_VB ester_JJ fractionation_NN in_IN an_DT E.H.P_NNP ._.
column_NN ._.
2_CD ._.
The_DT high_JJ acid_NN ghee_NN was_VBD found_VBN to_TO be_VB of_IN the_DT same_JJ composition_NN as_IN normal_JJ cow_NN butterfat_NN ._.
3_CD ._.
The_DT neutral_JJ ghee_NN contained_VBD the_DT same_JJ amount_NN of_IN the_DT low_JJ molecular_JJ weight_NN acids_NNS and_CC more_JJR of_IN the_DT myristto-palmito-stearic_JJ group_NN than_IN in_IN the_DT high_JJ acid_NN ghee_NN ._.
The_DT free_JJ fatty_JJ acids_NNS contained_VBD the_DT following_JJ percentages_NNS of_IN the_DT various_JJ acids_NNS ,_, butyric=4.5_NN ,_, copriylic=0.8_NN ,_, capric=1.7_NN ,_, lauric=2.4_NN ,_, myristic=9.6_NN ,_, palmitic=11.7_NN ,_, stearic=8.4_NN ,_, araehidic=2.1_NN ,_, oleic=50.4_NN ,_, and_CC other_JJ unsaturated_JJ acids=8.4_NN ._.
