and_CC News_NNP Edition_NNP ,_, 4_CD ,_, 175_CD STUDIES_NNP ON_NNP THE_NNP CURING_NNP OF_NNP POISONOUS_NNP JAWAR_NNP (_( SORGHUM_NNP VULGARE_NNP )_) PERS_NNPS ._.
By_IN N._NNP D.KEHAR_NNP AND_NNP S._NNP K._NNP TALAPATRA_NNP ,_, Animal_NNP Nutrition_NNP Section_NNP ,_, Imperial_NNP Veterinary_NNP Research_NNP Institute_NNP ,_, Izatnagar_NNP (_( Received_VBN for_IN publication_NN on_IN 8_CD August_NNP 1946_CD )_) JAWAR_NNP is_VBZ ordinarily_RB a_DT nutritious_JJ and_CC palatable_JJ fodder_NN ,_, but_CC under_IN conditions_NNS of_IN drought_NN ,_, wilting_VBG and_CC frost_VB it_PRP developes_VBZ large_JJ quantities_NNS of_IN cyanogenetic_JJ glucosides_NNS ._.
Benson_NNP and_CC Subba_NNP Rao_NNP [_NNP 1906_CD ]_NNP ,_, Mann_NNP [_NNP 1919_CD ]_NNP and_CC Sharma_NNP [_NNP 1935_CD ]_NN have_VBP reported_VBN several_JJ deaths_NNS of_IN cattle_NNS due_JJ to_TO jawar_VB poisoning_NN ._.
Since_IN jawar_NN is_VBZ grown_VBN over_IN large_JJ areas_NNS and_CC as_IN the_DT average_JJ farmer_NN can_MD not_RB afford_VB to_TO discard_VB his_PRP$ affected_JJ crops_NNS without_IN serious_JJ setback_NN to_TO his_PRP$ already_RB lean_JJ fodder_NN resources_NNS ,_, enquiries_NNS were_VBD received_VBN from_IN several_JJ field_NN investigators_NNS whether_IN poisonous_JJ jawar_NN could_MD in_IN any_DT way_NN be_VB fed_VBN to_TO livestock_VB ._.
This_DT investiga-_JJ tion_NN was_VBD undertaken_VBN to_TO find_VB an_DT answer_NN to_TO this_DT query_NN ._.
EXPERIMENTAL_NNS Due_NNP to_TO the_DT partial_JJ failure_NN of_IN monsoon_NN in_IN 1944_CD prussic_JJ acid_NN was_VBD detected_VBN in_IN jawar_JJ plants_NNS of_IN the_DT Institute_NNP farm_NN in_IN October_NNP ._.
This_DT provided_VBD sufficient_JJ material_NN for_IN exploratory_JJ studies_NNS ._.
Fresh_JJ samples_NNS were_VBD first_RB tested_VBN with_IN picrate_JJ paper_NN according_VBG to_TO the_DT A.O.A.C_NNP ._.
[_NN 1940_CD ]_JJ procedure_NN ._.
Having_VBG detected_VBN the_DT presence_NN of_IN appreciable_JJ amounts_NNS of_IN prussic_JJ acid_NN qualitatively_RB ,_, a_DT quantitative_JJ estimation_NN was_VBD made_VBN by_IN the_DT acid_JJ titration_NN method_NN [_NNP A.O.A.C._NNP ,_, 1940_CD ]_NN ._.
Samples_NNS of_IN jawar_NN containing_VBG prussic_JJ acid_NNS were_VBD then_RB cured_VBN by_IN different_JJ methods_NNS to_TO evolve_VB a_DT technique_NN by_IN which_WDT prussic_JJ acid_NN could_MD be_VB decomposed_VBN into_IN innocuous_JJ constituents_NNS ._.
Accordingly_RB a_DT bulk_NN sample_NN of_IN jawar_NN was_VBD brought_VBN to_TO the_DT laboratory_NN immediately_RB after_IN cutting_VBG ._.
The_DT prussic_JJ acid_NN content_NN of_IN the_DT representative_JJ fresh_JJ sample_NN was_VBD estimated_VBN and_CC the_DT rest_NN of_IN the_DT material_NN was_VBD treated_VBN as_IN follows_VBZ :_: (_( a_DT )_) Dried_VBN in_IN shade_NN at_IN room_NN temperature_NN varying_VBG from_IN 25°-30°C_JJ ._.
and_CC prussic_JJ acid_NN estimated_VBN at_IN the_DT end_NN of_IN (_( i_NN )_) 24_CD hours_NNS ,_, (_( ii_NN )_) 48_CD hours_NNS ,_, (_( iii_NN )_) 5_CD days_NNS and_CC (_( iv_NN )_) 15_CD days_NNS ._.
(_( b_NN )_) Dried_NNP in_IN the_DT sun_NN for_IN eight_CD hours_NNS and_CC then_RB kept_VBD in_IN the_DT shade_NN at_IN room_NN temperature_NN over-_JJ 102_CD Studies_NNPS on_IN the_DT Curing_NNP of_IN Poisonous_NNP Jawar_NNP Pers_NNP Table_NNP I_PRP reveals_VBD several_JJ points_NNS of_IN interest_NN ._.
It_PRP may_MD be_VB seen_VBN that_IN the_DT amount_NN of_IN prussic_JJ acid_JJ present_NN in_IN the_DT stem_NN was_VBD comparatively_RB more_JJR than_IN that_DT of_IN leaf_NN ._.
Similar_JJ results_NNS were_VBD obtained_VBN on_IN examining_VBG 12_CD samples_NNS from_IN the_DT same_JJ affected_JJ area_NN ._.
Bagchi_NNP and_CC Ganguly_NNP [_NNP 1941_CD ]_NNP also_RB found_VBD stems_NNS of_IN 16_CD to_TO 36_CD inches_NNS long_JJ plants_NNS richer_RB in_IN hydrocyanic_JJ acid_NN than_IN the_DT leaves_NNS ._.
Acharya_NNP [_NN 1933_CD ]_NN ,_, however_RB ,_, stated_VBD that_IN the_DT leaves_NNS contained_VBD more_RBR hydrocyanic_JJ acid_NN ._.
On_IN drying_VBG the_DT plant_NN ,_, at_IN room_NN temperature_NN about_IN 70_CD per_IN cent_NN of_IN the_DT prussic_JJ acid_NN was_VBD lost_VBN after_IN 24_CD hours_NNS ,_, and_CC 75_CD per_IN cent_NN after_IN 48_CD hours_NNS ._.
When_WRB drying_NN was_VBD continued_VBN for_IN five_CD days_NNS in_IN shade_NN at_IN room_NN temperature_NN (_( 27°_CD to_TO 30°C_CD ._. )_)
the_DT loss_NN in_IN the_DT prussic_JJ acid_NN content_NN was_VBD 77_CD per_IN cent_NN ._.
The_DT plant_NN could_MD not_RB be_VB made_VBN absolutely_RB free_JJ of_IN prussic_JJ acid_NNS even_RB on_IN drying_VBG in_IN shade_NN for_IN 15_CD days_NNS ._.
Acharya_NNP (_( loc_JJ cit_NN )_) also_RB found_VBD that_IN drying_VBG in_IN shade_NN had_VBD little_JJ effect_NN on_IN the_DT prussic_JJ acid_NN content_NN ._.
Swanson_NNP [_NN 1921_CD ]_NN ,_, however_RB ,_, stated_VBD that_IN the_DT shade_NN dried_VBD sorghum_NN contained_VBN only_RB traces_NNS of_IN prussic_JJ acid_NN ._.
A_DT remarkable_JJ loss_NN of_IN prussic_JJ acid_NN was_VBD observed_VBN when_WRB the_DT plant_NN was_VBD dried_VBN in_IN the_DT sun_NN even_RB for_IN short_JJ periods_NNS ._.
Eight_CD hours_NNS drying_VBG reduced_VBD the_DT prussic_JJ acid_NN by_IN 90_CD per_IN cent_NN ._.
Seven_NNP days_NNS drying_VBG under_IN field_NN conditions_NNS rendered_VBD the_DT plant_NN absolutely_RB free_JJ from_IN prussic_JJ acid_NN ._.
Leather_NNP [_NN 1906_CD ]_NN found_VBD that_IN sun-drying_NN did_VBD not_RB decrease_VB the_DT amount_NN of_IN cyanogenetic_JJ glucoside_NN and_CC Acharya_NNP (_( loc_JJ cit_NN )_) stated_VBD that_IN sun-drying_NN reduced_VBD the_DT amount_NN of_IN prussic_JJ acid_NN appreciably_RB ._.
Chopra_NNP and_CC Badhwar_NNP [_NNP 1940_CD ]_NNP also_RB assume_VBP that_IN the_DT well_RB dried_JJ plants_NNS are_VBP not_RB dangerous_JJ ._.
This_DT procedure_NN of_IN drying_VBG in_IN the_DT sun_NN and_CC leaving_VBG the_DT plants_NNS out_RP in_IN the_DT open_JJ at_IN night_NN was_VBD repeated_VBN thrice_NN with_IN the_DT same_JJ results_NNS ._.
The_DT whole_JJ area_NN under_IN jawar_JJ crop_NN was_VBD cured_VBN like_IN this_DT and_CC fed_VB to_TO cattle_VB without_IN any_DT untoward_JJ effects_NNS ._.
An_DT alternative_JJ method_NN of_IN curing_NN was_VBD also_RB tried_VBN by_IN ensiling_VBG the_DT affected_JJ plants_NNS ._.
The_DT fresh_JJ plants_NNS were_VBD cut_VBN into_IN two_CD and_CC ensiled_VBD in_IN two_CD small_JJ experimental_JJ pits_NNS of_IN 4_CD ft._NN ×_VBD 4_CD ft._NN ×_VBD 4_CD ft_NN ._.
Locally_RB grown_VBN hay_NN consisting_VBG mostly_RB of_IN Saccharum_NNP spontaneum_NN (_( kans_NNS )_) was_VBD used_VBN as_IN cover_NN ._.
Samples_NNS from_IN one_CD pit_NN were_VBD examined_VBN after_IN every_DT 10_CD days_NNS for_IN prussic_JJ acid_NN ._.
It_PRP may_MD be_VB seen_VBN from_IN Table_NNP II_NNP that_IN the_DT plants_NNS ensiled_VBN for_IN about_IN a_DT month_NN lost_VBD the_DT entire_JJ prussic_JJ acid_NN content_NN ._.
It_PRP is_VBZ likely_JJ that_IN the_DT increased_VBN acidity_NN and_CC temperature_NN in_IN ensiling_VBG liberates_VBZ the_DT prussic_JJ acid_NN from_IN its_PRP$ combination_NN with_IN the_DT enzyme_NN and_CC it_PRP is_VBZ subsequently_RB decomposed_VBN ._.

nil_IN The_DT ensiled_JJ sorghum_NN from_IN the_DT second_JJ pit_NN opened_VBN after_IN two_CD months_NNS was_VBD fed_VBN to_TO three_CD bullocks_NNS for_IN a_DT period_NN of_IN 30_CD days_NNS with_IN no_DT harmful_JJ effects_NNS ._.
The_DT animals_NNS relished_VBD the_DT succulent_NN fodder_NN ._.
Although_IN there_EX is_VBZ no_DT experimental_JJ evidence_NN ,_, Van_NNP Der_NNP Walt_NNP [_NNP 1944_CD ]_NNP has_VBZ drawn_VBN attention_NN to_TO a_DT condition_NN of_IN chronic_JJ prussic_JJ acid-poisoning_NN if_IN improperly_RB cured_VBN sorghum_NN is_VBZ fed_VBN over_IN a_DT prolonged_JJ period_NN ._.
Similar_JJ views_NNS have_VBP been_VBN expressed_VBN in_IN the_DT U.S.A._NNP Veterinary_NNP Science_NNP News_NNP Letter_NNP [_NN 1944_CD ]_NN that_IN small_JJ amounts_NNS of_IN cyanogenetic_JJ forage_NN is_VBZ capable_JJ of_IN causing_VBG demyelination_NN if_IN repeatedly_RB consumed_VBN ._.
SUMMARY_NNP Attempt_NNP has_VBZ been_VBN made_VBN to_TO utilize_VB poisonous_JJ jawar_NN as_IN fodder_NN by_IN different_JJ treatments_NNS ._.
It_PRP has_VBZ been_VBN found_VBN that_IN drying_VBG the_DT affected_JJ plants_NNS in_IN the_DT sun_NN for_IN seven_CD days_NNS or_CC ensiling_VBG for_IN 30_CD days_NNS renders_VBZ the_DT plant_NN free_JJ from_IN prussic_JJ acid_NN ._.

19_CD ,_, 79_CD INVESTIGATIONS_NNP ON_NNP EVAPORATED_NNP BUFFALO_NNP MILK_NNP By_IN C._NNP P._NNP ANANTAKRISHNAN_NNP and_CC ZAL_NNP R._NNP KOTHAVALLA_NNP ,_, Imperial_NNP Dairy_NNP Research_NNP Institute_NNP ,_, Bangalore_NNP (_( Received_VBN for_IN publication_NN on_IN 29_CD October_NNP 1945_CD )_) EVAPORATED_NNP milk_NN is_VBZ condensed_VBN milk_NN to_TO which_WDT no_DT extraneous_JJ sugar_NN has_VBZ been_VBN added_VBN and_CC which_WDT has_VBZ been_VBN sterilized_VBN in_IN hermatically_RB sealed_VBN cans_NNS ._.
Much_JJ attention_NN has_VBZ been_VBN paid_VBN towards_IN the_DT study_NN of_IN the_DT preparation_NN and_CC properties_NNS of_IN the_DT evaporated_JJ cow_NN 's_POS milk_NN ,_, but_CC very_RB little_JJ work_NN has_VBZ been_VBN done_VBN on_IN the_DT milk_NN of_IN other_JJ animals_NNS ._.
In_IN India_NNP ,_, buffaloes_VBZ form_VB an_DT important_JJ source_NN of_IN milk_NN and_CC dairy_NN products_NNS and_CC the_DT milk_NN and_CC butterfat_NN from_IN these_DT animals_NNS have_VBP formed_VBN the_DT subject_NN of_IN many_JJ investi-_JJ gations_NNS ._.
However_RB ,_, no_DT information_NN regarding_VBG the_DT suitability_NN of_IN buffalo_NN 's_POS milk_NN for_IN condensing_VBG seems_VBZ to_TO be_VB available_JJ ._.
Therefore_RB ,_, investigations_NNS were_VBD carried_VBN out_RP to_TO get_VB information_NN as_IN to_TO (_( 1_CD )_) the_DT possible_JJ method_NN of_IN finding_VBG out_RP the_DT stability_NN of_IN evaporated_JJ milk_NN during_IN sterilization_NN and_CC (_( 2_CD )_) the_DT applicability_NN of_IN 'rapid_JJ tests_NNS '_POS which_WDT are_VBP at_IN present_JJ in_IN general_JJ use_NN (_( for_IN cow_NN 's_POS milk_NN )_) for_IN predicting_VBG the_DT heat_NN stability_NN of_IN evaporated_JJ buffalo_NN milk_NN ._.
EXPERIMENTAL_NNP The_DT main_JJ factors_NNS contributing_VBG towards_IN the_DT success_NN of_IN milk_NN condensing_VBG are_VBP uniform_JJ behaviour_NN of_IN liquid_NN milk_NN and_CC uniform_JJ composition_NN ._.
Uniform_JJ composition_NN is_VBZ important_JJ in_IN controlling_VBG the_DT degree_NN of_IN condensing_NN aimed_VBN at_IN ,_, which_WDT is_VBZ generally_RB done_VBN by_IN determining_VBG the_DT specific_JJ gravity_NN ._.
The_DT standard_NN in_IN Great_NNP Britain_NNP for_IN evaporated_VBN milk_NN is_VBZ 9_CD per_IN cent_NN fat_NN and_CC 22_CD per_IN cent_NN solids-not-fat_NN ._.
This_DT gives_VBZ a_DT Fat_NN :_: S.N.F_NN ._.
ratio_NN of_IN 1:2.44_CD which_WDT nearly_RB conforms_VBZ to_TO the_DT ratio_NN for_IN the_DT average_JJ composition_NN of_IN fluid_NN milk_NN and_CC allows_VBZ for_IN a_DT slightly_RB lower_JJR fat_NN content_NN ._.
The_DT United_NNP States_NNPS standards_NNS are_VBP lower_JJR than_IN the_DT above_NN ._.
Previous_JJ to_TO July_NNP 1940_CD the_DT minimum_JJ standards_NNS for_IN evaporated_JJ whole_JJ milk_NN were_VBD 8_CD per_IN cent_NN fat_NN and_CC 28_CD per_IN cent_NN total_JJ milk_NN solids_NNS ._.
In_IN the_DT present_JJ investigation_NN the_DT fat_NN :_: solids-not-fat_JJ ratio_NN aimed_VBN at_IN is_VBZ 9:22_CD ._.
In_IN order_NN to_TO obtain_VB this_DT ratio_NN in_IN the_DT raw_JJ milk_NN and_CC to_TO facilitate_VB the_DT control_NN of_IN the_DT degree_NN of_IN concentration_NN reached_VBN later_RB ,_, the_DT liquid_NN milk_NN is_VBZ toned_VBN to_TO 4.0_CD per_IN cent_NN fat_NN always_RB ,_, unless_IN otherwise_RB stated_VBN ._.
The_DT milk_NN used_VBN in_IN all_DT cases_NNS was_VBD a_DT composite_JJ sample_NN from_IN the_DT Murrah_NNP buffalo_NN herd_NN of_IN the_DT Institute_NNP farm_NN ._.
Milk_NN was_VBD always_RB taken_VBN for_IN condensing_VBG four_CD hours_NNS after_IN production_NN ._.
Condensing_NN was_VBD done_VBN in_IN a_DT pilot_NN condensing_VBG unit_NN manufactured_VBN by_IN The_DT Dairy_NNP Engineers_NNPS Ltd._NNP ,_, Edinburgh_NNP ._.
Forewarming_VBG was_VBD effected_VBN by_IN steam_NN in_IN a_DT tinned_JJ copper_NN kettle_NN with_IN revolving_JJ agitator_NN ,_, evaporation_NN in_IN a_DT tinned_JJ copper_NN vacuum_NN pan_NN ,_, and_CC condensation_NN in_IN a_DT surface_NN condenser_NN ._.
The_DT vacuum_NN is_VBZ created_VBN by_IN means_NNS of_IN a_DT wet_JJ vacuum_NN pump_NN ._.
VACUUM_NNP PAN_NNP OPERATION_NNP The_DT vacuum_NN pan_NN was_VBD thoroughly_RB rinsed_VBN with_IN water_NN and_CC steamed_VBD for_IN 10_CD minutes_NNS ._.
The_DT air_NN valves_NNS were_VBD closed_VBN ,_, and_CC water_NN turned_VBD into_IN the_DT condenser_NN ._.
Then_RB water_NN was_VBD allowed_VBN into_IN the_DT vacuum_NN pump_NN and_CC the_DT pump_NN was_VBD started_VBN ._.
When_WRB the_DT vacuum_NN gauge_NN registered_VBD over_IN 62_CD cm_NNS ._.
the_DT valve_NN of_IN the_DT milk_NN pipe_NN leading_VBG to_TO the_DT pan_NN was_VBD closed_VBN ._.
When_WRB the_DT milk_NN just_RB filled_VBD the_DT jacket_NN and_CC when_WRB it_PRP touched_VBD the_DT steam_NN coil_NN in_IN the_DT pan_NN ,_, steam_NN was_VBD turned_VBN into_IN it_PRP ._.
When_WRB all_PDT the_DT milk_NN was_VBD drawn_VBN into_IN the_DT pan_NN the_DT inlet_NN was_VBD closed_VBN and_CC the_DT steam_NN pressure_NN in_IN the_DT jacket_NN was_VBD increased_VBN gradually_RB and_CC taken_VBN up_RP to_TO 22_CD lb_NN ._.
in_IN about_RB 6_CD minutes_NNS ._.
The_DT temperature_NN of_IN the_DT vacuum_NN pan_NN was_VBD maintained_VBN between_IN 122_CD to_TO 128°F_CD ._.
If_IN the_DT inside_JJ temperature_NN of_IN the_DT pan_NN was_VBD increased_VBN more_JJR than_IN 128°F_CD ._.
initially_RB ,_, milk_NN would_MD begin_VB to_TO froth_VB too_RB much_JJ and_CC might_MD even_RB be_VB carried_VBN on_IN to_TO the_DT condenser_NN ._.
Therefore_RB ,_, the_DT steam_NN pressure_NN in_IN the_DT jacket_NN should_MD be_VB carefully_RB controlled_VBN ._.
It_PRP has_VBZ been_VBN found_VBN by_IN various_JJ trials_NNS that_IN a_DT steam_NN pressure_NN of_IN 22_CD lb_NN ._.
in_IN the_DT coils_NNS was_VBD quite_RB suitable_JJ for_IN condensing_VBG the_DT milk_NN ._.
The_DT temperature_NN of_IN the_DT outlet_NN water_NN from_IN the_DT condenser_NN ranged_VBD from_IN 110_CD to_TO 115°F_CD ._.
Just_RB before_IN the_DT desired_JJ concentration_NN was_VBD reached_VBN (_( judged_VBN by_IN looking_VBG through_IN the_DT man-hole_NN )_) a_DT sample_NN was_VBD drawn_VBN out_RP from_IN the_DT pan_NN and_CC its_PRP$ specific_JJ gravity_NN determined_VBN at_IN a_DT temperature_NN of_IN 110°F_CD ._.
When_WRB the_DT specific_JJ gravity_NN was_VBD about_IN 1.066_CD ,_, the_DT steam_NN pressure_NN in_IN the_DT jacket_NN and_CC the_DT coils_NNS was_VBD reduced_VBN ,_, the_DT vacuum_NN break_NN opened_VBD ,_, the_DT vacuum_NN pump_NN and_CC the_DT steam_NN in_IN the_DT jacket_NN were_VBD stopped_VBN ._.
The_DT condensed_JJ milk_NN is_VBZ then_RB drawn_VBN out_IN of_IN the_DT pan_NN and_CC cooled_VBD to_TO room_NN temperature_NN 72.76°F_CD ._.
After_IN standardization_NN to_TO the_DT desired_VBN composition_NN ,_, the_DT evaporated_JJ milk_NN was_VBD filled_VBN in_IN 8_CD oz_NN ._.
sterile_JJ vent_NN hole_NN cans_NNS ,_, or_CC in_IN sterile_JJ glass_NN bottles_NNS plugged_VBN with_IN cotton_NN wool_NN and_CC used_VBN for_IN sterilization_NN studies_NNS ._.
105_CD L_NNP 106_CD Investigation_NNP on_IN Evaporated_NNP Buffalo_NNP Milk_NNP Forty_NNP lb_NN ._.
of_IN standardized_JJ milk_NN was_VBD used_VBN for_IN condensing_VBG purposes_NNS and_CC it_PRP generally_RB took_VBD 20_CD to_TO 25_CD minutes_NNS to_TO complete_VB one_CD batch_NN ._.
STERILIZATION_NNP Sterilization_NNP was_VBD always_RB carried_VBN out_RP in_IN an_DT autoclave_NN within_IN two_CD hours_NNS after_IN condensation_NN ._.
The_DT 'coming_VBG up_RP '_POS time_NN ,_, i.e_NN ._.
raising_VBG the_DT temperature_NN of_IN the_DT autoclave_NN from_IN room_NN temperature_NN to_TO 240.8°F_CD ._.
or_CC 248°F_CD ._.
was_VBD always_RB adjusted_VBN between_IN 20_CD to_TO 25_CD minutes_NNS ._.
The_DT time_NN taken_VBN from_IN starting_VBG the_DT heat-_JJ ing_NN of_IN the_DT autoclave_NN to_TO the_DT point_NN of_IN filling_VBG steam_NN was_VBD generally_RB 10_CD to_TO 14_CD minutes_NNS ,_, and_CC from_IN this_DT time_NN the_DT heating_NN was_VBD carefully_RB done_VBN to_TO raise_VB it_PRP to_TO the_DT required_JJ pressure_NN and_CC temperature_NN ,_, and_CC in_IN no_DT case_NN were_VBD the_DT above_JJ limits_NNS relaxed_VBN ._.
After_IN holding_VBG the_DT samples_NNS at_IN various_JJ temperatures_NNS and_CC for_IN different_JJ lengths_NNS of_IN time_NN ,_, cooling_VBG was_VBD effected_VBN in_IN such_JJ a_DT way_NN that_IN the_DT samples_NNS came_VBD to_TO room_NN temperature_NN in_IN 20_CD minutes_NNS ._.

was_VBD noted_VBN ._.

in_IN less_JJR than_IN five_CD minutes_NNS ._.

The_DT contents_NNS of_IN the_DT tube_NN were_VBD then_RB mixed_JJ and_CC the_DT tubes_NNS immersed_VBN in_IN a_DT boiling_JJ water_NN bath_NN for_IN 5_CD minutes_NNS ._.

Twenty-five_JJ trials_NNS were_VBD conducted_VBN with_IN farm_NN produced_VBN milk_NN having_VBG acidity_NN ranging_VBG from_IN 0.12_CD and_CC 0.15_CD per_IN cent_NN and_CC the_DT results_NNS are_VBP presented_VBN in_IN Table_NNP V._NNP TABLE_NNP V_NNP Relation_NNP of_IN alcohol_NN and_CC phosphate_JJ test_NN with_IN the_DT time_NN of_IN coagulation_NN of_IN evaporated_JJ buffalo_NN milk_NN Number_NNP of_IN trials_NNS Alcohol_NNP test_NN Phosphate_NNP test_NN Coagulation_NN time_NN at_IN 240.8°_CD F._NNP in_IN minutes_NNS 8_CD 110_CD Investigation_NN on_IN Evaporated_NNP Buffalo_NNP Milk_NNP TABLE_NNP VI_NNP Effect_NNP of_IN stabilizers_NNS on_IN the_DT heat_NN coagulation_NN of_IN evaporated_JJ buffalo_NN milk_NN at_IN 240.8°_CD F._NNP for_IN 30_CD minutes_NNS Sample_NNP No_NNP ._.
0.0_CD Amount_NNP of_IN Na2HPO4_NNP used_VBD in_IN ml_NN ._.
0.2_CD 0.4_CD 0.6_CD 0.8_CD 1.0_CD 1_CD C._NNP P._NNP ANANTHKRISHNAN_NNP AND_NNP ZAL_NNP R._NNP KOTHAVALLA_NNP 111_CD to_TO contain_VB spores_NNS and_CC rod_NN shaped_VBD organisms_NNS ._.
Fresh_JJ samples_NNS of_IN evaporated_JJ milk_NN containing_VBG 22.0_CD per_IN cent_NN S.N.F_NNP ._.

for_IN 20_CD minutes_NNS ._.
After_IN this_DT process_NN ,_, the_DT samples_NNS were_VBD incubated_VBN for_IN 3_CD days_NNS at_IN 98.6°F_CD ._.
to_TO find_VB out_RP whether_IN they_PRP survive_VBP or_CC not_RB ._.
None_NN of_IN these_DT samples_NNS were_VBD found_VBN to_TO be_VB sterile_JJ ._.
In_IN another_DT trial_NN the_DT time_NN of_IN holding_VBG at_IN 248°F_CD ._.
was_VBD increased_VBN to_TO 30_CD minutes_NNS and_CC then_RB the_DT samples_NNS incubated_VBN as_IN before_RB ._.
It_PRP was_VBD found_VBN that_IN these_DT samples_NNS were_VBD practically_RB sterile_JJ ._.
But_CC the_DT holding_VBG time_NN of_IN 30_CD minutes_NNS at_IN 248°F_CD ._.
for_IN evaporated_VBN milk_NN with_IN a_DT 22.0_CD per_IN cent_NN S.N.F_NNP ._.
was_VBD found_VBN to_TO be_VB too_RB much_JJ for_IN this_DT reason_NN ,_, that_IN the_DT final_JJ product_NN curdled_VBN in_IN the_DT sterilizer_NN ._.
So_RB ,_, when_WRB these_DT heat_NN resistant_NN spores_VBZ get_VBP into_IN milk_NN ,_, which_WDT is_VBZ to_TO be_VB used_VBN for_IN the_DT manufacture_NN of_IN evaporated_JJ milk_NN ,_, the_DT only_JJ way_NN of_IN getting_VBG at_IN a_DT wholesome_NN sterile_JJ product_NN is_VBZ found_VBN to_TO be_VB ,_, to_TO concentrate_VB the_DT milk_NN to_TO only_RB 19_CD per_IN cent_NN S.N.F_NNP ._.
and_CC sterilize_VB at_IN 248°F_CD ._.
for_IN 30_CD minutes_NNS ._.
But_CC ,_, this_DT procedure_NN would_MD give_VB a_DT final_JJ product_NN satisfying_VBG only_RB the_DT U._NNP S._NNP Standards_NNP for_IN evaporated_JJ milk_NN ._.
SUMMARY_NNP The_DT suitability_NN of_IN buffalo_NN milk_NN for_IN the_DT manufacture_NN of_IN evaporated_JJ milk_NN was_VBD investigated_VBN ._.
It_PRP has_VBZ been_VBN found_VBN ,_, that_IN as_IN the_DT concentration_NN of_IN the_DT milk_NN solids_NN increases_NNS ,_, the_DT temperature_NN of_IN coagulation_NN of_IN the_DT evaporated_JJ milk_NN for_IN 30_CD minutes_NNS sterilization_NN decreases_VBZ progressively_RB ._.
For_IN a_DT product_NN having_VBG 22.0_CD per_IN cent_NN solids-not-fat_NN ,_, as_IN the_DT temperature_NN of_IN sterilization_NN decreases_VBZ the_DT time_NN required_VBN for_IN coagulation_NN increases_NNS ._.
With_IN milk_NN containing_VBG 22.0_CD per_IN cent_NN S.N.F_NNP ._.
the_DT temperature_NN of_IN forewarming_VBG influences_NNS the_DT time_NN of_IN coagulation_NN ._.
A_DT five_CD minutes_NNS forewarming_VBG at_IN 203°F_CD ._.
was_VBD found_VBN to_TO be_VB the_DT most_RBS suitable_JJ for_IN buffalo_JJ milk_NN ._.
The_DT alcohol_NN test_NN was_VBD found_VBN to_TO be_VB more_RBR reliable_JJ than_IN the_DT phosphate_JJ test_NN in_IN predicting_VBG the_DT heat_NN stability_NN of_IN evaporated_JJ buffalo_NN milk_NN ._.
Stabilizers_NNS like_IN di-sodium_NN hydrogen_NN phosphate_NN and_CC sodium_NN citrate_NN increase_NN the_DT heat_JJ stability_NN of_IN evaporated_JJ buffalo_NN milk_NN ._.

For_IN house-hold_JJ consumption_NN milk_NN in_IN some_DT parts_NNS of_IN India_NNP is_VBZ brought_VBN to_TO boil_NN and_CC allowed_VBN to_TO simmer_VB for_IN about_RB ten_JJ minutes_NNS before_IN consumption_NN ._.
In_IN certain_JJ other_JJ parts_NNS of_IN the_DT country_NN ,_, it_PRP is_VBZ common_JJ to_TO continue_VB boiling_VBG for_IN longer_JJR periods_NNS or_CC even_RB allow_VB milk_NN to_TO simmer_VB for_IN over_IN such_JJ long_JJ intervals_NNS as_IN 10-12_JJ hours_NNS ._.
It_PRP is_VBZ ,_, therefore_RB ,_, of_IN great_JJ importance_NN from_IN the_DT point_NN of_IN view_NN of_IN human_JJ nutrition_NN to_TO determine_VB whether_IN any_DT dimnu-_JJ tion_NN in_IN the_DT nutritive_JJ value_NN of_IN milk_NN of_IN either_CC cow_NN or_CC buffalo_NN is_VBZ brought_VBN about_IN by_IN boiling_VBG ._.
In_IN foreign_JJ countries_NNS where_WRB a_DT large_JJ proportion_NN of_IN milk_NN is_VBZ pasteurized_VBN the_DT question_NN as_IN to_TO whether_IN or_CC not_RB heat_JJ treatment_NN seriously_RB diminishes_VBZ the_DT nutritive_JJ value_NN of_IN milk_NN has_VBZ been_VBN exhaustively_RB studied_VBN ._.
A_DT large_JJ number_NN of_IN investigations_NNS are_VBP reported_VBN and_CC the_DT results_NNS are_VBP summarized_VBN by_IN Stirling_VBG and_CC Blackwood_NNP [_NNP 1933_CD ]_NNP and_CC Kon_NNP [_NNP 1934_CD ]_NNP ._.
It_PRP is_VBZ generally_RB concluded_VBN that_IN pasteurization_NN does_VBZ not_RB materially_RB affect_VBP the_DT nutritive_JJ value_NN of_IN milk_NN ._.
In_IN holder_NN pasteurization_NN method_NN ,_, milk_NN is_VBZ not_RB taken_VBN over_RP 145°F_CD ._.
and_CC the_DT question_NN arises_VBZ whether_IN taking_VBG milk_NN to_TO boiling_JJ temperature_NN or_CC simmering_VBG it_PRP as_IN is_VBZ usually_RB done_VBN in_IN our_PRP$ country_NN ,_, affects_VBZ the_DT nutritive_JJ value_NN of_IN milk_NN ._.
Henry_NNP et_CC al_RB [_JJ 1938_CD ]_NN studied_VBD the_DT effect_NN of_IN com-_JJ mercial_JJ sterilization_NN on_IN the_DT nutritive_JJ value_NN of_IN milk_NN and_CC found_VBD that_IN there_EX were_VBD no_DT differences_NNS in_IN the_DT growth_NN promoting_VBG values_NNS of_IN milks_NNS ._.
The_DT rats_NNS on_IN sterilized_VBN milk_NN consumed_VBD it_PRP more_RBR readily_RB than_IN their_PRP$ mates_NNS on_IN raw_JJ milk_NN ._.
Mitra_NNP [_NN 1942_CD ]_NNP studied_VBD the_DT growth_NN promoting_NN and_CC biological_JJ values_NNS of_IN procins_NNS of_IN raw_JJ cow_NN and_CC buffalo_NN milk_NN and_CC concluded_VBD that_IN there_EX was_VBD no_DT difference_NN in_IN their_PRP$ growth_NN promoting_VBG values_NNS ._.
In_IN the_DT present_JJ investigation_NN ,_, the_DT common_JJ method_NN of_IN processing_VBG milk_NN namely_RB boiling_VBG for_IN ten_NN minutes_NNS has_VBZ been_VBN adopted_VBN to_TO determine_VB the_DT effect_NN of_IN heat_NN treatment_NN on_IN the_DT nutritive_JJ value_NN of_IN milks_NNS of_IN cow_NN and_CC buffaloes_NNS ._.
EXPERIMENTAL_NNP Raw_NNP milk_NN was_VBD collected_VBN daily_RB for_IN the_DT feeding_NN experiments_NNS from_IN the_DT whole_JJ bulk_NN of_IN cow_NN and_CC buffalo_JJ milks_NNS from_IN the_DT herd_NN of_IN the_DT Imperial_NNP Dairy_NNP Research_NNP Institute_NNP ._.
A_DT part_NN of_IN the_DT sample_NN was_VBD heated_VBN to_TO boiling_VBG and_CC simmered_VBN for_IN about_RB ten_JJ minutes_NNS ,_, taking_VBG care_NN not_RB to_TO allow_VB any_DT skin_NN to_TO be_VB formed_VBN on_IN the_DT surface_NN by_IN keeping_VBG the_DT liquid_NN continuously_RB stirred_VBD ._.
It_PRP was_VBD then_RB cooled_VBN taking_VBG the_DT same_JJ precau-_JJ tion_NN ._.
The_DT buffalo_NN milk_NN was_VBD toned_VBN with_IN separated_JJ milk_NN to_TO the_DT same_JJ fat_JJ percentage_NN as_IN cow_NN milk_NN before_IN heating_NN ._.
To_TO study_VB the_DT nutritive_JJ value_NN ,_, the_DT technique_NN of_IN Henry_NNP and_CC Kon_NNP [_NNP 1937_CD ]_NNP was_VBD adopted_VBN ._.
Young_NN rats_NNS were_VBD weaned_VBN when_WRB 21_CD days_NNS old_JJ and_CC placed_VBN in_IN experimental_JJ cages_NNS when_WRB 28_CD days_NNS old_JJ ._.
Twelve_NNP male_NN litter_NN mates_NNS from_IN 12_CD animals_NNS were_VBD used_VBN for_IN each_DT group_NN and_CC were_VBD fed_VBN exclusively_RB on_IN raw_JJ or_CC boiled_VBN cow_NN or_CC buffalo_NN milk_NN ,_, supplemented_VBN with_IN minerals_NNS ._.
Iron_NNP was_VBD supplied_VBN in_IN the_DT form_NN of_IN ferric_JJ chloride_NN ,_, and_CC copper_NN and_CC manganese_JJ as_IN sulphates_NNS ._.
The_DT minerals_NNS were_VBD administered_VBN per_IN animal_NN per_FW day_NN as_IN follows_VBZ :_: First_NNP week114_VBZ Nutritive_NNP value_NN of_IN raw_JJ and_CC boiled_VBD Milks_NNP [_NNP NLS_NNP note_NN :_: a_DT graphic_JJ appears_VBZ here_RB -_: see_VBP image_NN of_IN page_NN ]_NNP FIG_NNP ._.

DISCUSSION_NNP All_PDT the_DT animals_NNS grew_VBD exceedingly_RB well_RB on_IN the_DT four_CD types_NNS of_IN milks_NNS ._.
They_PRP were_VBD in_IN good_JJ flesh_NN ,_, their_PRP$ coats_NNS were_VBD smooth_JJ and_CC their_PRP$ eyes_NNS bright_VBN ._.
It_PRP will_MD be_VB readily_RB seen_VBN from_IN Fig_NNP ._.
1_CD that_IN rats_NNS fed_VBP on_IN different_JJ milks_NNS show_VBP almost_RB the_DT same_JJ rate_NN of_IN growth_NN ._.
The_DT animals_NNS receiving_VBG cow_NN milk_NN had_VBD grown_VBN a_DT little_JJ better_RBR but_CC the_DT gain_NN was_VBD not_RB statistically_RB significant_JJ ._.
As_IN seen_VBN from_IN Tables_NNP I_PRP ,_, II_NNP ,_, III_NNP and_CC IV_NNP ,_, the_DT differences_NNS in_IN daily_JJ gains_NNS in_IN weight_NN made_VBN by_IN rats_NNS fed_VBN on_IN different_JJ milks_NNS are_VBP negligible_JJ ._.
The_DT efficiency_NN of_IN utilization_NN of_IN milk_NN as_IN measured_VBN by_IN the_DT gain_NN in_IN weight_NN per_IN 100_CD ml_NN ._.
of_IN milk_NN was_VBD also_RB same_JJ for_IN all_PDT the_DT groups_NNS ._.
The_DT figures_NNS for_IN milk_NN consumption_NN further_RB revealed_VBD that_IN there_EX was_VBD no_DT difference_NN in_IN the_DT appetite_NN of_IN the_DT rats_NNS in_IN the_DT various_JJ groups_NNS ._.
Thus_RB it_PRP is_VBZ seen_VBN from_IN the_DT results_NNS of_IN the_DT experiment_NN that_IN boiling_VBG either_CC cow_NN or_CC buffalo_NN milk_NN for_IN about_RB ten_JJ minutes_NNS had_VBD no_DT appreciable_JJ effect_NN on_IN their_PRP$ growth_NN promoting_VBG values_NNS ._.
When_WRB the_DT body_NN lengths_NNS of_IN the_DT rats_NNS fed_VBP on_IN these_DT milks_NNS are_VBP taken_VBN into_IN considera-_JJ tion_NN after_IN killing_VBG it_PRP was_VBD found_VBN that_IN the_DT mean_NN body_NN length_NN of_IN the_DT rats_NNS on_IN boiled_VBN buffalow_NN milk_NN was_VBD slightly_RB less_JJR (_( by_IN about_IN 4.5_CD mm_NNS ._. )_)
than_IN those_DT on_IN either_CC raw_JJ buffalo_NN milk_NN ,_, raw_JJ cow_NN milk_NN or_CC boiled_VBD cow_NNS milk_NN ._.
This_DT slight_JJ difference_NN ,_, however_RB ,_, does_VBZ not_RB appear_VB to_TO be_VB of_IN any_DT special_JJ significance_NN ._.
N_NNP 118_CD Nutritive_NNP Value_NNP of_IN Raw_NNP and_CC Boiled_NNP Milks_NNP SUMMARY_NNP The_DT male_NN rats_NNS were_VBD fed_VBN ad_NN libitum_NN for_IN a_DT period_NN of_IN eight_CD weeks_NNS on_IN raw_JJ and_CC boiled_VBD milks_NNS of_IN cows_NNS and_CC buffaloes_NNS supplemented_VBN with_IN minerals_NNS ._.
No_DT differences_NNS were_VBD observed_VBN in_IN the_DT growth_NN promoting_VBG values_NNS under_IN the_DT conditions_NNS of_IN boiling_NN ,_, viz._NN ,_, allowing_VBG the_DT milk_NN to_TO simmer_VB for_IN ten_JJ minutes_NNS ._.

5_CD DETECTION_NNP OF_NNP ADULTERATION_NNP OF_NNP MILK_NNP WITH_NNP MILK_NNP POWDER_NNP By_IN K._NNP N._NNP SHAMA_NNP SASTRY_NNP and_CC NOSHIR_NNP N._NNP DASTUR_NNP ,_, Imperial_NNP Dairy_NNP Research_NNP Institute_NNP ,_, Bangalore_NNP (_( Received_VBN for_IN publication_NN on_IN 5_CD August_NNP 1946_CD )_) IN_NNP normal_JJ times_NNS cheap_JJ skim-milk_JJ powder_NN is_VBZ available_JJ and_CC this_DT is_VBZ used_VBN freely_RB in_IN certain_JJ urban_JJ centre_NN to_TO tone_VB whole_JJ milk_NN rich_JJ in_IN ._.
fat_NN ._.
If_IN the_DT milk_NN powder_NN solution_NN is_VBZ prepared_VBN carefully_RB and_CC tonning_VBG so_RB carried_VBN out_RP that_IN the_DT final_JJ product_NN conforms_NNS to_TO the_DT legal_JJ standard_NN for_IN fat_JJ percentage_NN in_IN milk_NN ,_, this_DT tonning_NN can_MD not_RB be_VB detected_VBN by_IN the_DT routine_JJ methods_NNS normally_RB used_VBN for_IN testing_VBG milk_NN ._.
Nutritionally_RB such_JJ tonning_NN is_VBZ not_RB objectionable_JJ but_CC there_EX is_VBZ no_DT doubt_NN that_IN the_DT product_NN can_MD not_RB be_VB regarded_VBN as_IN genuine_JJ milk_NN ._.
Further_RB ,_, such_PDT a_DT practice_NN has_VBZ graver_VBN effects_NNS on_IN the_DT genuine_JJ liquid_NN milk_NN market_NN than_IN are_VBP apparent_JJ at_IN first_JJ sight_NN and_CC requires_VBZ to_TO be_VB curbed_VBN by_IN all_DT available_JJ means_NNS ._.
The_DT problem_NN of_IN adulteration_NN of_IN milk_NN with_IN milk_NN powder_NN is_VBZ peculiar_JJ to_TO the_DT urban_JJ centres_NNS in_IN India_NNP ._.
Studies_NNS have_VBP been_VBN ,_, therefore_RB ,_, undertaken_JJ to_TO find_VB simple_JJ methods_NNS which_WDT will_MD prove_VB useful_JJ under_IN house-_JJ hold_NN conditions_NNS and_CC the_DT laboratory_NN ._.
The_DT results_NNS of_IN these_DT studies_NNS are_VBP given_VBN below_IN ._.
Experimental_JJ 1_CD ._.
Milk_NN powders_NNS used_VBD Three_NNP brands_NNS of_IN milk_NN powders_NNS were_VBD used_VBN ,_, viz._JJ ,_, spray-dried_JJ skim-milk_JJ powder_NN (_( New_NNP Zealand_NNP )_) ;_: roller-dried_JJ skim_NN milk_NN powder_NN (_( Benares_NNP )_) ;_: and_CC roller-dried_JJ whole_JJ milk_NN powder_NN (_( Benares_NNP )_) ._.
Solutions_NNS of_IN different_JJ powders_NNS were_VBD prepared_VBN as_IN follows_VBZ :_: (_( i_NN )_) Spray-dried_JJ skim-milk_JJ powder_NN ._.
Skim-milk_JJ powder_NN ,_, 9.5_CD gm._NN ,_, was_VBD sprinkled_VBN over_IN 90_CD ml_NNS ._.
of_IN water_NN (_( 40ºC_CD ._.
)_) ,_, shaken_VBN for_IN a_DT minute_NN and_CC filtered_VBD through_IN muslin_NN ._.
The_DT fat_JJ percentage_NN of_IN this_DT solution_NN was_VBD 0.1_CD per_IN cent_NN and_CC the_DT solids-not-fat_JJ content_JJ 8.4-8.5_JJ per_IN cent_NN ._.
(_( ii_NN )_) Roller-dried_JJ skim-milk_JJ powder_NN ._.
A_DT quantity_NN ._.
9.0_CD gm._NN ,_, of_IN the_DT powder_NN were_VBD sprinkled_VBN over_IN 90_CD ml_NNS ._.
of_IN water_NN (_( 60ºC_CD ._.
)_) ,_, shaken_VBN for_IN one_CD minute_NN ,_, cooled_VBN and_CC filtered_VBN through_IN muslin_NN ._.
The_DT fat_JJ percentage_NN of_IN the_DT reconstituted_JJ skim-milk_NN was_VBD 0.25_CD per_IN cent_NN and_CC the_DT S._NNP N._NNP F._NNP varied_VBD from_IN 8.4-8.5_JJ per_IN cent_NN ._.
(_( iii_NN )_) Roller-dried_JJ whole_JJ milk_NN powder_NN ._.
Whole_JJ milk_NN powder_NN ._.
10.2_CD gm._NN ,_, was_VBD sprinkled_VBN over_IN 90_CD ml_NNS ._.
of_IN water_NN (_( 60ºC_CD )_) ,_, shaken_VBN for_IN a_DT minute_NN ,_, cooled_VBN and_CC filtered_VBN ._.
The_DT fat_JJ percentage_NN of_IN this_DT solution_NN varied_VBD from_IN 1.4-1.6_JJ per_IN cent_NN and_CC the_DT S._NNP N._NNP F._NNP from_IN 8.4-8.5_JJ per_IN cent_NN ._.
In_IN all_DT cases_NNS it_PRP was_VBD aimed_VBN to_TO get_VB S._NNP N._NNP F._NNP of_IN about_RB 8.5_CD per_IN cent_NN and_CC so_RB the_DT quantity_NN of_IN powder_NN to_TO be_VB used_VBN was_VBD varied_JJ accordingly_RB ._.
2_CD ._.
Preparation_NN of_IN tonned_JJ milk_NN For_IN preparing_VBG tonned_JJ milk_NN ,_, the_DT fat_JJ percentage_NN of_IN fresh_JJ whole_JJ buffalo_NN milk_NN was_VBD brought_VBN to_TO 4.0_CD per_IN cent_NN and_CC that_IN of_IN fresh_JJ whole_JJ cow_NN milk_NN to_TO 3.5_CD per_IN cent_NN by_IN adding_VBG appropriate_JJ amount_NN of_IN respective_JJ milk_NN powder_NN solutions_NNS ._.
3_CD ._.
Tests_NNS tried_VBD (_( i_NN )_) Stability_NN to_TO heat_NN ._.
Pure_NN samples_NNS of_IN milk_NN ,_, both_DT raw_JJ and_CC boiled_VBD can_MD easily_RB be_VB distinguished_VBN from_IN similar_JJ samples_NNS of_IN milk_NN powder_NN by_IN their_PRP$ odour_NN ._.
However_RB ,_, such_JJ distinction_NN could_MD not_RB be_VB made_VBN so_RB easily_RB with_IN tonned_JJ samples_NNS ._.
Hence_NN trials_NNS were_VBD carried_VBN out_RP by_IN incubating_VBG the_DT samples_NNS for_IN different_JJ lengths_NNS of_IN time_NN at_IN 37ºC_CD ._.
This_DT temperature_NN was_VBD selected_VBN as_IN facilities_NNS are_VBP usually_RB available_JJ for_IN main-_JJ taining_VBG it_PRP in_IN all_DT public_JJ health_NN laboratories_NNS ._.
In_IN a_DT series_NN of_IN experiments_NNS samples_NNS of_IN milk_NN and_CC tonned_JJ milk_NN ,_, 50_CD ml_NN ._.
in_IN glass_NN stoppered_VBD bottles_NNS ,_, were_VBD kept_VBN at_IN 37ºC_CD ._.
The_DT flavour_NN was_VBD compared_VBN at_IN intervals_NNS of_IN an_DT hour_NN over_IN a_DT period_NN of_IN eight_CD hours_NNS ._.
It_PRP was_VBD found_VBN that_IN under_IN these_DT conditions_NNS tonned_VBD milk_NN samples_NNS developed_VBD a_DT peculiar_JJ burnt_NN flavour_NN which_WDT characterised_VBD them_PRP from_IN other_JJ samples_NNS ._.
This_DT flavour_NN became_VBD very_RB pronounced_VBN after_IN four_CD hours_NNS incubation_NN and_CC longer_JJR intervals_NNS did_VBD not_RB seem_VB to_TO make_VB much_JJ difference_NN in_IN the_DT intensity_NN of_IN flavour_NN ._.
This_DT observation_NN was_VBD made_VBN both_DT with_IN cow_NN and_CC buffalo_NN tonned_VBD milks_NNS ._.
In_IN the_DT above_JJ experiments_NNS it_PRP was_VBD found_VBN that_IN to_TO distinguish_VB tonned_VBN milk_NN from_IN pure_JJ milk_NN ,_, it_PRP was_VBD necessary_JJ to_TO have_VB samples_NNS of_IN raw_JJ milk_NN for_IN comparison_NN ._.
Due_JJ to_TO the_DT development_NN of_IN acidity_NN during_IN incubation_NN the_DT burnt_JJ flavour_NN in_IN tonned_JJ milk_NN became_VBD slightly_RB masked_VBN ._.
To_TO overcome_VB this_DT ,_, tests_NNS were_VBD 119_CD O_NNP 120_CD Detection_NNP of_IN Adulteration_NNP of_IN Milk_NNP with_IN Milk_NNP Powder_NNP TABLE_NNP I_PRP Results_NNP of_IN rennet_JJ test_NN with_IN raw_JJ ,_, boiled_VBD and_CC tonned_VBD buffalo_NNS milk_NN and_CC raw_JJ and_CC boiled_VBD spray_NN dried_VBD separated_VBN milk_NN (_( Coagulation_NNP time_NN in_IN seconds_NNS )_) Serial_JJ No_NNP ._.

0.0410_CD 0.3292_CD 3_CD 0.0637_CD 0.3255_CD 0.1195_CD 0.2037_CD 0.0850_CD 0.7340_CD 4_CD 0.0525_CD 0.4400_CD 0.1073_CD 0.3050_CD 0.0566_CD 1.1320_CD 5_CD 0.0945_CD 1.0530_CD 0.1127_CD 0.2077_CD 0.0720_CD 0.3037_CD 6_CD 0.0730_CD 0.2940_CD 0.1275_CD 0.2447_CD 0.0700_CD 0.2835_CD 7_CD 0.0702_CD 0.6525_CD 0.1685_CD 0.1817_CD 0.1070_CD 0.3925_CD 8_CD 0.0625_CD 0.3660_CD 0.1065_CD 0.2360_CD 0.0482_CD 0.3620_CD 9_CD 0.0750_CD 0.3675_CD 0.1845_CD 0.4020_CD 0.0635_CD 0.2600_CD 10_CD 0.0700_CD 0.7000_CD 0.1115_CD 0.3941_CD 0.0615_CD 0.5120_CD 11_CD 0.0660_CD 0.6620_CD 0.1065_CD 0.2415_CD 0.0557_CD 0.4062_CD 12_CD 0.0625_CD 0.4216_CD 0.1125_CD 0.2368_CD 0.0612_CD 0.5265_CD Average_JJ 0.0710_CD 0.4891_CD 0.1215_CD 0.2689_CD 0.0616_CD 0.4527_CD It_PRP was_VBD found_VBN that_IN fresh_JJ milk_NN samples_NNS give_VBP values_NNS much_RB below_IN 0.10_CD per_IN cent_NN dry_NN residue_NN in_IN a_DT large_JJ majority_NN of_IN cases_NNS and_CC the_DT average_JJ varies_NNS from_IN 0.060_CD to_TO 0.081_CD per_IN cent_NN ._.
There_EX was_VBD a_DT great_JJ variation_NN in_IN results_NNS obtained_VBN from_IN the_DT same_JJ class_NN of_IN animals_NNS on_IN different_JJ days_NNS and_CC hence_NN it_PRP was_VBD not_RB possible_JJ to_TO differentiate_VB between_IN cow_NN and_CC buffalo_VB milk_NN from_IN individual_JJ figures_NNS ._.
It_PRP may_MD further_RB be_VB added_VBN that_IN the_DT studies_NNS reported_VBN here_RB were_VBD carried_VBN out_RP with_IN farm_NN produced_VBN milk_NN and_CC it_PRP is_VBZ quite_RB likely_JJ that_IN market_NN samples_NNS will_MD give_VB higher_JJR values_NNS for_IN dry_NN residue_NN than_IN those_DT recorded_VBN ._.
Compared_VBN to_TO raw_VB cow_NN and_CC buffalo_NN milk_NN ,_, milk_NN powder_NN solutions_NNS give_VBP much_JJ higher_JJR values_NNS ._.
The_DT average_NN for_IN spray_NN dried_VBD skim-_JJ milk_NN powder_NN was_VBD 0.34_CD per_IN cent_NN ._.
Tonning_VBG raw_JJ milk_NN invariably_RB gives_VBZ a_DT higher_JJR figure_NN ._.
When_WRB roller_NN dried_VBD milk_NN powders_NNS are_VBP used_VBN tonning_NN can_MD be_VB detected_VBN without_IN any_DT difficulty_NN as_IN the_DT percentage_NN of_IN dry_JJ residue_JJ increases_NNS from_IN less_JJR than_IN 0.05_CD per_IN cent_NN to_TO nearly_RB 0.5_CD per_IN cent_NN ._.
When_WRB spray_NN dried_VBD powder_NN is_VBZ used_VBN the_DT percentage_NN of_IN dry_JJ residue_NN does_VBZ increase_VB but_CC the_DT demarca-_JJ tion_NN is_VBZ not_RB so_RB sharp_JJ ._.
For_IN guidance_NN it_PRP is_VBZ suggested_VBN that_IN if_IN the_DT percentage_NN of_IN residue_NN is_VBZ greater_JJR than_IN 0.11_CD per_IN cent_NN the_DT possibility_NN of_IN the_DT sample_NN being_VBG tonned_VBN may_MD be_VB tentatively_RB assumed_VBN and_CC confirmed_VBN by_IN the_DT following_VBG further_JJ tests_NNS :_: (_( a_DT )_) The_DT dry_JJ residue_NN may_MD be_VB estimated_VBN on_IN the_DT sample_NN after_IN it_PRP has_VBZ been_VBN boiled_VBN ._.
It_PRP has_VBZ been_VBN found_VBN that_IN milk_NN samples_NNS give_VBP a_DT higher_JJR percentage_NN of_IN residue_NN after_IN boiling_VBG ._.
On_IN the_DT contrary_JJ tonned_VBD milk_NN (_( as_RB well_RB as_IN spray_NN dried_VBD skim_JJ milk_NN powder_NN )_) shows_VBZ the_DT reverse_NN ,_, i.e._FW ,_, on_IN boiling_VBG the_DT amount_NN of_IN residue_JJ usually_RB decreases_VBZ ,_, probably_RB due_JJ to_TO the_DT fact_NN that_IN on_IN boiling_VBG some_DT more_JJR of_IN the_DT residue_NN goes_VBZ into_IN solution_NN ._.
(_( b_NN )_) The_DT dry_JJ residue_NN is_VBZ subjected_VBN to_TO the_DT xantho-protein_JJ reaction_NN ._.
The_DT residue_NN is_VBZ dissolved_VBN in_IN 2-5_JJ ml_NN ._.
concentrated_VBN nitric_JJ acid_NN ,_, diluted_VBN with_IN 5_CD ml_NNS ._.
of_IN water_NN and_CC then_RB 2.5_CD ml_NNS ._.
liquor_NN ammonia_NN added_VBD ._.
It_PRP was_VBD observed_VBN that_IN the_DT residue_NN from_IN pure_JJ milk_NN gives_VBZ a_DT solution_NN with_IN a_DT yellow_JJ colour_NN ,_, milk_NN powder_NN residue_JJ gives_VBZ a_DT deep_JJ orange_NN solution_NN ,_, while_IN tonned_VBN milk_NN samples_NNS give_VBP a_DT colour_NN varying_VBG from_IN light_JJ orange_NN to_TO orange_NN ._.
The_DT results_NNS are_VBP given_VBN in_IN Table_NNP XI_NNP ._.
132_CD Detection_NN of_IN Adulteration_NNP of_IN Milk_NNP with_IN Milk_NNP Powder_NNP TABLE_NNP XI_NNP Xanthoprotein_NNP reaction_NN with_IN dry_JJ residue_JJ Serial_NNP No_NNP ._.
Buffalo_NNP milk_NN tonned_VBN with_IN spray_NN dried_VBN skim-milk_JJ powder_NN Cow_NNP milk_NN tonned_VBN with_IN spray_NN dried_VBD skim-_JJ milk_NN powder_NN Raw_NNP samples_VBZ Boiled_NNP samples_NNS Raw_NNP samples_NNS Boiled_VBD samples_NNS Original_NNP Tonned_NNP Milk_NNP powder_NN milk_NN used_VBN for_IN tonning_VBG Original_NNP Tonned_NNP Milk_NNP powder_NN milk_NN used_VBN for_IN tonning_VBG Original_NNP Tonned_NNP Original_NNP Tonned_VBD 1_CD Y_NNP +_NNP +_NNP +_NNP +_NNP +_NNP +_NNP +_NNP +_NNP +_NNP +_NNP +_NNP +_NNP +_NNP +_NNP +_NNP +_NNP +_NNP +_NNP +_NNP +_NNP +_NNP +_NNP +_VBD 2_CD Y_NNP +_NNP +_NNP +_NNP +_NNP +_NNP Y_NNP +_NNP +_NNP +_NNP +_NNP +_NNP +_NNP +_NNP Y_NNP +_NNP +_NNP +_NNP Y_NNP +_NNP -I-_VBD 3_CD Y_NNP +_NNP +_NNP +_NNP +_NNP +_NNP K._NNP N._NNP SHAMA_NNP SASTRY_NNP AND_NNP NOSHIR_NNP N._NNP DASTUR_NNP 133_CD (_( iv_NN )_) Other_JJ tests_NNS tried.Besides_IN the_DT ones_NNS indicated_VBN above_IN ,_, original_JJ and_CC tonned_JJ milk_NN samples_NNS were_VBD subjected_VBN to_TO the_DT following_JJ tests_NNS :_: a_DT ._.
Freezing_VBG point_NN determination_NN b_NN ._.
Microscopic_NNP study_NN c._VBD Methylene_NNP blue_JJ reduction_NN test_NN d._NN Resazurin_NNP test_NN ,_, and_CC e._JJ Estimation_NNP of_IN total_JJ minerals_NNS None_NN of_IN these_DT tests_NNS helped_VBD to_TO clearly_RB differentiate_VB between_IN various_JJ samples_NNS of_IN milk_NN and_CC hence_NN detailed_JJ results_NNS are_VBP not_RB given_VBN here_RB ._.
SUMMARY_NNP The_DT following_JJ nine_CD methods_NNS were_VBD tried_VBN for_IN differentiating_VBG genuine_JJ milk_NN from_IN tonned_VBN milk_NN :_: (_( 1_CD )_) Stability_NN to_TO heat_VB (_( 2_CD )_) Coagulation_NN with_IN rennet_NN after_IN dilution_NN with_IN water_NN (_( 3_CD )_) Estimation_NN of_IN dry_JJ residue_NN (_( 4_CD )_) Xanthoprotein_FW reaction_NN with_IN dry_JJ residue_NN (_( 5_CD )_) Freezing_VBG point_NN (_( 6_CD )_) Microscopic_NNP study_NN (_( 7_CD )_) Methylene_NNP blue_JJ reduction_NN test_NN (_( 8_CD )_) Resazurin_NNP test_NN ,_, and_CC (_( 9_CD )_) Estimation_NN of_IN total_JJ minerals_NNS Studies_NNS have_VBP been_VBN carried_VBN out_RP using_VBG spray_JJ dried_VBN skim-milk_JJ powder_NN ,_, roller_NN dried_VBD skim-milk_JJ powder_NN and_CC roller_NN dried_VBD whole_JJ milk_NN powder_NN ._.
Amongst_IN the_DT tests_NNS tried_VBD microscopic_NN study_NN ,_, methylene_NN blue_JJ test_NN ,_, resazurin_JJ test_NN ,_, freezing_VBG point_NN and_CC estimation_NN of_IN total_JJ minerals_NNS have_VBP proved_VBN of_IN little_JJ value_NN ._.
The_DT odour_NN of_IN samples_NNS after_IN incubation_NN for_IN four_CD hours_NNS at_IN 37°C_CD ._.
provides_VBZ the_DT simplest_NN and_CC a_DT very_RB reliable_JJ test_NN ._.
Incubation_NN is_VBZ carried_VBN out_RP after_IN adding_VBG a_DT drop_NN of_IN formalin_NN to_TO suppress_VB the_DT development_NN of_IN lactic_JJ acid_NN odour_NN ._.
This_DT test_NN can_MD be_VB done_VBN under_IN house-hold_JJ conditions_NNS ._.
The_DT rennet_NN test_NN after_IN diluting_VBG the_DT milk_NN sample_NN with_IN distilled_JJ water_NN is_VBZ another_DT simple_JJ test_NN and_CC the_DT results_NNS can_MD be_VB obtained_VBN in_IN a_DT short_JJ time_NN ._.
Tonned_VBN milk_NN takes_VBZ a_DT much_RB longer_JJR time_NN to_TO coagulate_VB ._.
Cow_NNP and_CC buffalo_VB milk_NN are_VBP found_VBN to_TO differ_VB to_TO some_DT extent_NN in_IN their_PRP$ behaviour_NN towards_NNS rennet_NN ._.
Cow_NNP milk_NN takes_VBZ a_DT longer_JJR time_NN and_CC also_RB the_DT time_NN of_IN coagulation_NN markedly_RB increases_VBZ on_IN dilution_NN with_IN water_NN ._.
The_DT estimation_NN of_IN dry_JJ residue_NN is_VBZ another_DT test_NN which_WDT will_MD prove_VB useful_JJ ._.
It_PRP is_VBZ likely_JJ that_IN the_DT figures_NNS for_IN dry_JJ residue_NN obtained_VBN in_IN the_DT present_JJ studies_NNS may_MD require_VB some_DT modification_NN when_WRB working_VBG with_IN market_NN samples_NNS ._.
The_DT results_NNS of_IN this_DT test_NN are_VBP further_RB confirmed_VBN by_IN the_DT xanthoprotein_NNP reaction_NN with_IN the_DT dry_JJ residue_NN ._.
Pure_NNP milk_NN gives_VBZ a_DT yellowish_JJ coloured_JJ solution_NN ,_, whilst_NN tonned_VBD milk_NN samples_NNS give_VBP an_DT orange_NN colour_NN ._.
ACKNOWLEDGEMENT_IN The_DT authors_NNS wish_VBP to_TO express_VB their_PRP$ thanks_NNS to_TO the_DT Imperial_NNP Council_NNP of_IN Agricultural_NNP Research_NNP for_IN giving_VBG special_JJ grants_NNS to_TO complete_VB these_DT studies_NNS ._.
STUDIES_NN ON_NNP THE_NNP HAEMOTOLOGY_NNP OF_NNP DOGS_NNP IN_NNP HEALTH_NNP AND_NNP WHEN_NNP INJEC-_NNP TED_NNP WITH_NNP BABESIA_NNP GIBSONI_NNP (_( PATTON_NNP 1910_CD )_) By_IN B._NNP M._NNP PRASAD_NNP ,_, Imperial_NNP Veterinary_NNP Research_NNP Institute_NNP ,_, Mukteswar_NNP (_( Received_VBN for_IN publication_NN on_IN 14th_CD October_NNP 1946_CD )_) THE_NNP purpose_NN of_IN the_DT present_JJ investigation_NN was_VBD to_TO obtain_VB precise_JJ data_NNS on_IN the_DT total_JJ red_JJ and_CC white_JJ cell_NN counts_NNS ,_, the_DT differential_JJ white_JJ cell_NN counts_NNS and_CC the_DT haemoglobin_NN content_NN of_IN the_DT blood_NN of_IN dogs_NNS in_IN health_NN and_CC when_WRB suffering_VBG from_IN piroplasmosis_NN due_JJ to_TO infection_NN with_IN Babesia_NNP gibsoni_NN ._.
MATERIAL_NNP AND_NNP METHODS_NNP Three_NNP healthy_JJ pariah_NN dogs_NNS were_VBD used_VBN ._.
To_TO obtain_VB the_DT normal_JJ blood_NN picture_NN ,_, seventeen_JJ counts_NNS were_VBD made_VBN on_IN ten_JJ other_JJ healthy_JJ dogs_NNS and_CC the_DT results_NNS obtained_VBD were_VBD more_RBR or_CC less_RBR in_IN agreement_NN with_IN those_DT obtained_VBN with_IN the_DT three_CD original_JJ dogs_NNS at_IN different_JJ periods_NNS prior_RB to_TO infective_JJ inoculation_NN ._.
The_DT dogs_NNS were_VBD obtained_VBN from_IN Almora_NNP in_IN the_DT Kumaon_NNP hills_NNS and_CC their_PRP$ age_NN ranged_VBN from_IN two_CD to_TO four_CD years_NNS and_CC body_NN weight_NN from_IN twentyfive_JJ to_TO thirty_VB pounds_NNS ._.
Two_CD of_IN the_DT three_CD animals_NNS were_VBD artificially_RB infected_VBN with_IN a_DT laboratory_NN strain_NN of_IN B._NNP gibsoni_NN and_CC the_DT other_JJ served_VBD as_IN a_DT control_NN ._.
Towards_IN the_DT close_NN of_IN the_DT experiment_NN this_DT dog_NN ,_, too_RB ,_, was_VBD given_VBN a_DT dose_NN of_IN infected_JJ blood_NN to_TO see_VB if_IN it_PRP was_VBD susceptible_JJ to_TO the_DT disease_NN and_CC a_DT fatal_JJ piroplasmosis_NN resulted_VBD ._.
The_DT injections_NNS were_VBD given_VBN subcutaneously_RB with_IN the_DT idea_NN that_IN the_DT disease_NN might_MD develop_VB as_IN under_IN natural_JJ conditions_NNS ;_: the_DT disease_NN is_VBZ known_VBN to_TO be_VB transmitted_VBN from_IN one_CD animal_NN to_TO another_DT by_IN the_DT tick_NN Haemaphysalis_NNP bispinosa_NN ._.
The_DT animals_NNS were_VBD housed_VBN together_RB and_CC kept_VB on_IN an_DT uniform_JJ diet_JJ consisting_NN of_IN ½_NNP lb_NN ._.
of_IN cooked_VBN beef_NN and_CC chapattis_NN given_VBN in_IN one_CD meal_NN in_IN the_DT afternoon_NN ;_: but_CC during_IN the_DT acute_JJ stage_NN of_IN the_DT disease_NN the_DT affected_JJ dogs_NNS refused_VBD solid_JJ food_NN and_CC were_VBD then_RB given_VBN either_CC milk_NN or_CC soup_NN ._.
The_DT shed_VBN was_VBD a_DT hundred_JJ yards_NNS from_IN the_DT laboratory_NN ,_, this_DT distance_NN was_VBD traversed_VBN twice_RB daily_RB by_IN the_DT dogs_NNS and_CC constituted_VBD their_PRP$ daily_JJ exercise_NN ._.
When_WRB the_DT illness_NN was_VBD advanced_VBN ,_, they_PRP were_VBD unfit_JJ to_TO walk_VB ,_, and_CC remained_VBD indoors_NNS with_IN the_DT control_NN animals_NNS ._.
Blood_NN samples_NNS were_VBD always_RB drawn_VBN at_IN the_DT fixed_JJ time_NN of_IN day_NN (_( 10_CD A.M._NNP )_) Both_NNP the_DT dogs_NNS took_VBD the_DT infection_NN and_CC it_PRP is_VBZ interesting_VBG to_TO note_VB that_IN while_IN in_IN one_CD ,_, the_DT disease_NN was_VBD fatal_JJ in_IN about_RB 16_CD days_NNS after_IN the_DT first_JJ appearance_NN of_IN the_DT parasites_NNS in_IN the_DT blood_NN ,_, in_IN the_DT other_JJ ,_, it_PRP was_VBD chronic_JJ and_CC the_DT animal_NN apparently_RB recovered_VBN ._.
All_DT samples_NNS of_IN blood_NN were_VBD collected_VBN from_IN the_DT marginal_JJ ear-vein_NN or_CC the_DT external_JJ Sephana_NNP vein_NN ,_, as_IN between_IN these_DT two_CD sites_NNS there_EX was_VBD no_DT difference_NN in_IN the_DT blood_NN picture_NN ._.
The_DT area_NN where_WRB the_DT puncture_NN was_VBD to_TO be_VB made_VBN was_VBD cleaned_VBN with_IN cotton_NN wool_NN and_CC alcohol_NN ,_, rubbing_VBG being_VBG continued_VBN for_IN about_RB one_CD minute_NN ._.
When_WRB the_DT alcohol_NN had_VBD evaporated_VBN ,_, a_DT puncture_NN was_VBD quickly_RB made_VBN with_IN a_DT thin_JJ sterilized_VBN hypodermic_JJ needle_NN and_CC after_IN rejecting_VBG the_DT first_JJ two_CD or_CC three_CD drops_NNS ,_, the_DT blood_NN was_VBD taken_VBN up_RP in_IN a_DT capillary_JJ pipette_NN direct_NN from_IN the_DT puncture_NN ._.
For_IN red_JJ cell_NN counts_VBZ the_DT blood_NN was_VBD diluted_VBN ._.
200_CD times_NNS in_IN a_DT potain_NN pipette_NN (_( 0.5136_CD Study_NNP on_IN the_DT Haematology_NNP of_IN Dogs_NNP in_IN Health_NNP was_VBD made_VBN and_CC the_DT first_JJ drop_NN that_WDT oozed_VBD out_RP without_IN squeezing_VBG was_VBD taken_VBN up_RP on_IN a_DT slide_NN and_CC spread_NN over_RB another_DT as_IN rapidly_RB and_CC uniformly_RB as_IN possible_JJ ._.
Giemsa_NNP stain_NN gave_VBD good_JJ results_NNS ._.
Immature_NNP cells_NNS of_IN lymphoblastic_JJ and_CC myeloblastic_JJ origin_NN were_VBD differentiated_VBN by_IN the_DT oxydase_NN reaction_NN in_IN freshly-_JJ prepared-blood_JJ smears_NNS ._.
For_IN this_DT purpose_NN the_DT method_NN recommended_VBN by_IN Piney_NNP [_NN 1931_CD ]_NN was_VBD generally_RB followed_VBN ._.
Films_NNS ,_, immediately_RB after_IN air-drying_JJ were_VBD put_VBN in_IN a_DT glass_NN stoppered_VBN jar_NN containing_VBG 2_CD per_IN cent_NN osmic_JJ acid_NN and_CC allowed_VBN to_TO stand_VB for_IN 30_CD seconds_NNS for_IN complete_JJ fixation_NN ._.
They_PRP were_VBD then_RB washed_VBN thoroughly_RB with_IN distilled_JJ water_NN and_CC stained_VBD for_IN 10_CD minutes_NNS with_IN a_DT mixture_NN of_IN equal_JJ parts_NNS of_IN 1_CD per_IN cent_NN solutions_NNS of_IN alpha-naphthol_NN and_CC paraphenylenediamine_NN ._.
They_PRP were_VBD then_RB washed_VBN in_IN distilled_JJ water_NN and_CC mounted_VBD without_IN drying_VBG in_IN water_NN glass_NN ,_, oxydase_NN granules_NNS being_VBG stained_VBN blue_NN ._.
For_IN the_DT actual_JJ content_NN of_IN the_DT leucocytes_NNS the_DT smears_NNS were_VBD mounted_VBN and_CC examined_VBN by_IN the_DT method_NN known_VBN as_IN the_DT 'Four_CD field_NN meander_NN ,_, technique_NN ,_, and_CC Arneth_NNP Index_NNP was_VBD taken_VBN for_IN neutrophiles_NNS ._.
EXPERIMENTAL_NN From_IN Table_JJ I_PRP it_PRP may_MD be_VB observed_VBN that_IN compared_VBN with_IN figures_NNS reported_VBN by_IN various_JJ workers_NNS else-_JJ where_WRB the_DT average_JJ erythrocyte_JJ count_NN per_IN c.mm_NN ._.
of_IN blood_NN in_IN the_DT experimental_JJ dogs_NNS is_VBZ within_IN the_DT normal_JJ range_NN of_IN variation_NN ._.

6_CD 81.1_CD 12.6_CD 5.7_CD 4.5_CD 18.3_CD 23.0_CD 12.5_CD 2.6_CD 61.3_CD 23.0_CD 9.6_CD 5.2_CD 0.3_CD 14-5_JJ to_TO 26-5_JJ ._.
7_CD 81.1_CD 12.2_CD 6.1_CD 4.2_CD 15.3_CD 23.0_CD 13.1_CD 2.0_CD 61.4_CD 22.3_CD 10.0_CD 6.3_CD 0.1_CD N.B.138_NNP Study_NNP on_IN the_DT Haematology_NNP of_IN Dogs_NNP in_IN Health_NNP SUMMARY_NNP This_DT paper_NN records_VBZ the_DT results_NNS of_IN studies_NNS made_VBN to_TO determine_VB the_DT total_JJ red_JJ and_CC white_JJ cell_NN counts_NNS ,_, the_DT differential_JJ white_JJ cell_NN counts_NNS ,_, and_CC the_DT haemoglobin_NN content_NN of_IN the_DT blood_NN of_IN dogs_NNS during_IN health_NN and_CC during_IN piroplasmosis_NN (_( B._NNP gibsoni_NNP infection_NN )_) of_IN there_EX apparently_RB healthy_JJ dogs_NNS between_IN two_CD to_TO four_CD years_NNS of_IN age_NN ,_, two_CD of_IN which_WDT were_VBD infected_VBN artificially_RB with_IN the_DT parasites_NNS and_CC the_DT third_NN was_VBD used_VBN as_IN a_DT control_NN ._.
Morphological_JJ studies_NNS and_CC haemoglobin_JJ estimations_NNS were_VBD made_VBN of_IN the_DT blood_NN of_IN these_DT animals_NNS before_IN infection_NN and_CC also_RB during_IN the_DT disease_NN ._.
In_IN the_DT two_CD infected_JJ dogs_NNS the_DT readings_NNS did_VBD not_RB change_VB significantly_RB during_IN the_DT incubation_NN period_NN ._.
For_IN comparative_JJ purposes_NNS seventeen_VBP (_( 17_CD )_) counts_NNS were_VBD made_VBN on_IN the_DT blood_NN of_IN 10_CD apparently_RB healthy_JJ pariah_JJ dogs_NNS with_IN results_NNS similar_JJ to_TO those_DT obtained_VBN in_IN the_DT case_NN of_IN the_DT experimental_JJ dogs_NNS before_IN infec-_JJ tion_NN was_VBD established_VBN ._.
In_IN the_DT two_CD infected_JJ dogs_NNS the_DT red_JJ cell_NN count_NN fell_VBD to_TO about_IN one_CD million_CD per_IN c.mm_NN ._.
during_IN the_DT disease_NN ._.
The_DT white_JJ cell_NN count_NN increased_VBD to_TO a_DT peak_NN at_IN nearly_RB 80,000_CD per_IN c.mm_NN ._.
and_CC this_DT was_VBD followed_VBN by_IN a_DT gradual_JJ decrease_NN to_TO almost_RB normal_JJ level_NN ,_, irrespective_NN of_IN whether_IN the_DT disease_NN ended_VBN in_IN death_NN or_CC recovery_NN ._.
The_DT differential_JJ white_JJ cell_NN count_NN showed_VBD during_IN a_DT period_NN of_IN marked_JJ leucocytosis_NN a_DT mild_JJ neutrophilia_NN ,_, slight_JJ lymphopenia_NN ,_, eosinopenia_NN ,_, and_CC a_DT shift_NN to_TO the_DT left_NN of_IN the_DT neutrophiles_NNS and_CC this_DT was_VBD followed_VBN by_IN a_DT moderate_JJ monocytosis_NN ._.
During_IN the_DT disease_NN the_DT average_JJ haemoglobin_JJ content_NN dropped_VBD to_TO 12.5_CD per_IN cent_NN from_IN normal_JJ ._.
The_DT outstanding_JJ features_NNS of_IN B._NNP gibsoni_JJ infection_NN in_IN dogs_NNS are_VBP the_DT decrease_NN in_IN total_JJ red_JJ cell_NN count_NN and_CC the_DT marked_JJ fall_NN in_IN haemoglobin_NN due_JJ to_TO a_DT certain_JJ extent_NN to_TO rapid_JJ destruction_NN of_IN the_DT red_JJ cells_NNS ,_, but_CC more_JJR to_TO the_DT failure_NN of_IN formative_JJ tissues_NNS ._.
ACKNOWLEDGEMENT_NNP My_NNP thanks_NNS are_VBP due_JJ to_TO Dr_NNP F._NNP C._NNP Minett_NNP for_IN examining_VBG and_CC correcting_VBG the_DT paper_NN ._.

Recent_JJ advances_NNS in_IN haematology_NN ,_, 2nd_CD Ed._NNP ,_, J._NNP R._NNP Churchill_NNP ,_, London_NNP STUDY_NNP ON_NNP THE_NNP VITAMIN_NNP A_NNP ACTIVITY_NNP OF_NNP CAROTENE_NNP IN_NNP GREEN_NNP FODDER_NNP By_IN B._NNP C._NNP ROY_NNP SARKAR_NNP and_CC K._NNP C._NNP SEN_NNP ,_, Imperial_NNP Veterinary_NNP Research_NNP Institute_NNP ,_, Izatnagar_NNP ,_, and_CC Imperial_NNP Dairy_NNP Research_NNP Institute_NNP ,_, Bangalore_NNP ,_, India_NNP (_( Reprinted_VBN from_IN Journal_NNP of_IN Agricultural_NNP Science_NNP ,_, Vol_NNP ._.
36_CD ,_, Part_NNP 2_CD ,_, April_NNP 1946_CD )_) IN_NNP some_DT recent_JJ papers_NNS ,_, Seshan_NNP and_CC Sen_NNP (_( 1942_CD a.b.c.d_NN )_) described_VBD a_DT modified_JJ technique_NN for_IN extracting_VBG carotene_NN from_IN different_JJ feeding_VBG stuffs_NNS and_CC utilized_VBD it_PRP for_IN the_DT study_NN of_IN carotene_NN in_IN plants_NNS including_VBG some_DT balance_NN experiments_NNS with_IN ruminants_NNS ._.
It_PRP was_VBD pointed_VBN out_RP by_IN the_DT authors_NNS that_IN the_DT term_NN carotene_NN was_VBD used_VBN in_IN the_DT ordinary_JJ sense_NN denoting_VBG the_DT epiphasic_JJ pigment_NN ,_, and_CC no_DT chromatographic_JJ study_NN was_VBD made_VBN of_IN the_DT time_NN ._.
As_IN such_JJ ,_, the_DT carotene_NN figures_NNS for_IN materials_NNS like_IN old_JJ stored_VBN hay_NN straw_NN ,_, silage_NN and_CC cattle_NNS faeces_NNS were_VBD liable_JJ to_TO revision_NN because_IN of_IN the_DT production_NN of_IN non-carotene_JJ pigments_NNS not_RB removable_JJ by_IN phase_NN separation_NN with_IN 90_CD per_IN cent_NN methyl_NN alcohol_NN used_VBN in_IN the_DT method_NN ,_, but_CC it_PRP was_VBD felt_VBN that_IN no_DT sub-_JJ stantial_JJ error_NN was_VBD likely_JJ to_TO be_VB caused_VBN in_IN the_DT case_NN of_IN green_JJ fodders_NNS ._.
It_PRP was_VBD ,_, however_RB ,_, decided_VBD to_TO check_VB up_RP the_DT method_NN by_IN simultaneously_RB carrying_VBG out_RP a_DT biological_JJ and_CC chromatographic_JJ assay_NN of_IN the_DT carotene_NN contained_VBN in_IN the_DT feeding_NN stuffs_NNS ._.
The_DT results_NNS obtained_VBD are_VBP being_VBG presented_VBN below_IN ,_, and_CC based_VBN on_IN these_DT ,_, the_DT Seshan-Sen_NNP method_NN of_IN extraction_NN of_IN carotene_NN has_VBZ been_VBN combined_VBN with_IN chromatographic_JJ adsorption_NN for_IN the_DT routine_JJ analysis_NN of_IN vitamin_JJ A-active_JJ carotene_NN in_IN feeding_VBG stuffs_NNS ._.
While_IN these_DT data_NNS were_VBD being_VBG written_VBN up_RP ,_, Austin_NNP and_CC Shipton_NNP [_NNP 1944_CD ]_NNP published_VBD a_DT critical_JJ examination_NN of_IN the_DT methods_NNS of_IN determin-_JJ ing_VBG carotene_NN and_CC came_VBD to_TO the_DT conclusion_NN that_IN ,_, of_IN the_DT variety_NN of_IN methods_NNS designed_VBN for_IN the_DT extraction_NN of_IN carotene_NN ,_, that_IN proposed_VBN by_IN Seshen_NNP and_CC Sen_NNP was_VBD the_DT most_RBS satisfactory_JJ ,_, being_VBG decidedly_RB more_RBR efficient_JJ and_CC more_RBR widely_RB applicable_JJ than_IN the_DT process_NN recommended_VBN by_IN Peterson_NNP ,_, Hughes_NNP and_CC Freeman_NNP [_NNP 1937_CD ]_NNP ._.
Austin_NNP and_CC Shipton_NNP have_VBP suggested_VBN the_DT use_NN of_IN 'heavy_NNP '_POS magnesia_NN for_IN the_DT chromatographic_JJ separation_NN of_IN non-carotene_JJ pigments_NNS in_IN conjunction_NN with_IN slightly_RB modified_VBN Seshan-Sen_NNP method_NN of_IN extraction_NN ._.
Although_IN a_DT fair_JJ amount_NN of_IN work_NN has_VBZ been_VBN done_VBN by_IN different_JJ investigators_NNS on_IN the_DT determination_NN of_IN carotene_NN for_IN evaluating_VBG theoretically_RB the_DT vitamin_NN A_NNP potency_NN of_IN stock_NN feeds_NNS ,_, there_EX are_VBP comparatively_RB few_JJ data_NNS on_IN the_DT relation_NN between_IN the_DT carotene_NN content_NN and_CC the_DT vitamin_NN A_NNP potency_NN of_IN those_DT materials_NNS as_IN measured_VBN biologically_RB ._.
Woods_NNS ,_, Shaw_NNP ,_, Atkeson_NNP and_CC Johnson_NNP (_( 1932_CD )_) ,_, Woods_NNP ,_, Atkeson_NNP ,_, Wellhonsen_NNP and_CC Johnson_NNP (_( 1935a_CD )_) ,_, Woods_NNP ,_, Atkeson_NNP ,_, Shaw_NNP ,_, Slater_NNP and_CC Johnson_NNP (_( 1935b_CD )_) ,_, Woods_NNP ,_, Atkeson_NNP ,_, Slater_NNP ,_, Arndt_NNP ,_, and_CC Johnson_NNP (_( 1935c_CD )_) and_CC Archibald_NNP ,_, Bennett_NNP and_CC Pitchie_NNP (_( 1943_CD )_) determined_VBD the_DT biological_JJ potency_NN of_IN certain_JJ grasses_NNS ,_, but_CC their_PRP$ carotene_NN content_NN was_VBD not_RB simultaneously_RB estimated_VBN ._.
The_DT work_NN of_IN Taylore_NNP ,_, Russell_NNP and_CC Bender_NNP (_( 1939_CD )_) on_IN the_DT carotene_NN content_NN and_CC vitamin_VB A_NNP potency_NN of_IN different_JJ types_NNS of_IN silage_NN ,_, and_CC that_IN of_IN Hodgson_NNP ,_, Murer_NNP and_CC Knott_NNP [_NNP 1939_CD ]_NN on_IN green_JJ ,_, dehydrated_VBN and_CC sun_JJ cured_VBD pea_NN vines_NNS and_CC pea_JJ vine_NN silage_NN ,_, etc._FW ,_, may_MD also_RB be_VB mentioned_VBN ,_, although_IN some_DT of_IN the_DT results_NNS obtained_VBD are_VBP of_IN questionable_JJ value_NN ._.
In_IN the_DT case_NN of_IN green_JJ vegetables_NNS and_CC other_JJ plant_NN foods_NNS ,_, some_DT work_NN by_IN different_JJ workers_NNS is_VBZ on_IN record_NN ._.

(_( 4_CD )_) Relative_JJ efficiency_NN of_IN the_DT standard_JJ carotene_NN and_CC preformed_VBD vitamin_FW A_NNP This_DT was_VBD studied_VBN essentially_RB by_IN assaying_VBG the_DT standard_JJ carotene_NN ,_, which_WDT has_VBZ been_VBN shown_VBN to_TO be_VB quite_RB as_RB potent_NN as_IN the_DT green_JJ fodder_NN carotene_NN ,_, against_IN cod-liver_JJ oil_NN ,_, standardized_VBN by_IN the_DT spectrographic_JJ method_NN [_NNP Coward_NNP ,_, 1938_CD ]_NN ._.

TECHNIQUE_NN is_VBZ given_VBN of_IN preparation_NN and_CC dosage_NN of_IN a_DT modified_JJ Waldmann_NNP 's_POS vaccine_NN ._.
Production_NN is_VBZ in_IN three_CD stages_NNS ,_, (_( a_DT )_) preparation_NN of_IN virus_NN ,_, (_( b_NN )_) preparation_NN of_IN aluminium_NN hydroxide_NN solution_NN ,_, (_( c_NN )_) facture_NN of_IN vaccine_NN ._.
(_( a_DT )_) Infective_JJ epithelium_NN from_IN guinea_NN pigs_NNS is_VBZ ground_NN finely_RB in_IN buffer_NN solution_NN pH_NN 7.6_CD and_CC paper_NN filtered_VBN ._.
The_DT filtrate_NN is_VBZ diffused_VBN under_IN the_DT dorsal_NN lingual_JJ epithelium_NN of_IN susceptible_JJ cattle_NNS ._.
After_IN 24_CD hours_NNS the_DT whole_JJ epithelium_NN over_IN the_DT inoculated_JJ area_NN is_VBZ pelled_VBN off_RB and_CC placed_VBD in_IN a_DT freezer_NN ._.
When_WRB frozen_JJ solid_NN ,_, it_PRP is_VBZ passed_VBN through_IN a_DT fine_JJ meat_NN grinder_NN ,_, freshly_RB distilled_JJ water_NN is_VBZ added_VBN in_IN amount_NN of_IN three_CD to_TO one_CD ,_, and_CC the_DT mixture_NN centrifuged_VBN at_IN 1500_CD r.p.m_NN ._.
for_IN 5_CD minutes_NNS ._.
After_IN drawing_VBG off_RP the_DT super-_JJ natant_NN ,_, distilled_JJ water_NN equal_JJ to_TO four_CD times_NNS the_DT original_JJ amount_NN of_IN epithelium_NN is_VBZ added_VBN to_TO the_DT sediment_NN and_CC the_DT mixture_NN is_VBZ ground_NN ._.
This_DT process_NN is_VBZ repeated_VBN once_RB ._.
The_DT resulting_VBG solution_NN of_IN virus_NN in_IN the_DT amount_NN of_IN eleven_JJ times_NNS the_DT quantity_NN of_IN original_JJ epithelium_NN is_VBZ passed_VBN through_IN Seitz_NNP Filters_NNP ,_, first_RB size_NN 5_CD and_CC then_RB size_NN 6_CD ._.
(_( b_NN )_) To_TO prepare_VB 20_CD litres_NNS of_IN hydroxide_JJ solution_NN ,_, (_( 1_CD )_) 20_CD litres_NNS of_IN water_NN are_VBP warmed_VBN to_TO 63°C_CD ._.
and_CC 880_CD gm_NN ._.
of_IN ammonium_NN sulphate_NN added_VBD ._.
(_( 2_CD )_) 1500_CD gm_NN ._.
of_IN aluminium_NN ammonium_NN sulphate_NN are_VBP dissolved_VBN in_IN 4_CD litres_NNS of_IN water_NN ._.
(_( 3_CD )_) Solutions_NNS of_IN steps_NNS (_( 1_CD )_) and_CC (_( 2_CD )_) are_VBP mixed_JJ and_CC 2_CD litres_NNS of_IN cold_JJ ammonia_NN added_VBD ._.

and_CC the_DT fluid_NN drawn_NN off_IN ._.

Such_JJ low-_JJ grade_NN enzootics_NNS are_VBP seen_VBN in_IN nearly_RB all_DT Indian_JJ farms_NNS and_CC many_JJ villages_NNS of_IN the_DT peninsula_NN and_CC usually_RB produce_VBP an_DT unending_JJ trickle_NN of_IN abortions_NNS of_IN 1_CD to_TO 5_CD per_IN cent_NN in_IN the_DT year_NN ._.

1_CD )_) reveals_VBZ a_DT curious_JJ position_NN ._.

TABLE_NNP II_NNP Above_NNP average_JJ abortion_NN rates_NNS occurring_VBG in_IN the_DT wetter_NN Military_JJ Farms_NNS 150_CD Brucellosis_NNP in_IN India_NNP SUSCEPTIBILITY_NNP Inextricably_NNP entangled_VBD as_IN it_PRP is_VBZ with_IN many_JJ little-understood_JJ features_NNS of_IN disease_NN transmission_NN ,_, susceptibility_NN per_IN se_NN is_VBZ an_DT imponderable_JJ attribute_NN ._.

18*_CD 2*_CD 11.1_CD 152_CD Brucellosis_NN in_IN India_NNP It_PRP must_MD be_VB noted_VBN that_IN all_PDT the_DT animals_NNS considered_VBN in_IN the_DT foregoing_NN sketch_NN are_VBP kept_VBN in_IN somewhat_RB similar_JJ conditions_NNS and_CC that_DT their_PRP$ standards_NNS of_IN life_NN are_VBP good_JJ ,_, many_JJ of_IN the_DT pure-bred_JJ zebu_NN herds_NNS in_IN particular_JJ living_NN under_IN semi-ranch_JJ conditions_NNS in_IN a_DT favourable_JJ climate_NN ._.
But_CC severe_JJ epidemics_NNS of_IN abortion_NN can_MD occur_VB ,_, even_RB in_IN non-cohabiting_JJ zebu_NN situated_VBN in_IN good_JJ climates_NNS ._.
Tables_NNS IX_NNP and_CC X_NNP give_VBP data_NNS of_IN one_CD such_JJ outbreak_NN ._.
Ninety-five_JJ per_IN cent_NN of_IN the_DT aborted_JJ animals_NNS on_IN this_DT farm_NN were_VBD Brucella-_NNP positive_JJ and_CC if_IN the_DT annual_JJ abortion_NN rate_NN during_IN the_DT period_NN of_IN this_DT epidemic_JJ be_VB assessed_VBN at_IN 25_CD per_IN cent_NN J_NNP ._.
B._NNP POLDING_NNP 153_CD India_NNP ,_, where_WRB brucellosis_NN is_VBZ common_JJ in_IN village_JJ cattle_NNS ._.
Thus_RB ,_, of_IN 405_CD sheep_NN and_CC goats_NNS bled_VBD in_IN 15_CD towns_NNS of_IN south_JJ India_NNP ,_, 11_CD (_( 2.5_CD per_IN cent_NN )_) were_VBD positive_JJ :_: of_IN 250_CD tested_VBN in_IN 11_CD towns_NNS of_IN north_JJ India_NNP ,_, none_NN was_VBD positive_JJ ._.
DISSEMINATION_NNP The_DT channels_NNS by_IN which_WDT Brucella_NNP leave_NN and_CC re-enter_VB their_PRP$ host_NN are_VBP well_RB known_VBN ._.
The_DT point_NN to_TO be_VB noted_VBN is_VBZ that_IN ,_, although_IN these_DT parasites_NNS are_VBP considered_VBN obligatory_JJ ,_, in_IN favourable_JJ circumstances_NNS they_PRP will_MD survive_VB outside_IN the_DT host_NN and_CC be_VB available_JJ for_IN dissemination_NN ._.
In_IN this_DT part_NN of_IN the_DT paper_NN an_DT at-_JJ tempt_NN is_VBZ made_VBN to_TO indicate_VB the_DT conditions_NNS governing_VBG this_DT dissemination_NN in_IN a_DT continent_NN ,_, where_WRB extreme_JJ cases_NNS give_VBP opportunities_NNS for_IN comparison_NN not_RB often_RB seen_VBN elsewhere_RB ._.
Throughout_IN north-west_JJ India_NNP ,_, there_EX is_VBZ daily_JJ scorching_VBG sunshine_NN from_IN April_NNP to_TO October_NNP ,_, natural_JJ shade_NN is_VBZ rare_JJ ,_, and_CC the_DT total_JJ annual_JJ rainfall_NN is_VBZ one_CD inch_NN or_CC less_JJR ._.
In_IN the_DT south_NN ,_, conditions_NNS are_VBP the_DT converse_NN ,_, temperatures_NNS vary_VBP little_JJ around_IN blood_NN heat_NN ,_, the_DT atmosphere_NN and_CC land_NN surface_NN are_VBP moist_JJ ,_, while_IN natural_JJ shade_NN is_VBZ everywhere_RB more_RBR com-_JJ mon_NN and_CC for_IN fairly_RB long_JJ periods_NNS the_DT sky_NN is_VBZ overcast_RB ._.
However_RB ,_, this_DT survey_NN has_VBZ shown_VBN that_IN brucellosis_NN is_VBZ enzootic_JJ in_IN the_DT south_NN and_CC rare_NN in_IN the_DT north-west_JJ ._.
The_DT inference_NN is_VBZ that_IN sunshine_NN and_CC dryness_NN are_VBP inimical_JJ to_TO Brucella_NNP ,_, or_CC conversely_RB that_IN equable_JJ temperatures_NNS ,_, humidity_NN and_CC shade_VB favour_VBP their_PRP$ sur-_JJ vival_NN ._.
Certain_NNP less_CC general_JJ observations_NNS support_NN this_DT premise_NN ._.
Earlier_RBR in_IN this_DT paper_NN ,_, the_DT decrease_NN of_IN brucellosis_NN on_IN the_DT Punjab_NNP grantee_NN farms_NNS was_VBD noted_VBN ._.
These_DT farms_NNS lie_VBP in_IN a_DT semi-desert_JJ tract_NN and_CC for_IN the_DT most_JJS part_NN their_PRP$ indigenous_JJ stock_NN live_NN and_CC calve_VB out-of-doors_NNS ._.
It_PRP is_VBZ possible_JJ that_IN this_DT is_VBZ an_DT example_NN of_IN self-elimination_NN of_IN brucellosis_NN due_JJ to_TO animals_NNS living_VBG in_IN dry_JJ ,_, sun-lit_JJ surroundings_NNS ._.
By_IN contrast_NN ,_, there_EX are_VBP three_CD farms_NNS in_IN Assam_NNP ,_, a_DT region_NN enduring_VBG a_DT heavy_JJ and_CC protracted_JJ monsoon_NN and_CC lying_VBG within_IN the_DT bi-seasonal_JJ rainbelt_NN ._.
The_DT animals_NNS of_IN these_DT farms_NNS are_VBP similar_JJ in_IN type_NN and_CC origin_NN to_TO those_DT of_IN the_DT grantee_NN herds_NNS ,_, yet_RB in_IN 1941_CD the_DT incidence_NN of_IN reactors_NNS amongst_VBP them_PRP was_VBD 20_CD per_IN cent_NN ,_, whilst_VBP their_PRP$ abortion_NN rate_NN varied_VBD from_IN 2_CD to_TO 6_CD per_IN cent_NN per_IN annum_NN ._.
In_IN another_DT indigenous_JJ herd_NN of_IN the_DT Punjab_NNP (_( farm_NN I_PRP )_) ,_, the_DT mean_JJ annual_JJ abortion_NN rate_NN during_IN the_DT climatically_RB normal_JJ period_NN 1930-1935_CD was_VBD 1.27_CD per_IN cent_NN of_IN several_JJ thousand_CD pregnancies_NNS ,_, while_IN during_IN the_DT entirely_RB rainless_JJ period_NN 1936-1939_CD the_DT rate_NN was_VBD only_RB 0.66_CD per_IN cent_NN ._.
Here_RB ,_, another_DT important_JJ consideration_NN arises_NNS ,_, for_IN during_IN the_DT rainless_NN years_NNS the_DT stock_NN could_MD not_RB be_VB grazed_VBN but_CC had_VBD to_TO be_VB stall-_JJ fed_VBN in_IN congested_JJ corrals_NNS ._.
The_DT result_NN of_IN this_DT over-crowding_NN was_VBD a_DT severe_JJ epidemic_NN of_IN tuberculosis_NN ._.
It_PRP appears_VBZ ,_, therefore_RB ,_, that_IN conditions_NNS of_IN congestion_NN ,_, sufficient_NN to_TO produce_VB an_DT air-borne_JJ respiratory_NN infection_NN due_JJ to_TO a_DT relatively_RB resistant_JJ organism_NN ,_, resulted_VBD in_IN a_DT decrease_NN of_IN Brucella_NNP infection_NN during_IN a_DT period_NN of_IN constant_JJ sunshine_NN and_CC extreme_JJ dryness_NN ._.
Thus_RB congestion_NN as_IN a_DT factor_NN in_IN the_DT spread_NN of_IN bru-_JJ cellosis_NN may_MD be_VB secondary_JJ to_TO excess_VB of_IN sunlight_NN ._.
In_IN contradistinction_NN to_TO these_DT observations_NNS in_IN the_DT classical_JJ outbreak_NN noted_VBD in_IN Tables_NNP IX_NNP and_CC X_NNP (_( farm_JJ 2_CD )_) ._.
Here_RB again_RB atmospheric_JJ humidity_NN was_VBD negligible_JJ and_CC sunlight_NN was_VBD more_RBR or_CC less_RBR conti-_JJ nuous_JJ ._.
Congestion_NN also_RB was_VBD extreme_JJ ,_, the_DT animals_NNS never_RB being_VBG out_IN of_IN the_DT farm_NN compound_NN ._.
The_DT contradictory_JJ results_NNS of_IN farms_NNS 1_CD and_CC 2_CD may_MD perhaps_RB be_VB explained_VBN on_IN the_DT grounds_NNS of_IN hygienic_JJ condi-_JJ tions_NNS ._.
On_IN farm_NN 1_CD ,_, aborting_VBG animals_NNS were_VBD segregated_VBN and_CC gross_JJ infective_JJ materials_NNS ,_, such_JJ as_IN the_DT pla-_JJ centa_NN ,_, were_VBD quickly_RB destroyed_VBN ._.
On_IN farm_NN 2_CD ,_, no_DT such_JJ precautions_NNS were_VBD taken_VBN and_CC general_JJ cleanliness_NN was_VBD lacking_VBG ._.
In_IN cows_NNS ,_, therefore_RB ,_, it_PRP appears_VBZ that_IN ,_, provided_VBD gross_JJ sources_NNS of_IN contagion_NN are_VBP removed_VBN ,_, the_DT steri-_JJ lizing_NN effects_NNS of_IN sunlight_NN are_VBP sufficient_JJ to_TO suppress_VB the_DT remaining_VBG minor_JJ sources_NNS ,_, even_RB when_WRB conges-_JJ tion_NN is_VBZ great_JJ ;_: conversely_RB ,_, where_WRB animals_NNS are_VBP dispersed_VBN ,_, hygiene_JJ becomes_NNS of_IN less_JJR importance_NN and_CC the_DT effects_NNS of_IN sunlight_NN are_VBP paramount_NN ._.
Village_NNP cattle_NNS on_IN the_DT whole_JJ graze_NN over_IN wide_JJ areas_NNS and_CC dispersion_NN thus_RB counteracts_VBZ the_DT lack_NN of_IN hygiene_NN ,_, but_CC here_RB again_RB sunlight_JJ probably_RB plays_VBZ a_DT major_JJ part_NN in_IN sup-_JJ pressing_VBG the_DT disease_NN ._.
There_EX are_VBP ,_, however_RB ,_, other_JJ aspects_NNS of_IN the_DT effect_NN of_IN climate_NN on_IN the_DT dissemination_NN of_IN Brucella_NNP ,_, namely_RB humidity_NN and_CC rainfall_NN ,_, but_CC while_IN the_DT possible_JJ importance_NN of_IN moisture_NN is_VBZ well_RB illustrated_VBN by_IN the_DT restriction_NN of_IN indigenous_JJ brucellosis_NN to_TO the_DT humid_JJ tracts_NNS of_IN India_NNP ,_, it_PRP is_VBZ even_RB more_RBR sharply_RB em-_JJ phasised_VBN by_IN some_DT aspects_NNS of_IN the_DT epidemiology_NN of_IN brucellosis_NN in_IN buffaloes_NNS ._.
154_CD Brucellosis_NNP in_IN India_NNP Only_RB one_CD major_JJ endemic_NN of_IN brucellosis_NN has_VBZ been_VBN encountered_VBN in_IN buffaloes_NNS (_( farm_NN 3_CD )_) ._.
Here_RB the_DT annual_JJ abortion_NN rate_NN was_VBD 21_CD per_IN cent_NN of_IN pregnancies_NNS over_IN a_DT period_NN of_IN six_CD years_NNS ;_: this_DT for_IN India_NNP is_VBZ cer-_JJ tainly_RB excessive_JJ ,_, possibly_RB unique_JJ ._.
In_IN an_DT attempt_NN to_TO explain_VB this_DT unusual_JJ incidence_NN ,_, many_JJ environ-_JJ mental_JJ factors_NNS have_VBP been_VBN considered_VBN but_CC the_DT only_JJ extraordinary_JJ influence_NN discoverable_NN was_VBD the_DT ex-_JJ ceptionally_RB heavy_JJ monsoon_NN ,_, with_IN 80_CD in_IN ._.
of_IN rainfall_NN during_IN the_DT period_NN June_NNP to_TO September_NNP ._.
Table_JJ XI_NN presents_VBZ a_DT statement_NN of_IN the_DT monthly_JJ abortion_NN rates_NNS among_IN susceptible_JJ stock_NN ,_, calculated_VBD from_IN an_DT ag-_JJ gregate_NN of_IN the_DT returns_NNS for_IN five_CD years_NNS ._.
This_DT shows_VBZ that_IN abortion-rate_NN for_IN the_DT months_NNS November_NNP to_TO July_NNP varied_JJ little_JJ about_IN a_DT mean_NN of_IN 1.4_CD and_CC although_IN the_DT population_NN of_IN susceptible_JJ animals_NNS steadily_RB increases_VBZ from_IN January_NNP to_TO July_NNP ,_, there_EX is_VBZ no_DT corresponding_JJ increase_NN in_IN the_DT abortion-rate_NN ._.
In_IN August_NNP ,_, however_RB ,_, whilst_VBZ the_DT number_NN of_IN susceptible_JJ animals_NNS commences_NNS to_TO decrease_VB ,_, the_DT abortion-rate_JJ sud-_JJ denly_NN doubles_NNS and_CC in_IN September_NNP and_CC October_NNP it_PRP is_VBZ thrice_JJ the_DT mean_NN for_IN the_DT normal_JJ months_NNS of_IN the_DT year_NN ._.
Thereafter_RB ,_, the_DT rate_NN returns_NNS to_TO normal_JJ ._.
Now_RB as_IN the_DT period_NN of_IN transmission_NN and_CC incubation_NN of_IN the_DT disease_NN is_VBZ likely_JJ to_TO occupy_VB a_DT period_NN of_IN 1_CD to_TO 2_CD months_NNS ,_, the_DT critical_JJ period_NN of_IN increased_JJ infection-rate_JJ causing_VBG the_DT increased_VBN abortion-rate_NN during_IN August_NNP ,_, September_NNP and_CC October_NNP ,_, commences_NNS in_IN mid-_JJ June_NNP and_CC lasts_VBZ into_IN August_NNP ._.
But_CC in_IN this_DT period_NN the_DT abortion-rate_NN ,_, and_CC therefore_RB presumably_RB the_DT bacterial_JJ excretion-rate_NN ,_, is_VBZ constant_JJ ,_, whilst_WP the_DT corrected_JJ number_NN of_IN susceptible_JJ animals_NNS does_VBZ not_RB vary_VB greatly_RB round_VB a_DT mean_NN of_IN 1200_CD ;_: further_CC the_DT absolute_JJ number_NN of_IN abortions_NNS in_IN July_NNP is_VBZ the_DT same_JJ as_IN in_IN May_NNP ._.
In_IN other_JJ words_NNS donor_NN and_CC receptor_NN influences_NNS do_VBP not_RB vary_VB sufficiently_RB during_IN this_DT period_NN to_TO account_VB for_IN the_DT large_JJ increase_NN of_IN abortions_NNS in_IN August_NNP ,_, September_NNP and_CC October_NNP ,_, and_CC this_DT increase_NN must_MD be_VB explained_VBN by_IN a_DT change_NN in_IN environment_NN which_WDT affects_VBZ bacterial_JJ survival_NN and_CC transmission_NN ._.
But_CC in_IN mid-June_JJ the_DT climate_NN changes_NNS completely_RB from_IN diurnal_JJ sunlight_NN to_TO total_JJ sunlessness_NN and_CC con-_JJ tinuous_JJ rainfall_NN and_CC this_DT suggests_VBZ that_IN either_CC the_DT absence_NN of_IN sunlight_NN or_CC the_DT presence_NN of_IN moisture_NN ,_, or_CC both_DT ,_, favours_VBP the_DT spread_NN of_IN brucellosis_NN in_IN buffaloes_NNS ._.

As_IN before_RB however_RB the_DT factor_NN of_IN congestion_NN complicates_VBZ the_DT picture_NN ._.

Panzootic_JJ This_DT comparison_NN surely_RB suggests_VBZ that_IN in_IN buffaloes_NNS at_IN least_JJS rainfall_NN plays_VBZ a_DT considerable_JJ part_NN in_IN the_DT dissemination_NN of_IN brucellosis_NN ._.
This_DT and_CC many_JJ other_JJ similar_JJ records_NNS lead_NN to_TO the_DT same_JJ conclusion_NN and_CC it_PRP is_VBZ tempting_VBG to_TO accept_VB the_DT simple_JJ explanation_NN that_WDT at_IN least_JJS among_IN buffaloes_NNS a_DT fluid_NN vehicle_NN is_VBZ more_RBR satisfactory_JJ for_IN dissemina-_JJ tion_NN than_IN a_DT dry_JJ one_CD ._.
In_IN this_DT respect_NN the_DT buffalo_NN 's_POS habit_NN of_IN wallowing_VBG requires_VBZ consideration_NN ._.
Observa-_JJ tions_NNS on_IN this_DT habit_NN have_VBP been_VBN recorded_VBN by_IN Minett_NNP [_NNP 1947_CD ]_NNP ._.
In_IN north_JJ India_NNP at_IN least_JJS buffaloes_NNS wallow_VBP voluntarily_RB from_IN April_NNP to_TO October_NNP and_CC there_EX is_VBZ a_DT natural_JJ desire_NN to_TO do_VB so_RB when_WRB the_DT air_NN and_CC water_NN tem-_JJ peratures_NNS are_VBP above_IN 85°_CD and_CC 77°F_CD ._.
respectively_RB ._.
The_DT desire_NN to_TO wallow_VB is_VBZ intense_JJ during_IN hot_JJ damp_JJ months_NNS ,_, August_NNP and_CC September_NNP in_IN north_JJ India_NNP ._.
During_IN the_DT hot_JJ dry_JJ period_NN of_IN April_NNP to_TO June_NNP ,_, water_NN is_VBZ short_JJ and_CC the_DT few_JJ available_JJ shrunken_JJ tanks_NNS and_CC ponds_NNS are_VBP grossly_RB congested_VBN ,_, while_IN during_IN the_DT rains_NNS ,_, the_DT animals_NNS are_VBP dispersed_VBN over_IN a_DT far_RB wider_JJR expense_NN of_IN water_NN ._.
If_IN therefore_IN it_PRP can_MD be_VB accepted_VBN that_IN the_DT sterilizing_VBG effect_NN of_IN sunlight_NN ,_, which_WDT is_VBZ admittedly_RB great_JJ for_IN Brucella_NNP ,_, can_MD suppress_VB the_DT contagion_NN during_IN the_DT sunny_JJ months_NNS ,_, then_RB increased_VBD infection_NN of_IN buffaloes_NNS during_IN the_DT rains_NNS ,_, despite_IN wider_JJR dispersion_NN ,_, might_MD be_VB partially_RB accounted_VBN for_IN by_IN wallowing_VBG ,_, especially_RB when_WRB this_DT is_VBZ done_VBN in_IN tanks_NNS ._.
Many_JJ epidemiologists_NNS have_VBP associated_VBN moisture_NN with_IN the_DT spread_NN of_IN diseases_NNS ._.
Rogers_NNS [_VBP 1926_CD ]_NN ,_, for_IN example_NN ,_, found_VBD that_IN cholera_NN spreads_NNS as_IN the_DT absolute_JJ humidity_NN reaches_VBZ 0.4_CD in_IN ._.
and_CC it_PRP may_MD be_VB noted_VBN in_IN passing_VBG that_DT ,_, in_IN lower_JJR Bengal_NNP and_CC on_IN the_DT Coramandal_NNP and_CC Malabar_NNP coasts_NNS (_( i.e._NN ,_, in_IN the_DT Brucella-_NNP endemic_JJ areas_NNS of_IN India_NNP )_) the_DT absolute_JJ humidity_NN is_VBZ never_RB below_IN 0.4_CD in_IN ._.
About_IN Brucella_NNP little_JJ has_VBZ been_VBN proffered_VBN ,_, but_CC Cameron_NNP [_NNP 1932_CD ]_NNP ,_, who_WP has_VBZ tested_VBN fairly_RB thoroughly_RB the_DT viability_NN of_IN Brucella_NNP ,_, shows_VBZ on_IN the_DT whole_NN that_IN drying_VBG is_VBZ harmful_JJ to_TO the_DT organism_NN ._.
SUMMARY_NNP The_DT results_NNS of_IN a_DT survey_NN of_IN brucellosis_NN in_IN India_NNP have_VBP been_VBN analysed_VBN in_IN an_DT effort_NN to_TO trace_VB some_DT of_IN the_DT factors_NNS which_WDT control_VBP the_DT spread_NN of_IN the_DT disease_NN in_IN that_DT country_NN ._.
The_DT scatter_NN of_IN the_DT disease_NN amongst_NN farms_NNS was_VBD uniform_JJ and_CC thus_RB uninformative_JJ ._.
On_IN the_DT other_JJ hand_NN ,_, an_DT indigenous_JJ enzootic_JJ among_IN village_JJ cattle_NNS occurred_VBD throughout_IN the_DT bi-_JJ and_CC tri-seasonal_JJ rain-_JJ fall_NN areas_NNS only_RB ._.
The_DT incidence_NN of_IN infection_NN in_IN farms_NNS was_VBD often_RB high_JJ where_WRB total_JJ rainfall_NN was_VBD high_JJ ,_, and_CC vice_NN versâ_NN ._.
The_DT rate_NN of_IN village_NN infection_NN was_VBD negligible_JJ in_IN semi-desert_JJ areas_NNS but_CC considerable_JJ in_IN humid_JJ coastal_JJ belts_NNS ._.
It_PRP is_VBZ concluded_VBN that_IN the_DT sterilizing_VBG effect_NN of_IN continuous_JJ sunlight_NN is_VBZ paramount_VBN in_IN checking_VBG dissemina-_JJ tion_NN of_IN the_DT disease_NN ,_, while_IN humidity_NN ,_, rainfall_NN and_CC sunlessness_NN are_VBP favourable_JJ to_TO its_PRP$ spread_NN ._.
Neverthe-_NNP less_NN ,_, unhygienic_JJ conditions_NNS and_CC congestion_NN of_IN animals_NNS play_VBP an_DT important_JJ part_NN in_IN transmission_NN ._.
Abortion_NN statistics_NNS are_VBP given_VBN for_IN European_JJ zebu_NN crossbreds_NNS ,_, for_IN pure_NN zebus_NN ,_, and_CC for_IN buffaloes_NNS ._.
The_DT susceptibility_NN of_IN these_DT animals_NNS and_CC of_IN sheep_NN and_CC goats_NNS is_VBZ assessed_VBN ._.
