EXPERIMENTAL_NNP Methods_NNP The_DT criteria_NNS used_VBN for_IN typing_VBG were_VBD ,_, (_( 1_CD )_) CO2_NN requirements_NNS at_IN time_NN of_IN isolation_NN ,_, (_( 2_CD )_) H2S_NNP secretion_NN ,_, (_( 3_CD )_) inhibitory_NN action_NN of_IN dye_JJ media_NNS ,_, and_CC (_( 4_CD )_) antigenic_JJ structure_NN ._.
The_DT techniques_NNS of_IN items_NNS (_( 1_CD )_) to_TO (_( 3_CD )_) were_VBD those_DT of_IN Huddleson_NNP [_NNP 1939_CD ]_NNP ,_, that_IN of_IN (_( 4_CD )_) was_VBD based_VBN on_IN the_DT work_NN of_IN Wilson_NNP and_CC Miles_NNP [_RB 1932_CD ]_NN ._.
Controls_NNS with_IN type-specific_JJ strains_NNS were_VBD prepared_VBN throughout_IN ._.
Strains_NNS were_VBD examined_VBN for_IN dissociation_NN as_IN follows_VBZ ._.
Two-day-old_JJ agar_NN cultures_NNS were_VBD suspended_VBN in_IN 12_CD per_IN cent_NN ._.
saline_NN and_CC adjusted_VBN to_TO density_VB 1_CD to_TO 2_CD on_IN Brown_NNP 's_POS scale_NN ._.
The_DT suspensions_NNS were_VBD immersed_VBN in_IN boiling_VBG water_NN and_CC readings_NNS for_IN agglutination_NN made_VBN after_IN 5_CD ,_, 15_CD ,_, 30_CD and_CC 60_CD minutes_NNS ._.
The_DT suspensions_NNS were_VBD then_RB removed_VBN and_CC left_VBN on_IN the_DT bench_NN until_IN the_DT following_VBG morning_NN when_WRB they_PRP were_VBD again_RB examined_VBN for_IN agglutination_NN ._.
A_DT strain_NN agglutinating_VBG in_IN these_DT circumstances_NNS was_VBD regarded_VBN as_IN dissociated_VBN ._.
Tests_NNS for_IN antigenic_JJ sensitivity_NN were_VBD made_VBN as_IN follows_VBZ ._.
Standard_JJ antigens_NNS were_VBD prepared_VBN by_IN suspending_VBG 48-hour-old_JJ slant_JJ cultures_NNS in_IN 12_CD per_IN cent_NN ._.
saline_NN and_CC their_PRP$ density_NN very_RB accurately_RB adjusted_VBN to_TO 1_CD on_IN Brown_NNP 's_POS scale_NN ._.
Stableforth_NNP 's_POS [_NN 1936_CD ]_NNP standard_NN dried_VBD serum_NN was_VBD reconstructed_VBN according_VBG to_TO his_PRP$ directions_NNS ,_, but_CC the_DT concentration_NN of_IN his_PRP$ final_JJ dilution_NN series_NN was_VBD halved_VBN in_IN saline_NN ._.
In_IN a_DT series_NN of_IN tubes_NNS ,_, 0.5_CD c.c_NN ._.
of_IN the_DT antigen_NN to_TO be_VB examined_VBN was_VBD added_VBN to_TO 0.5_CD c.c_NN ._.
of_IN each_DT dilution_NN of_IN serum_NN in_IN the_DT halved_JJ Stableforth_NNP series_NN ,_, thus_RB forming_VBG a_DT titration_NN range_NN of_IN 1/640_CD ,_, 1/800_CD ,_, 1/960_CD and_CC 1/1120_CD and_CC 1/1280_CD and_CC the_DT ultimate_JJ reaction_NN after_IN 24_CD hours_NNS '_POS incubation_NN at_IN 37°C_CD ._.
was_VBD noted_VBN ._.
In_IN this_DT range_NN ,_, type-specific_JJ antigen_NN prepared_VBN in_IN a_DT similar_JJ way_NN had_VBD been_VBN previously_RB found_VBN to_TO react_VB to_TO about_IN +_JJ +_NN at_IN 1/1280_CD ,_, and_CC this_DT titre_NN was_VBD accepted_VBN as_IN the_DT datum_NN with_IN which_WDT the_DT end_NN points_NNS of_IN the_DT titrations_NNS of_IN the_DT field_NN strain_NN were_VBD compared_VBN ._.
Strain_NN typing_NN In_IN the_DT intemperate_JJ climate_NN of_IN India_NNP ,_, the_DT procuring_NN of_IN satisfactory_JJ specimens_NNS for_IN bacteriological_JJ examination_NN offers_NNS many_JJ peculiar_JJ difficulties_NNS ._.
The_DT main_JJ troubles_NNS are_VBP the_DT early_JJ putrefaction_NN of_IN dead_JJ tissues_NNS ,_, dust_JJ contamination_NN ,_, long_JJ periods_NNS of_IN transportation_NN in_IN warm_JJ environment_NN and_CC above_IN all_DT difficulties_NNS of_IN communication_NN ,_, for_IN abortions_NNS usually_RB occur_VBP without_IN notice_NN in_IN remote_JJ localities_NNS ,_, which_WDT can_MD not_RB be_VB reached_VBN in_IN time_NN by_IN persons_NNS qualified_VBN and_CC equipped_VBN to_TO take_VB samples_NNS fit_VB for_IN examination_NN ._.

Outbreaks_NNS of_IN the_DT disease_NN occur_VBZ mostly_RB on_IN the_DT introduction_NN into_IN healthy_JJ flocks_NNS of_IN newly_RB purchased_VBN birds_NNS which_WDT are_VBP either_DT diseased_JJ or_CC are_VBP in_IN the_DT incubation_NN period_NN or_CC have_VB just_RB recovered_VBN ,_, and_CC the_DT dissemination_NN of_IN virus_NN is_VBZ brought_VBN about_IN by_IN infected_JJ exudates_NNS and_CC excreta_NN ._.
Outbreaks_NNS in_IN flocks_NNS with_IN no_DT history_NN of_IN contact_NN infection_NN are_VBP attributed_VBN to_TO the_DT dissemination_NN of_IN the_DT virus_NN by_IN such_JJ mechanical_JJ carriers_NNS as_IN crows_NNS ,_, pigeons_NNS ,_, vultures_NNS and_CC other_JJ wild_JJ birds_NNS ,_, but_CC there_RB is_VBZ as_IN yet_RB no_DT proof_NN of_IN this_DT nor_CC has_VBZ the_DT virus_NN been_VBN isolated_VBN from_IN any_DT such_JJ carriers_NNS ._.
The_DT possibility_NN of_IN its_PRP$ transmission_NN by_IN fowl_NN ticks_NNS (_( Argas_NNP persicus_NN )_) has_VBZ been_VBN investigated_VBN by_IN Komarov_NNP [_NNP 1940_CD ]_NN with_IN negative_JJ results_NNS ._.

disease_NN ._.
Thus_RB the_DT digestive_NN and_CC respiratory_NN tracts_NNS appear_VBP to_TO be_VB the_DT usual_JJ routes_NNS of_IN infection_NN ._.
Extensive_JJ studies_NNS have_VBP been_VBN made_VBN on_IN the_DT bionomics_NNS of_IN the_DT causal_NN agent_NN in_IN countries_NNS where_WRB the_DT disease_NN occurs_VBZ ._.
Virus_NNP suspension_NN ,_, on_IN which_WDT most_JJS of_IN the_DT experimental_JJ work_NN has_VBZ been_VBN done_VBN ,_, at_IN ice_JJ temperature_NN retains_VBZ its_PRP$ viability_NN for_IN several_JJ months_NNS and_CC this_DT explains_VBZ the_DT wide_JJ incidence_NN of_IN the_DT disease_NN during_IN the_DT cold_JJ season_NN ._.
However_RB ,_, the_DT virus_NN is_VBZ very_RB fragile_JJ and_CC is_VBZ readily_RB affected_VBN by_IN a_DT warm_JJ at-_NN mospheric_JJ temperature_NN and_CC by_IN sunlight_NN ._.
At_IN 50ºC_CD ._.
to_TO 55ºC_CD ._.
the_DT virus_NN is_VBZ rendered_VBN inert_JJ by_IN 30_CD minutes_NNS '_POS exposure_NN and_CC killed_VBN by_IN direct_JJ sunlight_NN in_IN one_CD hour_NN ._.
In_IN garden_JJ soil_NN or_CC in_IN stagnant_JJ water_NN at_IN room_NN temperature_NN (_( temperature_NN not_RB given_VBN )_) it_PRP became_VBD non-infective_JJ in_IN four_CD days_NNS [_NNP Farinas_NNP ,_, 1930_CD ]_NN ._.
In_IN con-_JJ taminated_JJ brooders_NNS Dobson_NNP [_NN 1939_CD ]_NN was_VBD able_JJ to_TO recover_VB the_DT virus_NN for_IN a_DT period_NN of_IN seven_CD weeks_NNS ._.
In_IN the_DT light_NN of_IN these_DT data_NNS a_DT vigilant_JJ breeder_NN can_MD achieve_VB considerable_JJ success_NN in_IN mitigating_VBG losses_NNS ._.
The_DT secretions_NNS ,_, excretions_NNS and_CC tissues_NNS of_IN affected_JJ fowls_NNS are_VBP all_DT infective_JJ ,_, providing_VBG wide_JJ scope_NN for_IN dissemi-_JJ nation_NN ._.
Doyle_NNP [_NN 1927_CD ]_NN demonstrated_VBD that_IN the_DT disease_NN is_VBZ readily_RB produced_VBN by_IN a_DT light_JJ application_NN over_IN the_DT mouth_NN and_CC pharynx_NN with_IN a_DT swab_NN of_IN cotton_NN wool_NN soaked_VBD with_IN mouth_JJ exudate_NN of_IN an_DT affected_JJ bird_NN ._.

EXPERIMENTS_NNS ON_NNP INHALATION_NNP Two_CD wooden_NN boxes_NNS were_VBD so_RB constructed_VBN that_IN through_IN an_DT opening_NN on_IN one_CD side_NN the_DT neck_NN of_IN the_DT fowl_NN would_MD protrude_VB ,_, the_DT base_NN of_IN the_DT neck_NN being_VBG held_VBN in_IN position_NN by_IN means_NNS of_IN a_DT cardboard_NN collar_NN ._.
The_DT two_CD boxes_NNS were_VBD so_RB placed_VBN that_IN there_EX was_VBD a_DT distance_NN of_IN two_CD feet_NNS between_IN the_DT beaks_NNS of_IN the_DT two_CD birds_NNS ,_, one_CD infected_VBD 48_CD hours_NNS previously_RB with_IN Ranikhet_NNP disease_NN virus_NN and_CC the_DT other_JJ healthy_JJ ._.
The_DT entire_JJ structure_NN was_VBD covered_VBN with_IN a_DT piece_NN of_IN muslin_NN cloth_NN for_IN ventilation_NN ._.
After_IN three_CD hours_NNS '_POS exposure_NN the_DT healthy_JJ bird_NN was_VBD removed_VBN ;_: four_CD days_NNS later_RB ,_, it_PRP developed_VBD symptoms_NNS of_IN the_DT disease_NN and_CC died_VBD on_IN the_DT fifth_JJ day_NN ._.
The_DT day_NN after_IN removal_NN of_IN the_DT first_JJ healthy_JJ bird_NN ,_, another_DT healthy_JJ one_CD was_VBD exposed_VBN under_IN identical_JJ conditions_NNS to_TO the_DT infected_JJ bird_NN now_RB in_IN its_PRP$ third_JJ day_NN from_IN inoculation_NN ._.
In_IN this_DT case_NN also_RB the_DT disease_NN was_VBD conveyed_VBN through_IN the_DT expired_JJ air_NN to_TO the_DT healthy_JJ bird_NN which_WDT died_VBD on_IN the_DT seventh_JJ day_NN ._.
Another_DT healthy_JJ bird_NN was_VBD similarly_RB exposed_VBN to_TO a_DT fowl_NN infected_VBN four_CD days_NNS previously_RB showing_VBG signs_NNS of_IN acute_JJ illness_NN ._.
In_IN this_DT case_NN infection_NN was_VBD not_RB transmitted_VBN and_CC the_DT bird_NN was_VBD later_RB found_VBN sus-_JJ ceptible_NN ._.
In_IN three_CD subsequent_JJ trials_NNS the_DT distance_NN was_VBD increased_VBN to_TO three_CD feet_NNS ,_, the_DT time_NN of_IN exposure_NN and_CC other_JJ conditions_NNS remaining_VBG unchanged_JJ ._.
In_IN all_PDT these_DT ,_, however_RB ,_, the_DT results_NNS were_VBD negative_JJ ._.
In_IN a_DT second_JJ series_NN of_IN experiments_NNS carried_VBN out_RP under_IN similar_JJ conditions_NNS except_IN that_IN the_DT muslin_NN was_VBD replaced_VBN by_IN thick_JJ cloth_NN of_IN close_JJ texture_NN so_RB as_IN to_TO minimise_VB air_NN currents_NNS ,_, a_DT healthy_JJ bird_NN was_VBD ex-_JJ posed_VBN for_IN three_CD hours_NNS to_TO an_DT infected_JJ fowl_NN at_IN a_DT distance_NN of_IN two_CD feet_NNS ._.
Fifteen_NNP days_NNS later_RB the_DT exposed_VBN bird_NN proved_VBD susceptible_JJ to_TO Ranikhet_NNP virus_NN ._.
This_DT experiment_NN was_VBD repeated_VBN thrice_NN with_IN similar_JJ results_NNS ._.
In_IN another_DT experiment_NN a_DT healthy_JJ bird_NN was_VBD exposed_VBN under_IN the_DT same_JJ conditions_NNS but_CC for_IN a_DT duration_NN of_IN six_CD hours_NNS with_IN negative_JJ result_NN ._.
In_IN a_DT third_JJ experiment_NN of_IN this_DT second_JJ series_NN involving_VBG three_CD infected_VBN and_CC three_CD healthy_JJ fowls_VBZ the_DT distance_NN was_VBD reduced_VBN to_TO one_CD foot_NN ._.
However_RB ,_, in_IN only_RB one_CD case_NN did_VBD the_DT healthy_JJ bird_NN contract_NN the_DT disease_NN ,_, dying_VBG on_IN the_DT 7th_JJ day_NN ._.
DISCUSSION_NN It_PRP appears_VBZ that_IN Ranikhet_NNP disease_NN virus_NN is_VBZ rendered_VBN inert_NN in_IN the_DT digestive_JJ tract_NN ._.
The_DT above_JJ results_NNS may_MD be_VB explained_VBN by_IN the_DT fact_NN that_IN ,_, whereas_VBD solid_JJ food_NN is_VBZ quickly_RB swallowed_VBN ,_, during_IN the_DT process_NN of_IN drinking_NN fowls_NN fill_VB the_DT mouth_NN ,_, raise_VB the_DT head_NN and_CC swallow_JJ each_DT gulp_NN gradually_RB so_RB that_IN the_DT mouth_NN ,_, pharynx_NN and_CC larynx_JJ become_NN contaminated_VBN ._.
It_PRP seems_VBZ likely_JJ therefore_IN that_DT infection_NN takes_VBZ place_NN via_IN ._.
the_DT nasopharynx_NN and_CC before_IN the_DT virus_NN enters_VBZ the_DT crop_NN ,_, since_IN swabbing_VBG the_DT throat_NN with_IN the_DT virus_NNS easily_RB produces_VBZ infection_NN ._.
There_EX is_VBZ little_JJ doubt_NN however_RB ,_, that_IN under_IN natural_JJ conditions_NNS droplet_NN infection_NN is_VBZ the_DT most_RBS common_JJ method_NN of_IN transmission_NN ._.
The_DT experience_NN of_IN Farinas_NNP [_NNP 1930_CD ]_NN that_IN infec-_JJ tion_NN is_VBZ not_RB readily_RB transmitted_VBN between_IN cages_NNS may_MD be_VB explained_VBN by_IN the_DT lack_NN of_IN air_NN currents_NNS favourable_JJ for_IN spread_NN ._.
In_IN droplet_NN infection_NN the_DT chances_NNS of_IN transmission_NN by_IN coughing_VBG or_CC breathing_VBG largely_RB depend_VB on_IN the_DT distance_NN between_IN the_DT infected_JJ and_CC susceptible_JJ ._.
If_IN the_DT distance_NN is_VBZ too_RB great_JJ ,_, the_DT virus_NN may_MD be_VB diluted_VBN beyond_IN its_PRP$ infective_JJ potentiality_NN ._.
After_IN expulsion_NN the_DT virus_NN may_MD be_VB carried_VBN by_IN air_NN currents_NNS some_DT distance_NN from_IN its_PRP$ source_NN and_CC contaminate_VB the_DT surrounding_VBG areas_NNS ._.
This_DT explains_VBZ how_WRB ,_, as_IN some-_JJ times_NNS noted_VBN in_IN practice_NN ,_, an_DT outbreak_NN of_IN Ranikhet_NNP disease_NN starting_VBG at_IN one_CD end_NN of_IN a_DT poultry_NN farm_NN may_MD spread_VB in_IN a_DT few_JJ days_NNS to_TO the_DT interior_NN and_CC even_RB to_TO the_DT farthest_JJS corner_NN of_IN the_DT farm_NN ._.
SUMMARY_NNP 1_CD ._.
Ranikhet_NNP disease_NN virus_NN ,_, enclosed_VBN in_IN a_DT gelatin_NN capsule_NN ,_, within_IN wheat_NN dough_NN or_CC mixed_JJ with_IN grains_NNS ,_, when_WRB introduced_VBN directly_RB into_IN the_DT digestive_JJ tract_NN does_VBZ not_RB produce_VB the_DT disease_NN in_IN susceptible_JJ birds_NNS ._.
2_CD ._.
Susceptible_JJ birds_NNS contract_NN the_DT disease_NN when_WRB allowed_VBN to_TO drink_VB water_NN containing_VBG Ranikhet_NNP disease_NN virus_NN in_IN the_DT form_NN of_IN tissue_NN suspension_NN from_IN infected_VBN birds_NNS ._.
J_NNP ._.
A._NN IDNANI_NNP AND_NNP C._NNP SEETHARAMAN_NNP 169_CD 3_CD ._.
A_DT susceptible_JJ bird_NN contracts_NNS the_DT disease_NN when_WRB exposed_VBN for_IN three_CD hours_NNS or_CC more_JJR to_TO an_DT infected_JJ one_CD at_IN a_DT distance_NN of_IN not_RB more_JJR than_IN two_CD feet_NNS under_IN conditions_NNS suitable_JJ for_IN the_DT play_NN of_IN air_NN currents_NNS ._.

3_CD ,_, 239-41_JJ POSSIBILITY_NNP OF_NNP COLOURING_NNP VANASPATI_NNP WITH_NNP RATANJOT_NNP TO_NNP PREVENT_NNP ITS_NNP USE_NNP AS_IN AN_NNP ADULTERANT_NNP IN_NNP GHEE_NNP By_IN NOSHIR_NNP N._NNP DASTUR_NNP ,_, A._NNP KANNAN_NNP AND_NNP ZAL_NNP R._NNP KOTHAVALLA_NNP ,_, Imperial_NNP Dairy_NNP Research_NNP Institute_NNP ,_, Bangalore_NNP (_( Received_VBN for_IN publication_NN on_IN 20_CD November_NNP 1946_CD )_) HYDROGENATED_NNP vegetable_NN oils_NNS ,_, or_CC what_WDT are_VBP popularly_RB known_VBN as_IN vanaspati_NN ,_, are_VBP used_VBN now_RB a_DT days_NNS in_IN large_JJ quantities_NNS as_IN cooking_VBG media_NNS ._.
They_PRP provide_VBP a_DT cheap_JJ substitute_NN for_IN ghee_NN for_IN this_DT purpose_NN and_CC for_IN this_DT reason_NN are_VBP normally_RB made_VBN to_TO resemble_VB ghee_NN ,_, as_RB closely_RB as_IN possible_JJ ,_, in_IN appearance_NN ._.
The_DT two_CD being_VBG visually_RB very_RB similar_JJ there_EX is_VBZ always_RB the_DT temptation_NN to_TO vendors_NNS to_TO mix_VB the_DT cheaper_JJR product_NN (_( vanaspati_JJ )_) with_IN ghee_NN and_CC to_TO pass_VB the_DT mixture_NN off_RP as_IN genuine_JJ ghee_NN ._.
The_DT detection_NN of_IN the_DT admixture_NN of_IN these_DT two_CD is_VBZ further_RB made_VBN difficult_JJ by_IN the_DT fact_NN that_IN there_EX is_VBZ great_JJ variation_NN in_IN the_DT chemi-_JJ cal_JJ composition_NN of_IN ghee_NN and_CC it_PRP is_VBZ not_RB always_RB possible_JJ to_TO distinguish_VB between_IN genuine_JJ ghee_NN and_CC adultera-_JJ ed_NN products_NNS ,_, even_RB by_IN routine_JJ chemical_NN methods_NNS ._.
The_DT ordinary_JJ purchaser_NN must_MD rely_VB on_IN his_PRP$ sight_NN to_TO distinguish_VB between_IN the_DT two_CD products_NNS and_CC in_IN order_NN to_TO enable_VB him_PRP to_TO do_VB this_DT it_PRP has_VBZ been_VBN strongly_RB urged_VBN that_IN all_DT vanaspati_NNS manufactured_VBN in_IN India_NNP should_MD be_VB given_VBN such_PDT a_DT distinct_JJ colour_NN that_IN it_PRP may_MD not_RB be_VB mistaken_VBN for_IN ghee_NN even_RB by_IN a_DT casual_JJ pur-_NN chaser_NN ._.
Deep_RB yellow_NN (_( turmeric_JJ )_) and_CC orange_$ colour_NN (_( like_IN the_DT one_CD given_VBN by_IN annatto_NN )_) are_VBP obviously_RB not_RB suitable_JJ ._.
Next_JJ to_TO these_DT two_CD ,_, red_JJ is_VBZ the_DT most_RBS agreeable_JJ colour_NN ._.
It_PRP was_VBD therefore_RB ,_, decided_VBD to_TO carry_VB out_RP trials_NNS to_TO determine_VB the_DT most_RBS suitable_JJ variation_NN in_IN red_JJ to_TO colour_VB vanaspati_NN and_CC 'rose_VB red_JJ '_'' or_CC the_DT tint_NN commonly_RB known_VBN as_IN 'Gulabi_NN '_'' was_VBD finally_RB decided_VBN upon_NN ._.
The_DT selection_NN of_IN this_DT tint_NN no_DT doubt_NN was_VBD rather_RB arbitrary_JJ ,_, considering_VBG the_DT fact_NN that_IN the_DT accepted_JJ colour_NN of_IN natural_JJ fats_NNS is_VBZ yellow_JJ but_CC that_IN made_VBD the_DT selection_NN of_IN a_DT tint_NN other_JJ than_IN yellow_IN all_PDT the_DT more_RBR necessary_JJ ,_, as_RB long_RB as_IN it_PRP was_VBD not_RB repulsive_JJ to_TO the_DT consumer_NN and_CC fulfilled_VBD all_PDT the_DT requirements_NNS of_IN a_DT cooking_JJ medium_NN ;_: for_IN ,_, after_IN all_DT vanas-_JJ pati_NN is_VBZ used_VBN for_IN this_DT purpose_NN only_RB ._.
The_DT dye_NN to_TO be_VB used_VBN for_IN colouring_VBG edible_JJ products_NNS like_IN vanaspati_NN must_MD fulfil_VB certain_JJ essential_JJ re-_JJ quirements_NNS such_JJ as_IN ,_, (_( a_DT )_) it_PRP must_MD be_VB easily_RB available_JJ ,_, (_( b_NN )_) it_PRP should_MD be_VB non-toxic_JJ in_IN raw_JJ state_NN or_CC even_RB after_IN heating_VBG to_TO the_DT frying_JJ temperature_NN of_IN vanaspati_NN ,_, (_( c_NN )_) it_PRP should_MD not_RB in_IN any_DT way_NN affect_VBP the_DT quality_NN of_IN vanaspati_NN by_IN lowering_VBG its_PRP$ keeping_VBG quality_NN or_CC imparting_VBG a_DT foreign_JJ flavour_NN to_TO it_PRP and_CC (_( d_NN )_) the_DT coloured_JJ vanaspati_NN must_MD be_VB stable_JJ to_TO light_JJ and_CC heat_NN to_TO a_DT reasonable_JJ extent_NN so_IN that_IN the_DT colour_NN may_MD not_RB be_VB des-_JJ troyed_VBN during_IN storage_NN ._.
Preliminary_JJ examination_NN of_IN several_JJ natural_JJ and_CC synthetic_JJ dyes_NNS showed_VBD that_IN the_DT red_JJ dye_NN obtained_VBN from_IN the_DT ratanjot_NN roots_NNS ,_, Onosma_NNP echides_VBZ ,_, fulfilled_VBD all_PDT the_DT above_JJ conditions_NNS ._.
Ratan-_JJ jot_NN plants_NNS grow_VB in_IN abundance_NN in_IN colder_NN regions_NNS of_IN India_NNP ._.
The_DT roots_NNS form_VBP the_DT main_JJ source_NN of_IN the_DT dye_NN ._.
EXPERIMENTAL_NNP Isolation_NNP of_IN the_DT Dye_NNP ._.
The_DT colouring_VBG principles_NNS of_IN ratanjot_NN are_VBP insoluble_JJ in_IN water_NN but_CC freely_RB soluble_JJ in_IN fats_NNS and_CC common_JJ organic_JJ solvents_NNS ._.
The_DT dye_NN was_VBD usually_RB concentrated_VBN by_IN extraction_NN with_IN ether_NN ._.
Before_IN extracting_VBG the_DT roots_NNS with_IN ether_NN ,_, they_PRP were_VBD steeped_VBN in_IN ten_JJ parts_NNS of_IN water_NN for_IN about_IN 24_CD hours_NNS ._.
The_DT roots_NNS were_VBD dried_VBN at_IN room_NN temperature_NN and_CC fibres_NNS and_CC other_JJ impurities_NNS were_VBD removed_VBN ._.
The_DT loss_NN in_IN weight_NN during_IN the_DT steeping_NN was_VBD of_IN the_DT order_NN of_IN 6_CD per_IN cent_NN ._.
The_DT percentage_NN of_IN impurities_NNS ,_, including_VBG fibres_NNS ,_, etc._FW ,_, varied_VBD from_IN 13_CD to_TO 18_CD per_IN cent_NN ._.
Thus_RB on_IN the_DT whole_JJ the_DT quantity_NN of_IN extractable_JJ roots_NNS was_VBD about_IN 80_CD per_IN cent_NN of_IN the_DT original_JJ roots_NNS taken_VBN ._.
Steeping_VBG was_VBD also_RB done_VBN in_IN 5_CD per_IN cent_NN salt_NN solution_NN ._.
This_DT however_RB ,_, did_VBD not_RB give_VB any_DT better_JJR results_NNS ._.
The_DT concentration_NN obtained_VBN was_VBD to_TO the_DT extent_NN of_IN 6_CD per_IN cent_NN calculated_VBN on_IN the_DT basis_NN of_IN the_DT weight_NN of_IN cleaned_JJ roots_NNS ._.
The_DT constitution_NN of_IN the_DT colouring_VBG principles_NNS of_IN the_DT ratanjot_NN roots_NNS has_VBZ not_RB been_VBN studied_VBN in_IN detail_NN but_CC presumably_NN it_PRP is_VBZ closely_RB related_VBN to_TO that_DT of_IN the_DT alkanet_NN roots_NNS ,_, Anchusa_NNP tinctoria_NN ,_, lam_NN ._.
[_JJ Perkin_NNP and_CC Everest_NNP ,_, 1918_CD ._. ]_VB
Nargund_NNP [_NN 1942_CD ]_NN suggested_VBD the_DT formula_NN C30_NNP H28_NNP O8_NNP for_IN the_DT colouring_NN matter_NN ._.
It_PRP melts_VBZ at_IN 220ºC._CD ,_, with_IN previous_JJ softening_VBG at_IN about_IN 190ºC_CD ._.
Ratanjot_NNP roots_NNS are_VBP commonly_RB sold_VBN in_IN the_DT bazar_NN ._.
The_DT roots_NNS on_IN storing_VBG do_VBP not_RB seem_VB to_TO loose_VB their_PRP$ colour_NN imparting_VBG property_NN ._.
The_DT colour_NN concentrate_NN ,_, extracted_VBN with_IN ether_NN ,_, when_WRB stored_VBN at_IN 37ºC._CD ,_, 171_CD F_NNP 172_CD Colouring_NNP Vanaspati_NNP with_IN Ratanjot_NNP for_IN eight_CD months_NNS did_VBD not_RB suffer_VB deterioration_NN in_IN the_DT colour_NN giving_VBG property_NN and_CC can_MD thus_RB be_VB taken_VBN as_IN fairly_RB stable_JJ under_IN ordinary_JJ storage_NN conditions_NNS ._.
On_IN the_DT other_JJ hand_NN ,_, if_IN the_DT dye_NN is_VBZ heated_VBN to_TO a_DT very_RB high_JJ temperature_NN it_PRP does_VBZ not_RB give_VB any_DT red_JJ colour_NN to_TO fats_NNS but_CC will_MD still_RB give_VB the_DT characteristic_JJ blue_JJ colour_NN with_IN alkali_NN which_WDT is_VBZ now_RB taken_VBN as_IN a_DT specific_JJ test_NN for_IN indicating_VBG the_DT presence_NN of_IN ratanjot_NN ._.
Colouring_VBG vanaspati_NN ._.
The_DT concentrate_NN obtained_VBN by_IN extraction_NN with_IN other_JJ is_VBZ not_RB directly_RB used_VBN for_IN colouring_VBG vanaspati_NN as_IN it_PRP is_VBZ found_VBN that_IN all_DT of_IN it_PRP is_VBZ not_RB soluble_JJ in_IN fats_NNS ._.
One_CD hundred_CD grams_NNS of_IN vanas-_JJ pati_NNS require_VBP nearly_RB 0.25_CD gm_NN ._.
of_IN this_DT concentrate_NN to_TO give_VB an_DT almost_RB saturated_JJ solution_NN of_IN colour_NN in_IN fat_NN ._.
To_TO extract_VB all_PDT the_DT colour_NN ,_, the_DT mixture_NN is_VBZ repeatedly_RB heated_VBN to_TO about_IN 60ºC_CD ._.
with_IN constant_JJ stirring_NN ._.
This_DT is_VBZ then_RB filtered_VBN and_CC the_DT deep_JJ red_JJ vanaspati_NNS used_VBN for_IN colouring_VBG any_DT further_JJ quantities_NNS of_IN vanaspati_NN to_TO the_DT required_JJ intensity_NN is_VBZ obtained_VBN ._.
On_IN an_DT average_JJ vanaspati_NN of_IN the_DT kind_NN ordinarily_RB offered_VBN in_IN the_DT market_NN requires_VBZ 5.5_CD gm_NN ._.
of_IN the_DT concentrated_JJ coloured_VBD vanaspati_NN of_IN the_DT type_NN ,_, described_VBN above_IN ,_, to_TO colour_VB 1000_CD gm_NN ._.
of_IN it_PRP to_TO one_CD red_JJ unit_NN ,_, as_IN measured_VBN in_IN Lovibond_NNP Tintometer_NNP using_VBG 1_CD cm_NN ._.
cell_NN ,_, the_DT colour_JJ com-_NN parison_NN being_VBG carried_VBN out_IN at_IN 50ºC_CD ._.
This_DT gives_VBZ a_DT concentration_NN of_IN 0.0096_CD per_IN cent_NN ._.
Under_IN practical_JJ trade_NN conditions_NNS a_DT colour_JJ intensity_NN of_IN seven_CD red_JJ units_NNS is_VBZ suggested_VBN as_IN most_RBS suitable_JJ ._.
A_DT high_JJ intensity_NN of_IN colour_NN can_MD easily_RB be_VB given_VBN ,_, but_CC for_IN the_DT purpose_NN in_IN view_NN this_DT is_VBZ not_RB necessary_JJ ,_, as_IN the_DT presence_NN of_IN vanaspati_NNS so_RB coloured_VBD can_MD fairly_RB easily_RB be_VB detected_VBN as_IN has_VBZ been_VBN described_VBN later_RBR ._.
Stability_NN of_IN coloured_JJ vanaspati_NNS to_TO light_NN ._.
Investigations_NNS were_VBD carried_VBN out_RP with_IN different_JJ brands_NNS of_IN vanaspaties_NNS available_JJ in_IN the_DT market_NN ,_, and_CC they_PRP were_VBD coloured_VBN to_TO three_CD different_JJ intensities_NNS ,_, viz_NN ._.
five_CD ,_, six_CD and_CC seven_CD red_JJ units_NNS ._.
For_IN the_DT sake_NN of_IN brevity_NN ,_, however_RB ,_, results_NNS obtained_VBD with_IN only_RB one_CD popular_JJ brand_NN of_IN vanaspati_NN ,_, made_VBN from_IN the_DT groundnut_NN oil_NN ,_, and_CC coloured_VBD to_TO seven_CD red_JJ units_NNS ,_, have_VBP been_VBN dealt_VBN with_IN below_NN ._.
The_DT vanaspati_NN in_IN question_NN was_VBD kept_VBN in_IN glass_NN bottles_NNS stoppered_VBN with_IN corks_NNS and_CC exposed_VBN to_TO ordinary_JJ daylight_NN in_IN the_DT laboratory_NN ._.
The_DT changes_NNS in_IN colour_NN ,_, peroxide_NN values_NNS and_CC acidity_NN were_VBD recorded_VBN at_IN intervals_NNS ._.

of_IN N/500_NNP thiosulphate_NN per_IN gm_NN ._.

It_PRP is_VBZ ,_, therefore_RB ,_, necessary_JJ to_TO see_VB that_IN coloured_JJ vanaspati_NN is_VBZ not_RB exposed_VBN to_TO light_NN as_RB far_RB as_IN possible_JJ ._.
This_DT will_MD not_RB be_VB a_DT difficult_JJ matter_NN under-trade_JJ conditions_NNS as_IN the_DT vanaspati_NN is_VBZ invariably_RB sold_VBN packed_VBN in_IN tins_NNS ._.

1.4_CD 12.6_CD 36.7_CD The_DT above_NN date_NN indicate_VBP that_IN :_: (_( a_DT )_) With_IN the_DT increase_NN in_IN temperature_NN of_IN storage_NN ,_, a_DT decrease_NN in_IN colour_JJ intensity_NN is_VBZ observed_VBN ._.
Considering_VBG the_DT extent_NN of_IN the_DT decrease_NN noted_VBD ,_, this_DT may_MD not_RB be_VB considered_VBN serious_JJ under_IN practical_JJ trade_NN conditions_NNS ,_, as_IN vanaspati_NN may_MD ordinarily_RB be_VB expected_VBN to_TO be_VB disposed_VBN off_RP in_IN 3.4_CD months_NNS '_POS time_NN after_IN its_PRP$ manufacture_NN ._.
(_( b_NN )_) Under_IN ordinary_JJ climatic_JJ conditions_NNS ,_, a_DT decrease_NN of_IN about_IN 10_CD per_IN cent_NN in_IN the_DT colour_JJ intensity_NN may_MD be_VB expected_VBN in_IN about_RB six_CD months_NNS '_POS time_NN ._.
This_DT was_VBD further_JJ borne_NN out_RP by_IN the_DT fact_NN that_IN coloured_VBD vanaspati_NN samples_NNS kept_VBD in_IN sealed_JJ tins_NNS under_IN climatic_JJ conditions_NNS prevail-_JJ ing_NN in_IN Bangalore_NNP and_CC Bombay_NNP during_IN summer_NN months_NNS showed_VBD a_DT decrease_NN in_IN colour_NN to_TO the_DT extent_NN of_IN 11_CD per_IN cent_NN after_IN six_CD months_NNS '_POS storage_NN in_IN Bombay_NNP and_CC 1_CD per_IN cent_NN after_IN three_CD months_NNS '_POS storage_NN in_IN Bangalore_NNP ._.
(_( c_NN )_) During_IN these_DT studies_NNS a_DT record_NN of_IN the_DT development_NN of_IN peroxide_NN value_NN and_CC acidity_NN was_VBD also_RB kept_VBN ._.
No_DT difference_NN in_IN the_DT keeping_VBG quality_NN of_IN the_DT coloured_JJ vanaspati_NN and_CC original_JJ samples_NNS was_VBD observed_VBN ._.
Effect_NN of_IN adsorbents_NNS on_IN coloured_JJ vanaspati_IN The_DT edible_JJ colours_NN as_IN a_DT rule_NN are_VBP removable_JJ to_TO varying_VBG degrees_NNS by_IN the_DT use_NN of_IN different_JJ kinds_NNS of_IN adsorbents_NNS ._.
This_DT fact_NN is_VBZ in_IN practice_NN is_VBZ utilized_VBN for_IN bleaching_VBG vegetable_JJ oils_NNS used_VBN in_IN the_DT manufacture_NN of_IN vanaspati_NNS itself_PRP ._.
It_PRP is_VBZ ,_, therefore_RB ,_, to_TO be_VB expected_VBN that_IN these_DT adsorbents_NNS would_MD also_RB remove_VB the_DT colour_NN from_IN coloured_VBN vanaspati_NN ._.
To_TO study_VB the_DT effects_NNS of_IN the_DT various_JJ adsorbents_NNS quantitatively_RB ,_, therefore_IN the_DT following_JJ experiments_NNS were_VBD carried_VBN out_IN :_: (_( a_DT )_) One_CD hundred_VBN grams_NNS of_IN coloured_JJ vanaspati_NNS were_VBD mixed_JJ with_IN known_JJ amounts_NNS of_IN rice_NN husk_NN ,_, charcoal_NN ,_, Fuller_NNP 's_POS earth_NN and_CC kaolin_NN ._.
The_DT mixtures_NNS were_VBD heated_VBN off_RB and_CC on_IN for_IN three_CD hours_NNS at_IN 70ºC_CD ._.
with_IN occasional_JJ stirring_NN ._.
The_DT fat_NN was_VBD then_RB filtered_VBN and_CC the_DT colour_JJ com-_NN pared_VBD ._.
The_DT results_NNS obtained_VBD are_VBP given_VBN in_IN Table_NNP III_NNP ._.

0.9_CD 87.1_CD 2.9_CD 58.6_CD 5.2_CD 25.7_CD The_DT ratanjot_NN colour_NN is_VBZ removed_VBN fairly_RB easily_RB by_IN different_JJ adsorbents_NNS ._.
Activated_JJ charcoal_NN seems_VBZ the_DT cheapest_NN and_CC best_JJS adsorbent_NN ._.
Based_VBN on_IN this_DT property_NN ,_, a_DT method_NN has_VBZ been_VBN suggested_VBN later_RBR for_IN detecting_VBG the_DT presence_NN of_IN ratanjot_NN even_RB in_IN a_DT very_RB small_JJ quantity_NN ._.
This_DT removal_NN of_IN colour_NN from_IN coloured_VBN vanaspati_NN by_IN adsorbents_NNS ,_, it_PRP may_MD be_VB argued_VBN ,_, is_VBZ likely_JJ to_TO provide_VB a_DT loop-hole_JJ to_TO the_DT trade_NN ,_, viz._NN ,_, to_TO first_RB refine_VB the_DT vanaspati_NN before_IN mixing_VBG it_PRP with_IN ghee_NN ._.
It_PRP is_VBZ however_RB ,_, felt_VBD that_IN the_DT separation_NN of_IN adsorbents_NNS from_IN the_DT fat_NN may_MD not_RB prove_VB such_JJ an_DT easy_JJ matter_NN for_IN small_JJ merchants_NNS ._.
The_DT treatment_NN can_MD not_RB be_VB adopted_VBN on_IN such_PDT an_DT extensive_JJ scale_NN as_IN theoretial_JJ results_NNS would_MD suggest_VB and_CC yet_RB go_VB undetected_JJ ._.
Based_VBN on_IN the_DT fact_NN that_IN the_DT colour_NN of_IN vanaspati_NNS can_MD be_VB removed_VBN by_IN adsorbents_NNS ,_, some_DT workers_NNS have_VBP suggested_VBN that_IN addition_NN of_IN sesame_JJ oil_NN to_TO vanaspati_VB would_MD provide_VB a_DT more_RBR effective_JJ way_NN of_IN detect-_JJ ing_VBG the_DT presence_NN of_IN vanaspati_NN if_IN used_VBN as_IN an_DT adulterant_NN with_IN ghee_NN ,_, viz._NN ,_, the_DT application_NN of_IN a_DT specific_JJ test_NN 'Furfurol_POS test_NN ,_, '_'' for_IN sesame_JJ oil_NN ._.
Experiments_NNS were_VBD ,_, therefore_RB ,_, carried_VBD out_RP using_VBG coloured_JJ vanaspati_NNS containing_VBG 5_CD and_CC 10_CD per_IN cent_NN sesame_NN oil_NN ._.
These_DT samples_NNS were_VBD treated_VBN with_IN 5_CD per_IN cent_NN char-_NN coal_NN and_CC Fuller_NNP 's_POS earth_NN ._.
The_DT decrease_NN in_IN the_DT colour_JJ intensity_NN of_IN the_DT Furfurol_NNP reaction_NN and_CC the_DT colour_NN of_IN vanaspati_NN was_VBD observed_VBN as_IN noted_VBN in_IN Table_NNP IV_NNP ._.

55.5_CD 86.1_CD 88.9_CD 69.4_CD It_PRP will_MD be_VB seen_VBN that_IN as_RB far_RB as_IN the_DT effect_NN of_IN adsorbents_NNS is_VBZ concerned_VBN ,_, both_DT coloured_VBN vanaspati_NN and_CC vanaspati_NN containing_NN sesame_NN oil_NN ,_, are_VBP almost_RB equally_RB affected_JJ ._.
This_DT point_NN is_VBZ very_RB important_JJ but_CC is_VBZ overlooked_VBN by_IN those_DT who_WP advocate_VBP the_DT addition_NN of_IN sesame_JJ oil_NN in_IN preference_NN to_TO colouring_VBG vanaspati_NN for_IN detecting_VBG its_PRP$ presence_NN in_IN ghee_NN as_IN an_DT adulterant_NN ._.
Use_NNP of_IN coloured_JJ vanaspati_NNS to_TO detect_VB adulteration_NN in_IN ghee_NN ._.
(_( i_NN )_) Visual_NNP Detection_NNP ._.
The_DT main_JJ object_NN of_IN colouring_VBG vandapati_NN is_VBZ that_IN if_IN any_DT of_IN it_PRP is_VBZ added_VBN to_TO ghee_VB its_PRP$ presence_NN should_MD be_VB evident_JJ to_TO the_DT consumer_NN ._.
A_DT colour_JJ intensity_NN of_IN seven_CD red_JJ units_NNS is_VBZ suggested_VBN as_IN it_PRP is_VBZ expected_VBN to_TO provide_VB a_DT reasonably_RB good_JJ safeguard_NN without_IN making_VBG vanaspati_NNS in_IN any_DT way_NN un-_JJ welcome_NN to_TO the_DT consumer_NN ._.
Adopting_VBG this_DT colour_JJ standard_NN ,_, it_PRP has_VBZ been_VBN possible_JJ to_TO detect_VB visually_RB the_DT N._NNP N._NNP DASTUR_NNP ,_, A._NNP K-ANNAN_NNP AND_NNP Z._NNP R._NNP KOTHAWALLA_NNP 175_CD presence_NN of_IN even_RB 5_CD per_IN cent_NN of_IN coloured_JJ vanaspati_NNS in_IN buffalo_NN ghee_NN and_CC of_IN 15_CD per_IN cent_NN in_IN cow_NN ghee_NN ._.
This_DT is_VBZ a_DT great_JJ improvement_NN over_IN the_DT existing_VBG routine_JJ chemical_NN tests_NNS with_IN which_WDT it_PRP is_VBZ not_RB possible_JJ to_TO detect_VB even_RB up_IN to_TO 20176_CD Colouring_NNP Vanaspati_NNP with_IN Ratanjot_NNP when_WRB most_JJS of_IN the_DT charcoal_NN goes_VBZ to_TO the_DT bottom_NN ._.
The_DT fat_JJ layer_NN is_VBZ then_RB decanted_VBN off_RP ._.
The_DT residual_JJ charcoal_NN is_VBZ warmed_VBN with_IN 5_CD ml_NNS ._.
of_IN chloroform_NN and_CC filtered_VBD ._.
The_DT filtrate_NN is_VBZ collected_VBN in_IN a_DT white_JJ porcelain_NN dish_NN ._.
The_DT extraction_NN is_VBZ repeated_VBN two_CD more_JJR time_NN ._.
The_DT total_JJ filtrate_NN is_VBZ now_RB freed_VBN from_IN solvents_NNS on_IN a_DT water_NN bath_NN and_CC a_DT strong_JJ aqueous_JJ solution_NN of_IN alkali_NN is_VBZ added_VBN ._.
The_DT residue_NN in_IN the_DT dish_JJ assumes_VBZ a_DT greenish_JJ blue_NN tint_NN in_IN the_DT presence_NN of_IN ratanjot_NN ._.
Ghee_NNP prepared_VBD from_IN cow_NN 's_POS milk_NN or_CC from_IN artificially_RB coloured_VBN butter_NN does_VBZ not_RB show_VB any_DT change_NN on_IN the_DT addition_NN of_IN alkali_NN when_WRB subjected_VBN to_TO similar_JJ treatment_NN ._.
By_IN this_DT test_NN it_PRP is_VBZ possible_JJ to_TO detect_VB the_DT presence_NN of_IN even_RB 5_CD per_IN cent_NN of_IN added_VBN coloured_JJ vanaspati_NN ._.
Toxicity_NN of_IN ratanjot_JJ gye_NN ._.
This_DT has_VBZ been_VBN systematically_RB tested_VBN in_IN experiments_NNS with_IN rats_NNS and_CC guinea_NN pigs_NNS ._.
It_PRP is_VBZ found_VBN to_TO be_VB completely_RB harmless_JJ ._.
Even_RB on_IN heating_VBG to_TO the_DT frying_NN temperature_NN it_PRP does_VBZ not_RB acquire_VB any_DT toxic_JJ effects_NNS ._.
SUMMARY_NNP To_TO safeguard_VB trade_NN in_IN genuine_JJ ghee_NN it_PRP is_VBZ considered_VBN desirable_JJ that_IN all_DT vanaspati_NNS should_MD be_VB coloured_VBN ._.
The_DT colour_NN should_MD be_VB attractive_JJ ,_, very_RB distinct_JJ from_IN that_DT of_IN natural_JJ ghee_NN ,_, non-toxic_JJ ,_, fairly_RB stable_JJ to_TO heat_VB and_CC light_JJ and_CC should_MD not_RB impart_VB any_DT foreign_JJ taste_NN and_CC odour_NN to_TO vanaspati_VB ._.
The_DT use_NN of_IN ratanjot_NN for_IN this_DT purpose_NN is_VBZ suggested_VBN ._.
The_DT intensity_NN of_IN colour_NN recommended_VBN is_VBZ seven_CD red_JJ units_NNS ._.
As_IN vanaspati_NN is_VBZ solely_RB used_VBN as_IN cooking_VBG medium_NN its_PRP$ colouring_NN is_VBZ not_RB likely_JJ to_TO harm_VB the_DT legitimate_JJ interests_NNS of_IN the_DT vanaspati_JJ trade_NN in_IN any_DT way_NN ._.
Food_NN cooked_VBN in_IN vanaspati_NNS so_RB coloured_VBD does_VBZ not_RB acquire_VB any_DT extraneous_JJ flavour_NN ,_, taste_NN or_CC colour_NN ._.
Vanaspati_NNS coloured_VBN with_IN ratanjot_NN is_VBZ found_VBN to_TO preserve_VB its_PRP$ colour_NN at_IN atmospheric_JJ temperature_NN and_CC in_IN diffuse_NN light_NN such_JJ as_IN are_VBP likely_JJ to_TO be_VB encountered_VBN under_IN conditions_NNS during_IN its_PRP$ storage_NN and_CC marketing_NN ._.
Coloured_VBN vanaspati_NN does_VBZ not_RB suffer_VB in_IN any_DT way_NN in_IN its_PRP$ keeping_VBG quality_NN ._.
While_IN there_EX are_VBP other_JJ tests_NNS such_JJ as_IN the_DT addition_NN of_IN sesame_JJ oil_NN to_TO vanaspati_VB which_WDT can_MD help_VB to_TO detect_VB adulteration_NN ,_, colouring_VBG vanaspati_NNS provides_VBZ the_DT most_RBS direct_JJ and_CC the_DT simplest_JJS solution_NN ._.

.._JJ .._NNP .._NNP .._NNP .._NNP .._NNP .._NNP .._NNP .._NNP .._NNP .._NNP .._NNP .._NNP .._VBD 46.4_CD Total_NNP ._.
30.4_CD 38.6_CD 37.5_CD 32_CD 1_CD 28.4_CD 23.2_CD 31.0_CD 25.4_CD 78.2_CD 78.1_CD 74.5_CD 74.4_CD 70.9_CD 70.0_CD 96.6_CD 96.4_CD 182_CD Components_NNS of_IN Fatty_NNP Acids_NNP of_IN Butter_NNP Fats_NNP DISCUSSION_NNP From_IN the_DT analytical_JJ data_NNS in_IN Table_NN I_PRP it_PRP will_MD be_VB seen_VBN that_IN goat_NN and_CC sheep_JJ butterfats_NNS have_VBP almost_RB similar_JJ characteristics_NNS to_TO those_DT of_IN cow_NNS and_CC buffalo_NN butterfats_NNS ._.
Goat_NNP and_CC sheep_JJ butterfats_NNS have_VBP a_DT high_JJ Polenske_NNP value_NN and_CC low_JJ iodine_NN value_NN ._.
In_IN the_DT case_NN of_IN groundnut_NN vanaspatis_NN with_IN a_DT higher_JJR degree_NN of_IN hydrogenation_NN as_IN indicated_VBN by_IN the_DT melting_NN point_NN ,_, there_EX is_VBZ a_DT gradual_JJ decrease_NN in_IN the_DT B._NNP R._NNP index_NN and_CC iodine_NN value_NN ._.
The_DT mustard_NN oil_NN is_VBZ characterised_VBN from_IN the_DT other_JJ fats_NNS by_IN a_DT very_RB high_JJ iodine_NN value_NN ,_, and_CC low_JJ saponification_NN value_NN ,_, indicating_VBG the_DT presence_NN of_IN glycerides_NNS of_IN high_JJ molecular_JJ weight_NN fatty_JJ acids_NNS ._.
The_DT amount_NN of_IN butyric_JJ acid_NN in_IN cow_NN butterfat_NN as_IN seen_VBN in_IN Tables_NNP II_NNP and_CC V_NNP is_VBZ higher_JJR than_IN in_IN other_JJ butterfats_NNS in_IN which_WDT the_DT molar_JJ percentage_NN of_IN this_DT acid_NN is_VBZ almost_RB equal_JJ ._.
The_DT values_NNS for_IN C6_NNP C10_NNP acids_NNS in_IN goat_NN and_CC sheep_JJ ghee_NN confirm_VBP the_DT high_JJ Polenske_NNP value_NN already_RB described_VBN in_IN Table_JJ I_PRP ._.
The_DT data_NNS given_VBN by_IN Dhingra_NNP [_NNP 1937_CD ]_NNP and_CC Hilditch_NNP and_CC Jasperson_NNP [_NNP 1944_CD ]_NN are_VBP in_IN agreement_NN with_IN present_JJ results_NNS ._.
The_DT percentage_NN of_IN lauric_JJ acid_NN is_VBZ also_RB higher_RBR in_IN the_DT butterfats_NNS of_IN goat_NN and_CC sheep_NN ._.
With_IN regard_NN to_TO percentage_NN of_IN stearic_JJ acid_NN ,_, it_PRP is_VBZ seen_VBN that_IN the_DT proportions_NNS in_IN buffalo_NN ,_, goat_NN and_CC sheep_JJ butterfats_NNS are_VBP almost_RB similar_JJ ,_, while_IN cow_JJ butterfat_NN is_VBZ richer_VBN by_IN about_IN 6.0_CD per_IN cent_NN in_IN stearic_JJ acid_NN content_NN ._.
The_DT sum_NN of_IN myristo-palmi-_JJ to-stearic_JJ group_NN acids_NNS is_VBZ ,_, however_RB ,_, constant_JJ in_IN all_PDT the_DT butterfats_NNS ._.
The_DT total_NN of_IN all_PDT the_DT acids_NNS up_IN to_TO C14_NNP is_VBZ higher_JJR in_IN case_NN of_IN goat_NN (_( 31.5_CD per_IN cent_NN ,_, and_CC sheep_RB 32.9_CD per_IN cent_NN )_) milkfats_VBZ as_RB compared_VBN to_TO cow_VB (_( 20.3_CD per_IN cent_NN )_) and_CC buffalo_NN (_( 21.2_CD per_IN cent_NN )_) milkfats_NNS ._.
This_DT is_VBZ mainly_RB caused_VBN by_IN the_DT high_JJ amount_NN of_IN capric_NN and_CC lauric_JJ acids_NNS in_IN goat_NN and_CC sheep_JJ butterfats_NNS ._.
Arachidic_JJ acid_NN is_VBZ almost_RB similar_JJ in_IN all_PDT the_DT fats_NNS ._.
The_DT percentage_NN of_IN the_DT lower_JJR unsaturated_JJ acids_NNS C10-C16_NNP in_IN the_DT butterfats_NNS is_VBZ confirmed_VBN in_IN the_DT present_JJ study_NN [_NNP cf_NN ._.
also_RB Acharya_NNP and_CC Banerjee_NNP ,_, 1946_CD ]_NN ._.
It_PRP is_VBZ found_VBN that_IN they_PRP are_VBP distributed_VBN in_IN almost_RB the_DT same_JJ proportion_NN in_IN all_PDT the_DT butterfats_NNS ._.
The_DT percentage_NN of_IN oleic_JJ acid_NN is_VBZ similar_JJ in_IN cow_NN and_CC buffalo_NN butterfats_NNS ,_, while_IN in_IN goat_NN and_CC sheep_JJ butterfats_NNS ,_, the_DT proportion_NN is_VBZ found_VBN to_TO be_VB much_RB less_JJR as_IN will_MD be_VB seen_VBN from_IN Table_JJ V._NNP This_DT is_VBZ in_IN close_JJ agreement_NN with_IN the_DT iodine_NN values_NNS of_IN the_DT samples_NNS ._.
There_EX are_VBP marked_JJ variations_NNS in_IN linoleic_JJ acid_JJ content_NN of_IN different_JJ butterfats_NNS ._.
However_RB ,_, Hilditch_NNP has_VBZ shown_VBN that_IN the_DT amount_NN of_IN this_DT acid_NN in_IN butterfat_NN varies_NNS with_IN the_DT diet_NN of_IN the_DT animals_NNS as_IN it_PRP increases_VBZ if_IN the_DT animals_NNS are_VBP given_VBN plenty_NN of_IN green_JJ grass_NN ._.
It_PRP is_VBZ found_VBN from_IN the_DT data_NNS that_WDT unsaturated_VBD acids_NNS higher_JJR than_IN C18_NNP are_VBP also_RB present_JJ ._.
No_DT attempt_NN was_VBD made_VBN to_TO examine_VB this_DT fraction_NN in_IN detail_NN and_CC they_PRP have_VBP been_VBN grouped_VBN as_IN C20-C22_NNP unsaturated_JJ acids_NNS ._.
The_DT proportions_NNS of_IN this_DT fraction_NN in_IN different_JJ butterfats_NNS were_VBD found_VBN to_TO be_VB almost_RB similar_JJ ._.
Our_PRP$ results_NNS for_IN palmitic_JJ and_CC stearic_JJ acids_NNS in_IN buffalo_NN ghee_NN agree_VBP closely_RB with_IN those_DT of_IN Acharya_NNP and_CC Banerjee_NNP [_NNP 1946_CD ]_NNP ._.
The_DT amount_NN of_IN oleic_JJ acid_NN in_IN the_DT sample_NN analysed_VBN here_RB is_VBZ much_JJ higher_JJR (_( 26.3_CD per_IN cent_NN molar_NN )_) than_IN the_DT value_NN (_( 17_CD per_IN cent_NN molar_NN )_) shown_VBN by_IN the_DT above_JJ workers_NNS ._.
These_DT workers_NNS ,_, however_RB ,_, have_VBP not_RB given_VBN detailed_JJ results_NNS and_CC as_IN such_JJ no_DT strict_JJ comparison_NN can_MD be_VB made_VBN ._.
Our_PRP$ results_NNS for_IN the_DT major_JJ component_NN acids_NNS of_IN goat_NN and_CC sheep_JJ butterfats_NNS agree_VBP with_IN those_DT of_IN Dhingra_NNP [_NNP 1933_CD ]_NNP ._.
It_PRP is_VBZ also_RB found_VBN (_( Table_JJ V_NNP )_) that_IN the_DT proportions_NNS of_IN different_JJ acids_NNS in_IN sheep_JJ butterfats_NNS are_VBP almost_RB similar_JJ to_TO those_DT of_IN goat_NN butterfat_NN ._.
The_DT results_NNS of_IN the_DT analysis_NN of_IN hydrogenated_JJ groundnut_NN oils_NNS of_IN m.p_NN ._.
34.1ºC._CD ,_, 37.0oC_CD ._.
and_CC 39.0ºC_CD ._.
are_VBP represented_VBN in_IN Table_NNP III_NNP ._.
It_PRP is_VBZ seen_VBN from_IN those_DT results_NNS that_WDT as_IN the_DT melting_VBG point_NN increases_NNS from_IN 34.1ºC_CD ._.
to_TO 39.0ºC._CD ,_, there_EX is_VBZ a_DT gradual_JJ increase_NN in_IN the_DT content_NN of_IN stearic_JJ acid_NN from_IN 6.2_CD to_TO 12.6_CD per_IN cent_NN ._.
Hydrogenation_NN ,_, however_RB ,_, does_VBZ not_RB seem_VB to_TO affect_VB palmitic_JJ acid_NN ,_, arachidic_JJ ,_, behenic_JJ ,_, and_CC lignoceric_JJ acid_NN contents_NNS ._.
Obviously_RB the_DT total_JJ amount_NN of_IN saturated_JJ acids_NNS progressively_RB increases_VBZ with_IN the_DT rise_NN in_IN melting_VBG point_NN ._.
The_DT percentages_NNS of_IN oleic_NN and_CC linoleic_JJ acids_NNS on_IN the_DT other_JJ hand_NN ,_, gradually_RB decrease_NN ._.
The_DT net_JJ result_NN of_IN hydrogenation_NN is_VBZ the_DT conversion_NN of_IN C18_NNP unsaturated_JJ acids_NNS to_TO C18_NNP saturated_JJ acids_NNS ._.
The_DT results_NNS of_IN the_DT composition_NN of_IN Indian_JJ mustard_NN oil_NN are_VBP presented_VBN in_IN Table_NNP IV_NNP ._.
The_DT results_NNS closely_RB agree_VBP with_IN those_DT reported_VBN by_IN Sudborough_NNP et_CC al_RB [_JJ 1926_CD ]_NN ._.
Mustard_NNP oil_NN differs_NNS from_IN common_JJ edible_JJ oils_NNS in_IN that_DT it_PRP contains_VBZ a_DT very_RB high_JJ proportion_NN of_IN eureic_JJ acid_NN (_( 51.0_CD per_IN cent_NN )_) ._.
The_DT oleic_NN and_CC linoleic_JJ acids_NNS are_VBP present_JJ to_TO the_DT extent_NN of_IN 29.8_CD per_IN cent_NN and_CC 18.2_CD per_IN cent_NN respectively_RB ._.
Thus_RB the_DT total_JJ un-_JJ saturated_JJ acids_NNS in_IN the_DT mustard_NN oil_NN are_VBP 96.4_CD per_IN cent_NN ,_, the_DT remaining_VBG being_VBG made_VBN up_IN of_IN small_JJ quantities_NNS of_IN myristic_JJ ,_, behenic_JJ and_CC lignoceric_JJ acids_NNS ._.
V._NNP R._NNP BHALERAO_NNP ,_, et_VBD al_RB 183_CD SUMMARY_NNP (_( 1_CD )_) Detailed_VBN analysis_NN of_IN fatty_JJ acids_NNS of_IN cow_NN ,_, buffalo_NN ,_, goat_NN and_CC sheep_JJ butterfats_NNS ,_, hydrogenated_VBD groundnut_NN oils_NNS of_IN melting_VBG point_NN 34.1ºC._CD ,_, 37.0ºC._CD ,_, and_CC 39.0ºC_CD ._.
and_CC mustard_NN oil_NN have_VBP been_VBN carried_VBN out_RP ._.
(_( 2_CD )_) The_DT cow_NN and_CC buffalo_NN butterfats_NNS are_VBP found_VBN to_TO be_VB similar_JJ in_IN composition_NN and_CC differ_NN from_IN goat_NN and_CC sheep_JJ butterfats_NNS ,_, in_IN that_DT the_DT latter_JJR contain_NN more_JJR of_IN caprylic_NN ,_, capric_NN ,_, and_CC lauric_JJ acids_NNS and_CC less_JJR of_IN oelic_JJ acid_NN ._.
The_DT presence_NN of_IN unsaturated_JJ acids_NNS lower_JJR than_IN C18_NNP in_IN the_DT butterfats_NNS of_IN buffalo_NN ,_, goat_NN and_CC sheep_NN have_VBP also_RB been_VBN confirmed_VBN ._.
(_( 3_CD )_) In_IN case_NN of_IN hydrogenated_JJ samples_NNS of_IN groundnut_NN oil_NN ,_, with_IN the_DT increase_NN in_IN the_DT melting_NN point_NN there_EX was_VBD a_DT gradual_JJ lowering_NN in_IN the_DT content_NN of_IN oleic_NN and_CC linoleic_JJ acids_NNS and_CC a_DT corresponding_JJ increase_NN in_IN stearic_JJ acid_NN ._.
(_( 4_CD )_) The_DT chief_JJ component_NN fatty_JJ acids_NNS of_IN mustard_NN oil_NN are_VBP found_VBN to_TO be_VB eureic_JJ acid_NN (_( 51.0_CD per_IN cent_NN )_) ,_, oleic_JJ acid_NN (_( 29.8_CD per_IN cent_NN )_) and_CC linoleic_JJ acid_NN (_( 18.2_CD per_IN cent_NN )_) ._.

9A_CD ,_, 43_CD VITAMIN_NNP C_NNP CONTENT_NNP OF_IN THE_NNP MILK_NNP OF_NNP SOME_NNP IMPORTANT_NNP BREEDS_NNP OF_NNP INDIAN_NNP CATTLE_NNP By_IN KERALA_NNP VARMA_NNP AND_NNP T._NNP M._NNP PAUL_NNP ,_, Indian_NNP Dairy_NNP Research_NNP Institute_NNP ,_, Bangalore_NNP (_( Received_VBN for_IN publication_NN on_IN 27_CD September_NNP 1946_CD )_) A_DT CONSIDERABLE_NNP of_IN work_NN has_VBZ been_VBN done_VBN abroad_RB to_TO study_VB the_DT vitamin_NN C_NNP content_NN of_IN milk_NN and_CC the_DT influence_NN of_IN various_JJ factors_NNS like_IN feed_NN ,_, season_NN of_IN the_DT year_NN ,_, etc._FW ,_, on_IN it_PRP ._.
Riddel_NNP et_CC al_RB [_JJ 1935_CD ]_NN observed_VBD that_IN the_DT vitamin_NN C_NNP content_NN of_IN milk_NN was_VBD not_RB subject_JJ to_TO changes_NNS in_IN the_DT diet_NN of_IN the_DT cow_NN ._.
Whitnah_NNP and_CC Riddel_NNP [_NNP 1937_CD ]_NNP studied_VBD the_DT various_JJ factors_NNS affecting_VBG the_DT vitamin_NN C_NNP content_NN of_IN milk_NN ._.
They_PRP noticed_VBD that_IN it_PRP was_VBD low_JJ in_IN the_DT early_JJ stages_NNS of_IN the_DT lactation_NN ;_: also_RB that_IN there_EX was_VBD a_DT rise_NN from_IN October_NNP to_TO December_NNP ,_, a_DT fall_NN from_IN December_NNP to_TO February_NNP and_CC again_RB a_DT rise_NN in_IN February_NNP to_TO March_NNP ,_, but_CC they_PRP could_MD not_RB correlate_VB this_DT fluctuation_NN with_IN any_DT change_NN in_IN feed_NN or_CC any_DT other_JJ factor_NN and_CC hence_NN they_PRP thought_VBD it_PRP merely_RB accidental_JJ ._.
Holmes_NNP et_CC al_RB [_JJ 1940_CD ]_NNP observed_VBD an_DT increase_NN in_IN the_DT first_JJ month_NN ,_, although_IN the_DT increase_NN was_VBD not_RB of_IN much_JJ practical_JJ significance_NN ._.
Bartlet_NNP et_CC al_RB [_JJ 1938_CD ]_NN however_RB found_VBD that_IN the_DT vitamin_NN C_NNP level_NN was_VBD very_RB variable_JJ but_CC was_VBD highest_JJS in_IN the_DT milk_NN of_IN cows_NNS fed_VBN on_IN sprouted_JJ maize_NN ._.
Holmes_NNP et_CC al_RB [_JJ 1941_CD ]_NN have_VBP also_RB recorded_VBN certain_JJ fluctuations_NNS which_WDT they_PRP correlated_VBD with_IN advance_NN in_IN pregnancy_NN ._.
Here_RB again_RB ,_, they_PRP found_VBD some_DT difference_NN from_IN breed_NN to_TO breed_VB ,_, and_CC there_RB was_VBD a_DT gradual_JJ fall_NN in_IN the_DT vitamin_NN content_NN as_IN pregnancy_NN and_CC lactation_NN advanced_VBD ._.
Karl_NNP Guggenheim_NNP [_NNP 1940_CD ]_NNP observed_VBD a_DT peak_NN in_IN the_DT first_JJ half_NN of_IN the_DT year_NN ,_, reaching_VBG the_DT maximum_NN in_IN June-July_NNP which_WDT had_VBD no_DT relation_NN with_IN feed_NN ._.
Thus_RB the_DT general_JJ conclusion_NN is_VBZ that_IN feed_NN has_VBZ little_JJ effect_NN on_IN the_DT vitamin_NN C_NNP content_NN ,_, while_IN breed_NN ,_, stage_NN of_IN lactation_NN ,_, etc._NN ,_, have_VBP some_DT effect_NN ._.
In_IN India_NNP comparatively_RB little_JJ work_NN has_VBZ been_VBN done_VBN on_IN the_DT vitamin_NN C_NNP content_NN of_IN milk_NN ._.
The_DT few_JJ investigations_NNS that_WDT have_VBP been_VBN made_VBN give_VBP the_DT impression_NN that_IN the_DT milk_NN of_IN Indian_JJ cows_NNS and_CC buffaloes_NNS is_VBZ rather_RB poor_JJ in_IN vitamin_JJ C_NNP content_NN as_IN compared_VBN to_TO the_DT milk_NN of_IN the_DT European_JJ breeds_NNS ._.
Ghosh_NNP and_CC Guha_NNP [_NNP 1935_CD ]_NN have_VBP reported_VBN the_DT vitamin_NN C_NNP content_NN of_IN cows_NNS milk_NN as_IN 0.007_CD mg/ml_NN ._.
Chakravarthy_NNP [_NN 1935_CD ]_NN has_VBZ also_RB recorded_VBN the_DT same_JJ figures_NNS while_IN Ranganathan_NNP [_VBP 1935_CD ]_NNP got_VBD a_DT still_RB lower_JJR value_NN of_IN 0.004_CD mg/ml_NN ._.
Ray_NNP et_CC al_RB [_JJ 1941_CD ]_NN found_VBD the_DT average_JJ vitamin_JJ C_NNP content_NN of_IN milk_NN to_TO be_VB 0.0194_CD mg._JJ per_IN ml_NN ._.
with_IN a_DT maximum_NN of_IN 0.0223_CD and_CC minimum_NN of_IN 0.0133_CD mg._NNS per_IN ml_NN ._.
Even_RB this_DT is_VBZ lower_JJR than_IN the_DT figures_NNS reported_VBN for_IN the_DT milk_NN of_IN European_JJ breeds_NNS ._.
Kothavala_NNP and_CC Gill_NNP [_NNP 1943_CD ]_NNP alone_RB report_VBP the_DT vitamin_JJ C_NNP content_NN of_IN the_DT milk_NN of_IN Indian_JJ cattle_NNS to_TO be_VB comparable_JJ to_TO those_DT recorded_VBN by_IN western_JJ workers_NNS ._.
Such_JJ great_JJ difference_NN in_IN the_DT values_NNS for_IN vitamin_NN C_NNP content_NN of_IN milk_NN might_MD possibly_RB be_VB due_JJ to_TO the_DT difference_NN in_IN the_DT method_NN of_IN collection_NN of_IN the_DT samples_NNS ,_, part_NN of_IN the_DT vitamin_NN C_NNP being_VBG destroyed_VBN in_IN cases_NNS where_WRB the_DT milk_NN has_VBZ been_VBN exposed_VBN to_TO light_NN or_CC metal_NN surfaces_NNS ._.
However_RB ,_, no_DT conclusive_JJ data_NNS are_VBP available_JJ regarding_VBG the_DT vitamin_NN C_NNP content_NN of_IN the_DT milk_NN of_IN the_DT different_JJ breeds_NNS of_IN Indian_JJ Cattle_NNP ,_, or_CC the_DT extent_NN of_IN variations_NNS in_IN the_DT vitamin_NN C_NNP content_NN of_IN their_PRP$ milk_NN due_JJ to_TO breed_VB ,_, season_NN of_IN the_DT year_NN and_CC stage_NN of_IN lactation_NN and_CC hence_RB the_DT present_JJ work_NN was_VBD undertaken_VBN ._.
EXPERIMENTAL_NNP Five_CD animals_NNS were_VBD selected_VBN from_IN each_DT of_IN the_DT following_JJ breeds_NNS maintained_VBD at_IN this_DT Institute_NNP farm_NN :_: Sindhi_NNP ,_, Gir_NNP ,_, Tharparkar_NNP ,_, cross-bred_JJ cows_NNS and_CC Murrah_NNP buffaloes_NNS ._.
The_DT animals_NNS were_VBD of_IN almost_RB the_DT same_JJ age_NN and_CC were_VBD in_IN the_DT first_JJ or_CC second_JJ week_NN of_IN the_DT particular_JJ lactation_NN ._.
The_DT usual_JJ concentrate_NN ration_NN of_IN the_DT institute_NN herd_NN consisting_NN of_IN a_DT mixture_NN of_IN wheat_NN bran_NN ,_, gram_NN ,_, gram_JJ husk_NN and_CC ground-_JJ nut_NNS cake_NN ,_, mixed_JJ in_IN the_DT proportion_NN of_IN 4.0:1.5:2.0:2.5_CD ,_, was_VBD fed_VBN to_TO the_DT animals_NNS at_IN the_DT rate_NN of_IN 1_CD lb_NN ._.
for_IN every_DT two_CD pounds_NNS of_IN milk_NN yielded_VBN by_IN the_DT animal_NN with_IN a_DT minimum_NN of_IN 3_CD lb_NN ._.
The_DT roughage_NN fed_VBD consisted_VBN of_IN 55_CD lb_NN ._.
green_JJ grass_NN (_( mixture_NN of_IN Guinea_NNP and_CC Napier_NNP grasses_NNS )_) and_CC 3_CD lb_NN ._.
of_IN ragi_JJ straw_NN for_IN cows_NNS and_CC 70_CD lb_NN ._.
of_IN the_DT same_JJ mixture_NN of_IN grasses_NNS and_CC 3_CD lb_NN ._.
of_IN ragi_JJ straw_NN for_IN buffaloes_NNS ._.
Individual_JJ milk_NN samples_NNS were_VBD collected_VBN in_IN the_DT morning_NN in_IN glass_NN bottle_NN coated_VBD outside_JJ with_IN a_DT thick_JJ layer_NN of_IN Japan_NNP black_JJ so_RB that_IN there_EX was_VBD no_DT chance_NN of_IN any_DT action_NN of_IN light_NN on_IN the_DT vitamin_NN C_NNP content_NN of_IN the_DT samples_NNS ._.
Immediately_RB the_DT samples_NNS were_VBD analysed_VBN for_IN their_PRP$ vitamin_NN C_NNP content_NN by_IN the_DT method_NN of_IN Bessey_NNP and_CC King_NNP [_NNP 1933_CD ]_NNP ._.
To_TO 20_CD ml_NNS ._.
of_IN milk_NN ,_, 5_CD ml_NN ._.
of_IN 20_CD per_IN cent_NN trichloracetic_JJ acid_NN were_VBD added_VBN ;_: the_DT mixture_NN was_VBD then_RB shaken_VBN well_RB and_CC filtered_VBN ._.
Five_CD millilitres_NNS of_IN the_DT clear_JJ filtrate_NN was_VBD titrated_VBN against_IN a_DT standard_JJ solution_NN of_IN 2:6_CD 185_CD I_PRP 186_CD Vitamin_NNP C_NNP Content_NNP of_IN Milk_NNP dichlorophenol_NN indophenol_NN and_CC vitamin_NN C_NNP expressed_VBD as_IN mg._NN of_IN ascorbic_JJ acid_NN per_IN litre_NN of_IN milk_NN ._.
From_IN a_DT few_JJ preliminary_JJ trials_NNS it_PRP was_VBD found_VBN that_IN fresh_JJ milk_NN collected_VBN in_IN dark_JJ bottles_NNS contained_VBN only_RB a_DT very_RB negligible_JJ amount_NN of_IN reversibly_RB oxidised_VBN ascorbic_JJ acid_NN ._.
The_DT same_JJ observation_NN was_VBD made_VBN by_IN Ray_NNP et_CC al_RB [_JJ 1941_CD ]_NN ._.
Hence_NNP only_RB the_DT reduced_VBN ascorbic_JJ acid_NN was_VBD estimated_VBN in_IN the_DT experimental_JJ samples_NNS ._.
The_DT estimation_NN of_IN the_DT vitamin_NN was_VBD carried_VBN out_RP every_DT week_NN for_IN about_RB 12_CD months_NNS when_WRB most_JJS of_IN the_DT animals_NNS went_VBD dry_JJ ._.
The_DT average_JJ vitamin_JJ C_NNP content_NN of_IN the_DT milk_NN of_IN each_DT breed_NN for_IN each_DT month_NN is_VBZ calculated_VBN and_CC presented_VBN in_IN Table_NNP I_PRP ._.

.._RB 26.4_CD .._JJ 23.2_CD .._JJ 24.8_CD Average_NN for_IN the_DT lactation_NN exclud-_JJ ing_VBG the_DT first_JJ month_NN 24.2_CD 22.1_CD 19.8_CD 20.4_CD 25.6_CD 22.6_CD DISCUSSION_NN It_PRP was_VBD noticed_VBN that_IN in_IN the_DT case_NN of_IN all_DT except_IN cross-bred_JJ cows_NNS ,_, the_DT average_JJ vitamin_JJ C_NNP content_NN of_IN milk_NN in_IN the_DT first_JJ month_NN of_IN lactation_NN was_VBD slightly_RB lower_JJR than_IN the_DT average_JJ value_NN for_IN each_DT of_IN the_DT other_JJ months_NNS ._.
These_DT figures_NNS were_VBD also_RB lower_JJR than_IN the_DT breed_JJ average_NN or_CC the_DT herd_JJ average_NN for_IN the_DT whole_JJ lactation_NN ._.
This_DT is_VBZ an_DT agreement_NN with_IN the_DT findings_NNS of_IN Whitnah_NNP and_CC Riddel_NNP [_NNP 1937_CD ]_NNP ._.
After_IN the_DT first_JJ month_NN of_IN the_DT lactation_NN ,_, there_EX was_VBD a_DT gradual_JJ increase_NN in_IN the_DT vitamin_NN C_NNP content_NN of_IN the_DT milk_NN of_IN all_DT except_IN cross-bred_JJ cows_NNS ._.
This_DT increase_NN continued_VBD till_IN the_DT fourth_JJ month_NN and_CC there-_NN after_IN the_DT values_NNS began_VBD to_TO decline_VB till_IN the_DT end_NN of_IN the_DT eighth_JJ month_NN when_WRB an_DT increase_NN was_VBD observed_VBN which_WDT was_VBD kept_VBN up_RP till_IN the_DT end_NN of_IN lactation_NN ._.
In_IN the_DT case_NN of_IN the_DT cross-bred_JJ cows_NNS ,_, from_IN the_DT very_RB first_JJ month_NN ,_, the_DT values_NNS for_IN vitamin_NN C_NNP declined_VBD gradually_RB till_VB the_DT eighth_JJ month_NN when_WRB an_DT upward_JJ trend_NN occurred_VBD and_CC this_DT was_VBD maintained_VBN till_IN the_DT end_NN of_IN the_DT lactation_NN ._.
The_DT fluctuations_NNS observed_VBN in_IN the_DT vitamin_NN C_NNP content_NN of_IN milk_NN can_MD not_RB be_VB attributed_VBN to_TO feed_VB ,_, since_IN ,_, the_DT animals_NNS were_VBD receiving_VBG more-or-less_NN the_DT same_JJ feed_NN throughout_IN the_DT experiment_NN ._.
Of_IN the_DT other_JJ factors_NNS that_WDT might_MD influence_VB the_DT vitamin_NN C_NNP content_NN one_CD is_VBZ the_DT season_NN ._.
In_IN the_DT present_JJ investigation_NN two_CD peak_NN levels_NNS were_VBD observed_VBN ,_, one_CD in_IN February_NNP and_CC a_DT still_RB greater_JJR one_CD in_IN September_NNP ,_, but_CC in_IN view_NN of_IN the_DT more_RBR or_CC less_RBR uniform_JJ climate_NN of_IN Bangalore_NNP ,_, it_PRP may_MD be_VB reasonable_JJ to_TO attribute_VB these_DT changes_NNS in_IN vitamin_NN C_NNP content_NN of_IN milk_NN to_TO lactational_JJ changes_NNS only_RB ._.
It_PRP will_MD be_VB observed_VBN that_IN breed_NN variations_NNS in_IN the_DT vitamin_NN C_NNP content_NN of_IN milk_NN are_VBP quite_RB marked_VBN ._.
The_DT average_JJ vitamin_JJ C_NNP content_NN of_IN the_DT milk_NN of_IN the_DT different_JJ breeds_NNS of_IN Indian_JJ cattle_NNS as_IN observed_VBN in_IN the_DT present_JJ investigation_NN compares_VBZ very_RB favourably_RB with_IN the_DT figures_NNS reported_VBN by_IN foreign_JJ workers_NNS for_IN the_DT milk_NN of_IN European_JJ breeds_NNS ._.
Individual_JJ variations_NNS are_VBP observed_VBN in_IN the_DT vitamin_NN C_NNP content_NN of_IN milk_NN ._.
In_IN the_DT case_NN of_IN the_DT milk_NN of_IN Sindhi_NNP cows_NNS figures_NNS ranging_VBG from_IN 21.9_CD mg._NNS to_TO 48.8_CD mg._NN of_IN ascorbic_JJ acid_NN per_IN litre_NN have_VBP been_VBN observed_VBN ,_, but_CC generally_RB the_DT range_NN is_VBZ much_RB smaller_JJR ._.
In_IN the_DT case_NN of_IN the_DT other_JJ breeds_NNS also_RB more_RBR or_CC less_RBR the_DT same_JJ KERALA_NNP VERMA_NNP AND_NNP T._NNP M._NNP PAUL_NNP 187_CD degree_NN of_IN variation_NN was_VBD observed_VBN in_IN the_DT vitamin_NN C_NNP content_NN of_IN milk_NN ,_, but_CC in_IN the_DT case_NN of_IN cross-bred_JJ and_CC Tharparkar_NNP cows_VBZ the_DT values_NNS for_IN vitamin_NN C_NNP fluctuated_VBD within_IN narrow_JJ limits_NNS ._.
SUMMARY_NNP (_( 1_CD )_) The_DT vitamin_NN C_NNP content_NN of_IN the_DT milk_NN from_IN Sindhi_NNP ,_, Gir_NNP ,_, Tharparkar_NNP and_CC cross-bred_JJ cows_NNS and_CC Murrah_NNP buffaloes_NNS have_VBP been_VBN studied_VBN for_IN one_CD complete_JJ lactation_NN ._.
(_( 2_CD )_) The_DT average_JJ values_NNS obtained_VBN for_IN the_DT milk_NN of_IN the_DT Indian_JJ cattle_NNS compare_VBP very_RB favourably_RB with_IN the_DT figures_NNS reported_VBN for_IN European_JJ breeds_NNS ._.
(_( 3_CD )_) The_DT vitamin_NN C_NNP content_NN of_IN the_DT milk_NN was_VBD low_JJ in_IN all_PDT the_DT breeds_NNS in_IN the_DT first_JJ month_NN of_IN lactation_NN :_: peaks_NNS were_VBD observed_VBN the_DT fourth_JJ month_NN and_CC towards_VBZ the_DT end_NN of_IN lactation_NN ._.

of_IN these_DT animals_NNS were_VBD disease_JJ free_JJ ,_, we_PRP can_MD get_VB another_DT 19.2_CD million_CD pounds_NNS of_IN the_DT material_NN from_IN the_DT dead_JJ animals_NNS ._.
The_DT total_JJ yearly_JJ production_NN of_IN 47.4_CD million_CD pounds_NNS of_IN the_DT material_NN can_MD be_VB fed_VBN to_TO 142.2_CD million_CD animals_NNS weighing_VBG 500_CD lb_NN ._.
for_IN a_DT day_NN ,_, as_IN the_DT total_JJ digestible_JJ protein_NN supplement_NN for_IN maintenance_NN ._.
Expressed_VBN in_IN other_JJ words_NNS ,_, approximately_RB four_CD hundred_VBD thousand_NN animals_NNS can_MD be_VB provided_VBN with_IN a_DT rich_JJ source_NN of_IN protein_NN all_PDT the_DT year_NN round_NN ._.
SUMMARY_NNP Investigations_NNS have_VBP been_VBN carried_VBN out_IN to_TO find_VB the_DT possibility_NN of_IN feeding_VBG entrails_NNS as_IN a_DT total_JJ protein_NN substitute_NN for_IN livestock_NN ._.
Entrails_NNS which_WDT are_VBP a_DT rich_JJ source_NN of_IN protein_NN and_CC fat_NN have_VBP been_VBN fed_VBN to_TO Kumaoni_NNP bullocks_NNS as_IN a_DT sole_JJ source_NN of_IN digestible_JJ protein_NN for_IN a_DT period_NN of_IN 10_CD weeks_NNS ._.
During_IN the_DT observation_NN period_NN the_DT adult_NN animals_NNS maintained_VBD satisfactory_JJ health_NN and_CC live_JJ weights_NNS ._.
The_DT high_JJ digestibility_NN coefficients_NNS of_IN protein_NN and_CC ether_NN extract_NN (_( 78.3_CD and_CC 96.1_CD ,_, respectively_RB )_) and_CC the_DT biological_JJ value_NN ,_, digestible_JJ protein_NN and_CC starch_NN equivalent_NN (_( 87.5_CD ,_, 60.4_CD and_CC 88.7_CD ,_, respectively_RB )_) warrant_VBP its_PRP$ value_NN as_IN a_DT high_JJ grade_NN concentrate_NN ._.
It_PRP has_VBZ been_VBN calculated_VBN that_IN if_IN all_PDT the_DT waste_NN from_IN the_DT healthy_JJ dead_JJ animals_NNS is_VBZ utilized_JJ ,_, the_DT digestible_JJ protein_NN is_VBZ sufficient_JJ to_TO feed_VB 142.2_CD million_CD adult_NN animals_NNS (_( 500_CD lb_NN ._. )_)
for_IN one_CD day_NN or_CC approximately_RB four_CD hundred_VBD thousand_CD adult_NN cattle_NNS for_IN the_DT whole_JJ year_NN ._.
REFERENCES_NNP Kehar_NNP ,_, N._NNP D._NNP (_( 1944_CD )_) ._.

14_CD ,_, 40_CD PROTECTIVE_NNP INOCULATION_NNP WITH_NNP DRY_NNP PIGEON-POX_NNP AND_NNP SHEEP_NNP AND_NNP GOAT-POX_NNP VACCINE_NNP By_IN D._NNP A._NNP MUNRO_NNP ,_, Imperial_NNP Veterinary_NNP Research_NNP Institute_NNP ,_, Izatnagar_NNP (_( Received_VBN for_IN publication_NN on_IN 6_CD December_NNP 1946_CD )_) IN_NNP view_NN of_IN the_DT well_NN established_VBN efficacy_NN of_IN dry_JJ pigeon-pox_JJ vaccine_NN for_IN protecting_VBG fowls_NN against_IN fowl-pox_NN ,_, it_PRP was_VBD considered_VBN desirable_JJ to_TO test_VB the_DT effectiveness_NN of_IN this_DT method_NN against_IN similar_JJ infections_NNS of_IN sheep_NN and_CC goats_NNS ._.
The_DT observations_NNS which_WDT follow_VBP throw_NN light_NN on_IN the_DT method_NN of_IN producing_VBG immunity_NN with_IN the_DT use_NN of_IN a_DT dry_JJ vaccine_NN on_IN both_DT sheep_JJ and_CC goats_NNS ,_, as_RB well_RB as_IN on_IN fowls_NN and_CC pigeons_NNS ._.
Amongst_IN the_DT most_RBS prominent_JJ methods_NNS of_IN protective_JJ inoculation_NN against_IN variola_NN infections_NNS ,_, the_DT one_CD which_WDT has_VBZ been_VBN found_VBN most_RBS suitable_JJ ,_, and_CC is_VBZ now_RB almost_RB universally_RB practised_VBN for_IN the_DT control_NN of_IN goat_NN and_CC sheep-pox_NN ,_, is_VBZ the_DT use_NN of_IN a_DT sensitised_JJ vaccine_NN as_IN recommended_VBN by_IN Bridré_NNP and_CC Boquet_NNP [_NNP 1913_CD ]_NNP ._.
The_DT conception_NN of_IN this_DT method_NN of_IN prophylactic_JJ treatment_NN owed_VBD its_PRP$ origin_NN to_TO Besredka_NNP 's_POS classical_JJ findings_NNS in_IN the_DT field_NN of_IN sensitised_JJ vaccines_NNS ._.
These_DT authors_NNS [_VBP 1933_CD ]_NN have_VBP since_IN published_VBN statistical_JJ returns_NNS to_TO show_VB that_IN nearly_RB 25_CD million_CD doses_NNS of_IN the_DT vaccine_NN have_VBP been_VBN issued_VBN from_IN the_DT Pasteur_NNP Institute_NNP ,_, Algeria_NNP ,_, for_IN use_NN in_IN various_JJ countries_NNS during_IN the_DT twenty_CD years_NNS following_VBG its_PRP$ introduction_NN and_CC the_DT results_NNS have_VBP been_VBN consistently_RB satisfactory_JJ not_RB only_RB in_IN so_RB far_RB as_IN judged_VBN by_IN the_DT protection_NN conferred_VBD on_IN vaccinated_JJ sheep_NN ,_, but_CC also_RB by_IN the_DT degree_NN of_IN safety_NN with_IN which_WDT the_DT latter_NN could_MD be_VB allowed_VBN to_TO come_VB in_IN contact_NN with_IN untreated_JJ animals_NNS ._.
In_IN India_NNP ._.
Viswanathan_NNP [_NN 1939_CD ]_NN in_IN Madras_NNP ,_, reports_VBZ his_PRP$ success_NN in_IN controlling_VBG an_DT outbreak_NN of_IN sheep-_JJ pox_NN by_IN inoculating_VBG 2.388_CD sheep_NN with_IN the_DT sensitised_JJ vaccine_NN ._.
The_DT results_NNS obtained_VBN by_IN him_PRP in_IN goats_NNS ,_, however_RB ,_, do_VBP not_RB appear_VB to_TO have_VB been_VBN satisfactory_JJ ,_, for_IN he_PRP writes_VBZ :_: 'Out_CD of_IN .510_JJ goats_NNS ovinated_VBD two_CD died_VBD with_IN symptoms_NNS of_IN goat-pox_NN ,_, 20_CD developed_VBD severe_RB generalized_VBN reaction_NN and_CC recovered_JJ and_CC in_IN the_DT rest_NN severe_JJ local_JJ reaction_NN was_VBD present_JJ '_POS ._.
Chadha_NNP [_NN 1939_CD ]_NN ,_, in_IN the_DT North-West_NNP Frontier_NNP Province_NNP ,_, tested_VBD the_DT value_NN of_IN this_DT method_NN of_IN vaccina-_JJ tion_NN on_IN 77_CD sheep_NN and_CC found_VBD inflammatory_JJ reaction_NN on_IN the_DT fifth_JJ day_NN ,_, with_IN an_DT elevation_NN of_IN body_NN tempera-_JJ ture_NN 105º-107ºF_CD ._.
In_IN many_JJ cases_NNS the_DT swellings_NNS reached_VBD the_DT size_NN of_IN walnuts_NNS ._.
The_DT animals_NNS ,_, however_RB ,_, eventually_RB returned_VBN to_TO normal_JJ health_NN ._.
While_IN the_DT introduction_NN of_IN the_DT sensitised_JJ vaccine_NN must_MD be_VB regarded_VBN as_IN having_VBG registered_VBD a_DT definite_JJ advance_NN over_IN the_DT old_JJ method_NN of_IN 'ovination_NN '_'' ,_, a_DT number_NN of_IN workers_NNS have_VBP referred_VBN to_TO certain_JJ disadvantages_NNS of_IN this_DT method_NN ._.
Thus_RB ,_, Kolyali_NNP and_CC Mavridis_NNP [_NNP 1934_CD ]_NNP in_IN Turkey_NNP ,_, refered_VBD to_TO the_DT high_JJ cost_NN of_IN preparation_NN of_IN this_DT vaccine_NN and_CC to_TO the_DT insufficiency_NN of_IN measures_NNS for_IN its_PRP$ despatch_NN ,_, without_IN loss_NN of_IN potency_NN ,_, to_TO various_JJ parts_NNS of_IN the_DT country_NN ._.
Angeloff_NNP [_NN 1934_CD ]_NN points_NNS out_RP that_IN the_DT sensitised_JJ vaccine_NN can_MD not_RB be_VB conserved_VBN and_CC that_DT ,_, in_IN spite_NN of_IN painstaking_VBG aseptic_JJ precau-_JJ tions_NNS in_IN its_PRP$ preparation_NN ,_, there_EX is_VBZ a_DT possibility_NN of_IN contaminating_VBG organisms_JJ developing_VBG during_IN prolonged_JJ transit_NN ._.
Moreover_RB it_PRP is_VBZ not_RB the_DT case_NN that_WDT animals_NNS treated_VBN by_IN this_DT method_NN do_VBP not_RB exhibit_VB any_DT symptoms_NNS ._.

Thus_RB James_NNP [_NNP 1931_CD ]_NNP ,_, Glover_NNP [_NNP 1931_CD ]_NNP ,_, Johnson_NNP [_NNP 1932_CD ]_NNP ,_, Bierbaum_NNP [_NNP 1935_CD ]_NNP ,_, Doyle_NNP [_NNP 1935_CD ]_NNP and_CC others_NNS refer_VBP to_TO the_DT highly_RB satisfactory_JJ results_NNS obtained_VBN by_IN them_PRP from_IN its_PRP$ use_NN ,_, while_NN ,_, as_IN will_MD be_VB seen_VBN from_IN what_WP has_VBZ to_TO be_VB stated_VBN later_RB ,_, the_DT present_JJ writer_NN found_VBD it_PRP consistently_RB effective_JJ in_IN the_DT experimental_JJ inoculation_NN of_IN fowls_NN against_IN pox_NN ._.

]_NN ;_: Graham_NNP and_CC Barger_NNP ,_, 1936_CD ,_, Stafseth_NNP ,_, [_JJ 1931_CD ]_NN ._.
The_DT danger_NN of_IN using_VBG fowl-pox_JJ virus_NN is_VBZ strikingly_RB illus-_JJ trated_VBN by_IN an_DT instance_NN cited_VBN by_IN Leyhausen_NNP [_NNP 1933_CD ]_NNP in_IN which_WDT considerable_JJ mortality_NN occurred_VBD in_IN a_DT flock_NN of_IN chicks_NNS inoculated_VBN with_IN a_DT proprietary_JJ pigeon-pox_JJ vaccine_NN containing_VBG traces_NNS of_IN fowl-pox_JJ virus_NN whilst_VBZ no_DT untoward_NN symptoms_NNS occurred_VBD in_IN birds_NNS which_WDT received_VBD pigeon-pox_JJ vaccine_NN alone_RB supplied_VBN at_IN the_DT same_JJ time_NN by_IN the_DT same_JJ firm_NN ._.
The_DT use_NN of_IN fowl-pox_JJ virus_NN would_MD thus_RB appear_VB to_TO be_VB fraught_JJ with_IN real_JJ D._NNP A._NN MUNRO_NNP 195_CD danger_NN and_CC the_DT writer_NN therefore_NN used_VBD only_RB pigeon-pox_JJ virus_NN in_IN the_DT experiments_NNS to_TO be_VB presently_RB described_VBN ._.
According_VBG to_TO Picard_NNP [_NNP 1931_CD ]_NNP ,_, fowl-pox_JJ virus_NN ,_, by_IN passaging_VBG through_IN pigeons_NNS ,_, may_MD be_VB attenuated_VBN and_CC brought_VBN to_TO a_DT constant_JJ degree_NN of_IN virulence_NN ,_, so_RB as_IN to_TO be_VB suitable_JJ for_IN inoculation_NN with_IN safety_NN into_IN fowls_NN ._.
Evidence_NN produced_VBD more_RBR recently_RB by_IN Donatien_NNP and_CC Lestoquard_NNP [_NNP 1941_CD ]_NNP ,_, however_RB ,_, shows_VBZ that_IN the_DT virus_NN never_RB reaches_VBZ a_DT fixed_JJ stage_NN ,_, but_CC that_IN it_PRP progressively_RB loses_VBZ its_PRP$ virulence_NN ,_, until_IN the_DT latter_JJ disappears_VBZ altogether_RB ._.
An_DT inquiry_NN into_IN the_DT question_NN of_IN constancy_NN of_IN virulence_NN of_IN the_DT virus_NN was_VBD con-_JJ sidered_VBN by_IN the_DT writer_NN hardly_RB profitable_JJ to_TO undertake_VB ,_, for_IN ,_, apart_RB from_IN the_DT results_NNS reported_VBN by_IN the_DT last_JJ two_CD named_VBD workers_NNS ,_, a_DT biological_JJ standardization_NN of_IN the_DT virus_NN to_TO ensure_VB constancy_NN did_VBD not_RB ,_, at_IN least_JJS ,_, in_IN theory_NN ,_, seem_VBP possible_JJ ._.

MATERIALS_NNP AND_CC METHOD_NNP The_DT skin_NN of_IN the_DT abdomen_NNS of_IN a_DT sheep_NN was_VBD shaved_VBN and_CC thoroughly_RB cleansed_VBN with_IN warm_JJ water_NN and_CC soap_NN and_CC dried_VBN ._.
A_DT one_CD per_IN cent_NN suspension_NN of_IN sheep-pox_JJ virus_NN in_IN normal_JJ saline_JJ solution_NN was_VBD now_RB rubbed_VBN into_IN the_DT superficial_JJ epithelial_JJ layer_NN of_IN the_DT skin_NN which_WDT had_VBD been_VBN lightly_RB scarified_VBN ._.
After_IN four_CD or_CC five_CD days_NNS ,_, material_NN from_IN the_DT pustules_NNS was_VBD collected_VBN aseptically_RB by_IN scraping_VBG in_IN a_DT receptacle_NN and_CC was_VBD then_RB desiccated_VBN in_IN vacuo_NN over_IN phosphorus_JJ pentoxide_NN or_CC calcium_NN chloride_NN ._.
The_DT process_NN of_IN drying_NN was_VBD carried_VBN out_RP in_IN the_DT cold_NN as_IN high_JJ temperatures_NNS have_VBP a_DT deleterious_JJ effect_NN on_IN the_DT keeping_VBG quality_NN of_IN the_DT vaccine_NN ._.
The_DT material_NN was_VBD now_RB weighed_JJ and_CC ground_NN to_TO a_DT powder_NN in_IN a_DT sterile_JJ mortar_NN ._.
It_PRP was_VBD then_RB stored_VBN both_DT in_IN the_DT form_NN of_IN wet_JJ suspension_NN and_CC in_IN the_DT form_NN of_IN dried_JJ powder_NN at_IN two_CD temperatures_NNS ,_, viz._NN ,_, 42ºF_CD ._.
and_CC 98.6ºF_CD ._.
The_DT dry_JJ vaccine_NN was_VBD prepared_VBN as_IN follows_VBZ before_IN use_NN ._.
The_DT material_NN was_VBD rubbed_VBN to_TO a_DT smooth_JJ paste_NN in_IN a_DT sterile_JJ mortar_NN by_IN the_DT addition_NN of_IN a_DT small_JJ quantity_NN of_IN 50_CD per_IN cent_NN glycerine_NN saline_NN ._.
Sufficiently_RB more_JJR of_IN this_DT diluent_NN was_VBD now_RB added_VBN to_TO make_VB the_DT full_JJ quantity_NN ,_, which_WDT was_VBD then_RB filtered_VBN through_IN sterile_JJ muslin_NN to_TO remove_VB extraneous_JJ matter_NN and_CC used_VBD the_DT same_JJ day_NN ;_: 0.3_CD gm_NN ._.
of_IN the_DT dried_JJ vaccine_NN suspended_VBN in_IN the_DT diluent_NN was_VBD found_VBN sufficient_NN for_IN one_CD hundred_CD animals_NNS ._.
A_DT total_NN of_IN 110_CD animals_NNS were_VBD used_VBN in_IN the_DT present_JJ experiments_NNS and_CC of_IN these_DT ,_, 56_CD were_VBD sheep_JJ and_CC 54_CD goats_NNS ._.
The_DT vaccinated_JJ animals_NNS were_VBD duly_RB tested_VBN for_IN immunity_NN after_IN an_DT interval_NN of_IN 14_CD days_NNS ._.
Controls_NNS were_VBD kept_VBN in_IN each_DT case_NN ._.
In_IN the_DT case_NN of_IN pigeons_NNS ,_, the_DT feather_NN follicles_NNS of_IN both_DT legs_NNS were_VBD plucked_VBN ,_, and_CC immediately_RB there-_NN after_IN a_DT one_CD per_IN cent_NN suspension_NN of_IN pigeon-pox_JJ virus_NN in_IN normal_JJ saline_NN ,_, was_VBD rubbed_VBN on_IN to_TO the_DT denuded_JJ follicles_NNS ._.
The_DT crusts_NNS were_VBD collected_VBN from_IN the_DT 15th_CD to_TO the_DT 21st_JJ day_NN and_CC the_DT subsequent_JJ procedure_NN was_VBD similar_JJ to_TO that_DT adopted_VBN in_IN the_DT preparation_NN of_IN sheep_NN and_CC goat_NN vaccines_NNS as_IN described_VBN above_IN ._.
The_DT vaccinated_JJ birds_NNS were_VBD tested_VBN for_IN immunity_NN after_IN 21_CD days_NNS by_IN inoculating_VBG them_PRP with_IN the_DT specific_JJ virus_NN ._.
Controls_NNS were_VBD kept_VBN in_IN each_DT case_NN ._.
EFFECT_NN OF_NNP VACCINATION_NNP Vaccination_NNP when_WRB carried_VBD out_RP with_IN a_DT good_JJ sheep_NN or_CC goat_NN vaccine_NN usually_RB resulted_VBD in_IN a_DT crop_NN of_IN vesicles_NNS at_IN the_DT site_NN of_IN inoculation_NN resulting_VBG in_IN a_DT benign_JJ form_NN of_IN the_DT disease_NN ._.
In_IN a_DT few_JJ sensitive_JJ patients_NNS the_DT injection_NN was_VBD followed_VBN by_IN a_DT period_NN of_IN dullness_NN ,_, loss_NN of_IN appetite_NN ,_, and_CC fever_RB ,_, but_CC this_DT seldom_NN lasted_VBD for_IN more_JJR than_IN a_DT few_JJ days_NNS and_CC the_DT animal_NN returned_VBD to_TO normal_JJ after_IN a_DT short_JJ period_NN of_IN complete_JJ rest_NN ._.
The_DT usual_JJ experience_NN was_VBD ,_, however_RB ,_, that_IN no_DT disturbance_NN to_TO health_NN occurred_VBN in_IN the_DT animals_NNS that_WDT receive_VBP the_DT protective_JJ inoculation_NN ._.
In_IN some_DT cases_NNS ,_, when_WRB testing_VBG out_RP brews_NNS of_IN freshly_RB prepared_JJ vaccine_NN ,_, the_DT results_NNS were_VBD not_RB as_IN expected_VBN ,_, the_DT animal_NN scarcely_RB showing_VBG any_DT reaction_NN whatsoever_NN ._.
These_DT animals_NNS when_WRB tested_VBN later_RB with_IN a_DT potent_JJ virus_NN failed_VBD to_TO show_VB any_DT specific_JJ reaction_NN ,_, proving_VBG thereby_NN that_IN they_PRP were_VBD immune_NNS ._.
The_DT results_NNS are_VBP summarised_VBN in_IN Table_NNP I._NNP L2_NNP 198_CD Protective_NNP Inoculation_NNP with_IN Dry_NNP Pigeon-Pox_NNP TABLE_NNP I_PRP Effect_NNP of_IN vaccination_NN in_IN sheep_NN and_CC goats_NNS Temperature_NNP Duration_NNP of_IN storage_NN of_IN vaccine_NN Vaccine_NNP used_VBD wet_NN or_CC dry_JJ Sheep_NNP Goat_NNP Number_NNP of_IN animals_NNS tested_VBN upon_IN Result_NNP of_IN test_NN in_IN pustules_NNS Number_NNP subjected_VBD to_TO immunity_VB test_NN ,_, Result_NNP of_IN immunity_NN test_NN in_IN pustules_NNS Number_NNP of_IN controls_NNS used_VBN Reaction_NNP in_IN controls_NNS Number_NNP of_IN animals_NNS tested_VBN upon_IN Result_NNP of_IN test_NN in_IN pustules_NNS ._.

2_CD +_JJ +_$ 2_CD D._NNP A._NN MUNRO_NNP 197_CD In_IN the_DT case_NN of_IN pigeons_NNS and_CC chickens_VBZ a_DT good_JJ local_JJ reaction_NN occurs_NNS and_CC this_DT usually_RB takes_VBZ the_DT form_NN of_IN an_DT inflammation_NN and_CC swelling_NN of_IN the_DT feather_NN follicles_NNS ._.

(_( a_DT )_) In_IN sheep_NN It_PRP will_MD be_VB seen_VBN from_IN Table_JJ I_PRP that_IN out_IN of_IN a_DT total_NN of_IN 14_CD sheep_NN inoculated_VBN with_IN the_DT 'dry_NNP '_POS vaccine_NN that_WDT had_VBD been_VBN preserved_VBN in_IN cold_JJ storage_NN for_IN varying_VBG periods_NNS ,_, 11_CD (_( 78.5_CD per_IN cent_NN )_) did_VBD not_RB react_VB when_WRB tested_VBN later_RB for_IN immunity_NN ,_, though_IN the_DT controls_NNS in_IN each_DT case_NN developed_VBD the_DT usual_JJ pustules_NNS following_VBG the_DT virus_JJ inoculation_NN ._.
A_DT total_NN of_IN six_CD sheep_NNS were_VBD inoculated_VBN with_IN the_DT wet_NN suspension_NN kept_VBD at_IN 42ºF_CD ._.
and_CC only_RB one_CD of_IN these_DT reacted_VBN to_TO the_DT vaccine_NN ,_, showing_VBG the_DT remarkable_JJ rapidity_NN with_IN which_WDT this_DT form_NN of_IN vaccine_NN loses_VBZ its_PRP$ potency_NN (_( Srikantiah_NNP ,_, ante_NN )_) ._.
The_DT protective_JJ value_NN of_IN vaccine_NN stored_VBN at_IN 98.6ºF_CD ._.
was_VBD tested_VBN on_IN eight_CD sheep_NNS and_CC none_NN reacted_VBD to_TO the_DT inoculation_NN ,_, irrespective_NN of_IN the_DT fact_NN whether_IN the_DT vaccine_NN used_VBN was_VBD in_IN wet_JJ suspension_NN or_CC in_IN the_DT dried_JJ form_NN ,_, though_IN six_CD of_IN these_DT were_VBD found_VBN susceptible_JJ when_WRB tested_VBN later_RB for_IN immunity_NN ._.
In_IN spite_NN of_IN the_DT small_JJ number_NN of_IN tests_NNS ,_, these_DT results_NNS were_VBD considered_VBN sufficiently_RB representative_JJ to_TO warrant_VB the_DT conclusion_NN that_IN this_DT temperature_NN was_VBD quite_RB unsuitable_JJ for_IN storage_NN of_IN the_DT vaccine_NN and_CC further_JJ tests_NNS along_IN this_DT line_NN were_VBD not_RB therefore_RB proceeded_VBN with_IN ._.
(_( b_NN )_) In_IN goats_NN It_PRP will_MD be_VB seen_VBN that_IN a_DT total_NN of_IN 18_CD goats_NNS were_VBD subjected_VBN to_TO immunity_VB test_NN after_IN they_PRP had_VBD received_VBN the_DT protective_JJ inoculation_NN with_IN vaccine_NN preserved_VBN at_IN the_DT lower_JJR temperature_NN and_CC that_IN only_RB seven_CD proved_VBD resistant_JJ to_TO the_DT test_NN ._.
Five_CD of_IN the_DT corresponding_NN controls_NNS ,_, however_RB ,_, did_VBD not_RB react_VB to_TO the_DT virus_NN inoculation_NN ,_, so_IN that_IN the_DT results_NNS in_IN these_DT cases_NNS must_MD be_VB regarded_VBN as_IN inconclusive_NN ._.
The_DT results_NNS obtained_VBD with_IN vaccine_NN stored_VBN at_IN 98.6ºF_CD ._.
were_VBD in_IN conformity_NN with_IN those_DT obtained_VBN in_IN sheep_NN ,_, for_IN not_RB one_CD of_IN the_DT goats_NNS in_IN this_DT category_NN reacted_VBD to_TO the_DT vaccine_NN ._.
Kolayli_NNP ,_, Mavridis_NNP and_CC Ilhami_NNP [_NNP 1933_CD ]_NNP have_VBP recommended_VBN the_DT utilization_NN of_IN sheep_JJ scab_NN in_IN vaccina-_JJ tion_NN of_IN goats_NNS and_CC the_DT use_NN of_IN variola_NN virus_NN of_IN goats_NNS against_IN pox_NN of_IN sheep_NN ,_, for_IN in_IN either_DT case_NN a_DT benign_JJ form_NN of_IN the_DT disease_NN is_VBZ produced_VBN by_IN the_DT vaccine_NN and_CC ,_, furthermore_RB ,_, according_VBG to_TO these_DT authors_NNS ,_, '_'' the_DT virus_NN of_IN variola_NN of_IN goats_NNS is_VBZ not_RB transmitted_VBN by_IN natural_JJ contagion_NN from_IN goat_NN to_TO sheep_VB '_POS ._.
A_DT series_NN of_IN experiments_NNS were_VBD carried_VBN out_IN to_TO test_VB the_DT value_NN of_IN this_DT method_NN of_IN vaccination_NN for_IN both_DT sheep_JJ and_CC goats_NNS and_CC the_DT results_NNS are_VBP shown_VBN in_IN Table_NNP III_NNP ._.
It_PRP will_MD be_VB seen_VBN from_IN Table_JJ III_NNP that_WDT ten_VBP sheep_JJ were_VBD inoculated_VBN with_IN the_DT specific_JJ vaccine_NN and_CC eight_CD (_( 80_CD per_IN cent_NN )_) did_VBD not_RB react_VB when_WRB later_RB tested_VBN for_IN immunity_NN ._.
On_IN the_DT other_JJ hand_NN 10_CD goats_NNS were_VBD inoculated_VBN with_IN sheep-pox_JJ vaccine_NN and_CC only_RB four_CD (_( 40_CD per_IN cent_NN )_) proved_VBD immune_JJ on_IN test_NN ._.
The_DT protec-_JJ tive_JJ value_NN of_IN goat-pox_JJ vaccine_NN was_VBD tested_VBN on_IN ten_JJ goats_NNS and_CC ten_JJ sheep_NN and_CC positive_JJ results_NNS were_VBD obtained_VBN in_IN eight_CD (_( 80_CD per_IN cent_NN )_) and_CC three_CD (_( 30_CD per_IN cent_NN )_) animals_NNS ,_, respectively_RB ._.
These_DT results_NNS justify_VBP the_DT conclu-_JJ sion_NN that_WDT though_IN the_DT two_CD viruses_NNS are_VBP closely_RB allied_JJ ,_, neither_DT of_IN them_PRP can_MD be_VB used_VBN as_IN a_DT dependable_JJ agent_NN for_IN protecting_VBG the_DT heterologous_JJ species_NNS ._.
(_( c_NN )_) In_IN fowls_NN It_PRP will_MD be_VB observed_VBN that_IN the_DT vaccine_NN stored_VBN for_IN the_DT maximum_JJ period_NN of_IN six_CD months_NNS at_IN 42ºF_CD ._.
remains_NNS fully_RB potent_VBP for_IN fowls_NN and_CC pigeons_NNS ,_, whereas_IN a_DT marked_JJ deterioration_NN takes_VBZ place_NN when_WRB the_DT vaccine_NN is_VBZ kept_VBN at_IN 98.6ºF_CD ._.

+_RB 200_CD Protective_JJ Inoculation_NN with_IN Dry_NNP Pigeon-Pox_NNP has_VBZ a_DT seasonal_JJ incidence_NN ,_, inoculations_NNS may_MD be_VB carried_VBN out_RP in_IN good_JJ time_NN beforehand_NN ,_, and_CC not_RB as_IN an_DT emergency_NN prophylactic_JJ measure_NN ._.

When_WRB the_DT figures_NNS of_IN incidence_NN of_IN surra_NN are_VBP compared_VBN each_DT year_NN ,_, it_PRP is_VBZ seen_VBN that_IN peak_NN is_VBZ reached_VBN in_IN the_DT same_JJ month_NN each_DT year_NN ,_, with_IN occasional_JJ minor_JJ variations_NNS ._.
