These_DT figures_NNS show_VBP that_IN surra_NN has_VBZ no_DT direct_JJ relation_NN to_TO rainfall_VB as_IN previously_RB stated_VBN but_CC its_PRP$ incidence_NN is_VBZ increased_VBN in_IN the_DT months_NNS usually_RB after_IN the_DT summer_NN monsoons_NNS in_IN the_DT Punjab_NNP ._.
It_PRP is_VBZ known_VBN that_IN trypanosomes_NNS feed_VBN by_IN osmosis_NN on_IN the_DT glucose_NN of_IN blood_NN which_WDT is_VBZ naturally_RB mobilised_VBN from_IN the_DT store_NN ,_, i.e._FW ,_, the_DT liver_NN ,_, and_CC that_IN there_EX is_VBZ hyperglycaemia_NN in_IN the_DT early_JJ stages_NNS of_IN trypanosome_JJ in-_JJ fection_NN and_CC hyperglycaemia_NN in_IN the_DT latter_JJ stages_NNS when_WRB the_DT trypanosomes_NNS usually_RB disappear_VBP ._.
Ray_NNP (_( personal_JJ communication_NN )_) pointed_VBD out_RP to_TO the_DT author_NN that_IN there_EX is_VBZ a_DT seasonal_JJ variation_NN in_IN the_DT blood_NN sugar_NN of_IN equines_NNS ._.
The_DT seasonal_JJ incidence_NN of_IN the_DT disease_NN and_CC seasonal_JJ variation_NN in_IN the_DT quantity_NN of_IN blood_NN sugar_NN and_CC the_DT increase_NN in_IN the_DT number_NN of_IN flies_NNS and_CC other_JJ insects_NNS during_IN the_DT surra_NN season_NN throw_VB some_DT light_NN on_IN the_DT epizootology_NN of_IN the_DT disease_NN ._.
It_PRP seems_VBZ from_IN the_DT histopathology_NN of_IN the_DT disease_NN studied_VBD on_IN a_DT few_JJ cases_NNS by_IN Ray_NNP and_CC Lall_NNP in_IN 1944_CD (_( unpublished_JJ )_) that_IN the_DT lesions_NNS produced_VBN in_IN chronic_JJ cases_NNS of_IN surra_NN are_VBP pathogonomics_NNS of_IN sugar-glycogen_JJ metabolic_JJ disorders_NNS and_CC its_PRP$ further_JJ study204_JJ Seasonal_NNP Incidence_NNP of_IN Surra_NNP number_NN of_IN cases_NNS are_VBP fewer_JJR in_IN the_DT dry_JJ climate_NN of_IN Multan_NNP as_IN compared_VBN to_TO that_DT of_IN Ambala_NNP and_CC Lahore_NNP where_WRB the_DT climate_NN is_VBZ more_RBR humid_JJ and_CC there_EX are_VBP extensive_JJ low_JJ lying_VBG areas_NNS ._.
The_DT last_JJ factor_NN seems_VBZ to_TO be_VB the_DT deciding_JJ factor_NN ,_, as_RB far_RB as_IN surra_NN is_VBZ concerned_VBN ._.
The_DT total_JJ rainfall_NN in_IN Lahore_NNP and_CC Rawalpindi_NNP and_CC Ambala_NNP divisions_NNS is_VBZ approximately_RB the_DT same_JJ ,_, but_CC there_EX is_VBZ a_DT difference_NN in_IN the_DT number_NN of_IN cases_NNS (_( on_IN the_DT average_JJ basis_NN per_IN 10,000_CD heads_NNS of_IN equine_NN and_CC camel_JJ population_NN )_) in_IN each_DT division_NN ._.
Jullundur_NNP ,_, having_VBG a_DT much_RB heavier_JJR rainfall_NN ,_, has_VBZ more_JJR or_CC less_JJR the_DT same_JJ incidence_NN as_IN Rawalpindi_NNP ._.
The_DT peak_NN is_VBZ reached_VBN in_IN October_NNP in_IN Lahore_NNP and_CC Jullundur_NNP ,_, in_IN September_NNP in_IN Ambala_NNP ,_, Rawalpindi_NNP and_CC Multan_NNP (_( see_VB Fig_NNP ._.
3A_CD )_) ;_: this_DT is_VBZ very_RB probably_RB owing_VBG to_TO the_DT larger_JJR camel_JJ population_NN in_IN these_DT divisions_NNS ,_, because_IN in_IN the_DT case_NN of_IN camels_NNS peak_NN is_VBZ reached_VBN in_IN September_NNP ._.
In_IN Ambala_NNP ,_, which_WDT has_VBZ proportionately_RB a_DT large_JJ camel_NN population_NN ,_, it_PRP is_VBZ noticed_VBN from_IN the_DT records_NNS that_IN the_DT majority_NN of_IN the_DT surra_NN infected_VBN animals_NNS brought_VBD to_TO hospitals_NNS were_VBD camels_NNS ._.

SUMMARY_NNP The_DT data_NN of_IN surra_NN cases_NNS in_IN the_DT Punjab_NNP ,_, for_IN the_DT year_NN 1932-1944_NN has_VBZ been_VBN analysed_VBN and_CC its_PRP$ seasonal_JJ and_CC geographical_JJ distribution_NN discussed_VBD the_DT study_NN of_IN the_DT relevant_JJ records_NNS in_IN the_DT Punjab_NNP points_NNS to_TO the_DT facts_NNS that_IN there_EX is_VBZ no_DT quantitative_JJ relationship_NN between_IN the_DT incidence_NN of_IN surra_NN and_CC the_DT annual_JJ rainfall_NN ,_, and_CC that_IN the_DT incidence_NN of_IN the_DT disease_NN always_RB increases_VBZ after_IN rainfall_NN ,_, indicating_VBG the_DT need_NN of_IN prophylactic_JJ treatment_NN for_IN one_CD or_CC two_CD months_NNS following_VBG for_IN summer_NN monsoon_NN ._.
There_EX is_VBZ a_DT decline_NN in_IN the_DT number_NN of_IN surra_JJ cases_NNS presented_VBN for_IN treatment_NN following_VBG the_DT cessation_NN of_IN the_DT use_NN of_IN naganol_NN ,_, it_PRP appears_VBZ that_IN owners_NNS will_MD forego_VB treatment_NN rather_RB than_IN submit_VB to_TO one_CD which_WDT causes_VBZ some_DT inconvenience_NN ;_: it_PRP ,_, therefore_RB ,_, follows_VBZ that_IN simplicity_NN of_IN treatment_NN should_MD take_VB pre-_JJ cedence_NN over_IN the_DT ultimate_JJ total_JJ effectiveness_NN of_IN the_DT treatment_NN or_CC should_MD at_IN least_JJS be_VB considered_VBN as_IN equally_RB important_JJ to_TO it_PRP ._.

Report_VB A_DT NEW_NNP METHOD_NNP FOR_IN THE_NNP STUDY_NNP OF_NNP EXTENSION_NNP IN_NNP WOOL_NNP FIBRE_NNP By_IN P._NNP N._NNP NANDA_NNP ,_, M.R.C.V.S._NNP ,_, and_CC TARLOK_NNP SINGH_NNP ,_, B._NNP Sc_NNP ._.
(_( HONS_NNP ._.
)_) ,_, M_NNP ._.
Sc._NNP ,_, Government_NNP Livestock_NNP Farm_NNP ,_, Hissar_NNP (_( Received_VBN for_IN publication_NN on_IN 6_CD May_NNP 1946_CD )_) (_( With_IN plate_NN III_NNP and_CC one_CD text_NN figure_NN )_) STRENGTH_NNP and_CC elasticity_NN form_VBP two_CD of_IN the_DT most_RBS important_JJ qualities_NNS of_IN wool_NN ,_, as_IN the_DT strength_NN and_CC weaving_NN properties_NNS of_IN the_DT fabric_NN are_VBP dependent_JJ upon_IN them_PRP ._.
Whether_IN a_DT fabric_NN is_VBZ fine_JJ or_CC coarse_NN ,_, it_PRP must_MD handle_VB elastic_JJ and_CC lofty_JJ ._.
The_DT term_NN elasticity_NN ,_, as_IN applied_VBN to_TO wool_VB ,_, denotes_VBZ the_DT power_NN is_VBZ possesses_NNS to_TO assume_VB its_PRP$ normal_JJ condition_NN after_IN being_VBG subjected_VBN to_TO stress_VB ._.
Its_PRP$ exact_JJ determination_NN may_MD be_VB made_VBN by_IN the_DT measure_NN of_IN the_DT limit_NN upto_NN which_WDT the_DT fibre_NN extends_VBZ when_WRB under_IN stress_NN ._.
For_IN the_DT measurement_NN of_IN strength_NN in_IN wool_NN fibres_NNS ,_, Oneill_NNP Hair_NNP Tester_NNP ,_, originally_RB devised_VBN by_IN Charles_NNP Oneill_NNP [_NNP 1863_CD ]_NN is_VBZ being_VBG used_VBN in_IN this_DT Farm_NNP Laboratory_NNP and_CC it_PRP is_VBZ described_VBN in_IN detail_NN in_IN the_DT Textile_NNP Journal_NNP ._.
As_IN regards_NNS extension_NN ,_, however_RB ,_, very_RB little_JJ information_NN is_VBZ available_JJ ._.
In_IN the_DT course_NN of_IN our_PRP$ experiments_NNS on_IN the_DT measurement_NN of_IN fibre_JJ strength_NN ,_, we_PRP were_VBD able_JJ to_TO introduce_VB a_DT subsidiary_NN contrivance_NN within_IN the_DT apparatus_NN without_IN altering_VBG it_PRP in_IN any_DT way_NN ._.
With_IN the_DT help_NN of_IN this_DT contrivance_NN ,_, it_PRP is_VBZ possible_JJ to_TO measure_VB the_DT maximum_JJ length_NN to_TO which_WDT a_DT fibre_NN or_CC a_DT portion_NN of_IN the_DT fibre_JJ extends_VBZ before_IN it_PRP snaps_VBZ ._.
The_DT contrivance_NN ,_, as_IN shown_VBN in_IN Figs_NNP ._.
1-3_JJ ,_, consists_VBZ of_IN the_DT following_VBG four_CD parts_NNS :_: (_( i_NN )_) The_DT support_NN ,_, a_DT thin_JJ cylindrical_JJ piece_NN of_IN wood_NN about_IN half_PDT an_DT in_IN ._.
long_RB ,_, having_VBG a_DT longitudinal_JJ hole_NN in_IN the_DT centre_NN ,_, which_WDT goes_VBZ as_RB deep_JJ as_IN its_PRP$ middle_NN (_( Fig_NNP ._.
1_CD )_) ._.
The_DT support_NN is_VBZ tied_VBN to_TO the_DT cork_NN of_IN the_DT float_NN of_IN the_DT tester_NN with_IN the_DT help_NN of_IN a_DT thread_NN as_IN shown_VBN in_IN Plate_NNP III_NNP ._.
The_DT lower_JJR end_NN of_IN the_DT support_NN is_VBZ made_VBN to_TO remain_VB above_IN the_DT level_NN of_IN the_DT water_NN when_WRB the_DT float_NN is_VBZ freely_RB and_CC vertically_RB suspended_VBN in_IN it_PRP ._.
(_( ii_NN )_) The_DT rider_NN consisting_NN of_IN a_DT piece_NN of_IN fine_JJ metallic_JJ wire_NN bent_NN at_IN right_JJ angles_NNS at_IN both_DT ends_NNS ,_, one_CD arm_NN being_VBG longer_JJR than_IN the_DT other_JJ (_( Fig_NNP ._.
2_CD )_) ._.
The_DT shorter_NN arm_NN fits_VBZ into_IN the_DT hole_NN of_IN the_DT support_NN while_IN the_DT longer_JJR arm_NN carries_VBZ the_DT index_NN at_IN its_PRP$ end_NN ._.
(_( iii_NN )_) The_DT index_NN ,_, a_DT crescent_NN shaped_VBN metallic_JJ piece_NN ,_, the_DT inner_JJ curvature_NN of_IN which_WDT is_VBZ the_DT same_JJ as_IN the_DT curvature_NN of_IN the_DT outer_NN tube_NN of_IN the_DT tester_NN (_( Fig_NNP ._.
3_LS )_) ._.
It_PRP has_VBZ a_DT hole_NN in_IN the_DT middle_NN in_IN which_WDT the_DT end_NN of_IN the_DT longer_JJR arm_NN of_IN the_DT rider_NN is_VBZ fixed_VBN ._.
The_DT index_NN moves_VBZ along_IN the_DT scale_NN ._.
(_( iv_NN )_) The_DT scale_NN marked_VBN in_IN inches_NNS (_( 1/10th_CD )_) on_IN an_DT ordinary_JJ piece_NN of_IN white_JJ paper_NN ,_, which_WDT is_VBZ rendered_VBN water-proof_JJ by_IN giving_VBG it_PRP a_DT dip_NN in_IN hot_JJ paraffin_NN ._.

Parts_NNS Oneill_NNP Hair_NNP Tester_NNP 1210_CD Study_NNP of_IN Extension_NNP in_IN Wool_NNP Fibre_NNP Working_NNP When_WRB the_DT apparatus_NN is_VBZ in_IN use_NN ,_, it_PRP operates_VBZ as_IN shown_VBN in_IN Plate_NNP III_NNP ._.
The_DT fibre_NN to_TO be_VB tested_VBN is_VBZ mounted_VBN on_IN paper_NN mounts_NNS ,_, the_DT ends_NNS of_IN the_DT fibre_NN being_VBG secured_VBN with_IN sealing_VBG wax_NN at_IN a_DT distance_NN of_IN one_CD inch_JJ apart_RB ._.
This_DT length_NN is_VBZ selected_VBN as_IN a_DT standard_NN for_IN comparative_JJ study_NN ._.
The_DT paper_NN is_VBZ then_RB fixed_VBN in_IN the_DT hooks_NN provided_VBN in_IN the_DT apparatus_NN ._.
Along_IN with_IN the_DT fibre_NN ,_, the_DT rider_NN is_VBZ also_RB put_VBN in_IN the_DT hole_NN of_IN the_DT support_NN ._.
After_IN fixing_VBG the_DT upper_JJ fixed_JJ point_NN of_IN the_DT apparatus_NN ,_, the_DT initial_JJ reading_NN at_IN which_WDT the_DT pointed_JJ end_NN of_IN the_DT index_NN stands_VBZ is_VBZ taken_VBN ._.
Readings_NNS are_VBP taken_VBN upto_JJ two_CD decimal_JJ places_NNS ,_, the_DT second_JJ place_NN being_VBG estimated_VBN by_IN judgment_NN ._.
Water_NNP is_VBZ then_RB allowed_VBN to_TO flow_VB out_IN of_IN the_DT tester_NN as_IN a_DT result_NN of_IN which_WDT pressure_NN is_VBZ exerted_VBN on_IN the_DT fibre_NN and_CC it_PRP extends_VBZ ._.
On_IN account_NN of_IN the_DT extension_NN ,_, the_DT tube_NN moves_VBZ down_RB ,_, and_CC with_IN it_PRP the_DT index_NN also_RB glides_VBZ downwards_NNS along_IN the_DT scale_NN ._.
A_DT careful_JJ watch_NN is_VBZ kept_VBN on_IN the_DT movement_NN of_IN the_DT index_NN ._.
Just_RB when_WRB the_DT fibre_NN breaks_NNS ,_, reading_VBG at_IN the_DT scale_NN is_VBZ noted_VBN ._.
The_DT difference_NN between_IN the_DT initial_JJ and_CC the_DT final_JJ readings_NNS on_IN the_DT scale_NN gives_VBZ the_DT limit_NN up_IN to_TO which_WDT the_DT fibre_NN extended_VBD per_IN unit_NN inch_NN ._.
The_DT water_NN taken_VBN out_RP for_IN breaking_VBG the_DT fibre_NN is_VBZ measured_VBN in_IN c.c_NN ._.
and_CC the_DT breaking_NN load_NN is_VBZ calculated_VBN by_IN the_DT formula_NN :_: F_NNP =_NNP Vr2/_NNP R2Indian_NNP J._NNP Vet_NNP ._.

1_CD ._.
It_PRP is_VBZ ,_, therefore_RB ,_, established_VBD that_IN the_DT method_NN gave_VBD similar_JJ results_NNS with_IN both_DT trials_NNS ._.

(_( b_NN )_) Trials_NNS by_IN different_JJ observers_NNS ._.

2_CD referred_VBD to_TO above_VB ._.
This_DT was_VBD divided_VBN into_IN five_CD lots_NNS each_DT consisting_VBG of_IN approximately_RB 10-20_JJ fibres_NNS ._.
It_PRP is_VBZ not_RB difficult_JJ to_TO judge_VB the_DT number_NN of_IN fibres_NNS in_IN small_JJ samples_NNS by_IN experience_NN ._.

Tables_NNS IV-V_NNP show_VBP the_DT results_NNS and_CC their_PRP$ Analysis_NN of_IN variance_NN :_: P._NNP N._NNP NANDA_NNP AND_NNP TARLOK_NNP SINGH_NNP 213_CD SUMMARY_NNP A_NNP subsidiary_NN contrivance_NN has_VBZ been_VBN devised_VBN and_CC added_VBN to_TO Oneill_NNP Hair_NNP Tester_NNP ._.
Besides_IN strength_NN ,_, the_DT apparatus_NN can_MD now_RB be_VB used_VBN for_IN the_DT measurement_NN of_IN extension_NN of_IN the_DT wool_NN fibres_NNS ._.
The_DT contrivance_NN described_VBD is_VBZ simple_JJ and_CC records_NNS extension_NN on_IN a_DT magnified_JJ scale_NN ._.
It_PRP gives_VBZ consistent_JJ results_NNS which_WDT are_VBP independent_JJ of_IN personal_JJ errors_NNS ._.

LXXXI_NNP (_( 4-5_JJ )_) A_DT BRUCELLOSIS_NNP infection_NN is_VBZ described_VBN in_IN a_DT 43_CD years_NNS old_JJ patient_NN at_IN Poona_NNP ._.

LXXXII_NNP ,_, 24_CD AN_NNP INFECTION_NNP of_IN 10½_CD year_NN old_JJ Punjabee_NNP girl_NN ,_, who_WP had_VBD come_VBN to_TO Assam_NNP after_IN spending_VBG a_DT three_CD months_NNS '_POS holiday_NN in_IN the_DT Punjab_NNP ,_, is_VBZ described_VBN ._.

respectively_RB ._.
The_DT chief_JJ symp-_JJ toms_NNS were_VBD undulant_JJ fever_NN ,_, painful_JJ swelling_NN of_IN left_JJ wrist_NN joint_NN ,_, headache_NN and_CC poor_JJ appetite_NN ._.

[_NN H._NNP K._NNP L._NNP ]_NNP REVIEW_NNP A_NNP preliminary_JJ Review_NNP of_IN the_DT use_NN of_IN penicillin_NN in_IN Veterinary_NNP Practice_NNP BY_NNP IMPERIAL_NNP CHEMICAL_NNP (_( PHARMACEUTICALS_NNP )_) LTD._NNP ,_, ALDERLY_NNP EDGE_NNP ,_, MANCHESTER_NNP ,_, AUGUST_NNP 1946_CD ,_, PP_NNP 32_CD A_NNP REVIEW_NNP of_IN the_DT experience_NN gained_VBD date_NN of_IN Penicillin_NNP in_IN veterinary_JJ practice_NN has_VBZ been_VBN published_VBN in_IN a_DT booklet_NN by_IN Imperial_NNP Chemical_NNP (_( Pharmaceuticals_NNP )_) Ltd._NNP ,_, Alderley_NNP Edge_NNP ,_, Manchester_NNP for_IN issue_NN to_TO veterinary_JJ surgeons_NNS ._.

215_CD MGIPCORIGINAL_NNP ARTICLES_NNP INCIDENCE_NNP OF_NNP BRUCELLOSIS_NNP IN_NNP DAIRY_NNP HERDS_NNP IN_NNP BENGAL_NNP By_IN RAM_NNP NARAIN_NNP MOHAN_NNP ,_, Veterinary_NNP Investigation_NNP Officer_NNP ,_, Bengal_NNP (_( Received_VBN for_IN publication_NN on_IN 5_CD July_NNP 1945_CD )_) *_NN AS_IN in_IN other_JJ Provinces_NNS ,_, attention_NN to_TO contagious_JJ abortions_NNS in_IN cattle_NNS in_IN Bengal_NNP followed_VBD the_DT inception_NN in_IN 1932_CD of_IN the_DT scheme_NN for_IN the_DT appointment_NN of_IN a_DT Veterinary_NNP Investigation_NNP Officer_NNP ,_, with_IN the_DT help_NN of_IN funds_NNS from_IN the_DT Indian_JJ Council_NNP of_IN Agricultural_NNP Research_NNP ._.

METHODS_NNP In_IN the_DT earlier_JJR period_NN ,_, from_IN 1934_CD to_TO 1941_CD ,_, the_DT investigations_NNS were_VBD restricted_VBN chiefly_NN to_TO one_CD or_CC two_CD important_JJ herds_NNS ,_, at_IN least_JJS one_CD of_IN which_WDT suffered_VBD a_DT serious_JJ outbreak_NN of_IN abortions_NNS and_CC still-births_NNS ._.
Speci-_JJ mens_NNS of_IN blood_NN serum_NN taken_VBN from_IN aborting_VBG and_CC other_JJ animals_NNS of_IN these_DT herds_NNS ,_, were_VBD ,_, from_IN time_NN to_TO time_NN ,_, and_CC often_RB repeatedly_RB ,_, despatched_VBD to_TO the_DT Indian_JJ Veterinary_NNP Research_NNP Institute_NNP ,_, Mukteswar_NNP ,_, where_WRB they_PRP were_VBD subjected_VBN to_TO the_DT standard_JJ tube_NN agglutination_NN test_NN ._.
Later_RB on_IN ,_, from_IN 1942_CD to_TO 1945_CD ,_, when_WRB periodical_JJ consignments_NNS of_IN suitable_JJ antigen_NN and_CC a_DT portable_JJ outfit_NN for_IN a_DT quick_JJ slide_NN agglutination_NN test_NN were_VBD received_VBN from_IN Mukteswar_NNP ,_, the_DT survey_NN was_VBD extended_VBN to_TO some_DT more_RBR ,_, herds_NNS located_VBN in_IN different_JJ parts_NNS of_IN the_DT Province_NNP ._.
Unpreserved_VBN specimens_NNS of_IN blood_NN serum_NN ,_, generally_RB from_IN all_DT available_JJ adult_NN stock_NN and_CC sometimes_RB including_VBG a_DT few_JJ grown-up_JJ calves_NNS ,_, were_VBD tested_VBN on_IN the_DT spot_NN within_IN a_DT few_JJ to_TO 24_CD hours_NNS ,_, taking_VBG the_DT usual_JJ precautions_NNS ._.
The_DT reactions_NNS obtained_VBN were_VBD mostly_RB clear-cut_JJ and_CC the_DT percen-_JJ tage_NN of_IN doubtful_JJ reactions_NNS was_VBD small_JJ ._.
While_IN some_DT consignments_NNS of_IN antigen_NN went_VBD bad_JJ comparatively_RB soon_RB ,_, others_NNS remained_VBD well_RB and_CC discriminatingly_RB agglutinable_JJ (_( checked_VBN against_IN fresher_JJR consignments_NNS )_) for_IN long_JJ periods_NNS ,_, in_IN one_CD case_NN for_IN more_JJR than_IN a_DT year_NN at_IN room_NN temperature_NN ._.
The_DT occurrence_NN of_IN positive_JJ reactions_NNS in_IN any_DT herd_NN was_VBD regarded_VBN rather_RB as_IN an_DT indication_NN of_IN the_DT presence_NN of_IN infection_NN in_IN the_DT herd_NN than_IN a_DT correct_JJ and_CC dependable_JJ index_NN of_IN the_DT extent_NN of_IN infection_NN ._.
The_DT herd_NN owners_NNS were_VBD advised_VBN accordingly_RB and_CC ,_, where_WRB necessary_JJ ,_, suitable_JJ hygenic_JJ control_NN measures_NNS were_VBD prescribed_VBN ._.
RESULTS_VB The_DT main_JJ results_NNS are_VBP summarized_VBN in_IN Table_NNP I_PRP ._.

217_CD 218_CD Brucellosis_NN in_IN Dairy_NNP Herds_NNP in_IN Bengal_NNP [_NNP XVII_NNP Evidently_NNP ,_, the_DT infection_NN was_VBD introduced_VBN along_IN with_IN the_DT imported_JJ animals_NNS ,_, spread_VBP rapidly_RB among_IN the_DT original_JJ (_( more_RBR susceptible_JJ )_) stock_NN and_CC later_RB also_RB among_IN the_DT imported_JJ stock_NN ._.
This_DT serves_VBZ as_IN a_DT typical_JJ example_NN of_IN the_DT dangers_NNS to_TO which_WDT a_DT previously_RB uninfected_JJ herd_NN is_VBZ exposed_VBN when_WRB indiscriminate_JJ additions_NNS are_VBP made_VBN ._.
Among_IN the_DT herds_NNS tested_VBN ,_, there_EX were_VBD two_CD buffalo_NN herds_NNS ._.

DISCUSSION_NN It_PRP was_VBD originally_RB planned_VBN to_TO test_VB a_DT large_JJ number_NN of_IN herds_NNS ,_, but_CC it_PRP was_VBD soon_RB realized_VBN that_IN that_DT was_VBD neither_DT practicable_JJ ,_, since_IN some_DT herd_NN owners_NNS could_MD not_RB be_VB persuaded_VBN to_TO the_DT test_NN ,_, nor_CC necessary_JJ ,_, because_IN in_IN many_JJ herds_NNS abortions_NNS were_VBD reported_VBN to_TO be_VB either_RB absolutely_RB unknown_JJ over_IN long_JJ spans_NNS of_IN years_NNS or_CC too_RB few_JJ and_CC far_RB between_IN to_TO warrant_VB a_DT suspicion_NN of_IN Brucellosis_NNP ._.
A_DT majority_NN of_IN the_DT herds_NNS left_VBD out_RP was_VBD small_JJ ,_, well_RB isolated_JJ and_CC practically_RB self-contained_JJ units_NNS ,_, in_IN contrast_NN with_IN many_JJ of_IN the_DT larger_JJR herds_NNS in_IN which_WDT abortions_NNS have_VBP been_VBN occurring_VBG frequently_RB and_CC to_TO which_WDT indiscriminate_VB additions_NNS have_VBP been_VBN made_VBN from_IN time_NN to_TO time_NN ._.
Thus_RB ,_, while_IN actual_JJ testing_NN of_IN a_DT few_JJ herds_NNS of_IN the_DT former_JJ class_NN has_VBZ shown_VBN them_PRP to_TO be_VB free_JJ from_IN demonstrable_JJ infection_NN ,_, even_RB in_IN the_DT face_NN of_IN a_DT few_JJ sporadic_JJ abor-_JJ tions_NNS ,_, a_DT varying_VBG incidence_NN of_IN positive_JJ reactions_NNS has_VBZ been_VBN encountered_VBN in_IN many_JJ herds_NNS of_IN the_DT latter_JJ class_NN ._.
As_IN expected_VBN ,_, the_DT highest_JJS percentage_NN of_IN infection_NN was_VBD in_IN a_DT pinjrapole_NN herd_NN which_WDT is_VBZ constituted_VBN on_IN lines_NNS welcoming_VBG all_DT sorts_NNS of_IN animals_NNS at_IN all_DT times_NNS ._.

THE_DT RELATIVE_NNP RATE_NN OF_NNP ABSORPTION_NNP OF_NNP DIFFERENT_NNP OILS_NNP AND_NNP FATS_NNP By_IN V._NNP R._NNP BHALERAO_NNP ,_, D._NNP VENKATAPPIAH_NNP and_CC C._NNP P._NNP ANANTAKRISHNAN_NNP ,_, Imperial_NNP Dairy_NNP Research_NNP Institute_NNP ,_, Bangalore_NNP (_( Received_VBN for_IN publication_NN on_IN 16_CD December_NNP 1946_CD )_) THE_DT relative_JJ nutritive_JJ value_NN of_IN natural_JJ oils_NNS and_CC fats_NNS is_VBZ generally_RB judged_VBN by_IN the_DT rate_NN of_IN a_DT ssimilation_NN and_CC the_DT percentage_NN of_IN utilization_NN in_IN the_DT body_NN ._.
With_IN regard_NN to_TO the_DT rate_NN of_IN absorption_NN of_IN different_JJ fats_NNS ,_, a_DT number_NN of_IN investigations_NNS have_VBP been_VBN reported_VBN ._.
Steenbock_NNP et_CC al_RB [_JJ 1936_CD ]_NN determined_VBD the_DT comparative_JJ rate_NN of_IN absorption_NN of_IN different_JJ fats_NNS in_IN experiments_NNS with_IN rats_NNS following_VBG the_DT technique_NN of_IN Irwin_NNP et_FW al_NN [_NN 1936_CD ]_NN and_CC indicated_VBD that_IN in_IN general_JJ lard_NN and_CC hydrogenated_VBD oils_NNS were_VBD absorbed_VBN at_IN approx-_JJ imately_RB the_DT same_JJ rate_NN ,_, while_IN butter_NN oil_NN ,_, halibut_NN liver_NN oil_NN and_CC codliver_NN oil_NN were_VBD absorbed_VBN at_IN a_DT more_RBR rapid_JJ rate_NN ._.
Irwin_NNP et_CC al_RB [_JJ 1936_CD ]_NN found_VBD that_IN hydrogenation_NN decreased_VBD the_DT rate_NN of_IN absorption_NN of_IN an_DT oil_NN ,_, but_CC the_DT variations_NNS in_IN the_DT melting_NN point_NN below_IN body_NN temperature_NN were_VBD without_IN effect_NN ._.
Basu_NNP and_CC Nath_NNP [_NNP 1946_CD ]_NNP found_VBD that_IN there_EX existed_VBD a_DT real_JJ difference_NN in_IN the_DT rate_NN of_IN absorption_NN of_IN cow_NN butter_NN fat_NN ,_, mustard_NN oil_NN ,_, cocoanut_NN oil_NN ,_, sesame_NN oil_NN and_CC groundnut_NN oil_NN in_IN a_DT four_CD hour_NN period_NN ,_, but_CC after_IN six_CD hours_NNS all_PDT the_DT fats_NNS were_VBD absorbed_VBN almost_RB to_TO the_DT same_JJ extent_NN ._.
The_DT present_JJ communication_NN deals_NNS with_IN the_DT rate_NN of_IN absorption_NN of_IN the_DT fats_NNS commonly_RB occurring_VBG in_IN India_NNP namely_RB of_IN butter_NN fats_NNS of_IN cow_NN ,_, buffalo_NN ,_, goat_NN and_CC sheep_NN of_IN edible_JJ oils_NNS ;_: sesame_NN ,_, groundnut_NN ;_: cocoa-_JJ nut_NN ,_, safflower_JJR ,_, mustard_NN and_CC cotton_NN seed_NN ,_, of_IN vanaspathies_NNS from_IN groundnut_NN ,_, sesame_NN and_CC cottonseed_NN oils_NNS and_CC of_IN the_DT body_NN fats_NNS from_IN cow_NN ,_, buffalo_NN ,_, goat_NN and_CC sheep_NN ._.
EXPERIMENTAL_IN The_DT technique_NN of_IN Irwin_NNP et_FW al_NN [_NN 1936_CD ]_NN was_VBD adopted_VBN ._.
Adult_NN rats_NNS from_IN 4_CD to_TO 7_CD months_NNS old_JJ weighing_VBG about_IN 200_CD gm_NNS ._.
were_VBD fasted_VBN for_IN 48_CD hours_NNS ,_, during_IN which_WDT period_NN water_NN was_VBD given_VBN ad_NN libitum_NN ._.
With_IN the_DT help_NN of_IN the_DT stomach_NN tube_NN ,_, 1.5_CD c.c_NN ._.
of_IN melted_VBN fat_NN was_VBD then_RB delivered_VBN into_IN the_DT stomach_NN ._.
In_IN a_DT similar_JJ way_NN 1.5_CD c.c_NN ._.
of_IN the_DT fat_NN was_VBD delivered_VBN into_IN beaker_NN and_CC weighed_VBD ._.
The_DT average_NN of_IN three_CD such_JJ weighings_NNS was_VBD taken_VBN as_IN the_DT weight_NN of_IN the_DT fat_JJ fed_NN ._.

The_DT sections_NNS were_VBD then_RB filled_VBN with_IN petroleum_NN ether_NN (_( 40°C.222_CD Rate_NNP of_IN Absorption_NNP of_IN Oils_NNP and_CC Fats_NNP [_NNP XVII_VBD It_PRP was_VBD found_VBN that_IN at_IN the_DT end_NN of_IN four_CD hours_NNS the_DT stomach_NN of_IN the_DT animals_NNS fed_VBD body_NN fats_NNS contained_VBD a_DT visible_JJ hard_JJ fat_NN ._.

With_IN regard_NN to_TO edible_VB oils_NNS ,_, mustard_NN oil_NN is_VBZ found_VBN to_TO be_VB least_JJS absorbed_VBN while_IN sesame_NN and_CC cocoanut_NN oils_NNS happened_VBD to_TO be_VB absorbed_VBN to_TO the_DT same_JJ extent_NN as_IN cow_NN ghee_NN ._.

Vanaspathies_NNS ,_, in_IN general_JJ ,_, are_VBP found_VBN to_TO be_VB less_JJR absorbed_VBN ._.
If_IN the_DT rates_NNS of_IN absorption_NN of_IN groundnut_NN vanaspathies_NNS are_VBP taken_VBN into_IN consideration_NN ,_, it_PRP is_VBZ seen_VBN that_IN as_IN the_DT melting_VBG point_NN of_IN the_DT sample_NN increases_NNS from_IN 34.1°C_CD ._.
to_TO 39.0°C_CD ,_, the_DT absorption_NN correspondingly_RB decreases_VBZ from_IN 36.5_CD per_IN cent_NN to_TO 33.6_CD per_IN cent_NN Though_IN the_DT sample_NN having_VBG a_DT melting_VBG point_NN of_IN 34.1°C_CD ._.
compared_VBN favourably_RB well_RB with_IN groundnut_JJ oil_NN ,_, the_DT rates_NNS of_IN abosrption_NN of_IN other_JJ two_CD vanaspathhies_NNS were_VBD significantly_RB lower_JJR ._.

This_DT discrepancy_NN in_IN the_DT rates_NNS of_IN absorption_NN of_IN different_JJ fats_NNS can_MD be_VB partly_RB explained_VBN by_IN following_VBG closely_RB the_DT changes_NNS that_WDT take_VBP place_NN in_IN a_DT fat_NN as_IN digestion_NN proceeds_NNS ._.
This_DT has_VBZ been_VBN done_VBN by_IN analyzing_VBG the_DT intestinal_JJ residues_NNS from_IN each_DT group_NN for_IN B._NNP R._NNP Index_NNP ,_, saponification_NN value_NN and_CC the_DT iodine_NN values_NNS and_CC the_DT data_NNS are_VBP shown_VBN in_IN Table_NNP II_NNP ._.

It_PRP is_VBZ also_RB seen_VBN from_IN Table_NNP II_NNP ,_, that_IN there_EX is_VBZ a_DT lowering_NN in_IN the_DT saponification_NN value_NN and_CC Reichert-_NNP Meissel_NNP value_NN of_IN the_DT butter_NN fats_NNS ._.
Though_IN the_DT differences_NNS are_VBP not_RB large_JJ ,_, there_EX is_VBZ an_DT indication_NN that_IN the_DT short_JJ chain_NN fatty_JJ acids_NNS are_VBP more_RBR readily_RB absorbed_VBN than_IN the_DT long_JJ chain_NN fatty_JJ acids_NNS ._.
There_EX is_VBZ not_RB so_RB much_JJ lowering_NN in_IN the_DT iodine_NN value_NN as_IN in_IN the_DT case_NN of_IN oils_NNS or_CC vanaspathies_NNS indicating_VBG preferential_JJ ab-_JJ sorption_NN in_IN the_DT gastro-intestinal_JJ tract_NN of_IN the_DT short_JJ chain_NN acids_NNS as_IN compared_VBN to_TO the_DT unsaturated_JJ acids_NNS in_IN case_NN of_IN butter_NN fats_NNS ._.
The_DT presence_NN of_IN lower_JJR fatty_JJ acids_NNS in_IN the_DT butter_NN fats_NN is_VBZ a_DT probable_JJ explanation_NN of_IN their_PRP$ quicker_NN absorption_NN as_IN compared_VBN to_TO the_DT other_JJ fats_NNS ._.
Cocoanut_NNP oil_NN also_RB behaves_VBZ in_IN the_DT same_JJ way_NN as_IN butter_NN fats_NNS ,_, as_IN is_VBZ seen_VBN from_IN the_DT fact_NN that_IN the_DT saponification_NN value_NN of_IN the_DT residual_JJ fat_NN is_VBZ lowered_VBN considerably_RB from_IN 259.0_CD to_TO 231.4_CD indicating_VBG a_DT quicker_NN absorption_NN of_IN the_DT lower_JJR acids_NNS ._.
In_IN case_NN of_IN the_DT body_NN fats_NNS there_EX is_VBZ no_DT definite_JJ indication_NN except_IN the_DT fact_NN that_IN the_DT unsaturated_JJ acids_NNS are_VBP absorbed_VBN proportionately_RB more_RBR as_IN evident_NN from_IN the_DT slight_JJ lowering_NN of_IN the_DT iodine_JJ value_NN of_IN the_DT undigested_JJ fat_NN ._.
There_EX is_VBZ a_DT marked_JJ change_NN in_IN the_DT nature_NN of_IN edible_JJ oils_NNS during_IN the_DT digestion_NN ._.
The_DT iodine_NN value_NN is_VBZ almost_RB reduced_VBN to_TO two-thirds_NNS in_IN all_PDT the_DT oils_NNS except_IN cocoanut_JJ oil_NN ._.
This_DT leads_VBZ to_TO the_DT conclusion_NN that_IN the_DT un-_JJ saturated_JJ acids_NNS ,_, namely_RB oleic_JJ and_CC linoleic_JJ ,_, are_VBP more_RBR readily_RB digested_VBN than_IN the_DT saturated_JJ acids_NNS ._.
224_CD Rate_NNP of_IN Absorption_NNP of_IN Oils_NNP and_CC Fats_NNP [_NNP XVII_NNP The_DT lowering_NN of_IN absorption_NN of_IN the_DT oils_NNS by_IN hydrogenation_NN may_MD be_VB explained_VBN by_IN chemical_NN changes_NNS that_WDT are_VBP brought_VBN about_IN during_IN the_DT process_NN ._.
The_DT linoleic_JJ acid_NN is_VBZ converted_VBN to_TO oleic_VB and_CC iso-oleic_JJ acid_NN and_CC finally_RB into_IN stearic_JJ acid_NN ,_, thus_RB the_DT proportion_NN of_IN oleic_NN and_CC linoleic_JJ acids_NNS gradually_RB decrease_VBP with_IN a_DT proportionate_JJ increase_NN in_IN the_DT stearic_JJ acid_NN content_NN ._.
This_DT lowering_NN of_IN the_DT unsaturated_JJ acid_NN contents_NNS in_IN the_DT fat_NN is_VBZ probably_RB responsible_JJ for_IN the_DT lowering_NN of_IN its_PRP$ rate_NN of_IN absorption_NN ._.
It_PRP is_VBZ thus_RB seen_VBN from_IN the_DT results_NNS that_IN the_DT short_JJ chain_NN fatty_JJ acids_NNS and_CC the_DT unsaturated_JJ acids_NNS ,_, particularly_RB oleic_JJ and_CC linoleic_JJ acids_NNS ,_, are_VBP more_RBR readily_RB absorbed_VBN than_IN the_DT long_JJ chain_NN saturated_VBD fatty_JJ acids_NNS in_IN four_CD hours_NNS absorption_JJ period_NN ._.
SUMMARY_NNP The_DT realtive_JJ rate_NN of_IN absorption_NN of_IN cow_NN ,_, buffalo_NN ,_, goat_NN and_CC sheep_JJ butter_NN fats_NNS ,_, the_DT body_NN fats_NNS of_IN cow_NN ,_, buffalo_NN ,_, goat_NN and_CC sheep_NN ,_, the_DT vegetable_NN oils_NNS ,_, cocoanut_NN ,_, sesame_NN ,_, groundnut_NN ,_, cottonseed_NN ,_, safflower_JJR and_CC mustard_NN ,_, the_DT hydrogenated_JJ groundnut_NN oils_NNS of_IN melting_VBG points_NNS of_IN 34.1°C._CD ,_, 37.0°C_CD ._.
and_CC 39.0°C._CD ,_, the_DT hydro-_JJ genated_JJ sesame_NN oils_NNS of_IN melting_VBG points_NNS of_IN 37.1°C._CD ,_, 38.7°C._CD ,_, 39.3°C_CD ._.
and_CC the_DT hydrogenated_JJ cottonseed_NN oils_NNS of_IN melting_VBG points_NNS of_IN 35.5°C._CD ,_, 37.3°C_CD ._.
and_CC 38.5°C_CD ._.
were_VBD determined_VBN after_IN four_CD hours_NNS by_IN feeding_VBG 1.5_CD c.c_NN ._.
of_IN each_DT fat_NN ._.
The_DT undigested_JJ fats_NNS in_IN the_DT alimentary_JJ canal_NN were_VBD also_RB examined_VBN for_IN their_PRP$ chemical_NN characteristics_NNS ._.
It_PRP was_VBD found_VBN that_IN sesame_JJ oil_NN and_CC cocoanut_NN oils_NNS were_VBD absorbed_VBN at_IN the_DT same_JJ rate_NN as_IN cow_NN butter_NN fat_NN ,_, while_IN sheep_JJ butter_NN fat_NN ,_, safflower_JJR oil_NN ,_, groundnut_NN oil_NN and_CC cottonseed_NN oil_NN were_VBD absorbed_VBN somewhat_RB more_RBR slowly_RB ,_, but_CC the_DT absorption_NN was_VBD not_RB significantly_RB less_JJR than_IN that_DT of_IN cow_NN ghee_NN ._.
All_PDT the_DT body_NN fats_NNS and_CC hydrogenated_VBN oils_NNS were_VBD significantly_RB less_JJR absorbed_VBN as_IN compared_VBN with_IN cow_NN ghee_NN ._.
It_PRP was_VBD also_RB found_VBN that_IN hydrogenation_NN lowered_VBD the_DT rate_NN of_IN absorption_NN of_IN an_DT oil_NN ._.
It_PRP is_VBZ suggested_VBN that_IN the_DT short_JJ chain_NN fatty_JJ acids_NNS are_VBP more_RBR readily_RB absorbed_VBN than_IN the_DT long_JJ chain_NN fatty_JJ acids_NNS and_CC among_IN the_DT long_JJ chain_NN fatty_JJ acids_NNS ,_, the_DT unsaturated_JJ acids_NNS are_VBP more_RBR readily_RB absorbed_VBN than_IN the_DT saturated_JJ acids_NNS ._.

RESAZURIN_NNP TEST_NNP FOR_IN ASSESSING_NNP THE_NNP STERILITY_NNP OF_NNP DAIRY_NNP UTENSILS_NNP By_IN F._NNP D._NNP AIBARA_NNP and_CC H._NNP LAXMINARAYANA_NNP ,_, Indian_NNP Dairy_NNP Research_NNP Institute_NNP ,_, Bangalore_NNP (_( Received_VBN for_IN publication_NN on_IN 13_CD June_NNP 1947_CD )_) IT_NNP is_VBZ well_RB known_VBN that_IN dairy_NN utensils_NNS and_CC milk_NN plant_NN ,_, which_WDT are_VBP not_RB thoroughly_RB cleaned_VBN and_CC efficiently_RB sterilized_VBN ,_, represent_VBP the_DT most_RBS important_JJ sources_NNS of_IN bacterial_JJ contamination_NN in_IN milk_NN ._.
Accordingly_RB the_DT efficiency_NN of_IN the_DT methods_NNS of_IN cleansing_VBG and_CC sterilization_NN in_IN a_DT dairy_NN is_VBZ required_VBN to_TO be_VB checked_VBN periodically_RB by_IN testing_VBG the_DT equipment_NN and_CC utensils_NNS for_IN sterility_NN ._.
For_IN this_DT purpose_NN the_DT plate_NN counts_NNS of_IN either_CC the_DT rinsings_NNS or_CC of_IN swabs_NNS are_VBP most_RBS widely_RB employed_VBN ._.
Since_IN absolute_JJ sterility_NN ,_, i.e_NN ._.
complete_JJ freedom_NN from_IN all_DT living_NN organisms_NNS ,_, is_VBZ impracticable_JJ under_IN commercial_JJ conditions_NNS ,_, maximum_JJ limits_NNS of_IN plate_NN counts_NNS are_VBP allowed_VBN for_IN different_JJ types_NNS of_IN utensils_NNS varying_VBG from_IN 10_CD per_IN ml_NN ._.
of_IN rinse_JJ solution_NN in_IN the_DT case_NN of_IN bottles_NNS to_TO 100_CD per_IN ml_NN ._.
for_IN milk_NN pails_NNS and_CC 500_CD per_IN ml_NN ._.
for_IN churns_NNS [_JJ Chalmers_NNP ,_, 1945_CD ]_NN ._.
An_DT official_JJ technique_NN for_IN the_DT examination_NN of_IN washed_JJ churns_NNS and_CC suitable_JJ limits_NNS of_IN plate_NN counts_NNS for_IN evaluat-_JJ ing_VBG the_DT efficiency_NN of_IN farm_NN sterilization_NN methods_NNS have_VBP also_RB been_VBN prescribed_VBN by_IN the_DT British_JJ Ministry_NNP of_IN Agriculture_NNP [_NNP 1943_CD ]_NNP ._.
The_DT plate_NN count_NN method_NN is_VBZ ,_, however_RB ,_, complicated_VBD and_CC involves_VBZ considerable_JJ delay_NN in_IN obtaining_VBG results_NNS ._.
The_DT presumptive_JJ coliform_NN test_NN which_WDT has_VBZ also_RB been_VBN used_VBN for_IN the_DT purpose_NN is_VBZ not_RB found_VBN to_TO be_VB of_IN much_JJ value_NN ,_, particularly_RB in_IN the_DT case_NN of_IN bottles_NNS [_NNP Mattick_NNP and_CC Hoy_NNP ,_, 1937_CD ;_: Bark-_NNP worth_NN ,_, 1941_CD ]_NN ._.
Thomas_NNP [_NN 1943_CD ]_NN suggested_VBD the_DT use_NN of_IN resazurin_NN as_IN a_DT simpler_NN and_CC quicker_JJR test_NN for_IN detecting_VBG churn_JJ sterility_NN ._.
The_DT method_NN was_VBD subsequently_RB modified_VBN by_IN Davis_NNP and_CC Watson_NNP [_NNP 1943_CD ]_NN ,_, according_VBG to_TO whom_WP the_DT rinse_NN solution_NN from_IN the_DT churn_NN is_VBZ added_VBN to_TO sterile_VB separated_VBN milk_NN and_CC incubated_VBN at_IN 22°C_CD ._.
for_IN 24_CD hours_NNS ._.
The_DT incubated_JJ sample_NN is_VBZ then_RB subjected_VBN to_TO the_DT resazurin_JJ test_NN and_CC if_IN the_DT colour_NN is_VBZ not_RB reduced_VBN to_TO a_DT lilac_NN shade_NN (_( disc_JJ 5_CD )_) in_IN half_PDT an_DT hour_NN ,_, it_PRP is_VBZ an_DT indication_NN of_IN a_DT satisfactory_JJ degree_NN of_IN sterility_NN in_IN the_DT churn_NN ._.
Discs_$ 5_CD to_TO 3½_CD are_VBP taken_VBN to_TO denote_VB a_DT '_'' doubtful_JJ '_POS condition_NN while_IN reduction_NN to_TO disc_VB 3_CD or_CC below_NN is_VBZ an_DT index_NN of_IN unsatisfactory_JJ condition_NN ._.
A_DT good_JJ agreement_NN between_IN these_DT resazurin_NN standards_NNS and_CC the_DT plate_NN count_NN limits_NNS laid_VBN down_RB by_IN the_DT Ministry_NNP of_IN Agriculture_NNP was_VBD found_VBN by_IN Davis_NNP and_CC Watson_NNP ._.

Furthermore_RB ,_, any_DT substantial_JJ shortening_NN of_IN this_DT period_NN would_MD help_VB in_IN considerable_JJ saving_NN of_IN time_NN in_IN obtaining_VBG the_DT results_NNS ._.

of_IN rinse_JJ solution_NN )_) obtained_VBN in_IN respect_NN of_IN different_JJ utensils_NNS and_CC the_DT corresponding_JJ resazurin_NN reduction_NN stages_NNS at_IN the_DT end_NN of_IN 30_CD minutes_NNS ,_, one_CD hour_NN and_CC two_CD hours_NNS are_VBP given_VBN in_IN Table_NNP I_PRP ._.
The_DT resazurin_NN colour_NN shades_NNS (_( blue_JJ ,_, lilac_JJ ,_, mauve_NN ,_, pink_VBP mauve_NN ,_, purple_JJ pink_NN ,_, pink_NN and_CC white_JJ )_) are_VBP expressed_VBN in_IN terms_NNS of_IN disc_NN numbers_NNS 6_CD to_TO 0_CD (_( indicated_VBN on_IN the_DT resazurin_NN ._.
comparator_NN )_) for_IN facilitating_VBG interpretation_NN ._.
There_EX was_VBD no_DT appreciable_JJ colour_NN change_NN at_IN the_DT end_NN of_IN 10_CD minutes_NNS due_JJ to_TO the_DT interval_NN being_VBG too_RB short_JJ and_CC the_DT reduction_NN after_IN three_CD hours_NNS had_VBD invariably_RB advanced_VBN to_TO either_VB a_DT pink_NN or_CC colourless_NN stage_NN in_IN almost_RB all_DT cases_NNS ._.
Hence_NNP these_DT observations_NNS are_VBP not_RB included_VBN in_IN the_DT data_NN ._.
The_DT results_NNS of_IN the_DT coliform_NN test_NN for_IN each_DT group_NN of_IN samples_NNS are_VBP also_RB given_VBN ._.
It_PRP is_VBZ seen_VBN that_IN the_DT resazurin_NN colour_NN changes_NNS (_( disc_JJ numbers_NNS )_) are_VBP fairly_RB comparable_JJ with_IN plate_NN counts_NNS in_IN bringing_VBG out_RP the_DT marked_JJ difference_NN between_IN washed_VBN and_CC sterilized_VBN utensils_NNS in_IN their_PRP$ standards_NNS of_IN cleanliness_NN ._.

2_CD 2_CD .._NNS Out_NNP of_IN 25_CD utensils_NNS satisfying_VBG the_DT plate_NN count_NN standard_NN ,_, 22_CD are_VBP passed_VBN by_IN the_DT resazurin_JJ test_NN and_CC of_IN 32_CD utensils_NNS failing_VBG on_IN the_DT former_JJ scale_NN only_RB 20_CD are_VBP condemned_VBN by_IN the_DT latter_JJ test_NN ._.

Thus_RB ,_, the_DT resazurin_JJ test_NN ,_, although_IN capable_JJ of_IN detecting_VBG most_JJS of_IN the_DT efficiently_RB or_CC inefficiently_RB sterilized_VBN vessels_NNS ,_, fails_NNS to_TO pick_VB out_RP an_DT appreciable_JJ number_NN of_IN samples_NNS condemned_VBN on_IN the_DT plate_NN count_NN ._.
This_DT anomaly_NN is_VBZ easily_RB explained_VBN considering_VBG that_IN (_( a_DT )_) the_DT slightest_JJS contamination_NN occurring_VBG at_IN the_DT time_NN of_IN plating_NN and_CC other_JJ inevitable_JJ sources_NNS of_IN error_NN in_IN the_DT technique_NN will_MD give_VB rise_NN to_TO a_DT higher_JJR count_NN without_IN affecting_VBG the_DT reduction_NN test_NN to_TO the_DT same_JJ degree_NN ,_, and_CC (_( b_NN )_) the_DT flora_NN surviving_VBG inefficient_JJ sterilization_NN in_IN ._.
some_DT cases_NNS (_( e.g_NN ._.
bottles_NNS )_) may_MD be_VB of_IN an_DT inert_JJ type_NN without_IN much_JJ influence_NN on_IN the_DT reduction_NN of_IN resazurin_NN ._.
Accordingly_RB the_DT resazurin_JJ test_NN would_MD appear_VB to_TO be_VB less_RBR sensitive_JJ and_CC accurate_JJ than_IN plate_NN count_NN in_IN detecting_VBG faulty_NN methods_NNS ,_, while_IN it_PRP is_VBZ more_RBR reliable_JJ in_IN indicating_VBG the_DT presence_NN of_IN actively_RB reducing_VBG types_NNS of_IN organisms_NNS that_WDT have_VBP survived_VBN in_IN the_DT containers_NNS and_CC which_WDT are_VBP apt_JJ to_TO bring_VB down_RP the_DT keeping_VBG quality_NN of_IN milk_NN ._.
In_IN any_DT case_NN failure_NN of_IN the_DT utensils_NNS to_TO pass_VB the_DT resazurin_JJ standard_NN is_VBZ a_DT definite_JJ indica-_JJ tion_NN of_IN inefficient_JJ methods_NNS and_CC this_DT factor_NN is_VBZ of_IN sufficient_JJ practical_JJ value_NN in_IN controlling_VBG the_DT operations_NNS under_IN commercial_JJ conditions_NNS ._.
It_PRP is_VBZ possible_JJ that_IN many_JJ samples_NNS condemned_VBN by_IN the_DT resazurin_JJ test_NN may_MD come_VB under_IN the_DT '_'' doubtful_JJ '_POS class_NN suggested_VBN by_IN Davis_NNP and_CC Watson_NNP [_NNP loc_NN cit_NN ._. ]_NN ._.
The_DT present_JJ data_NNS have_VBP not_RB provided_VBN any_DT basis_NN for_IN fixing_VBG up_RP an_DT intermediate_JJ standard_NN ._.
If_IN the_DT object_NN of_IN applying_VBG the_DT test_NN is_VBZ to_TO determine_VB whether_IN the_DT method_NN of_IN washing_VBG and_CC sterilization_NN of_IN utensils_NNS is_VBZ effective_JJ enough_RB or_CC not_RB ,_, the_DT provision_NN of_IN any_DT such_JJ intermediate_JJ grade_NN has_VBZ no_DT practical_JJ significance_NN ._.
Further_JJ application_NN of_IN the_DT test_NN under_IN actual_JJ com-_JJ mercial_JJ conditions_NNS is_VBZ necessary_JJ for_IN elucidating_VBG the_DT above_JJ point_NN ._.
SUMMARY_NNP The_DT applicability_NN of_IN the_DT resazurin_JJ test_NN for_IN assessing_VBG the_DT sterility_NN of_IN dairy_NN utensils_NNS ,_, e.g_NN ._.
bottles_NNS ,_, milk_NN pails_NNS ,_, churns_NNS ,_, receiving_VBG tank_NN and_CC cooler_NN ,_, as_IN a_DT means_NN of_IN checking_VBG the_DT efficiency_NN of_IN the_DT cleansing_NN and_CC sterilization_NN methods_NNS in_IN the_DT dairy_NN has_VBZ been_VBN examined_VBN ._.
2_CD ._.

mixed_JJ with_IN 10_CD ml_NNS ._.
sterile_RB separated_VBN milk_NN and_CC then_RB incubated_VBD at_IN 22°C_CD ._.
for_IN 16_CD hours_NNS )_) and_CC the_DT colour_NN changes_NNS in_IN half_PDT an_DT hour_NN (_( at_IN 37°C_CD ._. )_)
fairly_RB agreed_VBN with_IN the_DT plate_NN counts_NNS of_IN the_DT rinsings_NNS ._.

IV_NNP ]_NNP F._NNP D._NNP AIBRA_NNP AND_NNP H._NNP LAXIMINARATANA_NNP 229_CD 3_CD ._.

Welsh_NNP J._NNP Agric_NNP ._.
17_CD ,_, 115_CD A_NNP COMPARATIVE_NNP STUDY_NNP IN_NNP THE_NNP USE_NNP OF_NNP DIFFERENT_NNP MEDIA_NNP FOR_NNP THE_NNP ESTIMATION_NNP OF_NNP COLIFORM_NNP ORGANISMS_NNP IN_NNP MILK_NNP BY_NNP M._NNP A._NNP KRISHNASWAMY_NNP AND_NNP H._NNP LAXMINARAYANA_NNP ,_, Indian_NNP Dairy_NNP Research_NNP Institute_NNP ,_, Bangalore_NNP (_( Received_VBN for_IN publication_NN on_IN 26_CD August_NNP 1946_CD )_) IN_NNP VIEW_NNP of_IN the_DT great_JJ importance_NN attached_VBN to_TO the_DT presence_NN of_IN members_NNS of_IN the_DT coli-aerogenes_NNS group_NN in_IN milk_NN and_CC milk_NN products_NNS ,_, the_DT attention_NN of_IN workers_NNS in_IN the_DT field_NN has_VBZ been_VBN focussed_VBN on_IN the_DT develop-_JJ ment_NN of_IN suitable_JJ methods_NNS for_IN their_PRP$ detection_NN and_CC estimation_NN ._.
The_DT dilution_NN extinction_NN method_NN (_( originally_RB introduced_VBN by_IN Lister_NNP )_) using_VBG various_JJ liquid_JJ media_NNS has_VBZ been_VBN widely_RB employed_VBN for_IN the_DT purpose_NN and_CC recently_RB plating_VBG on_IN solid_JJ media_NNS for_IN the_DT enumeration_NN of_IN coliform_NN organisms_NNS and_CC the_DT direct_JJ differentia-_JJ tion_NN of_IN coli_NN and_CC aerogenes_NNS types_NNS have_VBP also_RB come_VBN into_IN practice_NN ._.
Most_JJS of_IN the_DT media_NNS were_VBD originally-_RB introduced_VBN for_IN water_NN analysis_NN and_CC subsequently_RB suggested_VBN for_IN the_DT examination_NN of_IN milk_NN ._.
MacConkey_NNP 's_POS lactose_JJ peptone_NN bile_NN broth_DT [_JJ 1905_CD and_CC 1908_CD ]_NN has_VBZ been_VBN almost_RB exclusively_RB used_VBN for_IN the_DT presumptive_JJ coliform_NN test_NN in_IN England_NNP [_NNP Ministry_NNP of_IN Agriculture_NNP ,_, 1934_CD ]_NN while_IN in_IN the_DT United_NNP States_NNPS a_DT standard_NN lactose_NN broth_NN ,_, differing_VBG from_IN the_DT former_JJ mainly_RB in_IN the_DT omission_NN of_IN bile_NN salt_NN ,_, was_VBD in_IN general_JJ use_NN for_IN a_DT long_JJ time_NN ._.
The_DT serious_JJ drawbacks_NNS of_IN the_DT latter_JJ medium_NN in_IN permitting_VBG the_DT growth_NN of_IN other_JJ types_NNS of_IN organisms_NNS and_CC giving_VBG many_JJ false_JJ positives_NNS were_VBD realized_VBN early_RB and_CC this_DT led_VBN to_TO the_DT introduction_NN by_IN various_JJ American_JJ workers_NNS of_IN several_JJ selective_JJ liquid_NN media_NNS ,_, which_WDT ,_, while_IN permitting_VBG the_DT growth_NN of_IN coliform_NN bacteria_NNS ,_, would_MD inhibit_VB other_JJ organisms_NNS ._.
Two_CD of_IN these_DT namely_RB ,_, two_CD per_IN cent_NN brilliant_NN green_JJ bile_NN broth_NN [_NNP Jordan_NNP ,_, 1927_CD ]_NN and_CC formate_JJ ricinoleate_NN broth_DT [_NNP Stark_NNP and_CC England_NNP ,_, 1935_CD ]_NN have_VBP been_VBN generally_RB regarded_VBN as_IN most_JJS satisfactory_JJ [_NN Farrell_NNP ,_, 1937_CD ;_: McCrady_NNP and_CC Langevin_NNP ,_, 1932_CD ;_: McCrady_NNP and_CC Archambault_NNP ,_, 1934_CD ;_: Noble_NNP and_CC White_NNP ,_, 1935_CD ;_: Babel_NNP and_CC Parfitt_NNP ,_, 1936_CD ]_NN and_CC they_PRP are_VBP now_RB re-_JJ commended_VBN for_IN the_DT presumptive_JJ coliform_NN test_NN in_IN the_DT bacteriological_JJ examination_NN of_IN milk_NN in_IN the_DT United_NNP States_NNPS [_JJ American_NNP Public_NNP Health_NNP Association_NNP ,_, 1941_CD ]_NN ._.
Solid_JJ media_NNS were_VBD originally_RB employed_VBN for_IN differentiating_VBG between_IN the_DT various_JJ members_NNS of_IN the_DT coli-aerogenes_NNS group_NN and_CC confirmation_NN of_IN positive_JJ broth_DT tubes_NNS in_IN the_DT presumptive_JJ test_NN ._.
MacConkey_NNP 's_POS agar_NN [_NN 1905_CD ]_NN has_VBZ been_VBN most_JJS commonly_RB employed_VBN in_IN England_NNP for_IN the_DT purpose_NN ,_, although_IN several_JJ other_JJ selective_JJ media_NNS namely_RB ,_, Eijkman_NNP 's_POS medium_NN ,_, Simmon_NNP 's_POS citrate_NN agar_NN and_CC Koser_NNP 's_POS citrate_NN medium_NN ,_, have_VBP also_RB been_VBN used_VBN for_IN distinguishing_VBG between_IN the_DT two_CD groups_NNS [_VBP Wilson_NNP and_CC colleagues_NNS ,_, 1935_CD ]_NN ._.
In_IN other_JJ countries_NNS ,_, Endo_NNP 's_POS [_NN 1904_CD ]_NNP medium_NN ,_, litmus_VBP lactose_JJ agar_NN ,_, Levine_NNP 's_POS [_NN 1918_CD ]_NNP eosin_FW methylene_NN blue_NN agar_NN and_CC recently_RB violet_VB red_JJ bile_NN agar_NN (_( Difco_NNP laboratories_NNS ,_, U.S.A._NNP )_) and_CC desoxycholate_JJ agar_NN [_NNP Liefson_NNP ,_, 1935_CD ]_NN have_VBP been_VBN widely_RB used_VBN ._.
The_DT employment_NN of_IN solid_JJ media_NNS for_IN the_DT enumeration_NN of_IN coliform_NN organisms_NNS and_CC direct_JJ differentia-_JJ tion_NN of_IN coli_NN and_CC aerogenes_NNS types_NNS have_VBP received_VBN attention_NN only_RB recently_RB ._.
Its_PRP$ main_JJ advocates_NNS have_VBP been_VBN Tonney_NNP and_CC Noble_NNP [_NN 1932_CD ]_NN who_WP recommended_VBD a_DT complex_JJ ferrocyanide_NN citrate_NN agar_NN medium_NN ._.
Kon_NNP [_NNP 1932-33_JJ ]_NN could_MD not_RB get_VB clear-cut_JJ results_NNS on_IN any_DT of_IN the_DT solid_JJ media_NNS suggested_VBN by_IN previous_JJ workers_NNS ._.
Wilson_NNP et_CC al_JJ [_JJ loc_NN ._.
cit_NN ._. ]_NN
conclude_NN that_IN MacConkey_NNP 's_POS medium_NN (_( whether_IN liquid_NN or_CC solid_JJ )_) is_VBZ of_IN great_JJ value_NN in_IN the_DT estimation_NN of_IN coliform_NN bacilli_NN ._.
According_VBG to_TO McCrady_NNP and_CC Archambault_NNP [_NNP loc_NN ._.
cit_NN ._.
]_NN ,_, Bartram_NNP and_CC Black_NNP [_NNP 1937_CD ]_NNP ,_, Babel_NNP and_CC Parfitt_NNP [_NNP loc_NN ._.
cit_NN ._. ]_NN
and_CC Miller_NNP and_CC Pricket_NNP [_NNP 1938_CD ]_NNP violet_NN red_VBD bile_JJ agar_NN gives_VBZ most_RBS satisfactory_JJ results_NNS in_IN 24_CD hours_NNS ,_, while_IN Chilson_NNP and_CC Eglinton_NNP [_NNP 1936_CD ]_NNP and_CC Yale_NNP [_NNP 1937_CD ]_NNP advocate_VBP the_DT use_NN of_IN desoxycholate_NN agar_NN ._.
The_DT last_JJ two_CD media_NNS namely_RB ,_, violet_NN red_JJ bile_NN agar_NN and_CC desoxycholate_NN agar_NN ,_, have_VBP now_RB been_VBN recommended_VBN for_IN the_DT presumptive_JJ coliform_NN test_NN in_IN milk_NN and_CC eosin_JJ methylene_NN blue_NN or_CC Endo_NNP 's_POS agar_NN for_IN subsequent_JJ isolation_NN of_IN colonies_NNS for_IN confirmation_NN and_CC identification_NN [_JJ American_NNP Public_NNP Health_NNP Association_NNP ,_, 1941_CD ]_NN ._.
Although_IN no_DT legal_JJ standards_NNS or_CC official_JJ methods_NNS for_IN the_DT bacteriological_JJ examination_NN of_IN milk_NN have_VBP been_VBN prescribed_VBN in_IN India_NNP ,_, the_DT presumptive_JJ coliform_NN test_NN using_VBG MacConkey_NNP 's_POS broth_NN [_NNP Ministry_NNP of_IN Agriculture_NNP ,_, 1934_CD ]_NN is_VBZ employed_VBN in_IN certain_JJ public_JJ health_NN and_CC dairy_NN laboratories_NNS for_IN assessing_VBG the_DT hygienic_JJ quality_NN of_IN water_NN and_CC milk_NN ._.
Cunningham_NNP and_CC Raghavachari_NNP [_NNP 1924_CD ]_NNP and_CC Raghavachari_NNP [_NNP 1926_CD ]_NNP studied_VBD the_DT application_NN of_IN some_DT recent_JJ methods_NNS of_IN differentiating_VBG lactose_JJ fermenting_VBG organisms_JJ 231_CD E_NNP 232_CD Comparative_NNP Study_NNP in_IN the_DT Use_NNP of_IN Different_NNP Media_NNP [_NNP XVII_NNP in_IN faeces_NNS ,_, soil_NN ,_, milk_NN and_CC water_NN under_IN Indian_JJ conditions_NNS and_CC found_VBD that_IN MacConkey_NNP 's_POS bile_NN salt_NN lactose_VBD broth_DT was_VBD the_DT most_RBS suitable_JJ medium_NN for_IN the_DT purpose_NN ._.
A_DT similar_JJ conclusion_NN has_VBZ been_VBN reached_VBN by_IN Raghavachari_NNP and_CC Sitarama_NNP Iyer_NNP [_NNP 1934_CD ,_, 1936_CD and_CC 1939_CD ]_NN ,_, who_WP examined_VBD the_DT use_NN of_IN several_JJ media_NNS for_IN estimating_VBG coliform_NN contamination_NN in_IN water_NN ._.
In_IN his_PRP$ studies_NNS on_IN the_DT types_NNS of_IN colon_NN organisms_NNS present_JJ in_IN milk_NN supplies_NNS in_IN Pusa_NNP ,_, Walton_NNP [_NNP 1931_CD ]_NNP used_VBD MacConkey_NNP 's_POS broth_NN with_IN litmus_NN as_IN a_DT selective_JJ medium_NN for_IN the_DT detection_NN and_CC growth_NN of_IN coliforms_NNS and_CC Endo_NNP 's_POS agar_NN for_IN confirming_VBG them_PRP ._.
The_DT use_NN of_IN solid_JJ media_NNS for_IN estimating_VBG coliform_NN organisms_NNS in_IN Indian_JJ milks_NNS does_VBZ not_RB seem_VB to_TO have_VB received_VBN atten-_JJ tion_NN ._.
There_EX is_VBZ thus_RB considerable_JJ divergence_NN of_IN opinion_NN as_IN to_TO the_DT best_JJS medium_NN for_IN carrying_VBG out_RP the_DT presumptive_JJ coliform_NN test_NN in_IN milk_NN ._.
While_IN the_DT English_JJ workers_NNS favour_VBP McConkey_NNP 's_POS broth_NN ,_, the_DT American_JJ authors_NNS recommended_VBD several_JJ liquid_NN as_RB well_RB as_IN solid_JJ media_NNS for_IN the_DT purpose_NN ._.
The_DT most_RBS suitable_JJ one_CD from_IN among_IN them_PRP may_MD be_VB selected_VBN and_CC adopted_VBN for_IN use_NN in_IN this_DT country_NN ._.
It_PRP is_VBZ well_RB known_VBN that_IN the_DT nature_NN of_IN bacterial_JJ flora_NNS developing_VBG in_IN milk_NN is_VBZ characteristic_JJ of_IN the_DT climatic_JJ and_CC environmental_JJ conditions_NNS and_CC since_IN India_NNP differs_NNS so_RB widely_RB from_IN the_DT western_JJ countries_NNS in_IN these_DT respects_NNS ,_, any_DT bacterio-_JJ logical_JJ test_NN or_CC medium_NN evolved_VBN there_EX must_MD be_VB examined_VBN for_IN its_PRP$ applicability_NN as_RB well_RB as_IN reliability_NN in_IN testing_VBG Indian_JJ milks_NNS before_IN accepting_VBG it_PRP with_IN confidence_NN ._.
Accordingly_RB the_DT present_JJ study_NN was_VBD under_IN taken_VBN with_IN a_DT view_NN to_TO compare_VB some_DT of_IN the_DT well-known_JJ liquid_NN and_CC solid_JJ media_NNS available_JJ for_IN the_DT estimation_NN of_IN coliform_NN organisms_NNS in_IN milk_NN ._.
EXPERIMENTAL_NNP Media_NNP compared_VBN ._.
The_DT following_JJ media_NNS ,_, which_WDT could_MD be_VB obtained_VBN locally_RB or_CC prepared_VBN in_IN th_JJ laboratory_NN from_IN available_JJ materials_NNS ,_, were_VBD compared_VBN for_IN estimating_VBG the_DT coliform_NN organisms_VBZ in_IN milk_NN by_IN the_DT dilution_NN and_CC plating_VBG methods_NNS :_: Liquid_NNP media_NNS MacConkey_NNP 's_POS broth_NN Formate_NNP ricinoleate_NN broth_NN Brilliant_NNP green_JJ bile_NN broth_NN Solid_NNP media_NNS MacConkey_NNP 's_POS agar_NN Endo_NNP 's_POS agar_NN Eosin_NNP methylene_NNP blue_JJ agar_NN Violet_NNP red_VBD bile_JJ agar_NN With_IN the_DT exception_NN of_IN MacConkey_NNP 's_POS broth_NN ,_, the_DT media_NNS were_VBD constituted_VBN from_IN the_DT Difco_NNP dehydrated_VBN products_NNS (_( U.S.A._NNP )_) ._.
The_DT MacConkey_NNP 's_POS broth_NN was_VBD prepared_VBN in_IN this_DT laboratory_NN according_VBG to_TO the_DT formula_NN given_VBN by_IN Chalmers_NNP [_NNP 1945_CD ]_NNP ._.
In_IN the_DT course_NN of_IN the_DT investigation_NN ,_, the_DT Difco_NNP preparation_NN of_IN MacConkey_NNP 's_POS agar_NN was_VBD exhausted_VBN early_RB and_CC further_JJ quantities_NNS could_MD not_RB be_VB obtained_VBN ._.
Some_DT preliminary_JJ trials_NNS were_VBD ,_, therefore_RB ,_, under-_JJ taken_VBN to_TO prepare_VB the_DT medium_NN in_IN this_DT laboratory_NN ._.
A_DT medium_NN prepared_VBN from_IN ordinary_JJ ingredients_NNS according_VBG to_TO the_DT formula_NN given_VBN by_IN Chalmers_NNP [_NNP 1945_CD ]_NN or_CC using_VBG Difco_NNP formula_NN gave_VBD very_RB unsatisfactory_JJ results_NNS ._.
The_DT chief_NN trouble_NN seems_VBZ to_TO lie_VB with_IN the_DT quality_NN of_IN peptone_NN ,_, bile_NN salt_NN and_CC indicators_NNS ,_, as_IN a_DT result_NN of_IN which_WDT characteristic_JJ colonies_NNS of_IN coliform_NN organisms_NNS could_MD not_RB be_VB obtained_VBN and_CC other_JJ types_NNS of_IN organisms_NNS could_MD not_RB be_VB prevented_VBN from_IN growing_VBG on_IN the_DT medium_NN and_CC giving_VBG misleading_JJ results_NNS ._.
Ultimately_RB the_DT following_JJ composition_NN ,_, employing_VBG Difco_NNP ingredients_NNS and_CC a_DT suitable_JJ concentration_NN of_IN the_DT indicators_NNS ,_, was_VBD found_VBN to_TO give_VB satisfactory_JJ results_NNS comparable_JJ with_IN those_DT yielded_VBN by_IN the_DT dehydrated_JJ product_NN and_CC was_VBD adopted_VBN in_IN subsequent_JJ work_NN :_: Bacto-peptone_NN ._.

(_( Final_NNP pH_NN 7.1_CD )_) All_PDT the_DT media_NNS were_VBD sterilized_VBN at_IN 15_CD lb_NN ._.
pressure_NN for_IN 20_CD minutes_NNS and_CC incubated_VBN at_IN 37°C_CD ._.
for_IN 3_CD to_TO 4_CD days_NNS for_IN detecting_VBG and_CC weeding_VBG out_RP any_DT contaminated_JJ tubes_NNS before_IN employing_VBG them_PRP for_IN the_DT ex-_JJ periments_NNS ._.
XVIII_NN ]_NNP M._NNP A._NNP KRISHNASWAMY_NNP AND_NNP H._NNP LAXIMINARAYANA_NNP 233_CD Presumptive_NNP test_NN ._.
Three_CD successive_JJ tenfold_JJ dilutions_NNS of_IN the_DT milk_NN sample_NN (_( corresponding_VBG to_TO its_PRP$ general_JJ level_NN of_IN bacteriological_JJ quality_NN )_) were_VBD prepared_VBN in_IN saline_JJ water_NN in_IN the_DT usual_JJ manner_NN ,_, i.e._FW ,_, by_IN adding_VBG one_CD ml_NN ._.
of_IN milk_NN to_TO 9_CD ml_NNS ._.
of_IN saline_JJ water_NN for_IN making_VBG 10-1_JJ ml_NN ._.
dilution_NN and_CC preparing_VBG further_JJ dilutions_NNS from_IN the_DT latter_NN ._.
Where_WRB the_DT dilution_NN series_NN started_VBD from_IN 10-2_JJ ml._NN ,_, one_CD ml_NN ._.
of_IN original_JJ milk_NN was_VBD added_VBN to_TO 99_CD ml_NNS ._.
water_NN to_TO make_VB up_RP 10-2_JJ ml_NN ._.
dilution_NN and_CC subsequent_JJ dilutions_NNS made_VBN from_IN it_PRP in_IN the_DT same_JJ manner_NN ._.
One_CD ml_NN ._.
portions_NNS of_IN each_DT dilution_NN were_VBD inoculated_VBN into_IN the_DT three_CD broth_NN (_( liquid_JJ media_NNS )_) tubes_VBP in_IN triplicate_NN and_CC also_RB plated_VBN in_IN duplicate_NN on_IN the_DT four_CD solid_JJ media_NNS ._.
After_IN the_DT agar_NN had_VBD selidified_VBN in_IN the_DT petri_NN dishes_VBZ about_IN 4_CD ml_NNS ._.
of_IN the_DT same_JJ medium_NN was_VBD peured_VBN over_IN it_PRP in_IN order_NN to_TO prevent_VB the_DT formation_NN of_IN atypical_JJ surface_NN colonies_NNS ._.
The_DT broth_NN tubes_VBZ as_RB well_RB as_IN the_DT plates_NNS were_VBD incubated_VBN at_IN 37°C_CD ._.
and_CC examined_VBD after_IN 24_CD hours_NNS and_CC 48_CD hours_NNS in_IN the_DT beginning_NN ._.
All_PDT the_DT liquid_NN madia_NN which_WDT were_VBD to_TO show_VB the_DT production_NN of_IN acid_NN and_CC gas_NN did_VBD so_RB invariably_RB in_IN 24_CD hours_NNS and_CC there_EX was_VBD no_DT advantage_NN in_IN contiuning_VBG the_DT incubation_NN for_IN 48_CD hours_NNS ._.
In_IN the_DT case_NN of_IN plates_NNS ,_, the_DT maximum_JJ number_NN of_IN colonies_NNS were_VBD obtained_VBN in_IN 24_CD hours_NNS and_CC further_JJ incubation_NN only_RB resulted_VBD in_IN an_DT increase_NN of_IN the_DT size_NN of_IN the_DT colonies_NNS and_CC in_IN many_JJ instances_NNS it_PRP permitted_VBD the_DT growth_NN of_IN certain_JJ slow_JJ acid_NN producers_NNS which_WDT gave_VBD misleading_JJ results_NNS ._.
Accordingly_RB ,_, after_IN making_VBG observations_NNS at_IN the_DT end_NN of_IN 24_CD hours_NNS ,_, only_RB such_JJ of_IN the_DT tubes_NNS and_CC plates_NNS as_IN gave_VBD negative_JJ or_CC doubtful_JJ results_NNS were_VBD incubated_VBN for_IN further_JJ 24_CD hours_NNS and_CC observed_VBD ._.
None_NN of_IN them_PRP ,_, however_RB ,_, gave_VBD any_DT positive_JJ reactions_NNS at_IN the_DT end_NN of_IN 48_CD hours_NNS ._.
The_DT production_NN of_IN acid_NN and_CC gas_NN (_( more_JJR than_IN 10_CD per_IN cent_NN in_IN the_DT Durham_NNP 's_POS tube_NN )_) in_IN at_IN least_JJS two_CD out_IN of_IN the_DT triplicate_NN broth_NN tubes_NNS and_CC the_DT appearance_NN on_IN the_DT plates_NNS of_IN typical_JJ dark-red_JJ or_CC brick-red_JJ colonies_NNS of_IN at_IN least_JJS 0.5_CD m.m_NN ._.
in_IN diameter_NN and_CC not_RB less_JJR than_IN five_CD (_( average_NN of_IN duplicates_NNS )_) in_IN number_NN were_VBD taken_VBN as_RB positive_JJ presumptive_JJ evidence_NN of_IN the_DT presence_NN of_IN coliform_NN organisms_NNS in_IN any_DT particular_JJ dilution_NN ._.
The_DT total_JJ number_NN of_IN coliform_NN colonies_NNS on_IN the_DT plates_NNS was_VBD also_RB counted_VBN ._.
Completed_VBN test_NN for_IN confirmation_NN ,_, of_IN the_DT presumptive_JJ evidence_NN ._.
All_PDT the_DT positive_JJ fermentation_NN tubes_NNS as_RB well_RB as_IN selective_JJ agar_NN plates_NNS in_IN each_DT of_IN the_DT dilutions_NNS were_VBD subjected_VBN to_TO the_DT confirmatory_JJ test_NN accord-_NN ing_NN to_TO the_DT procedure_NN recommended_VBN by_IN the_DT American_NNP Public_NNP Health_NNP Association_NNP [_NNP 1941_CD ]_NNP ._.
In_IN the_DT case_NN of_IN positive_JJ plates_NNS showing_VBG more_JJR than_IN five_CD colonies_NNS any_DT two_CD of_IN the_DT typical_JJ colonies_NNS were_VBD picked_VBN up_RP for_IN confirmation_NN ._.
The_DT results_NNS of_IN the_DT above_JJ tests_NNS parried_VBD out_RP on_IN 53_CD samples_NNS of_IN milk_NN (_( induing_VBG farm-produced_JJ milk_NN ,_, village_NN milk_NN ,_, bulk_NN samples_NNS handled_VBN in_IN dairies_NNS and_CC pasteurised_JJ milk_NN )_) are_VBP given_VBN in_IN Tables_NNP I_PRP and_CC II_NNP ._.
RESULTS_VB A_DT comparison_NN of_IN the_DT combined_JJ results_NNS of_IN the_DT presumptive_JJ coliform_NN test_NN in_IN different_JJ media_NNS for_IN all_PDT the_DT samples_NNS grouped_VBD according_VBG to_TO the_DT dilutions_NNS at_IN which_WDT positive_JJ reactions_NNS were_VBD indicated_VBN is_VBZ given_VBN in_IN Table_NNP I_PRP ._.
In_IN order_NN to_TO bring_VB out_RP clearly_RB the_DT comparative_JJ efficiency_NN of_IN each_DT medium_NN in_IN giving_VBG a_DT clear_JJ reaction_NN in_IN 24_CD hours_NNS ,_, in_IN the_DT same_JJ material_NN ,_, the_DT number_NN of_IN samples_NNS positive_JJ or_CC negative_JJ in_IN MacConkey_NNP 's_POS broth_NN at_IN different_JJ dilutions_NNS have_VBP been_VBN separately_RB indicated_VBN in_IN two_CD series_NN ._.
Taking_VBG them_PRP as_IN standard_NN ,_, the_DT number_NN of_IN corresponding_VBG samples_NNS in_IN each_DT group_NN showing_VBG an_DT identical_JJ reaction_NN in_IN the_DT other_JJ media_NNS is_VBZ indicated_VBN ._.
Since_IN all_PDT the_DT presumptive_JJ positive_JJ tubes_NNS as_RB well_RB as_IN plates_NNS were_VBD positive_JJ to_TO the_DT confirmatory_JJ test_NN ,_, no_DT separate_JJ column_NN is_VBZ provided_VBN in_IN Table_NNP I_PRP for_IN illustrating_VBG this_DT point_NN ._.
It_PRP will_MD be_VB seen_VBN (_( Table_JJ I_PRP )_) that_WDT practically_RB all_PDT the_DT samples_NNS ,_, whether_IN showing_VBG a_DT positive_JJ or_CC negative_JJ presumptive_JJ test_NN in_IN MacConkey_NNP 's_POS broth_NN ,_, have_VB given_VBN similar_JJ reactions_NNS in_IN the_DT other_JJ two_CD liquid_JJ media_NNS ._.
The_DT few_JJ discrepancies_NNS observed_VBD may_MD be_VB due_JJ to_TO sampling_VBG errors_NNS ._.
There_EX were_VBD no_DT false_JJ positives_VBZ en-_JJ countered_VBN as_IN the_DT results_NNS of_IN the_DT presumptive_JJ test_NN in_IN all_PDT the_DT media_NNS were_VBD confirmed_VBN without_IN exception_NN :_: This_DT is_VBZ in_IN accordance_NN with_IN the_DT observation_NN of_IN Wilson_NNP et_FW al_NN [_NNP loc_NN ._.

5_CD ,_, 333_CD THE_NNP VARIATIONS_NNP OF_NNP ACIDITY_NNP ,_, ALCOHOL_NNP TEST_NNP AND_NNP PHOSPHATE_NNP NUMBER_NNP IN_NNP SAMPLES_NNP OF_NNP FRESH_NNP BUFFALO_NNP MILK_NNP By_IN PANWAR_NNP GAJ-RAT_NNP SINGH_NNP ,_, T._NNP M._NNP PAUL_NNP and_CC C._NNP P._NNP ANANTAKRISHNAN_NNP ,_, Indian_NNP Dairy_NNP Research_NNP Institute_NNP ,_, Bangalore_NNP (_( Received_VBN for_IN publication_NN on_IN 17_CD December_NNP 1946_CD )_) GENERALLY_NNP milk_NN can_MD withstand_VB high_JJ temperature_NN without_IN undergoing_VBG any_DT unwelcome_JJ change_NN and_CC this_DT is_VBZ a_DT very_RB important_JJ factor_NN both_DT from_IN the_DT manufacturers_NNS '_POS as_RB well_RB as_IN the_DT consumers_NNS '_POS points_NNS of_IN view_NN ._.
But_CC ,_, it_PRP is_VBZ not_RB very_RB uncommon_JJ that_IN sometimes_RB certain_JJ samples_NNS of_IN milk_NN do_VBP not_RB stand_VB even_RB the_DT ordinary_JJ boiling_NN ._.
To_TO determine_VB the_DT hygienic_JJ .quality_NN as_RB well_RB as_IN to_TO assess_VB the_DT suitability_NN or_CC other-_JJ wise_NN of_IN the_DT different_JJ lots_NNS of_IN milk_NN arriving_VBG on_IN a_DT factory_NN platform_NN for_IN various_JJ methods_NNS of_IN processing_VBG different_JJ platform_NN tests_NNS have_VBP been_VBN suggested_VBN from_IN time_NN to_TO time_NN ._.
The_DT boiling_NN test_NN ,_, acidity_NN determina-_JJ tion_NN ,_, alcohol_NN test_NN and_CC phosphate_NN test_NN are_VBP the_DT chief_NN among_IN them_PRP ._.
The_DT boiling_VBG test_NN when_WRB positive_JJ ,_, indicates_VBZ that_IN the_DT milk_NN has_VBZ developed_VBN rather_RB high_JJ acidity_NN ,_, which_WDT removes_VBZ calcium_NN from_IN combination_NN with_IN the_DT protein_NN ,_, and_CC therefore_RB allows_VBZ casein_NN to_TO settle_VB ._.
Boiling_VBG only_RB accelerates_VBZ the_DT last_JJ phase_NN of_IN this_DT reaction_NN ._.
Acidity_NNP determination_NN ,_, as_IN it_PRP is_VBZ usually_RB done_VBN ,_, by_IN titration_NN against_IN decinormal_JJ sodium_NN hydroxide_NN ,_, does_VBZ not_RB give_VB a_DT correct_JJ picture_NN of_IN the_DT true_JJ acidity_NN of_IN a_DT complex_JJ fluid_NN like_IN milk_NN according_VBG to_TO Rogers_NNP et_FW al_NN ._.
[_NN 1921_CD ]_NN ._.
Even_RB the_DT true_JJ acidity_NN of_IN milk_NN as_IN determined_VBN by_IN pH_JJ value_NN is_VBZ not_RB a_DT criterion_NN in_IN ascertaining_VBG the_DT heat_NN stability_NN of_IN milk_NN according_VBG to_TO the_DT same_JJ authors_NNS ._.
Again_RB ,_, acidity_NN of_IN milk_NN from_IN individual_JJ animals_NNS ,_, is_VBZ subject_JJ to_TO considerable_JJ variation_NN and_CC the_DT value_NN of_IN acidity_NN determination_NN be-_NN comes_VBZ very_RB questionable_JJ ._.
Thus_RB the_DT usefulness_NN of_IN the_DT acidity_NN test_NN is_VBZ limited_VBN to_TO the_DT detection_NN of_IN milk_NN that_WDT has_VBZ developed_VBN considerable_JJ amount_NN of_IN acidity_NN as_IN a_DT result_NN of_IN bacteriological_JJ action_NN caused_VBN by_IN unhygienic_JJ ways_NNS of_IN production_NN ._.
The_DT alcohol_NN test_NN has_VBZ been_VBN commonly_RB used_VBN for_IN weeding_VBG out_RP milk_NN produced_VBN under_IN unhygienic_JJ conditions_NNS ,_, as_RB well_RB as_IN those_DT that_WDT are_VBP unstable_JJ to_TO heat_VB ._.
According_VBG to_TO Sommer_NNP and_CC Binny_NNP [_NNP 1923_CD ]_NN this_DT test_NN is_VBZ subject_JJ to_TO the_DT influence_NN of_IN various_JJ factors_NNS ,_, so_RB much_RB so_RB ,_, that_IN its_PRP$ usefulness_NN is_VBZ very_RB restricted_JJ ._.
The_DT findings_NNS of_IN Dahlberg_NNP and_CC Garner_NNP [_NNP 1921_CD ]_NNP do_VBP not_RB guarantee_VB that_IN this_DT could_MD always_RB be_VB used_VBN as_IN a_DT criterion_NN of_IN the_DT heat_NN stability_NN of_IN milk_NN ._.
The_DT effects_NNS of_IN acidity_NN and_CC the_DT concentration_NN of_IN salts_NNS are_VBP additive_JJ so_RB far_RB as_IN the_DT alcohol_NN test_NN is_VBZ concerned_VBN ,_, but_CC Rogers_NNP and_CC Deyshire_NNP [_NNP 1921_CD ]_NNP and_CC Sommer_NNP and_CC Hart_NNP [_NNP 1926_CD ]_NNP suggest_VBP that_IN the_DT concentration_NN of_IN the_DT mineral_NN salts_NNS forms_VBZ only_RB a_DT minor_JJ factor_NN in_IN determining_VBG the_DT heat_NN stability_NN of_IN a_DT milk_NN ._.
In_IN fact_NN no_DT test_NN which_WDT could_MD predict_VB the_DT heat_NN stability_NN of_IN condensed_JJ milk_NN with_IN a_DT reasonable_JJ amount_NN of_IN certainty_NN was_VBD known_VBN till_RB Ramsdell_NNP et_CC al_NN ._.
[_NN 1931_CD ]_NN developed_VBD the_DT phosphate_JJ test_NN ._.
The_DT above_JJ authors_NNS have_VBP reported_VBN a_DT phosphate_NN number_NN ranging_VBG from_IN 12_CD to_TO 37_CD for_IN single_JJ herd_NN milk_NN samples_NNS from_IN Freisian_JJ and_CC Channel_NNP Island_NNP breeds_NNS and_CC composite_JJ milk_NN samples_NNS ._.
According_VBG to_TO their_PRP$ findings_NNS ,_, milk_NN samples_NNS with_IN a_DT phosphate_NN number_NN below_IN 20_CD coagulated_VBD within_IN four_CD minutes_NNS during_IN sterilization_NN ,_, while_IN samples_NNS with_IN a_DT phosphate_JJ number_NN above_IN 20_CD had_VBD greater_JJR heat_NN stability_NN ,_, but_CC at_IN the_DT same_JJ time_NN ,_, they_PRP warn_VBP that_IN a_DT high_JJ pho_NN phate_NN number_NN does_VBZ not_RB always_RB indicate_VB a_DT highly_RB heat_NN resistant_JJ milk_NN sample_NN ._.
Although_IN there_EX is_VBZ no_DT local_JJ or_CC even_RB seasonal_JJ surplus_NN of_IN milk_NN in_IN India_NNP for_IN the_DT manufacture_NN of_IN con-_NN densed_VBN milk_NN ,_, during_IN the_DT last_JJ war_NN various_JJ isolated_VBN attempts_NNS were_VBD made_VBN in_IN certain_JJ places_NNS to_TO manufac-_JJ ture_NN condensed_VBN milk_NN out_IN of_IN buffalo_NN milk_NN ._.
Anantakrishnan_NNP and_CC Kothavalla_NNP (_( unpublished_JJ work_NN )_) have_VBP reported_VBN that_IN the_DT alcohol_NN test_NN is_VBZ more_RBR reliable_JJ than_IN the_DT phosphate_JJ test_NN in_IN predicting_VBG the_DT suitability_NN of_IN buffalo_NN milk_NN for_IN condensing_VBG and_CC sterilization_NN ,_, but_CC this_DT is_VBZ just_RB the_DT contrary_NN of_IN the_DT findings_NNS of_IN Rams_NNP dell_VBP et_RB al_RB ._.
[_NN 1931_CD ]_NN ._.
Probably_RB this_DT difference_NN might_MD be_VB due_JJ to_TO certain_JJ peculiarities_NNS in_IN the_DT phosphate_JJ number_NN of_IN buffalo_JJ milk_NN as_IN distinct_JJ from_IN cow_NN 's_POS milk_NN which_WDT alone_RB was_VBD investigated_VBN by_IN the_DT foreign_JJ authors_NNS ._.
Therefore_RB a_DT study_NN of_IN the_DT seasonal_JJ and_CC lactational_JJ variations_NNS in_IN the_DT phosphate_NN number_NN with_IN special_JJ reference_NN to_TO its_PRP$ relation_NN to_TO other_JJ platform_NN tests_NNS like_IN acidity_NN and_CC alcohol_NN tests_NNS was_VBD undertaken_JJ and_CC the_DT results_NNS of_IN the_DT investigation_NN are_VBP presented_VBN in_IN the_DT following_JJ pages_NNS ._.
EXPERIMENTAL_NNP Six_NNP Murrah_NNP buffaloes_NNS ,_, all_DT in_IN the_DT first_JJ month_NN of_IN lactation_NN ,_, were_VBD selected_VBN from_IN the_DT herd_NN of_IN the_DT Indian_JJ Dairy_NNP Research_NNP Institute_NNP ._.
Milk_NN samples_NNS were_VBD collected_VBN in_IN the_DT morning_NN and_CC tested_VBN for_IN acidity_NN ,_, alcohol_NN 237_CD G_NNP 238_CD The_DT Acidity_NNP ,_, Alcohol_NNP Test_NNP and_CC Phosphate_NNP in_IN Buffalo_NNP milk_NN [_NNP XVII_NNP test_NN and_CC phosphate_VB test_NN at_IN 9_CD a.m._RB Acidity_NNP was_VBD determined_VBN by_IN the_DT usual_JJ titration_NN against_IN standard_JJ solution_NN of_IN sodium_NN hydroxide_NN with_IN phenolpthalein_NN as_IN indicator_NN ._.
The_DT alcohol_NN test_NN was_VBD carried_VBN out_RP as_IN usual_JJ by_IN mixing_VBG equal_JJ amounts_NNS of_IN alcohol_NN and_CC milk_NN (_( 2_CD ml_NN ._. )_)
but_CC the_DT strength_NN of_IN the_DT alcohol_NN was_VBD varied_VBN from_IN 60_CD to_TO 80_CD per_IN cent_NN by_IN volume_NN till_NN a_DT positive_JJ test_NN was_VBD obtained_VBN ._.
The_DT method_NN of_IN Ramsdell_NNP et_FW al_NN ._.
[_NN 1931_CD ]_NN was_VBD adopted_VBN for_IN the_DT phosphate_NN number_NN ,_, viz._NN ,_, by_IN adding_VBG different_JJ amounts_NNS of_IN 0.5_CD M._NNP solution_NN ._.
(_( 68.1_CD gm_NN ._.
per_IN litre_NN )_) of_IN potassium_NN dihydrogen_NN phosphate_NN to_TO 2_CD c.c_NN ._.
lots_NNS of_IN milk_NN till_NN coagulation_NN occurred_VBD within_IN 0.02_CD ml_NNS ._.
of_IN the_DT reagent_NN on_IN heating_VBG the_DT mixture_NN in_IN a_DT boiling_JJ water_NN bath_NN for_IN five_CD minutes_NNS ._.
Any_DT coagulation_NN was_VBD taken_VBN as_IN positive_JJ and_CC the_DT phosphate_NN number_NN was_VBD calculated_VBN by_IN multiplying_VBG the_DT amount_NN of_IN the_DT reagent_NN expressed_VBN in_IN fractional_JJ millilitres_NNS by_IN 100_CD ._.
The_DT tests_NNS were_VBD carried_VBN out_RP for_IN about_IN one_CD complete_JJ lactation_NN to_TO study_VB the_DT seasonal_JJ and_CC lactational_JJ variations_NNS in_IN the_DT various_JJ tests_NNS if_IN there_EX were_VBD any_DT ._.
Also_RB two_CD composite_JJ samples_NNS ,_, one_CD cow_NN and_CC one_CD buffalo_NN ,_, were_VBD tested_VBN daily_RB for_IN acidity_NN ,_, alcohol_NN and_CC phosphate_NN tests_NNS ._.
Altogether_RB about_IN 1,500_CD tests_NNS were_VBD made_VBN ,_, each_DT for_IN phosphate_NN number_NN ,_, acidity_NN and_CC alcohol_NN tests_NNS ._.
In_IN the_DT case_NN of_IN the_DT phosphate_NN number_NN ,_, it_PRP was_VBD a_DT very_RB tedious_JJ process_NN to_TO arrive_VB at_IN the_DT actual_JJ amount_NN of_IN phosphate_JJ solution_NN required_VBN to_TO produce_VB coagulation_NN as_IN the_DT phosphate-_JJ number_NN varied_VBD between_IN 8_CD and_CC 80_CD ._.
Almost_RB a_DT similar_JJ difficulty_NN was_VBD experienced_VBN in_IN the_DT case_NN of_IN the_DT alcohol_NN test_NN ,_, where_WRB also_RB there_EX was_VBD considerable_JJ variation_NN from_IN sample_NN to_TO sample_VB ._.
The_DT weekly_JJ average_NN of_IN the_DT phosphate_NN number_NN for_IN the_DT individual_JJ buffalo_NN milk_NN samples_NNS as_RB well_RB as_IN the_DT two_CD composite_JJ milk_NN samples_NNS are_VBP presented_VBN in_IN Table_NNP I_PRP ._.
The_DT relationship_NN between_IN acidity_NN and_CC phosphate_NN number_NN ,_, acidity_NN and_CC alcohol_NN test_NN and_CC alcohol_NN test_NN and_CC pho_NN phate_NN number_NN are_VBP indicated_VBN in_IN Tables_NNP II_NNP ,_, III_NNP and_CC IV_NNP respectively_RB ._.

29_CD 29_CD 55_CD 24_CD 60_CD 31_CD 38_CD 36_CD 31_CD DISCUSSION_NNP Acidity_NNP There_EX are_VBP considerable_JJ variations_NNS observed_VBN in_IN the_DT acidity_NN of_IN fresh_JJ individual_JJ samples_NNS of_IN buffalo_NN milk_NN and_CC even_RB for_IN the_DT same_JJ individual_JJ sample_NN ;_: day_NN to_TO day_NN variations_NNS are_VBP so_RB considerable_JJ that_IN they_PRP can_MD not_RB be_VB attributed_VBN to_TO experimental_JJ error_NN ._.
The_DT average_JJ acidity_NN of_IN fresh_JJ buffalo_NN milk_NN in_IN the_DT first_JJ IV_NNP ]_NNP P._NNP GAJ_NNP RAJ_NNP SINGH_NNP ,_, et_VBD al_RB 239_CD month_NN of_IN lactation_NN is_VBZ found_VBN to_TO be_VB 0.12_CD per_IN cent_NN expressed_VBN as_IN lactic_JJ acid_NN but_CC there_EX is_VBZ a_DT slight_JJ gradual_JJ increase_NN in_IN titratable_JJ acidity_NN as_IN the_DT lactation_NN advances_VBZ ;_: this_DT is_VBZ more_RBR pronounced_JJ in_IN certain_JJ cases_NNS while_IN it_PRP is_VBZ not_RB so_RB evident_JJ in_IN other_JJ cases_NNS ._.

34_CD 104_CD 159_CD 157_CD 184_CD 151_CD 128_CD 63_CD 64_CD 41_CD 1,085_CD A_DT glance_NN at_IN Table_NNP II_NNP will_MD clearly_RB show_VB the_DT wide_JJ variations_NNS in_IN the_DT distribution_NN of_IN the_DT phosphate_NN numbers_NNS ._.
Although_IN no_DT consistent_JJ relationship_NN between_IN titratable_JJ acidity_NN and_CC phosphate_NN number_NN has_VBZ been_VBN reported_VBN by_IN the_DT foreign_JJ workers_NNS ,_, it_PRP is_VBZ quite_RB clear_JJ that_IN the_DT phosphate_NN number_NN comes_VBZ down_RB as_IN the_DT acidity_NN increases_NNS ._.
At_IN an_DT acidity_NN of_IN 0.10_CD per_IN cent_NN lactic_JJ acid_NN in_IN milk_NN ,_, only_RB below_IN one_CD per_IN cent_NN of_IN the_DT readings_NNS for_IN phosphate_NN number_NN fall_NN below_IN 20_CD ._.
As_IN the_DT acidity_NN increases_VBZ the_DT percentage_NN of_IN phos-_JJ phate_NN numbers_NNS below_IN 20_CD increases_NNS rather_RB rapidly_RB so_IN that_DT at_IN an_DT acidity_NN of_IN 0.13_CD per_IN cent_NN ,_, 27_CD per_IN cent_NN of_IN the_DT readings_NNS fall_VBP below_IN 20_CD ,_, and_CC 56_CD per_IN cent_NN at_IN an_DT acidity_NN of_IN 0.19_CD per_IN cent_NN ._.
Therefore_RB ,_, it_PRP is_VBZ quite_RB clear_JJ that_IN there_EX is_VBZ some_DT relationship_NN between_IN acidity_NN and_CC phosphate_NN number_NN ,_, and_CC this_DT too_RB is_VBZ found_VBN to_TO be_VB statistically_RB significant_JJ ._.

GAJ_NNP RAJ_NNP SINGH_NNP ,_, et_VBD al_RB 241_CD number_NN below_IN 20_CD is_VBZ as_RB low_JJ as_IN 5_CD ,_, and_CC beyond_IN 62_CD per_IN cent_NN alcohol_NN this_DT percentage_NN is_VBZ negligible_JJ ._.
In_IN the_DT alcohol_NN test_NN it_PRP is_VBZ a_DT common_JJ observation_NN that_WDT as_IN the_DT quality_NN of_IN milk_NN deteriorates_VBZ the_DT sample_NN gives_VBZ a_DT p_JJ itive_JJ alcohol_NN test_NN with_IN lower_JJR and_CC lower_JJR concentration_NN of_IN alcohol_NN ._.
Similarly_RB Ramsdell_NNP et_CC al_NN ._.
[_NN 1931_CD ]_NN have_VBP reported_VBN that_IN samples_NNS with_IN phosphate_JJ number_NN below_IN 20_CD are_VBP less_RBR stable_JJ to_TO heat_VB ._.
In_IN view_NN of_IN the_DT findings_NNS of_IN the_DT present_JJ investigation_NN these_DT two_CD tests_NNS could_MD be_VB put_VBN together_RB to_TO assess_VB the_DT quality_NN of_IN the_DT milk_NN sample_NN under_IN investigation_NN ._.
Table_NN I_PRP shows_VBZ the_DT individual_NN and_CC other_JJ variations_NNS in_IN the_DT phosphate_NN number_NN so_RB far_RB as_IN buffalo_JJ milk_NN is_VBZ concerned_VBN ._.
For_IN fresh_JJ individual_JJ samples_NNS of_IN milk_NN ,_, figures_NNS as_RB low_JJ as_IN 10_CD and_CC as_RB high_JJ as_IN 82_CD have_VBP been_VBN met_VBN with_IN ,_, but_CC such_JJ figures_NNS are_VBP very_RB few_JJ ,_, so_RB that_IN the_DT mean_NN is_VBZ always_RB far_RB from_IN both_DT of_IN these_DT ._.
In_IN most_JJS of_IN the_DT individual_JJ samples_NNS ,_, it_PRP is_VBZ found_VBN ,_, that_IN there_EX is_VBZ a_DT gradual_JJ increase_NN in_IN the_DT phosphate_NN number_NN as_IN the_DT lactation_NN advances_NNS ,_, although_IN this_DT increase_NN is_VBZ not_RB maintained_VBN towards_IN the_DT end_NN of_IN the_DT lactation_NN ._.
Almost_RB the_DT same_JJ tendency_NN is_VBZ observed_VBN in_IN the_DT case_NN of_IN the_DT composite_JJ cow_NN and_CC buffalo_NN samples_NNS ._.
There_EX is_VBZ considerable_JJ daily_JJ variation_NN in_IN the_DT phosphate_JJ number_NN of_IN the_DT individual_JJ milk_NN samples_NNS although_IN this_DT is_VBZ not_RB so_RB very_RB marked_VBN in_IN the_DT case_NN of_IN the_DT composite_JJ sample_NN ._.

This_DT shows_VBZ that_IN there_EX are_VBP at_IN least_JJS a_DT few_JJ samples_NNS which_WDT fall_VBP below_IN 20_CD ._.
Ramsdell_NNP et_CC al_NN ._.

From_IN Table_NNP I_PRP it_PRP is_VBZ seen_VBN that_IN buffalo_JJ composite_JJ milk_NN has_VBZ got_VBD a_DT higher_JJR phosphate_NN number_NN when_WRB compared_VBN to_TO cow_VB composite_JJ milk_NN ._.
Pro-_JJ bably_RB this_DT may_MD be_VB due_JJ to_TO the_DT difference_NN in_IN salt_JJ distribution_NN balance_NN ._.
SUMMARY_NNP 1_CD ._.
The_DT various_JJ commonly_RB used_VBD platform_NN tests_NNS like_IN the_DT acidity_NN ,_, alcohol_NN and_CC phosphate_NN tests_NNS have_VBP been_VBN studied_VBN from_IN the_DT beginning_NN of_IN one_CD lactation_NN for_IN nearly_RB six_CD months_NNS in_IN the_DT case_NN of_IN individual_JJ buffalo_NN milk_NN samples_NNS ._.
2_CD ._.
The_DT inter-relationship_NN between_IN the_DT various_JJ tests_NNS has_VBZ been_VBN investigated_VBN and_CC discussed_VBN ._.
3_CD ._.
There_EX is_VBZ considerable_JJ variation_NN in_IN the_DT acidity_NN of_IN the_DT samples_NNS from_IN individual_JJ to_TO individual_JJ and_CC from_IN day_NN to_TO day_NN ._.
4_CD ._.
The_DT alcohol_NN test_NN requires_VBZ modification_NN by_IN way_NN of_IN reducing_VBG the_DT concentration_NN of_IN the_DT alcohol_NN ,_, to_TO be_VB used_VBN for_IN buffalo_JJ milk_NN ._.
A_DT concentration_NN of_IN 60_CD per_IN cent_NN alcohol_NN by_IN volume_NN is_VBZ recommended_VBN for_IN buffalo_NN milk_NN ._.
5_CD ._.
There_EX is_VBZ found_VBN to_TO be_VB wide_JJ variation_NN in_IN the_DT phosphate_JJ number_NN of_IN individual_JJ buffalo_NN milk_NN samples_NNS ._.
6_CD ._.
An_DT increasing_VBG number_NN of_IN samples_NNS with_IN high_JJ titratable_JJ acidity_NN have_VBP a_DT phosphate_NN number_NN below_IN 20_CD ._.
7_CD ._.
A_DT good_JJ proportion_NN of_IN the_DT samples_NNS giving_VBG a_DT positive_JJ alcohol_NN test_NN with_IN 60_CD per_IN cent_NN alcohol_NN were_VBD found_VBN to_TO have_VB a_DT phosphate_JJ number_NN 20_CD or_CC below_IN ._.
