67_CD ,_, 47_CD H_NNP AN_NNP OUTBREAK_NNP OF_NNP GOAT-POX_NNP IN_NNP HISSAR_NNP DISTRICT_NNP (_( PUNJAB_NNP )_) By_IN H._NNP K._NNP LALL_NNP ,_, B_NNP ._.
Sc._NNP ,_, M._NNP R._NNP C._NNP V._NNP S._NNP ,_, GOPAL_NNP SINGH_NNP L.V.P_NNP ,_, and_CC JAGAT_NNP SINGH_NNP ,_, L.V.P._NNP ,_, Government_NNP Livestock_NNP Farm_NNP ,_, Hissar_NNP (_( Received_VBN for_IN publication_NN on_IN 21_CD May_NNP 1947_CD )_) OUTBREAKS_NNP of_IN goat-pox_NN have_VBP been_VBN reported_VBN from_IN time_NN to_TO time_NN from_IN various_JJ provinces_NNS and_CC States_NNS of_IN India_NNP ,_, but_CC as_RB compared_VBN to_TO sheep-pox_VB its_PRP$ occurrence_NN has_VBZ been_VBN less_RB conspicuous_JJ ._.
Three_CD cases_NNS of_IN goat-pox_NN were_VBD recorded_VBN in_IN 1929-30_CD at_IN the_DT Government_NNP Livestock_NNP Farm_NNP ,_, Hissar_NNP ,_, but_CC there_RB isno_JJ reliable_JJ evidence_NN of_IN its_PRP$ recurrence_NN until_IN 1944-45_JJ when_WRB the_DT disease_NN spread_NN to_TO farm_NN goats_NNS from_IN the_DT experimental_JJ goats_NNS ._.
The_DT present_JJ work_NN arose_VBD out_IN of_IN an_DT outbreak_NN of_IN this_DT disease_NN in_IN Hissar_NNP district_NN ._.
In_IN January_NNP ,_, 1945_CD ,_, the_DT disease_NN was_VBD reported_VBN from_IN Dabwali_NNP but_CC no_DT material_NN was_VBD available_JJ for_IN investigation_NN ._.
A_DT month_NN later_RB ,_, report_NN of_IN a_DT fresh_JJ outbreak_NN was_VBD received_VBN from_IN Ratia_NNP ,_, Sarsa_NNP and_CC Fatehabad_NNP villages_NNS to_TO the_DT east_NN of_IN Dabwali_NNP ._.
The_DT disease_NN has_VBZ been_VBN observed_VBN in_IN the_DT other_JJ parts_NNS of_IN Punjab_NNP in_IN winter_NN or_CC early_JJ spring_NN ;_: sheep-pox_NN has_VBZ a_DT similar_JJ seasonal_JJ trend_NN ._.
Such_JJ a_DT trend_NN has_VBZ not_RB been_VBN mentioned_VBN in_IN the_DT various_JJ Disease_NNP Investigation_NNP Officers_NNP '_POS reports_NNS ._.
Chadha_NNP [_NNP 1942-43_JJ ]_NN has_VBZ ,_, however_RB ,_, stated_VBN in_IN connection_NN with_IN an_DT outbreak_NN in_IN Bombay_NNP in_IN 1942-43_JJ that_IN the_DT disease_NN prevailed_VBD throughout_IN the_DT year_NN ._.
The_DT goats_NNS affected_VBD in_IN the_DT outbreak_NN in_IN Ratia_NNP were_VBD of_IN the_DT ordinary_JJ desi_NN type_NN ._.
The_DT various_JJ flock_NN owners_NNS reported_VBD the_DT mortality_NN as_IN 19_CD per_IN cent_NN in_IN goats_NNS and_CC 11.4_CD per_IN cent_NN in_IN sheep_NN ,_, but_CC whether_IN all_PDT this_DT illness_NN was_VBD due_JJ to_TO goat-pox_NNS can_MD not_RB be_VB definitely_RB said_VBD ._.
Most_JJS of_IN the_DT animals_NNS examined_VBN by_IN us_PRP were_VBD recovering_VBG and_CC showed_VBD pox_JJ nodules_NNS in_IN the_DT form_NN of_IN haemorrhagic_JJ scabs_NN over_IN the_DT back_NN and_CC flanks_NNS ._.
Two_CD examined_VBD post-mortem_NN showed_VBD no_DT internal_JJ lesions_NNS except_IN for_IN a_DT single_JJ lung_NN nodule_NN in_IN one_CD of_IN them_PRP ._.
One_CD female_NN kid_NN had_VBD pox_VBN lesions_NNS all_DT over_IN the_DT body_NN including_VBG the_DT udder_NN ,_, the_DT size_NN of_IN discrete_JJ nodules_NNS varying_VBG from_IN that_DT of_IN a_DT 4_CD anna_NN to_TO Sanna_NNP bit_NN ._.
To_TO study_VB the_DT disease_NN in_IN detail_NN ,_, a_DT kid_NN having_VBG pox_JJ nodules_NNS was_VBD brought_VBN to_TO Hissar_NNP ._.
EXPERIMENTS_NNS AT_NNP HISSAR_NNP Transmission_NNP work_NN Preliminary_NNP experiments_NNS were_VBD carried_VBN out_RP in_IN one_CD of_IN the_DT farm_NN blocks_NNS ,_, about_RB 1½_CD miles_NNS from_IN the_DT main_JJ dairy_NN flock_NN ._.
The_DT disease_NN was_VBD transmitted_VBN to_TO two_CD six-month_JJ old_JJ kids_NNS (_( Nos_NNP ._.
1_CD and_CC 2_CD )_) ,_, using_VBG a_DT suspension_NN of_IN scab_JJ material_NN from_IN the_DT diseased_JJ kid_NN ._.
This_DT suspension_NN was_VBD scarified_VBN on_IN the_DT abdomen_NNS and_CC a_DT drop_NN of_IN it_PRP was_VBD also_RB injected_VBN intracutaneously_RB ._.
Two_CD other_JJ kids_NNS ,_, three_CD months_NNS old_JJ (_( Nos_NNP ._.
3_CD and_CC 4_CD )_) ,_, one_CD of_IN which_WDT was_VBD of_IN hill_NN breed_NN ,_, were_VBD then_RB infected_VBN from_IN material_NN taken_VBN from_IN kids_NNS 1_CD and_CC 2_CD ._.
To_TO main-_NN tain_NN the_DT virus_NN for_IN further_JJ study_NN ,_, yet_RB another_DT kid_NN was_VBD infected_VBN with_IN virus_NN from_IN Nos_NNP ._.
3_CD and_CC 4_CD ,_, but_CC it_PRP failed_VBD to_TO react_VB and_CC we_PRP presumed_VBD that_IN the_DT virus_NN was_VBD lost_VBN ._.
On_IN previous_JJ occasions_NNS also_RB some_DT difficulty_NN has_VBZ been_VBN experienced_VBN in_IN establishing_VBG the_DT disease_NN under_IN experimental_JJ conditions_NNS ._.
A_DT similar_JJ experi-_JJ ence_NN has_VBZ been_VBN expressed_VBN by_IN Henderson_NNP [_NNP 1938_CD ]_NNP ._.
None_NN of_IN the_DT inoculated_JJ kids_NNS developed_VBD the_DT disease_NN in_IN generalized_JJ form_NN ._.
Iyer_NNP [_NN 1939_CD ]_NN has_VBZ reported_VBN successful_JJ experimental_JJ reproduction_NN of_IN goat_NN pox_NN in_IN a_DT generalized_JJ form_NN by_IN inoculating_VBG sub-cutaneous-_JJ ly_NN blood_NN taken_VBN at_IN the_DT height_NN of_IN fever_NN or_CC by_IN means_NNS of_IN spleen_JJ suspension_NN ._.
However_RB ,_, these_DT methods_NNS were_VBD not_RB tried_VBN by_IN us_PRP ._.
Following_VBG the_DT cutaneous_JJ inoculations_NNS in_IN our_PRP$ experimental_JJ kids_NNS ,_, only_RB a_DT local_JJ reaction_NN was_VBD observed_VBN ._.
Four_CD or_CC five_CD days_NNS after_IN the_DT inoculation_NN ,_, there_EX was_VBD a_DT slight_JJ reddening_NN of_IN the_DT scarified_JJ area_NN ,_, corresponding_VBG with_IN a_DT rise_NN of_IN body_NN temperature_NN ._.
After_IN eleven_JJ days_NNS ,_, Kid_NNP No_NNP ._.
1_CD showed_VBD sharply_RB defined_JJ vesicles_NNS ._.
The_DT vesicles_NNS were_VBD flattened_VBN and_CC firm_NN to_TO the_DT touch_NN ,_, and_CC had_VBD little_JJ fluid_NN in_IN them_PRP ._.
In_IN kid_NN No_NNP ._.
2_CD there_EX was_VBD a_DT rather_RB firm_JJ prominent_NN swelling_VBG over_IN the_DT scarified_JJ area_NN ,_, up_RB to_TO the_DT size_NN of_IN the_DT palm_NN of_IN the_DT hand_NN ._.
Within_IN the_DT next_JJ few_JJ days_NNS the_DT lesions_NNS in_IN these_DT two_CD animals_NNS became_VBD very_RB hard_JJ and_CC nodular_JJ and_CC were_VBD covered_VBN with_IN haemorrahagic_JJ scabs_NNS ._.
The_DT vesicular_JJ stage_NN was_VBD very_RB transient_JJ ._.
The_DT temperature_NN rose_VBD by_IN nearly_RB 2°244_CD An_DT Outbreak_NN of_IN Goat-Pox_NNP in_IN Hissar_NNP District_NNP [_NNP XVII_NNP Spread_NNP of_IN the_DT disease_NN Some_DT adult_NN goats_NNS ,_, which_WDT were_VBD being_VBG kept_VBN for_IN another_DT experiment_NN in_IN the_DT same_JJ enclosure_NN as_IN the_DT pox-infected_JJ kids_NNS ,_, were_VBD transferred_VBN to_TO the_DT main_JJ goat_NN dairy_NN one_CD month_NN after_IN the_DT last_JJ transmission_NN experiment_NN ._.
These_DT goats_NNS did_VBD not_RB catch_VB the_DT infection_NN during_IN five_CD to_TO six_CD weeks_NNS they_PRP were_VBD in_IN contact_NN with_IN the_DT artificially_RB infected_JJ kids_NNS ,_, and_CC it_PRP was_VBD therefore_RB presumed_JJ they_PRP were_VBD healthy_JJ ._.
However_RB ,_, six_CD weeks_NNS after_IN the_DT adult_NN goats_NNS were_VBD transferred_VBN ,_, cases_NNS of_IN goat-pox_NN were_VBD detected_VBN among_IN them_PRP and_CC also_RB among_IN the_DT dairy_NN goats_NNS ._.
After_IN the_DT disease_NN had_VBD subsided_VBN in_IN the_DT female_JJ stock_NN ,_, it_PRP spread_VBD to_TO the_DT males_NNS which_WDT were_VBD being_VBG kept_VBN away_RB from_IN the_DT dairy_NN goats_NNS ,_, to_TO avoid_VB infection_NN ._.
These_DT observations_NNS seem_VBP to_TO suggest_VB that_IN the_DT incubation_NN period_NN in_IN goat-pox_NN may_MD be_VB fairly_RB long_RB ._.
According_VBG to_TO Melanidi_NNP and_CC Tzort-_NNP zaki_NNP [_NNP 1936_CD ]_NNP ,_, the_DT incubation_NN period_NN in_IN goat-pox_JJ is_VBZ two_CD to_TO three_CD days_NNS ,_, followed_VBN by_IN a_DT stage_NN of_IN skin_JJ eruption_NN lasting_VBG for_IN two_CD to_TO three_CD weeks_NNS ._.
Mortality_NNP and_CC lesions_NNS From_IN the_DT reports_NNS of_IN Disease_NNP Investigation_NNP Officers_NNP [_NNP 1936-1945_JJ ]_NN ,_, it_PRP is_VBZ found_VBN that_IN in_IN Bombay_NNP ,_, in_IN 1938-39_JJ ,_, there_EX was_VBD 9_CD per_IN cent_NN mortality_NN in_IN one_CD outbreak_NN and_CC 73_CD per_IN cent_NN in_IN another_DT ;_: two_CD outbreaks_NNS recorded_VBN in_IN the_DT United_NNP Provinces_NNPS in_IN 1938-39_JJ and_CC 1942-43_JJ showed_VBD a_DT mortality-rate_JJ varying_NN from_IN 15_CD to_TO 20_CD per_IN cent_NN ._.
Vishwanathan_NNP [_VBZ 1938-39_JJ ]_NNP reported_VBD a_DT 30_CD per_IN cent_NN mortality-rate_NN in_IN an_DT outbreak_NN diagnosed_VBN in_IN 1938-39_JJ ._.
Kuppaswamy_NNP [_NN 1936_CD ]_NN reports_VBZ a_DT mortality_NN rate_NN of_IN 54_CD per_IN cent_NN attributing_VBG the_DT high_JJ percentage_NN to_TO unfavourable_JJ climatic_JJ conditions_NNS ._.
lack_NN of_IN hygiene_NN and_CC unsuitable_JJ food_NN ._.
According_VBG to_TO Donation_NNP and_CC Lestoquard_NNP [_NNP 1936_CD ]_NNP discrepancies_NNS in_IN the_DT results_NNS of_IN different_JJ workers_NNS on_IN sheep-pox_NN are_VBP due_JJ to_TO differences_NNS in_IN the_DT susceptibility_NN of_IN individual_JJ sheep_NN and_CC state_NN of_IN the_DT virus_NN ,_, which_WDT has_VBZ three_CD distinct_JJ phases_NNS of_IN virulence_NN from_IN extreme_JJ to_TO low_JJ ._.
This_DT is_VBZ probably_RB true_JJ in_IN the_DT case_NN of_IN goat-pox_NN as_IN well_RB ._.
Altogether_RB ,_, in_IN the_DT original_JJ outbreak_NN ,_, 11_CD out_IN of_IN 179_CD female_JJ goats_NNS (_( 39.7_CD per_IN cent_NN )_) ,_, 3_CD out_IN of_IN 13_CD male_NN goats_NNS ,_, 25_CD out_IN of_IN 100_CD kids_NNS (_( 25_CD per_IN cent_NN )_) ,_, and_CC 15_CD out_IN of_IN 30_CD (_( 50_CD per_IN cent_NN )_) castrated_VBD kids_NNS ,_, males_NNS ,_, suffered_VBD from_IN the_DT disease_NN ._.
The_DT incidence_NN was_VBD less_RBR in_IN females_NNS and_CC kids_NNS than_IN in_IN males_NNS and_CC adults_NNS ._.
The_DT outbreak_NN lasted_VBN for_IN about_RB two_CD months_NNS ._.
There_EX were_VBD only_RB two_CD deaths_NNS ,_, viz_NN ._.
goat_NN No_DT ._.
59_CD ,_, which_WDT developed_VBD gangreaous_JJ pneumonia_NN as_IN a_DT complication_NN ,_, and_CC an_DT Angora_NNP buck_NN which_WDT showed_VBD pox_JJ lesions_NNS in_IN the_DT lung_NN ._.
Mortality_NN was_VBD ,_, therefore_RB ,_, low_JJ in_IN this_DT outbreak_NN as_IN compared_VBN with_IN that_DT reported_VBN by_IN the_DT Disease_NNP Investigation_NNP Officers_NNP [_NNP 1936-45_JJ ]_NN possibly_RB due_JJ to_TO low_JJ virulence_NN of_IN the_DT virus_NN ._.
In_IN most_JJS cases_NNS pox_VBP nodules_NNS were_VBD generalized_VBN over_IN the_DT body_NN ,_, the_DT teats_NNS and_CC scrotum_NN being_VBG parti-_JJ cularly_RB affected_VBN ._.
There_EX was_VBD rise_NN of_IN temperature_NN lasting_VBG for_IN 10_CD days_NNS or_CC more_JJR ,_, and_CC considerable_JJ decline_NN in_IN the_DT milk_NN yield_NN during_IN the_DT active_JJ phase_NN of_IN the_DT outbreak_NN ._.
A_DT typical_JJ acute_NN case_NN was_VBD that_IN of_IN goat_NN No_NNP ._.
929_CD ._.
Vesicles_NNS were_VBD present_JJ all_DT over_IN the_DT body_NN ,_, nostils_NNS ,_, lips_NNS ,_, udder_NN and_CC teats_NNS ._.

This_DT goat_NN ,_, however_RB ._.
recovered_VBN after_IN a_DT laborious_JJ treat-_JJ ment_NN ._.
In_IN some_DT cases_NNS there_EX was_VBD suspension_NN of_IN rumination_NN ,_, and_CC rapid_JJ respiration_NN ._.
A_DT tendency_NN to_TO sit_VB in_IN the_DT sun_NN was_VBD observed_VBN in_IN many_JJ cases_NNS ._.
On_IN the_DT seventh_JJ day_NN vesicles_NNS became_VBD black_JJ and_CC by_IN the_DT ninth_JJ day_NN scabs_VB had_VBD formed_VBN ._.
SUSCEPTIBILITY_NNP OF_NNP OTHER_NNP ANIMALS_NNP According_VBG to_TO the_DT flock_NN owners_NNS ,_, sheep_NN also_RB died_VBD during_IN the_DT outbreak_NN ,_, but_CC no_DT affected_JJ sheep_NN were_VBD seen_VBN at_IN the_DT time_NN of_IN the_DT visit_NN ._.
From_IN the_DT reports_NNS of_IN the_DT various_JJ Disease_NNP Investigation_NNP Officers_NNP [_NNP 1936-45_JJ ]_NN it_PRP seems_VBZ that_IN in_IN outbreaks_NNS of_IN goat-pox_JJ only_RB goats_NNS were_VBD affected_JJ ,_, though_IN it_PRP is_VBZ not_RB clearly_RB stated_VBN in_IN all_DT cases_NNS that_IN these_DT were_VBD the_DT only_JJ animals_NNS affected_VBD ._.
According_VBG to_TO Melanidi_NNP et_FW al_NN ._.
[_NN 1936_CD ]_NN ,_, cattle_NNS ,_, horses_NNS ,_, rabbits_NNS and_CC poultry_NN are_VBP also_RB susceptible_JJ to_TO the_DT virus_NN of_IN goat-pox_NN while_IN man_NN is_VBZ insusceptible_JJ ,_, but_CC it_PRP is_VBZ only_RB in_IN goats_NNS that_IN the_DT disease_NN takes_VBZ an_DT epizootic_JJ form_NN ._.
Slagsvold_NNP [_NN 1938_CD ]_NN ,_, on_IN the_DT other_JJ hand_NN ,_, states_VBZ that_IN disease_NN is_VBZ readily_RB transmissible_JJ among_IN goats_NNS and_CC sheep_NN ,_, and_CC attempts_NNS to_TO infect_VB cattle_NNS ,_, pigs_NNS ,_, horses_NNS ,_, rabbits_NNS ,_, guinea-pigs_NNS and_CC poultry_NN failed_VBD ._.
Bennett_NNP ,_, Horgan_NNP and_CC Haseeb_NNP [_NNP 1944_CD ]_NNP obtained_VBD a_DT typical_JJ pox_NN syndrome_NN in_IN sheep_NN ,_, cows_NNS ,_, and_CC rabbits_NNS with_IN goat-pox_JJ virus_NN ,_, though_IN they_PRP found_VBD no_DT immunological_JJ relationship_NN between_IN the_DT viruses_NNS of_IN vaccinia_NN ,_, sheep-pox_JJ and_CC goat-pox_JJ ._.
A_DT close_JJ relationship_NN ,_, however_RB ,_, was_VBD observed_VBN between_IN the_DT viruses_NNS of_IN goat-pox_NN and_CC contagious_JJ pustular_JJ dermatitis_NN of_IN goats_NNS ._.
Hutyra_NNP and_CC Marek_NNP [_NNP 1926_CD ]_NN have_VBP also_RB stated_VBN that_IN in_IN some_DT cases_NNS transmission_NN of_IN goat-pox_NN to_TO sheep_VB is_VBZ successful_JJ but_CC that_IN only_RB an_DT incomplete_JJ pox_NN exanthema_NN is_VBZ produced_VBN at_IN the_DT point_NN of_IN inoculation_NN ._.
IV_NNP ]_NNP H._NNP K.LALL_NNP ,_, GOPAL_NNP SINGH_NNP AND_NNP JAGAT_NNP SINGH_NNP 245_CD In_IN the_DT first_JJ instance_NN we_PRP tried_VBD without_IN success_NN to_TO infect_VB two_CD lambs_NNS ,_, a_DT buffalo_NN calf_NN and_CC a_DT cow_JJ calf_NN ._.

.248_NN developed_VBD a_DT local_JJ reaction_NN and_CC pox_JJ lesions_NNS on_IN the_DT sixth_JJ day_NN on_IN the_DT scarified_JJ area_NN only_RB ,_, while_IN the_DT other_JJ developed_JJ vesicles_NNS on_IN the_DT abdomen_NNS at_IN about_IN the_DT same_JJ time_NN ._.
These_DT experiments_NNS indicate_VBP that_IN it_PRP is_VBZ possible_JJ to_TO produce_VB a_DT localized_JJ lesion_NN in_IN sheep_JJ with_IN goat-pox_JJ virus_NN ,_, but_CC that_IN sheep_JJ do_VBP not_RB get_VB a_DT generalized_JJ form_NN of_IN the_DT disease_NN either_CC by_IN artificial_JJ infection_NN or_CC by_IN exposure_NN to_TO naturally_RB diseased_JJ animals_NNS ._.
A_DT group_NN of_IN cross-bred_JJ hill_NN goats_NNS ,_, maintained_VBN at_IN the_DT farm_NN (_( Kangra_NNP hill_NNP Angora_NNP )_) contracted_VBD the_DT disease_NN naturally_RB and_CC ,_, of_IN course_NN ,_, it_PRP was_VBD also_RB possible_JJ to_TO transmit_VB the_DT disease_NN to_TO them_PRP artificially_RB ._.
Out_IN of_IN the_DT two_CD cross-bred_JJ kids_NNS used_VBN for_IN experiment_NN ,_, one_CD was_VBD scarified_VBN on_IN the_DT abdomen_NNS and_CC the_DT other_JJ was_VBD injected_VBN intracutaneously_RB at_IN the_DT caudal_NN fold_NN ._.
The_DT kid_NN which_WDT was_VBD scarified_VBN developed_JJ local_JJ vesicles_NNS on_IN the_DT third_JJ day_NN and_CC a_DT generalized_JJ form_NN of_IN the_DT disease_NN on_IN the_DT eighth_JJ day_NN ,_, while_IN the_DT other_JJ failed_VBD to_TO develop_VB the_DT disease_NN except_IN for_IN a_DT local_JJ reaction_NN in_IN the_DT form_NN of_IN a_DT hard_JJ nodule_NN ._.
VACCINATION_NN When_WRB the_DT first_JJ case_NN was_VBD brought_VBN to_TO our_PRP$ notice_NN ,_, it_PRP was_VBD deemed_VBN necessary_JJ to_TO immunize_VB the_DT rest_NN of_IN the_DT flock_NN ,_, for_IN which_WDT purpose_JJ serum-sensitized_JJ and_CC glycerinated_JJ virus_NN vaccines_NNS were_VBD tried_VBN ._.
The_DT virus_NN was_VBD obtained_VBN from_IN field_NN cases_NNS ._.
This_DT method_NN along_IN with_IN '_POS ovination_NN '_'' has_VBZ been_VBN tried_VBN by_IN Chadha_NNP [_NNP 1942-1943_JJ ]_NN with_IN inconclusive_JJ results_NNS ._.

Glycerinated_VBN virus_NN Fifteen_NNP female_NN goats_NNS 12_CD to_TO 15_CD months_NNS old_JJ and_CC ten_JJ kids_NNS two_CD to_TO three_CD months_NNS old_JJ were_VBD inoculated_VBN intracutaneously_RB at_IN the_DT caudal_NN fold_NN on_IN the_DT 19th_CD April_NNP ,_, 1945_CD ,_, with_IN two_CD drops_NNS of_IN glycerinated_JJ virus_NN (_( virus_JJ material_NN mixed_NN with_IN an_DT equal_JJ volume_NN of_IN glycerine_NN )_) which_WDT had_VBD been_VBN left_VBN for_IN 24_CD hours_NNS at_IN serum_NN pit_NN temperature_NN (_( about_IN 55-65°F_NNP ._. )_) ._.
The_DT vaccinated_JJ animals_NNS ,_, with_IN one_CD exception_NN ,_, developed_VBD a_DT typical_JJ local_JJ reaction_NN in_IN the_DT form_NN of_IN a_DT flat_JJ ,_, sharply_RB circumscribed_JJ vesicle_NN of_IN the_DT size_NN of_IN an_DT eight_CD anna_NN bit_NN ._.
The_DT reaction_NN started_VBD as_IN a_DT reddening_NN on_IN the_DT third_JJ day_NN ,_, developing_VBG into_IN a_DT raised_VBN flat_JJ vesicle_NN two_CD or_CC three_CD days_NNS later_RB ._.
In_IN three_CD cases_NNS ,_, where_WRB an_DT excess_NN of_IN virus_NN was_VBD injected_VBN by_IN accident_NN ,_, the_DT local_JJ reaction_NN was_VBD severe_JJ ,_, resulting_VBG in_IN necrosis_NN and_CC ulceration_NN of_IN the_DT skin_NN ._.
Five_CD female_JJ goats_NNS also_RB developed_VBD a_DT few_JJ lesions_NNS on_IN the_DT body_NN ,_, but_CC these_DT animals_NNS were_VBD possibly_RB in_IN the_DT incubation_NN stage_NN at_IN the_DT time_NN of_IN vaccination_NN ._.
Mild_NNP thermal_JJ reaction_NN lasting_VBG for_IN three_CD to_TO four_CD days_NNS was_VBD seen_VBN in_IN some_DT cases_NNS on_IN the_DT sixth_JJ day_NN ._.
Serum-sensitized_JJ virus_NN Scabs_NNP from_IN fresh_JJ cases_NNS were_VBD soaked_VBN in_IN serum_NN from_IN a_DT recovered_VBN animal_NN ,_, who_WP had_VBD shown_VBN an_DT acute_JJ infection_NN and_CC the_DT suspension_NN kept_VBD in_IN the_DT serum_NN pit_NN for_IN 24_CD to_TO 48_CD hours_NNS ._.
Ten_CD kids_NNS were_VBD injected_VBN intra-_JJ cutaneously_RB into_IN the_DT caudal_NN fold_NN with_IN suspension_NN which_WDT had_VBD been_VBN held_VBN for_IN 24_CD hours_NNS ,_, and_CC this_DT produced_VBD a_DT local_JJ reaction_NN in_IN all_DT except_IN one_CD ._.
Three_CD of_IN the_DT kids_NNS developed_VBD a_DT mild_JJ degree_NN of_IN pox_NN with_IN two_CD to_TO three_CD vesicles_NNS only_RB ._.
In_IN a_DT second_JJ group_NN of_IN five_CD goats_NNS ,_, which_WDT were_VBD given_VBN a_DT 48-hour_JJ old_JJ suspension_NN ,_, there_EX was_VBD a_DT local_JJ reaction_NN only_RB ._.
These_DT reactions_NNS were_VBD similar_JJ to_TO ,_, though_RB slightly_RB milder_JJR than_IN the_DT ones_NNS produced_VBN by_IN glycerinated_JJ virus_NN ,_, and_CC consisted_VBD of_IN a_DT rise_NN of_IN temperature_NN on_IN the_DT fourth_JJ to_TO the_DT sixth_JJ day_NN ._.
A_DT week_NN after_IN the_DT reaction_NN had_VBD subsided_VBN ,_, all_PDT the_DT vaccinated_JJ animals_NNS along_IN with_IN five_CD controls_NNS ,_, were_VBD kept_VBN in_IN close_JJ contact_NN with_IN infected_JJ goats_NNS for_IN three_CD weeks_NNS ,_, but_CC unfortunately_RB neither_DT controls_NNS nor_CC vaccinated_JJ showed_VBD any_DT symptoms_NNS ._.
These_DT experiments_NNS were_VBD thus_RB inconclusive_JJ ,_, except_IN for_IN the_DT fact_NN that_IN neither_CC glycerinated_VBD nor_CC serum-sensitized_JJ virus_NN produced_VBN severe_JJ reactions_NNS when_WRB used_VBN as_IN a_DT vaccine_NN ._.
246_CD An_DT outbreak_NN of_IN Goat-Pox_NNP in_IN Hissar_NNP District_NNP [_NNP XVII_NNP Chadda_NNP [_NNP 1942-1943_JJ ]_NNP however_RB ,_, obtained_VBD unexpectedly_RB severe-reactions_NNS in_IN one_CD of_IN his_PRP$ experiments_NNS and_CC believed_VBD this_DT to_TO be_VB due_JJ to_TO the_DT serum_NN not_RB being_VBG sufficiently_RB protective_JJ ._.
Immunity_NNP test_NN Ten_NNP female_NN goats_NNS ,_, obtained_VBN from_IN a_DT goat-pox-free_JJ area_NN ,_, were_VBD successfully_RB vaccinated_VBN with_IN glyceri-_JJ nated_JJ virus_NN on_IN the_DT 22nd_CD June_NNP 1945_CD ._.
These_DT were_VBD kept_NNS for_IN the_DT purpose_NN of_IN immunity_NN testing_NN ._.
Un-_NNP fortunately_RB ,_, at_IN this_DT time_NN ,_, no_DT goats_NNS could_MD be_VB vaccinated_VBN with_IN serum-sensitized_JJ virus_NNS due_JJ to_TO lack_NN of_IN facilities_NNS ._.
Nearly_RB six_CD months_NNS later_RB ,_, eight_CD of_IN these_DT goats_NNS ,_, together_RB with_IN four_CD kids_NNS four_CD months_NNS old_JJ and_CC born_VBN after_IN the_DT outbreak_NN subsided_VBD ,_, acting_VBG a_DT controls_NNS ,_, were_VBD scarified_VBN on_IN the_DT abdomen_NNS with_IN a_DT saline_JJ suspension_NN of_IN goat-pox_JJ virus_NN obtained_VBN from_IN the_DT Indian_JJ Veterinary_NNP Research_NNP Institute_NNP ,_, Mukteswar_NNP ._.
Marked_NNP local_JJ and_CC thermal_JJ reaction_NN (_( rise_NN of_IN 2°F_CD ._. )_)
was_VBD noticed_VBN on_IN the_DT fifth_JJ day_NN in_IN the_DT vaccinated_VBN as_RB well_RB as_IN in_IN control_NN animals_NNS ._.
On_IN the_DT tenth_JJ day_NN the_DT temperature_NN returned_VBD to_TO normal_JJ ,_, and_CC the_DT local_JJ reactions_NNS subsided_VBD after_IN 20_CD days_NNS ._.
The_DT results_NNS were_VBD thus_RB again_RB inconclusive_JJ ._.
Apparently_RB ,_, the_DT Mukte-_NNP swar_NN virus_NN was_VBD not_RB very_RB virulent_JJ ,_, as_IN none_NN of_IN the_DT animals_NNS was_VBD severely_RB affected_JJ ._.
The_DT present_JJ experi-_JJ ments_NNS ,_, as_RB well_RB as_IN those_DT of_IN other_JJ workers_NNS in_IN India_NNP ,_, indicate_VBP the_DT need_NN for_IN further_JJ work_NN on_IN the_DT virulence_NN and_CC potency_NN of_IN goat-pox_JJ virus_NN in_IN India_NNP ,_, its_PRP$ relation_NN to_TO that_DT of_IN sheep-pox_NN and_CC the_DT methods_NNS of_IN com-_JJ bating_VBG the_DT disease_NN in_IN the_DT field_NN ._.
SUMMARY_NNP An_DT outbreak_NN of_IN goat-pox_NN is_VBZ described_VBN in_IN the_DT dairy_NN flock_NN of_IN goats_NNS at_IN the_DT Government_NNP Livestock_NNP Farm_NNP ._.
The_DT disease_NN spread_NN from_IN animals_NNS experimentally_RB infected_VBN with_IN virus_NN obtained_VBN from_IN an_DT out-_JJ break_NN in_IN Hissar_NNP district_NN ._.
Mortality_NNP was_VBD low_JJ ,_, but_CC there_RB was_VBD considerable_JJ reduction_NN in_IN milk_NN yield_NN as_IN the_DT result_NN of_IN the_DT disease_NN ._.
Attempts_NNS to_TO produce_VB the_DT disease_NN in_IN a_DT calf_NN and_CC a_DT buffalo_JJ calf_NN were_VBD unsuccess-_JJ ful_NN ._.
It_PRP was_VBD ,_, however_RB ,_, possible_JJ to_TO produce_VB local_JJ lesions_NNS in_IN lambs_NN with_IN the_DT goat-pox_JJ virus_NN ._.
Groups_NNP of_IN goats_NNS vaccinated_VBN with_IN serum-sensitized_JJ or_CC with_IN glycerinated_JJ virus_NN ,_, along_IN with_IN non-vaccinated_JJ controls_NNS were_VBD exposed_VBN to_TO natural_JJ infection_NN immediately_RB after_IN vaccination_NN ,_, but_CC neither_CC the_DT controls_NNS nor_CC the_DT vaccinated_JJ ones_NNS developed_VBD the_DT disease_NN ._.
An_DT immunity_NN test_NN ,_, carried_VBD out_RP on_IN another_DT group_NN of_IN goats_NNS six_CD months_NNS after_IN vaccination_NN ,_, with_IN glycerinated_JJ virus_NN ,_, was_VBD also_RB inconclusive_JJ ,_, because_IN both_DT vaccinated_JJ and_CC control_NN goats_NNS reacted_VBD with_IN goat-pox_JJ virus_NN obtained_VBN from_IN the_DT Indian_JJ Veterinary_NNP Re-_NNP search_NN Institute_NNP ,_, Mukteswar_NNP ._.

Report_NN of_IN the_DT Disease_NNP Investigation_NNP Officer._NNP ,_, Madras_NNP SOME_NNP OBSERVATIONS_NNP OF_IN PASTEURELLOSIS_NNP I.248_NNP An_DT Outbreak_NNP of_IN Pasteurellosis_NNP in_IN Geese_NNP [_NNP XVII_NNP A_NNP few_JJ drops_NNS of_IN heart_NN blood_NN from_IN the_DT rabbit_NN were_VBD diluted_VBN with_IN about_RB 5_CD c.c_NN ._.
of_IN sterile_JJ broth_NN and_CC inoculated_VBD subcutaneously_RB into_IN another_DT rabbit_NN and_CC intravenously_RB into_IN a_DT fowl_NN ._.
Again_RB ,_, both_DT died_VBD the_DT following_JJ night_NN and_CC pasteurella_NN was_VBD demonstrated_VBN in_IN large_JJ numbers_NNS in_IN films_NNS and_CC in_IN cultures_NNS from_IN their_PRP$ heart_NN blood_NN ._.
Similarly_RB ,_, from_IN the_DT guinea-pig_NN ,_, heart_NN blood_NN was_VBD subinoculated_VBN intravenously_RB into_IN a_DT fowl_NN and_CC subcutaneously_RB into_IN another_DT guinea-pig_NN ._.
The_DT second_JJ guinea-pig_NN looked_VBD sickly_NN for_IN some_DT days_NNS ,_, but_CC survived_VBD ._.
The_DT fowl_NN died_VBD about_IN 40_CD hours_NNS after_IN inoculation_NN and_CC showed_VBD typical_JJ pasteurella_NN in_IN peri-_JJ pheral_JJ blood_NN ,_, heart_NN blood_NN ,_, liver_NN and_CC spleen_JJ films_NNS ._.
Clinical_JJ features_NNS ._.
These_DT were_VBD not_RB observed_VBN systematically_RB ._.
The_DT symptoms_NNS noted_VBN were_VBD :_: mark-_JJ ed_NN dullness_NN ,_, loss_NN of_IN appetite_JJ ,_, increased_VBD thirst_NN ,_, some_DT discharge_NN from_IN the_DT beak_NN ,_, diarrhoea_NN ,_, and_CC in_IN a_DT few_JJ cases_NNS weak_JJ limbs_NN probably_RB due_JJ to_TO involvement_NN of_IN joints_NNS ._.
Post-mortem_JJ findings_NNS ._.
According_VBG to_TO the_DT post-mortem_JJ picture_NN most_JJS cases_NNS would_MD fall_VB in_IN the_DT class_NN of_IN sub-acute_JJ infection_NN ._.
Thus_RB ,_, besides_IN usual_JJ haemorrhages_NNS and_CC varying_VBG degrees_NNS of_IN enteritis_NN ,_, the_DT liver_NN was_VBD found_VBN studded_VBN with_IN numerous_JJ minute_JJ discrete_JJ grayish-yellow_NN '_'' necrotic_JJ '_POS foci_NN ._.
A_DT few_JJ livers_NNS examined_VBN earlier_RBR in_IN the_DT outbreak_NN appeared_VBD clean_JJ ,_, except_IN being_VBG slightly_RB enlarged_VBN ,_, while_IN in_IN a_DT few_JJ case_NN ,_, examined_VBD later_RBR in_IN the_DT outbreak_NN ,_, larger_JJR '_POS necrotic_JJ '_POS areas_NNS were_VBD noted_VBN ._.
The_DT spleen_NN was_VBD never_RB found_VBN distinctly_RB enlarged_VBN ._.
CONTROL_NNP MEASURES_NNP The_DT obvious_JJ preliminary_JJ step_NN was_VBD to_TO relieve_VB overcrowding_NN ._.
This_DT could_MD not_RB be_VB accomplished_VBN for_IN want_NN of_IN space_NN ._.
Such_JJ other_JJ sanitary_JJ measures_NNS ,_, like_IN disinfection_NN of_IN premises_NNS ,_, etc_FW ._.
were_VBD adopted_VBN as_IN the_DT prevailing_NN conditions_NNS permitted_VBD ._.
Inoculation_NN with_IN fowl_JJ cholera_NN vaccine_NN and_CC serum_NN as_IN prepared_VBN by_IN the_DT Indian_JJ Veterinary_NNP Re-_NNP search_NN Institute_NNP was_VBD undertaken_VBN ._.
Since_IN the_DT owners_NNS could_MD not_RB be_VB persuaded_VBN to_TO withhold_VB sale_NN beyond_IN a_DT few_JJ days_NNS ,_, the_DT results_NNS of_IN these_DT measures_NNS could_MD not_RB be_VB correctly_RB assessed_VBN ._.
Deaths_NNS continued_VBD to_TO occur_VB during_IN the_DT first_JJ week_NN after_IN inoculation_NN ,_, but_CC later_RB the_DT disease_NN seemed_VBD to_TO have_VB been_VBN brought_VBN under_IN control_NN ._.
ACKNOWLEDGEMENTS_IN The_DT cultural_JJ and_CC biochemical_JJ tests_NNS were_VBD done_VBN in_IN the_DT School_NNP of_IN Tropical_NNP Medicine_NNP ,_, Calcutta_NNP ._.
The_DT facilities_NNS granted_VBN by_IN the_DT Director_NNP ,_, Lt.-Col._NNP Pasricha_NNP ,_, are_VBP gratefully_RB acknowledged_VBN ._.
The_DT authors_NNS are_VBP also_RB grateful_JJ to_TO Mr._NNP J._NNP R._NNP Haddow_NNP ,_, Veterinary_NNP Adviser_NNP to_TO the_DT Government_NNP of_IN Bengal_NNP ,_, for_IN his_PRP$ interest_NN in_IN the_DT work_NN ._.
II.-PASTEURELLOSIS_NNP IN_NNP DUCKLINGS_NNP By_IN ,_, S._NNP NURUL_NNP MOHTEDA_NNP ,_, G.M.V.C._NNP ,_, Assistant_NNP Disease_NNP Investigation_NNP Officer_NNP (_( Poultry_NNP )_) ,_, Hyderabad_NNP Dn_NNP ._.
(_( Received_VBN for_IN publication_NN on_IN 14_CD October_NNP 1946_CD )_) FOWL_NNP CHOLERA_NNP ,_, as_IN it_PRP affects_VBZ ducklings_NNS three_CD to_TO four_CD months_NNS old_JJ ,_, was_VBD studied_VBN for_IN the_DT first_JJ time_NN in_IN Hyderabad_NNP State_NNP in_IN 1943_CD ._.
A_DT general_JJ survey_NN of_IN poultry_NN disease_NN in_IN the_DT State_NNP revealed_VBD the_DT existence_NN of_IN sickness_NN affecting_VBG ducks_NNS which_WDT caused_VBD sudden_JJ death_NN and_CC which_WDT was_VBD suspected_VBN to_TO be_VB either_RB cholera_NN or_CC paratyphoid_JJ infection_NN ._.
The_DT disease_NN usually_RB subsided_VBD of_IN its_PRP$ own_JJ accord_NN ._.
In_IN the_DT present_JJ investigation_NN the_DT death_NN of_IN 12_CD ducks_NNS was_VBD reported_VBN within_IN four_CD days_NNS of_IN their_PRP$ purchase_NN ._.
No_DT relevant_JJ information_NN concerning_VBG the_DT source_NN of_IN the_DT disease_NN was_VBD available_JJ ._.
One_CD ailing_NN and_CC one_CD dead_JJ bird_NN were_VBD brought_VBN to_TO the_DT laboratory_NN for_IN examination_NN ._.
Lesions_NNS ._.
No_DT diagnostic_JJ symptom_NN of_IN pasteurella_NN infection_NN was_VBD apparent_JJ ._.
Pinpoint_NNP haemorr-_JJ hages_NNS were_VBD found_VBN in_IN the_DT heart_NN coronary_JJ fat_NN ;_: the_DT lungs_NNS were_VBD congested_VBN and_CC partly_RB pneumonic_JJ ;_: the_DT liver_NN contained_VBD petechial_JJ haemorrhages_NNS ,_, as_RB well_RB as_IN white_JJ necrotic_JJ foci_NN ,_, while_IN the_DT intestines_NNS were_VBD affected_VBN with_IN catarrhal_JJ haemorrhagic_JJ enteritis_NN ._.
All_DT other_JJ organs_NNS were_VBD normal_JJ ._.
Diagnosis_NN ._.
Films_NNS of_IN heart-blood_NN and_CC liver_NN contained_VBD bipolar_JJ organisms_NNS simulating_VBG Pasteurella_NNP aviseptica_NN ._.
To_TO confirm_VB the_DT diagnosis_NN a_DT pigeon_NN was_VBD infected_VBN intraperitoneally_RB with_IN 2_CD c.c_NNS ._.
of_IN the_DT suspen-_JJ sion_NN of_IN the_DT liver_NN ,_, spleen_JJ and_CC heart-blood_NN ,_, while_IN a_DT fowl_NN was_VBD infected_VBN intravenously_RB with_IN the_DT same_JJ amount_NN of_IN suspension_NN of_IN bone_NN marrow_NN ._.
Both_DT died_VBD after_IN 18-20_JJ hours_NNS and_CC smears_NNS of_IN this_DT blood_NN contained_VBD organisms_NNS indistinguishable_JJ from_IN those_DT of_IN P._NNP aviseptica_NN ._.
Again_NNP ,_, another_DT fowl_NN was_VBD infected_VBN intraven-_JJ ously_RB with_IN the_DT same_JJ results_NNS ._.
A_DT rabbit_NN inoculated_VBN intraperitoneally_RB with_IN 1_CD c.c_NNS ._.
of_IN heart-blood_NN died_VBD within_IN five_CD hours_NNS of_IN the_DT injection_NN after_IN struggling_VBG for_IN 5-10_JJ minutes_NNS and_CC passing_VBG semi-solid_JJ faeces_NNS ._.
In_IN this_DT case_NN also_RB blood_NN smears_NNS were_VBD positive_JJ for_IN P._NNP aviseptica_NN ._.
The_DT material_NN from_IN the_DT original_JJ case_NN as_RB well_RB as_IN from_IN the_DT experimental_JJ birds_NNS were_VBD sent_VBN to_TO Izatnagar_NNP for_IN bacteriological_JJ study_NN ._.
The_DT material_NN included_VBD demuscled_JJ femur_NN and_CC tibia_JJ bones_NNS preserved_VBN in_IN powdered_JJ charcoal_NN ,_, a_DT portion_NN of_IN the_DT liver_NN ,_, a_DT heart-blood_JJ swab_NN ,_, and_CC heart-blood_NN in_IN a_DT pipette_NN ._.
Pasteurella_NNP infection_NN was_VBD confirmed_VBN ._.
The_DT organism_NN isolated_VBD was_VBD pathogenic_JJ to_TO fowl_VB ,_, duck_NN ,_, pigeon_NN and_CC rabbit_NN ,_, but_CC cross_JJ agglutination_NN tests_NNS with_IN various_JJ types_NNS of_IN sera_NN proved_VBD it_PRP to_TO be_VB different_JJ from_IN the_DT usual_JJ fowl_NN strain_NN ._.
SUMMARY_NNP An_DT outbreak_NN of_IN fowl_NN cholera_NN or_CC pasteurellosis_NN among_IN ducklings_NNS in_IN an_DT endemic_JJ form_NN has_VBZ been_VBN recorded_VBN in_IN Hyderabad_NNP State_NNP ._.
The_DT duck_NN strain_NN (_( Past_NNP ,_, aviseptica_NN )_) on_IN serological_JJ examination_NN revealed_VBD significant_JJ differences_NNS in_IN its_PRP$ antigenic_JJ composition_NN from_IN that_DT of_IN the_DT chicken_NN strain_NN ._.
249_CD B_NNP III.-AN_NNP OUTBREAK_NNP OF_NNP PASTEURELLOSIS_NNP IN_NNP DUCKS_NNP By_IN S._NNP K._NNP BHADURY_NNP ,_, B.Sc._NNP ,_, Assistant_NNP Disease_NNP Investigation_NNP Officer_NNP (_( Poultry_NNP )_) ,_, Bengal_NNP (_( Received_VBN for_IN publication_NN on_IN 20_CD January_NNP 1947_CD )_) THE_DT disease_NN ,_, though_IN not_RB uncommon_JJ ,_, seems_VBZ to_TO have_VB been_VBN little_JJ described_VBN so_RB far_RB as_IN concerns_NNS symp_JJ toms_NNS ,_, post-mortem_NN features_NNS and_CC other_JJ correlated_JJ aspects_NNS of_IN diagnosis_NN and_CC control_NN ._.
The_DT present_JJ article_NN deals_NNS with_IN a_DT subacute_JJ type_NN of_IN outbreak_NN in_IN Bengal_NNP ._.
Pasteurellosis_NN was_VBD first_RB suspected_VBN from_IN microscopical_JJ examination_NN of_IN films_NNS prepared_VBN from_IN the_DT heart_NN blood_NN of_IN affected_JJ birds_NNS ,_, and_CC diagnosis_NN was_VBD subsequently_RB confirmed_VBN by_IN biological_JJ test_NN ._.
A_DT significant_JJ point_NN was_VBD that_IN the_DT causal_NN organisms_NNS could_MD be_VB demonstrated_VBN only_RB in_IN birds_NNS in_IN which_WDT the_DT course_NN of_IN the_DT disease_NN was_VBD prolonged_VBN ._.
The_DT charac-_JJ teristic_JJ liver_NN lesions_NNS ,_, viz_NN ._.
greyish_JJ necrotic_JJ foci_NN ,_, were_VBD a_DT regular_JJ feature_NN in_IN the_DT protracted_JJ cases_NNS ,_, and_CC were_VBD absent_VBN in_IN the_DT less_JJR acute_JJ cases_NNS ,_, in_IN which_WDT also_RB films_VBP from_IN heart_NN blood_NN were_VBD apparently_RB free_JJ from_IN organisms_NNS ._.
History_NN ._.
About_IN the_DT middle_NN of_IN March_NNP ,_, 1946_CD ,_, a_DT firm_NN of_IN contractors_NNS in_IN Calcutta_NNP sent_VBD to_TO my_PRP$ laboratory_NN two_CD living_NN and_CC one_CD dead_JJ duck_NN from_IN their_PRP$ farm_NN ._.
This_DT farm_NN was_VBD started_VBN about_IN six_CD months_NNS previously_RB and_CC to_TO its_PRP$ stock_NN frequent_JJ additions_NNS were_VBD made_VBN from_IN time_NN to_TO time_NN from_IN local_JJ markets_NNS ._.
Prior_RB to_TO the_DT investigation_NN the_DT total_JJ number_NN of_IN ducks_NNS on_IN the_DT farm_NN was_VBD 300_CD ._.
For_IN the_DT previous_JJ two_CD months_NNS sporadic_JJ deaths_NNS of_IN one_CD or_CC two_CD ducks_NNS were_VBD reported_VBN ,_, and_CC were_VBD ascribed_VBN to_TO the_DT overwhelming_JJ number_NN of_IN males_NNS to_TO females_NNS ._.
Little_NNP was_VBD done_VBN to_TO combat_VB these_DT losses_NNS ,_, and_CC no_DT serious_JJ attention_NN was_VBD paid_VBN to_TO these_DT isolated_VBN reports_NNS ._.
This_DT state_NN of_IN affairs_NNS continued_VBN until_IN suddenly_RB the_DT mortality_NN figure_NN rose_VBD to_TO fifteen_VB dead_JJ in_IN a_DT single_JJ day_NN ._.
The_DT owners_NNS ,_, then_RB suspected_VBD some_DT contagious_JJ disease_NN and_CC segre-_NN gated_VBD the_DT affected_JJ birds_NNS ,_, but_CC heavy_JJ losses_NNS continued_VBD during_IN the_DT next_JJ few_JJ days_NNS till_VBP the_DT matter_NN was_VBD referred_VBN to_TO me_PRP ._.
Investigation_NN ._.
The_DT duck_NN farm_NN was_VBD spacious_JJ and_CC was_VBD sheltered_VBN by_IN tall_JJ shady_JJ trees_NNS ._.
Adjoining_NNP was_VBD a_DT wide_JJ ,_, deep_JJ ,_, semicircular_JJ pond_NN ._.
Some_DT of_IN the_DT ducks_NNS were_VBD found_VBN to_TO be_VB swimming_VBG in_IN the_DT tank_NN ,_, others_NNS were_VBD resting_VBG or_CC moving_VBG about_IN with_IN a_DT certain_JJ amount_NN of_IN freedom_NN ,_, in_IN a_DT manner_NN that_WDT did_VBD not_RB seem_VB to_TO prohibit_VB fully_RB indiscriminate_JJ mixing_NN ._.
At_IN the_DT date_NN of_IN my_PRP$ visit_NN ,_, the_DT number_NN of_IN ducks_NNS on_IN the_DT farm_NN had_VBD diminished_VBN from_IN 300_CD to_TO 150_CD ,_, and_CC about_IN 25_CD sick_JJ birds_NNS had_VBD been_VBN segregated_VBN ,_, of_IN which_WDT four_CD were_VBD already_RB dead_JJ ._.
The_DT course_NN of_IN the_DT disease_NN was_VBD generally_RB rapid_JJ ,_, varying_VBG from_IN 16-20_JJ hours_NNS ,_, though_IN some_DT took_VBD a_DT protracted_JJ course_NN and_CC lingered_VBD up_RP to_TO three_CD days_NNS ._.
The_DT disease_NN appeared_VBD to_TO have_VB become_VBN widespread_JJ and_CC losses_NNS at_IN this_DT stage_NN were_VBD recorded_VBN at_IN the_DT rate_NN of_IN about_IN 30_CD a_DT day_NN ._.
Six_CD birds_NNS (_( three_CD sick_NN and_CC three_CD recently_RB dead_JJ )_) were_VBD brought_VBN to_TO the_DT laboratory_NN for_IN further_JJ study_NN ._.
Symptoms_NNS ._.
Clinical_JJ symptoms_NNS were_VBD few_JJ but_CC were_VBD similar_JJ and_CC more_RBR or_CC less_RBR well_RB pronounced_VBN in_IN almost_RB every_DT case_NN ._.
There_EX was_VBD lameness_NN of_IN both_DT legs_NNS ,_, foul-smelling_JJ greenish-yellow_JJ diarrhoea_NN ,_, and_CC discharge_NN from_IN the_DT eyes_NNS ,_, which_WDT at_IN times_NNS was_VBD copious_JJ and_CC purulent_NN ._.
In_IN some_DT cases_NNS ,_, the_DT eyelids_NNS of_IN both_DT eyes_NNS were_VBD glued_VBN together_RB by_IN an_DT adhesive_JJ discharge_NN ,_, but_CC on_IN retracting_VBG the_DT lids_NNS ,_, the_DT eyes_NNS seemed_VBD to_TO be_VB normal_JJ ._.
As_IN the_DT disease_NN progressed_VBD the_DT birds_NNS lost_VBD strength_NN in_IN their_PRP$ legs_NNS and_CC rested_VBN on_IN their_PRP$ hocks_NNS ,_, with_IN head_NN sunken_VBN in_IN and_CC turned_VBD towards_NNS the_DT body_NN ._.
There_EX was_VBD respiratory_NN difficulty_NN ,_, marked_VBN by_IN a_DT long_JJ inspiration_NN and_CC short_JJ rapid_JJ expirations_NNS ._.
Finally_RB ,_, the_DT neck_NN and_CC limbs_NNS were_VBD stretched_VBN and_CC the_DT bird_NN collapsed_VBD ,_, the_DT body_NN sometimes_RB turning_VBG turtle_NN ._.
There_EX was_VBD inappetance_NN and_CC general_JJ lethargy_NN throughout_IN ,_, but_CC the_DT leg-weakness_NN was_VBD usually_RB the_DT first_JJ sign_NN marking_VBG the_DT beginning_NN of_IN the_DT malady_NN ._.
Post-mortem_NN ._.
The_DT carcases_NNS were_VBD generally_RB in_IN fair_JJ condition_NN but_CC heavily_RB infested_VBN with_IN lice_NN ._.
On_IN opening_VBG the_DT body_NN ,_, the_DT first_JJ noticeable_JJ feature_NN was_VBD an_DT unusual_JJ stickiness_NN of_IN the_DT viscera_NN ,_, which_WDT were_VBD enmeshed_VBN in_IN a_DT gelatinous_JJ ,_, brownish-yellow_JJ exudate_NN ._.
This_DT exudate_NN was_VBD so_RB gummy_JJ ,_, that_IN it_PRP hamper-_JJ ed_IN the_DT post-mortem_JJ operation_NN ._.
The_DT heart_NN ,_, liver_RB ,_, spleen_JJ ,_, lungs_NNS ,_, and_CC kidneys_NNS showed_VBD signs_NNS of_IN acute_JJ congestion_NN ._.
The_DT intestines_NNS were_VBD filled_VBN with_IN dark-coloured_JJ semi-fluid_JJ ingesta_NN ,_, and_CC the_DT mucous_JJ mem-_JJ brane_NN showed_VBD haemorrhagic_JJ patches_NNS throughout_IN ._.
In_IN two_CD cases_NNS the_DT liver_NN was_VBD pale_JJ and_CC anaemic_JJ ._.
Caecal_JJ scrapings_NNS of_IN two_CD ducks_NNS showed_VBD fairly_RB frequent_JJ trichomonads_NNS ;_: from_IN the_DT coecum_NN of_IN another_DT case_NN about_IN two_CD dozen_NN trematodes_NNS (_( N._NNP attenuatus_NN )_) were_VBD recovered_VBN ._.
251_CD M_NNP 252_CD An_DT Outbreak_NN of_IN Pasteurellosis_NNP in_IN ducks_NNS [_VBP XVI_JJ Diagnosis_NNP ._.
From_IN the_DT course_NN and_CC the_DT nature_NN of_IN mortality_NN ,_, the_DT contagious_JJ nature_NN of_IN the_DT disease_NN was_VBD apparent_JJ from_IN the_DT beginning_NN ._.
Films_NNS of_IN heart_NN blood_NN ,_, liver_NN and_CC spleen_NN from_IN three_CD dead_JJ birds_NNS at_IN the_DT height_NN of_IN the_DT disease_NN and_CC from_IN two_CD other_JJ that_WDT had_VBD died_VBN an_DT hour_NN earlier_RBR showed_VBD no_DT bacteria_NN ._.
The_DT presence_NN of_IN a_DT large_JJ number_NN of_IN living_VBG trichomonads_NNS from_IN the_DT coecal_JJ scrapings_NNS of_IN two_CD recently_RB dead_JJ birds_NNS suggested_VBD that_IN these_DT organisms_NNS were_VBD the_DT cause_NN ,_, but_CC this_DT was_VBD not_RB confirmed_VBN as_IN no_DT trichomonads_NNS were_VBD noticed_VBN in_IN other_JJ cases_NNS ._.
The_DT liver_NN in_IN two_CD other_JJ birds_NNS which_WDT died_VBD a_DT little_JJ later_RBR were_VBD enlarged_VBN and_CC congested_VBN ,_, and_CC showed_VBD numerous_JJ ,_, minute_NN ,_, discrete_NN ,_, whitish_JJ ,_, '_'' necrotic_JJ '_POS foci_NN from_IN pin_NN point_NN to_TO pin_VB head_NN size_NN and_CC sometimes_RB of_IN an_DT irregular_JJ shape_NN ._.
The_DT heart_NN fat_NN in_IN the_DT coronary_JJ groves_NNS showed_VBD petechial_JJ haemorrhages_NNS ._.
Films_NNS of_IN heart_NN blood_NN and_CC liver_NN of_IN one_CD of_IN these_DT showed_VBD a_DT few_JJ Pasteurella-like_JJ organisms_NNS ,_, but_CC from_IN the_DT other_JJ bird_NN smears_NNS of_IN heart-blood_NN and_CC liver_NN showed_VBD in_IN enormous_JJ numbers_NNS bipolar_JJ organism_NN typical_JJ of_IN Pasteurella_NNP septica_NN ._.
Pathogenicity_NN ._.
About_IN 0.25_CD c.c_NN ._.
of_IN blood_NN was_VBD aspirated_VBN into_IN a_DT sterile_JJ syringe_NN directly_RB from_IN the_DT heart_NN of_IN the_DT two_CD latterly_RB autopsied_JJ ducks_NNS and_CC injected_VBD subcutaneously_RB into_IN two_CD fowls_NN ._.
Both_DT the_DT fowls_NN died_VBD within_IN 23_CD hours_NNS ;_: from_IN them_PRP ,_, blood_NN films_NNS stained_VBN by_IN Leishman_NNP method_NN showed_VBD large_JJ numbers_NNS of_IN typical_JJ Past_NNP ._.
septica_NN ._.
Liver_NNP smears_NNS also_RB showed_VBD fairly_RB frequent_JJ typical_JJ Past_NNP ._.
septica_NN ._.
Control_NNP ._.
At_IN the_DT time_NN control_NN measures_NNS were_VBD introduced_VBN ,_, only_RB 90_CD birds_NNS were_VBD available_JJ ._.
These_DT were_VBD divided_VBN into_IN three_CD groups_NNS to_TO be_VB treated_VBN with_IN serum_NN ,_, with_IN vaccine_NN and_CC a_DT control_NN group_NN ._.
Un-_NNP fortunately_RB ,_, the_DT owners_NNS insisted_VBD that_IN the_DT control_NN should_MD also_RB be_VB treated_VBN ,_, so_IN these_DT were_VBD given_VBN both_DT serum_NN and_CC vaccine_NN ._.
For_IN these_DT purposes_NNS ,_, bovine_NN pasteurella_NN serum_NN and_CC vaccine_NN were_VBD used_VBN ,_, sub-_JJ cutaneously_RB at_IN the_DT rate_NN of_IN 10_CD c.c_NN ._.
serum_NN and_CC 1_CD c.c_NN ._.
vaccine_NN for_IN each_DT bird_NN ._.
Results_NNS ._.
The_DT result_NN of_IN vaccination_NN is_VBZ shown_VBN in_IN Table_NNP I_PRP ._.
It_PRP was_VBD hoped_VBN to_TO keep_VB the_DT vaccinated_JJ birds_NNS quite_RB separate_JJ for_IN careful_JJ study_NN ,_, but_CC owing_VBG to_TO lack_VB of_IN proper_JJ supervision_NN on_IN the_DT part_NN of_IN the_DT owners_NNS this_DT plan_NN did_VBD not_RB entirely_RB succeed_VB ._.
Post-mortem_JJ examination_NN was_VBD continued_JJ time_NN to_TO time_NN in_IN birds_NNS dying_VBG after_IN vaccination_NN ._.
Past_NNP ._.
septica_NN was_VBD seen_VBN in_IN blood_NN films_NNS of_IN the_DT dead_JJ birds_NNS ,_, in_IN small_JJ or_CC large_JJ numbers_NNS ._.

SUMMARY_NNP An_DT outbreak_NN mainly_RB ,_, subacute_NN in_IN type_NN ,_, of_IN pasteurellosis_NN in_IN ducks_NNS is_VBZ described_VBN ._.

SAYED_NNP ALI_NNP ,_, Animal_NNP Nutrition_NNP Section_NNP ,_, Dacca_NNP Farm_NNP (_( Received_VBN for_IN publication_NN on_IN 29_CD May_NNP 1947_CD )_) (_( With_IN two_CD text-figures_NNS )_) NAPIER_NNP GRASS_NNP (_( Pennisetum_NNP purpureum_NN )_) is_VBZ a_DT fodder_NN which_WDT has_VBZ been_VBN recommended_VBN for_IN use_NN by_IN the_DT Bengal_NNP Agricultural_NNP Department_NNP ._.
The_DT chief_JJ point_NN in_IN its_PRP$ favour_NN is_VBZ that_IN it_PRP is_VBZ a_DT prolific_JJ grower_NN ._.
In_IN the_DT earlier_JJR feeding_JJ trials_NNS conducted_VBD during_IN 1932_CD ,_, it_PRP was_VBD found_VBN to_TO contain_VB about_RB 10_CD to_TO 16_CD per_IN cent_NN of_IN dry_JJ matter_NN and_CC 90_CD to_TO 84_CD per_IN cent_NN of_IN water_NN ._.

N2_RB 256_CD Nutritive_JJ Values_NNS of_IN Different_NNP Parts_NNP of_IN Napier_NNP Grass_NNP [_NNP XVII_NNP If_IN the_DT distribution_NN of_IN nitrogen_NN and_CC dry_JJ matter_NN between_IN leaves_NNS and_CC stems_VBZ is_VBZ examined_VBN ,_, by_IN far_RB the_DT largest_JJS amount_NN of_IN nitrogen_NN ,_, whether_IN in_IN terms_NNS of_IN total_JJ yield_NN or_CC percentage_NN ,_, falls_VBZ to_TO the_DT share_NN of_IN leaves_NNS ._.

VARIATION_NN IN_NNP THE_NNP NUTRITVE_NNP MAKE-UP_NNP OF_IN THE_NNP SOFTER_NNP AND_NNP THE_NNP COARSER_NNP PARTS_NNP It_PRP will_MD be_VB noted_VBN from_IN a_DT general_JJ survey_NN of_IN the_DT preceding_VBG that_IN possibly_RB somewhere_VB about_IN the_DT 3_CD to_TO 4_CD ft._NN stage_NN the_DT combinations_NNS of_IN components_NNS are_VBP such_JJ as_IN to_TO provide_VB an_DT economic_JJ utilization_NN ._.

It_PRP was_VBD IV_NNP ]_NNP I_PRP ._.
B._NNP CHATTERJEE_NNP ,_, MD_NNP ._.

A_DT some-_JJ what_WP arbitrary_JJ procedure_NN was_VBD adopted_VBN ._.
The_DT Napier_NNP grass_NN was_VBD fed_VBN chaffed_RB but_CC as_RB soon_RB as_IN the_DT grass_NN was_VBD brought_VBN for_IN chaffing_VBG not_RB less_RBR than_IN twenty_NN plants_NNS were_VBD picked_VBN at_IN random_NN ,_, the_DT length_NN of_IN each_DT plant_NN was_VBD measured_VBN and_CC then_RB all_PDT the_DT plants_NNS weighed_VBD ._.

0.03_CD 0.05_CD 0.02_CD 0.04_CD 0.14_CD 0.36_CD 0.17_CD 0.22_CD 21.8_CD 63.2_CD 15.0_CD 260_CD Nutritive_JJ Values_NNS of_IN Different_NNP Parts_NNP of_IN Napier_NNP Grass_NNP [_NNP XVII_NNP It_PRP is_VBZ noted_VBN here_RB that_IN the_DT coarser_NN stem_NN has_VBZ the_DT largest_JJS percentage_NN of_IN organic_JJ matter_NN (_( 96.7_CD per_IN cent_NN )_) ,_, chiefly_JJ fibre_NN (_( 38.6_CD per_IN cent_NN )_) and_CC nitrogen.free_JJ extract_NN (_( 56_CD per_IN cent_NN )_) ;_: as_IN a_DT matter_NN of_IN fact_NN these_DT constitute_NNS such_PDT a_DT large_JJ part_NN of_IN the_DT organic_JJ make-up_NN that_WDT very_RB little_JJ is_VBZ left_VBN for_IN the_DT other_JJ nutritive_JJ components_NNS specially_RB protein_VBP (_( 1.61_CD per_IN cent_NN )_) or_CC fat_JJ (_( 0.47_CD per_IN cent_NN )_) ;_: much_RB of_IN the_DT nitrogen-free_JJ extract_NN is_VBZ however_RB embedded_VBN in_IN the_DT hard_JJ integument_NN which_WDT prevent_VBD its_PRP$ full_JJ assimilation_NN ._.
The_DT coarser_NN stem_NN is_VBZ also_RB very_RB poor_JJ in_IN lime_NN (_( 0.12_CD per_IN cent_NN )_) ,_, a_DT characteristic_NN of_IN the_DT whole_JJ plant_NN (_( 0.29_CD per_IN cent_NN CaO_NNP )_) ._.
The_DT leaves_NNS contain_VBP the_DT largest_JJS percentage_NN of_IN protein_NN (_( 8.01_CD per_IN cent_NN )_) and_CC lime_NN (_( 0.51_CD per_IN cent_NN )_) ,_, while_IN the_DT softer_JJR stem_NN stands_VBZ second_JJ in_IN protein_NN content_NN but_CC first_JJ in_IN soluble_JJ ash_NN (_( 4.82_CD per_IN cent_NN )_) ,_, potash_NN (_( 2.33_CD per_IN cent_NN )_) magnesia_NN (_( 0.46_CD per_IN cent_NN )_) ,_, phosphorous_JJ (_( 0.86_CD per_IN cent_NN )_) and_CC chloride_NN (_( 0.31_CD per_IN cent_NN )_) ._.
Taken_VBN on_IN the_DT whole_JJ the_DT more_RBR useful_JJ components_NNS exist_VBP in_IN larger_JJR percentages_NNS in_IN the_DT leaves_NNS and_CC softer_JJR stem_NN ._.
This_DT aspect_NN is_VBZ more_RBR clearly_RB demonstrated_VBN on_IN the_DT basis_NN of_IN proportionate_JJ distribution_NN of_IN nutrients_NNS shown_VBN in_IN the_DT last_JJ three_CD columns_NN of_IN Table_NNP VII_NNP ._.
It_PRP will_MD be_VB noted_VBN that_IN per_IN 100_CD parts_NNS of_IN whole_JJ plants_NNS (_( leaves_NNS ,_, softer_JJR stem_NN and_CC coarser_NN stem_NN )_) about_IN 79_CD parts_NNS of_IN organic_JJ matter_NN are_VBP distributed_VBN between_IN the_DT leaves_NNS (_( 33.3_CD parts_NNS )_) and_CC the_DT softer_JJR stem_NN (_( 46.0_CD parts_NNS )_) leaving_VBG nearly_RB 21_CD parts_NNS for_IN the_DT coarser_NN stem_NN ._.
Protein_NNP and_CC ether_RB extract_JJ run_NN parallel_RB ,_, being_VBG divided_VBN between_IN 6_CD to_TO 7_CD parts_NNS in_IN the_DT coarser_NN stem_NN ,_, 31_CD to_TO 33_CD parts_NNS in_IN the_DT softer_JJR stem_NN and_CC 60_CD to_TO 63_CD parts_NNS in_IN the_DT leaves_NNS ._.
Though_IN the_DT actual_JJ fibre_NN content_NN is_VBZ highest_JJS in_IN the_DT coarser_NN stem_NN ,_, it_PRP only_RB forms_VBZ 22.3_CD parts_NNS for_IN 100_CD in_IN the_DT whole_JJ plant_NN ._.
This_DT is_VBZ due_JJ to_TO the_DT fact_NN that_IN the_DT entire_JJ coarser_NN stem_NN does_VBZ not_RB constitute_VB more_JJR than_IN one-fifth_NN of_IN the_DT whole_JJ plant_NN ._.
Of_IN the_DT soluble_JJ ash_NN 90_CD parts_NNS are_VBP divided_VBN between_IN the_DT leaves_NNS (_( 35.3_CD parts_NNS )_) and_CC the_DT stem_NN (_( 54.5_CD parts_NNS )_) leaving_VBG 10.2_CD parts_NNS for_IN the_DT coarser_NN stem_NN ._.
The_DT leaves_NNS also_RB contain_VBP most_JJS of_IN insoluble_JJ ash_NN (_( 57_CD parts_NNS )_) as_IN compared_VBN to_TO 34.2_CD parts_NNS in_IN the_DT softer_JJR stem_NN and_CC 8.8_CD parts_NNS in_IN the_DT coarser_NN stem_NN ._.
Of_IN individual_JJ minerals_NNS the_DT leaves_NNS have_VBP 60.1_CD parts_NNS of_IN lime_NN ,_, the_DT softer_JJR stem_NN 31.6_CD parts_NNS and_CC the_DT coarser_NN stem_NN 8.3_CD parts_NNS ._.
The_DT softer_JJR stem_NN have_VBP the_DT largest_JJS share_NN of_IN magnesia_NN ,_, potash_NN ,_, phosphate_NN and_CC chlorine_NN ,_, viz_NN ._.
55.0_CD ,_, 58.6_CD ,_, 56.4_CD and_CC 63.2_CD respectively_RB ._.
Contrary_JJ to_TO expectation_NN phosphate_NN has_VBZ been_VBN found_VBN highest_JJS (_( both_DT in_IN composition_NN and_CC distribution_NN )_) in_IN the_DT softer_JJR stem_NN and_CC less_RBR in_IN the_DT leaves_NNS ._.
Taking_VBG all_DT facts_NNS into_IN consideration_NN the_DT coarser_NN stem_NN ,_, if_IN rejected_VBN ,_, will_MD account_VB for_IN a_DT loss_NN of_IN 20_CD parts_NNS organic_JJ matter_NN ,_, about_RB 8_CD to_TO 9_CD parts_NNS of_IN lime_NN ,_, 14_CD parts_NNS of_IN phosphate_NN ,_, 26_CD parts_NNS of_IN soda_NN and_CC 7_CD parts_NNS of_IN potash_NN ._.
The_DT animal_NN is_VBZ generally_RB inclined_VBN to_TO reject_VB much_RB of_IN this_DT part_NN ._.
The_DT object_NN of_IN this_DT work_NN was_VBD to_TO ascertain_VB whether_IN in_IN feeding_VBG Napier_NNP grass_NN it_PRP would_MD be_VB more_RBR economical_JJ to_TO put_VB the_DT whole_NN plant_NN to_TO the_DT feeding_NN trough_NN or_CC to_TO discard_VB the_DT coarser_NN part_NN ._.
The_DT results_NNS suggest_VBP that_IN the_DT coarser_JJR part_NN is_VBZ poor_JJ in_IN composition_NN with_IN respect_NN to_TO all_DT components_NNS except_IN fibre_JJ and_CC nitrogen-free_JJ extract_NN ._.
But_CC on_IN account_NN of_IN its_PRP$ coarse_NN and_CC tough_JJ integuments_NNS it_PRP is_VBZ bound_VBN to_TO involve_VB an_DT expenditure_NN of_IN a_DT large_JJ amount_NN of_IN energy_NN in_IN the_DT work_NN of_IN digestion_NN ._.
It_PRP is_VBZ likely_JJ that_IN its_PRP$ exclusion_NN from_IN the_DT diet_JJ might_MD prove_VB more_RBR economical_JJ than_IN its_PRP$ inclusion_NN because_IN of_IN the_DT saving_NN of_IN energy_NN and_CC because_IN the_DT diet_NN would_MD be_VB more_RBR efficiently_RB digested_VBN the_DT loss_NN of_IN essential_JJ minerals_NNS would_MD be_VB negligible_JJ ._.
SUMMARY_NNP 1_CD ._.
The_DT composition_NN of_IN the_DT coarse_JJ stem_NN ,_, the_DT rest_NN of_IN the_DT stem_NN ,_, and_CC the_DT leaves_NNS of_IN Napier_NNP grass_NN ,_, a_DT 1_CD ft._NN ,_, 2_CD ft._NN ,_, 3_CD ft._NN ,_, 4_CD ft._NN ,_, 5_CD ft._NN and_CC 6_CD ft._NN high_JJ grown_VBN in_IN Bengal_NNP was_VBD assayed_VBN and_CC is_VBZ discussed_VBN ._.
2_CD ._.
It_PRP is_VBZ suggested_VBN that_IN the_DT coarse_JJ part_NN of_IN the_DT stem_NN is_VBZ not_RB worth_JJ feeding_NN ._.
SOME_NNP DIGESTIBILITY_NNP TRIALS_NNP ON_NNP INDIAN_NNP FEEDING_NNP STUFFS_NNP XIII_NNP ._.
DESI_NNP SUGARCANE_NNP SACCHRUM_NNP BARBARI_NNP JBSW_NNP (_( KATHA_NNP )_) By_IN LAL_NNP CHAND_NNP DHARMANI_NNP ,_, AGRICULTURAL_NNP CHEMIST_NNP II_NNP ,_, KARTAR_NNP SINGH_NNP LOHARA_NNP ,_, B.SC._NNP ,_, (_( AGRI_NNP ._. )_)
and_CC N._NNP AKBAR_NNP ALI_NNP ,_, B.Sc_NNP ._.
(_( AGRI_NNP ._. )_)
(_( Received_VBN for_IN publication_NN 26_CD Oct._NNP 1945_CD )_) THICK_NNP Coimbatore_NNP varieties_NNS of_IN sugarcane_NN introduced_VBN by_IN the_DT Department_NNP of_IN Agriculture_NNP in_IN the_DT Punjab_NNP ,_, yield_NN higher_JJR tonnage_NN of_IN cane_NN and_CC bring_VB more_JJR profit_NN to_TO the_DT growers_NNS than_IN desi_JJ sugarcane_NN ._.
Inspite_NNP of_IN this_DT the_DT zamindars_NNS in_IN the_DT Punjab_NNP still_RB grow_VB desi_JJ varieties_NNS of_IN sugarcane_NN on_IN a_DT fairly_RB large_JJ scale_NN and_CC Katha_NNP is_VBZ one_CD of_IN the_DT most_RBS favourite_JJ canes_NNS ._.
The_DT main_JJ reason_NN of_IN its_PRP$ finding_VBG favour_NN with_IN the_DT zamindars_NNS is_VBZ that_IN during_IN the_DT days_NNS of_IN fodder_NN scarcity_NN this_DT cane_NN can_MD be_VB fed_VBN to_TO cattle_NNS ,_, being_VBG thinner_JJR than_IN all_PDT the_DT Coimbatore_NNP varieties_NNS ._.
It_PRP has_VBZ a_DT great_JJ tillering_NN capacity_NN and_CC can_MD stand_VB drought_NN ,_, flooding_VBG and_CC frost_NN ._.
Its_PRP$ thickness_NN (_( average_JJ diameter_NN )_) is_VBZ 1.44_CD c.m_NN ._.
Stripped_NNP cane_NN forms_NNS 66_CD per_IN cent_NN of_IN the_DT whole_NN ._.
Digestibility_NN trials_NNS were_VBD conducted_VBN with_IN Katha_NNP sugarcane_NN on_IN five_CD Sahiwal_NNP heifers_NNS with_IN a_DT view_NN to_TO find_VB out_RP the_DT feeding_VBG value_NN of_IN this_DT cane_NN as_IN compared_VBN to_TO wheat_VB bhusa_NN ,_, the_DT staple_JJ fodder_NN of_IN cattle_NNS in_IN the_DT Punjab_NNP ._.
Five_CD Sahiwal_NNP heifers_NNS Nos_NNP ._.
171_CD ,_, 200_CD ,_, 212_CD ,_, 199_CD and_CC J._NNP D._NNP ,_, two_CD to_TO three_CD years_NNS old_JJ ,_, were_VBD used_VBN as_IN ._.
experimental_JJ animals_NNS for_IN the_DT digestibility_NN trials_NNS ._.
The_DT technique_NN followed_VBD was_VBD the_DT same_JJ as_IN is_VBZ usually_RB employed_VBN in_IN such_JJ trials_NNS at_IN the_DT Lyallpur_NNP Animal_NNP Nutrition_NNP Centre_NNP [_NNP Memoirs_NNP of_IN the_DT Department_NNP of_IN Agriculture_NNP in_IN India_NNP ,_, 1928_CD ,_, IX_NNP (_( 7_CD )_) ]_NN ._.
The_DT experimental_JJ animals_NNS were_VBD kept_VBN on_IN the_DT usual_JJ preparatory_JJ period_NN of_IN 15_CD days_NNS ._.
During_IN the_DT experimental_JJ period_NN all_PDT the_DT animals_NNS were_VBD given_VBN weighed_JJ amount_NN of_IN the_DT feed_NN and_CC their_PRP$ voidings_NNS were_VBD carefully_RB collected_VBN and_CC sampled_VBN for_IN detailed_JJ analysis_NN in_IN the_DT labora-_JJ tory_NN ._.
The_DT entire_JJ sugarcane_NN including_VBG tops_NNS and_CC dry_JJ leaves_NNS was_VBD cut_VBN into_IN half_JJ inch_JJ pieces_NNS with_IN a_DT chaff_NN cutter_NN before_IN feeding_VBG to_TO the_DT animals_NNS ._.
Three_CD digestibility_NN trials_NNS were_VBD carried_VBN out_RP with_IN this_DT feed_NN during_IN the_DT months_NNS of_IN December_NNP and_CC January_NNP ._.
RESULTS_VB The_DT chemical_JJ composition_NN of_IN the_DT feed_NN employed_VBN during_IN the_DT three_CD trials_NNS is_VBZ given_VBN in_IN Table_NNP I_PRP ._.
The_DT chemical_JJ composition_NN of_IN wheat_NN bhusa_NN is_VBZ also_RB given_VBN for_IN sake_NN of_IN comparison_NN in_IN the_DT same_JJ Table_NNP ._.

of_IN the_DT feed_NN along_IN with_IN the_DT total_JJ digestible_JJ nutrients_NNS are_VBP given_VBN in_IN Tables_NNP II_NNP and_CC III_NNP the_DT nitrogen_NN balance_NN is_VBZ shown_VBN in_IN Table_NNP IV_NNP ._.

It_PRP has_VBZ ,_, however_RB turned_VBD out_RP to_TO be_VB inferior_JJ to_TO wheat_VB bhusa_NN as_IN it_PRP is_VBZ one_CD and_CC a_DT half_JJ times_NNS richer_VBP in_IN protein_NN than_IN sugarcane_NN though_IN total_JJ digestible_JJ nutrients_NNS in_IN both_DT the_DT cases_NNS are_VBP almost_RB the_DT same_JJ ._.

SHELL_NNP SEALING_NNP OF_NNP EGGS_NNP By_IN T._NNP S._NNP KRISHNAN_NNP ,_, Poultry_NNP Research_NNP Section_NNP ,_, Indian_JJ Veterinary_NNP Research_NNP Institute_NNP ,_, Izatnagar_NNP (_( Received_VBN for_IN publication_NN on_IN 16_CD June_NNP 1947_CD )_) (_( With_IN one_CD text-figure_NN )_) THE_NNP efficiency_NN of_IN lime_NN and_CC water-glass_NN for_IN egg_NN preservation_NN under_IN Indian_JJ conditions_NNS was_VBD studied_VBN by_IN Macdonald_NNP and_CC Krishnan_NNP [_NNP 1943_CD ]_NNP ._.
The_DT preservative_JJ action_NN of_IN these_DT substancer_NN is_VBZ generally_RB attributed_VBN to_TO the_DT sealing_NN of_IN the_DT egg_NN shell_NN pores_NNS ;_: which_WDT ensues_VBZ during_IN the_DT storage_NN in_IN their_PRP$ solution_NN ._.
An_DT attempt_NN has_VBZ been_VBN made_VBN to_TO determine_VB the_DT minimum_JJ time_NN required_VBN to_TO effect_NN this_DT ._.
An_DT increase_NN in_IN size_NN of_IN the_DT egg_NN air-cell_NN is_VBZ due_JJ to_TO evaporation_NN of_IN water_NN from_IN the_DT egg_NN contents_NNS ,_, which_WDT ,_, other_JJ factors_NNS remaining_VBG the_DT same_JJ ,_, depends_VBZ on_IN the_DT porosity_NN of_IN the_DT egg-shell_NN ._.
In_IN this_DT work_NN it_PRP has_VBZ been_VBN assumed_VBN that_IN the_DT degree_NN of_IN shell-sealing_NN is_VBZ inversely_RB proportional_JJ to_TO the_DT increase_NN in_IN air-cell_JJ depth_NN ,_, i.e._NN ,_, the_DT more_JJR complete_JJ the_DT sealing_NN ,_, the_DT smaller_JJR the_DT increase_NN in_IN air-cell_JJ size_NN and_CC vice_NN versa_NN ._.
Day-old_JJ infertile_NN eggs_NNS were_VBD soaked_VBN for_IN varying_VBG periods_NNS in_IN lime-water_JJ and_CC water-glass_NN ,_, prepared_VBD as_IN usual_JJ [_NNP Macdonald_NNP and_CC Krishnan_NNP ,_, 1943_CD ]_NN ,_, and_CC then_RB put_VBD into_IN an_DT incubator_NN at_IN 100°F_CD ._.
along_IN with_IN an_DT equal_JJ number_NN of_IN similar_JJ but_CC untreated_JJ eggs_NNS ._.
After_IN seven_CD days_NNS storage_NN ,_, lots_NNS of_IN twelve_NN eggs_NNS were_VBD taken_VBN from_IN each_DT of_IN the_DT above_JJ series_NN and_CC the_DT depth_NN of_IN the_DT air-cell_NN in_IN each_DT egg_NN was_VBD measured_VBN (_( see_VB Table_NNP I_PRP )_) ._.
TABLE_NN I_PRP Average_VBP air-cell_JJ depth_NN in_IN eggs_NNS ,_, treated_VBN in_IN different_JJ ways_NNS ,_, after_IN seven_CD days_NNS storage_NN at_IN 100°F_CD ._.
Period_NN of_IN immersion_NN in_IN preserving_VBG liquid_JJ Depth_NNP of_IN air_NN cell_NN (_( mm_FW ._. )_)

5.1_CD 9.0_CD 11.2_CD N.B.266_NNP Shell_NNP Sealing_NNP of_IN Eggs_NNP [_NNP XVII_NNP [_NNP NLS_NNP note_NN :_: a_DT graphic_JJ appears_VBZ here_RB -_: see_VBP image_NN of_IN page_NN ]_NNP FIG_NNP ._.
1_CD ._.
Interior_NNP quality_NN of_IN eggs_NNS after_IN storage_NN IV_NNP ]_NNP T._NNP S._NNP KRISHNAN_NNP 267_CD view_NN is_VBZ further_RB supported_VBN by_IN the_DT fact_NN that_IN the_DT sealing_NN is_VBZ quicker_JJR and_CC more_RBR complete_JJ in_IN fresh_JJ eggs_NNS ,_, which_WDT generally_RB contain_VBP more_JJR CO2_NNP ,_, than_IN in_IN old_JJ ones_NNS ,_, which_WDT usually_RB contain_VBP much_JJ less_JJR of_IN this_DT gas_NN ._.
With_IN water-glass_PDT the_DT sealing_NN is_VBZ probably_RB due_JJ to_TO the_DT deposition_NN in_IN the_DT pores_NNS of_IN insoluble_JJ gelatinous_JJ SiO2_NNP formed_VBN by_IN the_DT hydrolytic_JJ dissociation_NN of_IN the_DT Na2SiO3_NNP and_CC its_PRP$ consolidation_NN with_IN time_NN ._.
This_DT ,_, as_IN has_VBZ been_VBN observed_VBN ,_, is_VBZ evidently_RB a_DT slow_JJ process_NN ._.
To_TO determine_VB the_DT effect_NN of_IN shell-sealing_NN on_IN the_DT keeping_VBG quality_NN of_IN eggs_NNS ,_, a_DT comparative_JJ study_NN of_IN the_DT interior_JJ quality_NN of_IN similar_JJ lots_NNS of_IN treated_JJ and_CC untreated_JJ infertile_NN eggs_NNS stored_VBD at_IN 100°F_CD ._.
(_( summer_NN conditions_NNS )_) was_VBD made_VBN ._.
The_DT treatment_NN given_VBN was_VBD immersion_NN for_IN 12_CD hours_NNS in_IN lime-water_NN ._.
Water-_JJ glass_NN was_VBD abandoned_VBN as_IN being_VBG too_RB slow_JJ for_IN practical_JJ commercial_JJ application_NN ._.
The_DT results_NNS of_IN the_DT study_NN are_VBP presented_VBN in_IN Fig_NNP ._.
1_CD ._.
It_PRP was_VBD found_VBN in_IN each_DT test_NN that_IN the_DT interior_JJ quality_NN ,_, as_IN judged_VBN by_IN albumen_NNS index_NN (_( Average_JJ diameter_NN Height_NNP of_IN thick_NNP white_JJ )_) ,_, percentage_NN thick_JJ white_JJ and_CC yolk_JJ index_NN (_( Height/Diameter_NNP of_IN yolk_NN )_) ,_, was_VBD somewhat_RB better_JJR in_IN the_DT treated_VBN eggs_NNS than_IN in_IN the_DT untreated_JJ ones_NNS ._.
The_DT air-cell_JJ depth_NN ,_, however_RB ,_, showed_VBD a_DT marked_JJ difference_NN in_IN the_DT two_CD lots_NNS ._.
The_DT treated_JJ ones_NNS had_VBD a_DT signi-_JJ ficantly_RB smaller_JJR air-cell_NN depth_NN than_IN the_DT controls_NNS at_IN all_DT stages_NNS of_IN the_DT storage_NN period_NN ._.
In_IN the_DT above_JJ experiment_NN ,_, which_WDT simulates_VBZ summer_NN conditions_NNS ,_, the_DT maximum_JJ allowable_JJ air-cell_JJ depth_NN of_IN 9.5_CD mm_NN ._.
(_( 3/8_CD in_IN ._. )_)
according_VBG to_TO the_DT Agricultural_NNP Grading_NNP and_CC Marking_NNP Act_NNP ,_, was_VBD attained_VBN in_IN the_DT untreated_JJ eggs_NNS in_IN four_CD days_NNS ,_, while_IN in_IN the_DT treated_JJ ones_NNS this_DT level_NN was_VBD reached_VBN only_RB after_IN 11_CD days_NNS ._.
In_IN the_DT commercial_JJ grading_NN of_IN eggs_NNS by_IN candling_VBG ,_, considerable_JJ weight_NN is_VBZ attached_VBN to_TO air-cell_JJ size_NN ._.
Those_DT with_IN air-cells_NNS of_IN more_JJR than_IN SELECTED_NNP ARTICLE_NNP EFFECT_NNP OF_NNP LOCAL_NNP INJECTIONS_NNP OF_NNP PENICILLIN_NNP ON_NNP STAPHYLOCOCCI_NNP IN_NNP THE_NNP COW_NNP 'S_POS UDDER*_NNP By_IN LOUIS_NNP A._NN KLEIN_NNP ,_, V.M.D._NNP ,_, DAVID_NNP W._NNP CRISMAN_NNP ,_, B.S._NNP ,_, D.V.M._NNP ,_, and_CC JOHN_NNP W._NNP MOOR_NNP ,_, V.M.D._NNP ,_, Philadelphia_NNP ,_, Pennsylvania_NNP THE_NNP results_NNS obtained_VBD with_IN local_JJ injections_NNS of_IN penicillin_NN in_IN the_DT treatment_NN of_IN empyema_NN ,_, mastoiditis_NN and_CC chronic_JJ wound_NN sinuses_NNS in_IN man_NN due_JJ to_TO staphylococcus_VB or_CC streptococcus_VB infection_NN ,_, as_IN reported_VBN by_IN the_DT Floreys,1_NNP the_DT National_NNP Research_NNP Council_NNP 's_POS Committee_NNP on_IN Chemotherapeutic_NNP and_CC Other_JJ Agents,2_NNP and_CC by_IN Lyons,3_NNP suggest_VBP that_IN intramammary_JJ injections_NNS via_IN the_DT teat_NN canal_NN might_MD be_VB effective_JJ in_IN catarrhal_JJ mastitis_NN ,_, also_RB called_VBD chronic_JJ mastitis_NN ._.
In_IN this_DT form_NN of_IN mastitis_NN ,_, conditions_NNS exist_VBP that_WDT have_VBP been_VBN found_VBN favourable_JJ to_TO the_DT action_NN of_IN local_JJ injections_NNS in_IN treating_VBG human_JJ patients_NNS ,_, viz._NN ,_, the_DT infection_NN is_VBZ situated_VBN in_IN a_DT closed_JJ cavity_NN or_CC space_NN from_IN which_WDT the_DT contents_NNS can_MD be_VB readily_RB withdrawn_VBN ,_, and_CC the_DT infection_NN is_VBZ localized_VBN and_CC accessible_JJ ._.
Frei4_NNP and_CC other_JJ investigators_NNS have_VBP found_VBN that_IN in_IN catarrhal_NN mastitis_NN due_JJ to_TO streptococci_VB ,_, it_PRP is_VBZ the_DT excretory_NN channels_NNS that_WDT are_VBP involved_VBN ,_, usually_RB the_DT milk_NN cistern_NN and_CC the_DT larger_JJR ducts_NNS primarily_RB ,_, while_IN clinical_JJ symptoms_NNS indicate_VBP that_IN the_DT disease_NN is_VBZ similarly_RB situated_VBN when_WRB it_PRP is_VBZ caused_VBN by_IN staphylococci_NN ._.
In_IN this_DT location_NN the_DT causative_JJ organisms_NNS are_VBP readily_RB accessible_JJ to_TO solutions_NNS introduced_VBN through_IN the_DT teat_JJ canal_NN while_IN any_DT exudate_JJ present_NN can_MD be_VB readily_RB milked_VBN out_RP before_IN making_VBG an_DT injection_NN ._.
Most_JJS clini-_JJ cians_NNS with_IN experience_NN in_IN treating_VBG human_JJ patients_NNS with_IN the_DT drug_NN are_VBP of_IN the_DT opinion_NN that_IN local_JJ injections_NNS should_MD be_VB supplemented_VBN by_IN intravenous_JJ or_CC intramuscular_JJ injections_NNS but_CC recovery_NN or_CC improvement_NN has_VBZ been_VBN obtained_VBN in_IN the_DT conditions_NNS mentioned_VBN above_IN with_IN local_JJ injections_NNS alone_RB ._.
It_PRP was_VBD decided_VBN to_TO test_VB the_DT action_NN of_IN intramammary_JJ injections_NNS of_IN penicillin_NN on_IN the_DT staphylococci_NN which_WDT cause_NN mastitis_NN and_CC also_RB to_TO determine_VB the_DT effect_NN on_IN the_DT cow_NN ,_, especially_RB on_IN the_DT under_IN tissue_NN ._.
The_DT penicillin_NN used_VBN was_VBD prepared_VBN specifically_RB for_IN this_DT study_NN by_IN Dr_NNP Waltee_NNP Kocholaty_NNP ,_, Thos_NNP ._.
H._NNP Dougherty_NNP ,_, Jr_NNP ._.
Fellow_NNP in_IN Research_NNP in_IN Brucellosis_NNP ,_, University_NNP of_IN Pennsylvania_NNP School_NNP of_IN Medicine_NNP ,_, in_IN July_NNP ,_, 1943_CD ._.
Staphylococci_NNP are_VBP one_CD of_IN the_DT causes_NNS of_IN catarrhal_JJ mastitis_NN and_CC the_DT symptoms_NNS they_PRP produce_VBP are_VBP similar_JJ to_TO those_DT caused_VBN by_IN streptococci_NN ._.
They_PRP also_RB cause_VBP a_DT severe_JJ type_NN of_IN acute_JJ perenchymatous_JJ mastitis_NN which_WDT is_VBZ often_RB complicated_VBN by_IN sepsis_NN ,_, and_CC gangrene_NN of_IN the_DT udder_NN is_VBZ frequently_RB associated_VBN with_IN it_PRP ._.
This_DT type_NN of_IN udder_JJ infection_NN was_VBD selected_VBN because_RB clinical_JJ results_NNS show_VBP that_IN it_PRP is_VBZ more_RBR re-_JJ sistant_NN to_TO the_DT agents_NNS now_RB used_VBN in_IN intramammary_JJ injections_NNS than_IN the_DT mastitis_NN streptococci_NN ,_, and_CC also_RB because_IN in_IN in_IN vitro_NN tests_NNS penicillin_NN was_VBD found_VBN to_TO be_VB more_RBR effective_JJ than_IN some_DT of_IN these_DT agents_NNS against_IN Staphylococcus_NNP aureus_NN ._.
Fleming5_NNP found_VBD it_PRP four_CD times_NNS as_RB potent_JJ as_IN sulfathiazole_NN and_CC twenty_NN times_NNS as_RB potent_JJ as_IN sulfapyridine_NN against_IN this_DT organism_NN ,_, and_CC Heilman_NNP and_CC Herrell6_NNP found_VBD it_PRP more_RBR effective_JJ than_IN gramicidin_NN ._.
Identification_NN of_IN mastitis_NN staphylococci_NN In_IN examining_VBG samples_NNS of_IN milk_NN or_CC other_JJ udder_JJ secretions_NNS for_IN the_DT staphylococci_NN which_WDT cause_NN mastitis_NN ,_, it_PRP is_VBZ necessary_JJ to_TO differentiate_VB them_PRP from_IN the_DT nonpathogenic_JJ cocci_NN ,_, usually_RB called_VBD micrococci_NN ,_, which_WDT are_VBP normally_RB present_JJ in_IN the_DT udder_NN and_CC the_DT milk_NN ._.

From_IN the_DT results_NNS obtained_VBD ,_, they_PRP concluded_VBD that_IN ability_NN to_TO coagulate_VB rabbit_NN or_CC human-blood_NN plasma_NN is_VBZ more_RBR closely_RB related_VBN to_TO pathogenicity_NN than_IN any_DT other_JJ property_NN ._.
The_DT greater_JJR number_NN of_IN the_DT coaguse_NN positive_JJ strains_NNS were_VBD hemolytic_JJ but_CC some_DT were_VBD not_RB ._.
They_PRP also_RB concluded_VBD that_IN staphylococci_NN from_IN the_DT udder_NN which_WDT are_VBP hemolytic_JJ on_IN ox-blood_JJ agar_NNS are_VBP usually_RB pathogenic_JJ whether_IN they_PRP have_VBP coagulative_JJ ability_NN or_CC not_RB ,_, as_IN are_VBP also_RB staphylococci_RB associated_VBN with_IN a_DT leucocyte_JJ count_NN of_IN 500,000_CD or_CC over_RB provided_VBD the_DT cow_NN is_VBZ not_RB in_IN the_DT early_JJ or_CC late_JJ stage_NN of_IN lactation_NN ._.
They_PRP found_VBD no_DT definite_JJ correlation_NN between_IN pigment_NN formation_NN and_CC the_DT leucocyte_NN count_NN ._.
Nearly_RB as_RB many_JJ strains_NNS of_IN staphylococci_NN associated_VBN with_IN a_DT low_JJ leucocyte_NN count_NN produced_VBD pigmented_JJ colonies_NNS as_IN those_DT associated_VBN with_IN a_DT high_JJ count_NN ._.
Chapman_NNP ,_, Berens_NNP ,_, Peters_NNP ,_, and_CC Curcio,9_NNP who_WP studied_VBD staphylococci_NN of_IN human_JJ origin_NN and_CC determined_VBN pathogenicity_NN by_IN injecting_VBG cultures_NNS into_IN rabbits_NNS ,_, found_VBD that_IN while_IN strains_NNS which_WDT coagulated_VBD human-_JJ blood_NN plasma_NNS were_VBD usually_RB pathogenic_JJ regardless_NN of_IN the_DT color_NN of_IN the_DT colonies_NNS ,_, those_DT which_WDT produced_VBD hemolytic_JJ yellow_JJ colonies_NNS were_VBD usually_RB pathogenic_JJ regardless_NN of_IN coagulative_JJ ability_NN and_CC hemolytic_JJ noncoagulating_NN strains_NNS that_WDT produced_VBD white_JJ colonies_NNS were_VBD usually_RB nonpathogenic_JJ ._.
Plan_NN of_IN experiment_NN In_IN selecting_VBG the_DT cows_NNS for_IN this_DT experiment_NN ,_, ability_NN to_TO hemolyze_VB ox-blood_NN ,_, coagulate_VB human-blood_NN plasma_NN ,_, and_CC produce_VB pigment_NN were_VBD used_VBN ,_, together_RB with_IN the_DT leucocyte_NN count_NN ,_, to_TO differentiate_VB patho-_JJ genic_JJ staphylococci_NN from_IN the_DT nonpathogenic_JJ cocci_NN (_( micrococci_NN )_) which_WDT are_VBP commonly_RB present_JJ in_IN cow_NN 's_POS milk_NN ._.
The_DT methods_NNS by_IN which_WDT these_DT determinations_NNS were_VBD made_VBN are_VBP described_VBN below_IN ._.
Samples_NNS of_IN milk_NN were_VBD taken_VBN from_IN each_DT quarter_NN of_IN the_DT udder_NN at_IN the_DT time_NN of_IN the_DT evening_NN milking_NN but_CC before_IN the_DT cow_NN was_VBD milked_VBN ._.
After_IN the_DT udder_NN had_VBD been_VBN prepared_VBN in_IN the_DT usual_JJ way_NN to_TO prevent_VB external_JJ contamination_NN ,_, three_CD streams_NNS were_VBD expressed_VBN from_IN the_DT quarter_NN and_CC discarded_VBD ,_, and_CC 15_CD to_TO 20_CD c.c_NN ._.
of_IN milk_NN were_VBD then_RB drawn_VBN into_IN a_DT sterile_JJ container_NN ,_, which_WDT was_VBD placed_VBN in_IN a_DT refrigerator_NN until_IN removed_VBN to_TO the_DT laboratory_NN ._.
